58.description: This little gem was discovered while my roommate and I were looking for a place to go where we didn't have to avoid the Chicago marathon craziness. Little did we know it is literally across the street from us in the private residences building. The place is a little pricey (so -1 star for that). Who can't love $5 mimosas and bloody marys. It is fairy small, but the food is great. -1 for size and wait time.

56.description: I've been in here a few times.  The food is ok and it's a fine place to sit a while.  Normally this would be a three or four star review except for a couple important points.1. No substitutions. I'm a vegetarian, and if I want a croissant sandwich I don't want to pay for BACON on it.  Bacon is expensive and I don't want it so either take a dollar off or let me get some avocado or whatever.2. When I say NO BACON (and pay extra for substituting avocado), then DON'T PUT BACON ON IT.

29.description: This place is terrible. It's dirty and dingy and just looks generally unkept. We had a couple of lattes here today and they were lukewarm at beat even though we asked for them to be extra hot. Also the owner kept screaming at the barista while we were standing right In front of them waiting for our lattes.

42.description: I like this place! The staff is friendly and approachable, the coffee is strong and the food is memorable. Yes, some of the food is a little pricey and the "no substitutions" policy can be a pain, but there definitely is something on the menu for everyone you just gotta know what to get. The location and decor is great and a hidden gem in the South Loop.TIPS:- $5 house-made bloody mary (with house-made pickles!) on saturdays and sundays (WHAT??!)- the breakfast burrito is addictive and can feed you twice (order it without lettuce, unless you like warm lettuce)- the turkey rueben is stacked with turkey and 'kraut and a unique twist on a reuben (i pay the extra $.50 to add tomatoes)

23.description: My boyfriend and I stopped in before we headed to a Bears game last Sunday. If you're headed to Solider Field it is a really close walk, which is nice. I got the prosciutto waffle sandwich. I was feeling wild, you know. I wasn't really sure how it was going to turn out because it seems like the flavors wouldn't work together. I was very happily surprised. It was very tasty. The waffle wasn't so sweet that it took over the flavor of the rest of the sandwich. My guy got the turkey Rueben and it was pretty tasty as well. I was happier with my order because his little sandwich just fell apart in his hands. I got a coffee and it was just fine. I'm not going to give it more praise than that because it was just a cup of coffee. He got a hot toddy and was all about it.  I was super bummed with the sides. If you have those tasty sandwiches, having a sad little pile of Lays potato chips on the side was just underwhelming. I expected a bit more from the taste of the sandwich. It's a little odd when you walk in. You walk in to a pastry counter, but you don't order there. There's a giant chalk board with their menu on on it. We didn't know if we were supposed to sit, if we ordered up front, or what? It was just odd. We walked in to a crowd of other people who didn't really seem to understand what was going on either. You order sort of around the corner and then they bring some things to you and other things they just hand you...? I don't know, maybe I'm being a baby about it but it seemed a lot harder than it really should have been. I didn't like how I was treated when I was in. We both got treated like we were stupid when we asked if we were meant to order up front or sit first. I get that they were busy, but rudeness isn't okay. I also HATED being scolded by the waitress. She brought us a hot toddy and said "Where's your number?" I didn't have a clue what she was talking about. She said "You HAVE to have a number." And I said I didn't have one and she rolled her eyes and went and got me one. I don't understand why I got in trouble for your weird system falling apart. Don't scold me. There's no need to ever be mean, especially in the morning, so I left with a bad taste in my mouth. All in all it was fine. The tasty sandwich saved this from being a 2-star review because of the treatment and the confusion. Convenient for a Bears game but I won't be back. I'll walk a few more blocks to be treated nicely.

47.description: So first time here. Food is ok. I got the turkey Ruben. It was kinda cold. Cold to the point where it wasn't tasty. I'm not sure if a turkey Ruben is like that. I'm used to corn beef so this was a change. My girlfriend got the BLT she said it was ok as well. Got the flamingo smooth and OMG was good. Deff get the smoothies here. All fresh. Really tasty. Plus once you check into here you get a free drop coffee with an entree.

8.description: Very disappointed in quality of meat. Ordered Wasabi burger - meat tasted old, lacking flavor. For over 10 dollars expect a high quality meat which is definitely not the case. Employees seem disinterested and more worried about closing the restaurant and getting people out by closing time than providing a quality experience. Will not return.

31.description: I typically had good experiences here, but the last 2 times I went I had coffee grounds in my iced coffee. Totally ruined the place for me!

34.description: Wow! I am hooked on this place. I didn't know how this place got any business because it's hidden inside Tower Residence Condos on Indiana Ave where there's little parking. After walking my dogs in the area, I saw that it was packed on weekends and heard they had great espressos.When you walk in, you do have to order like you're at Starbucks, but your order & food comes out fast with a food runner. Their menu has a variety of breakfast, sandwich and drink items. I had the Banana Batter pancakes & the Red Velvet waffles on another occasion. Let me say, it's the best breakfast entree's I've had. I don't mind that I'm paying a few extra bucks for great food. There's plenty of Subways & Starbucks to eat cheap. I also liked their Happy Hour drink specials. The $5 Mint Jelups on Thursdays beat other neighborhood bar specials.The Little Branch Cafe is a prime example of what word of mouth can do for a business. Obviously, the locals are aware of it. And if there was parking and visible signs, this place would be a mess with business. This is definately the definition of yoir favorite hidden find in the big city. I will come back here even with all the great options around me in Chicago.

16.description: What a fun find! I'd definitely like to come here again, since we only got to swing in for post-brunch cocktails. The set up is a little strange, but once we figured out you order Starbucks style and then wait at your table, it was all good. They have drink specials from Wednesday-Sunday. We came in on Sunday, so the special was either a Bloody Mary or Mimosa for just $5! The Bloody Mary was a steal, but the Mimosa was a bit on the tiny side and served in a martini glass, which seemed off to me. The menu looks great with many breakfast/lunch offerings. My friends had a smoothie that seemed overpriced to me, but it included gelato as one of the ingredients, so I suppose the price makes sense. If I make it back to Chicago for brunch, I will be hitting up Little Branch for more than just beverages.

13.description: Getting to Little Branch Cafe can be a huge pain when you are walking in 12 degree weather and the wind is beating your face like you stole something....HOWEVER, the food (red velvet waffle) is worth it. Little Branch Cafe has a great brunch/lunch menu which overs a variety of options that I'm sure even the pickest of eaters could find something to their liking.The red velvet waffle is sweet and tasty. You only get one, but if it can fill me it than you should be good.The apple maple chicken sausage weren't that good. I don't know how one can mess up chicken sausage, but they succeeded. They should stop purchasing their chicken sausages from whatever store they get them from and hit up Trader Joe's.Home fries were could, but just needed a little bite more seasoning to really knock my socks off.

11.description: I live in the building next door and work from home, so as soon as someplace close with wifi opens in the neighborhood, I won't be back. As other reviews have pointed out, the owner is rude. (She's scolded me multiple times for not having cash to pay for coffee, and once refused to give me the cafe's wifi password until I after ordered something. A barista -- not the owner-- gave it to me as I packed up and threatened to leave. Unfortunately, I think he no longer works there...) The place is loud, not from the conversation, but mostly from the constant bang -- strong enough to rattle the windows -- of a back door slamming shut as people go in and out. The kitchen staff also seems to be forever taking out its anger on something (working for an evil owner, perhaps?) by slamming around what sounds like large metal objects in the back. I could live with this if the food was better and/or not so overpriced. Please, someone open a cafe in the South Loop with better service, free wifi and decent coffee to save us all from this place! The staff at Little Branch have not set the bar very high, so you don't even have much to live up to.

39.description: This is a cool place to get some coffee, gelato and great casual eats that are very well prepared. Off the beaten path but a warm and cozy place with a very nice brunch selection, paninis and

37.description: Having moved to the South Loop, I was looking for a nice breakfast spot. This place is not it. Maybe it was my imagination, but I swear I could hear the ding of the microwave just before the breakfast came to me. Nothing was fresh and nothing was hot.  Staff seemed nice though.I live down the street and I wouldn't go back.

0.description: I am a fan! had the breakfast burrito, ordered blueberry pancakes, and two eggs, potatoes and toast.. ( They forgot my toast) :( But that's okay! It all tasted great! They also have mimosas and bloodys.. I will HAVE To come back to try those. I tried the spit pea, (vegan) which was really good! Totally a nice take on Split Pea, when it's normally made with prosciutto. I will be back I am sure!

38.description: How rediculous is this place! I think it's the perfect neighborhood breakfast/brunch place. The food is really good, but a bit on the expensive side. Most annoying is the COFFEE REFILL CHARGE of 25 cents when you just paid over $15 for one person to eat eggs!! Obviously 25 cents is nbd, but it's the principle. I mean really? Who carries around coin change nowadays anyways... Makes u feel inadequate and bad when u ask for a 2nd cup and you don't have any change to pay. Should I offer my debit card?? Lol. I hope they get rid of this policy quick. What a bad experience it leaves you with - at a normally great little cafe.

51.description: I visited this restaurant for breakfast.  The owner greeted us at the front counter but she was very very rude. When I asked questions about the menu she seemed annoyed that I had questions.  After I placed my order I waited 30 minutes but my food was prepared incorrectly.  I waited an additional 20 minutes for my food.  I asked how much longer I was going to have to wait and the owner replied "we don't give out free food?" I was treated very rudely.  I don't understand why she was so rude.  I have heard great things about this place but I was extremely dissapointed.  I will never go back to this terrible place.

27.description: I have witnessed the steady decline of Little Branch Cafe.  About 4 years ago LBC was an off the path breakfast haven in the south loop, especially since breakfast options were limited. Serving great coffee and solid breakfast at a price range that only people in the south loop could afford.  Times have changed; menus expanded, owners changed, liquor licenses came and went and came again, and food became a shell of what it once was.  I used to like the slightly edgy scene. Now I get a snow hat toting hipster kid in, in summer, that slams the coffee canisters against the counter so loud that my ear drums cringe. Quiche that is microwaved until it is crispy-nuked, and to mention it wasn't the quiche that was advertised on the little sign. Nothing has changed, ever. I think the chalk on the blackboards is caked on there so thick that you would need Goof-Off and an ice scrapper. The fresh chips they used to have, replaced by lays. I guess to sum up this review, if you're not striving to get better, you are getting worse. I want LBC to be awesome... but it's not. Sucks. The coffee still decent... but somehow it's more expensive that starbucks now. Quiche and coffee, 12.01? Not worth it.

32.description: Totally cute little place!  Granted I went there on a weekday so there was no wait, but I got a perfect table outdoors to sit and relax with a good book.  The wait staff was very friendly and helped me choose a really yummy breakfast.  It's kind of hidden away from a main street so I don't know if it gets as crazy as the other breakfast places in the area.  But since it is smaller the food choices are more limited.  However they do have great lunch options in addition to breakfast food,  so good for a true brunch.

54.description: I've been to Little Branch countless times for both breakfast and lunch. The food is really good, and definitely not the usual fair you get from other brunch places in the area.Try the soups and the cucumber roll. The crab cake roll is my wife's favorite.

48.description: After a few more visits- not great... owner (the lady) isn't the friendliest person you'll meet and was serving drinks while coughing/sneezing.  I live close and frequented this place often due to proximity but have not returned since.  Having worked in hospitality, not cool to see her yell at her workers in public either.  They often forget to give you everything on your order and similar items come out VERY different from one time to the next (French toast used normal bread "stuck" together vs brioche...).

44.description: After a few visits and same outcome I'm ready to review.  It took me several visits thinking perhaps they were having an off day, but they have been pretty consistent after several visits. The service is lacking. primarily the owner.  She is very rude and very impersonal. The food leaves something to be desired and is way overpriced. Last visit I paid nearly $20 for a small canary drink with almond milk and a mediocre oatmeal.  The place is quaint, but needs a good dusting. I will not be returning.

24.description: The staff was rude and food was mediocre.  The staff repeatedly made mistakes and the charged us.  The food came out at inconsistent times so that half our party was watching the other half eat.

7.description: Great place to grab a quick lunch and drink before we headed over to the Museum Campus, which is just a short walk away. The menu is diverse without being overwhelming and the atmosphere is laid back. We sat on the little patio outside to enjoy the weather, and while the patio view isn't much, it was quiet.The fritata sandwich was awesome as was the prosciutto and mozarella pannini. Definitely recommended for those who are looking for a casual lunch with good food and a cocktail (or two).

49.description: Little Branch Café is a quaint café that is tucked away in a small neighborhood, off the main roads.  If you don't live in the area, then parking may be an issue.  There is meter parking about 3-4 blocks away on the main streets, so prepare for a little walk.  This café is part of an apartment complex, so there seem to have a lot of locals' chit chatting with each other or busily working away on their computers.When you first walk in, you will be greeted with huge colorful chalkboards with their specials and drinks.  I decided to try out the cinnabon, breakfast burrito, and a green tea latte.  The cinnabon was hard as a rock when I tried to cut into it.  I would expect them to have at least offered to heat the cinnabon back up so it could be soft, warm, and gooey.  But I had to go through rolled eyes, dirty looks, and some attitude to get it heated back up.  The breakfast burrito was a pretty decent size.  It was wrapped in a flour tortilla and filled with scrambled eggs, avocado, beans, Chihuahua cheese, pico de gallo, and bacon.  It also came with a side of fruits and chili cream.  I enjoyed all the different flavors and texture.  The winner of the meal was the green tea latte.  It was hot, foamy, and full of matcha flavor.  The food here was decent (nothing too great to make me want to come back,) but the service was horrible.  All the employees were not really friendly and had nasty attitudes.  I just don't understand why people were in such a bad mood...maybe something in the air, but I don't think I will be dining in anymore.

40.description: What a fun find! I'd definitely like to come here again, since we only got to swing in for post-brunch cocktails. The set up is a little strange, but once we figured out you order Starbucks style and then wait at your table, it was all good. They have drink specials from Wednesday-Sunday. We came in on Sunday, so the special was either a Bloody Mary or Mimosa for just $5! The Bloody Mary was a steal, but the Mimosa was a bit on the tiny side and served in a martini glass, which seemed off to me. The menu looks great with many breakfast/lunch offerings. My friends had a smoothie that seemed overpriced to me, but it included gelato as one of the ingredients, so I suppose the price makes sense. If I make it back to Chicago for brunch, I will be hitting up Little Branch for more than just beverages.

53.description: May have been on an off-morning, but things were a bit of a mess.  I had the bagel sandwich, which was missing its egg and all a bit soggy.  My girlfriend had the waffle-of-the-day, a cinnamon/nut/raisin thing.  It was very soggy, with a ton of cinnamon (as in, hard on the throat) and it came out a good 15 minutes after my dish.  Cute space, and the menu has a lot of interesting options, but I'd be hard pressed to go back.

30.description: Love the ambiance here and the food is great too! I've also had some delicious teas and drinks! So fun that they serve alcohol! They even have a cute little outdoor patio. And it could be a great place to hang out and study, too!

46.description: First visit to Little Branch after living in the South Loop for almost two years and it's great to have another breakfast/lunch spot in the neighborhood.  Staff is friendly and the setup is decent.When it came to the food, it was just okay.  My prosciutto & mozzarella panini was good but the balsamic vinaigrette was too overpowering and took over the entire sandwich.  My partner had the ham & swiss and liked it but once again, felt the mustard overpowered the sandwich.My biggest gripe was that the place needed a good dusting and sweeping.  The window ledges had not been dusted for a while and they were looking "fuzzy".  The floor between the window and column was littered with straw wrappers and dust.  The lamp shades could've used a once over with a swiffer.  It may sound trivial but people notice these things and the overall look & upkeep of the restaurant is just as important as the food.  I may be back but I'm not gonna rush.

1.description: I was so disappointed in my meal at little branch. I ordered the lavender chai latte and it was basically scented steamed milk, I couldn't drink it. I also ordered a vegetarian panini that was barely toasted, it was mostly spinach covered heavily in some sort of pink salad dressing served on rye bread. The sides were cheap potato chips and a pickle that appeared to be a dill spear but did not taste anything like one. My total meal (with tip b/c you tip at the counter before your food comes) cost $16 which felt like a complete ripoff. I could have prepared something better than this at home for much less. Everything that went into the meal seemed cheap and haphazard. Maybe we caught them on a bad day but I will not be back.Side note: my friend had to send back her eggs and bacon because the plate was full of grease and the fruit looked like it had been sitting out for days. They offered a free pastry to make up for it on our way out but nothing sounded appetizing at that point.If you're in the area for brunch, do yourself a favor and just go to bongo room, it's so much better.

55.description: Getting to Little Branch Cafe can be a huge pain when you are walking in 12 degree weather and the wind is beating your face like you stole something....HOWEVER, the food (red velvet waffle) is worth it. Little Branch Cafe has a great brunch/lunch menu which overs a variety of options that I'm sure even the pickest of eaters could find something to their liking.The red velvet waffle is sweet and tasty. You only get one, but if it can fill me it than you should be good.The apple maple chicken sausage weren't that good. I don't know how one can mess up chicken sausage, but they succeeded. They should stop purchasing their chicken sausages from whatever store they get them from and hit up Trader Joe's.Home fries were could, but just needed a little bite more seasoning to really knock my socks off.

9.description: Little Branch Café is a quaint café that is tucked away in a small neighborhood, off the main roads.  If you don't live in the area, then parking may be an issue.  There is meter parking about 3-4 blocks away on the main streets, so prepare for a little walk.  This café is part of an apartment complex, so there seem to have a lot of locals' chit chatting with each other or busily working away on their computers.When you first walk in, you will be greeted with huge colorful chalkboards with their specials and drinks.  I decided to try out the cinnabon, breakfast burrito, and a green tea latte.  The cinnabon was hard as a rock when I tried to cut into it.  I would expect them to have at least offered to heat the cinnabon back up so it could be soft, warm, and gooey.  But I had to go through rolled eyes, dirty looks, and some attitude to get it heated back up.  The breakfast burrito was a pretty decent size.  It was wrapped in a flour tortilla and filled with scrambled eggs, avocado, beans, Chihuahua cheese, pico de gallo, and bacon.  It also came with a side of fruits and chili cream.  I enjoyed all the different flavors and texture.  The winner of the meal was the green tea latte.  It was hot, foamy, and full of matcha flavor.  The food here was decent (nothing too great to make me want to come back,) but the service was horrible.  All the employees were not really friendly and had nasty attitudes.  I just don't understand why people were in such a bad mood...maybe something in the air, but I don't think I will be dining in anymore.

26.description: Items Selected:Cinnamon RollBlueberry SconeChocolate Chip CookieMascarpone Stuffed French Toast - 4 slices of brioche stuffed with mascarpone, grilled and topped with blueberry compoteSelected largely as a result of its proximity to Burnham Harbor my second breakfast on the Saturday of my sister's wedding saw me seated at a tiny two-top inside Little Branch Café, an unassuming little place next-door to an organic dry-cleaner that surprisingly generated a steady stream of patrons throughout the course of my 45 minute stay.  Apparently present since 2007 and well known to residents of the South Loop, where destination dining is rare, it was just moments past 10:00am when I entered the snug space and with counter-service followed by self-seating the service was perfunctory at best - a four item order with item to be prepped by the kitchen while the rest were bagged despite my insistence that they were going to be enjoyed in house.  Presented with an empty plate and a plastic cup for water my first bites of Little Branch would come in the form of a thinly frosted cinnamon roll and proving far more doughy than the version from Brunch only a few bites were taken before the rest was set aside, my attention soon turning to a chocolate chip cookie that was good, if not memorable, followed by a still-warm scone that proved the best of the trio as pockets of fresh berries juxtaposed sugary pearls amidst a background built on butter.  To this point largely underwhelmed it was approximately twenty minutes after seating that my French Toast would arrive and although admirable in its sweetness even before adding maple syrup I couldn't help but find the description oversold - the 'four' pieces of brioche cut so thin that each 'sandwich' was no larger than a standard slice while a light smear of mascarpone offered no more texture or nuance than the pool of Crème Anglaise did by itself.

25.description: I had their breakfast burrito and it was terrible. My wife got some other equally bad egg dish. I have heard great things about this place and will try it again.

12.description: I've been here a bunch of times over the past 5 plus years or so. They were definitely better when they only served breakfast. Today's food was less than stellar. It sounded grest via description but the flavor was missing. I don't know if they changed ownership or chefs recently but it is definitely not what it was 2 yrs ago. Great location. Warm decor. Probably stick to drinks.

59.description: LBC is in my neighborhood and super convenient especially on snowy days, rainy days, lazy days... you catch my drift!? It's a cute, chill, low key place to grab coffee or a bite to eat or a drink. I've been here numerous times for the two former reason, but I haven't come in the evening for a drink although they do have drink specials posted daily. It's also nice that they have free wi fi so you can come post up for a while and multitask. When the weather is nice (not like now... heavens no!) they have cute wooden stools and tables on the outside to sit down. I've had quick meetings out there before.

21.description: I wish there was a MINUS 5 stars available. Awful service. Or lack of it since you pick up the drinks yourself. Their omelette comes WITHOUT toast. If you ask for it they inform you about the $2 charge only when they bring it to the table. If you decide to skip it they'll charge you anyway. As I told the manager: I live in the building but they won't see my face again.

17.description: My boyfriend and I stopped in before we headed to a Bears game last Sunday. If you're headed to Solider Field it is a really close walk, which is nice. I got the prosciutto waffle sandwich. I was feeling wild, you know. I wasn't really sure how it was going to turn out because it seems like the flavors wouldn't work together. I was very happily surprised. It was very tasty. The waffle wasn't so sweet that it took over the flavor of the rest of the sandwich. My guy got the turkey Rueben and it was pretty tasty as well. I was happier with my order because his little sandwich just fell apart in his hands. I got a coffee and it was just fine. I'm not going to give it more praise than that because it was just a cup of coffee. He got a hot toddy and was all about it.  I was super bummed with the sides. If you have those tasty sandwiches, having a sad little pile of Lays potato chips on the side was just underwhelming. I expected a bit more from the taste of the sandwich. It's a little odd when you walk in. You walk in to a pastry counter, but you don't order there. There's a giant chalk board with their menu on on it. We didn't know if we were supposed to sit, if we ordered up front, or what? It was just odd. We walked in to a crowd of other people who didn't really seem to understand what was going on either. You order sort of around the corner and then they bring some things to you and other things they just hand you...? I don't know, maybe I'm being a baby about it but it seemed a lot harder than it really should have been. I didn't like how I was treated when I was in. We both got treated like we were stupid when we asked if we were meant to order up front or sit first. I get that they were busy, but rudeness isn't okay. I also HATED being scolded by the waitress. She brought us a hot toddy and said "Where's your number?" I didn't have a clue what she was talking about. She said "You HAVE to have a number." And I said I didn't have one and she rolled her eyes and went and got me one. I don't understand why I got in trouble for your weird system falling apart. Don't scold me. There's no need to ever be mean, especially in the morning, so I left with a bad taste in my mouth. All in all it was fine. The tasty sandwich saved this from being a 2-star review because of the treatment and the confusion. Convenient for a Bears game but I won't be back. I'll walk a few more blocks to be treated nicely.

10.description: Overall, the food was pretty good. Not many complaints about that. However, they were not very busy and this is two times in a row I've been there and everything has been dirty. There's been trash coming out of the trash cans, the tables have been dirty, the chairs of been dirty.this place has a good location and a good ambiance . It just needs a little bit more order in their kitchen and their operations.

5.description: So I'll preference this rating that it may be move up once I try more items on the menu. The location itself is a little hidden, but easy to find to those that live in the neighborhood. My friend just got a condo across the street so this maybe our spot to come to grab something quick to eat.Last night we went to just pick up our food cause we had to run. I had the chicken breast sandwich that included either fries, sweet potato fries or a salad. I went with the salad cause I already ate horrible earlier. The sandwich wasn't horrible but it tasted like something I could whip up real fast at the deli. I did enjoy the garlic mayo though. Salad was okay but nothing spectacular. I look forward to going back and trying them for brunch...oh yeah and there dessert selection.

3.description: Marscapone stuffed French toast is amazing. This cafe is wonderful if a little hit or miss. The cafe is not well organized and at times chaotic. That aside this is a great spot in the south loop!

35.description: Very cosy! Loved to have breakfast here! The omelette is delightful...  Would come more often if i lived here!

19.description: First visit to Little Branch after living in the South Loop for almost two years and it's great to have another breakfast/lunch spot in the neighborhood.  Staff is friendly and the setup is decent.When it came to the food, it was just okay.  My prosciutto & mozzarella panini was good but the balsamic vinaigrette was too overpowering and took over the entire sandwich.  My partner had the ham & swiss and liked it but once again, felt the mustard overpowered the sandwich.My biggest gripe was that the place needed a good dusting and sweeping.  The window ledges had not been dusted for a while and they were looking "fuzzy".  The floor between the window and column was littered with straw wrappers and dust.  The lamp shades could've used a once over with a swiffer.  It may sound trivial but people notice these things and the overall look & upkeep of the restaurant is just as important as the food.  I may be back but I'm not gonna rush.

28.description: used to come here all the time on dates when they first opened and i had a significant other in Printer's Row a lifetime ago...we would wake up late, take a leisurely stroll thru Grant park as the leaves changed, and enjoy a cupcake on LBC's beautiful patio while the world went by.  they were perfect, and always reminded me why Chicago was the city i would move back to when I could.i finally live across the street from Little Branch and the magic of everything else is still there, even if my paramour is not...except this once lovely cafe now hosts some of the most disinterested staff in the US, has replaced their delicious pastries with a menu that consistently over-promises and under-delivers, and always has long waits for reasons i will never understand

45.description: I don't know what everyone is talking about. The staff was so sweet and the good was delicious. It was a super comfortable casual environment to sit and get some work done.

33.description: I previously enjoyed Little Branch Cafe and recommended it to others.  However, it has unfortunately gone down hill.  After waiting FORTY minutes for our food today, we were very disappointed.  For that amount of time and the quality of food, Scout down the street would have easily been a better choice.A) The cash register associate specifically told me there is no other vodka available except what goes in the Bloody Mary.  When at the bar waiting to receive said Bloody Mary, there is clearly a call vodka - Belvedere Bloody Mary vodka that is an option.B) Do not advertise brioche bread for French Toast if you are using plain white bread.C) Not once did we complain about the amount of wait time (as others did) assuming that when our food came out it would be quality.  Not so.  My French Toast had merely been slapped on the grill to give it a brown color rather than actually cooked in French Toast style.  Overall, after previously enjoying this cafe, we will no longer be going here.

43.description: The concept is great and welcome in the neighborhood. However, it is very pricey for the product. The smoothies are great and the food is good but the price isn't warranted. My biggest gripe is that there are "no special orders". If you don't want bacon on your egg sandwich it's a huge deal.Who cares? And what if you are a vegetarian? I would definitely avoid if you have any special needs when it comes to food because they can't be bothered. Ever heard of the customer is always right?

2.description: I have been to Little Branch several times, and each time, I walk in saying, "Maybe this time I'll actually like what I eat."  Unfortunately, my aspirations notwithstanding, I cannot yet make that representation.  If you enjoy not-fresh breakfast options (the vaunted French toast that I ordered this morning tasted like it had once been frozen, and the "blueberry compote" was just a mountain of thawed blueberries), stale pastries, and not-that-good coffee drinks--all offered at a really cute and convenient location with free [really slow] wifi, then this is definitely your place.  I honestly don't understand why this place keeps getting featured by local publications as an inspired breakfast option, when there are so many places (close by!) that are far far better.  Perhaps if they cut their menu in half and really focused on making fresh, made-to-order food; completely switched up their vendor for their pastry selection (or made their own homemade baked goods); got rid of the tragic looking gelato section in front; and used better coffee beans, this place would the standout that it has the potential to be.  In the meantime, it'll limp along, propped up by reviews of questionable credibility...

18.description: Loved the food! I had the french toast (original) and it was delicious and needed no syrup, great, thick cut bacon and a mimosa. The gentleman who rang us up was very friendly and helpful in picking out his favorites (he was so right about the french toast). The woman there was less than polite and I imagine is the same grouch others spoke of in their reviews - she's the only reason for the 4 stars instead of 5. I'll be back for sure.

41.description: We absolutely LOVE Little Branch Cafe. Living in the South Loop, we don't have too many options for brunch or even good coffee drinks. This "hidden gem" is now our go-to place for delicious lattes, breakfast, lunch, you name it! Not to mention, the atmosphere is laid back and comfortable, and service is always great! Food is very well priced and always includes fresh ingredients (not a greasy spoon like some other brunch places). Whenever we have family visit we always take a walk to Little Branch; they love it just as much as we do! Thank you Little Branch!

52.description: Had the LBC burger, done perfectly! And they had a water service with cucumber infused water that was awesome. My fiancé had the crab po boy and enjoyed it very much. The atmosphere was casual and had light jazz playing that wasn't so loud it would overwhelm the conversation, but was loud enough to cover some of the chatter from other diners. Would recommend this place.

50.description: Live across the street....used to love their food, last two times, food quality poor. Scrambled eggs were like the kind you get free from hotels out of carton. Toasted bread soggy. My wife has been there a few times, giving them benefit of doubt, same issue with food

4.description: Great cafe in the heart of the south loop. Relaxing atmosphere and cozy dining. The wood log bar stools give you the feeling of being in a cabin out in the mountains. Great food and great service. Two thumbs up!

6.description: We ordered the Pancake and Mascarpone Stuffed French Toast. The French Toast was FANTASTIC!!! My boyfriend ordered it for me, so I didn't know there was some filling in it. But when I had the first bite, I was amazed by the texture. I will definitely visit again for this must-have French toast.

22.description: I go here all the time, absolutely recommend the Snow White Omlette, it's divine! The smoothies are pretty good too! My only issues are that there's no parking (not even street parking) and depending on which chef is working depends on how good the food is. But even when it's not it's best, it's pretty good. A little overpriced though.

15.description: Not worth it, unless you're desperate. Drinks are a lie, food is a ripoff, expensive. Take your money elsewhere.

57.description: Stopped in here on our way to the museums.  As others have said it's hard to find but well worth the effort.  You order at the counter before sitting down.  Food was great, portions were large, service was fast.  We got the breakfast burrito, prosciutto waffle sandwich, coffee, and a bloody marry. I'll be recommending this place to friends and going there again.

20.description: After five years of patronizing this place I think I've had my last visit. From the beginning, the owner and lots of the (ever-rotating) staff were very rude. This has continued throughout the years but I, like many in my neighborhood, frequented Little Branch because it was the only Café and restaurant in the prairie district, and because the menu is really good (when executed properly in the kitchen). Well, the good coffee/food isn't worth the bad service. Here are a few things that happened and you can call it for yourself.1. I wanted a half-caff small coffee when I was preggo and they made me purchase 2 small coffees (one caffeinated and one decaf) that I could mix together myself. I'd understand if they brewed each cup individually, but we're talking pre-brewed carafe's here, so why all the extra ridiculousness?2. I ordered a hot panini that included roast beef, cheddar, horseradish and pickled onions. It came without the onions or cheese- the bread was hot and the roast beef was as cold as the refrigerator. When I asked the waitress if the order could be fixed, she brought me out some raw red onions and a cold piece of cheese on a plate.3. The owner is rude. 4. I ordered a latte that was supposed to come with 3 shots of syrup. I only wanted 2, but wanted one shot of vanilla and one of blueberry. The owner rang up each part of the drink a la carte-totaling more than $2 in excess of the listed price. I figured it was a mistake, but when she tried to justify charging me almost 2 extra dollars for my latte, I realized that some major logic was being lost. It was at the point when she raised her voice to a disrespectful "Do you want it or not?!", that I decided not to come back. 5. Refer to #3. I give this place a2 star rating because the food can be good, and the coffee is good. The gelato is always chewy and gross from too much thawing and freezing.  There are more incidences, but I've made my point.

36.description: So I'll preference this rating that it may be move up once I try more items on the menu. The location itself is a little hidden, but easy to find to those that live in the neighborhood. My friend just got a condo across the street so this maybe our spot to come to grab something quick to eat.Last night we went to just pick up our food cause we had to run. I had the chicken breast sandwich that included either fries, sweet potato fries or a salad. I went with the salad cause I already ate horrible earlier. The sandwich wasn't horrible but it tasted like something I could whip up real fast at the deli. I did enjoy the garlic mayo though. Salad was okay but nothing spectacular. I look forward to going back and trying them for brunch...oh yeah and there dessert selection.

14.description: I am fortunate to have the Little Branch literally steps out of my front door.  I moved to the south loop a year ago and was delighted to find this place so close. This is a great place on a few fronts. I can be found most days sitting with doing some work in the morning enjoying my green tea. The staff is always super friendly.  Love the food - that which I've tried. I don't eat gluten/sugar so most of the menu is off limits to me but I do have my favorites. Spicy Tuna w/sea weed salad is great - as is the Spicy Tuna sandwich minus the roll.  My fav though is the Lox plate sans bagel. The salmon is always fresh but it's the pickled onions (ya I know pickled onions) that really make it for me.  The Little Branch has quickly become my second home.

28.description: I went to Basia again after setting up a correction appointment with the owner, Basia. She kept the salon open late for me, personally explained the circumstances behind my stylist's rescheduling and did not rush on my hair. She listened to what I wanted and not only did the color come out beautifully, but she took the time to style my hair perfectly since I was headed for a night out after my hair appointment (which was so appreciated and extremely considerate of her!). She did not charge me for these services and she was extremely polite and professional. I fully intend to return to Basia Salon for future highlights and cuts. My hair turned out so well, she took pictures for her portfolio! I am EXTREMELY HAPPY with my hair now and I have Basia to thank for that!Based on my combined experiences at Basia, I advise future clients to not only bring pictures, but also to write down in extremely specific detail what you want so your personal vision for your hair is as well articulated as possible.

1.description: I'm giving this one star because I can't give it 0. My daughter is, as I type, having her hair "fixed" after Jasmine gave her the worst ombre coloring I have ever seen. I would have been better off buying the ombre kit at Target. My daughter also has an eyebrow threading scheduled- there is NO WAY I would let Jasmine touch her eyebrows after this. Now I will have to pay probably close to $200 to have our old stylist (we moved to Chicago from the suburbs recently) fix her hair, which is absolutely fried from bleaching, coloring & re-coloring. There is no way I will be relinquishing the Groupon to this business, and I can only hope Groupon will refund my money.When I called a little while ago I had the absolute pleasure (sarcasm) of speaking to Olga, who indicated that she was a manager. She explained to me that Jasmine was "fixing" my daughter's hair. The fact that she admitted it was being "fixed" is admittance enough to the horrible job that was done. WHen I informed her I wasn't paying, she became belligerent. TERRIFIC customer service. WOW. Never again. Avoid this place like the plague. I only hope I can upload pictures of the nightmare that is my daughter's hair.

39.description: Love, love, love this salon. It is a hidden gem in the lower level of the Hilton Hotel. The owner, Basia, has been my stylist for many years (always a fabulous cut & color). I will be a client 4-life!

9.description: What a great experience!  I came here on a whim after buying a Groupon Now! Deal ($95 for a haircut and highlights). Basia was nice enough to make an appointment for me at 7:30PM (even though that meant I would be closing the place out with a 2-hour process). In addition to the highlights, Sam (the stylist) suggested for my roots to be dyed too since my hair was lighter on the bottom due to previous dyeing.Sam worked efficiently and precisely.  He was very friendly and made me feel at ease.  I have naturally stick straight dark brown hair, which he turned into a wavy rich medium brown w/ caramel highlights.  Sam gave me layers to add body to my hair as well as side bangs that swept across my forehead.  He kept the length of my hair long, and the cut was exactly what I asked for. In short, my hair looks amazing!  I haven't had highlights for years, but after this experience I definitely plan on coming back again and doing it all over again. My hair just looks so shiny, full and SEXY!  I definitely recommend this place to anyone!

29.description: The best Brazilian Wax in town! Go to Marta! Ive been seeing Marta for a couple years now and she does waxes along with amazing facials!

23.description: I got a haircut and higlight deal from groupon for $95, so i thought, why not?  They had availability that afternoon so timing was extremely convenient.  Finding the place was a bit of a challenge as they are in the basement of a hotel.  The salon needs a facelift, but if you go in with the attitude that you are getting a good deal, the glitz and glam aren't needed...I got my hair cut and highlighted with Sam, who was really nice.  However, I felt not attentive.  I have gotten higlights many times before... and he seemed to have left the highlights in for a rather long time.  As i was waiting someone else came in to get a blow dry last minute. While i patiently waited, 5 minutes turned into 20+ minutes.  At one point I had to interupt their conversation and remind Sam that I still needed tending to.  The highlights didn't turn out as even as i had hoped (i don't like the chunky look and even after mentioning it, his resassurance proved inadequate).  The haircut was great, but I don't think i will return.  But then again... i only paid $95 - so what could i expect?  I would only go if you needed a last minute fix and you got a deal.

5.description: I still go to Marta regularly for my waxes and she has been the best aesthetician I've come across. I recommend her to all of my north-side living friends and she is worth the trek to the South Loop.

31.description: I went here last month after getting a Groupon for a cut and highlights and it was terrible! I had to spend over $200 dollars and 3 hours getting my hair fixed the next day at my regular salon (Red Door Spa). First of all, the place was hard to find, no signs or anything, and then it was in the basement and looked like a cheap place from the 80's. I had made an appointment and there were no other customers but I still had to wait forever to get started. I should have left by now, hind sight is 20/20. When they can finally be bothered to get to me the guy talks me into getting low lights for an additional cost. There's no music playing or any separation between stylists stations so when another customer came in I had to spend an hour listening to his entire conversation about back waxing and breaking up with his girlfriend. When everything was finished, at first I thought it looked good. I blame this on the terrible fluorescent lighting because it wasn't until I got home and my boyfriend looked at me horrified and asked why my hair was gray that I could see my "highlights" were bleach blonde and the "low lights"  were big BLACK streaks! I have red hair, WHITE and BLACK are NOT highlights and low lights! I had to go to my regular salon the very next morning and spend over $200 dollars and 3 hours having them fix my hair. I was also informed that they never should have offered me low lights, those are only used when someone has had a lot of past highlights and they need to even your hair  tones back out some. He just wanted to get more money from me. I do not recommend this salon, I can't believe there are so many good reviews on here for them. The atmosphere and their work is awful.

25.description: Marta is the best waxer ever! So fast and virtually pain-free. They run good deals, too. Don't waste your time at the other south loop salons. This place is no frills - not fancy and sort of hard to find in the basement of the Hilton. But, well worth it.

12.description: I went to Basia again after setting up a correction appointment with the owner, Basia. She kept the salon open late for me, personally explained the circumstances behind my stylist's rescheduling and did not rush on my hair. She listened to what I wanted and not only did the color come out beautifully, but she took the time to style my hair perfectly since I was headed for a night out after my hair appointment (which was so appreciated and extremely considerate of her!). She did not charge me for these services and she was extremely polite and professional. I fully intend to return to Basia Salon for future highlights and cuts. My hair turned out so well, she took pictures for her portfolio! I am EXTREMELY HAPPY with my hair now and I have Basia to thank for that!Based on my combined experiences at Basia, I advise future clients to not only bring pictures, but also to write down in extremely specific detail what you want so your personal vision for your hair is as well articulated as possible.

37.description: Great place, awesome stylists and welcoming atmosphere. I have been going there for over 10 years to do my highlights as well as cuts. Basia, the owner helped me so much with chosing the color and style every time I was there. She always finds time for you even though she is booked every day.Beside good service, people who work there are very nice and proffesional.I will be back ;-)

21.description: In San Diego I have been going to the same woman for over 10 years and when I moved to Chicago, I was convinced that I would never find anyone just as fabulous as her, I think I've found my match, his name is Sam and he works at Basia's! I went in for partial highlights, low lights and a cut and couldn't be happier with all three services. I told Sam I wanted my highlights chunky but classy and tasteful, he also suggested my lowlight color be a little warmer than my natural color. Do you ever see a woman with the most beautiful and healthy hair that has not a strand out of place and think she must have spent a fortune on her hair? Thanks to Sam, I'm that woman now! And I didn't have to spend a fortune on it. I was checking out hair of the other women in the salon and they all had beautiful, classy, tasteful, and expensive looking hair. It is quite clear that everyone at Basia's knows what they are doing. If you want a timeless look, go to Basia's and you will leave looking like a million bucks! I can't wait for my next appointment with Sam!

16.description: I have been going to Basia to get my hair cut and colored for a couple of years now and wouldn't dream of going anywhere else.  I stumbled upon Basia when I was in a last minute, dire need of having my roots done and she made time to squeeze me in.  It was love at first dye.  I went back a month later for a hair cut and it was exactly what I asked for.  Not only is she very skilled with hair services, but she is also very warm and welcoming.  She is also very accommodating with her schedule.  Her salon is hidden in the lower level of the Hilton Towers and isn't going to wow you aesthetically (it is very simple and humble), but when I think of how many times I walked into a high end salon with all the bells and whistles to set a perfect ambiance, only to end up leaving with a so-so haircut/color and next month's rent check halfway spent....I am a faithful customer here for a reason and if you're looking for somewhere great to go downtown for hair services that will leave you smiling and at a cost that won't break the bank, this should be your one and only choice.

17.description: What a hidden gem!  I work in the South Loop, and really wanted to get a haircut on my lunch break.  I have not had good luck with a few other South Loop salons, so I went searching around on Yelp before heading out.  Basia Hair Design didn't have many reviews, but they were all 5 stars, so I thought I would check it out.It's a bit tricky to find.  You have to go down into the basement of the Hilton.  But it's well worth it.  The space is pretty bare bones.  No fancy lighting or elaborate stations.  But the staff there clearly knows what they're doing.  I was able to walk right in and get a great haircut from Olga.  She did exactly what I wanted and helped me think about how I might cut my hair after it grows a bit more.  She was super meticulous.  I will definitely be back.

10.description: i have been Basia's customer for about 3 years. i first dealt with Sam for my highlights and base color, then when he left, she took over and did what i would call an overall good job (ok, had to go back a few times to remove some orangey parts). That means spending $210 every about 45 days (calculate the total spent there), in addition to keratin treatments & occasional trims. i think she is among the most expensive salons in chicago, but no money is spent on improving the salon's appearance. It looks very basic. it was nice to feel treated like a guest and be able to schedule easily. We always had a very friendly relationship, not really a stylist/customer one. Unfortunately it ended in a very unpleasant way for me. My last visit was extremely stressful, as i could feel negative vibes from her, and it was similar during the previous visit....45 days earlier. So both times were unpleasant. When i asked her what was wrong, why she was stressed, she kept saying she was fine. She was coughing and her voice wasn't clear. i wanted to check if she was sick to protect myself, she flat out said "NO, i am NOT sick. i am in PERFECT health". She kept coughing over my face all the time, including during the shampooing. i thought "okay, looks like she IS sick after all, and that i will be contaminated". The visit was long, and When i briefly expressed my frustration with the fact that my stylist was taking out her bad mood on me, i got yelled at in a sort of a blow up / nervous breakdown where she said she was "worried about" (something that i won't disclose here). So i was right from the start that something was wrong. To be honest, i was shocked to find myself in this truly awkward, uncomfortable and unpleasant situation and have to endure 1 more hour of negative vibes there. i didn't say anything, and even though i empathize with her issue, it does NOT justify yelling at your customer and acting stressed out all the way TWICE in a row. After all, she is not doing me a favor, i am paying BIG bucks for those visits. i was stupid enough to leave a tip but was in a rush to get out once and for all...with a 1.5 INCH chunk of platinum/yellow hair on the top of my head and copper orange on each side when i had insisted i wanted to get away from the chunky look. When i pay $210, i expect a better job. Here is the "scoop": the very next morning i woke up with throat ache, mucus, all over body aches and a runny nose and am still struggling with it, and struggling to work. If i had not been contaminated by Basia who was careless and unprofessional enough to cough around customers and make them sick while denying she is sick, i would not have updated this review. i remember i had a 70+ year old Esthetician long time ago whose husband was literally dying from cancer and who was always incredibly professional and nice everytime, even after he passed away....We all have worries in our lives, and when i go there i have my own worries too, and you do too. it does NOT justify taking them out on your customers, ESPECIALLY a long time one. This is just entitled, spoiled behavior. When you are unable to deal with stress and work at the same time, you stay at home. When you are SICK, you wear something to cover your mouth or you inform your customer, or you stay at home. This is all just so unprofessional and ridiculous. But there are many hair salons in chicago to choose from.

11.description: Went here based on the stunning reviews. Had an O.K. experience. The ambiance was lacking, the tone and feel of the place very unprofessional, but the lady who cut my hair (Olga?) was kind and took her time, albeit cutting my hair a little too short. Oh well, hair grows back. Glad I gave it a shot, but I won't be coming back.

26.description: I have to say that I love this place!! My main reason for visiting was because my "Rock Star" aesthetician, Marta, joined the staff. Once I walked in, I feel in love. The staff is friendly and knowledgeble. You're greeted the moment you walk in; you don't have to wait forever before you're seen.And if you're in need of a good waxing, have no fear, Marta is here! Hands down (no pun intended!!), Marta is the best when it comes to your waxing needs. She makes you feel comfortable, and is totally fantastic at what she does. I've been going to her for years, and I wouldn't even consider going to anyone else. This place is great! Convenient location, excellent prices, 5 star service!

27.description: I usually stick to one stylist but she burned my hair and then cut it like an ugly birds nest with too many sticks on one side, so I had no choice but to sever the relationship. Heartbroken and ticked off, I went on hair strike and waited too long to get a highlight and cut.  My hair was droopy and ugly and I was as stubborn as my fuddy father is in going to the doctor. I am always leery of going to a new salon but I knew the day would come when I needed to look like a human being again. I took a chance, bought a groupon and I am soooo glad I did. I had really good luck. Among the other reviews here, I am going to add another great review for Sam. I explained what I wanted, got what I wanted and walked out feeling like a million bucks in under 2 hrs. The best thing about this place is their flexibility. I felt like if I asked them if I could come in for an updo for a surprise ball gown function, they would stick around just to help me, without question. They just want to be there for their customers, hopefully gaining repeats. I will be one of them. AND Basia is a quirky host and Prince Jordan her little old-guy rescue Yorkie is ADORBS. He scuttles around following her like a little guard slash supervisor. I LOVE HIM. Thanks.

35.description: What a hidden gem!  I work in the South Loop, and really wanted to get a haircut on my lunch break.  I have not had good luck with a few other South Loop salons, so I went searching around on Yelp before heading out.  Basia Hair Design didn't have many reviews, but they were all 5 stars, so I thought I would check it out.It's a bit tricky to find.  You have to go down into the basement of the Hilton.  But it's well worth it.  The space is pretty bare bones.  No fancy lighting or elaborate stations.  But the staff there clearly knows what they're doing.  I was able to walk right in and get a great haircut from Olga.  She did exactly what I wanted and helped me think about how I might cut my hair after it grows a bit more.  She was super meticulous.  I will definitely be back.

8.description: Used a Groupon and booked an appointment with Jasmine.  She listened and did exactly what I was looking for.  The highlights look very good and the cut was very professional.  It was a very good experience and I'd recommend them.

0.description: I have to say that I love this place!! My main reason for visiting was because my "Rock Star" aesthetician, Marta, joined the staff. Once I walked in, I feel in love. The staff is friendly and knowledgeble. You're greeted the moment you walk in; you don't have to wait forever before you're seen.And if you're in need of a good waxing, have no fear, Marta is here! Hands down (no pun intended!!), Marta is the best when it comes to your waxing needs. She makes you feel comfortable, and is totally fantastic at what she does. I've been going to her for years, and I wouldn't even consider going to anyone else. This place is great! Convenient location, excellent prices, 5 star service!

38.description: I recently went in for a hair cut and style after buying a Groupon Now deal.  I have really thick, curly hair, so usually when I get it cut, it looks awesome when I leave the salon, but I can never get it to look that good myself.  I'll spend over an hour blow drying and going over it with a flat iron, and I still look like a triangle head.But alas!  Bashia gave me a haircut that actually works with my hair!  She layered and thinned just right, so that I can spend a half hour blow drying and it looks good!  The haircut was about a month ago and I'm still able to re-create the look.  I've honestly not sure what she did different, but she did tell me when I walked in that she loved thick hair...so maybe it's her specialty...who knows.I've very happy with my hair cut and will return in a few months!  Only thing I didn't like was that it was downstairs in the Hilton, kind of hidden away, so it took me several minutes to find the place.  But if you have a better sense of direction than I do (which is basically everyone in the world), you'll find it no problem.

20.description: Went here based on the stunning reviews. Had an O.K. experience. The ambiance was lacking, the tone and feel of the place very unprofessional, but the lady who cut my hair (Olga?) was kind and took her time, albeit cutting my hair a little too short. Oh well, hair grows back. Glad I gave it a shot, but I won't be coming back.

19.description: I recently went in for a hair cut and style after buying a Groupon Now deal.  I have really thick, curly hair, so usually when I get it cut, it looks awesome when I leave the salon, but I can never get it to look that good myself.  I'll spend over an hour blow drying and going over it with a flat iron, and I still look like a triangle head.But alas!  Bashia gave me a haircut that actually works with my hair!  She layered and thinned just right, so that I can spend a half hour blow drying and it looks good!  The haircut was about a month ago and I'm still able to re-create the look.  I've honestly not sure what she did different, but she did tell me when I walked in that she loved thick hair...so maybe it's her specialty...who knows.I've very happy with my hair cut and will return in a few months!  Only thing I didn't like was that it was downstairs in the Hilton, kind of hidden away, so it took me several minutes to find the place.  But if you have a better sense of direction than I do (which is basically everyone in the world), you'll find it no problem.

33.description: I went to Basia for the first time today and couldn't have been more pleased with the cut and style Sam gave me.  Definitely my new go-to stylist.

2.description: My stylist Jasmine was VERY sweet and skilled. My coarse Ainu hair cannot be tamed but she did an amazing job. I was staying at Essex Inn across the street for my friend's wedding weekend and needed help with bridesmaid hair. Very convenient place to get done up for a wedding in the loop. I would give her handiwork 4.5 stars -- I did the other bridesmaids' hair myself but my own hair is very difficult.What detracts from the very positive results was the very unpleasant experience with owner Basia. When I had booked the appointment I explained I was looking to spend no more than $60 and they said they would take care of me and give me a good deal. But of course when the services were finished she wanted me to pay $80, not including tip. When I wanted to use a Yelp deal to offset that she added a restriction and said that the deal was only valid for Chicago residents and that I could not use it. I was in a rush to stick to the wedding day-of schedule so I just sucked it up. But it was pretty lame to feel misled and ripped off.

34.description: If I could hire anybody to be my daily stylist, it would be Sam. He listened to my ideas about what I thought I needed, he gave me suggestions, and then followed through in execution and made my hair so much more beautiful than I imagined. I love my cut, highlights, and the entire experience. Next to walking out feeling beautiful, I love getting my scalp massaged and hair washed. And let me tell you... I think I might come back JUST to get my hair washed. It was the best shampoo of my life! No joke! And then he proceeded by blowing out my hair to perfection. The salon is modest, but I will trade that for the wonderful service that I received. No rushing, pretentious attitudes, or lack of cleanliness here. Sam's great personality is backed by his 20 years of experience, and I will definitely be going back.

32.description: I got the groupon now for highlights and cut and Sam did a great job! It's not hard to find there's even a sign when you walk into the Hilton. I appreciated the fact that they got me in right away and I didn't spend 4 hours in there. Sam works fast and great. Also there are no hidden fee's, he told me right away it was going to be extra $40 for low lights and asked if I still wanted them. Great place all around, and Jordan is a cute little dog that comes with Basia!

18.description: A hidden little gem!  In addition to Yelp deals, they run Groupon Now deals fairly regularly - it's so easy to get a last minute appointment and they do a good job.

41.description: Nestled in the lower level of the Hilton is a sweet spot where I just went to get a great haircut. A South Loop gem-walking distance from so many places. My hair cut is as good or better than the ones I've gotten at the  super expensive salons on the Gold Coast. Basia, the owner and my stylist, gave time and ideas as we consulted about the look I was hoping to achieve. She is meticulous, professional and talented. The shop isn't fancy-schmancy like the chrome and glass glossy salons who are filled with young stylists just learning their craft-ON YOU! Basia is seasoned but very contemporary-my hair is just perfect!

13.description: I went to Basia a couple months ago with a groupon for partial highlights and haircut. She was AMAZING! I showed her a couple pictures on my phone of how I wanted my highlights to look and she totally followed what I showed her. These highlights have lasted longer and looked fresher months later than anywhere else I have gone. I'm finally going to call to make another appointment but I know I'll be in good hands with Basia.

4.description: I had a groupon and made an appointment with Jasmine. My partial highlights and cut turned out wonderful and the best part, I was in and out in just an hour and a half! I highly recommend Jasmine as a stylist. She is sweet and really tries hard to do exactly what the client wants. I took a risk and got my eyebrows threaded by her too. Oh my. It was painful but so worth it. My unmanaged eyebrows are asymmetrical with more hair on one side than the other. This usually trips waxers up but not her. The shape of my eyebrows turned out to be natural with just a little arch and both sides looking exactly the same. Just like I want them to be. :)

24.description: It is amazing and the price is reasonable! Highly recommended!

6.description: Terrible cut, layers look like my hair got chopped with a machete.They don't blend together. I will have to go somewhere else to fix this mess.Don't go there.

22.description: I got my nails done here for my wedding.  The owner did my manicure and pedicure herself, and they turned out great. She was even able to salvage the nail I broke about a week before.  I tend to destroy manicures in no time flat, and I didn't get a single chip for nearly a week, and they still looked OK two weeks later.  The pedicure has held up for over a month now. Negative points though because I told her I needed to be back in my hotel room by a certain time to meet my makeup artist and I had to leave her waiting in the lobby for 15 minutes because my appointment ran long.  Also, at $85, it was a little more than I'm used to paying for a mani-pedi.

15.description: Ok I didn't actually go to this salon but I did enquire about their waxing services (which are listed on their website and there are other reviews about these services on Yelp....) So looking at the positive reviews I phoned them up. The woman who picked up the phone promptly told me they are just a hair salon! So FYI fellow yelpers - just in case you are looking for a Spa - maybe this just isn't the place!

40.description: I have been going to Basia to get my hair cut and colored for a couple of years now and wouldn't dream of going anywhere else.  I stumbled upon Basia when I was in a last minute, dire need of having my roots done and she made time to squeeze me in.  It was love at first dye.  I went back a month later for a hair cut and it was exactly what I asked for.  Not only is she very skilled with hair services, but she is also very warm and welcoming.  She is also very accommodating with her schedule.  Her salon is hidden in the lower level of the Hilton Towers and isn't going to wow you aesthetically (it is very simple and humble), but when I think of how many times I walked into a high end salon with all the bells and whistles to set a perfect ambiance, only to end up leaving with a so-so haircut/color and next month's rent check halfway spent....I am a faithful customer here for a reason and if you're looking for somewhere great to go downtown for hair services that will leave you smiling and at a cost that won't break the bank, this should be your one and only choice.

7.description: Had a GREAT experience here when in Chicago for business trip. Desperately needed some hair repair as color applies few days earlier did not match and left me wanting to hide from my colleagues. The stylist took time and effort to rematch my color and then did a gorgeous blowout. I was very nervous about final cost but was very reasonable - given all the work she did. Would definitely recommend.

36.description: What a great experience!  I came here on a whim after buying a Groupon Now! Deal ($95 for a haircut and highlights). Basia was nice enough to make an appointment for me at 7:30PM (even though that meant I would be closing the place out with a 2-hour process). In addition to the highlights, Sam (the stylist) suggested for my roots to be dyed too since my hair was lighter on the bottom due to previous dyeing.Sam worked efficiently and precisely.  He was very friendly and made me feel at ease.  I have naturally stick straight dark brown hair, which he turned into a wavy rich medium brown w/ caramel highlights.  Sam gave me layers to add body to my hair as well as side bangs that swept across my forehead.  He kept the length of my hair long, and the cut was exactly what I asked for. In short, my hair looks amazing!  I haven't had highlights for years, but after this experience I definitely plan on coming back again and doing it all over again. My hair just looks so shiny, full and SEXY!  I definitely recommend this place to anyone!

30.description: I needed a haircut BAD and found a special Basia was having a special so I decided to go for it- though risking going to a salon I knew nothing about. It was tricky to find at first, being in the basement of the Hilton, but I was very pleased once I found it and was finished. The staff was very friendly and welcoming, and Sam did amazing with my highlights and cut. Sometimes I spend up to 3 hours in a salon for a partial, hair cut and dry but Sam worked quickly and efficiently and I was out in about 2. They also take good care of their customers and always willing to do what is in the best interest for them - including offering competitive prices!

3.description: Pros:  Staff was very nice and accommodating.  Location was super convenient (we were staying at the Hilton - the salon is on the lower level).  I had a manicure, pedicure, and eyebrow threading.  All were fine.Cons:  My 7 year old daughter had polish applied to her fingernails and toes (not a full manicure/pedicure. Just polish).  It was $40 total for her.  $25 for polish on her teeny tiny toenails, and $15 for her itsy bitsy fingernails.

14.description: I got the groupon now for highlights and cut and Sam did a great job! It's not hard to find there's even a sign when you walk into the Hilton. I appreciated the fact that they got me in right away and I didn't spend 4 hours in there. Sam works fast and great. Also there are no hidden fee's, he told me right away it was going to be extra $40 for low lights and asked if I still wanted them. Great place all around, and Jordan is a cute little dog that comes with Basia!

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Perms, Extensions, Straight Perms, Coloring

58.description: New brewery in the South Loop is a great place to catch a Bears game or just catch up with friends over a good brew.  This place has a welcoming, neighborhood feeling where all the staff is welcoming and genuinely wants to get to know their customers.  They don't serve food, but allow you to bring in your own from local restaurants.  I got the beer flight, which was great for a beer newbie like me.  One of the owners came over and explained all the different brews to me and what made each one unique.  I liked 5 of the 6 and was so glad I got the flight so that I knew which one I liked most and would order again.  The bar had great picnic table seating and a bar area.  It also had tvs everywhere, which was perfect for watching a football game.  When I went the weather was great out, and the folding windows helped bring the great weather into the bar.  Definitely a great addition to the neighborhood and I'll be back!

56.description: This has quickly become my new favorite watering hole in the neighborhood, not just for their great beers, but for the friendly service, engaging owners, and laid back atmosphere. I'm not THE biggest beer girl in the world, but the Oregon-raised microbrew snob piece of me says that these are the real deal. Make sure to sample all with a flight - I'm a huge fan of the Pleasure Trip, and Everleigh, but the Porter takes the cake in my book. You want growlers? You got growlers. Reasonably priced (the growler itself is $5 for a 64oz, refills are $18ish), it's an excellent way to take Vice with you. TVs have gone in, providing a great spot for Sunday football. No food (aside from some jerky and a popcorn machine), but you can bring in your own. Perhaps it's because it takes me 3.2 seconds to get there from home, but this place rocks. Now if they could just fix those too-short bar stools (or too tall counters, whatever you prefer)...

29.description: I always mistakingly think this place is called Vice City. Because I'm clearly stuck on Playstation 2 games from 2003.Vice District was opened up by a couple of brothas. It shows because their bar is about neck-high to people of average height. So if you're a 6'7" NBA player, you'd be real comfortable sitting at this bar. I like Vice District. I don't love it. I almost said "I like VD", but that sounds wrong. Nobody likes that shit. I reckon.I want to go back, but not necessarily anytime soon. Clearly my feelings are mixed. They had a couple of good beers. Nothing spectacular. The service was unorganized, slow, but for the most part, friendly. Kind of a quirky place, but worth a try if you're into drinking beer from the source and trying to accrue the number of breweries visited.

42.description: Very nice taproom and brewery.  Very professional bartenders, friendly and the beer was pretty good too.  a few beers were out of stock when I was there but as they grow I'm sure the tap handles will remain full.  Excited to check them out again soon!

23.description: PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE Get different bar stools. The stools are unreasonably short and it feels like riding high handle bar motor cycle. It seriously takes away from the experience. With that said, the interior is awesome and the music is terrific. The beer is creative and unique.

47.description: Absolutely love this place! Great beer and super chill! The BEST thing about it is they allow dogs!!!! New favorite spot!

8.description: I always mistakingly think this place is called Vice City. Because I'm clearly stuck on Playstation 2 games from 2003.Vice District was opened up by a couple of brothas. It shows because their bar is about neck-high to people of average height. So if you're a 6'7" NBA player, you'd be real comfortable sitting at this bar. I like Vice District. I don't love it. I almost said "I like VD", but that sounds wrong. Nobody likes that shit. I reckon.I want to go back, but not necessarily anytime soon. Clearly my feelings are mixed. They had a couple of good beers. Nothing spectacular. The service was unorganized, slow, but for the most part, friendly. Kind of a quirky place, but worth a try if you're into drinking beer from the source and trying to accrue the number of breweries visited.

31.description: My friend and I each ordered a flight of beer - five 5oz pours.  A few of them were great, some of them weren't very good.  I asked our server if I could switch out the ones I didn't like with a new pour.  She replied that she checked with the owner and he said no.  I have never been to an establishment (from dive bars to five star restaurants) where you could not switch out a drink if you were displeased with it.  I asked to switch a 5oz tasting pour that I didn't drink, not a $14 dollar cocktail.  I was pretty surprised that the owner declined my request.  My friend and I will not be returning to this bar, I prefer to support local pubs with better customer service.

34.description: My friends and I stopped in for the first time. It was a Friday night and the place was crowded...but in a good way.  Not too many people where you can't move but not so empty that you wonder where everybody is.  Somebody helped our group of four find a place to sit (unusual for a tap room) and we ordered flights of every beer on the menu.The beer is good--and I am not a beer drinker!  My favorite was the porter--smooth with a definite hit of coffee taste.  Yum.  My boyfriend liked the double IPA so much, he bought a growler to go.We sat at the bar and got to talk to the owner Quentin.  Very hospitable.  He answered all of my questions (and I always ask a lot).  My friends commented how The service at Vice Bar was so good compared to most of the taprooms we had been to in the Chicago area.  You can tell that the owners are passionate about beer AND sharing the experience with people.Love the vibe too. Industrial-chic.  They cover up the TVs with art when not in use so you don't feel you are in a sports bar.  Very nice touch.  Vice Bar is a great addition to the area.  We will be back!

16.description: My taste buds did not like this beer. Watery and blah. Three others I was with agreed. Not from the neighborhood but visiting friends in town staying in south loop and came here based on reviews. First sat at bar. Stools too low so went to a very available table on a Friday night. Service was good. Beers not so much. I live around Begyle and Half Acre so this place didn't even come close.  Also thought the beers were expensive!! $13 for a flight of 5.  6.75 for a regular beer.
