Whaaat.  Just didn't add up. Wish you all the best because I support local. But wouldn't go back if you were in our neighborhood. Save you tastebuds from watery beer!

13.description: Went on a weekday just to check it out. Good beer selection. There's just something with the height of the bar and the stools. Maybe the bar is too high(good for standing) and stool is too low. Anyways, it was not too crowded when we came. Bar tender was very attentive. Bring your own food if you're hungry but you can check yheir website for food truck schedule.

11.description: New brewery in the South Loop is a great place to catch a Bears game or just catch up with friends over a good brew.  This place has a welcoming, neighborhood feeling where all the staff is welcoming and genuinely wants to get to know their customers.  They don't serve food, but allow you to bring in your own from local restaurants.  I got the beer flight, which was great for a beer newbie like me.  One of the owners came over and explained all the different brews to me and what made each one unique.  I liked 5 of the 6 and was so glad I got the flight so that I knew which one I liked most and would order again.  The bar had great picnic table seating and a bar area.  It also had tvs everywhere, which was perfect for watching a football game.  When I went the weather was great out, and the folding windows helped bring the great weather into the bar.  Definitely a great addition to the neighborhood and I'll be back!

39.description: I absolutely loved this taproom / brewery.  It's very simple on the inside - just the bar and a ton of long wooden tables.  The beer was amazing.  I tried everything except the IPA's (not a fan) and there was only 1 beer I didn't care for.  The Porter and the Metrosexual Chocolate were so delicious that I was dreaming about them last night.  If you like dark / coffee tasting beers, try these for sure.They do not serve food here, but they have a binder with various delivery menus from restaurants in the area.  So, you can pretty much eat whatever you want.  This also leaves them more time to focus on beer.  Win Win!We went on a Sunday afternoon and the vibe was very low key.  They were playing hip hop until someone brought their kid in at which point they switched to more classic soul type music.  I pretty much liked everything they played.  There are various board / card games to play if you are in need of some entertainment.  There were some good ones in the pile - Heads Up, Taboo, Cards Against Humanity, Monopoly, etc.  I live on the way north side and made the trek down here on a Sunday and had a blast.  I'm only sad that it's a haul from my house, but I will be back here for sure.  It is well worth the time spent getting there and home.

37.description: Relaxed table service craft beers at ~$6 for 16 oz.  Afternoon atmosphere was great with some tables playing board games and canine friendly.

0.description: Passionate group of people behind vice! Expect a welcoming atmosphere, fantastic conversation, and even membership benefits.  Always looking forward to their new beer releases!!

38.description: I am in love!  I'm not really much of a beer person (certainly no expert), but everything about Vice District was spectacular!First, the way the place is arranged is really conducive to groups of all sizes. The long, community tables allow customers to socialize, and sure do help out when you're playing one of the games Vice District allows you to try out!When my group of 6 was there, 9 beers were available.  The menu very clearly spelled out the attributes of each brew, which was perfect for a novice like me.  Big shout out to the South Town Small Porter!Staff was super friendly and accomodating. Everyone seemed like they genuinely enjoyed working there, which always helps the ambiance of a business.The real kicker - customers can bring their dogs inside!!!  I can totally get my dog fix without having to adopt one of my own!Vice District Taproom really knocked it out of the park in my book.  I can't wait to go back.  Bravo!

51.description: This is my second review for Vice District brewery.Sunday I was visiting other Chicago brewers and my last ones was Vice District brewery.They beer flavors killed other brewing creations!I absolutely Love that place.You come here as a guest and leave as a Friend!The staff is great with classy service.One more thing they have The Best Music!!!If you want to bring your furry Friend they are welcome too.I will be coming back there again again and again.Love     Kristina k

27.description: Amazing brewery. I can see a whole bunch of people hanging out here having fun. It's loud it's noisy it's vibrant. The beer is really good. This is coming from a person who doesn't care much about it. But this is the best beer I've had. I can see myself becoming a regular. Their custom brewed and really good. I got The Hideout and it was gooooddd.

32.description: My very own local brewery and taproom hangout.  I love this place. I love these guys. I love the beer. It's an a-typical startup brewery.  Vice hasn't been afraid to go out there with their brew recipes.  Also they've been busting their asses by making a LOT of different beers throughout the year.   Both of these points I feel differs from a lot of small breweries who tend to play it safe and be all things to all people, which results in uninteresting beer.  All of Vice's beer is good, because they don't expect each person to like each beer.  But they will have a beer that you like.  For sure.Vice is socially focused.  The TVs only go on when there's a game, or on Movie Night.  There are lots of board games to play, AND BATTLESHIP!  Plus fresh popcorn, or if you're looking to eat, it's BYOF.  Or a lot of nights there will be a food truck outside.My favorites:Initiation - session IPAHabitual - Black IPACluster - Double IPA????? - IPA, (I can't remember the name), I had it last week before it came out and it's great. (If you want to have the new beer before it comes out too, become a member.)

54.description: The beer itself only garners 3 stars. The service also 3 stars. But the experience 5 stars. A great neighborhood hang out in the south loop. Was there on a Saturday evening and the place was 80% full. I love the atmosphere of the place. It was filled with dogs in leashes and kids in car seats. And an authentic neighborhood experience. If you are in south loop you should stop here for a pint.

48.description: I've been following this Brewery on Facebook for a while now and was really excited to check them out. As far as ambiance goes, I liked the feel of the taproom, although I do agree with a few other Yelpers that the lights could be a little dimmer. I'm also a sucker for free popcorn so that was great! We sat at one of the community style tables and thought service was good as well. The big disappointment came when I found out that they were only serving three of their six beers. Really?? Only three beers? I understand if you maybe ran out of one for a day or two but I was told the other three wouldn't be available for another two - three weeks! My husband and I love craft beer, have been to well over 50 breweries/taprooms, and I've never seen a brewery only serving three beers. I get that they're new, but they should at least have their general menu of beers available at all times. Swap our your seasonals or smaller batch beers but not the mainstays. As for the taste, I thought the blonde was decent but we likely won't be returning soon....

44.description: Great south loop spot to grab a beer. You can bring your own food which is cool.

24.description: Vice District is a nice addition to the South Loop! I went solo last week and bellied up to the bar. My biggest and probably only issue with VDT - I'm a 5'5" lady and I found the bar stools to be way low! I had to stretch to reach up and it was pretty uncomfy. I talked to some others who have been there and over 6' and they still had the same issue. So pretty please, Vice District get some new taller bar stools!!! This is muy importante if you want solo beer drinkers like myself to come back & chill out at the bar.You can get a flight of 5 brews for $13 which is a great deal or get glasses of various sizes ranging from $2.75 for a 5 ozs sample size to $8.25 for a 20 ouncer. The price for most 16 oz pint pours was $6. I always get flights when I go to new breweries so that's exactly what I did here. One improvement I'd like to see is some kind of labeling for flights. My first fight she told me which beer was which...but my second flight was just dropped off so I wasn't completely sure which was which and had to deduct it myself based on beer type.Beer wise I found everything to be palatable though there was only one brew that was good enough to warrant me inquiring about a growler. Standouts for me were the South Town Small (porter), Metrosexual Chocolate (stout) and the Hideout (hefeweizen) was the growler-worth-best-beer with some banana notes, warranting 4 bottlecaps from me on Untappd. I loved the bartender and found her to be really personable & fun to talk with. Also, she immediately gave me water when I sat down which was much appreciated. They had two ladies working the bar and I think they could have used a third because at some points in the evening, they were completely tapped out. Also, I heard them talking some smack about another customer which wasn't amazing to witness, but it happens.I really enjoyed the atmosphere and the 90s hip hop that was playing. I Got 5 On It! Plus I was down with the food truck outside, even with the guy hitting on me hardcore who was serving up grub. I was very thankful for the food to balance out all the suds.I'll definitely go to Vice District again, but please get taller stools! I think their brews are good for a brewery just a year into production and am excited to see what they have in store for the South Loop!

7.description: This place is great! I love the name, a throwback to the area around the turn of the century, when it WAS the Vice District. I turn you now to a book called "Sin in the Second City" for that history. The guys who own it and work her are incredibly enthusiastic about their beer and this taproom. I was here with a big group, and several of us found ourselves in the back room (hey, now!) gazing at the giant tanks where the magic happens. The beer was great too. Worth a trip to this area of Michigan - which is rapidly picking up with cool stuff.

49.description: Came here before the All Blacks match at Soldier Field. It was pretty busy and the bartenders were slammed and slow and a bit disorganized. Still super friendly service though. Good recommendation for pizza for us to load up on before the game. The beers weren't my favorite, but I'm not really a hoppy craft beer person, so don't take my word for it. Otherwise, it seemed like a super laidback, hip place, with nice wooden tables made of sliced tree trunks.

40.description: I like that this place is no-frills and a nice addition to the neighborhood. I've been using it to bribe my friends up North to hang out on the South Side, and it's been working. That being said, I do kind of wish they served something besides beer as it's not quite my thing. However, I like that the menu is small so it's much easier to make a decision when you don't know that much about beer (like me).

53.description: great neighborhood hang out place! my husband and i stopped by during a week night and after w long day at work. good beer and friendly staff. they don't serve food, but that's probably better

30.description: Went here with Esther on Friday night and got 2 seats at the bar around 730. Ordered 2 flights, and 2 16oz beers. Enough for a real good buzz and one bathroom break.All the beer was great. The Southern Pitch food truck hit the hungry spot . Free popcorn rules. There were dogs and babies/toddlers in the bar, that rules. The music was at the perfect volume. The TVs get covered with a canvas artwork after the White Sox lost, bittersweet. We played UNO, I won best of three!!! 2 guys at the bar came to check out the neighborhood and decide where to move in Chicago. South Loop!! THIS is your neighborhood bar.

46.description: This brewery is a laughing stock.I took my boyfriend here for his birthday and called them days in advance to inform them of this to see if they could help celebrate in any way.They obviously didn't give a fuck.It was mid September and warm, we sat at the bar and when my guy went to the bathroom I told them it was us. We ordered 2 beer flights which were given to us completely out of order so the whole time we had to try to figure it out for ourselves. When we tried to ask the people who worked there which ones were which they seemed annoyed and acted too busy to help.The beer tasted watered down. The only good one was the stout mainly because it was just the only one with flavor.Towards the end the owner comes up to us and says a lame "happy birthday" to my boyfriend.I am so embarrassed I even brought him there, I am still apologizing to this day.

1.description: I love breweries, I love beerpubs, I love taprooms. The closer I can get to the source of the beer, the better. So I was so sure I would enjoy this place. Local, large beer list, all originals? I sure fire hit!Unfortunately I left disappointed, as did everyone with me. Disappointed, not mad or unhappy. I really liked the atmosphere of the place. It is small, for sure, and they don't serve food, but there are plenty of delivery options. They have board games, so I was able to show off my impressive jenga skills. The deck of cards even had almost ALL of the cards, impressive in a bar. There are a number of large tables, and maybe 10 or so seats around the bar. Two TVs, each set to the NFL when I was there (be wary during the regular season, not enough TVs for all the games).Service was OK, although there was only one bartender and the place seemed a bit busy. When you pay you need to use an Ipad, and it is slow, so make sure you leave enough time to close your tab if using a card. One of the girls I was with had a lot of help choosing beers for her flight - one of either the employees or regulars was a bit too touchy feely with her, and we had to stand someone between them while she waited on her beer. Can't really mark that against the bar unless we know he was an employee.Really though, it comes down to the beers. They are quite often out of the beers that they have listed on the menu. That's fine, they are a small brewery, but they don't remove them from the chalkboard either! Makes it hard to know what's available. I only like 2 out of the 5 beers. IPA's are my favorite, but the IPA and Double IPA I had here were horrible. They tasted very soapy. I don't know if that's the beer or if they just didn't clean the lines well, but it left a bad taste in my mouth, literally. I may get pulled back here again by coworkers, but I am not so sure I will drink.They allow dogs, so that's nice.

55.description: Friends and I visited Vice last night. We all agreed that this is perhaps one of the best bars and breweries we have been to and are already making plans for our return and for getting more friends to experience this amazing place. Vice is very inviting, fresh, non-pretentious locale, with great beer and fabulous service! Friends and I were impressed to see the hard work from all staff and especially from the owners, doing every job needed and still finding time to interact with guests and make us all feel special. We couldn't ask for anything more and are excited to return!

9.description: Location? Right on Michigan Ave. Perfect. Looks cool inside. Except what the fuck is up with bar stool choice? If I'm going to park my ass to drink some beers give me a decent place to park. The beers? Not good folks. "Cluster, damn near killed her" beer sounded like it was going be awesome. But no. It left a taste like I had licked the concrete on Michigan Ave. I think it was the first time I left beer I drank at the bar......

26.description: Fantastic beer, great service and terrific atmosphere.  Would be better if they offered food though. Regardless, I highly recommend visiting.

25.description: I was pretty excited when a new brewery opened up so close to where I live.  The service here is quick and pretty good, and it's nice that you can bring your own food.  Unfortunately, the beer just isn't very good.  I tried three different IPAs there and none of them were hoppy or bitter in the classic west coast style.  They all kind of tasted watered down.  If their beer improves, I will certainly be back because the location and service are good, but there are a lot of higher quality beer options in chicago.

12.description: I am in love!  I'm not really much of a beer person (certainly no expert), but everything about Vice District was spectacular!First, the way the place is arranged is really conducive to groups of all sizes. The long, community tables allow customers to socialize, and sure do help out when you're playing one of the games Vice District allows you to try out!When my group of 6 was there, 9 beers were available.  The menu very clearly spelled out the attributes of each brew, which was perfect for a novice like me.  Big shout out to the South Town Small Porter!Staff was super friendly and accomodating. Everyone seemed like they genuinely enjoyed working there, which always helps the ambiance of a business.The real kicker - customers can bring their dogs inside!!!  I can totally get my dog fix without having to adopt one of my own!Vice District Taproom really knocked it out of the park in my book.  I can't wait to go back.  Bravo!

59.description: Great addition to the South Loop! We live in the same building as Vice District so I'm already predicting it will be our go-to place once the weather gets worse. I've been twice now and tried 3 of their 6 beers. The Blonde Ale is my favorite although I've also had the Initiation and Everleigh. Definitely a great option for groups as the tables are huge and there is plenty of space at the bar as well.

21.description: This place is great! I love the name, a throwback to the area around the turn of the century, when it WAS the Vice District. I turn you now to a book called "Sin in the Second City" for that history. The guys who own it and work her are incredibly enthusiastic about their beer and this taproom. I was here with a big group, and several of us found ourselves in the back room (hey, now!) gazing at the giant tanks where the magic happens. The beer was great too. Worth a trip to this area of Michigan - which is rapidly picking up with cool stuff.

17.description: My very own local brewery and taproom hangout.  I love this place. I love these guys. I love the beer. It's an a-typical startup brewery.  Vice hasn't been afraid to go out there with their brew recipes.  Also they've been busting their asses by making a LOT of different beers throughout the year.   Both of these points I feel differs from a lot of small breweries who tend to play it safe and be all things to all people, which results in uninteresting beer.  All of Vice's beer is good, because they don't expect each person to like each beer.  But they will have a beer that you like.  For sure.Vice is socially focused.  The TVs only go on when there's a game, or on Movie Night.  There are lots of board games to play, AND BATTLESHIP!  Plus fresh popcorn, or if you're looking to eat, it's BYOF.  Or a lot of nights there will be a food truck outside.My favorites:Initiation - session IPAHabitual - Black IPACluster - Double IPA????? - IPA, (I can't remember the name), I had it last week before it came out and it's great. (If you want to have the new beer before it comes out too, become a member.)

10.description: came in here as part of my brothers bachelor party and it was pretty damn sweet. they took care of us even though we came in unannounced. The drink selection was pretty good and, if i remember correctly there were games for guests to play, such as jenga, minoploly, uno and the like.

5.description: I really do enjoy that south Michigan Area!  We had our Christmas party here and I enjoyed the location.  Plenty of street parking! The bartenders were very friendly and helpful. I loved the decor, exposed brick, prohibition era photos.  Since it is a brewery I wanted to try the beer and I opted for a light beer called Liquid Gold.  Love the name and the flavor.  I would love to come back on a regular night.

3.description: Vice District is a nice addition to the South Loop! I went solo last week and bellied up to the bar. My biggest and probably only issue with VDT - I'm a 5'5" lady and I found the bar stools to be way low! I had to stretch to reach up and it was pretty uncomfy. I talked to some others who have been there and over 6' and they still had the same issue. So pretty please, Vice District get some new taller bar stools!!! This is muy importante if you want solo beer drinkers like myself to come back & chill out at the bar.You can get a flight of 5 brews for $13 which is a great deal or get glasses of various sizes ranging from $2.75 for a 5 ozs sample size to $8.25 for a 20 ouncer. The price for most 16 oz pint pours was $6. I always get flights when I go to new breweries so that's exactly what I did here. One improvement I'd like to see is some kind of labeling for flights. My first fight she told me which beer was which...but my second flight was just dropped off so I wasn't completely sure which was which and had to deduct it myself based on beer type.Beer wise I found everything to be palatable though there was only one brew that was good enough to warrant me inquiring about a growler. Standouts for me were the South Town Small (porter), Metrosexual Chocolate (stout) and the Hideout (hefeweizen) was the growler-worth-best-beer with some banana notes, warranting 4 bottlecaps from me on Untappd. I loved the bartender and found her to be really personable & fun to talk with. Also, she immediately gave me water when I sat down which was much appreciated. They had two ladies working the bar and I think they could have used a third because at some points in the evening, they were completely tapped out. Also, I heard them talking some smack about another customer which wasn't amazing to witness, but it happens.I really enjoyed the atmosphere and the 90s hip hop that was playing. I Got 5 On It! Plus I was down with the food truck outside, even with the guy hitting on me hardcore who was serving up grub. I was very thankful for the food to balance out all the suds.I'll definitely go to Vice District again, but please get taller stools! I think their brews are good for a brewery just a year into production and am excited to see what they have in store for the South Loop!

35.description: I love supporting local businesses and this might be my favorite one in the South Loop. A craft brewery is *exactly* what we needed! Vice District is a great spot and a tremendous asset to the neighborhood. I'm as picky about beer as I am about wines and I love the selection offered at Vice. The beer flight is a winner and I've found that while the service can sometimes be spotty, the servers are very knowledgeable and patient with helping the beer-challenged make good selections.It's like a real English pub in many ways -- community seating, no frills, board games, loudness and revelry! What's not to like? I must also give a special shout out to the owners, Curtis and Q, who are always there and really help create an environment that is warm and welcoming to everyone. There's always a good, cosmopolitan crowd here. There's no food, but you can bring your own, and they keep the old-fashioned popcorn machine going so a warm bowl is never far away. My diet will not allow the copious consumption of alcohol, so I don't get to Vice as often as I'd like, but when I do, it's always a great time. I hope this business lasts in the South Loop for a long, long time.

19.description: This has quickly become my new favorite watering hole in the neighborhood, not just for their great beers, but for the friendly service, engaging owners, and laid back atmosphere. I'm not THE biggest beer girl in the world, but the Oregon-raised microbrew snob piece of me says that these are the real deal. Make sure to sample all with a flight - I'm a huge fan of the Pleasure Trip, and Everleigh, but the Porter takes the cake in my book. You want growlers? You got growlers. Reasonably priced (the growler itself is $5 for a 64oz, refills are $18ish), it's an excellent way to take Vice with you. TVs have gone in, providing a great spot for Sunday football. No food (aside from some jerky and a popcorn machine), but you can bring in your own. Perhaps it's because it takes me 3.2 seconds to get there from home, but this place rocks. Now if they could just fix those too-short bar stools (or too tall counters, whatever you prefer)...

28.description: Run don't walk to this amazing brewery! Curtis is the man! Beers are always on point and totally satiate my beer snob-ness:)

45.description: I WAS SERVED!I've never been to a local brewery where someone actually approached my table and took orders AND served us water while we waited. AND did I mention there's free, serve-yourself Popcorn on the side? Nobody does any of that at all my local breweries back home. A+ service!LET'S TALK BEERStouts--my fav type--are absent on the list which sticks to hoppier offerings. We took a flight of five. There were six Brews offered but they had already run out of two by our arrival. The Amour (English Brown Ale) was my favorite of the bunch.THOUGHTS ON THE SURROUNDINGSI felt very at home here. On a Friday night it seemed every seat was taken with the young professional crowd all dressed casual and relaxing with the board games offered. Our flight cost almost double what most flights are but considering the extra service and the area, I guess it seemed appropriate.

33.description: Very enjoyable place. Arianna Ardennes, South Town Small, and Habitual are very good. Loaded Dice isn't, and the IPAs need some work. The atmosphere is really good. The people are friendly. Location is perfect. This is a wonderful place to come

43.description: This place has a very... brewery feel. Really. (No s--- it IS a brewery!) But I'm talking about appearance because there's LOTS OF STEEL and pipes and big drums to one side with ACCENTS OF WOOD. Lots of young professional-type people laughing the night away. HIPSTER-TYPE people. This is my scene. I kinda liked how somebody actually APPROACHED AND SERVED ME instead of me chasing people down at the bar. It didn't matter because all those working were FRIENDLY enough. And there's FREE SERVE-YOURSELF POPCORN to the side. This is a dream come true! Toss in a few BOARD GAMES and this became a great night of relaxing with some brews after a day of sight-seeing. Unfortunately, I wasn't a very big fan of the choices because everything was VERY ALE-Y. Too light and too carbonated for my taste.

2.description: I would describe this place as the Halfacre taproom vibe with DryHop decor and Rockbottom Brewery/Dry Hop-like beer. And my experience as bizarre.I was reading the reviews on here regarding the poor service and to be completely honest, I wouldn't say the service was "poor" but rather very strange. This place just celebrated their first anniversary of opening, and being still relatively new, it would have been nice if their bartenders bothered asking if it was our first time, etc. - hell, it's a brewery! Most breweries take pride in their brewmasters and their in-house brewing!...Instead we were kind of rough-handled (for the lack of another word) at the bar. They had signs (chalk-written signs) in addition to their menu and since it was easier to read than flipping through their menu (which the bartender didn't bother introducing...and probably should have considering there was a variety of hard alcohol on there [ps they don't have mixers], they don't serve food etc.), I looked to the chalkboard. Anyhow, we wanted a flight each (5 for $13) and the bartender kept trying to convince us to share a larger flight to try everything. Now, sometimes places offer larger flights for a better price - and her pushiness would have been appreciated. But, there was no deal here and it was just weird and to be honest, kind of rude. We were pretty insistent that we wanted to choose our own beers - she was pretty insistent to try everything. Anyway, after this back and forth for what seemed like forever, we stuck to our guns and got our own flights.There was a chalk-written sign, so I thought I was safe ordering from there. (I mean, when most places sell out of something, they simply cross it out or wipe it off.) Anyway, I ordered my first beer of the flight. She snaps at me "we don't have that." ...um..OK... So I order my second choice (technically my first now). "We don't have that either. We only have what's written on the board."...Read your own frickn board. I'm only following what you put out to me. Anyway, she then proceeds to yell across the bar to some guy "Yo, why the hell are there things on the board we dont have?" ...it was just abrupt and awkward/could have been handled a lot better.We finally order our beers and they aren't bad. A guy plops down to me, orders a stout/porter (didn't pay attention, just saw her pour) and finally can't take it and says to her, "Can I just teach out a better way to pour?"...And then, all of the sudden her attitude toward us changed!I don't know if it was embarrassment or what - she started introducing the brewery, etc....only like an hour too late.We had 3 rounds and left. I will say that while their beers generally were mediocre (they aren't "terrible" like some here have said), their INFUSED beers are actually quite good.Truthfully, I probably won't be back - despite the nice decor, there are a plethora of breweries with better service + brews north of the South Loop.

18.description: Good beers. The tender was inundated with customers and seemed preoccupied.  We had a flight and enjoyed a number of tastes.  But did not stay for another round.My wife and I would definitely go back.  It was hot with the doors and windows open.  A very good local craft brew place.

41.description: Love this place! A great neighborhood spot with maybe the friendliest staff ever. The beer is great and I think enough variety to please anyone, and you can purchase growlers for home. The scene is very casual and comfortable and dogs are welcome! It's great to be able to hang out somewhere and spend time with your doggie too! This a a place to come again and again!  Liz

52.description: The beers on tap were delicious, complex, and sessionable.  Our favorite was the Initiation IPA, which was refreshing and herbal.  This is a very promising start for the brewery!

50.description: I was here the other weekend on a Saturday. At 7 pm they were already out of 3 of their 5 beers. As someone who lives in the area, I have high hopes for this place to succeed. My message to management is manage your beer production - and lower the lighting. I felt like a vampire in this place!

4.description: We liked this place very much. Went there on a monday afternoon, had a flight (13 $ for 5x5oz) of their 6 available beers on tap, plus a pint afterwards. The quality of the beer was good, the porter brewed with molasse was especially well balanced (the taste of molasse being subtile but present) and kind of unsual to me (= very interesting). There were a few board games, always a plus to relax a few hours with good pints. The waitress was kind, responsive; didn't asked us if everything was alright but this is the way I like it. The beer announced on the board was available (I have seen some comments complaining about the beers being always all sold out), only 2 on the menu were'nt available. The brewer was working at the time we were there.

6.description: I absolutely loved this taproom / brewery.  It's very simple on the inside - just the bar and a ton of long wooden tables.  The beer was amazing.  I tried everything except the IPA's (not a fan) and there was only 1 beer I didn't care for.  The Porter and the Metrosexual Chocolate were so delicious that I was dreaming about them last night.  If you like dark / coffee tasting beers, try these for sure.They do not serve food here, but they have a binder with various delivery menus from restaurants in the area.  So, you can pretty much eat whatever you want.  This also leaves them more time to focus on beer.  Win Win!We went on a Sunday afternoon and the vibe was very low key.  They were playing hip hop until someone brought their kid in at which point they switched to more classic soul type music.  I pretty much liked everything they played.  There are various board / card games to play if you are in need of some entertainment.  There were some good ones in the pile - Heads Up, Taboo, Cards Against Humanity, Monopoly, etc.  I live on the way north side and made the trek down here on a Sunday and had a blast.  I'm only sad that it's a haul from my house, but I will be back here for sure.  It is well worth the time spent getting there and home.

22.description: We stopped in here after a very long day of dancing at Spring Awakening. We were just looking for a place to hang out before heading home and this was a great spot with a very chill atmosphere. The bartender was very helpful in helping me find a drink especially since I wouldn't really call myself much of a beer drinker. The staff was over all very kind and pretty funny. Great way to end the day!

15.description: Quentin and Curtis, the owners, are wonderful!! This place is very welcoming and has a good vibe. There are games to play at you leisure and a good selection of beers. I do not drink but everyone in my large party enjoyed their selections. You can bring your own food or order from a local restaurant. I will come back...to play a game or two and hangout.

57.description: BYOF - I've never seen this concept before and found it cool! You can bring your own food or even order delivery to the location. The service is super slow. The beers are good, especially the English bitter, but not amazing. If they had more space, better service, and a few more varieties of beer, it'd be a great weekend hangout!

20.description: This is a cool spot in the South Loop. It has a warehouse feel to it, which I really liked. They also have chalkboards in the bathrooms, which is fun. They also have board games to play, and they allow dogs in, which is really convenient for me as I love bringing my pup places. All the servers are really friendly, and they were really gracious when my dog (embarrassingly) had a little accident on the floor. There are really about 2-3 of their beers that I like, but I'm not sure if that's due to personal preference or the quality of the beer. They don't serve food but allow you to bring food in or order it. All in all, one of my favorite spots in the South Loop.

36.description: Loved it.  We had no idea what to expect, my husband and I were walking past and decided to stop in.  I typically opt for the light golden ales, but often feel at breweries they can be too bitter or heavy.  The Pleassure Trip was sooo good.  It was a nice light golden ale that was perfect.My only recommendation is to put the story of Vice District on the back of the menu.  I looked it up because I was curious what the place was all about and was even more impressed.  Anyone who can make a passion into a successful business should tell their story.Go watch some March Madness and support the local talent!

14.description: Who is the IDIOT that built this bar! The only person that can sit comfortable at is a NBA player....seriously WTF!

3.description: My very first *non Mcdonald's* smoothie!!!!! It was okay. I couldn't taste the fruit and I'm scared to know how much sugar was in it... It tasted like a spoonful of it would kill a diabetic. But it was tasty I guess.... I hadn't eaten all day and I got it around 5pm so I was ravenous.

1.description: I seriously want this place to be better due to it's convienent location and nice staff, but it's just not.  You definitely get your money's worth in terms of amount of food, but quality and taste leave much to be desired.  The shrimp fried rice consists of fried rice and minimal shrimp... nothing else.  What about egg or vegetables?  I've been going here for a while and have been trying to convince myself that it's good, but friends and family have finally opened my eyes and I see the light.  There has got to be a better spot for cheap chinese and as much as it  pains me to remove this from my go-to, it must be done.Goodbye Liang's Kitchen...

2.description: Um, this place is terrible.  It was semi-edible so I'll give it two stars instead of one and they gave me extra soy sauce packets, my favorite kind, so they are going to save face and get 2 stars.  Crab Rangoon had something gross inside of it, I don't know what, but it certainly wasn't cream cheese and crab.  The portions were small.  The mongolian beef was no beef, lots of random crap.  Sesame chicken and sweet and sour chicken were both just not that good.  The shrimp fried rice was about the only thing I could eat and not be completely disgusted.I'm sorry, but I will NEVER order from here again.

5.description: I think this is my go-to for Chinese take out - based on the deliciousness of food. It's a really small hole-in-the-wall establishment for take out only. No dine-in services. I'd like to comment though, the lady who takes the orders comes across as very abrasive - in a "hurry up and order something now and don't waste my time" tone. So, if you can get passed that, the food is remarkable. I typically order the combination pan fried noodle dish (pork, shrimp and beef) which is my favorite. I've also had the chicken egg foo young - amazing. The scallops (in oyster sauce) is also a favorite of mine - generous portions. Non-tapioca smoothies are also available here.

6.description: For a joint that doesnt make any pretentious claims of stardom, Liang's Kitchen is a very decent, low-priced, delivery restaurant. I have been patronizing this place for years and they have never disappointed in taste and service. i must say however that thir delivery wait time is much longer than necessary, but then they never said they were Jimmy Johns.

7.description: Absolute garbage... worst Chinese food I have ever had, and I eat Chinese on a regular basis. Orange chicken was this mushy light yellow soggy breaded mess in a box that tastes like it was cooked in Karo Syrup and food coloring. BBQ Pork Lo Mein was HORRIBLE - they don't even use lo mein noodles in it. It looks more like brown thread with some oversized chunks of pink sliced pork. Egg rolls had the worst flavor and smell I've ever encountered in an egg roll. And the only item that even came close to resembling what it should be was the sweet and sour pork which came divided up in fried pork balls in one box and the sauce and vegetables in another. The sauce was the lowest grade sweet and sour you could possible get. I'm guessing the only reason this place is even opened is because of the portion sizes in relation to price. It is very cheap, and by cheap - you definitely get what you pay for. Should have gone down the street to chinatown and eaten somewhere more reputable.

8.description: Yikes! We had virtually the identical experience while visiting my sister and her hubby - back when they still lived in the South Loop.  We all felt too laid back to venture out for Sushi - and we had the delivery menu - so we called in an order. It was all downhill from there...We had specifically mentioned more than once ABSOLUTELY NO Shrimp or even contact with shrimp in any dish (my husband is deathly allergic.) But sure enough - there were the shrimp in the Spring Roll... Fortunately - too obvious to miss...Not so the case with something else (not sure what?)  Which kept my husband up all night in the violent throes of PURGE-atory. The rest of us wished we could  also frequent the bathroom with such thorough vehemence and suffered from  lingering and wretched Sour Stomach. We just ordered a couple of Chicken dishes and  one vegetarian (the broccoli was probably the best thing - only because all things are relative.)For two days I felt like my stomach was swimming in hydrocloric acid.   No amount of Pepto or Alka Seltzer can take on a G/I assault of this magnitude!

0.description: I've been to almost every chinese restaurant in China Town - Phoenix, every Tony Hu restaurant, Joy Yee, etc.  Liang's does a great job compared to all of them. It's tucked outside of China Town but people should be coming here to get the best Chinese food.  I've tried several dishes and none of them disappoint.  They don't have much of a dining room so I recommend take out.

4.description: Worse Chinese food ever. For them to be right by Chinatown. There egg rolls are not good! There lunch specials suck! There shrimp fried rice is average but with small shrimp. I don't go here anymore when I want good Chinese food I go into Chinatown

28.description: I wish it were better. I hope it gets better. You'll see what people are talking about if/when you come.I'm a block away, still waiting for a bar I like in the sloop.

1.description: Good place to lay back and catch up with friends. Very small but great music and people. The drinks are priced pretty high and the music is good. Limited space so it can become overwhelmingly crowded.

9.description: I went with friend for a late drinking night. It is such an inconspicuous place. When you step in, it's very intimate and there's a casual upscale vibe (if that makes any sense). I also felt like I was in someone's living room for a cocktail party. I got a dirty martini and it was very good. There aren't a lot of seats available, but I didn't mind.

29.description: I hope this review helps to clarify the context of some of the other reviews posted here for Bureau Bar. As a South Loop resident for a few years, there are a woefully few number of bars in the area, so it was exciting to see that a brand new bar would be opening up, literally across the street from my apartment.The Bureau is a cozy, intimate bar. The decor is retro-modern, with ornate incandescent bulbs, cozy furniture, and non-intrusive background music that really completes a pleasant atmosphere. There are two large TVs mounted in the bar as well.Yes, as some reviewers have pointed out, during their first couple of weeks in business, things were a bit rocky. Drink service was a bit slow with only one bartender, coupled with the fact that the venue was completely packed for the first few weeks (the new business rush). However, the timeliness was never a glaring issue, and the staff has been nothing but accommodating, polite, sociable, and competent. I went into the Bureau the first day they opened, and have been regularly returning since, and those 'growing pains' The Bureau experienced their first few weeks should not be held against them. A few months in, it has become my favorite neighborhood bar, not only because of the proximity and convenience, but the neighborhood feel of the establishment, their unique tap selection (Kentucky Bourbon Ale, extremely delicious), and the overall positive experience I have had every time I've been in. The proprietor is a very nice gentleman who constantly makes his rounds through the bar, interacting directly with customers, thanking them for their patronage, and just generally making them feel like their business is valued.If you gave the Bureau a chance after opening and had a bad experience, I would urge you to give them another shot. If you haven't been in before, don't let these reviews throw you, it's a great neighborhood bar, and considering how few of them we have in the South Loop, I think they deserve at least a chance.

23.description: Terrible drinks.  How do you mess up a rum & coke?  They also gave us the wrong bill.  Overall, not a good addition to the s. loop bar scene.  I've tried them twice now, and I definitely won't be back.

5.description: Thank you! Thank you! THANK YOU! I really appreciate you accommodating our group, especially at the last minute. I love your place, the staff was great. Look forward to making many visits to your bar.

31.description: The Bureau Bar is the bomb! This has been the only bar in Chicago that has officially gotten me tipsy as hell. Sam is the best bartender in Chicago! Ask for her if you want to feel good and tipsy. The music is also great and puts you in the vibe.

25.description: This spot is funny because they don't seem to be too concerned about advertising their presence. It's a small, speakeasy-feeling lounge that offers some great beer and liquor options. I'd treat this place as a date spot or a drinks after work spot. They have TVs but I wouldn't come here to watch a game. It really seems to be meant for socializing with people over drinks. No more. No less.

12.description: Bureau Bar is a very interesting spot in the South Loop. My wife and I went after work one weekday and decided to stop in for a drink. The place is small and decorated with local art. Very cool feeling and atmosphere. The bartender was also a very nice guy. We ordered a few specialty cocktails and were disappointed in both drinks. With some love, this could be a great spot. Please upgrade the drink menu!

37.description: Lindsey is great (bartender).  Great little addition to this part of the South Loop.  They have Kentucky Bourbon Barrel ale on tap, with a nice fireplace.  Good mix of demographics.  Check it out.

21.description: Nice and cozy. Friendly staff and great to have another hang out in the S Loop! Give it a chance, go in for a drink before or after a pedicure (the nail social is right next door). Sit on the comfy couch and people watch out the window or up at the bar and enjoy the atmosphere.

16.description: ONLY order drinks here if Mechelle is behind the bar. Otherwise, just sit back, enjoy the music and the vibe...with a glass of water.

17.description: What a cozy, beautiful gem located in the South Loop.  I was there last night for a dance event and the staff was welcoming and gracious; the decor was soothing and the smooth, wooden floors were amazing to dance on; and the Sunday evening patrons were friendly as well.  I would definitely return.

10.description: I want this bar to succeed. I anxiously anticipated its debut last fall, and I've walked by it countless times because I live down the block. I've peered in the window from before it opened until now. Yet I only went inside for the first time last night.Why? I think it's because I haven't been able to figure it out. At first I thought it was a lounge, and I guess to some degree it is, but they have TVs on the wall that almost always seem to be playing sports.The decor looks lounge-y and they have an excellent beer selection, yet the chalk sign on the street advertises macro beers. (Miller? Bud? Coors? Who remembers--I don't.) Right under the name, "The Bureau Bar," which once again connotes "lounge" to me. And it's very small and cozy, where I would expect people to be sipping something a little more special and more-profitable for the business.Inside, I did find it to be pretty comfy, though we only stayed for a drink. I think the trendy little stools would have made it difficult to stay for too long. The waitress we had was very friendly and attentive, though she mentioned up front that they didn't have a drink list. Very strange if they're going for a lounge feel. One big plus: mixed races and ethnicities, both clientele and staff. We need more of that in this otherwise great city, and some places in the South Loop are at least trying.In the end, I guess I thought of The Bureau Bar as being in its adolescence: it's at that awkward phase where it doesn't yet know exactly what it wants to be and is a little uncertain of itself. I plan to go back; but I hope it leans toward what I first expected--more of a lounge, even if they occasionally turn on the sports for a big game. (No problemo with the Hawks being on for the playoffs last night).

11.description: The female bartender was extremely rude.  From the start, her attitude was one where she gave zero @ucks about anyone.  My friend and I walked in just to have a a drink, and when we asked for it, she acted as if it was the biggest burden!  Terrible service! Will never come back! negative stars would be a better rating.

26.description: We had to wait for the bartender for about 10 minutes before she noticed we were there... which is almost impossible because it's about 200 sq feet in there. Then just before we were going to leave, Snooki Jr. the bartender,came up to greet us.  When asked about a drink menu, she said they had no menu.  Snooks  was sneaky and shifty and  up charged our drinks above her original quote of $10. We had 3 drinks and every drink had a $3 upcharge!!! Total bullshit.!! Will never go back. The owner was behind the bar too and didn't even say hello.. service sucks!! Desperado is your only reason to go in here.

27.description: I live down the block and on my frequent walks over to Acadia, I pass by and really wanted to check it out.  It's really small but cozy.  The decor is comforting and it was actually a solid time.  They have Kentucky Bourbon Ale on tap, which is unique.  Not a huge wine selection but adequate for their size.  The good part about a small venue like this is the attention and being able to get personal preferences.  Like we were there during the Olympics and the bartender asked us if we wanted music or the Olympics on.  There were only 5 of us in there, but still, it was nice.  We all were chatting together and it felt a little like a Cheers.  There's no food given their size but they may want to consider things that don't require a kitchen.  Like charcuterie or small bites like Square One does.  The bartender, Sam, was awesome.  She was super friendly and made it feel like we were all hanging out in someone's basement.  She was definitely the highlight of the place.  Overall it's an average neighborhood bar that I'm sure I'll make part of my regular group of spots I visit.  The only knock I have is one guy, who appeared to be the owner, just sat in the corner the entire time not being friendly or anything.  It makes a huge difference when owners, chefs, managers, etc. really show their patrons that they appreciate their business and it makes you want to go back to those places.  I think a bit more effort could be made there to attract regulars.

35.description: Took my fiancé here for some drinks before her birthday dinner. I rate my experience a 2. The one great thing about this place is the decor. It made me feel like I was walking into a well done man cave. Everything else was terrible. The place was so quiet it was awkward to talk above a whisper. The bartender had no clue what she was doing. She was so bad I would guess she has never had a drink in her life. I ordered a captain and coke and I received a drink that made me laugh out loud. First off the rocks glass was at most a four ounce glass. It was filled maybe with 3 ounces of liquid and ice. After my laughter I sample the drink and it was definitely shaken. It tasted like mcdonalds coke that was left in the car over night. My fiancées Manhattan took 5 attempts to get close to what the bartender thought was right. It wasn't. And the glass was chipped which they happily replaced. At this point I was still willing to give the place another shot because of convenience. Then I got the bill. $8 for 3 ounces of shaken ice coke and $11 for a Manhattan. Not in the south loop and not at this place. I will give it a couple of months and try again. If they don't have better talent behind the bar, better glassware, and better prices I will never return. I truly hope they listen to all the people who complain.Bartender and owner were very nice. Just hope they try to improve.

8.description: Miko - this is the name of the worst bartender ever.I've had people look at me like they wanted to cut my throat before. This is the first time a bartender gave me this look because I asked for a drink. Oh, and yes, I asked for a drink because she never asked me if I needed one. She gave me a look so hateful when I ordered a drink, I asked the busboy for a glass of water out of fear. I eventually mustered up the courage to ask for a second drink and her vile look got worse. My friend asked for a margarita. He almost apologized for bothering her. The margarita tasted horrible because she added the ingredient of hatred. He waited to see if she would ever offer to get him a second drink. 30 minutes later, he asked for another one with less disgust in it. Miko's look pierced his request with an evil never seen before. How dare we ask a bartender for a drink? I realized she was like this with everyone at the bar. I never once saw her ask anyone if they needed anything. I never once saw her lips move in an upward direction where it's known to most of us as a smile. She gave me my tab pretty quickly. I'm sure it's because she wanted me to get the hell out. That's the best thing she did all night. I didn't want to spend a second longer in Satan's toilet. We left...forever. Miko is living proof - anyone can get any job.I'm tempted to have my Yelp review mailed to the bar..*Update*This is a message the owner sent me on 06/27/15:"I am owner of the Bureau Bar and would like to know why if the service was that bad and the drinks that bad why would u stay and ask for another drink . Makes no since and you obvisouly don't have anything else to do because most of your post are negative. Get a life"After reading the OWNER'S response to my Yelp review, I'm only further convinced how awful this establishment is.  I hope this helps reveal to potential guests the true character and quality of the people involved with this business.

0.description: Stopped in here for two Manhattans before dinner at Acadia, next door.  I showed up around 5:45 and the place was empty and stayed empty until the time I left at 6:15, aside from the owner, the burly bartender and his back.  The Manhattans were OK but I shared a nice conversation with the bartender which made me feel at home.   I explained that I showed up early for a dinner and found them on YELP and asked what kind of clientele they draw.  The bartender said it was a mix of local residents, sport fans, club hoppers and "promoters."  I'd go back for sure if I was in the area for a drink and I'm curious to see how it is during the later hours.Looking at previous reviews, it appears they had a rotten bartender.  The big burley tatt'ed up guy they have now is quite pleasant so don't judge this place by their bartender now.

38.description: Quaint locale neatly couched between South Wabash and South Michigan on 16th. Upon entering, a distinguished gentlemen (like a scene from the Cotton Club in Harlam Nights) dressed to the nines complete with a trench coast, suit and tie with a stern yet welcoming demeanor said, "come in".... We did. The decor was fitting for SLoop types: clean and modern with a neighborhood feel. The "jury is still out on the service". There seemed to be a disconnect with the loud-ish, hipster personality type behind the bar and the sophisticated first impression of the gentlemen at the door and the pleasant decor. Still, as a 16th Steet resident, I will pop in from time to time. More importantly, I want to officially welcome The Bureau Bar to the SLoop and much success and prosperity!

20.description: Stopped in here for a drink with my husband on a gorgeous 70 degree day. The atmosphere is cozy and it feels like you're in a friends living room/ library. Then you turn your head to the left and there is a big painting with a gigantic 3-dimensional wang sticking out of it. The bartender was sweet but she was terrible at making drinks. Even my jack and coke was awful. We each tried a specialty cocktail. They were a little pricey which I don't mind, but I do mind this when they taste disgusting. We were the only patrons of the bar for most of the time that we were there. They had a small food menu but considering how terrible the drinks were we decided to pass on the food. I would really like to like this place, so clean up your act ok guys?

19.description: Very low key, cozy place with an urban feel to it. The drinks are okay; stick with simple mixes or choose a beer. The best thing about this place is that you are allowed to order in food. Be sure to check out what specials they have for the day.

33.description: My new favorite bar...Rarely can you find a place that is visually appealing, fun to go to, reasonably priced and not pretentious in a bar. I've found it. Bureau Bar meets all my requirements in a neighborhood watering hole. I recently went for Monday Night Football and enjoyed every minute. The people were all genuine and that's a rarity in the south loop nowadays. Being a brand new establishment, of course there a kinks to work out. They have been open around 3 or 4 weeks and I had no complaints. Matt was attentive and knowledgeable behind the bar. That's all I ever ask for in a bartender! The free food was a nice unexpected bonus for the football game. Also got to watch the Bulls game while MNF was on, so I was a happy camper...

2.description: 3.5 StarsI had been meaning to check this place out and my friend was djing and told me to come through. The setting is small and very intimate. Most people appeared to be regulars. Lol. Not that you need this experience but I like the DJ room still allowed you to look out towards the bar and interact with the patrons.I can't speak to the drinks cause i wasn't having any after this weekend. Lol. I like that you can order food to be delivered. Only bad part of the night (which this had nothing to do with the bar) is when we placed an order for a pizza at Giordano's. Everyone was getting there order except us. When our friend called to check they said they thought our order was for the next day. WTF!?! Lol...all in all good place to mingle with friends and I met a couple cool new people.

34.description: Hmmm....The South Loop is in desperate need of new bars, so I was hopeful when I heard about this place opening up. Unfortunately, unless they get their act together, not really going to add much.No drink menu? I get that you have only "just opened" a few weeks ago, but that seems like one of those things you get in order BEFORE you open. Instead, I was just pointed to a row of open wine bottles sitting on the bar top. And a shelf of liquor - the bartender, who was very nice and friendly, pointed in the direction and just said "I'll make whatever you see." Surprisingly small - very limited seating. Maybe two high tops, a few couches around a fireplace, and a small bar. Just a cramped layout. Tiny rocks glasses - I know you, old bartender trick. On a Friday night around 9, there were maybe a dozen patrons or so in there. Seems like a place that's ok if you just need a place to grab a drink and head elsewhere, but not gonna hold my breath on this one lasting.

32.description: Went here for the first time recently and enjoyed it. The bartender Sam was sweet and very accommodating. I tried her cranberry mojito and truly loved it. The space is very relaxed and a good place to grab a drink and unwind after work.

18.description: Quaint locale neatly couched between South Wabash and South Michigan on 16th. Upon entering, a distinguished gentlemen (like a scene from the Cotton Club in Harlam Nights) dressed to the nines complete with a trench coast, suit and tie with a stern yet welcoming demeanor said, "come in".... We did. The decor was fitting for SLoop types: clean and modern with a neighborhood feel. The "jury is still out on the service". There seemed to be a disconnect with the loud-ish, hipster personality type behind the bar and the sophisticated first impression of the gentlemen at the door and the pleasant decor. Still, as a 16th Steet resident, I will pop in from time to time. More importantly, I want to officially welcome The Bureau Bar to the SLoop and much success and prosperity!

13.description: The atmosphere is comfortable and intimate, the owner is a good guy, which is why it was not a problem to pay for overpriced drinks.  However an immature bartender with no idea of what customer service means will keep me from patronizing this business a second time.

4.description: Its small space that's conducive to intimate conversation for few people. That has its appeal and definite use. However that is very specific and limiting. Yhe drinks were on point. The staff were serviceable.  I can't say they were great or poor because all I needed was a drink in my hand,  which they provided. Also, the drink did its job! Not watered down or too much ice used. Prices are reasonable.You and a friend wanna chill? Need to ave a serious conversation? Don't wanna be seen? This is the spot to ho to!!!

24.description: This place is cozy and the bartender is great.  Speakeasy type atmosphere, a place to have a glass of wine and conversation.

6.description: Came over for a friend's bday last night.I was starving so I was hoping they served food here. I found out quick that they did not. They do allow you to order from a nearby Mexican restaurant that is pretty good. The place itself isn't that big, but it is quite nice. They have TVs as well as bookshelves that come equipped with books...lol The bartenders are pretty nice, personable people which is quite important.Decent chill spot!

22.description: I want this bar to succeed. I anxiously anticipated its debut last fall, and I've walked by it countless times because I live down the block. I've peered in the window from before it opened until now. Yet I only went inside for the first time last night.Why? I think it's because I haven't been able to figure it out. At first I thought it was a lounge, and I guess to some degree it is, but they have TVs on the wall that almost always seem to be playing sports.The decor looks lounge-y and they have an excellent beer selection, yet the chalk sign on the street advertises macro beers. (Miller? Bud? Coors? Who remembers--I don't.) Right under the name, "The Bureau Bar," which once again connotes "lounge" to me. And it's very small and cozy, where I would expect people to be sipping something a little more special and more-profitable for the business.Inside, I did find it to be pretty comfy, though we only stayed for a drink. I think the trendy little stools would have made it difficult to stay for too long. The waitress we had was very friendly and attentive, though she mentioned up front that they didn't have a drink list. Very strange if they're going for a lounge feel. One big plus: mixed races and ethnicities, both clientele and staff. We need more of that in this otherwise great city, and some places in the South Loop are at least trying.In the end, I guess I thought of The Bureau Bar as being in its adolescence: it's at that awkward phase where it doesn't yet know exactly what it wants to be and is a little uncertain of itself. I plan to go back; but I hope it leans toward what I first expected--more of a lounge, even if they occasionally turn on the sports for a big game. (No problemo with the Hawks being on for the playoffs last night).

15.description: Awesome place. Loved the cozy atmosphere and the friendly and accommodating staff. Great location. Will come back again.

7.description: The Bureau Bar is one of my favorite South Loop hangout because it is intimate, warm and  and comfortable like meeting at a good friend's house. A perfect place to meet up for drinks with a small group or even for a date. The staff is very friendly and service oriented. There are TVs on-site so the bartenders will take request if there is something specific you want to watch. Some nights there is a DJ to add to the ambiance. The Bureau is NOT a place to go for specialty mixed cocktails. They have bartenders, not mixologists. So only order basic cocktails or the speciality cocktails that are on their menu. The owner is great and is always welcoming and accommodating should you have special requests or groups coming in.

36.description: What better review than the literal review I gave my friend in an email?:[i went to] this new spot on 16/michigan (the [3 peas] location or whatever it was called). it's called the bureau bar. quaint, nice decor... but not gonna last. my wine was DISGUSTING. like damn. and the bartender, sam (a female) was really sweet but clueless. this guy ordered a drink, i didn't hear the name, but she literally pulled up her phone for the recipe in his face and at the end was like "oh we don't have x and y, so i can't make that. sorry! [but i have to try that some time... it sounds good.]" [wth!] and even the beer [my friend] had... they only had enough on tap for ONE [drink]. they've been open for 1.5 weeks... how is that possible that you are out of stock of regular [insert bad word here lol]!?! the only somewhat positive is that the offer a FREE food buffet on the weekends (otherwise they don't have food... oh and nor do they have drink menus). fail. not going back. [my friend] was less turned off but you know how i am. what was surprising was the traffic... a solid number of people came in for a drink. they pretty much only stayed for 1 then rolled out, but there was consistent flow. i was very shocked considering the newness of it.Okay... so that was the real, honest truth I gave my friend about this place within a few hours after my visit. I haven't been back so I can't say this is an update review, but I will add a little more color. I gave it 1 star because as of now, "eek, methinks not". I said I wouldn't go back and I don't think it's going to last. That's potentially a little harsh. I would give it another try on a weekend perhaps. My visit was last Wednesday. Again, Sam was super sweet and welcoming. However, if a bar's only purpose is to serve drinks, I expect the drinks to be 1) of quality, 2) made well and 3) available. I'll give it another shot to see if the review can be bumped up a bit. I love my neighborhood so I would really love for this spot to be successful.

30.description: "A work in progress"A group of us went here and found some seats. You can tell the place doesn't really cater to large groups.. moreso intimate groups based on the layout. It is a nice bar and I'd love to have an after dinner drink with some convo there.So we went and there was a food buffet (not sure if it was day related or Bears related). It was quite tasty. Our waiter came over and we tried to order drinks. Ordered something from the menu (a beer) only to learn they didn't have it.. uhm why is it on the menu?! Anywho.. ordered the drinks she brough the total. I was about to pay and someone was like wait.. that total doesn't make sense.. She mixed up the order.. no harm no foul.. then after I paid.. I thought about it.. it was still pricey for 2 beers and a drink.A reviewer said it.. the ambiance and bar staff don't necessarily mesh. I have to go back again and think about this place in the context of a smaller group and I'll update if applicable.

3.description: Hidden Gem in the south loop.  Any review below 5 stars does it no justice.   My glass never went empty...not Once!  Mikko the bartender has impeccable timing when providing service.   Love how she interacts with the patrons.Such a great place to listen to music and partake in a positive welcoming ambiance.

14.description: Hmmm....The South Loop is in desperate need of new bars, so I was hopeful when I heard about this place opening up. Unfortunately, unless they get their act together, not really going to add much.No drink menu? I get that you have only "just opened" a few weeks ago, but that seems like one of those things you get in order BEFORE you open. Instead, I was just pointed to a row of open wine bottles sitting on the bar top. And a shelf of liquor - the bartender, who was very nice and friendly, pointed in the direction and just said "I'll make whatever you see." Surprisingly small - very limited seating. Maybe two high tops, a few couches around a fireplace, and a small bar. Just a cramped layout. Tiny rocks glasses - I know you, old bartender trick. On a Friday night around 9, there were maybe a dozen patrons or so in there. Seems like a place that's ok if you just need a place to grab a drink and head elsewhere, but not gonna hold my breath on this one lasting.

3.description: To be completely honest, this is the only bakery I don't really like in Chinatown. The baked goods just aren't on par with those at other bakeries and the selection is also smaller.

1.description: Maxim's Bakery was one of the contestants in my ongoing BBQ Pork Bun Off competition.  The review is entirely about their BBQ pork buns, which is the one standard by which I hold all of my Chinatown bakeries accountable.  I used 5 criteria, each with a possible 10 points, for a total possible score of 50 points.Other things to note about Maxim's before the bun-off: they also sell lottery tickets here and there's a giant room in the back with tables for eating your purchases, if you care to hang around a dingy little lotto-bakery...BBQ Pork Bun Off ResultsSurface: 3 out of 10The top is sticky, but not so sticky that my fingers feel sticky after touching it.  Everywhere except the center of the bottom feels tough and crusty, with crumbs able to fall off when touching the edges.Dough: 2 out of 10The dough outside of the filling has the consistency of packing material with a faint taste and odor of yeast.  I can vaguely tell that this is a baked good due to that, but aside from that, there is no flavor to help the dry and crumby dough.The BBQ sauce: 7 out of 10The sauce itself has a good flavor to it.  Not a whole lot of spice, but enough of a sweetness that it goes well with the pork and is smooth enough to fight some of the issues with the surrounding dough, though it has caused some structural integrity problems with the center-bottom of the bun, making it very soft and almost mushy.The pork: 6 out of 10The major damage to the score on this facet was that there were basically 3 monstrous pieces of pork and then a few slivers and chunks elsewhere.  They were tender enough that biting into a huge chunk caused it to split cleanly, avoiding the "string of meat falling from the bun and hanging from your lips" moment that I've admittedly experienced in the past during my many years of BBQ-pork-bunnery.  No gristle, but some extended chewing on those larger bits of meat.Overall presentation: 2 out of 10The buns were maybe 75% dough, and with dough like that it was not a lot of enjoyment to be had.  One thing that struck me was the piece of green onion stuck to the bottom of my test sample - which could only have come from cross-contamination on the shelf or on the utensils used to extract my bun and place it in the paper bag, which developed some spottage sometime during the trip home.  The overall experience was negative, aside from the sauce that I enjoyed and found to be quite little of in the grand scheme of things.Total Score: 20 points of 50 (40%)The complete/ongoing results of the BBQ Pork Bun Off can be found on my blog.  aaronbsam.blogspot.com

2.description: I wouldn't say that I'm a pastry aficionado, but I know a good sweet bun when I try one!  When I first moved to Chicago, I'd take the red line down to Chinatown for a cup of coffee and 2 Coconut Sweet Top Buns nearly every Sunday morning ($3.00). I soon realized that I'm not the only one with a hankerin' for Maxim's coconut buns as they are typically gone by 1 PM.  When they are good, they lady usually "You shouldn't have slept in..."  How does she know my sleep schedule?  But, if you missed on them something else. When most items are 60-70 cents, it's worth a trying something else. The BBQ pork bun is also good.  Put down your Little Debbie Snacks and go to Maxim's instead...

5.description: Thanks to Chicago yelpers, we were here last week to pick up a wintermelon cake and an egg custard tart.Both were okay. Not much difference from the ones in NYC.

6.description: I don't have a great opinion of Maxim's Bakery. Chiu Quon and Captain Cafe and Bakery do a far better job with baked goods. I tried the apple pie at Maxim's, which I can only describe as tasteless and needlessly greasy. I don't like the overall appearance of the bakery which is rundown. And I don't know if I want to buy baked goods from a place that sells lottery tickets. I dunno... All in all, there are far better bakeries in Chinatown than this one.

7.description: Nothing gets more Chinatown than Maxim's. Great Pork buns and other Chinese pastries make this place a must go if your ever in the mood for a cheap sweet treat. Nice women at the counter and the back room is filled with old Chinese men playing chess and watching the latest soap operas from Hong Kong, looks authentic enough to me. If you want to get a feel for the real Chinatown stop in here.

8.description: A typical bakery for the area, prices are a bit higher than the shops across Cermak with the stickybuns.

9.description: This bakery is located in Chinatown and has lots of cakes with fillings.  I got a lotus cake that they heated up.

0.description: I'm a fan of Maxim's for mainly one set of products: moon cake.When the season is on (near the New Year in February), this bakery produces a nice variety of the usual types of solid little moon cakes:  sweet red bean paste (adzuki beans, I believe), sweet ground lotus seed paste (paler inside), and traditional variations with whole cooked egg-yolk inside one of the two fillings (a traditional detail (it's the 'moon' in moon cakes), and an acquired taste.  Frankly, I happen to dig odd stuff like this, but they make versions of the cakes without the yolk for a reason.)They make a show-stopping coconut sweet-top bun and they have a nice variety of other savory buns; BBQ pork buns, ham & egg buns and other handy breakfast items.Like many of the bakeries on Wentworth, Maxim's has an 'eat-in' back room.  And cash only; the ATM outside is not maintained well and is often out-of-order, but don't let that stop you from dropping in for a classic of Chinese bakery -- one of Maxim's moon cakes!

4.description: This review is for the Maxim's on Broadway, in Argyle.Delicious bakery, I love it that they are not so sweet like most American bakeries. Cakes are fluffy and melt in your mouth. And the price is very affordable. Just remember to bring cash, they don't take any other way of payments.

3.description: Mr. Antonio Rogers means it when he says his passion is to make women feel beautiful.  Everything about his product line is upscale, it makes you feel upscale.  Even the customer experience is stellar.  LavishAR Hair is my exclusive source!

1.description: I bought human hair and a closure from here about a year ago. The hair has held up nicely and I have done about 3 installs with it, the guy who sold the hair was really nice and helpful and the salon is very pretty, my only problem is the closure and the hair looked like the same texture when I bought it, but they are different. I know that the hair most likely came from 2 or more different people, but the closure became Super curly after I washed it and the bottom hair was a loose wave so I can't wear them together unless I want to flat iron it everyday. The steam from the shower makes the closure frizz up ugh!!! All in all I'll return I'll just ask more questions about the textures.

2.description: I purchased hair from here before my trip out of town. Three bundles of wavy hair. The customer service was great. However, the hair tangles sooooooo much. I can literally put a hat on and it tangles all the way up to the point where I can't even put my fingers in it and it sheds like crazy when I comb it. I take very good care of my hair and I'm disappointed by the quality. I bought 3 bundles, installed 2. The other bundle will not ever be used in my hair. It was a waste of money. I feel like I spend more time combing my hair then anything.

0.description: Best quality hair in Chicago!!! The owner stands behind his product and guarantees your satisfaction. He has so many styles and textures that are sure to please. I have worked with him for the last 5 years and he has yet to disappoint. His prices cannot be beat for the quality of his product. Check him out!

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: African-American Hair, Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Perms, Extensions, Coloring, Kids' Hair

3.description: If I had the choice I would never go to this LA Tan.  The only thing I like about this salon is the convenient location.  Every time I've been there the employees seem annoyed that they have to help me.  The rooms are small and there are never any doors with actual door hangers on the backs of the doors that work; all you have is a little chair to set your belongings on, which is really inconvenient when it's winter time. My most recent experience there a little over a week ago I came in and I was told that I had a "late fee" on my account.  I explained to the blonde girl that my debit card was stolen and I received a new one, which I took to the LA Tan on Madison to get updated and it wasn't updated properly.  She said to me rudely that she didn't do it and it wasn't her problem, and said that she wasn't going to argue with me about getting the fee removed.  Long story short, she wouldn't even contact the manager to get the late fee removed so I just paid it because I didn't want to deal with the rude employee.  I went to my regular LA Tan on Madison and they reimbursed me and apologized.  I have never had a hard time at any other LA Tan besides this one. I will not be going to this LA Tan again.  Get it together.

1.description: Good service ! Clean and close to home and my gym.Been going there since 2014.Kristina

2.description: Awesome place to tan! They have great customer service, and the space is very clean. I would recommend it to everyone in the area!

9.description: The girls behind the desk are friendly and sweet, so this review is not to reflect them.   There is a lot of undisclosed pricing that LA TAN seems to leave out.. and a lot.  I received an add In the mail a couple months ago for 4 tans for $4. What a great deal.. NOWHERE ON THE FLYER did it say anything about it being ONLY FOR NEW CLIENTS. Ticks me off when companies do this shit.. lousy management to be luring you - waste of my time to go there and then be told that.. uncomfortable for everyone because I get upset, and the poor girl behind the computer is like, 'I know.. the add doesn't say that, I'm sorry."  Making it just as aggravating for her.   Fast forward a couple months to now.. its Thursday and I wanted to take advantage of the cocktail tan deal.. use any lay down bed and combine it with a spray tan.  Website says its 20.00 so I call to find out if its for any level bed, and I'm told, any level bed, yes, however, the actual cost is  $25-27.00 and not 20.00 because they now have the Versa Tan and its more expensive than their former 'Mystic' Tan machine.   Umm... hey, guess what!?  MOST places are now using VersaSpay Tan.. welcome to 2013.. Why are they acting like its something so special that they have and is so much more expensive.. sure, it may be, I guess the solution is more expensive to them, than their former Mystic Tan 's machine solution was..
