The salon opened only 2 weeks ago and my waxing was only $40 on special! Bonus!The salon itself is very clean and nice. There is free parking in back. I live in the area so this will be my new go-to place!

18.description: Love this salon.  Fabulous massages from Ursula.  Thoughtfully done spa pedicures from just about every nail specialist on staff.  Friendly service, efficient, timely, and never rushed.   A neighborhood keeper.

13.description: I have waited years to write a review here on yelp, and I have finally found a worthy place!  Izabela's is a great addition to South Loop.  It doesn't look like much from the outside, but the inside is spacious, up to date, and very clean.  I have had my hair cut twice by a lady named Gosia.  She does a wonderful job, and she is extremely detailed oriented.  A wash, cut, and blow dry will run anywhere between $40-60.  I have also had several manicures here, they do a consistently better job than Spa O down the street.

4.description: The South Loop has an overwhelming number of nail places. Other places are inconsistent, impersonal or overpriced, but Izabela's is none of that; I now go there exclusively. While all of the ladies seem very sweet, I only let Ivana touch my nails for the most part. She's super sweet, friendly and never rushes through a service. Since it's on my way home she often tells me to stop by to see if I'm ready for a fill-in or if I can wait another week (which my wallet appreciates!). She's become wayyy to popular so I usually have to make and appointment, but can often get one the same day. I've also had eyebrow waxes with Basha, and she's excellent.

24.description: Izabella's is amazing. My nails are working their way back to health under Silvia's care, although I believe all the manicurists are equally good. I feel pampered, and the regular price for manicures and pedicures is less than the special at the nearby nails-only salon that did a terrible job. I will be trying other spa services at Izabella's. A welcome addition to the neighborhood.

6.description: I love this place, it is my regular waxing salon and it really couldn't be better. Basha is a complete professional, she knows exactly what she is doing and I feel comfortable talking (or not talking) with her during my appointment. She has given me great tips on decreasing ingrown hairs and has been super helpful as I plan for my wedding and trying to get all of my skincare ready and in shape. As for the wax itself, she always listens to what I wants and then does a very good job - less painful (on the waxing scale) and getting every bit of hair. Waxing in the States is never super cheap, but their prices don't break the bank and the quality of the service is definitely worth the price!

22.description: Came here for the first time a few days ago. The service was pleasant. Everyone there seemed nice. However,  some workers were having personal conversation in front of clients, which I did not appreciate.  My manicurist was Anna; she was super sweet and helped me pick a great no chip color.  I only got a no-chip manicure and no other services although this is a full service salon.

15.description: Not quite sure why this place is well rated. Chose it over the other two nearby salons based on yelp ratings but was pretty disappointed.Cuticles Shredded- my nail tech repeated cut too much cuticle, even after I winced and said something. My pinky has actually scabbed up. Not to mention the burning sensation from her spraying the cuts.Appointments Not Useful- made a 2pm appointment but didn't get in a chair until 2:45Other than that, it's your average low end salon. Not that clean. Nails came out below average. Won't be returning.Note: Cash Only for Tips

7.description: I went in for a manicure last night And the woman who did my nails was very nice.  The actual manicure was pretty good but the polish part was horrible. I could tell when she started putting it on it was a little thick and didn't seem right but I didn't say anything.  When I got home about 2 hours later that night the polish already started chipping and I noticed weird bubbles on some of the nails.  It's safe to say I don't think I'll ever be back since my nails look terrible less that 24 hours later. Oh and it's the CND weekly polish that usually lasts at least 5-7 days for me.

8.description: I had acrylic nails done. One fell off in 3 days. A second fell off after 1 week. Izabela does not have adequate equipment, so it took the woman who did my nails ONE HOUR with a manual file just to shape the nails. Moreover, she was so poorly trained that she hurt my fingers by accidentally filing skin at least 4 times. The nail applied to my thumb was misshapen and she did a poor job in trying to fix it. I don't blame the young woman for the poor quality of her work and the unpleasant procedure, but blame Izabela herself for not investing in adequate equipment and for failing to give adequate training to her employees before imposing them on customers. I would NEVER return to this place. If you just want your nails painted, it's probably okay, but if you want acrylic nails, go someplace else.

30.description: Izabela's is a wonderful nail salon that is only going to get better and better.  I say this because the salon has been open a little more than a month and Izabela continues to add services and increase her staff.  She has operated a salon on Clark and Fullerton for years and has very high standards.  If you are looking for a salon that you can get in and out in half an hour, this is not the place for you. It is not a "nail factory". Things are done thoroughly and the right way.  Many of the people who work for Izabela did their training in Europe where cosmetology school/training is intense, extensive, and demanding.  In other words, the people there know their stuff! Her esthetician can do anything.  There is one hair stylist (more to come) and everyone she works on walks out of the shop with her hair looking stunning.   I was very excited to find out that they got a machine to use for oxygen facials.  I had this type of facial done in New York, loved it, and have been looking for the same kind of facial in Chicago for three years.  The facial will be my birthday present to myself next month.  This Michigan Avenue salon is new but it is already getting the same kind of friendly, chatty vibe the salon in Lincoln Park has that starts with Izabela's warm personality.  Izabela is going to have a masseuse on staff soon and there is plenty of parking in the back of the shop.  What could be better?

3.description: Izabella did my nails perfectly. I couldn't have asked for anything better. I got acrylic nails and they look like really nails. I'm getting a lot of compliments on them.

14.description: Worst experience. Cuticles are butchered.  I could have done a better job at home! Big waste of $35 for a gel manicure!!!!!

58.description: We never tried Sarpino's until last night, because we were getting back from a concert late night and nothing was open. So, the great thing about this place is that they are open until 5 a.m. on Saturdays! This is amazing because most places stop serving at like, 10. The second great thing about Sarpino's is the customer service. We were there for several minutes last night, waiting for our order and honestly, everyone was friendly, competent, smart, empowered and very attentive. If I were basing the review on those two things, I'd be giving it 5 stars. Unfortunately, I feel compelled to also review the food. We got a pizza, salad and garlic bread. We were starving, so I was not inclined to be picky. That said, the "garlic bread" was inedible. For $5.99, you would expect a pretty damn good loaf of bread. Except that this wasn't bread. It's leftover (rejected?) pizza crust with some kind of something on top. It tasted like cardboard and we threw it out. Next up was the pizza- it smelled great and I was happy to see real mushrooms, not the canned kind, were used. The crust, though, was a nightmare. I really can't even call it crust. It was this spongy, almost cake-like mess that tasted like nothing and had no crunch or good consistency to it at all. The sauce was decent but the artichokes we ordered were diced up and almost non-existent. I don't know what we would have gotten had we ordered one of their "gourmet" pizzas. Maybe that would be worthwhile. The salad, by contrast, was very fresh, very crisp and the cukes were definitely appreciated. We used our own dressing, though, because what they gave us looked weird. Overall, it's only decent if you're starving late at night. If they would just upgrade/fix that crust, I would be more complimentary.

56.description: First I'll give the good news.  The driver who delivered to the hotel where I was staying was very friendly and definitely earned his tip.  Now the bad news.  I ordered a medium barbeque chicken bonanza pizza and the pizza arrived within the hour the order taker said and it tasted good, but it certainly didn't taste like it was described.  Instead of a barbeque sauce it had a sweet tomato pizza sauce and there was not a scrap of chicken anywhere on it.  The other advertised ingredients where on it but the 2 star ingredients that were advertised were noticably absent and that is the reason I can't go higher than a 2 star rating even though it was a pretty good tasting pizza.  I was hungry and tired and didn't feel like waiting for another 45 minutes for a replacement pizza so I did not bother calling back and requesting they send me a correctly made barbeque chicken bonanza pizza.  Too bad because I was really craving a good barbeque chicken pizza.

29.description: Called numerous times starting at 2am, was put on hold by "Arturo" for over 30 minutes but than eventually was hung up on. This is ridiculous, and now the store isn't answering .

42.description: The worst customer service ever!  I wanted the chicken wings with sauce on the side.  The man on the phone indicated that the buffalo sauce on the side is not an option. He also asked details about my location despite being at the Hilton Chicago.  Not enough that there are few hiltons in Chicago but he also needed the exact location and address. I was so annoyed I hung up on him.

23.description: The Mediterranean Veggie Sandwich is my FAVORITE! I created it when I was pregnant and it is the BEST. (Order: Mediterranean Veggie on Panini with Pesto and Ranch) Would be even better if they grilled it with a little butter, which I sometimes do myself.The pizza is not the best, but my kids are happy with it. It's usually over cooked, so I order LITE BAKED and either put it in the oven or toast the bottom on a buttered pan. I think they could put more sauce and practice baking the pizza properly. I have been ordering from here for a while and there are varied degrees of service, one time I did have a very long wait, as in hours, but I got a credit and haven't had the problem again. Oh, and once they didn't put the dressing on MY Favorite sandwich, so after trying to eat it and being really disappointed, my husband convinced me to call. They ended up bring me a new one done to perfection. Yay!Delivery is getting better, I live in Hyde Park and order at least an hour in advance.The coupon system sucks, they email me offers and who knows how to apply them to the order? They only have this 15% off, which comes up sometimes or the Store Special section which is better but doesn't have the offer that was emailed. "To redeem offer order all items and then use a loyalty offer at checkout to receive your discount" Weird... Sometimes doesn't work as supposed to. Should be be more user friendly.It would also be nice if they offered discounts on the sandwiches, which are my favorite. That is all. ; )

47.description: Stay away from this location!! They always seem to get my order wrong. The customer service is subpar as well. Whenever I order from this location I seem to always get a phone call from the delivery driver asking me to come down. My buzzer works just fine last I checked. I'll never order from this location ever again. Save your money, time, and energy!!!

8.description: Ordered from here while I was in Chicago for a quick weekend.  I did not do too much research just found somewhere close that delivered, they met both criteria (yay!).  I ordered the Classic Italian pizza.  They delivered pretty quick for a snowy night, the pizza was hot, loaded with toppings and cheese.  I have zero complaints.  They are also just regular pizza, not chicago style so just an FYI if you were looking for that (I was NOT).  Food was quick and tasty, and not bad prices for a personal sized one.

31.description: I used to love Sarpino's. The pizza is delicious but the last several times that I've ordered from them, I've had horrible experiences. The last 3 times I called for delivery it has taken 2 hours to get my pizza! 2 hours! Then there was a driver who told me that he didn't have change for my $20 bill on my $11 order and if I wanted change I had to indicate that when I ordered. I took my $20 back and told him I didn't want the pizza. Miraculously he was then able to produce change. Really?!

34.description: I skipped breakfast and was starving by lunch time. Worst part was I was trapped at work. Lunch was ordered late but luckily, Sarpino's delivers quickly.It was not good pizza though. There is a pool of grease laying on the pizza and if you don't get the pizza straight out of the oven, the cheese turns into a plastic texture. I felt so sick afterwards and my mouth was dry the rest of the day.

16.description: Pizza is pretty good. Ordered delivery came in the time frame promised. I got garlic cheese bread and wings on side.  The garlic cheese bread was old and hard. The wings were slimy and gross to the touch not fresh at all or possibly NOT cooked thoroughly.  The pizza arrived room temperature slightly warm.  Cheese had hardened over . Flavor for one of the pizzas  is the only reason im giving this review 2 stars and for not forgetting my paper plates with the order.

13.description: Called numerous times starting at 2am, was put on hold by "Arturo" for over 30 minutes but than eventually was hung up on. This is ridiculous, and now the store isn't answering .

11.description: The Mediterranean Veggie Sandwich is my FAVORITE! I created it when I was pregnant and it is the BEST. (Order: Mediterranean Veggie on Panini with Pesto and Ranch) Would be even better if they grilled it with a little butter, which I sometimes do myself.The pizza is not the best, but my kids are happy with it. It's usually over cooked, so I order LITE BAKED and either put it in the oven or toast the bottom on a buttered pan. I think they could put more sauce and practice baking the pizza properly. I have been ordering from here for a while and there are varied degrees of service, one time I did have a very long wait, as in hours, but I got a credit and haven't had the problem again. Oh, and once they didn't put the dressing on MY Favorite sandwich, so after trying to eat it and being really disappointed, my husband convinced me to call. They ended up bring me a new one done to perfection. Yay!Delivery is getting better, I live in Hyde Park and order at least an hour in advance.The coupon system sucks, they email me offers and who knows how to apply them to the order? They only have this 15% off, which comes up sometimes or the Store Special section which is better but doesn't have the offer that was emailed. "To redeem offer order all items and then use a loyalty offer at checkout to receive your discount" Weird... Sometimes doesn't work as supposed to. Should be be more user friendly.It would also be nice if they offered discounts on the sandwiches, which are my favorite. That is all. ; )

39.description: The pizza I ordered took 90 mins to be delivered.  By time I got it, it was cold, the toppings I ordered were non-existent, no dipping sauce or peppers, and it wasn't even cut.  They told me theyd send another and that one took 60 mins.  The driver took 10 minutes to get from their car to my door.  The pizza still wasnt cut.  This place is a joke.

37.description: I've unfortunately had to order pizza from this place multiple times and every time the pizza is late and cold. The only plus is that they are cheap and open late, but it's frustrating not knowing when/if the pizza is going to arrive. Today was the last straw because not only is the pizza currently late, but noone at the store or at the main hotline is answering the phone.

0.description: In town to watch my Grandson. He wanted pizza and movie. I chose Sarpino's just on distance and delivery. What a great pleasant surprise. Fast delivery hot pizza very reasonable price and a wonderful pizza. The pizza was as good as any I have ever had. This will be my go to for pizza when in Chicago.

38.description: Drivers do not carry cash! Make sure you pay over the phone if you do not have exact change. Our delivery driver arrived, didn't have cash, and I had to spend 20 min to get a hold of the restaurant just to pay over the phone. In the mean time, the driver had to leave and the I had to wait another 45 minutes to get my pizza. Don't order from here.

51.description: Called two.hours.before they close and said they would deliver.  55 min later they never arrived and we continied callong and they never answered.  Worst service ever.

27.description: Absolutely terrible. I ordered late night/early morning pizza on a Sunday. It never came. I never got any missed calls. NOTHING. Sunday afternoon at 2pm I called and explained the situation to GrubHub and they re-placed the order and told me Sarpino's quoted it at 45 minutes to an hour. I had already been charged close to $30 and was relieved it would be there soon for a late lunch. Late lunch is an understatement. I called the store immediately to add a soda to my order & confirm it had been placed...An hour and 15 minutes went by... I called them back & was assured it would be there with in another 15 minutes. 35 minutes went by. NOTHING. I called Sarpino's again & the man had his manager get on the line. This manager is AWFUL. He was rude. He was non-responsive. He blamed me. I only talked over him or got loud was when he sat in silence when I asked for an apology at the least. Awful service. Even worse customer service. And, all this for LOUSY, COLD pizza. Never again.

32.description: I ordered two large pizzas for my friend's birthday at 6:36 pm and it got to us at 8:17pm.  The driver apologized to us but I ordered it online so the tip was already paid.  I called the store on Archer to complain and they offered no apologies or compensations and told me to wait longer.  This is how they run business.  Totally unacceptable.  The pizzas are all cold now and they expect us to eat this crap.  Go Sarpino's, yeah.  I want to give zero stars actually.

54.description: Late night and we wanted some pizza, so we picked from the limited selection on GrubHub. Unfortunately, we chose this Sarpino's. We left special instructions to make sure they rang our doorbell, since our cell phones don't get great reception here. Pretty simple, right?Well, finally, we are watching TV and waiting. About the time we were told in the email our food might arrive, I suddenly received two voice mails. One a blank, assuming from the lazy driver, and the other from the store, saying he's sorry but they're closed and since we didn't answer the phone the driver had to leave. I checked my GrubHub order to make sure I'd stated to ring the doorbell, and sure enough, it was there in black and white.I immediately call back both numbers, but within 5 minutes neither is answering. There's a reason for the special instructions on GrubHub. If you aren't going to read them or follow them don't accept their orders. This was ridiculous.This was all on the 13th, and I'm still fighting with GrubHub to get my credit card refunded. Obviously I'm not important enough to the store to follow my directions or accept a call back within minutes. Will never order here again and will be very vocal to everyone I know, especially as I'm out almost 36 dollars for food they were too lazy to ring the bell to deliver.Is there no way to give zero stars? There should be for places like this!!!

48.description: Your food isn't that bad though I would not know how it tastes warm because I don't recall ever having something delivered to my house that is about 5 blocks away from your store that was not cold because your delivery drivers are perpetually late and always get lost. You may want to give them a quick lesson on the street grid system in Chicago. It is so simple my third grader can figure it out. I have been a loyal customer for several years and gave you way too many chances though this last time really put me over the edge...ordered at 434pm, out for delivery at 506pm...finally cancelled my order at 621pm since the order was still not here. You just lost an extremely loyal customer. I hope you are much better as a result of this review and do not treat others like this.

44.description: Easy to order Fast delivery

24.description: Ordered delivery at 630. Two phone calls later, including one ((after an hour of waiting)) in which they told me they didn't have my address. Well thanks for calling and getting my address?! Extremely incompetent. It is now nearly 9 pm and the food has not arrived. Never order delivery from here. I thought it was also important to mention I live only 1 mile away.

7.description: The new management at this location must have messed with the formula. The pizza USED to be crisp, awesome. Now it is greasy and messy. To top it off, calling the restaurant just got me insulted. "We don't take complaints"Apparently pizza is greasy, I know because the worker on the phone told me all about the various kinds of meats that cause grease. Sarcasm, anger, and contradicting me was the response to my complaint. I have ordered from here many times (more than 15 times) and haven't had problems until recently, but this will be the last pizza I order from here.

49.description: I usually call in for a pick up order, I am always greeted by a friendly and helpful associate. They offer me coupons for buy one get one free which frankly works for me! Hot and delicious. Only comment, they need to put more pineapples on the pineapple pizza.  -Angela

40.description: Wow.  Just wow. I have no idea how a company can be so incompetent. While the food is passable, they go out of their way to find the worst drivers and customer service people. A few of the incidences include a driver who called us and said she couldn't find our apartment.  When we told her we were on the 8th floor, she called us liars because the building only had 4 floors. When she realized she was in a building on Wabash and not State, she eventually found our place. Food was cold, of course. Tonight, our delivery guy gave us the entirely wrong order. When I called the store to tell them we had somebody else's order. The girl had no idea what I was telling her. After being on hold for 7 minutes, she finally came back and told me our order was coming back to us. I asked if someone else had gotten our order since we had gotten someone else's, she hesitated and said "oh no. Your order is fine". Yeah, right. They then picked up our wrong order, which I'm assuming they went ahead and delivered to the intended  customer. Enjoy your cold food, people at 777 S State!  And there have been several other times where they were just incredibly late. There is no concern for quality or customer service at Sarpinos. It's not worth the frustration to deal with these idiots.

53.description: AWFUL. DISGUSTING. WORST MISTAKE EVER!!! Oh, hello food poisoning I've missed you. NOT!! The Good- They're open until 5am so if you're feeling brave you've got options. That's it. Haha. The Bad- Delivery took 90 minutes and I fell asleep. Were there THAT many people wanting pizza at 3am? Never mind, there may have been but that's excessive when I'm told 35min. The Ugly- We got food poisoning!! The pizza was soooo greasy, the chicken was cold and the garlic bread was burnt. We called the next day and they swore they couldn't even find our order. Reallllllllly? Stay away!!!!!

30.description: Most incompetent staff I've ever dealt with.  We ordered 4 straight times before finally banning this place, so shame on me for continuing to order and thinking I'd I get a different result.  They messed up each and every order we placed, with only a shoulder shrug as compensation.  With so many superior pizza restaurants in this city, I am more than happy never ordering from this one again!

46.description: Food was cold & just received an incorrect order!!! first dude hung up on me after having me wait on hold greater than 5 minutes. Called back, was put on hold again. Chicken strips are adult sized processed chicken nugget nastyness. idiot tried to tell me I didnt know the differece between mozarella & feta..  not to mention my calzone was all gummy & disgusting on the inside.. food is below terrible.Dont eat here. Have a lunchable instead... or a stick of butter... anything besides this crap!

1.description: Ugh. Wish I had read reviews before ordering from this place. I won't recount my entire frustrating experience but here are the bullet points*Inaccurate descriptions of menu items*Got my order wrong*Longest. Delivery. Time. Ever. *The delivery man lied to my face about why it took so longDo not order from this location. Seriously.

55.description: We enjoyed our pizza and really like the idea of their "lobby pizza nights!" The sauce is sweet and we loved the extra cup of it that they include in the box! Maybe a little more cheese would be nice, but we'll definitely pick one up again next time!

9.description: Ordered here based on our hotels recommendation. It took almost two hours to get our food delivered. I'm just echoing all the horrible reviews. Wish I had checked yelp before ordering instead of blindly taking our hotels word for it

26.description: Today I ordered 4 calzones for myself, the person doing my hair, her sister and her 11 year old daughter. My steak calzone box contained a chicken calzone,  which I didn't realize until I started eating it.  The little girl ordered a chicken alfredo, which had bacon, causing her to vomit. Her mom called the location and was told that they contain bacon.  She read from the menu we used to place the order,  and was told the same thing again Since I had placed the order on my account,  I called.  The person who answered the phone told me "Stephon not here. " I then asked for a manager.  The person who came to the phone said he's the manager.  I explained the situation.  He told me he's worked there for 4 years and KNOWS the menu says bacon.  I read it again and he repeated it. He then asked me what color the menu I was reading from was.  I'm getting livid now and asked why would I lie when I just read exactly what the menu said.  He said he wasn't saying I wad lying but he knows it said bacon. I said the time you're using to argue with me,  3 people still haven't eaten.He told me he needed the old food back to confirm.  I said we hadn't eaten it's here,  along with the menu we used and the receipt. Meanwhile,  it's now 5:17 and I don't have the food I placed an order for at 3:22.

25.description: The new management at this location must have messed with the formula. The pizza USED to be crisp, awesome. Now it is greasy and messy. To top it off, calling the restaurant just got me insulted. "We don't take complaints"Apparently pizza is greasy, I know because the worker on the phone told me all about the various kinds of meats that cause grease. Sarcasm, anger, and contradicting me was the response to my complaint. I have ordered from here many times (more than 15 times) and haven't had problems until recently, but this will be the last pizza I order from here.

12.description: Absolutely terrible. I ordered late night/early morning pizza on a Sunday. It never came. I never got any missed calls. NOTHING. Sunday afternoon at 2pm I called and explained the situation to GrubHub and they re-placed the order and told me Sarpino's quoted it at 45 minutes to an hour. I had already been charged close to $30 and was relieved it would be there soon for a late lunch. Late lunch is an understatement. I called the store immediately to add a soda to my order & confirm it had been placed...An hour and 15 minutes went by... I called them back & was assured it would be there with in another 15 minutes. 35 minutes went by. NOTHING. I called Sarpino's again & the man had his manager get on the line. This manager is AWFUL. He was rude. He was non-responsive. He blamed me. I only talked over him or got loud was when he sat in silence when I asked for an apology at the least. Awful service. Even worse customer service. And, all this for LOUSY, COLD pizza. Never again.

59.description: Never in my life.  Called them at 3am. Said it would take 1 hour.  Called them at 4. Said im sorry we're backed up. It will be there in 25 minutes at no charge. 5am...no answer. They're closed. Never again  willl I call them. At any location.

21.description: I had another good experience with this place. It's cheap pizza with free delivery. It was delivered within the time frame they promised. The only annoying thing was that I gave them instructions on how to get into my building, and instead the delivery guy called from downstairs asking if I wanted him to come up. And then I had to give him the punchpad code again. Of course you need to come up. It's delivery!

17.description: over an hour late and cold pizza

10.description: The worst service of any delivery pizza ever!!! So I ordered Sarpinos for my staff that had a 3 day job in the south loop. While checking on yelp I needed something that I can have fast delivery and will be there before noon. So the delivery took about an hour the delivery called me since my staff is deaf and mute. My staff is in a high rise building so they had to take the elevator down which probably took them approximately 4 minutes. The delivery driver had the audacity to text me saying "Wait all this time for nothing thank u tips -_-" I did not realize that I did not include the tip during check out on Eat24 which was a mistake, but after that text I have never been forced into giving a tip and thank god i didn't cause the food was cold which is necessarily not the drivers fault but I could only imagine the carelessness of this driver after such text.I then called the manager to ask him to tell his driver not to call our phone any more as I was doing so the driver texted me again. There has to be some sort of privacy policy for customers. Worst customer services ever!!! They missed out on 3 days of orders from one mistake.

5.description: I skipped breakfast and was starving by lunch time. Worst part was I was trapped at work. Lunch was ordered late but luckily, Sarpino's delivers quickly.It was not good pizza though. There is a pool of grease laying on the pizza and if you don't get the pizza straight out of the oven, the cheese turns into a plastic texture. I felt so sick afterwards and my mouth was dry the rest of the day.

3.description: Today I ordered 4 calzones for myself, the person doing my hair, her sister and her 11 year old daughter. My steak calzone box contained a chicken calzone,  which I didn't realize until I started eating it.  The little girl ordered a chicken alfredo, which had bacon, causing her to vomit. Her mom called the location and was told that they contain bacon.  She read from the menu we used to place the order,  and was told the same thing again Since I had placed the order on my account,  I called.  The person who answered the phone told me "Stephon not here. " I then asked for a manager.  The person who came to the phone said he's the manager.  I explained the situation.  He told me he's worked there for 4 years and KNOWS the menu says bacon.  I read it again and he repeated it. He then asked me what color the menu I was reading from was.  I'm getting livid now and asked why would I lie when I just read exactly what the menu said.  He said he wasn't saying I wad lying but he knows it said bacon. I said the time you're using to argue with me,  3 people still haven't eaten.He told me he needed the old food back to confirm.  I said we hadn't eaten it's here,  along with the menu we used and the receipt. Meanwhile,  it's now 5:17 and I don't have the food I placed an order for at 3:22.

35.description: Yeah they suck, the only thing that is good is that they're open late, but the bad thing is that they're the only place that's open late.

19.description: I am so done ordering from this location! i ordered my food at August 28, 2015 11:20am and the time is now 1:20pm and i haven't revived my food. it has been out for delivery since 12:30pm. I order a lot from this place but now i am done! hopefully i will eat my food before the day is over with. Not to mention i have been calling the store since 1:00pm and no one has been answering.

28.description: Wish I could give negative stars. If you ever plan on ordering delivery from this place via Grubhub make sure you do it about two and a half hours BEFORE you want to eat. Called once they told me it was on it's way, called back about a half hour later they put me on hold to find the order, then came back on and tried to take my order and I had to again tell them I was waiting on my order I'd already placed, and THEN they tried saying they never even get the order. Tried blaming it on Grubhub but come to find out they didn't pull the order from Grubhub when it came through. Needless to say I suggested they remove their profile from Grubhub because they can't seem to figure out online ordering. And asked if they thought I'd have my order by breakfast the next day.

45.description: I really wish I had looked at the reviews before ordering from here. I've ordered Sarpino's many times before, but usually the lake st location. The pizza is decent enough, they deliver super late and have great dipping sauces. This was however an awful experience compared to that. My delivery of one pizza took over 1:15... My dipping sauces were incorrect and the pizza was cold. When I called I was out on hold for 5 minutes. All they said was "sorry about that" and "the driver is new and got lost" which, isn't really my problem. I asked for my order to be corrected and they said they could either send out just the sauces which would take another hour (!?) or they could credit a dipping sauce to my account for my next order. Wow. 50 cents credit. Needless to say I will never be ordering from this location again and may never order from the franchise if this is the type of customer service they provide. I'll just keep a pizza in the freezer...

33.description: Best thin crust pizza in Chicago!! The kind you can fold in half and let drip down your arm.  Dip into one of their many sauces and enjoy!  Another great item to order are their sides....all baked, not fried. I love their salads too!  Can't go wrong with Sarpino's. They have great food and amazing customer service.  Our go to for pizza night, EVERY time.

43.description: Food and delivery was timely and good, but the restaurant charged us $18 for a medium pizza, claiming that we didn't use a coupon for the 2 medium pizzas for &10.99 each. We called in on the phone, so we didn't get the deal. If we had ordered online we would have, but then the website said pickup only! The woman on the phone refused to try to remedy the situation, very poor customer service!

2.description: Decided to give a second chance... over an hour late and still waiting for my food. Steer clear of this location.

18.description: Wow.  Just wow. I have no idea how a company can be so incompetent. While the food is passable, they go out of their way to find the worst drivers and customer service people. A few of the incidences include a driver who called us and said she couldn't find our apartment.  When we told her we were on the 8th floor, she called us liars because the building only had 4 floors. When she realized she was in a building on Wabash and not State, she eventually found our place. Food was cold, of course. Tonight, our delivery guy gave us the entirely wrong order. When I called the store to tell them we had somebody else's order. The girl had no idea what I was telling her. After being on hold for 7 minutes, she finally came back and told me our order was coming back to us. I asked if someone else had gotten our order since we had gotten someone else's, she hesitated and said "oh no. Your order is fine". Yeah, right. They then picked up our wrong order, which I'm assuming they went ahead and delivered to the intended  customer. Enjoy your cold food, people at 777 S State!  And there have been several other times where they were just incredibly late. There is no concern for quality or customer service at Sarpinos. It's not worth the frustration to deal with these idiots.

41.description: Yeah, what everyone else says. Starving and exhausted, ordered a pizza a little over a couple of hours before closing time, through Grubhub. After about an hour I get an e-mail saying my order is canceled because Sarpino's delivery range has changed...yeah I live very close. They still shouldn't be closed for another 30 or so mins, I call like three times and it just rings and rings. Of course everything else is closed, so I go to bed hungry. So I call the next day because hey I think maybe it really did change. Nope. The woman on the phone is just like "Well I don't know what happened last night." Alright well obviously someone wanted to go home early. Or maybe they had a family emergency, I don't know. Not really my problem! I was hoping she would give me a discount or at least apologize but she just said angrily "Well what do you want me to do? You got a refund through Grubhub." Um, how about a coupon or something? Mind you I had been polite and understanding the whole time I was talking to her. Geeze. Never again. There's a lot of cheap pizza in this area.

52.description: I was contacted by customer service and received a $20 gift card for the inconvenience.

50.description: Usually this place is always on point, friendly service, fast delivery but tonight was not the night...First off the delivery took an hour to arrive because they mixed up my address from 16th to 15th...next when it arrives its completely the wrong order...Not sure how we can go from Chicken Parmesan thats $11 to a buffalo Chicken Pizza for $17...then instead of offering to fix the situation the girl i talk to on the phone tells me they can just send me out another one but its gonna take another 10 mins to cook and then I need to wait for the delivery...Keep in mind this place is 4 blocks away...Yea im good I think that is the LAST time i ever order from there. Way to ruin a customer's experience.

4.description: I wish I had read the reviews prior to ordering. As I write this, the delivery is over 1 hour late. Calls to the restaurant were met with vague, " driver en route" responses. Will never, ever order from this place again regardless of the quality of the pizza.

6.description: Sometimes you just need some thick, doughy, greasy, cheesey pizza for cheap. Sarpino's is a guilty pleasure of mine. How does it stack up against some other craft pizza places in the area? Not even close. But what Sarpino's does is appeals to the hungry pizza lover in all of us. It's one of those things that if it is sitting in front of you, you will eat it, and you will enjoy it. I don't go out telling my friends, "You have to go get Sarpinos! You don't know what you're missing out on!" However, when I'm just hanging out and the group says they're hungry, I won't hesitate to throw it out there as a quick option. Other perks: open year round, no delivery charge, multiple locations, and most importantly consistency. I've ordered from 5+ locations and got the same quality pizza every time. Next time you consider getting another chain such as Papa Johns, Pizza Hut, or Dominos, try out Sarpino's and you may never go back.

22.description: I recently ordered a large 14'' pizza with a Greek salad. My total came out to roughly $50 which seemed really steep for pizza and salad order. But I told myself it would be a huge pizza and salad that would make up for the price. WRONG. I received my order after about an hour. The pizza was very small (12'' roughly) and tasted like it has been sitting out for several hours from it's cardboard appearance and texture. It was also very greasy, cold and difficult to chew because the crust was hard as a rock from being reheated I presume. I will NEVER order from Sarpinos again. It's sad that the quality has gone down so much over the years.

15.description: Love their calzones and cheesy bread sticks. However if you're choosing delivery it could be over an hour. This place must be busy or under staff with delivery drivers. A few times I chosen to pick up and my order was ready in 15 minutes!

57.description: The best pizza in Chicago in my opinion. I love the calzones and I love that there is no minimum order or delivery charge.Make sure you order online, there is a 15% discount. Can't beat that.

20.description: Wanted a quick, easy dinner for a work meeting this evening.  I called and made my order at 4:20, expecting that it would arrive around 5 for the start of the meeting.  Wrong.  By 5:45 I decided to call and check on our order.  The guy who answered the phone said it was on its way.  Wrong.  Called back at 6:15, as there was still no pizza.  The guy who answered the phone put me on hold, saying he was talking with the driver.  Got back on the phone and told me the driver got a flat tire and was now on his way.  WRONG!  About 20 minutes later the pizza arrived.  The driver was super apologetic, explaining that he had about 6 other deliveries which was why he was so late.  "So you didn't have a flat tire?" I asked.  "No," he replied, "Who told you that?"  I was also told (after being lied to) that they would not be able to give me a discount, even though my pizza came over 2 hours after my order.  Instead they applied a $5 coupon to my next order.No thanks.  I will never be ordering from here again and I will be advising everyone in my summer cohort to avoid this place too.

36.description: Ordered at 12:35am and by 2am still no pizza. I had received a notification that the pizza was ready at 1:04am. Called to see what was up and was told that they had no delivery people coming our direction so it would be at least 20 minutes before our food was out for delivery. WTF!?! I seriously had no idea that if they didn't have a delivery in our direction that they would hold on to it until they had multiple deliveries. I spoke to Stephan who although was cordial was also pretty clueless. We cancelled our order and he said we still needed to call back tomorrow. Why!?! We never received the goods! Don't charge me!! Never again! I'm just mad that they are inconveniencing me and still freaken charging me.

14.description: Wanted a quick, easy dinner for a work meeting this evening.  I called and made my order at 4:20, expecting that it would arrive around 5 for the start of the meeting.  Wrong.  By 5:45 I decided to call and check on our order.  The guy who answered the phone said it was on its way.  Wrong.  Called back at 6:15, as there was still no pizza.  The guy who answered the phone put me on hold, saying he was talking with the driver.  Got back on the phone and told me the driver got a flat tire and was now on his way.  WRONG!  About 20 minutes later the pizza arrived.  The driver was super apologetic, explaining that he had about 6 other deliveries which was why he was so late.  "So you didn't have a flat tire?" I asked.  "No," he replied, "Who told you that?"  I was also told (after being lied to) that they would not be able to give me a discount, even though my pizza came over 2 hours after my order.  Instead they applied a $5 coupon to my next order.No thanks.  I will never be ordering from here again and I will be advising everyone in my summer cohort to avoid this place too.

3.description: Best Pedicure in Chicago- hands down!  I went to Bella Mia back in November for the first time for a bridal party spa day for a friend's wedding. A word about my feet: I have bad feet. I get pedicures at least once a month, pumice on my own, but alas, I get bad calluses and my heels are dry.  Then I met Mama. She started in on my feet and I got lost in my magazine, and randomly looked up with the realization that she had been pumicing my feet for what had to have been at least 30 minutes. I am used to the normal places that spend 2-3 minutes on each step. At first I thought it was just my bad feet, and felt mortified. But then the girl next to me with lovely feet was experiencing the same treatment - I guess it's just how they roll at Bella Mia. My entire pedicure took over an hour (I assume it was a tad longer due to my bad feet). It was wonderfully luxurious, and she did an amazing job. My feet stayed smooth and pretty for almost  a month after words. I made a follow up appointment - same great treatment!I live all the way north in Rogers Park, so this is a hike for me - at least 35 minutes in no traffic, an hour in rush hour. But the pedicure is so amazing, that I am making the trip yet again this Thursday!

1.description: Really impressed with this salon. First, was glad they were open and available on a Sunday with only a day or so notice. Really nice phone service- they were patient with me as I kept going back and forth on time options. Salon is cute. Their music is perfect and relaxing. Never had a pedicure with seemed like 3 massages and included scrub cost. She was so careful and gentle. Loved the pedi. Mani was nice. Not a ton of no-chip color options and definitely not the best polisher. My nails could have been filed a bit more shapely. She applied the polish fine but after being done I noticed that my leftover cuticles also got painted. Went on a Sunday so didn't get a great deal but was able to use their first time customer coupon for 10 bucks off via their website. With so many options in the city I am going to keep exploring.

2.description: My nail infection from here is still growing out since mid May.  I have to wear a band aid on it until it is fully grown out.  Even though it came highly recommended and employees were very nice, I can't say it worked out for me.  I will not be going back.

9.description: I was looking for a new place for a mani/pedi and I stumbled across this place.  Absolutely loved the girls in the salon and am very pleased with my nails!! I got a no-ship manicure for the first time and I'm hooked!  Can't wait to go back!

10.description: So, I actually stumbled onto this place by accident. I was looking for another salon with a similar name that's a 3 minute walk from my front door, and accidentally booked this one. I was pleased! It is a small place that does waxings and mani/pedis in addition to hair. I got my eyebrows waxed and my hair cut, and both were done exactly as i had asked them to be done. The prices seemed a little high for how small the place it is, but I was satisfied with my experience overall.

4.description: The best mani/pedi in chicago! You cannot go wrong here. Welcoming and warm environment.  Very clean.

6.description: This is an amazing salon. I have been going here for over a year. The quality of their work is outstanding!

11.description: hands down best pedicure you will ever get! my mother and i have been going for years and while we may stray, nothing compares to the ladies at bella mia. pedicures can take up to an hour but not because they are slow but because they take time to make sure your feet are perfect. our pedicures usually last about a month and in those summer months your feet still look and feel perfect. the staff is friendly and personable. they owner is usually there working the front desk. for pedicures, definitely make an appointment.

5.description: Would recommend Berta at Bella Mia Salone, her manicures and pedicures are amazing.  She's been doing my nails for over seven years and they always turn out great.  She cares about her customers and ensures they have a great and local experience.

7.description: Went to this salon today as my normal mani/pedi places were booked or closed on a Monday.  From the Yelp reviews, website and pricing was expecting a great service and was disappointed.  I did the special mani/pedi $45 combo, which is more than the usual $35 the salons by me charge, but decided to spoil myself.  The salon is old and can use some sprucing up - the nail chairs are old and the place is a bit outdated.  My entire mani/pedi was done in just over an hour - so very fast and not much flare.  My manicurist was nice, but not very talkative and only complaint was that she filed my nail in uneven shapes.   The worst part of the visit was the other manicurist who received a personal call on her cell phone while working on the only other customer in there.  She took the personal call from a family member who was very loud on the other side of the phone and proceeded to have a full 5 minute conversation with this family member who she said was intoxicated and yelling at her on the phone.  It was extremely uncomforable to hear this entire conversation  all while her client sat there uncomforably getting her nails filed.  I go to a salon to relax - not here a worker have a full on confrontation with a family member on their personal phone.  Completely unprofessional and ruined my so-so experience.  The reason for the 2 start is 1.  over priced service for a mani/pedi that was very express 2.  having to listen to an employee talk on their cell phone.  I will not be returning and just cannot recommend.

8.description: I made the appointment to have my hair cut one evening after work, I had a 5:30 appointment.  The layout of the salon was a set up as a nail salon environment.  So there was a lot of smelly chemicals in the air. There was one work station for they stylist.  She was really nice and very willing to make sure that my hair was cut to my liking, so she asked a lot of questions and took her time. She did a pretty good job, but I was sadly somewhat disappointed with me haircut.  As it isn't as good as my previous stylist in Kansas City did for me and my friend everytime.I've been debating whether or not to go back as my hair needs cut again and it's 1 week or so later and still haven't found the stylist that can cut my hair well. I have blonde hair and thinning areas on back and front and a good haircut is a must. I normally get my haircut every 2 weeks.

0.description: Had the Manhattan Facial (for men) with Lahoya. Excellent experience  She gets five stars for her expertise and smooth bedside manner. She has the hands of an angel. I left with my face feeling clean and revitalized. Looking forward to my next visit.

1.description: This is such a cute place!  I can't really speak to the selection of children's items since I was looking at all of the items for women, but this really is a great shop.  The selection of clothing and jewelry is really nice and VERY fairly priced.  I've bought two different pieces of jewelry here and always get compliments.  I've been in there twice, and have met 3 different members of the staff, and everyone was friendly and helpful - not at all pushy.  I'm so happy this place has opened in my neighborhood! :)

0.description: Love this Place!!!!

12.description: The owner and staff of PianoForte Chicago are dedicated not only to offering superb pianos and purchasing guidance; they have available wonderful recital and meeting facilities.  PianoForte's reach goes beyond their beautiful showroom:  The PianoForte Foundation, a non-profit which provides piano lesson scholarships and piano donations, presents world-class performances year-round.  PianoForte Chicago provides a full circle of support for Chicago's piano community.

3.description: Just made another purchase at PianoForte, this a small one.  Whether buying a Fazioli Concert Grand or a simple keyboard, Thomas and his staff show the same level of care, support and customer service.  The facility and the cultural events hosted at Piano Forte are an under-appreciated gem in the City.

1.description: My first interaction with PianoForte Chicago was posting an inquiry through their website concerning a particular model of pianos, which Thomas Zoells (the owner) answered immediately.The showroom was lovely during my visit in November 2014. I was assisted by Steve Marcus, who was very helpful in providing detailed comparisons of my various options. While I really longed for the tactile response of an acoustic piano, city/apartment life isn't particularly conducive to owning a grand piano. I walked in the store with my heart set on the Yamaha Clavinova series of digital pianos, but Steve demonstrated several hybrid pianos, which combine the versatility of digital sound with the touch of an acoustic piano. I walked out of the building the new owner of an AvantGrand N1.There was one hiccup when I received the incorrect owner's manual upon delivery of the instrument, but Steve was quick to provide me with the right materials during a follow-up visit to the store. PianoForte offers excellent professional service in my experience and I have not regretted my purchase since. If I were to someday upgrade to an acoustic, I wouldn't hesitate to return.

2.description: I actually had a very odd experience with PianoForte a couple years ago.  I was calling around to different venues four months in advance of a personal piano recital I wanted to host.  I contacted PianoForte through their online form and listed the date I was interested in.  I did receive a response right back which included the rental hall agreement I would need to sign: rules about having to obtain special liability insurance, their rates, etc.I decided it wasn't for me and did not sign the agreement, nor did I reply to the message to indicate in any way that I wanted to finalize things.  This was in February.Then, four months later in June on the date I had initially inquired about, I received a phone call from PianoForte asking why I hadn't arrived yet.  I was very confused, considering neither myself or PianoForte had followed up about this.  The person I spoke with seemed quite upset that I hadn't showed up, but I hadn't provided any payment information nor had I signed the rental hall agreement.  When I explained this, the person said something like "Oh I guess I should note that for the future."Even though I knew I wasn't in the wrong, I felt bad about it.  I just think it was odd that my space rental had been considered final when nothing had been signed or paid for.

9.description: I went to PianoForte not as a buyer, but as a photographer wanting to take pictures of piano soundboards. The personnel allowed me to spend as much time as I needed and gave me free access to all pianos on display. During my 2 hours taking photographs, I could not help but notice the interactions between customers and PianoForte personnel. They are extremely knowledgeable, polite, and accommodating. If one is thinking about purchasing a piano, PianoForte should be your first (and most likely only) stop.

10.description: BAD. Did not deliver what was committed (per their contract).Somewhat snooty, snobbish and with a snide remark when faced with what he had done wrong.Feedback specifically for their recital rooms which they rent.We had arranged for a recital at PianoForte. Were promised a beautiful room with Fazioli piano. Lo and behold got a junk room with an out of tune lousy piano, nothing like the picture they had shown and promised.Hope this behavior does not propagate to their sales of pianos.

4.description: I live in a suburb far from PianoForte but I would NOT make any serious decisions regarding my pianos without consulting them.  - Thomas Zoells is, himself, a fine pianist. He knows the artistic and practical issues of acquiring a piano. He comes from a musical family. He knows how to match pianos with a wide range of professionals and amateurs of all skill levels and he works tirelessly to do just that. - It should be said that Thomas Zoells has become quite important to the musical life of greater Chicago. His broadcasting connections & foundation promote jazz & classical guest artists who perform almost daily at events in PianoForte's own auditorium. Interested customers can enjoy a lifelong relationship with Chicago's finest piano resource, as evidenced by considerable repeat business. Anyone or any organization interested in pianos should make a point of consulting Thomas Zoells at PianoForte.

6.description: As a pianist who recently moved to Chicago, PianoForte quickly became my second home. It is not your usual piano sales company! They support and are so passionate about the arts, the artists and the culture in general. It is the only place in Chicago as a one stop shop for piano lovers: rent a room to practice, rent a gorgeous studio to make high quality video and audio recordings, stream your performances, buy a piano, find a technician to work on your piano, attend hundreds of incredible concerts, receptions, find a perfect teacher etc. And what makes it an incredible place is the people who work there: dedicated, honest and personable.

15.description: The owner of Pianoforte, Thomas Zoells, is the epitomy of what a true salesperson should be: honest, informative, and ultimately interested in finding the piano that is a perfect fit for his client.  We thoroughly enjoyed our trips to downtown Chicago to peruse his inventory and ponder our purchase over the course of several visits.  Piano buying comes full circle with his foundation, which fosters the enjoyment of music through performances.  I highly recommend Pianoforte to anyone considering such a significant investment.

0.description: I've had the pleasure of using PianoForte's recording services and piano studio numerous time in the last few years. And I can happily say that this is not only one of the best studios I've ever worked in, but is also the most comfortable environment I've yet encountered for the grueling and often psychological straining processing of recording music.Tom Zoells is an asset to Chicago's music scene in general, and his piano shop (whose proceeds have allowed him to extend so much of his goodwill to the rest of Chicago) are a testament to his taste and honesty as a businessman. Make your next recording here. Or buy your next piano or keyboard. You'll immediately see what sets Tom and the rest of the team at PianoForte apart.

5.description: As a piano store, this is the best, the best selection, the most knowing purveyor of fine instruments in Thomas Zoells.  the facility is wonderful for concerts and recording!  I've done some amazing two piano recordings here and I hope to be back soon!  If you have kids who want to take lessons, this is also the place.  absolutely 5 stars!

13.description: Pianoforte is amazing. First floor is a piano showroom for different kinds of piano thats on sale. Second floor is a music recital hall for people singing, playing other instruments, music lessons, and cafeteria/kitchen of refreshments from wine, wine coolers, and even different types of craft beer. They also serve cheese, h'or d'ouevres, and other foods. Third floor can categorized as a piano recital music hall. You can play piano pieces from jazz to classical. Awesome place for musicians and people who appreciate music.

11.description: Thomas and the staff at PianoForte are honest, knowledgeable, low pressure yet attentive when it matters. Thomas's story of how he came to be in the piano business is inspiring, and his zeal in bringing quality pianos and music to Chicago is unsurpassed. He's not really a sales person as much as someone who loves pianos and wants others to have great ones. The Fazioli pianos are really amazing, yet he carries a broad spectrum of new and used pianos with fair prices to match. If you're looking for the world's best piano or something for your child to start with, you can't do better than to start (and probably end) your search for a piano at PianoForte. Highly recommended.

8.description: I have used PianoForte Chicago as a location for my studio recitals for many years and each time my students and myself have had a wonderful experience.  The space is beautiful and the piano for performance is always top quality (to say the least). The students and their families often comment on what a lovely performance space PianoForte is.  In addition, through the years several of my students, I am happy to say, have also been able to find and purchase a piano at PianoForte.  Thomas Zoells and his staff couldn't be more caring and considerate of all our needs.

14.description: Very beautiful showroom and you can expect to work with genuine, professional and nice people. Ask for Thomas and he will guide you the right way. I am in the market for a good professional upright so I had visited almost all the piano stores that you can name in chicago. I had visited stores that i would not want to give my business to, and PianoForte is definitely on the opposite end of it. PianoForte has some of the nicest piano in the world (Fazioli, Grotrian, Feurich, and the more popular one which is Kawai). Even though they sell very expensive piano, I find they also have some entry to mid level piano. so something for everyone. Piano shopping can be a very stressful process and experience. as many people said, sometimes it's even worse than car shopping. However, I don't think it's necessary the case when you work with people who are truly passionate about music. They care more about you finding *your* right instrument than just pushing for a sale. and I think Thomas's passion in setting up this store as well as the creation of PianoForte Foundation is a testament of his passion in piano. Check out the PianoForte Foundation website and you'll understand what i meant.I have no associations with this piano store. I'm just a regular customer who haven't played piano for 20+ years and now it's time to pick up my childhood hobby. I just want to share my experience with others (esp. amateur players or adult beginners). When I started my piano search, I looked up piano stores in yelp and didn't have much success in finding info. and I had some really bad and negative experience. I hope my review will help someone in finding *their* instrument and have a great experience.I'd be happy to share my experiences that I had with other stores (beside PianoForte, I would also recommend a few other places) and piano models that i had tried. Feel free to send me private messages.Piano shopping should be a pleasant journey!

7.description: A wonderful and unique place in Chicago. Much, much more than a piano shop. I have attended a few wonderful concerts at this place, and am so impressed by Thomas Zoells' knowledge and passion.

58.description: Clean, quick, and careful work.  Great selection of polish colors, and while I was there, a bunch of new fall colors arrived.Best prices if you go M-W.

56.description: After a particularly harrowing Target run, I decided at the last minute that I deserved a Saturday afternoon pedicure. I'd had a very rushed, damaged-while-still-in-the-shop pedicure a few months back at another South Loop nail den, so I thought I'd try my luck at Salon Vision.  It was 4pm when I arrived and pretty busy, so I didn't think I'd get in (did I mention it was Saturday?) but the woman at the desk penciled me in for 4:30, I ran a couple other errands, and had a chair waiting for me when I came back a few minutes early.  SV had all the new Essie shades for fall (as well as my favorite summer OPI's still in the rack) and I plopped into a super comfortable massage chair for my 33 buck pedicure.The verdict?  Yay!  The space is super clean (even at the end of a weekend day), the staff is lovely, my pedicure came out perfectly.  And they let me stay in the chair for 45 minutes to dry (the UV dryers were busy, which means I missed out on a little neck massage, but, I had the chair, I guess).  On the way out, I got mah toes sprayed and plastic-wrapped up since I didn't have flip flops on me, and lo and behold: when I arrived home a few hours later, and pulled off my socks and boots, the nails looked great.  I'm so pleased, and definitely coming back (probs for one of those M-W mani/pedi deals). Of course, I'd like a little more leg/foot massage, but hey - for 33 bucks, no biggie.What a nice surprise!

29.description: This place was fabulous.  My friend and I both got pedicures - my friend is in the spa business and she said her pedicure was great.  The staff was wonderful - I have specific needs due to a physical disability and the tech knew exactly how to help me.  That alone was priceless.

42.description: Nice clean place.. I've had a good pedicure and will be going back. The ladies are very nice.

23.description: I have been here several times. I usually walk in and get whoever. The place is clean with lots of polish choices & they are reasonably priced. Today I was lucky & got a special experience with Vera. I will request her next time. She is a special woman you must request her!

47.description: In town for a week, I had walked miles each day and was really looking forward to a great spa manicure and pedicure.   I didn't want to spend a lot, but didn't want to go the cheap route either.    So, i relied on reviews written on yelp and other sites.   This one seemed like the right choice and was in the right area for where we were planning to spend our day.   I made appts for myself and my daughter.   I requesedt 6:00.  They said "oh, that's not enough time....we close at 7:00."  So I thought, good, they'll be giving us a good long pedicure and manicure....So we moved it to 5:30....YES....an hour and a half of much needed care to my poor feet and legs.Oh....how wrong.  I arrived at 5:00, and they were able to accommodate us early.  The place looked nice and clean.  Relieved, my daughter and I walked over to our waiting technicians, April and Laura.    I noticed right away that April seemed to have an attitude.  She did not smile at my daughter once, gave her orders in short and rude tones, and then did not do what she had asked her to do.  Laura was more pleasant though she spoke very little english...or so i thought.   during my manicure she spoke very perfect english on her personal phone call.  not impressed.    Speaking of my manicure...i've never had a more uneven paint job.   she didn't go all the way to the sides of the nail, the tips had little coverage.  Some nails had thick coats, others had very little.   It looked worn off before i even left the salon.  My daughter had the same problem with her pedicure.....the colors we each chose obviously needed a third coat but apparently they weren't interested in doing the job right.Now let's talk about the pedicure.   I know what a spa pedicure should feel like.   This wasn't it.  It started off ok...but she went through everything so fast a I kept thinking..well, she'll come back to that...nope she didn't.   pitiful massage, pitiful exfoliation, pitiful cuticle trimming....and i have to wonder what was the purpose of slathering on a handful of lotion, wrapping my legs in saran wrap, then laying a hot towel near scalding on top of that....if you are going to leave it in for so long that it turns ice cold and gives me goosebumps.  That was the most unpleasant experience of the day.   Did absolutely nothing for me but made me uncomfortable.  My daughter agreed....that was horrible. When this was all over....we were taken to the 'drying table'.  I was sat in a stool....so low that I nearly fell onto rather than sit down onto it.   once there Laura did give me a nice little shoulder rub....but did not make up for the shitty mani-pedi.   April sat my daughter down....gave her shoulders one squeeze and sulked off.   The over one hour experience I  thought I was paying for was really only a rushed 45 minutes.I would NEVER recommend this place to anyone.  And I am sick to think that I paid them.....and gave them a fat tip....I will never tip just because I think I have to again.

8.description: This is a nice, newer looking, updated nail salon. I always get a no-chip mani and a standard pedi and typically don't have many complaints. I will say though how unfriendly the front desk girl is. Every.Single.Time. I actually walk into this place prepared for her attitude..which is why I recently stopped going.Oh, and after my last visit I developed a nasty paronychia (fungal/bacterial infection of the nail) within HOURS. The docs I work with said that the instruments must have been so contaminated for my nail to swell and ooze that fast. Yuck!

31.description: Visited Salon Vision to catch up with a friend.  I was pretty disappointed though.  The quality of their on my fingernails and toes was subpar.  It was almost as if I painted my nails myself.  I spent $50 for a lousy job? ugh...  I was not impressed and will think twice before returning to Salon Vision.

34.description: I'm surprised at the negative reviews....The interior of this place is great & relaxing. All the nail technicians were friendly and helpful. Their services are very fairly priced and my resulting pedi is perfect. Long lasting and well done!The best part was that it was quick, but not too quick. Just long enough to feel relaxed.

16.description: Great place. Clean, well decorated and takes walk-ins. The only thing that was a little disappointing is that the staff could be a little friendlier. But it was a great experience. They even fixed my nail when it chipped!

13.description: Came 1 hour before close and was told they had  nobody who could do a polish change or eye brow waxing. Huh? There were a few people in the salon getting serviced and one who had clearly just finished getting serviced so how is it possible nobody can do 10 minutes worth of work? I can understand being told there would be a wait but to flat out say nobody is available is absurd.  But I guess I should be glad she didn't offer to do seeing as she was blowing her nose in the middle of talking to me and digging in with tissue. Gross!

11.description: This was my first visit for a manicure. Prices are comparable to other nail salons. However additional perks are added, such as the warm towel hand compress that provides instant relaxation! They are also great at accommodating to your time schedule! Also, I got my manicure on Monday (8-31) and as of Saturday (9-5)...no chips! Couldn't say enough positive things!

39.description: Can I get a smile? I opted for the manicure/pedicure weekday special. Most of the ladies in the salon were nice, but I can't say the same for everyone. The woman doing my manicure was rude and pushy. I went with a friend for my birthday so we wanted to sit next to each other and chat. Rather than say 'excuse me' or something along those lines to get my attention, the manicurist would roll her eyes and snip at me (as if having a conversation is not allowed). There was only one other customer there.To make matters worse when I was deciding on nail color for my hands she quipped, "you have to decide now - we close at 7:30" (it was 7:15 by the way). She was clearly having a bad day, but she didn't need to take it out on the birthday girl. I told her that if she's in a hurry to leave or needs to be somewhere I understand and I'm fine with one of her colleagues completing the polish. She walked away and I never got color polish on my nails. The pedicure was great - the manicure was awful. Happy birthday to me.If you're looking for a relaxing and courteous spa-like experience, I wouldn't recommend this place. If you're looking for a good manicure/pedicure special and in-and-out service, do your thing.

37.description: The service is not the best but they get you in and get you out quickly.  Plus they have a nice special M-W.  They play movies, so even though they are not speaking to you, you at least have something to look at.

0.description: Salon Vision is a great neighborhood nail salon.  The manicures and pedicures are consistently high quality and the salon is clean, modern, and efficient.  The staff is friendly and the environment is comfortable and relaxing.  They even cap off your experience with a shoulder massage.  You can't get any better at this price point.

38.description: I have visited this place 3 times. On both of my first visits I made an appt for man/pedi. When i arrived they insisted that i do both the mani and pedi at the same time. The first time I agreed, the second time (i wouldn't have gone but no other salon had an avail appt and they did. wonder why???). Both of the times it was uncomfortable. What do i mean by that? They pull your arm to accommodate them, not you. They purposely discombobulate your arm so they can "work". They huff and puff and talk about you right in from of your face in their ignorant little language. They barely cut any cuticles and my nails looked like they were painted by a 10 year old. I explained to them that i would rather sit at a station for the nails to be painted (the second time) but they wouldn't have it. The reason they make you do this is so they can get in as MANY people as possible. Furthermore, they do pedicures in 25 minutes. When i asked her to keep scrubbing (she didn't even smooth them out!) she said "no, that is all i do". WHAT?!?! A pedicure done in under 45 min (AT LEAST) is not a pedicure. They barely buff the heals and ball of the foot, the massage consisted of her pounding my calf's for a total of 25 seconds and i won't even go into the paint job. The third time i visited this salon i called prior to going (yet again... no other appts anywhere) and requested a mani/pedi. I was specific on the phone that i wanted them to be done SEPARATELY. When i arrived they once again insisted that i have them done together. When i said no, they said they could only do one service for me because they had other customers coming in and "COULDN'T DO ANYTHING FOR ME. TOO BAD." (with their arms crossed and staring at me all dumb... mind you there were 4 of them just sitting there with no clients) When i explained that i asked for them to be done separately and the woman on the phone confirmed it would be done as so, they said "noo, too bad. you go somewhere else." It is POOR business to: a) promise people appointments on the phone and then change them when you arrive b) have someone taking appointments who doesn't care what the client is saying c) have someone taking appointments who DOESN'T EVEN SPEAK ENGLISH. What kind of a salon tells you to go somewhere else? This place is a typical,nail chop shop where they prefer quantity over quality. Save your money and your man/pedi's . Stay AWAY from this horrific establishment.

51.description: Apparently the third time is not the charm. I came here again out of sheer laziness--I didn't want to drive all the way north to my regular spot--and I got what I deserved: a half-a**ed manicure. My friend got it worse: her toes were smeared and chipped the same day. Plus--what a treat to watch a full-length children's movie twice in a row while getting my mani-pedi. (No, there were no kids in the salon.) Sigh. Wishing for a great salon in the South Loop.

27.description: I never write reviews, but I've been going to Salon Vision since moving back to the south loop in July and they always do a great job. I have very long natural nails and they never pressure me to cut them off like other places do, best no-chip mani in Chicago and only $35!!! If I go with one of the Gelish colors I can get 6 or 7 weeks without a chip, only go back because of the the nail growth starts to look tacky after a while :)

32.description: First word that comes to mind....Rude!!!! Very disappointed considering that I've been there once before when they originally opened because I live in the same high rise, but most apparently the staff has changed and wow oh wow...Fist of all, it's not polite to talk in your native language and then giggle between each other in front of customers who can't understood. I'm a foreigner myself and I would never do that. I wanted to get a little TLC time for me and my boyfriend for our anniversary. Well when we got there we weren't greeted, second off the girl's face looked like she literally was doing us a favor.  She looked at me all crazy and chuckled when I asked for a no-chip pedicure, another ignorant type of behavior. I'm a dancer therefore my toes get beat up quite a lot, hence me requesting a no-chip pedicure. Fine, they don't do them. No big deal. I said that I'll get the regular one. Well my pedicure lasted about 15 minutes, my boyfriend's 10 minutes. Sloppy work to say the least, accompanied by rude behavior. As I went to dry my nails she came right over and asked me to pay even before I was done. Really?! Could you make it more obvious that you want us out of there?! Nobody forced them to work on Memorial day and not want to be there attitude is what we got for $80.00.  We left there quite disappointed and upset.  If you want a shitty expensive experience then this salon is a place for you!

54.description: The manicure/pedicure that I received here was just okay.  I thought it to be a little overpriced for the interior of the salon, along with the nail polish colors that they offered and the snobby attitude of the woman doing my nails.  Maybe she was just having a bad day?  Also, unlike almost every other nail salon that I have been to, this salon does not even offer water (or any other beverages) to their customers.

48.description: Very nice! On Mondays, Tuesdays, & Wednesdays they have a deal on mani pedi. Just popped in for a pedicure; my feet feel and look great, and I was pleasantly surprised that they give you a free shoulder massage while your nails dry. Awesome!

44.description: I have been on a major search for a good manicure place in the area and my search is not over yet. i came here because i read some pretty good yelp reviews but i was thoroughly disappointed. the manicurist completely rushed through both my mani and pedi and it completely shows. she painted more of my cuticles than she did my nails... it looks like a child painted them. there is no chance that I will go back.

24.description: While I continue to like the technicians at this salon and have been happy with my pedicures here, I had to update my review to say that this is the second time I've been turned away for a walk-in service when there was only ONE other customer in the salon at the time! I respect that patrons with reservations come first but honestly how long does a pedicure take? I was told they could fit me in if I came back in an hour. Instead I walked over to Spa O and got a pedicure right away (despite 5 other clients getting services done at the same time). I was finished 30 minutes before Salon Vision's next opening. I can't believe Salon Vision would turn away business like that. Oh well. Spa O is great, too!
