7.description: The front desk girl here is so rude!!!  Also all the no-chip manicures I get here chip within 3 days, and its so much more expensive than other places in the city.  Another thing that makes this place the worst is that somehow they are always "booked", but there aren't a lot of people in there... maybe they are short staffed, but I could see why if they have to work with the receptionist.

49.description: I LOVE this salon!!  I am a "nail person" and I am very picky about the quality of my mani/pedi.  I rate salons based on consistency and quality.  I have been a half dozen times and every time I got perfect, lasting quality.  Every time I try somewhere else I compare it to Salon Nails.  And nothing seems to match up to it.  However, I recommend calling in advance to be sure they can fit you in.

40.description: I've been here multiple times for mani/pedi's and have always been extremely happy. The decor is calming and the pedicure chairs are the BEST I've found in Chicago - large, clean leather chairs that have self operated massage functions. The staff is friendly, efficient, and always cheerful. Also, I went there for my wedding with a total of 10 ladies and we were in and out within an hour and a half and they only charged us $35 each for mani/pedi's!! Bonus - it's BYOB, and they gladly keep your beverages cold and refill your glass whenever it's empty.

53.description: I had the pleasure of going to this Salon and was very happy with the service.  I had the waxing services and the lady I had was fantastic.  I had an appointment at 11am and walked right in and received prompt service.  So, I would definitely recommend this place.

30.description: I usually just go here for waxing. It's a bit pricey and they usually do a good job - depends on who you get.Mani/pedi's are ok. I'm not pleased with how they do french manicures. But they do offer deals and it's not too hard to get an appointment here. Honestly, I just go here because it's in the neighborhood.And btw, they do speak English here pretty ok. I know that's an issue we face at a lot of salons!

46.description: Been meaning to write a review on this place in forever and finally sat down to do it.  I love this salon!!!!  Always get awesome lasting manicures and good service.  The decor is relaxing and there's always a good movie playing to keep you company.  I have a spa day here for my B-Day last year and they were very accommodating with the large group of girls that I had!

1.description: The technician didn't clean the instruments before starting working with me and when I realized and asked her she gave me an attitude and told me it was clean (which was not, i could clearly see old cuticles in there, it was so disgusting). I only had a manicure, it was ok,  nothing perfect and detailed as I would expect. Not worth coming back. I specially didn't like that all the technicians are talking (yelling) to each other across the room in their language and it just makes the whole experience weird and not relaxing as it should be.

55.description: I realize everyone has a bad day.  I was so sad to lose such a great neighborhood business that I went back to Salon Vision again.  I am thrilled to report that this time all was in order and like the old days - great service, no rush and "the pampering treat" I'd remembered from previous visits.

9.description: I just moved to the neighborhood. I really loved this place. It's modern and the employees are friendly. I like their specials and the girl who did my nails were so sweet and helpful in choosing my color. I didn't get the name of the girl that helped me unfortunately. My no chip still looks awesome.

26.description: I think I just received the worlds quickest pedi, the nail polish was horrible. It was lumpy not smooth, my child could have done a better job. Mine you I asked her to fix it three times now, she just dabbed some nail polish remover around the corners of my nail.  However,the sweet hostess did have another tech redo my toes. I will not be here anymore.

25.description: I really wanted to like this place. While the hostess and my nail tech were accommodating and very pleasant, the polish chipped within 3 days.  The pedicure was fabulous and the tech paid attention to detail but, the value of a No-chip lies in its longevity.  For this reason, Salon Vision receives a D in the value category.

12.description: Love going to SV Nails.  I go every other week for gel polish.  Angel is super friendly and all the nail techs are so nice and detail-oriented.  If you get a regular manicure they give you a short 30 second shoulder massage (super amazing).  I wish they would do this for the bi-weekly gel patrons. ;) All of their services are great and the salon is clean and relaxing.  They are priced a bit higher than some other places in the area- but the cleanliness and friendly atmosphere, all while allowing you silence to relax, makes the cost totally worth it.

59.description: This nail salon is pretty good.  They have a good selection of polish colors, and get the new colors for the season regularly.  The woman who did my pedicure took her time and really did a good job.  My manicure was just so so, but two days out I still have no chips so that's good.  I caution you that if all the other women who work there have taken reservations from their regular customers and you make an appointment without a preferred manicurist, you may be left waiting until the regulars have been taken care of.  (It happened to my mom.)   Besides that, the ambiance is fantastic,  the staff is relatively friendly, and they do a pretty good job.

21.description: I went here for a mani/pedi on a Saturday afternoon. My friend and I didn't have an appointment, but they were able to accommodate us right away. Like most of the newer salons the pedicure chair had massage capabilities which was nice.This has nothing to really do with the service itself, but I think they really like the movie Why Did I get Married. We walked in on the end of the movie and it immediately started over again as we were getting our nails done. The service was decent and she listen to how I wanted my nails shaped and didn't cut too much, which some places can do. I like my nails to be on the longer side. I was given plenty of time to let my nails dry and they wrapped our feet before we put our boots back on to help protect the polish. All in all a pretty decent place The price point is comparable to other salons in the area. I would return.

17.description: Best nail salon! I had a pedicure and manicure there yesterday. This is the only place I have found in the city that actually scrubs your feet and massages for more that 1 minute. And my nails looked great!

10.description: I have tried out some other nail salons in the area and have decided Salon Vision is the best.  Forget about trying to find a better nail salon.

5.description: Great selection of no-chip colors. I have been to this salon three times. The first and second time my nails did chip after a couple of days, but the technicians repaired them with no question. The third visit was by far the best. Yuka (I may have misspelled her name), did a fantastic job on my nails. The only reason I had to get them done recently was because they were growing out, but had not chipped yet! I am giving 4 stars because the price total for a pedicure and no-chip manicure is a little high ($65) in my opinion. Otherwise great nail salon!

3.description: Anna is actually really great here. I gave this place numerous chances as I was ready to make it my weekly spot. Unfortunately, every single time I've made an appointment here they've made me wait for 15 minutes plus to start after I've picked a color. The last time more than 30 minute wait when they've got me penciled in for the day. I understand when you're running late.. But what's the point of making an appointment if I wait every single time?Ridiculous and frustrating . Telling me "2 more minutes" and having me wait for over 15  more is demeaning. I walked out.

35.description: this place is great for mani pedis and eyebrow waxing anything else is a no go but they do a great job with what they are good at

19.description: Salon Vision is one of the best salons in Chicago.  I have been going there for years.  The service is fantastic, always greeted with a warm hello and seated right away.  My mani/pedi is always impeccable.  I normally go to Cindy, who is just an absolute delight and always does a wonderful job, but all of the technicians there are great.  They have all of the latest nail colors and collections to choose from.  The salon is very clean.  The spa pedi tubs are also always spotless.  The spa chairs are beyond comfortable.  They also play current movies to watch, bonus.  You can also make it a girls day and bring in your own treats and champagne, always will to accommodate.  If you are looking for a great place to get your nails/toes done, go to salon vision.

28.description: I have been here twice, and have not enjoyed my experience either time.  My nails ended up looking worse than if I did them myself.  They soaked off my no-chip, and charged me for the soak off.   What they did NOT do is use any kind of ridge-filling product to compensate in any way for the damage done by the no-chip.  I did not expect a miracle, but this is a nail spa, and I expected that they would use some corrective process. In addition, the staff at this salon are consistently rude.  This is not a cheap place, where you excuse the rudeness for a mani+pedi for under $30.   They won't get my money a third time.

45.description: This place is clean comfortable and QUIET.  They have the expected movie playing on TVs around the salon but it's always been on mute when I've come in.  I've had probably 5 different women do mani/pedi and all have been great.  I'm notoriously hard on my nails but my mani's from Salon Vision last (without chipping) for a good week which is pretty miraculous for me.  Heads up, you HAVE to set up an appointment for this place.  I don't think I've ever seen anyone manage to walk in off the street and get in despite many free manicurists sitting around.  They always claim to have regulars scheduled with appointments but I've often been there for a good 30+ minutes after they've sent someone away and still see 2-3 women still sitting around not seeming to expect anyone.

33.description: This is the only salon I go to anymore, and when I friend wants to meet for a mani date (which habitually on the north side, because who lives south of North Ave. anyway?! oh that's right, I DO!) I always cringe. There is one goddess of manicures who is the best nail painter and cuticle maintenance-er I have ever had the pleasure of meeting. Unfortunately, I can't tell you her name because I would probably have a hard time getting an appointment with her, but she is a perfectionist, and I greatly appreciate it. This year, at Christmastime, they also gave me a gift certificate for being an awesome, loyal weekly customer. Thanks!!  Also...I do often see people walk in and expect the ladies to accommodate them immediately, however it DOES NOT SAY WALK-INS WELCOME anywhere on the door...so I don't understand why people get an attitude when they say they don't have any appointments. I've seen it happen more than once. Oh well, more time for me and my perfect nails :D

43.description: I think this is the only nail salon in the South loop that has deals for mani/pedis.  $39 on M-W is a good deal.This place is cute, clean, and has a nice staff.It's easy to get to (1 block from Roosevelt CTA stop).

2.description: I went here for a mani/pedi on a Saturday afternoon. My friend and I didn't have an appointment, but they were able to accommodate us right away. Like most of the newer salons the pedicure chair had massage capabilities which was nice.This has nothing to really do with the service itself, but I think they really like the movie Why Did I get Married. We walked in on the end of the movie and it immediately started over again as we were getting our nails done. The service was decent and she listen to how I wanted my nails shaped and didn't cut too much, which some places can do. I like my nails to be on the longer side. I was given plenty of time to let my nails dry and they wrapped our feet before we put our boots back on to help protect the polish. All in all a pretty decent place The price point is comparable to other salons in the area. I would return.

18.description: Salon Vision was my favorite Chicago nail spot. It's not the cheapest or the fastest, but overall, quite good.- they have lots of OPI and Essie polishes, including the latest collections- lots of magazines to peruse- there's always a movie playing, which I enjoy, because then I don't have to make small talk, I can just enjoy the mani/pedi- they do offer no chip- I've gotten standard wear out of my mani/pedis- they wrap your toes in saran wrap so you don't smuge when you put shoes on- CLEAN- reasonably priced- you can make appointments online- not really good for walk-ins, even though the door says they take them - much better to make an appointment

41.description: I've gone here multiple times for special occasion mani/pedis.  Manicures never seem to last for me no matter how much I pay for them, so I can't comment on how good or bad they are here.  The pedicures, however, are incredible and I've gotten them to last a full month with some additional coats of clear polish.  The staff is friendly, there's never usually a long wait and they play movies while you're getting your nails done.  I'm going again for a no-chip manicure so hopefully that will last longer!

52.description: My mother and  I have had mani pedis done at salon vision several times. In January my mother went and 2 weeks later when she took off her polish she had the lovely surprise of a toenail fungus. Hearing my mothers story I thought maybe it was just a one time occurrence I went back to Salon Vision mid March, right when it opened believing that I would be safe since the tools would be clean. Low and behold, today I took off my polish and what did I find? The same fungus as my mother. I believe that the ladies do nice work but I warn that you make sure that all the tools are clean, especially the clippers, or you may end up with some unsightly nail conditions right before the summer months that I have. I will definitely will not be going back to Salon Vision.

50.description: I don't often splurge on anything spa like, being frugal, and well, busy. We won't discuss how long I try to stretch out a cut & color because I don't have the time for an appointment....But sometimes a mani/pedi is a necessity. I was looking for a new place on a weekday, they had a special advertised somewhere, and off I went. I've only gone in during a weekday, so I can't speak to their busyness during evenings or weekends. But every time I've been, I was able stroll right in and and get a chair immediately. And I've had the same lady attend to me during each visit....probably because when I do go, it's on the same weekday, at roughly the same time. This salon is very clean, very comfortable, with beautiful decor. And the staff is great. They do accept appointments over the phone or online. A wide range of polish colors available. They do show a movie on the big screen, it's appears as though they show one movie on repeat for a week or so? So you can catch a flick if you time it right, though I imagine it gets boring for the staff. It's about an hour of relaxing. And no unnecessary attempt to chat me up...I get to lean back, and enjoy my pedicure in peace, just the way I like it. It's my quiet time. :)There's a mani/pedi special Mon-Wed that is totally worth it. Street parking kind of sucks, but there's an el station a block away. And every time I've gone, my polish has lasted at least two weeks, which is about when I'm ready for a new color.

4.description: Not impressed.  Got a "no chip" mani and reg pedi here today.  First time here--less than friendly staff.  Surprised at the price--$65+ on a Monday?  There's a special on regular Mani Pedi's on Monday, but no chips means you get no special pricing.  Take note.   Also, pretty sure my "no chip" is going to peel within the week based on how weak and fragile the gel seems.  My last no chip (or gel) which I had done while travelling in CA lasted 3 weeks.  I'm a little afraid to do much in this one because it's so thin.Finally, my manicurist was sick.  Sneezing and dripping everywhere.  I'm sympathetic--I've had a sinus infection for the last 4 weeks.  But really? Send the poor girl home.  This is supposed to be a sanitary space. No thanks, I'll keep looking for decent gel mani that lasts longer than a week someplace in this city!  So disappointing.***Less than 24 hours later.I already have a chip.  Sigh.

6.description: Salon Vision is the best nail spa in town! Trust me, I've tried a lot of them. If you're looking for a clean, fun and modern place to be pampered, this is it! The services and staff are top notch. Five years ago, I moved to Sloop and stumbled upon this gem.  I was looking for a pink/white refill but was informed that they didn't offer that service.  Instead the owner, Angel, suggested we try growing natural nails and I expressed my concerns about being a nail bitter. Together we discussed a plan to overcome that challenge and I had my first manicure. Fast forward to today and I can't say enough great things about Salon Vision! The staff is wonderful; they actually speak to you, not at you. Very knowledgeable, courteous and gentle. There is a huge selection of nail polishes, both Essie and Opi.  They have movies playing all the time so I can catch up on the new releases. But I'd say the icing on the cake is the shoulder massage you get to end the experience. It's the little touches that keeps me coming back every week! Thank you, Angel and team, for all that you do.

22.description: I have tried out some other nail salons in the area and have decided Salon Vision is the best.  Forget about trying to find a better nail salon.

15.description: Talk about rude, snooty and absolutely NO customer service. I went into this place looking to get an acrylic fill-in and pedicure. The receptionist, with a very snide and sarcastic tone stated that they did not do fill-ins. I apologized and told her I was new to the area and was not familiar with all the shops and she told me that she wouldn't know what other shops offer in terms of services but her shop did not do fill-ins and that I should go Google it. Such a nasty attitude and I will make sure to tell everyone I know or meet to...NOT to patronize this "salon" EVER! I only gave it one star because there wasn't an option to give it none.

57.description: I was in the need of a manicure before a job fair, and I did not have time to run up north on a Wednesday night, SO I turned to my trusty Yelp iPhone App and my fellow yelpers led me to Salon Vision. Even though it was a Wednesday evening it was packed. I arrived around 5:20pm and was told the earliest they could fit me in was 6:15pm. I took myself to the Starbucks by Jewel to wait (still quicker than trying to drive up north during rush hour). When I arrived again I took note of the wide range of colors, wonderful ambiance and "Letter's to Juliet" playing on the wide screen tv. I  ended up receiving a manicure and a toe polish change for $30- not bad at all. My manicure was nice, I enjoyed the mini hand massage I received-however when it came time for my polish change my technician was a little rough with the tools! She did not injure me or anything, and I suppose it was my fault for not speaking up, but.......I am going to thoroughly enjoy the manicure/toe polish change combo as my feet don't need a full pedicure THAT often (specially in the colder months). However the mini neck massage customers receive at the drying station guarantees I will be back when I don't have time to run up north to my trusted Arbre.I had to edit my review to state that one week later my nails are still chip FREE! And this is coming from a woman who is glad if she goes 3days without chipping. Arbre may have some competition......

20.description: Salon Vision was my favorite Chicago nail spot. It's not the cheapest or the fastest, but overall, quite good.- they have lots of OPI and Essie polishes, including the latest collections- lots of magazines to peruse- there's always a movie playing, which I enjoy, because then I don't have to make small talk, I can just enjoy the mani/pedi- they do offer no chip- I've gotten standard wear out of my mani/pedis- they wrap your toes in saran wrap so you don't smuge when you put shoes on- CLEAN- reasonably priced- you can make appointments online- not really good for walk-ins, even though the door says they take them - much better to make an appointment

36.description: I have been coming here since they opened. The service has gotten worse as the years have ticked by. Today was a prime example of why I will no longer be a patron at Salon Vision. I called ahead and made an appointment for a pedicure and was told that 1pm would be fine. I scheduled my morning accordingly. I arrived early at 1240 and was informed that they were just getting ready to call me as they were too booked to do my appointment at 1 but could maybe try for 130 or 200. I told no thank you as in the past I have had a hurried half done pedicure at their place and definitely didn't want that experience again. So now I'm off to find a different place for pedicures in the future. No thank you Salon Vision.

14.description: Terrible these people must not like African Americans of a certain age I didn't get a foot massage or a shoulder massage as the white clients got  The tech used dirty tools that were sitting there already . And yes when I arrived around 430 the fro t deal girl looked at me with a disapproving expression then looked at the clock .  They were open until  6 what was the issue

58.description: Bought a Groupon and am glad I did! Drinks were good-lots of fun concoctions. Our waiter was very knowledgeable about the various meats and cheeses offered-and with his suggestions we really enjoyed what we chose. Caprese salad was also delicious and perfect for sharing. Definitely a hidden, trendy place! Not big, so probably not ideal for a large group.

56.description: We had appetizers and wine at Square 1 and I enjoyed both. Items were pricey and they could have added more food to the appetizer plate, but the food was good nonetheless. The wine was delicious and there were multiple options I was interested in trying. I would like to return and try their dinner menu.

29.description: Great place to have a drink and sit back and relax when it's not busy. When it's busy, you may wait a while for service. The service is really not up to par. You may feel like you were abandoned and will find yourself going up to the bar which in case you will get your check screwed up. The venue is great. Sit outside if with a few people, inside if you have a larger group.

42.description: They have outdoor seating when the weather is nice and let you bring your dog to sit outside, it's great! Also, half off wine bottles on Tuesday is doing serious damage to my Wednesdays!

23.description: I have been here a total of 3 times, and wonder what all the negative reviews are about. To me, its a nice quiet place to hang and have a glass of wine or a cocktail. I have also reserved the 'living room' area (2 large sofas by the fireplace) before when I had a larger group coming. Bonus, they have board games you can play. I wouldn't come here for food, all they really have is bread & cheese platters, which are decent but nothing to write home about. The people I have come here with all say the Moscow Mule is really good. I have enjoyed the wine and also found a new whiskey I like.

47.description: I have been to Square One twice. The first was on an invite from a friend and it was fine - the cocktails weren't great but the cheese was tasty and it was a nice evening.I bought a groupon a month or two later for cocktails and cheese here because it is close to work.  I went with my boyfriend and the service was terrible. We were one of two groups of people there and the bartender ultimately had to come out to take our order because the waitress was ignoring us. Again the cocktails were not great but the cheese was fine. I unfortunately didn't have cash and so paid the remainder on a card. Lo and behold, I looked a few days later and a twenty-five dollar tip had been charged rather than a five dollar tip and I got to dispute it with Discover.Never again.

8.description: It's a different type of lounge. It's very casual and intimate. I love the Tiffany blue walls and the white curtains and the food and drinks are more on the fancy side. I don't see a lot of draft beers. I like how they have games laying around, so you can start a board game and just chit chat with a glass of wine in your hand.

31.description: Easily the worst experience I have ever had in my life, anywhere, ever! So bad that its unbelievable and incredible that such places even exist.Our server was a woman who was more interested in having her own drinks than taking our orders. (Why is she on the job anyway? I guess some other reviewers have run into her or someone like her). After a long wait, she showed up without any menus or water, and took our drink orders. The cocktails turned out to be below par. We couldn't taste the listed ingredients, for example the cocktails lacked any bitters and had an overdose of sugar. After three or four requests, (hailing waiters, etc), we got her to bring us ONE menu and then she went back to drinking again, chatting with a group of people at the bar. Some time later, another server came over and apologized for the slow service. We thought this will be followed by some concerted effort and alertness. But no one came to take our food order. We just could not believe how awful the service continued to be all evening. The place was not that busy, many of us had headed here after Ghana-USA World Cup game. I think the servers probably want to run the place down as soon as possible, for I am sure a few other customers were left unattended for quite long time too. The waitress was just exceptional. Quite a nice job she has. Gets to drink for free. Gets to sit around and do nothing and gets paid for her total lack of work ethic. There are many amazing places in South Loop, and they have exceptional food and service. Other places have their crowds and yet they pay attention to every customer. But I guess all the other restaurants in the area are in the business for making money, and want repeat customers. The staff at Square One makes me wonder if their only objective today was to ensure that some of us never return to the place. The service was so bad that I think YELP needs to introduce negative stars to really take down the overall rating of such places. In the end, we paid up and left without eating anything. For that too, I had to hail another server to our table with some acrobatics and gesticulation. I told him I am going to create a yelp account just to report our horrible experience (and you are reading what I wrote after creating this account). He said a curt 'sorry' and promptly brought us the bill for our drinks. Yes, the worst experience I have ever had in my entire life!

34.description: Two words: "Old Fashioned." That was my libation last night, and one word: "Delectable." A quick perusal of the reviews here: Yelpers seem to have bipolar reactions. I guess I've been lucky. I've been here about ten times over the past couple years, in winter and in summer, inside and outside, by the window and by the fireplace, at tables and at the bar, in sickness and in health... You get the picture. I've always had a good experience. I usually come during non-popular hours, on weeknights, and the service has always been friendly. Last night, at 7:30 on a Friday, there was no problem getting a table, with those always-comfy chairs.The inside is unique: the place seems almost as tall as it is wide, and it's fun to see what movie they have silently playing on the big screen on the wall, when there is a lull in your conversation. Did I say comfy? And with music low enough to hear my compadres? Outdoor tables on 14th rather than Michigan give you a chance to people watch without all the traffic noise. I almost exclusively come here to drink, though I do remember having a good platter of charcuterie and queso once or twice. I've never tried the self-serve wine on the wall, but I always mean to. Funny, they've never mentioned it when ordering, though. Then again, I tend towards their cocktails. I'm glad it's in the neighborhood, as am I.

16.description: A great new addition to the South Loop and the perfect contrast to the abundance of sports bars and taverns in the area.  Square One is a great place for a more quiet yet fun and hipsterish atmosphere when you're looking to grab a pre or post dinner drink.  Friendly service, good chill music, and a great assortment of board games (yes, I said board games, don't judge) to grab and play while you drink.  They have a wine dispenser in the back where you can pay by the taste, half glass, or glass from a rotating selection.They have some pretty interesting cocktail choices - my two favorites are the Sheriff Pepper and the Q&M.  They make a pretty good old fashioned too.  We come here pretty often whenever we're in the area and looking for something a little more chill than Scout or Wabash Tavern.  Haven't had the food yet, and to be honest, I'm not sure I'll get around to trying it with amazing places like Asian Outpost a block away, but the vibe and the atmosphere are perfect for getting drinks with friends or a date.

13.description: This place used to be good but has really gone  downhill.  We live in the area and used to go there all of the time for the craft cocktails and good service.  Now the service is awful (especially one female bartender with a nose piercing who ignored us most of the time and then yelled at us the last time I visited). The drinks are barely decent these days when you can actually get a bartender to pay attention to you. We haven't gone back since that last time since the service and atmosphere was awful.

11.description: Went there on Friday.....ordered the meat and cheese tray. It was awful. Cheese had horrible odor & meats where spoiled. Then ordered a pizza. Dough was under cooked and mushy. Very disappointed. Told the server about it and argued back that's how the cheese is suppose to be. Staff was rude and we will never go back

39.description: The main reason I gave this place a 4 is because of the absolute quality drinks they serve, especially the Old Fashioned. The decor is very nice, prices a tad high but not crazy, and service when not sitting at the bar can be dreadfully slow. That being said, this is a cocktail and wine bar, and the cocktails are amazing. If you're looking for a jack and coke it's not the spot, but for a more complex drink with out the "mixologist" pretentiousness this is a great spot.

37.description: One of my favorite spots to relax in front of a warm fire place with a yummy glass of pinot noir. Overall the place has a comfortable yet classy feel with brick walls, plush seating, large couches and a fire place. My friends and I usually come here to sit by the fire and play board games while enjoying cocktails and/or wine. Ronnie is our usual server and he's the best! Easy to chat with, good for recommendations, and not bad to look at either ;PAlong with the great wine list, there are specialty cocktails and a pretty decent beer list too.I haven't had much of the food, I've only tried a few things like the mixed olives, and the cheesecake dessert. Both of which I enjoyed :)Some parts of the decor kind of throw off the vibe of the place, but maybe I'm just weird and these things bother me more than they would other people... There's a random wall that has industrial steel covering it that is kind of distracting. The wallpaper above the fire place also doesn't go with the overall look of the place, and there's another wall that has palm-tree esque wall paper and is covered with pictures of guests. Like I said though, maybe I'm just weird and other patrons don't even notice this stuff.You can usually find me here on a Friday night :D

0.description: This place is great. James Bond inspired drinks. The owner Ron is ok. Have a Max Zorin they are good and refreshing. Ron is actually a pretty cool guy just do not tell him said that.

38.description: Absolutely wonderful place, very comfortable and low key.  Drinks are delicious and the food has always been fresh and yummy.  They have a great selection on wines and excellent cocktails with lots of specials.  The staff has always been excellent to us, great customer service.  Would definitely come back again and highly recommend it for every kind of crowd.

51.description: A-Ok, as the 3 stars imply.  If I lived in the neighborhood, I probably would come here a little more often and sit outside, but this place didn't make that much of a registration on me.  I'm a sucker for nice people and conversation, and the bartender regarded me with a slight antipathy, as if I was one of the many late night zombies in the Viagra Triangle, at 6pm.  Plus the Old Fashioned was passable.  It was good, but nothing worth consuming past one.  This could have been 4 stars if the service matched the decor.

27.description: Headed here before a concert Sunday night. The speed of service and quality of drinks was subpar to say the least. Had a group of 11 and we were seated immediately, which was great; however, once we were seated we saw the waitress three times in an hour and twice had to go inside to the bar, which was not busy, to get service. We ordered their margaritas, which was their Sunday special. The first margaritas we had were delicious; however, the second margaritas we ordered were not even close to the same taste or color. The waitresses explanation to us was that different bartenders were making the drinks. When I walked in to have them touch up the margaritas there was only one bartender on site and the waitress was trying to make drinks behind the bar. Apparently she was working on her bartending skills in between taking orders. In fact the service was so slow we were unable to order food prior to the concert starting. Definitely disappointing for a location should have the service to match with the great location.

32.description: Came in here last night and was greeted by the super friendly bartender, Ron. He took real nice care of us. Loved his beer and cocktail menu. I had the best Manhattan of my life here with Angels Envy Whiskey. The whiskey is aged in Port Wine barrels and give the drink some great flavor. I haven't seen any bars in Chicago with it. The ambiance, drinks, cocktails and service was fantastic. I would highly recommend it. Turns out Ron is the owner too. Great guy and place. A most go to.

54.description: Square One is a quirky little wine bar and I dig the odd vibe. Walking in it has all of the makings of a chic vintage bar, but behind the bar you have two TVs playing the latest sporting events, then glancing up even higher on the giant projection screen you'll catch a classic movie (such as my childhood fav - the Princess Bride - which was playing last night). Specialty drinks are creative but fall a little flat. I would recommend sticking with the solid wine list and then ordering up a meat and cheese plate. Good place for a quiet date night.

48.description: Ehhhhhh...Everything about Square One seems rather forced. The space, while handsome, isn't really user friendly. While couches and high tops look cool, neither is particularly comfortable or natural.While there are self-serve wine taps on the wall, the server never actually mentioned them, and I'm not sure they are functional.While the cocktail list looks fun, I spit out my Moscow Mule in disgust. Since when do they taste like soap?While the server was friendly, honest, and attentive, wrong wines were still brought out. Perhaps it was an off-experience, but judging by how empty it was at 10pm on a Saturday night, maybe I'm not the only one who felt this way. Not a bad place to grab a glass of wine and catch up with a friend (it's quiet and dead enough that you can have a good convo), but nothing stands out that should steer you this way.

44.description: I had high hopes for Square One, given the attractive decor and Delirium beer sign  outside. Unfortunately, this place not only failed to live up to my expectations but was actually downright disappointing. To begin, the woman (whom I assume is the manager) at the entrance was cold and brushed off my husband's question about the Enomatic wine dispenser. My expectations were beginning to lower. Once we were seated, we ordered wine and the caprese salad. My husband ordered a Cabernet Sauvignon, and when it arrived he was shocked by an overwhelmingly astringent taste. Clearly, the wine was corked. Strike 1. My husband, who is a certified sommelier, ask the server to provide another class. The server went to the bar, talked to the bartender, and came back to the table with this to offer: "Both I and the bartender, who has lots of experience, tasted the wine, and it seems fine to us. Also, the bottle was just opened, so it couldn't have gone bad." Now, I am certainly no expert on wine, but I know 1) wine can go bad before being opened, and 2) the Cab that was served was definitely corked. Regardless, we didn't come to a restaurant to argue over a glass of wine, so my husband just ordered another. However, we were shocked to see the first glass on our check at the end of the night. Strike 2. After about 10 minutes of waiting for the salad, our server informed us that the kitchen was out of tomatoes, so they could not serve the caprese. We said that was fine, and just to send out some mozzarella and meat. Another 10 minutes passed, and someone from the kitchen personally came to our table and informed us that he was not comfortable serving the mozzarella, as he suspected it, too, had gone bad. I understand that their focus is more on spirits, wine, and beer, but don't put food on the menu if you can't deliver.  That said, I did appreciate his informing us that the food wasn't up to standard, but I just wish I had known 20 minutes before. Instead, we ordered the meat plate and a side of olives.After another 15 minutes, the meat plate arrived, but our server had apparently forgotten about the olives. Again, not a huge deal, but compounding that with everything else makes me doubt the professionalism and preparedness of this restaurant. Strike 3. An hour later, we left the table with sediment at the bottom of the wine glass (the second red we tried), unsatisfied stomachs, and a sour taste from the less than inviting manager.

24.description: Went to this on a weekday evening to enjoy a light dinner and a glass of wine.  As I was sitting at an inside table on a night that was just turning chilly I had a rat run across my foot.The waiter/bartender initially appologized stating he had seen it run in not long before we arrived.   The doors were open as it had been a beautiful day so we decided to stay and have our dinner and drinks.  The waiter/bartender chose to wait on another table before us, we ended up having ask to be able to order food only to be told the Rita pizza that we wanted could not be made due to not having the ingrediants.  When we received our bill nothing was discounted even though a RAT had ran over my foot!  I cannot imagine receiving worse service in this situation.  Looking back we should have left as soon as we saw the rat, but decided to give them the benefit of the doubt.  On top of the rat issue the pizza that we were told to purchase since they couldn't make the Rita we wanted, tasted about like a frozen pizza.  We were offered a free "shot" of something not that we were interested in shots on a Monday night.  Absolutely horrible customer service!

7.description: I'm pretty easy to please when it comes to bars. As long as the place is clean (relatively), has cold beer, attentive bartenders, and no one cabbage patching on speaker boxes, then I'm in. Square One covered all my bases and added a friendly crowd.

49.description: This is my unimpressed face: =TOne of my best girl friends lives super close to Square One so it seemed the logical choice for a place to drink some wine on a chill Saturday night.There were surprisingly quite a lot of seats at the bar considering it was a midnightish on a Saturday night. But yet, even with all the open seats, it seemed as if my friend and I didn't get paid much attention from the bartenders. They had some friends or regulars in which they were hanging with most of the time and our service was short and not friendly although I wouldn't call it unfriendly either, just to the point. Honestly after we paid for our bottle, I didn't think they were into talking to us. We got more attention from drunk canoes in the bar who weren't after our tips...I could make some dirty tip reference here but I'll resist.We were most interested in the self serve wine option but it seemed they just wanted us to get a bottle. Quick and easy, bing bam boom.I really liked the atmosphere inside minus some solo fellas there trying to hit on every lady within eyesight. The bar itself was chic & classy, loved the lighting and the modern design of it. Gorgeous wood floors & chalkboard walls.I'm sure I'll go back due to the proximity and fingers crossed that I'll up the starrage,

40.description: Square One is a cozy, cute, laid-back type of bar/lounge.  The décor gives off a vintage type of vibe with their lighting fixtures, over-sized booths and sofas, and exposed wood panels.  They play sports/news on the two TVs behind the bar and even old school movies with a projector over the bar.  I like how there is something for everyone.The best thing I love about this place is that it is very low key.  It's never too crowded that you will not able to snag a seat.  They offer a pretty good variety between wine, beer, and cocktails.  They even offer a variety of board games.  Who doesn't like games and alcohol?  For the service, I thought it was better than most people stated.  They are attentive, but not too imposing.  Perfect waiting staff if you ask me.  Go check this place out if you are looking for a good time, but without all the chaos.

53.description: This is the kind of place that grows on you.  We live fairly nearby so it was natural to stop in and it really grew on us. At first you wonder about the quirkiness - it is an unusual space in an unusual place.  People looking for trendy flash or hipster validation this is not for you.  Nor is it for the Groupon short attention span crowd.  Why did we come to love it?  First, the staff - it seems every single one has been there since opening and you are always greeted by a familiar, friendly but not too friendly bartender.  That's a hard mark to hit and they do it. We also like the mix of quirky/industrial/arty vibe mixed with down to earth casual like people playing cards and board games on cocktail tables by the fireplace.  Trust me it works once you get used to it.  There's adventure like the kegged tap wine samplers and local whiskey if you want it, or just go for comfort of the family feel that's become part of the vibe as the place ages.  Comfort can be boring and uniqueness can be irritating.  Somehow Square One makes its own perfect combination if you give it a chance.  Excellent Moscow Mules.

30.description: We were pretty undemanding, sitting at a table outside and drinking a modest amount of beer.  Nonetheless, the place didn't seem totally able to meet our demands.  Our server, while affable, was not super-responsive.  And more distressingly, they were out of a lot of beers, and the substitution the server recommended was a terrible idea.  (No, Hoegaarden is not "close to an IPA.")Luckily, the company was excellent.

46.description: I literally could not believe this was a real business.  I thought I had stumbled onto the set of you got punked.  There was only one other couple in the place yet it took 10 minutes till the one and only server came out to greet us.  We ordered a couple of cocktails and an appetizer.  It took 40 minutes until the appetizer was served and then we asked where our drinks were. After another 12 minutes we got one drink and was told they didn't have the ingredients for the other drink. We asked for a Cabernet but they didn't have that either.  What a joke. This was THE WORST experience I've ever had at a restaurant or bar. The decor was cool, but the entry area had lots of tables and chairs stacked up like the place was going out of business.

1.description: Came in randomly on a Friday night with some friends.  They have a great menu of specialty drinks which are reasonably priced & nice selection of meats and cheeses and a chill atmosphere. Great way to top off a late weekend night . The venue is intimate, but is spacey due to the high ceiling. Parking is not bad around 10 pm onwards.

55.description: I feel bad giving this place a 2 only because some of my friends would give it a 5. Got a  groupon deal and did the wine tasting even though this is a beer type of place. They only accepted two per table but a crowd of us 9 people were sitting on 3 tables (small ones) and the service is what made me upset. Our waiter got annoyed of us and told us how busy he is. I feel that they were either short staffed or poorly trained. It's a place for a date I would assume but it ended up being a happy hour spot for most people who work in the area. They have cheese boards at expensive prices and a huge LCD screen but I don't know what it plays. They take candid pictures there and post them near the bathroom walls in the back. I guess they are just trying to turn this place into a new concept of fun but they didn't succeed for me.

9.description: I really want to support this place - They have a good wine selection - and a laid back comfortable atmosphere  - but the staff needs work.  Went by last weekend, the place was maybe 1/2-3/4 full..... We couldn't get the waitress to give  us our check, finally flagged down another waiter who brought our check... looked at the bill, then put in a credit card  placed it on the table and waited.... stood it up so the credit card was more visible and waited... decided we had enough cash to pay the bill and a small tip, and just handed it to another bartender....    If you can't handle the rush of a half full room (and it was too cold for anyone to be at the outside tables) not sure how long you are going to be around.....

26.description: Square One is a great spot to start the night. Drink specials are good after work and the pizzas are a great addition to the original cheese and meat offerings!The only negative I have is that Square One often seems to run out of the special beers listed on their menu.

25.description: This place sucks! My wife and I walked in on a Thursday night for a drink. We sat ourselves at the bar. It was pretty empty. It took the one bartender 10 min before we got a menu, while it only took her 10 sec to ask what we wanted. We barely got the menu open in that amount of time. We ordered a few glasses of wine and cheese. The wine must have been a day or 2 old. They seem to just re-cork it after a poor instead of pumping the air out of the bottle to preserve the wine. The bread and cheese came out but the bread was dry and hard. They don't have a real kitchen but rather a small closet at the end of the bar where one of the guy who busses the tables also "prepares" food. Their food was disgusting. That's nothing close to any sort of kitchen or designated place any food should be coming out of. The bartender was also the waitress. She wasn't professional at all. She was walking on the benches where people sit instead of walking around (who does that?)  The girl never came to check up on us. We never got our water. The guy who dries the glasses ended up putting more oily smudges on the glass from cutting up meat. It was a sad scene.My wife and I joked they need Jon Taffer from the show Bar Rescue to help this place badly. We couldn't get out of there fast enough.

12.description: We were pretty undemanding, sitting at a table outside and drinking a modest amount of beer.  Nonetheless, the place didn't seem totally able to meet our demands.  Our server, while affable, was not super-responsive.  And more distressingly, they were out of a lot of beers, and the substitution the server recommended was a terrible idea.  (No, Hoegaarden is not "close to an IPA.")Luckily, the company was excellent.

59.description: I'm giving it 3 stars, because one time was 5-star perfect, another was 1-star horrible.  The first time we had awesome, timely, attentive service.  The bar tender was funny and let us be while we chatted away about our girl drama.  The second time, the server was SO horrible.  She kept demanding that we order even though we requested to wait for our friend.  She did NOT know the menu, got almost all of the cheeses wrong, gave me the wrong drink, and billed us incorrectly.  I would only go there again if it didn't come out of my bank account.  But since I'm married, that's probably never going to happen.

21.description: Good place to stop for drinks! Very cozy, especially by the fireplace overlooking Michigan Ave. I've never tried the food, but what I've seen looks good! Always a good beer selection.

17.description: As one of the only lounge-like, wine bars in South Loop, this place as a lot of promise. However, I've consistently experienced poor service every time I've been to Square One. On an average night, there is about 15-20 people in the entire bar. It's pretty cozy, nice fireplace, high tops, lounge seating. Even with such an intimate, small setting, the wait staff cannot seem to manage its customers. The first time my boyfriend and I went to Square One, there were 3 other couples and 3-4 people at the bar, and it was still about 10 minutes before a server took our order and 20 minutes after we were finished with our drinks to receive and pay the check.Just recently, we stopped by for a nightcap after midnight. There were 5 servers, and about 20 people in the entire bar. We sat at a high top for 15 minutes and NO ONE came to take our order. The bartender acknowledged our presence once or twice with a glare, but not one of the five servers came over to our table. After 20 minutes, we decided to get up to leave and the manager said 'Thank you!' to us on our way out. Really? It's too bad the service is so terrible. The cocktails were actually pretty good and the venue is nice. Despite the convenience of the location, I think I would rather take a cab up to a bar up north so I can actually get served.

10.description: A friend and I stopped in here after dinner for a few drinks. When passing by it had a decent crowd, not packed for a Saturday night (Halloween weekend), which was nice. Their selection of cocktails and beer was good and at reasonable prices. The reason for the 2 stars was mainly due to the poor service. It took forever to get a drink and we were sitting at the bar. For a place that wasn't too busy I was surprised to hear there was a delay on drinks because they didn't have glasses. The poor service may have also been due to the fact the bartenders were drinking as much as their patrons. I am all for a little fun at work, but when it takes away from you helping people wanting to spend money at your establishment, I have to frown upon that.   We would have left sooner, but I will be damned they were playing great music and at most places that is hard to come by. So we stayed for two rounds of drinks, enjoyed the music, and each other's conversation.

5.description: This is a great local bar with a great whiskey selection. The vibe is very good for a lounge style. I will go back.

3.description: Stopped in for a drink with my sis tonight.. I love the decor and the ambience of the place..Drinks: We both ordered the old fashioned... It was a lil sweet, but good. Food: meat and cheese tray was good.. Got to take more risks next time tho.. LolWill def be back!!

35.description: One of the best bar/lounge in the South Loop. They have some really good servers who are knowledgable about the cocktails they serve. I have been to this place atleast 5-6 times and the cocktails or the staff none of them have ever disappointed me. Sheriff Pepper and Old fashioned are must try. They also have a decent collection of bourbon. What impressed me the most was, that they have high west distillery whiskeys. The owner has put a lot of thought in kind of liquor he want to keep and serve. A must try lounge!! Their Sheriff Pepper is addictive (watch out)!!

19.description: One of the best bar/lounge in the South Loop. They have some really good servers who are knowledgable about the cocktails they serve. I have been to this place atleast 5-6 times and the cocktails or the staff none of them have ever disappointed me. Sheriff Pepper and Old fashioned are must try. They also have a decent collection of bourbon. What impressed me the most was, that they have high west distillery whiskeys. The owner has put a lot of thought in kind of liquor he want to keep and serve. A must try lounge!! Their Sheriff Pepper is addictive (watch out)!!

28.description: This is a great place.  The decor is very cool but most importantly the staff was awesome!  We went on a Sunday evening and the bartender/waitress was very attentive and helpful.  The wine was awesome too!  We would definitely go back.

45.description: Worst bar / restaurant experience of my life!  Reiterate Brian's comments... I thought I was being punked! Do NOT go to this place!  The experience was so bad it compelled me to do my first ever review.Arrived before the Jay Z concert.. at this stage they were not busy.  The decor is actually quite nice with the potential to be a decent bar, but unfortunately the service would have to be the worst experience in my life.Was served relatively quickly, and ordered 1 bottle of wine and a cheese / meat platter.  20 mins later the server returns to say that wine is not available.  We selected another option, and the server returns 10 minutes later to say that it is also sold out. Finally received a bottle of white wine after a total of 45 minutes with no food or drink.  Was promised our cheese / meat platter was on its way.  After the 1 hour mark, the server returns to say our food was "accidentally" given away, and if we could "refresh" her memory on what we ordered (I'm guessing she actually had no idea what we ordered).  1.5 hours passed still with no food, and was getting close to the concert beginning so we asked for the bill.  After 15 mins waiting for the bill, they arrived with our bill, with the correct bottle of wine we drank listed on the bill, however we were overcharged by $5 compared with the menu price.  This was not only the worst service I have ever received, but they over charged for it. I would never return to this place.  I'm sure if you asked anyone else who was at this bar last night they would agree.

33.description: A great new addition to the South Loop and the perfect contrast to the abundance of sports bars and taverns in the area.  Square One is a great place for a more quiet yet fun and hipsterish atmosphere when you're looking to grab a pre or post dinner drink.  Friendly service, good chill music, and a great assortment of board games (yes, I said board games, don't judge) to grab and play while you drink.  They have a wine dispenser in the back where you can pay by the taste, half glass, or glass from a rotating selection.They have some pretty interesting cocktail choices - my two favorites are the Sheriff Pepper and the Q&M.  They make a pretty good old fashioned too.  We come here pretty often whenever we're in the area and looking for something a little more chill than Scout or Wabash Tavern.  Haven't had the food yet, and to be honest, I'm not sure I'll get around to trying it with amazing places like Asian Outpost a block away, but the vibe and the atmosphere are perfect for getting drinks with friends or a date.

43.description: This place has the best cocktails!  Every drink is made fresh and the bartenders are really friendly.  Just moved to the area and I have been twice.  I will definitely be back!  The onnatop cocktail was my fav.

2.description: I wanted to patronize this joint...the photos make it look so upscale.  Baby bye...pictures do lie. I went in and was willing to give it a try until I went to the restroom. OMG!!! So disgusting. It looked as though the toilet nor sink had ever been cleaned.  I looked at the menu and every drink was $12 and up!  If your going to be expensive and swank, can I get a clean bathroom?!?!?! I left. Bye!!!

18.description: This place sucks! My wife and I walked in on a Thursday night for a drink. We sat ourselves at the bar. It was pretty empty. It took the one bartender 10 min before we got a menu, while it only took her 10 sec to ask what we wanted. We barely got the menu open in that amount of time. We ordered a few glasses of wine and cheese. The wine must have been a day or 2 old. They seem to just re-cork it after a poor instead of pumping the air out of the bottle to preserve the wine. The bread and cheese came out but the bread was dry and hard. They don't have a real kitchen but rather a small closet at the end of the bar where one of the guy who busses the tables also "prepares" food. Their food was disgusting. That's nothing close to any sort of kitchen or designated place any food should be coming out of. The bartender was also the waitress. She wasn't professional at all. She was walking on the benches where people sit instead of walking around (who does that?)  The girl never came to check up on us. We never got our water. The guy who dries the glasses ended up putting more oily smudges on the glass from cutting up meat. It was a sad scene.My wife and I joked they need Jon Taffer from the show Bar Rescue to help this place badly. We couldn't get out of there fast enough.

41.description: I absoutely adore this place!! It's super cute, low-key, and a couple blocks from where I live.  They have a wide selection of wines and have pretty good drink specials on almost every week night (i.e. half off bottles of wine, $5 margaritas, etc.).  It's never too crowded, and the perfect place to come with a date or a group of friends.  The atmosphere is stylish and trendy without being pretentious.  The bartenders are also nice and attentive.  I've been here quite a few times and the service/experience has been pretty consistent.  They also have a wide selection board games upfont to play while your'e there -- which I absolutely love!

52.description: I like the overall feel of this place..the inside is very nicely decorated with a modern, industrial feel and the seating is very comfortable and inviting. I spent a good deal of our visit taking in the ambiance. Our waiter, who was also the owner, was very relaxed and outgoing. The service was good, he checked up on us often and gave us his own recommendations. We were there on a Sunday, though, and it was not busy at all. There are not many food options other than caprese salad and the meat and cheese platter, so it's more of a bar you'd just stop at before or after your meal. They have some good beer options, but I didn't care for my signature cocktail. We're looking forward to the outdoor patio this summer!

50.description: Great spot for cocktails or a glass of wine - and on a recent summer's eve visit, it wasn't too crowded. We walked in and were seated immediately. Be sure to try one of the cheese - this diner is a fan of the triple creamed Brie in particular - or charcuterie plates.Fun, stylish-yet-low-key atmosphere, prompt service, and great menu - this is a great little spot and I enjoy bringing friends and family to check it out. I'm also a big fan of the Polaroid photo wall and wine-dispensing cabinet - perfect for tiny tastes!

4.description: Two words: "Old Fashioned." That was my libation last night, and one word: "Delectable." A quick perusal of the reviews here: Yelpers seem to have bipolar reactions. I guess I've been lucky. I've been here about ten times over the past couple years, in winter and in summer, inside and outside, by the window and by the fireplace, at tables and at the bar, in sickness and in health... You get the picture. I've always had a good experience. I usually come during non-popular hours, on weeknights, and the service has always been friendly. Last night, at 7:30 on a Friday, there was no problem getting a table, with those always-comfy chairs.The inside is unique: the place seems almost as tall as it is wide, and it's fun to see what movie they have silently playing on the big screen on the wall, when there is a lull in your conversation. Did I say comfy? And with music low enough to hear my compadres? Outdoor tables on 14th rather than Michigan give you a chance to people watch without all the traffic noise. I almost exclusively come here to drink, though I do remember having a good platter of charcuterie and queso once or twice. I've never tried the self-serve wine on the wall, but I always mean to. Funny, they've never mentioned it when ordering, though. Then again, I tend towards their cocktails. I'm glad it's in the neighborhood, as am I.

6.description: Square One is a great spot to start the night. Drink specials are good after work and the pizzas are a great addition to the original cheese and meat offerings!The only negative I have is that Square One often seems to run out of the special beers listed on their menu.

22.description: A friend and I stopped in here after dinner for a few drinks. When passing by it had a decent crowd, not packed for a Saturday night (Halloween weekend), which was nice. Their selection of cocktails and beer was good and at reasonable prices. The reason for the 2 stars was mainly due to the poor service. It took forever to get a drink and we were sitting at the bar. For a place that wasn't too busy I was surprised to hear there was a delay on drinks because they didn't have glasses. The poor service may have also been due to the fact the bartenders were drinking as much as their patrons. I am all for a little fun at work, but when it takes away from you helping people wanting to spend money at your establishment, I have to frown upon that.   We would have left sooner, but I will be damned they were playing great music and at most places that is hard to come by. So we stayed for two rounds of drinks, enjoyed the music, and each other's conversation.

15.description: I love this place. They have a great drink selection, phenomenal food and excellent service.  My favorite is the Lactose Tolerant pizza.

57.description: So I get that this place offers brunch and shouldn't and I think they have figured it out by now.  But the meat and cheese that they do offer regularly is really good.  The serve yourself wine station is also awesome, I've never had a bad glass of wine from there!  I have a favorite waiter who will chat with us and he seems to always be there.  I've never tried anything but wine but the drink list is long and looks like a lot of fun! It's definitely not somewhere to come if you are starving and looking for a meal, it's a place to enjoy a couple glasses of wine.  I love this place, I think it's a great addition to the neighborhood.

20.description: Stopped in for a drink with my sis tonight.. I love the decor and the ambience of the place..Drinks: We both ordered the old fashioned... It was a lil sweet, but good. Food: meat and cheese tray was good.. Got to take more risks next time tho.. LolWill def be back!!

36.description: This is the best lounge-type bar in the South Loop.  It's just as perfect for low-key dates as it is for hanging out with friends.  When you walk-in from Michigan Ave, you are greeted on your right by a very comfortable looking seating area featuring two linen-upholstered couches and a bench surrounding a sizable coffee table placed in front of an equally inviting fireplace.  There is a TV mounted atop the fireplace for those who want to watch games and board games (ala Yatzee, Connect 4 and Sorry) on the mantle for those who like to play.  The other prominent seating options are these perfectly sized window alcoves with cushions lining the bottom and sides of the frame.  They are perfect for an intimate conversation with a friend or an even more intimate conversation with a "friend".  There are tasteful booth seats across from each alcove so don't worry, your group of 4 or 5 will fit perfectly.The beer and wine selections are carefully and very well selected and the staff is very knowledgeable.  I can't personally speak for the cocktails but I hear good things.  The food is excellent though slightly pricey as you might expect from a cozy lounge and as an update for those that have visited over the years, they recently expanded their menu to include more than just fine meats & cheeses.  I had a prosciutto pizza with arugula last night (for $15).  It was a good size - maybe a medium at regular pizza joints - and the flavor and texture was AMAZING!Your tip of the day is to grab a copy of their weekly promo calendar.  For a long time now, they've had 50% wine bottles on Tuesdays but there are some other sweet deals that may inspire a visit.  For Tuesdays specifically, try to arrive before 7pm to beat the rush.  There's not always a rush but when there is, a pre-7pm arrival typically beats it.

14.description: This place is a nice decor but they should replace the bar staff. Especially the girl with blue hair. I don't understand how bartender can be so nasty, unkind to customers that pay and give tips. So suggestion: just go to any other bar in the area if you want to have good time!

3.description: If anyone asks me for a salon recommendation, MJ2 would be my suggestion. The south loop location is great, the interior is modern and comfortable and the stylists are very friendly. JoJo is my stylist and she has really helped transform my hair from being dry and brittle, to now being healthy and bouncy. Not to mention, she just gave me awesome highlights, just in time for the summer. I was so nervous because it was my first color and I didn't want to risk any damage. JoJo took the time to examine my hair and she made the best recommendation that worked for me and my hair type...and I am very pleased. As a matter of fact, I now want even more color! Lol!! Great salon, great people and a great experience overall.

1.description: Gina is my stylist. I followed her here from another salon.  She is the best! Overall, this salon seems to be pretty nice. I see a lot of the same faces come back here often, and I come here a lot. It's in a nice location. The atmosphere inside is really nice as well. They offer nail services and wax and threading services too. I have not a single complaint and will be coming here for as long as Gina is still here!

2.description: I had a great experience. Tequlia did my hair and it was wonderful. It had body and bounce I have never had someone do my hair and it last two weeks. I didnt have to do anything to it. I really liked it because she took her time. Overall it was just great.

5.description: So on my most recent trip home to Chicago I needed to get my hair done quickly, I looked around and found MJ2 was close by and opened. BEST DECISION Ever!!!!! Jo did my hair and she even convinced me to let her trim it which i'm usually very apprehensive about. But i must say she did an excellent job and 4 weeks later its still doing well and holding my style better than ever. I think its growing a little too. She was very patient and used top notch products. GIve them a try!!!I didn't get my nails done but i saw the lady doing a pedicure on another client and she was very detailed. I wish i could get a foot massage like that!!! I'll definitely go back

6.description: I rediscovered chief stylist and co-owner Jo quite by accident. Jo had taken excellent care of my hair at a former salon. Not only was I impressed with her talent with all types of hair, I love the fact that she works with you to improve the condition of your hair. She's a whiz - even with my tangled mess :-)The salon itself is lovely, the vibe is friendly and relaxed. Definitely a drama-free zone. As soon as I walked in, Jo said, "Welcome home." I think so, yes.

7.description: I've been going to Jo for few years now and she's taken excellent care of my hair.  The criteria I care about most when evaluating a stylist are: 1) Healthy hair care techniques2) Affordability3) Respecting my time (if you've ever spent more than 4 hours in the shop for a service that should only take 2 - 2.5  hours, you can appreciate this)4) Clean/comfortable/professional environmentJo gets top marks on all of the above.  Jo is a professional who cares about all the same things I do when it comes to taking care of my hair (mindful of heat, gentle styling and uses great products). Jo listens to my concerns, and gives me her professional opinion.  She also knows how to care for a variety of different hair types.  I've been to a number of different stylists in the chicago area.  I used to stick with one for a few months, while still continuing the search. My search finally ended with Jo. I don't feel like I have to trade off/compromise on any of the things I want and need from a stylist with Jo.  In addition to being a great stylist, Jo is also a very genuine person and typically goes beyond what is expected to help out her clients.  I recommended my mother - in - law to Jo a few weeks ago when her stylist cancelled on her at the last minute.  Jo got her in, in less than 24 hours, and she was very pleased with the service (she has short, natural hair, which she had washed, blown dry, and curled), and said she would definitely be back.   On another occasion, my 15 year old sister was visiting and we decided to get her hair done.  We went in for a consultation (on short notice) and after talking with Jo, decided that a cut and then braids would be the best option for the health of my sisters hair, as well as a style that a teenager could easily maintain.  After getting the cut and deciding on the style of braids at Jo's salon, Jo and her assistant called around to various braiding shops in the area, and negotiated a good price for us, and we were able to get my sister's hair braided that same day. As you can tell from the above, it's been an all around great experience with Jo

8.description: I followed Mia, the nail technician from another salon.  Besides,  I'll keep following her, should she ever choose to leave this soothing space, because she is that great.  No acrylic, funky design, bedazzling here.  Just beautiful shape, perfect color, and my horrible runner's feet, after one of her pedis, are as soft as a baby's butt.  Do make an appointment, though.

9.description: I followed Mia the nail technician from her previous salons.  I will go wherever she goes!  Her pedicures are excellent.  When I leave my feet feel like they have never touched the ground.  She is very professional as well.  I have referred many of my friends to her and they all love her.

0.description: Tequila is a wonderful stylist..My twists look heathy and wonderfully styled. I received a lot of compliments from co-workers and others. A few friends have also taken their daughters to her for styles. I have natural hair and wouldn't go any place else for care and maintenance.

4.description: I had my first experience at this salon a few weeks ago and I'm definitely sold on this place! This salon offers a relaxing atmosphere where knowledgeable stylists and staff take great care of your hair using the best products. JoJo was attentive and I left the shop with a head full of silky, shiny hair! I love the fact that she specializes in natural hair and is passionate about treating hair and educating customers about healthy hair care.

58.description: Great BYOB sushi place in the South Loop. I had the sushi platter and was not disappointed. Be aware that they do charge a fee PER PERSON if you bring in booze. I think it's only $2-3/pp... but let them know if there's a person not drinking (like our pregnant friend that night), and they'll waive the fee for her/him.

56.description: Loved this place until I encountered the owner. I began frequenting here for lunch with co-workers more than a year and a half ago and we absolutely adored the place. Great sushi at a reasonable price with a great staff........, but that damn owner has ruined my perception of the establishment. Judging by the previous reviews, my experience may be a one-off situation, but this doesn't mean it's not valid. Very long story short, I decided to celebrate my bday dinner here with family, friends and coworkers. Our waitress was great. She was cool, warm and quick.BUT the owner didn't appreciate our business. He voiced his concern stating that we took up too many tables, but we made reservations so that didn't make sense. We squashed it. Later he explained he didn't want liquor there anymore.....ITS A BYOB!!!!!!!! I stay away from paying the race card, but this bigot was full of excuses. We ended up having a very heated discussion in front of patrons where he asked my group and I to leave. I explained that our money is as good as anybody's and we're not done eating, but we still left. My group, the majority of which who were Black got up at once and walked away. The owner didn't like the look we placed on his establishment. My group and I felt very offended. Never again will I or anybody in my party eat here again.

29.description: Very good food and service. Reasonable prices for sushi augmented with BYOB. Small neighborhood place would have given 4.5 if offered. Ask for the fresh wasabi too!

42.description: This is my sushi delivery place. The location is a more casual sushi dining experience. Their delivery is always prompt (often early!) and friendly. I suggest trying the starred specialty rolls if you don't know where to start - all the one's I've tried have been delicious, especially the Ocean roll!

23.description: Very delicious, very fresh and very unique sushi here! Very nice ambiance and the customer service is great!!! My brothers favorite of ALL time is the Chicago Fire- I liked it too but I also love the Volcano Roll and all the rest of the 10 we tried... AWESOMENESS. And yes it's a nice to have the option of BYOB!

47.description: Best sushi in the South Loop. Very friendly and efficient staff. Best part- it's BYOB. The Sushi is fresh and the portions of their specialty rolls are generous. I usually get the Salmon belly Sushi- which is amazing, a MUST get, the Super Crunchy and their special of the day. Never disappointed. Also, they're great when it comes to delivery.

8.description: I really like the sushi here! Always fresh, always delicious. Great service too--for take out and eat in!Also, it's BYOB. That's always a plus. Tonight I went to do take out and there was a line out the door for tables--always a good sign!!!

31.description: Great quality, really good combinations, the food itself is 5 stars, but the service is just terrible, this is why it's only 4. :(  Waitresses are usually beginners, that I don't mind if they don't try to rush me to eat the last piece to take my plate. :S

34.description: first of all, i wanted to say that the service is great, even though it was a busy night, but we never felt neglected, the waitress will drop by to make sure everything is good, for service alone, i would give it 5 starsFor the food, I would say this is very average sushi, nothing really stand out, but I guess given the price, it is supposed to be just a neighborhood restaurant. The rice's texture is not that good, and a bit too much rice vinegar. the fish quality is very much so so.

16.description: So I've been twice now and each experience was truly pleasurable.  Staff:  Very friendly and super attentiveFood:  What can I say, it was high quality sushi, they don't hold back on the ingredients and everything tastes fresh.  The tuna, the avocado, the salmon.  All pretty top notch.Seating:  Decent size, large outdoor patio area, more than usual in the south loop.

13.description: Met friends here for dinner last night.  Pretty solid little sushi joint.  I recommend the Ocean and the Green Turtle rolls.  We didn't partake, but it is BYOB which is always good.The knock would be the extremely slow service.  25 mins past from the time our table was cleared to when we finally received the billed, then another 20 minutes for it to be processed.

11.description: Great sushi but do not order online/grub hub. Estimated an hour for delivery and waited 2! And this is the second time this has happened.

39.description: Chicago Fire roll is by far the best roll at Kai. Shrimp shumai appetizer is also delicious :)

37.description: A friend and I went to this restaurant after attending a seminar in downtown Chicago. It was fairly far from where we were, but we wanted to try it because of the high rating. We were definitely not disappointed!We were eating a little bit early to accommodate later plans, so when we got to Kai we were able to sit down immediately. Our edamame appetizer was excellent - seasoned very well and piping hot! For our rolls we shared the Ocean Roll, the Lobster Mania Roll, and the Dancing Eel Roll. All three were just amazing. If I had to pick a favorite I would say it was the Ocean Roll.Our server was polite and attentive. The atmosphere isn't anything to write home about, but it is nice and quiet.Will definitely be returning the next time I'm in Chicago!

0.description: We ordered Kai Sushi via Grubhub.com last Friday night. This was our first order ever with Kai Sushi. It was delicious! We ordered everything spicy, Hamachi Special Roll, Volcano Roll, and Super Crunchy Roll. The rolls were excellent! The sushi rolls were fresh and tasty. We usually order from another sushi place in the South Loop but hands down Kai Sushi is much better. We love their rolls! This is our new go to place for sushi! Thank you Kai Sushi for a fantastic dinner and great experience!

38.description: Had their lunch special (2 rolls and a miso soup for $10). The portions were nice for a lunch special and the sushi was fresh!

51.description: I need you to know that I deleted the yelp app many years ago. I redownloaded it today because I had to tell the world about my experience here. I went for dinner on 10/1/15. There were gnats and mosquitos everywhere. Against my better judgment, I still ordered. My cucumber salad tasted great, unfortunately it has a vinegar dressing that attracts gnats. I had to kill two on my plate so I didn't finish the salad. I tried three sushi rolls. Two were decent. I ordered the white dragon because I love escolar. I had one piece....it was tangy. Escolar is not tangy. Escolar (aka super white tuna) is buttery, delicious, soft...never tangy. Escolar is white, sometimes blush in hue, this was gray.When they asked me if it was ok, I said no...it was tangy. Instead of an apology a gentleman asked me if I'd ever had super white tuna before.
