I said "yes, it's one of my favorites." And he said "well people have ordered it all day and not had a problem." And I said, "well it is 8:00 pm and the gnats make me question your refrigeration policy."I am giving them two stars instead of one because it is byob and the service (besides the one guy) was actually great. I wouldn't eat there again, but if my friends wanted to meet there I would just take my own wine.

27.description: The shiitake roll is fantastic, and all the rolls are really fresh. Love the seaweed salad and miso as well. Specialty Mali is good, but I prefer the regular rolls.

32.description: I order from this restaurant regularly if I am having sushi for dinner. The rolls are always fresh and taste great. The pricing is beyond reasonable and they do have a weekly or daily special (I believe). I definitely recommend this for sushi if you're in the south loop.

54.description: I almost hate to write a review of this place since I don't want it to get too popular but the owners deserve good publicity. Every roll I have gotten here has been great, my favorites are the super crunchy roll and the ocean roll. Spicy tuna and salmon roles are also very good. Reasonably priced.Most importantly, it's BYOB, so drop by Trader Joe's or Jewel Osco and buy a bottle of wine to enjoy with your dinner.

48.description: I think this is some of the best sushi and reasonably priced. Plus, it's BYOB. We tried many rolls, and honestly, they were all delicious. Parking on the street is hit or miss, and the tables are very close together. The waitress was super friendly and attentive. I'll be back!

44.description: Very tasty sushi. Great service too! I dined in the middle of the day and it was fairly slow but I still enjoyed my experience and sushi.

24.description: Been here two times. Although I'm not a sushi expert, I thought it was pretty good. The last time, I brought the kids. They loved it. Their favorite was the volcano roll. The spring rolls were really good as well, they ate them. My picky eater ate fried sweet potatoes and rice. It's manageable for the entire family. It's great that this place is in the neighborhood. They're already excited to come on their own.

7.description: Amazing sushi!!Generous portions. Love the ginger salad. Some of the best rolls I've ever had:Super crunchyOceanVolcanoFlaming VIP Texas

49.description: Kai sushi was solid.  I'd likely give it a 4.5 if I could. I went for a quick lunch. Outdoor patio seats were great on this beautiful fall day. Quick service, complimentary cucumber salad. I was a bit perturbed there were no substitutions allowed on the lunch special, but with the 50% off specialty roll I was able to get an order of sashimi and a specialty roll for a very reasonable price. Salmon sashimi was fresh. The specialty roll I got had spicy crab inside and salmon on the outside - pretty good, but not amazing. I loved the orange wedges they gave me with my check. Likely the most reasonably priced sushi in south loop. Will be back!

40.description: The sushi here is solid, nothing to wrote home about but sufficient if you are craving sushi. I had the dragon roll and spicy salmon maki, both were decent.I was very disappointed that they were not honoring the Yelp check in offer, and was a bit turned off by the fishy smell in the restaurant.

53.description: Met friends here for dinner last night.  Pretty solid little sushi joint.  I recommend the Ocean and the Green Turtle rolls.  We didn't partake, but it is BYOB which is always good.The knock would be the extremely slow service.  25 mins past from the time our table was cleared to when we finally received the billed, then another 20 minutes for it to be processed.

30.description: Disappointed by the service. I wanted to order a couple of rolls over the phone for pick up. I called to ask to about the lunch special and apparently they only offer certain selections. The lady wasn't clear on explaining and was distracted when I was talking to her. I ordered the lunch special first and she was in a rush giving me the total about to hang up. She thinks this a low proft order with just the lunch special. I was going to continue my order but I felt kind of disrespected so I just ended the call. If they don't have the patience to listen to my order, I don't think they deserve my business. I'm going to Umai.

46.description: Seems they have somewhat improved the lighting situation (dark ceilings) and the rolls are getting to be really top notch with yummy specials!  And no cork fee BYOB- what more can a girl ask for!  I almost don't want to write this review and encourage other s to go here because it is small and our go to place and right across from our house.  So when its nice out and people are having a good time outside it can be kind of noisy for us!  So go enjoy your sushi, great service, and byob but keep it down outside ;-)  lol

1.description: The Food tasted very good, BUT there is AN IMPORTANT HEALTH issue. I took PICTURES of the three CHEFS who were preparing the sushi rolls, one of them HAD NO GLOVES COVERING HIS HANDS! which puts customers in a SERIOUS risk of FOOD POISONING! This gloves-less guy even picked something that fell on the floor while he was working, dusted off his hands and went back to work again and I SAW HIM! When I asked the waitress why this guy isn't taking food handling precautions in consideration aka no gloves, her answer was "well I know some Italian places who don't abide by food handling precautions as well!", REALLY??? I wouldn't count on someone's personal view of how clean their hands should be when IT COMES TO THE FOOD THAT I'M EATING! Ps : I'll upload the evidence to the pictures section of this profile

55.description: Our new favorite place in Chicago.  Not only is it BYOB, but the service and Sushi was great!  Can't wait to visit again.

9.description: I normally order 2-3 rolls at sushi restaurants to fill me up. In this case, I only ordered one because I had a hot yoga class right after. Just not a good idea to stuff my face if I don't want to die.The restaurant would be cuter in the evening, when it's not sunny outside. The lack of lights inside combined with the sun shining through the huge windows didn't make a warm atmosphere. They have outdoor seating, which is nice for the summertime.The service was friendly and attentive. No complaints there.I ordered an Ocean roll as recommended on Yelp. My first impression was "Wow, that's a lot of sauce on the plate......and swirled so nicely!" The roll was really good. I was trying so hard to savor each bite, which was very, very difficult to do. I would definitely recommend ordering the Ocean roll.I'll be back to try the other rolls because one is not enough!

26.description: Excellent sushi. Great prices. Great value lunch menu. I'll be back.

25.description: My first time coming here and the food was absolutely delicious! Everything was fresh and the taste was amazing! I didn't even need to add wasabi or soy sauce because the rolls I ordered were already sauced to perfection. I ordered the ocean roll, dynamite roll, salmon roll, spider roll, and eel/freshwater nigiri, and boy did I leave full and pleased. I'll definitely recommend anyone to come here. Plus, the waiter was really nice and always had a smile on.  :)

12.description: Best sushi I have ever had in South Loop or even perhaps in Chicago in general. Very nice service and everything including green tea ice cream that is to die for. Will definitely go back!

59.description: Honestly the best sushi I've had in Chicago. Love this place. I've been here at least 10 times and everything is great including the sashimi and rolls. I would list rolls but you seriously can't go wrong. I've noticed that Chicago has a lot of sushi places with bad rolls, which is baffling since almost anything is delicious that is covered in spicy mayo. The quality of fish here is spot on so you can trust the sashimi and it's really just an added bonus it's BYOB. I also appreciate its straight sushi and rolls without any fusion nonsense. Get yourself here - you won't regret it. My only regret is we don't come here more often.

21.description: Excellent service. Excellent sushi with vegetarian friendly options. BYOB is a plus. Kai Sushi is a hidden gem.

17.description: My experience was just average . Nothing bad to say . Good place overall. I reserve 4 and 5 stars for what they are meant for ... Above average businessesI wanted to give them 4 stars , but the tuna I had did not seem to be that high quality or fresh. Also their crab meat was imitation which is what my girlfriend wanted . They told us ahead of time which was respectable Positive - they have quail egg shooter on menu. That's rare it seems ( like 33% in my experience)

10.description: Been here two times. Although I'm not a sushi expert, I thought it was pretty good. The last time, I brought the kids. They loved it. Their favorite was the volcano roll. The spring rolls were really good as well, they ate them. My picky eater ate fried sweet potatoes and rice. It's manageable for the entire family. It's great that this place is in the neighborhood. They're already excited to come on their own.

5.description: We went back to Kai again last night. It had been 4-5 months since our last visit. The fish was fresh, rolls were still great and they are still BYO. I felt compelled to write another review and take down a star since a Yelp check in still reflects 50% off any specialty roll but sadly the restaurant refused to honor it and the waitress said they stopped accepting it a long time ago. If it's been that long, then I am sure they can contact Yelp and have it taken down or better still honor it when someone does present the offer.

3.description: The South Loop dining scene has been bombing lately, and one of the hidden gems is Kai. Located close to the EL and CTA stops, the location is ideal for those on public transit, there is street parking but if you're visiting at peak hours you may have to circle. As a vegetarian my favorite roll is the "Shiitake Special Roll", which at $10 is a steal, as per my dining companions the sashimi is fresh, and there are a variety of options so that everyone at your table will leave with a full tummy at a price that won't hurt your wallet. The fresh oranges they serve when you request your check is a nice touch. The service is as relaxed as the atmosphere, the servers are friendly and do not hesitate to bring you ice or drink ware as needed. This BYOB spot is an ideal place to chit chat with your pals after work and share the news of the week.

35.description: They don't take reservations after 5PM, but my friend and I were able to get a table for two within 10 minutes of waiting on a Saturday night. The food was great! We had the salmon avocado roll, crunchy crab roll and a sushi platter (15 pieces). The sushi platter is really good if you like fish. If you like a balance, the salmon avocado is highly recommended

19.description: This place is great! Best sushi in the south loop hands down. The staff is super friendly and helpful. The Texas and Chicago fire is yummyYou won't be disappointed with this place.

28.description: 3.5 stars actually. So I read the reviews on Yelp and really wanted to try this place. It's small but cozy. The sushi rolls are good. I had ordered three and ended up liking just one. The super crunchy was really really good! The other two I had gotten were sokuru and Texan, both were a bit to fishy for me. The Texan felt like someone had opened up a can of tuna and just put it inside the roll. Needless to say those two are not recommended. The waiter was prompt and very nice. I would actually go back for the super crunch. They also gave us a cute cut up orange at the end.

45.description: Sushi was good, we ordered carry out as to avoid taking our two year out.  Very disappointed in their attention to detail no chopsticks, soy sauce or spoons for miso soup which made for a disappointing meal.  Check your order.

33.description: Awesome food and awesome service. We were here at 5:30 and the food came out in literally no time. John was our server and he is delightful. So sweet!!

43.description: Well... I'm not sure where to start.Since I live right around the area, and I have often a craving for sushi and its accompaniments, I'm inclined to go here often.The first time I went here was really solid. I loved my experience here. The second time, it started to dwindle down. The staff were unattentive towards me compared to the other customers (there were only 2 other parties present, with two maximum at a table), and questioned and tried to elaborate on what I ordered, thinking that I absolutely had no clue of what I was getting into.My visit today however, was a completely different story. When I came in, I felt like I wasn't exactly welcome -- there was a large delivery order in place. I feel that I was fairly patient with this incident, however; the staff this time seemed to be very aloof towards me, who presumably was the only other customer in the room at that time. The waitress I got this time kind of gave me the same treatment as I got my second time here, but with less skepticism but more snark. As other customers trickled in during the half hour that I had my dinner, I see the staff being more attentive and friendly to them rather than me, which at the same time is somewhat understandable, yet questionable when it comes to customer priority ethics. To be honest, the only thing consistent with the place is the amount of fruit flies within the establishment.Not to mention, I came home with a really upset stomach, and to spare you the gruesome details... yeah you know what. strange since all of the 'raw' items I've ordered were all blow-torched to the point where it shouldn't be. I came here for nigiri and sashimi, not a hot well-done meal. I'd come here again, but this place needs to step their game up more.

2.description: Kai Sushi looks like a fast food type sushi restaurant, which it probably is, but the sushi was surprisingly good! The bf and I bused/walked our way here in the rain last June, and it was worth it. The staff was super friendly, and I believe the serve who helped us had just visited SF so we chatted for a bit.As I said earlier, this place is definitely comes off as a place where you'd order to go rather than sit down and eat. The menus they give you when you dine in are paper brochure menus, like a to-go menu pretty much. No big deal, butWe mainly ordered rolls and then a couple nigiri just to try. I believe we had the Ocean, White Tiger, Hamachi Special and Chicago Fire rolls. Unfortunately, I don't recall which nigiri we had -- scallops for sure, and it was good! The bf and I enjoyed Kai muchhh more than Umai. The sushi was fresh and all the rolls were delicious.Definitely recommend Kai Sushi if you're visiting, or living in, Chicago!

18.description: I went on a Sunday night-probably around an hour before close. I ordered a chirashi and a dynamite roll. The food was actually very good. Great rice to fish ratio. However the service left much to be desired. I will give them a pass however because the guy said it was his first day The food: 11 big slices of fish over a generous portion of rice. The dynamite roll was good too. The sauces were also nice. I asked for eel sauce and spicy mayo. These were given free of charge-unlike some places that charge 1.00 per 2 tbsp of the sauces. I'll definitely be returning sometime. The place isn't big, but it offers outdoor seating for when the weather is nice. Location is not in the heart of the loop, so traffic isn't as hectic. Overall 4/5.

41.description: We went back to Kai again last night. It had been 4-5 months since our last visit. The fish was fresh, rolls were still great and they are still BYO. I felt compelled to write another review and take down a star since a Yelp check in still reflects 50% off any specialty roll but sadly the restaurant refused to honor it and the waitress said they stopped accepting it a long time ago. If it's been that long, then I am sure they can contact Yelp and have it taken down or better still honor it when someone does present the offer.

52.description: Nondescript outside so took a while for me to try, but should have tried it sooner.Cute outdoor space in summer with white lights.  Inside is clean and modern.   Sushi is very fresh.  Servers are very fast and accommodating.  Also byob!!! We took our 2 week old (was our wedding anniversary and were super anxious to leave the house but also antsy about dining out)  the wait staff was amazing and our sushi was brought out so fast. They knew we were nervous with a very little one. We really appreciate it!  Have since returned and are very happy to have this place in our neighborhood.

50.description: I thought Kai sushi was mediocre. I finally had a chance to try to this place. I pass it pretty frequently and checked out the reviews on Yelp and also read it's byob. For these reasons, I thought for sure my date and I wouldn't be able to get a table on a Friday night. However, we were seated right away. I didn't care for the ambiance, the lighting was bright and it felt cramped. Our server was great but the food was nothing to rave about. Food we ordered: Sashimi platter. I've had fresher fish elsewhere.-Spicy tuna roll; not rolled tight enough and had too much rice. -Hamachi, jalapeno, avocado roll ( I'm giving the ingredients because I can't remember the name of the actual roll).  That roll was tasty but only because it tasted like guacamole! -Spring rolls were pretty good. Again, nothing wowed me. I wouldn't go back.

4.description: first of all, i wanted to say that the service is great, even though it was a busy night, but we never felt neglected, the waitress will drop by to make sure everything is good, for service alone, i would give it 5 starsFor the food, I would say this is very average sushi, nothing really stand out, but I guess given the price, it is supposed to be just a neighborhood restaurant. The rice's texture is not that good, and a bit too much rice vinegar. the fish quality is very much so so.

6.description: Very delicious, very fresh and very unique sushi here! Very nice ambiance and the customer service is great!!! My brothers favorite of ALL time is the Chicago Fire- I liked it too but I also love the Volcano Roll and all the rest of the 10 we tried... AWESOMENESS. And yes it's a nice to have the option of BYOB!

22.description: Though it's a small restaurant, it was a lot better than I expected. The fish was fresh, sushi was nice, the staff were very very friendly. We had the sushi deluxe and a curry udon. It was totally worth the price. Great place for Japanese food in Chicago.

15.description: 3.5 stars actually. So I read the reviews on Yelp and really wanted to try this place. It's small but cozy. The sushi rolls are good. I had ordered three and ended up liking just one. The super crunchy was really really good! The other two I had gotten were sokuru and Texan, both were a bit to fishy for me. The Texan felt like someone had opened up a can of tuna and just put it inside the roll. Needless to say those two are not recommended. The waiter was prompt and very nice. I would actually go back for the super crunch. They also gave us a cute cut up orange at the end.

57.description: Best sushi I have ever had in South Loop or even perhaps in Chicago in general. Very nice service and everything including green tea ice cream that is to die for. Will definitely go back!

20.description: This is my favorite sushi restaurant in all of Chicago, especially for lunch (2 rolls for $10, hellllooo)! My favorites are just your standard salmon avocado roll, the spicy tuna, the ocean roll, and the crunchy crab. The salmon here is so fresh and flavorful -- seriously, skip those trendy sushi joints and come to Kai. You won't regret it.

36.description: I ordered shrimp tempura udon (off menu, $9) and it was delicious! The tempura batter tasted different from what I'm used to in various Los Angeles Japanese restaurants.  I wish there were more :) Bf got the sakura ($) and super crunchy rolls ($13.95).  8 pieces comes per sushi roll orders.  He really liked the sakura more than the super crunchy.  Overall, it was a solid Japanese restaurant and our server was really welcoming and attentive!

14.description: I've never been to a BYOB restaurant before. I so want to go back. The sushi rolls were absolutely amazing. So flavorful and delicious. Beautifully constructed. The waitress even brought wine glasses and opened the bottle of wine. We had the super crunchy roll, dynamite roll and a special roll with salmon belly. I really liked the dynamite roll. Personal favorite of the three but the super crunchy roll had a nice slow heat to it from the jalapeño. That was really good. The cucumber salad was very good and the orange for dessert was a perfect ending. Looking forward to coming back. We were in town for a concert and stumbled across this place. What a gem.

28.description: I received a Groupon for Marimarshe Salon, for a 4 hour mani-pedi, facial, and massage. So basically half a day of pampering and forgetting about all worries and stresses. I was able to make the appointment easily, I wanted to use the Groupon in one sitting...and weekends were booked out for 3-4 weeks. Nothing surprising, its expected. So I made an appointment for 10am on a weekday. Honestly at first I wasn't too excited about waking up early and running to the spa, but after my experience, I would highly recommend going in the AM. Not many customers are there, the staff gives you attention, and you can fully relax!So as I got there, upon giving my name and appointment time, the receptionist said that I was only booked in for a mani-pedi...?!?!?! wth! I mentioned to her the only reason I came in at 10am was so I could use the complete 4 hours in one sitting! At this point I was skeptical about the spa, the services, and the experience I was about to have.....The receptionist asked me to have a seat, and said to give her a few minutes, she talked to other coworkers/manager made a call, and got someone to come in to keep my appointment! How awesome is that! I mean, she didn't argue or doubt me once but right away apologized and rectified the issue above and beyond! 3 1/2 hours later...I received all four services from three different aestheticians. The mani-pedi - one of the bests I have had! Facial - staff was very knowledgeable regarding products and skin care, made recommendations and not once pushed to buy any products (to be honest when I am pushed to purchase products I have not heard of even though I may have liked it, i get turned off, big time!). And lastly the Massage was relaxing, relaxing, relaxing! About two to three times I was offered something to drink, and brought water without asking for it. Overall I had a great first experience at Marimarshe Salon. Definitely felt pampered! Very professional and friendly staff. This place has been open for just under a year, I wish them all the best and hope they keep up with the excellent services!

1.description: Okay, so I just happen to google a spa in the South Loop area. I found this place. It was $50+ for a Brazilian Wax, but the lady quoted me an automatic $55? Why? Hmm...Latonya, the lady who performed by wax was really nice. It took her 40 mins which was long and I didn't mind, but WHY is there still hair near the labia and thigh area from a Brazilian?! All that talking, she should have been doing her job. It wasn't too professional either, as she kept going over the same section 2 and 3 times...which causes irritation. The work was on the amateur side. Smh. I've learned my lesson. I won't be back here again.

9.description: Why list Sunday hours when you really don't have Sunday hours

29.description: I like this place. They aren't too busy and arent too expensive. It's in the south loop an right by the #4 and #1 bus stop so it's easy to get there. They use all the good products like Morrocanoil, Mizani, and KeraCare. I saw Janell who did a touch up for me and she styled my hair just the way I wanted it without me telling her! I'm coming back here.

23.description: Tried them out as part of a lifebooker. Conveniently located in motor row, the salon is gorgeous, everyone there is super nice and the no chip lasted for 2 weeks no problem AND peeled off easily when i wanted it off. A gem for sure!

5.description: Marcia is the best! She is a lovely shop owner and stylist who I have been coming to for about 4 years now. You will not be disappointed. When I first came to her my her was in terrible shape. She saw what my hair needed and did what was best for me. Healthy hair first along with the latest styles. You can't beat that!

25.description: So I purchased a groupon for a mani-pedi.  I scheduled an appointment, but on the way to the appointment I was delayed.  The appointment was with Mallory and she was a sweetheart.  She understood and rescheduled my appointment for the next day (no talk of cancellation fee, etc.).  So I went to my rescheduled appointment.  The Salon is nice, clean and sizeable.  I loved the atmosphere.  There was nice music playing, but not a bunch of noise.  There were a few casual conversations going, but overall it was very peaceful.My nail tech Mallory gave me the absolute best pedicure that I have received in Chicago.  I will definitely recommend her for anyone going for their nails.  Mallory worked on my feet and hands very well.  She was polite and nice.  She was also very understanding because I was not feeling very well.  She offered me water and went and got it for me.I used to pass this salon all the time and did not know it was there.  I will definitely be back!

12.description: I have received nothing less than superb customer service from the staff at Marimarshe Salon.  From the moment I walk in the salon, until the time I leave, i'm always made to feel like I can kick back, relax and get pampered.  I'm always greeted with a warm welcome, and not just by the receptionist. During my time there, everyone is always checking to make sure I'm ok and comfortable.  This is important to me because I'm usually stopping in after a long day of work. I appreciate that this is a ful-service salon, as well.  Being able to get all the services we (women) like under one roof is certainly a plus!  In regards to hair, Marcia is beyond awesome!  I am more than satisified with the work she does.  I'm extremely picky and she takes the time to listen, advise and work magic at times!  She is a true professional.  I appreciate that she cares about your hair. I've been to plenty of stylists that just style!  They don't care about your hair being healthy.  They just style.  Not Marcia!  She is 100% invested in your hair because she knows it is a direct reflection of her work.  This is what I look for in a stylist; professionalism and that extra TLC.  I can't end this review without also mentioning LaTanya.  I've been lucky enough to have a facial and brow waxings done by her.  She's also amazing!  She's more than good at what she does, she also provides that extra TLC that I so desire after a long day at work.  So there you have it, nothing but thumbs up for me for this salon.  Great people and great services.

21.description: This place is being billed as a spa but there is NOTHING spa like about the atmosphere OR the service. I've had plenty of manicures and pedicures in my life and this ranks as the absolute worst. I can't speak for the other staff but my nail technician -and I'm being kind even referring to her as a "tech" because she was the most overconfident, unskilled person I've ever dealt with- was the worst. She was lazy and lacked any nail care skills while surprisingly boasting that "she was good at what she did." Here is how good she was: She clipped my nails haphazardly. She lacked any deft of hand in clipping my cuticles, leaving them in pain and now they're peeling back. She used an old, weathered nail file that couldn't file my nails. She didn't clean off the nail file dust from my fingers before painting my nails. At no point did she use polish remover to clean my nails. And to top it off, she lazily painted my nails, constantly leaving color on the edges. I immediately removed the polish and repainted my hands when I got home given the terrible paint job. While taking care of me, she also complained about having another client following me and said she would call to see if they could reschedule. I was so turned off by her and the service that I opted to have a regular polish instead of the no-chip manicure I paid for with my Groupon. I thought perhaps she was just a lump of coal in a diamond mine but the place itself was also disappointing. The location was dirty, the nail polish selections were minimal and almost all the polishes were clogged and thick. I hesitated getting into the pedicure tub as the one next to me looked like it had never been cleaned. In short, I will NEVER step hand or foot into this place again, not even if they paid me. Even 1 star feels too generous. Enter at your own risk.

16.description: THIS REVIEW IS FOR THE MASSAGE THERPIST, MIA, NOT THE SALON OR ANY OTHER SERVICES!!!I have been getting massages at least 2x/month for a very loooooong time...years! This was definitely one of the best! Mia listened to my history, concerns and expectations, which EVERY massage therapist should do. Her techniques are great, she is very professional and the price is RIGHT!Only negative is that since the massage room is in a  salon, I initially heard customers chatting and the sound of blow dryers; however, after a few minutes I was so relaxed I forgot about any noise interference.If you are looking for a "spa" experience and to be pampered, this is not your place. If you are looking for a GREAT massage, whether just to relax or to work out some kinks, then Mia is the one you definitely want to see.Too bad you have to go through the salon directly to schedule the appointment, because they could use a few lessons in telephone etiquette and even face to face customer service. But, if you can look past that, which I know should be important, I guarantee that you will be happy with your massage. That is not in Mia's control and I'm glad I did not judge her by the salon's customer service.  She is a young professional and definitely has a bright future ahead of her! I will definitely be back to see Mia. BTW, there is plenty of street parking, just don't forget to pay the meter!

17.description: My daughter and I have going to marimarshe' salon for almost 3 years.  Marcia is our stylist and is quite knowlegeble about hair growth, conditioning, cuting, coloring and styling. It's her salon so of course she is an expert. I've never used any of the other spa services because I'm loyal to who I've used in the past but if you need something done to your hair....Set up an appointment with Marcia.

10.description: I received a Groupon for Marimarshe Salon, for a 4 hour mani-pedi, facial, and massage. So basically half a day of pampering and forgetting about all worries and stresses. I was able to make the appointment easily, I wanted to use the Groupon in one sitting...and weekends were booked out for 3-4 weeks. Nothing surprising, its expected. So I made an appointment for 10am on a weekday. Honestly at first I wasn't too excited about waking up early and running to the spa, but after my experience, I would highly recommend going in the AM. Not many customers are there, the staff gives you attention, and you can fully relax!So as I got there, upon giving my name and appointment time, the receptionist said that I was only booked in for a mani-pedi...?!?!?! wth! I mentioned to her the only reason I came in at 10am was so I could use the complete 4 hours in one sitting! At this point I was skeptical about the spa, the services, and the experience I was about to have.....The receptionist asked me to have a seat, and said to give her a few minutes, she talked to other coworkers/manager made a call, and got someone to come in to keep my appointment! How awesome is that! I mean, she didn't argue or doubt me once but right away apologized and rectified the issue above and beyond! 3 1/2 hours later...I received all four services from three different aestheticians. The mani-pedi - one of the bests I have had! Facial - staff was very knowledgeable regarding products and skin care, made recommendations and not once pushed to buy any products (to be honest when I am pushed to purchase products I have not heard of even though I may have liked it, i get turned off, big time!). And lastly the Massage was relaxing, relaxing, relaxing! About two to three times I was offered something to drink, and brought water without asking for it. Overall I had a great first experience at Marimarshe Salon. Definitely felt pampered! Very professional and friendly staff. This place has been open for just under a year, I wish them all the best and hope they keep up with the excellent services!

11.description: Mixed feeling about this salon. I went once, was a bit scarred but wanted to use the other part of my groupon. The first time I went, the girl who did my service (pedicure and no chip mani) worked me over like it was her first time. It was embarrassing for her and for me. She treated my feet like they were made of porcelain. I'm a server, on my feet for 8 hours a day, my feet need a rough, yet efficient hand. They are beat up, and she barely you touched them. My manicure was shoddy and messy, chipped 2 days out. The salon was cold and empty. It was awkward all around.The next time I dreaded my appointment. I get there and the salon is dark and no one is there. I was the first appointment of the day and I had to wait 30 minutes is drizzly cold weather to get in. I was peeved and wet. I had the same technician. This time she was, well not great, but more experienced. Much better results. She is uncomfortably silent though. All attempts at conversation were clipped and painfully awkward. Again, I was the only one is the salon. It's a miracle they can afford to stay open when I'm sure I'm always the only one there. If I had my druthers, I'd never go back but unfortunately the place where I get my threading merged with them, so it looks Luke I have no choice. Appointments can be hard to get, you have to call 3 to 4 times to finally get someone on the phone. Parking on Michigan is easy and not that expensive...I just don't know...

26.description: I bought a groupon for the spa for a massage, facial, mani and pedi.  It was absolutely amazing!  Very clean salon, everyone was very professional.  I used to drive to the Northside for spa treatment and this is so close to me.  I plan to be a repeat customer.

27.description: I always go to Erin to get my eyebrows threaded. She does an amazing job! Once I was actually asked by a total stranger how I got such nice brows, so I pointed her here. The staff that I have talked with have always been really friendly. Make sure you bring cash for the tip-- they can't put it on your card and there's no convenient ATMs.

0.description: I had a Groupon for lash extension here. I had no idea what to expect after all of the unflattering reviews. First, I called to make an appointment and they were very friendly and accommodating. To work with my schedule they were nice enough to honor my Groupon a week after it expired.Second, I was 30 minute early due to getting out early from something before and not knowing how long it would take for me to cab it down there. Being early, the lady at the front desk was super nice to me. We chatted for 30 minutes as we waited for my technician to come. She did arrive 1 minutes early before my appointment was to startThird, Troy, my lash technician, was right on time and very courteous. We talked through the whole appointment. She was great to talk to and when I looked at lashes I was amazed how natural and beautiful they are. It has been 48 hours and not 1 lash has fallen out!Two things to work on are:1. I asked how long the appointment would take and they told me 1 hour. I came in the middle of a work day so i told them my time was very sensitive. It end up taking 1.5 hours. 2. The glue Troy used stung my right eye so bad it got infected. I had to see an eye Dr to day and get antibiotics because of the glue getting in there.Overall, I would definitely come back even if it's way out of my neighborhood.

20.description: If i could give them zero stars i would.  its a cluster out there.  Pain in the butt for scheduling my groupon massage.  First I tried to call and literally tried for about 3 weeks before I actually got someone on the phone.  I tried at different hours of the day but always got there voicemail which led me to there website.  However the problem with scheduling online is there is no option for a groupon.  Finally got someone on the phone and she was rude to me and brushed me off.  Then I called on the 12/22 and she said the receptionist was not in and could not make an appointment, told me to call back the next day. I called back to find out that the massage person was not coming in on the 24th.  Then the final kicker, the groupon is expiring on dec 26, I asked if she could extend it and she said the owner says you can pay the difference.   No way!  This company needs to learn how organize and get there priorities straight with some better customer service.  Yikes this is not how you treat potential new customers and was not only one person it was multiple as I talked to several ladies there, all clearly incompetent or not trained properly.

19.description: I always go to Erin to get my eyebrows threaded. She does an amazing job! Once I was actually asked by a total stranger how I got such nice brows, so I pointed her here. The staff that I have talked with have always been really friendly. Make sure you bring cash for the tip-- they can't put it on your card and there's no convenient ATMs.

2.description: So I really wanted to like this place. Especially since its black owned and I want to support the efforts of the underdog in the business world. With that said, let's start at the beginning. From what I can see, the downfall of this place is the customer service. Management needs to make sure that the people working there have some aspect of what true costumer service means. The people who should be picking up the phone are NOT picking up the phone and when they do - they aren't 'smiling' while they speak. Someone has said once to me, call back in an hour or 'hold on' and I was put on hold for 12 minutes before I hung up and tried again, with no answer! Today the woman at the front desk let the phone go to voicemail 3 times while I was standing there waiting for my appointment - was she busy you ask? NO, she was shopping for shoes online! The phone should NEVER go unanswered, that's clients/business calling on the other end! With 5 employees present, the phone should never go unanswered! Well today, I get there on time for my appointment and I'm made to wait while I can clearly see my technician talking to another tech in the hallway. Another thing, which just happened right now as I am typing this, the tech should not be picking up their cell phone while filing my toe nails or what happened during my pedi last time, the tech walking away to pick up the phone while in mid filing. Or the way they dress: sweats, T-shirts and flip flops sometimes dirty - they should dress according to the type of clientele they want to attract. With all the walkaways from my technicians (both times) my Mani/pedi has taken over 2 hours. It should under NO circumstances take that long! Here I am again waiting for my technician to return. The shitty thing is that I've met the owner and she seems really awesome and customer service minded. I don't understand why she doesn't demand the same from her staff. There should be rules, no phones while with a client, no visitors while with a client (yes my tech just had someone visit and stepped away for a moment), no letting the phone go unanswered, no walking away from clients, treat clients well, talk to clients (its been about 25 minutes and my tech still hasn't given me a name! One more thing: you need to demand that your staff clean the salon thoroughly and the stained towels should be thrown away - that's just nasty - use paper towels when painting nails so the towels don't get stained. I shouldn't have to ask for a clean towel every time I'm here! ...which unfortunately, today will be the last time I'm here. Marcia, I wish you and your business well.

18.description: Nice salon in the near south neighborhood. They have a lot of services at great prices. Only thing I wasn't happy with was the nail polish selection was limited. But the staff is friendly and it's easy to get an appt.

13.description: This place is being billed as a spa but there is NOTHING spa like about the atmosphere OR the service. I've had plenty of manicures and pedicures in my life and this ranks as the absolute worst. I can't speak for the other staff but my nail technician -and I'm being kind even referring to her as a "tech" because she was the most overconfident, unskilled person I've ever dealt with- was the worst. She was lazy and lacked any nail care skills while surprisingly boasting that "she was good at what she did." Here is how good she was: She clipped my nails haphazardly. She lacked any deft of hand in clipping my cuticles, leaving them in pain and now they're peeling back. She used an old, weathered nail file that couldn't file my nails. She didn't clean off the nail file dust from my fingers before painting my nails. At no point did she use polish remover to clean my nails. And to top it off, she lazily painted my nails, constantly leaving color on the edges. I immediately removed the polish and repainted my hands when I got home given the terrible paint job. While taking care of me, she also complained about having another client following me and said she would call to see if they could reschedule. I was so turned off by her and the service that I opted to have a regular polish instead of the no-chip manicure I paid for with my Groupon. I thought perhaps she was just a lump of coal in a diamond mine but the place itself was also disappointing. The location was dirty, the nail polish selections were minimal and almost all the polishes were clogged and thick. I hesitated getting into the pedicure tub as the one next to me looked like it had never been cleaned. In short, I will NEVER step hand or foot into this place again, not even if they paid me. Even 1 star feels too generous. Enter at your own risk.

4.description: i come here on a regular bases for eyebrow threading with chacku. she is wonderful and precise, and i will keep coming back!

24.description: Sadly, worst hair salon experience to date. While overall, the staff was friendly and the space nice, the experience and the price far outshadow the positives.I called the day of to see if they had any openings, and was told to come in an hour. On the phone,  I was asked if I also wanted a shampoo with my haircut. I said yes, as I assumed they go together like all of the other salons I have ever been to.I arrived and was warmly greeted by the front desk staff, but then sat for nearly 20 minutes after my scheduled appointment time. Finally, I was brought to the shampoo area and after the stylist washed my hair (all of 5 minutes, at most) I was sent back to the waiting area to wait another 15 minutes with wet hair.Finally, an assistant came to bring me back to dry my hair,  prior to the stylistic cutting my hair. Had I known this was the procedure I would have opted out of the shampoo. But at all of the dozens and dozens of salons I have been to across the country, my hair has always been washed, cut, then dried at one listed price. After nearly 2 hours into the event, I explained to the stylistic that I needed to go and would finsh styling on my own. She walked me up front, and told the front desk staff to take $10 off since I had to leave prior to her styling my hair. I thought that was considerate until I was told my total was $95!!! For a simple trim! I questioned where that price came from as I had seen a haircut was $25 on their website. I was informed that because the owner had cut my hair it was actually $45 for the haircut. I could have dealt with that, but it would have nice to have been informed when making the appointment.So where did the other $50 come in, I questioned. Apparently, they charge $60 to wash and dry your hair!! I was dumbfounded as I had never paid separately, and I have fine, thin hair that is not diffucult to work with. Even a blowout at Blow by Blow in the Gold Coast is only $35 so I do not understand how they can justify their prices for the location and space they are in.While I wish the owner and salon the best of luck, I felt the need to inform people of my experience. A little communication when booked,  regarding that I was with the owner so the price would be increased, that they charge separately to wash your hair, and that they might not actually be able to get me in at that time or even that day would have gone a long way.

6.description: I have very mixed feelings on this place as I came here twice. I should've written 2 separate yelp reviews, as both of my experiences were vastly different for the same service and with the same tech. I purchased a Lifebooker (another type of groupon-like site) for 2 no-chip manicures. First off, this place is impossible to book an appt. I literally called for weeks and was never able to get someone on the phone. I thought the place had closed down for a second because I couldn't comprehend how a nail/hair/salon could not answer the phone during regular business hours. Anyway, after weeks of trying, I finally got someone on the phone. They then told me it was going to be about 3 weeks to get an appointment for a no-chip mani. Extremely upset, I scheduled the appt anyway. I wanted to just get my money's worth and move on. I had a family emergency (a big one) and wasn't able to make it to my appt. I called the day before and they said I wouldn't be able to get another appt for another few weeks. I decided to call back at a later time as I was too stressed to deal with this A month later, I call and they answer on the first try. Remarkable. I made an appt on a Saturday morning. I get there and easily score a parking spot right outside. I walk to the salon and have to punch a code on a metal box for someone to buzz me and open the door. Is tight security really needed for a salon? Anywho, I walk in, mention I have an appt and was told to wait. They started looking for the person to perform the mani and couldn't find them. Then they realize they didn't come in today. This would've been nice to know beforehand, especially since they had my contact info on file. I was then instructed to sit with another individual that could perform the task. I was shown the wall of no-chip polish and liked they had Opi, Sheliac and Gellish varieties.I then sit down with a really young (she probably just graduated out of high school) girl and started taking off my nail polish. I immediately notice there is no water to soak my hands in. Nails 101: You never cut a cuticle or polish/buff a nail before soaking, as you have to soften the skin and wash the gunk off. This was not done here. She quickly went through the cuticle-cutting and buffing and did not cut the nail as short as I described. A lot of cuticle and rough, dead skin (that annoying, corner skin) was also not adequately or thoroughly removed. She then proceeds to paint my nails. Again, no hand-washing or water soaking after all this dust and debris was on my hands. As it was really early in the morning and I was exhausted, I didn't pay close enough attention to the nail tech. She started on a THIRD coat of polish. If you know about no-chip, you know in essence, there's 4 coats: 1 base, 2 color and 1 top. This already makes the nail look a little thicker than regular polish if not done correctly. With globs of polish and an unnecessary coat, it looked like I had little helmets on my hands. Seriously, someone thought I had fake nails, even though they're real. The coating was ridiculously thick. This is a massive pet peeve of mine and I brought it up immediately. The nail tech argued that the color was very light and needed an extra coat for it to be visible. I let it go. Once it was done, I was extremely upset and really never wanted to step foot in here again.After about a week or 2, the polish was all messed up. This is unusual for no-chip as I have easily gone a month without having to touch-up my nails. About a month later, I realized I was out of money but needed a mani badly. I took my chances and went back to Marimarshe' for the 2nd no-chip purchased. This was a MUCH better experience. The same nail tech assisted me and remembered me. She said she hopes my nails were ok the last time and has "been practicing really hard to get better." This broke my heart. I must've been such a bitch to this poor girl, I can only imagine how hard she was working on her craft after that day. The mani this time did include a hand washing after buffing but again, no water before. This is still very strange to me. I picked a cool white polish and she did a free design on my ring finger for free. She did improve in the sense of placing the perfect amount of polish on the nail but I still had bubbles in one nail, a hair stuck in another, and after a week, chips again. I see this as not the tech's fault. She probably just started and needs more practice. I see this as the salon's fault for placing inexperienced staff to do services on the busiest salon days. I really liked the girl that helped me. She was genuinely sweet and I'm sure she tried her hardest to do a good job. I just feel that this salon should know better than not to have water for any mani and to put staff that still require training wheels. After using my second of 2 services, I will not come back here again. Sorry, my hands deserve better.0 stars for 1 visit, 3 for the 2nd (solely on the customer service)= 2

22.description: My best friend visited the salon for the first time and was very disappointed in the weave that she had done. I told her that I had purchased a Groupon for a mani-pedi and she was relieved that I was not getting my hair done. Her weave looked like an amateur had done it. So I booked my appointment for my mani-pedi, only to have my appointment cancelled because the person who was scheduled to perform it called off. That was almost 3 weeks ago. I keep calling to reschedule and now they don't have any appointments available for 6 weeks. I really regret purchasing the Groupon. I will call before I purchase another one.

15.description: BEWARE! I purchased 2 Global Keratin Services and 3 Cut/Blowouts through Lifebooker with no problem. They refused to honor the second voucher because they said there was a 1 per customer limit.That's $125... down the drain.

7.description: Get your nails done here if you love to waste money, hate having nice looking hands/feet and have hours to waste.I bought a groupon for two no chip mani and pedi here. SO DUMB.The first time I was here, I waited an HOUR for the nail tech. I have NO idea what she was doing since I had an appointment and there was no one else ahead of me.  My no-chip started peeling after 3 days. I was in Mexico and could get them fixed so I had to rip all the nail polish off all my fingernails.  I was very hesitant to go back but I figured I'd at least get a pedi out of it, the first one was at least mediocre.This time I had to wait another 1/2 hour for the nail tech, different girl this time. She made me soak in lukewarm water that turned cold because she ran off someone to talk on her phone for 20 minutes while I was soaking.  When I told her about the peeling from the last no-chip, she tried to tell me it was my fault because I was in water a lot.  Ugh...that's why people get no-chips! SO they can go on vacation!!!!!!!this time, my no-chip had some color on the cuticles so I wanted to peel that off. It pulled a little color off my actual nail, so I'm keeping my fingers crossed that the whole finger doesn't peel off because of it.  My toes have a big chip on it 4 days after the mani.  I can do my toes better at home. this place sucks. DO NOT GO.

8.description: So I purchased a groupon for a mani-pedi.  I scheduled an appointment, but on the way to the appointment I was delayed.  The appointment was with Mallory and she was a sweetheart.  She understood and rescheduled my appointment for the next day (no talk of cancellation fee, etc.).  So I went to my rescheduled appointment.  The Salon is nice, clean and sizeable.  I loved the atmosphere.  There was nice music playing, but not a bunch of noise.  There were a few casual conversations going, but overall it was very peaceful.My nail tech Mallory gave me the absolute best pedicure that I have received in Chicago.  I will definitely recommend her for anyone going for their nails.  Mallory worked on my feet and hands very well.  She was polite and nice.  She was also very understanding because I was not feeling very well.  She offered me water and went and got it for me.I used to pass this salon all the time and did not know it was there.  I will definitely be back!

3.description: If i could give them zero stars i would.  its a cluster out there.  Pain in the butt for scheduling my groupon massage.  First I tried to call and literally tried for about 3 weeks before I actually got someone on the phone.  I tried at different hours of the day but always got there voicemail which led me to there website.  However the problem with scheduling online is there is no option for a groupon.  Finally got someone on the phone and she was rude to me and brushed me off.  Then I called on the 12/22 and she said the receptionist was not in and could not make an appointment, told me to call back the next day. I called back to find out that the massage person was not coming in on the 24th.  Then the final kicker, the groupon is expiring on dec 26, I asked if she could extend it and she said the owner says you can pay the difference.   No way!  This company needs to learn how organize and get there priorities straight with some better customer service.  Yikes this is not how you treat potential new customers and was not only one person it was multiple as I talked to several ladies there, all clearly incompetent or not trained properly.

14.description: Sadly, worst hair salon experience to date. While overall, the staff was friendly and the space nice, the experience and the price far outshadow the positives.I called the day of to see if they had any openings, and was told to come in an hour. On the phone,  I was asked if I also wanted a shampoo with my haircut. I said yes, as I assumed they go together like all of the other salons I have ever been to.I arrived and was warmly greeted by the front desk staff, but then sat for nearly 20 minutes after my scheduled appointment time. Finally, I was brought to the shampoo area and after the stylist washed my hair (all of 5 minutes, at most) I was sent back to the waiting area to wait another 15 minutes with wet hair.Finally, an assistant came to bring me back to dry my hair,  prior to the stylistic cutting my hair. Had I known this was the procedure I would have opted out of the shampoo. But at all of the dozens and dozens of salons I have been to across the country, my hair has always been washed, cut, then dried at one listed price. After nearly 2 hours into the event, I explained to the stylistic that I needed to go and would finsh styling on my own. She walked me up front, and told the front desk staff to take $10 off since I had to leave prior to her styling my hair. I thought that was considerate until I was told my total was $95!!! For a simple trim! I questioned where that price came from as I had seen a haircut was $25 on their website. I was informed that because the owner had cut my hair it was actually $45 for the haircut. I could have dealt with that, but it would have nice to have been informed when making the appointment.So where did the other $50 come in, I questioned. Apparently, they charge $60 to wash and dry your hair!! I was dumbfounded as I had never paid separately, and I have fine, thin hair that is not diffucult to work with. Even a blowout at Blow by Blow in the Gold Coast is only $35 so I do not understand how they can justify their prices for the location and space they are in.While I wish the owner and salon the best of luck, I felt the need to inform people of my experience. A little communication when booked,  regarding that I was with the owner so the price would be increased, that they charge separately to wash your hair, and that they might not actually be able to get me in at that time or even that day would have gone a long way.

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: African-American Hair, Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Perms, Extensions, Straight Perms, Coloring, Kids' Hair

1.description: We bought a few things of ice cream for $10.22.  I gave the person a $20 and she gave me change.  When I got back to our car, I noticed she gave me $8.78 back when it should have been $9.78.  So she short changed me a $1.  It could have been an honest mistake or it could be the employees are skimming money.  Either way we won't eat there again.

0.description: In front of the Shedd Aquarium there is a Food stand, named Museum Campus Cafe, serves Hot dogs, Burgers, Pizzas, Snacks and Ice creams.It was nice refreshing breezing sunny early summer day, great season to eat outside.  I ordered My first Chicago style Hot dog  $3.95.They served me in less than 1 minute. Wow... Chicago hot dog is super fast food.My first Chicago style Hot dog came with Chips.Onions, Tomatoes, Sport peppers and huge pickle on top of the beef frankfurter and poppy seeds are sprinkled on top of the buns.Looks bit Ugly and not delicious thought, It was....mmm really yummy more than my anticipation. May be better than tiny cheap New yorker vendor's one.  But, watch out, it's really  "HOT" dog!!

12.description: This is my first review, which you can see how much the service has impacted me. I needed a haircut desperately and researched the whole Chicago for hairstylist good with Asian hair. Took the risk asked for Robert to cut my long hair to a bob. He is very reassuring, making sure he knew what I want and giving his own professional opinion as well. The cut turns out to be really refreshing, everyone who saw me complimented on the new look. Will be returning for more cuts.

7.description: Sandy did an awesome job !  She is very sweet and patient.  She understood what I wanted and gave me the perfect cut !! Great reception, warm staff, awesome location and 2 hr free off street parking. I dint even check the rates before going as Yelp reviews were so great. I think 75 $ is very reasonable.

19.description: Patrick has been doing my hair for several years. I love his new place at the Styling Studio. He is laughing and enjoying his job again - great thing to see! I know he will be successful - with his positive attitude and superior skill - you can't go wrong.

1.description: I've been going to Deborah Anthony since I moved to the city in 2010. I followed her to Styling Studio a few years ago and couldn't be happier. I used to live in the South Loop, but I now live in the Ukrainian Village, and that doesn't stop me from my appointment every two weeks! Deb just did my nails for my wedding and the amount of compliments I received was unbelievable. She is professional, extremely clean and creative. She is not only my nail tech, but has become a friend over the years. Give her a try. I promise you, you will not regret it.

2.description: I never been to Styling Studio however , I know Deborah and her work I been with her as a  professional nail tech for over 10 yrs plus mainly because I  am not able to travel.She readily comes to my home and does the most beautiful and professional job ever. She timely , courteous, and professional. Deborah is always ready to get the nail job done for me and since she knows my circumstances she is accommodating.I recommend her to anyone and everyone with the knowledge she will do a beautiful and safe as well as professional job no questions asked.

9.description: I had a great experience with Robert.  I found my hair stylist!  How could I not have not  known about this place when I've lived in the South Loop for 7 years.  It's amazing what a little research can do.Robert has given me the best haircut and haircolor I've ever had in Chicago!  So so happy!  And he was very nice too.  I'm Asian and he totally gets my hair.  I love my sexy hair!  Thank you Robert!

6.description: Five stars for Michele Lynn, my hairstylist at the Styling Studio. I've been seeing ML for three years. She was my first hairstylist when I moved downtown. At that time, I was suffering from a truly heinous haircut, and I needed help -- fast. She was featured in Chicago Magazine as one of the best stylists in the city so I figured I would see if she could rectify the problem. I filled out the online reservation form, and I was in her studio within a day. I wholeheartedly put my trust in her, and she worked her magic. For three years, she's been giving me great haircuts. I've never had more compliments on my hair in my life. My hair has shortened over my time with ML... I started with long hair, and now I have a pixie; she does it all, and she does it well. Not to mention that she's one of the nicest women I've ever met. I will continue to go to ML as long as I live in the city/she cuts hair. She only recently moved into the Styling Studio. The place itself could use a makeover, but everyone is friendly and helpful.

18.description: I had a hair disaster, contacted Patrick (patrickedaniels.com/inde… ), and now my hair is lovely (if I do say so myself).  Patrick took the time before/during my appointment to find out what had been done to my hair, and explaining what he could do and what I should expect.  During my appointment (3 1/2 hrs) Patrick and his assistant Dory were focused on me and my hair, no one else.  I had a marvelous experience and am indebted to Patrick for color correcting my hair, it looks fantastic!

10.description: I had a great experience at Styling Studio. Alana was my stylist. She was very sweet and I was very! very! happy she was able to bring my hair back to life! My hair is  a challenge to work with some times. I have wavy hair in some areas, curly in others, and strait in the rest. She went through a step by step list of what she was going to do before hand, which I thought was very respectful. It mad me feel comfortable & relaxed. I loved that the overall experience didn't feel rushed, which in the past for some reason I always felt like my hair appointments were always being rushed, which leaves you feeling unimportant. It was a pleasant experience & am looking forward to future hair appointments with Alana. I am very happy I was able to find someone in my area... Finally!:)-Also the hair cut she gave me lays and  flows just beautifully!!Love it!!!

13.description: I have to agree with Cate M. I have been going to Patrick for I think going on 2.5 years, and I can't tell you how much I love him.  He is the first stylist that I can say I truly LOVE. He is also the first stylist that I trust enough to put color in my hair.  I even dragged my mom from North Carolina there when she was in town. I am so glad he is at the Styling Studio. It is so fun and relaxed there. I am glad he found his new playground at such a great place. I will continue to recommend to everyone who asks where to go. I can't wait to go back and see him again! (stolen from Cate M.) Patrick is in on Wednesday, Thursday, & Friday from 11am-7pm and on Saturday from 10am-6pm. He will be setting up his own appointments, so please call him at 312-550-2803. His website is patrickedaniels.com and you can learn what's new with him there.

16.description: Well, couldn't say a word after the hair cut.I'll never go there again.

17.description: I purchased an eyebrow wax via Lifebooker, and wasn't sure what to expect, other than the fact that Styling Studio had great reviews.  The end result was beautifully sculpted brows, and an atmosphere that feels like you're in another world (in a good way).The salon is located in the South Loop, and I was able to find street parking without much of an issue.  I walked up to the front door, and it was locked, even though it was busy inside.  A guy came to let me in, who I assume was the owner.  I didn't have my Lifebooker gift cert with me but did have it on my phone, and was worried that they may not accept it.  The owner said it wasn't a problem and had me email him a copy of the gift cert. I sat down on the couch to wait, and noticed that there were chocolate shot glasses, vodka, and Bailey's sitting on the table.  I was later told that it is always there.  My kind of place :-D  The inside of the studio is hard to describe.  There are chandeliers, giant light bulb lanterns hanging from the ceiling, a lot of different colors, cool furniture, and - maybe the most different feature of all - instead of mirrors in front of each hair cut station, they have video cameras, and a monitor where you can see yourself.  Very different/ cool!On to the waxing, my esthetician, Rose, had me lay down on a comfy bed with new paper over it (slightly doctor's office-ish, but I appreciate the sanitation).  Rose asked me if I wanted my brows shaped or cleaned up.  She definitely took her time, and was very nice/ professional.  I was quite pleased with the outcome - my brows may never have looked so perfect before.The normal price for an eyebrow wax is $20, which is pretty standard for downtown Chicago prices, but this location is a bit out of downtown.  I would expect it to be a little less considering the location, and since I can get my eyebrows threaded for $7 up north (although the atmosphere is nowhere near as cool, and it's a lot more rushed).I would be interested in going back to try some of their other services.

15.description: Robert is the man.  I have naturally curly, difficult hair, and he has given me amazing cuts, each time.  Hands-down my best haircut experience in the city and though it isn't cheap, it is totally worth the price.

0.description: So, I have been getting my nails done by Deborah Anthony for years.  The five star rating is for Deborah, as I have never used any of the other services or personnel at the Styling Studio.  As a client, I followed Deborah from a spa where she was previously employed.  She does excellent work and is very serious about cleanliness and health standards.  You won't find Illegal toxic glues here - no face masks and gloves while your nails are being done (and if you go to one of those places, you better run or get your own face mask to wear).  You know the products being used on you by Deborah are safe. Parking is usually readily available on the street near the salon, but there are some metered side streets a block away for days where the south loop is hopping.  While I'm a Shellac no-chip gal, Deborah also has a great selection of colors in good, quality conventional polish brands. I have been resisting writing a review because I do not want Deborah's book to get so full that I cannot get my own nails done.  However, it isn't really fair to keep her to myself.  This probably is not a place you have walked past, but it is a place you need to go to if you want your nails done right!!

5.description: I wanted to update because I had Patrick do my makeup and hair for my wedding in September.I've only had my makeup done a few times professionally before, and I must say, despite the 20+ years of experience the stylist had, and the 10 or so years I knew him, Patrick did a much better job. Patrick's only been doing my hair for 2 years, but each and every time he knows exactly what's "me." It works the same way for makeup. We did my trial back in July, and while I thought it was amazing and that I looked better than I ever had before, my husband thought I didn't look like myself. I was bummed. I mentioned this to Patrick and he decided that he had to change it. He toned it down and I looked awesome. I was seriously impressed. If there's ever another reason I need to be made up like that, I'll call Patrick. My hair was equally amazing, and Patrick was so meticulous and made sure it was absolutely perfect. I have to give HUGE props to him for perfectly securing my hat & veil.Edit: I can't believe I forgot to say this. My dad has always been a very critical person. Critical of me ("If you would just lose 20lbs, you'd look so much better") especially. Needless to say, when he saw how Patrick had done my hair and makeup, my jaw hit the floor as he called me "gorgeous." I was in serious shock.  Initially, Patrick took a few photos after my trial, which he sent me and I posted to facebook. I also sent them to my mom and my aunts, and my cousin decided to share them with my dad. He liked them so much that he insisted I give him copies of the photos, and has been on my case to get originals from Patrick (which I keep forgetting to ask for). If that doesn't convince you how amazing Patrick is, I don't know what will.

11.description: It was only serendipity that brought me to Patrick's chair at a salon other than this one. I had cancellations in my schedule so I decided on the spur of the moment to get my hair cut. Patrick, normally booked pretty solid, also had cancellations because of the snow, and so I met the best stylist my hair has even know.  I'm a Pilates instructor so I need hair that doesn't require a lot of effort. I went in and showed him a picture that I liked, and told him that the cut needed to look good even when I didn't style it because on most days I don't. Ever since, I have never had a bad hair day. He's always been there for me to prevent bad hair decisions. I once came in and wanted to 'cut it all off" in response to a breakup. He told me no, and said that the next time I came in if I still wanted a short cut, he would happily oblige. In this world of shady people who will tell you anything to get your money, it's good to have someone I can trust.

8.description: Alana is the greatest stylest I've ever had. I have natural hair and she gives me a great blowout and has my hair looking luxurious every time.  She has a strong knowledge of overall hair care, and uses the best products out there.The styling studio is a great place.  It's relaxing and inviting and a very professional atmosphere.  I suggest Alana to everyone regardless of hair texture who wants to look their absolute best.

3.description: Deborah Anthony is a professional, meticulous, and fantastic nail technician. I've been coming to her regularly for approximately 7 years, and I never leave disappointed. She stays current with whatever the trends are in nails and does a wonderful job while making sure the client's health and well-being come first. She doesn't use products with harsh chemicals nor does she prefer drilling or stripping your nails. She uses shellac products which last the longest out of all the "no chip" styles but don't ruin your nails. She uses Vinylux products for pedicures which also last the longest on your toes. I will keep coming back to Styling Studio despite moving to the suburbs because Deborah Anthony is the best at what she does.

14.description: I saw Rob the owner for my first cut at this salon - could not have been more happy with my hair. He did a fabulous job and the staff I met there were very friendly and professional.

4.description: Nail tech Connie is very precise, very patient and very thorough. If you're the kind of person that'd rather just do things yourself than to let other people do it because you're an extreme perfectionist... Connie is your other self as it pertains to your nails. I've been getting my nails done for about 13 years and Connie is the best I've ever had. She's just so careful and precise and does't miss anything! She has a very delicate touch too for those with sensitive fingers. Also, if you like designed/fantasy nails she has a whole book of things she does. I don't know if she takes walk ins but I made an appointment and was taken right away. The whole Connie Experience took two hours, I wasn't expecting that but I also didn't expect her to be so perfect lol.

0.description: I only had a manicure & pedicure here so that is what I'm rating.  First, I'll talk about the good.  The salon is really cute and everyone there is super friendly.  Chris greeted me as I walked into the salon and there was a few minutes wait without an appointment.  Chris was very interactive, very detail oriented making sure the shape was just right with my nails and he made sure I didn't have a single smudge on my toes.  He also gives the best hand and foot massages I've had EVER!  Overall it was a pampering experience.  However, Chris was on the phone while he was doing my pedicure which I think is poor customer service.  Also, the polish on my toes wore off on the edges within 24 hours.  The last thing to mention is make sure you wear your flip flops because they don't have the foot slippers most nail salons have and you have to put your own sandals on when they paint your toes.  This isn't that big of a deal because they aren't just a nail salon, but it would have been nice to know.

58.description: I would definitely eat here again. It was difficult to decide what to try, because everything sounded so good. Between the bf and I, we managed to try two types of Stromboli and two starters (the polenta fries and the stuffed mushrooms). The mushrooms were solid and the polenta fries were amazing. It is admittedly kind of hard to go wrong with polenta, since it is delicious, but these were a nice twist. They had a perfectly crispy exterior with a wonderfully creamy interior. Of the two Stromboli, (Italian beef, Sausage) the Italian beef was the clear favorite. The sausage was good, but not quite the star that the beef was. Also, I personally think the Stromboli would have been plenty large enough to share (and they already come nicely divided into two pieces), but we did not take that route, which unfortunately left us with absolutely no room to try any of their desserts.In short, I would definitely recommend this place, and would say you can't miss the Italian beef or polenta fries.

56.description: If you live or work nearby, come for the polenta fries. They were great, and the truffle honey oil adds a great flavor and nicely complements the fries. The stromboli was a bit of a disappointment - the bread was so hard it bordered on stale and was completely flavorless. The meat didn't have a lot of flavor either. Honestly, the only thing that made it worth eating was the super flavorful tomato sauce (although there wasn't enough of it) that they provide for dipping.The much-reviewed cupcake tasted like yellow cake mix to me, and not even freshly made yellow cake from a mix. Overall, I would split a bottle of wine (they're BYOB) and eat the fries, but probably not do dinner again.

29.description: The PamBurger is the house special...ya gotta try it. Juicy burger with large wedge fries. The owner's mom waited on me and was a nice Italian lady from Ohio. Tell em' Dr Jake sent you.

42.description: This is a wonderful restaurant with friendly staff and a delicious menu that is a new spin on traditional Italian food. The pepperoni sticks are a great appetizer. I was delighted to find all the food here was very crisp and clean and not at all greasy as I have found at many other Italian restaurants.

23.description: A hidden gem in South Loop. The restaurant is very cozy and their people are very friendly. I tried the Italian Beef Sandwich, which I realized was prepared from scratch and took around 5 minutes. The bread was hot and fresh, the beef was very tender and juicy, and the grilled banana peppers were otherworldly. Potatoes were also amazing and were fresh. I must also say the portions run rather large. And all this came at a nominal price of $10. I didn't have time to try their strombolis, which take a little longer than the sandwich, since they are prepared and baked fresh. Therefore I am certainly going back!How did I manage to miss this place all this time?!

47.description: Delicious delicious delicious! We met some friends here after a busy day at Shedds aquarium. Based on previous yelp reviews I was not surprised when the food was as fantastic as people had said. I got the chicken parm and it was superb! The homemade pasta was perfectly cooked and the chicken bites were muy bien. My only complaint was that I wish there would've been more sauce. My friends got the parm burger, and they raved about it. I will definitely eat here again when I'm in the area!

8.description: This restaurant is one of the staples of the south loop, in my opinion. The parm sandwich, sandwich not burger, is my favorite item on their menu. Definitely worth a try. If you live in the south loop, it may just become your go to for carryout.

31.description: Me and my wife stumbled in here by accident. The food reviews looked great so we have it a shot. The food was amazing. Super flavorful home cooked Italian. The stuffed banana peppers where insane. Aside from the food, the place is really casual and comfortable and the service was great. The owner took time to chat with us and was so friendly. The passion for the food is obvious Id recommend this place to anyone and everyone. The other Best part was its BWOB so we bought a bottle of wine at the grocer next door and enjoyed it with our food w no corkage fee!!!

34.description: Ameritalia was the perfect spot for a late afternoon lunch! The owners were extremely friendly and personable and offered excellent recommendations. We tried the Italian beef sandwich and the chicken PLT and both were quality-made and fresh-tasting. Everything on the menu sounded amazing and I can't wait to go back and try it all! I definitely recommend this place if you're in the neighborhood.

16.description: We walked in right as they opened and were greeted by a cheerful woman. All of our food was delicious! We ordered the popo 's salad (salad with cucumber, red onion, and tomatoes in an oregano dressing)  it was fresh!  We also ordered the white bean dip: one word... BOMMIN!! It was seasoned well and had a bunch of flavor. The last dish we ordered was the delux calzone.  The crust was super tasty and went perfectly with the side sauce.   The woman even came up and asked how our food was-  that to me was the winner. Great customer service and awesome food.  This is the perfect spot to get a bite to eat before a night on the town.  I will definitely come back here the next time I'm in Chicago.

13.description: Came here with some friends and some alcohol because it's byob and we had a great time. The food was delicious, and not too expensive, and the hostess, Anna, was so nice and extremely helpful.

11.description: The food is fantastic - and their menu has a great mix of 'American' food and Italian classic.
