The order was ready super fast and price was good.For an order out / delivery place they also make sure the inside is quite nice and welcoming for eating in.As a plus, the staff is incredibly friendly and looking to really foster community and be a part of the neighborhood.

39.description: Seemed like a family owned place which is great, and everyone was super friendly. Walked over to get a sub for dinner, but I was a little let down by the meal as I had high expectations based on the reviews. These are simple subs, nothing particularly memorable here, but happy to support a local business.

37.description: My favorite restaurant in South Loop, hands down. I've been over a dozen times and I've only ever gotten the Ameritalia sandwich. It's sooo good. My boyfriend got the spaghetti once but tried my sandwich and gets his own ever since.

0.description: Vegetarian Review:Arrived hungry on a not-so-busy Tuesday evening.  Service was fantastic. Very helpful with picking out vegetarian options and super friendly. Food: 5 starsPolenta fries are served piping hot! The honey and truffle is amazing.  I wish I had more (probably good that I didn't). Quinoa pepper was tasty. Fresh tasting ingredients. Wish the plating sauce was warmer, but still a great, healthy dish. Garlic grilled cheese and tomato soup...YUM!  This is one of those hot meals that hits the spot. Cheesy, crunchy goodness in the sandwich, and tart and creamy tomato love in the soup. Washed it all down with a Joe's peach tea. Wow!I already know what I'm ordering next time. Give this place a chance on a cold winter day!

38.description: Excellent establishment in the SLoop, and very accommodating.  For the Chicago Marathon last year, they allowed us to host a group of ppl at their place, and equally important allowed us to offer a customized menu for the group.  Two weeks before the marathon, I contacted them to reserve a table for 10, and to also see if they could make some items that were not on the menu, such as a pasta with Bolognese sauce.  They offered our group a delicious salad, three types of pasta, and cupcakes for dessert; everything was served family style.  It's a great place for a meal, and also for catering an event.  Cheers!

51.description: Food was ok....I was expecting a little more with restaurant being rated at 4.5....I have better in little Italy.

27.description: Ameritalia is not a fancy place, for sure (fast casual cafeteria might describe the ambiance), but we sure enjoyed the food on a recent visit! The menu is compact, the décor is spare and the music had nothing to do with Italy. The staff was cordial and helpful. And it's BYOB.We shared an Ameritalia salad; it was simple, generous and delicious. Ditto a sausage Stromboli and a Di Parma grilled cheese sandwich. Roasted potatoes were oddly dry & fluffy, as though they were made from russet potatoes (rather than, say, Yukon golds). The star of the show was a big bowl of wedding soup with tender little chicken meatballs -- so delicious!This is not a romantic date spot, but the food is good, and for my money it's the best value in the South Loop (which is a pretty dismal dining destination overall). Ameritalia is great spot for a bite to eat prior to a performance at the Dance Center of Columbia College just across the street. I'll be back...

32.description: Great Italian sandwiches, soups and calzones.  The Chicken PLT with JOJO fries is the best.

54.description: We walked in right as they opened and were greeted by a cheerful woman. All of our food was delicious! We ordered the popo 's salad (salad with cucumber, red onion, and tomatoes in an oregano dressing)  it was fresh!  We also ordered the white bean dip: one word... BOMMIN!! It was seasoned well and had a bunch of flavor. The last dish we ordered was the delux calzone.  The crust was super tasty and went perfectly with the side sauce.   The woman even came up and asked how our food was-  that to me was the winner. Great customer service and awesome food.  This is the perfect spot to get a bite to eat before a night on the town.  I will definitely come back here the next time I'm in Chicago.

48.description: Parm burger was absolutely awesome!!! The orange chicken nuggets tasted good and the pep sticks were super filling. The owner was very friendly and sociable and spent time talking to us when the restaurant was empty and made us feel welcomed. Everyone needs to stop by to try the Parm Burger at least once!

44.description: 3.5 really. Came in and got the Chicken PLT without the crispy pepperoni. The sandwich came out a few minutes later and was pretty good. The chicken breast was nice and moist, the bun was toasty and came with some lettuce and tomato. The real star here was the sauce. And lots of it, without this slightly peppery aioli, its a just a simple sandwich. What came along with it were some decent potato wedges with some crispy polenta scattered on top. Really, the polenta adds nothing to the dish, except for the fact that it dries your mouth out faster than a bowl of weed. For 10 bucks I'd rather go get some chipotle and save a couple of bucks. But if you decide on coming here, its a decent enough place to spend your money.

24.description: Not only was the food great, the owners are great too. When I told the chef I was visiting- he kindly gave me lots of great recommendations to his favorite local spots.

7.description: Had lunch twice.  Meatball pepperoni Stromboli and the chicken bites.  It was very good.....the Stromboli was a little cold inside but probably just came to early.  Ton of chicken bites in order.  Other things look good

49.description: This place is amazing! They have authentic Italian food and great deserts. I was looking for desert one day so I stopped by because I seen on yelp they had cupcakes. I did the chocolate cupcake and my boyfriend had the brownie bites. They were both amazing. So we've been meaning to go back for food. So then we went by on a gloomy afternoons for lunch. I got the chicken Parmesan and he got the spaghetti and meatballs. For a appetizer we got stuffed peppers because we were starving. The food was excelled and fresh. You can tell it was freshly made because of the food temperature it was piping hot. Now don't get me wrong this is not a fine dining up scale restaurant but the food quality is there. I recommend this place to anyone who likes Italian foods. The family that owns the place are very nice and the son is the chef. The pasta is fresh made pasta not that boxed stuff. The tomato sauce is not too salty and doesn't give you heart burn. The bread is freshly made as well. This place should be very popular also they have BYOB. I think they would attract more people if they served wine and cocktails however this place was amazing and I will be a returning customer :)

40.description: This was a great lunch stop for our family.  I had the Ameritalia Salad and loved it. Others in our party had salads, chicken parm sandwich, meatball sandwich, and spaghetti with meat balls. All were very tasty and the owner was attentive and clearly takes pride in what she does.  We stopped over as a break from the over-priced and underwhelming museum cafes. If you're visiting "museum campus" it's worth the walk to get a fresh, quality lunch.

53.description: Walked two miles based on Yelp reviews and thought it was okay.  Fresh food, friendly service.

30.description: Had lunch twice.  Meatball pepperoni Stromboli and the chicken bites.  It was very good.....the Stromboli was a little cold inside but probably just came to early.  Ton of chicken bites in order.  Other things look good

46.description: I wanted to be wowed, I wasn't.  I ordered the DeParma Grilled cheese Jo Jo potatoes, and a side ameritalia salad. I can't say that any of these choices were fabulous.  I did love the polenta fries with honey dipping sauce.  Get these.  Skip the gorgeous, but flavorless cupcakes.  Cake is dense and plain, icing is too thick and just, nah-skip it.I don't know that I would return, but the staff are great and it seems popular.

1.description: I live right around the corner, and during my Fat Tuesdays (which for me is everyday), I come here primarily for its convenience, but also for its consistency. I love the Parm Burger here, it might be one of my favorite burgers in Chicago! My dock for it being only 4 stars is that, of all the times I've been here, there is always only 2 people working: the Chef and the very nice lady in the front (both of whom I believe are both owners of the place). That wouldn't be an issue at all, if not for the fact that the wait can get long if there are more than 2 or parties trying to order. Having only one cashier and one cook, things can get backlogged and orders can end of taking a while.I've only had a few other items on there menu outside of the Parm Burger: the meatball & pepperoni side, orange chicken nuggets appetizer, and the Ameritalian. the Parm Burger was by far the best, and I'd almost be willing to give 5 stars just for that. The other 3 items were OK to good, but nothing amazing or memorable in my opinion.

55.description: I LOVED the parmburger. Two juicy patties with a good balance of flavor from the tomato and basil. I also tried the pulled chicken rigatoni, which was not as flavorful as the parmburger, but still delicious. I was surprised at how empty it was on a Saturday evening, given the great ratings. I think the neighborhood isn't the most lively, but the food is definitely worth stopping in for if you're in the area. Next time, I'm going after the desserts!

9.description: Good spot for dinner.  It's a very casual Italian place.  The owner is very friendly, and helpful.  Prices are what you'd expect for the S. Loop area.  Atmosphere is fun.  Went on a Sunday night with a friend and they had the football game on and everyone in the place was talking and having a good time.  Food was good. Atmosphere was good. All around a good experience.   Will definitely return.

26.description: Great small Italian spot with creative classics (calzones, stromboli) on a small, but diverse, menu.  I'm guessing they stick to what they're good at, instead of offering something they haven't perfected yet.  Family service makes you feel right at home and makes you want to stay a while and definitely come back. You get freshly cooked quality italian at an affordable price.  The Chicken PLT is simply amazing.  The cavatelli with cheese is great too. BYOB if you want to kick off the night here. Great addition to the otherwise repetitive Chicago Italian food scene.

25.description: Ameritalia is a great place whether you are looking to get something affordable to go, or whether you want to sit down and enjoy a great dinner. They have a great variety of things, all of which have been spectacular. Ranging from the Parm buger to the different Strombolis to the Cavatelli and Cheese, everything has been good. My go-to for an entree is normally the Deluxe Stromboli. Another must have are the polenta fries with a great honey-like dipping sauce. The portions are quite generous and normally I have enough left over to eat for left-overs the following day.The food is always out quickly, and the staff is welcoming. It also is BYOB which is great if you aren't wanting to spend a lot of money on drinks at a restaurant.

12.description: A great find in the Near South Loop.    Located at 13th and Michigan, this little place seems to be family run.   You order at the counter and then sit at any of the comfortable tables and wait for them to make your food and deliver to your table.It's BYOB, we had the Beet salad with Chicken and the Cavatelli with Cheese.  Both were Excellent.    The pasta dish was made with perfectly al dente cavatelli and the sauce was perfect, not too heavy, not too salty, not too runny.   One of the best pasta dishes I've had in a long time.     The Beet salad was made with very fresh vegetables, and the chicken was nicely grilled and warm.I would stop here anytime for lunch or dinner.    They run specials often so you can maximize your bang for your buck.

59.description: The meatballs and marinara in my calzone made me nostalgic for the sauce and meatballs my grandma and mom used to make. That's a very powerful feeling when food can take you back to childhood memories. There are many other things I want to try and I will definitely be back.

21.description: Hidden gem in the South Loop!  It's certainly casual, but the food is delicious and a good value, and it's BYOB.  We loved the stromboli, cavatelli with cheese, and di parma grilled cheese.  Four stars because the atmosphere leaves a bit to be desired, but this place is definitely worth a visit.

17.description: I really can't find any complaint. I was a little worried since I don't eat pork, but I had no problem choosing menu items. I came in with 4 kids. The cavatelli and cheese (without prosciutto) was perfect for the kids. It's like a mac-n-cheese. Kids also got the orange chicken nuggets, but they didn't like the sauce. And my older daughter made her own calzone with chicken because there wasn't one with chicken. My husband and I have big appetites and shared (well he ate most) the parmburger, Italian beef stromboli, and an ameritalia salad. Everything was great. It was a little pricey, but it's important to support local businesses, plus it's walking distance, which is great.

10.description: The Ameritalia was delicious! The bread was perfectly baked, soft on the inside and crunchy on the outside. The dressing is made in house and adds just the right of flavoring to the sandwich. Perfect for lunch!

5.description: The food here was great! We ordered food for delivery and everything we ordered was great. We ordered the loaded jojos as an appetizer and they were delicious. The tomato sauce was delicious. We ordered the deluxe calzone and the sausage stromboli and both were delicious. We definitely plan on going again!

3.description: A cool little spot in an area I would not expect.I came in expecting a typical sit down restaurant but it is not that, you order at the counter and then they bring your food to your table.They have a good range of classic Italian choices.I got the meatball sandwich since that is my go to and it was not bad.I have had many meatball subs and this one was good but I have also had better for less money.Would recommend this spot if you're looking for a tasty bite to eat in the area.

35.description: The meatballs and tomato sauce are sooo delicious!  I order a side to go and have them with zoodles (zucchini noodles) at home for a low carb dinner!  I highly recommend Ameritalia for homemade Italian at a very reasonable price. It is a real treat to have them in the South Loop.

19.description: I probably have to have a kid now just so I can name it Stromboli. So delicious. Everyone was friendly and talkative, food was fresh and hot, restaurant was clean, and did I mention the Stromboli?? Or the pepperoni sticks?This is my new go-to for delicious and authentic Italian fare because you can taste the care that goes into the food they prepare. I can't wait to get back there and sample more of the menu (hello, tiramisu cupcake...come over here for a minute).

28.description: So good! Their salad was very delicious with fresh ingredients and their sausage stromboli was awesome.

45.description: My Italian friend from Jersey wanted to find some Italian beef.  I looked this place up on Yelp.  He went next door to score a bottle of Chianti.  We spent the time chatting with the mother of the owner who's family was from a place in Italy near my friends origins.  The beef was wonderful and the whole experience was memorable.

33.description: A great find in the Near South Loop.    Located at 13th and Michigan, this little place seems to be family run.   You order at the counter and then sit at any of the comfortable tables and wait for them to make your food and deliver to your table.It's BYOB, we had the Beet salad with Chicken and the Cavatelli with Cheese.  Both were Excellent.    The pasta dish was made with perfectly al dente cavatelli and the sauce was perfect, not too heavy, not too salty, not too runny.   One of the best pasta dishes I've had in a long time.     The Beet salad was made with very fresh vegetables, and the chicken was nicely grilled and warm.I would stop here anytime for lunch or dinner.    They run specials often so you can maximize your bang for your buck.

43.description: This place is Incredible!!!! Top to bottom awesome. We had the cavatelli, parm burger and an awesome salad. Come eat here. You will not be disappointed!!!

2.description: I really wanted to love Ameritalia because we need more good restaurants in the Sloop but I just wasn't "wowed". When we arrived on a beautiful Saturday afternoon around 1:30, the place was empty. We walked up to the front counter and a nice woman came out from the back. The cook/chef also came walking from out back. It just was not a very "welcoming" experience. The food was good; not great. I opted for the grilled cheese and "jojo" potatoes. The bread for the grilled cheese was a bit too thick but it had a decent taste. The jojo potatoes looked good but didn't have much taste and were too mealy. My partner choose the meatball sandwich. It had tons of toppings that hid the taste and made it hard to eat. He didn't like the fries at all.Perhaps it was what we ordered. We'll be back because the food was okay and I want to see South Loop businesses thrive but the whole experience and food left me underwhelmed.

18.description: Ameritalia is not a fancy place, for sure (fast casual cafeteria might describe the ambiance), but we sure enjoyed the food on a recent visit! The menu is compact, the décor is spare and the music had nothing to do with Italy. The staff was cordial and helpful. And it's BYOB.We shared an Ameritalia salad; it was simple, generous and delicious. Ditto a sausage Stromboli and a Di Parma grilled cheese sandwich. Roasted potatoes were oddly dry & fluffy, as though they were made from russet potatoes (rather than, say, Yukon golds). The star of the show was a big bowl of wedding soup with tender little chicken meatballs -- so delicious!This is not a romantic date spot, but the food is good, and for my money it's the best value in the South Loop (which is a pretty dismal dining destination overall). Ameritalia is great spot for a bite to eat prior to a performance at the Dance Center of Columbia College just across the street. I'll be back...

41.description: This restaurant replaced the small Italian grocery where I had my first porchetta sandwich. Sadly that's not on the menu of the new one, so I settled for Italian beef. It was ok. Portion size was huge, but I had only 2 pieces of peppers in my sandwich and the beef was dry. The bun was nice & crusty though. It's counter service so you order/pay food and server will bring your food out. They must not have many people working in the kitchen because our food took a long time. On the other hand, I suppose that means it's cooked fresh to order. Decent if you're in the vicinity and too hungry to walk more than a few blocks.

52.description: Pepperoni sticks dough was sooooo good but wish this item had cheese!Veggie calzone was great but wished it had more sauce.Sausage stromboli was awesome!

50.description: I went here with my boyfriend yesterday and the food was literally amazing! We got the parmburger and one of the calzones and they were incredibly tasty. The staff was also so nice and welcoming! Definitely recommend!!

4.description: Hidden gem in the South Loop!  It's certainly casual, but the food is delicious and a good value, and it's BYOB.  We loved the stromboli, cavatelli with cheese, and di parma grilled cheese.  Four stars because the atmosphere leaves a bit to be desired, but this place is definitely worth a visit.

6.description: I just brought in a large group here for our staff Christmas party. What an AMAZING experience!! First of all, chef Brad is the best. He was just so flexible and attentive to the needs of our group for the event. He gave me suggestions for catering, let me know when I had ordered too much food, was flexible in the amount of time we took up the restaurant, I couldn't ask for more. And that was all just before I'd even met him or stepped foot in the restaurant!Brad's lovely mother Anna was our server for the night. What an angel!! She helped me set up tables and did a wonderful job tending to the needs of our rambunctious group. Her hard work definitely showed and we are so appreciative!Now for the food itself: SO GOOD. And also quite economical! I personally tried the polenta fries, meatball calzone and the cavatelli with cheese. Mind you, I just tried a little of each because the plates are so filling!! But everything I tried is worth getting again the next time I visit! Our group tried everything from the Stromboli to the pasta and the burger and sandwich. Everyone loved it. They also have very cute, but large, cupcakes to top off the meal!Thank you so much to Brad and the team. You made our holiday party unforgettable, and you'd better believe we will be back (though maybe in smaller numbers!):)

22.description: Tasty beet salad and parm burger. The polenta fries were good too, little bit crumbly but nice change of pace. The spot was small and quiet on a Sunday afternoon. The menu is a nice mix of contemporary Italian American food on the lighter side.

15.description: Really great food! We split two dishes - the grilled cheese (minus the prosciutto on my portion due to a dietary restriction) and the pasta with a sharp white cheddar sauce. Our server (whose name I'm embarrassed to be forgetting - I'm guessing she owns the restaurant) was very friendly! The Joe's lemonade was really good, too.

57.description: This place is amazing! I live right down the street and just now got around to visiting. The lady that helped us was very friendly. We both had the Deluxe Stromboli. We wanted the regular,  although we came in after the lunch rush and they had run out. HIGHLY recommended this place!

20.description: Cavatelli and cheese is delicious. We liked the chicken nuggets and the polenta fries as well. My 5 year old son keeps asking to come back. Great service.

36.description: AMAZING. The service was phenomenal and the food was just as great. I'm vegan and nothing there was vegan, but they worked with me until just deciding to create something for me! He even made an amazing sauce for a veggie calzone that he also invented for me. And my sister and her husband enjoyed their jojos and Stromboli! If you're in the area and you want a really casual, inexpensive, real family feel, then Ameritalia is your place!

14.description: 3.5 really. Came in and got the Chicken PLT without the crispy pepperoni. The sandwich came out a few minutes later and was pretty good. The chicken breast was nice and moist, the bun was toasty and came with some lettuce and tomato. The real star here was the sauce. And lots of it, without this slightly peppery aioli, its a just a simple sandwich. What came along with it were some decent potato wedges with some crispy polenta scattered on top. Really, the polenta adds nothing to the dish, except for the fact that it dries your mouth out faster than a bowl of weed. For 10 bucks I'd rather go get some chipotle and save a couple of bucks. But if you decide on coming here, its a decent enough place to spend your money.

58.description: Great place for Italian food. plus side not only do you get bread at the table, but also marinara sauce that one else does. Service was great as well. I ordered the Veal Parmigiana which was very good. My niece ordered pizza which was good as well. Can't wait to go back and try something different.

56.description: I've always wanted to try Cafe Bionda since it was close to where we live and seemed to have pretty decent reviews on yelp. We finally got the chance to try them out two weeks ago to celebrate our parents anniversary. Our reservation was for 6:30pm on a Saturday and we had been a little worried that parking might be a problem. But, we got lucky and found a spot in the parking lot out back. Others from our group found parking on the street. It also looks like they have valet parking for those who do not want to search for a spot on their own.We walked in through the entrance from the back of the restaurant. We saw a couple of waiters who just glanced at us, but none attempted to direct us to where the hostess was. After looking around the crowded place for a bit, we finally figured out where the front desk was located. We had reservations, so we didn't have to wait long to get seated. The ambiance was lively and pretty upbeat with constant chatter....what you would expect at an Italian restaurant. It would be a bit noisy for intimate conversation, but our family was fine with it and the kids loved that they did not have to whisper through dinner. We had the zucchini/calamari combo as well as the steamed mussels for appetizers. All of us loved the fried combo...crunchy, light and seasoned just right. We would have ordered another one if we weren't afraid that we wouldn't finish our entrees later on! The mussels were only ok though. The meat was not tender and didn't taste all that fresh. The wine sauce that it came with was just ok. A bit on the salty side. Definitely could not compare to the mussels from Cafe Iberico.After a wait (they were pretty busy that evening), our food finally came out. My Gnocchi Romano was delicious! The gnocchi was soft with just the right amount of chew and the sauce was not overly thick and seasoned very well. I could have done without the peas, but the mushrooms were really good and the  spicy sausage gave the dish a kick. My kids shared a spaghetti and meatball dish which they both said was yummy. My youngest normally isn't the biggest fan of marinara sauces, but he actually asked for a second helping! Others in the group also seemed to really enjoy the food. I had a bite of my mom's veal marsala and it was tasty and tender! The only gripe was that it may have come with a bit too much sauce. I also had a bite of the linguini with shrimp and broccoli and let me tell ya, the shrimps were pretty big! The linguini could have used a slightly bit more salt & pepper, but in all it was a nice light dish. My sister's chicken parmigiana and my bro-in-law's Linguine Vongole (baby clams) both got thumbs up. You should have seen the amount of baby clams in the Vongole dish. The chicken was also perfectly cooked and tender. The salads we ordered (the baby arugula and one other which I forgot) were pretty huge! four people can probably share one as a side. We had brought in our own cake, so ended up not trying any of their desserts. All in all, a great place for a decent Italian meal down near the south loop area. Plate sizes are decent, service was also decent tho I think it would've been nice to see more jovial/friendly wait staff. They all looked a bit on the sad side and some were a bit huffy. The owner/manager did come by our table to check and see how we were doing and said a few words to us which was nice. I would definitely go back and would recommend others to at least try the place. Not mind-blowing, but you'll not have to worry about not being full and prices are decent.

29.description: Yummy. First course Grey Goose Extra Dirty. Chilled to perfection. I would swear our waitress was straight out of the MGM backlot. All that " honey chile and sweetie" was right up my tight alley. The grilled calamari is Devine. Now the zipper de mare and the scallops...best in Chicago!!

42.description: I absolutely love this place! The food is delicious!! I tend to come more for lunch, rather than dinner..The grilled calamari is the best in the city, especially with the Sunday salad!!Surprisingly, they make one of the best Lemon drops in the city! Kinda expensive for the area (to me).... Overall, this place is solid and consistent!

23.description: Cafe Bionda has a nice busy makes you feel special atmosphere. We had wine at the bar until we were seated which was only about 20 minutes. Wine selection was good had a couple basic reds a chianti and the Ruffino. Both nice. Our waiter was very nice and friendly. Enjoyed the Bionda salad and mussels In white wine. The basket of bread and marinara were great. We had the Zuppa de Mare and the stuffed shells. The Zuppa de was great with lots of different sea food treats and linguine, plenty to take home. The shells were very gooey and cheesy, ricotta seemed processed not fresh, a little too rich for me but took them home for my family. Had the chocolate lava cake with salted Carmel gelato. It was very good but needed more gelato! Overall a nice dinner and atmosphere but not cheap! $150 for 2 plus tip,( 3 glasses with of wine). Still would go again for the atmosphere and would try something else and tell them go light on the cheese.

47.description: This was my 4th dinner restaurant stop as one of our colleagues was staying at the Hyatt connected to the McCormick.  This place was in relatively close walking distance so we gave it a shot!....I loved it!It was pretty packed for a Monday evening and the sound level wasn't too bad.  I loved the bread they first brought with the marinara dipping sauce.  I got a nice glass of Montepulciano with my meal - yum!  I had to get the baby clams with linguine as this is my go-to dish if I see it on the menu, and I wanted to compare it to others I've had.  YUM!  Baby clams were piled high and the pasta was cooked perfect al dente - love the garlic, mmm mmm!  I had a lot leftover so I took it back to my hotel, and had it for breakfast the next morning - unusual, I know, but I loved it!  And the garlic flavor is even better overnight!  Service was so friendly and attentive, and since we were visiting, the hostess gave us a list of her favorite Chicago spots to visit.  Sweet!  Grazie, Cafe Bionda, I will be back!

8.description: Food: 3.5 ordered a traditional spaghetti w meatballs, eh, had betterService: 4Cleanliness:4

31.description: This was my pick for a "Ladies Night Out" dinner and was given high reviews for this restaurant.  We had drinks at the bar.  They were very well made cocktails by a knowledgeable friendly bartender.Dinner started out great.   We began with fried calamari which was exceptional.  It was light, crispy, tender and not over cooked.  Then came the disappointment.Two of us ordered Veal Marsala.  We could taste the flour and there was no Marsala flavor to the dish. The other person ordered Chicken Francaise and she said there was only a slight lemon taste. These were BASIC Italian dishes.   I told the waiter at the end of the meal and he said we should have told him earlier.  I just have visions of what could happen if we had sent all three meals back to the kitchen.  But that's just me.I will probably give it another chance but as of now I am not impressed.

34.description: So, the broccoli salad used to have delicious red peppers...now they are using green peppers! No like!

16.description: Had nanas' gravy which was pot roast that taste like spaghettos' sauce was like it was out of a can was not happy at all after I read all the great reviews about this dish . It did have great service an nice setting for south loop

13.description: I will not be coming back. I thought the place was really over-priced. I ordered a vodka penne pasta and nothing else and my bill came out to $20 with tip. There was nothing special about the pasta. The portions weren't big or anything. I really felt like I got ripped off for what I paid. It tasted the same as if I were to make it at home; I just need to buy the pre-made sauce and boil some penne pasta. It would only cost me $4 dollars and I would have lunch and dinner prepared for the next few days.

11.description: I guess I can say my husband & I are regulars at this restaurant. Great food is a must for me when dining out BUT service & atmosphere make the experience that much better.  There are very few restaurants that have such a "homey" feel. The owner is there frequently and he never hesitates to talk to the customers. They make you feel like family. We have a favorite server, Guy, who knows how to treat customers. He makes our dining experience special EVERY TIME we're there (and sometimes that's every week)! I have tried SEVERAL dishes on the menu and have never been disappointed. My favorites are the baby arugula salad, grilled calamari, seafood fettuccine, lasagna..... you get the picture !!

39.description: A solid Italian restaurant in an easy-to-get-to South Loop location.  There's definitely an emphasis on their sausage.  Multiple entrees feature it. The whole boneless chicken is the best-selling menu item. Some unique offerings include a cold broccoli salad with black olives and fresh lemon. Calamari is offered three ways: grilled, fried or Calabrese. Limited al fresco dining. Definitely worth a try.

37.description: One of the worst dinning experiences in my life. Terrible service and the food was marginal at best. Spoke to manager they didn't offer to comp anything. Disappointing to pay good money for such crap. Won't be returning.

0.description: This has very quickly become ourGo to Italian place.Love the neighborhood vibe and that they always remember us. We always get the same things, baked clams/gnocchi/vodka rigatoni, but the Caesar salad is my new fav. The service was shotty at first but since the addition has improved. I know to ask for our fav waiter now!

38.description: The service was fine but the food was pretty meh to me. Maybe the non-Italian dishes or something fancier would have been better but, hey is it unreasonable for me to expect them to nail the basics? At the prices on their menu (no entree under $15 and very few under $20) I certainly expect a lot better than what I had. The stuffed shells ($19) doesn't even make sense. It is essentially a huge plate of cheese. Don't get me wrong, I LOVE cheese, but this was just crazy....Jumbo shells filled way too much with boring, barely seasoned ricotta, then covered in a vodka cream sauce (yay... more cheese...) and topped with a ridiculous amount of mozzarella (because cheese). There was absolutely no presentation of the food either. It was served on an oblong, roughed up off-white plate and just looked like an angry lunch lady ladled it on. It was sooooo monotonous and a huge chore to eat. I ate half just for something to do and the other half was wrapped up and the multiple attempts that have been made to eat it at home (because $$$) have been mostly unsuccessful. It wasn't a good dish served poorly, it was a bad dish. I always thought Gordon Ramsay was being crazy picky about stuff on his myriad shows but I get it now. Chefs sometimes have terrible ideas. This was one of them. My recommendation to Cafe Bionda on this dish... 1) spinach in the ricotta or at least some (more?) fresh herbs. 2) a very fresh, simple marinara would have made this a LOT better. vodka sauce is not the answer. 3) don't stuff the shells that much. do a google image search of stuffed shells. no one is stuffing them that much. and bland stuffing is the last thing anyone wants more of!(an afterthought... I also had the tiramisu... it was also very bland. I liked that it wasn't too sweet but it wasn't too flavorful in any direction and that was pretty disappointing.)

51.description: Great neighborhood drink spot.  The food is delicious, service is great and the drinks are spot on.

27.description: A lot of reviews that are totally off about this place. If you are looking for some great Italian food, this is the place to go. Great find. Prices might be a bit off but that is expected IMO with Italian food (ALL Italian food is overpriced). Never had bad service here. Ask for the server named Guy, he's great. The calamari is great, along with the sausages for apps. The salads are big and great to share. The Nanna's Gravy is my favorite pasta dish here, maybe in town. Love the pork roast on top and with the pasta is a great flavor and texture combo. I wanted more pasta! I really enjoy coming here and the expanded space looks beautiful. Parking lot in the back, lots of beer bottles to choose from. Will keep coming back!

32.description: I will not be coming back. I thought the place was really over-priced. I ordered a vodka penne pasta and nothing else and my bill came out to $20 with tip. There was nothing special about the pasta. The portions weren't big or anything. I really felt like I got ripped off for what I paid. It tasted the same as if I were to make it at home; I just need to buy the pre-made sauce and boil some penne pasta. It would only cost me $4 dollars and I would have lunch and dinner prepared for the next few days.

54.description: Nothing to really brag about. The place was okay and was convenient to where I lived. Husband and I were too lazy to cook after work on Friday and stopped by.  I had the NY steak drenched in red wine demi glazed and the some seafood pasta. The steak was engulfed in the glazed (not a fan). When I have a steak I want to taste the meat. The pasta had a strong seafood smell. The calamari with calabrese was tasty. Otherwise I might come back only if I was craving Italian and didn't want to go far. Our dinner bill was about $80 for the 3 items. The atmosphere was okay, nothing fancy.

48.description: I wish I could go here, the grilled calamari is ridiculous. Yum. Sadly we only made it through the appetizer of calamari. We were dinning on the patio, saw a rat family in the flower bed on the patio, screamed and headed inside. Front door was open which made us nervous with said rat family lurking a few feet away....and made us wonder if the back door was open in the kitchen as well? We were pretty uneasy and the host and manager were way too nonchalant. They acted like it was an inconvenience to move us inside. This was a few years ago and it still makes us uncomfortable!

44.description: We ate dinner to celebrate a graduation this evening. So looking forward but found the food average and the wine was overpriced. My husbands steak was very good, and the mussels were good, but the shrimp franchise had 5 shrimp, about 16 noodles and was watery. The price was $ 28.00. The veal was bland and the antipasto was small and again fair. The chicken parm. Was smothered in cheese, way to much. 5   people $300.00 before tip, so not worth it.  I would have given it one star but the steak was good. I would go to Olive Garden before this place....and I don't go to Olive Garden . Try Taylor street

24.description: Excellent every time. Hard to get me to order something other than the fantastic brick chicken. Sausage with rapini and beans is to die for. Can't wait to get back!

7.description: Yum yum yum! I ordered for take out tonight and the lady that answered the phone was courteous and clear on the phone. We ordered the Arugula salad, Caprese salad, Linguine Vongole and the Spaghetti with Sausage.Firstly, the portions are HUGE. You definitely get your money's worth. Each dish could easily be for two people. That's not always a great thing, sometimes when portions are huge, quality suffers - not at this place!Onto the food - the Caprese salad was fresh, with real basil leaves and big juicy tomato wedges. Fantastic. The Arugula salad was also fresh and the toppings plentiful. My friend had the Linguine Vongole and loved it so much, she wolfed the entire thing down without me getting a bite! The spaghetti was delicious, not too saucy, not too sweet, came with an actual spicy sausage link, and was total Italian perfection.Lastly, the staff - I stopped in to pick up my food and the atmosphere looked really nice, complete with a patio and valet parking. The staff were very friendly, held the door for me, greeted me immediately and were prompt in getting my food to me (only took 20 minutes from the time I called until I picked up the food!).The food isn't inexpensive, but it's quality and that's what will make me come back for more - definitely 5 stars.

49.description: I'll start with the good.  The marinara sauce is delicious, and the rest of the classic Italian American food is mostly correctly prepared and tasty. The neighborhood bar/mid-20th century Italian ethnic vibe (hints of "American Hustle") can be cool if you are in the mood.But only in its way, and not if the food is this pricey.  We had an early reservation, and even though there were plenty of open tables on the restaurant side, we were seated in the bar -- music from a pop radio station, TV on, people having drinks and yelling, typical bar atmosphere.  We were in a good mood, rolled with it, had a bottle of wine.  The food was good, except for the terrible bread, and the portions are big. But once you add on the up charge for a vegetable to complement the main dish -- it otherwise comes entirely plain -- the bill came to $30 for chicken parmigiana and a little grilled asparagus. Plus the wine was much more expensive than it is in even excellent Italians elsewhere in town ($38 for the cheapest bottle on the list). I don't mind spending money on food, but it has to feel justified, and it bugged me to pay $60 a person (without appetizers or coffee and with only one desert) for such a "meh" meal.All in all, the food was fine, I'd go back regularly if the price point was right for the atmosphere and the simple Italian American food. But as it is, you can eat MUCH better in Chicago for the price, and I left the meal with a little aftertaste of ripoff.

40.description: This is the best Italian spot in Chicago.  Typical Italian joint in that sometimes you get a more laid back and less attentive server but consistently delicious food and reasonable prices.

53.description: This is a great date night place! They bring you unlimited bread and marinara that's so delicious! I usually try the specials as they never let me down. Absolutely recommended.

30.description: Love  this place! Great staff good eats! One of the negatives you smell like a kitchen for days. Baked clams could use a good washing too soooo gritty. Other than that best Italian restaurant in the south loop!

46.description: I am by no means a foody or a picky eater but this restaurant has a nice atmosphere and okay staff. I had the grouper Italiano and the fish was overcooked and stale. The potatoes that came with the dish were stale and seemed like they were previously frozen. My girlfriend got the gnocchi, and while it was tasty, it was  overwhelming and the sauce too thick. Overall, the ambience is good but the food is overpriced for what it is.

1.description: This is a hidden gem!If you are staying at the Hyatt, this is an easy walk from the front door.The staff are some of the friendliest folks in Chicago.The food is just amazing and amazing is a strong word.The Veal Marsala is great. The fried zucchini is absolutely delicious.You have got to do this walk. It is past the White Castle the take a right and walk north two blocks.The neighborhood seems safe and there are no pan handlers like the rest of Chicago.

55.description: I went there at 8:30 pm on a Friday night, we made reservations but our table wasn't quite ready so we waited at the bar.  The bar was nice, we had a round of drinks and all were great.  When we got to our table, Guy was our server and he was absolutely amazing.  We ended up ordering a ton of food and sharing everything....we had mussels, salad, meatballs, a pasta dish, and our favorite, the New York strip.  All of it was amazing, so much to choose from on the menu so I would recommend ordering a few plates and sharing.  If he is working, I would request Guy as your server...he will give you his honest opinions and makes sure you have everything you need!

9.description: I've only eaten here once when I was in Chicago on business. Picked this place randomly for lunch. It blew my mind! I got the Rapini e Orichetti pasta which had a delicious sweet homemade sausage. Granted where I live in California doesn't really have any Italian food like this. Its all way too foofy. The place itself was classy and the food looked as delicious as it tasted. What I loved though, is that the food was delicious without being pretentious. The meatballs were also a home run. I will definitely be coming back here next time I am in town.

26.description: Linguine with baby clams is very delicious. It's my go-to.Unfortunately the other day, I decided to dine in and tried their parmesan chicken. I have never been more disappointed with this dish. It had a weird, old, stale texture and odor. I had a bite and just left it. I will stick to thw linguine from now on. As for service, we had a woman server who was incredibly pushy. We didnt't want wine. Or appetizers. After she.saw that we were only there for entrees, she didn't pay us much attention. We had to flag down the busser to refill our water. When the waitress dropped off the check, she didn't say anything, no thank you, nothing. So I got terrible food and service. Great. I will stick to carry out and linguine from now on.

25.description: Jacki was a great server & good was super tastey with large portions

12.description: Been here a few times, the service is always middling and the food only decent but this time was the last straw.  We had a chicken parmigiana and a Gnocchi.  The chicken, which is supposed to be crispy, was drenched in marinara which rendered it quite soggy, not what you'd expect for $22.  The gnocchi was more like soup of microwaved gnocchi.  The thing was drowning in a very thin sauce that literally submerged all of the gnocchi.  The crumbled sausage was nowhere to be found.  Flavor wasn't awful, but it was very clearly microwaved.  Certain areas were warm-ish, other areas were scalding hot.  Add to that the soupy sauce that it was drowned in and you have a clear case of microwaved food.  Again, not what you'd expect for $22.  Refills on drinks or comments about the food were not possible as our server was M.I.A. during the entire duration of our meal.  It was a stretch of over 30 minutes that she never came over to us.  After we were done eating we had to wait another long while for her to come over and pack our food and give us the check.  'At this point my dining partner was just absolutely fed up with this experience (her last night in the States and she wanted a nice Italian dining experience).  She went up to the waitress while we were on our way out and asked for the manager.  She gave a smirk and went over to get him.  As my dining partner went over what was wrong with the manager, only two things happened:  the only words to come out of his mouth were "oh i'm sorry," and he was smirking, bordering on smiling, the entire time.  What that was all about is beyond me.  I don't know if the pair were high,  friends protecting each other or more, who knows.  All i know is that this is the last time we're going here.  I know it's convenient for us south looper's when we don't feel like trekking out to the north side, but do yourself a favor, don't go here, make the trek up to the north side or UKV and have some real italian food that's actually good and that comes along with actual service.

59.description: We came here last week since we were working at McCormick and Cafe Bionda so close. That being said, I don't know if I would come all the way down near Cermak for Italian food unless I was working at McCormick again.THAT being said, the food was pretty good. The calamari and bread were great mainly because the marinara sauce was delicious and had a good kick at the end. I ordered the Beefsteak Tomato & Bufala Mozzarella Salad which was good, but I was craving something a little heavier. I switched my plate with a friend who got the Rigatoni Alla Vodka (no meat) and that was very good. Another friend got the chicken parmesan which was pretty good as well.Our waitress didn't really wait on us until she was constantly told to attend to our table by her boss or if one of us flagged her down so we ended up being here longer than intended. As I said, the food was good, not life changing, and I would most likely return here next year when I am working at McCormick due to its convenient proximity.

21.description: On my last visit 2 weeks ago our service was poor. I could not figure out if they were understaffed, our server just hated her job, or maybe she didn't want to wait on us because we are young? Either way I hope this place works out the staff issues because I would like to go back. The food is excellent.

17.description: On my last visit 2 weeks ago our service was poor. I could not figure out if they were understaffed, our server just hated her job, or maybe she didn't want to wait on us because we are young? Either way I hope this place works out the staff issues because I would like to go back. The food is excellent.

10.description: This was my 4th dinner restaurant stop as one of our colleagues was staying at the Hyatt connected to the McCormick.  This place was in relatively close walking distance so we gave it a shot!....I loved it!It was pretty packed for a Monday evening and the sound level wasn't too bad.  I loved the bread they first brought with the marinara dipping sauce.  I got a nice glass of Montepulciano with my meal - yum!  I had to get the baby clams with linguine as this is my go-to dish if I see it on the menu, and I wanted to compare it to others I've had.  YUM!  Baby clams were piled high and the pasta was cooked perfect al dente - love the garlic, mmm mmm!  I had a lot leftover so I took it back to my hotel, and had it for breakfast the next morning - unusual, I know, but I loved it!  And the garlic flavor is even better overnight!  Service was so friendly and attentive, and since we were visiting, the hostess gave us a list of her favorite Chicago spots to visit.  Sweet!  Grazie, Cafe Bionda, I will be back!

5.description: Great food, cozy environment, awesome waitress!  Only reason I gave a 4 is because the hostess was a little snotty, said she gave away our table but we were only 6-7 minutes late and then sat us at a table that was practically in the kitchen - loud pots and pans banging that was very distracting.  We were able to switch tables and then everything was great.

3.description: Seriously amazing. My boyfriends father and his girlfriend took us here for Valentine's Day, and it exceeded all expectations. I forget our waitresses name, but she was outstanding. Very informative, friendly, and explained everything on the menu to us. The food was absolutely delcious. Wine was fantastic. And the customer service was excellent. Zero complaints, and I highly recommend!

35.description: I used opentable to make a reservation for 6 people at 7:30pm last Friday. My husband and my best friend were running the marathon two days later so this dinner was to serve as a celebratory carb loading dinner. We arrived at 7:20pm and walked inside to a REALLY crowded restaurant. That's great, of course, however, they have this teeny tiny little hostess stand so there is nowhere for anyone to stand while waiting for a table. We waited at the hostess stand for a few minutes before anyone came over. When they did come over, they didn't even say hello, just looked at the computer. I waited patiently. Finally, one of the women said "Yes?" They didn't greet us, say welcome, nothing... flat and short.  I told them about our reservation, which they quickly found, but then they said "You're going to have to give us a minute." So short and rude. They looked totally harried by how busy it was, which I understand, but I just arrived, I didn't do anything to add to your stress, so please don't be rude to be for absolutely no reason. We all walked over to the right and stood in a busy little hallway between bar and restaurant. The hostess came over a few minutes later and we were seated in the back of the right side of the restaurant. Shortly after being seated, a woman came over and got our drink order. She did not introduce herself as our waitress. She delivered the drinks a few minutes later and walked away. FORTY FIVE minutes later, I asked a bus boy if we had a waitress. He rudely said, "Yes. She delivered your drinks! What do you need her for?" WHAT? Seriously, WHAT? I need her so we can ORDER! I just responded, "It has been 45 minutes. We would like to order." It was then that we realized that the woman who brought over our drinks, the bartender, was ALSO the waitress for the 6-9 tables in the room AND the entire bar! It was a FRIDAY night people! The waitress/bartender came over a few seconds later and took our order but offered us no guidance in ordering. It was very bare minimum service. The food came out quickly. I had the stuffed shells, they looked amazing but were really salty. I wish they had been accompanied by a vegetable....or I wish the waitress had told me that they were best ordered as something for the entire table. My husband didn't like what he ordered so he didn't eat any of it--not that anyone who worked there cared and/or noticed. One of my friends ordered gnocchi in a vodka sauce and she loved it. It looked really good. I don't know. I just felt like we paid a lot of money for crappy service. When we finished eating, the waitress/bartender came over and asked if we were finished, we all said yes. She walked away and 25 minutes later we asked her for the check. We would have ordered dessert and coffee but we were really fed up at this point. Throughout dinner, she never even asked anyone if we even wanted another drink. I know I could have used one! Ahh. I'm getting annoyed just thinking about the whole night. Bottom line: I would try this again but only during the week in hopes that the staff will be able to keep their cool on slower nights. I don't appreciate the rude attitudes when it is the restaurants fault for not knowing how to staff appropriately, not the fault of the customers for just being there.

19.description: First impressions are lasting...Reservations were under my friend's name. I arrived first and was greeted by the hostess who clearly doesn't love her job and has a nasty attitude, "Ummm, I don't see a reservation for so-and-so. I have one for Amy, John, Renee." My straight faced response said to her, "That's not the name I said so what purpose does it serve to rattle off everyone else's name?" She just looked at me, no word on whether they were too busy to accommodate a party of two, no apology for the mix up, nada. THEN she walked away. WTH! Another party of two walks in, she comes back to the stand, asks if they are walk-ins, grabs two menus and is about to seat them! Hold the heck up!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I'm honestly on my best behavior so I keep calm but step up like "Hi there, remember me, party of two, missing reservation, you weren't just about to seat those two walk-ins ahead of me were you?" The manager is standing there at this point, like no, we'll take care of you. The hostess trying to save face was like "of course I was going to seat you first, you were here first." Don't try to be cute now... I couldn't keep quiet and said, in front of her manager, still in a calm tone tho ;-) "oh really, because you just motioned to them without even acknowledging me and the reservation mix up. But thanks for tending to me first, I appreciate it." And there were MAD tables in the back. Unnecessary delays and rudeness. Sheesh.She seats me in a corner, I move to the middle. No mention of who my server will be, no enjoy your meal, nada. If my friend hadn't picked this place I would have left. Not to mention she was late so I had no motivation to give this restaurant a shot at this point.Guy was the name of our server (spelled differently but I can't remember how). He seemed a little awkward in the beginning... like he interrupted our conversation a couple of times to see if we were ready or wanted this or that. That's not a bad thing of course because he was attentive, but his approach was bit off-kilter. The turnaround. He provided good input on the menu and made suggestions on some of the tweaks I wanted. I ordered the Rigatoni Alla Vodka and added spicy crumbled sausage. Best decision ever and I thank Guy for co-signing on my choice! The food was FANTASTIC. It came in such a large portion and it did not disappoint. I enjoyed my leftovers equally as much the next day! My friend ordered the whole chicken... yup... a WHOLE chicken. The presentation was kind of like whoa... messy in a way. They literally split the chicken in half and spread it on a large oval plate. I tasted it though and it was very tender and flavorful. Bottom line: I would absolutely ORDER OUT from here again. The food was yummy!! I would be very reluctant, however, to dine in again. A friend suggested eating at the bar instead... perhaps that would help with the restaurant experience. Tip: You get a sizable portion of bread and tomato marinara sauce when you're seated... save some bread to dip in your pasta!!! Tip: There's a parking lot in the back. Who knew??

28.description: Incredible food! We had tomato, mozzarella salad, chopped salad and the lobster fettuccine. My God, I was in heaven! We had a wonderful bartender, Jackie, who was not only sweet and fun, but she totally sold us on the place upon arrival. The way she described the food made us positive we were at the right spot. Count me as a new regular!

Don't try to be cute now... I couldn't keep quiet and said, in front of her manager, still in a calm tone tho ;-) "oh really, because you just motioned to them without even acknowledging me and the reservation mix up. Tip: You get a sizable portion of bread and tomato marinara sauce when you're seated... save some bread to dip in your pasta!!! Tip: There's a parking lot in the back. Who knew??

33.description: Place had great atmosphere, great food and great bar set up. Very welcoming. We will definitely be back. Staff was great

43.description: The best Italian food in the south loop.

2.description: first time i came here, i had Guy as my server and he was the best.  the food is good.today was my second time here.  i brought my family here for my sister's birthday.  the food was good, but the waitress was horrible.  each time when the waitress came by it was because i called for her.  at one point, she walked and checked on the table to my left, and she walk passed my table and checked on the table to my right.  she then walked away. she just ignored me and my family.maybe i would do carry out, but i wont go back unless Guy was working. i can tell you i would rather dine at another italian restaurant before i come back over here.

18.description: It's hard to find an Italian spot that has something unique. There are so many good Tratorrias around, but Cafe Bionda surprises with interesting sauces and preparations. We really enjoyed the chicken parm, a pretty basic dish, because of that sauce. Great service. A place where the staff and ownership shows pride in what they do.

41.description: I love Cafe Bionda.  Love it!  I've never had a bad meal or bad experience here.  I like all of their plates so I can't pick and choose which one to talk about.  What I really like is they give you bread & gravy right when you sit down and it's so delicious.  The staff is always nice.  They have now expanded their restaurant so it's so much more roomy and you don't feel boxed in or on top of each other.  I really love the new layout.  I love sitting at the bar top tables because everyone you know congregates at the bar and you're able to people watch and have a great time.

52.description: The food here was excellent.  I had nanny's gravy and it was just like my grandma used to make and she was directly from Italy.  My wife had the fish special and she was very impressed.  The calamari was great and the fried zucchini was perfect.  I would not hesitate to go again.

50.description: I just had lunch here with a couple of friends.  Bob and his partner Matt.  We arrived at about 1120 am on a Friday and the place was empty. They start you out with fresh baked bread and gravy which was delightful  We started out with grilled octopus, meatball salad and spicy sausage with peppers.  All were very good.  I especially liked the meatball salad.  Meatball was moist (I love that word) and flavorful.  I finished with the chicken parmesan.  My chicken was pounded thin and covered in cheese.  It was pretty good.  I washed all of this down with water and a black coffee.  The coffee was strong and very good.  Our server was the girl behind the bar and she did a good job.  Every time I have eaten here is has been very good.  I will come back.

4.description: Authentic food and a great neighborhood.... The stuffed banana pepper and grilled calamari were great starts to our dinner. We had the prawns on special and cheesecake desert. Everything was flavorful but still light enough not to over indulge. A gem of the up and coming south loop

6.description: A group of 6 of us walked in here around 8:30 pm crossing our fingers they would be able to accommodate us...amazingly after a cheerful smile and a quick 5 minute wait, we were seated!  Staff was extremely efficient and pleasant...and the reviews are right on...portions are incredible.  I opted for the rigatoni alla vodka and was not disappointed.  Great atmosphere and nice neighborhood location in South Loop.  If you are in the vicinity of McCormick Center and looking for Italian, check them out!

22.description: I have been here many times and I have never had a bad meal here.The food is fantastic and the portions are very large. The staff is friendly and there is a good wine selection as well. The check will not break the bank either!

15.description: Don't order the Steak and you'll be fine.  Otherwise, great place.

57.description: Friends and it is on the low end,The food was very good. If you have some food left on your plate. Double that they pack I all.The crispy chicken with lemon garlic can be consumed everyday.We would have loved some spinach with the meal. We general would a green vegetable also.

20.description: I've only eaten here once when I was in Chicago on business. Picked this place randomly for lunch. It blew my mind! I got the Rapini e Orichetti pasta which had a delicious sweet homemade sausage. Granted where I live in California doesn't really have any Italian food like this. Its all way too foofy. The place itself was classy and the food looked as delicious as it tasted. What I loved though, is that the food was delicious without being pretentious. The meatballs were also a home run. I will definitely be coming back here next time I am in town.

36.description: Probably  one of the best Italian  meals I've  had. Our server was exceptional,  she spent time with us and explained  in detail what each dish was and how it would be served. I would highly recommend  a dinner  here.

14.description: Excellent every time. Hard to get me to order something other than the fantastic brick chicken. Sausage with rapini and beans is to die for. Can't wait to get back!

3.description: Having gone to D'Jon's for several years, it is time I give them a much-delayed Yelp review.  As a female, with short hair, I must be careful who I have shorning my hair.  Many barber shops do not accept females. I have also had barbers give me a masculine haircut.   It is a pleasure to have D'Jon's as my barber salon of choice, but also to let everyone know what a wonderful experience it is to come here.Receptionist Pam is friendly and has a great huge 1970s afro.  Naim is my barber of preference and has thusfar, done the best haircuts I have ever had.  The salon has an urban,edgy design, is always clean and has easy street parking.  I have always been accommodated with last minute appointments.  There is a great shoe shine person on the premises also.

1.description: This is a proper barber shop with real talent for classically great cuts. The barbers, like surgeons, use their scissors like scalpels with exacting attention, really took care of my husband and three year old son. We will come here again!

2.description: Recently moved to the South Loop area and have been getting my hair cut monthly in Lakeview, so I wanted to try a local business.  It is by far the worse experience I have ever had getting my hair cut.First, welcome to Chicago and have a web presence.  If you do not have a website, then you should be out of business.  Shame on me for trying to support them even without one.  I have truly learned my lesson.   Second, scheduling was alright, with the provider that they have and made setting up the visit easy. It was a simple profile to build and two clicks with a email confirmation.  Simply and easy. Third, My hair cut is not difficult, guard #2 on the back and sides, blended to the top. Top cut short so I can spike it. The individual that I did my hair cut, tried the military high and tight.  However, he was not even able to do that, because his ability to do a straight line with the bangs in the front.  Furthermore, blending from short to long hair was completely beyond his capabilities. I strong urge this individual to return to the institution and be remediated.   After 45 minutes in the chair, I gave up and yes that will be fine.  Thank goodness Hair Cuttery is open until 9pm on S. Wabash.  The young lady there was able to correct his mistake in 10 minutes and I was good to go.  Her and her fellow co-workers were able to have some comedy to their evening and we shared a few laughs at the atrocity that was called a hair cut.   Finally, I only suggest going to this location if you hair cut requires a pair of clippers only.  That is all that they are capable of doing.

5.description: Recently moved back to the area ... Was very apprehensive of letting anyone touch my hair. Saw this shop and was brought in by esthetics at first, I can't lie. But I must say the look of the shop was just as great as their service!! Friendly atmosphere; I was greeted like a regular & serviced quick. I believe my barber's name is Rashaad .. He did a amazing job & was a bit entertaining in conversation as well. If you ever stop here I'm sure all the barbers are wonderful with their cuts. . . But my recommendation goes to Rashaad. He was very refreshing being he was diverse in the type of hair texture he could deal with. Most barbers only cut one type of hair & he seemed to be comfortable with all types. I really appreciated it & will be a regular returning customer!! Also they have reasonable prices when it comes to cuts. Trust your paying for QUALITY, excellent quality!

0.description: Great staff. They open at 8am, what more could you ask for?

4.description: I had a bad experience at this barbershop. I live in the South Loop and have been going to Hyde Park to get my haircut and I think I'll keep making the commute. I asked for a simple haircut - guard #2 with a fade - and thought it would take about 30 minutes. Instead, he didn't give me guard #2 and the haircut took more than an hour. I feel as though the fact that he was going into my ear and near my mouth with the clipper was rather unsanitary. Also, I never asked for a beard trim, but he just went straight for it and took an extra 15 minutes. Though I came out with an OK haircut, I was displeased by the fact that what took them 75 minutes took my other barber 25 and my other barber did a better job. As for the place itself, it looked rundown. The chairs and walls were worn, it looked like nobody had swept the floors in about a week and the vibe was reminiscent of a ghost town. If you're looking for a new barbershop, pass by this place and keep looking.

3.description: Cori is the only stylist I trust to color my natural hair in Chicago. It had been almost a year since the last time she colored my hair, so I  was excited to book an appointment and get some more color in my life. I went in there not sure of what I wanted, but knowing that I needed something to excite me about my natural curls again. I told Cori that I wanted something to brighten me up, but lower maintenance than what I had previously had. Her suggestion? Heavy highlights sans the overall base color. I was game! Once again she used 2 different Wella colors for highlights, but I did opt for bleach this go-round. So far I'm loving my hair and it was just what the doctor ordered.For anyone in the Chicago area looking for a professional, personable, and prompt stylist that can take care of your strands - - Cori is perfect. Justin's Salon Studio is a great addition to the South Loop and perfect for your hair care needs.

1.description: I've been going to this salon since June and my hair was in very bad shape at that time. It was breaking, very dry and very uneven. Cori has been my stylist since then and has restored my hair back to its normal health and my hair grew out so fast within 3 months. I get compliments every time I leave the salon and I feel super confident as well. She is great with her appointments, very efficient with time and she keeps me happy always. Thanks Cori!

0.description: If you're looking for hair extensions THIS is the place to go! Call up the studio and ask for Naomi, she has revived the life of my hair! She uses DreamCatchers Hair Extensions and after doing extensive research, it's the best way to go. I had to find something that worked well with asian hair and didn't make my hair look like I obviously had a weave going on! DreamCatchers use a "micro-cylinder" technology that is permanent, reusable and non-damaging. Meaning-- NO glue, bonding or sewing in!! The extensions give my natural hair fullness and body and they also allow my hair to grow healthily while in place. The extensions also come with a two year warranty! How fabulous is that? It's worth every penny!Call the salon for your consultation with Naomi. You won't regret it!!----Other info about the salon: Everyone there is extremely friendly and the salon is very clean and well kept. There's always music and laughter whenever I've gone in. There is ample street parking in the area, but some streets require you to pay the meter and others are free without meters or zone limits. It's a great addition to the South Loop!

2.description: I went to Justin for the first time 2 weeks ago based on yelps reviews and my experience was bad. He was friendly, facility nice reason for the one star, everything else I beg to differ. One review said he starts on time, well my appt was at 4, they told me to get there 15mins early!?! Anyway got there at 4, he was starting to flat iron someone's hair, 40 mins later I'm in the chair, ok-strike 1. He wash/condition/color rinse in my hair and sat me under the dryer for 10 mins, what the wt&$&@!?! Then he sits me at his station and blow dry my hair-strike, WT$&&$!?! Finishes and guess what ...flat iron more heat. If I didn't have damage I probably have it now-strike 2. Now he's styling my hair from the back. Ok. Now this so called style looks like how I came in without the grease, okay!?! He leaves me and walks in a closet behind the counter. I'm sitting there like is he looking for something for my hair.  Then he says from the closet he's done it'll be $85. REALLY...REALLY!!! Mind you I sat in the chair as he finished his previous person and walked her to the counter, checked her out and pretty much walked her to the door.  What the heck happened, first time customers don't get that. STRIKE 3!!!!  So the lady sitting at the counter looking at my hair like wow ask me if I wanted to schedule my next appt. my mind said sugar honey ice tea no, as nicely as I can put it but I said no thank you. I get home and there's a black line across my forehead and on the side of my face from the rinse. If he was a real stylist he would of checked that. Last thing sorry so long, but he ask to shape my neck I said yes. Those clippers was so dang sharp OMG. REALLY?!?! and he didn't wipe neck down after grazing it. Wow. Second so called beautician/stylist in Chicago I've been too and I'm done!!!! I'll hed back hm everyone month. Just ridiculous, the price and the service, SUCKS!!!.  That's it. Good luck.

5.description: I. LOVE. THIS. SALON!!!!  First about my stylist:Cori is a true master of her craft and the only one I trust with my follicles.  I love the fact that she is an artist and uses your hair as her canvas to create works of beauty that even Matisse and Monet would admire.  I give her absolutely no instruction.  I simply sit in her chair and allow her to create.  Each and every time the results are absolutely amazing and render compliments from the time I leave her chair until I return for my next appointment, usually months later.  Specific things that make her one of the most talented people in a smock:1. Cori is EXTREMELY punctual and attentive.  In the 7 years that she has been my stylist, she has NEVER stacked a client on top of my appointments which can last anywhere from 2.5-5 hours depending on my color needs.2. She has an amazing gift with color.  She once told me that she dreams in hair color and it totally shows.  The way she combines base/natural colors with highlights is completely unmatched in this city.  My hair is a kaliedescope of colors that compliment one another and my complexion.  She also takes the time color your brows to match your hair.  My favorite color job from her occurred in October 2012 where she colored my hair to look like the colors of the trees as the leaves began to fall.  My head was full of vibrant brown, red, and gold tones that slowly faded (as color does)  to honey/amber tones as winter set in.  It was simply gorgeous.3. She is the ONLY stylist I have met in my entire life who can cut my natural hair PERFECTLY without having blow dry/flat iron it first.  She had me at "hello" with this one.Now the salon itself:This is, by far, my most favorite salon where Cori has worked.  Justin has an amazing and warm personality, that invites you into this family-oriented space.  You're greeted at the door by a smiling and hospitable woman, I do believe her name is Verna, who immediately sets the stage for the service to come.  Justin, too, is a master of his craft.  I've only seen him create sew-in weave extensions and perform sew-in maintenance, but that man is working pure unadulterated magic with that hair!  A few things I love about the space include:1. Intimate feel - It is a smaller, loft-style space that is extremely well planned and used.  The flow from the chair, to the bowl, to the dryer, back to the chair can happen without roadblocks and twists and turns.2. Location - It is centrally located in the South Loop and easily accessible from a number of main thoroughfares and expressways.  Traffic is forever free-flowing and metered parking is ALWAYS available.3. Decor - The decor is simple with clean lines and warm, inviting colors.  Browns and blues with silver accents and photos of the amazing Chicago Skyline make for a relaxing trip to the salon.4. Sanitation - I don't think I've ever walked in and seen a piece of hair sitting on the floor.  Even when I get my hair trimmed, by the time I remove my smock and grab my coat to leave, my hair magically disappears from the floor.  Each stylist's station is well organized and aesthetically pleasing.  The bathroom is also impeccable.If you are looking for a salon and stylist who truly takes your hair seriously and has your follicles' best interests in mind, THIS. IS. THE. PLACE. FOR. YOU!

6.description: Justin is the bomb!  That is all.

7.description: I was referred to Justin by a friend who's hair is always gorgeous. Justin does an outstanding job at everything...natural hair, sew-ins, cuts (absolute best) and color. He colored my daughter's hair and people regularly stops her and raves about her color. He does a great job with my hair and I love the way he cuts it. Perfect!!!

8.description: I was referred to Justin by a close friend of mine who's hair is always looking fly and now I'm hooked!  I just love Justin!  Everytime I leave the salon I look like a rock star!For anyone looking for a stylist in the Chicagoland area, give Justin a try.  He's reliable, he has great listening skills, he's consistent and he truly knows what will look good on you.

9.description: I had a great experience at Justin's! I'm natural, and wanted a fresh spring cut and color after having braids for about 6 months. I decided to try Justin's because a friend gave the salon rave reviews. I scheduled my appointment a week in advance, and was easily able to get in Justin's book. When I arrived the morning of my appointment, I was given a consultation right away, and was on my way to highlight heaven within a half hour. Everyone at the salon was attentive and courteous, explaining the color/wash/cut/style processes to me as my appointment went on. My hair was gorgeous when I left the salon, and remains so, as Justin gave me a fresh, low-maintenance bob w/highlights - just what I wanted! Check this salon out!

10.description: A+++ I had my hair styled by Justin after receiving a recommendation from a good friend. I feel like I hit the lottery! He is a super talented stylist! Beautiful salon, wonderful ambiance, great conversation, very professional and conveniently located right around the corner from my home (BONUS!!!). I've found my new hair home! Kudos to Justin!!!!

4.description: Had a blow out here and the girl who did it was amazing! This Salon is around the corner from my house so, I wasn't too sure how it would go but, I was defiantly satisfied. The girl who blew my hair out didn't even use a flat iron which for me is unheard of as my hair is extremely curly and in the Chicago humidity is impossible to keep straight. Thank you Justin's I will be back :)

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: African-American Hair, Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Extensions, Straight Perms, Coloring, Kids' Hair

3.description: Horrid service, always been but this on the way to pick up my kids from after school and have gone there despite terrible service but not anymore!! I went through the drive through on wednesday and ordered 2 chicken sandwiches and when i got to the pick up window the lady @ the counter asked me to wait in the parking area and someone was going to bring me the sandwiches. I said NO because the last time i did that i waited for over 25 minutes. She started to abuse me and call me names. Who are these people hiring?? In-fact i never want to go to another burger-king in my life.

1.description: This particular Burger King, while it is the most convenient to my home, won't have to worry about seeing me again...at least at night.The day crew that is here is absolutely wonderful and professional, and makes you want to be there and spend your money.  The night crew however, could care less.  I say that because they are unprofessional, and a little on the "hood" side.  Not the best way to greet customers that are spending money and pretty much paying your salary.About a week or so ago I visited this Burger King at night.  Now while I'm not accusing anyone of anything (mistake or otherwise), when I received my change I had $4.00 in change instead of the $9.00 I should have had.  I know, I should have counted it at the window.  Lesson learned.  I did contact the manager and of course they could do nothing to rectify the situation.  Again, not accusing anyone of anything (mistake or otherwise), but this won't happen again, at least to me.  So this is what I'M going to do to rectify the situation:The closest Burger King is on Ashland near 31st - I think I'll be going there from now on.
