2.description: The cashier was nice, but lines can get long.It'll be more efficient if they didn't have the one cashier go get the food and just take the orders since they had a few people back there. Food wasn't very hot. I only came because it was the closest thing to my brothers place.

9.description: Slowest service ever!  Don't go here on your lunch break!  You will be late!

10.description: I can't rate this low enough. Consider my rating a negative eleventy billion stars.This is the only quick place near my client datacenter. I'm sure there are other places, but we're usually running out for lunch in the middle of a very long day of work, and it needs to be fast. Unfortunately, it's never fast. Or correct. Ever.Today, it took at least four people to ring out my coworker and I - apparently, a combo meal is really hard. I made the mistake of ordering cheesy tots (which are good) instead of fries. That was a mind bender. And my friend ordered tacos. Don't get me started.So, after 15 minutes, we got our food. Then we had someone repairing stained and leaking ceiling tiles, probably showering me with asbestos and rat droppings.So yeah. Burger King. Woo!

4.description: The worst Burger King in the USA ,that place need to be closed for a lot of reasons , one of them is hygiene , the people working are so improfetional and need to take a shower before handling people's food . Nasty

6.description: Honestly, this place it still open?

12.description: The place is clean and relaxing, but the food was average at best and the service was terrible. All the employees didn't care about their jobs and were repeatedly shouting to each other to get it done. The guy who took my order took ages and still got it wrong. I ordered just a whopper and a mango smoothie. Honestly a 10 year old could have done it better than him. The burger was disappointing and tasted just like a McDonald's burger. The smoothie was decent and that's what earned the place 2 stars instead of 1.

5.description: The following review takes place between 12:00 - 12:30 (voiceover delivered by Kiefer Sutherland)Slowest Drive thru ever...over 15 minutes to order chicken nuggets for my hungry child. I would have went somewhere else but I needed nuggets. Now we are waiting for a 4 piece chicken nugget. My wife said, "There is no progress...they take your order but the can't make your order!". I don't think she realized she just recycled a Seinfeld joke (rental car reservation episode). The clock is still ticking and no nuggets yet. It has been 24 minutes now.  If we leave this line, then we will have one upset child.  What to do?  They do realize it is lunchtime.  Oh yeah not a single car is parked in the lot, so that can't be the issue. And the clock keeps ticking. 28 minutes and one car in front.  My wife is ready to bail...I think my child is too. 30 minutes And we are finally handed outr bag!!!On a good note... Laytana was very nice and apologized for the hugeDelay...some free fries might have made it feel sincere!!!

13.description: Since this location is near downtown I expected better service. I've visited this location on 3 separate occassions. The first time I ordered through drive thru and the didn't have all my food items in my bag but I didn't become aware of this until I was a block away from home. The second occassion. I walked in to have the cashier/order taker ignore me for 5 mins until she was ready to take my order. Not a smile, hello, thank you or what so ever. The third time I visited this location it was on my way to work. Exactly 5:16am, myself and several other cars decided to go through drive thru. No answer or response, I went to peek through the window and not a soul in sight. (I remind you that they are supposed to be up and running by 5:00am.) I just so happen to have called the restaurant later that evening to ask what time they actually open and the woman who answered the phone asked me, "Is this a prank call, are you serious?" I said, "YES!" She said we oen at 4am. I told her I was there around 5am that morning. She said I'm not here that early so I don't know what to tell you.  ARE YOU SERIOUS! WOW! Excellent Customer Service guys!

11.description: It's a BK.  Decent option if you don't feel like the McDonald's a couple blocks east.  You have to know it is there since you can't really see it from north of Cermak.It's a suprisingly un-shady parking lot versus another joint nearby (rhymes with Bright Tassel).

8.description: I don't know where to begin with this. I mean, I know it's BK but come on!! BK is one of my fave fast food places. So after a movie downtown my wife felt like BK and this is the place we ended up because it was on the way home. This place is a waste of life and a waste of space downtown. This location has been given this huge parking lot and lot that it does not deserve in any way. SLOW! Let me spell it out...S...L...O...W = SLOW. I don't understand what the point of having a drive thru is when the people working inside do not want to work. I pulled in to the drive thru at 9:30pm and was told to hold. Mind you, at this moment, there is not a single car in front, behind, or parked in the lot anywhere. We are sitting in the car waiting on someone to ask us for our order so I say "hello?" and once again I'm told to wait. 9:40pm and she finally comes on to ask for my order. No joke and no exaggeration. We pull up at the window and paid (for which I wasn't given my change). Finally ended up leaving the window with the meal (which was for my wife only...so only 1 combo ordered) at around 9:50pm. 20 MINUTES!!! For a drive thru? When we were the only car ordering? You have got to be kidding.I don't even want to give it a star but since we have to, I had to give it the 1 star. Save your time and gas...plus your patience. Go to another location or eat something else. Not worth your money!!

0.description: It is not the best BK I have ever been to but not the worst. It is usually pretty empty and prices are same as all other BKs. With that being said, whenever I order food, there is usually at least a 5-10 minute wait in the drive-thru...with it being empty! The employees are pretty nonchalant, I cannot really say anything on their behavior. The restaurant is just seems drab and mediocre. But it's one of the only fast food restaurants with a drive-thru in that area so it holds potential!

7.description: Well, they automatically get one start for having Coke Icees, one of the best beverages ever created. And another star for friendly service. But the rest of the experience is typically pretty painful. Like other reviewers, I have waited in a not-that-long-of-a-line drive thru for over twenty minutes. Last week, I just wanted to drive-thru for a Diet Coke. After 10 minutes of waiting at the order taker thing, I just left. I"m baffled by how this continues to be a problem there. Hope they get it together so I can still have summer Icees ;)

1.description: No passbook reader. "Read out numbers" where is 'please'? And why don't you see for your self? And eye-contact when you are talking to the customer! At least face it. WTF.

0.description: Nice decoration here.More expensive than the regular starbucks... And doesn't reload card.

3.description: I look forward to this sale every year as both a consigner and a shopper. The process to sell is super easy and convenient. It has really helped me to stay motivated about spring cleaning and trying to minimize the amount of "stuff" that we keep. I am always amazed at the check that I get back from all of the things that I am able to sell. I have had a ton of luck with clothing, shoes, toys and books. I love that I can drop it all off to one place and then eagerly await what feels like a bonus check in return! I have also had great luck as a shopper. Last year I was able to pick up a new bike for my son. It was in excellent condition at a third of the price of a new one. I am already looking forward to this spring's event!

1.description: I have been a shopper and a seller many times and tell EVERYONE I know about this sale. Three are some really amazing finds and it's a great way to get rid of gently used things and make some $$$. Would highly recommend to anyone who is expecting or has small children.

2.description: I have shopped every sale since my son (now 4) was born.  So many amazing deals for clothes, shoes and toys.  The pricing is set by the consignor so it varies, but always great deals to be found.  The largest selection is for newborn through infant - mostly since it is the most gently used before they grow out it of it.  But I have been able to buy most clothes for an upcoming season for my son through 5-6 (his current size).  I highly recommend signing up for the Pre-Sale the first night.  Either volunteer or purchase a sneak peek ticket.  You'll find the best deals and the largest selection.  I'll be a consignor for the upcoming sale and I've found the process to be easy and straightforward.  Looking forward to making a few extra $$ instead of just taking it all to goodwill.

5.description: As a new mom, I was pretty psyched that this was going on near my house.  I'm a thrift/consignment shopping addict and had high hopes for what was promised to be a huge event.  In the end, though, what I found was sort of like a Goodwill.This isn't really a "store" - it's a consignment sale that happens for about two weeks a year.  Families collect, price, tag, and drop off their used baby/kids stuff and receive 65% of the paid price in return.  There are lots of "pre-sales" that you have to register for or volunteer to get in to, supposedly since the best stuff goes first.The sale opened on Wednesday for pre-sale and I didn't make it there till Thursday at 4pm.  By the time I arrived, things were pretty severely picked over.  Toys were either priced unreasonably high or didn't work.  The clothing was all over the place but most was either very worn or nice but priced too high.  There were plenty of the things nobody wants to buy- used breast pumps, crib bedding sets, plaid shorts in baby sizes- but very little of the good stuff.  I walked out with a swim set for $6.50 and a couple of $4 rompers, but I felt I could have easily found these same items at the same prices at Goodwill.Here's the question I can't answer yet though-- is it that BTNM is not a good sale?  Or that I came too late for the good stuff?  Hmm.  I'll go for a pre-sale next time and report back.

0.description: I'm always looking forward to this event. I've been a consignor, volunteer and shop every season. I've consigned at other places and this event is by far my favorite.When you consign for the first time, it can feel a little overwhelming, but once you learn the system, it get's easy. I don't know what I would do if I didn't have the opportunity to sell my things at this consignment. I'm able to be clutter free, selling the things my kids don't use and buying the things they need.Owner is very responsive. They have never lost my things. I once forgot something I have purchased, the owner saved the item for me and I picked it up at the next sale.

4.description: I signed up to sell my items I no longer needed. I was a first time consigner so it was all very new to me. I read the site as to how they like to have their things packaged, tagged, hung, etc.  It was a bit confusing to me. I placed items that I wanted to sell together, like a 4 pack of onesies in a zip lock bag. About a couple weeks prior to the sale an email was sent out saying no zip lock bags. I emailed inquiring on how they would like them to be packaged, they informed me and they did include more detailed description on their site so people would know.  When I reread the site I did notice it said no zip lock bags but under the tips section it mentioned to use zip lock bags.  I again inquired about this cause I wasn't sure then if I could just leave mine they way they were or to change it, the point is to get your stuff sold, not return home with them. They will send your stuff back with you if its not to their requirements.  I also suggested that instead of giving out the hangers to the buyers, take the hangers off the clothes when someone purchases clothes, make a pile of hangers so when people come back to collect the items that didn't sell they can also take hangers so when the next sale comes along they already have hangers, cuts down on the cost for the consigner.  My return response was that I was being to critical and that I am welcome to come to the spring event but to look for a different consignment sale in the future. If you like to have grown adults throw a temper tantrum because you asked a question or had a concern than this is the sale for you, otherwise I would find a different sale to go to where the person running it is adult enough to answer questions without pouting.

58.description: A crazy busy jewel with no parking whatsoever.

56.description: Gross.Izzy nailed it: "Good God. I should have known. Friday after work. Rush house in the city. Nightmare."

29.description: Only buy liquor here folks and shop around for that too..I visit only out of convenience since Walmart has the WORST parking during the day. Prices are hella high...meaning high as he!!.Produce is gross...flys the whole 9 folks...I mean is this a 3rd world country or something...I don't think any of it passed inspection if so it was a month ago. Can't find anything or anyone to help...once I saw a group of 4 teen-aged kids in the potato chip isle having a REAL good time, I tried to join in but they just walked away quietly, head down for some reason...Check the dates on your milk, bread and meat...they work it till the last day folks and who wants to stand in line at customer service for a $1.50 gallon of milk that expired the same day you bought it...NOT ME...bot even Jesus himself would drink a gallon of milk he would take it back AND ask for a manger cause that's just plain silly.

42.description: I dread coming here. Lines are always long. High staff turn over, and best of all the small aisles. The only reason I stop here is to pick up beer and shop a sale. They are often out of the items that I have gone there for and the place just sucks, other Jewel's aren't this bad and I prefer to shop at Jewel versus Dominick's. This Jewel is always crowded and never adequately staffed.

23.description: It serves its purpose. My main complaint is that I'd like to see more organic items. They are in a good location so that's why I end up here a lot.

47.description: This place gets 1 star for convenience (it's smack-dab in the middle of my 'hood) and another for the people watching. Bag ladies talking to themselves buying groceries right next to women with $800 strollers.  A real slice of life to say the least.Honestly, if this place wasn't two blocks away I'd avoid it at all costs. The isles are NARROW and the positioning of most items makes no sense. I've also noticed that if you buy coffee in aisle 7 one week, it's probably going to be in aisle 4 a month later. Annoying.Also, if you do your shopping around the same time as most people (right after work or on the weekends), let me be the first (or judging on these reviews, the 50th) to let you know: don't even bother because it's going to be rock concert-level crowded. Then again, I've been in here at 3pm on a Tuesday and still felt claustrophobic. Unfortunately, this place is unavoidable since it doesn't exactly have a ton of surrounding competition. Word on the street is there is a new grocer opening up across the street soon though...

8.description: Majority of the staff is always friendly and polite but there is one cashier to mans the express check out, she is extremely rude. Every time I go I ask myself "does she hate her job!". Food is always fresh delicious. I bought the most beautiful cake for my wife.

31.description: the worst grocery store ever!!!!! i never write reviews but i had to! i just moved here from north carolina, and this store is a mess! the store is dirty, the selection is horrible especially when it comes to fresh! and even worse than the selection of products and being a dirty store the employees are the most rude people ever! at the register they are all yelling at each other and talking about who is going to break next and when they are taking their lunch! get off your lazy ass and work! i also asked for paper instead of plastic bags and the lady looked at me like i was crazy and never said yes, she just grabbed a paper bag and huffed and started throwing  my things in it! i will  never go back! i guess this is what i get for living in the "southside"! pshhhht!!!!!

34.description: This is a tough one for me. There are a lot of negative reviews here, which I can sympathize with. However, its pretty ideal of for me. Mind you, I don't do the shopping at my house. It's great for a quick fix, which is really all I need these days. So, I really can't complain anything. Plus, I live across the street.  Probably not a 4 star grocery or even a 3 star, but for my needs it's great.

16.description: I've only been to this Jewel twice.   But I am a semi-regular suburban Jewel shopper.  This locaiton reminds me more of a whole foods or an upscale grocery store, than the suburban Jewels.   You walk in and they have a lot more prepared foods - sushi, olive bar, great selection of cheeses, lots of grab and go.  Everything just looks more upscale and classy.  I've had lots of luck with running in and picking up a few snack like items to bring to an event.   Great parking lot too!

13.description: Cashiers are just a joke there! They don't even know what you have in your bag.. and they usually put a different price for fruits and veggies. Instead of lb, ea..etc. Be aware if you choose this place to do groceries and always check your receipt before you leave the register.. Go to Trader Joe's instead! Much nicer, cheaper and just across the street!

11.description: Their sushi section is decent. There has been some new item selection added lately. Great for a quick take out. Comparable quality to mariano's. Better than whole food's or trader joe's in my opinion.

39.description: I don't know how they got the name Jewel but it is not a gem. Worst store ever. Any time I ask someone to help me find something they appear to be more confused than I am. It is always over crowded in the narrow aisles and the store is just a mess. I always try to avoid shopping here. The groceries are also over priced even with discounts. Waste of time and money.

37.description: This Jewel contains a triple threat of chaos:Students, the homeless and the fact that it's the only grocery in the South Loop. When I was a student (back in the day, ho ho ho!), I was walking into this Jewel and a man came up behind me, pushed me into the gumball machines and shoved his hands into my pocket. Do. Not. Want.The lines are long and chaos is always ensuing somewhere. The chicken tendies and potatoes are good, though.

0.description: Jewel like Walgreens can be a great place to shop if you take advantage of sales and use coupons.  However, if you come in blindly to buy, get ready to get taken advantage of.  I recently bought 48 pounds of boneless chicken breast at 1.47 a pound! This is Jewel and I wouldn't come here for service.  The cashiers are always talking and seem bothered when a customer "interrupts" their conversation.  I recommend coming here during off hours to avoid lines,  This is a grocery store and you buy food here.  Forget about the Mission Statement of "We are Here to Change the World!"  Does every business have to change the world and make it a better place?  I give you money and you give me food is a fair transaction to me.

38.description: The prices are nice, but why do I always have a feeling that the store is not clean enough?  Also they don't have any organic produce at all! The good thing is their bread - freshly made and very tasty!

51.description: Every trip to this store is almost a guarantee that it will provide some form of entertainment. Last trip here, the cashier was complaining that her manager told her she needs to make eye contact with the customers. Another previous trip, I saw an eaten chicken bone sitting on shelves next to the cereal...This store is disgusting. IF they have the item you're looking for, the prices are so inflated it's ridiculous. Their little "specials"? Yeah, what a joke. Employees are usually talking about some topic you don't want to hear about. Like one time the cashier talking to the bagger about her previous night encounter.Every time I come to this store it makes me want to vomit--and leave the city.

27.description: I've only been to this Jewel twice.   But I am a semi-regular suburban Jewel shopper.  This locaiton reminds me more of a whole foods or an upscale grocery store, than the suburban Jewels.   You walk in and they have a lot more prepared foods - sushi, olive bar, great selection of cheeses, lots of grab and go.  Everything just looks more upscale and classy.  I've had lots of luck with running in and picking up a few snack like items to bring to an event.   Great parking lot too!

32.description: Remodeled upstairs with large selection of alcohol. Conveniently located and has ample parking space. There is usually a security guard outside to help regulate flow and keep people safe hopefully! Interior is like any other typical jewel with no extra flare or design. Prices are comparable to Dominick's and they sell their own brand called essentials or another cheap brand called shoppers value. Overall a good location. I usually check out myself, but this jewel can get busy because of its prime location so be ready to be walking through small aisles trying to squeeze past people.

54.description: Messy... Unorganized and lacking good produce. Ugh... Limited parking and all over a pain in the arse.

48.description: Having grown up in suburban Chicago, I'm a fan of Jewel - but Becca S. nails it when she says not all Jewels are the same. This particular store is much too cramped - the aisles are small, the selection is about half of what you might see in a suburban store, and the staff is unpleasant.This location always seems to be rearranging and/or removing items so it can be a challenge to find what you're looking for. I often think the shelves look a bit picked-over, and there have been several occasions where an item I need is sold-out.The photo and alcohol departments are housed on the second level, which means you have to take an elevator if you have a cart. Pain in the rear if you just need to grab some cheap cooking wine.This store gets swamped from about 5:00 p.m. to 7:00 p.m. with people buying dinner, so expect long lines and crowded aisles if you are unfortunate enough to have to visit during that time period.

44.description: There's not much to say about a supermarket, but if I have to, I will say this:That this place is the best supermarket around!.. at midnight or later. Primarily since this place is a 24 hour location, your options quickly become reduced to one. This place is going to have a hard time competing for the quality of their products as there is a Trader Joe's opening across the street, a little further west there is a Whole Foods and Dominick's.. Another added bonus is that there is someone available at the pharmacy for counseling needs 24 hours a day as well. This is also one of the locations that have a large liquor floor.

24.description: This place has most of what you need and they tend to have great deals... Just don't ever eat from the buffet.  I saw a woman taking stuff and putting it back. GROSS!

7.description: Most people have been to a Jewel. It has one of the best bakeries for a grocery store ( strawberry torte is my favorite cake of all time). They also have a lot of fresh fruits and vegetables. I usually don't get bruised produce from them. Their hot foods are pretty good, especially the chicken wings. The one thing I don't like about this Jewel is there a lot of creepy and strange people. Some are talking violently to themselves or are in your face asking for money. It is Chicago, so it should be expected but I would think the store would take some precautions like have a security guard on duty.

49.description: I love this Jewel location. Whenever I have a transit pass and I'd like to do some grocery shopping, this Jewel store is always the first destination to take care of shopping for groceries.What is it that I love about this Jewel? I'm going to list the things I love about it. Here we go:1 Great customer service2 Sushi (oh that always lures me)3 Great prices on everything inside the store regardless of this location's surroundings.4 Clean and easy to navigate5 No evil fellow shoppers here6 Huge selection of food items that I can't and won't find at grocery stores, including other Jewels, here on the south side of the city.7 For you liquor fans, I'm not one, the liquor is on the second floor, so, if you're worried about dropping your booze while walking down the stairs of this Jewel with it, then this place is not for you. Sorry.

40.description: I would not normally review a Jewel but I want to send props out to the older Asian lady who works the flower section. She always takes extra time to put the flowers together nicely, even swapping out droopy or dying buds in a big arrangement.  Wraps everything extra nice.  She cares more than she has to.And of course cause it is Jewel the flowers are fresh cause of their high volume just like all its produce.  Jewel is one of those places it's easy to complain about but who has better food at mid-range prices, huge variety and fresh? Jewel.The negative here of course is the crowd but it's not Jewel's fault that so many are drunk, strung out, slowwwwe in line, or generally unaware of surroundings that's just part of the deal.

53.description: I hate this place.  I will drive 5 miles down the road vs. coming here.I am a big fan of dominicks on canal street.  Much bigger parking lot, Much bigger store, Much friendlier staff.  A lot less chaos.Period.

30.description: Only if I can't get certain things at Trader Joe's and only if I'm desperate. We bought pork ribs there, Hormel, packaged straight from the manufacturer. Two-for-one? Ok cool, I can do that. Prices ranged from $22-26 per package (a whole rack of ribs plus some extra meat). They were delicious, cooked up perfect, blah blah.Forward a week to trips to both Mariano's and Target only to find - the SAME EXACT PRODUCT for.... wait for it... $6-$8. Let it sink in. Just... let it wash over you. Feel that? That's blind rage, kids. I emailed Jewel corporate to point out their casual extortion and express my discontent [sic] and received a "we price fair/get over it"-style email in response. Jewel, I hate your face.

46.description: Would I buy produce from here?  Probably not.  Would I buy soda, chips, and toothpaste here?  Definitely.  This is not the greatest, cleanest, freshest grocery store but it certainly fits the bill to pick up a few things.  I think the employees are friendly enough, but some of the people who shop there are a bit off.

1.description: I don't know what short bus was hijacked to populate this village of stupid, but some web toed HR genius hit the single digit IQ jackpot. Eternal and infernal checkout lines staphed by cashier creatures that would rather you not inconvenience them with your silly grocery purchase thankyouverymuch, drooling stock creatures with Appalachian eyes who couldn't distinguish a baby carrot from what lies in the dark void of their trousers and prices that would cause even the most ardent of Whole Foods drones to take pause make for an experience that only Rod Serling could conjure.Run, don't walk, away from this den of retardation.

55.description: You think all Jewels are the same but they aren't. I got everything I need, but I have never had a good experience here. The parking lot is a nightmare and the people are jerks. Okay, probably not all of them. I stopped in tonight for a few things around 8 PM. There were 2 people in front of me in line. The first woman said "do you give out the stickers here?" and the checker replied "You'll get them at the end" so the woman retorted "Okay, so that's a yes?" She got a dirty look, and as soon as the woman was out of ear shot the checker began reenacting the interaction with the bagger the altercation, and announcing all the things she *wanted* to say to her, but lamenting that she seemed like the kind of woman who'd report it. The next person in line in front of me had forgotten her Jewel card. The checker said she couldn't put one in for her. Have you ever heard of that? I've forgotten my car dozens of times, they always put in a card. I offered up my card to the person in front of me, and the woman said she couldn't put in my card for someone else unless we lived together. Oh please. Similar annoyances occur every time I go there, so I will likely just avoid it.

9.description: I don't get the 2.5 star average for Jewel-Osco. I haven't died from the food here, yet. If you live in the area, sometimes you get a 10% off coupon for no reason. It's a grocery store. What are you expecting? I can buy a 4-pack of Gilbert's Sausages here for $4 sometimes, when Gilbert's Sausages are a Red Hot Deal. These are deals that last for 1-4 weeks at a time - which is why they're Red Hot.You can buy other things here, like a loaf of "French" Bread for $2. I bought one of these and it lasted for the week it took me to eat it, while it was in my fridge.You can even buy a Crush Orange or 7-up cake here. I have not tried it yet and have no plans, but if you do try it, by all means post a review.Sometimes it seems like things are slightly more expensive than Trader Joe's across the street, which seems counterintuitive to me. Anyways, if you want to overpay for watermelon or almonds, come to this Jewel.

26.description: The only nice thing about this Jewel is their location. They recently remodeled the inside, but the remodel wasn't anything amazing. The selection is okay, nothing spectacular. The prices here can be pricey depending on what items you are buying. Why the two stars when everything sounds just ok? Their customer service is horrible. It takes forever to flag someone down for a question. If you are able to find a person they seem a little annoyed they've to help you. Don't even get me started on the cashiers! I brought my own bag and put it on their tiny counter (the check out counters are now 2 feet long) in their express lane. Keep in mind I only had less than 6 items. The cashier stared at me and rolled her eyes then proceeded to ask me rudely " Are you going to unload your bag or what?" I apologized and put my items out. I paid for my groceries and instead of putting back the items in my bag she left it on the counter. I was confused since she bagged the guy's groceries before mine and that is what they normally do. So I asked "umm...are customers suppose to bag their own stuff?" The cashier rolled her eyes at me and scoffed and just kept staring at me. Then she asked me again rudely "Are you going to bag your stuff or what?" I save your money and go somewhere else...nobody got time for rude people.

25.description: Ghetto Customer service at times. There are some nice people that work here but most feel like they are doin you a favor, like Lou Gossett Jr at the Chicken Hut!  Does he really hv the nerve to get an attitude when asked is the chicken fresh?

12.description: This Jewel is the epitome of why the Yelp system of being unable to give zero stars is flawed. Time and time again we have been plagued by rude customer service, over-inflated prices, outdated items, and an overall terrible grocery shopping experience with routine check out line wait times in excess of 30 minutes. Please consider starving and not buying food to eat before considering shopping here.

59.description: I visit this store probably 4-5 times a week and I have mixed feelings about this location.  I hope a manager reads this.1.  Fried chicken bar, but no salad bar?  Perhaps downsize the enormous cheese section and make room for one?2.  AWESOME pumpkin pies and German Chocolate Cake.  3. Fresh salmon selection is always spotty.  Lately it's been nothing but the color added farm raised kind.  Gross.  4.  $3 Milk?  I can get that anywhere.  Why no deals on milk, ever?  5.  Deli ladies...I think I've gotten a half pound every time I've asked for a pound.  Every time.

21.description: This place is terrible.  The employees are rude and there are unpleasant customers as well.  I refuse to ever shop here again.

17.description: Employees are downright mean, nasty and onry. I was at the deli. I was asked what I wanted and told I had 2 minutes to make up my mind. Several minutes later the person returned and said " Well have you made up your mind yet?"Wait! I thought I was the customer here? Never coming back. Marianos is the place to go in this area for us. Prices are much more reasonable and the employees are helpful and pleasant!!!

10.description: Make sure your car is locked, don't look anyone in the eye nor "exchange words" with them either.And don't look up either! It's pigeon poo hell right at the L tracks.

5.description: Four stars because they do have a very friendly customer service staff. This Jewels is very busy and it's hard to get things done in here. It's not very big and you have to be patience with this Jewels. They have the sales that the ads advertise and they have a chicken wing station which I think is a nice touch. I wouldn't come here too often just because it's just crazy to shop in there.

3.description: I stop by here every morning with my own plastic bag forgot it this morning they actually said I can't have one unless I purchase a larger black one just seems moronic yo me I will be shopping Marianos much more now never had a bullshit experience there like  at Jewel

35.description: This is open 24/7, which is great when you want to grab last minute things or get out of work late and you need groceries. However, this sucks when you go inside and you find homeless people hiding in the bathroom. They have their own parking lot, which is great. The selection of food that they have inside is good.

19.description: Honey Tenders! I love their deli, the wings are incredible, the sliced turkey is great... love it. This is my go to spot, plus their open overnight. While I never feel all the way safe running around the city after 2am, this parking lot is at least well lit, so you can keep your eyes open. I love this place. Highly recommended.

28.description: I like this jewel a lot. It's super convenient, lots of parking available and it's open 24 hours a day. I always come to this location to get all my groceries. They have everything I need, just a little more expensive. Come here at least twice a week

45.description: Good Lord do not go to this Jewel. Please take the extra 5 minutes and drive over the bridge to Dominick's! I sincerely hope this place closes down so they can build a big fancy restaurant. BAD QUALITIES OF THIS JEWEL:1.HORRIBLE customer service: Many times they will be standing around TALKING and customers will have to go through the self-serve check-out line. Sure, whatever, dude. It's only your fucking job.2. Too skinny of aisles (which has been mentioned in many reviews). 3. They keep changing the fucking layout around! What was in aisle three Monday will be in aisle five Friday. 4. The parking lot sucks and there is no goddamn security.5. It's a fucking Jewel! What do you expect, a miracle? They suck all over! In the memebase.com of life, Jewel-Osco is the Scumbag Steve.

33.description: Close to where I live, gets the job done, and I love that they bag your groceries for you. Lines are typically long because they never open enough registers and it seems like every time I want meat at the deli counter, everyone and their brother does too.Will continue to frequent here because it serves its purpose.

43.description: [Updated 2011.09.29] - I should give this two stars now since it is a little less crowded now that Trader Joe's opened across the street. But then again I went again today and reconfirmed why it is a 1 star.[2011.05.23] - This place is always way to crowded and the service is horrendous.  If your employee is watching the self-checkout ... please provide them the proper training for using them and troubleshooting them.  Also, if you want to get something from the deli; it should not take over 30 minutes to get 1/2 pound of sandwich meat.  I can't wait until Trader Joes moves in across the street.

2.description: After continued disappointments, I have had my fill of this Jewel. When I first moved to the neighborhood a few years ago, it was a pleasant place to shop. These days it always seems to be a frustrating experience. Self-service checkouts removed:  One of the previous highlights was the ability with self-checkout to zip in and out of the store when coming come from work and needing just a few things. Granted, there were the occasional novice shoppers who jammed up the lines, but for the most part you could be in and out with minimal fuss. Today, those self-checkout lanes are removed and replaced with shortened express lanes with inattentive cashiers. I am all for giving folks cashier jobs (my single mother supported us with her grocery clerk job), but rarely are all of these lanes open and when they are, they are staffed with employees who clearly don't want to be there. Further, there is scarcely enough counter room to place your handbasket to empty it and then you don't know where to put it afterward.  And of course having the cashier take it for you would be too courteous. It's just a logistical hassle and makes me avoid shopping there for quick trips. Erratic pricing:  It used to be you could assume Jewel had the cheapest prices in the neighborhood. But now with Target and Mariano's within a few blocks, you have to be very careful and comparison shop. For example, there is a common frozen food item that has an everyday price 60% higher at Jewel than the everyday price at Mariano's. Truly exorbitant for no reason. And trust me, that is just one example. Don't get me started on non-food items.Questionable quality of "fresh" items:  If you like spongy nectarines, kale that wilts in two days and "fresh baked" pastries so stale that they actually crunch when you bite into them, head over to this Jewel.  For me, the straw that broke the camel's back was this morning when I bought a tray of cinnamon rolls with a purchase by date two days from now. I could drive in nails with them, they were so old.  Totally disgusting and inedible. Even though its location is very convenient for me, this Jewel continues to disappoint. Take your precious time and money elsewhere.

18.description: Finally after all these years(a decade) the Floral department has someone who can understand the customers needs. I picked an orchid plant to gift a friend and the new hire Jocelyn did an awesome job gift wrapping with a bow. Good to have some excellent customer service.

41.description: Jewel is bla... It's expensive groceries with some deals on some stuff. Go to Trader Joes first then walk over here and get whatever it is you want that Joes didn't have. Would you like a nice cultural experience??? Go here midweek during the day. It's fascinating. Perhaps from my ivory tower office and my high rise apartment I didn't notice what neighborhood I lived in... Seriously... I never knew what a LINK card was until the 5 people in front of me in line used them. nonetheless they all had something to complain about. I suppose it's a great time to go shopping when everyone else in the world is working but that's another essay. Like I said Joe's first, Whole foods if your a millionaire, then Jewel and Dominicks to switch it up and keep it fresh.

52.description: Nice bathroom, but I cannot believe that they do not have a service to jump start a vehicle parked in their parking lot. Last night when I asked customer service he said "I can get you a number to a tow truck". Really?????? Security was nice and tried to help. We ended up waiting about 15 minutes for the people that were parked next to us and they gave us a jump. Thanks guys!!!

50.description: I agree with some of the other reviews that the store is small and that is not the best. The ailses are small, the parking lot as well. But it is right under the green and orange lines for the cta and not far from several cta express routes and metra as well so that is plus. They also have a lot of things with are far cheaper than some other stores. Another thing is the fact that they carry merchandise that other stores do not carry. The hot food section is also another plus.

4.description: The selection here is pretty basic. If Marianos was within walking distance, I would go there instead. Prices are high and their salad bar is not all that. Lines always take too long and the employees look angry all the time. Oh and by the way, Tell your employees to pull up their pants. I don't need to see their underwear at the checkout counter.

6.description: It's fine. It's a grocery store so I'm not expecting too much, and they're really not missing too much.Like I said, it's a grocery store. The stock seems to be fine, the fresh foods, produce and fruits are always good, and they have a nice bakery.Two stars is for the employees. To say it's hit-or-miss is a tad generous, as they mostly miss. You don't have to throw rose petals down as I walk, or interview me about my day, or smile like an insane person. But it might be nice if my "hello" was returned. It might further be nice if you stopped talking to other employees while I'm standing there. Sometimes these things happen. Generally, they do not.

22.description: Finally after all these years(a decade) the Floral department has someone who can understand the customers needs. I picked an orchid plant to gift a friend and the new hire Jocelyn did an awesome job gift wrapping with a bow. Good to have some excellent customer service.

15.description: I'm not sure why this Jewel is so busy, when it seems significantly more expensive than Mariano's and Trader Joe's, both of which are nearby.  (proximity to the train and bus may have something to do with it.)  Pluses for me: variety of foods.  Negatives for me: price and tight parking lot.  I went in today after several months, and the store looks run down.  Plus the check out aisles are so crowded with extra merchandise that it feels like checking out in a tunnel.  Just average, not a go-to by any means.

57.description: Always Crowded, People that work there are always rude no matter what day of the week, Parking lot constant nightmare!

20.description: I don't get the 2.5 star average for Jewel-Osco. I haven't died from the food here, yet. If you live in the area, sometimes you get a 10% off coupon for no reason. It's a grocery store. What are you expecting? I can buy a 4-pack of Gilbert's Sausages here for $4 sometimes, when Gilbert's Sausages are a Red Hot Deal. These are deals that last for 1-4 weeks at a time - which is why they're Red Hot.You can buy other things here, like a loaf of "French" Bread for $2. I bought one of these and it lasted for the week it took me to eat it, while it was in my fridge.You can even buy a Crush Orange or 7-up cake here. I have not tried it yet and have no plans, but if you do try it, by all means post a review.Sometimes it seems like things are slightly more expensive than Trader Joe's across the street, which seems counterintuitive to me. Anyways, if you want to overpay for watermelon or almonds, come to this Jewel.

36.description: Was a little surprised about all the negative reviews at this local Jewel. Security in the parking lot I think has improved - there's usually security standing around when I'm walking there, and I've heard yelling and screaming from suspected shoplifters arguing with security, so security must be doing their job.Sure, there are many other options here in the South Loop now that might be rated higher (Whole Foods, Trader Joe's, Dominick's) and be cleaner/nicer, but I stop by this Jewel because its an easy hop and skip from my place. Sure, the lines can get kind of long sometimes, but this is usually dependable for somewhat reasonable prices and a good selection of groceries.

14.description: This Jewel location is good for what it is. The produce, meat, and overall selection are all good. The prices are ok, but slightly higher than the rest of the area. Nothing great about this place.Mariano's and Trader Joes are both viable options is you have a car in the area. I find Jewel to have the highest average prices and lower average quality.

58.description: We ate lunch on the rooftop patio today and had an excellent experience. Our waiter, Jerry, provided great service- incredibly nice and attentive. The super 6 pizza was cooked to perfection! Will definitely be back!

56.description: I tried this new place in my hood today. I was expecting a very average pizza because being so new, it looked so commercial, rather than mom and pop.I was by myself, so I went with the 6 inch personal pizza.  It was surprisingly delicious. Crispy, perfect crust, and sauce a bit sweet. I loved it!My only complaint is that I added 2 toppings which cost an additional dollar per topping. The pizza was already 6 bucks to begin with, and adding a few teaspoons of topping on that little guy brought it to almost $9 before tip, and I was not stuffed. That's about equal to a slice at many restaurants.Service was good, place is clean. Im going with a bigger group next time so I can eat more.

29.description: Has ANYONE noticed that this location uses pure mozzarella (bad) instead of the normal aurelios cheese blend? Why change a good thing? Why are you the only location that does this?  Please fix this aberration

42.description: I grew up in the south suburbs where Aurelios pizza was and is a fixture.  The Homewood location  was the place  to be after football games when I was in high school.  Since moving to the South Loop from the south burbs. I struggled to find a thin crust pizza that could compare to Aurelios (yes I have tried Lou Malnati's and they are tasty but not my Aurelios).  So imagine my sheer delight when I discovered that my beloved pizza joint was moving in literally steps from my home. I could not wait for them to open!  My husband and I finally took the kids there this past Thursday and the pizza was delicious!  The staff was super friendly and the upper terrace was perfect. This Southland girl is very happy to have an unpretentious piece of home in the South Loop! Thank you Thank you Aurelios!

23.description: There was a homeless man hanging outside this restaurant watching TV mounted in their outdoor seating area. He was blocking the entrance and looked so creepy, I lost my appetite and didn't even go in here. This restaurant needs to do a better job of having an appealing environment, not crowded outside by leery disgusting guys, yuck ! I wanted to try out their pizza on my way home from work, but don't think I will ever go back unless they get rid of the homeless guys outside.

47.description: Stopped by Aurelio's for an early dinner yesterday, and had an okay experience. I really loved the upstairs outdoor seating and the service was good, but I was not blown away by this place. The pizza was decent, with a nice crust and a good amount of cheese, but it didn't blow my mind. I will say the garlic bread was amazing though! I ended up spending around $40 for garlic bread, a large 2-topping pizza, and a lemonade, which I thought was a bit pricey. Also, I was given a paper bag and a piece of cardboard to take my leftover pizza home in, and the bag was definitely not grease-proof-- very inconvenient! I might come here again for the convenience of being close to work, but wouldn't make a trip out of my way for it.

8.description: I was hesitant to come given the mixed reviews but I actually thought the pizza was pretty good. Last Thursday was the last bears preseason game and football and pizza are an obvious fit so I got the number 17 (sausage and hot peppers) to go. I should note that the girl who took my order and who I picked up the pizza from could not have been nicer and that always makes the overall experience better. It's not the best pizza in Chicago by any stretch of the imagination but it was good and I thought the space was cool.

31.description: pizza is delicious....still brand new, doesn't have that hometown feel to it, but I believe that will come. still very new and sems like walking on eggshells, but food and staff god enough to figure out what works in time.

34.description: Did somebody say salty? Holy crap, do these people own stock in Morton? I had a 'lil pizza which I could only eat half of because I was pretty sure that I would have a stroke if I finished it. Yuck.

16.description: We did delivery and it worked out great.  Took about an hour- food came hot, salad came fresh.  Pizza was good!

13.description: We decided to stop in at Aurelio's after learning they hadn't started delivery yet. They place is big with two dining rooms and two level patio. And there are TV's everywhere. It's impossible not to be looking at one.  Service was decent but they appeared to be heavily overs staffed. As for the pizza...meh. I was hoping for a "midwest" style thin crust, similar to Donato's but it wasn't. While it is better than Lou Malniti's thin crust, I've had much better thin crust pizza.  I liked the crispy edges but the pizza was pretty greasy.  We also tried the tomato bread. On the website, it shows the tomato on a corner piece of bread with a little mozzarella on top.  However, our bread was literally draped in mozzarella with a small slice of tomato completely covered by the mozzarella. Once again, an opportunity to have a decent restaurant in the sloop is wasted. We keep getting mediocre burger & pizza places while better places are killing themselves to open in the West Loop. This space could have been put to better use

11.description: Just went back cause I was having a pizza attack! I walked out feeling sauced (pizza sauce that is). This place is still my fav, I'm sure it will stay that way. Download the app and rack up some points to cash in for credit off your bill, has a funny video game attached, how can you go wrong? Seriously how can you go wrong?

39.description: When a friend suggested eating pizza at the popular chain from the Chicagoland suburbs, I said sure. The new outpost near my home in the South Loop is a perfect spot, though perhaps a bit hard to get to if you are driving -- but right across the street from the Roosevelt L station. We ordered The Works (pepperoni, sausage, Canadian bacon, green peppers and mushrooms), and it was surprisingly good! The best parts were the buttery crust and the grated Parmesan on top that made a nice crispy layer. I split a large with my friend, and there was more than enough. He's an 18-year-old young man, who took a third of it home.The service was friendly, and the wait was reasonable during our visit on a Friday after 1 p.m. Can't say whether they perform well under pressure. However, I would definitely get Aurelio's to go or take friends there again.

37.description: Takes a long time to order. I just ordered  a small sauage pozza an s was told 15 minutes its almost 30  minutes and waiting.  Please dont wasre your time here.

0.description: Although not as good as the original, still a great option for pizza in the city. It's not your traditional deep dish - they have stuffed and thin crust, and I highly recommend the thin. The chicken alfredo pizza from here is amazing, and their pepperoni comes in a close second.The restaurant is spacious enough inside, there's a couple different rooms to dine in, and a bar area. They also have a lunch special where you can get a drink and a personal pizza for $8. Glad they added this place to the neighborhood, but if you ever make it out to the burbs, I still recommend the original location.

38.description: Lazy Sunday...with no pizza from Aurelio's. They only deliver until 3:30...who orders pizza delivery in the afternoon on a Sunday before 3:30??? Really, this one makes no sense to me! Wait...pizza breakfast is delicious so scratch that (although I doubt they deliver early either). There is no where to park to pick up on Roosevelt so this is going to be a big pass for me-only because they make it so difficult to actually get their pizza! I guess they are going for the tourist crowd and not catering to people that live in the neighborhood outside of easy walking distance-good luck with that!

51.description: Tried this place because it's near to my house.   Overpriced, salty pizza, poor service!!!   I called ahead to place my order for pick up. I repeated the order twice to the lady on the phone.  When I got there, they still messed up the order.  I waited for 20 more minutes to get my order and I had to ask the girl in front to check if my order is ready.  It ended up, it's already ready and they just forgot about it.  Now, there were three people in front, 2 were playing on their phones, it's in the mid afternoon and there were not a lot of customers.  So the lack of attention is unforgivable.  The girl who finally gave me my order apologized but I will never go back to this place again.  For better pizza and service, I recommend walking just a block south to Giordano's or Flo and Santos!  Awesome pizza!!!  No thanks Aurelio's!!!

27.description: When you've had just about enough of Toppers this is the place to go! Pizza is amazing.  For a side I would strongly recommend the fried ravioli.Now if only someone would remind staff that Carry out salads do not belong in the warming oven. Nothing like steamy lettuce to go along with the delicious pizza.

32.description: I was excited that Aurelio's finally opened after all the hype in the area but ... nope.1. You can only order delivery through GrubHub - I called because I wanted to customize something and was redirected to the internets. The person on the phone assured me though that she'd take note of my request even after I submitted my order online - didn't happen. (Honestly I just wanted some extra sauce for my wings, man. How is this not an option?)1a. The Grubhub-only thing is also a bummer because Aurelio's has some sort of rewards system and I got $2.50 instantly for downloading the app and creating an account which I couldn't redeem because...GrubHub. The app tells me I can redeem by being there in person or by being "on the phone placing your order", but as I've already mentioned...ok I'm tired of writing about this. I will say though that the person on the phone was not concerned about this at all. I know $2.50 isn't much, but come on.2. Four pieces of your standard garlic bread is $5. Five whole dollars.3. In my humble opinion, the pizza is overpriced and yes, oversalted. Others mentioned this and I didn't believe it - I love salt! I am here to tell you that Aurelio's loves it even more than me, which is a lot. Believe it.3.5. Blue cheese dressing comes in a Kraft packet. My two-topping pizza was like $27. Are you for real?A large and very salty pizza, unremarkable garlic bread, some wings and a packet of Kraft dressing ran me about $50 (including tax, tip & delivery). Is that standard? I don't know, but I wasn't feeling it at that price. I mean it wasn't The Worst, but I'll definitely be sticking with Lou's.

54.description: When we arrived, a waitress offered us a table in the outdoor sitting area which was pretty nice, but we waited for about 25mins and nobody showed up to take our order. Finally I had to call another waiter who was serving the table next to ours. He politely apologized and took our order immediately, and after that he gave us a 20% discount to compensate for the long wait.This place was full of loud families and children, and might not be the best choice for people who are looking for a quiet place.Other than that, the food and service was really good.

48.description: On top of this being one of the best pizza's I've ever eaten, our server was seriously amazing. he was extremely helpful considering we were from out of town. The place looks SO nice, I was thinking it would be really expensive but prices were reasonable. Especially considering how great the food & service was. It was all around really great! Highly suggest.

44.description: I just walked to this place around 7 pm from my condo in South Loop. I was alone and asked the staff for a seat in the patio, either upstairs or down stairs. There were three ladies at the reception and all of them told that there was no seating available. They did not even tell me the wait time. As I walked around the place, I was able to see at least 3 tables empty. As I walked back and brought this to their attention, I was told that they were just became available and not ready until cleaned. When I requested to talk to the manager, he repeated the same thing. As I confronted him that he is not telling the truth, he told the waitress to seat me. As I sat in the upstairs patio, clearly there were 4 tables cleaned and ready to be occupied.  I am not sure why these people behaved in such a manner . Either it is because I am alone and they do not want to give the full table for one person or I look different ( I am an Indian) and they do not encourage people who look different ( skin color). The latter seems to be the case as I have seen a local american walking alone and was offered a seat. Be ware of the attitude of this place if you are some one like me. This place just opened and I thought that they should be welcoming people with open arms to increase business. There is no justification for their behavior and I am really upset !!!

24.description: Pizza is fine, but the prices are really high. I mean two toppings is roughly $40 high.Also, have yet to have a good experience with people working the front - misplaced orders, not calling when it is ready after taking my number etc.With a giordanos and Lou malnatis within blocks, you're better off going there.

7.description: Stopped by Aurelio's for an early dinner yesterday, and had an okay experience. I really loved the upstairs outdoor seating and the service was good, but I was not blown away by this place. The pizza was decent, with a nice crust and a good amount of cheese, but it didn't blow my mind. I will say the garlic bread was amazing though! I ended up spending around $40 for garlic bread, a large 2-topping pizza, and a lemonade, which I thought was a bit pricey. Also, I was given a paper bag and a piece of cardboard to take my leftover pizza home in, and the bag was definitely not grease-proof-- very inconvenient! I might come here again for the convenience of being close to work, but wouldn't make a trip out of my way for it.

49.description: Good pizza , very friendly bartender , I had a good experience . Thank you and I will be back

40.description: Great pizza and a friendly staff , but I have to say I had the best dessert ever!! It was a warn chocolate chip cookie with heaping scoops of gelato  ,whipped cream, chocolate chips  topped with fudge. It was to die for! It is a must try.

53.description: Fantastic pizza & service. Loved the pizza!! Kid friendly too. You owe it to yourself to visit this establishment!!

30.description: I was hesitant to come given the mixed reviews but I actually thought the pizza was pretty good. Last Thursday was the last bears preseason game and football and pizza are an obvious fit so I got the number 17 (sausage and hot peppers) to go. I should note that the girl who took my order and who I picked up the pizza from could not have been nicer and that always makes the overall experience better. It's not the best pizza in Chicago by any stretch of the imagination but it was good and I thought the space was cool.

46.description: We had the bruschetta which was great and the spinach, mushroom and tomato pizza which was FAAAAAABULOUS. Super yummy.

1.description: The pizza is decent, not enough sauce.  The more important thing is that it's too expensive for what you get.   The price, quality and quantity is much better if you go a few blocks south to Flo & Santos or Giordanos.On a brighter note, the outside patio here seems pretty cool.

55.description: Ohh, Aurelio's. I wish I knew how to quit you.(dramatic pause)Proceed. Look, after being under construction since the great Chicago fire, Aurelio's opened a few weeks ago. And today I checked it out. The place looks great. Lots of cool sports memorabilia on the walls. Sweet bar. Outdoor patio area if that's your thing. Whatever. It's the pizza that everyone cares about, and the pizza is excellent. Considering I live right above this joint, it's almost too excellent. I'm not guaranteeing that Maury Povich will definitely be showing up with a forklift and a flatbed to haul me out of my apartment in a year, but if it does happen, I pre-blame Aurelio's. I probably have to move now because of a damn pizza parlor. For now you'll have to dine in or pick up (what I did) but it's well worth it.

9.description: Ohh, Aurelio's. I wish I knew how to quit you.(dramatic pause)Proceed. Look, after being under construction since the great Chicago fire, Aurelio's opened a few weeks ago. And today I checked it out. The place looks great. Lots of cool sports memorabilia on the walls. Sweet bar. Outdoor patio area if that's your thing. Whatever. It's the pizza that everyone cares about, and the pizza is excellent. Considering I live right above this joint, it's almost too excellent. I'm not guaranteeing that Maury Povich will definitely be showing up with a forklift and a flatbed to haul me out of my apartment in a year, but if it does happen, I pre-blame Aurelio's. I probably have to move now because of a damn pizza parlor. For now you'll have to dine in or pick up (what I did) but it's well worth it.

26.description: My wife and I were excited about the opening of Aurelios. I had Aurelios a few times as a kid and my wife just discovered them last year. Now on to the review. Let me start by saying that since they opened, my credit card statement indicates that we place an order from there every 8.3 days. Their thin crust pizza is their specialty and is what we typically order. The crust is perfect but I think the sauce is what makes their pizza special. It has a slight hint of sweetness while having a great tangy flavor. It's balanced perfectly.  Their toppings taste fresh and their sausage and pepperoni are delicious.  Aurelios,  we'll see you in 8.3 days.

25.description: This is my second negative pizza ordering experience in a week. I will never stray from Connie's or Lou's again.We've had Aurelio's before and it was fine. Today? All the food we actually got arrived cold. I live on Clark and Roosevelt, and this store is on Michigan and Roosevelt. That's 6 blocks. And, they didn't send my salad... since they deliver through Grubhub, the driver didn't want to bring it to me, and no less than 3 people said they would just credit my bill for the salad. IT'S MY DINNER; I don't want a credit, I want my food. The salad just came, and the woman who brought it was very nice and apologetic, but it came without any salad dressing. I mean this whole thing has just been a comedy of errors. The salad thing is an anomaly (and they did ultimately comp it), but the food arriving cold is unacceptable. BOO

12.description: Really good thin crust, but it was a bit salty for my taste. It also could have used more cheese. With that said, it was very good and I'll probably go back. It is a bit pricey for pub style pizza, and they give you two pieces of wax paper and a bag if you want to take leftovers home... All and all it is a good spot to watch sports, full bar, and a pretty solid menu that I look forward to exploring.I hope the owner switches to to-go boxes eventually though.

59.description: We approached the restaurant to find an overwhelming number of hostesses, one of which proceeded to lead us to our wobbly ass table. We asked what the house specialties were and we were told that not only that the stuffed pizza was stupendous (it was terrible), but that it out classed Lou Malnati's. I've never met a least trustworthy human being in my life. To make things worse, they don't even serve pitchers of beer. Shitty beer, like coors. And when I ordered my Rocky Mountain delight they poured it out of my ice cold glass into a Luke warm stale ass plastic cup. Disgusting. So basically what I'm saying is the pizza is of such a poor quality that i wouldn't feed my dog the leftovers. Because I  love my dog. I don't want my dog to die. And on top of that the service was shit.

21.description: I'm not terribly picky about pizza but the pizza I had from Aurelio's was inedible.  The thin crust was soggy,  the cheese was greasy and there was virtually no sauce.  I will never eat there again.   It actually makes me feel sick thinking about how it tasted.

17.description: The sauce was a bit thin. Best part of the pie was the sausage. They are overpriced based on quality.The sauce is touted as awesome, but it's only about a C+. Giordano's is a block south and is a better pie and better value. Sorry Aurelio's, this native born south sider lost that loving feeling.

10.description: Waited over 2 hours for delivery and they gave us moldy bread....don't wste your time here

5.description: $26 for two Buffalo Trace on the rocks; a low grade whiskey. Does this sound right? Luis, the manager, refused to help us. Thanks, Luis! I'm never coming back.

3.description: Good pizza, chill atmosphere, kind service.  Not too much more to be said here!  Nothing super special, but still a solid addition to the South Loop.

35.description: Best pizza in the City in my opinion! Don't waste time at the over marketed pseudo chains like Giordanos, Malnatis, or Gino's...Aurelio's is the BEST! And you don't walk out feeling like you just paid Gibson prices. This is a sleeper and for selfish reasons I hope it stays under the radar. But I hope it does survive because there isn't a lot of advertising and it's in a pretty high rent location. Try this place and I guarantee you will make it a must do Chicago spot!

19.description: When you've had just about enough of Toppers this is the place to go! Pizza is amazing.  For a side I would strongly recommend the fried ravioli.Now if only someone would remind staff that Carry out salads do not belong in the warming oven. Nothing like steamy lettuce to go along with the delicious pizza.

28.description: I really enjoy Aurelios. It has great pizza and is always quality. One of the best pizza spots in Chicago.This location is very confusing. Although it is new, they still do not have their delivery system figured out. Sometimes the driver is there, sometimes they are gone for the day, therefore you have to use Grubhub. Very frustrating. Also, a lunch buffet would be an excellent addition to this location.

45.description: Aurelio's has some of the best pizza in Chicago, and I have been to many places during my 20 years living here. Some people may not agree with me, but their catchphrase "Aurelio's is pizza" seems pretty accurate. Their pizza has a crisp yet buttery crust, loads of cheese, and has probably the best tomato sauce I've had on a thin crust. You can tell they use quality ingredients and put care and effort into their pizza. And it's worth it. I've been here quite a few times since they opened a short while ago, and I would probably eat here every other day if I could afford it. Plus it's at such a convenient location, right next to the Roosevelt train stop, just south of downtown. So I would definitely recommend it. It may not be your type of pizza, but you should at least give it a taste, and you might end up loving it.

33.description: Great tasting pizza and prompt delivery. Toppings are high quality too.  I would consider this some of the best thin crust in town.

43.description: As a South Loop resident, we were very excited for this pizzeria to open. We have been several times and the staff is great here, very attentive. The pizza and sandwiches are good, too. I was not impressed with the creamy garlic salad dressing; tasted like glorified mayonnaise. The 3 stars is really for the lack of a children's menu. A pizzeria with a tagline "family pizzeria" should really have offerings for young children. The half order of pasta is too large for young kids and leftovers aren't for everyone.

2.description: Call me juvenile, but I can't think of the name "Aurelio" without thinking of that term for a certain part of the human anatomy that has an orbiting quality and is usually more-easily observed on the fairer sex.  But juvenile turns out to be my key word for an Aurelio by any other name, in this case.It took a long time for Aurelio's to actually open this location, and I had pent-up excitement to try their thin crust. I had read a few raves about their Homewood location, and there is a dearth of good thin crust pizza south of Pat's in the South Loop, with the exception of Flo & Santo's, which is delicious but more of a specialty pizza. Not that there's anything wrong with Lou Malnati's a few blocks north, which is a high bar for any pizza, whatever the thickness. A mom and two kids were visiting, one of whom was about ten or eleven years old. Wow, it turns out that they make gluten-free people younger and younger these days. I assumed that Flo and Santo's would have a gluten-free pie. Doesn't everyone these days? No, they do not. We took the walk to try Aurelio's. I struck gold for him here. He loved the plain, gluten-free cheese pizza. The rest of us had the regular crust.Perhaps I should have asked for "extra gluten" as an ingredient for ours, because the crust on the regular pizza was pretty listless, and the sauce had little to no pizazz either. Had I been reviewing as the ten- or eleven-year-old, I'd have given Aurelio's five stars with flying tomato colors (shout out to my U of IL peeps). And for the people who grew up with Aurelio's in the 'burbs, I get it: I would probably reminisce around one of these pies once in a while as well. For myself, though, I'll just continue to giggle a little about the name as I pass by on my way to Lou's.

18.description: This is my second negative pizza ordering experience in a week. I will never stray from Connie's or Lou's again.We've had Aurelio's before and it was fine. Today? All the food we actually got arrived cold. I live on Clark and Roosevelt, and this store is on Michigan and Roosevelt. That's 6 blocks. And, they didn't send my salad... since they deliver through Grubhub, the driver didn't want to bring it to me, and no less than 3 people said they would just credit my bill for the salad. IT'S MY DINNER; I don't want a credit, I want my food. The salad just came, and the woman who brought it was very nice and apologetic, but it came without any salad dressing. I mean this whole thing has just been a comedy of errors. The salad thing is an anomaly (and they did ultimately comp it), but the food arriving cold is unacceptable. BOO

41.description: I went a few weeks back, and was very impressed by the service! A really nice staff, and expedient service. The view from the outdoor seating was great, and the food was delicious. The bruschetta was amazing, as well as the pizza. To top off the whole experience, we had a fantastic cookie cake topped with ice cream. I would definitely recommend it, and would go back again!

52.description: It's rare for me to not enjoy pizza.  I don't understand why there in so much salt in this pizza.  Is the point to make people buy more drinks?  The pizza is almost bitter.

50.description: We decided to stop in at Aurelio's after learning they hadn't started delivery yet. They place is big with two dining rooms and two level patio. And there are TV's everywhere. It's impossible not to be looking at one.  Service was decent but they appeared to be heavily overs staffed. As for the pizza...meh. I was hoping for a "midwest" style thin crust, similar to Donato's but it wasn't. While it is better than Lou Malniti's thin crust, I've had much better thin crust pizza.  I liked the crispy edges but the pizza was pretty greasy.  We also tried the tomato bread. On the website, it shows the tomato on a corner piece of bread with a little mozzarella on top.  However, our bread was literally draped in mozzarella with a small slice of tomato completely covered by the mozzarella. Once again, an opportunity to have a decent restaurant in the sloop is wasted. We keep getting mediocre burger & pizza places while better places are killing themselves to open in the West Loop. This space could have been put to better use

4.description: Finally visiting my local Aurelio's. It's literally across the street. I did have a slice one time in the summer when they were selling them off the street. I wasn't impressed when I had it. But having it today was a different story. We ordered a 'fiesta' size pizza aka XL. Half ofIt was cheese, the other half was jalapeño. It was really good. My only complaint was it has too much cheese, but eating it hot made it easier to eat. Overall, we will definitely come back and try their other dishes.

6.description: I had such refreshingly phenomenal customer service this evening, that I can completely overlook the fact that dinner & drinks for 2 set me back $90 pre-tip. I wish I had asked his name, but our server was so attentive and intuitive (without suffocating) that I wanted to hug him. Forget about how delicious the food is (it's pretty amazing)! I wasn't even aware how lacking my server experiences had been of late until I was shown the light tonight.

22.description: My boyfriend and I had high hopes for this pizza joint in the South Loop. We ordered a pick-up tonight, using the "free" appetizer with a $20 minimum purchase. When my boyfriend went to the restaurant to pick it up, he showed them the coupon, yet they forgot to give him the zucchini sticks. Then, when we got home and tried the mushroom/spinach/tomato pizza special - it was the SALTIEST pizza we have ever tasted. :'-(  Never again. No one should be eating pizza with cheese as salty as this! Such a let-down and it wasn't cheap either - almost $32.00 alone for a large pizza - after taxes. :-(

15.description: Could be good, but holy grease. The crust is good, but I felt sick after eating a slice. It seriously is really greasy and oily. Ordered sausage and it was so salty. I'll have to stick with Lou's.

57.description: Love Aurelio's

20.description: Pizza wasn't good. Service was ok.

36.description: Have been a long-time Aurelio's fan and was disappointed when their previous location in Chicago opened.  This new location is not convenient to my office, but I went anyway.  What a big, nice place!  TV's everywhere.  The pizza did not disappoint and is in the Aurelio's tradition of being "all about the sauce".  Aurelio's doesn't skimp on their toppings, and again, the secret is in the sauce.  I had a thin crust, 1/2 cheese / 1/2 pepperoni and it did not disappoint.  Great place to watch a ballgame too.  If you are a fan of thin crust pizza and in particular enjoy a pizza with a flavorful sauce.. then make your way to 1212 S Michigan Ave and enjoy the new experience!

14.description: I tried this new place in my hood today. I was expecting a very average pizza because being so new, it looked so commercial, rather than mom and pop.I was by myself, so I went with the 6 inch personal pizza.  It was surprisingly delicious. Crispy, perfect crust, and sauce a bit sweet. I loved it!My only complaint is that I added 2 toppings which cost an additional dollar per topping. The pizza was already 6 bucks to begin with, and adding a few teaspoons of topping on that little guy brought it to almost $9 before tip, and I was not stuffed. That's about equal to a slice at many restaurants.Service was good, place is clean. Im going with a bigger group next time so I can eat more.

29.description: South Loop Market is what this South Loop area needs.  The closest major grocery stores are Jewel and Target on Roosevelt, about a 10-30 minute walk away depending on where you live in the area (which is treacherous in the winter).  For city dwellers who commute via bus or foot, this is a convenient location for some basic needs.Yes this grocery store is expensive.  But you pay a premium for convenience.  If you want to do the majority of your grocery shopping on a budget, go to Jewel or Target.This store has fresh produce, alcohol, your basic grocery needs, and some more.  The store is relatively large for a corner grocery and very clean.  The staff is friendly.  There is a minimum charge to process credit; I think it's $3 or $4.I always swing by to buy items I forget at Jewel, typically fresh produce, which is reasonably priced.  It may be 25 cents more expensive, but once again, you're paying for convenience.Overall great place.  And you're supporting a local family run business too.  :)

42.description: This place has everything! Booze, soda, snacks, toiletries. Even a deli with freshly sliced meat and cheese. Need a sandwich? They'll make you one! Having the nearest grocery almost a mile away, it's nice to know that everything is in the little convenient store, only a couple blocks away. Of course, like all of them, it's a little pricey, but well worth it if you don't want to go far from home.

23.description: Not only is this place convenient, but their customer service is second to none. They've always gone out of their way for us in anything we've asked them to do or stock in the store. Thanks guys, you're the best !AJ

47.description: oh man...finally. This place is fantastic and fills a HUGE void in the South Loop. The beer selection is great, the sandwiches are amazing and they interior is done right. There is a little grocer up the street that may be out of business soon. These guys are nice and they did it right. They also are convenient...imagine that...they are open until midnight thurs-fri and 11 on mon-wed. As you can tell by my enthusiasm, I am stoked about this place!!

8.description: In passing from afar the first time, I thought this was a run-of-the-mill convenience/liquor store.  And then I walked inside.Incredibly valuable to have this place in the neighborhood.  You can seriously get anything you need and most things you don't.  How about a Boar's Head sandwich? Or an amazing selection of craft beer?  Avocado's? Fresh produce? Solid wine selection? and it goes on...It's a little more expensive, but for quick trips for a few things, you can zoom around and grab stuff in a matter of minutes versus dealing with the traffic at Jewel. SL Market does what it means to, very well.***************Yelp Binge #8

31.description: Family run, super clean, modern and yes, some items will be more expensive, but that 's why you buy what you need here.

34.description: Thanks again for not only moving into the neighborhood, but for expanding before winter hits again. These guys put the 'lazy' back into my week, saving me dreaded trips into Jewel for "Crap, I forgot that...". . Their beer selection has helped bridged the gap between Sam's closing on Roosevelt and making it over to Binny's in rush hour. Their all-too-convenient rotating selection of brews, most of which have local cred, make this place a no-brainer. See you soon -

16.description: South loop area is a food desert. Plain & simple.
