Quick list of negatives about food deserts include 1. more health issue due to lack of healthy food in the area and abundance of cheap fast food 2. preying on poverty stricken and those who relay on public assistance, because corner markets overcharge for basic  stables (hellooooo $9 cereal, milk and eggs). 3. and finally a disconnect between community and food, lack of access of quality food South loop Market is an oasis in a food desert. They have lots of quality and healthy items at very reasonable prices.

13.description: This place is pretty good. They're super expensive, but welcome to the Loop. They're nice and have good products. Over all, a good market. They also serve Intelligentsia coffee!

11.description: A blessing to this neighborhood! This convenience store truly have a little bit of everything -- and all of their selections are top-quality. They do not skimp on selection or freshness.I love coming here for a sandwich at breakfast or lunchtime instead of going to Potbelly's or Jimmy John's. They will make your sub by-order, using Boar's Head meats and cheeses. Such a treat!They also have a great selection of Labriola baked goods that are to die for. Flirty Cupcakes has some product in there as well. The only downside is that they do make their living by charging a premium. So come prepared for $7 cereal boxes and things like that. Also, no credit cards for purchases under $5.

39.description: I am so impressed with this family run business!

37.description: I LOVE South Loop Market. I am super excited about their expansion and can't wait to see it when it's bigger. I hear they have a very innovative architect working on the layout...can't wait!!!!  I love buying the fresh fruit and vegetables and also buy frozen when I need that, stopping by to get a perfectly prepared sandwich is so worth it, grabbing a beer is great to hang out and chill, or my favorite is being able to have a selection of great wines to choose from to enjoy!

0.description: I truly appreciate the convenience and availability of this South Loop mini-market!  Open late, easily assessable, well lit, and always well-stocked with a wide variety of fresh & deli meats, fresh vegetables, frozen goods, can goods and wines.  Reasonable prices and a helpful staff.  (The few times I've asked for a product they didn't already have in stock, they got it for me!)  The folks running this store care enough to always be present during operating hours (i.e., they aren't absentee owners), they care enough to listen to their customers' needs, and they stock their store according to what is needed - and not just what is most profitable! They are an important part of the South Loop community - and they are to be commended for investing in the future of this neighborhood!

38.description: I was here around lunch the other day so I decided to try out their deli; I don't remember the name of the sandwich but it was very fresh and so delicious. The bread was amazing.  The portion size was also very large, he could hardly close the sandwich.  Price-wise it was a bit on the high side, I think around 8 bucks for a sandwich but very satisfying, I really liked it and would stop here in a minute if I am hungry.

27.description: This is place is wonderful, a tad on the expensive side but not egregiously so. They recently expanded and have double the size for more refrigerated food items, dairy and produce. Their wine selection has tripled in size and though I am no sommelier, I haven't gotten a bottle that was interesting and pretty good. They are open til midnight everyday but Sunday, I believe. They've got a lot of expensive liquids that you wouldn't expect to find on display the counter. Need an avocado- they got it. Need a tub of greek yogurt-they got it. Need some lean beef for burgers-they got it. Need matzo ball soup- they got it. If you need some fresh scones or desert items- they got it. If you for some reason

32.description: South Loop Market is just what this neighborhood needed. No longer do I have to run to the larger stores to pick up staples for a picnic, grab a few cold ones, a bottle of wine or even my favorite cereal or ice cream. They have it all . . . .and I am in and out in a flash!I love that when I walk in I am always warmly greeted by whoever is standing at the checkout counter. Head to the back meat counter and you will find Boars Head meats and a range of cheeses and a friendly person to make you your favorite sandwich. Need a coffee pick me up?- it's right by the door. Their beer selection is also quite good and it rotates so you can always find something interesting to try.Sure- it's more expensive than the big grocery chains. But when I am looking for convenience when I am in the neighborhood- this is my "go to" place. And even better? I can always find parking right out front. Now that's real convenience!

48.description: With an attitude that wants to make the business work--this is a great new place for Boar's Head (only found previously by me at Treasure Island) AND the ubiquitous and needed milk, sodas...etc. Welcome addition to the neighborhood--they even had an opening celebrations (that we missed due to weather etc.) Clean, welcoming in appearance--and even carries some vegetables for the "oh I don't have a lemon or letture" moments. GOOD Luck to them and patronize them please to you.

44.description: While a convenience mart carrying the essentials fills a huge void in the neighborhood, I'm very disappointed in this place. The stars are solely for its presence and out of respect for the owner opening a small business in these times.  Unless they improve their customer service and prices, I'm not sure his gamble will pay off. I attempted to purchase a 20 ounce Coke the other day and pay with credit card. I was informed that I did not meet the proprietor's $3 minimum for credit card. As I did not have cash on me, I walked an extra 200 feet up the street to a similar establishment where I paid less for a larger (24 oz) beverage and was not hassled about swiping the plastic. Because I wanted to like South Loop Market, despite the fact that a 6 pack of Heineken or similar beer costs about $10, I mentioned this to the clerk on my walk back home. He was indifferent that he had lost business to a competitor. I'm not sure when customer service became optional but I plan to avoid this place. I'll be happy to swipe my plastic at the Food Mart up the street, or at Sky Grocer on 13th where they have craft  beers at better prices than I would pay for Amstel Light here.

24.description: I reviewed this before and it got pulled due to the "Reservoir Dogs" reference. Sorry to the Yelper I offended. Here is my original review with the offending part taken out! :)This is a nice little place to run to when you are out of x y and z and don't want to make the trek to that terrible Jewel on Wabash. Jesus Christ that Jewel is terrible. They have a pretty nice grocery section for your basic fruits and vegetables.Excellent selection of little items you like but might forget about most times like Matt's Cookies and Diet Green River. Fun tip for parents- they do carry baby water and formula as well as baby jar food in case you are really in a bind.Also the deli section is pretty good too.The guys at the counter are always nice and polite which is a plus.Why 4 stars and not five, B.L.? I dunno, it's nice but nothing special, I guess? Oh wait no it is cause the prices are a wee bit higher than the wonderful Dominick's across the bridge. Lower the prices and I'll re-review. Is that a word? Well it is now.

7.description: I work with South Loop for several networking events each month in the western part of the Loop, and they are awesome!I have a fairly standard order that fluctuates with our expected attendance. I work with Moe directly, and just email him the order. He'll check on inventory, get me a price and then process payment over the phone. I usually have event sponsors cover drinks, and South Loop is very flexible with having different people order, schedule, pay and receive the delivery. They do get busy late, so I always order a day ahead to give them time to fill the order and process it. Even though my events start in the evening, they have to deliver between 2pm - 4pm Luckily, I have refrigerators and ice but the early delivery time could be a challenge for other event planners. I highly recommend South Loop Market. They are professional, very nice and I've had great experiences ordering big deliveries from them multiple times a month!

49.description: South Loop Market is a godsend to South Loop residents. They have canned, boxed, and frozen food, paper goods, and booze in addition to a small selection of fresh fruits and veggies (apples, pineapples, garlic, onions, bananas, etc.). Cold drinks, including Mexican Coke in glass bottles (real sugar!), and made-to-order sandwiches are great for those that work in the area. I was surprised by the number of local/artisan items I found. They also carry a wide variety of Boar's Head meats and cheeses (much better quality than the stuff at the Jewel).Open until midnight on Friday and Saturday, 11pm Monday through Thursday, and 10pm on Sunday!

40.description: Great job guys! You did it right.  Your place looks clean, you sell alcohol, sandwiches, soups, pastries. Wish the back tables were usable. It looks like you're using it for storage, bad idea, the whole appeal is that you actually look like a cafe market and not a stock room, please change that, where are you supposed to eat your Boar Heads sandwich? I like that you have produce, THANK YOU!!!  The small place down the street promised they were going to get fresh produce, they call themselves Green Leaf or something like that but walked passed there the other day and nothing has changed. It looks cheap. Tone down on some of the fancy products, I don't want to pay Whole Food prices! The beer is very pricey too, Augh.  I hit up Dominick's on Roosevelt for beer and wine and if on occasion I forget something, I will walk the block to get here.  Convenient but way overpriced!!!!!!You guys need to look at your price points and change them.Do that and I'll become a regular shopper.Thanks!

30.description: Love this place.  Big, clean, nice staff, tons of stuff, and has booze!  They have a great wine, beer, chilled champagne, and even drink mixers section as well as meats, staples, and even flowers.   So nice to be able to make a quick, local stop for a bottle of wine on a Saturday night.

46.description: An upscale Kwik-E-Mart with a great variety of food and beverages.  I love their beer selection and the 22oz Blue Moon they carry.  The convenience here is amazing... I'd much rather prices that are perhaps just slightly higher to avoid the chaos that is Jewel-Osco.  I hope this business succeeds since they're a great asset to the neighborhood.

1.description: I will never ever walk back into this store again. The night manager is horribly rude and could care less if you shop there or not. Last night was the last straw. He has been rude and sarcastic too many times now. He made another rude comment to me last night when I asked him to look at a date a sandwich was made as I wanted to ensure it was still fresh. Then when I handed him my credit card he made another rude comment about how my credit card looked as it has a small indentation in it. Humm-m-m it works, do you want my money or not?? I was shopping here daily and spending between $500-$800 per month. Not any more. The other night when I went in he was asleep in a chair but don't ask him to look at any dates on any of their products as that is a hassle.  DONE- NO MORE.

9.description: Okay, short and sweet. The owner or what seems to be the owner is filthy at first glance. My initial thought was that he just worked hard & partied hard since his eyes are constantly red. Since I live and work near here, I'm in the store roughly 5 days per week at least for lunch & miscellaneous items. I was truly taken aback when I was infected with pink eye. After chatting with my doctor and looking at how its transferred I was certain it was him. Nearly daily use of the same credit card, same wallet, same right hand. Great store, nice selection but the owner having pink eye is just not clean to say the least. If he reads this, please wash your hands with soap and water. Thank you!

26.description: I'm a little hesitant giving away my secret spot, but these guys have most of everything you could need on short notice without running to the grocery store. They have the basics, but also tons of the extras including a vast wine and beer selection which is great if you've got an after-work hankering and don't want to overspend at a bar. The sandwiches are good, freshly made with Boar's Head Meats and Cheeses and they've got coffee by Intelligentsia brewed and for sale. There is some fresh produce and herbs, dairy and eggs, chips, soda, cereal, etc. They do good business and the guys who own and operate the place a great, I give them kudos for reading the neighborhood and providing what the customers want. The prices are moderate, you pay for the quality of what you buy, but the few extra pennies are worth not having to drive and find parking for soda or cilantro. Highly recommended!

25.description: The South Loop Market is a life saver! The first thing you'll notice is that's its extremely clean which is a very big deal to me as far as places go where I'm going to buy food. The 2nd thing you'll notice very quickly is that the staff is extremely friendly and helpful. They go out of their way to get to know their customers...to the point that you feel it's YOUR neighborhood store. I love the fact that they carry some of the high end brands. Personally I hate when I have to run to a bodega or convenience store and have to purchase off brand yogurt, toilet paper, cereal etc. And somehow they manage to carry just about anything you need from produce to small household needs. We're moving down the street and will be closer to a different store but will walk the extra distance just to keep coming to SLM.Oh, and the coffee is great!

12.description: South Loop Market is just what this neighborhood needed. No longer do I have to run to the larger stores to pick up staples for a picnic, grab a few cold ones, a bottle of wine or even my favorite cereal or ice cream. They have it all . . . .and I am in and out in a flash!I love that when I walk in I am always warmly greeted by whoever is standing at the checkout counter. Head to the back meat counter and you will find Boars Head meats and a range of cheeses and a friendly person to make you your favorite sandwich. Need a coffee pick me up?- it's right by the door. Their beer selection is also quite good and it rotates so you can always find something interesting to try.Sure- it's more expensive than the big grocery chains. But when I am looking for convenience when I am in the neighborhood- this is my "go to" place. And even better? I can always find parking right out front. Now that's real convenience!

21.description: Love the selection.  Price not so much, but I guess the convenience is worth it.  Usually get simple needs here (beer and wine) but the other day had a sandwich made at the deli and it was fantastic.  Definitely glad I live a block from here.

17.description: South Loop Market has everything you need! Very quick and convenient for grabbing a few items. Their deli sandwiches are the best I've ever had and they always have great salads to choose from! Not to mention the staff is always friendly and helfpul. Definitely a great little place to have in the South Loop!

10.description: Great selection of just about everything you need in a little market including beer and liquor selection but WOW.. this place is pricey.  $10 for a loaves of bread and milk and their meat section is about $10-$12 a # for turkey.  Unless you need something quick I recommend going to mariannos a few blocks over or going up to the jewel on roosevelt.

5.description: HORRIBLE IN THE DELI!!!!!  Almost every time I go there they mess up my order.  I have had multiple instances where I have ordered only to watch them give person after person that came after me their sandwiches.  Other times they completely get my order wrong.  Today was my last straw where I watched them give 3 people sandwiches while I stood and waited.  After asking where my order was they give me 3 orders of lunch meat none being the 1 that I had ordered.  The guy at the counter got nasty with me after that.  It is an absolute shame that I can not shop multiple times a week at the deli right next to my building.  NEVER AGAIN will I go there and my money will go elsewhere.

3.description: I felt very uncomfortable in this store. They watched me and kept following me around the store as if I wanted to steal something. I'd walk to one side, one employee walks over. I go to the other side the second employee follows me! They have plenty of cameras why couldn't they discretely profile me? Horrible  customer service, and pretty racist. Go across the street to the Cermak market they have a wider selection and the prices are about the same if not lower.

35.description: It's really nice having this place around. They just expanded and have a much larger variety. However I go there mainly for beer and their prices are out of hand. Charging $2 more per six pack can really add up over a year.

19.description: Totally convenient and they always have what I'm looking for whether its booze or food. The employees are fantastic and I love the feel of the place. And, as always, I have to mention that they sometimes have 6ers of Zombie Dust. I'm starting to think my Yelp! Life revolves around a businesses ability to sell me Zombie Dust.

28.description: Thank goodness for the South Loop Market! Great selection and friendly staff, always nice to to browse through the new stuff they bring in regularly. The Boar's Head deli counter is a must for my husband's work lunches. So fresh and much better than Jewel!

45.description: I love that this is in my building. Being in the SoLo its not always convenient when you run out of the basics. They have everything...produce, Boar's Head meat/cheeses and a decent beer selection.

33.description: South Loop Market is very convenient and has a great selection for a small market.  I was expecting 7-11 quality, but they have craft beers, nutella, organic foods, produce, and best of all, great fresh made sandwiches.  They are more expensive than Jewel, but I dont mind paying for the convenience.  Its a great addition to the neigborhood and often my dinner after a long day at work.

43.description: Boar's Head Cold Cuts......nuff said.

2.description: They had one person working the store and the sandwich shop is open which is supposed to have someone staffing it. So i waited 25minutes to make my order and the poor guy could only do so much back and forth between ringing up customers and making sandwiches. He should have told us how long to expect to wait. They also do nothing when homeless walk into the store and literally ask people to buy him food in front of store staff. Very awkward situation that made me want to leave.worst experience i have ever had at a sandwich shop. whoever the manager of this place is has explaining to do for staffing one person and leaving the sandwich shop open like that and explaining why they do nothing when homeless people openly ask customers for food in the store, YIKES!

18.description: A fantastic beer selection, lots of good granola bars to choose from, and plenty of dark chocolate bars...love this place!

41.description: I love this place -i'm really very jealous because i used to live in this building 2 years ago and there was NOTHING in the area. now theres a great grocery / multi use store IN the building - how awesome is that. No more walks in the freezing cold to the jewel on roosevelt. i think this is definitely a much needed addition to the 18th street end of the south loop - lets make sure this place stays in businesses!

4.description: I tend to agree with everyone's comments about the " owner" although I'm not sure that he's really the owner because I find it hard to believe that anyone who has vested interest in this place would be so unwelcoming and completely disinterested in the customer. For example, one day it seemed "the owner" was staring somewhere in the distance as he was ringing my order. But I didn't really notice until he said" oh I'm not staring at you, I'm watching the game" or on another day I asked him if he carried Jam Jar, a common red wine, to which he said, "I don't know, I don't drink" Seriously? Who cares if you drink? This has nothing to do with you! Do you know about the inventory of the store!?!?!?  That said the only reason I go to South loop market is convenience... and given the way they treat customers, South Loop Market is well aware that repeat customers will come down for that 1 thing they forgot at the grocery store, or a late night ice cream fix... So why should they expend any extra effort?!

6.description: I've been walking on crutches for the past several weeks and have been the recipient of both random acts of kindness and stares. What does that have to do with South Loop Market? Well, I can't drive on doctor's orders so this store is the closest to me in walking distance. I'm in the store, obviously looking for something while standing next to a guy looking for an item as well. One of the store owners only looked at the guy standing next to me and asked if he needed help. Never glanced my way. The owner has never been pleasant, and actually bordering on straight rude, but I gave him the benefit of the doubt and chalked it up to personality. Now I know he's simply an asshole who doesn't like a certain "kind" in his store. No worries, I won't be back.

22.description: They're very friendly here. We actually come here instead of the one right across the street from us. Seems cheaper and there's more variety of everything. The deli is a great alternative to Jewel and Dominick's. I've had 2 sandwiches from here, the Italian and the Reuben, and both were pretty tasty. Also they sell alcohol, so that's worth the 4 stars right there.

15.description: They're very friendly here. We actually come here instead of the one right across the street from us. Seems cheaper and there's more variety of everything. The deli is a great alternative to Jewel and Dominick's. I've had 2 sandwiches from here, the Italian and the Reuben, and both were pretty tasty. Also they sell alcohol, so that's worth the 4 stars right there.

20.description: This review is long due. This was a perfect addition to the South Loop and exactly what we needed. It is a life saver, especially when you wake up on Sat'day morning and realize you are out of milk for coffee :). They have a good selection of quality groceries, that you would need for emergencies. Also a great place to quickly get a bottle of wine - they have a great section for booze. Yes, it is a little more expensive - but then the convenience trumps the price.

36.description: This place is beyond convenient and a godsend. Whether I need milk or wine.. ice cream or an onion; they have everything!!  I always forget something at the grocery store but now I don't worry. The staff is always friendly and in a great mood which to me represents good management and ownership. Ps. They have delicious sandwiches too!! Quick lunch or dinner without the hassle of delivery

14.description: South Loop Market is what this South Loop area needs.  The closest major grocery stores are Jewel and Target on Roosevelt, about a 10-30 minute walk away depending on where you live in the area (which is treacherous in the winter).  For city dwellers who commute via bus or foot, this is a convenient location for some basic needs.Yes this grocery store is expensive.  But you pay a premium for convenience.  If you want to do the majority of your grocery shopping on a budget, go to Jewel or Target.This store has fresh produce, alcohol, your basic grocery needs, and some more.  The store is relatively large for a corner grocery and very clean.  The staff is friendly.  There is a minimum charge to process credit; I think it's $3 or $4.I always swing by to buy items I forget at Jewel, typically fresh produce, which is reasonably priced.  It may be 25 cents more expensive, but once again, you're paying for convenience.Overall great place.  And you're supporting a local family run business too.  :)

1.description: This place is amazing. The staff is extremely friendly and they go out of their way to help you. They know their shoes and their product very well. I will definitely be going back to buy more things from them. They also have a great shoe selection.

9.description: Came here with my guys, who happens to be somewhat of a sneaker head.  If your aren't into sneakers you will feel just as out if place as I did, total boys club. That isn't a knock, just an observation. The overall store layout seemed fine, not terribly inviting. Meh, I'd rather just go to Foot Locker.

23.description: Finally made my way over to check the store out. When you walk in you're immediately greeted by a friendly staff, a wide selection of sneaks and an urban but very clean, contemporary layout. I liked the selection of sneakers and clothes. Clothing seems to be a little over priced but the shoes seemed fair. Although the staff is cool and helpful they seemed to smother you a bit and I like to shop on my own. Overall the store is a decent place to shop for some of the latest in a clean layed back environment.

5.description: Succezz is a very cool spot in the South Loop. They sell sneakers and related clothing across the entire spectrum of prices. While I am not a collector of rare and hard to find sneakers, I do like picking up a cool pair of fashion focused shoes that are still comfortable and unique.Helpful Hint: Come by their location on the weekends and take a look at their sidewalk sales! You would be surprised at the awesome items you can buy for great prices!

25.description: Great selection of shoes and clothes. I always check this place for the latest releases. The main reason for the low rating is that their customer service is crap. They're very nice when you walk in, a little pushy when you do wanna try on some shoes but what do you expect from a shoe salesman? But what irks me the most is that I wanted to special order a shoe so they took my name and number down and they said they would call me back within the next two business days. I didn't hear a word from them. I had to contact them via Facebook and he said that they're still working on getting me the shoes. That was about a week or two ago...haven't heard from them since. All they had to do was let me know that they're still working on trying to get my shoe and that it may take a little while. It's also happened to a friend of mine twice. Although they're a great store, if their customer service stays this bad, then I won't be going here to shop.

12.description: [THIS REVIEW IS SOLELY ON HOW THEY HANDLE THEIR LIMITED/JORDAN/HYPEBEAST RELEASES]For Saturday. August 4, 2012Just moved to Chicago and was looking for the nearest sneaker spot releasing the Air Jordan IV Fire Red (picture of the shoe: i818.photobucket.com/alb…) Called Succezz which was about a mile away from where I live and they said they were going to have them on release date (8.4.12).Woke up and walked to the shop and was impressed how the store was arranged. Asked the salesguy for my size and he said they had them but it was going to cost $250 which is $90 over retail. I told him he could keep the pair and left the store.These guys are straight up hypebeasts. $250? Good luck with that! I took the bus over to Footlocker on State. Walked in, asked for my size, walked out with my pair. For $160. The FTL salesperson said the store received 300 pairs. Wowzers! This is how every release should be. For Succezz to charge that much on a release that plentiful is a damn shame for such a nice store.I can cross Succezz off my list of go-to sneaker places.

21.description: Best sneaker boutique in the city right now. Biggest selection of both general and limited releases. Great atmosphere. Great customer service.

16.description: This place rocks.  I am a mid thirties caucasian dude - so I am definitely not cool enough to come here.  Place is backed by Bobby Simmons, of NBA and Depaul Fame.  Dudes here are GREAT and friendly - I was very welcome.HERE IS WHY YOU COME THOUGH - best christmas present I ever got was the Bo Jackspon cross trainers (originals) in 1989.  Since then, I have been searching on eBay and all over the country for a new pair.  Guess what - SUCCEZZ had em - in my size (13).  I even saw my salesman a week later in the BP on wabash a few days late, and he recognized me and said whats up.GO HERE.  They have the best retro sneakers in chciago.

17.description: It's sad to hear that people had bad customer service experiences with Succezz.  Every single time I've gone in, called them (or, stalker called them seems to be more accurate in my case) or asked any questions to any of the staff, they've been nothing but super nice.Recently, I've had to make a number of phone calls for a pair of shoes I was trying to buy my Husband for Christmas.  I called a couple of months before they were supposed to be released, called them again a month before they came out, and then called AGAIN the day they were supposed to get them.  EVERY SINGLE time, they remembered me, they were nice to me, joked with me, and reassured me that my husband's "white elephat" pair would be there waiting.Sure enough, they were right there for me when I went to pick them up. Awesomeness.  Succezz always gets the shoes that are limited releases and hard to find.  With that, I'm sure people can get irritated with the "exclusivity" of it all, but if you give them a chance, you will be happy.  The owner, Vel, knows all his products, takes time to chat with the customers, and is always great.  I suggest that if you have any problems, to talk to him, and I'm sure he'll square everything away.  I love to support Chicagoians in their ventures, and this is a local place I'll always recommend.

10.description: After reading of the reviews of this boutique, I must first say that I'm sorry so many people had bad experiences shopping at this establishment. I've had more than my fair share of great experiences here. The owners are great and so are the associates. Shout out to V, Bobby, Fron, Marv, Dre, Ju and the whole Succezz team.

11.description: Don't even waste your time going to this joint unless you want to get raped!!!! Just a word of advice to the workers try not to ridicule your customers!!!! I should have reached across the counter and pimp slapped that little cocky hypebeast that was working the register!!!! I ask him a simple question and he fires back a smart ass response!!!! Oh and by the way I don't need your free junk mix cd with a bunch of clowns on it I never heard of I 'll use it for a frisbee!!!! If its sneakers you want go to a real sneaker store like nike a couple miles up Michigan ave they know how to take care of a customer!!!! To the owner of this whack ass store I hope your place folds like a lawn chair and you can get on your knees and suck a fart out of my hairy white poop shoot!!!!

26.description: Very fresh store! The selection is great, they offer a ton of sneakers and a huge range of t-shirts. What is even better then the selection is the great employees. They were really friendly and more then willing to offer a hand if I had any questions. Next time I am going to have to try designing my own shoes, they have an in-store service called SuccezZ Labs.

22.description: I was sad to see Self Conscious close its doors and finally got around to checking out Succezz (V Dot's other shop). The set-up and merch was similar, staff was cool, etc - all of what I came to love about SC. My trip to Succezz was to get my bro-in law a pair of sneakers for xmas, but when I was shown the brand new limited edition Clark Kent East Coast AF1s, I fell in love and couldn't leave without them. Addiction much? SC was only two blocks from where I live and although Succezz is a bit further, it's definitely worth the trip for me. It's a must go-to for any sneaker head.

0.description: Great selection of youth, women's and men's Jordan's, Lebron's, KD's, Nike gear and more. Great discounts too! Staff super friendly. Highly recommend!

20.description: the illest spot in all of Chicago for the hawtest gear and kicks!!!support your local spot and rep% Succezz!!!one!jason

19.description: So let's see.  I call the store for advice and/or to see if you want to buy some shoes that I stumbled upon and in return you tell me to "live in the real world, this ain't ebay yo". Really? I know that, I was asking for advice and the only frame of reference that I had was what a certain shoe was going for on ebay. I am not a sneaker expert and do not pretend to be. You can be damn sure, I will never be going to this place again. I have purchased a few pairs from them already. I will live in the real world....and go elsewhere. Way to demean and patronize your clients!!I have to say, the woman on the phone was just as sweet as can be, not sure if the guys didn't think I could hear them when she was relaying the message, but damn dude.

2.description: Great selection overall.  They stock some really hard to come by stuff.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Markups on some product were a bit high(think ebay reseller), but I'd still recommend stopping in.  Again, their selection really is outstanding.

18.description: Life is what u make it.........we had the best time at your store!   You entertained us and made us feel at home.   We were offered a seat when we first walked in (with ten 14 year olds) and pop or water.   We were shown several shoes that were not on the floor that the employees thought we might like!   The guys that work here are FULL of personality!   I'm thinking reality show.  The kids bought "what-the-kobies" and enjoyed seeing "air-yezzys" and Labron 10 championship pack".    We also found a rockin'  BHM Labron Jacket on sale.  Thanks for your time and we will be coming back soon!    Lafron and Devail.........u da best!    Thanks again!!

13.description: More 'urban' than other joints I checked out while I was in Chicago.  A lot of AF1s, big consignment collection and tops and kicks grouped by colour matching.  Nice.Sizes were a bit hard to come by though - but that's to be expected as when you carry the selection they do.  I missed the Nike Air Force 1 Low x Futura Grey when they came out last year - it was exhilarating to see they had a still pair on the rack.  But ball-crushingly painful when they searched the back and didn't find one in my size.  Emotional swings is just something you have to deal with as a sneakerhead.Salespeople are a bit aggressive and overeager to stalk you around the store.  Good thing is they offered me a 15% discount as a first time customer.  They were generally helpful - but I like to study and measure out my buys - I don't need a running commentary... I can tell you more about your product than you can.Anyways - a little out out of the way but worth a visit if you're on a the urbanwear tip.

4.description: Was there12:00pm last Sunday 5/10/15 with my kids to buy 2-3 pairs of shoes. The huge advertising on the door says "green tag sale, buy 1 green tag item get 1... 50% off"Without even looking for green tag items it happens Le Bron nike my son wanted had a green tag ...took it and took another nikes for my other son + few pairs of high  sox. Sales girls were wonderful and very attentive , helpful. They informed me about the sale etc. Loved them and their attitude.  Until I came to the counter to pay...The bearded THUG  at the counter was obrasive and unpleasent. Refused to honor the sale items ...I asked him why he didn't want tonexplain, sales girl was as shocked as I was. I asked him why he doesn't remove the sale sign from the door if sale is not being honored? He to my biggest surprise stunned me with the ...B'CUZ I DON'T HAVE TO!... I was gonna pay full price anyways since my kids loved the shoes,,,but it took me 3 seconds to realize ....I DON'T HAVE TO BUY IT FROM THAT GUY...& walked away. Hope this guy is not the store owner! and should be fired on the spot by the owner!!!I own a business and I would not treat any customer disrespectfully, regardless if they are spending $3.... or $ 350 as I was about to spend and most likely return there since it's my neighborhood store, and I believe in supporting local businesses.  But this store saw me last time and I'm making sure no one I know ever goes there again!!!If this THUG is the owner ...I don't see this lasting long, but if he just works there he should be let go! because he is dragging nice business down!  We walked out of the store and felt disgusted.  Sales girls were phenomenal so was the selection, but the thug business practice doesn't belong on such nice neighborhood as South Loop. Buyers be aware, watch out for bearded guy if you see him ....go to Nike Town, or try your size and order on line from Nike.I Still feel disgusting....and my children as well.

24.description: So let's see.  I call the store for advice and/or to see if you want to buy some shoes that I stumbled upon and in return you tell me to "live in the real world, this ain't ebay yo". Really? I know that, I was asking for advice and the only frame of reference that I had was what a certain shoe was going for on ebay. I am not a sneaker expert and do not pretend to be. You can be damn sure, I will never be going to this place again. I have purchased a few pairs from them already. I will live in the real world....and go elsewhere. Way to demean and patronize your clients!!I have to say, the woman on the phone was just as sweet as can be, not sure if the guys didn't think I could hear them when she was relaying the message, but damn dude.

6.description: Great customer service! Never had a problem finding what I want. The employees are amazing!

15.description: Nice spot, dudes are knowledgeable about sneakers and clothing. Their own clothing line is nice too when you can sport exclusive chicago themed gear in other cities. When you go there be prepared to find things that are DS/QS and ready to drop some bills. If you are a true connoisseur of shoes hit this place up.

7.description: Amazing service- I have never felt so taken care of. All of the staff on site asked me about my style and wanted to know if there was anything they could recommend. They were having several great sales when I visited. BBC 50% off, adidas shoes 25% off, air maxs and nike running shoes on sale, and 50% off nike hoodies and shirts for $5. Their inventory is great, a nice mix of "urban" brands. Everyone there answers any questions and checks in on you to make sure you're finding everything you need.

8.description: Went in there for the first time a few days ago. The staff was very helpful and all were super nice. They have a very good selection of gear... definitely will be going back in soon!

3.description: Can't recommend this spot enough for any sneaker fan. You don't need to be a certified sneaker-head to come in and get a great shopping experience. Easily the best sales staff around they make everyone that walks in feel welcome.

14.description: I'm very impressed with this shoe store has a large selection of Jordan's and great customer service I might say from the moment I walked in to the moment I paid for my shoes!!! This is my new favorite shoes store!!!

0.description: YOU OUGHTA BE IN PICTURES!             March 8, 2014Take 1 & Cut located in the exciting South Loop, will make that possible.When you first enter, you'll be greeted by a cheerful and professional staff.The motif is reminisicent of  a glamorous and elegant Hollywood studio.Mellow colors, warm lighting and peaceful music will sooth your spirit.This salon is kept absolutely immaculate.WHATEVER your gender, hair type, length or condition, you'll want  yourpicture taken afterwards. Get a before and after just for proof. My master stylist is Rene.I had neglected my hair for several months  and it showed.Rene took the time and truly listened to how I like to wear my hair and how much effort I'm willing to put in daily to maintain that style. ZERO.Rene made suggestions, then patientally and artistically cut my hair.My hair looked shiney and healthy. Plus, I looked ten years younger.  While cutting my hair, Rene explained what she was doing and theresult she was going for.Wow. That's the first time I had a beauticiando that.Days later, my hair still looked fabulous. That's the true test ofa great cut.I've seen the results of other stylists in the salon, and their clientsleft looking picture perfect too.One more thing I love about Take 1 & Cut, it's female owned.Thank you Rene. You Rock!!!Karen O.

28.description: This was a spur of the moment, on the whim, happen to be near, lets get in and out kind of trip. It's counter service with tables if you want to eat in. My friend is a regular here, she's into the fried fish. I had the chicken curry that came with rice pilaf and I ordered naan on the side. The naan was really, really good.  Warm, soft with a slight chew. Very satisfying. The chicken curry on the other hand was not. The chicken was super moist and tender, easily broken apart with a plastic fork. The rice and curry was pretty salty I thought. So much so that I tossed it after finishing the chicken. That sucks. For those that know me I never toss out my food- because I either eat it all or save the rest for later. IF it's good. Otherwise it goes in the trash or I give it to the homeless. Hey, it's a notch above eating up near rotten food that smells like death with a touch of poo. If you don't know the smell, go to your nearest dumpster or walk near state and kinzie. I'm not really inspired to come back really. The other fried food looks like typical Chicago hole in the wall fast food fare.Next.

1.description: Yummy cooked to order fried chicken that comes with a generous serving of potato wedges. Good find after walking the auto show at McCormick Place.

39.description: Wow... just had the curry chicken and rice.  FANTASTIC!  I always wanted to eat here, it just looks like the type of place that would have some killer food... and I wasn't wrong.  The chicken was so tender it was literally falling off the bone.  The rice is cooked with chicken broth and vegetables so it has TONS of flavor as well.Another gentleman in the restaurant mentioned that the lamb with rice and beans was terrific as well.There aren't many seats, it's primarily a takeout type of joint, but there are a few seats so if you're in the neighborhood, you can stop in for lunch or an early dinner (they close at 7:00).The price and portions were ok considering the quality.  It was about $7 after taxes for the Curry Chicken & rice and an RC.  If the food wasn't so spectacular, I could say it was a little on the high side for the amount of food (which was adequate for me, but I can imagine big eaters wanting more) but I did have some rice left.Anyway... this place rocks and I would recommend it to anyone.  The curry does have a little kick... and overall the meal was surprisingly "indian" tasting.    Which is to be expected given the curry... but imagine a very very very moist tandoori spiced chicken (which often tends to be dry, this is baked so it is different entirely) crossed with a fantastic curry chicken dish.  A+

9.description: They will never receive my business again.  First of all, they are over priced. Secondly,  when I placed my order,  I was told my order would be ready in 15 to 20 minutes.  Since there wasn't any parking available, I waited in a running car for 15 minutes with my son before I called for a status.  No only was there no record of my order.  I was told they would discount me $2.00..... Really,  I spent $2.00 worth of gas waiting for my order.  I told them that this was unacceptable and they told me that they would rush the order, and that it should only be another 15 minutes.  I'm sorry this is not good customer services.  I took my business across the street to Sharks and I'm currently enjoying my lemon pepper chicken.  Thank you sharks!

29.description: I don't hold back when it comes to this place! Chef Luciano is a Chicago food ICON. It is not unusual to see him there at some point EVERY DAY and he is still cooking. His son handles most of the business and Chef L focuses on the food. He hasn't lost a step and the food still has ALL of the passion from over 20+years of being there. The roast chicken is truly one of the best in the city and I DARE YOU TO FIND BETTER "BLACK EYED PEAS"!!!!! You will want the lemonade by the gallon...no joke. The fish is always fresh and I love the rice pilaf. I know "rice pilaf"? Parking can be a bit tough but that's Chicago for you. Go there, tell him Chef Julius sent you and says hi!!! You will thank me later

23.description: I tried the Fish curry and the chicken curry. The two curries and meat were seasoned very well. The chef also came and enquired about his food and had a good conversation with us. A nice experience overall!!

5.description: 22 minutes for chicken tenders. Meh. Next time I'll have to get an actual chicken meal.

31.description: For this type of food spot , the place is perfect: great comfort food, great prices. There are a few tables but not many.  Place your order and pick it up yourself at the counter type of place.  Clean.  The naan is amazing and so is the chicken curry.  Even though the lemonade looks radioactive, one large bottle serves 2 adults and 2 little ones.

25.description: Tilapia dinner. Enough said. You won't be disappointed.

12.description: Curry chicken with rice pilaf, German chocolate cake and a good ol' bottle of Chef Luciano's Gourmet Hot Sauce. Okay what is wrong with this picture? I was so looking forward to eating here and my co worker decided, lets go there. So we proceeded and first off, mind the meter man who sits and lurks by AT&T (behind the Chicken), he waits like a hawk and if you dare leave without visiting Mister Meter, good God almighty you will get a ticket. But of course that was not the case for me, I put in money because I knew that I would never be able to contest that ticket, but the others near me, Hmmmm, screaming at the top of their lungs that they were only there for 5 minutes (ummm you broke the law)! Anyway, the Curry chicken was alright, it did have a bite to it but not enough to knock me down! The rice pilaf was also okay and kind of disappointing. The German chocolate cake you ask? Now that threw me back so far that I saw past lives! It was really good! But this is not a "German Chocolate Cake Gourmet Spot". So for the first time coming here, I was disappointed enough for a 3 star. Not saying I wouldn't come back, because I definitely am coming back. But probably for the Chicken (on steroids) wings that my co worker bought. They were massive with attitude, and with some of my Luciano's Hot Sauce, well this should be interesting to say the least. Again, its not that I didn't like the food here, but if the dessert is better then the food, ummmm I am not sure if I can be worthy of a great status. But, I would definitely try them again like I said.

37.description: Wow this place is wierd..So i pass by this place everyday going to work and it looked just like a run of the mill south side greaser jointThere are 3 restaurants side by side "Gourmet chicken, Pollo al carbon, and Chef Luciano" and they're all owned by "Chef Luciano" who is actually Indian - Chef GuptaThe 3  all serve some of the same items (why different restaurants?) and the cuisine is something of a hodgepodge of international dishes likeItalian pasta+Indian curries+African+American southernI had the curry chicken was was quite tasty albeit pretty dang salty and greasy.  It was incredibly tender though, probably simmered all day.I'm not sure this qualifies as "Gourmet" as the signs imply, but hey I liked it.  Still very weird though, you should check it out.

21.description: Ok. Here's how a place gets 5 stars. The chefs behind the counter yelled out to everyone in the restaurant warning them, "the parking meter police are coming!". One of the guys in the restaurant rushes out and tries to move his car but the parking meter guy is already issuing a ticket. The owner of the place, I'm guessing it was Chef Luciano, goes out and starts yelling at the meter police saying, "hey, you're hurting my business". All to no avail, but I really appreciate the effort.Oh, and the roasted chicken, curried rice, fried okra, and cherry cola were superb. They even bottle their own house-made lemonade.If you want to avoid mediocre, overpriced food at the convention center but don't want to walk all the way to Chinatown, give this place a try.

16.description: This is definitely not a four star restaurant ! Barely a decent greasey spoon. My chicken curry was mostly skin and bones over rice with a few pieces of onion - walk over to the hyatt for much better food

17.description: Great lunch place but one of my catfish nuggets was freezer burnt.

10.description: Ok. Here's how a place gets 5 stars. The chefs behind the counter yelled out to everyone in the restaurant warning them, "the parking meter police are coming!". One of the guys in the restaurant rushes out and tries to move his car but the parking meter guy is already issuing a ticket. The owner of the place, I'm guessing it was Chef Luciano, goes out and starts yelling at the meter police saying, "hey, you're hurting my business". All to no avail, but I really appreciate the effort.Oh, and the roasted chicken, curried rice, fried okra, and cherry cola were superb. They even bottle their own house-made lemonade.If you want to avoid mediocre, overpriced food at the convention center but don't want to walk all the way to Chinatown, give this place a try.

11.description: The only complaint I have, is that the wait  can be long. However you're paying for the freshness of the food.  This place is quite good with a balanced menu.  I've been twice in three days.... Oh and the lemonade, well that's an acquired taste but I took it home and made Popsicles with it

26.description: I had their 1/4 Roast Chicken (breast and wing) that is served over Pilav Rice. It was VERY good. The Rice has an Indian flare, with just a nice little kick of spice.Don't forget to try their Root Beer or Ginger Beer, they make both in house and are worth the little extra from a regular soda.

27.description: Great food! Amazing deal!

35.description: At what establishment did I eat? The sign out front said "Pollo al Carbon," and above the cash register read, "Chef Luciano," but my receipt claimed that I just ate at "Gourmet Chicken"...Apparently they're all run by the same guy and all share a roof. The 3 restaurants flow seamlessly from one to another so there's really no way of knowing at which one you ate. I have a suspicion that "Gourmet Chicken" and "Chef Luciano" share a cash register, but there's no way to be sure.Anyway, the food options at the three places range from Mexican, to Middle Eastern, to Italian, to American Southern. Because why not? The $5.99 perch lunch platter came with fries and sauce. And a soda brought it up to about $7, which seems fair-priced for the amount of food I got. If it were a little cheaper, I'd make it my regular lunch spot. Friendly staff, fast service, good place for a quick bite. Voted "Best Place to Get Ocean Perch at a Chicken/Indian/Italian Food Joint in the Near South Side" by me.

8.description: I found this on yelp nearby the hotel within walking distance. I ordered shrimp curry and naan to go.  The price was right and food tasty. There was only room for a few to eat in that's why I did not give them five stars.  Excellent food for the type of setting.

0.description: The best restaurant in Chicago. I love them, jerk chicken pasta fish fried chicken sides etc. The best in my opinion if there not it's really close to it. They can b pricy but I treat myself every time I have a chance. Now they cook with untraditional seasonings and herbs but you'll luv um. The best must try!!!!

38.description: Only 2 reviews? You have to be kidding me...this place is a must-try in the South Loop-ish hood. Carryout only more or less, but I hit this all the time on the way home. The only chicken that's better may be the stuff you grill yourself (if you know how to slow roast curry chicken). Promise me you'll give this a shot? Order the 4 piece roasted curry chicken + rice & beans... giddy up.Oh, did I mention its under $6? Recession-Schmession.

20.description: Been living nearby for years but finally made it here. I got the naan bread (oh my its delicious) and the curry chicken. It was a great deal and I'd definitely go back. As others say its a good idea to call ahead during busy hours.

19.description: Got the fried chicken breast meal: great price:large breast, bread, potato wedges, $.3.84 ! But the chicken was over fried, the beading tasted oily and burnt. The potato edges were ok at best and the bread was a wheat version of Wonder Bread. Disappointed !

33.description: Not a big fan of this place. Some friends and I recently ordered some chicken, fish and potato wedges for delivery. First of, they said it'd take an hour and it took at least 20 minutes more. When the food finally arrives, we are super hungry. The fish is cold. The chicken is pretty bad. It looked and felt like it had been refried. And it was really dark. Never had chicken like that. The batter had an interesting taste...maybe ginger? Oh, and the potato wedges were a little stale and hard. Overall, did not like this place. It was not Gourmet. And it was not good chicken. Maybe they were having an off day?We ended not really eating the food and instead went to Church's near the Lozano Library. Much better.

2.description: I was staying at the Hyatt and decided to go on a walk. Glad I made it further into a neighborhood which looks to be more scary for some but hey, it's an adventure. Glad I did. There is a 20 minute wait for the fried chicken as it is cooked to order.Liked- fried chicken wings- potato wedges- hot sauceSo So- roasted chicken (it was dry and cold)Disliked- rice pilaf (cold and either undercooked or overcooked, just too dry)Go back for the fried chicken but not the roasted.

34.description: Cafe Luciano and Gourmet Chicken are all owned by the same person, Chef Luciano and oh can you tell once you order! My friend had the fish special (under $6) and I had fried mushrooms (sinful)! Everything is seasoned to perfection. No need to add anything extra to your food. You get to see Chef Luciano in action (cooking that is).  Ladies let me tell you, they really appreciate beautiful ladies in this place : ) Go for the food, stay for the service!

32.description: This place currently tops my list of southside restaurants that deliver. We have had a number of tasty fried chicken meals - the only downside is it came on wedge potatoes and a piece of bread. I wish those could be different sides.The chicken curry from here is ok, but the one from the Chef Luciano kitchen is amazing.This place is a tasty and reliable alternative when all the southside Mexican, Italian, and Chinese get boring.p.s. you might find yourself limiting your intake of the Chef's lemonade....ugh, why is it soooo good?

18.description: I recently enjoyed the Chef Luciano Experience. He was chilling in the dining area when  I ordered my Curry chicken. It was AMAZING! Well seasoned, not overly hot, spiced just right. The chicken was cooked tender and fell off the bone easily. The portion size was appropriate and the price - Best value meal I've had in Chicago so far. As a native of Toronto, Canada, i'm accustomed to multi-ethnic dining establishments. This was a rare find in chicago for me in a sea of chain/theme restaurants. The service is quick, friendly. I wished I had tried the lemonade. Next time, I'll try something more fried-PS - it was kinda cool to have a good chat with Chef Luciano himself, hear how he started, where he started from, and why his business has been successful, despite his humble beginnings. It was an honor to have my photo taken within him!I will return their with my family...

13.description: I had the curry shrimp. It was mild & flavorful. The portion size was decent but I wouldn't have been unhappy with more. I was expecting to receive a complimentary beverage as I did when ordered a lunch special from the adjacent restaurant, but I was told a beverage wasn't included because it wasn't a lunch special. I would recommend adding lunch specials to their menu. I would recommend ordering ahead if you're picking up lunch because they seem to stay pretty busy.

4.description: After 6 years and sampling basically everything they have, I can now say this place rocks.  Everything is good.  Just go and try something.  You won't be disappointed.

24.description: I recently enjoyed the Chef Luciano Experience. He was chilling in the dining area when  I ordered my Curry chicken. It was AMAZING! Well seasoned, not overly hot, spiced just right. The chicken was cooked tender and fell off the bone easily. The portion size was appropriate and the price - Best value meal I've had in Chicago so far. As a native of Toronto, Canada, i'm accustomed to multi-ethnic dining establishments. This was a rare find in chicago for me in a sea of chain/theme restaurants. The service is quick, friendly. I wished I had tried the lemonade. Next time, I'll try something more fried-PS - it was kinda cool to have a good chat with Chef Luciano himself, hear how he started, where he started from, and why his business has been successful, despite his humble beginnings. It was an honor to have my photo taken within him!I will return their with my family...

6.description: I got take out from this place.  I was impressed with the price point and quality.  The food was very good.  We got the 4 piece dark meal and the skin was super tasty.  The wedges that come with are super great.  I usually am not a fan of those cause they're bland but these were good.  I also got fried mushrooms, which were solid.  The chicken itself is very solid.

22.description: This place is serious i love their naan bread

15.description: I've never felt sicker after eating here.  Place should serve Pepto-Bismol as a side.

40.description: this place is definitely a gem. I've only had carryout from her. But its great stuff. The chicken curry with rice is delicious. Their fried chicken wings and red bean rice is amazing. The food might be a little spicy for some, but it's just right for me. Best jerk chicken ever!! And they have their own special made lemonade which is pretty good too. Definitely give this place a try. They have 2 entrances, one is to dine in, and another one that is strictly for carryout.

7.description: I ordered the Fried chicken to be delivered to my hotel delivered hot very good some of the best chicken I've ever had . portions very large too much, OK leftovers.

36.description: Been here twice so far.First time I got curry chicken and garlic mushrooms for carryout. The chicken was moist and rice was ok, but just wasn't very flavorful. Did have a kick to it as I kept eating. Garlic mushrooms had a nice crunchy breading and the sauce was nice. Just wish there was a bit more for the $2.95 price.....why are breaded mushrooms so expensive???Second time I ate there. We ordered the fried chicken and the fish fry which was fried tilapia with potato wedges, coleslaw and bread. Fried chicken was moist, but some of it still have red to it. Not much flavoring. Fried tilapia was ok, a bit soggy and potato wedges were ok. Coleslaw tasted a bit different than I've had and didn't care for it.Not a bad place, but was hoping for more flavor.

30.description: Curry chicken with rice pilaf, German chocolate cake and a good ol' bottle of Chef Luciano's Gourmet Hot Sauce. Okay what is wrong with this picture? I was so looking forward to eating here and my co worker decided, lets go there. So we proceeded and first off, mind the meter man who sits and lurks by AT&T (behind the Chicken), he waits like a hawk and if you dare leave without visiting Mister Meter, good God almighty you will get a ticket. But of course that was not the case for me, I put in money because I knew that I would never be able to contest that ticket, but the others near me, Hmmmm, screaming at the top of their lungs that they were only there for 5 minutes (ummm you broke the law)! Anyway, the Curry chicken was alright, it did have a bite to it but not enough to knock me down! The rice pilaf was also okay and kind of disappointing. The German chocolate cake you ask? Now that threw me back so far that I saw past lives! It was really good! But this is not a "German Chocolate Cake Gourmet Spot". So for the first time coming here, I was disappointed enough for a 3 star. Not saying I wouldn't come back, because I definitely am coming back. But probably for the Chicken (on steroids) wings that my co worker bought. They were massive with attitude, and with some of my Luciano's Hot Sauce, well this should be interesting to say the least. Again, its not that I didn't like the food here, but if the dessert is better then the food, ummmm I am not sure if I can be worthy of a great status. But, I would definitely try them again like I said.

3.description: Been coming to this place for many many years.. Chicken is better then ever. Love the fresh lemonade.. Now you can get it buy the case.Try the new Caramel Pecan Cookies Buy the way the food is cooked fresh to order so please remember that when you may be in a hurryThank you happy Eating

14.description: Been here twice so far.First time I got curry chicken and garlic mushrooms for carryout. The chicken was moist and rice was ok, but just wasn't very flavorful. Did have a kick to it as I kept eating. Garlic mushrooms had a nice crunchy breading and the sauce was nice. Just wish there was a bit more for the $2.95 price.....why are breaded mushrooms so expensive???Second time I ate there. We ordered the fried chicken and the fish fry which was fried tilapia with potato wedges, coleslaw and bread. Fried chicken was moist, but some of it still have red to it. Not much flavoring. Fried tilapia was ok, a bit soggy and potato wedges were ok. Coleslaw tasted a bit different than I've had and didn't care for it.Not a bad place, but was hoping for more flavor.

58.description: The staff is terrific and very helpful.Nice beds, great hours and super location.

56.description: My first review! So simply putStaff is great, really sweet owner(Sandra) , she also does the airbrush tan as well.  Although i havent tried it. Some of the girls upfront are a little ackward when asking them questions but they seem to know what they're talking about. Emphasis on SEEM, I know nothing on tanning so I wouldn't know if they're just really good at pulling bull-crap out of the air or are really tanning aficionados. Skip the eyelash extensions, not worth the amount  of eyelashes  for  the price, and the extensionists skill set is not all there. My eyes were sore the next day because a few blood vessels popped all  because the  medical tape to hold my lower lashes in place was pretty much too tight, and on top of that the extensions were falling out the next day (not enough glue maybe???  Or the poor girl just sucks??) The only other thing I have tried is the spray tan in light and medium. I did get darker which isn't to hard because I'm casper see- through normally, but the only complaint is that my hands were a little to orange and had a few spots, but whose fault was it to not put the barrier cream on correctly??? All  MINE! So I'll be back to see if I can get it done right. If not, who cares... All in all a normal place. Not Great not bad, sweet people, not so sweet eyelashes extensions. But if you really want them and are thinking about getting them from here, get them so I'm not the only idiot with bloodshot eyes. ( in no way am I advising you to actually get them- it's a joke for humor purposes and if I get sued because "I told you to" and your eyes are jacked up, I  repeat it's a joke!!!!)

29.description: Bella Bronze is very clean offering all types of services like tanning, spray tanning, teeth whitening and more.   The staff is also extremely friendly and always make a point to remember their clients by name.

42.description: The service was helpful and nice however the only reason my review has such a low rating is because although I was looking for a darker tint upon exiting...I wasn't going for red. I burned after my first session (they recommended I start in the diamond bed for 6 minutes...which was too powerful since I sport some red blotches that scream in the shower now..okay I'm exaggerating but it certainly isn't pretty nor feel good) and because the bronzing lotions were waaaaay too expensive. If I based this rating on service I would give it 5 stars but based on my experience tanning here... 2. I bought the monthly groupon deal so I will return at least once again...once I heal and adjust my tanning session accordingly. I shall update my review if my experience and outcome changes.

23.description: Just a fantastic spot! I can't tell you how many times I passed this place before stopping in. After reading other yelp reviews I gave it a shot and they were so right. From the moment you walk in the staff is incredibly friendly and attentive.While they were processing my paperwork, the owner took me in a tour of the facilities. The place is much larger that I anticipated with really great beds and a host of spa services as well. The sign up process was fast and easy. They have a great assortment of lotions and, if you buy a bottle there, can get a bag with your name and they will store your lotion and goggles there for you.The beds are clean and quiet. I have been at various times on different days since joining here and have yet to have to wait for a bed. Love the vanity room where you can remove make up before tanning. Overall I am so happy with my experience here. Looking forward to trying their spa services too and showing off my killer Bella Bronze tan when I hit Miami next weekend!

47.description: I visited several months ago. The place is clean and beautiful but the tanning bed (level 5 I think) was in drastic need of new bulbs. I have used tanning beds for many years, and I can attest there are much better in the neighborhood. Perhaps their spray tanning or other services might be better, but for someone who prefers the beds only, it's not worth the money.

8.description: I purchased a deal for unlimited tanning through Groupon that runs for a month. Upon my arrival, the customer service was excellent. They got me all set up in their system and explained how everything works. I was very impressed with not only their demeanor, but the esthetic of the store itself. Everything was clean and well laid out. I was shown around to the various options for tanning and other services. I was also told that my Groupon allowed me a Diamond membership that provides me discounts on other services which I will likely give a shot during my month trial.

31.description: If you've never gotten a Brazilian because you were too scared - you need to get yours at Bella Bronze! I've been getting waxed for 7 years and this is one of the best I've ever had. Victoria is THE BEST. You'll be in and out of there in under 20 minutes and it will be precision done. No random hairs left, no missed spots - perfect! She's super awesome and really personable. Keeps the conversation going so you forget that you're even getting waxed. It was done so well I didn't even have to return for 7 weeks - awesome! Also - Bella Bronze's prices cannot be beat - so affordable and 100% worth it. The entire staff is friendly, I feel like a regular each time I come in. So glad to have this place in the area!

34.description: Sandra and Victoria are amazing! Very great customer service and just very down to earth :) love this place- it's also very clean and there's never a wait

16.description: I went to Bella to get a facial. I'm looking for my new face place since I just moved to Chicago. I found a Groupon and it was so worth it. Victoria (who is really pretty btw) did the best job. I immediately looked at my skin right after and I was impressed. Because of my move I had not gotten a facial in awhile, so she really had her work cut out for her. I don't have severe acne, but she did quite a few extractions. It was relaxing as well, but even it if hadn't been, the results were worth it. My only problem is personal, it is a little expensive for me because I want to add a peel to the 45 facial. I think it's a fair price, just a little out of my budget. I do plan to go back as much as I can afford. Seriously, try this place. If their other services are like the facial, you will be happy. Oh, one thing, there is metered parking right in front, but I found free parking .2 miles away.

13.description: Bella Bronze never disappoints! Sandra is very accommodating in scheduling appointments and always extremely pleasant and genuine upon greeting me. She is amazing with customer service and even asks me about my mother and sister (who I have taken on only one occasion)...always feels great. Someone else who is amazing is Victoria. Her waxing is flawless, detail-oriented, and pain free ... Thank you, ladies!

11.description: This salon is amazing. I had my first bikini wax, and I hardly felt it while gushing about everything with Victoria, who is the sweetest and really makes you feel comfortable while she's waxing your nether regions. I made my Yelp account to give her and Sandra a 5-star review! They really know what they are doing here! The spray tan is also marvelous, it smells amazing and looks flawless, like a swimsuit model. Absolutely amazing. I will definitely be back!

39.description: While I was not satisfied with my tan (i got the airbrush tan), I will say, the customer service I received here was by far and away, some of the best customer service I have ever experienced.  The day after my tan, once I realized I was disappointed, I did write an email to the salon to share my experience. The owner responded directly apologizing for my unsatisfactory visit and offering to make it up to me, as customer service is their number one priority.  He followed up with me multiple times  make sure I was satisfied, and it was truly nice to see a business care about their customers this way.Additionally, everyone at the salon was very friendly, and made me feel very comfortable during my appointment.Although I was disappointed with my tan, most people have had a great experience, and I would not hesitate to recommend Bella Bronze to others.

37.description: First time in this tanning salon and it was a great experience. Place is nice, clean and employees are friendly. Great selection of tanning beds!!!

0.description: I have been coming to Bella Bronze for over two years now, and could not recommend them enough. Everyone that works here is super friendly, and extremely knowledgeable (especially Sandra!). The beds are much better than the beds at other salons in the same price range. They've never tried to upsell me, and there is usually not a wait. I love that they keep a bag with my lotion and eyewear, so that I can stop in whenever I'm in the area, rather than having to plan a trip. I've brought several friends here, and they always comment on how nice it is, and how the staff seem to be passionate about their work. This is definitely the best place to tan in Chicago - I tried several other places before coming here and was very dissapointed. I started off with a Groupon for a one month membership, which I planned to use to build up a base tan and then cancel. However, after the first tan, I knew this would be my new go-to tanning salon. When I informed them a few weeks ago that I would be cancelling my membership due to an out of state move, they helped me research new tanning salons that would be similar in New York. That's just insanely good customer service! I will really miss tanning here, and will definitely be coming back whenever I am visiting Chicago!

38.description: Staff was courteous and helpful, waxing with Victoria is a must - she was amazing.  I commute very far to get to here and it is worth it!

51.description: This was my first spray tan ever.  I was nervous of how it would turn out.  The women at the front desk were very helpful and calming.  Victoria applied the spray.  She was amazing!  Although I was probably the worst client ever, she was so understanding and patient.  See her if you are nervous.  It will turn out great!

27.description: I am perplexed by the excellent reviews. I'm going back to Ortanic and Exhale and Cleise. The Good:The estheticians at Bella Bronze are very warm, friendly and nice, the spa is clean, and parking is pretty easy! I also think the couture spray tan looks pretty good. The Not-So-Good:The owner would not honor my Groupon for a spray tan because I had used a Groupon for a wax on a previous visit. *** This was not listed as a limitation on the Groupon. *** Very disappointed. I had to shell out another $41 for my tan on top of my Groupon. Not great customer service.Also, they missed quite a few spots on my wax. I had to go to another spa to get cleaned up. I recommend going to Cleise, Trim, Exhale or Bliss for waxing.I don't think I will be back - Ortanic is better and honors the deals they give us clients, and the waxing is better at many places around this great city.

32.description: Victoria is awesome. She did my brow sculpt n bikini wax. She's quick n efficient. She's really nice and funny. Love this place.

54.description: I am so impressed with these ladies. They are sweet and so patient. I first came here with a living social deal and I have never gone anywhere else since then for my Brazillian. My pain tolerance has been severely tested with waxing but they have always been so kind and patient with me. They are incredibly accommodating and you can find some great promos that they always have going on so you are always dealing with reasonable prices. The spaces are clean and neat and you will feel at ease simply being in the room chatting it up with your aesthetician. (sp?)Best wax in the South Loop area and probably much of Chicago.

48.description: This place is clean. Plus! Not many tanning places in Chicago are.I've gone there for spray tanning, since I'm so fair skinned, I don't tan... just burn. And I'm not a fan of laying in tan beds. Anywho, been there like 4 times. And this is the only place I trust for a spray tan. I come out of there looking sun kissed... like I have color... and it looks so naturale ;)The girls know what they are doing, and they don't make you look like Snooki. Which too, is always a plus. Sandra is awesome, you forget you are naked chatting away about your weekend when she is spraying you. And very professional.Must always remember to exfoliate to get a nice even tan. Lasts about a week.Never have problems finding where to park on Michigan, always find metered parking.  You can get a great package deal. But if you get it by session, it can get pricey.

44.description: I love Bella Bronze!  The ladies that work there are amazing and remember my name every time I walk in.  Their spray tan booths are the absolute best.  I am fair skinned, so I used the lightest spray and it lasts for about 4 days.  Usually around November, they run a special that is $100 for 10 spray tans.  That is such an amazing deal and you have a whole year to use them.  The location is great, street parking is never an issue, and the place is just SO clean.  I will go there as long as I live in Chicago.

24.description: This was one of my best purchases from Groupon. I would have never come here (or found this place) otherwise. I was greeted when I walked in and they already knew who I was. There was little wait. They gave me a quick little tour of the facilities before my tan. Victoria made me feel comfortable during a very uncomfortable process. She was professional and had great tips and advice. I was most worried about turning orange, but instead, I had a kick ass tan for my Vegas trip!  I looked sun soaked but still so natural. I wish it lasted longer (about 5 days). But I know that's part of the deal. The only part I didn't like was it seemed like everything was an up sell. I'm in sales too, I get it. But I don't want to be badgered with lots of pricing and deals and promotions. I wish you could use more than one Groupon here, I would definitely come back. But unfortunately it looks like it's only valid for first time guests. BooI'd be up for coming in again if I could get some good deals.

7.description: The entire establishment is very up to date and clean. Tanning beds are well kept and tidy. The customer service is amazing very informative and accommodating. I will be coming back and referring friends!

49.description: Get your eyelash extensions here, best in the city by far!  (Ive tried several different studios, none come close in terms of quality and skill).  Just had a lash fill with Micki.  She did an AMAZING job!

40.description: I had a brazilian today with Victoria. She was charismatic, engaging, friendly, quick, hygienic, and nearly painless. The reason I'm giving 4 stars instead of 5 is that I got a  little tear in my skin down there, which has never happened before. I felt it when it happened but since she kept going, I didn't think anything of it. I only noticed when I stopped by the ladies room and saw a little blood. Overall, good work, friendly staff, good post-procedure explanations, and hygienic.

53.description: Love this place already and I only went there last night.  Friendly staff, super clean, lots of "extras" like massage, facials, spray tan, waxing.I've worked in a tanning salon before and these guys have it right.  High level beds and all the things you need to make your tanning experience as wonderful as possible.

30.description: Victoria is awesome plain and simple. Fantastic job on my service. I was a little nervous at first switching waxing ladies, but she is simply great. Will def return.

46.description: I've been going here for a few months.  I checked their prices a few years ago & found it to be a little too expensive compared to the competition, but now that I've taken the plunge I totally see the justification for the price.  The salon is always clean, always smells good, & seems genuinely hygienic.  The beds are much, much better than your LA tan beds, and I don't think there's every been a single time that I've walked through the entrance, and not received a warm & welcoming smile.  So, is it more expensive than other tanning salons?  Yes, but totally worth the money!

1.description: 1 star is too many. Have been here before with good service. Today I walked out never to return! Arrived at 12:10 for a 12:15 eyebrow wax. No one was at the front desk which is normal so no big deal. When the receptionist did come back she didn't even acknowledge I was there, just sat at the desk playing on her phone. At 12:25 I finally asked how much longer it would be & was told "they're just finishing up". Finally at 12:35 I told the girl I couldn't wait any longer & walked out.
