Not only is that poor customer service, but if people have to pay the outrageous parking meter fees to come to this place, the least they could do is be on time or be friendly/professional.

55.description: If you need a spray tan for a wedding or special event, but are nervous that it won't come out right - this is the place for you. I've used Bella Bronze over 15 times for spray tanning, and they are consistently the best in the city. I've never had streaks or areas missed. The spray tan has been perfect every single time, and lasted for about a week. If you are new to spray tanning, this is quite a feat. I've been to 3 other locations in the city, and no one does it this well every single time. The location is incredibly clean and Sandra (owner) and Victoria (staff) will remember your name and preferences after your first visit. They will actually create a file for you to make note of what you liked and didn't like.  The process will take about 45 minutes, so its helpful that there is metered street parking. The Redline is also available about 5 blocks away. Make sure you follow their instructions on the phone: 1.) Exfoliate/shave the day before2.) No lotions, make up, or a ton of deodorant when being sprayed3.) Have 8-12 hours allocated after the spray to make sure it sets4.) avoid exfoliating post spray to allow the tan to lastOn a side note, this is one of the few establishments that I go to that I'm always greeted with a smile, and a 'Hello Lindsey.' They know my name. and you feel welcome and taken care of from the moment you walk in the door. The staff is knowledgable and professional, and I wish them the best of luck getting new business.

9.description: I really love the service at this place.  The entire staff is super friendly, nice and informative.  The manager is also friendly and engages in conversation with everyone.  The place is very clean and  they offer a variety of services.  I have done the Couture Spray tan which went very well.  The girl who performed it asked questions and gave me lots of tips.  I have also used their tanning beds and no complaints.  Definitely my go to place for tanning.

26.description: This place is awesome. It's clean, cute, the staff is wonderful and they're amazing at what they do. I went the other day for a spray tan, something I've had many times. Victoria sprayed me after a quick 5 min tanning session, and she's a doll. She is informative, sweet, easy to talk to and great at her job. I asked 20 ?'s bc they seem to have a lot more "rules" regarding the after tan maintenance. Well, I didn't listen 100%, at all, and this has by far been the longest lasting spray ran I've ever received. I'm sold. After the session, I seriously felt 6 lbs lighter and a lot more attractive. Maybe they put hallucinogens in the spray, or maybe we should all do what makes us feel better! And spray tanning at Bella is one of those things from now on.

25.description: Victoria is the best.  As a loyal customer of hers, I can't imagine going to anyone else.  She's quick, make things comfortable (as much as they can be), sweet, and she really does a fantastic job. I would recommend her to anyone!

12.description: My review is ONLY for the pedicure with Ina.  I purchased a Groupon for a pedicure that would otherwise cost $55, which I think is extremely expensive.    Ina probably has given me the BEST pedicure ever!  I do not know what she did differently but my toes looked beautiful.  Unfortunately, I cannot afford to go back without a Groupon because I cannot justify the hefty $55 price tag in addition to the $10 tip I usually give.  I typically spend less than $30 for pedicure alone because I do it every month.       Buy the Groupon in addition to the additional 20% (or more) off that Groupon periodically offers.  I ended up paying only $21 with my $10 cash tip it was $31 and that price is reasonable.         There is meter parking directly in front of the store however, I got lucky and found parking only two short blocks away where they have no meters! That was a nice perk because I wanted to walk too.  There is a strip of two blocks just north of this shop where construction was done and they never put back the parking meters.  Be careful though of special events or a Bears game where they do monitor these spaces (apparently - I was told by one of the store owners when I asked why there are no meters). For the most part he said unless they put the meters back up there is no parking fee on that block.      They sell lotions, clothing(beach wear, special pedicure flip-flops(which I purchased) because it had hidden/foldable toe separators which was unique and fun - $15.

59.description: i am stricktly a versa spa spray tanner but as far as my experience goes this is the best place for versa spa the girls who work there are always friendly and attentive the spray is always custom to whatever color level and options you want and it lasts for a good week i would def recomend this place and in my opinion it is the best auto spray tan in the city

21.description: This tanning salon is great!  Awesome location close to home plus the staff takes time to thoroughly explain all my tanning needs regarding questions.  The salon is very clean and the atmosphere is unique.   They have a wide selection of lotions and other services like waxing, facials, massage spray tanning and even teeth whitening!!  I would recommend this place to anyone.

17.description: Went here for lash extensions from Micki.Overall, it was good.  I had a gilt city offer for application and fill.  I love me a deal!The first application was ok.  I like my lashes a little more full.  It was a good length, but I just like them super duper full.  The fill, she made them more full.  Maybe I was at a shedding point when I first went.  The second application I liked a lot more.Also, I found that her extensions didnt last as long as the other places that I went.  You will most definitely need a fill every two weeks to keep your doe eyes up.

10.description: First time getting a facial. It was awesome. Not sure of the employees names but they were very nice for my whole visit. The facial was great as well. Felt very relaxing and I highly reccommend them! I will be back again!

5.description: I had Victoria for a facial and she was awesome. I was a little apprehensive since I used a Groupon, but she exceeded all expectations. I've had a few facials in the city and this is the first one I've felt actually did a good job. She also gave me some samples to take home. I'll be back for sure!

3.description: DO NOT MAKE THE MISTAKE OF GETTING AN AIRBRUSH TAN HERE!!!!Bella Bronze RUINED my wedding day! 3 days prior to my wedding I came in for a "professional airbrush tan". I followed all of the directions/tips provided. In addition, I also purchased the recommended lotion and body wash in order to maintain the tan. All together the tan and products costed over $100.  Needless to say, come my wedding day the tanning solution stained and appeared all over my WEDDING DRESS!!! Much of my reception was spent obsessing over the fact that my wedding dress was completely stained and scrubbing to get the horrific color out! To make matters worse, after receiving my wedding pictures I was devastated to find that many once in a lifetime shots were destroyed thanks to the repulsive sight of tanning stains all over my dream gown. There is no worse feeling that what I experienced on my wedding day due to this awful place.

35.description: I went here yesterday for the first time. I am getting ready for my upcoming wedding and need a little bronzing before the honeymoon. I have to say that this place is one of the nicest tanning spas in the city. It is clean, well decorated and you can tell that they take a lot of pride in their product. Sandra was probably the nicest person I have ever met. She showed me the whole facility and it was so nice to see someone who takes pride in their business. I will be back over and over for tanning, spa services and anything else they offer.

19.description: I get teeth whitened and my waxes done here.. I really like the environment and service.. No complaints thus far I am a returning customer :)

28.description: Visited the Salon last night.  A friend of mine referred me to Victoria for a Brazilian wax. The Salon was clean, everyone was very nice. Victoria was excellent, made the whole process quick & as painless as it can be. I highly recommend her.

45.description: LOVE this PLACE!!I am very happy with the color I get from their beds. They have a variety of beds and packages to choose from that are reasonably priced. They also do massages, facials, waxing, spray tan and sell products like sunglasses and lotions. The staff is consistently friendly and rarely have I had to wait for a bed. Good hours of business too!Definitely beats any other tanning salon I have been to.

33.description: I recently moved to the area and was nervous about trying out a new place. I had a Brazilian Wax with Vanessa and I couldn't be happier! Nobody likes getting waxed....I mean seriously, but Vanessa made it as comfortable as possible. One of the best waxes I've ever had!I also decided last minute to do my eyebrows and Vanessa was able to squeeze me in right away which I really appreciated! Overall it was a great experience and I'll be back to Bella Bronze for my next wax. Very clean facility, excellent customer services and competitive pricing!

43.description: This is one of the best tanning salons I have been to in Chicago.  The beds and facility are always clean, the beds are newer and always clean, each room has hooks and at least one chair where you can hang your clothes, and there are mirrors in the rooms too.  The only downside, is that it is a little on the expensive side, but I would rather pay a little more for awesome beds and a high end facility.  They just featured a Groupon that I purchased, which made me THRILLED and love this place even more!

2.description: First time customer and I got a first time customer wax with Victoria which was amazing she was meticulous and fast. My mani and pedi with Ina was perfection. I even tried the teeth whitening and the results were immediate. This place is the ideal one stop shop, happily filled with professionals who take pride in their work. Can't wait to go back and try the facial and spray tanning services.

18.description: Just got a spray tan here a couple days ago. I am orange!  The place was also very dirty and the tan itself felt sticker than others I've had. Won't be coming back here!!

41.description: Moved to the city 6 months ago  and I did some free weeks at different tanning stores to see which I liked best.  After sampling tanning stores around the south loop, loop, and west loop NOTHING came close to Bella Bronze. Great beds, great experienced workers and great services other than tanning ( eyebrows, spray tans).  Victoria and Sandra are the best!

52.description: I first visited Bella Bronze for my lash extensions earlier this year, and have been a regular customer ever since. I adore Micki the lash technician, she's a doll, super accommodating (because sometimes I run late if I'm coming from work), and I receive so many complements on my lush, pretty lashes. I get them at a modest length - slightly longer and fuller than my own - so they look natural.  *Tip: The lashes adhere better and longer if you arrive for service without any eye makeup. Even if you use oil free makeup remover, doing this right before service alters the effectiveness of the lash adhesive; and you may not get the maximum results with how long they stay on.Prior to BB, I'd tried another popular lash place in town, but didn't really care for their impersonal manner nor their high priced service (prices were offered in confusing tiers based on some level of lash tech experience that was difficult to verify). With Bella Bronze, everyone is friendly, the entire space is always clean and relaxing, and  the lash prices are straight forward; they offer well priced packages also.The only thing I might look into improving are the adhesive eye strips that are applied under the eyes to ensure the lower lashes are out of the way.  They aren't completely uncomfortable, but it would be nice if the strips were cushioned or moisturizing or something. Plus removing the strip at the end of service might be a more bearable experience if you know your under eyes were being pampered while the lashes are being applied.  Don't know if its feasible, but its just a thought. :-)

50.description: I've received many airbrush and spray tans here, they are certainly some of the best in the city and much superior to the local LA Tan or Ultimate Exposure. I have not had their spa services, but for UV free tanning, this is the best.

4.description: I bought a package of 3 couture spray tanning sessions for $160 right before my wedding last year - they did a great job and we're really friendly.  However, when I called today to make an appointment before my trip to Mexico tomorrow, I was told that my 2 remaining sessions had expired and that I'd need to pay for a new session if I wanted to come in today.  I honestly had NO idea that they expired, and if I would have known that I would not have purchased a package. Also they technically expired 2 weeks ago, so I thought maybe they'd give me a break for that. Nope...I asked to speak with the manger who told me there was nothing she could do.  She basically said that it was my fault that I didn't know their policy.  She did however thank me for being a valued customer and referring people to the salon - BUT guess she didn't care enough to keep my business.  Glad that one spray tan cost me $160.00...Thanks a lot Bella Bronze.

6.description: Just a fantastic spot! I can't tell you how many times I passed this place before stopping in. After reading other yelp reviews I gave it a shot and they were so right. From the moment you walk in the staff is incredibly friendly and attentive.While they were processing my paperwork, the owner took me in a tour of the facilities. The place is much larger that I anticipated with really great beds and a host of spa services as well. The sign up process was fast and easy. They have a great assortment of lotions and, if you buy a bottle there, can get a bag with your name and they will store your lotion and goggles there for you.The beds are clean and quiet. I have been at various times on different days since joining here and have yet to have to wait for a bed. Love the vanity room where you can remove make up before tanning. Overall I am so happy with my experience here. Looking forward to trying their spa services too and showing off my killer Bella Bronze tan when I hit Miami next weekend!

22.description: I had to use one star since they would not let me choose zero.  After coming being "sold" on a package that the "manager" promised me would never expire - I went to use it and was told "it expired - 4 days ago".  And then was offered $10 off either a new package or a single use.  Really?  Now, I realize that I had not been there in some time - but they send me emails all the time  - it would have been nice for a reminder about the package expiring.  Or when the person on the phone told me "I will have the manager call" and then I never heard from them again.  No customer service.  AT ALL.  I will never go back.

15.description: Bella Bronze Tan is great! I've been here many times and each time has been pleasant.  Customer service seems to be top priority here which starts the second you walk in. The young lady at the front desk greeted me as soon as I walked in and even remembered my name! I was surprised by that because I've been to other tanning salons that don't have that same hospitality. I came early for my appointment and had to wait a few minutes in their lobby area. It's nicely decorated and feels cozy and warm! They also put up awesome decorations for the different holidays!Everyone there was so nice and accomadating to me!I use their tannings beds and they're always VERY clean and again their customer service was amazing as they explained everything before hand.Something else that surpised me was how dog friendly Bella Bronze was! They let me bring my boy Miles with me and the nice young lady at the front desk even watched him for me while I was tanning!I definitely recommend this tanning salon to anyone who wants a great tan and friendly customer service!!

57.description: I've lived in many different cities and visited many different tanning salons, and Bella Bronze is head and shoulders above the rest.Since the very first day I visited when I was given a personalized and complete tour of the place, I have felt that the staff value each customer's satisfaction and desired results -- unlike most salons where you're herded in and ushered out like cattle.And even though it's an otherwise insignificant thing, they ALL remember my name with a smile each time I walk in.  Even if I go for long periods without dropping by, they inevitably greet me like one of their best customers.Aside from the fantastic staff, the beds are always clean and provide consistently great results...even with fair skin like mine.  I also dig the hip urban zen vibe to the place....spacious with polished concrete floors, high ceilings, etc.  All in all, each visit is a pleasurable experience from start to finish.

20.description: This place is okay for tanning, good selection of beds but seems over priced. DO NOT go here for waxing. The girl just took out a big chunk of my eyebrow 3 weeks before my wedding. WORST wax job ever. I wish I could get all my money back for the waxing and tanning, because it's likely my eyebrows will still be a disaster for my wedding. I wish I could give negative stars!

36.description: Went here for lash extensions from Micki.Overall, it was good.  I had a gilt city offer for application and fill.  I love me a deal!The first application was ok.  I like my lashes a little more full.  It was a good length, but I just like them super duper full.  The fill, she made them more full.  Maybe I was at a shedding point when I first went.  The second application I liked a lot more.Also, I found that her extensions didnt last as long as the other places that I went.  You will most definitely need a fill every two weeks to keep your doe eyes up.

14.description: My daughter has the couture spray tan the other day. It's perfect! Not too light, not too dark, and not at all orangy. This is definitely the way to go to avoid the tanning beds.

1.description: The worst McDonald's ever.  I didn't think it was possible that a chain would be so different.  I went through the drive thru on Super Bowl Sunday.  Not only was my order wrong, 2x but the food was awful, worse than my average expectations of a typical McD's.  The mozzarella sticks were short & hollow, no cheese whatsoever.   When I showed her, she had an attitude, gave me replacement sticks that were also empty.  This franchise needs a quality check.  The rest of my order was completely wrong.  I was too annoyed with the bad attitude to go back.  I'll just never go again.  Fortunately,  I have other McD choices because I live near two others in Bronzeville.  It's too bad this one is next door to McCormick Place where out-of-towners could get a bad impression of Chicago simply by coming here.

9.description: I like this McDonald's it is clean, the cashiers are nice and the food is fresh!I don't have any complaints and its not a McDonalds that I frequent that often but when I'm in the area I do go to and like this restaurant!

23.description: Ok, so I hardly ever go to McDonalds--and when I do, I usually go for their soft serve ice cream.....it helps me with a craving for sweets, and it's "better" for me than heading over to Marble Slab, mixing in a snickers bar with my ice cream, and spending 5 bucks.1 star for being closeby1 star for having decent evening hoursThat's it.  That's all you get because you NEVER have ice cream.  How is it that you never have ice cream?!!!

12.description: I know I know...who writes a review for McDonald's?But when you have a long strand of HAIR in your breakfast sandwich you kinda feel like you need to warn other people....I think that's my punishment for eating there in the first place after a long stint of avoiding the franchise. I mean come on it's not even real meat.

21.description: This is a good McDonalds location.  The staff are nice, the service is good for a fast food chain, the place is clean, and the food comes out on time and hot like you would expect.  Even though it is next to the convention center the prices are still regular McD's prices with the full dollar menu and all.

16.description: If you have a choice, go ANYWHERE else.Staff is rude and condescending.NO REFILLS on drinks period. I even asked to see a manager to ask why. He just said, "We don't do that here. Buy another drink."

17.description: $1.8 for regular coffee...$5 for 5 chicken wings...hmmm

10.description: I wish there was a no star option!  Ghetto employees!  We couldn't even place a simple 2 parfait order because of them laughing in the background and fooling around. I could barely understand there English that's how ghetto she was talking. 1st and last time I come to this Mcdonalds.

5.description: Never gave mcdonalds low stars.  I've eaten here 20+ times and got diarrhea twice now.  I think they not making profit and using old food through day.  I asked for manager....alfazo Harris.  Plus no refills on soda.  This is def not a mcdonalds in my book.

11.description: Everyone knows McDonald's is notorious for getting orders wrong.  Sometimes that's understandable.  But this one can't even get black coffee right.  Even when it's all you order.  Twice I ordered just black coffee and when I got home I realized it had sugar and cream in it.  Hard to believe.  This made me stop going to all McDonald's restaurants.  Best 2 months of my life so far.  Keep your bad service.

22.description: They are professional stickup artist! Because this establishment is next to the McCormick Place Convention Center, it has some high food prices. The décor of great and the location is just on the north border of Bronzeville.  Be prepared for rowdy youth at certain times of the day from a high school in the area.

0.description: I live between two McDonald's locations, it would be a toss up as to which one is closer, in any event I choose to make this one the go to place. Compared to the one on 35th., it's cleaner inside and out. They maintain the grounds, and the parking lot is free of trash. They get my order right 99% of the time, and I prefer their items over Burger King, you're either one or the other. I've also learned from experience you marry someone that prefers the other.Hey it's fast food, odds are it's going to taste the same, so reviewing it isn't going to tell you anything you don't know about the food. What I can tell you is this one is pretty clean and efficient. Maybe something to do with being located by McCormick Pl., you have to figure on the conventioneers having some standards. The one on 35th., seems to cater to the neighborhood drunkies that wouldn't notice if their order was wrong.

20.description: Horrible service and they always get the order wrong. We ordered hamburger with cheese and 4/5 times, it doesn't come with cheese and we paid extra for it. Then the fries problem, they serve broken fries, stale and greasy with 1000g of salt. We understand it's McDonald, but service and food could be improved!

19.description: Ok, so I hardly ever go to McDonalds--and when I do, I usually go for their soft serve ice cream.....it helps me with a craving for sweets, and it's "better" for me than heading over to Marble Slab, mixing in a snickers bar with my ice cream, and spending 5 bucks.1 star for being closeby1 star for having decent evening hoursThat's it.  That's all you get because you NEVER have ice cream.  How is it that you never have ice cream?!!!

2.description: This is probably one of the worst McDonald's in Chicago.  The service is horrible and they either getting the order right are they don't have what I try to order.  They are always out of all ice cream products, which means they are just to lazy to clean the ice cream machine.  Hope this one is on the list to close.

18.description: Horrible service and they always get the order wrong. We ordered hamburger with cheese and 4/5 times, it doesn't come with cheese and we paid extra for it. Then the fries problem, they serve broken fries, stale and greasy with 1000g of salt. We understand it's McDonald, but service and food could be improved!

13.description: I can only vouch for the drive-thru - if the line is long stay away! I've been stuck in this line waiting for a coffee for a long while. The service is always friendly and orders accurate though.

4.description: Not sure if this McDonald's care at all about cleanliness or customer service. With their proximity to McCormick center this franchise should be embarrassed. Waiting for this one to renovated before going back. The toilet seats were horrifying. Stay away

24.description: Its important that a review be performed on this McDonald's restaurant. In my opinion, this is one of the best McDonald's in Chicago. The owner created a Black Heritage theme with an emphasis on the Civil Rights Movement within this establishment. Framed newspaper articles, Jet and Ebony cover pages from the 1960's help to create a very mural that details the Movement.  It is a  very classy, subtle educational artpiece which includes photos of Martin Luther King, Jr., Coretta Scott King, Jesse Jackson, Ralph Abernathy, Julian Bond and many other Civil Rights leaders.  This McDonald's has been remodeled in recent years and the seating arrangement and set up are wonderful.  Its located on Martin Luther King Drive, right at the Stevenson Expressway and in the vicinity of Mercy and Michael Reese Hospitals.  The Bronzeville statue is right at median near this McDonald's.  Now, in terms of service, they know they are in a strategic location and the service is of a very high quality. The drive-through is efficient and counter service always has a good number of workers so, even though it is a very busy restaurant, you do not have to wait a long time as the workers are courteous, well trained and organized.This is one McDonald's that I recommend you "order-in" for a wonderful educational exposure to Black Heritage / Black History in the United States.The owner of this McDonald's could have created any type of theme, or no theme at all.  So, I commend him for creating such a tasteful, educational and worthy themed restaurant.

6.description: This is pretty much the only restaurant in this area, so it can get pretty busy. The pros are 24 hours, pretty fast with orders, a lot of parking  and its convenient.  Cons are it sometimes gets too crowded and with the crowds it can get run down. Employees are nice though and they usually get my coffee orders correct

15.description: Attempted to have breakfast at this McDonalds on Sunday morning.  A lot of customers waiting at counter - no discernible lines. Staff were confused - waited 10 minutes and observed no orders taken from anyone during this time. Observed who appeared as manager to be rude to a couple of patrons who were seeking to get their orders corrected. Food was pushed at one person without a thank you. After 10 minutes left without placing an order. Very disorganized. Manager needs to be trained on procedures and customer service.

7.description: The drive thru service there is horrible! They can seem to get the orders correct  when your ordering and even by a miracle when they get the order right the person that fills the order still screws up. Not mention their poor customer service and these are the same people that are asking for a raise. PLEASE STAY AWAY FROM THIS LOCATION THEY SUCK!

8.description: Always immaculate with a helpful, efficient staff. 24 hour drive through as well as pleasant large area for customers to eat in. The completion of jazz artist, Bronzeville VIPs from the 50s is wonderful to see.  By far the most pleasant McDonald's in which to enjoy a very good cup of much needed coffee with the husband before continuing a day of multiple errands following my lab work.

3.description: Rude. Ignorant. Horseplay. Said I dont have any money on my card when I have enough. Went inside to their atm and withdrew cash infront of their face and they just laughed n went to hide in the back.

14.description: drive there to buy some ice tea which is in the drive thru menu... but they said they dont have it...

3.description: This salon is great! It's conveniently located in the South Loop and all of the stylists do great work. My stylist is Tasha, and I've been going to her for nearly 4 years. She gives awesome cuts and styles!! Thank you, Tasha! Ladies, visit Y'lonn, you'll be in for a treat.

1.description: I've been going to Y'lonn for over 10 years and would not know what to do with out her. She's the consummate professional and highly skilled. She firmly believes healthy hair and makes sure you  make all the right choices to keep your mane looking its best!

2.description: First and foremost, Y'lonn is a top notch professional, knows what she is doing and expects the same from her employees! My wifes hair looks amazing after she returns home from Y'lonn's! I wish we lived closer to  her studio, it's a 48 mile drive each way! As you can see, my wife will travel for good service! I think she's been going for 9 years now! It is worth the drive! Y'lonn is very educated when it comes to the health of your hair. I didn't understand why my wife drove so far at first, but now I completely understand! Look, you work hard and deserve good professional service, you owe it to yourself to try this place out.

0.description: Y'lonn is the consumate professional.  This is not the stereotypical salon experience with long waits.  This is truly all of the positives of going to the salon without the negative crap that makes you rethink scheduling your appointment.  From start to finish, Y'lonn is not a dissapointment.  First, I love that you can schedule your appointment online ... the calendar gives you a snapshot of her availabilit and lets you book & confirm right there.  My hair looked and felt great and lasted longer than usual.  Y'lonn also gave me tips on maintenence.  I got so many compliments on my hair.  Love this place.

58.description: Went to Waffles after a graduation (on a FRIDAY morning about 10:30am). Group of 6 were seated promptly then served coffee. Waited about 15 minutes before being asked our order. We ordered.One hour later. Our foods haven't arrived.We asked waitress if our foods were coming. Waitress: "It's going to be a little while longer."We asked for permission to cancel because we had to go.  "Sure," she shrugged nonchalantly.Was very surprised at their lack of concern or apology. This place on nice Michigan Avenue nearby downtown... doesn't seem fitting.We went to another restaurant and thankfully, were served our brunch in under 10-minute.

56.description: Went to Waffles on a Monday morning right when it opened. I had seen it on Unique Sweets and was excited to try the waffles. I ordered the Waffle Flight and it was delicious. My only reason for the three stars is the price. I paid $25 for coffee, waffles, and a side of turkey bacon. The waitress asked if I wanted the turkey bacon, making it seem like it came with the meal. $5 extra for the turkey bacon, which was insanely salty. Service was good overall but I don't know if I'd go back--mostly because of the price.

29.description: So this place has been here for a little while now. I always go to bongo room because I love the pancakes! Well today I wanted a change! Came over to waffles. OH MY GOD, I'm glad I did! First off, the place is cool and laid back. It's on Michigan avenue near museum park so you'd think this would be some fancy expensive place. Food is fancy, food is great, staff is excellent, prices are low and did I say food is fancy and amazing?I got the 3.99 special and dang it is ALOT OF FOOD! It's like basically free. I think I would have spent more at home if I made it myself. It comes out fast too. The place is casual which is nice. You never know when in prairie district/museum park. Like I just want to eat breakfast, I don't need a fancy place. As a matter of fact especially when I'm about to go to work I don't need some fancy pants place. It's clean and has a fantastic atmosphere. Not a greasy spoon or hole in the wall. You can see the kitchen too, no secrets lol. It smells delicious too.Did I say how good the food was? You have to come to WAFFLES. It's good, great, well dang can I say I love it? I'm vegetarian and I love it.

42.description: I love this place. Went with my bff and sat outside at the patio. Had the chicken,bacon waffles. Omg that was so delicious. My girl had the pulled pork waffles and that was really good too. I would definitely recommend it! I'll be back there. Parking is street parking and parking downtown sucks. Read the signs carefully where u park.

23.description: This place is basic on every level: food, service, ambience, everything. My husband and I walked into the restaurant at 3:05 The restaurant closes at 4 PM. The greeter acted as if she was doing us a favor by seating us a "whole hour" (insert sarcasm here) before the restaurant closed. She literally looked at her watch and said, "I guess I can seat you". we should have turned around then and walked out, but we were hungry so we decided to give it a shot. All of the food was not seasoned and very bland. I had the bacon and chicken waffles. The waffle was a bit hard as was the bacon. The chicken tenders would have been ok, but they had no seasoning. Honestly, I could have made better food at home. In fact, I do make better food at home. My husband had the "waffle flight" (May not be the exact name but it has something with the word flight in it). It was very basic. We ordered an omelette with cheese and broccoli. The broccoli was pretty tough and the cheese was not really scrambled in the egg more like laid on top of it. The place was freezing which made our food get colder faster. The waitress only came to check in on us once while we were eating. It was just bad. Not to mention the bill was 45 which wouldn't be bad if the food was worth it. My recommendation, if you're looking for a good brunch spot in that area, go around the corner to Bongo Room. The only reason why we didn't go there today was because they had already closed.

47.description: Great waffles. I got the bacon waffles with fried chicken, my wife the waffle sandwich. Bring your BYOB champagne to mix with the fresh squeezed OJ and take a wonut to go for when you need a dessert a little while later. Good stuff, does not disappoint.

8.description: So this place has been here for a little while now. I always go to bongo room because I love the pancakes! Well today I wanted a change! Came over to waffles. OH MY GOD, I'm glad I did! First off, the place is cool and laid back. It's on Michigan avenue near museum park so you'd think this would be some fancy expensive place. Food is fancy, food is great, staff is excellent, prices are low and did I say food is fancy and amazing?I got the 3.99 special and dang it is ALOT OF FOOD! It's like basically free. I think I would have spent more at home if I made it myself. It comes out fast too. The place is casual which is nice. You never know when in prairie district/museum park. Like I just want to eat breakfast, I don't need a fancy place. As a matter of fact especially when I'm about to go to work I don't need some fancy pants place. It's clean and has a fantastic atmosphere. Not a greasy spoon or hole in the wall. You can see the kitchen too, no secrets lol. It smells delicious too.Did I say how good the food was? You have to come to WAFFLES. It's good, great, well dang can I say I love it? I'm vegetarian and I love it.

31.description: Waffles are decent but we tried the chicken and waffles with bacon but the fried chicken tasted really badly and burnt. Horrible taste. My first and last time

34.description: I normally don't write reviews but I just had to let everyone know NOT TO COME HERE. Food isn't the same, very inconsistent! Service... well, WHAT service??! Note to owner/manager: please train servers, bussers THE PROPER WAY!!! Not that hard if you know what you're doing (obviously YOU dont).There are plenty of breakfast/lunch places nearby to spend your money, just not here.

16.description: I absolutely love this place!!!! Great environment! The servers are fast and sweet ladies! The food is amazing!!!!!! If you have a sweet tooth I promise you they have the yummiest pancakes here. I live an hour away and you bet I would drive there for breakfast every morning if I could. Must try it! Better then the Yolk restaurant that's down the street!!

13.description: Weekdays this place has a $3.99 Chicken Bacon Waffle selection on their menu.  Omg.  This is way better than McDonalds.  I pay almost the same thing for 2 Sausage McMuffins downtown.  Seriously!  I mean, its a great way to sample their food for starters.  I stop by whenever I want breakfast.  It is delightful for dine-in.  I wrote this review because I have pinned up excitement to share this delicious find!  The staff is pleasant too!

11.description: I was really looking forward to this place. An easy walk from the Hilton. Wasn't busy, and smelled divine. Got the waffle bacon egg and cheese sandwich.!Unfortunately the waffle was very dense and undercooked. Doughy even. I complained when the server came to check on me and she said only, "I'm sorry." When check came, it was full price. Wasn't happy. Maybe a fluke but probably not.

39.description: Food is good! Staff is friendly!! But the order takes too long...30mins more for the order...killing me..

37.description: Stopped in here on a whim because I had a taste for chicken and waffles. This place was great! Service very quick and staff was polite. I was actually very surprised with the chicken and waffles. Not only was it delicious, I felt it tasted a LOT healthier (if that's even possible) than say Roscoes. I mean this in the sense that it didn't seem so heavy. After I eat Roscoes, I'm in a food coma for about a week, haha. With this, it was perfectly satisfying and I didn't feel like I wanted to die after. The best part, is during the week, chicken and waffles and the ham and eggs meals are  only $3.99!!!! My mom and I both are very filling meals with coffee and our bill turned out to be a whopping $12! I would DEFINITELY come back to this place! Also, lots of police officers seem to like it , there were many inside and out for breakfast. I thought that was cool. Minus one star for the music. It's kind of blaring and it's like Rnb/HipHop. Which isn't bad, I like it. But not for breakfast. It's also unedited. So hearing songs that drop F-bombs in a family place I thought was in poor taste.

0.description: Great service, Awesome food!!! I love Waffles, we came for a late brunch and had the best time ever.  We brought some champagne (BYOB) and enjoyed the afternoon eating our delicious breakfast and chatting away.  There was no wait when we walked in which was also a huge bonus.  I would definitely return for brunch!

38.description: Can't beat breakfast for $4. Chicken and waffles or ham and eggs with potatoes and toast. Best to eat in thought cause getting it to go makes it soggy, but that's not their fault. I hard their ala-cart can get expensive so I'd stick with the weekday special.

51.description: Good breakfast food. Line was not too crazy on a holiday weekend. Decently priced. Ok service.

27.description: Went here on a Sunday at noon and was seated outside with no wait. We ordered the bacon chicken waffles, a side of potatoes and the mexican nachos (can't think of the name offhand). Waffles were awesome. We will definitely be back for those. Chicken tenders on the waffles were flavorless and dry so I would just order one of the plain waffles next time. I thought the nachos were pretty good. Boyfriend didn't like them but I think there is no such think as bad mexican, ever. Kind of reminded me of something basic at an all inclusive resort in Mexico if you know what I mean. Anyway..wasn't worth $44 for breakfast but the waffle itself was good! Hope this review helps.

32.description: I like this place .. Service is fast and food is good. Though I agree for the price we pay the quantity was a bit less. Overall a good experience.

54.description: This restaurant is in a great location. Of course their waffles are pretty good but everything else on the menu is seriously LACKING. I've been to this place 3 different times and each time something else was off.The first I want towards the end of December and I ordered the bacon waffle and chicken along with the breakfast potatoes and eggs. The menu online said it was supposed to come with actual chicken legs but I was told that they did not have chicken legs and it would come with chicken strips instead. I was disappointed but I still ordered it. It was good but nothing to write home about. The eggs were tasty and the breakfast potatoes were deliciously seasoned. My first visit was slightly disappointing but overall tasty. My second visit was match with even more disappointment. I went the morning of Valentine's Day with my girlfriend. I ordered the corn beef hash and pancakes. The pancakes were decent but the problem came from the corn beef hash. IT WAS CLEARLY FROM A CAN! It definitely was canned corn beef hash which is deeply disappointing since I love fresh made corn beef hash. They didn't even bother to crisp up the hash. So incredibly disappointing!The last visit occurred last Tuesday, so late June. I tried to go back to the chicken and waffles and still received chicken tenders instead of actual chicken legs. I also ordered potatoes that were unbelievably bland. The first time I had the potatoes they didn't need any sort of salt or hot sauce but this time I couldn't add enough salt or hot sauce. Those potatoes were absolutely flavorless. My girlfriend ordered a ham and cheese omelet with added spinach and it was greasy. Yup, she had a greasy omelet. It also had an overwhelming taste of artificial butter. We will no longer visit this restaurant again due to its immense inconsistencies in its menu and way of cooking the food. Decent food but don't expect to get exactly what the menu says. One day it'll be delicious and the next it will taste like cardboard.The service is also very nice just to add but overall terribly inconsistent restaurant!

48.description: In short, the food was pretty bad. We prob. had the worst biscuit and gravy ever. And I honestly think this place only serves regular waffles, instead of authentic Belgium waffles. 2 stars because this place serves Intelligentsia coffee.

44.description: Food is not bad. But I came over here at 3pm, they have started to clean tables. Come on, the restaurant time says you close at 4! They took away creams, napkins, and waitress ate their meal at counter, and no one service me. Very bad.

24.description: I absolutely love this place!!!! Great environment! The servers are fast and sweet ladies! The food is amazing!!!!!! If you have a sweet tooth I promise you they have the yummiest pancakes here. I live an hour away and you bet I would drive there for breakfast every morning if I could. Must try it! Better then the Yolk restaurant that's down the street!!

7.description: The clean decor and service are the only two good things about this place. The food is terrible. I could make better waffles and pancakes at home. If you have a bunch of kids and are on a budget, it's probably fine. But don't expect to go for a wonderful brunch experience.

49.description: Came here for brunch and left really full! Should have gotten coffee because that goes with waffles right? Anyway got the Waffle sandwich and Liege Waffles along with a side of sausage and potatoes. The Liege waffle were a bit dry but I think that is how they are supposed to be. I tried the waffle sandwich and that was really good. The sausage was done perfect but only 3 links. I thought at least 4 would have been nice. The potatoes were a decent amount but I didn't try them. my dining companion did like them but she put hot sauce on them which makes everything taste better!The service was ok. Lots of wait staff but no one ever asked to refill my soda. Do they not to free refills? Also the server never said her name. We also had to wait a while after our plates were cleared for the check. OK maybe we were in a hurry and that is why it seemed like a long wait. The staff is really nice though and we were seated right away. A large group came in after we placed our order. The staff was very nice to them and allowed them to all sit together which I really think was a good move. Kiddos for that.I will probably come again and have something else. The omelets looked great! They also have tables outside and when I'm not in a hurry I will try eating outside.

40.description: The best thing about here is that there is no wait and the service is timely. The seating is comfortable and the servers are polite and accommodating to the customers' needs. They let us pick our seats and bring us milk for our coffee (there's cream at each table). The food is great too so for no wait and friendly service, I would come here over more popular breakfast locales. We tried the red velvet waffles, ham steak with eggs, and corned hash with eggs. Oh and of course coffee, which is unlimited. Portions are substantial. The roasted potatoes that come with the egg dishes is perfectly cooked and seasoned, you also have a choice of toast or pancakes, both are great. There's whipped butter and strawberry jam at each table, which happen to be my favorite toppings for toast. Highly recommend!

53.description: I have to give them 5 stars, all 5 stars go to the food. From presentation to bite- nothing but amazing. I had their Chicago's Beat Waffle, and it was Chicago's Best Waffle. The portion was shareable and a good price for the food they put on the plate. There was no wait for a table on 4th of July. The food did take a long time to come out, but I'm guessing it was coz the kitchen was super busy. So all in all- if you do go here have their waffles! That's what they are known for.

30.description: Great! Unbelievably delicious! This may be due to me thinking of a waffles and then thinking waffle house only; because I'm southern and that's the only waffle I'm really familiar with : D hehehehe... Simply Delcious. Try it.

46.description: A typical breakfast place in Chicago.  It is worth going to if you need your pancakes and waffles. I drove and parked outside on the street.  There was more than enough parking.  It's not that special but you get food portions.  The servers seemed a bit snobby or not inviting that's why I did not give 5 stars.

1.description: I thought about three stars, but then I realized I really probably won't come back here. Not that the food was horrible, but just that for all of the food options that there are, this food didn't have much flavor to it at all for me. I got their ham and cheese special waffle where the waffles had ham baked into them and there was scrambled eggs on top and melted cheese. You would think all of those salty things and cheese would make it awesome, and it looked awesome presentation wise, but it really didn't taste like much at all. And this made me sad because our server was so happy and wonderful and attentive, but the food just really was nothing special at all. Our group did get seated right away and for this particular area there are not a ton of restaurants around, but I really think that they could jazz up the flavor in their dishes a bit more. And their coffee also was not the best either. So if you are in this area, you could totally go here and they have a huge menu with lots of options so perhaps other things might be better, but other than the bright color for the decor and our awesome server, not sure food wise if it is up to par for me.

55.description: Great place to eat the food was great the place is clean but for us the music got the day started. Thank you Waffles for a great breakfast and a jump start to our morning in Chicago!!!!

9.description: Their chicken and waffles special, good service, and their people watching outside tables makes this a brunch place i would frequent.

26.description: After an over night redeye flight with no sleep and crazy Chicago morning commute I stopped at Chicago Waffles.1. Clean windows and tables. As a restaurant operator best indicator of a clean kitchen for a customer is a clean front door. Tells me they care.2. My waitress Sunshine was cheery, delightful, attentive, not over bearing, and always busy.3. 3.99 special equals Great portions and great value. Tons of food. 4. Super quick service and food was hot. I like a little more salt on my chicken and I would have put the pepper in the chicken instead of the syrup, but that's me. Ham steak was tender, well seared and not overcooked. Jam selection was on point with blackberry and strawberry ( not jelly but quality jam ). 5. Back to Sunshine...she was the icing on the cake.  Helped turned a rocky start for my first trip to Chicago into a quality, memorable experience. I'll be eating breakfast here my entire stay.

25.description: The food was just ok, nothing special... Not too many healthy options or options besides waffles. Waiter was 2 star quality if that.

12.description: Yummy waffles, pancakes with quick friendly service! Fun breakfast atmosphere with a huge variety of food choices...just wish there were mamosias:-)

59.description: If you and your family are in the mood for waffles and have been for a while you look forward to the experience. If you show up at the restaurant and they have no such waffles when you arrive you will be upset. Well we showed up and mid way through us getting our coffee the waitress whispered that they didn't have waffles, we didn't hear her too clear but still. If you don't have waffles please post that so we don't order drinks. So $15 in coffee and orange juice later, we walked out and headed to a place a few blocks away to get food we knew would be there.So poor planning on your part does not mean we have to have our breakfast ruined or at least a major bummer. I will not be going back to this place. There are other places I know will have waffles waiting for me even if their name isn't waffles.

21.description: Waited for about an hour and a half for subpar food. Tables that got seated at least 30 minutes after us, got their food before us. They gave us wonuts as an apology, but they tasted like they had been sitting for a day, which is probably why they didn't mind giving them away. I'll never be back here again.

17.description: I used to dine more frequently when Waffles first open. I feel like the food is very inconsistent. I ordered the usual chicken and waffles which flavor was lacking and the waffle was too chunky and thick. The portion seemed larger and the quality is lesser. Please dont order the benedict with egg, because it didnt look appetizing nor did it taste good. Now, the food is just average.

10.description: Ham and cheddar waffles were amazing and waffle flight was great as well. Service wasn't all that great but the food made up for it.

5.description: If you're looking for a spot with good, fresh, soft and a bit crispy waffles....this is the place! Every time I come here I have to have a side of the mini waffles to go with my chicken breast, eggs, and potatoes. I'm very picky about ordering chicken breast at restaurants because sometimes they are not moist and juicy. This place has definitely pleasures my taste buds and has yet to disappoint me. So if you're looking for good waffles and a great chicken breast. This is the place to go!

3.description: Started a tradition here with my kids, we would come here on our way to our doctor or dentist appointments, usually on Fridays. The atmosphere is great, customer service is a plus. Food is amazing, not just because they have a special running Mon-Friday for $3.99 but the amount of food that you receive is so worth the price and you will get full. You should try it if you haven't already.

35.description: Awful experience. Server took forever to get to the table. Then put the order in wrong. 1 person of the 4 at our table got her food 10 minutes before the rest of us. Then when the other 3 dishes were put down they were wrong. Whatever, I had to eat what was given to me because our server never came to our table after our order was taken (food was brought by a runner) plates were even bussed before our server came back. Then another 15 minutes passed before our server told us the kitchen was slammed and our food will be out soon. What? We already ate and she had no idea we had been given food. When we complained to the manager the only thing she had to say was sorry..... just what you'll be if you come here

19.description: Soggy and uninspired. I tried to order take out twice. The first time was 3 star and was not terrible, but the second time I got a terrible club sandwich that was soggy, the fries were limp, and it was downright flavorless.As many of you many know, I am a pig. I will finish most anything. This, I could not. This place may be good for breakfast, to that I can not attest. But lunch is flat and bland.

28.description: I went here for the $3.99 deal. Big disappointment! So this deal comes with chicken waffles and bacon. I asked to substitute my bacon for turkey bacon because I'm trying to cut back on my pork consumption. They gave me one piece of turkey bacon (side eye). Then I got to eat my waffle and it has ham piece in the waffle it would have been nice to know that considering I'm trying not to eat pork!!! Also the chicken that you get a 2 small chicken tenders not real piece of chicken like a leg or a wing smh. On top of that I order a smoothie which was nothing but ice and the peach and mango purée smh worst smoothie ever nothing but sugar and disgusting. The food is good but the service bad and not what I expected.

45.description: If there could be negative stars that would be the rating I'd give it. I lived in the south loop and LOVED going here for breakfast and brunch, when ever family from out of town came in this was THE place they wanted to go to. Now on far north side we still make the drive but today, was honestly disgusting. My veggie scramble was not cooked, vegetables were fresh which is good but raw/hard and the eggs were runny. My Husbands chilaquiles were drenched in red sauce, I am full blooded Mexican and know my Mexican food and this was just terrible. I thought I would press on and add some pepper to my meal but the top wasn't screwed on so full pepper shaker went on my food. Just got worse as it went on. Mind you we've been to this place a million times, we complained and they did right by us the last half dozen times we've gone it's been consistently bad. I miss the old kitchen staff and you will miss my money, we're done with you waffles. We had a good run but it's over.

33.description: So I was very excited to try this place when it opened. But it was just OK. I mean the food was decent but It was just ok. Also the amount of food they gave was disapointing. I was still kind of hungry when I left. Maybe it was what I ordered but for the price I would expect more food.

43.description: Absolutely the worse customer service I've ever experienced. I live out of town and was looking forward to eating at "Waffles". I was with three other people and there was a long wait for food and after receiving the food, the order was incorrect. We were then encouraged to "just take what we could get" because it would take an additional 30 minutes to correct the order. To make an extremely long story short, I never received the meal I ordered, or any food, for that matter. I was offered a side of fruit if I wanted it, and I was also offered an extra side of pancakes that were brought to our table by mistake. I usually don't take the time to come to Yelp or any other website to complain, but my/our experience at Waffles was just that bad!

2.description: Third visit, decided to get something other than waffles.The banana crepes sounded good: "Our crepes topped with bananas, candied walnuts and whipped cream".What actually came out: crepes topped with bananas and pieces of chives, along with raw pecans.Um.I hate, hate, hate making trouble for servers by sending a meal back. I even tried to eat it, but...chives. And bananas. I could have overlooked the raw not-walnuts...but not freaking chives and bananas together on a plate.There were only a few pieces of chives in there, but it was obvious that someone in the kitchen had chopped up some onions and then used the knife for the bananas as well. The flavor of chive was definitely in there. And I have no idea how the nuts got messed up. I felt horrible about it but had to send it back, and got the liege waffles instead. Once again (see previous review) they were not prepared correctly and didn't have the sugar inside, and were also very dry and crumbly. My boyfriend also had liege waffles and agreed that they were not very good.I don't know what's going on at this place, but it seems to be going downhill. People with food allergies, watch out.

18.description: The best!!!! I am addicted and visit often. The food is amazing, especially the velvet waffles with caramel and chocolate drizzle topped with strawberry cream cheese and candied walnuts. Fast turn around, not a long wait at all and friendly hot staff!

41.description: The waffle was inedible. It was hard like doe thing that needs thawing after hours in a freezer. It's a mystery as to how they ruin something so easy to make.,My two and a half year old credited to take a second bite. I could barely finish half the plate.

52.description: I would have given given Waffles ZERO stars, but YELP made me give it at least one star. I met a group of 8 friends there for breakfast on Sunday, July 5. My order was very simple.  The meat lovers skillet, no cheese, eggs over medium.  The first time my order came, the bacon pieces were totally raw!  I showed that to the waitress and she agreed and took the order back.  By now all my friends are eating.  When my second order came the skillet was covered with cheese.  I sent it back.  By the time my friends were done dining, my meal still had not come, so I cancelled it.  I asked the waitress three times  if I could speak to the manager and he never came over.  If the manager had come to apologize, maybe I would not have written this bad review.

50.description: I had an unpleasant and frankly disgusting breakfast here this morning.  The room is pretty but from the time I asked where the restroom was and was informed to use the men's room because "the toilets in the ladies room weren't working" it was a turn-off.  There were about 3 men fixing a light fixture near my table shouting while they were doing that.  So inappropriate.  I asked them to speak quieter - they didn't.  I asked the waitress/hostess to have them quiet down.  They did to a certain degree but I could still hear them.  I really didn't enjoy my food.  Unhappy with the experience - although the hostess was nice.  My advice is that if you want a good breakfast in the South Loop, go to Yolk.

4.description: The best thing about here is that there is no wait and the service is timely. The seating is comfortable and the servers are polite and accommodating to the customers' needs. They let us pick our seats and bring us milk for our coffee (there's cream at each table). The food is great too so for no wait and friendly service, I would come here over more popular breakfast locales. We tried the red velvet waffles, ham steak with eggs, and corned hash with eggs. Oh and of course coffee, which is unlimited. Portions are substantial. The roasted potatoes that come with the egg dishes is perfectly cooked and seasoned, you also have a choice of toast or pancakes, both are great. There's whipped butter and strawberry jam at each table, which happen to be my favorite toppings for toast. Highly recommend!

6.description: Waffles galore!This was my first breakfast experience at Chicago Waffle that left me wanting to explore more of their menu.I am a huge fan of pastries and this place let me indulge in my passion for dough. The server expertly guided me to the Waffle flight platter that came in with 4 varieties of waffles. First one I tried was the Red Velvet kind that tasted like Valentine's day, followed by an impressive Mexican Chocolate Waffle. I was going strong with a  traditional variety one topped with Nutella and all of its Hazelnut goodness. Last was a crispy waffle with berries - great crisp but the topping was too sour to my delicate taste buds. I did enjoy Red Velvet the most and 3 out of 4 is really not bad. None of the waffles overwhelmed me with their sweetness. Decor and service were solid and I can't wait to come back and try rest of the menu.Alex's Yum Scale:1 star - terrible, 3 stars - OK, 4 stars - good, 5 stars - excellent My rating: 4 starsGreat waffles with Intelligentsia coffee - what more can you ask for a breakfast at 3pm?

22.description: I've been here a couple of times now, and I can't understand why Waffles gets such a bum rap.  The serving sizes are ginormous; omelets are made with 5 eggs!  The menu is extensive, and includes options for those with dietary limitations.  Every meal I've ordered at Waffles has been of excellent quality.  Another major plus in my book:  Waffles opens earlier than Eleven and Bongo Room.

15.description: The food was just ok, nothing special... Not too many healthy options or options besides waffles. Waiter was 2 star quality if that.

57.description: Very disappointed. We came back here because we remembered it as having the most phenomenal Eggs Benedict, but made with waffles instead of the traditional English muffin.  It had been a while and we were looking forward to our meals. It was terrible. The food was not hot. The waffle was tough and leathery. It didn't taste as though it has been made fresh for our meal. The flavor was rather bland and the hollandaise sauce was less than generous. When we asked for more, it was horribly salty. We will not be coming back any time soon.

20.description: I will be there soon to have a delicious waffle. I want to try the flight waffles little mini waffles step off that tiny but I want them all. Breakfast here I come...Ymmmmm!!

36.description: This place had a VERY long wait and I looked at it as "the food must be worth it" oh well sorry to disappoint but it's NOT!!! I'm not an IHOP kinda girl but imo that place is better. I had the hot chocolate flight and I remember one of them tasting "ok" nothing to rave about. As a matter of a fact I'm going to stop now so I won't say too many bad things about this place. I'll just say I expected more from them. From the hostess to the servers to the food... Won't be returning.

14.description: Best breakfast place ever!! The food is amazing, I have tried everything on the menu by now, have not had any issues.The servers are super friendly and attentive. Can't go wrong with this place, if you haven't eaten here I recommend you do.

3.description: Pretty much a gem if you need low-cost furniture. The place is neat and tidy and has some great furniture at reasonable prices. If you're okay with gently used - stop here first when you're in the market for tables, dressers, chairs, etc.  They deliver around the city for $49.

1.description: I was told this place was hit or miss...well a lot of the furniture here does look like it was hit and a lot of the furniture also looked like someone at the hotel it was taken from should be missing it too! This place is full of furniture that are from hotels from around the area, so lots of stock looking furniture (end tables, arm chairs, dressers, etc.) and the prices are pretty good. But you definitely have to come here ready to search. And I mean search hard core through the store, since they have all kinds of stuff hidden in the corners, stacked under other tables. It is generally grouped by type, but keep your eyes peeled here for you and who knows what you might find. A lot of the stuff was scuffed up and such, but what I do like is that everything is negotiable here, which you rarely see in an American store. Almost like a craigslist of hotel furniture but you get to see everything in person. They have a bunch of old frames and such here too, so if you are looking to upgrade your collection to nicer, more fun looking wooden frames, this place has a lot of that too.

2.description: I love this place. I passed by this store tons of times thinking it was closed. I finally decided to stop by and I am super glad I did. Rock bottom prices on some very good quality used furniture. Be warned that this is not an expensive furniture showroom. It is basically a warehouse with assembled furniture that you can purchase and take with you as is or have it delivered. You will be surprised to see some furniture that is brand new with the tags still on them. Also, if you ask, they can order pieces from the big name turns true stores at a discount. Lastly, I was shocked to learn that they can deliver items as soon as the same day. If you have an eye for sometimes hidden treasures, this is the place for you. People can't believe the nice stuff I have found here. Lots of hidden gems await.

5.description: I bought a couch here that was new for a very reasonable price.  They have a boat load of chairs, tables, dressers, lamps, couches, mirrors, ugly paintings all new and used stuff most of which is from hotels.There is a range from high end to cheap junk.  It is the kind of place you just go to see what they have.  It is hard to really walk in being too specific.  If you do find something you like, chances are it is pretty well priced.  The deliver for a fee.  I had the chance to meet the owner he and all the others that worked there were very friendly.

6.description: This place is kind of a nifty find and a great choice if you want to furnish on a tight budget without going the Ikea or Target route.  Most of what they have is from hotels- I guess they buy it up from hotels in the area that are refurbishing and getting rid of their old stuff.  The aesthetics of things vary, ranging from furniture with a distinctly 1980s vibe to much nicer, more modern pieces, to elegant Queen Anne type stuff.  The condition varies from pretty dinged up to wonderfully unscuffed. They also have some brand new places that they probably got from furniture stores that were liquidating, much of it similar to what you'd find at Pottery Barn but at much lower prices (eg. beautiful modern dark wood dining table and 6 chairs with tags still on and plastic still covering the seat upholstery for about $700 all together). In terms of used items, you can get items like coffee tables or floor lamps for as little as $10-15, as well as bigger pieces like armoires or console tables, couches or armchairs. A great thing about the stuff here is that because hotel furniture is meant to stand up to a lot of use and abuse, it's very sturdy. And this is a great place to get other classy decor things for cheap like fancy mirrors or huge picture frames.I have to admit, I shy away from the used mattresses, big bundles of hotel sheets.  The idea of buying stuff that hundreds of people have slept on, among other activities, gives me the heebies and the jeebies. Otherwise,  this is some fun shopping.

7.description: I been shopping at windy city furniture for about 6 years.  I found most of  the  furniture very reasonable not cheap.   Some pieces can be over price if you don't know u stuff like mirrors, couches and  coffee makers.  Most of the new tables and chairs are a bit over price, and the new dinning table n chairs is their for  years:cheaper at the furniture store.   flee market type of shopping. Cooper is better N cheaperThey r friendly, and good customer service  Amy

8.description: I really like this place. I try to go by once a year and see what they have and the items they have seem to be getting better and better!More new items than used, and they delivery as well. Very cool.

0.description: We bought a whole bunch of great stuff from Windy City this morning. Prices can't be beat. We bought chairs and mirrors for our home, but this place would also great for furnishing dorms, student apartments etc. I will be back for sure.

4.description: I've only been here once but it was really fun to look around and I found some great items! They have some used and some new furniture (the new is from Ashley Furniture- they can order it for you too at great prices) and I found a set of awesome tables (new for $119), another little table ($15!), a lamp ($20) and a coat rack ($29). They also have desks, chairs, sofas, and many other items. They don't have a parking lot- you need to park on the street and pay for it. You have to ask for the prices on some items- they weren't all labeled. The people working were friendly. This is a fun place for great deals!

3.description: People working there on a Sunday at the end of September were phenomenal. Food was fresh and the music was good. Very pleasant. Would recommend if you're looking for a place to grab a quick bite to eat!

1.description: I seriously have been looking for a place like this in the loop for years!  A salad that isn't aner with two strawberries for 17.99This place has everything you can want for your salad if you know what you like down to the science (which I do).  I am SO bummed out to see that review with the plastic glove (EW) and I'm really hoping it isn't real because I love this place!

2.description: This is my number one spot now the workers are friendly ! And I love their fresh juice all natural

5.description: Great food, great service, fresh ingredients. Best oatmeal. They have really great coffee.

6.description: Mac Kelly's is my spot! Super close to school so during the semester I'm there 2-3 times a week. Tons of healthy, vegetarian options make this girl happy. The staff is nice and the place is clean as well!

7.description: This place only gets 2 stars instead of 1 because I love their juices and smoothies. The place always looks a mess, the ambiance is very underwhelming, and the products are not merchandised well. It seriously looks like it was all thrown together at the last minute just to get the store open, with no thought into the look of it.  I have walked to this location in the freezing cold multiple times to find the door locked well before the closing time (7:30). Tonight, I got there at 6:20! The girl inside was counting the money and wouldn't even look up and make eye contact with me. No signage was posted about ANY change in hours, if there was supposed to be. I am so very disappointed because I was excited for a juice shop in South Loop (my neighborhood) but will have to venture elsewhere or find somewhere new nearby.  My suggestion as a culinary marketing professional: make it at least seem like you want to be open and inviting to customers. Restaurants close down in Chicago way too fast to be acting so nonchalant about your services.

8.description: I am a fairly regular customer at Mac Kellys and I usually get healthy salads and bowls from Mac Kellys. Yesterday (12/10) I ordered a salad without cheese and once it was made I took my order to go. Actually I took the order and first walked over to my house to get something and then walked to the bus stop past Mac Kelly (about 20 mins later). Suddenly I hear a voice by  me - the store employee Gina (I think that's her name) ran from her store about 2 blocks to bring me a replacement salad because the one she had given me had cheese in it (I had asked for no cheese). In fact she had already refunded the amount to me which I didn't see at that point in time and then she gave me both salads to boot because she made a mistake. I call that exemplary customer service and I really appreciate the thoughtfulness behind it. (in fact it was a crazy day with the fire at the restaurant near by and the area was filled with fire trucks and ambulances, etc). Had to mention this experience here. I do hope people read this and start going into the store more because we need them to do well and continue to make healthy meals for me so I don't need to cook (Just kidding!)

0.description: They gave me a sample of the mango frozen yogurt.  Really good.  I've had smoothies, painis and wraps here.  They have snacks, too.  It's all good

4.description: Last time I ordered there, I found a complete plastic glove inside my burrito. What concerned me the most is that the manager did not seem too worried when I showed the picture to her. She told me my next meal would be free. She didn't see that after something like that, there can't be a next meal.It's too bad, because I really like the concept of the store.

58.description: This place has it dialed in. Portion sizes are perfect, unless you're used to eating at Old Country Buffet. Our wait time was 20 minutes on a PACKED Sunday, but that was communicated (they actually estimated 25 minutes) before we ordered. The staff is super friendly...I think they actually enjoy their jobs....and the food..... ah-mazing!Ambiance is important. The outdoor patio is perfection, yet the indoor dining space is perfect for the winter months. The moment you walk in, you can tell there was a lot of heart and soul poured into the decor and set-up of Spoke & Bird.  A much needed secret treasure in Chi-town. We will definitely be back again....and again.... and again!

56.description: Awesome place that knows their stuff about food. The menu is always changing as well as what is on tap. Breakfast served all day, vegan and vegetarian options, and Counter Culture coffee is served too. It's a new business that seems to be on the rise. Be sure to check this place out. Gotta get the Jamburger!

29.description: Excellent service. Lovely place for coffee and a sandwich. My husband had the brisket sandwich and the potato salad and he really enjoyed it.  Try their home made ketchup.

42.description: What a treat it was to find this south loop gem. Walking to soldier field, you might walk right by this unsuspecting spot. With a huge outdoor patio and a detached indoor seating area, it can be a bit hard to figure out. But boy oh boy is the food worth it. The classic breakfast was filling and made perfectly. On top of that delicious glass of iced coffee made the meal perfect. Looking forward to coming back again and again.

23.description: I was staying at the convention center and it was such a beautiful fall day a walk was in order...   Found on Yelp and away I went...   A bit cramped inside, VERY FRIENDLY.  Perhaps the BEST vegetable barley soup I've had, and craft brew beers on tap...  The lambeque was tasty but in my opinion a bit over priced.  Then again, I'm in Chicago.  Definitely worth a visit if you live here or are in walking distance.  Parking would be an issue.  Did I say the vegetable barley soup was off the hook??

47.description: AVOID!!! They were crappy when it was cafe society. They are crappy now. Only thing they have going is the beer garden. Forced 15-20% tip at a self service restaurant. Portion fit for birds. Over-cooked food. Rude and elitist staff. Our tab came out to be close to $15-20 per person. All walked away hungry. Locally sourced is not a license to overcharge. It may be okay to let customers leave a little hungry if it's dinner. No one likes leaving hungry after breakfast. Come on!** edit **He tried to get Yelp to remove the review. Then reached out to me asking what the issue was. Just read my review and several others'. And spend the same amount of time you're spending here arguing with people and trying to prevent negative reviews... fix the source of the problem. That'll be infinitely more efficient.

8.description: Came here to study on a weekday morning.  Quaint little Shop with great selection of tea and breakfast.  Had the classic breakfast.  The sausage is amazingand homemade.  It wasn't too crowded and a nice place to get some work done.

31.description: I'm very happy I came across this place just a short walk from my hotel. Spoke & Bird is very "cute" - very nicely decorated in a simplistic way. Outdoor seating is very quaint and relaxing. There is also plenty of indoor seating for those cooler days.The first time I ate here, I was somewhat unimpressed with the food. I had the kids scrambled eggs and toast which were kind of bland and just plain forgettable. However, I gave Spoke & Bird a second try and ordered the egg sandwich with ham....YUM! It was full of flavor and downright delicious.I also had hot chocolate which was very rich and delicious! It hit the spot just right. This is a great place with a great vibe and for the most part, great food. Definitely worth giving a try!

34.description: Finally posting a review on my third brunch-dining experience here. First off, they have Organic coffee, Antibiotic-free meat and Cage-free eggs. Secondly, it tastes fantastic! The courtyard is the perfect spot for fall brunch. I'm going to get here for dinner soon.

16.description: I think Spoke and Bird is a neighborhood gem!Great spot for just a coffee, breakfast or lunch. Dog friendly patio! I love it!

13.description: I don't write one-star reviews lightly. This place really deserves it.I came here for brunch with my girlfriend around 10:30. There was a line and the place was pretty full. Seemed like a good sign. But the food took an hour to arrive at our table. I checked with the cashier after about 25 minutes and was told that it takes 30 minutes for food, but it would be about 10 more minutes.20 minutes later, my girlfriend checked again and a server told her she should ask the kitchen staff directly. Weird. But she asked and they explained to her there was a fire in the kitchen, which delayed all the orders. They said it would be about 10 more minutes. 15 minutes later, the food comes out. My "classic" breakfast was subpar. Small portions. The eggs (over easy) were cold, and covered in pepper. Home fries and sausage were lukewarm. If there was a fire in the kitchen that delayed the food prep, why wasn't the food hot?Girlfriend had the carbonara, which was also lukewarm and nearly flavorless. Her coffee was full of coffee grounds. Probably the only thing I liked about the whole meal was the jam on the toast. Even there they only give you about a half a teaspoon worth. The sausage was all right too, but would've been better hot. We ended up going to get a pizza after leaving here starving. Great concept, but extremely poor execution. We won't be back.

11.description: Very meh. Came here before Da Bears game last week for breakfast and ordered the traditional breakfast. Eggs were tiny, sausage was not good at all too herby for me and did not look appealing at all. Barely gave you any potatoes. However the bacon was awesome along with the toast & jam. Coffee was weak too it was just ok esp for $15

39.description: I absolutely love, love, love this place. It's a definite upgrade from their predecessor.  They have done a wonderful job with the space and their outdoor beer garden is a gem in the South Loop.
