Now, on to the review.  The food here is special. Their specialty is breakfast and they make eggs that have always been perfect. Their bacon is amazing. I'm not a huge fan of their breakfast sausage but my sons love it so it's 2 against 1. Their coffee is always fresh and on point. I love their egg sandwich which is basically a sunny side up egg on a English Muffin with your choice of ham or mushrooms. I don't know where they get their English Muffins but they are fantastic.  I just had lunch here and tried their cheese plate and Lambeque sandwich. The cheese plate was good and I love the toast it come with. The Lambeque sandwich was out of this world.  It has become my favorite item on the menu. Did I mention that they have beer?  Well, they do and they carry several local craft brews that will help round out your meal. Spoke and Bird is a tad pricey but you get high end food that is incredibly fresh and delicious.

37.description: Food is just okay, portions are small and outdoor seating is nice if you can get a table.

0.description: Burger. Whoooaaa.  Aggressively made. Super delicious.  Unless you're just down for a snack they recommend getting at least a Double.  I opted for the *asterisk*, which indicated a complementary fried egg that comes on the Triple upon request.  Well, saddle me one up!  The freshly made bun was key.  The tomato jam had a ton of flavor. And the egg just blended all the flavors together in gooey goodness.  It was honestly a killer burg and totally worth it.  Dare you to try the Quad!

38.description: We were told there would be a 30 minute wait for food, which we were ok with. Ended up being an hour. And the food was definitely not worth the wait. Go to Wishbone.

51.description: Incredible menu and tasty food. Good vegetarian options. I live in South Loop and am happy this place exists.That said, I can't get over waiting 42 minutes for pancakes, two sandwiches, and a side English muffin on Sunday. The restaurant was not full. Multiple servers seemed to be frequently checking in on the room without bringing food or checking in on us. I had brought my father from out of town and was sad we had to spend much of our time together hungry on a hard seats, waiting.

27.description: Long wait to order. Long wait for food. Bees attacked us as we ate. My pancakes were raw. All and all not the best experience.

32.description: This location is near a very beautiful park. As soon as I went in I knew I was in for some good homemade breakfast. Everything seemed so original and every detail perfected. I ordered a kid's menu $4 double pancake, then some hot chocolate. The pancakes were whole wheat, or sort of brownish, which probably means they're healthy. The hot chocolate was delicious to say the least. They have home-made ketchup sauce, is that cool or what? I thing I wished to have seen would be either colder water or ice for my water, but everything else was so perfect that I quickly forgave them for it. Come in and dine with your family or group of friends. Enjoy the cozy inside sitting area or the open-air seating in the back. This sure is a cute place to come with my girlfriend ;)

54.description: Bad service. I requested a burger and was delivered to other table. When I went to the cashier to know where my food was,  she said "I don't know". I went to the waitress and she took the burger from the wrong table and gave it to me, cold. I asked if they can warm up the burguer and she say: "why?"  It is a place with a bunch of kids playing a game called running business. They don't know customers attention skills.

48.description: We were in the neighborhood and decided to try The Spoke and Bird over the weekend and regretted trying it out. Terrible service: the cashier was fine, but the rest of the servers were not. The servers (3 of them) huddled a lot in the small utility room in the lobby area chatting and checking their phones. It took 1 full hour to get our food, which were lukewarm. Simply put, it's unacceptable service and unacceptable food quality.

44.description: Amazing coffee!!!! I had the root veggie muffin and I was pleasantly surprised at how delicious it was!! Love this place!

24.description: Spoke & Bird has quickly become one of my favorite spots for a beer and snack after cycling on the Lake Front Path. The location is fantastic (1/2 mile from the lake, close to a beautiful park) and I especially love the large, sunny patio.

7.description: I LOVE this place! It's great. The food is great, the service is amazing.  The prices are a little high but this place is worth the visit.

49.description: Hidden neighborhood gem our doorman told us about.  We came for breakfast.  Quaint place.  Great service.  Delicious good.  Happy this came recommended to us.

40.description: I've come here twice, both times for lunch this summer. The staff is all extremely friendly and I love bringing my dog because they gave her treats and they have a huge patio in a really nice and calm area. I've definitely been looking for a place like this in the South Loop. I'm pretty sure that their food and drink is local, which is very cool but on the downside, makes it more expensive. Their portions also are pretty small for the price.I haven't yet tried the breakfast food but I really loved the jam burger and potato salad. The burger itself if you get a single patty is a good portion size and you don't walk away feeling stuffed, but satisfied. And the jam is extremely tasty.Not so good: the mac and cheese. It was extremely small and dry. There was hardly and cheese sauce on it and to give it some flavor, sriracha had to be added.All in all, this was a great find and I'll definitely be coming back. They have a wide selection of food and beer, and the patio makes it all worth it.

53.description: Thank you for your reply, but my review remains the same. Yelp is not meant to operate as a medium for restuarant feedback. It is meant to "review and recommend" businesses to the general public. So while I appreciate your response, it's painfully passive aggressive in requesting that people NOT leave Yelp reviews when they're not satisfied, because you can't correct it through Yelp. Well sorry, this isn't the "suggestions box" in the back room, it's a review forum.

30.description: We've been here a couple times for coffee and to do a bit of work on the laptop, but it's also a cafe/eatery. The interior is sort of reclaimed + hipster + urban + simplified. They have outdoor seating as well. I had the double turkey burger and it was yummy on a brioche bun, especially after I dumped my mixed greens onto it. The mixed greens was a side dish, but it was drowning in dressing- not great for a salad but as a burger topper, it was excellent. It had these little bits of pickled something or other that gave the burger an extra kick. My sweetie had the brisket/sour kraut sandwich and thought it was solid. Potato salad on the side was too salty, but it had the makings of a nice side dish if that could be corrected. The staff is chill and polite. Good neighborhood spot.

46.description: Hey South Loopers!  This is the crown jewel you've been waiting for!  And calling all other Chicagoans, this is a super cool spot located in a super cool neighborhood that you did not know existed.  Great coffee, great inspired food menu, great rotating beer selections, awesomely friendly staff.  This is the rare place where you can swing by on the way to work for coffee and a quick breakfast to take to work, stop by for a quick, healthy lunch during the day, drop in for a beer on the way home from work, and then come out in the evening with friends to enjoy the nice shady outdoor patio along with beer, tea, coffee and espresso, great food and desserts - something for everyone, anytime.Also worth checking out is the nearby hidden park - beautiful and quiet, nice for a post-coffee stroll...

1.description: The coffee here is amazing. Not the espresso but the drip coffee. Espresso beverages are a little lacking, unfortunately. The staff is very friendly and personable so I really love coming here for my morning cup of coffee.The food is really very overpriced given the neighborhood and the portion sizes. I think I've actually gotten a meal here once because of how off putting the prices are. $5 for a muffin that is on the small side? What? No thank you.I did get the brownie once and it was divine.The maple bourbon pancakes were good but the butter wasn't as described and it didn't go with the flavor of the pancakes which was a disappointment because I really love butter. Felt like I wasted my money a bit.My partner loves their breakfast sandwiches and the potatoes are pretty good. This item is actually reasonably priced so we order it pretty regularly.

55.description: Loved their Kale Salad, sometimes...I live in the neighborhood and I'm very glad this place is here.  They have great potential.  I've had the Kale Salad four times.  I loved it when it is done right.  However, here are my concerns:1.  For the price, portion is too small.  Please give generous portions because it costs $9.00.2.  Kale must be fresh, or at least not have yellow leaves,  because it costs $9.00.  I've had not very fresh kale 2 out of four times.  3. Where are the roasted vegetables?I wish this place success!  Hope it improves!

9.description: I've had breakfast and lunch here.  I had a turkey burger with home fries for lunch and egg sandwich with home fries were breakfast.  Both were average in taste and quality.  My feeling is they are charging a premium for high quality food but delivering average quality food.  The service is just ok.  My favorite thing so far was the cappuccino.  My star reduction is based on the following-1 cost-1 quality of food based on cost-1 wait time for foodI will give this place some more time to develop since they're fairly new and go back to see if there is any improvement.

26.description: Though the food is very good (we had the pancakes and an egg sandwich with a couple side sausages) the total cost was $40 with tip.  Ok expensive yes, but then we went to get some jelly and they wanted another $1.65 - get a grip!  Not certain if we'll ever return or recommend to anyone.

25.description: Place is great for a cup of joe or a fancy breakfast.

12.description: I have to start this post off by saying Spoke & Bird is an adorable place and has a great patio/beer garden.  Wonderful lattes and breakfast.  Very nice owners. However, was bummed today when I had my husband pick me up the 'kale salad with roasted vegetables' I have been dying to try.  Knowing they use fresh ingredients I knew it had to be a winner.  He brought it home and I could believe my eyes.  A handful or some spring greens and some kale. There are about 5 pieces of butternut squash and some shallots.  That's it.  For a $10 price point I just feel there should be more salad and roasted veggies in this box.

59.description: This restaurant was the bomb.comEverything is farm to table. Had classic breakfast and the house made sausage was to die for. It was gorgeous, the atmosphere was awesome. Loved the coffee.  The BEST PART was out awesome friendly waiter Michael Hopkins. He really made our morning. Beautiful place!

21.description: How long does it take to make oatmeal? At my place about 2 minutes. At Spoke and Bird - about 20 minutes. How warm should oatmeal be? At my place, pretty dam hot. It's breakfast. At Spoke and Bird - about 37.5 degrees Fahrenheit. How much should oatmeal cost? At my place, a couple of bucks considering I source local too. At Spoke and Bird - $9. Guys, I get it. You want to keep it hip and local, and I am happy to pay when quality is top notch. But seriously, get your act together.  I stumbled over considering how close I live, wanted something healthy and wanted to try this place for myself despite the mixed review and the owner's arguments (which honestly is a major turn off). Man was I disappointed. Good luck on fixing this up. I'll give you guys a shot in one year. Till then - no soup for you.

17.description: A friend recommended I try Spoke and Bird for breakfast while I was in town. It's tucked away in the South Loop but not far from downtown. They have a full breakfast menu, coffee, tea and lunch as well. I got the classic breakfast of bacon, eggs, toast and potatoes. It was excellent, eggs cooked just as I asked, bacon was perfectly crispy, and the house made jam topped off the toast. It's a little pricey, I thought $11 for my order was fine, but I can't see the oatmeal being worth $11 too. This was a perfect way to wrap up a visit to Chicago.

10.description: Pretentious, very expensive and worst service in the neighborhood. The Kale salad was not made of kale, home fries overly salty and we had to wait 20mns between dishes. Amazing how, within a year, quality and service went down (smiling and being polite is only an option there)... owners should be around instead of leaving a bunch of teenagers running their business.

5.description: I'm very happy I came across this place just a short walk from my hotel. Spoke & Bird is very "cute" - very nicely decorated in a simplistic way. Outdoor seating is very quaint and relaxing. There is also plenty of indoor seating for those cooler days.The first time I ate here, I was somewhat unimpressed with the food. I had the kids scrambled eggs and toast which were kind of bland and just plain forgettable. However, I gave Spoke & Bird a second try and ordered the egg sandwich with ham....YUM! It was full of flavor and downright delicious.I also had hot chocolate which was very rich and delicious! It hit the spot just right. This is a great place with a great vibe and for the most part, great food. Definitely worth giving a try!

3.description: Cure little coffee shop. Feels cozy and warm being in there. I've had the mocha, and just regular coffee and I think I prefer the regular hot coffee over the mocha. Both delicious, however very pricey. The chocolate chip cookie was amazing too! Love this place!

35.description: I've been here a few times since it opened as I live very close, and finally thought to review it once a few of my neighbors asked about it.  (I'm sure I'll get a scathing reply from the owner like many of the Yelp reviews on here! Hah!)Coffee - they brew fancy stuff and it's typically good.  However, if you just want a coffee, you have to wait in the same line as people ordering food - they only have one register.  Food - Mediocre and expensive for a "cafe." Portions are tiny.  I once paid $10 for an egg mcmuffin with a few dried out home fries on the side.  My girlfriend had the porridge (also around $10 for a cup or less of it) and thought it was quite bland.  Food is never hot, always kind of warm to lukewarm.Wait time - Common them on here, I'm not surprised.  You have to wait in line to order and pay, and then wait for your food.  Rarely enough seating.  Up to an hour total on weekends, sometimes more!  Ridiculous for the quality of food.Staff - Cashiers are mostly friendly.  I was in there once and heard the cooks swearing at each other loudly and complaining about the orders (which I get that cooks do, but maybe not in a building shared by a children's day camp??).  Servers are young kids who look like they're in a state of panic at all times.  I've seen the owners (managers?) on weekends standing by the door and yelling at their staff to work faster and looking generally pissed off to be there, awkward when you're standing in line behind them.  Customers seem like an inconvenience to them, god forbid you don't know what pecornio is or have a food allergy.  I don't know, bad vibes from the kitchen area in a way I can't really place.Tipping - I'm really turned off by their tipping system.  If you pay with a card, you get an option on the screen to add a tip ahead of time, and it's awkward because the cashier is standing right there.  What are you tipping for?  The interaction with the cashier? The food runner?  The coffee refill I have to get myself?  This place gets business because they have no competition in the area.  I admire what they are trying to do, but the execution is lacking.

19.description: My husband and I went here for lunch. It was absolutely delicious! Their grilled cheese sandwich is probably one of the best I've ever had. It looks like they may be opening a new location in Pilsen, which I can't wait for since that's the neighborhood I live in. Hopefully it will be open soon, but in the mean time, I don't mind traveling to the South Loop for their yummy food.

28.description: Fantastic! Fun, fresh and unique menu options with a great, chill vibe. I had the beans & cornbread. Comes with pickled veggies and fried eggs on top and the cornbread is killer--sweet and chock full of goodies. A great place to grab lunch if you're at a conference at McCormick Place!

45.description: I think Spoke and Bird is a neighborhood gem!Great spot for just a coffee, breakfast or lunch. Dog friendly patio! I love it!

33.description: I found this place very rude to customers. 1st time there I saw some sandwiches ask them what kind of sandwich is it they just ignore me, fine took my coffee and leave. 2nd time there the old guy ask me "what you you want" like I'm lost walk into some ones back porch. Bad place for the naborhood : (

43.description: Great food, small portions for the price (though I couldn't have eaten much more). Order at the register, seat yourself. Great outdoor patio spot. Dog friendly. Good beer menu too. Helpful and friendly service. The price is the only reason they didn't get a 4th star.

2.description: FYI, I'm not at all associated with the restaurant, but thank you random Yelp user who messaged me rather unkindly and suggested so.  It's good - check it out - 'nuff said.  :)

18.description: I've been here a few times since it opened as I live very close, and finally thought to review it once a few of my neighbors asked about it.  (I'm sure I'll get a scathing reply from the owner like many of the Yelp reviews on here! Hah!)Coffee - they brew fancy stuff and it's typically good.  However, if you just want a coffee, you have to wait in the same line as people ordering food - they only have one register.  Food - Mediocre and expensive for a "cafe." Portions are tiny.  I once paid $10 for an egg mcmuffin with a few dried out home fries on the side.  My girlfriend had the porridge (also around $10 for a cup or less of it) and thought it was quite bland.  Food is never hot, always kind of warm to lukewarm.Wait time - Common them on here, I'm not surprised.  You have to wait in line to order and pay, and then wait for your food.  Rarely enough seating.  Up to an hour total on weekends, sometimes more!  Ridiculous for the quality of food.Staff - Cashiers are mostly friendly.  I was in there once and heard the cooks swearing at each other loudly and complaining about the orders (which I get that cooks do, but maybe not in a building shared by a children's day camp??).  Servers are young kids who look like they're in a state of panic at all times.  I've seen the owners (managers?) on weekends standing by the door and yelling at their staff to work faster and looking generally pissed off to be there, awkward when you're standing in line behind them.  Customers seem like an inconvenience to them, god forbid you don't know what pecornio is or have a food allergy.  I don't know, bad vibes from the kitchen area in a way I can't really place.Tipping - I'm really turned off by their tipping system.  If you pay with a card, you get an option on the screen to add a tip ahead of time, and it's awkward because the cashier is standing right there.  What are you tipping for?  The interaction with the cashier? The food runner?  The coffee refill I have to get myself?  This place gets business because they have no competition in the area.  I admire what they are trying to do, but the execution is lacking.

41.description: Cafe Society, how could you leave? This new place Spoke & Bird has left me underwhelmed & unsatisfied. I tried to give them the benefit of the doubt when I came looking for the cafe I was familiar with for a quick breakfast. I went out on a limb & now I hope to never return. I got the egg sandwich with home fries. My home fries were burnt on the outside & raw on the inside. My sandwich had runny eggs, a plethora of mayo & 1 skimpy sliver of ham on it. I should've just went to McDonald's... & I swore McDonald's off years ago. & as someone else already said, they force a tip at checkout. It wasn't worth it. This is the epitome of gentrified B.S.

52.description: Great place with a great atmosphere. Fresh ingredients, helpful staff and unique selections all made this a wonderful stop on a Sunday night in the city!

50.description: this place has the best patio seating area i have found in chicago!  they have wonderful food and the people who work here are great.  my only complaint is that you have to order inside - it would be nice to be able to order from your table, so those who bring dogs and sit outside do not have to leave the dog unattended.

4.description: It's a great little coffee shop to meet up at. The seating and the setting was cozy. The chai latte was pretty good but it was served slightly warm...it wasn't hot enough. I was able to drink it quickly. The boy didn't seen to care for the latte he had. We didn't get to try the food but it looked good as we some plates pass by. We just ordered some scones and muffins which were pretty good.

6.description: Food was okay, nothing amazing. The latte was good, nice and strong. The homemade ketchup was delicious. My friend got a sausage that was raw in the middle. Wouldn't go back for food, but I would stop by for coffee.

22.description: This is my morning coffee place. A remodeled face over the old Cafe Society where I always come to relax and breathe some fresh air.. It features locally grown foods and a much cleaner look. The food is great, the people are friendly, amd if you love to sit outside during the fall and summer, you can" people and dog watch". It's tucked in the Southeast  corner of 18th and Indiana next to Women's Park. It also happens to be the last place you can get a water or beer before you enter the bike trail.

15.description: How long does it take to make oatmeal? At my place about 2 minutes. At Spoke and Bird - about 20 minutes. How warm should oatmeal be? At my place, pretty dam hot. It's breakfast. At Spoke and Bird - about 37.5 degrees Fahrenheit. How much should oatmeal cost? At my place, a couple of bucks considering I source local too. At Spoke and Bird - $9. Guys, I get it. You want to keep it hip and local, and I am happy to pay when quality is top notch. But seriously, get your act together.  I stumbled over considering how close I live, wanted something healthy and wanted to try this place for myself despite the mixed review and the owner's arguments (which honestly is a major turn off). Man was I disappointed. Good luck on fixing this up. I'll give you guys a shot in one year. Till then - no soup for you.

57.description: This is a gem.  The breakfast is especially well crafted and I love the outdoor seating.  The staff really tries and I have been pleased every time I go.

20.description: My husband and I went here for lunch. It was absolutely delicious! Their grilled cheese sandwich is probably one of the best I've ever had. It looks like they may be opening a new location in Pilsen, which I can't wait for since that's the neighborhood I live in. Hopefully it will be open soon, but in the mean time, I don't mind traveling to the South Loop for their yummy food.

36.description: My review is solely based on the environment and staff members, as well as owners. I've been going to this place for a couple months now to study and grab a snack and/or coffee. These guys know me as a 'regular' here. The staff and owners always make an effort to make conversation and say hello. One of the staff members, Meg, even remembered my name! Every time I came in she would say hello and recall things I've said weeks ago and inquire about it. If I had a tough exam, she would sweetly surprise me by saying "Coffee is on the house good luck on your exam!" The owners are spectacular--always checking on their customers and are always friendly. I've even seen them pickup trash off the sidewalks, making sure their place is clean both on the inside and outside. The patio is amazing, especially during the summer it's a great place to grab a cold beer! The staff is very knowledgable and always recommend great things from their menu! I've recommended this place to lots of colleagues and many of my professors come here as well and never have I heard any negativity from anyone who comes here. The environment is uniquely designed with the Spoke and Bird sign inside and beautifully colored wood on the wall. I cannot say enough great things about this place--you're just going to have to check it out for yourself

14.description: This location is near a very beautiful park. As soon as I went in I knew I was in for some good homemade breakfast. Everything seemed so original and every detail perfected. I ordered a kid's menu $4 double pancake, then some hot chocolate. The pancakes were whole wheat, or sort of brownish, which probably means they're healthy. The hot chocolate was delicious to say the least. They have home-made ketchup sauce, is that cool or what? I thing I wished to have seen would be either colder water or ice for my water, but everything else was so perfect that I quickly forgave them for it. Come in and dine with your family or group of friends. Enjoy the cozy inside sitting area or the open-air seating in the back. This sure is a cute place to come with my girlfriend ;)

29.description: AVOID AT ALL COSTS!  My fiance went here for a wedding consultation for hair and makeup.  Long story short: she ended up looking like MiMi from the Drew Carey show. And oh so many problems:- rescheduled our appointment twice-hair stylist didn't show up-replacement stylist was COMPLETELY inappropriate-gave get curls after she said 'i don't want curls-clown makeup after she said I want it light, AND took two hours-didnt know ANY prices-waited 30 minutes while on phone with manager.  -charged us $100

42.description: Salon Heaven is true to its name. I have been going there for yeaaars and I love the workers. They give the best hospitality, the best shampoos, and personalize everything...they don't skimp on anything. My hair always feels bouncy healthy light and full after I finish. I advise you to go ...you'll never turn back to the others. Chris, Dedric, and Tan are great as well as other stylists.

23.description: I'm assuming there must be some stylist in this place that has some talent, but apparently I have never gotten them. I've been here twice and will never return ever again. The first time I went I got a trim and my eyebrows waxed. I should have cancelled the eyebrow wax after looking at my jacked up bangs, they were completely crooked, really thick and blunt (not what I asked for) and the overall experience was extremely poor. It was so dark inside as no one turned on any lights the entire time I was there and the stylists all seemed more interested in their conversation than on actually servicing clients. My eyebrow wax was atrocious. I walked away with one eyebrow about an inch shorter than the other. Thankfully my new thick chuncky ugly bangs covered it up. I decided to give them another try since they're so close to my house and went for just a bang trim and requested a different stylist. This guy trimmed my bangs sooooo slowly, we're talking about a half hour and then styled them in a way that made me literally laugh out loud when I looked in the mirror. I got full on DJ Tanner bangs! Yep! Curled underneath and curled back on top. These stylists need some serious training. If you're looking for a student to cut your hair, go to the aveda school in lincoln park. They'll do a much better job for a lot cheaper.Never again!

47.description: I started going to Salon Heaven back in December 2007. I can tell you that from the start, you know this place isn't just a business, but a treasure. They suggested I work with Crizen from the start. She really knows what she's doing and she works with you to figure out what will be perfect. She is a coloring queen and can get any cut on your head. If you have thick hair and you want a sleek chic bob, she can do it and make you feel fabulous. If you have super blonde hair and decide to go to a deep red (think Rene Russo from Thomas Crowne) she is your woman. Every time I leave there, I feel like a million bucks. Not only does she feed your ego with making you look great, she feeds your personality too. I had a crazy stressful day once, ready to cry, (or tear someones head off) and she told me to sit still for a minute. She came back 30 seconds later with a glass of wine and told me to spill. She's amazing. The rest of the staff there is equally impressive. They treat each other like family, extremely courteous, and I love that they come up to each other's stations to put in comments and feedback. The salon itself is stylish with feel-good music and a nice waiting area. Bathrooms are clean and prices are definitely beyond fair. You do not nearly pay enough for what you get. Finally, there is public transportation right in front of the building along with restaurants and bars within feet of the place which works out nicely because when you leave, you WANT to show off your new look. Definitely suggest this place.

8.description: Michael is a hair god. I have not walked out of a hair appointment feeling this cute and confident in a long time. He gave me exactly what I wanted- but better. Not only is he a great stylist, but he has such a great personality that I didn't even touch my magazine; we had a blast! :) He will definitely be my new go to hairdresser from here on out.

31.description: I had a great experience at this salon. Megan was so friendly & great with my unruly hair! They did a great job personalizing my Keratin treatment. The followup from Megan to make sure my hair was what we had hoped for was great too! Definitely going back!

34.description: Just got back home from Salon Heaven.  It had great yelp reviews and was in the South Loop, so I decided to stroll on over.  Megan was a gem!!!  I have naturally curly hair..and am always nervous before a haircut due to other stylists screwing up my hair and giving me bad layers....but Megan, right away, knew what she was talking about and made me feel right at home!I also got a mani/pedi..totally fun!  Megan was so nice and gave me some great ideas and i walked away with super perf toes and nails!  She even gave me extra spa-licious treatment (a fabulous scrub), for no extra cost!!! Great music was playing and my hair is schnazzy and ready for the weekend!! Normally, i  leave a salon and go straight home and style it again....but I proudly walked around downtown and felt great about my new do....Megan is even going to help me with some up-do experiments pre-wedding!! I highly recommend this super cute, lofty salon.  I am looking forward to my next visit!!!Thanks Megan!!!!!!!!! :)

16.description: I went for a massage with Elijah, and boy, did he do an excellent job! His was thorough, friendly and professional. He used a combination of techniques designed to soothe my tension and help me relax. Based on my subsequent interactions with the owner/manager and couple of the other stylists, I'd definitely go back. They have a stylist(s) that specializes in natural hair care and I look forward to trying her. Even though the prices are a bit on the high end, you get what you pay for. :)

13.description: After an unpleasant experience in the past with this salon I said I would never return, however the owner contacted me herself to apologize about the ordeal and offered any further assistance and services at her business which I appreciated. Will give the salon another chance based off her generosity, sincerity, and good business practices. Will come here again when I return to Chicago.

11.description: Fantastic Salon! Friendly and outgoing staff with Innovative, creative, artistic and multicultural people.  The whole ambiance of the salon was just a really great experience within itself. Sanitized and relaxed environment as all salons should be. I give it 5stars! You have to check this place out! Get your experience now.

39.description: 4.5....I just cant give it a 5 star review because I compare everything to my old stylist.However, Danyel called me and asked me to come back and try Salon Heaven because of the horrendous service that I received last time....alas, I am always letting businesses have a redemption, kind of like Tosh.O :)Anyway, so it was the day after the snowpacalypse & thundersnow so I called to make sure that they were open.  They had no apptmt for me.  And said that my apptmt had been for the previous Thursday.  I had a vm from the receptionist stating the date so something happened.  Either way, Danyel made it work.  She said to come on it....THANK GOODNESS I called though....I would have been PISSED!So she is so freaking nice.  I love her personality.  Just totally laid back, etc.  Not to pushy or annoying with trying to get to know you like some salons.  So for that....5 stars.The hair-I actually really liked it this time!  She did a fab-o job.  The cut was pretty good also.

37.description: Worst experience ever. I waisted two hours of my time on a manicure. She didn't know what she was doing at all. Megan is very inexperienced. I wouldn't recommend her at all.

0.description: I've been to this salon several times but I can say that each visit gets better & better! Most recently, I went in for a Brazilian wax & was immediately greeted with refreshments & a nice staff. Kiky, who did my service was very warm, nice & welcoming. She did a great job & I was charged a very great price. The team takes pride in providing top-notch service whether it be hair, nails, or body, it's definitely worth trying! They have a loyal customer who will send others their way! 5 STARS! Danie Lyn

38.description: I've never had a constant hairdresser, but I think I will now. I'm usually a bit apprehensive getting my hair cut, but I always tell myself that it grows back. I am very happy to have discovered Salon Heaven and Spa.Finding the place was a little difficult at first because the salon is actually located on the 2nd floor of a building and you have to press the buzzer to be let in. Upstairs the salon is decorated beautifully and everyone was very friendly. They took my coat when I arrived and actually returned it to me when I left. I've had the experience where I had to go fish my coat out of a closet on my way out of other hair salons.My appointment was booked with Megan. She was very nice and did an excellent job of identifying my hair type, cutting and styling. She was always sure to explain each step of the process and by the time we were done I was actually shocked to see my hair because she did such a great job. Probably the best haircut of my life in fact.I thought the haircut was going to be expensive, but it turned out to be a great value and with a discount below what I thought it was going to be. I will definitely be going back to Megan for my next trim!

51.description: The first time I went to Salon Heaven, I called and was able to be worked in immediately as there was an opening and I was able to show up quickly as I don't live far away.  I was placed with Crizen.  She was really awesome!  My first time here and it was her first time to cut my hair.  She really did a great job!  She used nothing but scissors and usually that worries me as I like to have my hair cut really short with a faux hawk kind of style.  It looked really great!  The interior of this place was really great too.  Very sexy, great staff, great for all hair types types.I was happy with my haircut but sadly ...as I usually get my haircut every two weeks, my haircut from Crizen only lasted about 1 week...maybe a week and a half at most.  But none the less, I would certainly go back to her.   I would just have her cut it shorter than she did.I was so happy to find a great location and it's really close to where I live. Yay!My second visit was great too!  I was able to get an appointment with Alithea (spelling may be wrong here).  She did a great job.  She took her time and I have no complaints with that.  It took about 35 to 40 minutes from start to finish. I tried to get Crizen but she wasn't in.  I was happy to get in nonetheless.  Alithea cut my hair shorter than when Crizen cut it and worked really well for me.  I can tell this haircut was shorter and would last longer for me. I'm really picky with my hair and I look damn good.  I would schedule again with Crizen or Alithea. I'm so happy I found Salon Heaven.

27.description: Just moved to Chicago from Florida so I've been looking for a good, dependable, affordable salon that knows how to properly take care of my hair. I've been to two other salons and wasn't completely satisfied with either, so I did a google search and found salon heaven. It was close to my downtown apt and the prices were affordable so I decided to give it a try. Glad I did :) The people were nice and welcoming, they knew what they were talking about, and most improtantly they knew what they were doing. Annie relaxed my hair w/o burning my scalp PLUS she was so nice. Iyon styled my hair and he did a great job, I don't ever remember seeing my hair with so much body and fullness. Another plus is that I've been thinking of going natural and they know how to transition my hair w/o having to make the "big chop" right away.

32.description: Salon HELL!! I spent 4 hours in the salon the first day, to come home the color washed out within a week. Went back to get it fixed, stated before I need to be somewhere in 2.5 hours.....2.5 hours later she was still putting color in my hair. I left the salon with my scalp burning and wet hair. After it dried the highlights started .5 inches away my roots. I had to go back again.  Nightmare from HELL!!! They hire inexperienced slow stylists.

48.description: Very good place, they where able to work me into the schedule to see Crizen before the weekend (had friends coming to visit). I had to wait a little bit when I got there, but they had some very nice comfy couches and water. The interior of the place is nicely designed too. I will definitely be going back alot. The owner was also there, and was very nice!

44.description: Crizen is fantastic, and is the only person in the world who does equally well with my hair AND my husband's hair (and his is NOT easy to deal with).  Jessica is a little difficult to pin down sometimes, but I have never had a better eyebrow shaping/tweezing session.  I used to be a 'threading only' gal, but she's converted me.  I love this place!

24.description: I had an appointment with Megan for full highlights (roots only) and a cut and I hate looking at the mirror now. I was very nervous going in as I have had the same hairdresser for years and was very nervous about entrusting  my hair into somebody else's hands. Megan looked at my hair, asked a few questions and I felt she knew what she was doing and it made me feel better. She assured me she is very good and I won't have orange hair or anything like that. She also said she does very thin highlights so that they look very natural. Perfect I thought! She washed my hair and walked me back to the chair. After I looked at myself in the mirror I got goose bumps - my roots did look too "warm" or simply orange. I started calming myself that once she dries my fair, it's going to look better. I was patiently waiting, preying inside that I will look good. For a moment I made myself think my hair looks good, I need to be open minded and need to stop comparing everything to what my previous hair stylist used to do. I walked out of Spa Heaven feeling all right, but as soon as I came home, my boyfriend said "you look...... nice". And I know it meant "not so nice". I stared at myself in the mirror and almost started crying. My roots were too golden, instead of having blond highlights, I couldn't distinguish the highlights and the streaks of my natural brown hair. I never thought that highlights can be so thin that they look like single a color! Everyone I saw that day thought I had my hair colored,  not highlighted. I was so upset about the color that I completely forgot the fact that she also gave me a haircut. I always had the most beautiful layers and all I wanted was to have 1-2 inches taken off.  When I was blow drying my hair the next day I noticed that the hair cut looked awful!  Looked like she chopped 1 inch off and didn't do layers at all! I just want to cry. 4 hours of my life and almost $200 wasted. I can't wait to go to a professional stylist in a couple of months, probably male, and have my hair fixed, even if it will cost me a fortune. There is no price tag on feeling fabulous. The reason I am not giving Megan one star is because she is a good person and was trying her best. Unfortunately, when  a person is only 26 years old, "her best" is not "the best of the best".

7.description: Michael is an amazing stylist, a hair god if you will.  I have known him, his work and seen his work for two years.  He hits the perfect mark every time, he has never failed.  So listen closely Miss Nicole B. you are clearly an idiot that does not know anything about her water sources that she has been using.  The tap water you have miss Nicole B. clearly has a high IRON Content.  You know you did not leave Michaels Salon red you got red from the shower anyone who understands simple chemistry should know that very simple good day Nicole B. is a liar.

49.description: As an African-American client, it's HARD to find the right salon.  Rest assured that with Salon Heaven your hair is in good hands.  The stylists are extremely knowledgeable and talented.  They have the right products and tools to leave you with a finished product that turns out great.  However, be prepared to spend more time there than necessary as multiple clients are usually booked for the same stylist at/around the same time.  So you will have to sit around waiting for a stylist to tend to you.  Of course, if you have the time and patience to sit idle, then you have nothing to worry about.  That's my only major issue with their business and the reason for only 3 out of 5 stars.

40.description: Got my Brazilian Blowout by Danyel today! SOOO amazing, and I'm blonde again! No more relaxers for me :)Also got a mini-massage by the massage therapist while my color was processing, it was all just wonderful :)After moving to Chicago a few months ago I went to about 5 different hair dressers before I found Salon Heaven, and I haven't been anywhere else since!

30.description: Just FYI, they've switched management and I believe staff also.  I haven't tried Salon Heaven again due to my terrible experience, but you may not encounter what I did in the past.

46.description: After deciding to never go back to my regular hairdresser again, I hopped on the internet to find  a new salon. There are a lot of good looking websites, let me tell you. Salon Heaven has really good reviews and offer a lot of services. What sold me was that they take walk-ins, and I didn't think I'd be able to make an appointment on such short notice (the day of). I was able to make an appointment, however, with Deadrick. When I walked in, the owner, Kiky Fynn, greeted me. She was really friendly and because I'm a new customer, gave me a form to fill out. While I was filling it out, another girl took me coat. I don't know where she kept coming from, but she also took the form back to Kiky for me, and brought my coat out to me as I was leaving. I don't know if she's always that attentive, or just because it was a slow day, but she was great.After a minute or two, Deadrick took me back to his station and asked some questions about my hair...how i wear it, how long it's been since my last cut,.... Then on to the shampoo. It was the best shampoo I've ever gotten!! Very relaxing. I'm usually a little anxious when getting my hair cut, but this time I wasn't at all. He seemed confident in himself and really put me at ease. He was really easy to talk to, and it didn't feel like forced, uncomfortable small-talk. I LOVE my hair now. It's exactly what I wanted even though all I knew going in, was what I didn't want. It looks better, and it feels better. Salon Heaven is a million times better than the salon I used to go to. Everyone on the staff seems to genuinely like and care about their job. I'm so so glad I went to Salon Heaven. I'll definitely be back when I need a trim.

1.description: I love when scammers like Nicole B. try to get free services by threatening to give hard working people a bad yelp review. As you can see she has given over 50% of her reviewed services and venues a 1 or 2 star.I was in the salon when this "lady" came in and demanded a refund for hair I actually thought was fantastic. I would imagine long thin stringy hair as hers is a challenge for any hair designer however I think the poor stylist did well.I cringed as she yelled and threatened him. Said she was going to sue him and she was going to get her money back one way or another. I wish I had my phone on video so I could have shared it.I was actually going in to get an up do and Michael did a fantastic job handling my wayward extensions and Irish curly hair that day. I have been going to him off and on for two years (I don't live as close to the south loop so sometimes I have to cheat on him haha).I have had brown hair, blonde, brown with blonde highlights and each time I have loved my hair. If I ever didn't and it was a reasonable request...I have no doubt he would fix it immediately no questions asked.Its a shame some people use Yelp as a way to bully and get free services. Janay A. GravesJG Events

9.description: I recently moved to the South Loop and need an updo for an event tomorrow. Scheduled an appointment last week with a woman who said she wasn't sure who would be available, "probably Michael" and scheduled me for 3/7/15 at 3:00. I was concerned about her vague response when I asked the stylist's name. I called today to verify, and  sure enough, I was not scheduled. I was put on hold for quite awhile and was told that I was not on the schedule, that they have 2 schedule books and that the owner with the other book was not in right now. What?!? The scheduler said she could work me in, but I decided against using such a disorganized salon. Now I have to find a stylist available on a Saturday at the last minute: great. I will not use this salon and do not recommend.

26.description: So I live right across the street and never knew this place was here.  I needed a quick pedi so thought I'd walk over.  Unfortunately while they do take walk-ins, she was booked.  She said she oculd take me after but I was legitimately in a hurry as I was leaving for the burbs shortly.  I said no worries, I understand but she said maybe just do a quick non-spa pedi.  I said sure.  Basically she shaped and polished and just cleaned up but my toes still looked awesome!  Toni did it and I really liked her.  The girl whose appointment I was taking was late but when she came in we also got to chatting and she loves this place and had some good taste in other Solo spots so I trusted her judgement.  The owner was extremely nice as well and I'll definitely go back.  Because it wasn't a full pedi, they only charged me $15!  That was so nice.  Would recommend.

25.description: My experience at Salon Heaven with Megan B was Top notch A+++++! She did an AWESOME job with the cut and style of my hair and an even more Fantastic job on my color. Due to a previous head injury I had to be very careful not to use regular hair dye to color my hair bc of sensitivity to all the chemicals. But I REALLY really wanted to be blonde, and not just have a small amount of highlights. So Megan went out of her way to give the same effect I wanted of a FULL BLONDE BOMBSHELL effect - but she did it with Custom Full Highlights, applying various shades of blonde and still keeping some mild lowlights of my natural color. The way she did it just made my hair look SO STUNNING AND NATURAL!! Everyone who has seen my hair just says "WOW!". And the layers of the cut make my hair look really full and healthy, too!I am more than happy with the work Megan did and I HIGHLY recommend her. She is not only an Excellent Hair stylist but she is also very friendly and personable and has a very positive upbeat energy to her.  You will absolutely LOVE her.  I feel like I found a new best friend, LOL! I can't wait to go back so I can keep this look forever.

12.description: I haven't been here in awhile since I've been getting my hair cut by a friend, but I will be coming back due to her relocation. All of the staff have been responsive and friendly. Several stylist have cut my hair and all have been attentive to my needs. I'm looking forward to returning!

21.description: UNPROFESSIONAL RECEPTION STAFF, GREAT WAX  BY KI-KI -  I originally tried out the salon for a brazilian wax after purchasing a living social coupon for discounted service.  My first experience started off horribly, I felt that initial reception wasn't that great, I arrived 10 minutes before my appointment, and only when the time ran 5 minutes past my scheduled appointment time was I told that the previous appointment had run over.  Given the fact that I was visiting the spa on my lunch break, time was very important and when this was expressed, the salon owner came out to let me know that she would service me as quickly as she could.  She did just that, and I had a great wax.  In spite of the problems with the front reception, I decided to visit the spa again.  I called the day before to make my appointment, again expressing that I'd have a tight window and needed to be serviced at teh time of my appointment by the owner.  When I arrived, the receptionist was on the phone and did not greet me or check me in.  Again, I arrived 10 minutes before my scheduled appointment.  when my appointment time came, and no one still had not come over to greet me I walked up to the receptionist, only to have another staff memeber tell me that there'd been a mix-up and not to worry the person doing my wax was just in the back.  What she did not tell me is that my appointment was not with the person I'd requested.  Once I was made aware of this, I was told that due to personal reasons the owner could not take the appointment, and that no one could call me before hand to tell me that if I chose to still come, I'd be with another technician.  I was also told that my appointment was placed in the books for the followign day not the day I was there.  In spite of the fact that the owner is great at doing waxes, I'd never return or recommend anyone else to visit the salon because the front office staff is horrible.  Very unprofessional and obviously not very time conscious.  Lastly, I received a confirmation email for an appointment in someone else's name - Veria Kelly - as well as a follow up to complete a survey (which only allows 500 characters).

17.description: Agostino is amazingly talented. Best haircut ever!! I just found my hairdresser for life.

10.description: After reading the reviews, figured I'd take a chance on Salon Heaven. Left a message to make an appointment to cut my hair, Kiky got back to me right away and was able to schedule me that same week! So had my haircut done by Michael (haven't had it cut in over 2 years, just needed someone who really knows how to cut curly hair), he gave me an excellent cut, 2 weeks later I was still getting compliments!! And he even texted me to check in to make sure I was satisfied! (that has never happened anywhere I've been!) He was super easy to talk to and asked questions about the cut as he went along to ensure he got it just right, really appreciate that. Guess I found my hairdresser!

5.description: I have been coming to see Michael for a little over a year now. I found him at Spoil me Salon, followed him to Kovo, and am thrilled to see he has his own place now. Michael is the best. Especially if you're looking for reds. We have changed it up, from back, to red, to strawberry blonde back to black (heads up, I may be going red again soon) and I have had amazing results every time. There was one time I had to rush out midway through processing because i had to go to work, but I came back in the next day to finish up, and as usual, it was exactly what I wanted. Most of the time I just let him loose. I tell him what I'm looking for and have him work his magic however he feels best. I trust him with my hair (no one else touches my hair right now). If for whatever reason you are not satisfied with your hair, Michael WILL fix it for you at no charge. Unfortunately, that leads to scammers like Nicole B, who will take advantage to try and get free services at the expense of hard working professionals. I saw pictures of her hair before and after and it looked amazing. Almost made me want to go blonde. Either way, Michael Hopkins is excellent and his new salon is amazing. If you don't believe me, check it out for yourself.Daisy M.

3.description: This review is for the lash application by SemekaI haven't got my eye lashes done in a while and saw a Groupon for Crème de La Lash (located at Salon Heaven & Spa). I booked my appointment about a month out and appreciated receiving a confirmation text. Sometimes I get worried when I book things so far an advance, but Semeka even sent me a reminder day of and was able to move my appointment time up. The salon itself is beautiful and pretty spacious. Very convenience location from the red line transportation.Having got my eye lashes done before I was sort of dreading laying there for an hour, but she played such good music I was almost able to fall asleep. I like that she did one eye at a time versus having both eyes taped and going back and forth between lash applications. Somehow that made a big difference in my comfort. (I'm a contact wearer) I love the results! Not too long that they look fake, but they do make a huge difference. I have very large eyes and you have to use a longer length in order to make them really stand out.As a side note something I will probably need to take up with Groupon, but she said that the deal where you get one full set of mink lashes and a follow up 4 week appointment is not correct. The follow up appointment is more so a filler appointment, but after four weeks you'll probably only have two lashes left and require a new set (which she is willing to charge a discount on). A little bit of sneaky advertising, but she said that Groupon would not fix it, so she opted to remove her groupon completely. We worked out something, but for others just a heads up! :)

35.description: It was an extreme pleasure to get my hair done by Jay LeAndre yesterday.  I had previously gotten my hair done elsewhere and was only looking for a back-up hairstylist  because my hairstylist was booked yesterday.  When I walked into the salon, Jay LeAndre was very attentive and spoke of his purpose of obtaining healthy, luxurious hair for his customers.  After I told him what I was looking for, he did exactly that with a little bit more.  I have never had a hairstyle that I didn't have to fix when I got home.  It's perfect.  Jay LeAndre is a genius with short hairstyles, ensuring that the overall effect is soft with movement.  All I can say is not only did I get exactly what I wanted, he fixed the bad cut I was dealing with, making it look natural and complimentary to my face.  I didn't find a back up hairstylist yesterday, I replaced my old hairstylist!  I scheduled my next hair appointment with him already.  Believe me, he is the truth!

19.description: Best.Wax.EverLike, seriously.  This Brazillian didn't even hurt that much...and I don't know how that's possible.  Hard wax is just that amazing, maybe?  Perhaps, it was due to the fact that I chugged a massive Rockstar during the day, so the caffeine was racing through my veins and helped induce some type of natural pain-killer?  I have absolutely NO idea. Def not complaining, though.  I think the waxer (also the owner - so sorry I forgot her name!) was just THAT good, though!  She was such a darling...so sweet and hilarious.  It took a little longer than expected (about 40 minutes), but I really didn't care because she did a great and thorough job.  Oh, and she was a lifesaver because she got me an appointment basically last minute on a Friday!  Whoooo!  The salon itself is spacious and cute...with tons of hairdresser stations, big mirrors, bright lighting !  It's located on the second floor, above the tanning studio, so you need to ring the bell and then can buzz you up.  I loved that there was a huge tv and hip hop blaring when I came in.  The wax is normally $55, but there's a 15% discount (I believe) for first time customers.  Street parking is normally pretty easy, too.  Another South Loop win!

28.description: Jay is awesome. I have to say that he is very passionate about hair and taking care of it. He lets you know what is best for you and even explains what he is using on your hair and how it helps. .  I love that he gives tips on the best way to maintain your hair at home as well.   My hair is natural and he does wonders so believe me your hair will definitely be healthy in his hands. He is one of the best hair specialist/stylist and I feel lucky to sit in his chair. When he is done you will always leave gorgeous, happy and satisfied.

45.description: I love the place!  Beautiful salon, great location, easy parking, professional atmosphere, people pleasing stylists, reasonable prices, what more can you ask for... besides of course a fabulous stylist? Dedric did an excellent job on my hair.  I wear my hair natural so styling is a process.  Dedric gave me a hot new color and a sharp new cut.  I heard he was good, and he really is.  I'm Salon Heaven's  #1 fan.

33.description: I was frustrated with my hair and ladies at salon heaven were amazing. They took the time to get to know me, my lifestyle (I love the outdoors) and was able to recommend a product to fit it. I'm so glad I trusted them because now I LOVE MY HAIR! I feel like I see my "real" self when I look in the mirror. I went back for a coloring and the colorist, Megan was awesome! She came up with a color combination that really complements my skin tone. I feel like I got an extreme make over. Thanks Salon Heaven!

43.description: Dedric is a hair saver! My hair was dry, brittle & damaged. Dedric has brought my hair back to life. He teaches & explains what needs to be so you can restore your hair. He doesn't believe in over processing. If you want to look great & have healthy hair. SEE DEDRIC!

2.description: Saroya did an amazing job on my hair! I have a ton of thick curly hair and she patiently roller set and trimmed my hair perfectly.  She listened closely to exactly what I wanted and did great work. Whenever I am in Chicago I will be coming to see her.

18.description: Where do I start??? Ok in march a purchased some hair from the salon which I communicated with Tony, the owner of the hair line. He refers to the hair as lavish hair smh. At that time I purchased what I believe to have been 4 bundles of Brazilian deep wave, 22inches. I paid $400 at that wish they made seem was a discounted price. I didn't mind at the time because I figure good quality hair is a lil more expensive. I've been wearing sewins since 2006. So I know about good quality. All my previous experiences with hair had been great. My sisters a stylist so she's always made sure I had the best hair which a the minimum lasted atleast 2yrs. I heard about salon heavens hair through social media so I decided to give it a try. So I co washed the hair mildly and had my sister install it. It was ok. I noticed it would get tangle so I jus made sure at nite I twisted it and wrapped it daily.                                                                       So about 3 wks ago I went to salon heaven and had a awesome stylist do my install. He washed it out my head then sewed it in. He worked a miracle and for the time being I was satisfied. He evn have me good hair advice about my natural hair. So instead of leavin my hair out I purchased a closure which was $125. I called bac this week to set a appt only to find out that stylist was no longer with the salon. I did my research and found him. A couple of days ago I wnt to him for a shampoo and style with the same Install he did jus 3wks ago. As soon water and a small amount of shampoo hit the hair it immediately started to tangle. It gotten so bad he set me under the steamer before the second wash. We tried so hard to untangle but the more we brushed and comb it startin shedding etc. We untangle the one side and it was about 2 bundles of hair that came out. We came to the conclusion this was not Virgin hair at all. It was synthetic blend which seems to be happening more and more these days. I immediately went to the salon heaven and let tony know happened after only two months of purchasing this hair. I just wanted to compromise tell him that the hair was professionally washed he jus so me bad hair and I wanted my money back. He was a complete jerk and did everything but admit his wrong. This was suppose to be a good investment for me. Instead it was a nightmare. He offered me $50 off my nxt hair purchase. Like who in they right mind would buy some more hair after experiencing that?? He is a fraud. I'm a young hard educated mother of two. I make sure I spend my money wisely. Because if this night mare I had to purchase more hair from a good reliable vendor. And get that hair taken out and the good hair installed. It was a long annoying day for me.                              I'm jus sharing this experience with the hope us women we be more careful with who we purchase hair from. Please don't let this dishonorable so called business owners fool you. I waisted money time and energy this day. Luckily I was able to find the stylist who by the way had nothing to with this nightmare instead welcomed me his new salon family who made me flawless again with some new hair that is 100%virgin. I love it. Jus wash out for lavash hair!!! It's not Lavish at all. It might not catch u right away but it will for sure that second wash. Most importantly wash out for Tony. I don't know if the actual salon owner is aware of what he is doing. She did seem a little sincere but she needs to let him go before he brings her business down!!!

41.description: I love this place. Everyone is so personable and accomodating. You can tell they really care. Just got a haircut from a new stylist, Carlito. He's fabulous, did a great job! Sometimes it can be tricky working with someone new, but he was patient, asked a lot of questions till he was sure he understood what I wanted, then went to work. I love my new cut!

52.description: ok, WOW.  this place rules.ive been living in the city for a year now and finally realized i need to stop waiting to get my haircut until i go home (to madison).  this place was close and i was REALLY in need.  i called for a manicure, highlight and cut and said i need someone good with curly hair.  she said, like afro american curly hair and i said no.  just curly.this shouldve tipped me off- i got there and was the only white person.  nice.  of course, i didnt let it scare me off - why would it?  my hair IS really curly.  my manicure started like a half hour late, but thats really the only negative thing i can say - plus i munched on the fruit and coffee they had out.  i still made it on time to the cubs game and both the stylist and manicurist were conscious of the time when i told them i had to go for the game.veronica did my nails and they are fabulous!!  she only does real nails, not acrylics, and only works weekends but shes WORTH it.  her little procedure is totally unique and i plan to go back for a pedicure.  my nails look fantastic and she was really easy to talk to.then came crizen, a cute little filipino chick, to do my hair.  i told her what i was thinking and she told me what SHE thought.. i said she should do what she thinks is best and boy was she right.  it came out better than it did in my head!  i know i sound pretty over the top, but i am really happy to have found a place within walking distance - i will definitely go back to see crizen.plus!  10% off for first time clients!without the discount, the manicure was $20, womens cut/partial highlight $115 (i think).

50.description: Love love love Crizen. After my hairstylist of 12 plus years left the profession I was totally lost. I went to a gazillion salons downtown, but no one came close to my old stylist. That was until I met Crizen. She does amazing highlights, color, and cut. She is my savior!! Oh, and I also got my husband hooked. He now won't see anyone else either!!!

4.description: I love this place and my stylist Jayleandre, he is a true artist. This is a no nonsense salon for the grown and sexy people of Chicago. Come on down and get your hair did, in fabulosity style

6.description: Worst experience ever!!! I decided to book an appointment with Megan, after searching for an awesome colorist/hair stylist close to home. A girl always needs a good back up plan when you main stylist goes on vacation or not available for that last minute appointment.So, I called Salon Heaven at least four days before my scheduled appointment and spoke with either the owner or manager (not sure which one). On the day of my appoint I decided to show up show up at least 20 mins. early so we could talk about color and cut before my appointment and the front receptionist couldn't find information my information calendar. What made it even worse...hair stylist wasn't even working that day. Receptionist made a call to the "owner" and she did apologize for not entering the appointment into the computer. I was told, "she was working off site for the day. I'm sorry. I can offer you a free manicure and schedule you for tomorrow (saturday)." Unfortunately, I wasn't able to fit the offer into my weekend schedule. I left disappointed and frustrated. I had to go back to my regular stylist...so happy to learn she was able to it me in her hectic schedule. The owner did follow-up with me and try to resolve the situation by offering another stylist at a steep discount but I wasn't comfortable. I was trying to get my hair colored and styled before an important vacation trip. Lesson learned...if it ain't broke don't fix it. Ashley at M Salon here I come.

22.description: I get my brazilian wax at Salon Heaven and Spa with Lucie.  Lucie is awesome!!!!!  She knows how to make you feel comfortable and has a great personality.  I will continue to go for as long as I can.  Love her!  Thanks Lucie.

15.description: Great service at this salon!  Definitely going back.  It was peaceful, my stylist was ready for me when I arrived, and I was pleased with my hair.

20.description: I went for a massage with Elijah, and boy, did he do an excellent job! His was thorough, friendly and professional. He used a combination of techniques designed to soothe my tension and help me relax. Based on my subsequent interactions with the owner/manager and couple of the other stylists, I'd definitely go back. They have a stylist(s) that specializes in natural hair care and I look forward to trying her. Even though the prices are a bit on the high end, you get what you pay for. :)

36.description: Best.Wax.EverLike, seriously.  This Brazillian didn't even hurt that much...and I don't know how that's possible.  Hard wax is just that amazing, maybe?  Perhaps, it was due to the fact that I chugged a massive Rockstar during the day, so the caffeine was racing through my veins and helped induce some type of natural pain-killer?  I have absolutely NO idea. Def not complaining, though.  I think the waxer (also the owner - so sorry I forgot her name!) was just THAT good, though!  She was such a darling...so sweet and hilarious.  It took a little longer than expected (about 40 minutes), but I really didn't care because she did a great and thorough job.  Oh, and she was a lifesaver because she got me an appointment basically last minute on a Friday!  Whoooo!  The salon itself is spacious and cute...with tons of hairdresser stations, big mirrors, bright lighting !  It's located on the second floor, above the tanning studio, so you need to ring the bell and then can buzz you up.  I loved that there was a huge tv and hip hop blaring when I came in.  The wax is normally $55, but there's a 15% discount (I believe) for first time customers.  Street parking is normally pretty easy, too.  Another South Loop win!

14.description: I was very impressed with Salon Heaven.  Wonderful Staff and they go the extra mile.  You will feel like you are in Salon Heaven.  Definitely adding them to my budget

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: African-American Hair, Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Perms, Extensions, Straight Perms, Coloring, Kids' Hair

1.description: Will never shop at this store again!! My 3 year old little girl got a frozen coin purse and a frozen stamp that she was so happy to get. She got her own bag for her stuff. 5 minutes later she realized her stuff was no longer in her bag because the bag was torn and her stuff had fallen out. I happened to see a lady picking her purse up in the street and just caught her before she put it her bag, but as for the stamp it was broken in the street and my daughter was heart broken. We went back to the store to get a new stamp and explain that the bag that was given to her was torn on the side and her stuff had fallen out. The lady was EXTREMELY rude and said we had to pay the 75 cents for the new stamp and that it wasn't their fault. I said are you kidding me??? AND her reply was U kidding me..and continued to be nasty. The 75 cents was not a big deal, it was the point and because of that I will be sure to never shop at this store again!!! I almost returned the other items we bought as well but since it was already given to my kids I did not. HORRIBLE customer service...

0.description: This was our last stop after visiting all the other tchotchke shops in China Town.  It has the best selection of items and at reasonable prices.  Everything is organized and neatly displayed, well lit and decent sized aisles.  Will definitely go back

12.description: Disclaimer: I am employed by the Adler Planetarium, which is where this cafe is located. However, you can visit the cafe without having to pay admission. Come in the front or (left) side doors and ask them to point you towards Galileo's.They're open 9-10 with a limited breakfast selection, and 11-3:30 for lunch; however, they sometimes close early so be sure to get there by 3 pm.This cafe has a million-dollar view of the city, whether you're there during the day to visit the museum, or at night for a private event. (You can get a preview of the view from the 'Sky Eye', Adler's webcam.) There are a number of free telescopes inside, along the windows facing the city... people really enjoy checking out the skyline through them.Galileo's is run by Food for Thought catering, which operates about thirty venues throughout the city. There are always daily specials and new things to try out on a regular basis. It's newly renovated and cleaner and airier than similar cafes at the Field and Shedd. Also less busy.Prices are decent but subject to the typical markup common to museums on the peninsula.Least busy times: right at 11 when they open, or after 1-1:30 depending on the day/holiday/season.Worst times to visit: weekends! It's always much busier then. It can also get kind of crowded when shows from the two theaters let out, especially right around noon. Holidays or other times when the kids are out of school can get completely insane. There are also some 'free days' (typically Mondays or Tuesdays) when crowds can get bad; you may want to call ahead to ask how busy it is.Overall, it's good food in a comfortable setting with a view that can't be beat.

3.description: The view that Galileo's Cafe provides definitely deserves 5 stars, although I feel the food would probably deserve around 3.5-ish stars.They do have lunch options that are made fresh, but the goodies that you see through the glass are not.But again, the view, it CANNOT be beat!

1.description: I have no clue why this is rated so highly.  My husband ordered the steak banh mi and I ordered the turkey sub.  It was pretty expensive for the portion size, and it doesn't even come with fries/chips/salad of any sort.  The bread was dry and slightly stale, and the sandwiches made Subway seem like a Michelin-starred restaurant.  Maybe I shouldn't be so harsh to a "museum cafeteria," but just last week we dined at North & Clark Cafe (next to the Chicago History Museum) where the prices are similar, yet the sandwiches come with a side and portions are bigger (and actually delicious)!Next time I visit Adler, I may sneak Subway sandwiches in my purse.

2.description: Had an early lunch here on a Saturday before heading into the Planetarium.  My husband and I both ordered the same sandwich (and paid separately), yet his was ready before mine.  Another 10 minutes went by and my sandwich was nowhere to be found.  I went up to the counter and the employee basically said they forgot to make it.  How does this happen?  It wasn't even crowded.  The sandwich was okay but, for the price, I will eat before going to the Planetarium again in the future.

9.description: You're trapped on museum campus and you need to eat? You could do worse. You could do better, too. Most of the prepared for you fresh menu choices are big enough to share, so there's that. But honestly, on a nice day I'd rather eat outside at one of the park food stands.If you're already out at Adler, it's not a bad option. And the view! OH THE VIEW! Even if you're not going to eat anything, go look out the windows to get one of the best views of Lake Michigan and the skyline.

10.description: Galileo's Cafe inside Adler Planetarium exceeded my expectations, at least what I had expected from a museum restaurant. They offer an array of vegetarian fare such as the Garden Bagel and Sunrise Egg & Cheese Sandwich for breakfast (both under $4) and the Caprese and Mediterranean Paninis for lunch (both under $7). The food quality here is about the same as a bistro in the city, and the prices are pretty reasonable for a museum eatery. The cafe itself is spacious and modern, and the views of downtown Chicago can't be beat. It is always spectacular no matter the time or weather.Note: The fountain soda, while only $1.49 for a large cup, is not refillable. Food and drinks are not allowed in the actual museum anyway.

4.description: LUNCH at ADLER Planetarium is ALWAYS my first choice with my out-of-town guests.  The view of the lakefront from this glass-walled dining room is magnificent.  (That is why so many weddings and special events are held here.)  The cafe prices are affordable.  The food is fresh with healthy options... and is casual cafeteria style.   I like to get to the Museum Campus in the morning and go to the Shedd to see the beluga whales or Field's mummies & dinosaurs.  Then walk to the Adler for lunch and take in one of their sky shows and walk the exhibits a bit.  Then finish it off by renting bicycles (right in front of Adler)  to do the easy scenic bike to Navy Pier, and take  a sail on the Tall Ship Windy.  Adler After Dark - the third Thursday EVENINGS each month is a great date night for 21+ older.  The observatory is usually open to visitors + music & drinks.

6.description: Great place for a fast and decently priced meal.  I had the greek salad (see photo) and it was definitely big enough to split.  Also had a yummy in-house made chocolate chip brownie.  The total with tax for the salad and brownie was $9.90.  A pretty good deal for a museum cafe.  The view right immediately outside (somewhat visible inside if you have a good tabel) of the cafe is probably the best view of the city in Chicago.

15.description: I took an out-of-town guest to show them the beautiful Chicago skyline and after freezing our buns off, what better to do? Go right next door to Galileo's! Of course the view from this cafe is absolutely stunning, but when it comes to food, I think they could have done a little better. Their paninis are okay, but they make the food as you order and of course Chicago gets a lot of tourists therefore there are huge lines and employees have to hurry up and kind of pile all the ingredients on top of each other and call it a panini. Salads are a little boring without any dressing really. And of course prices aren't that reasonable like at any other tourist attraction place. Maybe they have some other items that I would like, but oh well. I was just there to satisfy my hunger, not to enjoy an exceptional dinner in a chic restaurant or anything.

0.description: Amazing beautiful restaurant with windows overlooking the lake.  They have strange hours, and closed about 5 minutes after we placed our order, luckily.  (This was maybe 3pm?)The turkey and bacon sandwich that I had made for me was fresh, reasonably priced (for museum/planetarium fare), and we found seating with no problem.  The staff here seemed friendly. I found it mildly amusing that the food at this restaurant had a Tuscan Italian theme, since that is where Galileo was born and mainly lived, although I don't think that most of the food on the menu, including chocolate chip cookies, would be recognizable to 17th century Tuscany.

5.description: Only the view worth 5 stars. Food is not so bad.

13.description: Such an unexpected treat. I had the Santa Fe Taco Salad (w/o taco shell) which was very very tasty. My wife got the shredded ham and cheddar.  She thought it was very good. The cookie was awesome too. Very good experience.

11.description: Galileo's CafeI really enjoy the changes this place had had. I see there a re a lot of new faces in the kitchen, and there are new drinks in the cooler.I got the Cesar salad, and the guys were asking me if i wanted any other ingredient added.... ohhhh .... so sweet... ok, i added some olives then.The strawberry/lemon drink is very refreshing and you can eat the fruit at the end of your drink. I like the name that sandwiches have, galactic, hungry astronaut, etc, yogurts are very refreshing, with 2 types of fruit mix, just love it. The view is great from here, you can see the city, the boats, i didn't have to pay to get in, since i was only using the cafe, great little place, the only think is that they close early.

8.description: I came to the Planetarium when they opened at 9:30am and was hungry for breakfast by 10:15am.  I stopped off at Galileo's Cafe hoping for some good breakfast. Instead, I see a menu for lunch starting at 11am.  They offer a "continental breakfast" but I had no idea what that meant because there were brownies, cookies, and muffins that looked like dessert food for lunch.  I walked over to their refrigerated section where the had pudding, parfaits, and fruit cups. They also had cold sandwiches.  So I opted for half a turkey sandwich and a cup of coffee. Prices here are definitely reasonable.
