I paid less than $5 for these two items.The seating area is very nice. Very spacious and great views of the city. When I started eating my sandwich in this area, I find out my turkey sandwich was labeled incorrectly as it was a TUNA sandwich instead. Luckily I am not a picky eater and eat just about anything. But I cannot give a good rating to any place labeling their tuna sandwiches as turkey sandwiches!  Not a place I would want to come back to for breakfast! My mistake!

14.description: The food is good, the staff is friendly, the prices are pretty reasonable, especially if you have an Adler membership; and the view of the city is amazing!  I appreciate that they have takeout boxes for leftovers too :)

7.description: Best place to go for food on Museum Campus! You get better and more food for your buck (as compared to the places in the Field Museum). Sometimes it is a little chaotic, depending on what time of day you go and if there are groups there.Recommend: Apple Harvest Salad

1.description: Al, Manny, and the whole staff are very professional. Very accommodating. Al & Manny are great barbers. I travel across town & pass several shops just to have my son and my hair cut at Groom.

0.description: The Barber Manny is A1.. Always on point and takes his time.. The Groom Shop does not feel like a factory assembly line, with a get them in and get them out attitude. They take pride in treating every customer as a VIP..

12.description: I had the salad with spicy mustard dressing. Would recommend getting it on the side.  Turkey bacon panini was good and the fries were great

3.description: Ummm, wine and beer anyone? Yes please! Especially if there are a ton of field trip groups that you are maneuvering around all day.The food is delicious. There are many different things to choose from; burgers, salads, soups, sandwiches. And coffee. And beer. And wine. Did I already mention that?It's also in the perfect setting. Right off the Main Level, very modern, comfy, and nice employees. I found this to be a great spot to have lunch and take a quick break from the crowds.

1.description: Spot-on changing menu, a wine bar and gorgeous views of the large hall and Sue, the T-Rex, from one of the seating areas.  This is one of the best museum restaurants in the Midwest, quality-wise.  The menu isn't large, but they offer some interesting things here.  Over the past year, I've tried soup in a bowl, different sandwiches, pasta dishes.  Limitless coffee, sodas, teas, etc.  It's also surprisingly affordable, compared to other museum restaurants I've eaten in.Eat here and skip that crappy "Explorer Cafe" in the basement that's a complete waste of space and a joke.

2.description: For a rather informal museum restaurant , this is pretty good ! We both had paninis with - I think cheese, ham and turkey.They have good beer on tap.I had a Matilda from Goose Island- Belgianish- and an IPA of some sort.Wife had a glass of Chardonnay.It makes sense to eat here when you go to the museum because you aren't close to anything else and the museum is huge and when your done, you can say , that was rather nice.It's quick and attractive.

9.description: This is a good place to break away from the crowd at the museum.  There are less screaming children and less ill-mannered adults... probably because they have wine, beer, and espresso drinks... oh and cupcakes... I'd have to agree with another Yelper.  The staff is outstanding.  Super friendly people and the seating is decent too.  There are a lot of big windows in the back that brighten the area up and give a good view.

10.description: As far as museum food goes, the Field Bistro is actually pretty decent. It offers everything from standard burgers and hot dogs to paninis, soups, and salads. I found my half Panini/small soup combo to be worth the $6.50...it was more than enough to refuel me for my museum campus adventure.Line moves fairly quickly, but can be a bit disorganized. Entry into the bistro starts as one line, but then splits into multiple lines to each station...however, there is no dedicated "exit" to each line...so it does get pretty hectic at high time. The staff does try to control the chaos though and even through it all, the staff behind the counters are always friendly and ready to expedite your order. Food and drink is meant to stay within the area, but have no fear...ample seating is available.

4.description: I operate under the impression that tourist attractions are bound to have crappy food. You spend too long at the place and get starving so they can over charge you for marginal food items-- NOT THE CASE here!After two hours of walking around, and fighting crowds, coffee and a snack were desperately needed. With the main goal being to just sit down, we decided to stay in the museum and rest here. We wanted coffee, which they have (Self serve), but just a basic decaf and regular option. They do have cinnamon, etc you can shake in for extra flavor, though too. Looking around, they had a lot of pre-made fancy-sounding items under heat lamps ready for consumption, and made to order items as well. I spotted cups of fries and decided coffee and fry break sounded idea. The damage for two cups and a cup of fries was $8, which wasn't bad for a tourist attraction.The coffee was VERY hot and delicious. Hit the spot for a pick me up. The fries, I wasn't expecting much from, but ended up falling in love! They were crispy, fresh, perfectly salted and seasoned, but smooth and soft inside. It was only after we sat down with our food that we realized they also had beer on tap and wine for sale- a nice idea/treat for patrons/stressed out parents! I would definitely stop back in on my next trip to The Field Museum!

6.description: I am surprised this place has so many decent reviews.  I found the food to be horrible.  Literally no flavor whatsoever.  My 3 year old son got the Mac and cheese.  I took a bite before giving it to him and it was 100% bland.  Tasted like plain noodles. There was no cheese taste whatsoever- not even a salty flavor.  He took one bite and spit it out.  The cashier let us get a refund on it with no questions asked.I had a specialty salad that came with a poblano ranch dressing.  The dressing tasted like water.  The salad had absolutely no flavor.  The fries had no seasoning.  Tortilla soup was decent.  My mom liked her turkey burger.  I really wasn't expecting much since it's just a museum restaurant, but I did not expect it to be as bad as it was.

15.description: My husband and I are Field Museum Members, and we will never eat here again based on the rude staff and poor customer service. We requested a receipt and when one was never printed, I was told by check out they needed to find a manager. She wandered the restaurant for 10-15 minutes before bringing a manager over, who tols me to "Stop being impatient, Sweetheart." Again, very poor service skills, and general lack of caring about customer service. On top of that, food is only ok.

0.description: N I C E   M U S E U M   C A F E T E R I AWow, what a trendy and unique selection of food and drink ! Was I ever pleasantly surprised! And what a location,,,,with a view....people watching......surrounded by so much incredible history. Absolutely a memorable experience in a memorable building. It makes sense to eat here so you can continue seeing the entire museum without losing momentum. There are vending machines downstairs, oh yum. Or, right outside the front door there is a hot dog stand  :-)Well planned, well executed, well cleaned, well cooked, well serviced, etc !!C U T S E Y      C U T S E Y      C U T E S E Y

5.description: I expected this place to be ridiculously expensive but it wasn't all that bad... the food was good, lots of places to sit (at least for an early lunch), well designed room with a timeline of the museum on the wall and very clearly labelled garbage/compost/recycling. Great break while visiting the Field.

13.description: Food is good enough and there is some variety but otherwise it is overpriced for the amount if food you get.

11.description: Non-blah attraction food! Yay! We had the T-Rex panini (salami, black forest ham, cheese and an olive mix), Turkey bacon panini (with a pretzel like bread) and fries. Paninis were amazing. We bought two and shared so we both could try a bit of each. I have to say T-Rex was my favorite out of both. Fries had little pieces of potato skin on them and were slightly crisp. Very tasty! Be forewarned on the T-Rex tea though! It's a dollar more than soft drinks and has a mint flavor to it like a mojito. Also there are several lines once you walk in so pick something and pick a line. Three choices of soup with bread bowl option, make your own salad, burger/chicken sandwich line, world fair was stir fry with choice of protein and sauces, and paninis. So give it a try! It beats leaving the museum early for sure!!!

8.description: The lattes are good. I had a dark chocolate latte and it was the right amount of espresso with the chocolate. A very good pick-me-up.

14.description: Wow! Quite a step up from the Corner Bakery that formerly occupied this space. the food selection is varied, but not large.  I had the tacos and was pleasantly surprised but not overwhelmed.  The staff are nice and knowledgable. The atmosphere is the museum atmosphere, so it will vary by what day and time you visit. It's a but pricier than the McDonald's downstairs but worth the price.

7.description: This is the best place to eat if you don't want to leave the museum. It kind of has a captured audience. French fries are ok. Salad is served in a cardboard bowl. They have cheesburgers, bread bowl soups and a few items for kids. Decent. When we went it was extreemly  crowded.

28.description: Cute place. Very clean. Staff is very friendly. I've been there twice and my service was much faster this time then the first time I went. No-chip and pedi in less than 1.5 hours. I'm happy with that. Very happy to have something nice in the neighborhood on this end.

1.description: Updated: The co-owner of the shop sent me a note via email, explaining what he felt was the other side of the story, and offering the same service for free should I return. It was a professional and empathetic note. I told him I'd update the yelp review, although he did not request. I will not be returning, but always give credit where it is due.

9.description: I've only been here once but my experience was wonderful! Rose gave me an amazing no chip manicure. She took her time shaping my nails just right and meticulously painting them until they were perfect. 3 weeks later and my no chip is just finally starting to look shabby. Typically I get about a week and a half out of a no chip at other salons. Prices are comparable to other Chicago salons, the store is cute and clean, and I saw little snacks and wine in the waiting area which is nice. Minus 1 star for the snooty guy at the reception desk and the fact that they were playing Disney channel on the TVs when there were no children in the salon.

29.description: The owner was friendly and the decor was cute. They are still working out their "new salon" kinks though. First, they need to lock the door and add a bell in that spot. Secondly, their timing was off. It took us two full hours for just one service. Pedicures were OK but very basic unless you want to pay extra for any pampering. Some people left when we were there due to being off schedule. There is hope though - I think this salon will improve when they get a set esthetician team in place and get more comfortable with their space and schedule.

23.description: Got the $35 mani-pedi after work on a Thursday.  Good experience.  Definitely make an appointment, as there were only 2 people working.  A few people came in off the street while I was there and they were told there was about a 45 minute wait.  My manicurist was great and super friendly.  Prices were on target for the area and service.  Nice color selection.

5.description: I was in desperate need for a manicure and decided to stop by because they had an opening and I was in the neighborhood.  It took me by surprise that the tech stood up the entire time she did my nails.  It actually made me uncomfortable.  I didn't like the bar set up because it was uncomfortable to sit at and have your own space.  I found it distracting that they didn't have a receptionist and the tech had to continuously stop doing my nails to answer the phone and make appointments.  Maybe the concept works for some but it wasn't an experience I will remember for the right reasons.

25.description: After getting a botched pedicure at another establishment, I came to Rock 'N Nails to fix my feet before a date. Firstly, the place is clean, modern, and the music is good. Secondly, they give you free wine. And finally, my nails are PERFECT! Quick service, extremely reasonable prices, friendly staff and quality work. I will definitely be going back!

12.description: Absolute worst service I have ever experienced. There is NO street bike parking. So yelp info is wrong. When we came with a bike there was no place to park it and the manager was of no use. She didn't care and wasn't accommodating in any way. The girl that did my pani-medi was still in the training phase so everything she did was checked. She completed my manicure then when I checked it there was gaps all around my cuticle area. Someone else then took the polish off and repainted it. I was there for ages with such terrible service. The pedicure I was so excited to have was a failure also. I didn't get a good foot scrub or a massage. For the first time I didn't tip anyone. Awful. I don't recommend coming here as quality is poor. Lack of customer service and skills make this a no go place for me in the future which is a shame as it's super close to where I live. Oh well! I'm not wasting my money there again :(

21.description: I've only been here once but my experience was wonderful! Rose gave me an amazing no chip manicure. She took her time shaping my nails just right and meticulously painting them until they were perfect. 3 weeks later and my no chip is just finally starting to look shabby. Typically I get about a week and a half out of a no chip at other salons. Prices are comparable to other Chicago salons, the store is cute and clean, and I saw little snacks and wine in the waiting area which is nice. Minus 1 star for the snooty guy at the reception desk and the fact that they were playing Disney channel on the TVs when there were no children in the salon.

16.description: I love Rock'n Nails! Natalie is a sweetheart and always offers complimentary wine!  The salon is modern and clean and an added bonus, they are open seven days a week.

17.description: Rose does great nails. If you go please ask for her. The welcoming upon entering could be better especially by the owner Natalie. She is only welcoming to those that happen to be her clients. Speaking to all when they walk in is good business. Also her phone manner should be better by saying thank you and bye upon hanging up the phone.

10.description: Cute south loop location. They are skilled with great customer service.  However,  they go by appointments so you may not get seen just stopping randomly. Also, sometimes if you have an appointment you still have to wait.

11.description: Awesome place and so happy to have found a neighborhood nail place after just having moved to the area. Very affordable as well! I had Natalie who was super nice and accommodating and despite the time didn't rush through anything. Will definitely be a repeat customer!!

26.description: I've been here once and my experience was actually pretty nice. Today was where it took a turn. I called to see if they had any appointments available and they said they had a 12:20PM appointment (on a Thursday). I got there and they were running behind. No big deal, usually I've gone to salons and they have been behind schedule so they just soak me in a pedicure chair for a while (which is ok with me). Once it hit around 12:45-12:50 I eventually left because it was just taking too long. Appointments are made for people like me that are on a time crunch. I was very upset as she was rude (mind you its only 2 ppl in the salon) I wrote a review on Facebook alerting them of their service and I get a pretty unprofessional response. As a neighbor in the area I am appalled that a business would tell me that "my $24 means nothing because they are on Michigan Ave". Do better and be more professional..

27.description: Cute salon. Staff is friendly with affordable prices and great service! Highly recommended. I had a no chip mani and a pedi with Rose who was very meticulous and did an amazing job. Probably one of the top mani/pedis I've ever had. Ecstatic to have a place like this in the neighborhood.

0.description: I have passed this nail shop almost daily but yesterday was my first mani pedi here and it was better than I expected. I had no problem getting a 645 appt. even when I called the day of. Even better, they were ready as soon as I arrived. They have an expansive array of colors, both OPI and Essie and top of the line pedicure chairs.  The chair massage is...ummmm...thorough :). My nail tech was fantastic. It is a small operation but they are extremely attentive in catering to their customers. The shop closed at 8pm but that did not change the attention to my nails, my tech worked on me until almost 830pm.  I was beyond pleased with the results.  The entire staff was patient and focused on providing excellent service.This spot is also BYOB and has lots of daily specials. I've already started planning a treat yourself girls day with my friends.

20.description: I have never been to a salon that had such an unprofessional and rude receptionist! My friend and I made 6:30 appt after work for two pedis and I was getting a mani as well. I arrived at 6:15 and asked to get my mani done first while waiting for my friend who was held up at work. The receptionist was such a bitch! Lecturing me and my friend on being late, they had other appts, giving me dirty looks! I was never so uncomfortable in my life and I was the one paying for service! My friend came at 7 and they refused to do her nails even though no one else was there and they had free technicians sitting around. Appalled and never going back. The only professional person there was Rose who did my nails and I almost felt bad for her because she was very uncomfortable too and tried to offer us wine to defuse the situation. Horrible.

19.description: I wanted to try out this place as it is literally right by our condo.  However, being close is not worth it at all.  My mani/pedi took almost two hours.  Also, I am used to the gal/guy that does your pedi, then does your mani.  Not the case here.  After my pedi, I then sat and waited another 30 minutes for someone to start my mani.  Not acceptable when you have an appointment.  They need to hire more people.  Also, the color selection is not great.  As I was getting my pedi she asked if I wanted my foot calluses scrubbed.  I said of course.  As all my Pedi's always come with that.  That is the whole point.  She then charged my an extra $10 for that service.  I will never stray from salon vision again, even if it is the dead of winter and next door.

2.description: I was here in town for work at the McCormick Place and was badly in need of a full set after spending two days setting up for a trade show. My nails, fingers and hands took a beating. I called and Natalie was super flexible and patient with me especially since my scheduling kept changing. Michael, the nail tech, who worked on my nails was equally nice and super quick. I was in and out of there in about 45 mins. I love the modern decorations! They have this awesome semicircle bar-like counter that seats five or six people. Very unique, unlike traditional nail shops where you sit at "stations." The pedicure area had comfortable massage chairs with really cool-looking remote controls. If I had more time or if the weather was warmer, I would've loved to have gotten a pedicure too. Overall I was very impressed with the entire nail shop experience and even more grateful for the hospitality.

18.description: Awful.  The chick couldn't do eyebrows. I dont have thick brows at all. I go there and she is half ass doing my brows.  She used wax 5 times because she kept messin up..then she says "well your eyebrows are thick" I seriously was ready to go off . I asked if someone else could do them and she goes to say something to the receptionist.  Another lady came and it her 30 minutes. . 30 MINUTES! !!! AND MY EYEBROWS STILL WE NOT DONE. I AM SO PISSED OFF. I'D NEVER COME BACK HERE AGAIN

13.description: I've come here twice and both times they've turned me away because they say they're too busy but they have chairs open... I just don't get it. I even told them I would wait and they said ok but we can take you at 4pm but it's 12:40; you want me to sit here for hours on end, really?!?!? What the hell? I guess they lost my business. On to the next place!

4.description: I was hoping this would be my neighborhood go to spot, but although it's clean and modern, the good ends there.The staff especially the owner are super unfriendly. The vibe is not welcoming. I made an appointment and when I came in she still looked at me like "what are you doing here?" Which is the same look she gives walk ins. Yes you're busy, but there's a way to keep customers coming back, unfriendly isn't the way.I usually get a vinyl lux mani that lasts over two weeks, so I asked about an up charge for vinyl lux. She said there wasn't one, but that she recommends opi shine which is better and lasts 10 days, but costs $5 more. Fine by me, like I said, my manis last forever so an extra $5 is nothing.Here's where the real drama ensued...my nails chipped not 24 hours after, so I returned to the salon because I specifically asked about their guarantee. So I go back and try and be polite because it was busy and like I said, I was hoping this would be my spot in the Sloop. She told me she couldn't make an appointment for me, but that I'd have to come back that day (it was about 2:45.) So I asked how long it would be if I waited, and her response was "I don't know, we're busy, but maybe someone can do you in between other people." Okay so I waited almost an hour before someone who was obviously there only to polish started my nails. The owner said "pick a color", so I picked a nude because of the chipping issue. So the polish girl takes off my polish and the owner says "you shouldn't have taken off the polish on all only on the chipped ones" which basically was 8/10 nails. So anyway the girl is almost done polishing and the owner comes over and says "I have to charge you for a polish change because that isn't the same color." So I said "you never told me to choose the same color and I chose a different one in case the same thing happened again." To which she continued to argue with me. So long story short, super rude owner, terrible service and my polish change redo chipped within 24 hours again. So there's that.

24.description: I really like this place! The decor is super cute and they even have free wine for you to drink while you get pampered! Staff is very friendly and did a nice job. They spent a long time on my pedicure and my moms manicure. Prices are awesome-I will definitely be back!

6.description: I'd been wanting to try this place out, but kept going to my usual place.  Turns out a couple of my friends  go here and they highly recommended it.  Well, I went, tried the gel manicure for the first time and I loved it.  Rose was my manicurist and she was awesome.  the shop is super clean and they do a great job.  I've officially found a new nail shop.  yay!

22.description: Awesome place and so happy to have found a neighborhood nail place after just having moved to the area. Very affordable as well! I had Natalie who was super nice and accommodating and despite the time didn't rush through anything. Will definitely be a repeat customer!!

15.description: This is my go-to ever since I moved to the South Loop. They do such a great job. Their mani/pedi takes longer than I'm used to, but it's because they take time and effort in the overall experience. I highly recommend them.

7.description: So, I called this place as I was driving past on my way to another nail salon actually just to see if they were decent enough to go there instead. Asked "How much for an acrylic fill in?"The woman on the phone responded "it's 24 dollars."I turned at the next light and came back and parked on the side, may have taken all of four minutes.Walked in... spoke to the SAME person I just spoke with on the phone... "Oh, we don't offer artificial services here".... It was not point in saying "I literally just spoke with you on the phone" because for whatever reason they weren't going to service me... so I turned around and left.

8.description: I feel that perhaps this salon doesn't get the due it deserves. First of all, I've been coming here since it opened. After some initial growing pains, I settled into the routine that has served me fantastically so far.I can vouch for their no chip manicures and their regular pedicures--they are the best in the city, hands down. Their prices are lower than most salons, and they are comfortable, clean and convenient. Make an appointment, people. The owner, Natalie has always been warm and welcoming to me...on the phone and in-person. She's does fantastic work but I have to sing the praises of Rose. She is diligent, gentle and meticulous. I've never had someone who takes as much pride in her work. She never rushes and also puts time into making sure the foundation of your nails are as strong as they can be...which is my gripe with a few other salons, they rip, gouge and weaken your nails with their no chip removal...just as a note, Rose will also work to repair the damage inflicted by other lesser technicians. I always call before I come in, and they are always super flexible offering me multiple times. Also they have great pricing for a no chip polish change, as opposed to doing a full manicure as well. They've got my business and if you give either Natalie or Rose (request them when you make an appointment) a chance, they'll have yours as well.

30.description: Awful.  The chick couldn't do eyebrows. I dont have thick brows at all. I go there and she is half ass doing my brows.  She used wax 5 times because she kept messin up..then she says "well your eyebrows are thick" I seriously was ready to go off . I asked if someone else could do them and she goes to say something to the receptionist.  Another lady came and it her 30 minutes. . 30 MINUTES! !!! AND MY EYEBROWS STILL WE NOT DONE. I AM SO PISSED OFF. I'D NEVER COME BACK HERE AGAIN

3.description: I like the pedicures and atmosphere but they haven't figured out the scheduling. They are usually understaffed and don't have any regard for your appointment. I'm not sure why I make one or show up on time because they take me 30 min late. No respect for my personal schedule.

14.description: After getting a botched pedicure at another establishment, I came to Rock 'N Nails to fix my feet before a date. Firstly, the place is clean, modern, and the music is good. Secondly, they give you free wine. And finally, my nails are PERFECT! Quick service, extremely reasonable prices, friendly staff and quality work. I will definitely be going back!

1.description: DMK in Soldier Field initially sounded great, however the lack of communication, disorganization and misinformation resulted in a lackluster experience.  Prices are what you expect $13 for a single burger, $7 for fries and $7 for a large drink.  The issue started when I asked the cashier if I could change one cheese for another he said sure.  However, this system is set up whereby you take your receipt and hand it to another person who then hands it to the cook.  I asked the person who hands it off about the change, he says sure, the cook comes to me and confirms.  Then another cook confirms the change again! So far everyone is helpful. My order has not come out  after 20 minutes despite several people who ordered after me including those getting the #2 burger, which I attribute to my cheese request.  Then a female who was not wearing the same outfit as everyone else says what are you having? She then says we do not do ANY changes, you have to get whatever comes on it on the menu.  Ok so after 4 people including 2 cooks saying they would do  the change,  now after waiting 20 minutes you are telling me the cooks won't do it.  She then hands the person next to me a full box of fries and then proceeds to say here is your burger, standard #2, gives me the burger that was sitting there and a half box of fries.  Wait a second both of us paid $7 for fries but I get half the amount?  The best part, literally the next burger that comes out from another employee says #8 no mayo! Sounds like a change to me! The burger was average, I would get the fries again, assuming they had parmesan in the first quarter of the game unlike last time.Note this is for the Section 126 location.

2.description: I really do love DMK burger. I have been to their other locations multiple times and when my wife saw they were at Soldier Field no one was happier than she was. Very sad to say the quality there is SO lacking I'm having to write this. I understand that it's a football game and you are feeding a large crowd but if you cannot keep up some sort of quality you probably shouldn't do it. Utterly disappointed with the entire experience and quality of food. My wife ate less than half and honestly the only reason she ate that much was due to the cost. I will always continue to eat at the other locations but will never try this one again.

0.description: Don't you hate going to a football stadium and standing in a long concession line to ultimately overpay for moderate quality food at best? This was not the case at DMK Burger Bar. I was at Soldier Field for the Ravens-Bears game that got delayed for over 2 hours while we waited for tornado winds to clear Chicago. My buddy and I evacuated our seats in Section 126 and DMK was the first concession we saw. We knew we'd have a lot of time to kill so we went and stood in line. The line moved pretty quickly and the menu looked surprisingly good. We each ordered a burger, which came with fries, which I was not expecting. Even if you go to places like Smashburger or ZinBurger, fries don't come with the burgers. Burgers at those places are anywhere from $6-13 and fries are $3-4 separately. So when I saw that the burgers at DMK were going for $13 WITH fries AT a professional football stadium, I was thrilled, but still not expecting much from the quality. We picked up our order maybe 10 minutes after placing it and we were lucky. We were just about the last customers in line before the stadium concessions were forced to close due to the heavy rain and wind... This made for 60,000+ pissed off football fans who weren't able to overpay for food and beer even if they wanted to, while getting wet on the concourse without any indication as to when the game would recommence. Oh, and the Bears were down 10-0.When I tell you the burger and fries I had for $13 at a football stadium were among the best I've ever had in my life, I'm not kidding. The burger was cooked medium, the toppings (not all of which I can recall) integrated so well with the meat and the fresh bun, I didn't care when the game resumed. The fries were seasoned awesomely and were served with a chipotle ketchup. Who would have thought to do that?!All I can say is this place is awesome. I'm not sure if this is the only location in the stadium, but if there aren't and you're not sitting in the 100 section, this is well worth a trip down to the ground level.

28.description: I'm writing this review as I'm sitting in the restaurant. This is my first visit and so far, I love it! There isn't a large selection for brunch but what is available is delicious! I'm completely satisfied. The place doesn't look like much from the outside, but upon opening the door, it's beautiful. Small place but nice. I love the color scheme. Great date spot. I'm giving it 4 stars because I haven't had a chance to try their dinner menu. That being said, I will be back.

1.description: Unprofessional service. The restaurant was 10% full when the two of us arrived for our first time. January, on a Sunday 2016 at about noon. We were interested in trying a new brunch restaurant since we go out for brunch weekly and most of my friends get together for brunch often. Unfortunately, this place was not a good idea. The hostess had an attitude because we didn't have reservation for this empty brunch spot. We have never been before but I think it's odd to have been asked for a reservation and responded to negatively for not having one as there are many brunch restaurants in Chicagoland that are constantly busy and do not take reservations. This was a mostly empty spot on the south side. The outside looks like an abandoned commercial space complete with bars on the door and a pad lock. It is cafeteria style seating so any reservation is not going to have your party sitting at your own table. Speaking of which, the table was wobbly and the sofa chairs were white and some point but are now a dirty grey. The lighting is also very dim for a brunch restaurant. We were seated and told our server would be with us. We were then brought drinking glasses that were completely wet. It was about 15 min later (still no server), and my man asked the hostess about the food that was sitting out in trays on a table. We had no idea if we were to just go fix our own plate or if our orders were to be taken as there were no menus given to us. The hostess simply said "it's a buffet brunch" and walked off. Zero customer service and no update on our server. Another party then came in and was seated next to us. A server immediately came to them and provided service.At this time we decided to leave and felt it was best that we continue to spend our money else where. I don't recommend this place at all.

9.description: Some of my girlfriends and I went here in November.  I was pleasantly surprised by how much I enjoyed this place.  The food... was DELICIOUS! Everything was seasoned just right, and there were plenty of options. My favorite items were the french toast, wings, sausage links, and hashbrowns.  Honestly I could not get enough and ate myself into a stupor.  Brunch is bottomless which is AWESOME!  and for $6 bottomless mimosas are included. You know my girls and I did the mimosa option.  Totally worth it. The refills were constant without our needing to request . The restaurant is small and definitely has some growth and improvements to make just regarding set up for the buffet, etc.  However given its size, the space is use effectively.  The environment is very welcoming and trendy. The color scheme is super cute too! I just recently learned that they do host private events also.  My friend and I are hoping to host a joint birthday party/girls night there.  Definitely worth the visit and I will absolutely be returning.

29.description: The ambiance is beautifully dimmed by candlelight. The drinks are the best no bar menu as of yet but they will let you know the special. Not much to choose from if your a vegan. I had the lobster pasta which was a little over cooked but eatable. My friends had salmon crochet and mini burgers they said they were good. The staff are very friendly and they even let you know the price of the bill divided amongst a group. Outside location is pretty dark and there's meter parking. This sign and place isn't really big nor noticeable. Overall it's a nice place.

23.description: This place has great potential as someone stated.  I went for Sunday brunch and I really did enjoy the food.  However, I think charging $30+ is overkill.  It was unorganized and honestly I could have walked out without paying but I didn't want to be that person.  Here's a suggestion: payments should be taken before being able to get food.Service was meh.  No one asked what I wanted to drink or if I wanted more. I literally had to get up and ask for a mimosa but was never offered a second one and spending $30+ for an omelette, potatoes and fruit, I should be receiving better service.

5.description: This review is more for the ambience and great music. The set up reminds me more of a lounge than a restaurant. There are some tables, but also comfy lounge chairs. I was there on a Friday to hear Joe Kollege spin. Needless to say music was great, ambience cute, drinks basic/good, service excellent. I'll be back to try the food.

31.description: Fleetwood is a great addition to the south loop. It has great ambiance, good specialty drinks and decent food. The decor is sultry with rich purples, chandeliers, and white marble floors. The service was very friendly and the manager even came over to check on us. My one recommendation is to stay away from the fried chicken; it's got great flavor, but the way it's butchered results in you crunching on hidden slivers of bone. Not very appetizing. And ladies, be very careful walking in with your heels because that beautiful marble floor they have is very slippery when wet. Otherwise, this place is a cool spot for an after work drink.

25.description: We went there for drinks and we wanted to like it because we live near by. The interior and the staff were nice but I really think they missed the mark by covering the windows so you can't see in from the outside. A passer by would have no idea of what to expect inside or for that matter, even notice there was a bar there in the first place.

12.description: This was a tough rating, really it is a 3.5 but since that is not an option I will go with 3. The food was amazing, the Swedish meatballs were the best I have ever had. Great service but a little slow given how few people were in the restaurant and a big factor when bottomless mimosas  are involved. The food was great but the omelet and waffle station were nothing special. As stated above the place is small and they seem to cater almost exclusively to larger groups so call ahead. Dessert was missing which seems strange for brunch. The price does not seem to be on par with the food spread which was small and seemed to rely on the omelet station which left a lot to be desired.

21.description: These ppl are so rude.... Went in and got looked up and down which is rude in itself. Went to the bar- the bartender was so rude too he screamed "hellllloooo" because I was trying to process what spirits they had on the bar..... By the way, no one was waiting behind me... I was turned off completely, didn't bother to stay.I won't be trying the food unfortunately. I really hope this place gets it together!

16.description: Excellent food and service!  Used a groupon and my wife and I went on a Sunday for a bottomless mimosa and buffet brunch that was phenomenal.  I hope to go back soon!

17.description: The Fleetwood holds promise but at present it is still hit and miss. Although there were no dinner specials as advertised, the small plates looked appealing. I was going to order the shrimp wrapped with prosciutto but they were out. The restaurant is closed on Monday and Tuesday, so how were they out 30 minutes after opening? I chose the fried ( much too hard) calamari. My companion's catfish strips were crisp, flavorful yet still melted in your mouth.Her side of fries were dark and looked burnt!The atmosphere was soulful and laid back.Once their kitchen comes alive with a full menu prepared Fleetwood could be a small intimate gem on the South Side.

10.description: I was pleasantly surprised. I actually feel bad that my expectations were low for this place. It's new to the South Loop neighborhood and offers bottomless brunch on Sundays... 'nuff said right? I had to check it out. It's $27.99 for the bottomless mimosa option or $21.99 if you just have one mimosa (who would dare just have one?!). It's buffet style with a good variety of options. At first glance, it looks limited but in actuality who really needs more than an omelet station, waffle station, shrimp and grits, smothered catfish, turkey sausage, pork bacon, potatoes, Swedish meatballs, salad, fruit salad, and fried chicken?? That's a long list if you ask me. There might have even been more food that I'm missing. Ohhh, yeah, mac & cheese too. Unlike most buffets, they did a good job of keeping the food trays stocked and warm. I never felt like I was eating left overs.The venue is interesting. From the outside, I'm not sure what it looks like... a closed down record store? Certainly not a restaurant. The cab driver was like ummm, they serve food in there?!?! LOL. The inside has sleek décor and is cute. The server was pleasant and attentive and the gentleman refilling our water was EAGER... I guess he wanted to make sure we stayed hydrated because my glass never got below ¾ full.They have a high, shared table in the front by the windows, regular tables and chairs, padded seating along the walls, and a few cute sofa and leather seat and ottoman type sections - think VIP area. There are also 2 TVs in the front and since it was Sunday afternoon they had on 2 NFL games which I much appreciated.Overall, I enjoyed the food, service and my company so I would go back. It was a good value and wasn't overcrowded. We had a reservation but it wasn't necessary.

11.description: I very rarely write negative reviews but I couldn't keep quiet about this. I came here for dinner last night with a friend who was staying nearby at the Hyatt Regency McCormick Place. I had read about FleetWood on UrbanDaddy a few months ago. The decor is nice-ish. Black and white with pretty chandeliers. However, there were a bunch of people hanging around the entrance to the kitchen/bathroom area in the back of the restaurant where we were sitting. I couldn't tell if they worked there, were just hanging out, what was going on. The music (top 40 pop hits) was too loud for the dinner hour. But the real problem was the food.We both ordered the Tuscan salad, and I ordered mine with chicken. 5 minutes later, the waiter came over to tell me that their produce shipment hadn't arrived so the chicken they had went bad. Uh...gross. It made us worried about ordering the salad itself. But we risked it and went with it. The salads came out and truthfully they were ok. We also ordered some fries which were good.When we received the bill, the salads were $10.95, our glasses of wine were $10 and $11 each (I got cab sav, she got chardonnay). I can't believe 1) they didn't offer to compensate us for the disgusting chicken gone bad announcement and 2) their glasses of wine were the same price of their main dishes. It seemed very backwards. So essentially we paid $35 each for a salad, fries, and 2 glasses of wine. That seems crazy for the state/quality of this place. Needless to say I will never go back and I hope something else of quality goes up in this area so other people can avoid this place as well.

26.description: The burger with egg on it was good and so was the lobster ravioli.  The menu is a little limited and they don't have a drink menu yet. I did not like the decor. It reminded me of someone's basement.  The staff was friendly and attentive.

27.description: I had the pleasure of attending an event here last week and was very impressed.  The space is clean and modern.  The service was attentive and pleasant.  The drinks and food were well priced.  I would highly recommend having an event here either a birthday party, work event, anniversary, reunion etc.  The space is large enough to be comfortable, but small enough to be intimate.   Not sure if you could rent the whole place and bring a DJ, but that would be a fantastic time for sure!  My husband and I shared the lobster ravioli and the burger.  Both were delicious and generous.  The ravioli was rich and creamy and the pasta was cooked perfectly.  The burger was tasty and the fries were fantastic.  Overall a great time!

0.description: I ate here for brunch on Sunday and a few little things stopped me from giving it 5 stars. I was on time for my reservation but they were not ready I had to wait about 5 minutes. The food was EXCELLENT but it was a little cold. The mimosas were awesome and they keep them coming!!! The service was great very friendly and attentive staff. The omlette and waffle station was done by one person and he seemed a little overwhelmed. Other than that I loved this place. It's definitely a new business and has the potential to be top notch. I am definitely returning here. I recommend buying it on groupon.

20.description: I very rarely write negative reviews but I couldn't keep quiet about this. I came here for dinner last night with a friend who was staying nearby at the Hyatt Regency McCormick Place. I had read about FleetWood on UrbanDaddy a few months ago. The decor is nice-ish. Black and white with pretty chandeliers. However, there were a bunch of people hanging around the entrance to the kitchen/bathroom area in the back of the restaurant where we were sitting. I couldn't tell if they worked there, were just hanging out, what was going on. The music (top 40 pop hits) was too loud for the dinner hour. But the real problem was the food.We both ordered the Tuscan salad, and I ordered mine with chicken. 5 minutes later, the waiter came over to tell me that their produce shipment hadn't arrived so the chicken they had went bad. Uh...gross. It made us worried about ordering the salad itself. But we risked it and went with it. The salads came out and truthfully they were ok. We also ordered some fries which were good.When we received the bill, the salads were $10.95, our glasses of wine were $10 and $11 each (I got cab sav, she got chardonnay). I can't believe 1) they didn't offer to compensate us for the disgusting chicken gone bad announcement and 2) their glasses of wine were the same price of their main dishes. It seemed very backwards. So essentially we paid $35 each for a salad, fries, and 2 glasses of wine. That seems crazy for the state/quality of this place. Needless to say I will never go back and I hope something else of quality goes up in this area so other people can avoid this place as well.

19.description: These ppl are so rude.... Went in and got looked up and down which is rude in itself. Went to the bar- the bartender was so rude too he screamed "hellllloooo" because I was trying to process what spirits they had on the bar..... By the way, no one was waiting behind me... I was turned off completely, didn't bother to stay.I won't be trying the food unfortunately. I really hope this place gets it together!

2.description: I love great brunch places and I LOVE supporting black owned businesses. Alas, my experience didn't match up to those loves. I've been to Fleetwood on two prior occasions for non-dinning events. As a South Loop-er, woke up the morning and said "why not", time for me to give this black owned venue a try in terms of dinning. I purchased the groupon but since reservations have to be made 48 hrs in advance, I decided to go ahead with my girlfriend sin the groupon. We figured we could use the groupon on another occasion. Strike One, the hostess originally tried to sit us at the front of the restaurant at the unclothed high tables  immediately by the door instead of the nicer low tables that populate the majority of the restaurant. The nicer tables were empty but were apparently reserved for reservations. After asking kindly to move, we were able to. Seating in the front felt like second class seating. Not nearly as nice. Strike two, there is no printed menu. We had to prompt the waitress to explain the offerings. At no point was pricing for the Buffett even given. We informed the waitress that we did not want the bottomless mimosa option.The food was decent. The shrimp and grits were the best thing on the serving table. The waffles were excellent, though it's hard to mess that up. Omelletes, had to tell buddy to cook it a little bit longer--no biggie. The food, overall, was solid. Nothing less and certainly not more. Strike three, When we received the check, we noticed we were charged for a mimosa per person. Apparently, the non-bottomless mimosa buffet choice comes with one "free" mimosa. The waitress never explained it. We brought this to her attention, she apologized, and brought mimosas to the table. Strike four, the mimosa was 90% OJ. Even the table next to us scoffed at the taste. Strike five, they do not have coffee. At the end of the experience, I promptly cancelled my groupon. It certainly isn't worth the full price offering, let alone the groupon. As a S. Looper, I was hoping this could be our new black brunch spot. Sadly, it fell short.

18.description: Came here on Empire Wednesday and don't know if the service was bad because we didn't RSVP or what. We ordered food and drinks, and no one brought out our order. We sat there for 2 hours watching the Empire season finale STARVING. However, I would say the venue is small and comfy. I would say go and experience it for yourself. If you go on their popular night...please...please RSVP!

13.description: Ok so the funny thing about this review is that....I've yet to come to this place and I've already had a far from good experience. So lets begin in October when I called and spoke with Matt (the manager) and booked my dinner party of 20 for my 30th birthday; after speaking with Matt everything was good I was set for my BIG 30TH!!! I even had a follow up call from Naurese (not sure if I spelled that right sorry), both were very helpful she sent me the menu options for the style dinner I would have (Buffet) everything was good to go so now I can kick back and wait for the big day!!!! Well all of that changed November 14th 3:36pm when I received a text stating that someone booked a private event for November 22nd @ 8:00pm and I had the option of ending my dinner party at 7:30 (did I mention it was to start at 6:30 and go until 9). My blood pressure instantly went up Thank you for the 1 WEEK NOTICE so now I am left to scramble and find a venue to accommodate my party needs. THANK YOU FLEETWOOD.       Needless to say the young lady was extremely apologetic as well as Matt and really tried to accomadate considering the fact that I booked my party WAAAAYYYYYYY in advance however a 1 hour dinner party is just not going to work. I was extremely frustrated, annoyed and angry about this unfortunate situation but things happen and it was just VERY BAD business conducted on their end and the two people I spoke with did acknowledge that as well.        Now what really happened (THIS IS WHAT I BELIEVE). The owner of fleetwood did not have this 8:00 party on the schedule at all and these people called and wanted to buy of the entire restaurant (MONEY!!!) and my little private event for 20 on the 22nd from 6:30-9:00 was bumped and his employees being loyal employees gave me all the reasons in the world as to how this other party that was allegedly booked in advance was missed by everyone over the course of a month with consistent  communication from my end to theirs and they overlapped my party with this other party (SORRY DO NOT BELIEVE THAT AT ALL) however thumbs up to you all for not throwing your boss under the bus.       Needless to say I found 3 other venues willing to book me so I will spend my days checking these places out hopefully I can find something for the dinner portion of my birthday. What happened at fleetwood was extremely disappointing considering the fact that I love to support my people however it seems that every time  I try the business part is lacking, anyway I would ever book another important event with them because this just completely BLEW me however I may consider (and that's a very small consider)  trying them out for dinner one day!!! So unfortunate

4.description: A rather out of the way place with a limited and unpretentious brunch menu.The made to order omelette station has the usual veggie fixings but no meat options, for example, no ham if you want  a ham and cheese omelette.The tilapia in wine sauce was terrible, didn't even taste like tilapia, maybe it was overcooked and not seasoned well.The one good thing on the menu were the grits, they were seasoned well and tasted very good.Lastly, $21 gets you 1 mimosas, $27 gets you bottomless. A decent price but with the lackluster food choices, I have to shrug my shoulders and say maybe not again.

24.description: Great location, love the ambience, and the food was pretty good, went for brunch.Service was horrible!! We were seated, the waiter (who I thought was the bus boy), poured us water and left, never came back.  We were there at least an hour.  I had never been, so didn't know protocol.  The area where the food was, was very small.  They made waffles and omelettes to order, but they only had one skillet and one waffle maker so the lines tended to be long.    The door was open and it was a bit warm inside.  Hope they have air.  This place has great potential, but needs quite a bit of work.

6.description: Ok so I was invited here for a bday brunch. Place is small but has a nice quaintly decor. We were seated right in front a the high table over looking the other patrons of FleetWood. (Kinda like a wedding) 2 flat screens nicely added to the decor but wasn't really needed. Food was good, and was all you can eat! Shrimp and grits was good, waffles are amazing! All pork meat except for some preheated dry turkey links, ugh! The food was good, free mimosas!! service was a bit better than average, price was cool because we were allowed to use a Groupon which many ppl in our party used (it was for 2 or 4 ppl) I was partners with 3 others... Costing us $16 a piece. I gave it a 3, but it is a high 3. Maybe 3.7. There is nothing outstanding about this place but it is a nice quite place for you and a few. I would like to go back during normal hours to really get a true feel for this place...

22.description: My coworkers and I met up here for a party, promoted by one of our friends. The ambiance was very nice. I ordered a salad which was really good. My friend ordered the lobster ravioli which she regretted because it was too chewy. The music was good. Service was eh. We had to keep getting the waiter's attention. However, I would definitely go back.

15.description: Happy hour is great, awesome place to mingle, after hours has its fun.... Come for high energy... Not too expensive...

7.description: Sunday brunch with the ladies was a treat at this new Motor Row restaurant.  For $22 you can get the unlimited brunch buffet with a mimosa and for just $6 more you can upgrade to bottomless mimosas.  Unfortunately, the restaurant is located in an area that hasn't been well developed yet, but that was one of the only negatives.  The restaurant is cute, with a variety of seating options.  The staff was friendly and eager to please.  Our water as well as our mimosas were filled with regularity.  The food was a nice selection, although not vast.  It was fresh, hot and delicious.  There was also an omelette and waffle station.  When I went there were potatoes, pork bacon, turkey sausage, smothered catfish, grits, fried chicken, rice, fruit, and probably 3 more things that i simply can't remember right now.  Overall I'll go back.  The breakfast was good, the service was good and the ambiance was cute.

8.description: I was genuinely impressed with this place, which is a pleasant surprise considering the events leading up to getting more information and making a reservation left less than a positive impression. However, a place in the South Loop, we must try.It's a Brunch Buffet that you can opt for 1 mimosa ($21.99) or bottomless mimosas ($27.99). Brunch had something for everyone -- pork bacon, potatoes, turkey sausage, swedish meatballs, catfish and shrimp, shrimp and grits, fresh fruit, mac n cheese, waffle and omelette station). I must admit, most everything I had was delicious, especially the egg and waffles. I am not sure what they put in either, but they were very good.From a service perspective, they were on it. Clearing plates, making sure you had everything you need, turning the food over on a regular basis. Bonus (as my friend pointed out), they use small pans, so food isn't sitting out in masses. I also appreciated that I didn't feel rushed, even after we finished eating. Not everyone has that attitude.I would come back if someone mentioned it, but you have to understand that they are timely with emails and if you call, they may or may not identify themselves as Fleetwood (strange!).The venue, albeit small, is cute as well. I would describe it as simple chic.Give it a chance or at least go in and decide for yourself.

30.description: I am interested in planning a birthday party for my mom at Fleetwood. I heard about the restaurant from my Aunt and when I walked in I was in awe of the decor. It is so beautiful , sexy, mature, and elegant! The food is delicious and the service is great. This is a gem in Chicago!!! I will def be a returning customer!!

3.description: I will say that the location is great.  The hostess was rude, sat at the front desk with plastic gloves on the entire time. She asked my party of 5 to sit at a table with no glasses or place set up.  Wait, the table was dirty.  When I informed her that we'll wait until the table is setup properly my entire group detected an attitude.  The waitress was unresponsive.  The facility wasn't cleaned properly, we arrived at 10:40am and we were some of the first group there.  The highlight of my visit was Phil, he was very accommodating.  Phil was the reason my group didn't leave and go some place else.  So Matt, manager, please conduct a training on customer service to your employees, excluding Phil.

14.description: Fleetwood is a great addition to the south loop. It has great ambiance, good specialty drinks and decent food. The decor is sultry with rich purples, chandeliers, and white marble floors. The service was very friendly and the manager even came over to check on us. My one recommendation is to stay away from the fried chicken; it's got great flavor, but the way it's butchered results in you crunching on hidden slivers of bone. Not very appetizing. And ladies, be very careful walking in with your heels because that beautiful marble floor they have is very slippery when wet. Otherwise, this place is a cool spot for an after work drink.

3.description: It's unfortunate that I have yet to have a good meal at a nice restaurant as they are usually over priced and and the taste nothing special. Unfortunately form is the same. Please take the five minutes to walk to the city and get a meal. The crab cake was something I could have done at home not good at all.

1.description: I stopped by Forno for lunch around 2pm one day when in town for a large convention a few weeks ago.  As part of the Hyatt McCormick Place, it's convenient to both the conference center, where the convention I attended was held, as well as the hotel, where I stayed.  Given that there are few quick options convenient to the convention center and hotel, I figured I'd give Forno a try, since I was pressed for time and none of the other options seemed more appealing.  As a fast casual format restaurant, it seemed like a decent choice for lunch.  Even so, despite the late hour of my lunch visit, I ended up waiting in line for a good 15 min., plus another 5-10 min. to receive my food after placing and paying for my order.I ordered the salmon panzanella salad ($12 and change--forget exact amount) and a bag of salt and vinegar chips ($1.50).  These prices seemed a bit steep--I'm unsure of whether this is due to the proximity to the conference center, the hotel location, or just Chicago pricing (I'm from Pittsburgh, where prices are generally a bit less expensive).  Regardless of the reason, I'm glad this was a comped meal, since I'm cheap and don't like putting out this kind of money for a casual lunch.As for the food itself, the salad was large and the ingredients seemed fairly fresh, so no complaints there.  As someone with a smaller appetite, however, I found the size to be overkill, and could only finish 2/3 or so of the salad.  (I ended up eating the chips later as a snack.)  It would be nice if a smaller portion was offered for less $$ so that people with smaller appetites like me could avoid having to waste food and spend more than we'd like on lunch.Overall, while I wasn't displeased with my lunch, I found the value lacking.  Having said that, if you're at McCormick Place, Forno is one of the better convenient quick lunch options, and is less expensive than the sit down restaurant next door.  3.5 stars.

2.description: What a joke! $12 for a "grilled" chicken panini. Nothing grilled about this lunch meat chicken. Slim options in the convention center when you don't bring your lunch.

9.description: Small, walk up place inside the Hyatt for some great gourmet single serving pizzas and some other sandwiches and salads. The thin crust pizza has a very crispy crust and is thin and light. It was a worthy lunch stop while at McCormick Place.

10.description: Perfect place for a 20min lunch. Self service tables. Soup, salad, and the French dip sandwich recommended.

4.description: Forgettable... in Every WayForno is located between in the Hyatt McCormick Place and the actual Convention Center.  It a convenient place to grab a meal because the sit-down restaurants are usually mobbed.  Offering some salads, grilled sandwiches, and flat bread pizzas, Forno is pretty limited actually in it's offerings.  The staff are nice and helpful.I ordered the grilled chicken breast panini.  It was actually deli sliced chicken rather than a grilled breast.  The chicken was bland and the artichoke spread was non detectable.  The bread was a whole wheat focaccia that was fine.  The cheese was ok but also very mild tasting.  Overall, the sandwich did not taste like much.  You could do worse, for sure.  But, you can also do a lot better.

6.description: Had breakfast and dinner here this weekend. Very attentive staff. A friend with me had strict dietary needs and they accommodated with no fuss. Made sure to ask if we needed anything before we left and gave us bottled water and a beverage to go. For a hotel based operation, it was top notch. Especially the staff!

12.description: Brick oven pizza at it's finest.  This is a great alternative to Connie's.  I actually prefer their thin crust pizza to Connie's deep dish, especially if you have to go back to work after lunch as you tend not to feel so sluggish or drowsy afterwards.  My favorite was the chicken and prosciutto with a nice helping of sweet basil in the center.  They also have a nice assortment of panini's, salads and sandwiches which I have yet to try but my co-workers seemed to enjoy.  Plenty of indoor seating or if the weather's nice the Hyatt has some outdoor tables conveniently located just a few steps away.  This is always my favorite place to grab a bite when I'm at McCormick.

5.description: If you are working at McCormick Place, eat at Forno! We grabbed lunch for the staff each day and they did not disappoint! Food for everyone!

13.description: First, this in the Hyatt at McCormick Place. For a hotel, this is actually quite good....open in the strange hours that one sometimes finds themselves wanting to eat when working 16 hour days at a trade show or conference at McCormick....and surprisingly, they make a pretty decent Salad Nicoise for an Italian joint. Too many cherry tomatoes for my liking but, one can easily pluck those from the leafy dish and roll them down the hallway.

11.description: Service was awful and slow  and deserves 1 star (at Forno and Shor), had beg for soda refills so as not to choke on dinner. Margherita pizza was pretty good, 3 stars- not fresh tomatoes or enough basil, but fairly tasty thin crust if you're stuck at the Hyatt....better idea, order directly to your room and avoid the disappointing wait staff and rude hotel staff all together when possible.

8.description: This place is in the Hyatt.Close to McCormick's place.Very cute pizza and salad joint. Ambiance is modern with quirky salt and pepper shakers.I didn't get to try the pizza but they have half and half where you canchoose between salad, soup or panini I suggest you go with that because the portions for half and half are still pretty big.I had the chicken, pear, candied walnut and gorgonzola salad and carrot and ginger soup and cannoli. The salad was really good, portion was really big and a little too much cheese for me to finish but all in all good. My friend told me the carrot and ginger soup was amazing but it was ok. He even commented that it wasn't as good as he's tasted before so maybe they change it up sometimes. I'm not a fan of cannoli so I can't be a good judge of that but it wasn't drowned in sweetness as I'd expected it to be.It was under $10 for my half and half not including the cannoli.All in all I think this place is cute, if your at McCormick Place visiting definitely come here rather then getting over prices food at the convention center. The Yelp map makes it look as if it's really far but if you map it on google you will see Hyatt's right next to McCormick's. It's actually connected so you never have to go outside.

0.description: Forno saved me! I'm terribly afraid of conference food and there's not too much around McCormick's place... Forno is located in the hotel, but was pretty delicious! It's definitely a casual fast food option (think Panera bread).  Waiting in line was minimum since we came before lunch (11 amish. Don't be stuck waiting in line since I heard that the waiting was over 45 minutes later on in the day). I got a salad (brie...goat cheese). Very fast, large portion size (had the rest as a snack later in the day). It was a little bit of a struggle to find seats even when it was off-time... I can't imagine how difficult it would be when it's peak lunch time!

7.description: Thought id try this place due to the fact that there is very little vegetarian options ANYWHERE around here (other then salad). Fairly reasonably priced for being located in a Hyatt. I got the grilled veggie panini. Pretty much what it is. Grilled veggies in between grilled bread. Sadly lacking in flavor... very bland. Just because something is vegetarian doesn't mean it can't have taste. Try adding something like a reduced balsamic glaze to add a little zest.

58.description: RecommendThe Speziato(means spicy in Italiano)Nutella MochaProsHigh Quality Coffee in downtown area - Gives the Southloop a Coffee Culture(no need to travel to the Northside if you're in the area, Educates the south part of downtown and Chicago what coffee should   taste like)"Coffee so good dare you to try it without cream and sugar" - BrandonOutlets well situatedNew outdoor seatingCouches very comfy and they promote good posture(you'll see what I mean if you visit and bring your laptop here)Brandon and Amanda Neely(You can't help but love them. They give off that genuine, good people vibe, very positive aura)HugeGreat noise-quiet balanceState Bus #29 #62 Stop right in front of shopA good looking doctor frequents this coffee shopI bumped into Tim from Ipsento, he was dropping off coffee, Just think of it Ipsento coffee all the way in this part of town (that's my personal pro)They serve food, ahh I spent 8 hours straight hereThey promote volunteerism and non-profit organizations, ask them more about itCute coffee mugs for sale, good gift idea to a South LooperThey are a neighborhood coffee bar providing a venue of the people of the South Loop to meet (Tinder anyone)Open for Local Artists to promote their art

56.description: I like Overflow and I like Amanda and Brandon. I used to go to Overflow a lot for LSAT studying, and I used to come all the time with my friends,one of whom was studying to become an actuary and other was studying for the CPA. I really like the nonprofit aspect of Overflow, the idea that some of the profits go to the community. In law school, I remember learning about "b-corps"--corporations that are not non-profits but are not private entities either, as they are created to serve the community.  I immediately thought of overflow. When I go back to Chicago, I would love to visit Overflow and see if the area (my old neighborhood) has changed.  They also make really good coffee (they make latte art!, which i'm pretty sure is a sign that they know what they're doing). Overflow and Bridgeport Coffee Company are, in my opinion, the only two coffee shops worth going to in the south loop/chinatown/bridgeport area.

29.description: Excellent coffee!! The Nutella mocha was to die for. Worth the little trek I made over here. Location is a bit away from everything. Clientele at the shop was very considerate - leaving the room to take phone calls instead of loudly interrupting everyone's peace like you see at many coffee shops.

42.description: Big open space in this SLOOP coffee shop. So much open space that I think they should add more tables!I made a stop here twice on my trip to Chicago - first time, bought the nutella mocha (large $4.70), and I was SOLD. Great recommendation from fellow Yelpers! Pricey for a cup of coffee, yes, but this unique cuppa joe was so good, that I think it's worth those four bucks and seventy cents! Rich in nutella flavor but not so overpowering to mask the taste of coffee. Not overly sweet that it leaves you wanting some milk to wash it down.My second time, I tried the nutella latte. Some folks have pointed out that they use coconut milk for this. I couldn't taste it, to be honest, but I also found this cup of latte to be quite delicious. This one is a tad more milky and without the chocolate taste found in the mocha version.Great friendly service! They greet you with a smile. :)

23.description: When I want to enjoy a good caffinated beverage and get some letter writing done this is my go to place. The staff is plesant, they use actual mugs instead of paper cups and they put cayenne pepper in their house special mocha. I am also a fan of the espresso. Overflow also has a tiny section of fair trade items like stationary and jewelry. So if you need a small and ethical gift this is a good place to stop by.

47.description: So nice to see a business like this in the area. Cappuccino could have been a lot better, but a nice space and a good cause.

8.description: Overflow Coffee Bar is great. The place isn't overcrowded with seats, so you don't feel like you're getting pushed into a corner from the sheer amount of customers. The baristas are super friendly. They made helpful suggestions about what to order and the manner in which I might like it. Upon their suggestion, my regular hot chocolate was transformed into a hot pumpkin chocolate and my peanut butter and jelly sandwich was toasted. The addition of the pumpkin flavoring gave my drink a little kick and put me in the holiday spirit. Toasted peanut butter and jelly sandwiches are better than their untoasted counterparts; I will definitely be toasting my PB&Js from now on. It's a short commute from Columbia's campus. I definitely recommend this place.

31.description: This place is super cute and the staff is friendly. They are all organic which I love and their coffee is to die for

34.description: When starting a new job, expect trainings. When in training, expect to require copious amounts of caffeine. This is where Overflow Coffee Bar comes in. I was in the neighborhood for a week long DCFS training and was in dire need of easily accessible coffee shop that wasn't Dunkin Donuts. No hate on Dunkin though, just needed something different.My new boss says Overflow is owned by the same people who run Ipsento, can anyone confirm this? Either way, I loved their coconut milk latte with cayenne pepper. Yes, you read right. Cayenne pepper. It was exactly what I needed to warm me up from the inside without the help of my best friend whiskey. I also bought a cheese Danish, but wasn't too impressed. It was the same quality as something I could get from a box at a grocery store. Oh well. I am convinced this latte got me through the rest of my ever so cheerful day at the DCFS offices. If I'm ever back there for training, you can count on me drinking all the coconut lattes.

16.description: The place is like a coffee use for the nearby college.   The coffee was good, but the almond croissant was reheated in the MW.    That made for an uneven warmth and chewiness that was not very good.The raisin bagel was toasted properly and it was good...Not great ...though....

13.description: Overflow Coffee Bar is an excellent place to grab great direct trade coffee and relax in their warm environment. Brandon and the team are very hospitable. I highly recommend checking this place out!

11.description: The agave nectar latte and grilled cheese were excellent. We were expecting this to be a chill coffee shop but it was connected to a church and school so there was a lot of traffic coming in and out. Also, although there was a large central space, it was used well as there wasn't much seating. Would definitely go there again for the coffee but not a place to hang out.

39.description: Such an interesting concept of a Coffeeshop. You can sit here a while for conversation but hard to get much at the counter given the people working there are multitasking many roles, including running the soup kitchen in the prayer room inside. Definitely a local place to support for many reasons but not your typical Coffeeshop.

37.description: I'm a fan of this neighborhood coffee shop with a social mission (it is not a Christian-coffee shop as other reviewers have posted). I enjoy the quality of food, the signature Overflow drink and other beverages, free wifi, and their new and improved seating (love the booths!) I come here at least once a week and make this my remote office when I get kicked out of my home remote office. The staff members are incredibly friendly and remember your orders from months before. I look forward to seeing this cafe expand and grow. The cafe could certainly still use more seating (a lot of people seem to take advantage of the free wifi) and ambience (this takes money and time), but I trust this will come. The owners have great intentions, heart, and a desire to help others and make a more liveable world. I hope to support them in their future endeavors. I have not heard the owners evangelize once.  The fact church services take place in the building should not deter you from supporting this coffee shop. Oh, the South Loop Salad is fabulous.

0.description: Great lil place....love the coffee and danish.....can get crowded quickly not a lot of seating.....you should try it..

38.description: Nice Place, Surprisingly food and coffee,Latte was great, Bagel Sandwich was good, and the atmosphere is very relaxing. Music is always pleasantly diverse and fun, but never too loud. Cool spot, worth goin out the way to experience!

51.description: Today my 7 yr old and i stepped in for a quick coffee and muffin... It was great, the place wasnt crowded, the coffee was delicious and even my son said what a cute shop it was :) Will deff be back over and over for more :)

27.description: Added outdoor seating! Amanda and Brandon are very personable with their customers and care about their community through their business.

32.description: The latte was great.  Not bitter but smooth.  Great place to hang.  Locally owned and not franchised.  Minimal decorations but not stark.  Ample street parking and friendly helpful service.

54.description: The Overflow is my favorite coffee beverage in the entire city! It is a nutella latte made with coconut milk instead of regular milk. I don't even want to begin to think about the amount of calories that are in this drink but I love it dearly. Parking can be a bit rough around this area since everything is pay to park and really all I want to do is grab a latte before work without having to feed those awful meters. Nonetheless this is not Overflow's fault so they get to keep their perfect 5 stars.Another huge plus is that the baristas are so incredibly friendly! Which as we all know is a bit of a rarity. Go Overflow!

48.description: Sensational "Speziato" drink takes you to the moon! Coconut milk, hazelnut mocha with cayenne pepper ... I

44.description: Love the new twist on coffee drinks they have here!  If you like coconut milk, get the overflow drink...possibly the best coffee drink I have ever had.

24.description: I tried the Guatemalan coffee. It was not pleasurable at all to drink. Burnt coffee in a chipped mug. I would never come back here. $6 for 2 coffees, $2 to park and a 2 block walk.  Also didn't offer alternate brewing methods (French press, chemex)

7.description: Love the idea of a community coffee bar. This place is very inviting and I often find people in here quite early relaxing and enjoying their coffee or tea. The coffee is really good coffee and I find that I don't need to add a lot of extra stuff (which is great). Staff is a mixed bag, sometimes I get someone outgoing and talkative and other times I get the robot who simply takes my order and delivers the goods, nothing wrong with that, but just not common in this place so odd when it happens.I use to get my dog a treat from their dog "cookie" jar until I noticed that they were just Walmart or Sam's Club treats. Again, nothing wrong with that but if i'm supporting a small business then I want them to do so as well. Perhaps they can buy their treats from a local pet shop. That being said, this is a coffee shop so I'm not going to dwell on the dog bones :)Go grab a cup of joe and enjoy.

49.description: Utterly delightful. Great coffee, as well, great coffee drinks. Sandwiches, pastries, free WiFi (Ask for the password), electrical outlets, quiet ... everything I need when I need a break from planning to become the Dark Overlord of the Earth.

40.description: 1st time customer this morning. Really appreciated they let me bring my dog in to grab a latte to go. I appreciated that level of service. The place is spacious and plenty of seating. For the area and a Starbucks down the road, they still appear to do well. They're obviously doing things right. Will definitely be returning.

53.description: Great coffee, friendly staff, GREAT oatmeal. Will be back

30.description: I wished I had known about this place earlier. I drove right past it the first time because the awning was not what I expected a coffee bar's awning to look like. I was excited to see they brewed Ipsento beans...Ipsento is my fave!The first time I tried the Nutella mocha...good but could use a bit more flavor.My friend recommended I try the Overflow. It's a coconut latte with hazelnut syrup and chocolate...basically a coconut/hazelnut mocha. I always order soy lattes since I am lactose intolerant :( Idk how the guy made it but it still had the coconut, chocolate and hazelnut flavors and was so good!! The second time I went back to order it, the guy told me he couldn't make it for me with the coconut milk since the coconut milk and regular milk came premixed. I gave him a weird look but didn't question him. So when I did try my latte, it tasted like a regular soy latte....no chocolate or hazelnut flavor. SUCH DISAPPOINTMENT!!!!!!!
