I still went back twice more to give them a couple more chances. They still couldn't get it as good as the first time. Since there really aren't many good specialty coffee spots in the South Loop, I still go here. I'm hoping one of these days someone will make the soy Overflow correct for me!

46.description: Things I love about Overflow - the many many outlets for charging your devices, the open space, and the wide windows for natural light. And the chai tea latte - get the chai tea latte! This spot is good for studying, meeting up with people, and also a much-needed break from places like Sbux or caribou.

1.description: I love how many outlets this place has.The food choices are pretty healthy too. It's part of a community center. When I was there, some people were going to have a party in the commons room.

55.description: Speziato w extra cayenne is a must!  Everyone working here is nice and it's a great place to study

9.description: Not only does overflow have one of the best espressos I've had, they really are here to make a difference in the community and in the world. The first time I came I had their signature "overflow" drink and OMG it was heaven. Love this place, love their coffee, love love LOVE their mission!!!

26.description: This place is a lovely cafe/work space/community center. It's a great place to sit and work, a lot of large windows, and a good selection of drinks and food. It's great for people watching, but doesn't get too loud, and there seem to be a lot of after school activities (lots of kids after 3, but no one was too rowdy, mostly really adorable families). Overflow is one of the few cafes in this area that is one of my go to study places. And as a medical student, I study a lot. They're open from 7am to 8pm nearly all week, provide good coffee and food, have comfy chairs, tables near outlets, and free wifi, essentially a student's dream. Plus, everyone there is super friendly and eco friendly. I almost didn't want to write a review because I didn't want this place to "Overflow" with too many people (haha sorry for the bad joke) but it's too nice of a place to keep secret.

25.description: Great local gem!  Been frequenting this location since it opened and it's great!  The owners are wonderful and the staff is always very friendly!In the winter they've even brought my drink to my car!  HOW AWESOME IS THAT?Loading zone makes it so you don't need to find or pay for parking when you're in a rush.My favorite drink there is the iced nutella latte.  I've tried to replicate it, but it's impossible!  Great people, good values, great staff and good latte!  I'll be back!

12.description: Such an interesting concept of a Coffeeshop. You can sit here a while for conversation but hard to get much at the counter given the people working there are multitasking many roles, including running the soup kitchen in the prayer room inside. Definitely a local place to support for many reasons but not your typical Coffeeshop.

59.description: Really nice, eco friendly Coffee bar. I had the nutella mocha which was lukewarm when i sipped and sort of disappointing. Will give it another try.

21.description: Love their coffee! Both the hot & cold lattes are amazing. The staff is very nice & the atmosphere is somehow calm & lively. They also have a small assortment of gift type products ranging from jewelry to handmade notebooks.

17.description: This place is a lovely cafe/work space/community center. It's a great place to sit and work, a lot of large windows, and a good selection of drinks and food. It's great for people watching, but doesn't get too loud, and there seem to be a lot of after school activities (lots of kids after 3, but no one was too rowdy, mostly really adorable families). Overflow is one of the few cafes in this area that is one of my go to study places. And as a medical student, I study a lot. They're open from 7am to 8pm nearly all week, provide good coffee and food, have comfy chairs, tables near outlets, and free wifi, essentially a student's dream. Plus, everyone there is super friendly and eco friendly. I almost didn't want to write a review because I didn't want this place to "Overflow" with too many people (haha sorry for the bad joke) but it's too nice of a place to keep secret.

10.description: I passed through here on my way to a meeting so I can't really say much about the atmosphere.  The baristas did seem a little stoned, maybe it was the heat, who knows.  I'm surprised to hear they use Ipsento coffee because my cafe au lait was just way too bitter.  Maybe it was the preparation, maybe I already had too much coffee, or maybe I just don't like coffee when it isn't a Nutella latte.  Perhaps I need to conduct a little experiment to sort that out.  :P

5.description: I wished I had known about this place earlier. I drove right past it the first time because the awning was not what I expected a coffee bar's awning to look like. I was excited to see they brewed Ipsento beans...Ipsento is my fave!The first time I tried the Nutella mocha...good but could use a bit more flavor.My friend recommended I try the Overflow. It's a coconut latte with hazelnut syrup and chocolate...basically a coconut/hazelnut mocha. I always order soy lattes since I am lactose intolerant :( Idk how the guy made it but it still had the coconut, chocolate and hazelnut flavors and was so good!! The second time I went back to order it, the guy told me he couldn't make it for me with the coconut milk since the coconut milk and regular milk came premixed. I gave him a weird look but didn't question him. So when I did try my latte, it tasted like a regular soy latte....no chocolate or hazelnut flavor. SUCH DISAPPOINTMENT!!!!!!! I still went back twice more to give them a couple more chances. They still couldn't get it as good as the first time. Since there really aren't many good specialty coffee spots in the South Loop, I still go here. I'm hoping one of these days someone will make the soy Overflow correct for me!

3.description: Everything about this cozy spot is ideal. The people that come here aren't loud, the employees are friendly and always ready to strike up a conversation if you're up for it.I've had their lattes, teas and food. Almond croissants are my favorite as well as the south loop salad. I'd definitely recommend getting some food here and not just drinks. It's all fresh and delicious.

35.description: So I went here for the first time after Dim Sum the other day.  If this review were based purely on the quality of the coffee then it would be at least 4 stars.  I had a latte, it was great.  Tried someone else's coffee, also done well.  However to me a coffeeshop not named Dunkin Donuts and Starbucks should be a holistic experience.  The baristas were friendly, a little goofy even.  So A+ there, but the vibe of the place just didn't set well.  It felt cold and uninviting.  The chairs and tables weren't configured in any particular way.  The color scheme did nothing for the place.  It felt industrial.  Perhaps the vibe they were going for, but just wasn't my cup of tea.  See what I did there?

19.description: I came here to meet up with a friend who lives in Blue Island, and was pleasantly surprised. While the area and decor isn't the most swanky or put together, the people are friendly and the atmosphere is eclectic. I also happened to sit next to the owner who was working away on his computer and chatted with him for a short while. Definitely a friendly person and happy to chat about the business, coffee, and the things he's experienced over the years - an interesting conversation. Coffee was good, and the jalepeno bagel with cream cheese also hit the spot. Overall, a great place to sit down and get some work done if you're in the area.

28.description: My friend Erik (you might know him from my school) and I were first-time customers this afternoon. We got the Overflow and the Overflow Spizzo (flakes of friggin' cayenne pepper). It was, as Erik put it, "certifiably bomb." The cayenne pepper definitely added to the drink, not so much the flavor, but the experience. We don't know enough about the cafe to give it five stars, but it is definitely four-star material (like J. Timberlake). Great service, too!

45.description: The place is like a coffee use for the nearby college.   The coffee was good, but the almond croissant was reheated in the MW.    That made for an uneven warmth and chewiness that was not very good.The raisin bagel was toasted properly and it was good...Not great ...though....

33.description: Great casual coffee shop in south loop. The baristas are very friendly and helpful. Definitely coming back

43.description: Their Nutella Mocha is terrific! And great service too. Will definitely come back during my next trip to Chicago! Loved it.

2.description: State St. in the city of Chicago is known for the "commercial, touristy" loop shopping strip.  Nevertheless, rarely do non-Chicagoans go pass the south loop since "near south side" is mostly residential.  "Overflow Coffee Bar" isn't awfully far from the CTA Roosevelt Red/Green/Orange Line station, but this place is chill, serves good Ipsento coffee, and well-liked by the community.  Did I mention that they use Ipsento coffee?  Then you should know that Nutella Mocha is on the menu indeed.  I also took care Daddy J.'s order and asked for a large cup of Americano.  We then spent our late afternoon here. This place was chill and conversations-friendly.  The entire coffee shop was the atrium for different offices on the sides.  The Department of Media Production in Columbia College Chicago is literally feet away, so I imagine some students would be hanging out here when school resumes.  I like this community-focus coffee joint.  Free wifi, power outlets, ambiance, spaciousness, and the taste of coffee are successfully "checked-off" on my mental coffee-shop worksheet!

18.description: So I went here for the first time after Dim Sum the other day.  If this review were based purely on the quality of the coffee then it would be at least 4 stars.  I had a latte, it was great.  Tried someone else's coffee, also done well.  However to me a coffeeshop not named Dunkin Donuts and Starbucks should be a holistic experience.  The baristas were friendly, a little goofy even.  So A+ there, but the vibe of the place just didn't set well.  It felt cold and uninviting.  The chairs and tables weren't configured in any particular way.  The color scheme did nothing for the place.  It felt industrial.  Perhaps the vibe they were going for, but just wasn't my cup of tea.  See what I did there?

41.description: I absolutely LOVED the whole grain bagel & vanilla latte. My boyfriend ordered The Overflow coffee, which he loved so dearly! The prices are very affordable. Overall, I'm very happy we stopped by here- the service was amazing and the coffee was delicious! It is a great alternative to Starbucks.

52.description: Live long enough in the South Loop and you might forget that independent small businesses exist. There really isn't a "neighborhood" feel around here. When a place like this opens it takes us one step towards actually being more than just condos and chain stores.The South Loop really needs more places like Overflow. Good coffee, nice outside seating area, good pastries, and very friendly staff.Visit this place next time you're thinking about making a trip to Starbucks or Dunkin Donuts. You'll be pleasantly surprised and you'll help support independent small businesses that need it.

50.description: Every person you encounter has a smile with great personally.  I have been here about 6-7 times and they are always consistent. Food is healthy and good. Great selection of Teas. I say this is the best coffee/tea house in SLOOP!

4.description: I love spending the day working at Overflow when I am in the area. Their Nutella latte is amazing and I really like their quiche. There's good wifi and many people camp out there with their laptops. The only strange thing is the layout, but you get over that really fast once you experience the great vibe.

6.description: This place has pretty much everything needed to be  a go-to spot. They serve salads, pastries, sandwiches and other beverages. I had the Overflow which is a latte made  with coconut milk, chocolate and hazelnut. It was a very delicious drink.  I'm more of a regular coffee drinker and I was quite pleased. I like the layout. There's seating and they seem to support a lot of local and sustainable businesses which is awesome. They also had jewelry and soap for sale. If I were rating the drink and support alone, I would give 5 stars but alas something was, I don't know, amiss here. There were only a few people  when I went and they were lounging but the atmosphere did not feel very welcoming. I can't put my finger on it.  However, if you decide to stop in, do try the Overflow.

22.description: I didn't quite understand the setup: looks like this is a coffee shop in between 2 Christian colleges... Quite interesting, took me a while to figure out what's going on. Coffee was pretty good, I had latte: mild, but tasted good. I came here twice, one time I had a peanut butter / banana croissant and second time: bagel sandwich. They make sandwiches on the spot, so it's fresh and tasty. I liked that you can pick your side: banana, apple, chips. It didn't feel too cozy there, but had quite good experience, definitely one of the better coffee shops on that neighborhood.

15.description: I stumbled upon this gem while I was in the area. It's a cozy place with a chill atmosphere. There were plenty of outlets and a comfortable amount of seating. And the coffee was absolutely delicious. I think I just found my new go-to coffee shop!

57.description: Absolutely love this place! The staff is clearly invested in the place and they're so nice. It's such a friendly neighborhood place to good for some excellent coffee and food! My go to place

20.description: It might be my upbringing in Nebraska (that made me feel very comfortable in christian churches), but I love this place. Calm, quiet, lots of natural lighting, and sometimes the faint sounds of choir singing. I love their food & drinks (the Special is always amazing--coconut milk + cayenne mocha. yes), reasonably priced. Never too crowded & always good 90s music jammin'.

36.description: Whoever said Overflow sells the best croissants outside Paris was consuming some low end Parisian pastry!  That said:  super friendly staff; clean, cute interior; locally owned; tango music - what's not to like?

14.description: I'm in the area at least once a week, and I almost always stop at Overflow. I get the same thing every time because it's soooo good. I order The Overflow, which is a latte made with coconut milk, hazelnut, and chocolate. It's seriously delicious. One of the employees recommended and I try it with a dash of cayenne pepper. I did, and it's my new fave. The facade doesn't scream 'coffee shop,' so you might miss it. Friends who live in the area had never heard of it until I started raving about it. It's usually quiet, but don't be surprised if you hear music blasting from the Zumba class that goes on in the next room. One morning I enjoyed the smooth sounds of "Doo Doo Brown" while I waited for my latte. It didn't bother me because, first of all, it's a classic, also I took my order to go.

29.description: Okay.....so what had happened was i wanted to invest in a new beautician.  Havingnatural hair i was really frustrating in not getting good sew ins.  I searched yelp and decided to give this salon a try.  So satisfied!!!  The atmosphere is warm and inviting.  All stylists were welcoming and conversative and down to earth which is a plus.  The entire time i was there the ywere working with me.  I wish i would have asked "Akeelah and the Bee" to take a pic of my hair cause i couldn't  recurl my hair the way she did which means i will be returning soon!!!!!

42.description: I first visited the remy hair shop back in June. I was preparing for a vacation and needed a versatile sew in that would allow me to pull my hair up(without exposing all my details) or down. Kay was able to deliver, AND took me on a Monday. Yay. Second visit was a last minute one. I called up on a Friday asking for a Saturday afternoon appt. once again, they ladies were gracious enough to pencil me on in without a fuss. Even when they're busy, they just keep on working. I've been to stylists that have taken lunch breaks on me etc... I used the SAME HAIR that I bought from the remy hair shop back in June for my install in November. This hair has survived ocean water, plenty of washes, and a numerous amount of times of me falling asleep without a hair scarf. Also, my sew in lasted an entire 3months(don't judge me lol)I am very pleased with my sew in, the hair, and the staff at The Remy Hair Shop.  Thanks ladies

23.description: I like to think I did my due diligence before I picked a stylist to do my first ever sew-in but now I see I was sadly mistaken. Their issue was their over the phone costumes service. I was told before hand by yelp that their receptionist was somewhat...unprofessional but I figure eh, she's not the one doing my hair. I set up the hair appointment for Saturday and on Wednesday I call to make sure that my hair was there and everything was ok. The receptionist told me that I somehow cancelled my appointment threw their app (at 6am)  and that I rescheduled it with stylist Kelly. I did no such thing and that should have been my sign to cancel my appointment and look elsewhere but, once again, I said to myself eh, she's not the one doing my hair. I get to the salon and the receptionist asked me if I need a wash. Please note that a wash was included with the service I asked for over the phone so the question put me off again. The shampoo girl looked to be all of 15 and had no upper body strength so she did not do a good job with washing my hair. I all most asked her if I could wash it myself. To be fair, she did a great job on braiding so I have no complaints on that (This will be my only complement).  The stylist Kelly comes in and asked me what kind of hairstyle I wanted and I showed her 2 pictures of what I wanted. She told me that she got the idea for what I wanted but I didn't need all of the hair that I bought. I told her that she didn't have to use all of the hair, she could use 2 and half bundled if she wanted, I just wanted it to look full. She said okay and proceed to put ALL OF THE HAIR IN THERE. I take issue with stylists that will not let you see their mirror while they are working and I couldn't see that she was doing what I told her not to do. When she finally started to cut the hair was when I finally got to see it. SHE DOES NOT KNOW HOW TO CUT HAIR. The style that I wanted was shoulder length. She would not cut above bra length. And then it was a BLUNT cut. Who, besides Beyoncé, wears a blunt cut? Not me, that's who. She told me from the start that she was going to add layers. That never happened. I told her I wanted it cut shorter and she said again Its too much hair to make it any shorter. I wanted to start screaming, THAT'S WHY I TOLD YOU NOT TO USE ALL OF THE HAIR!!! Then she puts some hood rat curls in the hair which would not look good on anybody. I told her to straighten it back out and just bump the ends. At this point I was ready to leave. She then tells me that the hair would not take another curling because it was already straighten and curled twice. I said forget and I was ready to leave. Now I have to find somebody else, that actually knows what they are doing, to fix this. I wasted $405I WILL NEVER GO BACK TO THIS PLACE AGAIN, I'M NOT EVEN GOING TO WALK PAST IT.

47.description: Im lucky to have finally found Remy hair shop !! I was left in an emergency situation looking to find a place that would do a very partial weave for a reasonable price within the next 48hours. I called a couple  salons, my friends' hair stylists ,but the prices given to me were terrible. $160 dollars for just a partial weave?!? Um ..i just needed  a couple tracks, not a luxury car!!  I was referred to Remy Hair Shop by one of their models, she informed me that their partial weave was way under$100. She was able to get me an appointment the very next morning. This was very kind of the salon, I was not only a new client, but in an emergency ! Walking in the next day the owner and stylist, Kay was soo nice. I showed her my balled up (old) hair that she was able to work with and she got me outta there quick. I was amazed at how neat and tight my hair was in such a short amount of time. I enjoyed the service! I now go to Remy Hair Shop all the time. Kay and Another stylist Shay are always doing a wonderful job on my hair. I choose my hair from the various selections of hair they provide.(No longer using that cheap balled up mess I walked in there with)If im not sure what hair will work best, they give their expert opinion to help!I do not touch my hair, they do everything. I even go in for them to just wash it! This is the best environment and place to go for not only a nice partial weave but full! They charge $160 for a whole packaged deal, not just a partial like the others I've received quotes from! I recommend this place for sure!

8.description: I just received a natural sew in from Ashleigh at Remy hair shop. I will definitely recommend and return in the future. Ashleigh was very attentive and made sure that the end product was what I asked for. The salon sells hair but I brought in my own and she made sure that it blended perfectly with my natural hair.

31.description: DO NOT GO HERE FOR A NO CHIP MANI!!! Along with another reviewer I too had wished I would not have even gone into the sketch building. I purchased the Groupon deal(no chip mani/reg pedi) and given this salon is a block from where I live I thought it would be perfect! Perfect it was NOT. I arrived to my appointment on Sunday at 3pm(on time). Why did this appt take 2.5 hours?!?!? This is unheard of! I didn't get ouf of the pedi chair until 4:30pm again my appt was at 3pm and I was actually a few minutes early! While doing my pedi the manicurist cut my foot twice!!! To the point I needed a bandaid on one. 2nd it took another hour for my no chip! I've gotten this in the past it typically takes an 1 hour OR 1 1/2 MAX and that's even a long time. She gave me the service "on her" and i stated I bought a Groupon. She said I could come back and redeem. THAT WILL CERTAINLY NOT HAPPEN! 2nd NO chip means just that NO chip. However, my nails started to chip on MONDAY!! What?!??! This is insane! 2 other nails started to chip today. I had to go to another salon and get one totally redone. LADIES BEWARE DO NOT GO HERE FOR NAIL SERVICES. I contacted Groupon and received a refund. It is always a risk trying a new salon but this was definitely a nightmare.

34.description: This was my first time here. It is hard to find in a building that looks rather worn out, and they're in the back of the building rather than a street-facing space. So I ended up late. But once I got there, I had a lovely experience. The nail technician was the only one there, and stayed late for my appointment. I was pleased with the results, and will likely be back.

16.description: Tatianna did a wonderful job on my hair. She took her time and didn't rush through it, but I also liked the fact that I wasn't sitting in the salon all day long. She used a cap on my sew-in, which I prefer. I was very pleased with how it came out.

13.description: DO NOT BRING YOUR BUSINESS HERE.I was gifted a Groupon for a manicure pedicure. HORRIBLE customer service. I made an appointment 48 hours in advance. Upon my appointment time I still had to wait for 15 minutes. My appointment was for 1 pm on a Tuesday and I didn't leave until after 5 pm. The nail tech was HORRENDOUS, didn't clip my nails or even them out with the nail file. Work was subpar and I was with this tech for the ENTIRE 5 HOURS. I wasn't able to even get the no chip as the Groupon deal advertised because their nail polish is literally trash. They are all dry, used up and the nail techs work was incredibly streaky. After all of this foolishness they still expected me to pay.The absolute worst place. They wasted hours of my life on something that should have taken tops an hour. Incredibly disappointed.Prices not listed anywhere. It is a complete rip off.

11.description: Two stars for a kind staff (except one).  Everything else was disappointing.  I was on time, first thing in the morning, with braiding hair in hand because I had stopped by to confirm the details the day before.  I still waited an hour and a half to get started.  Evidently there were staff issues.  When I did get started, the stylist was very nice but also very slow with braiding.  She was trying to get it right and I appreciate that. However, she mentioned that my hair would only take about an hour (I was expecting two MAX).  It actually took FIVE AND A HALF HOURS.  I provided pictures of the size and style I wanted and we confirmed before she began that I wanted it just like the picture.  What I got were very small braids that only resemble the pictures in pattern. I did say it was ok to make them a little smaller because she mentioned that too large might stress the hair.  But what I got was completely different from what I wanted. I was already running late after being there all day and really didn't have any time to discuss it.  Maybe I would've had better luck with a sew-in but for a simple braid style, this was really bad. I really wanted to like this place because it would've been a convenient option but I just can't.

39.description: i really like my hair.  kay is a weaveologist!

37.description: I have only gotten my hair done twice but I wouldn't go anywhere else.I was new to Chicago and looking for a place downtown to get my natural hair done and ended up coming across this shop. I figured I'd would try it out with a special that they were having at the time just to see how the service would be all around. I went in I was the only one in the shop, which is always a concern for me when dealing with shops the wait and the crowd I just don't do. long story short  I loved my hair it lasted for a little over a month. it would have lasted longer if I wasn't going back to get something different for an up coming vacation. I went back the second time. this time it was a bit more crowded and there were other stylist, typical Friday night. Still no big complaints. I loved my hair once again. it didn't last a song as I hoped but I believe that was my fault... going on vacation in and out of water, I believe it dried the hair out. I called for help a couple weeks after coming home for vacation and Kay who had actually done my hair both times, was more than happy to give me tips to get it back right. I can't wait for my return!

0.description: I have had nothing but great experiences at Remy Hair Salon. My stylist Kay always has me leaving the salon looking like a star.I have been a client there for almost 1 year and the hair quality is so amazing that I have been able to reuse the hair for the past 10 months without flaw. The salon has a fun atmosphere and the staff is VERY knowledgable about hair care and want what's best for your hair.I think that people have to realize that salons, especially ones that specialize in ethnic hair care, are not going to have you in and out in 30 minutes. Too many of these reviews are bashing long wait times when it's possible you came to the salon with unrealistic expectations. Suggestion: If you're in a rush, book the earlier appointments. Also- wouldn't hurt to notify the salon in advance that you have time restraints and they'll do their best to accommodate.

38.description: I am new to Chicago and one of my first tasks was to find an affordable hair shop where I am able to purchase extensions and receive sew-in services. After a search online I found Remy hair shop, and I've been in love since. The owner, Kay, is extremely knowledgeable about the different hair textures and lengths that will work best for personal needs. Additionally, the salon has a welcoming atmosphere where it is easy to chat about current topics with the stylist and other customers. I am extremely pleased with this salon!

27.description: I should have read the reviews first before buying the Groupon.   I called to make an appt. with the nail tech. and the receptionist was GHETTO (chewing in my ear), and very unprofessional.  NO available dates for a whole month out.  Every time I called the shop they had Beyonce Drunk In Love blasting in the background. I'm all for supporting Black Businesses however treat your consumers with respect. Please I love Beyonce too, but maybe they should think about playing Smooth Jazz, it would be a better for holding music.

32.description: Pros- the stylist Kelly was amazing- she took her time doing my hair it was perfect lots of compliments. -i found a stylist she gets 6 starsCons- sometimes there's confusion with appointments but someone takes you :-)

48.description: Remy Hair Shop is a salon that takes pride in what they do. The stylists are very skilled in installing, coloring, and styling hair extensions. I'm a regular customer and I trust no one else to touch my hair when it comes to adding extensions. So if you're looking for the best Remy Hair Shop is the way to go. You will not be disappointed.

44.description: Terrible experience!!! Got a full sew in, closure came completely off in 1 week.  Made an appointment to come in. Rushed over on the super packed bus after work with grocery bags and an injured ankle. Got off bus, pouring ran. Pants soaked, took flats off to walk barefoot because shoes were so soaked, poured water out of them. Got there early,relieved to be able to just relax now, no one there. Called, left several messages - nothing. Called, texted "owner", nothing. Had to stand and wait out storm, OUTSIDE their shop, in the elements, for over an hour.Next day, still no return calls, no call to apologize, nothing. Shocked.  Owner wouldn't even speak to me. I was told that if I wanted an apology, I'd have to send her an email. She'd left the shop early the day of my appointment and didn't even bother to call me to cancel.So unless you want to pay a lot of money for your hair to only look good for a day and receive AWFUL customer service on top of that... Then by all means go to this salon. Their service is sadly why many black businesses don't survive. And as a African American woman with an MBA  who knows the statistics, it really pains me to say that.

24.description: I have always loved getting blowouts with my natural hair and wasn't really into sew ins.  However, when I found Remy Hair shop and Kay Lux that has changed.  Everywhere I go people compliment me on my hair and ask has it really been that long since they have last seen me because my hair has grown.  To me that speaks volumes because I have seen hair where you can tell it is not natural and it just doesn't blend.  I will continue to go to Remy Hair shop.

7.description: The ladies are always sweet, they get quality hair shipped right to the salo, I've never left disappointed.

49.description: Ok first and foremost the sew-in I received was nicely done. Extra tight, that laid flat. Customer service sucked like hell but I guess u can't complain because I went during a special. The owner as well as the workers had beautiful extensions. They were packed which let me know they were doing something right. I had some drama over the dye process about my extensions I brought into the shop, nevertheless I got them installed anyway by personal choice. That wasn't the best idea.I went back the next following week to get my hair issue resolved in hopes of getting it redone with their hairline in which they sell.  Sha who was my stylist was very apologetic about the service as well as my dissatisfaction about the overall outcome. She was helpful in trying to assist the issue to the best of her ability. She informed me that she wouldn't be able to do my hair until the next following week which is understandable. So I agreed to purchase the same hair in which I saw the owner as well as staff wear. It was a Italian brand weave. I was informed they only had a loose Italian wave pattern of this particular hair. So I agreed. I bought 2 bundles. I know how to sew hair in myself so I installed. I went to get my hair done professionally just to treat myself seeing I got my hair colored and cut earlier why not do it up all the way. Anyways after installing it I noticed it was wavy even after I flat ironed a section the tips where wispy looking very thin. So I decided to wash my hair, I use excellent shampoo and conditioner " Joico." I let it air dry because even before I washed it it looked wet. As if somebody slapped Vaseline in my hair. The washing didn't work. It looks jet black and slippery, not realistic as the employees hair. I know weave I've been wearing it since forever. It's always about the quality. This hair appears to be some wet and wavy bull mess. It holds no curl. It looks greasy even though I didn't add any oil to my hair when installing or after. All I can say is I wasted so much money. Maybe you will get the correct hair if you work with them. Because I refuse to believe this is a superior quality of extensions, never again.

40.description: Update: One year later and I'm still a faithful customer!I won't lie; I tried other stylists, other shops, etc. But no place could offer the services and warm environment that Remy Hair Shop provided.The owner, Kay, stole the title of being my favorite stylist in Chicago. Her solid knowledge of hair extensions combined with her growing creativity give RHS a unique advantage in Chicago's massive hair market. She's very attentive to my requests and gives good alternatives to potentially hair damaging styles.As mentioned previously, the shop as a whole is still on an upward growth path. In the past year, I watched massive reconstruction projects and met four new stylists (all of which are great, btw. I just never remember names, :-/). Downside? 'Rome wasn't built in a day' lol. But watching a Black business take the strides RHS has in one year? I won't let slow progress discourage my patronage :).

30.description: I will never go back there! I bought the groupon deal 2 no-chip mani/reg. pedi.... so I  went there twice. Sure the building and the salon isn't fancy at all, but I don't care. Every single appointment was just a bad experience. I arrived on time to my appointment and I had to wait for 90 minutes. It took her 2,5 hours to get my nails done! She made my nails so weak that the first nail broke the day after. Every day another nail broke and I wanted them to fix it. Wasn't possible to get an appointment soon. I had to wait a week! I have wasted my time, money and parking fee.I could write more.... but I think it's enough.The good thing was.... the nail technician Kelly, she is a very friendly and nice person.

46.description: One word, Shantell!!! I guess it's one name, but whatevs. Let me state that I am giving her 5*, but the salon as a whole 4. So here's how things went...I was in a state of disarray. I got my fist ever sew-in today done by another lady. The sew-in job itself was amazing, but the lady doesn't do styling and her business partner that does styling wasn't in the shop today. I left this afternoon feeling a little unsure that this sew-in was a good idea. I felt deflated. I had looked up places on Yelp last night that offered affordable cuts and style in preparation for having to get my hair done since I knew in advance that my hair wouldn't be cut/styled at the first place. That's when I saw this place. Their website says that on Sundays they are by appt. only. Sad, I thought for sure I wouldn't be able to get in.... Well, I called post sew-in, they said, "Come on in." SUPER!That's when I met Shantell... Nice, sweet, YOUNG lady. I had no idea what to expect, but there was no way I could leave looking worse than how I looked walking in. I had nothing to lose, and the price was right. Shantell did my hair whilst we chatted and she gave me some pointers on hair care and products. She started by first straightening my hair. I was already impressed. Then she cut. THEN, she made magic happen. She curled my hair in to lovely ringlets using her flat-iron. I loved it. She even showed me how she does the maneuver so I can try to copy it at home. Fast-forward til the end.. I am so happy I got the sew-in once Shantell brought out it's greatest potential. So, in conclusion, the shops' alright. They're remodeling, but it's got potential. I like that it's intimate and it could have that 'beauty shop' feel where women go to get beautified while sharing gossip. ;) And Shantell (have I posted her name enough) was my saviour today. My family and friends love the style, so do I. Will be back to see her again!

1.description: I purposely made a yelp account so I can tell people about my experience at the Remy Hair Shop. I have had many meh experiences with the Remy hair Shop. There's been a few confusions, but its always been settled. The customer service has never been why I come back, but I still went. The final product is why I used to like it so much. I have been three times before this incident occurred. I went to the shop, loved my hair, and went on my merry way like any other time.Three days after my appointment, I had noticed that my all white over-the-ear headphones were turning a blackish-blue color on the ear cushions. I assumed I was being careless and not taking care of them well enough and shrugged it off. Not thinking that the hair that was provided by the Remy Hair Shop could be what was destroying my $200 headphones. Two days later, I noticed a black rings on my white scarf. I knew it had to have been my hair. I called the shop and the receptionist believed that since it had been almost a week, it wasn't their problem. Even though they provided the hair and I spent $250 on my appointment. I told her that the dye had leaked onto my belongings and that still had not caused a different reaction. They did not offer to correct the problem only "I mean, you can try washing it." was all she kept interjecting. Frustrated I asked to speak to a manager and come to find out she was the manager. I told her that it was their responsibility to correct the problem. They sold me a defective product, and they should try to rectify the problem.  At least wash the hair for me to give me some kind of peace of mind. Alas, this did not happen. I wasn't even asking for compensation for my damaged belongings, but for them to wash the defective hair. Moral of the story, DON'T GO HERE. The receptionist doesn't care. The people that work their are more focused on what music is playing than doing your hair. It says in the From the business section: "We have the best hair on the planet"? Why they lying?

9.description: I just left Remy Hair Shop and I LOVE my hair. V was my stylist and she did an amazing job.  I got a sew in with minimal leave out. V asked me what I wanted and then made suggestions to let me know what would work. She told me everything she was doing to my hair and told me how to care for it when I got home. The atmosphere of the shop is laid back but professional.  Everyone laughs and jokes but are attentive to their customers at the same time.  The only con was the amount of time it took (but it is the beginning of the new year and I booked two days in advance). I would definitely go back again.

26.description: Ok so I saw this salon online and decided to call and set up an appointment,  the people sound really nice and professional on the phone but when I got there it was a hot mess , salon was dirty with three very loud ghetto hair stylist they were rude ghetto loud and did not deliver as promised they had friends in the salon playing music eating french fries I mean just Flat Out ghetto!  They quoted me a certain price over the phone but changed it when I got there I traveled all the way from vernon hills so I stayed and endure d the torture a crazy TRANSEXUAL did my hair It was Rude rough on my head  while eating greasy french fries 7n between also talking on the phone at the same time it was a nightmare im not sure how the owner got this shop maybe with drug money but all u know is THEY ARE FRAUD AND I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS MONEY PIT TO ANYONE RUN THE OTHER WAY PLEASE THIS HAIR SALON IS FRAUD

25.description: So I have to give credit where credit is due..And I'm not one to write reviews on a bunch of stuff. But some of the bad reviews for this place were rubbing me the wrong way so I had to say something.. I found this salon randomly off of yelp and I was nervous to try them out because of some mixed reviews but I'm so glad I did! (due in part to me really REALLY needing my hair done..) I felt welcome there and not at all like it was a unprofessional atmosphere, which I work in a very professional atmosphere so I know when things are "rough around the edges.." That was not the case here. Just a cute little shop in the city. Nice building and area alittle outside of downtown.. Fun beauty shop feel, which was refreshing to me. I even watched a movie as I had my hair done! All in all I will be back because most importantly, 3 days in and my hair still looks amazing. And the price point is GREAT for the area and the work done. Shoutout to the ladies at Remy! My husband could only say "WOW" when I got home!

12.description: Kay and Ty were fantastic! I came in with tangled hair from my previous sew in and they definitely took care of me. I travel so much on tour it's hard to find good quality hair salons for black women on the go. They were quick, professional and personable. Next time I'm in Chicago and I need my hair redone or touched up I know exactly where to go!!!

21.description: MEDIOCRE!  &  notice that no one gets hair Dyed there! that's Being nice, Extremely Unprofessional, Unbelievable to Go to pick up Extensions w/ roots Dyed & leave w/leopard Spots! and NO REFUND!

17.description: Just don't. Unprofessional. The building is sketchy from the beginning and I should have stopped there, called Groupon, and asked for a refund before even entering. But decided that sometimes beautiful things come in ugly packages so what the hell. Walked in and was greeted by one of the most unfriendly front desk people I've perhaps ever encountered. Waited for 45 minutes for my nail stylist. Asked for a status update and all I got was when the last person went in...as if that helps. Meanwhile, I'm not offered a magazine, drink, no apology. Kids are running around screaming. When the front desk girl left for 5 minutes I just scooted out.Ladies, if your deal is hair, stick with that. I don't doubt you can sew a weave in with the best of them, but you might as well just save yourself and customers the time and energy and do it out of your living room, because that was basically what you're doing now.

10.description: I went to Remy Hair Salon Yesterday for the 1st time. I got the sew-in special which included hair. Great deal! My hair was done by Kay. After being braided I sat in her chair and my sew-in was complete in about 40 minutes, fastest sew-in I've ever gotten. Although fast, it was still neat, full and secure. She kept checking in with me making sure I was comfortable and that my hair wasn't too tight. Overall great experience and I'm very satisfied with the work.

5.description: I love getting my extensions done at Remy Hair shop. I've been going there for almost a year now. Kay did my hair for my wedding which I loved and she recommended the best hair for my texture and for the style I was looking for. She actually came to my hotel room to style my hair the day of my wedding. I've been wearing the style hair for 9 months now and it looks so natural. Highly recommend.

3.description: Kay is awesome! She is prompt, professional and has a great personality! I love the South Loop location! As a busy law student who also works for a large firm, it's imperative that I'm not in the shop all day and I'm never waiting long at this shop! Oh and my hair is laid!

35.description: Just don't. Unprofessional. The building is sketchy from the beginning and I should have stopped there, called Groupon, and asked for a refund before even entering. But decided that sometimes beautiful things come in ugly packages so what the hell. Walked in and was greeted by one of the most unfriendly front desk people I've perhaps ever encountered. Waited for 45 minutes for my nail stylist. Asked for a status update and all I got was when the last person went in...as if that helps. Meanwhile, I'm not offered a magazine, drink, no apology. Kids are running around screaming. When the front desk girl left for 5 minutes I just scooted out.Ladies, if your deal is hair, stick with that. I don't doubt you can sew a weave in with the best of them, but you might as well just save yourself and customers the time and energy and do it out of your living room, because that was basically what you're doing now.

19.description: I've had my hair done at Remy Hair Salon since it opened.  I've enjoyed every experience. The service is prompt unlike so many AA owned salons they don't specialize in shampooing your hair to keep you from leaving. My full take down of old weave and install of new weave with shampoo and deep conditioner and braid was three hours...Very good at what they specialize in and that's  hair extensions! They have a variety of hair in many lengths and textures. Giver them a try you won't be disapp

28.description: Tatianna did a wonderful job on my hair. She took her time and didn't rush through it, but I also liked the fact that I wasn't sitting in the salon all day long. She used a cap on my sew-in, which I prefer. I was very pleased with how it came out.

45.description: Unfortunately I was not as happy as the others.... I had the worst experience ever. I arrived at my appointment on time, only sit and wait for my stylist Shay for 2 hours, she was very late.  So once she got there she began rushing around, which meant my hair style would take fault of this. She was in such a hurry to get to the next client, that she put my weave in wrong. Upon letting her know about this she promised she would fix my hair...well this is when the bigger problem occurred, I made several appointments, and each time she never showed up. So I brought this to the attention of the manager and the manager basically covered for her and told me she was coming in when she knew dam well that Shay was not coming in. In fact shay took off running like a thief and moved to LA...how crazzy is that...I will never ever go back to this salon, very unprofessional!!! No class at all.

33.description: So, it looks like Remy Hair Shop deleted my INITIAL review. Not surprising. As I've previously stated, I booked with Kay and was dismissed and sent to a completely different stylist(Kelly styles) with no warning, consultation, NOTHING. This was after previous correspondence with Kay prior to my appointment. Even after inquiring about and making sure Kay was doing my install, Kay never touched my hair aside from applying the closure. This was my first and last time patronizing this establishment. Not once did Kay or anyone reach out to address my concerns that I expressed to Kelly styles (who also expressed she felt blind sided by having to unexpectedly take on Kays new clients).The audacity of Kay/ supposed owner of Remy hair shop to delete an Honest review, speaks to their lack of professionalism, and makes it seem as if they're trying to cover up their bs "customer service."

43.description: I went in this past Thursday to get a sew in special. I was told several times that one girl would start on my hair and the other would finish. The one that was supposed to do my hair never got to me. She finished 2 women and was working on a third instead of doing my hair. The girl that did my hair asked me twice how I wanted it. I told her that I wanted it layered and feathered. She said okay. After 3 hours she finished and did not give me a single thing that I asked for. What she did was give me big barrel curls that I did not want. If my hair had been done the way that I asked and not the way the stylist wanted, I would have been satisfied. I am displeased and will probably never patronize their establishment again, nor recommend anyone. This ended up being a waste of my time and money.

2.description: This spot got 1 star because Yelp made me rate it. I waited a month before writing this review because I wanted to make sure that all irritation had left me to avoid writing an unpleasant review.  I scheduled an appointment with KayLux using StyleSeat.  When scheduling an appt on the site I was required to leave a credit/debit card to secure the appt. I received a confirmation email confirming the time of 1:15p for 12/20/15 the address of 1325 S. Wabash Ave and the stylist phone number as well as her email address. The confirmation also went into detail about the cancellation policy of being charged  50% of the services price for no shows&added that there was a 15-20 min grace period.  I arrived early at 1:05pm upon arriving the address was not visible and the Blue Awning of 1325 was for a business called Asian Outpost. I finally just stood in front of 1325 (Asian Outpost) hoping to see something resembling a beauty salon..nothing. After about 10 minutes I returned to my car and called the stylist at the phone number I received on my confirmation email -it appeared to be a Google phone number and was routing me to voicemail. I left 2 messages-I then emailed her twice stating I was at 1325 S. Wabash Ave but, am unable to find the entrance. I received no call back, no reply to my email and then I text her and of course no reply. It is 1:30p at this point and Im now nervous about being charged for services. I get back out of my car and see a small unmarked building tucked in the corner underneath the same blue Awning as the business Asian Outpost. I go in at 140p (10 min after my grace had expired)and was met by an extremely unprofessional and unhelpful receptionist stating that Kay had left for the day. I told the young lady that Ive been calling,emailing and texting the stylists for the past 25 min with no response. The receptionist asked what number was I calling-I recited the number to her and she said''Kay has a 312 number -I dont know what that number is that you've been calling'' I stood there initially in a state of disbelief and replied ''but, there is a 15-20 min grace period of which expired 10 min ago and you're saying the stylist is gone?''The receptionist replied ''yep'' and then walked away from the front desk. I finally received a reply back from the stylist on Monday stating she apologizes for the confusion -the shop called her and told her what happened and she can reschedule me if I'd like. Do I need to add that I received a text and email alert stating that a withdrawal of $324.00 was attempted for services?!  I emailed Kay informing her that an attempt was made to w/draw funds to which she replied ''that's your problem''. Lesson learned and I'm still unsure if this was some sort of scam or just plain unprofessional and reckless.

18.description: I have always loved getting blowouts with my natural hair and wasn't really into sew ins.  However, when I found Remy Hair shop and Kay Lux that has changed.  Everywhere I go people compliment me on my hair and ask has it really been that long since they have last seen me because my hair has grown.  To me that speaks volumes because I have seen hair where you can tell it is not natural and it just doesn't blend.  I will continue to go to Remy Hair shop.

41.description: these ladies not only have a talent  for ALL textures of hair,they also have HEART.they took me last minute with a tight budget and made me beautiful.they sympathized and really cared bout the wreck on my head. I enjoyed hanging out in the shop they made everyone so comfortable and feel welcomed. I laughed a lot and was in no hurry to leave !! they listened to all my requests and answered all my questions regardless of how dumb (!!) these ladies love hair.bottomline..and they give a damn bout YOU not just your wallet. I can't express how satisfied I am and genuinely HAPPY that I've now FINALLY found a shop to call "my regular"...I will be back again and again.their heart got them a loyal client for as long as their doors are open for business!!!!

4.description: Great place to get your hair done.Kay knows what she's doing. I always like my hair. I've been going here for over a year I think.It's hard to find a good stylist especially at an affordable price. She is conveniently located in a great location.I found her on Yelp and I'm glad I did.

6.description: Absolutely loved my experience and will be booking regular appointments for shampoo and blowouts. It is a very relaxed and fun environment, so many salons are stuffy but my stylist Kay is very welcoming and is VERY GOOD at what she does!  I highly recommend.

22.description: I enjoyed my experience at this shop. The ladies were personable. For the services that I received (washed, blown dry, hair moisturized, hair braided down, lace front installed, cut, AND styled) was worth the money. I will be back to have them do another installation or a protective style to help with my ever changing natural hair. Thank you Akila!

15.description: NEVER AGAIN , well I never had customer service like this before poor poor poor. I called myself trying to get a better grade of hair and color . I was tricked the manager and stylist were so nice over the phone seemed as this they knew what they were doing. I asked for my hair to be dyed honey blond with a lighter blond tips. Before I get deeper into this shit the blond turned out the way I wanted it (but the roots was fucked) they told me my hair would be ready by 4pm  got there @ 4:30 did not leave until 5:35 she just stated when I got there ( making me late for my appointment. And get this she still was not done , she then gave me the hair half dry and said she did not get a chance to deep condition the hair(GHETTO) I had to go so in my mind I said fuck it . They then should have took a few bucks off . So I went to get my hair done and my stylist, openly the hair up and baby I tell you. Instead of 1b roots and I got a freaking leopard print. I called back not trying to get my money but a simple do over and they wanted to dye the hair again . Just kept forcing me to just let them redo the same hair (poor hair ). I got nowhere. I asked to speak to a manger and she was the manger , the ask to speak to the owner they hung up. Great thank god I was pushed for time we improvise my stylist made it work. NEVER AGAIN that was the worst customer service I have ever received. The lack of professionalism the lack of consideration the lack of a stylist (Kay) was her name I believe go back to the books boo.

20.description: My stylist was over 40 minutes late, then added #2 sad looking weave to my 1b hair leaving me two toned. Sad

36.description: Please do not go here. Save yourself a lot of money!! I had my hair done about 2 weeks ago and I am not sure if my weave will last a month. I asked for a closure only to find out on the day of my appointment that it was not ordered for me. I had my hair done by a lady who was so rude during the process. This rudeness was unprovoked and I barely spoke to her because she was not very friendly. I then left the place with a cone head, I kid you not. I had to go back to get it fixed by another lady, but subsequently some of my front tracks have come undone. They also use a cap, which I am not a fan off! I am very disappointed because I spent $245 for the sew in and hair. The hair is OK quality so far but the weave is terrible. Again, I reiterate do not go here!!!

14.description: It's always a good time at Remy Hair Shop!  Kay offers and laid back environment where you are just one of the girls friends hanging out at the salon!  Unlike other salons, Remy is prompt for my appointments and I don't find myself waiting for hours for my serviceI have been getting my hair extensions done there for about a year now, and I get quality hair that I can re-wear after a good wash and deep condition.  I get my hair redone about every two months because I am a business professional and like to keep it fresh.  I can easily wash my hair at home with the hair in, or every once in a while I treat myself when there is a wash and style sale.If you are an easy-going, fun woman who is looking for quality hair care in styling for a reasonable price, this is the place for you.

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: African-American Hair, Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Perms, Extensions, Straight Perms, Coloring, Kids' Hair

58.description: Lovely! My pedicure was relaxing and turned out beautifully. A young guy took care of me and he was very detailed and took his time. Enjoyable ambiance and friendly/helpful staff."

56.description: I came to this shop on my birthday with my girls to get our nails done. There were 6 of us which I thought is gonna be big mess but surprisingly everything were just PERFECT!!! When we got here they were all ready to take us, every technicians came to us and got our coats, greeting nicely, and my girls brought some wine and snacks. They put our little birthday table together (even though they didn't have any tables they put all the chairs together) and the service got started. The services were just AWESOME! they did everything perfectly NICE and CLEAN. My friends had no problem no disappointment  nothing just appreciation. I would definitely go back to here since its really close to where I live.

29.description: I've  gone here 3 times now and was happy every time.  I've tried the no chip, the regular manicure and the vinyl polish which promises to last a week and it did. They were all very good.They also include a mini back massage before they paint your nails. They offer a Mani/pedi special Mon-Wed...

42.description: Best $15 manicure in the Chicagoland. Skilled technicians and tranquil setting.  I've been to South Loop, Oak Park and Long Grove and you can always count on Spa O for a great shape, relaxing massage, and perfect polish.

23.description: Update: After seeing my Yelp review, the manager at Spa O called to apologize for the poor customer service I received at my previous two visits. She even offered a complimentary manicure! I sincerely appreciate her reaching out to me as it serves as a reminder that the owners do care about their customers. Hopefully my experiences were anomalies. (But I'm not taking my chance - not even for a free manicure!)

47.description: Went here with a girlfriend yesterday and was really impressed.  great color selection, shoulder massage with manicure, clean, and a friendly staff all for $15!  It did take a bit longer than expected but maybe that's part of the pampering!

8.description: I went to Spa O for a mani/pedi and they are already chipping without any activities that would wear my nails down. I will not go to Spa O again.

31.description: Came here with friends for manis on a Saturday. They were fairly busy but able to seat us within 5 minutes. The price was very reasonable ($15 for a mani) and they did a really good job. The owner was particularly nice and made sure we had a great experience. Will definitely be coming back!

34.description: Spa O is the best! I have been going here for years. Lisa and Ganny are my favorite.  The salon is very clean, very professional,  abd attention is always paid to d err tail. A mani costs $15, a no chip mani is a little pricey at $45 but still worth it.

16.description: This place is clean I will give them that much. The only thing that really annoyed me was the service. I went in for a No-Chip manicure. I walked in without an appointment as It was a last minute decision. Came in and there was one person getting a mani and one getting a pedi. I asked if they could take me or if I should come back since I live a few blocks away. The receptionist looked at me like I had asked her to give me a kidney. As she looked annoyingly if there were any spots left. She said okay we can fit you in. My fault for not making an appointment. As for the manicure.He didn't file before applying the acetone which I thought was odd. When he went to remove the polish he looked at me and said "wait this is OPI, why didnt you tell me" ummm im sorry I didn't realize I had to. I hate places that do not soak your hands before cutting the cuticle. Basically you are getting your cuticles cut with just some soap and all this acetone on your hands. The next thing he says is "who did your nails before. The cuticles are cut poorly and the shape is not good" Oh sorry about that yet again. I will make sure to tell the last tech what a horrible job they did buddy. The last straw for me was as my nails were drying I lifted my hand to cover my mouth while sneezing and he scolds me for moving saying If I mess it up he has to do it all over again so do not move. Whoa. Sorry but not coming back to feel like I did something wrong the entire time. BTW its day 7 and my no-chip is already starting to "chip"

13.description: I really enjoy a good pedicure, and I figured I would try this place one Saturday morning while in the city since it had mostly positive Yelp reviews. As soon as I walked in I was immediately welcomed and checked in by the host. I picked out my color and sat down. I came a little before 1030 am on a Saturday morning without an appointment. Around 11, the place seemed to fill up more, so it might be wise to book an appointment on a Saturday afternoon at least. The pedicure received here was okay. I got the impression that my nail technician was a beginner due to the lack of time she spent scrubbing my feet, and messing up one of toes (she re did it thankfully). She also didn't apply lotion, which was unusual to me. When my feet were drying, the host asked how my pedicure went? I told her it went fine, but I needed some lotion. She gave me some, and I applied it to my dry feet. I am totally ok with paying $35 (normal price) for a pedicure, but this pedicure was missing some essential elements of an amazing pedicure. If I came in the future, I would probably just try with a different nail tech.

11.description: They i rush and do bad pedicure some of the lady's can't polish or understand you the men are ruff cutting cuticle make them bleed. UnProfessional. The only one can do nail is the pregnant lady and she gone

39.description: I went to get a mani/pedi here this week. I did not have an appointment and walked in on a Monday evening after work. They were able to accommodate me easily as there was hardly any crowd. The place is very clean and quite spacious. The service is a little off putting. The receptionist hardly cracks a smile and when I told her I didn't have an appointment she gave me an evil eye, even if the place was practically empty. The technician who worked with me was very quiet and not talkative at all. She did not even ask me if I liked the mani/pedi after we were done. But she was efficient and good. I liked the manicure better than the pedicure she gave me. It is a bit pricier than regular so will not visit too often, but good to know that there is a good option close to where I live. Its been 4 days since the mani and its  still going strong.

37.description: I went here to get a mani/pedi. The overall experience was not very satisfying. They put some type of scrub on my legs, it hurt really bad. Also, my french manicure lasted about 3 days before it started to chip. I do not know if it is because of the nail polish they used or what. I had a solid color (OPI) on my feet and they last 3 weeks now with no problem, but my french mani on my hand was with Essie and it didn't last very long. I saw other customers got a shoulder and back massage, but I didn't get one. :(

0.description: This is a very nice and clean place for customers to relax and get pampered, and the service is excellent, too!The receptionist was very welcoming. She immediately arranged our services as soon as my friend and I walked in. Our nail ladies were very professional. One of my pet peeves for nail salons is that they sometimes use cheap products on customers. Even though with the nail polish you can't see the damage, it always shows after you remove the coloring. But here at Spa O I don't have to worry about their products. Last time I was there, I recognized most of the products they used on me, and the standard mani-pedi included a vitamin E capsule. My nail lady cut it open and the oil inside flew right onto my hands, then she gave me a short hand massage. That felt really good! I wish she could keep massaging my arms and hands.The only reason why I didn't give it a five star is because of the noise. It's understandable that they're very popular and it's hard to keep the salon quiet with all the customers coming in and out. Also, they have a sign on the wall that customers should tip their nail ladies in cash. I don't usually carry a lot of cash on me, so every time I come here I have to make a trip to an ATM first. But if you don't mind all these and looking for a good place with a reasonable price to get pampered, give this business a try!

38.description: My first time here and I will definitely be back! Genny did an awesome job with my no chip French! And I can walk there!!!

51.description: Love being pampered here.   I went here with super short nails three weeks before my wedding and said, "help!" and they fixed me up so my hands looked great on the big day.  I'm not usually a pamper-myself person, but their no-chips did stand up to every-five-minute-hospital-hand-gel treatments for two weeks (no chip was their solution to allow my nails to grow out).  Anyway, a great place to keep in mind for future, and to put on my Christmas list for the new hubby!

27.description: The "O" must be stand for OH NO DON'T GO!!!  I had the most disinterested nail tech probably in the world.  Like if there were awards for the most disinterested nail tech in the world, she'd win it.  I got a pedicure and every single time she used the cuticle remover it hurt. She said one word to me which was hi.  She did a terrible job.  Which is what the one star is for.  IF you're gonna be rude by not engaging the client AT ALL, at least do such a great job that the client is forced to give a rating of 5 stars.  NOPE!  Needless to say, I won't be returning.

32.description: I don't know much about Nail Shop. But I do notice when I see quality service for a value price since I have been in sales for a long time.I and my gf dropped in without an appointment while we were visiting friends in South Loop. My gf was really pleased with the nail job and friendly service. And I can say with confidence she is picky:)My gf asked the owner if they have any branch or near plan to open a branch in West Suburb. Too bad they didn't, but it showed me she really liked the Spa O.Two thumbs up!

54.description: This is a great place to get your nails done.  They staff is friendly and I love that they take (and honor, ON TIME) appointments.  They give you a massage with your manicure which I love.  Prompt, clean, friendly; this is my go-to place to get manicures and pedicures!

48.description: Always fast and friendly. I feel relaxed and pampered every time I go for a pedicure. The staff is great!

44.description: OVERPRICED.for that location -next to Subway; NO parking; on the corner of Roosevelt & Michigan next to a crappy bus stop. The kind of location that doesn't say "EXPENSIVE SPA".I got a pedi for $35. French is $5 extra.------------------FOR REAL? $40 + tip for a pedi, it better be on amazing; a Day Spa with a great massage & top quality paint job.NOPE!She didn't seem to know how to cut my cuticles. She didn't paint the top of the toenails, over the tip. Now I have toes that look like they got a pedi three weeks ago, instead of 3 days.The foot scrub, which comes with the pedi was nothing compared to other places. It lasted 30 seconds and she put zero effort into it.LAME. If i had crusty toes or something, I could understand, but I'm young with well kept feet. For $40 those elbows should be moving!------------------I don't recommend this place.  I'm not sure if girls have to be licensed, but I don't think these girls are.

24.description: Live close to this place. Always drive by and think "I should go there one time." Glad I finely made my way inside. The look and feel of the nail salon is high class - clean, tasteful, modern and yet, serene. Had a pedicure by Luna. She is an incredible technician. Very meticulous - didn't rush through the service like most technicians do at other salons. A little more expensive than what I would typically pay for nail service but after my experience, I would say it was worth the money. Relax and enjoy at Spa O.

7.description: Very very pricey! This place was packed & they stayed busy long after their closing hour. I got a pedicure & it was done very well. I would say I would visit this place again, but again it is a little too pricey for my budget. Based on the service I received, I would recommend Spa O if you really want to pamper yourself for a day.

49.description: I just got back from Spa O and had a fantastic experience.  First off I changed my appointment from 12:00 pm to 1:00 pm and the lady I spoke to on the phone was very nice and accommodating.  I did get there early 15 minutes early as I always do with appointments and they were able to take me right away.  The salon was small but clean and very organized.  The girl who did my mani & pedi was very attentive and made sure I was comfortable the entire time.  She also did a great job on my nails.  The service was fantastic, quick and very reasonable.  I will defiantly be back as this is now my go to salon!

40.description: Sap O has become my go-to nail spa now that I live in University Village/South Loop. I usually just come in for a no-chip mani but this past weekend I went in for a no-chip mani plus pedicure. I  didn't have an appointment but I went pretty early in the morning on a Sunday when they opened (would def recommend making an appointment though as they do get pretty busy) They were very accommodating and had two technicians assisting me at the same time which was fine by me (idk other people might not be into that) it wasn't uncomfortable in the least bit and I'd rather everything get done efficiently rather than waiting around.While it is on the pricier side, I really think the service they provide is worth it. Not to mention how clean it is here. Many nail salons that I have visited you can tell that they use the same pumice scrubber on your feet (gross), but at Spa O they use new scrubbers and are very sanitary. Also they are very attentive unlike other places I've been where the technicians are distracted or are engaging in conversations with other co-workers. I come here to relax and not to have someone talking my ear off or someone else's for that matter.Ooh another plus is that they offer a great back massage and use a wonderful scrub during the pedicures. They are also great about helping you put your shoes/boots on during the winter so that your pedi doesn't get damaged. So if you're in the S loop/University village neighborhood I would definitely recommend getting your nails done here. They do accept credit card, but be sure to bring cash for tip.

53.description: now my preferred nail salon. as a south looper, there are a few options. but, this is within walking distance and it has a great $40 mani/pedi special Monday-Wednesday before 2. had a GREAT massage at the pedi bowl. really like the lemon nail soak during the mani. all of the technicians are friendly. nice color selection. most importantly, manicures last at least a week. only cons are that it's a little tight in there and you can't include your gratuity with your credit card payment, so bring cash.

30.description: Spa O was a great experience for me! I've gone three times so far and have done a no chip manicure, regular manicure, and have done a pedicure. I love the massage chairs they use when you're getting your pedicure. I literally passed out because it was so relaxing.The no chip really did last over 2 weeks for me and only started peeling off when my nails had grown out.The lady at the front desk is so nice and tries to make you feel welcome.I will definitely be back!!

46.description: I came here on Monday evening at 7 (they close at 8) and was told that there wasn't enough time to do a mani pedi, which is ridiculous. I couldn't believe they turned me away with an hour to perform services that at comparable salons take 45 minutes. Then I remembered the last time I was there (awhile ago) where it took the technician almost an hour to do my manicure alone! It lasted for about 4-5 days before chipping started. They're not at all efficient nor very friendly here- I'd recommend going elsewhere.

1.description: Updated to five stars!  I called Spa O to schedule a polish change, as my white nail polish had chipped a bit.  I was more than willing to pay for it, but they took care of it free of charge.  Billy was extremely detail-oriented in painting my nails, and he even performed some of the services that typically come with a full manicure.  And they look wonderful--check out the new photo I added!  They also apologized profusely for their small mistakes on my last manicure (they had seen my Yelp review).

55.description: I didn't want to travel too far for a much needed/long overdue mani & pedi.  Mind you, my tootsies haven't been pampered in about 2 mths.  I walked in, no appt. (Sat) so I waited about 15-20 mins which was fine w/o having an appt.  I was done with both in literally less than an hour WTF.  My usual gal in the Gold Coast costs $30 more and my mani/pedi combo takes 1hr (pedi) 45mins (mani) and YES!!! you can definitely feel, see, totally notice the difference.  While in the pedi chair I noticed my tech turn and look at the other male there (mgr?) and the "mgr shook his head "NO".  Were they referring to the cuticles on my feet? bcuz the tech barely snipped a thing.  After 2 mths of no pedis, trust me my feet needed more than just a scrub and massage.  I was pissed!Then off to get my manicure which  was also much to be desired.  After the polish dried you could see where spots were missed (which were many) and every nail showed the mishaps.  I cannot stand when my top coat is not applied evenly.  It is inexcusable and tells me that the tech doesn't really care or pay attention.No one should ever be done with a mani/pedi combo in less than an hour and my services were not anywhere near worth the $45 I spent.  It pained me to even tip but I didn't want to be "that girl"  The fact that I will never return nor recommend them is unfortunate enough.  I will continue to shlepp to the Gold Coast to get the level of service that I pay for!!!

9.description: Really enjoyed myself! Very clean and relaxing. The girls were really nice and listened to my requests and always made sure I was happy. Will most def come back. They made my nails very pretty. It so close to home and and easy to walk to.Have many great colors and may try their paraffin treatment in the cold winter for my hands. I didn't notice they had it until I was leaving. Also if u go in on Monday to Wednesday, 11-2pm, the mani-pedi is $40. Would most def return and recommend it. Also if u use yelp coupon they honor it.

26.description: I went to get manicure today and was very pleased with my nails and the hospitality while I was there.  I will be back!

25.description: Got a mani/pedi/15 chair massage for $60.Let me say mani/pedi was average to good. I liked that they were fast. Lots of color selection. Great massage chairs.The 15 min chair massage was GREAT! The girl had awesome pressure throughout and really worked on my knots.Parking around here is a bit of a disaster...sometimes you can get lucky with a street spot.

12.description: Pros-No wait time, huge selection of color including no-chip, very warm and inviting as far as the decor, and clean. Depending on what time you go, it can get crowded relatively quickly due to the limited space.Cons-little overpriced for services, very little space; I was with my boyfriend and both of us received a mani pedi and both taken at the same time which was good but the entire service lasted 35 minutes. There were no beverages (especially for it being downtown). My manicurist was very rough with my nails, I wasn't able to soak my feet for no time, the entire time I felt rushed and the job in my opinion was 1/2 done. oh, must I say that my manicurist nails was dirty as well. COMPLETE TURN OFF. I did not want her to touch my hands. I go for mani/pedi's very often and search around for deals and nice places to go. I do event planning so I am a "secret shopper" and I look for nice/recommendable places for my clients.  I give this place a 2 1/2.Will try Nail and City Spa next time.

59.description: Went for late afternoon mani-pedis with a gal pal. We showed up without appointments and were fit in immediately. Standard pedi. I'm not really happy with the shape of my tootsie nails, but the polish job is fine. The no chip mani turned out dull and crackly, so I am not really happy with the final product. They are also overpriced,  but the service is really good, so star redeemed. I don't think I would go back, though.

21.description: I give this place 5 stars. They are always friendly and they do a wonderful job. Plus they have a reward program...who doesn't love that?!?!

17.description: My local nail salon (literally 1-2 minute walk away).Great.  Fast, well done, and cheap.

10.description: The atmosphere is calm and inviting and the staff are pleasant. I don't often treat myself, but when I do this is the level of service I look for. The entire experience is designed to ensure the customer leaves relaxed and with great nails! The choice of nail color is astounding! This is my new favorite! Ladies and gents if you're looking for a serene environment that is as clean as it is peaceful, look no further than Spa O! You'll leave with soft hands and feet and memories of exceptional service!

5.description: The job well done deserves 4 stars, but the cost does not make me happy and I can't say the service is soooooo amazing that it's worth it at full price so it gets 3 stars. Pros:- Temka did a great job. My manicure surprisingly lasted for quite some time, as did my pedicure.- Close to the crib- $40 mani/pedi "special" M-W before 2pm. I somehow made it happen in January ;-) - They use your phone number to track their rewards program. You earn 10% for each dollar spent and once you spend $150, you would have racked up $15 that you can use towards services. For better or worse, since everything is so darn expensive it's pretty easy to spend $150 after a few visits.- Well, well, well... I just noticed on their website that they have official guarantees on service: "We guarantee 2 weeks for No-Chip, 1 week for weekly polish. We free to fix chipped nail within guaranteed period."Cons:- It's too darn expensive - $45 mani/pedi, $45 no-chip mani- Their promotions are not consistent. I came here the first time based on a Yelp 10% off check in promo for your first visit. When it was time to pay, they said that promotion was over and I couldn't use it. Sorry.
