Yeah, sorry for you guys. It's clearly on my phone, which you see, so yes, I can and will use it. They proceeded to show me their computer system that said the promo was over months prior. Again, not my fault. They need to update the promotion on Yelp. This was back in December and it's still listed as a Yelp check in offer today. So I would suggest that until they fix the listing don't back down from getting the discount. That's not our fault!FYI- Tips are cash only. They will literally swipe your card twice (for service, for tip) if you must use a CC tip.

3.description: Nice clean place for a manicure! I didn't feel rushed during my mani pedi and I felt like the woman did a very thorough job. My regular manicure lasted about 4-5 days without any major chips which I consider good. My toes lasted close to two weeks. The selection of nail polishes is very wide, and the staff seems very experienced and detail oriented! I will definitely be back. Only downside is he high prices.

35.description: My local nail salon (literally 1-2 minute walk away).Great.  Fast, well done, and cheap.

19.description: Update: After seeing my Yelp review, the manager at Spa O called to apologize for the poor customer service I received at my previous two visits. She even offered a complimentary manicure! I sincerely appreciate her reaching out to me as it serves as a reminder that the owners do care about their customers. Hopefully my experiences were anomalies. (But I'm not taking my chance - not even for a free manicure!)

28.description: Kate gave me the longest lasting no chip I've ever had in my life! Three weeks! I could not believe it!

45.description: It is the one stop shop for all the pampering I need. All the staff are very friendly, a bit small but clean and organized. I never could grow my nails, it would always break and chip. SpaO definitely made my nails healthier and stronger, the tecks told me that they use a real Nail Hardener as their base coat, instead of just a regular one. And their top coat is as quick as any nail polish could dry. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who wants to get great mani and pedi's.

33.description: Pros: Quick, really nice staff, clean, and accommodating (I usually can get right in as a walk-in)Cons: A bit pricey ($45 for mani/pedi) for the quality of the manicure. can usually push my regular mani about a week and a half, but the last 2 manicures I've gotten here chip within a matter of 2-3 days, which is super disappointing.

43.description: When it comes to mani/pedi and no chip mani Spa O is da bomb...and my to-go spot.  And no only because I live 2 blocks away.  The place is spacious and bright and very very clean.  The service is amazing - I love Daria she does the best job at no chip manis!  The price for no chip is decent not the best ($45).  I think it's worth it.  I really enjoy going there.  I've also seen several bachelorette/bridal shower get togethers there and it's super cute - it's the right space for that kind of thing.  I'd definitely highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a good mani/pedi spot (not cheap/conveyor type of establishment) :)

2.description: Great no chip mani! It was a little on the expensive side but the nail technician gave me a great chair massage! Definitely a plus! Plus no wait, I was in and out within 30 min.

18.description: Seriously love this place!! Wonderful service, great quality. Definitely coming back. Michelle did such a great job!!!

41.description: This place is clean I will give them that much. The only thing that really annoyed me was the service. I went in for a No-Chip manicure. I walked in without an appointment as It was a last minute decision. Came in and there was one person getting a mani and one getting a pedi. I asked if they could take me or if I should come back since I live a few blocks away. The receptionist looked at me like I had asked her to give me a kidney. As she looked annoyingly if there were any spots left. She said okay we can fit you in. My fault for not making an appointment. As for the manicure.He didn't file before applying the acetone which I thought was odd. When he went to remove the polish he looked at me and said "wait this is OPI, why didnt you tell me" ummm im sorry I didn't realize I had to. I hate places that do not soak your hands before cutting the cuticle. Basically you are getting your cuticles cut with just some soap and all this acetone on your hands. The next thing he says is "who did your nails before. The cuticles are cut poorly and the shape is not good" Oh sorry about that yet again. I will make sure to tell the last tech what a horrible job they did buddy. The last straw for me was as my nails were drying I lifted my hand to cover my mouth while sneezing and he scolds me for moving saying If I mess it up he has to do it all over again so do not move. Whoa. Sorry but not coming back to feel like I did something wrong the entire time. BTW its day 7 and my no-chip is already starting to "chip"

52.description: Originally, I did not have a great experience at Spa O. My days start early and end late. I needed a nail salon that was close to the condo and offered flexible business hours. Spa O was my first stop. On my first visit, my nail technician was pretty crabby and wasn't very attentive. I was convinced after that appointment that I wouldn't go back. However, I had one hour available on a Sunday and Spa O was the only nail salon in the area that had an opening for a no-chip manicure. I was reluctant, but it was my only chance to have my nails done that weekend. It was a completely different experience! Clearly, I just caught the first nail tech on a bad day. I have truly come to love Spa O! Their location, flexible hours, rewards program, shoulder massages and attentiveness are the reasons I continue to give them business. I would recommend Spa O to almost anyone. And to the users who gave them low ratings -- give them another shot. They won't let you down.

50.description: Ok......I was referred to this salon for a pedicure, if I could give it a zero I would, I made my appt. a week ago specifically with Chloe for today at 11am, I decided to take the day off and get some pampering done. I get there at about 1050am tell them I have an appt. with Chloe only to be told she was off, I then asked for Jenny because both of them came highly recommended and was told she was off too. I rescheduled Saturday with Chloe, but you know what I will not be going to this salon, plus when I walked in everyone just looked at me like I had 3 heads, no hello, nothing. I will take my money somewhere else.

4.description: I'm definitely a fan of this salon. I booked on a whim, loved it, and have been back twice more. It's a small space, but it's really clean, filled with tons of polishes (Essie, OPI, and one other brand) and has a friendly staff. All three times I've been my nail tech has been super nice and did a great job complete with a quick back massage while my hands were wrapped in a warm towel. They also use vitamin e capsules for ultimate skin softness and soak your hands in warm lemon or tea water. For a $15 manicure, you can't beat that!

6.description: Got a mani/pedi/15 chair massage for $60.Let me say mani/pedi was average to good. I liked that they were fast. Lots of color selection. Great massage chairs.The 15 min chair massage was GREAT! The girl had awesome pressure throughout and really worked on my knots.Parking around here is a bit of a disaster...sometimes you can get lucky with a street spot.

22.description: I came in to get my no-chip removed. They gladly removed it and inquired perhaps according to their records.. I was offered another no-chip or normal polish. The application was done well and I'm quite happy.Thanks, Sue.

15.description: I went to Spa O for a pedicure.   It was the most painful thing.  She cut me several times. The tech did not understand what I was asking. My toes were so painful after,  I had trouble putting shoes on .  It's very convenient but I'll never go there again.

57.description: Today I noticed that the quality of The Spa O has really gone down and I won't return. First, both my and my friends nails were cut too short and then we had to dry our nails (hands and feet) in cold air. At first it was cold and after we asked to turn the heat on (since it was freezing!), their power went out and an employee asked if we just wanted some spray on our nails...?! Why would we when they've just been made and were still wet..When the power returned they didn't change it for heat so we had to dry in freezing cold. At the same time, for whatever reason, they've decided to change the entrance, which leads to cold chills coming upon everyone waiting to dry their nails...Time to find a new place for mani-pedis!

20.description: The job well done deserves 4 stars, but the cost does not make me happy and I can't say the service is soooooo amazing that it's worth it at full price so it gets 3 stars. Pros:- Temka did a great job. My manicure surprisingly lasted for quite some time, as did my pedicure.- Close to the crib- $40 mani/pedi "special" M-W before 2pm. I somehow made it happen in January ;-) - They use your phone number to track their rewards program. You earn 10% for each dollar spent and once you spend $150, you would have racked up $15 that you can use towards services. For better or worse, since everything is so darn expensive it's pretty easy to spend $150 after a few visits.- Well, well, well... I just noticed on their website that they have official guarantees on service: "We guarantee 2 weeks for No-Chip, 1 week for weekly polish. We free to fix chipped nail within guaranteed period."Cons:- It's too darn expensive - $45 mani/pedi, $45 no-chip mani- Their promotions are not consistent. I came here the first time based on a Yelp 10% off check in promo for your first visit. When it was time to pay, they said that promotion was over and I couldn't use it. Sorry. Yeah, sorry for you guys. It's clearly on my phone, which you see, so yes, I can and will use it. They proceeded to show me their computer system that said the promo was over months prior. Again, not my fault. They need to update the promotion on Yelp. This was back in December and it's still listed as a Yelp check in offer today. So I would suggest that until they fix the listing don't back down from getting the discount. That's not our fault!FYI- Tips are cash only. They will literally swipe your card twice (for service, for tip) if you must use a CC tip.

36.description: Very nice space and experience. I was a first-time client and got a mani-pedi during the Mon-Wed special. The manicurist (Duki) was excellent. It's a clean, well-appointed place for the price range.

14.description: Decent service! I got a mani pedi for an early bird special which was only 40 dollars without tip. Beside the good job on the nails, what really sold me were the message chairs and the extra message services. The space was clean and nice.

3.description: Terrible service, bought a drink and the cup had a hole. They didn't wanna exchange it for me.

1.description: Management does not do anything about the shady people hanging out inside: homeless, drunk, etc. They dont support their workers in maintining safe a environment by asking non-costumers and scary people to not stay. Management and owners shiuld really do something about that, have had 2 scary experiences here. Avoid at night m.

2.description: Out of every subway I've been to, this is by far the worst. Horrible customer service- ran by a bunch of foreigners who smell. Also, there are a lot of shady people who hang out at this location who make it feel unsafe to eat there and add to the smell of the place.

0.description: Some people who write reviews must write theres out of anger or something. This subway is very much like any other subway. Nothing special just a regular, lackluster subway. Good for grabbing somethong quick or on the go.

4.description: Great bar area for sitting & watching people on Roosevelt while you eat, sadly, that was the highlight.  Food was mediocre, even for Subway, Buffalo Chicken a disappointment.  The bathroom was unbelievable, whoever was in there did an almost artful job of successfully urinating over the entire toilet seat in a perfectly uniform fashion.  I've rarely seen anything like it.

1.description: A relatively new brewpub, opened in January 2015, on the growing edge of South Loop gentrification.  Located on the second floor of an old commercial building; elevator-accessible.  A long, narrow room decorated in bare brick, with a small, six-seat bar and blond wood benches and tables.  Very clean restrooms.Bar snacks are limited to pretzel sticks and fresh-made popcorn, with shakers of a number of flavorings.  No other food service.  Friendly bartender, and the brewmaster was seated at the bar at the time of my visit, engaging with customers.Convenient to public transportation, two and a half blocks from the new Cermak-McCormick Place station on the Green Line.  Also can be reached on the 4-Cottage Grove bus from Michigan Avenue.  Two blocks west of the McCormick Place convention center.  For pub crawlers, about a mile south of Vice District Brewing.Beers tried, in a flight of six samplers at $9.95:-Reclamation Lager.  4.5% ABV.  Clear gold, light head.  Minimal nose.  Typical pils flavor profile; likely their "training wheels" beer for timid industrial-lager drinkers.-Out of the Loop IPL.  6%.  Rich brass color, light head.  Mild aroma hop nose.  Hop-forward, IPA-like flavor profile, though brewed with lager yeast.-New Phenix (sic) Lager.  5%.  Clear gold (though described as unfiltered).  Light head.  Almost no nose.  Moderate bitter hop taste against a solid malt base.  Grain bill includes "a touch of" rye and wheat, though these don't seem apparent in the flavor profile.-Dry Humor Belgian Honey Blonde.  5.5%.  Slightly cloudy straw color; head disappears almost at once.  Touch of honey in the nose (it's brewed with orange blossom honey).  Tart and citrusy; Brettanomyces yeast is noticeable in the taste.Coiffable (sic) American Red Ale.   6%.  Clear bronze color, halo head.  Malt and aroma hop nose.  Intense aroma hop taste against Munich malt, with a touch of woody "pencil shavings" at the finish.-Blutmond über Antwerpen Belgian Dubbel.  6.5%.  Named in honor of last week's "supermoon" eclipse.  Cloudy reddish brown, heavy head.  Slight flowery nose.  Hop variety is German Mandarina  (hence the name in German rather than Flemish).   Noticeably made with an abbey-style yeast; ethanol also approaches being a flavor note.  My favorite of the flight; I ordered another tulip of this.

9.description: A brewery with fantastic beer, low prices, and unbelievable friendly staff? This is the stuff beer dreams are made of.I've been there twice, each time with guests visiting from out of town and itching to see the Chicago brew scene. I've tried the beer flight (delicious and a fantastic deal) and followed up with the Dry Humor, which was my favorite. Adrian is super nice and gets to know you right away, which really completes the 'neighborhood bar' feel of the place. No pretentiousness, just really good beer with really good people. Also, free popcorn!

23.description: Great addition to the neighborhood! Visited the place twice with different friends in the past 2 weeks. My favorite beer--and my gf's-- is the Belgian Honey Blonde (if you like sweet beers). Also, the employees are friendly--one of them provided us a tour of the 2nd FL room. Overall, a great taproom. Oh, and the Motor Row neighborhood is full of great early 20th century architecture, if you're into that thing.

12.description: Was visiting Chicago, out for a walk. Saw the place and went in to catch some basketball. Light crowd, but everyone was friendly, it felt   as if I were a regular, which I might be if I lived in town.I started with the Pander Bear a dark beer, and sampled the Bi-polar and Multigrain Zwikel. Even though I normally like dark beer the Multigrain Zwikel was my favorite. Get there early they close at 10pm weekdays.

21.description: Right now, the only "open" aspect of this place is their "tasting room" with 4 beers.  Although I enjoyed 2 of the 4, it's simply a tasting room and I can't figure out how these breweries will survive without any type of food being served.  They plan to open a 2nd and 3rd floor, which is where most of the debauchery will apparently take place in the future, with the first floor remaining a tasting room/retail space.  I'd normally rate this place (for what it is today) 3 stars, but I'll give it the benefit of the doubt, since for this area, I applaud you.  Let's keep the gentrification going.  Good luck guys!  I hope you add "other brewery" beers and some level of snacks.  Otherwise, I'm not sure what would attract me to keep coming back.

16.description: Great beer. Good atmosphere. Easy parking on the street though you have to pay. Super clean bathrooms and free popcorn. I tried every beer and they were all delicious.

17.description: Great addition to the neighborhood! Visited the place twice with different friends in the past 2 weeks. My favorite beer--and my gf's-- is the Belgian Honey Blonde (if you like sweet beers). Also, the employees are friendly--one of them provided us a tour of the 2nd FL room. Overall, a great taproom. Oh, and the Motor Row neighborhood is full of great early 20th century architecture, if you're into that thing.

10.description: I echo the first review. Being a resident of the area makes my review bias; however if the drinks were not good and the environment was not welcoming, I would have ran this place out of town. We only need solid places in the neighborhood and this is hands down the right venue to kick things off.  Alot of future restaurants, hotels and bars are being planned, so this brewery/tap room will soon be available at a bar near you, but for now - go in sample some beers and buy a growler to go. Expensive at first, but refills for now are only $13.  Belgian Honey Blonde and Reclamation Lager are my favorites (NOTE: I prefer lighter vs stout flavor).FREE PARKING STILL ON 23rd street and Wabash between 23rd-24th.

5.description: I had the pleasure of wandering around the neighborhood while i awaited a flat to get fixed. While trying to avoid the burger king's pan handlers, I discovered this place. While there hours don't lend well to day drinking, with a 4pm opening, the pours encourage long visits. This small bar has stools and 5ish small tables. You are welcome to bring your own food and feign interest in the one TV.The TV entrainment will not be missed as you can drink a generous 20oz pour of beer for about 5 bucks.  Although their menu is short, they have about 6 different styles of beers all of which were under 6.50. Be prepared to pay for parking and not walk too many other places. But with beer so crisp and refershing you may not need to go anywhere else.

11.description: I may never leave. It's a tiny tap room.  And that's all you need.  A dozen places to sit and drink what??? Good fucking beer! I'm all about the beer names. Dumpster Diver DIPA 8.5%. Complex. Smooth. Bites. Loved it. Had 2. It was personal. There was humor. Great visit. I'll bring my people back her for sure. And thanks for the water labeled "Free Coors Lite". Lmfao!! Love you Motor Row. Peace from the Motor City!

22.description: Nice addition to the neighborhood.   Beer is very approachable, most of the stuff is less then 6%ABV.  They had 4 of their beers on tap with plans to add another 2 in the next two weeks.  The build out is small, but very nice, and the staff gets 5 stars.  They are super friendly.  No food for now, so we just ordered a Ricobenes pizza and had it delivered while we enjoyed our beer.  I'm a hop head so I went straight for the IPL.

0.description: This is a real place for the craft beer enthousiast. The taproom is small, nice and cute. On week-end days, they open the 2nd floor so they can host group events. We enjoyed the beers very much ... 12 $ for 6x5 oz flight is a good deal for that quality of beer. I must insist of that, the quality of their beers is amazing. You can tell that had fun making these recipes, testing, etc. They have some unsual stuff like an IPL brewed from their own yeast strain, a lagered Brett, etc... they were selling 4x Packs of two of their beers for only 8 $ each. Would definitely go back there often if I lived in Chicago!

20.description: I echo the first review. Being a resident of the area makes my review bias; however if the drinks were not good and the environment was not welcoming, I would have ran this place out of town. We only need solid places in the neighborhood and this is hands down the right venue to kick things off.  Alot of future restaurants, hotels and bars are being planned, so this brewery/tap room will soon be available at a bar near you, but for now - go in sample some beers and buy a growler to go. Expensive at first, but refills for now are only $13.  Belgian Honey Blonde and Reclamation Lager are my favorites (NOTE: I prefer lighter vs stout flavor).FREE PARKING STILL ON 23rd street and Wabash between 23rd-24th.

19.description: I've been here a couple times already and not bad.  Just the 1st floor is open and that only can handle about 25-30 people.  No food but you can order in.  They need a old fashion popcorn machine.  I tried several beers and I'm a big IPA guy and the IPL (IPA & Pilsner) combo was pretty good.  But my favorite was the Red by far, go figure.  That was one of the better Red's that I have had.  Can't wait for the 2nd floor to open!

2.description: Ask the bar manager about Ben Franklin and grey pussy. She will explain to you about mr franklins obsession with older women and how he preferred to sex their vaginas over younger those women around the same age. She is very friendly overall with food and other brewery recommendations but may get shy about ben's exploits. However she will always remember ben is a greyhound.

18.description: Very distinct home brew taste. Went with 2 friends, got the zwickel, ipl, and pale ale. Everyone tried everything and couldn't finish any of these.Great addition for the area but I would wait at least 3 more months for them to bring their beers up to the quality we expect now in Chicago.

13.description: Small but unique selection of beers you won't usually see elsewhere. Also, $6/beer is a pretty good deal, considering it's craft beer. They had seven beers to choose from, maybe less than some beer gardens, but the beer I had was tasty nonetheless, and the noise taproom is very tolerable, so this is a good place to go if you want to have a conversation with someone while sipping on a beer. No yelling required. Free pretzel sticks and popcorn on case you get hungry... Great local spot in the neighborhood, I'll definitely be back to sample their other brews

4.description: Great selection of brewed beers with a very descriptive menu. No food purely beer but a very friendly and knowledgeable staff. It's a very clean and comfortable atmosphere.

6.description: Anxious for the 2nd floor to open, to get a true feel for what this place will be, but for now....a decent little spot. The bartenders were friendly, and there are a couple of nice beers brewing. My faves were the Reclamation Lager and the Multigrain Zwickel. I look forward to trying the Coifable American Red Ale, but it wasn't quite ready yet, when we were there last night.My only complaints? First, I feel the lights are a tad too bright. My friend said he felt like he was sitting on a TV set all night! And second...the toilet in the women's room had a ring of scum in the bowl. Ewww. The brewery seemed clean besides that, but still...not something you want to see. Even given these things....glad to see things opening in this neighborhood, and looking forward to returning as Motor Row continues to expand their space.

15.description: Really great place with excellent staff. Went there after the auto show on a whim and could have been happier. All their beers are really good, the Zwickel being the best. Met the manager and the bartender, both very helpful. Had driving not been a necessary that night, I would have done more than one flight. Even better they had several pans of amazing food out for anyone to try. The place was such a good find we thought we accidentally walked in on a private party or something. Go, try it all, have a great time, and long live craft beer.

7.description: I love this place. Great beer, free popcorn, friendly bartenders, and never that crowded.

8.description: This is an intimate tasting room, 3 blocks from the Green Line train station, and 2 blocks from McCormick Place. The staff is friendly, and knowledgeable. The flights are priced very fair for the size of the pour. Their beer is all very good, but there wasn't a standout like you get from Revolution, or Vice down the street. Plenty of free parking around the corner. Save the money the Mayor will take from you on the meters in front.

3.description: I love Motor Row and every beer they make. As a lager guy, their Zwickel is probably the best I've had outside of Germany. Frank and his team love what they do and it shows. The folks are really friendly, and the taproom itself on South Michigan Avenue near McCormick Place is really a beautiful space, too. As a taproom they're OK with you bringing in food, too. Go now!

14.description: Tiny place that serves some kick ass beers. I recommend the Pander Bear...very different but very good. Would give 4.5 stars because they don't serve food.

58.description: Pork quesadillas were pretty decent.  Try the tamales, great app.  I really loved the piña coladas.

56.description: I was amazed at this place I'm usually a person that is hard to impress especially when it comes to Mexican food but , wow from the green salsa was on point, the tacos were well prepared not too much meat just the perfect amount I had them with cilantro and onions and that was the perfect amount  some restaurants add too much onions or too much cilantro but that was perfect, now I also the steak nachos that I probably I would not have again . The chicken quesadilla were delicious as well.  the prices are very good and they give you a large amount of food I was expecting less food on plate but that was perfect. will I eat there again? TOTALLY!

29.description: A great little cozy spot! Our server was great and although our drinks took a bit of time they were very delicious. The food is your typical Mexican fare, and portions were very generous. I would recommend this place to anyone who has a taste for margaritas and Mexican food.

42.description: The food is fantastic! Though it's always crowded, and seating is too close together or it would be 5 stars

23.description: We placed an order for pickup and arrived earlier than expected, but it was ready at exactly when I said I'd be there, so kudos to them on timing. It was the night before the marathon so the restaurant was packed. I watched as the host took care of everyone making sure they were acknowledged or attended to at the bar, if they had to wait.Food was great. I got the flautas and they were delicious. Four came with the entree, so it was a lot of food. Boyfriend got the steak chimichanga and thoroughly enjoyed it. Rice and beans came as sides and the rice was delicious. I also appreciated the guacamole on the side. Life is better with guac!

47.description: Ordered quesadilla and strawberry margarita. Had hot chips (for once). Margarita was excellent. Aldahir was our server and was very friendly and really attentive. Sat outside and was nice until group came and started rearranging the tables and laughing really loudly.

8.description: Shrimp Diablo is my favorite here. Great drinks and food, you can't go wrong by choosing to dine here.

31.description: Very cute and cozy cafe with live music on Friday night. The service was fast. Food was good. Very nice ambiance. Nice outdoor patio. Will return.

34.description: I live super close to this restaurant/ bar and the service is subpar and always has been for the 8+ years I have lived in the neighborhood.  It's really unfortunate to sit outside and have dry and empty glasses when there are 5+ tables total and yet not a single person checks in after serving appetizers.  Our party wanted to order more drinks and entrees but were not given the option.  We finally had to go inside to request our own check and when we expressed dissatisfaction still no one cared to help.  Total disappointment.  After years of bad service and average food at this point it's unlikely I will ever go back.

16.description: Best Chicken flautas in town!!!!!! The service and staff were super sweet and helpful! The pineapple margarita with Tajin on the rim is a must try!!!

13.description: Excellent mini chimichangas. The server was very nice and willing to modify the meal so I could have veggies and chicken in them. Their sangria was also very good! Strong, but delicious.

11.description: Wow! The service from the manager Gulio was horrible! I tried to get his attention multiple times, and he repeatedly turned his back to me as I waved to him. When I tried to walk towards him he walked away! The food was average, not any better than what you can get at another Americanized Mexican restaurant. It's probably only still open due to the  lack of other restaurants in the area.My queso was HARD. It was advertised as a "dipping cheese" but it broke my chip. Never again will I return. Avoid this place and go a little further west and support a real Mexican restaurant in pilsen.And again the manager Guilio needs to gain a little  professionalism, you are in the service industry  sir.

39.description: Ok I been to a lot of Mexican restaurant in Chicago!! But this place called themselves Mexican restaurant I don't think so!! I order the La cantina steak it was awful French fries mix with the cut up steak!! It gave me a stomach ache!! My friends ordered a steak it came over cooked!!  The place was over crowed with no elbow room to another table!! And the service was bad!! The only good thing about this place is the MARGARITA!!!

37.description: I have been craving some great tasting, authentic Mexican food for awhile. I didn't want to drive too far and I wanted decent prices and delicious food. So my 12 yr old(who loves Mexican)& I headed to South Loop to La Cantina, The inside was uber crowded, so we opted for outdoor seating. It was so relaxing and peaceful. The chips and salsa was very tasty with just the right amount of heat.I had the steak taco dinner and my daughter had the mini chimichangas. Delish! Everything was clearly fresh and prepared to order. We have found our spot for great Mexican food. Oh and the peach mojito was delicious.Can't wait to return.I only gave 4 stars because, the tables and chairs outdoors were not comfortable. The chairs should have straight backs not scooped backs where you can't sit up and the spider webs need to be taken care of on the wall by outdoor seating.

0.description: Great food here, fun atmosphere, really nice service. The Queso Fundido is a great appetizer! The waitress was kind enough to give me a spicier than normal salsa; I smothered the tortillas in the salsa, added the queso and basically had cheese tacos. Yum.Slightly redundantly I got the chicken quesadilla as an entree. They were very well made. I have no complaints. This is certainly a solid eatery.  The atmosphere is moody in the evening and potentially a good date spot. It's not a far walk from the Hyatt. Why 5 stars? The service.My waitress was a delight. She took care of me, she was attentive and understanding, she was sweet and had great recommendations...Unfortunately... No such luck for the woman sitting to my right with her date. He was loud and confrontational. I heard a lot of, "no, listen... Nooooo." And at one point he challenged her to stand up and dance with him. I need to stress this was a "challenge." Not a romantic invitation. Listening to their date made me question my manliness. As stereotypes would imply this guy was insensitive, aggressive, egotistical and extremely emotionally fragile underneath all the facial hair. I've got a lot to work on myself to reach this level... But I'm good on facial hair. I wish I could have stayed longer to enjoy different meals at this place! If you live nearby, it's certainly worth a few visits!

38.description: Food:4 Grilled chicken salad is always fresh and light, pork tamales steaming hot and moist, steak fajitas mediocreService:5 quick, efficient, friendlyAmbience: 4.5 romantic, but a little too crampedCleanliness: 5

51.description: The food is not good if you like authentic Mexican.  The margaritas on the other hand are tasty.

27.description: Every time I stay at the Hyatt McCormick, I make the half mile walk to this neighborhood gem - mostly to get away from bad hotel food. I've never had a disappointing meal here. The burritos, tacos and enchiladas are great and authentic.

32.description: La Cantina is a nice little spot, with great drink specials. Try the sangria, and they make tasty tacos, pretty authentic, just cilantro and onions.

54.description: Went to La Cantina for lunch today after wanting to try it for a few months. It was pretty good! Our waitress was very friendly and attentive. We were seated immediately. Nice place to stop in for a quick bite.

48.description: Don't know why there are so many recent bad reviews. The place is great. Food and drinks are great. Very few places in Chicago have good vegetarian Mexican options. This place does. But it was busy on a Sunday, may be due to the NBA finals. The owner recommended calling and reserving a table.

44.description: Easily the best mexican food place in the south loop.  The service here is great and there a ton of great vegetarian/vegan options - which is really nice to see.  The drinks are also excellent.  The only real downside is that since the place is pretty small, if it is crowded it gets super loud - but otherwise the food and service is great.

24.description: Vegetarian / Vegan review:Location: LOVE that this place is in the south loop.  There should be more places like this in that area. Service is slower than average, but comes with a huge smile and a great attitude. I think the vibe was meant to be relaxed so you can take your time. Menu: there is an entire vegan menu with fake chicken, beef, chorizo, cheese, sour cream. Vegans, go crazy!  Vegetarians, if you love your cheese, they will add real cheese to your fake meat dish if you ask.  Oh, and the rice and beans are vegetarian too. The salsa was awesome! Spicy awesome! I love a place that isn't afraid to kick it up. Fresh chips, yum.  Guacamole, everyone loved it, fresh!  Tortilla soup was a good mix of tortilla strips,  avocado and salt.  Yes, lots of salt. I took it home and remade it. Maybe it was a bad batch. Chorizo enchiladas with verde sauce was pretty good. A little dry on the inside bc it was just chorizo.  I would probably mix veggies, cheese, and chorizo together. BUT, the flavors were great! And that is really hard to find in this area. I can't wait to go back and try different options. Dollars to portions, you definitely get your money's worth!

7.description: La Cantina is fabulous!! Every person I interacted with was kind, prompt, and personable. Less than 3 minutes after we sat down (after no wait) we had chips and salsa, waters, and had placed our drink orders. The music was festive- so much so that our whole table was dancing (before the margaritas).The food was ...  AMAZING. I had the spicy green enchiladas and basically licked my plate clean. Steak chimichangas & nachos were also amazing! Great (gigantic) portions and very reasonable prices. I will absolutely be coming back to La Cantina :)

49.description: Went here because it was close to where I was staying on a business trip. They do have good drink specials, including a $6 margarita on this night, which is good for Chicago. Nice little place, very busy. The biggest thing about the ambiance is that it's very noisy. I mean very. The service was friendly, the prices quite reasonable. The food came very quickly. I had the steak fajitas. They were good. Just good. I've had better in my hometown. Maybe my expectations are higher for Chicago for some reason, as a world class city. Maybe the fajitas needed more spice? The steak was a little chewy. Overall, it was just ok. What else can I say?

40.description: Great location in the south loop section of Chicago. Amazing service and cuisine. Close seating allows intimacy with your neighbors if you're into that sort of thing, lol. Nice music selection and the sangria was good money. I had the shrimp and fish tacos and have no complaints. Do your self a favor. Have a bite!

53.description: I had chicken tacos with rice and beans & strawberry margarita. Although, I wanted this place to be fresh authentic Mexican food, close to home, it was the very opposite. The margarita is where La Cantina lost major points. The strawberry margarita was reminiscent of a cheap drink mix, cloyingly sweet... leaving a regrettable after taste. Needless to say, I won't be returning.

30.description: Awful service, just sat down and waited 10 minutes and no one even bothered to acknowledge me.  I live right next door, but, will not be back.

46.description: I love coming to this place. It's one of my favorite Mexican restaurants in the south loop. The drinks are always big and tasty. Just be careful, they are kind of on the strong side. The food is always great as well. My fav dish to get is the Chimichanga. It never fails me! The only down side to this place is the size. It's not that big of a place. It hold maybe 30-40 people comfortably. During the summer they have outdoor seating and its beautiful on a summer evening. If you come on a Friday or Saturday night, expect a long wait (about 30-45 mins). If you really want Mexican and good drinks, it's worth the wait. I give this place 4 stars because the service is not that great. Some of the waiters and waitresses are great but the majority of them are slow (in my opinion). Overall, the place is great to add into your rotation of places to go if you live in Chicago.

1.description: This is the best Mexican food place in Chicago. We are from Houston Texas, where are you can eat lots of great Mexican food. So believe me when I say it's very tasty and good. The restaurant is very clean and the wait staff is friendly. It is a small place and it does get busy.Their  Charro beans are delicious. I was not impressed with the guacamole however. My daughter got the chimichanga and really enjoyed it. My husband got the chicken fajitas and thought they were great. The best thing about the place is it's homemade salsa. Warm and spicy.

55.description: I wish I could give La Cantina 10 stars!! I've been coming to Cantina for years and always loved the great food, fabulous margaritas, and fun ambience.  But a year or two ago my love for them was taken to a whole new level when they introduced an entire FULL SIZE menu of just vegan food!!! As a vegan who loves Mexican food, this is a mind blowing thing to happen in my life.  We go there all the time and also place orders almost weekly for delivery because I am addicted to my La Cantina.  I can't recommend it enough and if any of the La Cantina staff is reading this, a huge thank you to you for not only being "vegan-friendly" but for going above and beyond to provide delicious vegan cuisine!

9.description: Food was great, a bit greesy, and I got food poisoning. Though before I got food poisoning my tamales were great, and I liked the spicy salsa they put down on the table.Our server was attentive and took great care of us also.

26.description: I love the whole staff they are awesome people. Came here for the first time after the Bears preseason game. We were just walking down the street heading to a different lounge when we notice this little place. We said why not and went to check it out.  We didn't notice they close at 11pm when we got to the door so we turn to leave. The owner said some in Ladies and let us order drinks. After we left I keep talking up the place to my friends how the drinks are freshly made margaritas. So I finally came back with another friend and she loved it. We went to celebrate my birthday somewhere else first and I talk her into taking me here for drinks. The staff was amazing once again and the owners father was the best with stories. We had such a great time sitting at the bar we were there for 3 hours how I don't even know.  I will be going back again to try their food.

25.description: This place is great! I've always had a good time here! It can be packed, but they are relatively quick with seating! I've had to wait the most maybe 20 minutes. The food is especially good--I've ordered the chimichanga and can't stop dreaming about it! I'm from Southern California, so I'm used to authentic Mexican food and this place does a pretty good job of getting to it. The staff is on top of it, always making sure my cup is full! The drinks here are decent--they could be a little stronger. I was surprisingly impressed by their Michilada. All in all, if you're looking for a place to dine at in the south, this is well worth it!

12.description: Limited outside seating, only for parties of two - what a bummer. Simple food in good portions but not overwhelming in flavor or presentation. The staff was friendly and accommodating, aside from the outdoor seating. I did have the BEST shot ever while I was there. My group told our waitress we'd like some rumchata shots, and she suggested we add Cafe Patron to them. They were SO GOOD. Like coffee ice cream in my mouth. Yum yum.

59.description: Had a great dinner! Strong drinks & food was delicious. I mentioned to the server that it was my boyfriend's birthday & she brought out a flan for him with a candle. We got there before the rush. Parking was easy (street parking, free after 6pm). Definitely going back

21.description: My favorite local place for Mexican food!  Service is great, efficient and super friendly.  The restaurant is always hopping.  Seating is very close knit, which either makes for an intimate evening with your dining companion or a chance to share your neighbor's chips.  Fortunately, every diner is in the same boat and it makes for lots of smiles and jokes.  The portions are plenty and the chile rellenos never disappoint. The guac is tasty and the chips are warm.  The salsa has a little kick to it.  They offer a milder version, but you have to ask for it.  The prices are affordable and the drinks plentiful.  Salud!

17.description: Vegetarian / Vegan review:Location: LOVE that this place is in the south loop.  There should be more places like this in that area. Service is slower than average, but comes with a huge smile and a great attitude. I think the vibe was meant to be relaxed so you can take your time. Menu: there is an entire vegan menu with fake chicken, beef, chorizo, cheese, sour cream. Vegans, go crazy!  Vegetarians, if you love your cheese, they will add real cheese to your fake meat dish if you ask.  Oh, and the rice and beans are vegetarian too. The salsa was awesome! Spicy awesome! I love a place that isn't afraid to kick it up. Fresh chips, yum.  Guacamole, everyone loved it, fresh!  Tortilla soup was a good mix of tortilla strips,  avocado and salt.  Yes, lots of salt. I took it home and remade it. Maybe it was a bad batch. Chorizo enchiladas with verde sauce was pretty good. A little dry on the inside bc it was just chorizo.  I would probably mix veggies, cheese, and chorizo together. BUT, the flavors were great! And that is really hard to find in this area. I can't wait to go back and try different options. Dollars to portions, you definitely get your money's worth!

10.description: We placed an order for pickup and arrived earlier than expected, but it was ready at exactly when I said I'd be there, so kudos to them on timing. It was the night before the marathon so the restaurant was packed. I watched as the host took care of everyone making sure they were acknowledged or attended to at the bar, if they had to wait.Food was great. I got the flautas and they were delicious. Four came with the entree, so it was a lot of food. Boyfriend got the steak chimichanga and thoroughly enjoyed it. Rice and beans came as sides and the rice was delicious. I also appreciated the guacamole on the side. Life is better with guac!

5.description: 3 stars for the food.1 star on the service.Slow to get to our table, then charged me for a dinner portion because I ordered my meal after 1:30pm... despite having to wait 15 minutes to order and sitting down around 1:10.  She even asked how I wanted my 3 enchiladas (lunch)... then brought 4 (dinner).Never got a second water until after I paid the bill.Guac was great and the vegans I was with all loved the vegan options. There are other places I can get food just as good with better service and not pay $20 for lunch (dinner).  My enchiladas were fine.

3.description: Great place for vegan eats. The vegan enchiladas and nachos are great. The salsa also has a great kick with fantastic chips.I'll definitely be coming back here and has always been a place on my list in the South Loop

35.description: Food was great, a bit greesy, and I got food poisoning. Though before I got food poisoning my tamales were great, and I liked the spicy salsa they put down on the table.Our server was attentive and took great care of us also.

19.description: We live in the South Loop and have been looking for great go-to restaurants that are walking distance. We have been disappointed so far, but really excited after our first meal here! It's a 5min walk and really great Mexican food. We like the ambiance and the menu options, though the service has been a little lacking. We have tried the enchiladas and the steak/shrimp fajitas... Both great! Our only complaint is that there was not very much steak in the fajitas, and the pieces were very small and varied in texture. The pieces that were well cooked, were extremely delicious! Others were very chewy. Overall, we enjoy the margs and the fresh, warm chips, plus the prices are very reasonable. We will back many times! :)

28.description: Love the food.  The ingredients taste very fresh.  Always very tasty.  Portion sizes are huge.  There can be a bit of a wait to be seated on the weekends.  The bar area stays full.  They often have live music whic I very much enjoy.  Several small to medium TV's for those who want to watch a game. It isn't a large dining area, but it's fine.  There is outside dining in the summer.  IThere is street metered parking.  The wait staff is okay.  They are not overly friendly, but not bad at all.  This is one of my go to spots for Mexican food.

45.description: Had the ground beef burrito. Great dish. Loved sitting out on the street, watching and listening to people.  The servers were really focused on a quality experience. They replaced my menu because it had some food on it...without me asking. Chips were OK...salsa was unique with a mild kick. It was a good choice and an easy walk from the Hyatt McCormick.

33.description: Horrible meal and service. We ordered queso and when it came out it was a blob of cheese. We literally had to cut it with a knife. I'm pretty sure your supposed to be able to dip a chip in it but not there's. We spent so much money there and when we complained they looked at us like we were crazy. We said that was the most expensive worst meal we have ever had!

43.description: It's too bad that I cannot give this restaurant zero stars, after today's experience.  I've eaten here a few times, and the food has always been very good. However an experience that I had today has just caused this restaurant to lose a good customer.  Today, after spending the entire day on our boat with three small children, I placed an online order at 4:00 for delivery to Burnham Harbor.  I received two email confirmations stating that the food would be delivered by 450. Knowing we are in Chicago, and being adjacent to Soldier Field where there are often weekend concerts and events,  I waited until the delivery was 20 minutes late before calling the restaurant to check on it.  At 5:10, a woman profusely apologized that the order had never been transferred to their internal ordering system, although she did see that I had placed the order online. She promised to rush the order and have it delivered ASAP. Now mind you, Burnham Harbor is only about 12 blocks away from this restaurant.  At 5:30, I received a call from someone at the restaurant telling me that because there is an event happening at Soldier Field, they would be unable to deliver the food to us.  The gentleman seemed to think that I couldn't possibly understand why they couldn't get through, as he stated all the roads were blocked off.   He actually said to me, "we are losing money on this right now".  I'm not sure what his point was.  No delivery attempt was even made.  If they were not going to be delivering to this area tonight,, the restaurant should have informed me within minutes after my online order was placed, instead of allowing me to believe that the order would be delivered 50 minutes after placing the order, and even after I called in 70 minutes after placing the order, assuring me that the food would arrive.  Here I sit, at 6:45 PM, and my three children still have not had any dinner because it took us an hour to close up our boat and get packed in the truck so that we can go home to feed them. And by the way... The roads are not blocked off, the traffic is just slow.  Needless to say, this restaurant has lost a customer permanently.

2.description: More vegan-friendly Mexican food on the southside! Tied with El Faro, honestly. The only reason I give 4 instead of 5 stars is because of the lack of vegan desserts.I have only ordered on GrubHub, so my review is based on that. The delivery is always as quick as estimated. Because I order delivery, it is obviously pricier than getting food to go, but the portions are huge. I always have leftovers.They have vegan cheese (daiya) and sour cream as well as soyrizo and other vegan "meats." Hooray! My favorite dish is vegan chimichangas with the vegan chorizo. I also recommend the tortila soup. The dishes come with rice and refried beans.My omnivore friends/family like it too, so it is great for a mixed crowd.If you want cheap, taqueria food, go with El Faro. But if you want something more filling, go to La Cantina.

18.description: Stopped in to La Cantina for the first time on Monday. Very nice rustic atmosphere. The food was good and reasonably priced, as well as the Monday drink special, which was $6.50/7.50 margaritas. I love Mexican food and the place I USED to go to faithfully to satisfy my Mexican needs went to hell, so... I needed a new place to frequent. I think this might be it.

41.description: Best mexican food in the city!  I love the chips & sauce.  My vegan enchiladas were awesome.  They actually have a large VEGAN MENU with 30+ items.  They use Daiya cheese & Tofutti sour cream for the vegan items.Service is a little slower than expected, but well worth the wait.

52.description: I grew up in Texas and have been looking for a great Mexican/Tex Mex place since moving to South Loop.  This is the closest thing I've found and we'll be back. For better or worse we judge a place on its chips, salsa, tacos, and margaritas. Definitely a place you can trust. Try the different salsas and you won't be disappointed.

50.description: Good food! Speedy delivery! Flour tortilla tacos are delish! Fish tacos were not as good as expected.Churros were awesome too! Finally found a place close to my house for my churros cravings, woo-hoo!

4.description: Chimichangas are the best in the city! If you have a valid student id they have a student menu available all day! The ambiance has dim lighting so I don't think I would bring kids here after 5 but it's a cute after work spot for drinks and dinner with friends or a hot date :)

6.description: I love the food here. I don't love the ambiance.My first time here was during lunch time and it was very quiet. My second and third times here have been after 5 on a Friday. It was very noisy, tables are very close to each other. In addition, the live "entertainment" is not very good. They have speakers over the tables so this man is blasting over your head as you try to have a conversation, which is pretty much impossible unless you want to shout. Also, the guy performs random songs like the Goo Goo DollsI can only speak to the vegan menu, and it is huge! The vegan chimichanga is to die for and I always end up taking half home. I also had a margarita that was topped with a sangria that was good. If it wasn't for the overly loud entertainment I would give this place five stars

22.description: Absolute ASSSSSHOLE! The manager was an absolute jerk, had no manners, no customer service etiquettes. I explained to him on the phone right after I ordered online about how I was having trouble putting my order in online, and he kept insisting like a 12 year old bitch that he couldn't find my address. I gave him my address which is 3 blocks away from the restaurant. He still kept complaining and then when I asked about delivery time he said 45 minutes for two damn steak tacos. I asked him can I cancel? because 45 minutes is a lot of time, he said he can't cancel because the tacos are already being made. If the GOD DAMN tacos were already being made and I live 3 blocks away, why would it take 45 minutes to deliver? His response: are u sure u wanna cancel? Cause if you cancel you will never be able to order from here again. He can go fuck himself. I have a billion places to take my business. Piece of shit!!!! La Cantina can kiss business good bye in the south loop.

15.description: I love the whole staff they are awesome people. Came here for the first time after the Bears preseason game. We were just walking down the street heading to a different lounge when we notice this little place. We said why not and went to check it out.  We didn't notice they close at 11pm when we got to the door so we turn to leave. The owner said some in Ladies and let us order drinks. After we left I keep talking up the place to my friends how the drinks are freshly made margaritas. So I finally came back with another friend and she loved it. We went to celebrate my birthday somewhere else first and I talk her into taking me here for drinks. The staff was amazing once again and the owners father was the best with stories. We had such a great time sitting at the bar we were there for 3 hours how I don't even know.  I will be going back again to try their food.

57.description: If Thalia's song "Amor a la Mexicana" ever inspired a place, La Cantina is the closest approximation to it. The restaurant is beautifully decorated and it serves delicious, mouth-watering Mexican food. And just like everything Mexican, the place is irresistible and unforgettable. I came here on a weekday, after a long day at work, with a friend after she highly recommended it. The setting is charmingly dark, cozy and the tables are wonderfully situated to fit groups of 2 or 4. But what is fascinating about this place is that it merges the best of both worlds -- while it has a distinct Mexican feeling, the music and the drinks selection are decisively Caribbean. Picture this: trying to decide which Mojito to drink, while Celia Cruz or Hector Lavoe are playing on the background, while the rest of the menu is peppered with your favorite Mexican dishes. We ended up having the Mango and Raspberry mojitos. They were nothing short of  spectacular. As for food, there was no way I was not going to have the Grilled Arachera. It was soft, tender, beautifully prepared and accompanied by a nice selection of rice, beans, pico de gallo and even asparagus! The mojitos were so good, we had to have them again. All in all, La Cantina is the type of place you can go to impress your date, take a group of a friends for, or even enjoy it on your own. Terrific place. Highly recommended. A+

20.description: Limited outside seating, only for parties of two - what a bummer. Simple food in good portions but not overwhelming in flavor or presentation. The staff was friendly and accommodating, aside from the outdoor seating. I did have the BEST shot ever while I was there. My group told our waitress we'd like some rumchata shots, and she suggested we add Cafe Patron to them. They were SO GOOD. Like coffee ice cream in my mouth. Yum yum.

36.description: La Cantina is fabulous!! Every person I interacted with was kind, prompt, and personable. Less than 3 minutes after we sat down (after no wait) we had chips and salsa, waters, and had placed our drink orders. The music was festive- so much so that our whole table was dancing (before the margaritas).The food was ...  AMAZING. I had the spicy green enchiladas and basically licked my plate clean. Steak chimichangas & nachos were also amazing! Great (gigantic) portions and very reasonable prices. I will absolutely be coming back to La Cantina :)

14.description: Every time I stay at the Hyatt McCormick, I make the half mile walk to this neighborhood gem - mostly to get away from bad hotel food. I've never had a disappointing meal here. The burritos, tacos and enchiladas are great and authentic.

3.description: Don't waste your time with this store they take too long on orders. I placed an order October 2011 and still have not received my full order.  They keep promising my order will be here in two weeks.  I finally cancelled all my orders now I have to deal with getting my money back.  They are nice and friendly but that's not going to deliver my equipment I ordered

1.description: I have been burned by this company more than once.First time was when I ordered a Double Sided Muslin backdrop for Halloween.  One side was Brown and the other side was a lite gray and beige.  I needed the brownside for our halloween/fall backdrop.  After it taking 2-3 weeks to get to me, I had one week to build my backdrop for Halloween.  I take it out of the package, and it looks NOTHING like the photo online.  I call the company, and they ask me to send them a photo of it.  I did just that.  They get it, and denie me a refund or free shipping to exchange it.  They will give me a store credit.  I still didnt get my replacement backdrop before halloween.  I used the credit on another backdrop that was on supposal backorder.  After pestering there company for 3+ months, the backrop finally arrive after me settling with them on a new style.Second time was ordering there Candy Stick Backdrops(3 differnt ones),  6 week wait for one to arrive.  It came the week of Easter, when I needed it.  Suprise Suprise it was damage when it arrive (Inside the package), and not by the postal service.  I ended up refusing the other 2 backdrops, since I didnt want to chance me getting burned with no refund like last time.  It took 2 months for me to receive a refund.I will never order from this company again.

2.description: Maybe it had something to do with their recent move from Chicago to California, but they screwed up my order time and time again.  I finally gave up trying.  First problem was I ordered a certain backdrop (among several other items and props) and when I got the background, it was not anywhere NEAR as nice a looking  background as their web listing showed.  To their credit, they took it back and gave me credit for other items, but then backstocked several of the items and finally told me those other items weren't in stock any more and would not be reordered.  So I tried AGAIN to order some ALTERNATE items with my credit.  Some of which came to me damaged or (again) different from the photo as shown in the web catalog.  The girl on the phone was very nice and apologetic every time I called, but they just couldn't keep anything in stock that I wanted, or sent the wrong items, or sent items in substandard packaging that got to me damaged.Two items DID get to me UN-damaged, but one of them was different than the item displayed on the web site.I might shop in the showroom floor if I ever get to Oceanside and can buy FROM the stock on hand, but hell if I'll ever order anything over the web from them again.I would give them 1.5 stars if I could.  I'm only holding back from ONE star because the lady on the phone appeared to be trying to solve the problems, but she never followed up with me to make sure all the missing items were finally shipped.  I had to call her OVER and OVER.I'm still owed a footstool prop that I just gave up on getting.

5.description: I ordered 5 backdops from the the Backdrop Outlet on Nov. 27th.  Its now Jan 28th and I have still not recieved them.  Other item is ordered have been recieved, yet they havve chaged my credit card for all of the items ordered.  I have sent emails with no resonse.  I have called weekly for several week and laways get the same answer.  "They'll ship next Friday."  When I callled today and asked to speak with a CS Manager, she never bothered to call me back. I've been more than patient.   DON'T FALL FOR THESE GUYS SALES!!!  Make sure the item you order is in stock or don't order it.  My next call will be to my credit card company for a refund of my money.

6.description: Waste of time.  False Advertising. They advertised a "Warehouse Sale" this past weekend.  When you get there, the prices are higher than they are on the website! They raised the prices and then "slashed" them to make it appear they are on sale.  You could buy a $50 softbox from them online, but during their "sale" you can buy it for $79.  Which they claim is $99 regularly.  Never again from these cheating bastards.

7.description: Same horrible experience as everyone else.  I ordered 7 candy sticks on May 9th ... yeap ... 3 months ago! 1st shipment showed up in 2 tubes, both items were damaged because they were packed wrong (6 backdrops in 1 tube wound so tight I couldnt get them out!).  Then they said they would send replacements, they never did and then finally they said they had to receive the returned items before sending out the new ones.  They finally sent the new ones and they sent me a backdrop I didnt' even order and it says 2 are on backorder,  So 3 months later I am still missing 3 backdrops.  I spent over $400 with these people and it is honestly the WORST service and WORST company anyone could ever do business with.  You don't actually save money when you spend so much time contacting customer service and spending your time to repackage and send back their damaged products! Check the Better business Bureau, and other online review places.  They all say the same thing! Booooooooooo! And shame on you Backdrop Outlet!

0.description: I bought two clearance items from Backdrop Outlet at the beginning of the month. I had previously made a purchase from them of  some backdrops at a Photo Expo in South San Francisco, and thought I'd peruse their website for some bargains.I ordered two items, and about 2 days later, the status showed that one was on backorder.  How does a clearance item end up backordered? To me, that seems a bit odd.Instead of shipping the item in stock and then sending the other one immediately, it took three weeks for them to shop both items. When they arrived, neither item had instructions to it.  I readily admit that the 7'x8' backdrop folding technique is a *me* problem (and very comedic to watch me move this rather large item around the room trying to fold it up to a little 3'x3' disc.

4.description: Went this past weekend for the "sale" which was a joke. Sale prices were more than the online prices as stated in other reviews. The outlet itself is a flashback to senior portraits from the 80s. If you need plastic props or tie die muslin head on down, but Ill never take the trip out there again.

3.description: Daily saver! Yummy snacks for on the people. The line is usually long. However it is the fastest moving coffee line I have experienced without sacrificing taste. Keep up the great work!

1.description: So, so bad. This place has a captive audience in the hotel guests and they know it. It's very convenient but ridiculously overpriced and the food is terrible. We stayed at the Hyatt Regency one night when we flew in late and we were looking for something quick to eat when we stumbled across this place. For about $30 we got two sandwiches, one bag of chips, and two waters. The Italian sandwich was so salty it was inedible. The turkey was sandwiched between a loaf of bread and the promised avocado was nowhere to be found. The next morning we wanted something quick and I've never met a breakfast sandwich I didn't like - or couldn't finish - until now. The fake egg was so thick it was like biting into an eggy hockey puck. Stick to the prepackaged (but still overpriced) foods or go somewhere else - this place isn't worth a dime.

2.description: I am giving it 3 stars based just on the convenience of the store. It is convenient if you are looking for deli/grocery store type options. It is very overpriced and the selection is very bare. They sell sandwiches, chips, convenience store type food.

5.description: This is the 24 hour take out snack and coffee bar at the Hyatt Regency McCormick Place.  Kinda pricey. They have a variety of quick eats including sandwiches and Chicago made snacks.  HOWEVER, if a snack shop is open 24 hours, I would think that all their offering would be 24 hours.  Notsoatall... I wanted a hot dog, but they said NO MORE hot food.. so disappointed...  They should reconsider...

0.description: Not bad but not great eitherLocated in the Hyatt McCormick Place, the Daily Grind offers a incredible selection of prepackaged snacks but an extremely limited selection of fresh food.  It's almost like a gas station convenience store except with very gourmet high end snacks.  If you are craving a 5 dollar bag of gourmet caramel corn, Daily Grind has the hook-up.  If you are looking for a fresh sandwich or soup, your choices are limited and the options are bland and simple.

4.description: Horrible coffee, no flavor what so ever.. They were all out of hot breakfast sandwiches at 10am.. The two girls working the shop were extremely rude. If you are staying in the hotel you are better off walking a bit further to another place to grab a coffee and breakfast. Cheaper , taste better and better service... Very disappointed.

58.description: What I like most about Reggie's is that there's something for everyone. I think there's this misconception that it's this heavy metal bar all the time, but that's not the case. They have a ton of variety when it comes to shows. But music's not all they do!Reggie's is seriously a great community place, they have lots of different events there (Brewtality Beer Fest  on the rooftop, in honor of Chicago Craft Beer Week, and seriously the BEST crawfish boil in town, so much more chill than McGee's or Toons, but ssh! I don't want the secret getting out!) and they'll even shuttle you out to different events around town (Cubs v. Sox games, concerts, and the best shuttle service out to Dark Lord Day, incredible). About the Dark Lord Day shuttle: I did my research. They're one of the only bars in town that still run the shuttle, and it's absolutely free. You'll want to get there kind of early, because shuttles are first come, first serve. They offer a $10, all-you-can-eat buffet and a wristband will get you breakfast and wings/mac and cheese before AND after the event. The shuttle bus plays metal music the entire way, awesome, and you can buy your choice of local beers for $5 on the bus (can't drink you own, sorry!)

56.description: I went to the rooftop a few weeks ago for lunch. The service was among the worst (if not THE worst) I have ever had. Not until my friend's food arrived did our waitress tell me that what I ordered wasn't available. Seriously? No clue until she went to get the order from the kitchen? As if it wasn't bad enough that I sat with no food while my friend ate, the waitress never asked if I wanted a drink refill. No food. No drink. NO apology. It wasn't even busy. No excuse for this horrible service.

29.description: We had a group of about 15 people for dinner and drinks on a Saturday night a few weeks ago. Our male server (black guy wearing stocking cap) made for a terrible experience. As he would come around we could smell the fresh weed he had just smoked. Over the course of 3 hours, I'd say he smoked at least 5-6 times.It's one thing to get high at work,  but it made a mess of him. He made a lot of mistakes on the food including forgetting to place an entire order. We closed the group tab and generous tip and got our last round or 2 at the bar while listening to the band. He came over an hour later and said he accidentally deleted a whole batch of credit card payments. We had to deal with a disaster trying to charge our cards again (seemed shady) and some people had already left.No management present,  they just let their employees run wild.

42.description: The last two times I was there the service was terrible. The server was rude and this made me sad. I love the food at Reggie's. It's too bad that the people they hire keep patrons out of their establishment.

23.description: Top 5 worst service experiences of my life. The very friendly and competent bartender Molly is fully responsible for 1.5 of these 2 stars.  She was great.  That was the only favorable part of my experience.To set the scene: I met up with two friends that were visiting Reggie's for a concert/show.  I live about a half mile away. We were going to grab a bite and have a few drinks until it was time for them to see the band play.On to the experience.  I've been to the rooftop bar at Reggie's several times, and while the service hasn't been outstanding, it wasn't bad enough to keep me from coming back.  Anyways, my friends text me to let me know that they've arrived at Reggie's, so I hit the pavement and walk over there.  10-12 minutes later, I join my group in the dining room.  It was raining, so we didn't go to the rooftop. Welp, neither of my friends have drinks in front of them yet.  BAD SIGN. They had been sitting there since before I left my house, and they were beer-less when I arrived.  One of my friends advises me that the beer he ordered was out of stock.  It happens, right?  10 minutes after I arrive, the server brings my friends their beers, and I order one for myself.  My beer is out of stock as well.  So, 2 of the 3 beers we ordered were out of stock. We should've taken our lumps and cashed out then.  We legitimately waited 20 minutes longer for my backup beer to arrive.  At this point, we're 40 minutes in for 3 beers!  We go on to order dinner.  I ordered the Molly's Mixed Greens, which appears to be a simple salad.  Another 10 minutes go by, and the server swings by and says, "We're all out of Molly's Mixed Greens, we have no mix."  Not, "I'm sorry, we don't have any mixed greens, can I get you something else?"  Just, "we don't have what you ordered."  How does a place run out of mixed greens?!  There is a grocery store just blocks away!!  Continuing on..... I don't order anything else to eat, apparently I'm just drinking tonight.  After a very nice member of the kitchen staff arrives to bring my friends their meals, he says to me, "You ordered the Molly's mixed greens, right?  We've got something else for you on the way." I appreciate the effort, but I must admit, I'm a little leery of what they've got in mind.  Turns out, it doesn't matter, because nothing ever came!!!!  My friend's meal was supposed to come with a dessert that never showed up, as well.  The server never came by to check on us until we asked for the checks.  We asked for water, it never came.  Our bills came, though.  My check, of course, had a Molly's Mixed Greens on it!  Our server couldn't be bothered to come back and take our payment or fix my check, so I flagged down another server, who fixed my bill and cashed us out with speed and a smile.Keep in mind that we can't go too far, because my friends are here to see the band, and it's pouring rain.  We go up to the rooftop to get as far away from this atrocious experience as possible.  Much to our dismay, the only open tables that were covered from the rain were reserved for a birthday party.  Sh*t, we've gotta go back downstairs.  We decide that we'll stay, as long as we can get seats at the bar, or in the front lounge area. Happily, there was space for us to sit up front.  No more servers, we're ordering directly from the bar from here on out.  Molly was really nice, and didn't seem like she was bothered by people ordering drinks.  What a concept!  And the icing on the cake, one of the beers that our server informed us was "out of stock" was absolutely in stock!  To sum it all up, Reggie's didn't have the food I ordered or the drink I ordered.  Our waiter made us feel like we were a burden to him, which is completely unacceptable. This caliber of service seems to be a recurring theme on Yelp.  Hopefully management eventually takes notice and makes changes.  In the meantime, I will not be returning.

47.description: Bus for the concert leaves at six. No problem!  We showed up at 5:30. Then we were told to go ahead and order food because there would be a bus to bring us to outlet venue at 6:45. Ok- still enough time to get us to or of our fav bands in the burbs. But after poor, slow service and no sign of a bus five minutes before the concert start time (venue at least 30 minutes away), there is still no sign of the promised shuttle! So we split a can between two other couples to the venue. No problem, right? Until it's time to leave and we have no clue where to pick uo the Reggie's bus and I have to pay over $100 for a cab back into the city. Thanks for nothing Reggie's! You really suck.

8.description: Impressive music venue/bar in south loop, you can listen to live music on the first floor, or visit the large record/movie store on the second floor, or you can go to the 3rd floor to the regular bar and play pool and watch TV, all the floors are pretty cool, parking isnt too bad or you can get off at the green line 22nd street stop, always a good time there

31.description: I came here on a Tuesday evening for their wing special. They had live music and charged a cover fee of $5 a person, but it got you a beer. The catch is, you have to buy an additional beer to get the wing special price of 40cents per wing. Lame, if you ask me, since we didn't come for the music and wasn't planning on drinking that night. We just wanted to eat some wings! Anyways, we got buffalo wings and buffal-q wings. The buffalo flavor is a bit spicy but delicious. The buffal-q isn't too bad either. It just tasted like spicy bbq flavor to me. We got side orders of fries, cheese fries, & mac and cheese. The fries were nothing to rave about, the cheese fries were better than the regular fries, and the mac and cheese was probably our best side order we had. Overall the  food was pretty good.

34.description: I came specifically for the fried pickles I heard people raving about. They're pretty good, definitely not what I'm used to in a fried pickle. They're also served with honey mustard...different for me, but in a good way. The beer selection is plentiful and the prices are decent. Customer service could use a little help, but overall this is a pretty cool spot.

16.description: Staff was rude and made me the butt of a joke for no reason when I was there for a friend's concert. Will never go back.

13.description: Pros:Street parkingOkay drinks (I've been spoiled so not many places are fantastic) Different types of music Attracts mid level artist and Grammy award winnersConverts nicely into a sports bar or a place to have bar food and laughsLarge dance floor and a large seating area - this place is just BIG! Cons: The vibe of the place changes based on the type of music they play so some nights it's not as diverse. -

11.description: Great thing about this place is that it is close to home and they have daily drink specials. It is also very chilled. Other than that, I think service can be better which can make the whole experience more enjoyable.

39.description: Took a chance to go to Reggie's with my mom and 17 year old brother... And it rocked. Staff was friendly, they had my favorite beer on tap: Hoegaarden, and the band was awesome! It was a great time and before long people were up and dancing. So much fun.

37.description: Pros:Street parkingOkay drinks (I've been spoiled so not many places are fantastic) Different types of music Attracts mid level artist and Grammy award winnersConverts nicely into a sports bar or a place to have bar food and laughsLarge dance floor and a large seating area - this place is just BIG! Cons: The vibe of the place changes based on the type of music they play so some nights it's not as diverse. -

0.description: Ambiance: downstairs has many cool retro rock and Chicago posters and paraphernalia and is dimly lit, I'd expect shows to be very fun here; there's also a roofdeck that's open in the summerService: nothing bad, nothing specialFood: no dining this timeDrinks: spectacular specials and a big variety; I had a Bloody Mary that was interesting b/c they added Guinness to it but it was still tasty

38.description: Went to a show here this past summer. I was a little skeptical at first, knowing it was closer to the south side of Chicago, but man, was I glad I went.We started off in the main bar area. Dimly lit, but in a way that gives off an awesome, intimate atmosphere. There was a pretty good band playing in the background on a small stage. Food was FANTASTIC (although it took the bartender a while to realize we were ready to order) and everyone I encountered there was very friendly.Some unique things about Reggies is the artwork... of pretty much every "Reggie" ever to exist in sports, painted on a wall. There is also a record/CD store upstairs which has a ridiculous selection, especially for fans of punk rock.The music venue itself (this is in a different room connected to the bar) was stellar. Sound was good and the size was perfect. There is also another bar there, ready to serve up the PBR all night.Parking may be an issue, so I would get there early for shows. We actually parked over a mile away, and not once did I feel threatened or nervous walking the streets.

51.description: I told myself I wouldn't leave anymore negative reviews and I would talk to the staff on site. However, there was no one to talk to in this case. It's definitely a busy Tuesday, I understand that. My friend arrived at a table at least 10mins earlier than I did and we still waited to be serviced. While we were eating, we witnessed our server tend to other tables and bypass us. I left the outside and went to my server at the bar to ask for to go boxes for our food. I then went to the bar and asked if there was a manager on duty. Her response was, "I don't know. She's probably upstairs dealing with something important."I'm a server, I understand busy but I don't appreciate being forgotten and then bring treated like I'm unimportant. Wings were cool as far as taste, drinks were alright. But the lack of service makes me not want to return.
