I did talk to my server and it seems there was a miscommunication between her and who took my order but there's a bad taste in my mouth and I more than likely will not return. On a more positive note, the music was excellent! But service is what keeps me coming back.

27.description: ABSOLUTELY one of my fav places to watch games...hangout...or hear a band.  They have GREAT specials every night of the week!!! EVERY NIGHT! Wednesday is my FAV (1/2 price Appetizers w/Drink order...$4 Stella/Hoegaarden). Street parking (metered) is pretty easy to find. An all around great place!

32.description: Reggie's is a rock bar. Half of it is laid back, the other half is the hard core/ rappers music scene. I've only been to the laid back half. The food is delicious. Each day of the week they have a special and the food is half off on certain days. There's half off sandwiches on Thursday, and their mushroom burger is really good. My favorite food is the BBQ chicken wings. It is so crispy and flavorful. I can eat 16 of these. The bar always seems short-staffed during lunch. It always takes so long to get my food, so I don't go too often during lunch. In the summer, head to their roof. It's scenic and chill. It's really easy to have a good time there.

54.description: Came to check this place out because they have a rooftop bar. Came in and the crowd was diverse and it wasn't bad. However, they are extremely understaffed with 3 people working the bar and one of them is also the server. I was feeling kinda hungry so I ordered wings at the bar. I came back twice cause the wings took 30 mins and it was tough trying to wait for people to order their drinks just so I can check on the status of my wings cause theres only 1 server for the whole rooftop and I didn't order through her. So I got my wings in around 30 mins and they were really good. I'll say top 3 in Chicago. The 312 was also cheap.

48.description: So let me start by saying this place has the worst customer service I've ever experienced. Great deals and drink specials but the overall experience in the main venue sucks. I was here today and waited an hour before I was serviced. I tapped the waitress 3 times and each time she acted like she was on another planet.After expressing my disservice to another staff member the manger came over and said that the restaurant was an hour behind. Sounds like someone needs to go back to the drawing board and learn how to effectively run a restaurant.One word to describe the service here...ghetto.

44.description: I would give Reggie's 0 stars if I could. Great bar and rooftop; horrible customer service. Loved Reggie's and continued to support them despite sporadically abysmal service because it's relatively close to my office. We've held several after-work functions here and I hoped to continue to patronize them because of their proximity. After having drinks spilled on me and my boss by an unapologetic waitress and a serious run-in with a nasty barkeep over an aggressive patron playing pool, I'm done with this establishment. I told the unprofessional bartender (who did not overhear the altercation, but sided with the jerk patron) as much and he agreed that I should never return after calling me a liar. I thought it best to exceed his request and share this incident with my friends, family and Yelp so that they can be forewarned of how Reggie's treats patrons.

24.description: Great thing about this place is that it is close to home and they have daily drink specials. It is also very chilled. Other than that, I think service can be better which can make the whole experience more enjoyable.

7.description: 2nd time here but going to make it every time in come in to Chicago. Great wings and selection of beers. Only been here during lunch time. Going to see make it here for one of there shows at night time.

49.description: This "joint" took out a booth at Roscoe Village Burger Fest 2014. Another vendor, McGee's, had a burger that blew this places' chorizo slider out of the water. I don't think I will ever head here. What is it with burgers and heavy metal (Kuma's, Reggie's). It makes me want to try Au Cheval!

40.description: This place is really cool. It's definitely a spot for underground performers who are on the come up. They have good vibes but sometime s their staff can be a bit rude

53.description: Been here a few times for drinks, never really eaten here. Great atmosphere especially the upstairs patio

30.description: I like seeing shows at this place, but I hate coming here due to the staff here are absolutely awful.  I once ordered a burger when I was sitting at the bar and after 45 minutes of waiting for my burger I asked some fat rude asian bartender named Megan where it was.  I watched her walk over to the other end of the bar and pick up a plate with my burger from under the bar then bring it over to me.  I asked her how long it was sitting over there and she replied that I should have asked where it was earlier in an extremely rude tone. I told her that it was not my responsibility to keep asking where my food is, and I told her that if it was cold I wasn't going to pay for it.  She replied that she didn't care and walked away. The burger was cold but I was starving, with a stomach full of beer and I just ate it.

46.description: Horrible Service. None of the Servers acted like they cared about us or how long we waited for beers or food.. But place is great to see band, and the food is great.. Hard to believe after all the reviews stating how bad the service is they haven't changed it !

1.description: My boyfriend and I came in on a Sunday, a little before dinner, the place was slightly dead... not exactly what I expected but I didn't let that ruin the evening. I have to say that the atmosphere is pretty cool, I didn't know what to expect with this visit being my first time. Overall the food was ok (see attached photos) and my Boyfriend and I had an ok time! Our visit could've been better, there were a few things - service wise - that definitely took some points off the overall experience. The service wasn't as attentive, our server definitely made it clear that he didn't want to be there. The server usually helps set the mood, unfortunately it was very clear from the beginning that my Boyfriend and I would have to bite our tongues on a few things... We just didn't think we'd be right!!!As far as service was concerned, Yes - our waiter checked on us a few times but never engaged. The service was cold and slightly uncomfortable and I made it a point to ignore it. It seemed very uncomfortable and difficult to ASK for a refill. You can't expect me to ration a plastic cup (smaller than a Beer Pong Cup) that is 70% ice and 30% 7UP... are you kidding me!?Anyways, we started with the Nachos and I have to say that I fell in love! I'm a big Nachos girl and Reggie's Nachos are high up on my list.I ordered the Veggie Burger En Fuego - With Fried Onions and an Egg on top - Side of French Fries. My Boyfriend ordered the Ribeye Steak Sandwich - Hold the onions - with a side of Mashed Potatoes (A suggestion that was made by the waiter himself). *** Can you guess how his came out? ***The sandwich came out with what looked like extra onions & French Fries -- Seriously?!My Boyfriend being a kind well mannered man he ignored the mistake... I on the other hand was shocked and a little disappointed considering we were 1 of 4 tables. It wasn't busy at all and you'd think the service would reflect that. WRONG!I enjoyed my food and my Boyfriend was indifferent about his. I feel like we were kindof cheated out of what could've been a great night! Obviously, I am not a fan of the lack of service... Get it together!

55.description: Love this place. My husband and I have been stopping here for the past two years now. Great service! Good food! Awesome atmosphere! Now we bring our kids and friends here for brunch on their rooftop patio weekends.

9.description: Wow got here and the lady she devil bartender was soooooo rude. Never will come here again. I came here on vacation to have a great time and this lady had the most snobbish attitude. I came into an establishment to spend money and have a great time and wow. Please just don't come here spend your money in a place where the give a f%#!

26.description: Always order delivery. I don't drink and not big on the bar scene.  Their burgers are really juicy and delicious and I love their Southwest Chicken Salad. Also. Big ++ are their chicken wings. Sometimes they forget my can pop when I order and they bring it right back!

25.description: I came here with some co-workers for lunch. I was the first to arrive and I stuck my head in the door to my horror. It was dark and stank like a locker room that serves alcohol. I walked in to wash my hands and I just shouldn't have bothered. As they were cleaner before I touched anything. The rest of our party shows up and TG we sat outside. Our waitress was as crusty as shit. One guy asked about what beer they had and she asked if he looked at the menu? And then proceeded to tell us she'll be back when we figure it out. I was not looking forward to ordering food. When she graced us with her presence, I got the buffalo chicken. It was actually very good. Spicy and crunchy and no needles or razor blades sticking out of it. The waitress got real nice around the time she brought the bill. Funny how that works. But I wouldn't come back here if Martha Stewart scrubbed the shit out of this place! But then again, I'm too old for this crowd.

12.description: I had a bad first experience here and because of that I will not be back and I definitely would not recommend it to others.  Food was mediocre to poor, but the one thing that really turned us off was the bad service. Our waitress was accommodating, sat us wherever we wanted to be seated, and approached us in a timely manner to take down our order. We were starving and wanted to get started with an appetizer, so we ordered their "best in the city" chicken wings with buffalo sauce. We waited, and waited...and waited. While we waited, our waitress was seated a few tables away from us chatting with either a customer or another waitress. Boyfriend was cranky from hunger and his crankiness started getting me cranky. Finally, food comes from one of the guys (assuming cook) in the back. Our entrees were placed in front of us, but not the wings. We let him know, he interrupts the seated waitress from her conversation, and she scurries to the back. We wait a few minutes more and finally get our wings. When asked if the order for the wings was put in, she just told us that it was, but a rush of people came up to the rooftop because it started getting nice out and the cook was really busy. No apologies, just excuses. Never did she come back to ask us how the food was or if we needed anything. She was actually by one of the registers off to our side, on her phone while it was plugged into the wall. She certainly was more attentive to her phone than to us. We had to flag her down to get a knife for the burger and then for the bill.  As for the food...I was really craving nachos and decided to order them as an entree. However, these were the worst nachos I've ever had in my entire life. Tortillas were really greasy, meat and melted cheese were dry and tasteless, tomatoes were slushy, and I couldn't find any onion. My high school cafeteria did a better job with nachos and I found myself longing for them instead of his pile of disgust. The only thing I enjoyed on the plate were the japalenos. I felt like I was eating crunchy, rubbery grease with jalapenos. I think I forced myself to eat about an eighth of the entire dish...what a waste of $12.50!! The buffalo wings were decent in size but I didn't think they were the city's best. They tasted like typical hot wings to me. It was as if they were tossed once in some kind of hot sauce and served to us. The burger was alright.  After the unsatisfying food, we actually went to another restaurant in Little Italy. Total let-down!

59.description: Ugh.  Went to the rooftop on Sunday, thinking it'd be a little slow.  Bad guess.  Forgot it was time for the fair-weather B-Hawks fans to come out in scores.  Packed to the gills and pressured to buy a bbq-all-you-can-eat wristband before we'd even grabbed a seat.  Of which there were none.  We opted out of the all you can eat, thankfully.  Went downstairs after seeing that the rooftop wasn't an option, debating if we should just drive up to F-- & S-----, but seeing a bevvy of street-level patio tables open, opted to stay.  Downstairs was pretty dead.  Waited, patiently, for 10 minutes.  No one came.  Husband went in to ask for a menu. He was told a server would be out soon.Perused menu.  Waited, less patiently, another 10 minutes.  We've yet to so much as be greeted. Husband walked into the bar to see if we could just order with the bartender.  Was told (again) a server would be out shortly.Again, we sat and waited at our table.  God knows how long.  STILL, no server. I decided to go into bar to order a couple drinks. Waited a few minutes without the (single) bartender acknowledging me. Left.  Consulted with husband.Tried again a few minutes later to have bartender cut me off and tell me he would find my server before I could finish my question (why can't I just order a couple of f-ing beers????)Waited.  Again.   Nothing.   Again. Meanwhile, we got to watch and listen to all the other staff stand around, smoking outside, joking, and bitching.  I started wondering if hubs and I simply didn't have enough tattoos or maybe we should have dusted out our Doc Martens and  Ramone's tees to fit in here.  Till we heard the table next to us complain that they hadn't gotten their drinks or dinner either (that they'd ordered 45 minutes ago.  .  .)     We spent almost an hour here, and were seriously NOT ALLOWED to spend our money.  Didn't drop a dime and listened to the employees standing in front of our table literally SNICKER at us as we FINALLY walked away.  Seriously Reggies?  So glad you make enough cash to turn away paying customers--in a very passive aggressive and insulting way. At any rate, we took our money elsewhere.  There are many choices in the south loop, don't waste your time.  We've been here several times before over the years, and experienced the very hit-or-miss service and dining.  After this one though--no thanks.  What a f-ing dump.  This was our last try here.

21.description: I have never been inside reggies to comment on the service, in which I hear is horrible but this review is on the Burger that I had at the Roscoe Village Burger Fest it was very very good and we had the chance to add our own toppings. I also had the Mac n cheese it was kinda mushy and sorta bland. But the burger was awesome!

17.description: We had a group of about 15 people for dinner and drinks on a Saturday night a few weeks ago. Our male server (black guy wearing stocking cap) made for a terrible experience. As he would come around we could smell the fresh weed he had just smoked. Over the course of 3 hours, I'd say he smoked at least 5-6 times.It's one thing to get high at work,  but it made a mess of him. He made a lot of mistakes on the food including forgetting to place an entire order. We closed the group tab and generous tip and got our last round or 2 at the bar while listening to the band. He came over an hour later and said he accidentally deleted a whole batch of credit card payments. We had to deal with a disaster trying to charge our cards again (seemed shady) and some people had already left.No management present,  they just let their employees run wild.

10.description: Love this place.  Food is great and plentiful.  Salads are fresh (love the south west salad!!!!!) french fries are freshly cut, burgers are a good size and who can't resist $1 tacos and 1/2 price draft beers on Mondays. By the way, awesome draft selection.  Sometimes service may be slow but we live in the neighborhood and for all the times we've been here, we are happy with the service and staff.  Not many places have consistent staff and this is one of them, which I think speaks a lot for the place. Check out a show at one of their spots.

5.description: Music club and bar on the first floor?  Record store on the 2nd?  Rooftop patio?  All in one place?  Hell yeah!  Shuttles to various concerts and sporting events?  Free?  Package deals to concerts and sporting events?  Are you kidding me?  Especially the Sox games on Sunday.Haven't had any of their menu food, but the buffet before the Sox games I've been to has been decent.  It's cheap buffet food so if you are expecting to be blown away you need to evaluate what you are doing here in the first place.  I've sure ate my fill while there without complaints.  Beer selection is quite good for a place that advertises itself as a music joint and is quite divey.It's a music joint.  Know that when you go there.  It's not an ultra lounge.  It's not some trendy hipster mixology place.  Love heading there during summer visits to Chicago.

3.description: We been here many times with friends for the White Sox game day deals. Is all summer long almost every other Sunday. Is $12 and that includes all you can eat at Reggie's (chicken, hotdogs,  hamburgers etc..) and a a ticket and free shuttle to the White Sox game.. Now that Is a Sunday Funday all for $12!!! The also have great drinks and beer specials. They have a awesome rooftop you can enjoy while you eat. Check their website for the game schedules. Get your friends together for a fun and cheap Sunday funday!!!

35.description: Reggie s is a kick ass place to eat drink and rock out ,they treat you like a old school bar, the wings are awesome,my favorite is the blackened cat fish sandwich and the Marconi and cheese beats my mom's,I work at McCormick place and that's how I found it,but  now that I found it and it's staff and food and music ,I don't want to lose it .check it out for yourself you will love it too,Rock and roll

19.description: I told myself I wouldn't leave anymore negative reviews and I would talk to the staff on site. However, there was no one to talk to in this case. It's definitely a busy Tuesday, I understand that. My friend arrived at a table at least 10mins earlier than I did and we still waited to be serviced. While we were eating, we witnessed our server tend to other tables and bypass us. I left the outside and went to my server at the bar to ask for to go boxes for our food. I then went to the bar and asked if there was a manager on duty. Her response was, "I don't know. She's probably upstairs dealing with something important."I'm a server, I understand busy but I don't appreciate being forgotten and then bring treated like I'm unimportant. Wings were cool as far as taste, drinks were alright. But the lack of service makes me not want to return. I did talk to my server and it seems there was a miscommunication between her and who took my order but there's a bad taste in my mouth and I more than likely will not return. On a more positive note, the music was excellent! But service is what keeps me coming back.

28.description: I had a bad first experience here and because of that I will not be back and I definitely would not recommend it to others.  Food was mediocre to poor, but the one thing that really turned us off was the bad service. Our waitress was accommodating, sat us wherever we wanted to be seated, and approached us in a timely manner to take down our order. We were starving and wanted to get started with an appetizer, so we ordered their "best in the city" chicken wings with buffalo sauce. We waited, and waited...and waited. While we waited, our waitress was seated a few tables away from us chatting with either a customer or another waitress. Boyfriend was cranky from hunger and his crankiness started getting me cranky. Finally, food comes from one of the guys (assuming cook) in the back. Our entrees were placed in front of us, but not the wings. We let him know, he interrupts the seated waitress from her conversation, and she scurries to the back. We wait a few minutes more and finally get our wings. When asked if the order for the wings was put in, she just told us that it was, but a rush of people came up to the rooftop because it started getting nice out and the cook was really busy. No apologies, just excuses. Never did she come back to ask us how the food was or if we needed anything. She was actually by one of the registers off to our side, on her phone while it was plugged into the wall. She certainly was more attentive to her phone than to us. We had to flag her down to get a knife for the burger and then for the bill.  As for the food...I was really craving nachos and decided to order them as an entree. However, these were the worst nachos I've ever had in my entire life. Tortillas were really greasy, meat and melted cheese were dry and tasteless, tomatoes were slushy, and I couldn't find any onion. My high school cafeteria did a better job with nachos and I found myself longing for them instead of his pile of disgust. The only thing I enjoyed on the plate were the japalenos. I felt like I was eating crunchy, rubbery grease with jalapenos. I think I forced myself to eat about an eighth of the entire dish...what a waste of $12.50!! The buffalo wings were decent in size but I didn't think they were the city's best. They tasted like typical hot wings to me. It was as if they were tossed once in some kind of hot sauce and served to us. The burger was alright.  After the unsatisfying food, we actually went to another restaurant in Little Italy. Total let-down!

45.description: I have a special place in my heart for Reggie's. They had this Wednesday night open mike thing for DJs to play a set with vinyl records. We dig this since my guy is a DJ and vinyl purest. We met some awesome people on our numerous Wednesday jams....in fact, we met our wedding DJs there! Besides the musical venue aspects of the place, the food is pretty good as well...at least the wings are. I know I've had more than wings there, but the wings are what seriously stand out. Makes me want some right now, in fact. And the special little attention we felt when our server, Ryan, remembered every week what we like to drink, didn't hurt at all.

33.description: 5 stars is all you need to know.Go there now.

43.description: This is a pretty cool place. I see a lot of reviews on here talk about crappy service, but our server was incredibly pleasant and friendly. He was really sociable and professional. Just make sure you tell your server if you want your check split up at the very beginning, because they won't do it at the end. When we settled the check and started ordering drinks from the bar, our bartender was also great. It was a Thursday night, so not as busy as a Saturday or a Sunday, but she was quick to take our order and was just as polite as our server. Thursdays they have half off burgers and sandwiches. I got a french toast chicken sandwich, and it was delicious. My friends all got burgers, and they only had good things to say as well. The drink specials were also pretty decent, and I'd definitely say both food and drinks were accurately priced.In terms of the actual space, it's not great for groups. If you have more than 6-8 people in your party, you'll probably end up splitting up. But that's not awful, there's a lot of little tables all over the place. The patio is also a nice environment. The bands were great, although the space is a little small for that level of volume. Definitely more about the music than about socializing with your friends, so keep that in mind. And oh, also, the bathrooms were really gross, so prepare for that.

2.description: While on a road trip this past summer, I stopped at a bar in Savannah, GA. I met a cool couple who told me they worked/owned this place. Since I was planning on coming in town to see a show at The House of Blues, I decided to look it up and see if I could stop by while I was in town. Turns out it is also a concert venue, that a different band my BF and I love was playing the night we flew in! We did not have time to eat there, but the venue was cool. Prices of beer and booze was reasonable, I am so glad we got to go!!!!

18.description: I went with my cousins and my best friend  to attend the Pancakes and Booze Art Show. The artists that were showcased were very talented. It was great to see a variety of artists with different styles come together and be able to express themselves via their art. When we first arrived the vibe was very laid back, relaxing music in the background  and we were able to walk around and talk with the artists and look at most of the exhibits. As the night progressed a DJ came out, the music got louder and it became difficult to talk with the artists that were placed 15 feet from the stage and the speakers. The DJ was good and the music was good it was just loud and made ir difficult to talk with tge artisists. We went outside and ordered some appetizers and then went back in. By this time the band was on the stage and there were drunk, rude and ignorant people all in front of the stage. Yes the band was good and we enjoyed the music but to place artists 15 feet from the stage with drunken patrons who are leaning against the makeshift walls and artists pieces are being knocked off and broken. Security  was NON EXISTENT. When I went to the page and posted my comments they were removed.  When artists posted that their work was damaged the people in charge of their social media deleted those comments as well This was our first time at Reggies and while the venue itself looked cool this event was poorly planned and executed. The fact that they ignore the artists and then delete my comments as well as theirs and do not even have the common courtesy to respond is unacceptable and cowardly. I will NOT be going to this establishment for any kind of function or just to hang out. Very disappointed in this place.

41.description: I love this place. good food and great service.

52.description: I've only been there on Tuesdays, for their drinks and wings special.  The wings are phenomenal.  Only a quarter and they are huge!  The drinks are pretty good, not too cheap with the liquor.  NOW, the service on the other hand, thats another story.  I think they specifically hire the ruddest slowest people on purpose.  Ive been more times than I can count, and only had great service ONCE, we were on the rooftop.  I'm big on customer service, so its hard for me to brush it off, but hey for 25cent wings, I'll live.

50.description: Myself and my friend's have had some great times here in the past 2 years! With that being said, this review is mainly about the poor service. I've kept going back for convenience and with hopes that the bad experiences were just them having a bad day. After these 2 years, that's just impossible to have that many bad days..... Also VERY consistent throughout the staff of unfriendliness attitudes! Definitely not a service with a smile place!!!!!!!! Vibe is awesome, coming from the patron's that is!!! Very cool atmosphere, live bands and very good bands at that! Although the staff is in need of some guidance and most definitely some manners, or perhaps guidance on just plain being friendly! Most of them (not all, but most) look and give off such an uneasy and just downright rude attitude towards patrons, it's hard to believe the place stays in business! I'm born and raised in Chicago and we are pretty friendly approachable people, I expect to feel comfortable and happy when coming here.....nope, doesn't happen. Always feel like I've walked into a time warp and I'm in another State.....A State of unfriendliness and full of ass*#%*s! :/!!!!! We were there for drinks a few months ago, sat at the bar with a good friend for a few hours. We literally just wanted to have some drinks, chat, forget about some problems for awhile and laugh.....well humongous damper was brought on by the female bartender! With every single drink order she brought her bitchiness....couldn't believe what was happening!!!! Well, her tip reflected this! She did look cool with her bandanna and all!!!!! LOLBut her attitude sucked!!!!! I'm a huge tipper, definitely at least 20 perc, usually always way more.... I know a lot of server's get treated poorly and it's a shitty job at times, but if someone is greeting and treating you with a smile and respect shouldn't the server react in the same manner?!!!!! Tough job, but each customer is different, these servers should try and remember this. Maybe their tips would reflect with a new change in their NEW attitude! Patrons usually pay a cover at the door for the live bands. Going here to eat and drink and just looking to unwind and have a good time, only to be met with the uppity attitudes of the servers! Just Sucks, any way you slice it! Upstairs bartender, front door guy with long hair and the bus driver are always very nice, informative and welcoming! I wish I knew their names to give them the credit they deserve!!!!!! Place needs more people like this!!!!! Mostly for the past 2 years of living right around the corner from here the experience is always the same....poor and very unfriendly. The staff acts as if they are being put out when you ask for a beer at the bar, or if they have a certain beer etc. Had dinner and beers as recently as last night, took 25 minutes for our waiter and he was so busy he really never came back until we had to flag him down, also had to go to bar for our own water, never got our order of onion rings and 3 of us were sick to our stomachs an hour after eating there! :/ Looks as though the place has now become under staffed, think our waiter was actually a guy that helps set up the stage etc..... Poor thing, looked like he was totally out of his element. So, just because you're a "COOL rocker type venue" doesn't excuse the fact that you're treating your paying customers like CRAP! Lastly, one good thing about this place was the wide beer selection.... Basically this is what has kept us coming back, not to mention plain convenience, although last night they were out of a few of our first selections off the menu. Then after ordering our beers, our server handed us a smaller beer menu with the beer options. I'm thinking that now the ONE great thing about this place has been removed! Not a great beer selection, so why go back?!!! :( ATTENTION: Manager or owner should take note or the doors will close forever and that would be a shame because the place has potential to be a long standing staple in the SouthLoop! This is of course is if only the owner would wake up from his slumber and take note of his rude and unfriendly employees!!!! Please make some much needed good changes to this place.... Would love to see the improvements and have a cool place to always come back to with good friends to enjoy some good beers!

4.description: I came here on a Tuesday evening for their wing special. They had live music and charged a cover fee of $5 a person, but it got you a beer. The catch is, you have to buy an additional beer to get the wing special price of 40cents per wing. Lame, if you ask me, since we didn't come for the music and wasn't planning on drinking that night. We just wanted to eat some wings! Anyways, we got buffalo wings and buffal-q wings. The buffalo flavor is a bit spicy but delicious. The buffal-q isn't too bad either. It just tasted like spicy bbq flavor to me. We got side orders of fries, cheese fries, & mac and cheese. The fries were nothing to rave about, the cheese fries were better than the regular fries, and the mac and cheese was probably our best side order we had. Overall the  food was pretty good.

6.description: Congratulations to this establishment for making my Yelp debut. One of their servers was annoyed with me from the time I got there because I didn't have a Slayer t shirt and neck tattoos. He didn't want to help me spend my money at the bar since he ignored me constantly and tried to be rude on purpose. On top of shitty service I got all night it was clearly justified to only tip him 10 % due to how rude and annoyed he was all night. As I'm leaving, their bartender comes up to me and gets in my face about why I only tipped him 10 % and not 20 %. I was lost for words honestly. Never have I dealt with someone so shitty in service and he comes up to me asking why I left him a poor tip. On top of that he tried to get in my face. Your bartender got in my face while working to get a better tip. I hope he gets fired or got fired since then. Super unprofessional. I'm never spending a dime here again and will never recommend this place to anyone. If you're into shitty service, this is the place for you.

22.description: Good food, terrible service. I came here on a Tuesday to order wings for the half off special. My group and I were all fasting for the month of Ramadan and time was running short to break fast. I went to the bar to see if I can order early. The lady gave me attitude saying that I could only get the special if I were seated and it would have to be through a server. There were no seats available first off. We went up to the rooftop but they wouldn't let me in because they thought my out of state drivers license was fake. Since time was running short I said whatever I'll pay double the rate, which is the original price and take it to go. We finally found an outdoor table. I came back to the bar to see if the food could be taken to the table once it was ready. The bartender started giving me attitude saying that I already ordered to go. Then when I said I was aware I simply wanted to get the order placed ASAP and now I had found a table she said that I should've waited with to find a table, with a terribly rude voice. I am paying double the amount and still dining in, as well as ordering plenty of drinks for my group at the table like the special requires. I wasn't asking to receive the half off special price anymore I simply wanted it brought to the outdoor table. She made a big fuss about it and when I asked to speak to the manager, it turned out she was the manager! No wonder I am reading all these reviews about terrible service, of course the service would be terrible when the manager is as unprofessional as she is. I'm not even going to go into how terrible the service was once we were seated. The black guy with the hat should not work there along with the manager.

15.description: Very Poor service!!  Bartenders took forever to bring our food and the expensive drinks weren't worth it!  We will not be supporting this establishment ever again!

57.description: What can I say. The service. Tuh! First time here and it's very clear they are short staffed, which is completely understandable but would be easier to digest if the attitude of the wait staff were better. The blonde is the worse! I despise bad service and she is the epitome. I said excuse me and she said very aggressively "in a minute". Then, after trying to get someone's attention for about 20 minutes I finally walked to the bar for napkins, she looked over me to avoid eye contact, looked annoyed by me asking for napkins at the bar and aggressively handed me only 2 napkins. Meanwhile, I'm a party of 4 and we're all eating hot wings! TF am I supposed to do with 2 napkins?! Anyway, cool location, ok food, terrible service.

20.description: Music club and bar on the first floor?  Record store on the 2nd?  Rooftop patio?  All in one place?  Hell yeah!  Shuttles to various concerts and sporting events?  Free?  Package deals to concerts and sporting events?  Are you kidding me?  Especially the Sox games on Sunday.Haven't had any of their menu food, but the buffet before the Sox games I've been to has been decent.  It's cheap buffet food so if you are expecting to be blown away you need to evaluate what you are doing here in the first place.  I've sure ate my fill while there without complaints.  Beer selection is quite good for a place that advertises itself as a music joint and is quite divey.It's a music joint.  Know that when you go there.  It's not an ultra lounge.  It's not some trendy hipster mixology place.  Love heading there during summer visits to Chicago.

36.description: Burger well done, tater tots ,gumball head beer, and chicken noodle soup.  Greatest thing in chicago!

14.description: I loved the BBQ wings, the chicken sandwich was just okay...better after I added BBQ sauce.I'm not into rock and I certainly didn't feel like I fit it, but the staffed didn't acknowledge that.  Probably won't go back but enjoyed it just for something different from a chain Resturant.  The patio looked cool.  Might go back for that if its not too hot.

12.description: This is a restaurant in the Shedd. The Shedd is a museum, meaning its resources, for the most part, get spent toward the fishies and outreach. I'm okay with that. So when I walk into the Soundings Cafe, I'm not expecting much. After all, it's just there for our convenience, not because the people at the Shedd really like cooking food. I'm going to say it: seeing all those fish made me really want seafood. Don't tell me you saw that Japanese Spider Crab and didn't think "with just a little lemon and butter you would be DELICIOUS!". I did. That's exactly what I thought.But, I digress. I was hungry and I wanted seafood. Much to my surprise, they have a sustainable seafood option! How cool! Tilapia with pasta and garlic sauce. It was pretty good, definitely exceeded expectations. The Tilapia was well seasoned and cooked just right. The real standout though was their Southwestern Salad. Seriously, I could eat those all day long.Either way, the meal is way better than the cold ham and cheese sammich I was expecting. I'd go back!

7.description: Pizza is garbage! Coffee is cold.  Stick to burrito bowl and bottled drinks which are severely overpriced!

19.description: Soundings Restaurant is located inside the John G. Shedd Aquarium.  We stopped here for lunch. I highly recommend it over the cafeteria/food court downstairs.I had a grilled chicken sandwich with grilled peppers, bacon and cheese.It came with french fries.  It was  good and inexpensive($9) considering the views, decor and service. The views here are fabulous. You have a beautiful view of the city and Lake Michigan.  It was a nice and romantic.  The servers are wonderful - very attentive and helpful.  Definitely a must if you plan on eating at the museum.  There are not many restaurant/eating options nearby, so it really is special.

1.description: If you step outside, the view is amazing but the food is overpriced & slow to serve with a limited menu.  "Don't expect anything and you won't be disappointed lol." Just remember how long the line was upon your arrival.  Those are the two hundred people that will be hungry, along with you, at lunch time.  The one thing we did find that was semi affordable & that we all could share was the cheese plate.  I have to admit that it was tasty to my palate since I never had goat cheese before but after waiting 20 minutes for service (with a growling stomach) perhaps a slice of cardboard with red sauce would have been 5 stars.  The Shedd is packed with families that walk around working up an appetite.  Bring some food items / snacks to "tide you over" (1860 version aka tie you over) and you will have a better more fulfilling experience not pressed by hunger.

2.description: If you're looking to avoid the mad rush of the lunch crowd as we were, Soundings isn't a bad plan. And something tells me the food court would have been overpriced *and* not tasted as good.As it was, at 11:45 on a Sunday we had room to stretch our legs and then some, which I found a bit odd. I ordered the burger ($14) for myself, while my wife had a pork sandwich ($11-ish) and we ordered the quesadilla for the kid. Pro tip: if you come here, consider ordering from just the kids meal section if they'll let you. The quesadilla, while dry, was huge and enough for two dinners for a 2-year old. Only $5!As it was, my wife liked the pork sandwich and I thought my burger OK. They didn't ask me how I liked it cooked, and it came out medium-well. The ingredients I thought were of great quality, but the seasoning was lacking. The fries were well seasoned, but essentially limp. Bacon was nice and crispy though!So no, don't expect a gourmet burger while you're here. Service was very good overall, though; friendly and helpful. The views of the city from our window booth were great. Plus the restaurant was a good respite from all those other tourists out there!

9.description: The Staff R Nice. The View of the City Skyline and Lake whist U eat is remarkable. The Food, Well My sister wouldn't eat there she said. I snuck away to get some soup, n a well it served its purpose I guess. Took them like 2 askings to get water.

6.description: If you're at the Shedd Aquarium, this is the place to eat.  The food wasn't to die for, but it was good.  Given the location, service, other limited options in the area and the quality of the food for the money...this place is the best you'll get at the Shedd (hence the 5 stars).We were all pretty hungry and the other food options in the area were more fast food cafeteria style, the Bubble Net food court and the Deep Ocean Cafe...both of which were too close to the smells of the water animals.Soundings is a sit down restaurant, we had a short wait of about 10 minutes for our buzzer to tell us there was room for a table of 6.  We ordered with the cashier, they gave us a number to place on our table and then we entered the dining room to find a clean open table.  The wait staff and bus staff that work that dining room, worked hard.  Our waiter was really great, very friendly and kept my Dad caffeinated with a full cup of coffee...and we're all thankful for that.  A caffeine addict is not fun to be around when they are going through withdrawal.I went with the Salmon salad, which was their special salad of the day.  The salmon was a little over cooked, so I wish I would have gone with something else.  But everyone else's entrees were very tasty.  The hubby went with a chicken panini, which was amazingly good.  The siblings went with the pulled pork on a pretzel roll, but the roll was soggy from soaking up the meat juices so they couldn't eat it like a sandwich.  Same with my Dad's beef sandwich.Then there was the dessert, flour-less chocolate lava cake.  Thank goodness we ordered two because one of them was literally inhaled by a little Blondie.  I take it, it was so insanely good she just didn't want to share it.  I guess that's what happens when you're the youngest...you have to eat extra fast or you may not eat at all.

18.description: Over the vast wasteland of the Internet you can't see it but I'm giving Soundings Restaurant the finger right now, from my couch. It's rare that I declare somewhere the "worst (fill-in-the-blank) ever" but for Soundings I have to declare it the worst service I've ever had, ever like eternally stretching across all time and space. I left no tip. NO TIP. I otherwise tip generously, even at times where my wife thinks it foolish. But for the waitstaff of Soundings I couldn't find it in myself to leave anything, it was that bad.We arrived at a bad time, I guess. Lunchtime on a Saturday. In tow were our two kids but almost every other table there had kids of some age or another, so I felt comfortable having our kids in what was otherwise a sit-down type establishment. Our wait in line was pretty quick, altho the host tended to walk off to check on various staff instead of standing and taking names. But it's busy, I understand these things, so I was just happy that we got to the front, told him we were two adults and one high-chair and were off to a table instantly. Now he confirmed the whole high-chair thing with me so imagine my surprise when I was left standing for five minutes waiting for someone to bring one by. I ended up asking a staff member if I could go grab one from recently vacated table and was told, "sure" in passing as that staffer rushed on to do something else. So I did. And we sat. And we waited.We waited, as aforementioned, and finally after about ten minutes we asked a different passing staffer if we could order. She asked if we wanted our server and I replied that I didn't know we had one, but yes we would. She walked away and a couple minutes later our server arrived for the first time, took our order and walked away. He returned with our drinks, which was promising, so we sat, fed my son some snacks and waited for our food. And waited.We waited, as aforementioned, and finally after about twenty minutes we asked a different passing staffer what the hold-up was. He informed me our server was "bringing it over right now" so we left it at that. And we waited. Finally five more minutes passed and most of our food was brought over. Most, but not all. So still we waited for our full meal to be delivered. Another five minutes and we were there. Not once were we offered refills on our drinks or any apologies offered for the delays. Just a lot of waiting.So Matt, you're asking, surely all this waiting was well worth it! Your meal must have been delicious, nay sumptuous and satisfying. But eh, it really wasn't. I had ordered a steak sandwich and it was marginally good, mostly sloppy and fatty. My wife had a simple burger which they managed to leave an ingredient off of and my son had their fish nuggets which he took one bite of and abandoned to consume more crackers and grapes. You don't pretend to have an uppish-scale sit down restaurant and staff it with folks that don't care about customer service. You just don't. I don't care if you can't find good candidates, I don't care if it's in a museum and I especially don't care that it's a busy day. Stop by the table and ask how things are, address my concerns with something more than a grunted syllable and for fuck's sake, give a shit about your job. I saw none of this at Soundings and as members of the Shedd Aquarium, I'm just angry my money goes towards supporting service this bad.

10.description: We went to the Shedd mid-morning.  We assumed any place to eat at the Shedd would not be very good and would offer low quality, prepared offsite, standard food.  And, naturally over-priced.How surprised we were at the fare offered at Soundings Cafe.  First, there is a great view of the Lake and the option to eat outdoors.  We were waited on for our drinks very quickly by a very polite lady.  Throughout our meal, she continuously provided water and soda refills without us ever seeing a glass go empty.My wife had a very good hamburger with excellent sweet potato fries.  I had a chicken sandwich with avocado and a cup of the tomato basil soup.  Both were very good.  We had expected plastic utensils and paper napkins.  Nice cloth napkins and real flatware.  The prices were very reasonable and the food came very quickly.  As a former restaurant manager and owner, it was good to see this type of establishment run so well.  Is it a 5 Star restaurant compared to normal establishments?  No, not really.  But, for being in a public museum, it is very much a 5 Star business!

13.description: Hands down exceeded expectations during a long day at the Shedd. For being in a museum, the price was actually very reasonable (9-12 bucks for a sandwich), and the serving sizes were great. It's not quite a restaurant, not quite a cafe; but it works just great! The tables were very clean, the wait-staff was very friendly, and even on a holiday weekend that was busy, it didn't take too long to get food. We've been to all the museums in town, and we get tired of having fast-food that is really terrible for you and your taste-buds. This place serves actual food! You even get a great view of the boats over the harbor.We were also surprised by having cloth napkins!!! No paper for our dirty fingers. The Shedd has done a great job improving the sustainability of their services over the last few years, and the Soundings Cafe was fantastic. I would definitely go there again.

16.description: Went to Soundings for lunch as we had just done the Aquarium and with baby in tow, we needed a place for all of us to sit and regroup...and feed the child.  Soundings is located inside the Shedd Aquarium (in case you had not figured that out by now) and it actually just hit the spot.  For a restaurant that has you at its mercy (like most all museum/tourist attractions do) Soundings is pretty alright.  How's that sound as an endorsement?I mean, La Bernardin it ain't.  But what is? (well, ok, Le Bernardin is...)  But it's also not a taco vendor selling you burritos with meats of dubious origin.  You order and pay as you walk in, seat yourself and wait for the servers to appear with your drinks and then about 5 minutes later, your food.  I wonder why they even wait that long.  It is clearly prepared well in advance, the wraps probably sliced to order, paninis pressed, salads tossed...you get the idea.So for all of this, we actually had great service, a really polite server (who cruised our table two or three times, when considering how busy it was that was impressive), and the food was ok.  Ok, not great, but better than it had to be and better than I expected it to be.  It was also a timely break from touring the Aquarium (which was great, btw)Anyway, if you are touring the museum, don't be afraid to stop in, it is a pleasant cafeteria experience.

17.description: Eh. This place could definitely make their food better, especially if they get a lot of hungry people seeking a quick bite after wandering around the aquarium. I ordered a Turkey Club Wrap that came with potato chips. The portions were small but was enough for me. The wrap and chips were both way too soggy and they completely overloaded on salt. I'm not sure if I should've gotten something else because they managed to ruin a really simple meal. I'd say if you have time, go around Chicago and find somewhere else to eat. If you're just looking for a quick bite, this place is sufficient in fulfilling your empty stomach even if you won't be completely satisfied.

15.description: Soundings is one of the eateries in the Shedd Aquarium. It's sort of like a Corner Bakery concept, so you order food off the menu, pay up, then find a table and plant your order number on a metal post. We did not wait too long for our food to come out. I ate a chicken Florentine panini, which was good but not great (Johnny T's Bavarian panini sounds way better!). You get your choice of side orders, so I had a side salad with vinaigrette dressing, and my friend had fruit cup with the chicken salad sandwich. You can also eat outdoors on a patio with a spectacular lakefront view, but unless you wish to relive Tippi Hedren's experience with seagulls attacking you, it is better to eat indoors or in the covered outdoor patio space.

0.description: We eat here every time we visit the Aquarium. The menu offers a lot of vegetarian options and the staff are really inviting. We love the view of the water too. The prices aren't too bad. We fed a family of five for $30 which is impressive. The food is very high quality. I've had the Mac and cheese and the Caesar salad. The soups are great too. My husband loves their burgers and sandwiches. As annual members,  we are happy there's a quality dining establishment to visit.

5.description: We came here for a late lunch while visiting the museum. We had two young children who were hungry and cranky, so we needed a good rest. We chose the Soundings because the food seemed better than down in the food court. The view of the lake is gorgeous from here. In better weather you can even sit outside. We ordered first at the register and then you get a number and sit down. You have a dedicated wait person who brings out drinks (plus refills) and all of your food. Our particular waitress was amazing. She was so very sweet and kept us fully stocked on drinks, silverwear and anything else we needed. She was very attentive and we made sure to tip her directly before we left. The food was all pretty good and fairly healthy. My boys both got a grilled cheese sandwich on whole wheat and a cup of applesauce and milk. My mother and I split a grilled deli sandwich with homemade chips and each got a cup of corn chowder. I felt the sandwich was good but the chowder was bland and not even salt and pepper helped. However, my mom loved the soup, so I guess I just like things a little more spiced up than some. Our waitress even offered to bring my mom another cup as it was getting close to the end of lunch and she said it was going to go to waste. So nice. Overall this was probably the best museum dining experience we had in Chicago. The prices were reasonable, the dining room was large and not crowded with a beautiful view, food was good and service was excellent. It was actually good compared to most museums I have experienced nationwide (and even internationally).

11.description: That hits the spot. One Bavarian Panini, waffle fries, Sprite and big pickle (no comments) later, and I am a new man. Who knew that you could get such good food at the Shedd? And, it's really good. My Bavarian Panini consisted of black forest ham, caramelized onions and gruyere cheese on pressed panini bread. They don't skimp on fillings here. My sandwich was packed to the edges with meat, cheese and veggies. Because I wanted some extra crunch, I cut up my sizable pickle and placed it in the halves. It was quite the nice addition and my belly was satisfied. The waffle fries were numerous, lightly salty and a terrific way to finish a quick meal on the go. No longer hungry, I can get back to the task of transforming fantasea into reality.On a day like today, it's best for everyone that I'm not stumbling around weak and hungry. You wouldn't like me when I'm hungry.

8.description: My bf and I went on a museum binge (Shedd, Field, and Art Institute on the same day) and came here for sustenance. We thought it was really weird that they served fish in the cafe of an aquarium, so we both opted for non-seafood items. I chose the lemongrass chicken wrap and he ordered the tarragon chicken salad sandwich, and we shared our orders. I thought my wrap was terrible and really small, as if I ordered it off the kids menu or something. The sandwich was okay, although the chicken dressing was super bland. I'm not sure if we just ordered the wrong thing or if the bad food is a consistent pattern, but I wouldn't opt to come here again.

3.description: No one has been mean here; it's a legit two (2) star-place.  It's located inside the Shedd Aquarium.  Unfortunately, this is the only option for food if you didn't bring your own snacks.  I'm not really here to bash how "bad" this cafe is, but the common sense will tell you that items are going to be marked up higher.  Although the food that we had was fine (veggie wrap and Spanish/pita croissant), if you want to save a few bucks, as I told you before, bring your own food and have a picnic by the whales.  They have a plenty of seating in there.  If you don't plan on purchasing any food item at this cafe, I'm assuming the view is free.  They do have a spectacular view of the Lake Michigan.

14.description: The workers made the place!  I hope they are paid well as I didn't see other people leaving tips.  Our table did.  They hustle & bring your food quickly.2 of us split the turkey wrap with homemade chips.  The 3rd had the chicken & spinach panini.  Everything was very tasty.  Reasonable prices for the location.  I had a nice Sierra Nevada in a cold glass & my friend had her fave Blue Moon.  Great views from the windows.  Would be nicer to sit outside but they don't let you do that at this restaurant.

4.description: We waited in line for 45 minutes, then 30 minutes to get our food. Once we had our food we waited another 10minutes for the server to bring our utensils by which time out food was cold. The only saving grace was a place to sit and a nice view of the lake. Don't bother ordering a pop. $3 for a flat soda the size of what used to be considered a small at Mcdonalds. Get plain water instead!

3.description: Had a slightly bent front rim and needed a quick truing. Charles' dad John was there and asked me to bring it by. He fixed it and tuned up the front break as well, rather than just getting it work. $10, a nice chat and 15 minutes later, I was on my way, near good as new. You'd never get that from one of the bigger bike shops. Nice to support one of the little guys.

1.description: Doesn't seem to open on Sunday. I tried calling 3 times no answer. Make sure that you can them before coming here. The place looks like a home, and there's no sign of business.

2.description: called on a sunday during the hours it said was open...no answer, so rode bikes over with my daughter..impossible to find this place. I gave up after a bit since the unit had no clear hint that it was the correct place. I'd love to give him another shot if I can find him because he is super close to where we live. perhaps I will have an updated review someday.

5.description: Before moving to Chicago in the fall I got a full tune up done on my bike, but when I brought it out of hibernation few weeks ago, my back breaks stopped working.  I couldn't identify the issue, so I looked around and was directed to this business.  After a few crazy scheduling conflicts (ALL on my part!), I finally managed to get my bike over to Velorepair.  I had an absolutely amazing experience.  I learned so much about my bike (which was AWESOME), including how to fix my breaks if it happens again, and I was taught so many preventative maintenance tips.  I even got some help on attaching a bike rack. I was shown exactly what what happening the whole time and the education was extremely appreciated.  I HIGHLY recommend Velorepair.  The service was extremely personal and overall a phenomenal experience for a very reasonable price. I really enjoyed the family/dad-and-son business experience.  I have definitely found my bike place in Chicago! :)

6.description: Brought my Trek Mtn Bike and my wife's older Hybrid bike here for a seasonal tune up. My wife's bike is almost 20 years old and has never had one. John was able to get the bike riding like new. She was floored. He also took the time to show me the adjustments he was making when i arrived a few moments early. He is extremely friendly,knowledgeable and honest. I will be getting all of my future repairs and tune ups done here.

7.description: Great little family bike repair place.  Cheap prices and they actually care about getting it right!  Estimates by email and you can pay via paypal.  I found my new bike shop.

8.description: My husband got 2 flat (bike) tires on his way home from work the other day & we took it in for repair at Velorepair yesterday.  Service, price, and workmanship were all A+!  Highly recommend.

9.description: I bike commute all year long in the city.  I came referred to VeloRepair after striking up a conversation with an older gentleman on the lakefront riding a strikingly beautiful vintage bike.  I checked their website and exchanged emails with John regarding a few bike questions.  I just picked up my daily commuter from its pre-winter tune up and all I can say is, "Yeah!"  I had two badly worn tires replaced.  John replaced a damaged pedal with a pair he picked up (ridiculously) cheap.  And, the tune up?  OMG.  SUCH attention to detail.  The front derailleur as delivered to John was grit and rust frozen in place.  Fixed.  When I arrived at his garage, he was wiping down the bike with protectant, which is a very nice touch no one would ever see.  Every teeny-tiny nook and cranny was immaculate and in showroom working order.  John is a craftsman.  Prices cannot be beat.  If you live or work in the vicinity, or are willing to go a little out of your way for your bike, and want to work with great people, I can't recommend VeloRepair highly enough.

0.description: Charles the owner is a college student who is really fond of bikes. Without the overheads of renting he uses his parent's garage as his bike workshop. Even though it's a garage, he have all the tools needed to fix the bike and his is really good at it! I came in today with two flat tires and I come out 20 min later with new tires just for 17 dollars!Make sure you make appointment with him first through text messaging and he will be on time and never let you down.

4.description: They may not have the convenience of a storefront, but the reasonable prices, personal service, excellent communication, and quality work more than make up for it.  I was able to arrange a convenient drop off time via email, received a spot on estimate and it was parked out front ready to go as promised.  He reviewed all the work he did for me, and had taken a test ride to make sure it was perfect.I have an older bike that I use for commuting that probably isn't the easiest to work on, but he had it running better than it has in years.  They have a passion for bikes, and you'll enjoy your rides much more after they get through with your trusty steed!

12.description: I tried this place a couple of times when I first moved to the South Loop.  They have good deals if you are a first-time customer, but after that, it just gets too pricey for the services rendered.

3.description: I was very pleased the way my thinning hair was cut and styled.I have received many compliments, and I love my improved look.

1.description: I had a men's haircut with Mallory.  She was very professional and friendly.  I was nervous about having somebody new cut my hair but Mallory and the staff at Michele Lynn made me feel very comfortable as soon as I walked in the door.  I didn't really know what I wanted and decided to let Mallory use her creativity and skills.  She exceeded my best expectations.  This place was a little on the pricey side but for the quality of the haircut it was well worth it... and i think they run specials every once in a while.  I would definitely go back for another haircut.

2.description: I'm so lucky this place is in my neighborhood.  I've been going to Bridget at Michele Lynn for almost 3 years now and she is absolutely the best stylist I've ever had.  Whether its just a standard cut & color or a crazy style for a special event - Bridget goes above and beyond - researching new techniques and tools, and getting just as excited about whatever we are doing as I am.  I've gotten more compliments on my hair since going here than I ever have before.  FANTASTIC!

9.description: I've never had my hair cut at a salon before fearing that it'd be too pretentious and expensive, but visiting this salon wasn't like that at all. Everyone there seemed genuinely friendly and helpful. Mallory cut my hair and I couldn't be happier with the way it turned out, she did exactly what I asked and I love it. I wasn't expecting anything besides a normal cut, but she also shampooed and massaged my head, I almost fell asleep right in he chair because it was so relaxing. And the price was extremely reasonable as well. Im usually a barber shop kind of guy, but I will definitely be going back to this salon regularly and having Mallory cut my hair.

10.description: So I went to Michele Lynn to dye my hair yesterday, the person that helped me dye my hair seemed pretty nice, but all throughout the time she was trying to sell me hair products and offering services like 'conditioning' or something which costs $15 ... she was really pushy about her products, why can't I just go in and dye my hair in peace. Its fine if you offer once, but it was like.... It went on for a good 20+ minutes.  After she finished dying my hair, which turned out average, I found out I was charged $30 extra for a 'glaze' service she didn't even ask me if I wanted. I just think it's a little shady to do something without telling the customer how much it costs. The way she explained it I thought it was part of the process. I just think if she knew how to do business, she wouldn't have charged me the $30 leading me write this review and telling all my friends about how shady they are. This place is average; my hair is really NOT smooth after they dyed it, maybe because she put some product in it? I'm not sure what she did. I guess just make sure they don't give you services that didn't ask for.

4.description: Michele is awesome.  I've been going to the same hair stylist for 8 years and moved to Chicago and had no idea who would do my hair.I read a review in Chicago magazine and decided to make an appointment.  I left impressed and with a new stylish cut.  She cut my hair completely different but also much more stylish than my last stylist so I was happy.She also introduced me to some products that have been great for my hair and that I would have never tried otherwise!I will keep going back!

6.description: I've been looking for a good haircut ever since my favorite stylist decided to start a different career. I think I found my new stylist.I got a hair cut. The price listed on the website is $62, but since I was a first time customer they gave me $25 off. So it was actually cheaper than a lot of other salons. Then they gave me a coupon for $25 off my next cut. I will definitely be using that. I have very straight, fine hair. In theory layers add body, but in practice many stylists take too much and my hair winds up appearing thinner--exactly what I don't want. She did a very good job of adding layers that give my hair body. My hair looks fuller and healthier. I've gotten a lot of compliments on my haircut already, and I've only had it for a couple days.She also gave me a head massage during the shampoo. It was unexpected but very relaxing. Actually, the whole experience was relaxing.

0.description: I just had my second haircut with Michele in the South Loop. She is a wonderful person and is very skilled. I have nothing but good things to say about my two haircuts so far and look forward to being her customer for a long time!

5.description: I tried this South Loop salon a year after it opened and sorry I waited the year. Very clean, good stylists and centrally located in the neighborhood. Pricing is very competitive and they have a referral program.   Not just for women either.

13.description: Walked in and told Michelle exactly what NOT to do to my hair.  She did everything I asked her NOT to do. Do not butch the back of my hair as I just grew it out, hair was maybe 1/16" long.  Do not give me whispy bangs, I have whispy bangs that drive me nuts and do not sit right or look good.  Do not give me a style that i have to use tons of product in, I have to use so much product to make this cut look even semi-decent.  I had just spent months growing out the back, now I have to spend months growing out the whole cut! She cannot fix it as there is no more hair left to cut...very unhappy

11.description: Okay so this is my new go to salon.  I absolutely love Michele, she does a great job cutting my hair.  I wasn't totally thrilled after my first visit but that was b/c of the price...$72 is really steep for someone w/tons of debt and had just started a new job...now a year later and almost debt free, my wallet can finally afford this place :)  I have always gotten tons of compliments after Michele has cut my hair (which has been 3 times now)...She is great at what she does and the price is totally worth it.  Plus they have specials and send out coupons in the south loop mailer.  I just booked color with her for two weeks from now so I'm hopeful she will be just as great at that!  I definetly recommed giving this place a try and spend the extra $$ to see Michele!

8.description: I really love this place. I do not see Michele I see a different lady (right chair closest to front on right). She is great. She can cut all different types of hair styles..and well!! I watched her cut the mom who was before me and gave her a great Mom do. Really looked awesome. Then she gave my friend (girl) a really cute funky Mohawk, then she gave me just a good bob! I have never left upset.  The only complain I have is that they are getting rid of their 50% off coupons and therefore after I use the two I have left I will have to go somewhere else. I can not pay $62 every month to have my hair cut.  The salon is not fancy its very relaxed.  I really recommend

14.description: I've been a loyal client of Michele Lynn's for years.  My cut and color always look great and I love the Redken products. The new salon is beautiful and offers all the services I need, plus it's close to the el.

7.description: I had a not so good experience at Michele Lynn.    I scheduled an appt here because I just moved to the area from out of state and wanted a local place that I could call "my own" for the next few years as my husband and I settle into the South Loop.  Since there were good reviews, I had gotten a coupon in the mail, and I was in desperate need for a cut and color, I decided to give it a shot.I called and made an appt same day, which was very nice.  I was set up with a young Asian associate who has punk rocker hair.  Since I have been highlighting my hair since high school (10+ years), I know my hair very well.   I explained exactly what I wanted (low/highlights that will blend well as they grown out, go a little bit darker, and ash blonde color) and warned her that my hair tends to pull warm tones, so go for as ashy as possible.  I also have an upcoming wedding which I am standing up in, so I wanted to make sure I look OK for that.  Of course, I got exactly what I didn't want:  bright brassy blonde hair, no lowlights that almost look like allover color, so you will see my roots as soon as I start to grow out. When I tried to explain the problem, she said "it's blonde for summer!" It's like she didn't even listen to me at all when I started the appt!!! So after that, she said she wasn't finished and put a glaze on my head, which I asked (since I am on a budget) if it was part of the color and she agreed.  Not much changed, so I asked for the manager or owner.Michele is the bright shining spot of this whole experience.  She was so sweet, and offered to touch up my hair free of charge and she even did the cut herself afterwards.  I would definitely think about seeing her again, although the initial experience left me with a bad taste in my mouth. She did a great job.Michele gave me an extra discount on top of my coupon, but the first girl ended up charging me an extra $45 for the glaze and color on top of the highlight and haircut price so it pretty much wiped out any savings I may have had.  Even with the discounts, I spent $150+.  It wasn't worth my time after all of that to dispute anything more.  I wish I would have just booked with Michele to begin with because I might have gone back, but I am going to find somewhere else in the South Loop from now on.

28.description: After seeing this storefront and looking over the reviews, I decided to fill my prescription here. The owner, Kushal, was very friendly and filled my prescription within five minutes. The cost, indeed, was less than the same product at Walgreens, and the service was great. I talked to him for several minutes, mostly about the items he carries. They're able to fill pet prescriptions, and to get an idea of how much it would cost to do this, I asked him to look up one prescription in particular. And wow, the price was significantly less, like 15-20% less than the vet. He told me that he can get practically anything, including organic vitamins; he even gave me a few vitamin samples to try before committing to a whole bottle. They also recycle old medications which is fantastic. He'll chat with you about any meds that you are taking and address any concerns.My only suggestion would be to add some music in the store so it's not so quiet. Other than that tiny issue, this is a wonderful addition to the neighborhood that offers an excellent personal and local touch in the world of big box pharmacies.

1.description: I began filling my prescriptions here about 3 years ago and I never would've thought a pharmacy would be one of my favorite local businesses. The customer service provided is absolutely stellar!From refill reminders to free delivery, the staff stays more on top of anticipating and fulfilling my needs than I do! They are so kind and lovely to work with too. My mother (who doesn't even live in the area) began using them awhile back as well as they price match her dog's medication with 1-800-PetMeds. They've also started delivering to her home as well which is great since I've recently relocated out of Chicago. Back to Walgreens or CVS for me, and it's definitely my loss!

9.description: Just did business with these nice and knowledgeable folks on a recommendation from the doctor at  the South Loop Immediate Care 2 doors down. Normally I go to the 'corner of happy and healthy' and leave so stressed out. This was a pleasant experience in a calm atmosphere. Not only did it cost the same as my other pharmacy but they will deliver the meds to my doorstaff in my building. Wow!  This is good old-fashioned service. I highly recommend this place.

29.description: If you live in the South Loop or have a doctor in the area you'd be crazy to go elsewhere. I had to have a prescription filled (yay second sinus infection in a month!) and Well Future is just awesome. They were hosting a neighborhood meet and greet when I stopped in which impressed me greatly. Why go to a big chain when you have folks who are really invested in growing a community? Also they're fast as hell. That's always important.

23.description: I didn't realize I hadn't Yelped this yet.  This place is literally as good as it gets.  The prices are the same or less than CVS and Walgreens (seriously have no issues with either one but would rather give my business to family owned local businesses).  This is a husband/wife duo (good for them) who are unreal.  I have only been there twice and still they know my name and everything.  Seriously anyone who lives in the area will not regret moving everything here.  Nothing bad to say.

5.description: Recently switched from cvs to here to get my prescriptions filled and I am regretting not coming here sooner!!! Short wait times, friendly staff, clean intimate office. 5 stars all around! They even stayed 30 minutes after closing to full my prescription! Thank you well future pharmacy!

31.description: I was sick.  SOOOOOOO sick.  I stopped by the Well Future Pharmacy after my visit to the South Loop Immediate Care to fill my prescription.  I was too sick to drive to any of the big box stores, and I certainly was in no shape to walk over to Walgreens or Jewel.  So, passing by here several times while walking my dogs, I stopped in here.  The two owners were in, and they were super sweet.  My prescriptions were filled in no time, and took time to answer my groggy questions, even when they didn't make any sense (let's just say having the flu and a nasty respiratory infection don't go hand in hand).Prices were competitive and they accepted my insurance with no issue.  I was also told that they offer a free delivery service in the neighborhood should I need anything refilled, which is amazing news, as if you're sick, the last thing you want to do is leave your bed and jammies (and in my case, two adorable sleeping cavaliers that are my bed-side nurses).I'll be ditching the big box stores to have my prescriptions filled here from now on!

25.description: I believe customer service is key to any business and this family owned company knows there stuff. They genuinely care about their customers and provide the best and most efficient service I have ever received as far as pharmacy goes. I have a 5 year-old so I am getting antibiotics constantly and they fill the script immediately no questions asked....unlike Walgreens. The woman who works the counter when I go in is always smiling, she recognizes my child, and always asks how we have been. I live in Lincoln Park so it does add some travel time to my day, especially when there is a Walgreens a block from my condo, but I would rather go to them with my business instead of a high priced, long-lined pharmacy with sometimes very rude employees ( not saying they are all rude) but Well Future Pharmacy is always nice and like I said fast!   Sorry this was so long I just wanted to get my point across "They Are Great!"

12.description: Outstanding Service and prices!!! I initially went there because they were kind enough to find me a specific generic medication, which Walgreens had stopped carrying. I live in Rogers Park and it is still worth the trip for the prices and attention to detail.It's owned by a young husband and wife and I believe they work VERY hard to offer stellar service. They also offer next day delivery at no charge. Just make sure you have your order in before noon. (Also, I imagine they have same day for customers who are not so far away.)I went to Walgreens out of necessity the other day to fill an RX. My W card expired that same day. They were not able to honor it. I will not be renewing the card because I wish to support this young couple's business and kind treatment of their customers, and even with the discount, Walgreens is not competitive!Last point, they close early on Saturdays and are closed on Sundays. But thyer go out o f their way to work around that by offering delivery etc.

37.description: After seeing this new, independent pharmacy in the South Loop, I had my regular prescription transferred over from one of the big chains right away. What I didn't know at the time was that I would be back almost immediately...after getting a skin infection AND shingles in one week! (Hereafter known as: The Worst Week Ever.)The entire staff at Well Future is friendly and extremely knowledgeable. They made sure I knew about any side effects or interactions that might be possible with the medications. They filled my prescriptions super fast, and they even offer free delivery!Although I hope I won't be back for a little while after this, Well Future's kindness and expertise made The Worst Week Ever a lot more bearable.

21.description: Excellent service!!! Home delivery is such a great perk, especially when you're sick. Best pharmacy I've ever had and will definitely recommend to anyone, especially around the south loop and printer's row area.

16.description: I was sick.  SOOOOOOO sick.  I stopped by the Well Future Pharmacy after my visit to the South Loop Immediate Care to fill my prescription.  I was too sick to drive to any of the big box stores, and I certainly was in no shape to walk over to Walgreens or Jewel.  So, passing by here several times while walking my dogs, I stopped in here.  The two owners were in, and they were super sweet.  My prescriptions were filled in no time, and took time to answer my groggy questions, even when they didn't make any sense (let's just say having the flu and a nasty respiratory infection don't go hand in hand).Prices were competitive and they accepted my insurance with no issue.  I was also told that they offer a free delivery service in the neighborhood should I need anything refilled, which is amazing news, as if you're sick, the last thing you want to do is leave your bed and jammies (and in my case, two adorable sleeping cavaliers that are my bed-side nurses).I'll be ditching the big box stores to have my prescriptions filled here from now on!
