17.description: I always try to support small businesses, so it was a no-brainer to transfer my prescription to Well Future. From day one, the owners, Drs. Bhavi and Kushal, made a point to know me - I don't even have to say my name when I come in anymore - and they are very knowledgeable. (I got a massive migraine at work and didn't have my prescription meds, so I asked what else I could take after downing several Advil as a holdover, which did nothing! They gave me good advice, ensuring me I wasn't going to OD myself.) They take my insurance, and call to remind about refills. Overall, great little store. Appreciate mostly that I don't have to go down the street to Walgreens, where the service is generally rude/lacking. Highly recommend!Luckily, I haven't been sick enough (knock on wood!) to require the delivery service, but I'm sure I'll appreciate it if the time comes!

10.description: There is a justifiable reason four the five stars, they earned it! During one of the Polar Vortex when my asthma should not go out in such wind chills, I needed a prescription filled and delivered. They did it all. Made the transaction so easy, I'm changing all my few meds to them. Normally I'd relish the stopping off the bus to pick up my prescription, but there are times when I need help. They helped. Thank you so much.

11.description: The owners Bhavi and Kushal are so wonderful! I have requested them for medication drop off for the kids many a time but today I sprained my leg and walked over to get a bandage. Kushal helped pick the appropriate one for my swelling and wrapped it so perfectly. Glad to have caring pharmacists in the South loop.

26.description: This place is WONDERFUL! I have filled multiple prescriptions here and they are always going above and beyond to provide the best service possible!! I have never had to wait, they offer free delivery, & the prices are awesome!!! They have graciously handled any problems I have had with prescriptions from my doctor, making it such an easy process on my end! I also have two insurances which can sometimes be an issue, but not here! So nice to have this place in the neighborhood!

27.description: It is so nice to have a "neighborhood" pharmacy."  It is like the old days (you know, the 90's) where you call up or walk in and are greeted by name.  Amazingly, I called once when they were closed but Kushal called back right away and offered to come down and open the store just for me. Try getting that kind of service from CVS or WalMart.

35.description: Well Future Pharmacy is an amazing alternative to getting your prescriptions filled at a Walgreens or supermarket.  The pharmacists who own the place give you personal attention, learn more about your needs, and remember who you are from one visit to the next.  I've found that they are actually LESS expensive than the chains and you get much better, friendly service.

8.description: This is how all pharmacies should be run. I love the customer service. They are basically next door to our apartment and frequently drop our prx off with our doorman for no charge. Friendly and clean and have other products we can purchase. Love this place!

0.description: Since moving to Chicago, there hasn't been another health related institution that I have valued more then Well Future Pharmacy. My old cat needs three heart meds daily, and WFP is able to compound all three into a liquid that tastes like chicken for him. This service apparently isn't provided at all compound pharmacies. On top of that, they have the best customer service I've ever dealt with. Every one on the phone is pleasant and helpful. Because this is a chronic health condition, my cat will need this medication for the rest of his life. Well Future Pharmacy always reminds me when my refills are almost up and gets his medication to me super quickly.

20.description: What a treasure for the South Loop! The owners make everything easy for their customers. I receive reminder calls when my prescriptions are almost due to be refilled. (As an older person who is on multiple medications, this is extremely helpful.) Kushal and Bhavi, the owners/pharmacists will contact the doctors for new prescriptions. (One more chore I no longer have to do!) They will order items for customers upon request. Prices are at least the same as for the larger chains...but usually lower. This is especially true for pet medications, where I have been shocked to pay SO much less than at the vet's or at the larger chain stores. Free delivery is also very helpful. Bhavi and Kushal are very knowledgeable and patiently answer all questions. They even helped me set up a medication schedule for my dog who was diagnosed with epilepsy. She gets two different medications, at two different time intervals. It was overwhelming initially until they helped me get it right. And along with everything else, they are genuinely friendly and kind to everyone. I'm so thrilled to have such a fine establishment in my neighborhood!

19.description: Great experience at this local pharmacy!   I was feeling horrible and was recommended by the South Loop Urgent care to check this place out for antibiotics. I normally have insurance but I am between jobs right now and the new insurance doesn't kick in for a few days. Well Future Pharmacy is very competitive with pricing, and even has a guide to show you how much you will save compared to big box stores on common prescriptions.  Very knowledgeable and friendly pharmacists! They will even home deliver your prescription!  Last time I wait in line at jewel.  I only have 1 regular prescription but will be happy to transfer to them.  Yay for South Loop local business!

33.description: Friendliest family-Owned pharmacy you will ever find.  They work hard to ensure that they meet all your needs and also always remember your name.  When was the last time you felt like that at Walgreens or CVS?

2.description: I'm happy I switched to Well Future due to their quick service, convenient location, and convenient delivery service in times I need to use it.They're located nearby, have good hours for an independent pharmacy, and parking has always been easy. Kushal in particular has always been receptive to questions and working with my doctor as needed.

34.description: I stopped in here after seeing the 'Pet Medications' sign on the door before my cat's appointment at South Loop Animal Hospital. I have a very hard time trying to get my cat to take medicine even in the form of treats, and thought this new pharmacy might have some advice. I was very impressed that they took the time to talk with me and try to figure out solutions even though I'm not a customer yet. I will definitely be getting my cat's prescription filled here when I run out!

32.description: After stopping by South Loop Immediate Care and finding out I had a sinus infection I had some prescriptions to pick up. Typically I would drive over to CVS and drop it off but the doctor at South Loop Immediate Care told me to go two doors down to Well Future Pharmacy. I figured why not support a South Loop business and check it out. It was super quick and the pharmacist was very nice and helpful. I read that they have delivery too which is really cool. Same price as CVS too so why not come here :) Gives me a reason to walk a few blocks in my favorite neighborhood.

18.description: After seeing this storefront and looking over the reviews, I decided to fill my prescription here. The owner, Kushal, was very friendly and filled my prescription within five minutes. The cost, indeed, was less than the same product at Walgreens, and the service was great. I talked to him for several minutes, mostly about the items he carries. They're able to fill pet prescriptions, and to get an idea of how much it would cost to do this, I asked him to look up one prescription in particular. And wow, the price was significantly less, like 15-20% less than the vet. He told me that he can get practically anything, including organic vitamins; he even gave me a few vitamin samples to try before committing to a whole bottle. They also recycle old medications which is fantastic. He'll chat with you about any meds that you are taking and address any concerns.My only suggestion would be to add some music in the store so it's not so quiet. Other than that tiny issue, this is a wonderful addition to the neighborhood that offers an excellent personal and local touch in the world of big box pharmacies.

13.description: This is what a pharmacy should be.  They are knowledgeable.  They call to remind you when prescriptions are coming due.  They talk to the doctors/hospital/insurance and resolve issues - quickly.  They are, truly, exceptional and I opted out of the mail order prescription savings because in our case, the type of medication one of our family members takes has to be the exact same type (due to the inert ingredients affecting the effectiveness) and I seriously only trust this pharmacy to make sure that happens.  As an added bonus they deliver but I will honestly stay with this pharmacy even if I move all the way across town and have to pick up my prescriptions myself.  Absolutely the best of the best.  And.. by the way... less expensive than the big chains which play the insurance billable game so well, they overcharge everyone - absolutely NOT the case with this pharmacy.

4.description: I DO NOT recommend this pharmacy for anything.  They have broken the law, broke our Hippa agreement and charged me for scripts I never asked for.  The staff is incompetent and delivery guy has told me of some unsavory things happening.  I stayed loyal for 3 years until all this began to happen.  They have their own set of rules that change on a daily basis.  Could this all be because none of them are American?  Walgreen here I come.  Trust me and do not give them your business.

24.description: Great experience at this local pharmacy!   I was feeling horrible and was recommended by the South Loop Urgent care to check this place out for antibiotics. I normally have insurance but I am between jobs right now and the new insurance doesn't kick in for a few days. Well Future Pharmacy is very competitive with pricing, and even has a guide to show you how much you will save compared to big box stores on common prescriptions.  Very knowledgeable and friendly pharmacists! They will even home deliver your prescription!  Last time I wait in line at jewel.  I only have 1 regular prescription but will be happy to transfer to them.  Yay for South Loop local business!

6.description: Update, I did mention I was new to the pharmacy, after a few refills, I got follow up calls from Kushal to make sure I was feeling better and if I needed him to call my doctor to change the dose. He was aware of my cultural diet restrictions (I'm guessing because of my name) and was able to suggest alternatives, although he's NOT from the same cultural background. I also received an apology about the tech's odd behavior in my earlier review.My meds are always delivered within an hour to the front desk of where I live! That kind of thing deserves a fan rating and an updated review. Great Job you guys and thank you

22.description: This is an incredible pharmacy and I recommend it to everyone!! They fill prescriptions quickly and for much better prices than Walgreens or CVS, and they even deliver!! That's right-- no waiting in line or driving anywhere, it's brought right to your door. The owners are extremely nice, and they really go above and beyond to take care of every person who walks in their store.

15.description: I believe customer service is key to any business and this family owned company knows there stuff. They genuinely care about their customers and provide the best and most efficient service I have ever received as far as pharmacy goes. I have a 5 year-old so I am getting antibiotics constantly and they fill the script immediately no questions asked....unlike Walgreens. The woman who works the counter when I go in is always smiling, she recognizes my child, and always asks how we have been. I live in Lincoln Park so it does add some travel time to my day, especially when there is a Walgreens a block from my condo, but I would rather go to them with my business instead of a high priced, long-lined pharmacy with sometimes very rude employees ( not saying they are all rude) but Well Future Pharmacy is always nice and like I said fast!   Sorry this was so long I just wanted to get my point across "They Are Great!"

7.description: I've used this pharmacy since they opened a few years ago. There should be many more like then who are independently owned. They've always helped me whenever they could. They are the best compounding pharmacy around.

36.description: I've now had two  prescriptions filled at this new pharmacy which is in my neighborhood. The second time I came in the fellow behind the counter (is he the owner?) just handed me my prescription without even asking my name! He talked to me about the drug (which was new for me), and was knowledgable and friendly. This independent is a wonderful refreshing change from the big chain drugstores. This is what a pharmacy ought to be - we are so lucky to have them in the area!

30.description: This neighborhood-independent-family-owned pharmacy is an absolute delight.  You can tell the owners (a married couple, both pharmacists) really care about the customers' needs first. It's a treat to be treated like a human being at a pharmacy. Your prescriptions will be filled very quickly.  The pharmacists will take their time to ensure you know what you are taking and why you are taking it.  They are a fountain of helpful information and are able to share it with customers. As an added bonus, they provide free delivery for their customers and are happy to provide phone follow-up consultation. Prices for prescriptions are significantly cheaper than commercial pharmacies; the prices here beat all the prices on Leslie's List - even the Costco pharmacy.  leslieslist.org/chicago/….  Though I have insurance, the co-pays certainly add up.  It's wonderful to know there are folks who are not trying to gouge their neighbors, but passing along the savings they receive. I cannot recommend Well Future Pharmacy enough.   It is a pleasure have an independent, family-owned pharmacy in the South Loop.

3.description: I travel pass at the very least 5 local pharmacies to get my prescriptions filled at Well Future Pharmacy. The staff are the very best in customer service and care and the owners are knowledgeable and caring which makes every visit a warm and welcoming experience.

14.description: I didn't realize I hadn't Yelped this yet.  This place is literally as good as it gets.  The prices are the same or less than CVS and Walgreens (seriously have no issues with either one but would rather give my business to family owned local businesses).  This is a husband/wife duo (good for them) who are unreal.  I have only been there twice and still they know my name and everything.  Seriously anyone who lives in the area will not regret moving everything here.  Nothing bad to say.

3.description: I like going to Chaku for my eyebrow threading. She does a great job. She gives me a great brow  shape and she's quick too!!! Will definitely recommend her to everyone.

1.description: She's awesome! Super fast, does a great job and you can text her for an appt and she gets right back to you even if it's last minute. It's also super super cheap!! My fav place to get my brows done in Chicago. FYI - it's no frills. If that's what you're looking for, this isn't the place. If you're looking for good brows, make the trip. Easy street parking too!

0.description: I was very pleased with my eyebrows!

2.description: She did a good job on my eyebrows. She is very friendly and attentive. I will be returning as a regular just after my first visit . The salon is beautiful as well.

5.description: Chaku is great.  My eyebrows too!  She's experienced and very quick.

6.description: I bought a Lifebooker brow and lash tint and was excited because the reviews were so good. However, the phone number for the business is disconnected, so I am very disappointed!

7.description: NO ONE makes my eyebrows look better!!  Great prices, great service and best of all...great results!  Highly recommend the threading service here.  Don't be deceived by the lack of reviews as she recently moved from her Indiana location.

8.description: I am OBSESSED!!!!! I love, love, love Chaku... no one makes my brows look better, no one.  The downside of that is that if she ever leaves Chicago, I will be forced to follow her wherever she goes because I honestly can't go to anyone else besides her.  She is quick and affordable, but mostly importantly makes my brows look amazing... and my eyebrows are difficult to maintain (too long in some parts, too sparse in others) and she does such a remarkable job that I walk out of there looking fabulous!

9.description: New location. Same lady (Chaku is her name). She does a great job, doesn't rush you. Has a lot of experience and prices are good!

10.description: She made my eyebrows look great!

4.description: This is my 2nd time coming and I'm highly pleased and satisfied. My first time was when she ( Chuka) was located on 21st & Indiana. Now she's in a new location inside of Marimarshe Salon. The new location is a little more busy because its full service with hair, nails, etc. But Chuka gets me in and out every time. If you're unsure about her work, check the reviews from the other location. I hope that her old clientele follows her and doesn't shy away from the new location, she dies GREAT work!!! Highly recommended. She also does waxing. I get my upper lip waxed as well.

58.description: I have enjoyed everything I have ordered from here. I've had the chicken kabobs and various salads. The flavor is ok, but like many others have said, nothing extraordinary. The staff is generally nice, except there was a very rude individual working when I was in to dine about a month ago. A nice lady behind the counter took my order, and I was patiently waiting. The rude worker walked up and said "what can I get for you?" I thought he was talking to me, so I said I had already placed my order. He responded by saying "yeah, I wasn't talking to you." Very disrespectful, and this individual didn't really seem to have a set job. After he was rude to me, he just sat at the counter and looked at his phone for the next 30-35 minutes, while I was in there. Like I said, there food is pretty good, but I won't be back due to the rude worker.

56.description: Today my chicken gyro had pieces of chicken that were nasty, not chewable or edible. Tough to chew, bad taste.  Also, pieces of fat and one piece of skin. It still ate the gyro, but i was careful with my bites. Wish it was less meat, but more consistent and better.

29.description: Nothing fresh or oddly enough Mediterranean about this place. Just another beef and ham and cheese place.

42.description: I've dined in and ordered to-go more then I'd like to admit. Pita Heaven consistently has good food with reasonable prices. I'm sold!

23.description: I still like going to this place when I pass by. The parking is still treacherous, but the food is delicious.

47.description: After reading the reviews on this restaurant I was surprised when I got the food. The food is decent for the price but there's really nothing special about it. Double check your order if you get delivery or pickup. It's often incorrect.

8.description: Very good food fast service plus very friendly staff they give generous portions so go hungry. Definitely try the shrimp with avocado appetizer.

31.description: The food was definitely of poor quality compared to other mediterrian restaurants.  We had ordered filafel sandwiches.  Firstly they do not serve filafel sandwiches by itself.  You pay for fries or potatoes whether you want them or not.  Well a side of fries by itself was $ 1,99,  We were in a group so ordered 6 filafel sandwiches to go.We paid $2.80 extra to substitute the fries for a side order or humus and a salad.Reaching home we could barely eat 2 sandwiches between the 4 of us as they were missing the authenticity, the depth, the flavor of a middle eastern filafel sandwich.We realized it was a very poor copy of a mediterrian filafel sandwich.  To begin with the bread was a gyro bread and not pita bread.  The humus was not finely grounded and had pieces of chick peas and the filafel's were hard and dry. Appeared to be possibly left overs from the AM shift.  Our dinner cost us $53 and we called to speak to the manager who instead of listening to our concern was very defensive, stating we had a problem with our order right from the beginning (she considered us informing them that - we did not eat fries or potatoes and either offering a substitute or then adjusting the price).  On one hand she stated to bring back the order on the other hand she questioned us if we would return it to another mediterrian restaurant.  It was only after the above experience did I realize from the reviews at Yelp that we were not the first one who had such a bad experience with their vegeterian filafils and humus. For more tasty, authentic filafel sandwiches and humus, I would suggest go somewhere different.

34.description: A couple quick hitter neighborhood Mediterranean reviews while I'm feeling Yelpy. First up is Pita Heaven, a perfectly decent pick up and go place that offers solid off-hours dining (they are open from 10 to 10 err'day). Ordering is counter and food comes out in a jiffy.My go-to is the gyro wrap, decently priced with a heaping of Sysco-frozen, elementary-school crinkled-cut fries. The gyro meat isn't the best, but isn't the worst either. I like it far better than the kabob meat and bifteki, which are both too dry without being flavorful enough. Pita Heaven loads up the pita with a pileful of delicious tzatziki, so if you're a sauce fan, this pita is for you.The chicken wraps come, somewhat puzzlingly, with dijon mustard instead of tzatziki, which provides some insight into this place's target consumer base. If you weren't already tipped off by the Italian beef and hamburger offerings on the menu, that is. That said, the tzatziki is easily substitutable on the chicken shawarma or kebob wrap. Just ask.The baklava is packaged and available on the counter and always looks enticing, but so far I've managed to resist. Service is friendly and expedient, making this a good option in a rush.

16.description: Forgot to change my review to a good one.  I've been back a few times and it's been great.   Everyone has a bad day!

13.description: The tzatziki sauce is insane - come here just for that appetizer. Had the chicken gyro and my hangover was cured. Great spot. Come check it.

11.description: Huge portions! We ordered a Chicken Shawarma plate, a Combination plate and some Greek Fries. This was more than enough for 3 hungry adults, we barely finished it. Located near the Grant Park. It was convenient to grab a quick lunch before heading out to walk the Lakefront Trail.

39.description: Visiting Chicago from Cali and after a ton of fried food meals, I needed something a little closer to home. I ordered the gyro plate with rice and the chicken gyros plates with oven potatoes. Both came with salad and pita bread.Both of the meats were great but the better of the two were the lamb and beef gyro! The amount of food you get is amazing!! The rice was good and pita was warm and soft.The chicken gyros meat was good, yet I wasn't a fan of the oven potatoes.. They seemed a little too bitter tasting due to lemon.The salad had a ton of dressing on them, it wasn't a bad flavor but a little too wet. They should serve the dressing on the side.All in all I gave it a four star because the beef and lamb gyro meat was good. Everything else seemed standard but was pleasant.

37.description: Great fast food place. Sure it's not Alinea but given the price (and speed) it's hard to argue with this place for a quick lunch.

0.description: Had the gyros plate which was great! My wife had the Meat Combo plate which was perfect! The saganaki was not really the way I'm used to. They didn't light it and it was overly lemony.  The baklava was just ok. But the place is clean. The staff is friendly.  And I loved my gyros. Definitely recommended.

38.description: I order from here often. You can expect their food to be fresh and delicious. Only thing I don't like from this place is their chips. It was too bland and flavorless. Some where over fried it was all brown. But other than that, I have tried that chicken plates, burger, gyros, and chicken gyros they were all really good. I specially love their chicken gyros. Their portions are huge too; so you are definitely getting enough food for your money. Their burger is huge and the meat always seems fresh. There's five guys near this place but I would rather have pita heaven's burger. It's huge, comes with fries and drink and way cheaper than five guys.

51.description: So food is better than average for its type.  Where they are great is delivery. Very quick and hot. No complaints there.

27.description: They give large amounts  of food on each plate. The Food is delicious and the customer service is good. The owners are very friendly. And the place is nice and clean.

32.description: Awesome quick service and of course delicious food!The chicken kabobs and gyros are my favorites!

54.description: It's not authentic but it's a welcomed joint given it's one of the few non mainstream chain fast food options in Sloop.The place has great service and it's clean. They have a decent gyro sandwich. The food is inconsistent. I ordered the meat combo platter twice and chicken was quite juicy and tender.  The kifta kebab was tasty too. The 2nd time it was all a bit dry. The rice was undercooked.Their veggie options are terrible...1 star. Eggplant spread ...blah. for a Greek/Mediterranean place, they have bad falafels. We go cuz it's convenient as its in the building and we know what not to get.

48.description: My boyfriend had a looooooong hair in is gyro plate. Gross.Outside of that, the prices are fair and the portions are large. We both got the gyro plate. It was tasty. We got delivery and it took about an hour early evening on Sunday.

44.description: Delivery was fast and food was excellent. Very generous portions. Gyro plate and chicken kebabs were delicious.

24.description: Craving a pita, got just a pita wrap and home made potato chips! Yum! Too bad I don't live nearby, would come here more often.

7.description: I ordered a gyro wrap with a side of hummus on Valentine's Day for delivery (in the middle of a snow storm...I'm from the south so this is unheard of), so I wasn't expecting much but OMG it was good. The portion sizes are more than worth the money (which is very reasonable), the staff from the lady that answered the phone to the delivery guy were nice and understanding.

49.description: Awesome, I will return a million more times

40.description: The lamb was delicious!!!! I would definitely get that again next time! The chicken pieces in the chicken wrap were just way too big to be wrapped. I opened it up and ate them individually.

53.description: Great neighborhood place with good service . Food is decent and great fries but the rest is a little bland for my palate . But nevertheless I like it hereI also like that it has a vibe of college kid energy and and families. Please go here often especially if you live in the south loop!

30.description: Pretty bad food. I have had better falafels and baklava else where. I would not waste my money on them

46.description: The food here is decent, but not amazing. The service is fast, the restaurant was very clean, but I felt like my food was missing some depth of flavor and balance. We ordered the gyro wrap which was a good portion, but had way too much meat and it was rather dry. The potato salad was good, slightly sweet in flavor. I've definitely had better gyros than this, but it was a pretty good price here. If you are looking for fast and quick and inexpensive, this is your place. For more tasty, authentic gyros, I would suggest somewhere different.

1.description: I had the gyro plate with oven potatoes as my side. I'm very satisfied as the meat portion is rather large. I wasn't sure if I could finish. I just took my time and filled up. The meat is okay. It is fresh and of good moisture. It wasn't as flavorful as what I'm used to, but is was okay. If you like lots of herbs, you'll enjoy the oven potatoes. This side dish was also large. The potatoes were well done. I didn't care for the salad. It was swimming in dressing which ended up all over my plate. The restaurant is clean, and the staff friendly. I would recommend this place for someone who wants a quick, filling meal. I don't recommend it for anyone looking for a lot of flavor.

55.description: Pretty good, ordered off GrubHub and delivered to the convention center

9.description: My favorite delivery restaurant!!I tried the gyros, chicken and beef kabobs and the rice. Everything is delicious specially the tzatziki sauce. One note is when you order their platter make sure to ask to seperate the salad. I recieved my gyros dipped in water from the salad more than one time. Their pita is also good btw, get a lot of it.

26.description: overall, a resounding eh.  very fast counter service and large portions for a good price.  the Greek salad was not great.  maybe I ordered the wrong thing...

25.description: If you like to be yelled at by the staff, this is the place for you! The mumbling clerk with a heavy accent yelled "A cup of water?" at me the third time I asked him to repeat it over the shitty techno-pop playing. But the wavy fries and falafel wrap are pretty good. Probably won't come back though.

12.description: Walked 4 blocks to get here starving. Me and the lady split the meat and veggie combo plates. Simply delicious. Plenty to eat for a reasonable price. Would come back.

59.description: I found this place on accident for a lunch break and now I've become a regular. The chicken gyro is pretty good. I haven't found a bad item on the menu yet.

21.description: We live a few blocks away and this is a our go to spot for a quick healthy dinner! I love their food and the staff is super friendly! Go here and support this great local business and enjoy a great meal too!

17.description: My boyfriend had a looooooong hair in is gyro plate. Gross.Outside of that, the prices are fair and the portions are large. We both got the gyro plate. It was tasty. We got delivery and it took about an hour early evening on Sunday.

10.description: A couple quick hitter neighborhood Mediterranean reviews while I'm feeling Yelpy. First up is Pita Heaven, a perfectly decent pick up and go place that offers solid off-hours dining (they are open from 10 to 10 err'day). Ordering is counter and food comes out in a jiffy.My go-to is the gyro wrap, decently priced with a heaping of Sysco-frozen, elementary-school crinkled-cut fries. The gyro meat isn't the best, but isn't the worst either. I like it far better than the kabob meat and bifteki, which are both too dry without being flavorful enough. Pita Heaven loads up the pita with a pileful of delicious tzatziki, so if you're a sauce fan, this pita is for you.The chicken wraps come, somewhat puzzlingly, with dijon mustard instead of tzatziki, which provides some insight into this place's target consumer base. If you weren't already tipped off by the Italian beef and hamburger offerings on the menu, that is. That said, the tzatziki is easily substitutable on the chicken shawarma or kebob wrap. Just ask.The baklava is packaged and available on the counter and always looks enticing, but so far I've managed to resist. Service is friendly and expedient, making this a good option in a rush.

5.description: Quick and tasty eats in the South Loop!  I ordered the hummus and the falafel wrap, and both were delicious.  The falafel wrap was a good value, but the hummus portion seemed a bit small to me for $5.95.  Maybe it was the small amount of pita bread that came with it.  Overall, though, the food was of good quality, the fast-casual atmosphere was comfortable and clean, and the staff was kind.  I will definitely be back.

3.description: The service and ambience were fine here, but the food was very bland. I'm used to more flavorful - maybe more garlicky - Middle Eastern food. The zucchini cakes and hummus were OK, but the falafel was dry. There was no feta on the side salad. The eggplant dip was not even close to baba ganouj - no smoky flavor whatsoever. It was like ham salad but with eggplant. Maybe their meat dishes are better?

35.description: Pita Heaven offers convenience, and a healthier food option for those living in South Loop. I want to like this place, but the past two salads I have ordered have had very slimy, bad arugula and/or lettuce in it. The first time it happened, I complained. They gave me my money back, but seemed to question me and my complaint, which was of course annoying.

19.description: This is my go to place for Greek food in the south loop. Great flavor and biiig portions for $10 per meal. The gyro pita wrap comes swimming in tzatziki sauce... Gets me hungry just talking about it. Also the staff is polite, great service in general.

28.description: I don't even think it is Greek owned anymore. I know Chris isn't working there. It seems like every time I call, Russian people answer. They didn't even know what Avgoleomo soup was. If you have a Mediterranean restaurant, you probably should know what that is. Let's hope the dinner we ordered for delivery tonight, i'd what we ordered.

45.description: Not the best fast food, but it makes do. They have a lot of options so it's a good place to stop by when you're in the mood/need to please picky eaters. The chicken kebabs are pretty good but I'd suggest avoiding the falafel.

33.description: Huge portions! We ordered a Chicken Shawarma plate, a Combination plate and some Greek Fries. This was more than enough for 3 hungry adults, we barely finished it. Located near the Grant Park. It was convenient to grab a quick lunch before heading out to walk the Lakefront Trail.

43.description: I got take out from here. The food was pretty bland, slightly overpriced and not impressive. The food wasn't disgusting by any standards but I was really unimpressed and disappointed. In a town with so many options for great food just like this - its a strong "pass"

2.description: Yeah, I'm a fan, BUT, just a few notes to self----Remember to ask that the Tzatziki Sauce be sided.----1st visit:  my gyros was baptized in too much damn Tzatziki Sauce :/|--If ordering the gyros plate w/side salad, remember to ask that the gyros/salad be separated.-----2nd visit:  some of the gyro meat was sitting in water :/

18.description: This is a great fast food restaurant. I love the gyros, which are always flavorful, fresh, and never dry. They give way more food than I can eat in one sitting, and The prices are about what you'd expect for a fast food restaurant: I ordered a gyro and fries and I think it cost about $8.  I don't love the french fries, but I always forget to get something different.   The staff is always very friendly and patient even when I'm being indecisive. The location is awesome, although parking in that area is tough. They do deliver, and have a really wide delivery area, so if you can't make it on, you can have it delivered to your door! I love Pita Heaven and think it's a must try.

41.description: This place has great food. You can take out, dine in, or even get the food delivered!They have tons of options even healthy and vegetarian options which isnt always easy to find. The workers here are also really nice as well.

52.description: Great option for quick mediterranean food. The greek fries are awesome! Don't order the steamed vegetables as a side. They taste like they are soaked in lemon juice. The gyro sandwich is stuffed with meat so I usually have some leftover. Great deal for the price!

50.description: This is a great fast food restaurant. I love the gyros, which are always flavorful, fresh, and never dry. They give way more food than I can eat in one sitting, and The prices are about what you'd expect for a fast food restaurant: I ordered a gyro and fries and I think it cost about $8.  I don't love the french fries, but I always forget to get something different.   The staff is always very friendly and patient even when I'm being indecisive. The location is awesome, although parking in that area is tough. They do deliver, and have a really wide delivery area, so if you can't make it on, you can have it delivered to your door! I love Pita Heaven and think it's a must try.

4.description: I am so happy we stumbled upon this great restaurant during our trip to Chicago. Never have I had such generous portions of meat and bread for our gyros. We order a gyro wrap and a gyro plate, as well as a squid salad. The gyro plate was huge! Definitely sharable for 2 people, we were going given a huge stack of toasty and fresh bread. The lamb was tasty and fresh, perfectly seasoned. The staff was also very friendly and had our experience very pleasant. This place totally exceeded my expectations of a street corner gyro place!

6.description: I ordered the gyro and fries to go. I was a fan of the sandwich, but the fries were a little too crispy and didn't have enough seasoning. Prices are decent and I will be back to order more menu items.

22.description: Overall the food was really good. a little on the bland side. The big complaint is that they delivered none of the condiments, plates or anything I requested through Eat24. In speaking with Eat24, this restaurant simply didn't read my entire order. I travel and use Eat24 to get food delivered rather than eating inferior hotel food. The restaurant needs to pay better attention because now I am less likely to order from them again.

15.description: The food here is decent, but not amazing. The service is fast, the restaurant was very clean, but I felt like my food was missing some depth of flavor and balance. We ordered the gyro wrap which was a good portion, but had way too much meat and it was rather dry. The potato salad was good, slightly sweet in flavor. I've definitely had better gyros than this, but it was a pretty good price here. If you are looking for fast and quick and inexpensive, this is your place. For more tasty, authentic gyros, I would suggest somewhere different.

57.description: Been here a number of times since we can walk here from our place. I've had gyros, kabobs, Greek salad, & combo platter and my wife usually gets the chicken gyros.  Everything we've had has been good--very good.  You order at the counter and they bring it out to you, so it isn't heavy on service, but everyone has been nice and helpful with questions.  Recommended!

20.description: Place is clean, service friendly and food is decent. Chicken came out great, but the bread is not fresh baked and potato sides are less than average.

36.description: Gyros Sandwich is good. But the stuffed grape leaves where OK. Im gonna treat myself and have a salad also

14.description: As a first timer last night, I was excited to try a new place. I ordered an Italian Beef dipped with cheese on top and bottom. I unwrap sandwich and there was only cheese on the bottom...and it was dry...ok no problem..things happen. I took one bite and it was incredibly salty. I couldn't eat it. My aunt ordered the same sandwich and she texted me the exact same thing. I took a bite of my fiance's burger and that was really good. Maybe a Greek restaurant shouldn't sell Italian Beef. The fries were good and the chips were tasty as well.

3.description: Worst pizza I have ever had in my life. Disgusting. I don't understand how it could be so terrible. I would have rather eaten a piece of white bread with ketchup and American cheese on top. So disgusting. And got flour all over me. Horrible.

1.description: The dining choices at McCormick Place are very limited.  Furthermore, the bar is set pretty low when eating at a convention center.  I wasn't expecting much, but I was in Chicago and I wanted to enjoy some deep dish pizza.  I knew that it wasn't going to be great, but Connie's looked better than the McDonald's across the way.After flagging someone down to take my order (this was pre-show, but there were still people working), I grabbed my tray and proceeded down the cafeteria-style line.  I gave my card to Ms. Apathy 2010 to pay for my single slice and soda which needed to be run a few times and proceeded to the rather spacious seating area and searched for a table that didn't have crumbs or smears on it.  Pizza was not great, but acceptable until I hit the cold patch in the center.  Seriously?

2.description: Worst service ever! Lady working at stand had the hospitality of a junkyard dog screaming "All I have is sausage!!!!" As long as the line was, we had no clue what type of stand was there, and many of us were returning the yells with "Sausage WHAT!?" The lady behind the counter became agitated and told us to get out of the line...We didn't of course, but certainly should have. The stand workers moved glacially and were unconcerned about the length of the line (my guess is 75-100 people). When we finally did get the pizza, it was cold and mediocre at best...Make sure you dine before your conference.

0.description: I was here for the 2013 Chicago Police Test, and I noticed there was a Connie's Pizza in the corridor between Halls A1 and B1 in complex.I didn't buy anything; it was closed, but it was there. I checked in and I am reviewing because if you are in Chicago, go to a different place, anywhere, for pizza. Connie's is not that good; go to Pizzeria Uno/Due, Lou Malnati's, or Gino's East for Deep Dish/Pan, or Art of Pizza or Giordano's for Stuffed. Connie's is pretty low on the food chain when it comes to good pizza. Sorry not sorry.

4.description: We all know that McCormick Place was ill conceived from the perspective of food amenities. I mean how did they envision tens of thousands of people only eating in a narrow food court or the McDonalds located in the North Building. Nevertheless, Connie's Pizza is housed in the McCormick but it seems like the owners don't really care. This quick serve place offered some of the most disgusting foods, including Pizza and stale salads. I am not sure why the owners don't invest a bit more time and money into the location as the traffic must be quite considerable. Unfortunately, poor food and service does not bode well for the entire organization. I would recommend avoiding Connie's Pizza and perhaps consider the Hyatt hotel or McDonalds for decent food. All the best and good luck in Chicago!

58.description: Wasn't expecting much but this place was great and we're glad it's in the neighborhood. I can't speak to the authenticity but both our curries were better than the vast majority of Indian we've had, especially the lamb tikka masala. The garlic naan was also a real hit in fact we got an extra one to go. The service was attentive and accommodating for dine in (haven't done take out or delivery yet) and we will definitely be back!

56.description: I've only had the Chicken Tikka and Naan, but both were delicious. I recommend.

29.description: First...I am not a native or expert on this cuisine. However I have travelled to India (not Nepal) and enjoyed preparations from many areas besides Mumbai. So, I believe the depth of the flavors and preparation are very representative of what I remember. You can tell by the aromas coming from the kitchen early in the day before the restaurant opens. The best curries and flavors come from the freshest ingredients which must be layered into the dishes. Nepal house does this very well and if you prefer a spicy dish they are quite capable of raising the heat! My only knock on Nepal House is the prices. They are high relative to the portions. While I'm not against paying for top quality, this is my only negative.

42.description: I've only ordered takeout and delivery here but have done so A LOT. So far, they have the best Indian food I've had in Chicago south of Devon avenue. They have a solid selection of north and some South Indian dishes, and everything I've had has always been super fresh, flavorful, and incredibly delicious. I get the Chana saag often as well as the lamb korma, queema, and chicken vindaloo. Unlike many other places I've been, their vindaloo is not only hot but SUPER tasty; it burns a lot to eat but I just can't stop shoveling it into my mouth, which is exactly what I want from a really hot dish. They have some chaat as well, and the chutneys and relish are always fresh and on-point. Their sweets are light and not dense or overwhelming, even heavy ones like gulab jamun are fluffy in texture even if covered in syrup. Their queema is well spiced and never greasy, which is another problem I've had at other restaurants. Their kebabs are always juicy, tender, and flavorful. Whoever is in the kitchen here knows what they are doing and cares a lot about making delicious food with a homey feel. I don't know much about Nepalese food and haven't had their Nepali dishes, but I can only imagine they are just as good given that this is their specialty. Delivery aways arrives hot (or cold if its a cold dish) and carefully-packed, and they are always really nice on the phone. I cannot recommend this place enough. If you live far away from Devon avenue, go here. They have never let me down.

23.description: This restaurant has standard Indian fare and the dining experience was better than I expected.  It is in a good location on the corner of 13th and Michigan and the staff was friendly and helpful.  If you are hungry for something quick on a weeknight or are a local and don't want to go too far this restaurant will do the trick.

47.description: I live right next door to this restaurant and ordered in one day. Food was below average with no real taste whatsoever! There are far better places for Indian and Nepali food in the city so stay away I suggest!

8.description: I ordered chicken makhani, lamb vindaloo, and garlic naan for delivery. It was pricey, but I expected that after reading the reviews. Unfortunately, I was pretty disappointed with my order and probably won't be ordering from here again. The chicken makhani had great flavor, but it was extremely watery. The lamb in the lamb vindaloo was delicious, but I thought the texture of the sauce was a little off from what I'm used to. On a positive note, the garlic naan was amazing and delivery time was reasonable.

31.description: Came here for lunch buffet and there were a smaller amount of options compared to other Indian buffets that I've been to but food was still tasty. Wished they had more soup and dessert options. On the pricier end for lunch buffet but considering the location it was expected.

34.description: Food is excellent. Went there for the lunch buffet and was very impressed with the taste and quality of the food. Highly recommend this place.

16.description: I love this place. It's so delicious. Slow service for sit down but WORTH it. Grab takeout, you will be happy! I especially love the paneer makhani and the navratan korma. I wish more naan came with the orders though!

13.description: Love their Chicken makhni , Dal makhni , Chicken dum-sum and Garlic Naan.Best thing about them.- Love their delivery service at home.- Always on time.- Food is always amazing.

11.description: Ordered chicken chili, garlic and cheese naan, butter chicken and Nepali dumpling. Loved the chicken chili but they gave such a small portion for the price it costs, the naan were really good but I think they should call cheese naan: panner naan instead because it wasn't "cheese" naan. I didn't like that one but the garlic naan was delicious! The butter chicken was very different from the ones we usually eat but it tasted really good. And the dumplings were okay, nothing like the authentic ones. This place is a bit fancy and expensive. I don't know if I'll go there again... But overall, it was alright.

39.description: This review is for the lunch buffet. After an appointment near by I randomly decided that I wanted something other than a sandwich for lunch, so I walked into this place. I was low on time, so the lunch buffet was ideal. There was a good selection of both meat and vegetarian dishes here, and everything I tasted was wonderful. I see reviews on here saying that the plated dishes are top notch as well. I'll have to come back sometime and try those as well

37.description: We ordered takeout from this place twice. The food arrived pretty quickly. It was amazing and flavorful both times! We really enjoyed the Dal Makhani and the chicken biriani! I used the leftover rice to make stuffed peppers for dinner the next night.

0.description: I'd like to think I'm seasoned-buffet goer, especially to Indian ones, or in this case, ones with a strong Indian influence.First off, I will start by saying that this review is only based on the 4+ times I've going to the buffet, and buffet only. The buffet quality is actually pretty good, although a limited selection (only 8 choices of cooked/prep food, and some cold/dessert choices as well). They also tend to offer the same dishes for there buffet each time, or they at least keep 6-7 out of the 8 dishes the same.I really like the tandoori chick and lamb curry the offer, but as mentioned above, if you come here often, the lack of variety can get dull. Buffet goers also get naan but from all my times coming here, it takes like 20 minutes before it arrives, for fast eaters like me, 20 minutes is a lifetime. Service can get inconsistent if its busy. Water refills, plate clean up and receiving naan can be very spotty since they usually only have like a waiter or two for the whole place.

38.description: Got a few curries and the spinach with cheeseNot bad, but a little pricey for what you get.

51.description: Love this place. I don't really understand the bad reviews. The food is delicious, great service and fair prices. I like that you have option between Nepal and India cuisine.They have like 8 different types of Naan. It's amazing!!! The sauces are delicious for the soma's. I highly recommend. We'll be back for sure and just became one of our favorite Indian places. YUM!

27.description: While overall I would say that it was tasty, I likely would not order delivery again. The portions were fairly small considering it was $45 for two entrees and 1 order of naan. The naan order was only 1 piece. The food itself tasted good, just not worth the price considering the portions are small.

32.description: Great food,  great service, and very friendly staff ! I Highly recommend it! We loved the chicken tikki Masala

54.description: Hubby and me were strolling on Mich ave in the South loop and decided to give Nepal House another try for lunch on a Saturday. There were a few customers in there and they have a lunch buffet. The buffet is small, with not too many choices. We decided to take the buffet. The first odd thing was the choice of plates at the buffet. It was a small shallow bowl-kind of plate, good for soups and such. I thought that the regular plates needed to be brought out and I asked the waiter for regular plates. He gruffly said - these are the plates for the buffet. Okay, then! It was impossible to eat from that plate. Every curry mixed in with the next one, super messy and a VERY BAD way to eat an Indian buffet. We sat at our table with our vegetables and curry waiting for over 10 mins for the naan to arrive at our table. I had to flag 3 ppl down to tell them that we were waiting for naan. Terrible service and people skills. The food was ok - definitely not the best out there, certainly not the worst.More ppl walked in for the lunch buffet - the restaurant was still only two thirds full at this point. At 2:10pm, the host came and told us that we should load our plates up because the buffet was going to close in 5 minutes. Who shuts down a lunch service buffet at 2:15pm on a weekend? Its like they don't want to do business. I hate to say this about this South Loop restaurant, but this place sucks!! For the price point they are at, they should have excellent service and great food. Nothing works at this place. I am not going back to this place ever.

48.description: delicious buffet!

44.description: I've lived in the neighborhood for a year and a half and have wanted to try this restaurant but couldn't get any one to try it with me. My 21 year old daughter came over and I insisted she come with me. Big mistake. We ordered the Tandoori 1/2 chicken. It was very very dry like it was old.  Our waiter didn't bring the Basmati rice so I asked him doesn't this dish come with rice and he said not with the 1/2 chicken well it doesn't say that on the menu also we found a hair in the free appetizers they give you. I put the hair on a white plate to show him and he said oh I'm sorry. WTF ! I'm sorry doesn't cut it for me. I work in the service industry and he should have comped the the meal or offered a free desert. Will never be back.

24.description: I wanted to try this place since the day I saw its name on a Chicago tourist magazine. My experience:Greasy samosas and dried meat ... I've had better Indian food at other places . Food tasted reheated and old... Specially the rice and the meat/chicken . I ordered delivery with grub hub and is my last time ordering from this place . It's easy to notice when the food is fresh and when is not ... Im definitely not ordering from this place again. 60 dollar dinner for two was a total waste of money. I eat better at chipotle for less .

7.description: I like this place. I have been to many indian and nepalese restautants but this one stands out the most. I ordered chicken momo and goat choila as an appetizer . i think it was great. Chicken momo was medium spice and had tasted great. The choila was a little sweet but hey i am not complaining because i am not a big fan of too spicy food. I ordered lamb korma as my entre along with a garlic naan. The korma was as i expected it to be. Medium spiced. Creamy and big chunks of lamb with enough sauce for your rice. Now let me tell you about the naan. They have the best naan here out of all the places i have been to. It was fluffy. Crispy and perfectly cooked. It was not suggy at all. Would have given a 5 star but i felt like it was a little to pricy. But the quality of service and food makea it totally worth it.

49.description: This place is awesome. Dont do the lunch buffet its just okay. Just order your food. The lamb is so good order lamb vibdaloo if you like spicy food. If your a vegetarian get the palak paneer. (spinach dish) really awesome as well not spicy. If you want other non spicy options order chicken tandoori (chicken kabob) or chicken tikka masala (chicken in creamy tomato sauce).Indian/ nepali places are great when you know what to order. You can always order things mild / medium / hot just ask and you shall receive.

40.description: Ordered lamb curry through seamless today. Prompt delivery, tightly packed. The amount is just right for me(female), and taste is awesome. Delicious curry, just a little bit spicy which makes it even better, lamb is tender and tasty. Recommend!

53.description: Since I moved to the South Loop, I have loved getting Indian from Nepal House and I would easily give them four stars... until tonight. I ordered my usual with a few friends and awaited a good meal. Unfortunately when it arrived, the order looked wrong. When I called to inquire, the manager was dismissive and said it was correct. Now, I have ordered about a dozen times the same dishes and I can tell you, this was not correct. He tried to explain the chef was different this evening so the dishes may look different but assured me the ingredients were the same. I tried them and was immediately disappointed. It was so unpleasant. Let's see: the tikka masala- yellow, watery and gross; the chicken vindaloo- a mess of bad seasoning, chewy chicken and weak taste; the chicken 65- well, we got lamb so that should tell you how that went; even the samosas were so unbelievably unpleasant it was barely edible. To top this off, the person on the phone was rude and unapologetic. All in all, the meal basically went straight to the trash and we were left with a very bad taste in our mouths.

30.description: 4 stars for food but overall 3 stars for service and attitude. Here is the short scoop.....This was our first trip to Nepal House and we wanted to order their Lamb Sekuwa since its chef recommended (in red font and all on the menu), but sadly they didn't have it since its a 'new menu'. I didn't understand the correlation of a new menu and non availability of their chef recommended dish. That said, we were pleasantly surprised by the food that was available. Although, not authentic Nepalese, our Chicken biryani, the Lamb Khasi and keema nan were all well prepared. The food alone would warrant a visit again! However, between their service and certain charges such as a $7 corkage and $2 for a few slices of raw Onions (a staple with Indian food), we might only do takeout or delivery. They don't close until 10 but by 9:15 during our meal, the server came twice to remove the pickle and chutney container, since it had to be washed before closing. Did I mention, we were still only half way through our meal? For a restaurant that's almost always empty, they can make some very minor tweaks that would earn them repeat customers including myself....oh, well one can hope!

46.description: I luv Indian food!! Nepal house has awesome food!! Not too oily which I appreciate! Prices are fair. Service isn't the best, however from my experience that's pretty typical of all of the Indian restaurants I have dined at (sooo many ) This is our go to Indian joint! Try it u won't regret it!!

1.description: I do not know anything about Indian food so I don't know how this compares. However, the food is pretty delicious in my opinion. We have had the curry chicken, butter chicken and garlic, cheese and regular Naan so far. My boyfriend and I tend to like a nice bit of spice and usually go with medium ( because it does build) or hot. We were offered "Indian hot" and it was way too much for me! Haha I had about two bites of my boyfriend's food and was done! The staff is always friendly and when we order out it is always on time. I haven't had their lunch buffet but I've heard good things about it!

55.description: We really enjoy the food and price point. This and sister restaurant Curry House are both very good buffets.

9.description: Pretty decent lunch buffet for $12 on a weekday. It's within walking distance of the museums, and a lot cheaper than most of those cafes. But Gulab Jamun only gets you 3 pieces for $3.95. Should be less than $1 per donut hole IMO.Service was a bit slow. All food was ordered to come immediately, yet the appetizer Vegetable Momo came about 10 minutes after everyone was done eating. I was about ready to just have it taken off the bill.

26.description: Ate here with two friends a few weeks ago.   We ordered the lamb vindaloo and a fish entrée.  The servers were very polite and patient and service was reasonable.  When we received our food, we were at first taken aback by how little there was; it barely seemed like enough for one person, let alone three of us.  However, the proteins were surprisingly filling and none of us left hungry.  The food was okay, good enough if you're hungry but probably not something you would eat if you're looking for quality Nepalese/Indian food.

25.description: Love their Chicken makhni , Dal makhni , Chicken dum-sum and Garlic Naan.Best thing about them.- Love their delivery service at home.- Always on time.- Food is always amazing.

12.description: Been to this place twice and was impressed each time. The food was tasty and fingerlickin' good! The naan they bring out (or was it something else?) was deliciously warm. Some kinks was with the placement of the sign. I'm not sure if they were just misplaced but chicken and lamb is very different. They offer a variety of meat (no pork... :P) and some choices of salads and dessert. Do give this a try!

59.description: Really great experience. Now, I'm definitely no connoisseur of Nepalese fare,  but was thoroughly impressed. We started with the vegetable momo, which was delicious. I could've eaten a dozen of them! The menu does a great job of spelling out what each item is, for rookies such as myself (appreciate that! ). There was a huge selection of vegetarian items (another plus for me). For the main course, I went with the vegetable kofta. It was amazing! I will be back for that dish alone! Yeah,  like other yelpers mentioned, service could've been better. There was an exorbitant amount of time between being seated and being waited upon. Luckily, we weren't in a rush. And luckily, the food was worth the wait.

21.description: Been to this place twice and was impressed each time. The food was tasty and fingerlickin' good! The naan they bring out (or was it something else?) was deliciously warm. Some kinks was with the placement of the sign. I'm not sure if they were just misplaced but chicken and lamb is very different. They offer a variety of meat (no pork... :P) and some choices of salads and dessert. Do give this a try!

17.description: This review is for the lunch buffet. After an appointment near by I randomly decided that I wanted something other than a sandwich for lunch, so I walked into this place. I was low on time, so the lunch buffet was ideal. There was a good selection of both meat and vegetarian dishes here, and everything I tasted was wonderful. I see reviews on here saying that the plated dishes are top notch as well. I'll have to come back sometime and try those as well

10.description: Great restaurant because they work at it. From soup to nuts, Nepal House does it right. Friendly, nicely decorated, spotlessly clean, food is very good, reasonable prices, you can't help feeling glad you came. I went there with my wife, daughter and her friend. We brought a few bottles of wine with us which they gladly opened for a very small corkage fee. We had two appetizers and four entrees, all excellent, and did not break the bank.  I look forward to returning.

5.description: Nepal House has recently been renovated and this was our first time back since it has reopened. We ordered the special non-vegetarian dinner for two with tandoori chicken, butter chicken, chicken tikka, lamb kebab, and plenty of naan to sop up sauces. We also ordered momos for appetizers which were delicious. This place was doing a nice business for a Saturday night. Even with a $7.00 corkage fee for BYOB it is good value for the money.

3.description: We had goat securra and it was really awesome. Would like to have it in future  and would definitely recommend to everyone.

35.description: Pretty decent lunch buffet for $12 on a weekday. It's within walking distance of the museums, and a lot cheaper than most of those cafes. But Gulab Jamun only gets you 3 pieces for $3.95. Should be less than $1 per donut hole IMO.Service was a bit slow. All food was ordered to come immediately, yet the appetizer Vegetable Momo came about 10 minutes after everyone was done eating. I was about ready to just have it taken off the bill.

19.description: If I could give negative stars I would. We ordered food 2 hours and 10 minutes ago-at 6:45. They told us that the food would arrive from 7:50-8:15. Then, at 8:00, they contacted us saying the food would arrive between 8:15-8:25. We were annoyed, but thought, "oh well". At 8:35, there was still no food, so I called. The woman I talked to told me Lake Shore Drive was closed and it was taking her driver a long time to get to us. She said she would call her driver and get back to me. She never did. At 9:00, I called her and back and told her the food STILL had not arrived. She told me she would call her driver again and get back to me again in 5 minutes. It has been 5 minutes with still no phone call. What makes matters worse is that Nepal House is 2 miles away from our house. They could have walked her and been over on time. FURTHERMORE, one does not need to take Lake Shore Drive to get to our house. She knew where our address was, because she asked me when I called her the first time. That means she lied to me, in order to buy herself more time. They did not offer any reimbursement for delaying our meal for so long, either. After waiting for over 2 hours (and 1 hour later than the original time), that is the very least a restaurant could do.I mean I hope the driver is alright, but the customer service was just awful.EDIT: We finally got the food. It is completely cold, but they refunded our money, which is the very least they could do.

28.description: I really love this place. The only thing that could possibly knock it down for me is the price. Around $14 for each meal. But they do have good portion sizes, which somewhat makes up for it. We've come here more than once, and always have gotten seated right away - there are always people in there, but it's not overly crowded. They start you off with a serving of papad, which comes with a couple different kinds of chutney. Good, but it's obviously been made some time back. I've tried three different dishes here: the Chicken Makhani (butter chicken), Chana Masala, and the Chicken Madras. I enjoyed all of them, but the best was definitely the butter chicken. There's pretty much a 100% chance of me coming back here.

45.description: The food was good, but delivery took 2 hours (one hour over the hour estimate), which was very disappointing.

33.description: I love this restaurant. Garlic nans are fresh. Chicken tandoori is my favorite. I order for delivery almost every week and it come hot even tho I live 6 miles away. Proud of these restaurant. Drivers are polite and professional.

43.description: Offers a buffet which is awesome for this type of cuisine- you get to try so much! Tandoori chicken and mango dessert were very good.

2.description: This place is the best indian restaurant in downtown Chicago I have been to this place lot of times and had deliveries alsoFirst dinning experience - it is not too crowded or empty, staff is very friendly and have enough choices to choose from. Also our orders are served within 10 mins (thats a huge plus for indian restaurant), taste is ok (i wont say great)Deliveries - they are always on time (i live two blocks away), they are packed well and always served hotPros: location, pleasant atmosphere Cons: pricey

18.description: I wanted to try this place since the day I saw its name on a Chicago tourist magazine. My experience:Greasy samosas and dried meat ... I've had better Indian food at other places . Food tasted reheated and old... Specially the rice and the meat/chicken . I ordered delivery with grub hub and is my last time ordering from this place . It's easy to notice when the food is fresh and when is not ... Im definitely not ordering from this place again. 60 dollar dinner for two was a total waste of money. I eat better at chipotle for less .

41.description: Great food.  Tastes authentic as compared to other Indian restaurants.Price is reasonable for Chicago downtown location.

52.description: Good restaurant with friendly staff, also a really good lunch buffet. I've had multiple things from the menu and it has all been solid. Get the chicken momos!

50.description: Well its more of a 2.5 rather than 3 star place. Had lunch buffet. Decent but i have had better. $11 is the price.. 2 non veg main dish and 1 non veg snack. Rest all is veg. Looked decent enough but didn't try any veg dish. The place was literally empty on a Wednesday noon.

4.description: 4 stars for food but overall 3 stars for service and attitude. Here is the short scoop.....This was our first trip to Nepal House and we wanted to order their Lamb Sekuwa since its chef recommended (in red font and all on the menu), but sadly they didn't have it since its a 'new menu'. I didn't understand the correlation of a new menu and non availability of their chef recommended dish. That said, we were pleasantly surprised by the food that was available. Although, not authentic Nepalese, our Chicken biryani, the Lamb Khasi and keema nan were all well prepared. The food alone would warrant a visit again! However, between their service and certain charges such as a $7 corkage and $2 for a few slices of raw Onions (a staple with Indian food), we might only do takeout or delivery. They don't close until 10 but by 9:15 during our meal, the server came twice to remove the pickle and chutney container, since it had to be washed before closing. Did I mention, we were still only half way through our meal? For a restaurant that's almost always empty, they can make some very minor tweaks that would earn them repeat customers including myself....oh, well one can hope!

6.description: Excellent food, nice seating arrangements, . courteous staff, If you love nepali food a must try. I can say this authentically because i ate only nepali food through out my stay in different cities and this place is the best

22.description: I've only been here for the lunch buffet and it's amazing. Great flavors, not greasy, tons of options. High quality Indian food in my opinion.

15.description: Ordered takeout from this place and it was ready within 20 minutes. The chicken tikka masala and chicken momo were absolutely delicious!  The only thing is the naan was different from what I'm used to. It was more like a chip but still very flavorful.

57.description: My family of 3 visited this restaurant while on a short trip to Chicago.  We were staying down the street, and wanted something that was both quick, and had a deal listed on restaurant.com (we have gift cards for that site).  We ordered the chicken chili (definitely recommend) and we ordered the Non-veg Dinner.  It came with lots of AMAZING food, and only one thing that was slightly meh.  It had two different types of curry, one with cheese and peas, and the other was a chicken tikka.  It came with naan and rice. Both of the curries were excellent.  I honestly couldn't pick my favorite.  The naan was naan, and the rice was rice. Both were as good as could be expected. It was a huge meal for two and we definitely have leftovers.  The meh part was the tandoori chicken and lamb. The lamb part was awesome, but the chicken could have used some help. It wasn't bad, but i think it needed a little extra punch of flavor.  We also ordered "galub jamun" for desert.  It's sweet dumplings in saffron syrup.  they tasted like a fresh warm donut.  It was awesome and even my 2 year old wouldn't keep away from it.  Prices are reasonable, especially when you use the restaurant.com gift cards! The staff was friendly and attentive.  My two year old had a mini tantrum when we entered, and within seconds they delivered a plate of the chips and a drink for her.  I am no beer/wine expert, but i also recommend getting the Newcastle with the dinner.  They worked well together.  There are tons of food options around this area, but I'm glad we chose this place.  If we lived in the area, we would certainly be repeat customers.  It's definitely going on our agenda for our next visit.

20.description: We ate dinner at Nepal House a few nights ago and thoroughly enjoyed our food and and the friendly service. We ordered Paneer Pakora for our appetizer, Kashmiri naan, Aloo Tama Bodi and Dal Makhani. The food was uniformly excellent and the portions were generous. We found the prices quite reasonable for the quality and portion size and the location is very convenient. We will definitely return.

36.description: Yum. It's a great place with yummy food. It has a semi-upscale feel but ok for anyone who enjoys indian or wants to try it out. I took my kid and she looked the buttered chicken. Parking is horrible. There is a garage across the street with reasonable rates

14.description: The food here is okay. I don't see how their version of Nepali food any different from Indian food. The waiters here at super pushy. They came to check on my friend and I at least 8 time during an hour of period. We ate light and wanted to have a nice conversation but they kept on wanting to take our plates away. It was obvious we had not finished out meal yet. I will never go back again.

36.description: Okay I know it takes a few minutes to get helped at this place, sometimes the sales guys /slash/ bike technicians /slash/ whatever they are take a little longer to get to you because they are busy with another customer, or they're fixing something, or they are staring at the ceiling.  Listen, the place is like a nutty inventor's garage, run by his crazy kids.  They don't always have what you want, and they don't get things done exactly when they say they wiil, but it's a place owned and run by people.  They get to know you, they like you, they help.They have a pretty broad assortment of bikes, priced pretty high.  I bought a bike on the street for a hundred bucks...  they fixed it up, made it great for a hundred dollars.  I like them.  They are nice.

29.description: I haven't had any repairs done here, I just stopped in for a few times looking for a new bike. Each time the three different employees I dealt with were kind and patient and really took the time to explain to me all the different bikes and answer all of the questions I had. Didn't end up buying a bike from  here because I found a great deal on craigslist, but I definitely recommend stopping in here for any of your bike needs. They have a great selection of Jamis and Kona bikes as well as some others.

42.description: KONA bike dealer, period.Lesson one in buying a bike, ride them, ride them all. If the shop won't let you ride BEFORE you buy, you've made a huge mistake.Carmichael alone makes the trip worth it, as he is on the small list of independent dealers that you want to support because he actually gives a darn. And he has a great selection of independent bike companies that follow suit.Some people will be put off with the atmosphere, which is just fine with me.

23.description: This place is awesome. Fast, friendly service. A super cool guard dog. And they didn't even charge me to realign my back tire so I could get back home on my bike. I would recommend this place to anyone.

31.description: Got a flat tire one time, took it here and they fixed it quick.  Very nice and friendly staff!

34.description: Update - got a bike from Working Bikes since there was nothing in my price range at Cycle Bike Shop.  Took it there for a checkup and some repair work - they were fairly nice and didn't treat me like an idiot.  They were honest in the sense that they told me I shouldn't put much money into fixing up this old bike but they were also creative in thinking of the cheapest ways to make it fit me better.  They originally told me to come back the same day but weren't finished and requested another day.  They were nice about it so no big deal - went back the next day and I love my bike now!Thanks Cycle Bike Shop!

16.description: I am a big fan of Cycle bike shop.  I purchased my bike there several years ago and its still one of the best bikes around when I compare it to my friends.  Lightweight, sturdy, great handling, and I didn't have to mortgage the house.  A Kona, a little obscure but a real trooper.   Carmichael customized it in ways I am still understanding --  rigging my rack so its sturdy, adjusting the handlebars, adding fenders, tweeking it as needed whenever I brought it in.  Chains, spokes, tubes, you name it.  Every year i bring it in for an overhaul and some new parts, and the work is always top notch but not insanely expensive.  Everyone who works there is very nice and they know what they are doing.  Love it!

11.description: Let's start with Carmichael.  He is the smartest bike person you will ever meet and he always wants to do things right.  He's got a quirky, deadpan way about him which I find engaging.  When I've wanted to do tricky modifications, Carmichael (or sometimes one of his well-trained employees) has always done a great job. And I'm something of a "bike guy" so I would know.  The staff at this shop sell you what you need without trying to up-sell.I believe Carmichael used to travel to Europe and do wrenching for some of the big-name races out there.  I don't know if he still does that, but that's the level of skill we are talking about.I remember one of his staff telling me about when she installed a new tube for a customer, and when she remounted the tire she didn't put the label by the valve stem (which helps figure out leak sources in case of future flats).  He made her redo the mount and she got it right every time after that.The most recent time I needed something done (new fenders) it was a cold Sunday in December just before Christmas.  My sister came over, and by the time she left Cycle's closing time had already passed.  I figured I would have to work out some way to pick up after work.  But Lo! Here's a call from Carmichael.  He had kept the shop open 40 minutes past closing so I'd have a chance to come in and get the bike.I thought I did a Yelp review of Cycle bike shop long ago.  I've bought a couple bikes for my family here, and had work done on bikes probably 20-40 times in the last 15 years.

39.description: Unexpected in this area.  I was having bike issues and the first bike messenger I asked told me it was the best shop around there.  The dog is hilarious, but seriously they hooked me up with service right away on a very busy day.  I only wish it hadn't been so rushed because while what I asked for was done awesomely, something was missed and caused the initial problem to reoccur. I figured out how to fix it myself the second time so it didn't matter anyway.  I'd hit it again.

37.description: This place sucks.  I wanted it to be good because it's so close to my home.  But service is terrible and don't look for gear or supplies here as they have very little inventory.POOR SERVICETune-ups are done slowly and incompletely.  Sometimes, after leaving the bike for a week or more, I'd return only to wait for them to "finish up" (read: we haven't gotten to it yet.)  So they'd put some air in the tires, squeeze the brake levers a couple times, and charge me for a tune up.They don't use a pressure gauge when filling tires.  Apparently they feel that their compressor is magic and will naturally find the correct air pressure level, automatically stopping at that point.  The bike tech actually said this to me.  (Although they didn't say "magic".)GROSS NEGLIGENCEFor one tune-up they did nothing other than slightly loosen the stem from the fork.  I have no idea why they thought this was necessary, but they let me take the bike without warning.  Guess what happened next.SALES & INVENTORY SUCKLast year I cut a tire on my mountain bike.  Cycle Bike did not have one in stock (wtf - it's a common item), so they wanted sell me a slick rather than a knobby...WTF?   Oh, and the place is a filthy, disorganized mess.

0.description: Excellent service, reasonable prices, with a personal touch.  Absolutely recommend this LBS.
