38.description: go to this bike shop- i hope carmichael gets enough business to stay in business during these times b/c it's a bike shop worth preserving.  got my new kona commuter bike (eschewing my "local" LBS) and he worked with me every step of the way to make it custom and exactly the way i wanted it.   plus, his dog W is a hoot.  he has a pretty wide range of bikes, mostly on the urban/commuter variety but i think he's the type that can order/make you something custom.  plus he has an assortment of used bikes as well.

27.description: Let me tell you a story- a story of a bike named Rapido. Radpido was normally a fast bike. Most times you couldn't see him, he was so speedy! He OWNED the streets of Chicago. One day, he wasn't feeling too well. Radipo's back tire suddenly went flat! He leaned against his best friend and they walked together to a bike shop named Cycle. This bike shop is close making it an obvious choice as Rapido could barely roll. Sarah cried to the mechanic, 'it's his wheel! will he ever dance again!?' 'Don't fret,' the man replied, he fixed the wheel in a jiffy and after a $17 exchange the two were on their way...But then... oh then, a terrible, TERRIBLE thing happened. Sarah took Rapido out for a spin- a ten mile spin. What happened when she finally reached her destination?! Yes, another flat. So the girl returned to Cycle to get Rapido's back tire fixed yet again. The man was very apologetic, 'sorry- so sorry,' and he fixed it in a jiff! Sarah said, 'thank you,' and the two merrily rolled into the sun light... but soon enough- another flat. THIS TIME Sarah (...and Rapido too) was not happy. She had all the intentions of yelling at the mechanic telling him 'what is up' but cat caught her tongue and the man called for a new tube ($44). What did we learn from this excursion you may ask? I don't think it was Cycle after all that gave Rapido his reoccurring flats. However I don't think I should have paid the initial $17 when it didn't help the situation in the least... I would have rather them gave me the new tube in the first place. But as I said it's a convenient location, and I will be back. The store is small- not many nick-nacks or streamers for your bike but I assume you can get a decent tune up when needed. There is a dog. Named W.

32.description: I am not a mega-biker, just have a normal bike that I use for running errands in the neighborhood.  This place has always been great for repairs.  It's not white-glove service or anything, but the people working there seem to know what they're doing and have never tried to up-sell me and have always completed any work on time.

13.description: Dog friendly, knowledgeable and unpretentious staff here make all the difference!  I've brought in a couple of folks to test out different models for their first bike purchase, and never even once did the experts employed there roll their eyes or anything!  They can do all of the basics, of course, but even if you can be a bit of a prissy uptight d-bag about things like 'shaving off grams' or custom leather saddles then Cycle will also answer your desires without hesitation.    Bottom line, they have what you need and what you want, and they have a big friendly dog.  And what really makes them stand out is that they do all of this in the SLoop!

24.description: This place isn't bad but there were some issues. I took my bike in on a Friday for a tune up. They told me Tuesday at 5pm. Seemed like a long time, but whatever, no big deal. The problem is when I showed up a 5pm on Tuesday, they hadn't even touched the bike yet! They told me "Give them an hour", so I went next door and grabbed a beer. Came back in an hour: still hadn't touched it. At this point this "pushed me to the front of the line" and got it done in 45 minutes.While I was waiting there, I overheard one of the techs tell someone who brought in a bike at 6pm that she'd have it done by 7pm. Weird considering my situation.They also didn't tighten the handlebars, which almost killed me 15 minutes into my next ride. Seems like a pretty big oversight for a tune up. Maybe it's because they rushed my bike through after ignoring it for 5 days?

7.description: This is the most honest and best bike shop in town.  Carmichael (Mike) knows everything about bicycles, maintenance and is always accommodating.  I always receive great customer service and timely maintenance of my 2006 Cervelo Dual triathlon bike with Zipp carbon racing wheels.  I'm very particular about where my bicycle is serviced.  And I love the store's big loveable dog who is so cute.

40.description: This is why I love Yelp. I would have probably never given this place a chance had I not looked it up on Yelp before hand. The service was great from the moment I walked in the door. The dog is awesome, someone said his name was "lazy", (hahahaha) but I'm a dog person so that might just be me. They let me take my bike on a test drive before I purchased it, and they were very informative and patient with me. I'm a bigger guy so I had researched my bikes ahead of time and I know what I wanted and needed. They were very polite and even did a seat switch for me. As I checked out they also gave me information in regards to registering my bike and the information needed if it ever gets stolen. I also got a 30 day tune-up/check up included with my bike. I couldn't be more pleased with the service I received.

30.description: Found this place on my phone when I got a flat tire by Museum Campus.  This or Trek.  I wasn't going to Trek with my single speed le tour.  Came to their building.  Saw a chain link fence inside the window and knew it will be a great place (or a really bad place).  Turned out to be the former.Got my tire fixed for $12 (labor and tube).  The guy was really helpful and informative.  Gave me tips on how to maintain the brake lines from getting to oxidized.  Would definitely check this place out again.  Knowledgeable people, reasonably priced, chilled out dog.  The only minus would be that it seems they don't have too much choices on their parts (just looking at stuff on display, but I wasn't in the market for anything so I can't comment on their variety of items).

1.description: The staff is really friendly and they have a variety of bike choices! I got a Jamie bike and I've been riding it ever since! The bike was finely tuned and easy to ride!

9.description: I live in the south loop and have been to the Cycle Bike Shop many times over the years. This summer I purchased a new bike and I LOVE it!  Thanks to Carmichael for his input and suggestions, I made the perfect choice.

26.description: This is my favorite bike shop in Chicago and I have been to a lot of them.  The staff is friendly and non-pretentious (SOO hard to find in this bikey city).  I haven't gotten anything done here but had flat tires fixed- but their prices are low and the customer service is amazing.  They also have some good-looking used and new bikes. I work nearby and had been going to Trek (11th and Michigan) when I would have a bike issue near work- they charged me $19 to change my tube (including a $2 fee to take my wheel off my bike- ANYONE CAN TAKE A WHEEL OFF A BIKE!) It is so sad to me that the shiny, sterile, pretentious Trek store is right up the street and always seems to have people there wasting their money.  Cycle is down the street -where you could spend a fraction of the price and leave feeling like you've given your money to a good business.  Chicago has so many bike shops- and if you don't need something brand-specific, all of these shops can give you what you need.   The only things that separate one shop from the next are prices and customer service- Cycle wins in both of these categories- I will be back again and again and tell my friends and coworkers to go.  Thanks guys!

25.description: Dog friendly, knowledgeable and unpretentious staff here make all the difference!  I've brought in a couple of folks to test out different models for their first bike purchase, and never even once did the experts employed there roll their eyes or anything!  They can do all of the basics, of course, but even if you can be a bit of a prissy uptight d-bag about things like 'shaving off grams' or custom leather saddles then Cycle will also answer your desires without hesitation.    Bottom line, they have what you need and what you want, and they have a big friendly dog.  And what really makes them stand out is that they do all of this in the SLoop!

12.description: This place is awesome.  Have brought my bike here several times over the last 2 years.  They always work quickly, explain everything, and offer very reasonable pricing.

21.description: Sorry guys but I've had a bad experience of this place.I recently bought a Groupon for a bike tune-up at this shop. I brought my bike and the employee there recommended me to change my bike's tires. I was on a budget at that time and asked her if they could start by changing the oldest tire and I would come back and get the other one changed later. She told me it would be $16 in addition to my prepaid tune-up and I said ok.When I came back to pick up my bike a few days later they asked me to pay $47. When I asked why, they told me they had changed both tires and air tubes! They told me they were "old" and that "they would have broken on my next bike ride". I had only agreed on one tire. These guys probably know more about bicycles than I do, but I don't think it's a valid reason to change so much in my bike without asking me first (plus, they had my number, if they needed my confirmation).The worst thing is, if they would have told me about it prior to changing the tires and air tubes I would have probably agreed on the changes (because I would have trusted them since they're supposed to be the experts). But in my case I really felt like they were cheating me. When I said I hadn't agreed on the changes, they told me to "just wait 30min so that they can put back the old tires and air tubes"!! Unacceptable service! I ended up paying the $47 and I promised myself I would never go back there. Either you know enough about bikes to make sure they're not trying to cheat you or I would suggest you try another bike shop for your bike.

17.description: I am new to cycling and was in the market to buy a new bicycle for the first time in MANY years.  I found the perfect bicycle for me at another shop (Rapid Transit), a Kona Dr. Good.  It was, however, sold out from under me in a move I thought was kind of scuzzy.  So I called around to see if I could find another.  I found the exact same bike at Cycle.  The deal they gave me was quite good.  The store owner and his lovable sidekick were very knowledgeable, and patient.  They answered all of my 147 inane questions without so much as batting an eye.  They helped by making several low or no cost modifications to this bicycle to meet my specifications for comfort and ride.  I think I will be VERY happy with the bicycle I have purchased for years to come.Here are the only things that prevent me from giving Cycle Bike Shop a perfect five stars:Several reviews have mentioned the friendly dog who will greet you at the door.  Indeed, doggie was there, but (possibly due to fairly advanced age) is practically comatose.  This kind of matches the vibe of the owner and employee.  I mean, "laid back" almost doesn't describe them adequately.  However, after they kind of warmed up, the sales experience was pretty good.  I enjoyed my time.  Several people describe the service as "unpretentious."  Very fair, but almost laid back to a fault.  I gave them my license when I test-drove the bicycle, as a little insurance policy for its return.  They forgot to give my license back and I forgot to ask for it.  That, in itself, is an honest mistake.  But it wasn't until late the next day that I discovered my error (when I reached for ID and didn't have it!).  But THEY had my name, address and phone number from the order I placed and never called to mention they still had my license.  I think that wouldn't have been too difficult a thing to do.  But again, that's a small quibble in an overall very good shopping experience.

10.description: Super friendly staff helped me to pick out my first bicycle in over fifteen years!  Love my new bike and can only rave about how easy an experience this was.  The owner seemed sincerely interested in making sure I felt comfortable with my new bicycle and provided me with a free tune up after thirty days.  Helped fit me for a helmet and changed out the seat and handlebars to help me ride out with the perfect bike for me!

5.description: I've been a regular here getting major tweaks and upgrades for my bike. Got my bike fixed twice up real good here for FREE not cos I didn't have money, but because the guy "Mike?" felt he didn't expend much in fixing it up. Very nice, welcoming and knows his job! 5 stars

35.description: My wife and I live 2 blocks from this place.  We've been there a total of three times for various reasons (mostly repairs but also just to buy different parts).  We've been greeted warmly and treated fairly every single time.  The prices are extremely reasonable, and the service is top-notch.  We've always been impressed with a place when the owner is present and seems genuinely interested in whatever they are selling.  We will definitely be back for all of our bicycle needs and would recommend it to all of our South Loop friends.Be careful not to step on the big dog!

19.description: This place isn't bad but there were some issues. I took my bike in on a Friday for a tune up. They told me Tuesday at 5pm. Seemed like a long time, but whatever, no big deal. The problem is when I showed up a 5pm on Tuesday, they hadn't even touched the bike yet! They told me "Give them an hour", so I went next door and grabbed a beer. Came back in an hour: still hadn't touched it. At this point this "pushed me to the front of the line" and got it done in 45 minutes.While I was waiting there, I overheard one of the techs tell someone who brought in a bike at 6pm that she'd have it done by 7pm. Weird considering my situation.They also didn't tighten the handlebars, which almost killed me 15 minutes into my next ride. Seems like a pretty big oversight for a tune up. Maybe it's because they rushed my bike through after ignoring it for 5 days?

28.description: I was unfortunately disappointed. Brought my bike in with a groupon for a tune up, and showed them my crank arm was loose as well. The tune up went well but they did not touch the crank arm. I did not notice until I was about 1 mile away, and at that point could not head back that day. At that point I looked on youtube and found it was a simple 1 minute fix.My main problem is I told them about it, and they didn't even look at it, I assume they did not write it down when I gave them the bike.

3.description: Always come here for repairs and tune-ups, never been disappointed with the service or prices. Everyone is knowledgable and friendly, without ever being pretentious like the majority of shops in the city.

33.description: Love this place. My experience of these guys has been that they're honest, skilled and full of good advice. Each time I've gone there, service was quick. They charged me $15 to straighten a badly crumpled tire rim, which is amazing because I thought it was write-off. I went in today to get an inner tube and the guy knew just how to word his questions in a way that didn't a) make me feel stupid despite my lack of knowledge and b) helped me buy the right kind for my bike. It was cheap,too. Plus, I like that I'm supporting a neighborhood small business.

43.description: One of my favorite businesses in the city, I give it only four stars because it can be a mess.  Great bikes, plenty of parts, fast service, and excellent prices.  Dog is great.  I love everything about the place, including the many cups of coffee sitting around the place.  The owner can be distracted.  Make sure you have everything when it's time to leave.  Some people will find it off-putting that he doesn't blow sunshine up their arse while shaking them upside down until all of their change falls out.  You couldn't pay me to go to a Village Cycle or a Kozy's as long as Cycle Bike Shop is around.  I love it, but not everyone will.

2.description: Been looking for a small single speed under $500 since my "too glossy to keep" expensive job got stolen from downtown.  I'd stopped in before for free air (with gages)Called cycle, chill, polite guy let me know they had what I wanted, took it for a spin (they require IDand cc) bought a helmet. Great shop. no snobs.

18.description: Definitely the best in town, have a great selection of bikes and their customer service is outstanding, very friendly, fast and accomodating.. Good prices too. Will never need to look for a bike place after I found this one.

41.description: great service, ultra fast, good advice, and great dogs.  what more could you ask for.08/27/07I changed my rating, only because after my tune up, my bike's first gear doesn't work, and it has to go back for fixing.

4.description: Quick and knowledgeable people. Come here

6.description: I first came to cycle 5 years ago, I'm still going there. I went in this week with a flat and Chris helped me.  This guy really knows what he's talking about. He gave me a tutorial on when to replace my tires and chain and recommended when I come back for that, AND he tightened down my rack which had lost one of its screws- for free. Carmichael is the owner, and he is also extremely friendly. I'll see them this spring to get my new chain. This place is the classic Chicago bike shop.

22.description: Be warned- if you go here, don't be afraid to ask questions and demand answers. The staff is nice, it seems Mike(?) or whatever his name is, is the expert and you will probably work with him. However, he has a tendency to stop mid sentence and walk away, or to be easily distracted. I had him install a part, only to find out later it was much more expensive than I expected. I should've asked first (my fault),    So don't be afraid to speak up and ask questions.  When you walk in, you're greeted by a friendly old black dog who welcomes a scratch politely but otherwise doesn't beg for attention. The employees have decided that this level of welcome is just the right amount, and they barely turn their heads at the sound of the door. This is good, I don't like the salespeople types. Nice selection of new and used bikes also, if you need one. Expect to spend $400 minimum if you're shopping around. Overall, best bike shop near downtown that I have seen. My only complaint is that the staff seems more shy than the customer when it comes to communicating.

15.description: Felt compelled to add to the great reviews for this bike shop after stopping by the other day. The service was friendly, informed, and super efficient! I stopped by to get some air for my back tire, and the guy up front took care of it in no time. On my way down the street after leaving, I realized my front hand break needed some tweaking. I felt terrible for coming right back in, but the same guy was super accommodating, busted out his bike-wrench-tool-thing, and fixed it in no time. And he didn't make me feel bad at all for coming in twice for some much-needed help and being charged $0.Love you, Cycle Bike Shop! I hope you stay here as my neighbor and go-to bike helpers for a long time :)

20.description: This place is great. I just started using my bike as a means to commute and I have run into some problems with my bike. When I came in, my seat was tilting back and forth. The girl took it in, tightened a screw, and I was on my way. No charge! I was pleasantly surprised. Its my go-to now for all by bike needs. Also, tune-ups are at a great price too.

8.description: Most reasonably priced bike shop in downtown Chicago vicinity (for parts at least). The staff is super friendly and super chill. And there's an big lovable dog around. Overall, my visit for a new seat was a successful and surprisingly pleasant experience.

14.description: If you come here then you will deal with Carmichael.  It's his shop.  He does all the repairs and all the sales.  Well his dog watches quietly but isn't much help.  He's a nice guy who won't over charge you.  No need to bargain.  He seems to have a ridiculous knowledge of bikes.  I had a fork cut and installed and while he did it on Carmichael time, he did a fantastic job. If you come here your not dealing with a mega shop you're dealing with one dude.  That's comforting.

58.description: I walked in randomly and I met Jimmy  who by far is the best hair dresser I've seen! Great experience from beginning to end Aniko is my new favorite spot! I would highly recommend Jimmy!# brilliant# cool person.

56.description: Good service. Very kinda, polite, accommodating front desk, staff... The person who did my make up was very nice too. But really, the front people were amazing! :)

29.description: Sam is a fantastic hairstylist, he is truly concerned about the health of my hair and not just running up a bill. It can be frightening to change hairstylist but Sam made me feel at ease immediately with his recommendations. I love my color and cut!

42.description: Sam did a phenomenal job with service, color and blow dry. He is very professional and knowledgable of all the products that they carry. He recommended going blue black for my color and the results were gorgeous. I would recommend his service!

23.description: Sam did great job with my hair, my highlights look amazing, highly recommend to book with him, he is very professional and skilled

47.description: My husband and I had the fortune of having a relaxing spa day at Aniko. From the moment we walked in, the staff was very welcoming, pleasant, and overall just plain nice. It's great to be received so warmly, have our coats taken, and asked for a beverage of choice. Our services -- nails with Tina, facial with Cosmina, and massage with Ashley -- were so worth it. We felt refreshed after walking out, already making plans for our return. Thank you!!

8.description: I'm giving this place 2 stars, because I only experienced two positives during my two trips to this salon.  Positives:1) The haircut did look good.  Not fantastic, but good.2) The highlights also looked good.  (They were nothing at all like I asked for, which I'll get to later, but still, they looked pretty good.)Negatives:1) I asked for and expected red highlights.  (I have dark blonde hair, which at the time didn't have any artificial coloring in it).  The highlights turned out a deep purple.  It looked pretty good, but wasn't anything I wanted/discussed/expected.2) I totally agree with everyone who mentioned the unexpected pricing - my bill was WAY higher than anticipated, and even higher than discussed!  When I made the appointment, I asked about the pricing (of course), and I was given the price for the service (cut/color).  I was neither given the price for the blow drying over the phone, nor told at any point in time that it was considered "extra".3) This was a freak thing, I'm sure, but during my visit for the color, their hot water heater went out.  It was below 25 degrees outside, and they had to wash my hair with cold water.  I understand there wasn't much they could do, but my stylist didn't seem bothered by it at all!  Another stylist was running around frantically trying to figure out how to improve the situation for his clients, but mine practically didn't notice the ice cold water.  4)  Finally....this place is DISGUSTINGLY DIRTY!  Dust everywhere, random clutter...seriously appalling.  I'd understand if this was a lower priced salon, but COME ON.  Clean up every now and then!! I will never be returning.

31.description: I got my locs colored at Aniko by Candis and it was an ordeal. It took over 5 boxes of color to get my shoulder length locs a deep violent color. Thank GOD for Candis. She explained every part of the process from step one even filling me in on something special she was going to do since my lock were lighter on the bottom. Boy was I glad she knew the mechanics behind colors because I used EVERY box of the color the salon had in stock and she had to make herself. She explained exactly what was happening and what she was going to have to do, then she just did. We talked the entire time because I could trust it was going to work out and it did. I would recommend her for natural hair and locs.

34.description: Had my first appointment with Sam for the first time and he was amazing! Very knowledgeable and knows what looks good and is also manageable. WillBe going back again and again!

16.description: I had Candis cut my hair last weekend. I had the same guy cut my hair for years but when I moved south it became too difficult to get to see him. Three months and 4 average to terrible haircut experiences later I've finally found Candis. She took her time cutting my hair and did not make me feel rushed. It was clear from the moment I sat down that she knew what she was doing when it came to cutting hair and interacting with her customers.Best haircut I've had in years. Thanks Candis!

13.description: I moved to Chicago recently from LA. My stylist in LA was amazing and I was concerned that I wouldn't find someone like him in Chicago. After trying a few salons, I met with Cheytonn at Aniko and knew right away that her expertise and professionalism were in alignment with my expectations. She is very skilled at working with my African-American hair type and I always leave satisfied. The salon has a great atmosphere as well. I highly recommend Cheytonn. She's been great!

11.description: Stay away unless you like to be charged for extra services that your stylist didn't even mention you were getting done! I have a few issues with my recent visit at Aniko and I will NOT be back!First of all, I never received the 20% off discount they were offering last month for having a service done of $60 or greater.  I received a gift card of $130 to get my hair done for Christmas and I made an appointment for 1/5/15 for a color and cut.  After making the appointment I received the email stating their special and called to make sure that preexisting appointments still qualify. The receptionist that I spoke with on Sunday the 4th said that I can still receive the discount. When I was cashing out on Monday I asked the guy (who was kind of rude) if the 20% discount was applied and he said that it was.  I don't know if he was confused and was thinking about the gift card, but after getting home and doing the math there was no 20% off applied to my bill.Speaking of paying, that brings me to my next issue.  When I was cashing out, I discovered that I still owed $90 after my gift card was applied totaling an amount $220.  I saw written down on a paper the following:Foil $130Glaze $30H/C $60Glaze?? Why am I being charged for a Glaze if my stylist NEVER mentioned anything about it.  I had NO Idea that it was an additional service that I was being charged for, and didn't even know that it was getting done.  I think it is a very irresponsible thing to do and definitely reflects poorly on their salon.  My fiancé and I have been coming to Aniko since we moved to Chicago over 3 years ago.  We have never had an issue before and this is absolutely ridiculous.  We both work in the service industry so we fully understand the meaning of upselling to increase the bill, but I would NEVER add something to someones bill without consulting with them first.When I called the next day to talk to a manager (who never seems to be around when I call), the best the receptionist could offer me is 50% off my next service. I don't want a discount off of my next service because honestly after this, I don't foresee myself coming back.  EVER! I have called several times since and sent an email and yet still no response. Way to be professional Aniko. You are stealing from your customers and its not right!

39.description: I've been seeing Sam now for about a year, I go to him for cut, color, styling and keratin treatment.  He is very professional and knowledgeable about products and techniques, and never fails to impress me. I highly recommend Sam! The reason I gave it a 4 and not a 5 is because I had a previous incident before with make-up application, but Minah salvaged the situation and did a good job.

37.description: I went there for the first time today and Candice was wonderful! Really wonderful! And I am very protective of my hair. I have always gone to the same stylist and only changed when I moved and then when the 2nd one decided to stay home to be with children more. Anyway, I finally branched out again to find someone I can now be faithful to and I found her! She took thorough time to both understand what I wanted and also explain to me how she'd achieve it. She made sure I was comfortable with her as a new stylist (to me) and didn't make me feel badly! She gave me exactly what I requested and it was as close to the picture as she could get! My hair is now a lovely, fresh ombré that is still professional, for my career, while being young and fun too! I recommend her to ANYONE, along with this place in general as everyone there seemed equally as cherished and dedicated!

0.description: They are the best, Steven made my hair look fabulous! Clean, friendly and quality service; these guys know what they're doing! I've been to so many salons, all over the world so know that service this good is hard to find. They don't tack on a bunch of extra hidden charges like I've seen at some other salons and the staff in here is just lovely. The best part is, if you live in the neighborhood you get a discount! Thanks Aniko!

38.description: Given all the positive reviews about this place, I was excited to try it out. Plus, it's close to where I live. However, my experience was pretty bad and I don't think I'll be going back. I went in for sort of a last minute full highlight and hair cut (I made the appointment the day before). They gave me Shantel. Looking back, I probably should have done some research and requested one of the well-known stylists, but I think she was the only one available and I was anxious to get my hair done. Anyway, she was definitely the worst stylist I've ever had. She apparently can't put foils in without yanking your head back repeatedly. I have been getting my hair highlighted for years and never experienced that anywhere else. I also know that in order for the color to process correctly, the foils need to sit for a while...apparently not with her! The very second she finished my foils, she took me over to start taking them out and rinsing my hair. I guess I should have said something, but you like to think that these people know what they are doing, especially at this type of salon. TERRIBLE ASSUMPTION. As one would guess, barely any of the highlights came through, and my hair is pretty much the same color it was when I went in. Huge waste of time and money. Now I am struggling with whether to find another salon to actually give me the results I am looking for (and drop more money) or just color it myself for way cheaper. Unbelievable. It sounds like there might be a couple of good stylists there, but I did not get to experience them unfortunately.

51.description: Patrick did my bridal make-up and hair. I loved my look!  I explained to him that I wanted the make-up to look as natural as possible, and he achieved just that!  I had my appointment with him at 8 am right before my photo shoot, and my make up and hair stayed fine way past midnight!  I would highly recommend Patrick for bridal make-up and hair!

27.description: If you want honest, respectful, timely, and professional in a hair stylist, look no further than Sam.. By far one of the best I've come across. He goes out of his way to advise you on what's best for you.  I've done keratin, hair cut and color with him. He suggested I do a keratin treatment that I absolutely love! He even came in on his day off to do my color because I was going out of town. Truly invested in his clients satisfaction and enjoys his job. Highly highly recommend him!! My hair hasn't looked better!!

32.description: Great experience at Aniko yesterday. I started with Thena for a mani/pedi, which was very nice. They have Vinylux brand polish, which I love. Next I saw Ashley for a wonderful 60 minute Swedish massage. Then I met with Steven for a great haircut with highlights & glaze. My hair looks great! I will definitely be back. In fact, I made my next hair appt before I left!

54.description: **** UPDATE **** I'm back. I've been three times now to see Sam, who is great with color and cuts. I'm a natural ash blonde, and I swim/sun a lot in the summer so my fine hair tends to turn brassy. Not with Sam! He corrected my color so it lasted throughout the summer, allowed my natural color to grow in, and gave me a great cut (correcting an impulse cut from a nearby salon - that review will come later). See Sam. He's new, he's sweet, and he's great.One star off because it's a little pricey (what good salon isn't) and also...I get a little tired of people who smoke putting their hands near my face - but that's just me.

48.description: This was my second visit.  I got a brow wax and no-chip manicure.  Both were good.  I'll review the now chip after I see how long it lasts.  The brow wax was ok.  My only complaint was the price. On the website it says the price is $20; yet, I was charged $29.  When I questioned the amount, I was told the woman who did the brow wax was a senior esthetician so the cost is higher.  I should have been told that when I made the appointment.  I simply asked for the first available person to do the wax.  I've never paid $29 for a brow wax that didn't include shaping and I never will again.  So, make sure you know the price when making the appointment. And Aniko Spa should inform customers in advance that the price is higher.  This is my second brow wax there and the lady who did it last time wasn't a senior esthetician and she did a better job for $20.

44.description: Sam Hindi, is the best hair stylist I have EVER had! Sam is the ONLY reason I get services at Aniko! I have super curly hair and he's a pro with styling it! Thank you Sam!

24.description: "Never underestimate the power of a good blowout". I have been going to Aniko for my hair cuts for the past 2+ years (ever since I moved to Chicago). I am a very picky person. My hair has to be just right. So I go to 1 girl and only her. Today she was unavailable and I fly out tomorrow. So I decided to go with Sam as he was available. OH MY GOD!! SAM is THE MAN! I mean as I was waiting, he was doing a blowout on another woman with thick hair, and I thought to myself.. Dear god, I hope he is my stylist today. And amazingly enough, he was. Starting from the wash, the conditioning, the cut and the amazing blowout, he was excellent!! Five star! Most professionals can not handle my hair. The person ends up looking really tired and fatigued  since I have really thick & long Indian hair. And that shows through on the hair. But Sam is incredible. He is a natural talent and he is probably Aniko's biggest asset. I hope he never leaves Aniko. And if he does, I will go where he goes to get my hair done :)

7.description: Candis was great! I had a new hairstyle done by another stylist somewhere else but I hated the length! So I dropped by Aniko and Candis saved my new hairstyle! She made it the exact length and density I was looking for. And she added layers that topped it off! I trusted her skills and she made it work for me. The salon was great too! Super friendly folks and nice ambiance! I'd totally recommend Aniko and more than anything Candis! Total hair saver she was!

49.description: I have long thick brown hair and usually wear it pulled back for work. It is so thick that it can tend to cause headaches just being in a loose pony or bun. I have strived to receive the perfect cut that not only can keep my hair looking long, but shape it in a way that thins it out to make it stylish and manageable.I received the best cut and style I have had in a very long time from Shanae Hundley. She understood what I was looking for and utilized 4 techniques to make my hair feel lightweight, yet still look long. She took her time and was very meticulous; every piece she cut was done carefully and thoughtfully. The entire experience was relaxing and met my expectations perfectly. From the amazing scalp massage during the wash and conditioning, to the thoughtful care she took for the cut, to the perfect blowout style with a round brush. Her colleagues even stopped at her station to comment on how great my hair looked. I recommend this place and stylist to everyone. It was a great experience and now I finally have the hair cut I've been searching for! Thanks, Shanae!

40.description: i have never had a "regular" person for my hair, until now... Minah is the ultimate professional, and she is so personable. From the first meeting she won my trust. She explained why my damaged hair wasn't ready for the dramatic coloring color choice i had made. She explained how to fix my hair, and then where to go from there. I appreciated that a ton. It would have been easy to take my money and run, and let me live with less than healthy hair. She did not do that. She did a great job cutting and later coloring/highlighting. You'd be in the best hands with Minah and her high personal standards!

53.description: My son gave me a 90 minute massage for my birthday!  Yay!  Too bad I got Darren as my masseur.  The ambience at this spa is very nice, but my massage was mediocre at best.  It was OK--not superb but just OK--until the last 20 or so minutes, when he decided to just sit here holding my head.  I thought he had gone to sleep.  I said politely that he could massage my head if he wanted.  No movement.  I suspect he had fallen asleep.  I said again that I was getting rather bored sitting there with him holding my head.  No movement.  Finally I just sat up and said "this is over", which I have NEVER done during a massage.   He mumbled something about doing cranial-something work, which is a pile of crap.  In fact, my neck now hurts where he was holding it and it did not hurt when I went in.  Being a sucker, I left him a tip for the first hour and now I want to go take it back now that I'm writing about it.  .     If this is the quality of massage workers they hire, I will not be back.  There are too many better places around, and though the ambience is nice, once you're face down on the table getting what you're really there for, who cares?

30.description: Sam is great! Great color, cut and blowout. Always colors my stubborn grays perfectly and styles my curly hair perfectly. Been seeing him for a year now and I will continue.

46.description: Super relaxing facial that was much needed.  Actually time to book another one as my face has been suffering some winter acne (never had this before).

1.description: Enter at your own risk. This salon has some talented stylists and some not-so-talented stylists.  I know this because I got a not-so-talented stylist that botched my poor hair, and a talented stylist tried to fix it.  I still don't like how I look, and I'm getting married in a week.  I've never been let down by a professional salon to such an extreme extent before Aniko, and I've been to many in many cities.  Maybe this was an isolated freak accident, but I'd still be careful when going here.  My color and cut were a total mess (I'm talking letting-your-best-friend-in high-school-style-your-hair bad), and it can't be resolved before my big day.  I'm a little traumatized, and I cry more than I knew I could cry about hair. I've really tried to embrace my "new look", but at the end of the day, I simply don't like it.I would like to add that the salon has been consistently doing what they can to be fair and accommodating.  I do what I can to keep any sense of entitlement I have in check; however, I do believe that I am entitled to feel good about myself on my wedding day ESPECIALLY when I've been working on just that for over a year.  The staff at Aniko has proven to be sensitive to my concerns and not defensive regarding my complaints.  For that, I am grateful.  I'm going to give them a second chance.  I'll let you yelpers know how it goes.

55.description: While this place has definitely improved their interior look at the salon, the customer service is still lacking and the spa still needs improvements. I love my stylist which is  the only reason why I continue to go here. The front desk staff is never anywhere to be found and my poor stylist is always scrambling to find someone or calling one of them over to the salon side of the business. While the front desk is always polite, I can't help but feel sorry for them and how short staffed they constantly seem to be. I am not a big fan of their newer line of salon products, and never have even heard of the brand before, so I choose to go to a different salon to buy my hair products now which is slightly inconvenient. Overall, if my current stylist leaves I will have no reason to go back here.

9.description: I just moved here from NYC and i always got my hair done at John Barrett Salon so clearly my exceptions are high . I walked into Aniko Salon for a cut yesterday and was paired up with Rafina.... every part of my experience with her was  amazing. Her shampooing skills were so relaxing they put me to sleep and got me to stop talking (which is rare) .... she did just what i asked for and then proceeded to give me an amazing blow out ( which is HARD to find....trust me !)I would send my mom or sister to her so I'm sure you can't go wrong by going to Rafina!note: bring cash for tips!!!

26.description: Let me just start off my saying I love this place! I just got my hair done here today, and wow what a transformation! It's not the first time, I've been going here for about two years now and my most favorite stylist is Sam!! He is amazing at what he does from balayage highlights, to a fabulous cut, not to mention a PERFECT blowout - I've never been disappointed walking out of the salon. I get so many compliments on my hair color and cut and it is all due to Sam. Highly recommend coming here and booking with Sam, you won't be disappointed!

25.description: The salon is fine, but Candis is amazing! She took her time on my hair and talked me through everything she was doing. My cut kept most of my length, still lightened my hair up for summer (which is what I wanted), and she gave me some subtle color that looks very natural (which is also what I wanted). Looking forward to seeing Candis again in the future!

12.description: I had an appointment  for a massage today .. I should  add... I am a 3 year customer  of this spa ... 1 hour before my appointment,  they phoned and said the therapist  didn't  come into work today ..  urg... suffice to say ... this is how they treat their long term loyal customers  ... I will finish using  my pre paid services  .. and take my business  elsewhere. ..

59.description: I consider myself a "expert" on the massage table :) as I have had many, many over the years.  I found Aniko near my hotel.  The massage certainly ranked in the top 10, it was great (thank you Ashley)!  I also like that they are open 7 days a week.  I highly recommend!

21.description: Today was my first time here and it was a great experience! Sam was wonderful! He was knowledgable, friendly, and put great effort and care into my blow out. It came out great! Not to mention it's super silky so kudos to their products and styling! :-)

17.description: Sam did a phenomenal job with service, color and blow dry. He is very professional and knowledgable of all the products that they carry. He recommended going blue black for my color and the results were gorgeous. I would recommend his service!

10.description: These stars are for my stylist. Not necessarily the salon!!! Candis is so skilled, kind and warm. It's just a treat to relax and sit in her chair. I desperately needed a cut and style and a stylist that understood my natural hair care needs and goals! I love my cut, I was heading to Cabo for the weekend and she gave me awesome beach ready curls. Just an amazing experience. I highly re content Candis!!!  Can't wIt yo go back for a color, I've seen some of her work and I'm excited for some summer color!!

5.description: Want to try to do something new with your hair. U can trust this man-Sam!! Just give in your ideas and watch him work so confidently. Loved his work and love my hair!:) thank you Sam and i will surely be back

3.description: Best Spa Ever!!!! I truly enjoyed my experience at the Aniko Spa. It was the Best Spa day EVER. Everyone was very welcoming, accommodating, and friendly. I had four services, all which were EXCEPTIONAL!!! I can confirm this is not a one time instance since, this is not my 1st visit. I will continue to Recommend Aniko Spa to all my Family and Friends and to anyone who ask. They have Totally Won Me Over and I will Continue to Return.

35.description: I had Candis cut my hair last weekend. I had the same guy cut my hair for years but when I moved south it became too difficult to get to see him. Three months and 4 average to terrible haircut experiences later I've finally found Candis. She took her time cutting my hair and did not make me feel rushed. It was clear from the moment I sat down that she knew what she was doing when it came to cutting hair and interacting with her customers.Best haircut I've had in years. Thanks Candis!

19.description: I went there for the first time today and Candice was wonderful! Really wonderful! And I am very protective of my hair. I have always gone to the same stylist and only changed when I moved and then when the 2nd one decided to stay home to be with children more. Anyway, I finally branched out again to find someone I can now be faithful to and I found her! She took thorough time to both understand what I wanted and also explain to me how she'd achieve it. She made sure I was comfortable with her as a new stylist (to me) and didn't make me feel badly! She gave me exactly what I requested and it was as close to the picture as she could get! My hair is now a lovely, fresh ombré that is still professional, for my career, while being young and fun too! I recommend her to ANYONE, along with this place in general as everyone there seemed equally as cherished and dedicated!

28.description: Candice is great! I am new to the neighborhood and did not know where to get my hair done. I read the reviews on yelp for many salons in the neighborhood, but had faith that Candice would help me figure out what style and color would best suit my face and skin color. She did not disappoint at all and gave me appropriate suggestions without being pushy or straying too far from what I originally wanted. The cut and layers came out perfect (not too short or too long) and I am happy with the color she chose as well. She is also a wonderful person and conversationalist. I will definitely be back to see her in a few months. The prices are good for the services as well.

45.description: My stylist, Minah, if 5 stars all the way. She took my crazy-Sicillian-curly-thick hair that had been totally fried out, and made it look so lovely. And I am extremely picky about hair cuts. Minah is a gem of a hairstylist, and such a sweetheart too!

33.description: These stars are for my stylist. Not necessarily the salon!!! Candis is so skilled, kind and warm. It's just a treat to relax and sit in her chair. I desperately needed a cut and style and a stylist that understood my natural hair care needs and goals! I love my cut, I was heading to Cabo for the weekend and she gave me awesome beach ready curls. Just an amazing experience. I highly re content Candis!!!  Can't wIt yo go back for a color, I've seen some of her work and I'm excited for some summer color!!

43.description: Stay away unless you like to be charged for extra services that your stylist didn't even mention you were getting done! I have a few issues with my recent visit at Aniko and I will NOT be back!First of all, I never received the 20% off discount they were offering last month for having a service done of $60 or greater.  I received a gift card of $130 to get my hair done for Christmas and I made an appointment for 1/5/15 for a color and cut.  After making the appointment I received the email stating their special and called to make sure that preexisting appointments still qualify. The receptionist that I spoke with on Sunday the 4th said that I can still receive the discount. When I was cashing out on Monday I asked the guy (who was kind of rude) if the 20% discount was applied and he said that it was.  I don't know if he was confused and was thinking about the gift card, but after getting home and doing the math there was no 20% off applied to my bill.Speaking of paying, that brings me to my next issue.  When I was cashing out, I discovered that I still owed $90 after my gift card was applied totaling an amount $220.  I saw written down on a paper the following:Foil $130Glaze $30H/C $60Glaze?? Why am I being charged for a Glaze if my stylist NEVER mentioned anything about it.  I had NO Idea that it was an additional service that I was being charged for, and didn't even know that it was getting done.  I think it is a very irresponsible thing to do and definitely reflects poorly on their salon.  My fiancé and I have been coming to Aniko since we moved to Chicago over 3 years ago.  We have never had an issue before and this is absolutely ridiculous.  We both work in the service industry so we fully understand the meaning of upselling to increase the bill, but I would NEVER add something to someones bill without consulting with them first.When I called the next day to talk to a manager (who never seems to be around when I call), the best the receptionist could offer me is 50% off my next service. I don't want a discount off of my next service because honestly after this, I don't foresee myself coming back.  EVER! I have called several times since and sent an email and yet still no response. Way to be professional Aniko. You are stealing from your customers and its not right!

2.description: Trusting anyone to 'get' your individual hair needs is super tricky, at least I've found that to be the case in the past,  Sam 'gets it'. From beginning to end. He assesses, listens and recommends in a none pushy way thendouble washes your hair himself + leaves the conditioner on a lil' while. A great wash = a blow dry that lasts days on end for me!  I came to see Sam as my pal from Europe uses only THE best [she reps celeb' hairdressers/makeup] and RAVED about Sam and her blow dry which looked awesome and lasted a week+. I was sold. Sam listens, doesnt try banging on about his chosen products [that drives me nuts] and doesnt use loads of styling products either but gets volume.I went for it [when I eventually got an appointment as I kept leaving it too late however he advised leave your details on reception and he'll call back/make it happen] and got a cut and blow dry on my first appointment and didn't regret it! I didn't realize that he is Tony & Guy trained and I love the way they teach layering. I have long hair and most hairdressers say I cant 'bounce' up the layers too short because its long - Sam could and did giving my hair body and texture. Price wise he is very reasonable and does a 'buy 3 get 4 package' on blow outs - making it less of a treat and more affordable on a weekly basis so I jumped on that for sure.He offered that I could come back within a couple of days for a 'touch up', so I did as I took in a couple of natural hair extensions I had and he washed, conditioned and blow dried them   two days later and he trimmed and styled them upon me - He's both talented and a genuinely nice fella.

18.description: Sam did an awesome job with my hair, love it!

41.description: Just moved back to the city after raising the fam in the burbs.  Wanted  to find a good salon within walking distance from our new place. Read some yelp reviews that convinced me to give Aniko a shot.   I'm so happy that I did. As many reviews already attest to, Sam is THE best!!!  The color cut and style is the best I've had in 10 years. He's got a customer for life.  I will be sending all of my family and friends his way.   Thanks Sam and the rest of the staff at Aniko!  Top notch in every way!

52.description: Got a prenatal massage here..EXCELLENT. Planning to go back soon for hair services.

50.description: Got a Brazilian wax today with jocelynn. She was super friendly and professional and made me feel like her face wasnt inches from my hoo ha. Highly recommend.Tip: arrive a little early and have a glass of wine and relax pre wax

4.description: Sometimes you're just ready for a change. That's how I was feeling when I made my way to Aniko to get my hair colored. The salon decor is nice and the receptionist was there to greet me. But Candis was amazing! She poured me a mimosa and then we talked through what I was hoping to achieve with my look ( I showed her a picture on my phone). She recommended a baylage with an ash brown toner. The scalp massage during my shampoo an added bonus. After she was finished, I couldn't have been happier with technique and depth of tones. It was spot on of the Jourdan Dunn pic I showed her. If you need a stylist in the the downtown area, I would definitely recommend Candis.

6.description: I haven't been here but my experience over the phone was enough for me to decide against it!I called to make an appt for getting my hair and makeup done for my engagement party and the girl on the phone was incompetent! She put me on hold too many times to count for little questions. She asked me for my credit card info to hold the appt and when I asked why (fair enough question) she put me on hold and then came back and said "um it's in case you cancel we charge 50% of the services". I said "wait in case I cancel...ever? Or is there a window of time?" She got frazzled and handed the phone to a manager and they had to clarify the 24 hr cancellation policy. Weird. I've been to many salons to get my hair done for events and all the stylists have told me that not every stylist likes doing up dos on clients so a lot aren't even good at it. I've been told by stylists to always ask who in the salon enjoys it to make my appt with them. So the answer I got when I asked this was "all of our stylists are trained to do everything and they all love doing hair." Oh come on, BS! She wouldn't give me a recommendation so I said forget it and said no thanks! The last thing I want on the day of my engagement party is a bad updo!

22.description: I have walked by here 1000 times living in the neighborhood and once my stylist moved to get married (how dare her!) I gave them a try.As son as I walked in the vibe was very friendly and attentive.  Sam colored, cut and styled my hair and he was AMAZING!! I love a stylist that tells you what you should do and then executes the vision to perfection rather than repeatedly asking me what I want.  I am so excited to have found Sam at Aniko and HIGHLY RECOMMEND him!!

15.description: My husband and I have been here for couples massages in the past and they have been amazing.I just came today for a pedicure and it was just what I needed! Incredibly relaxing, great nail tech named Minah--And it was a reasonable price! I will definitely be coming back here for my nail needs in the future!

57.description: First time getting a massage, and I believe I pick the right place. My time here was amazing, Darrin, my massage therapist is good. He really hit my troubled spots. I was so relaxed afterwards. A bit pricey but totally worth it.

20.description: I just moved here from NYC and i always got my hair done at John Barrett Salon so clearly my exceptions are high . I walked into Aniko Salon for a cut yesterday and was paired up with Rafina.... every part of my experience with her was  amazing. Her shampooing skills were so relaxing they put me to sleep and got me to stop talking (which is rare) .... she did just what i asked for and then proceeded to give me an amazing blow out ( which is HARD to find....trust me !)I would send my mom or sister to her so I'm sure you can't go wrong by going to Rafina!note: bring cash for tips!!!

36.description: My boyfriend and I went here for a couples massage this past weekend.  While our actual massages were good, there were quite a few other issues that definitely took away from the experience.  These included:1. Lockers missing robes to change into.  When this was pointed out, I was given a giant comically oversized robe to wear.  2. Flip-flops in the locker which were far too small and not adjustable which made half my foot hang off the back when I wore them around.3. The receptionist lady showed us to the mens changing room and just walks right into it while another older gentleman was in the process of changing.  I couldn't believe that the female receptionists just barge right in to the mens locker room like that.4. The "Tranquility room" (a.k.a. glorified waiting area) had a plate of cheese set out which looked like it had been left out since the morning (we were there at 3 p.m.) and which had started to become stinky (not rotten stinky, but stinky-cheese stinky) and also had a gnat or fruitfly or two walking on the cheese5. The person on the phone booked me for 2:45 but the actual massage didn't start till 3 o'clock.  Unsure if this was a miscommunication or if they deliberately tell you this so you'll be there early but it resulted in us sitting and twiddling our thumbs for a good 10+ minutes in the waiting area.On the positive side, the staff were nice and again the massages were good.  However, neither one of us would come back to this particular spa when there are so many other choices out there and this one had a significant number of issues that detracted from the overall experience.

14.description: I went to Sam for the second time (first was for a wash + blow out) for a 2-process color (base and highlights), trim + blow out and he worked a minor miracle for my over-processed hair - it looks fantastic! He's personable, professional and listens to his clients. I've been searching for a go-to hair stylist for a few years and I'm so happy to have found him!

58.description: If you find yourself going to Field Museum. Make sure you stop by one of their stands. You HAVE to try their Chicago Style Dog, amazing!

56.description: I really wanted to try an "authentic" Chicago style hot dog and Yelp pointed me towards Kim and Carlos :P Definitely did not disappoint so thank you to all the previous reviewers! The stand is located right outside of the museum campus near the Shedd Aquarium. They have many different types of hot dogs but of course I had to try the Chicago style. Amazing! If I could've stomach another, I would've :) The stand is cash only so bring the bills or else you will be missing out! We enjoyed our delicious hot dogs on the campus steps facing a beautiful view of the Chicago cityscape. Yummy food and a picturesque view of Chicago, what's not to like?

29.description: The best Chicago style hotdog in all of Chicago, it's a bold statement but I can say it!

42.description: What it is - a hot dog stand near SheddWhat it isn't - a rude vendorThat is what I like most about Kim & Carlo's, the people working are actually nice to people, unlike some other stands (ahem - talking about you stand on front side of Field) where they bark at you. You can get dog/chips/soda for $7, not bad. I also appreciate their signage, very transparent, all the prices are up front and even the fact that they accept credit cards (very unusual) and they also have noted on the sign that there is a 3 percent charge for credit use, which all at the same time, I don't like, I understand, and I appreciate. This is what I'm talking about, Kim and Carlo have YOU in mind. They want to keep it easy.  And talk about location, after you get your dog, if you are facing the vendor, go left up the stairs and then right to have one of the best views in Chicago to eat your dog.  If you are visiting, then you must have a chi-dog on your to do list.

23.description: I have tried the Chicago style hot dog once, but I was not pleased with the experience. Because of that, I wanted to give it one more try. This hot dog stand was conveniently located outside the field museum. I got the polish sausage with all the Chicago style toppings. It only cost $5. For $0.50 more you can also have the sauerkraut as a topping. It was nice that they do take various forms of card in addition to cash. I was not disappointed with the hot dog! The sausage was so juicy and meaty, while all the ingredients like the onion and tomatoes tasted very fresh. It was a little salty though. Make sure that you have a beverage with you because you will need it.

47.description: Perfect lunch to grab when you're spending a day at the museum. The Chicago dog is perfectly composed as is - don't need to add anything else!!

8.description: My first Chicago dog experience and yes coming from the East Coast I know about the dreaded NO KETCHUP ideology that seems to grip this town. The staff was warm and friendly and the hot dogs (fully loaded) were really good. Definitely hit the spot at this authentic place!

31.description: Excellent food, amazing service, and overall recommended to all!! My boyfriend and I walked up right as they were closing, not only did they not turn us away, they gave us two hot dogs & a polish with a smile on their face! You can tell they want their customers happy and I love finding new places around the city to stop for delicious food. Love this place!

34.description: The famous Chicago hot dog was okay...I felt like it wasn't as flavorful as it seems. The pickle and the pepper seems to take over most of the flavor of the dog.

16.description: Soo this is a weird review for me. Torn between 3 stars and 5 stars... Let me explain why:3 stars for overall culinary experience-- it is a Chicago style hot dog for 4 bucks. Is it tasty? yes, but at the end of the day, it is a hot dog from a stand, and I've had better hot dogs at other establishments. Don't expect to come here and get blown away by an amazing, unique dog. (I put this here because a 4/12 yelp star comes with a certain connotation...)However, 5 stars when compared to every other hot dog stand I have been to. Since this seems to be a couple of nice kids trying to make it in the city, I am going to go ahead and give them a 5 starrer.BROTIPS:+Order two if you are like me and can EAT. One didnt fill me up+3% charge for all credit+ Saurkraut is 50c extra+ chips +$1+Line can get looooong during lunch+For a full Chicago experience, order with all the fixins

13.description: A no frills hot dog stand, Kim & Carlo's gets five stars. Hold the bells and whistles, these delightfully hard-working folks serve up a bite of one of Chicago's proud staples: the hot dog. With bratwurst, turkey, and vegetarian options, Kim & Carlo's has something for all diets. Featuring great value combos, three different options of chips, and soda, choice paralysis is not an issue. Get your dog and go enjoy the beautiful lakeside views of the Windy City's majestic skyline.

11.description: Kim & Carlo's was my first experience with the famous Chicago dog! As a quick, affordable lunch during a busy museum day, it's just about perfect.I wanted the full Chicago dog experience and I have no qualms about the type of mystery meat that goes into my hot dogs, so I got the regular combo, which includes a hot dog, bag of chips, and can of soda for $7. It's a pretty decent value for lunch, especially compared to restaurant prices overall in Chicago.The link itself was unremarkable, kinda skimpy and nothing special. But the fluffy poppy seed bun, tomato and onion, dill pickle and pepperoncini really filled it out, so it's all about the toppings. The hot dog alone didn't fill me up, so I ended up eating the chips too. So if you have a big appetite, go for the combo (or two hot dogs and a drink).Service was friendly and fast, with no line at around 2:30 on a weekday, and I was in and out with hot dog in hand in under 5 minutes.There's no seating, as this is just a food cart, but you can easily perch on the nearby ledge or museum steps to eat. And then you can get right back to the museum or aquarium and SEE MORE! A tasty hot dog, if not mind-blowing or life-changing, and a good, fast option if you're at the Field Museum or the Shedd Aquarium. But I'm still loyal to the Seattle dog (hot dog, grilled onions, and cream cheese)!

39.description: I spent two days trying to find a place that would serve a Chicago-style hot dog with a vegetarian hot dog, & this was the only place I found, & it had raving yelp reviews. I trudged over in the snow only to find them closed! I thought this odd, since I know Chicagoans never bend to the weather, but I later saw on their Facebook page that they decided to close an hour early. I took the time out of my trip to come back from Forest Park the next day just to have lunch here & it was worth it!There are two stands at the Field Museum. One outside the museum facing the bus stops, and a second one in the courtyard on the side of the aquarium. It was my first time having a Chicago dog, & it was so good, I had one at each stand lol. The dog itself was $4, & a 20oz bottled water was $3. The Chicago dog included a veggie dog topped with tomatoes, celery salt, onions, sweet relish, sport peppers (spicy), mustard, & a dill pickle spear in a poppy seed bun. YUM SO MUCH GOOD!!!!! THE place to have a Chicago dog in the city!

37.description: Soo this is a weird review for me. Torn between 3 stars and 5 stars... Let me explain why:3 stars for overall culinary experience-- it is a Chicago style hot dog for 4 bucks. Is it tasty? yes, but at the end of the day, it is a hot dog from a stand, and I've had better hot dogs at other establishments. Don't expect to come here and get blown away by an amazing, unique dog. (I put this here because a 4/12 yelp star comes with a certain connotation...)However, 5 stars when compared to every other hot dog stand I have been to. Since this seems to be a couple of nice kids trying to make it in the city, I am going to go ahead and give them a 5 starrer.BROTIPS:+Order two if you are like me and can EAT. One didnt fill me up+3% charge for all credit+ Saurkraut is 50c extra+ chips +$1+Line can get looooong during lunch+For a full Chicago experience, order with all the fixins

0.description: Chicago style hot dog done the right way. No imitation here  an authentic Vienna frank with those fantastic sport peppers, tomato, and a dill pick spear.  Alll for the unbelievable price of $4.  How do you top that??I love hot dogs and I really like Chicago style. This one does not disappoint.  If you are by the Aquarium, it is the best value you will get in Chicago. You will thank me.

38.description: Wowzer! This is the best hot dog I have ever had!  I had the Chicago dog and it was incredible.  Poppy seed bun, mustard, onions, tomato, hot pepper, pickle and celery salt.  It lasted like 30 seconds before it was devoured.  I wanted to go back again but it was too cold and didn't want to walk through the snow again or I would have gone.  It will live on in my memory!

51.description: Wanted to just try a Chicago dog and this stand did not disappoint... Should've got two but one was just fine.... Everything on it was delicious and would definitely go back for more, in comparison to other places the prices weren't that bad either

27.description: Looking for a hot dog before getting in Shedd's long line? Maybe after exploring the dioramas at the Field? This is your spot. I am a vegetarian, but they have beef, turkey, tofu, or Polish on offer, and they'll even add kraut.

32.description: I stopped by the stand on my way into the Field Museum. I thought I would be getting an authentic Chicago hot dog, so this was 2 birds with one stone.OK, maybe it was my fault. I got a regular hot dog with mustard only on a poppyseed bun. The Chicago version would have come with a lot of extra toppings. In my plain version, I got to taste the dog itself very clearly. I'm sorry, but there was just nothing special about it. Could have been a hot dog from any hot dog stand anywhere in the country, and it wasn't even hot.I was happy because it got me fueled up for my visit to the museum, but this can't have been the "real" Chicago hot dogs that everyone raves about, even if I didn't get all the toppings.

54.description: Great hot dogs in a super convenient location! We ate here between spending the morning at the Field Museum and the afternoon at the Shedd Aquarium. They have veggie and turkey dogs too!

48.description: LEGIT. I like a heartier dog so I went with the Polish with everything. Mo went with the classic chicago with everything. Halfway through we switched as all foodie couples do. And GEEZ these peppers don't mess around here either. They will slap the Chicago cold outta you.**TIPS** There are two! One directly in front of the Field Museum & one in front of the aquarium so of one line is too long just bounce over to the either.

44.description: Not at all what I expected. The onions were frozen and the sauerkraut was from target. Disappointed!

24.description: The hungry tourists dream hot dog stand.Candy, ice cream and of course hot dogs conveniently adjacent to the field museum.I chose to go for gold with the Polish sausage chicago style with sauerkraut,  and I was not disappointed! They allowed me to customize my order in a manner that left me with a chihuahua sized hot dog all for $5.50. Keep in mind that sauerkraut costs an extra .50, but I think it's worth it. My polish hot dog was well spiced and the Chicago style peppers were really yummy. I would frequent this place if I were local for sure!

7.description: The hungry tourists dream hot dog stand.Candy, ice cream and of course hot dogs conveniently adjacent to the field museum.I chose to go for gold with the Polish sausage chicago style with sauerkraut,  and I was not disappointed! They allowed me to customize my order in a manner that left me with a chihuahua sized hot dog all for $5.50. Keep in mind that sauerkraut costs an extra .50, but I think it's worth it. My polish hot dog was well spiced and the Chicago style peppers were really yummy. I would frequent this place if I were local for sure!

49.description: It was my first Chicago hot dog, and after reading the reviews on here about it I had to find out for myself! It was AMAZING!! :)

40.description: I was dying of hunger AFTER THE FIELD MUSEUM. I stumbled out their doors--no restaurants in sight!... except... this HOT DOG STAND! Even in the cold weather there they were, two little people huddled inside the stand serving anyone passing from the Museum to the Aquarium. Talk about COLD WEATHER HARDCORE! After seeing someone get a CHICAGO-STYLE HOT DOG I ordered that (although you can also go all boring and PLAIN IF YOU WANT) and I was happy to see they also had a few candy bars. I needed some sugar. My dog was all tasty and stuffed with lots of Chicago-style... stuff. The large pickle slice wasn't too tangy but brought some nice sourness to the mildly flavored dog and salt of the peppers. I didn't care much for the BORING OL' BUN though. It just seemed like something that came from the grocery store just minutes ago. Say hi to these guys if you're in the area.

53.description: I really wanted a Chicago-Style and ended up finding this stand via Yelp. It was blisteringly cold however the journey to get to the cart was worth it. The dog is delicious and it's one of the most memorable ones I've had.

30.description: Kim & Carlo's was my first experience with the famous Chicago dog! As a quick, affordable lunch during a busy museum day, it's just about perfect.I wanted the full Chicago dog experience and I have no qualms about the type of mystery meat that goes into my hot dogs, so I got the regular combo, which includes a hot dog, bag of chips, and can of soda for $7. It's a pretty decent value for lunch, especially compared to restaurant prices overall in Chicago.The link itself was unremarkable, kinda skimpy and nothing special. But the fluffy poppy seed bun, tomato and onion, dill pickle and pepperoncini really filled it out, so it's all about the toppings. The hot dog alone didn't fill me up, so I ended up eating the chips too. So if you have a big appetite, go for the combo (or two hot dogs and a drink).Service was friendly and fast, with no line at around 2:30 on a weekday, and I was in and out with hot dog in hand in under 5 minutes.There's no seating, as this is just a food cart, but you can easily perch on the nearby ledge or museum steps to eat. And then you can get right back to the museum or aquarium and SEE MORE! A tasty hot dog, if not mind-blowing or life-changing, and a good, fast option if you're at the Field Museum or the Shedd Aquarium. But I'm still loyal to the Seattle dog (hot dog, grilled onions, and cream cheese)!

46.description: This is a great hot dog stand - super nice people and an excellent location. But location aside, it's a better than average hot dog, tasty and good toppings and pickles. Once you have your lunch, enjoy the view sitting on a handy bench - perfect afternoon.  I think they are open year round too.

1.description: Ya gotta get a Chicago Dog when you're in Chicago.  In fact, you gotta get a Chicago Dog when you're NOT in Chicago, but it's alot easier here.  Kim & Carlo's does a brisk, and, sitting outside the Field Museum next to Lake Michigan, I do mean BRISK business with their portable Dog Stand.  The Chicago Dog all the way (and I ain't dancin' for no stinkin' ketchup) was delicious.  We went here twice.  The first time it was perfect, but the second time the bun got soggy.  Still, the toppings were right on, the bun was steamed and soft, the dog was Vienna's Finest finest.  Ahhhhh, now I can go on and enjoy the Windy City.Like the Terminator, I'll be back.

55.description: Recommended by our bus tour guide to get. Real Chicago dog at the best price. $7 gets you a can of pop, fully loaded Chicago dog and a bag if chips. Fast and friendly staff. Look for the yellow flag. Located over by the shed aquarium and field museum.

9.description: I always stop by here when I'm in town for a couple vegetarian Chicago dogs. My only gripe is that they use regular relish instead of neon relish, but there must be a reason for that. They're tasty!  I'll be back next time I'm in town. The veggie dogs taste good and I'm very happy they have them as an option.

26.description: Five Stars for the Veggie-dog option!

25.description: I do not get the fuss about this place at all.  I get a better hotdog at the stand outside Home Depot in Michigan than I had here.  Koegels for life!

12.description: LEGIT. I like a heartier dog so I went with the Polish with everything. Mo went with the classic chicago with everything. Halfway through we switched as all foodie couples do. And GEEZ these peppers don't mess around here either. They will slap the Chicago cold outta you.**TIPS** There are two! One directly in front of the Field Museum & one in front of the aquarium so of one line is too long just bounce over to the either.

59.description: Customer service was terrible!  Rushing us along and acted perturbed when we changed our order.  If you go ask, for a receipt, we were overcharged by the cashier.  Food was good but will not go back.Two locations, one near Shedd and another near the Field Museum south entrance.

21.description: Kim & Carlo's Hot Dog Stand is located right next to the Shedd Museum and Field Museum.  They're opened even though it's -30 outside.  It looks close but there is actually someone in the hot dog stand.  You just have to walk up and they sliding window will open.  It's not a creepy person who's about to kill you.  Chicagoans have one rule when it comes to their hot dogs and they're Nazis about it.  Chicago Hot Dog Rule:  No Ketchup. Don't Ask.We got the Polish Sausage with everything on it.  It had yellow mustard, dill pickles, slices of tomato, chopped white onions, salt, relish, peppers, a poppy seed bun and no ketchup.  I asked for ketchup and she gave me a dirty look.  What?  Did I stutter, m*hf*ckah?!  Anyway, the Chicago dog is definitely distinct from other cities' take on how a hot dog should be eaten.  The Chicago dog has a juicy and sour bite to it.  The bun is soft and the main act is the toppings.  As you bite into the Chicago Hot Dog, the first thing your palate will notice is the crisp and plumpness of the hot dog followed by the sourness of the toppings as you chew.  It's a good marriage of flavors for Chicago weather and the only reason why Chicago Hot Dogs are only good in Chicago.  It's the same thing as NYC Pizza and Halal Guys only being good in NYC.  LA has it's late night taco stands and dirty dogs cart and no other city does those two things better in the United States. Anyway, the difference between a Chicago hot dog versus an LA dirty dog is the preparation.  Chicago hog dogs and buns are boiled or steamed with the exception of the char-dog.  The boiled or steam gives the Chicago dog the crisp juicy bite to them.  Now, LA Dirty Dogs are "grilled" and wrapped in bacon.  The toppings are the same except for a few items.  The onions are grilled and usually caramelized due to how long it has been on the grill.  It comes with mustard, ketchup and mayo.  The condiments are more diverse than a Chicago dog.Overall, Kim & Carlo's interpretation of a Chicago dog was good and had a lot of flavors to it.  I definitely enjoyed it as a snack and wouldn't recommend it as a whole meal unless you eat like 2 of them.  It's a good spot to stop for a snack or lunch during your day at the museum.

17.description: The famous Chicago hot dog was okay...I felt like it wasn't as flavorful as it seems. The pickle and the pepper seems to take over most of the flavor of the dog.

10.description: Positioned right by the water near the aquarium and planetarium, this spot is obviously frequented by tourists- it's not bad for what it is, but it's far from the great Chicago dog experience you were hoping for. I literally had better at the airport. Service is fast and friendly, prices are reasonable considering the location, with a cheap lunch clocking in around $7. Splurge for the polish dog for the best experience.

5.description: I absolutely love this family and their food. Kim & Carlo are a local fam, hard working and committed to serving the folks of their hometown.  I've visited their Loop brick and mortar location as well as their portable West Town food cart. Both of which offer all of your favorite Chicago-style delectables.

3.description: Overall: Post soldier field hot dogs in front of the museum. Pretty tasty and authentic with a nice view of the cityFood: I got the Chicago hot dog. Classic and delicious--For four dollars, you too can live the dream of eating a Chicago hot dog in front of the beautiful skyline.

35.description: I was looking for a vegetarian Chicago hot dog while visiting the city, and the reviews on Yelp convinced me to try Kim and Carlo's. I definitely recommend this stand! The hot dog was great, and the employees were incredibly nice. I'll definitely be back when I am in Chicago again.
