19.description: Great people!  Come get an inexpensive Chicago hot dog from Denise and Gitta.....  good quality all beef dogs......

28.description: So everyone's all like you're in Chicago. You HAVE to get a Chicago dog.... So I did. And I get the hype. Luckily for me I'm not a fan of that overly sweet but tasteless sloppy red sauce (aka ketchup) people are accustomed to putting on their dogs. So I knew I wouldn't be breaking that rule of no ketchup on the Chicago style dog rule. They day was cold the dog was nice and hot. The pickle was cool and crisp. The service was fast and friendly. The price was mehhhhh, alright. But the first time experience with a Chicago dog was great.

45.description: EASY TO SPOTDo you know where the Field Museum is? Then just look to the south east corner of the property. It's smaller than a food truck (it's on the sidewalk) but bigger than a car (fits two people inside!). Its small menu of offerings is displayed prominently yet with meaningful fare such as a Vegetarian Hot Dog and Low Fat Turkey Hot Dog for those on diets. Chips, Candy, and Soda are also offered.OM NOM NOM HOT DOGSContinue the Chicago greats after visiting the Museum by getting a Chicago-styled Hot Dog for only $4. With everything on it, the flavors and textures all blended very well together yet you could still taste each ingredient separately. Everything tasted great--no complaints. The colors of the entire Dog were also pretty and bright.DISCLAIMERThis is the only Chicago-style Dog I've tasted BUT I'm NOT reviewing this place as a Chicago-style Dog expert. Instead I'm reviewing it as someone who cares about the flavors, textures, freshness, and appearance of edibles and their locations.

33.description: Fantastic Chicago dog that didn't disappoint. We were in a hurry since we were museum hopping abd saw their reviews on Yelp.  Had to try it and they were amazing hotdogs and the spot peppers added a nice touch (if you like spicy).

43.description: Third hot dog in the city. Not the best for sure! Seems as those hh all ingredients come out of pre made jars that are store bought! Nice workers, but food was just ok.

2.description: Not sure what all the fuss is about. Visiting from California and wanted to try an authentic Chicago style dog. With the high yelp review, I was expecting something great. It's just a hot dog people! Yes it did have a lot of toppings but nothing you can't get anywhere else.  It's your average hot dog with toppings minus ketchup. If you happen to be in the area and are craving a hot dog, go for it. However, I wouldn't go out of my way to come here

18.description: This hot dog stand was right between the Shedd Aquarium and Field Museum. I went with all of the fixings on a Chicago dog. It could have been a little hotter; can't compare to the Chicago dog I had at Wrigley field, but given the limited choices in the area, it was good. The fresh fixings made the difference. Fast and friendly service. $2 for a can of soda? Okay, I understand, you need to make a living.

41.description: After walking all the museums in the area (like the hardcore tourist I am) this place really hit the spot. This is a cute little stand with sweet girls working in it. I got a polish dog with everything and it was a damn good Chicago dog. It was perfect eating it on the steps of the Field Museum while admiring the skyline and the lake. Yay for Kim and Carlo's.

52.description: DELICIOUS! Staff was very friendly.  Great tasting hot dog, went to portillos as well because it was highly recommended, but we gotta say Kim & Carlo's was the favorite.  So good, we stopped by on 2 different days.

50.description: Overpriced and nothing special, but of course its location by the museums gets it a lot of custom. Go elsewhere for a hot dog unless you're trapped here. Also, 3% credit card surcharge.

4.description: This little hotdog stand/cart is located at Museum Campus --as if it wasn't a more prime location for a tourist spot. I knew I had to try the infamous Chicago dog while in Chicago, so my friend recommended this place. I chose the Chicago hot dog ($4), which came with mustard, relish, pepperoncinis, sliced tomatoes, and a pickle wedge. The buns are steamed with poppy seeds. It was surprising how hot my hot dog was being made in under a minute.I am not sure if it's my difference in tastebuds, but a Chicago dog is not for me. I would choose a LA dirty dog any day. The sourness of the pickle was interesting as for the tomatoes was just confusing to me. I ate them on their own instead.

6.description: Kim & Carlo's Hot Dog Stand is located right next to the Shedd Museum and Field Museum.  They're opened even though it's -30 outside.  It looks close but there is actually someone in the hot dog stand.  You just have to walk up and they sliding window will open.  It's not a creepy person who's about to kill you.  Chicagoans have one rule when it comes to their hot dogs and they're Nazis about it.  Chicago Hot Dog Rule:  No Ketchup. Don't Ask.We got the Polish Sausage with everything on it.  It had yellow mustard, dill pickles, slices of tomato, chopped white onions, salt, relish, peppers, a poppy seed bun and no ketchup.  I asked for ketchup and she gave me a dirty look.  What?  Did I stutter, m*hf*ckah?!  Anyway, the Chicago dog is definitely distinct from other cities' take on how a hot dog should be eaten.  The Chicago dog has a juicy and sour bite to it.  The bun is soft and the main act is the toppings.  As you bite into the Chicago Hot Dog, the first thing your palate will notice is the crisp and plumpness of the hot dog followed by the sourness of the toppings as you chew.  It's a good marriage of flavors for Chicago weather and the only reason why Chicago Hot Dogs are only good in Chicago.  It's the same thing as NYC Pizza and Halal Guys only being good in NYC.  LA has it's late night taco stands and dirty dogs cart and no other city does those two things better in the United States. Anyway, the difference between a Chicago hot dog versus an LA dirty dog is the preparation.  Chicago hog dogs and buns are boiled or steamed with the exception of the char-dog.  The boiled or steam gives the Chicago dog the crisp juicy bite to them.  Now, LA Dirty Dogs are "grilled" and wrapped in bacon.  The toppings are the same except for a few items.  The onions are grilled and usually caramelized due to how long it has been on the grill.  It comes with mustard, ketchup and mayo.  The condiments are more diverse than a Chicago dog.Overall, Kim & Carlo's interpretation of a Chicago dog was good and had a lot of flavors to it.  I definitely enjoyed it as a snack and wouldn't recommend it as a whole meal unless you eat like 2 of them.  It's a good spot to stop for a snack or lunch during your day at the museum.

22.description: Positioned right by the water near the aquarium and planetarium, this spot is obviously frequented by tourists- it's not bad for what it is, but it's far from the great Chicago dog experience you were hoping for. I literally had better at the airport. Service is fast and friendly, prices are reasonable considering the location, with a cheap lunch clocking in around $7. Splurge for the polish dog for the best experience.

15.description: So everyone's all like you're in Chicago. You HAVE to get a Chicago dog.... So I did. And I get the hype. Luckily for me I'm not a fan of that overly sweet but tasteless sloppy red sauce (aka ketchup) people are accustomed to putting on their dogs. So I knew I wouldn't be breaking that rule of no ketchup on the Chicago style dog rule. They day was cold the dog was nice and hot. The pickle was cool and crisp. The service was fast and friendly. The price was mehhhhh, alright. But the first time experience with a Chicago dog was great.

57.description: It's always a treat to find a little gem of a place in a big city of choices. This cart is one of those little finds!Besides a great Chicago style dog you'll get a big smile, friendly service and even advice on how to dress your dog, should you request it.Get a dog before you visit the Field museum, walk your booty off inside, take the stairs and not the elevator, and have another one afterward.

20.description: Located right outside the Field Museum. We actually came back outside and ordered lunch from there. Prices were WAY high inside museum for basic food. Hot dog was great. My first Chicago style dog and it was not a let down at all. Great price. Would do again in a heartbeat. :)

36.description: Perfect for lunch before heading to the aquarium! Dealt with a bigger family fast and easily.

14.description: I have tried the Chicago style hot dog once, but I was not pleased with the experience. Because of that, I wanted to give it one more try. This hot dog stand was conveniently located outside the field museum. I got the polish sausage with all the Chicago style toppings. It only cost $5. For $0.50 more you can also have the sauerkraut as a topping. It was nice that they do take various forms of card in addition to cash. I was not disappointed with the hot dog! The sausage was so juicy and meaty, while all the ingredients like the onion and tomatoes tasted very fresh. It was a little salty though. Make sure that you have a beverage with you because you will need it.

1.description: Bought a nice bamboo plant, some insense, and chopstick rests. Also some nice flat chinese soup spoons here. The woman at the counter was very nice and friendly. We discussed making egg drop soup! They had alot of stuff at fair prices. Next time i visit chinatown, i will stop by for sure.

2.description: LOVE this store, it is a good souvenir and gift place. There's sooooo much inside and you can always find something fun - traditional Chinese items like gowns, slippers, Hello Kitty, chopsticks, plates and teapots, little figurines to my favorite items - jewelry! Real jade bracelets, necklaces and rings. There are many items for under $10 and even surprise boxes for $1. The staff is always friendly and check out the fun signs that rhyme around the store - don't break anything!

0.description: went here before dinner @ -big- three's happiness to shop for decor for my chinese new year party. i'm not chinese, but my roommate is half, so it was an excellent excuse for a celebration.after wandering in a few different gift shops in the area, we bought all our items here because the prices were right, and the service was super friendly! they translated all the signs we got, helped us find great garments to wear to our party (i got the cutest shirt for $15!), and gave us a bunch of freebie treats once we completed our order.these shops tend to all look alike after visiting more than one, so my advice is to keep this as your last stop and purchase all those things you've been eyeing here!

3.description: Absolutely the WORST customer service I've ever encountered. Called in a huge catering order for a hungry site crew an hour and 15minutes before they were needed for pickup... Was ASSURED the order would be ready for pickup at 5.30pm (extremely time sensitive) and was asked to provide a credit card to secure the order. We provided our AMEX details over the phone, to then find out they don't accept AMEX- we then put down another card and are asked to pay 50% of the order up front. Not ideal, wanting to pay cash, but not a problem. We then arrive at 5.20pm for pickup as scheduled, assured and confirmed; they accept the remaining payment as cash and then inform us that it won't be ready for another 15minutes and that they weren't going to fulfill the order until full payment had been received...?!?!?!? The order ended up taking an additional 45minutes to complete- completely unacceptable. So far, so bad... Mistakes happen though! Perhaps the manager/owner maybe apologetic, offer an explanation of misfortune or offer some sort of compensation for a $450+ order going so wrong? Nope the owner was infuriatingly rude and unapologetic about the whole thing. Disgraceful business practices, average food and piss poor customer service from top to bottom... Needless to say we'll be taking our fairly lucrative large group orders elsewhere.AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

1.description: Note to consumers: This restaurant seems to now be operating as Jack's Chicago Grill.I placed what I thought was a pretty simple order, trying to patronize a "new" establishment. Close to delivery time (nearly an hour later), received a telephone call from the restaurant stating that they didn't have an item I'd ordered from their menu, and asked if I'd care to substitute. I agreed, and they said that at that point they would START the order, and it would require another hour.Minutes later, received a second call from the restaurant saying that they didn't have my beverage choice, and queried whether I'd like to substitute for another soft drink. Again, I agreed to, and they then said it (order, plus beverage, quantity of 2) would be delivered "as soon as possible." After about 45 minutes, the order was delivered with no beverages at all.I alerted GrubHub, through whom I'd ordered, they promptly attempted to contact Jack's about the omission and suddenly they were unreachable, long before their stated closing time. The following morning, they declined to deliver the drinks nor issue a credit, though I spent over $40. A word from the wiser: Avoid. Take your business elsewhere.

2.description: Sign out front says "JACKS". Stopped in for a quick bite at lunch, place is tiny, not a lot of seating, but the service was good, and the food was a little better. Typical hot dog/ Gyro place, familiar yellow Vienna sign out front, the one we all love. Ordered a Gyro, fries and a can of pop. ($6.99 meal deal) Gyro was excellent! Large portion, pita was soft and floury, and the sauce (ziti ?) was spread perfectly, not overbearing. Fries were cooked perfectly, but had a slight "fishy" taste, sort if expected. I'll definatly go back.

5.description: Love the food but if you want it get it delivered because the man that's there in the early evening has a major attitude problem. And if I'm paying I deserve service with a smile. I can't stand the I don't even want to be here stank attitude from a man. And won't be walking in for an order ever again. Hey dude just in case you didn't know you absolutely suck at your "job".

6.description: i wish i could give them zero stars!!!! never received my food!! i waited an hour for the delivery driver to not even show!!  cant rate the food. didnt get a chance to try it

7.description: Been here twice now and I'm a fan if I'm in the mood for something quick.  Menu is huge so you have a lot of options and prices are reasonable.  It is a smaller place so yes it may take a little bit of time but what do you expect? Atleast you know it's fresh! Staff is always friendly.. Good addition to south loop.

8.description: As a person who grew up on the south side this gyro spot was a welcome addition to the south loop for me when it opened. I've frequented it multiple times since opening. They've got an extensive menu and the food is pretty good. However the last 3 times I've been in here I've had to wait at least 6-7 minutes and once 15 minutes to even place an order as the cashier is on the phone taking delivery orders while the line of people accumulates with no acknowledgement of anyone in line. They really need to figure out a different process..super frustrating.

9.description: I gave this place a try because its in my neighborhood but it was absolutely disgusting.  The meat did not taste fresh at all.  The place was unhygienic and frankly does not look like it belongs in the South Loop.  Save your money and just go to Greek Town if you want quality Gyros.

0.description: I came here a few days ago to get a quick bite before attending a show next door at Reggies Rock Bar. The place is small, has 4 tables that seat 2 per table. They have a fountain drink dispenser and also fridges with bottled soda, water and other drinks. Since I was in a slight rush to eat before the show, I just ordered mozzarella sticks and a regular size drink. The food did take quite some time, I think close to ten minutes, which Im not sure why it took so long, was it my order of the sticks? Or are they just slow in general? IDK. Anyway once I got my food, I sat down and boy is the food fresh. It was hot when I got it, I had to force myself to eat the food quickly while it was freshly hot, i didn't burn my mouth, because I had come ice cold coke with me. The mozzarella stick cheese melted when I took a bite out of them, but they did keep their shape before I took a bite. A large layer of fries was underneath the mozzarella sticks. I would say about 8 sticks were in my order and then the bottom of the fries plate was full of fries. I just ordered mozzarella sticks but they threw in the fries too? Wow I have never had that happen to me. More food for the same price! Their only drinks out of the fountain dispenser is either Pepsi OR 7 of their house BMG lemonades, fruit drinks and coke. Its all their own homemade drinks in the dispenser which has 8 drinks, aside from pepsi. Anyway, the guy at the front seemed a little off, he could barely hear me and I was talking in my normal voice, he seemed annoyed and was like "what??" I had to speak up more which was unusual but whatever. Long story short, I avoided talking to the guy here the rest of the time I was here. Its a nice take out place, it was my first time here, aside from what I got, they have burgers, chicken, gyros, chicken gyros, gyros burgers, chicken burgers, rotisserie chicken, vienna beef hot dogs, etc etc. I would come back again if I am ever in the area with a friend or two, again there is not much seating, so its more of a take out place. The parking is street parking, you must pay the ticket/valet box in front of this place, unless you plan on taking out or eating very quickly, for the parking meter is $2/hour. You can pay with coins, (no pennies), dollars or a credit/debit card. Anyway this place was decent in my eyes, I hope to be back in the area again soon!

4.description: Food greasy but taste good.  Their small items in the frig like coleslaw, desserts...my reason to walk here.  They have great deals depending on what day...

58.description: Great new local place for a reasonably priced pedi & no chip mani ($70).  Sunday parking is free if you drive and it's nice that they're open 7 days per week.  Lots of color options, very clean, personable people working and a nice short shoulder massage at the end.  I already scheduled my next appointment but walk ins are welcome too.

56.description: Just finished up at omg nail spa! They did a fabulous job for my mani n pedi! I'm very OCD and quite the perfectionist. I have pretty high standards and they were met by the nail tech! The place is very clean and new and airy. Great vibe! They have a plethora of colors as far as zoya brand goes! And they have all my fav colors from opi n Essie!  Currently they have a promotion for a $35 mani n pedi combo! Such a steal!!

29.description: Great services.  Clean.  Friendly.  Fantastic and large selection of polished.  I think they have every color by Zoya as well as OPI.  Huge selection of No Chip Colors too.  Just what the south loop needed! I love this place.

42.description: Amazing! Great spa pedicure and no chip. Will be coming back every two weeks! Hundreds of colors especially no chips.

23.description: This is one of the best nail salons I have been to in my life (and I have lived in several large cities in my life). It is always clean and smells so nice (and not like chemicals because they use mostly organic products). I always leave the salon with PERFECT nails (no chip or regular) because they take their time. The shoulder rub and foot scrubs are just a bonus. Be prepared to spend some money (especially if you get the no chip), but ti is worth every penny!

47.description: OMG spa is hands down the BEST nail spa in Chicago!  The owner Chloe is incredible; she is an amazing manicurist and now she gets to add 'business owner' to her title.  She's a force to be reckon with and knows how to run a spa.  Upon entering the spa you are asked if you would like a beverage (wine included) and she sets the standard for asking you to 'pick out your color.'  Hundreds of nail polishes from CND Shellac, CND Vinyl Lux, Essie, OPI, Zoya....you name it, OMG Spa has it.It's such a welcoming and comfortable environment; the spa facilitates customers talking to one another.  That's one of my favorite parts; every time I go I meet someone cool.  Kudos to Chloe for a phenomenal spa!

8.description: Pros: They do a great job on your nails, they use good products, and it's very clean.Cons: Not friendly (on the phone or in person), I felt like the women who did my nails and my friends were annoyed the entire time. They don't allow you to tip on credit card transactions. Pricing is average for a gel manicure.

31.description: Average Asian spot , just no Drills.Tried this salon 3 times (summer) and I won't be going back. While the set-up, decor and efficiency is great, the salon lacks verve. The nail techs (techs, not manicurists) go through the motions swiftly and efficiently and robotic. This last mani/pedi (regular) was especially meh. During the cuticle work, pinched my skin and didn't acknowledge it (thankfully no bleeding); streaky nail polish on the manicure (light pink OPI color); and not great shaping to the nails.The positives are the decor, materials and products used, and music (Charlie Parker that day).

34.description: I moved to the south loop a little over a month ago and can I just say, manicures are EXPENSIVE down here. I'm walking distance from OMG Spa though and I am so glad, because they are the most reasonably-priced salon around - for regular manicures, anyway. (I'll need to think twice about my next no-chip.)I love the atmosphere, the music (I came in on a rainy day and the jazz playing was perfect), the efficiency and the friendliness of everyone there. I'll be back soon!

16.description: First time in OMG Spa today. A very nice nail salon! The space was clean, bright and pretty. The music was a tad loud, but it was nice new jazz and not hard to listen to. There were NO TVs. AMAZING. I love no TVs! Having the tv on just distracts for the relaxing I want to do.The service was great. Everyone was very polite and attentive, asking if I needed water or a glass of wine. It was really friendly and I did feel "treated". My nail tech Sammy was a sweet lady, easy to chat with and very good at what she was doing. My nails look wonderful, her massages were GREAT. I'll book with her again for sure!Only down side was the wait, but their menu does say appointments preferred, so I suppose that was just my own mistake. I had read that people walked in, but I should have double checked. Overall, the service, cleanliness and price were all very good. I'm hoping all the techs are paid fairly, and not just tipped workers, because they are impeccable and talented! I was sure to tip well, just in case. I'd recommend it! For a treat, get the $85 OMG Spa mani/pedi combo. Extra long massages, sugar scrubs, coconut oil lotion, skin mask. Really a nice way to get some overdue self-care!

13.description: It pains me to leave this place a poor review, because they are friendly and the salon is cute. The girls I've worked with have been sweet, but just haven't been as diligent with their work. Well perhaps that's not fair. The first time I came to get a pedicure and my technician treated my poor battered feet as if they were made of glass. I need a firm hand to remove calluses. The massage was nice but I'd rather have the callouses removed than the massage. I feel like I shouldn't have to choose. The polish was pretty and I admire that they carry zoya but polish is secondary when it's mid fall, early winter...I thought she'd removed the calluses with the tool that looks like a cheese grater (sorry for the imagery), but in two days time my heels were rougher than before...which apparently is common...with that tool...a vigorous pumice stone rub down is what I needed...sigh.The no chip manicure is what really let me down. I had a two week old no chip that had to be removed. They don't do just a polish change, you have to purchase a full no-chip manicure (every time, which seems excessive when you get it changed bi-weekly). Either way, there are all kinds of frills that I don't believe are necessary but are appreciated by some. What the tech did that unnerved me is she filed the existing polish so far that it felt hot on my nail. She was filing on top of the polish before she applied the foil and acetone, which isn't uncommon but how far she went down was painful. She brushed off my concern and assured me that what she was doing was normal. I should have stopped her there but I did not want to tell a person how to do their job. My bad. It looked fine, but chipped 2 days later. It can happen, I get that. What didn't surprise (but did disappoint) me was over the next two weeks, 8 of my 10 nails broke, split, or ripped off...you know why. Because my nails has been damaged and weakened significantly. $45+tip for the months it will take to repair and restore them, no bueno.

11.description: I got a really pretty no chip design for Halloween today! I really like it. It is a beautiful place, and nice music around there. The server did a good job. I am totally sure I will be back for that.

39.description: I've been here before and absolutely loved my experience but today not so much. I asked for a mini pedicure and must have been misunderstood because I received a full pedicure and was charged more than double what I was expecting. My lady was extremely young, highly doubt she was licensed because she had no idea what she was doing. My right big toe was gashed bad by the cuticle trimmer causing it to bleed and still hurt to walk over four hours later. Not sure her name but like I said very young probably 17. My first experience was so nice I'll give them another shot but request someone else. The paint job looks okay but has a mark already and filing was too hard as well as the foot scrub which previously stated I didn't even want. Very irritating trip overall.

37.description: I must say, this nail salon is hands down the best I've been to so far. I live in the South Loop and there's about 4 nail salons surrounding me and I haven't been impressed with either of them. I had a no-chip manicure about two wks ago, and my nails still look great! The paint hasn't chipped off at all! Very friendly  staff too.

0.description: Oh wow, I love this place.  I will definitely be returning.This place is clean, has great selection of polish choices, has massage chairs, and has nice staff.  What more can you want?It's the things that aren't standard anywhere else that really make this place fantastic.-They have a nice little waiting area with comfortable seating, and a basket of candy.-They do a good foot massage with the pedicure and a good shoulder massage with the manicure.-They offer you a drink when you come in.  I had a glass of white wine, and a mini bottle of water.-They rub a vitamin E capsule on your hands when doing the manicure.-They put a pad with lotion on the bottom of your heel and saran wrap it to the foot to add moisture.-They use Zoya nail polish which is vegan, cruelty-free, and 5-free.  So you can feel good about your choice.-Their products smell amazing.  This was completely different than any other manicure/pedicure I've ever had.  The place didn't smell chemically and my hands smelled great the whole time.The sections to dry your hands and feet were motion sensor-ed fans.  I'm not sure if that's helpful, but I thought it was really cool.The manicure/pedicure was $45, and it was worth the price.  This will be my new spot for mani/pedis.

38.description: love this place so much my girlfriend and I, she was doing really good job massages for me, Will comeback soon for sure!

51.description: I absolutely love the owner of OMG Nail Spa, Chloe -- I've been following her for years! OMG nail spa is very clean and bright. The service is impeccable. I truly go out of my way to have my nails and massage here. Highly recommended.

27.description: First time in OMG Spa today. A very nice nail salon! The space was clean, bright and pretty. The music was a tad loud, but it was nice new jazz and not hard to listen to. There were NO TVs. AMAZING. I love no TVs! Having the tv on just distracts for the relaxing I want to do.The service was great. Everyone was very polite and attentive, asking if I needed water or a glass of wine. It was really friendly and I did feel "treated". My nail tech Sammy was a sweet lady, easy to chat with and very good at what she was doing. My nails look wonderful, her massages were GREAT. I'll book with her again for sure!Only down side was the wait, but their menu does say appointments preferred, so I suppose that was just my own mistake. I had read that people walked in, but I should have double checked. Overall, the service, cleanliness and price were all very good. I'm hoping all the techs are paid fairly, and not just tipped workers, because they are impeccable and talented! I was sure to tip well, just in case. I'd recommend it! For a treat, get the $85 OMG Spa mani/pedi combo. Extra long massages, sugar scrubs, coconut oil lotion, skin mask. Really a nice way to get some overdue self-care!

32.description: I called the weekend of July  10th and made an appointment for 10am full set on the 24th. It's the 24th and I walked in at 9:57a. Why was I told I do not have an appointment when I walked in? I paid for parking before I walked in and I was asked to came back at 1 or 2p. So disrespectful!!! "Maybe someone made a mistake...there's only one person that does gel and she's with a customer" that's not my effing fault! I'm so heated because I haven't had a full set in quite some time so I was looking forward to it. I had talked it over with friends but I have nothing to show when I see them. Whoever I talked to on the phone when I made the appointment asked for my name, number, and if I had been to the salon before. This would have been my first time. I'm so disappointed.

54.description: Excellent new spa for a mani/pedi. Everything was very clean and all staff was extremely friendly. Prices were good (M-W mani/pedi special for $35 is a good deal) and service was terrific. The massages during each service and the shoulder massage at the end were a nice touch. Highly recommend!

48.description: Excellent service and wonderful staffs! Best nail spa in South Loop. Love the store design, the Jazz, and the paintings. The owner puts so much thoughts in the lotion, scrub, nail polish and all the other products used in the store. Their sea salt scrub and hand masks are awesome! Totally recommend for anyone who value a great service.

44.description: Today I made a mistake.  I called OMG for an appointment and they were all booked up. Of course, this place is awesome.  I thought I would just run in Rock n Nails down the street to get a quick mani and pedi.  I knew this salon wasn't that great but I need to get them done.   After they told me they had time for my appointment a technician took off my big toenail nail polish and then someone came over to tell me they actually don't have time.  Who does that?   Don't go there.  So I walked down four blocks to OMG where I knew I loved it.   The girls are super chill and great at doing nails. The space is welcoming and clean.   And it's just all-around awesome.   So now I'm waiting over an hour to get my nails done there because I've learned my lesson. OMG all the way.

24.description: Reasonable prices. Nice atmosphere. Good service and nail techs. I have been coming here for the past 6 months since moving back to Chicago from Bethesda, MD. The bonus is the back rub AFTER pedi - Wow!

7.description: I can't believe this place has existed for five months and I am only now discovering it. I had been getting acrylics for a while at a different place and decided it was time to give my nails a break with a regular mani. I'm very, VERY particular about where I get pedis done (I gotmy hands done at the last place for 6 months before finally trying a pedi there and the experience left much to be desired.) so I was super excited to read the yelp reviews about this place and since its only a couple blocks away from my apartment I decided to give it a try, and I do believe I have found my new place!they have a special mon-wed for a $35 mani/pedi (before 2pm) so I went right when they opened today. the decor is very modern, and very organized and CLEAN! and not just superficially clean; all the surfaces are white or light colored so there is no place for grime to hide, and there was none to hide anyway! they were playing jazz music and it was kinda loud like some other reviewers said, but that's not an issue for me because the last thing I want to do while relaxing is make small talk. so I dug it. they have a ginormous selection of Zoya polish, which I LOVE! their colors are so pretty AND chemical free. for you traditionalists, they also have OPI and Essie, as well as CND Vinylux ($5 more) and no-chip of course, which I never get cause I like changing my colors at home on a weekly basis. the massage chairs are brand new and phenomenal, and again, everything is clean and sanitary. they have autoclaves and you actually see them IN USE, not just sitting in a corner turned off. another cool thing is the dryers are motion activated, which I thought was a neat eco-friendly touch. I really can't say enough about the service here too. it's really a spa atmosphere, not a nail salon atmosphere (you know what I'm talking about.) they offer you a beverage right away, they always carry your belongings for you, and there was absolutely no chatter between the employees. I mean, like none. and no up selling or pressuring to get a no chip. it was such a relaxing vibe throughout my whole service. as for the mani/pedi itself, it was all top notch. usually when you get the special deal at places, you get a half assed performance, but not at OMG. the girl who did my mani/pedi was Yao Yao (?) and she was sweet, fast, and meticulous. she did exactly what I wanted as far as water temp, shaping, etc. the massages were fantastic, and they even give a shoulder massage with the mani-AWESOME! my nails look awesome and my feet feel fantastic. I will definitely be coming back to OMG!!

49.description: Great little spot! Quality pedicures, great massage chairs and the space is beautiful! I'll definitely be back!

40.description: My normal spot (Nail Party) is pretty hard to beat.. However, this place comes in a very close second. Primarily because of the prices (normal for a salon, a little pricey to me for a drop-in salon). Misc. comments:(+) super welcoming people. patient on the phone as I had questions. they give a very nice ~2min shoulder massage (I also spotted a chair massage thing in the corner). Bathroom is cute. candy by the register. TONS of colors, incl no chip. you earn 5% in bonus points for $$ spent (easier than bringing a punch card each time). if you're saavy- free parking. they make sure you like the color and that you are happy with the service. hand gloves (see photos) smelled really good, and finish with hot towels. have a low-chemical/organic(something?) nail polish line as an option.(-) was hot and humid in there. music was loud. tables are thin, so my knees kept knocking my technicians. the no-chip OPI lamp was hot!! can only tip in cash. was $45 for my no-chip.They are busy so be sure to make an appt!

53.description: First and foremost, the service here is outstanding. All of the employees are very attentive and helpful. The color selection is really nice and the prices are great (35 mani-pedi Monday-Wednesday). The mani-pedi was one of the best I have gotten, they take their time and make sure it looks beautiful. Amazing addition to the South Loop neighborhood. I will definitely be coming back. Recommend it 100%.

30.description: I can't believe this place has existed for five months and I am only now discovering it. I had been getting acrylics for a while at a different place and decided it was time to give my nails a break with a regular mani. I'm very, VERY particular about where I get pedis done (I gotmy hands done at the last place for 6 months before finally trying a pedi there and the experience left much to be desired.) so I was super excited to read the yelp reviews about this place and since its only a couple blocks away from my apartment I decided to give it a try, and I do believe I have found my new place!they have a special mon-wed for a $35 mani/pedi (before 2pm) so I went right when they opened today. the decor is very modern, and very organized and CLEAN! and not just superficially clean; all the surfaces are white or light colored so there is no place for grime to hide, and there was none to hide anyway! they were playing jazz music and it was kinda loud like some other reviewers said, but that's not an issue for me because the last thing I want to do while relaxing is make small talk. so I dug it. they have a ginormous selection of Zoya polish, which I LOVE! their colors are so pretty AND chemical free. for you traditionalists, they also have OPI and Essie, as well as CND Vinylux ($5 more) and no-chip of course, which I never get cause I like changing my colors at home on a weekly basis. the massage chairs are brand new and phenomenal, and again, everything is clean and sanitary. they have autoclaves and you actually see them IN USE, not just sitting in a corner turned off. another cool thing is the dryers are motion activated, which I thought was a neat eco-friendly touch. I really can't say enough about the service here too. it's really a spa atmosphere, not a nail salon atmosphere (you know what I'm talking about.) they offer you a beverage right away, they always carry your belongings for you, and there was absolutely no chatter between the employees. I mean, like none. and no up selling or pressuring to get a no chip. it was such a relaxing vibe throughout my whole service. as for the mani/pedi itself, it was all top notch. usually when you get the special deal at places, you get a half assed performance, but not at OMG. the girl who did my mani/pedi was Yao Yao (?) and she was sweet, fast, and meticulous. she did exactly what I wanted as far as water temp, shaping, etc. the massages were fantastic, and they even give a shoulder massage with the mani-AWESOME! my nails look awesome and my feet feel fantastic. I will definitely be coming back to OMG!!

46.description: I would give 6 stars if I could. This place is amazing, and I do not want to go anywhere else. I actually didn't want to leave when I was finished! They offer outstanding service, massages, wine, huge selection of colors, including organic polishes.

1.description: I have found my new favorite salon! This is my second time coming and everyone is always so friendly, patient, and friendly! Rena is the best! She has given me what I wanted and exceeded my expectations. She is gentle, sweet, and talented! Look at the picture :). I usually go for a no-chip manicure. My first one lasted for more than 2 weeks and I only changed it due to an upcoming event. My manicures have been accompanied with a nice hand and back massage. I will be back! I've only worked with Rena but the other techs do great work from what I've seen.Oh yeah, as you're serviced and spend a certain amount you earn credit towards future services! Awesome!

55.description: I went to OMG Spa for the first time two weeks ago, and received a nail service from Ms. Mori, it was awesome! She is very professional and nice. I loves the service , price and place. I will totally return!

9.description: Great atmosphere, professional and friendly staff. I received a spa pedicure and shellac manicure, I was very pleased with the outcome. Prices are also very reasonable.

26.description: So grateful to have OMG Nails in the South Loop / Prairie District! The salon is clean, well managed, and the staff does great, thorough work. We have been able to walk-in or make appointments at any time with no problem. I've come by after work for a quick mani but have also had multiple pedicures and no chip manis mid-day on the weekend and have always left happy. Nice music, wine, and candy as well! Did I mention no TVs?! So relaxing. This spot has become my go-to nail salon. Highly recommended.

25.description: Horrible customer service when they mess up!! I've gotten my past 3 no chips Manicures here and they've all chipped in less than a week!! Also Mory the manager is a liar and Chloe has the worst customer service I've ever seen!! Mory said she scheduled an appt for me to get my nail fixed..bc it chipped...Chloe said I wasn't in the books so she would fix my one nail that chipped 4 days later. I'm done! Also I asked Chloe if she could fix my nails after she was done with someone and she said "no I'm going home"..they close an hrs later!! Horrible horrible and I'll never do biz there again. There are too many other great salons on Michigan ave.

12.description: I come to this place since the very beginning when it opened and it is just impressing what the owner has created ! This salon delivers high quality service In a very clean and friendly atmosphere . there is no hectic or pushing and you truly feel the deep engagement of the nail technicians to satisfy the customer to the highest level.Jazz and classical music from CD , original paintings from local artists on the Wall .Huge selection of Nail polish !! (OPI, Essie,Zoya , butter London, CND weekly.)Be prepared to feel special !

59.description: Nice new nail place. Clean, hundreds of colors to choose from. Basic mani was great & included a hand/arm massage and a lovely back & neck massage. Open Sundays, which is great!

21.description: Great atmosphere, professional and friendly staff. I received a spa pedicure and shellac manicure, I was very pleased with the outcome. Prices are also very reasonable.

17.description: 1/16/16 was my first experience. My no chip mani was flawless! When it came to my pedicure the water was ice cold. The owner and staff knew there was an issue with the boiler and never gave me the option to skip the service. Instead lathered my legs with COLD solution. The room temperature of the establishment was cold, the products were cold and water cold. Free nail art was offered that that consisted of two lines. I tipped the girl $20 as I knew it wasn't her fault. The owner immediately asked me to pay when I sat to dry my feet which I did. I asked if there would be compensation towards a future visit and was told the nail art was free. NEVER AGAIN WILL I PATRON THIS PLACE. Over priced and bad service. I will continue to drive to Lincoln Square for organic nail services.

10.description: Great spa! Very friendly, skilled and relaxing atmosphere.  This is my new spot! So far I've tried pedicure,  fill in and a wax. All services superbly done! I look forward to my next visit;)

5.description: My normal spot (Nail Party) is pretty hard to beat.. However, this place comes in a very close second. Primarily because of the prices (normal for a salon, a little pricey to me for a drop-in salon). Misc. comments:(+) super welcoming people. patient on the phone as I had questions. they give a very nice ~2min shoulder massage (I also spotted a chair massage thing in the corner). Bathroom is cute. candy by the register. TONS of colors, incl no chip. you earn 5% in bonus points for $$ spent (easier than bringing a punch card each time). if you're saavy- free parking. they make sure you like the color and that you are happy with the service. hand gloves (see photos) smelled really good, and finish with hot towels. have a low-chemical/organic(something?) nail polish line as an option.(-) was hot and humid in there. music was loud. tables are thin, so my knees kept knocking my technicians. the no-chip OPI lamp was hot!! can only tip in cash. was $45 for my no-chip.They are busy so be sure to make an appt!

3.description: I love this nail salon! I do not live in Chicago, but every time I am there I make sure to get my nails done at OMG. The no chip is the best that I have had and it always lasts for 2 or more weeks. All of the ladies are super nice and they give you wine! I highly recommend this nail salon.

35.description: OMG is all I can say about this place. Went in based on other Yelp reviews and thrilled that I did. I will definately return. Relaxing, clean and very friendly. As one reviewer stated the music is way too loud, and I agree (smooth jazz was playing when I went in). For this reason I am giving 4 stars instead of 5 (if I could give 4 1/2 stars I would).I had a no chip mani and regular pedi. Both were great. I have gone to other salons in the area and with a no chip mani they skip the hand/arm massage (which I think is the best part) - not here, it is a priority that you are pampered. The gloves during the mani were wonderful. During the pedi they also put a hydrating cream on your feet and wrap in plastic to get the full benefit of the moisturizing. Loved that. I can't wait to go again. I thought the prices were reasonable - I paid $72 for the no chip and the regular pedi - that seems about normal for the area.

19.description: I absolutely love the owner of OMG Nail Spa, Chloe -- I've been following her for years! OMG nail spa is very clean and bright. The service is impeccable. I truly go out of my way to have my nails and massage here. Highly recommended.

28.description: I'm so happy I decided to visit OMG Spa. I'm new to the neighborhood, so I used yelp reviews to make a decision after walking around and talking to neighbors about various locations that provided very little services yet demanded premium dollars.  OMG is clean, professional and cater to their customers. I didn't feel like I was just another person walking in the door, they offered water and included a darn good back massage. Here's the best part Alice actually knows how to do a hand massage, don't be confused with other salons that rub lotion abrasively on your hands, she actually massages your hands! I so need it after typing and texting all day. Highly recommend OMG!

45.description: Really clean, Brand new chairs and great organic products , and loved the costumer service! I could just suggest having disposable files and buffers and make sure the instruments are autoclaved by opening the package in front of the client.

33.description: I didn't like this place much the young lady that did my manicure and pedicure was very rude and inconsiderate she kept asking me where I lived as if to say that only people from the downtown area to get your nails and feet done there so I just answered her and told her that I was from the southside then that's when everything started to go downhill she became very rude to me and she acted as she didn't want to finished The pedicure or the manicure I I had to tell her that she had to put a second coat on my nails and my feet. Then she started talking in her own language as if she was talking about me. Now I'm a big tipper especially when the service is very good and when the technicians are not rude . I only tipped her $6.she could've got at least a $30 tip out of me or $40 tip.I will not be visiting this place again.

43.description: This place is immaculate, friendly and quiet. There is no small talk between technicians, they have lounge-like music. It's very relaxing and they do a great job on nails. I haven't tried any other services yet.

2.description: I returned to give them another shot, and they did a pretty good job on my pedicure. The chairs were nice quality, materials seemed hygenic, atmosphere was chic and open, and they had a wide color selection.They had wine available (nothing fancy, but free of charge) however I didn't partake. A quick shoulder massage was offered while my polish dried, which was a welcome addition.They are a bit pricey and don't offer any decent specials ($39 mani pedi, but has to be early in  the day while most people are at work), and the staff could be a bit friendlier, but it's a prety decent spot for locals - I'm just not sure I'd make it my regular location.

18.description: OMG spa is hands down the BEST nail spa in Chicago!  The owner Chloe is incredible; she is an amazing manicurist and now she gets to add 'business owner' to her title.  She's a force to be reckon with and knows how to run a spa.  Upon entering the spa you are asked if you would like a beverage (wine included) and she sets the standard for asking you to 'pick out your color.'  Hundreds of nail polishes from CND Shellac, CND Vinyl Lux, Essie, OPI, Zoya....you name it, OMG Spa has it.It's such a welcoming and comfortable environment; the spa facilitates customers talking to one another.  That's one of my favorite parts; every time I go I meet someone cool.  Kudos to Chloe for a phenomenal spa!

41.description: OMG indeed! This place is fantastic! Super clean, awesome music, and relaxing. The mani-pedi I had here was (dare I say it) the best I have ever had. Rejuvenating, tranquil-- just what the doctor ordered after a rough exam week. They do a special on mani-pedis Monday thru Wednesday before 2 pm. With as great as the service is here, the special feels like a total steal. I will definitely be returning.

52.description: The atmosphere is even better since my first visit! Its smells like sweet green tea blended with notes of Californian moscato. The music - smooth jazz and easy listening- for example today " I'm glad there is you" by Grover Washington Jr.  I'm in love with this place- can you tell? Morie is amazing, sweet technician- go and have an appointment with her-you will love Morie's professionalism!

50.description: This place is great!  Very clean, great attention to detail, amazing service and a high-end mani and pedi;  I used to drive to Mario Tricoci in Schaumburg but not anymore.

4.description: This is my 5th time at this wonderful place , it is always best quality in customer service ! I can only recommend it ! And thanks for the Christmas gift !Merry Christmas to everyone !!

6.description: They killed it, they take their time and do a great job. Definitely make an appointment as many people got turned away in the time period I was there. Highly recommend

22.description: I've been looking for a quality salon since I moved back to Chicago. I have found the spot! I stumbled across this nail salon while browsing Yelp for a place to get my nails done. I've been to several places in the last two months and they've all been subpar. From the moment I called for directions ( I was parked right in from of the salon and didn't realize it), to the moment I walked out the door, I was treated like royalty. I didn't have to ask for something to drink, it was offered as soon as I took a seat in the waiting area. The giant bowl of candy sitting on the table was a nice touch, yet I stayed strong and resisted! Even the bathroom was nice! Sammy was my technician and she did an awesome job! I showed her a photo of what I wanted, and she made it happen. The only down side is the cost. $82 for a no chip manicure with a design, and a basic pedicure. Over $100 including the tip. If you want to relax without the normal nail shop atmosphere, this is your place. Diana Krall sang me into relaxation whole Sammy massaged my feet. It was a great treat on a Monday!

15.description: I moved to the south loop a little over a month ago and can I just say, manicures are EXPENSIVE down here. I'm walking distance from OMG Spa though and I am so glad, because they are the most reasonably-priced salon around - for regular manicures, anyway. (I'll need to think twice about my next no-chip.)I love the atmosphere, the music (I came in on a rainy day and the jazz playing was perfect), the efficiency and the friendliness of everyone there. I'll be back soon!

57.description: Great manicure and pedicure experience at OMG today. Beautiful interiors and welcoming atmosphere. Efficient but relaxing, professional service. This is a great addition to the neighborhood.

20.description: Slow holiday and wanted a quick mani/pedi.  As noted in other reviews, the place was clean, outstanding polish selection and pleasant.  It was a bit annoying having to call to make an appointment as opposed to a web interface and when I got there the receptionist was a bit aloof.  Despite those annoyances, the mani pedi was professional, efficient (a tad over a hour) and competitively priced for $39.  If I'm in the need for a quickie and have schedule availability - I can deal with the unpleasantries when weighed against the service and its value!

36.description: It's really a fantastic experience. The girls here are so patient to listen to your requirement about the pictures on you nails. The results show their skills are so good make my nails like an art.

14.description: Reasonable prices. Nice atmosphere. Good service and nail techs. I have been coming here for the past 6 months since moving back to Chicago from Bethesda, MD. The bonus is the back rub AFTER pedi - Wow!

3.description: The first time I went here I was not very impressed since I had to wait half an hour before anyone could do my nails ( there was only one woman who did gels apparently and I needed fills). Gave it another chance though and went back today to get a new full set. Ended up getting the Entity gels from OPI which are supposed to be better for your natural nails and I must say they did a really good job. Just like I wanted them....slightly oval and just over the fingertip lengthwise...nice not to have someone insist on looong and square like most places!!!!

1.description: What Kristen said. About three hours for mani/pedi with soak off during pedi. $55. The manicure is still soft after an hour. Kind of sad and run down. No massage chair, no hand or foot massage included with basic service. If I'd known I had extra time I should have gone to 47th St Hyde Park Nails.

2.description: My pedicure has lasted four weeks, and looks like I had it done yesterday (aside from the nail growth, of course) -- I will definitely be back.

5.description: This place is amazing and will take you if you come in five minutes before closing.  My nails last a really long time too!  Ask for Amy :-)

6.description: Cheap  and old nail polish.  Manicure lasted about 12 hours.  Toes are still holding on. Do not bother with this place.  My cuticles are still peeling.  YUCK.

7.description: Family owned and apart of the neighborhood for a long time.   Friendly service and competitive prices.  Go visit and see for yourself

0.description: I don't know what the negative reviews were based on. I came here bc it was close and I figured if it really was terrible like Yelpers say..then I'll go somewhere to fix it tomorrow. With that said, Betty just gave me the BEST pedicure and manicure I've ever gotten ... anywhere.... ever. It hurt a little at times but it was worth it because she was so thorough with my cuticles and my feet that I'm sure she was just doing what others never did bc they were lazy. She didn't cut or make me bleed so maybe I'm just sensitive. The polish job was perfect. I hope she stays here bc I'll go to her exclusively from now on. P.s. I have natural nails so what I got was a basic manicure. Not gel or tips.

4.description: Just walked out and couldn't wait to review this place. It was the absolute worst experience ever! It took almost 3 hours for a basic mani and pedi that both had to be repeated due to the first tech "in training" doing such an awful job. Not to mention it cost $40, not a deal considering how bad the service is. You can easily find a much better salon for the same price. The salon is also not very clean. Definitely will not be returning.

3.description: this restaurant is very clean - even the washrooms were spotless. The clerks were also friendly. Wish they had an outlet so I could charge my phone.

1.description: The staff is rude and take a long time to even come out from the back in the morning.

2.description: This Subway was pretty busy the whole time we were there but the line moved very quickly.  The workers were very friendly but kept the line moving.  The actual sitting area was clean and there were a ton of seats.  The parking lot is a nice bonus but it was a little congested since the parking lot is for a strip of stores/restaurants.  If I was in the area again, I would here for a quick bite!  I love Subway!

0.description: Great service!

4.description: not only is this the subway i go to most often, but i think it's one of the best subways around. even though this area is starting to see more and more condos pop up, the prices have stayed low-normal. for instance, if you go to a subway in the loop, you might have to pay extra to make your sub a wrap instead...not so at this location. the staff is also nicer than some other subways i go to on a regular basis.what really does it for me when it comes to subway is when they'll substitute turkey for ham in the BMT. i don't really like ham, but salami and pepperoni are tops, so i always ask for turkey instead of ham. some locations will do it, others will not. this one does.a coworker recently asked to get the meatball sub with the meats from the pizza sub added on. when he got to the register, they just charged him for the meatball sub with double meat (a buck more for a 6" sub). i'm sure they'll cut that out if people start taking advantage of it, but for now it's a pretty sweet deal.the fact that i love subway combined with their service ensures that i try to eat there as often as i can throughout the work week.

29.description: I rarely write reviews unless my experience is so atrocious or so spectacular that it motivates me to do so. I am happy to say that this experience was spectacular! I was at a friends apt in the South Loop and we ordered online and everything was perfect! Came right on time, was plenty hot, and loved the thin crust pepperoni and jalepeno! I'm so glad Papa Johns is in Chicago now...I'll be ordering from this location again, or one of the ones closer to my house like Lincoln Square. 5 stars!

42.description: I'm so glad they opened closer to me. I love being able to just order and pay online and pick it up. No muss no fuss.

23.description: I just got a message from the store manager to follow up on the confusion w/ the online delivery system and etc.  5 stars for the follow up.  Much respect and appreciation to those who take each customers reviews into consideration.  Thanks Chip!

47.description: Took an hour before I even got a notification that my pizza was on its way.The driver managed to somehow get lost between 80 E Cermak and 350 E Cermak.  That's three blocks!  After three attempts to call him and guide him to the correct corner, he stopped picking up the phone.Gave up, canceled my order.  He showed up a few minutes later, told him to get lost.

8.description: Called them for delivery, told them the address, was told I had to pick it up even though the only other time we ordered from them, it was delivered. Which is why we got a deal coupon for buy one get one. The guy on the phone could not give any less of a crap. This location should REALLY reconsider their staff and pay attention to the reviews.

31.description: It takes a lot to get me to comment, but I had such a great experience with this Papa John's location, I had to comment.  Even though there was some confusion around the timing of my large order, everyone was extremely pleasant and the issue was sorted out without Incident (at least to me).  It was a huge relief because I was ordering food for a big group and the food arrived exactly on time, the delivery person was helpful in bringing the pizza into the building, and the pizza was hot and delicious!  Thank you Papa John's on Cermak - we will order from you in the future without question.

34.description: The things I could have done by the time I received my pizza:1) Flown to Miami2) Made 2 pizzas3) Gone to the suburbs and back4) Driven to U of I5) Watched an Indian movie without fast-forwarding the songs6) Gotten married with an Indian weddingOn top of it...they didn't even cut it the way we wanted and the pizza was coldThe one star is for giving my my money back, not because Yelp made it mandatory.

16.description: Place always got all my orders right.  I think once our pizza looked off but tasted fine.

13.description: Do NOT order from this location. Waited over two hours. They never called or tried to contact me. I called several times. Staff is highly unprofessional. No apology. The so called manager made up a lie as an excuse.

11.description: The positive reviews are clearly manufactured.  I've never come across a business that works so intently against its own business interests. The following is an absolute fact, and 90% of the reason I decided to write this review--I recently endured the third (and obviously final) installment in the soap opera that is "Ordering A Pizza from Papa Johns, Near South".  Again, not kidding: for the third time, consecutively, and fourth time overall, they have delivered the first pizza 40 minutes late, gotten it wrong, sent a second pizza, which they also got wrong, then a third--yes, third time seems to be a charm.  It makes me so sad to see a neighborhood business struggle to this degree.

39.description: Put in an online order at 10:00pm, it's 11:03 I'm still waiting and I'm starving.When I called 14 minutes ago, I was told my order was sent to another address and she was just about to call me.  I'm hunnnngggrrrrryyyyyy......

37.description: Isn't their slogan "better ingredients, better pizza...?"  really, better than what exactly, pizza you find at the bottom of a garbage can?  Ordered delivery and they told me it would take 60-90 minutes, ok, seems like a long time, but I'll wait, no rush.  110 minutes later, yes, nearly 2 hours for 1 large pizza (I live 2 miles away, I should have just done carry out but was being lazy), it finally came, luke warm, cheese not melted and kind of soggy.  Customer service over the phone was non-apologetic and not helpful.  If I have a hankering for chain pizza, Dominos beats Papa's hand down.

0.description: My fiancé and I ordered the 5 topping pizza for $9.99. The pizza was made very fast, when we called to confirm the girl on the phone said "yeah what about it" she had an attitude. The toppings were pretty good, but the pizza was very doughy. Not sure I would recommend.

38.description: This location's bicycle delivery people are road hazards.Or speed bumps. If I hadn't been driving so vigilantly. Road. Pizza. Just to run the red light directly outside their store. Get it together guys.

51.description: I love pizza. I was really excited when I saw the Papa Johns in the south loop. It reminded me of my college days. Well,  I was treated to a rude awakening by this place. My husband placed a pre-order for 5pm, it's an option on the website. Well, at 5pm, no pizza. So, we called at 5:35pm to check the order the status. The woman on the phone verified that our order was suppose to be delivered at 5pm. She said to wait an additional 10 min. If the driver doesn't show up, call back. So, we waited 10 min, no pizza. We called Papa Johns, the woman on the phone apologized again. She said she could not contact the driver, because the cell phone was not working nor did the driver check in. She said, she was going to make us another pizza and send us a gift certificate for a free pizza. So, I said fine. At 5:56pm the original pizza arrived, the driver said he got lost. I don't understand considering on Papa Johns website there is map and I only live 10 min away near a major intersection in the south loop?!  So, I refused to accept this pizza because now that food is cold. So, at 6:10pm, I called papa johns to find out the status of our second pizza, the manager told me the driver left 15 min ago, finally at 6:23pm, our pizza arrived. I have never had this many problems with the delivery of food.  The employees seem unorganized. If  the place is not capable of handling pre-orders, then don't make it an option on the website. If your employees are not familiar with the area, then ask for directions.  Also, the pizza tasted very sweet, the dough was chewy. This is not the same Papa Johns I remember. The chicken strips were better. I'm was very disappointed by the service and quality of food. Hopefully, these problems will be fixed soon.

27.description: I returned for a second round tonight, and the staff was at least competent this time. My pizza was ready when they said it would be, although I didn't exactly get "service with a smile". They had a ton of people working tonight, but absolutely nobody manning the cash register. It took a couple minutes after I walked in to get someone to help me, and he seemed a little annoyed that he had to help a customer. (Although maybe it wasn't his job and he was picking up the slack for someone else - it was so disorganized I couldn't tell.) There was another guy there who looked like he had been waiting for awhile. I still can't quite recommend the place, but it will probably do in a pinch for carryout.

32.description: So I ordered a pizza last Friday night on the web and paid with my credit card.  The delivery driver delivered quickly and I gave him a cash tip.  Great job!  :)  On the credit card receipt I just signed it and went on my way.  Last night I got my statement and noticed the charge was a bit more than I expected.  I looked at the receipt still on the counter to find that the delivery driver went ahead and gave himself an additional $5 tip on top of the cash I already gave him!  Ughh.. My bad for not writing in "cash" in the tip spot.  So I called the store last night and the manager couldn't do anything.  He took my info and said the district manager would call me today.  No calls today.  So I called and spoke to Janice (store manager maybe?).  She claimed my story didn't match what she heard from the manager the night before and basically called me a liar.  She proceeded to say she would need to look into it more.  Really?  It's $5 - a good manager would have just reversed it or just given me a credit on my next purchase and moved on.  Called Discover and they filed a credit card fraud claim!  Won't be ordering from this location ever again!

54.description: It's not secret that I secretly love chain pizza, so nice to have a Papa Johns in the neighborhood.  Good pizza, competitive prices, and GREAT breadsticks.  They just opened, so they still have a few issues to work out, part of our order was missing when we went to pick it up, but the manager came out and rectified the problem immediately.  They were busy though and the pizza/breadsticks were yummy.  Once they get running smoothly, this will be a great location for takeout.  Welcome to the South Loop Papa Johns and thanks for opening up!

48.description: I figured I would relive my college years and give the new Papa Johns a try! Bad decision. Pulled the menu up online, and called to order a combo we found under "current specials" at that particular location. Girl on the phone said that it was not valid at their location. I asked to speak to her manager, and he said the same thing, and that he would have no way to ring it up that way. False advertising! Any idiot could take a second and pull up online to see, instead he acted as if I was crazy. Needless to say No Papa Johns for us now or never. Pizzeria Brandi for life...

44.description: This is about the 4th time we've ordered here. The 1st time went well, pizza was what you expect and so was the service. However, the past 3 times they always forget something.  It's ridiculous they charge for red pepper, and then forget to add it in the box. While I understand that you pay extra for sauces, if you're paying extra for sauces it would be nice if they actually included them inside the pizza box, instead of forgetting them or giving you the wrong ones. Sadly, home ranch isn't the same.They also just today mixed up my order and gave my pizza to someone else, then when I asked if they had to make me another one they said, "we just got your toppings wrong. It's almost ready." Granted they did make another one pretty quickly but at least be honest and clue me into what I already know is going on.  So yeah. The service isn't all that great,and  they seem to be very unorganized so I'd be sure to check your order before walking out the door or leaving a friendly tip. Overall, it's papa johns so you're not getting gourmet pizza. But you would think the service would make up for it in some way. Sadly, this one doesn't. Maybe i'll start going to Dominos where they include all my sauces.

24.description: Since my last couple of experiences with the local South Loop Papa John's, the timeliness has improved.  I even received a phone call and email from the General Manager.They are starting to trend in the correct direction...

7.description: I was in Chicago for a conference, but really on the outskirts of town.  Some friends and I decided to walk down the street to a market to stock our room fridge, and were happy to find Papa John's right next door.  They had a $5 deal, so I grabbed a pepperoni pizza to go.  My friend ordered some bread sticks.  As we were waiting, a couple more people came in to pick up to-go orders.  I heard one customer ask for packets of cheese and peppers, but the clerk told him that they cost extra.  What??  I've never heard of that before!So, the pizza was pretty standard as far as Papa John's goes...but pretty sad to be eating Papa John's in the land of Chicago-style pizza, right?If you're staying in the McCormick area, there aren't many places to eat, and Papa John's is the Starbucks of pizza - consistent and predictable.  Plus, you can't beat $5!  A-OK for sure!

49.description: Always happy when a new place opens up south of Roosevelt, as the choices aren't as plentiful as the north side.For as many employees working, they seemed disorganized or maybe so many people running around was a part of the problem. We were greeted right away by a friendly enough fellow and he told us about the specials, then he disappeared while we were deciding, maybe he thought the other guy would get our order, or maybe the other one, or the other one... In any event we just stood there thinking, does anyone want to take our order?We did order a thin and their regular to give both a sampling, and found the thin to be the better of the two. This is not outstanding pizza, it's pizza that you get in 20 minutes that will get you through wanting some pizza.       Why an A-Ok rating, solely for the long wait to order and for a bit I did think they forgot that we were there waiting on the order. The pizza itself can be a four or even five star review, because they produce exactly what their aim to produce is, this isn't a gourmet pizza, it's a formula. So get organized, and clean up the area by the door where people walk in, no reason for plastic bags and dirt on the floor. You have all these employees running around, must have been 20 people in there.

40.description: This Papa John's pizza quality is as good as any Papa John's. They seem to do what they should do as far as pizza quality.My quibbles? They have a terrible system in store as evidenced by never getting our sauce count correct. It's been three times nowWe order extra sauces- they can't get it right. It's not worth having them run them out either. Delivery time is on the slower sideNeeds new management. But the ovens and ingredients seem to be just fine

53.description: My brother got some carryout and my sister brought a slice home and a parmesan breadstick. Even after a few hours and a quick few seconds in the microwave and it was still good. Pizza - Ingredients tasted fresh and the crust had a soft chewy consistency to it.Parmesan Breadstick - Very flavorful even without sauce. It is a bit more dense than others, but very good.Like my sister says "So glad a Papa John's is near us now!"

30.description: Poor service. I know I shouldn't expect much, but still.Called in at 12:30 am and the delivery time was supposed to be 40-50 min. 90 min later - no delivery. No explanationNow i dont need the food so when I called to cancel my order, they told me to keep the food for no charge. So, when the food FINALLY arrives: they tell me that they can't really give me the food. What the #%@! is going on? At least get your apology right!Disappointing.

46.description: This location is awful. The driver at this location decided to add an extra 10 dollars onto his tip. The pizza also arrived cold. . Check your bank statements, as he is probably trying to scam multiple clients. I would give them zero stars if i could.

1.description: This pizza blows - literally. When I bit into it, it popped, like I released air where actual food should be! The delivery driver was smiling when he pulled up - I guess that was actually a smirk on his face, as if to say "Enjoy your air 'za, Sucker!" I'm binge watching "The Knick" right now - these old-school quacks couldn't cure anything in 1900 without using the white stuff. God, this pizza sucks.

9.description: fuck john!!!!!!!!!!! its been an hour where is this fool????? not at my door with a pizza

26.description: Poor Service, Employees dont't have clue.Ordered a pizza yesterday, it took 2 hours, to get at in the afternoon. Called the store lady on the phone kept saying the order went out.   Ending up calling the main support line, they said the pizza left 10 minutes prior to my call, and then the door rang. The employee lied, FLAT out.   Will NEVER order from here, the place is a disgrace to the franchise.

25.description: We usually get pizza from here since its close by. The pizza is pretty good, but the store and staff could be a bit cleaner. Every time I go in there, the place is a mess. Plus the employees are really laid back. They don't really greet you or anything.

12.description: I love Papa Js. Always have. Unfortunately I ordered a pizza with an expected wait time of 30-40 minutes and it was finally delivered in over 1 hour and 30 mins. I asked the delivery guy what the holdup was and he said traffic. Considering I was staying in a hotel only 3.4 miles away I find it unlikely. Pizza was just above room temperature. Good franchise but not this location.

21.description: By far THE worst pizza downtown Chicago. Barely any toppings, chewy crust, cheese?  What cheese?  Uggggg. Took over an hour to get delivered and the it was barely warm. And I'm only about 6 blocks away!!! Lady taking order on the phone could barely speak English. Got one star because they make you give at least one.  Never again. I'll pay more and get it from beggars.

17.description: I just got a message from the store manager to follow up on the confusion w/ the online delivery system and etc.  5 stars for the follow up.  Much respect and appreciation to those who take each customers reviews into consideration.  Thanks Chip!

10.description: I live a block away. Pizza arrived lukewarm. Asked for well done & sausage on pizza and the wings were underdone.  Had to place in the oven. Ended up tipping 3 bucks to the driver because "he didn't have change". So I was charged $2.95 delivery fee & $3 tip for a horrible pizza that he coulda walked to me & I woulda gotten it faster. Won't ever order from them again. Next time I take my lazy arse out in the snow.

5.description: REALLY BAD SERVICE!!  I ordered a veggie pizza. The delivery guy came exactly after an hour, made me come all the way out of my building (which no other delivery person has never done before) and delivered a pepperoni pizza. I called him up and he started grumbling, and said he will get my order done now. I waited for another hour and no response. So after 2 hours of waiting for food, I call up this store and the person on phone just said "we will refund you, sorry!" and hung up. 2 hours of waiting and I have no food and its past midnight and I have no other decent place to order from. Thanks papa johns for teaching me a valuable lesson to never order from you again!

3.description: Worst service ever .. I waited for an hour to get the pizza delivered , even after following up by call ,they delivered to wrong address and nothing got delivered . Pathetic service

35.description: Exactly what I wanted on a Tuesday evening.  Ordered two pizzas on special at the beginning of the game, got them something like 30min later.  Professional delivery guy.  I'd order again.

19.description: My brother got some carryout and my sister brought a slice home and a parmesan breadstick. Even after a few hours and a quick few seconds in the microwave and it was still good. Pizza - Ingredients tasted fresh and the crust had a soft chewy consistency to it.Parmesan Breadstick - Very flavorful even without sauce. It is a bit more dense than others, but very good.Like my sister says "So glad a Papa John's is near us now!"

28.description: The first I would like to say is that their pizza was pretty good.  The last thing I want to say is that their delivery service is beyond terrible. They call me to tell me to "come out and get the pizza". There's clearly a spot outside that you can stop at to bring me my pizza. That's not even the worst thing.. They asked me if I had a pen to sign a slip. You deliver, shouldn't you have your own pen.. If i hadnt gven tip through my card i wouldnt give him any at all. Never ordering from this location ever again.

45.description: Well the manager read my review and wanted me to give them another try and sent me a  free pizza code. I ordered yesterday, Wednesday and the pizza this time was "perfect", OMG it was amazing. Such a big contrast to last week's pizza. What happened? Did you guys fire the chef and flew someone over from Italy, lol. Thanks for redeeming yourself Papa John's. The pizza was perfect.

33.description: Don't order from here... PLEASE DO NOT ORDER FROM HERE... Order from Brandi's across the street or Flo Santos.Thought to give them a try one night. Most people would not see this as an issue, but if you put yourself in my shoes, I would hope you would understand.I love Buffalo Chicken pizza.. I have oredered it a million times from many places. Granted, maybe I should have read the FINE PRINT that they add Bacon (I cannot eat bacon) to their Buffalo Chicken pizza, but every other pizza that has something 'major' to it, would say it in the Title of the Pizza - NOT THIS ONE.  Anyway, after getting the pizza I called and kindly asked if I would be able to get a new pizza, but the manager said he needed to check with his manager, took my number - never called back after reconfirming my phone number.

43.description: Tonight we ordered a large half pepperoni half green pepper and mushroom pizza.  A couple weeks ago we ordered a spinach alfredo.   Our pizzas have not been good.  We are usually very pleased with Papa Johns, which is why we kept giving you a chance.  But I don't know what the problem is.  The pizzas are not very appetizing.  I think it's a combination of being a little under cooked and the use of lower quality ingredients.
