5.description: I was at the Hyatt Regency for a conference.  To make a very long story short, I waited for over an hour and never ended up getting my meal (I ordered a tuna melt, they brought me a soup & salad, I said I didn't order that, my tuna melt never came and I had to get back to the conference).  I ended up spending $2 on Pringles for my lunch at the snack shop.  In hindsight, I should have just eaten the soup & salad.

31.description: Atmosphere is very nice and upscale. The servers were awesome and very nice. The food prices are high, but what can you expect from a hotel restaurant. I ordered steak and eggs. The steak was not the greatest and the potatoes had too much black pepper in them. They tried to make it look fancy, but the food was very mediocre at best.

25.description: Shor is the restaurant at the Hyatt hotel; we stayed here for three days and ate at the restaurant several times.  The food was excellent.  Service was a bit slow, although the staff was very nice.  Prices were a bit high, although that's expected given the location in the Hyatt at the convention center.Summary: good food, someewhat high prices, slow service.

12.description: The food (vegetable stack for dinner, lemon curd with fresh berries) was outstanding and service was attentive.  I was pleasantly surprised in a hotel restaurant.

37.description: One of the worst meals I've had. Horrible buffet. Stuck at  the convention center with no close restaurants to choose from. Also just craziness to wait in line to even get in/wait is very, very long -- and definitely not worth it. Buy a bag of frito chips and it'll be better -- and at least worth the money. Don't settle for this place -- let's all hope the Hyatt makes a change for the better.

21.description: Meh. Not much of a menu. The salad bar was okay. I did love the little martini glasses with mini cheesecake in it.

16.description: I was attending a conference at McCormick Place and not wanting a convention center sandwich so I found this place as about the closest restaurant since it's in the Hyatt. The hostess here was a bit rude and the menu is quite limited.   They are really geared towards getting you to eat at the buffet. I had a salad that was just ok and a business associate had a sandwich and soup.   He thought his food was good but this guy thinks anything he doesn't have to pay for is amazing. I gave it two stars simply because that's what it deserves.  It's twice as good as the food in the convention center but that's not saying a whole hell of a lot. Overpriced and overrated.

17.description: The service was amazing. But the food! As a vegetarian, very rarely am I wowed by the vegetarian entree at a traditional restaurant. The "Veggie Stack" was out of this world! It's a must try for even carnivores.

10.description: Great burgers.. Damn? $12 ok.. I get it Hotel restaurant prices, but I can't be mad at them because the food and service was fast and friendly. James Brown on the speakers and they have a lot of draft beer on the menu.. This'll do nicely!

11.description: After traveling for 5 1/2 hrs from California, I was hungry. My appetite was growing while I was high above the clouds on my way to Chicago. So I checked in at McCormick and in the directory I stumbled upon this restaurant. I was going to skip dinner but as my eyes browsed through the list of food places my stomach started growling. So I made my way to the restaurant which isn't very hard to find considering how humongous this hotel is. From the north tower, go straight past the lobby to the south tower, then make a left then past the escalator on your right & snack shop on your left. You'll reach the end of the hall. Across is Forno ( Italian ) and on your immediate right is Shor. Before I asked for a seat, I was presented with 3 menus. Turns out that each menu is designated to a certain room. Since it's dinner time, the main room was pretty occupied. Sandwich menu and drinks/appetizer menus to the other two smaller rooms. Don't know why they have this arrangement but it must work for them. I chose the menu with the steak since I needed to fill my gut really quick here. The room was large, quite dim but cozy. Groups on the other side and couples and solo guests along the entrance. I was served right away and my steak arrived in 10 mins. I ordered a medium rare 14 oz ribeye with a loaded baked potato. Although the meat was tender & juicy, it needed more flavor. I sliced through the meat and the left half was cooked medium & the right half was med rare, didn't complain about it. I was hungry. The baked potato although it was also good was on the cool/warm side. Price wasn't too bad. Steak, loaded potato, a beverage plus taxes, it came down to $47. In California, at a restaurant with a 3 star rating, that price is just for the steak & taxes (not even Filet mignon). Customer service was excellent. I wish my waitress gave me her name. She was so attentive and made sure my glass is refilled constantly. When I left the restaurant, I didn't realize that I left my leather jacket on my chair. I kept walking & stopped by the snack shop to grab a bottle of Gatorade and then one of the managers approached me and asked if I left my jacket somewhere. All of a sudden it dawned on me that it was my jacket . I thanked him for it. I've left some items in restaurants before like a hat, scarf, pen, etc but no one has ever made an effort to find me later on for something I've left behind. Kudos to this manager. Again, I wish I asked for his name. If the business owner is reading this, I was at Shor on 3/28 at 8 pm and left around 9ish. Two men in black suits (one African American and a Caucasian guy were in the snack shop at the same time). Please let them know how grateful I am. Again, a pleasant experience. For the price I'm paying to stay at Mccormicks, it's worth it.

26.description: Good Breakfast.

27.description: Seems to be a well-designed menu without the ability to properly carry it out.  I expected it to be overpriced, given its location in the hotel, but I also expected, at these prices, to have good quality.  The haricots verts in the bib-lettuce wedge salad were old and tough, though the rest of the salad was quite good. The $29 a la carte Rib-eye was cooked closer to medium-well than the medium-rare that was ordered (which is completely unacceptable) and was swimming in the au poivre sauce. The service was genial (though a bit forced) and they offered to redo my steak.This could be a very good overpriced restaurant, but they need someone with better oversight.

35.description: I'm not sure what quite goes into the name of Shor: whether it was named after an Indian movie, a stock ticker or because it sounds vaguely Nordic and pretentious. I suspect more likely the later. Regardless of the name, it's one of the few dining options that you have in the near vicinity of the Convention Center. The thing is, the owners know this too and you'll be paying a steep markup for basic food.There's not a huge amount of ambience here, since the restaurant is basically open in a hallway between the convention center and the hyatt. The furnishings are fine, sort of a nice minimalist Ikea design. I went with some lemonade and the chicken fettucini here. I thought the fettucini was fairly well done with reasonable sauce; the chicken had a little spicy breading that was a nice touch. The lemonade was, well, lemonade. But there were frequent refills.Service here was actually fairly good. My server was a pharmacy student who was working a long shift (I bumped into her again 10 hours later working in the bar), but was still pleasant and came by frequently to refill my drink.So basically it's reasonable and convenient food with friendly service at a poor value from the price markup. Not a memorable dining experience, but was filling and friendly enough to offset the grumbling about the price. Thus three stars.

8.description: Your average hotel/convention dining spot. Had the Eggs Benedict and a glass of water. With tip, total came out to $20. A bit steep considering the food wasn't extraordinary, but the service was efficient and you can just charge to your room. Could definitely get pricey for groups.

0.description: Yes, it will be an overpriced hotel dinner. At the Hyatt, there are only a few options especially in that neighborhood it you do not want to walk 4-5 blocks to nearest restaurant.Liked- fried calamari appetizer- pretty good wine selections- attentive service- fast kitchenSo so- ahi tuna salad (skimpy on the tuna)For $50+ / person, could have been better but good quality food.

38.description: We went to Shor for dinner after a long day at the convention center.  Not only was it extremely convenient, but it was so delicious- I'd go back even if I weren't in the area for business.  The atmosphere is so contemporary and sleek- you definitely feel like you are eating in style!  I had the salmon which was amazing and my friend had the steak which was also great.  We were so stuffed we considered booking a room at the Hyatt McCormick instead of going home!

20.description: I was attending a conference at McCormick Place and not wanting a convention center sandwich so I found this place as about the closest restaurant since it's in the Hyatt. The hostess here was a bit rude and the menu is quite limited.   They are really geared towards getting you to eat at the buffet. I had a salad that was just ok and a business associate had a sandwich and soup.   He thought his food was good but this guy thinks anything he doesn't have to pay for is amazing. I gave it two stars simply because that's what it deserves.  It's twice as good as the food in the convention center but that's not saying a whole hell of a lot. Overpriced and overrated.

19.description: Went. Got food poisoning. Just spent the last few hours of a conference going back an forth to the restrooms. Don't go. Cream for coffee had dirt/specks in it. I should have paid attention to that warning. Now going to catch a flight. I better get an aisle seat!!  Save yourself the drama. If this is the only option...go hungry.

33.description: Shor is a good place to eat if you are in the convention center with no escape.  Food quality is a cut above convention food and Mccormick food vendors.  Still could be better, but decent for what it was.That sad, can be a bit pricey. Staff was ok.  Overall, no complaints.

2.description: We went to eat there yesterday and actually never made it to a meal.  We waited for a host to even seat us (no waiting for other people, just for the actual host to come to the front).  We then waited 15 minutes with no server.  Someone brought water, and said a server would be right over.  No server.  We asked again.  No server.  Finally after a 30 minute process from start to finish, we got up and left with still no one approaching us.  For a half empty restaurant, this seemed very odd.  I would pass for sure.

34.description: THis was one of the only restaurants open during a weekday convention at McCormick Place.  The decor is fabulous, but the people working there seem a bit odd.  I will say the service could have been a lot better for this finer dining atmosphere.  My tuna sandwich was very tasty and the rest of my group said that their food was good too.  I would eat here again if at McCormick place.

32.description: the only restaurant in the hotel....after 2nd meal, you will get sick just by thinking going here.

18.description: Don't go too late...at close to 8 pm there was a 45 minute wait. Since it would have taken at least as long to get a cab and then wait at a restaurant somewhere in the city, we rolled with it. Over 45 minutes later, we got a table...only to be told that they were only serving the buffet at that point. At least it wasn't totally picked over, and what there was (Chicken marsala, mashed potatoes, green salad with some dressing options, fresh fruit, israeli couscous) was decent for a buffet, and fairly warm. Still, it was annoying that after such a long wait we did not have a choice. Going somewhere else probably would have been preferable.

41.description: This restaurant is in the Hyatt Regency McCormick Place (yelp.com/biz/BqJ10kFkEJi…) and basically there isn't much in the Southside of town and so you're stuck eating hotel and convention food.Our server was nice but had to deal with a table of 14 as well as us 3.  I would say 98% of their clients are either hotel guests, convention goers, or both.  I fall in the latter.My steak was okay for $34.  My friend's pasta and my husband's fish were bland.  This place gauges because of what I had mentioned early of the area being isolated from the center of town.  We would have gladly gone to Brasserie Joe's or someplace better but my companions had to go back to work after dinner in the conference center.We ate breakfast here back in April and I remember the 'buffet brunch' was disappointing as well.   I really not happy of how they take advantage of their guests and overcharge on bad food.

13.description: Was here during a convention so it was very busy.  Had a steak and food was delicious.

4.description: Ok the menu looked promising but it was a let down. I ordered the carmalized onion and portobello mushroom omelette with a side of  turkey sausage and white toast. The omelette would have been good if it was warm. The turkey sausage was absolutely gross (cold with chunks of bone and cartilage) after eating my meal I typed this review up and never had the waiter stop to ask if everything was ok. Finally flagged him down and asked for my toast that I was suppose to have with my meal! NOT A RECOMENDED PLACE TO EAT BREAKFAST!

24.description: Came here on a Sunday afternoon and there were only two other parties in the restaurant with us. Waiter didn't seem to know the menu or wine list at all. I ordered the fish and chips, they weren't bad, nothing special and over-salted. My friend ordered the steak and it was overdone. Overall I wouldn't recommend it. Plenty of better places to eat.

6.description: A respite from the McCormick Place food court and the hustle and bustle of a large trade show, Shor actually seems to have three distinct areas. This review is specifically for lunch at the more formal, sit down restaurant, sandwiched between the bar area and the casual eatery.If you're a regular trade show / conference-goer, then you know how blessed it can be to sit in relative silence, alone, eating a decent plate of food to gather strength for the afternoon slog. I recommend going early to lunch, between 11-11:30 am, especially for a large show at McCormick, as the place fills quickly. My options from the menu were limited, as I have a gluten allergy, but the one GF item on the lunch menu was really, really good - if you enjoy seafood. The grilled seafood salad comes with salmon, shrimp and scallops, served over french beans, shredded jicama, carrots and spiced olives, with a light vinaigrette. My seafood was excellently prepared, and I savored every bite.Service was efficient, and good at keeping beverages filled. Sure, prices are steep, as they are at most hotel restaurants, but for me, totally worth it for an hour of calm amidst the storm.

22.description: Well had some time to kill at McCormick Place so figured I'd grab lunch at Shor at the Hyatt--mistake.  The booth they sat me with needed to be washed.  I ordered a chicken caesar salad, I could't even eat it.  They stuck 6 anchovies on top, which I wouldn't mind, but these things looked raw.  I don't know how you can screw up grilled chicken breast, but they can.  Anyways, I spent $25 on lunch for one and ate 3 bites--i'd rather go without than go back.

15.description: Best Crab Cake I have EVER had. How is that possible in Chicago?

40.description: The food is rather 'cafeteria' style but the price is exorbitant. I ordered a crab cake appetizer and a seabass entree. The crab cake portion is huge but with no flavor. The seabass is ok. The side veges that go with it is bland, overcooked and flavorless. Quite a waste of food.  Finally, I tried some creme brulee to see if they are any good with it, it's also disappointing. The overall price tag ended up to be $66 without drinks. This is a place where I will not go again.

7.description: I've had worse, but not much.  If you are looking for a decent meal, don't look here.  It's really the breakfast buffet area trying to make some extra money by serving dinner. Convenient, yes.  But I struggle to say I shouldn't have walked somewhere else.  Calamari was 'mushy' and ribeye was coated in a 'brown gravy' and meat was from the local 2nd hand grocery store.  Sorry, but a Hyatt this nice should have a nicer place to offer its guest.

36.description: This hotel reside inside the Hyatt I was staying at.  As with the previous reviewer this is the south side of the Chicago and there isn't much around this area as far as walking distance wise.  The atmosphere is nice; one would expect a dining experience of higher caliber.  However, this restaurant fail horribly to in terms of meeting one's expectation from the visual.  Highly overpriced in both service and taste.  Overall lackluster, go ahead and make the 10-15 minutes fight in traffic, it will pay off.  And did I mention, you'll come out with a $20 parking bill as well. ;-)

30.description: 1 star service....food was ok if you cannot get out of the Hyatt....but if you can escape the marginal food and disappointing wait/hotel staff....run! So much better food and service nearby in many directions for the same price.

3.description: I have only had the breakfast buffet at Shor Restaurant and it was very limited. There is your standard fruit, french toast, scrambled eggs and bacon as well as an omelet station. There isn't very much beyond that though. I would have had a more satisfying breakfast, for half the cost had I ordered a la carte.

14.description: Over priced hotel food.  I had eggs benedict and it was nothing special with coffee and juice the bill was $30!  Don't waste your money here.

28.description: I bought a 20 minute whitening session on YouSwoop. When I got there, the man behind the desk offered to increase my session to 30 minutes for only $15 more. A 50% increase for $15? Sure, awesome. The workers were very kind and helpful. First of all, BRING YOUR MP3 PLAYER! I was quickly seated in a small cubicle and given the tray for my teeth. By the time I realized that I would be sitting there for 30 minutes with nothing to do, I had a machine in front of my face shining a blue light on my teeth.I used my feet to grab my bag and managed to pull out my iPod. If I didn't have my mp3 player with me, I would have been sitting in a dark, quiet, room in an uncomfortable chair for 30 minutes with absolutely nothing to do.For the first ten minutes, I was in a lot of pain. I was considering asking to stop the session. When the 30 minutes were over, I went to rinse out my mouth and saw that my gums were WHITE and BLEEDING.I told a worker and she replied "Oh, he didn't tell you?"What? That my gums would be whiter than my teeth and that I'd be bleeding from the mouth? No, he didn't tell me about that.It's called blanching. Apparently it happens to 1 in 3 people. I had this treatment done four days ago and my gums are still sore. I can't even brush my teeth without reopening the wounds.Are my teeth whiter? Not noticeably. Maybe a little bit, but not enough for this experience to have been worth it. I wouldn't do this again.Update: A day after writing this review, I was contacted by Smiling Bright. They apologized for my disappointing experience and offered free services. While I appreciate the offer, as well as the excellent customer service, I declined.

1.description: I saw a deal and came in here without pre purchasing the deal. There are a lot of deals for this place-which was good but which also makes me nervous-because psychologically we associate higher price with better results, which is not always the case and certainly wasn't the case here. I didn't pre-purchase any deal so I wasn't losing money if I ran out of time on my trip (I need to find something similar to this in LA) also, it's better to just pay a business cash, especially small businesses bc deals are for advertising, getting repeat clients and they make less than 50 percent of the already low price of most deals. My dad was a business owner so I think about things like not charging with a credit card and causing the merchant a fee, etc.Anyway, my teeth: I drink a lotta tea. Apparently the worst thing you can do if you want a white grin. So they put this piece of plastic in my mouth and while I didn't take pics I'm sure I looked something similar to Hannibal Lecter in transportation gear. It wasn't too uncomfortable though. Then they put in this heavily peroxide coated plastic tray, gave me some sunglasses, aimed a laser at my mouth and I read a Vanity Fair for about 40 minutes. I spit it all out, threw it all away (so relieved because some high-cost dentists try and re-use equipment) and compared it to the chart. I had reached the lightest shade in under an hour for under 100. Not Friend's episode white, but pretty close.  I almost skipped this appointment, so glad I didn't.

9.description: If you are looking for a quick easy way to whiten your teeth, then I definitely recommend Smiling Bright.  They have 2 locations in the city and the offices are clean and staff is professional.  I first tried them over a year ago and was pleased with my results - after just 30 minutes my teeth were 2-3 shades whiter.  Quick, painless and at a great price.  Since then, I have gone several more times for a touch up. I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a touch up or before a special occasion!

29.description: You get what you pay for here.  The technician was very sweet but the overall experince was not worth the price I paid.  I bought two living social coupons but ended up only using one.  I may try to sell the other one if I can.  First off, I have had my teeth whitened once before by BrightSmile, and from what I know now, will return there again.  At BrightSmile, you sit in a relaxing dentist's chair with your feet up, you get your own small tv with cable and they put the remote in your hand, a person puts the whitening solution on each of your individual teeth, they also put clamps in your mouth to keep your lips open, and finally they put one of those tubes in your mouth that constantly sucks out the built up saliva. At smiling bright, none of that.  You sit in an Ikea style chair (ok comfort), and I wasn't offered the footrest even though it was in the room, no tv (was there music - I don't remember), you get a qtip of vitamin E to swath around your gums and lips, and the whitening solution is in a tray that you have to constantly bite down on and push back towards your teeth.  You have to hold your lips open like Wanda, and after 5 minutes, I had to use my hands to keep them open.  And you drool.  Because I floss every day, the peroxide took off a layer of my gums next to each of my front teeth on the top and bottom.  They are still sensitive Tuesday, and I got the treatment on Saturday.Just know what you are getting into.  If I had to choose between this place and BrightSmile, I would pay the extra money for BrightSmile.A day after posting the text above, the technician contacted me and offered me a full refund for the session and my unused coupon.  I offered some suggestions, and it appears that Smiling Bright is implementing some of my suggestions.  I definitely appreciated my concerns being addressed and believe that Smiling Bright has good customer service.

23.description: just wanted to mention that we got our wedding pics back, and our teeth look *dazzling* (but not unnatural, a la ross in that one friends episode where his teeth, like, glowed creepily).this was one of the best things we to prep ourselves for the wedding -- even my husband was happy with the results (and he typically could care less about such things :)), and it was fun to do it together.  we requested a double appointment, and got to share a room and make fun of each others goofy-looking visages (courtesy of the mouth-stretchy thingy that keeps your lips from squishing against the whitening stuff combined with the goggles.  hot :)).  it felt kinda cool to engage in some sort of pamper-y-like wedding-related activity with him, since most of that kind of thing kind of excludes guys, you know?i had no problems either session with sensitivity, but my husband (who uses special 'sensitive' toothpaste daily) did mention discomfort for a few days following.  (that didnt prevent him from encouraging me to book another appointment for him, though!  yay!  we are going to cleanse our oral cavities of all evidence of our nasty coffee + tea habits :))

5.description: So disappointed, this was a waste of money and it burnt my gumline also.  The only thing that got whiter was my gums from the hydrogen peroxide.

31.description: First of all, the experience itself is less than fun.  The lady who works there is very sweet, but this is by no means a fun treatment.  You sit in a chair in silence for the duration of your whitening.  No music, no tv, no talking, nothing.  But what's killer is that you have to hold your gums back with your fingers and bite down hard on the tray the entire time.  Longest 20 minutes ever!  Oh, and you'll definitely end up drooling.  Super hot.As for results, I can't say I was too impressed.  My teeth were relatively white to begin with, so I guess I shouldn't have expected a big difference.  It was only $30 for the Pretty City special, so at least it was a good deal.

25.description: My boyfriend and I went here yesterday and we both got two 30 minute treatments. Kimberley was so nice and tried to make us feel as comfortable as possible during the whole process. I'd definitely recommend not using an electric toothbrush or flossing 24 hours before the appointment as it makes your gums extra sensitive. My teeth were already pretty white to begin with but got 2 shades whiter. My boyfriend has veneers and was worried they would get whiter than the rest of his teeth but the treatment made all of his teeth evenly white and several shades whiter! I would 100% recommend Smiling Bright over teeth whitening strips, you can get several shades whiter in 30 minutes and it lasts for up to a year instead of using the strips every day for two weeks. Also, definitely bring a book or music to listen to during the treatment!

12.description: I was a bit skeptical of Smiling Bright when I bought the Groupon and read the reviews online but I was pleasantly surprised at the experience and overall results. The staff was friendly and the appointment started on time (which is huge win for me). It was a bit dull sitting in the room with no music/entertainment for 30 minutes but if you can try use the time to relax, it is just fine. I definitely saw results (3-4 shades brighter) and was pleased with the outcome. I am going to see how long it lasts but definitely plan on coming back in the future.

21.description: If you want your pearly whites shades whiter and your smile looking brand spankin'  new, go to Smiling Bright.     I bought the deal off of Groupon and bought another session before I left because I loved the results so much.  How good were the results, you asked?  4, count 'em 4 shades whiter and I left feeling like the girl from the Orbit commercials.  The whole procedure was a piece of cake and the ladies that helped were friendly.  I was in and out in a jiffy, leaving time to spend my hard earn birthday money on some new threads.   So, yes-the procedure uses the device that goes in your cheeks to open your mouth.  But if anyone has ever had braces, this shouldn't be a big deal.  I went through 4 years with monthly encounters with "the stretcher" as I liked to call it, with no skin off my nose.  Paste tray fit right in, the light was placed over my mouth, I put my headphones in and took a little cat nap.     Yes, my gums were also a little white on the bottom, it went away quickly and they told me that it could happen.               Need I say it again?  Beauty is pain-and this was well worth it.                               Two thumbs up for this fine establishment!

16.description: I just got home from Smiling Bright.  I've used white strips at home before, but never paid for professional whitening.  I was one of the unfortunate people who had bright white spots on my gums after the procedure.  However, the girl warned me that this was possible, and after I let her know that my gums were burning a few minutes in, she said I should definitely expect the white spots.  They were gone within an hour, like she said.I'm pleased with the results.  My teeth are definitely whiter.  I'm dealing with some gum discomfort right now, but nothing worse than burning your gums by biting into some hot pizza.  I have no tooth sensitivity.Megan, the girl who helped me, was very sweet.  I did end up buying another session before I left.  I wish I didn't have the discomfort, but overall I'm pleased with my experience.P.S. I brought my kindle, which made the 30 minutes much more bearable.

17.description: I have to start off by saying that the staff is super nice and friendly.  With that said, I don't think I have seen an improvement.  I first saw this great deal for $49 on Living Social for a 1/2 hour teeth whitening session.  I thought they were a little better but not much change so maybe it was because of all the coffee and red wine I drink that had damaged my teeth's coloring.  So I go back two more times.  Never saw much of an improvement.  I wasn't asking for Ross Gellar neon white but dang, I wanted to see a big improvement after 3 times.  I'm currently testing out Crest whites.  I hope the strips make a difference.  :(

10.description: One of the best experiences I had at the South Loop location for teeth whitening. A very clean environment; with friendly, professional staff working there. I went in for a 30 minute session, and I saw quick results that day. Couple days pass and I saw even better results. In my pictures I notice how much change I received from Smiling Bright. I'm very happy with my results, and the service provided to me from South Loop.  I will definitely go back to that location for service again!

11.description: Regular Price:  $149.99 for 20 min of whitening.  Pretty in Pink special:  $31.  Score?  Oddly they could only fit me in during lunch, and claimed all after work appointments were completely booked for the month.  And it was a week into October.  Oh, and just a heads up - they share a space with Posture Perfect Pilates, but from the window you should be able to spot the Smiling Bright sign above the front desk.Procedure Time:After filling out some quick paperwork, I was led to a private room and given a finger puppet like device to brush my teeth and a few cotton swabs with liquid to be applied to the gums and lips.  I was then given a mouthpiece with the gel already loaded in.  Unfortunately it didn't fit very well, so the gel got all over my gums - not ideal when whitening solution is involved.  I was then told to smile and keep my mouth open as much as possible.  This became the one time I missed those mouth open thingies I was tortured with during my orthodontist days.  The Results:  Two shades whiter with a side of sensitive teeth and irritated gums, and a little thank god I didn't pay full price for this.  Only the teeth in front were whitened, and there was a distinct lack of whitening close to the gum line.  Yup, def missing the orthodontist torture device.  Oh, and remember the mouthpiece that didn't fit?  Well, all that bleaching solution on my gums caused them to turn grey and completely peel over the next few days.  Luckily, my dentist did not lecture me during the call of shame and told me to just keep coating them with vitamin E, so muchas gracias Dr. Izzo.  Overall, this would've been an amazing deal with a correctly sized mouthpiece and cheek retractors.  In the end, I'd much rather pay a premium for a place that separately applies the bleaching solution to each tooth to ensure gum safety and has the orthodontist thingies to make sure more than just a few front teeth get brighter.

26.description: I've had teeth whitening sessions before, most recently with Smiling Bright this afternoon.  (I also experienced "Zoom" a couple of months ago, which I found to be ineffective and ridiculously overpriced.)The results of the Smiling Bright treatment were far better and absolutely worth the price paid!  I could see the difference at the office, and my teeth seem whiter still since I arrived home!!  The only drawback with Smiling Bright is the level of comfort during the session.  You can never really appreciate how long a 30 minute session lasts until you sit in a room with nothing to do except watch the timer count down!  Really?  Get a few TVs and charge a bit more for the customers who request those rooms.  The only other issue - I would like to see the very nice tech use hand sanitizer each time she enters the room since she goes from room-to-room attending to and offering instruction to clients.  Other than that, good experience, great value!  I will be returning and purchasing additional sessions as gifts.

27.description: I did a 40 minute treatment at Smiling Bright. After 20 minutes, there was a noticeable difference.  Enamored with the results, I figured, hey! Let's go for 40 minutes.  And I'm glad I did.  I look really, really good :-)    The entire experience was very comfortable and exceeded my expectations. As someone who can barely sit still for 10 minutes. I was a bit hesitant about the prospect of sitting still for 40 minutes. However, the chair and room were so comfortable, it was no problem at all.  The office is very nice and the treatment is extremely easy and comfortable.  I will definitely use Smiling Bright on a regular basis.

0.description: I've had three treatments here and each one was great! My teeth are noticeably whiter and the staff is extremely friendly. I will definitely be back for another round in a few months. I'm

20.description: I just got home from Smiling Bright.  I've used white strips at home before, but never paid for professional whitening.  I was one of the unfortunate people who had bright white spots on my gums after the procedure.  However, the girl warned me that this was possible, and after I let her know that my gums were burning a few minutes in, she said I should definitely expect the white spots.  They were gone within an hour, like she said.I'm pleased with the results.  My teeth are definitely whiter.  I'm dealing with some gum discomfort right now, but nothing worse than burning your gums by biting into some hot pizza.  I have no tooth sensitivity.Megan, the girl who helped me, was very sweet.  I did end up buying another session before I left.  I wish I didn't have the discomfort, but overall I'm pleased with my experience.P.S. I brought my kindle, which made the 30 minutes much more bearable.

19.description: I come here about once every 6 months for a touch up and always get great results! My teeth are on the whiter side naturally but even still I always see improvement! I do 30 minute sessions when I come and as long as you don't brush hard or floss immediately before it's painless.

2.description: I had an appointment at 12.30pm and I had to wait 10 minutes until someone came out from the back room. I'd like to thank someone who called Smiling Bright at 12.40, otherwise, I wasn't sure how long I had to wait. I forgot my headphone at home so I couldn't listen to the music while I was getting the treatment. Anyway, I love the result. My boyfriend came to pick me up and said that my teeth are much whiter. I'm so happy and can't wait to go back again in few months.

18.description: The best teeth whitening experience I've ever had.  I've tried many different avenues to get my teeth truly white with limited success.  I found Smiling Bright on Groupon.  The place was easy to find, I actually walked from the loop/river area. The owner was working the front desk and took time to explain the procedure and walked me through everything.  I left gaining several shades of whiteness making my teeth the whitest they have ever been.  More effective than any white strips, mouthwash or anything else I've purchased from Walgreens.Great value!

13.description: Fantastic Experience!Got a groupon deal for 49$. I could not actually believe that my teeth went few shades brighter in 30 minutes. The technician  was nice and professional. There was no wait either, they are perfect on time. I purchased that day additional 2 hours. My friends do see results as well! Love it and recommend it!

4.description: Pay to park....parking is challenging!  It took me a few  trips around the block to find parking so  make sure you leave your house early!The place was easy to find.  I actually was late to what I thought was my "12:30" appointment.  My appointment was actually on the following weekend.  Holy screw ups!The receptionist was super nice and said I could wait ten minutes and take the 1:00 appointment if they didn't show up.  They didn't (lucky me).Place is very clean.  They share a place with Pilates and Smiling Cleaners. The process was quick and pretty pain free and shame free (except for some drool).  My teeth were 4 shades whiter with only 30 minutes! I had a Groupon and they offered me the same deal when I left.  Of course I got it because I really want another 60 minutes to make the smile perfect!

24.description: Regular Price:  $149.99 for 20 min of whitening.  Pretty in Pink special:  $31.  Score?  Oddly they could only fit me in during lunch, and claimed all after work appointments were completely booked for the month.  And it was a week into October.  Oh, and just a heads up - they share a space with Posture Perfect Pilates, but from the window you should be able to spot the Smiling Bright sign above the front desk.Procedure Time:After filling out some quick paperwork, I was led to a private room and given a finger puppet like device to brush my teeth and a few cotton swabs with liquid to be applied to the gums and lips.  I was then given a mouthpiece with the gel already loaded in.  Unfortunately it didn't fit very well, so the gel got all over my gums - not ideal when whitening solution is involved.  I was then told to smile and keep my mouth open as much as possible.  This became the one time I missed those mouth open thingies I was tortured with during my orthodontist days.  The Results:  Two shades whiter with a side of sensitive teeth and irritated gums, and a little thank god I didn't pay full price for this.  Only the teeth in front were whitened, and there was a distinct lack of whitening close to the gum line.  Yup, def missing the orthodontist torture device.  Oh, and remember the mouthpiece that didn't fit?  Well, all that bleaching solution on my gums caused them to turn grey and completely peel over the next few days.  Luckily, my dentist did not lecture me during the call of shame and told me to just keep coating them with vitamin E, so muchas gracias Dr. Izzo.  Overall, this would've been an amazing deal with a correctly sized mouthpiece and cheek retractors.  In the end, I'd much rather pay a premium for a place that separately applies the bleaching solution to each tooth to ensure gum safety and has the orthodontist thingies to make sure more than just a few front teeth get brighter.

6.description: Teeth are much whiter after two 30 minute sessions. Just don't brush or floss before you go in.

22.description: The best teeth whitening experience I've ever had.  I've tried many different avenues to get my teeth truly white with limited success.  I found Smiling Bright on Groupon.  The place was easy to find, I actually walked from the loop/river area. The owner was working the front desk and took time to explain the procedure and walked me through everything.  I left gaining several shades of whiteness making my teeth the whitest they have ever been.  More effective than any white strips, mouthwash or anything else I've purchased from Walgreens.Great value!

15.description: The procedure/facility itself is great.  You can book appointments online and they are prompt when you arrive.I had the 30 min. Service twice. A tech sets you up on a room and while boring, it is not painful.My low stars are because I'd be lying if I said I noticed any difference in my teeth after two sessions.  Not even my boyfriend, close friends/family noticed a difference.  They looked at me like, "really? You had your teeth whitened?" I felt like I wasted my time/money here.

7.description: Parking on the side street was easy which was a plus. The staff is friendly and accommodating. I was serviced less than 5 mins after walking in. I had the 1-hour titanium service. I was very pleased with the outcome of my whitening service. I will return for service in the future.

8.description: First review in 2011 was 4 stars.  I had such a good experience then that I returned in 2012 AND purchased an additional treatment before I left.  I'd forgotten about the additional treatment that I paid for (thank goodness they don't expire) and purchased still another Groupon in early May 2014 AND a Living Social deal that came up a couple of weeks later.  I had a whitening session in 2013 with a different company and was pleased with the results, but the session was in another state.  Fast forward May 2014.  I went in for a session prior to going on vacation.  I was not pleased with the results and said so at the end of said session.  The owner, Kimberley, indicated where she thought I was on the color scale - I immediately disagreed.  Do they pick a color darker than your actual shade to cover themselves if the treatment fails???  Kimberley also said, as they all do, that my teeth would continue to whiten over the next 24 hours.  Honestly, this time I did not see a noticeable difference.  I emailed Kimberley to let her know.  You would think a business owner would want to make it right.  Especially for a repeat customer who purchased additional treatments!  Apparently not this one. Long story short, the treatment did not work this time.  Had I paid $150.00 I would be furious!  And this owner was not willing to make it right.  I see why there are so many reviews (68) for the Lakeview location vs only 16 for the South Loop location.  And so many positive comments for David at the Lakeview location.  I could ask Groupon and Living Social for refunds, but instead I will try the other location. I l love the comments about David and how he goes above and beyond, sending customers home with whitening pens or upgrading sessions so that customers leave with the results they desire; generally exceeding expectations.  Read the Lakeview reviews, skip the South Loop location and save yourself some time and aggravation.  I will post my impression of the Lakeview location at a later date....

30.description: I bought the livingsocial coupon, too, and it was well worth the money. The atmosphere was great, very clean and modern, and the staff was very nice. I had great results, and they offered me my second appointment at the same price as the coupon if I bought it that day, which I definitely did.

3.description: Pleased with the results!I purchased the Groupon ($89 for 60 minutes). I didn't really know what to expect when I went in. My appointment was recorded incorrectly, but they got me in within 15 minutes, since another person didn't show. My teeth were at least 4 shades whiter and I was very pleased!Staff was friendly. The actual facility is connected to a Pilates (I think, or yoga) studio, so that was a little confusing and threw me off... getting my teeth whitened but hearing a pilates instructor 10 feet away. Aside from that, clean facility. Note: I consider myself to have sensitive teeth. I use Crest White Strips (sensitive formulation) and still get that 'feeling' after using them. Secondly, I feel like my teeth whiten relatively easily (using white-strips gets them white just after 3-4 uses). Everyone's teeth whiten differently, so go in w/ that expectation. The actual process is simple. You go in a room, sit down in a chair and the process beings:- You're given Vitamin E swabs to put on your gums (try not to get it on your teeth). They didn't explain what this was used for, but found out that it's to protect your gums from the process. Tip: request 2 - one for the top and one for the bottom (I have bigger gums, however). - You're then given a plastic 'mouth spreader', which is used to spread your mouth open like Steven Tyler from Aerosmith. - You're then given the mouthpiece w/ the whitener.- Finally, they put a bib on you, because YOU WILL DROOL like a dog in front of a plate of bacon! Tip: you can bring your own or request tissues, since the bib isn't meant to absorb, just protect and collect said drool. - If you signed-up for 60 mins, they'll do this process twice (once to start then again in 30 mins)ProTips: Bring your headphones. I listened to a podcast and music for the hour - otherwise, you'll just end up focusing too much on your helpless drooling face. USE THE VITAMIN E! My gums 'burned' in a couple spots where I missed and were sensitive for 2 days after. You'll tell your gums are burned bc they'll be WHITE in certain spots (it'll go away after about 20-30 mins and go back to your normal color but remain sensitive). Keep your head tilted back a bit to avoid over-drool and ensure the bib is positioned right, or the drool can go down your chin. If you're lucky, the curtain to your room and the one adjacent or across from you will be open just enough to see your fellow neighbor and helpless drooler also looking as strange as you!

14.description: If you want your pearly whites shades whiter and your smile looking brand spankin'  new, go to Smiling Bright.     I bought the deal off of Groupon and bought another session before I left because I loved the results so much.  How good were the results, you asked?  4, count 'em 4 shades whiter and I left feeling like the girl from the Orbit commercials.  The whole procedure was a piece of cake and the ladies that helped were friendly.  I was in and out in a jiffy, leaving time to spend my hard earn birthday money on some new threads.   So, yes-the procedure uses the device that goes in your cheeks to open your mouth.  But if anyone has ever had braces, this shouldn't be a big deal.  I went through 4 years with monthly encounters with "the stretcher" as I liked to call it, with no skin off my nose.  Paste tray fit right in, the light was placed over my mouth, I put my headphones in and took a little cat nap.     Yes, my gums were also a little white on the bottom, it went away quickly and they told me that it could happen.               Need I say it again?  Beauty is pain-and this was well worth it.                               Two thumbs up for this fine establishment!

1.description: The vip tickets were definitely NOT worth it. We will certainly come back coz we love the Bears, but, we're NOT going to go with the vip tickets. Great location, but there was nothing special about Midway Bar, same teeny mugs for both regular and vip ticket holders, and you can count with one hand the number of booths that actually offered delicious bacon.

0.description: My friend and I went to this festival combining beer & bacon on October 10th - two of my favorite things!I absolutely loved that was at Soldier Field...I haven't been there in forever! It was all nicely laid out and of course had ample seating space which is GREATLY appreciated at beer fests. We were general admission which means we had 3 hours to soak in the goodness of the event. The good of the festival of course was the beer - 44 local (and a bit further out) breweries were in attendance. Each brewery offered 1-3 flavors with most having 2 flavors. I was slightly sad because almost every brewery had beers I had already had aka nothing rare or unusual. That being said some breweries had awesome employees there and others had reps who were completely disinterested & miserable. I'm always sad to see the unhappy people because it never bodes well for a brewery!Lines for beer were usually about 10 people deep but always moved fairly quickly. Lines for food were on another level! Each food line had about 50 people and many were stopped as places ran out of food very early. Most places didn't have food after the first hour and the ones that did....their lines grew....and grew....and grew! Not worth waiting in a Disneyland-esque line for a bit of baconwhatevertheyhad. Pass! So the food bit of the admission tix? Not worth it at all. My friend and I tried 3 food bites. We went to Chinatown after because we were starrrrrrrvvvvvvving.I loved the adorable mini solo cup ceramic taster, loved the Duff Beer Biscuit mix take-home gift, and we had fun in the photo booth despite the drunkard who refused to get out of our photos until he was escorted off set.Chicago has about a million beer festivals and I have to say that this was sadly on the weaker end of them. They just didn't deliver the food to justify their higher-than-other beer fest ticket prices. And too many beer spots ran out of brew too early. Fun for a time but probably won't

56.description: Hell no. I'll pay you to eat somewhere better.

29.description: Cheap. Fast. Friendly. No indoor seating.

42.description: Keep your eyes and ears open around this establishment. The neighborhood is not the best and there are suspicious people hanging around. I would recommend doing the drive thru just in case you need to use your vehicle as a weapon. Ok, ok, I'm being dramatic. Anyways, this is the third time I've had white castle. Its a tasty small burger. What more can I say? If you're hungry and want something fast and cheap, check this place out.

23.description: Coming from California and having loved Harold and Kumar, I was anticipating this a lot. These things are TINY! I can fit an entire one in my mouth no problem.Anyways, the slider meat looked really pink as if it wasn't really fully cooked. The sliders were also really moist for some reason, so they tasted a bit soggy in my opinion. I'll admit they tasted better than I expected, but the soggy texture of the slider in general was a bit off-putting!Also, the location and the place itself are a tad unsettling, but that's just the area that they're in.

47.description: I'm from Texas so the only time I heard about White Castle was from Harol and Kumar.  I was excited to move to the midwest where these chains reign aplenty.  I had 2 hamburgers, 2 cheese burgers and 2 jalapeno cheese burgers with fries.  All very good, will definitely get more.  Not frequently though I because I think you can hear yourself getting fatter as you eat.

8.description: Every time I visit Chicago, I ALWAYS visit White Castle.  Unfortunately, we do not have one here in Texas, but I sure wish that we did!!!  They have delicious sliders and burgers.  I have heard that their burgers are notorious for giving first-timers a stomach ache, but I didn't have that issue when I had eaten there for the first time.  Their double cheeseburgers are amazing, and I also love that they serve krinkle-cut fries!  You don't see that at alot of restuarants!  The employees are friendly and prompt with service.  If we had one here in Texas, this place would be poppin' with the after club crowd, the after school crowd, and the weed-smoking crowd.  White Castle: if you ever have plans to expand to other parts of the country, please put Dallas on your list!!!

31.description: OMG i have to laugh. because i knew what i was getting myself into at this white castle, but i have a strong dose of thanatos so i went for it anyway.dry, shriveled buns. grainy-textured fries. watered down beverages. what more do you need to know?

34.description: Hey it's White Castle, if you're expecting great food what were you thinking? You drive through and in a short while you'll get that hungry monkey off your back, cured that empty feeling is gone.Satisfied? Well tomorrow is another day, so pick better. Again, hello... it's White Castle!

16.description: I've eaten at the White Castle in Detroit and saw this White Castle because our GPS got us lost (believe it or not). This place is in the hood, beware of crackheads inside and outside the restaurant, and the service takes very long. The workers are nice to you, but they work very slow. Also, if you have to use the restroom, use it elsewhere. It seemed as if a drunk person was in the bathroom the whole time while we waited for 3 sliders (20 minutes).

13.description: Great service and friendly staff!!! They noticed we were waiting longer than usual and gave us a free drink and apologized.... Plus, our order was free since it was national slider day!

11.description: My favorite is the Bacon Cheese Slider. The juicy burger with melted cheese, caramelized onions, and smoked bacon atop a soft bun is just heavenly. White Castle is always a must-stop when I am in Chicago!

39.description: Sure, Harold and Kumar made this place look like Heaven but in real life, it was gross. First off this place is not in the best of areas in the Chi, so keep your windows closed (until you give your order) and your doors locked. The wait in the drive-thru took forever, and I was sweating bullets and praying someone doesn't try to carjack my rental and try to cut me in the process. When I finally got to the window to receive my order, the employee took his sweet time and was very unfriendly. All that to get disgusting hamburgers is not my idea of a good experience. Worst part is, you have to order multiple sliders! So, feeling guilty, I was forced to finish my 4 mini-burgers and fries. Oh, they're fries are really greasy. I'm talking "will-give-you-acne-if-you-rubbed-it-on your-face-greasy". But then again, what fries won't?I'll just stick to Mickey D's.

37.description: Om noms! Post-party om noms! I just love when you're placed in a walk-in situation and all sorts of people wander into the kingdom of the Castle! There were so many laughs as we waited to for our food, it was like being in a sitcom.On to the food. It was fab. I went small with a kids meal, 2 burgers, a small fry and drink, but wait, there was a BONUS: Fruit Snacks! Made me smile :) I wish they had White Castle in Cali. If someone wants to front the money, I'll manage to chain restaurant out here and we'll make a small fortune. :)

0.description: #19Yes, we all remember the Beastie Boys making White Castle famous.  And, yes, I remember my first job as a little 16 year old girl at the White Castle here in Chicago... I would hang out at Medusa's all night, maybe after a Right's of the Accused or a Thrill Kill Cult show--and we would meander down via the "L" as all underage drunks did (and most likely still do) and try to kill our upcoming hangovers in advance with a slider or two.  And here I am, after all these years, returning to grab a slider and reminisce.Those sliders... We ordered 12 original sliders, 8 double-bacon cheese sliders, 6 western bbq grilled chicken sliders (which they did not have when I worked here), 4 orders of french fries, hella drinks and grabbed a bunch of napkins and a table while we waited. The BBQ Chicken slider is not the best addition to this utopia of coolness we call White Castle--I would take it off the menu, but then again, I am not the owner of this sublime little chain.  The sliders are off the hook, so I hate that they ruin it with that BBQ thing.  But back to the sliders--BOMB.com!How do they get that delicious grilled onion flavor throughout the sliders?  Oh yeah, I knew the secret, but it has been a long time, I guess I crowded my brain with other things and lost that, but I wish I could remember.  I think I kinda recall coming in at like 5 in the AM on the weekends and getting the little diced onions and then crowding the grill with the little sliders with these little holes in them so they would soak up the juices.  And, I also remember that double knit polyester, ugly, zip up uniform and stupid hat, and did I mention the hair net?--but that has nothing to do with the delicious sliders and this review.*moves to back to the review and forgets her teenage memories*White Castle is most def an, "I've been drinking and need to eat fast," type of place.  You do not come here for the service, or for quality---but you get both. Every time I visit Chicago, I make sure I visit White Castle and bring whomever I come with so they too can partake of this underground favorite of my youth.   Stephani Smiles for White Castle ;)#sometimestheymakemytummyhurt

38.description: Dammit why is this location always sooooo slooooow. Sure the service is friendly and the burgers are piping hot and delicious but why do they have to torture me with the long wait?

51.description: Slider's?  checkMozzarella Sticks?  checkChicken Rings?  checkOpen 24 hours checkBulletproof glass?  NOPEonly 4 stars for you

27.description: .., nothing beats eating a Craver's Case in the rain @ 3am w/ Chicago natives. Our midwest trip wouldn't have been complete to me unless I had a White Castle burger. After a night of drinking @ Howl at the Moon, our group of friends set off for some late night munchies. Being in Chicago for the first time, they encouraged this decision haha. I ordered a Craver's case that had 30 burgers in it. Along w/ some fries & a drink. Our gf's sat & ate inside their car as they watched the guys stand outside in the rain laughing & chewing insanely as if we were kids. It was awesome haha. Good Times! Sadly I'm back in CA where White Castle can only be found in the freezer section of a grocery store. I miss you White Castle, I really do!

32.description: went through the drive through and they "forgot" to put my jalepeno burger in the bag.....WTF.  didnt realize til i was at home.  i also paid with my credit card and so i guess ill find out later if they start stealing my money from my card.also the buns were kinda soggy already like 5 minutes later when i got home.

54.description: Definitelty not somplace you walk to. Although two blocks west are some nice buildings. BUT WHO CARES! CASE RACE Anyone!?!??!

48.description: I want my last bite of food on Earth to be a White Castle slider....(The bulletproof glass at this place freaks me out, though.)

44.description: You're gonna want to stay out of this joint. Let me preface this by saying that I LOVE White Castle. Was born and raised on White Castle. Will die requesting a slider with cheese and extra pickles and ketchup. That said, you're gonna want to stay out of this joint. Forget that it's ghetto fabulous with servers with monstrously bad attitudes and slow, bad service. Forget the rats running rampant in the parking lot (which should be the first tip-off that you don't really want to eat here...)I will never patronize this particular White Castle again because I was poisoned here twice. Seriously. Clutching the porcelain, thought I was going to die poisoned. Sliders might give you indigestion and/or gas, particularly when eaten in the wee hours of the morning after copious alcohol consumption. But they're not supposed to give you food poisoning.I'd rather drive all the way to the "mothership" White Castle on 79th and Stony Island than ever risk my life and central nervous system eating at this joint again. No matter how much you're craving it at 4 a.m., just don't do it. Not at this location.

24.description: Being from and living in California my whole life I have been deprived of the illusive White Castle Burger. Recently I have had a taste of the frozen ones you can find in a grocery store. Not gonna cut it! I happened to be visiting Chicago and remembered they had White Castle in the area so I sought one out. As for fast food... it was awesome. Oddly shapped chicken nuggets and tiny burgers is exactly what I wanted and that's exactly what I got. My craving has been curbed.

7.description: I wanted to try it freshly made.  I was highly satisfied and W.C. didn't disappoint my expectations since we have them at home however nuked instead of fresh. Now it's not Shake Shack, the Habit, Five Guys, or Epic, but I was very satisfied. I tried six different burgers. I had the original, the original with cheese, a spicy (think a pepper jack cheese), a western (like CJ's bbq sauce with onion ring), a fish sandwich, a chicken ring (onion ring shaped fried chicken), fries (wrinkle cut), loaded fries (fries with cheese) and onion rings. The flavor formulas seemed like a copy cat from McD's filet'o fish or CJ's western bacon.  But the originals w/and w/o cheese were my favorite. The spicy was a nice surprise for the taste buds.  The kids had double burgers which I should have done because although they're small burgers, the bread added up.  The kids went back for more.  I simply wanted tastings of everything.  I didn't get the mushroom burger tho.  One of the shakes was a disappointment. I think it was the peach.  We tossed it.  The chocolate and strawberry-banana were delish.  I'd go back for more! I had to go back to the window after not receiving two burgers.  The lead said it was one burger and made me pay for the other. ( My kids started eating so I couldn't take the whole order back to the window. )Then I realized we were missing one of the fries as well! Two go backs.   :-P

49.description: By far one of the most disappointing meals I've ever had.  My friends and I decided to walk here from Millennium Park which was a bad idea but we figured it would be a nice walk until we noticed the neighborhood got worse the closer we got to White Castle.  We got excited as soon as we saw White Castle but that was followed with immediate disappointment when we realized there were no seats.  We walked in shaking our heads not believing we just walked 2 or 3 miles in the cold and there was no place to sit down.  So we figured the food will make us feel better.  Didn't happen.  I ordered five jalapeno cheeseburgers and a chicken breast sandwich with fries.  I don't know what they use for meat but it had no taste, it's like i ate a spicy cheese mushy slider.  chicken sandwich was ok, and the fries were at least a plus but only cuz the burgers weren't so good.  We ate our food using the trash can as a table.  My friends threw away half of the food they ordered.  The journey there was the best part, but the food was just a huge disappointment.  But I can understand how it can be good to eat when you're drunk.  As long as I'm sober I'll pass on White Castle.

40.description: I now see why people eat here while drunken...Unfortunately, I was not drunk. Not even close...and ya know, as much as I'd like to cash in on the hype of mini-burgers-in-a-box, I am not sold. I felt a tad "unright" for the rest of the evening...not sick, but not well. I know, vague...hence the 3-stars...1 star: friendly, albeit SLOW. 2 star: fries were hot. 3 star: Um, friendly?I'll come back some other time after 8 or 9 martinis and give it another whirl ;)

53.description: I finally know what they're talking about when people wax poetic about "Slyders".  I also ate these weird re-constituted chicken O's shaken with ranch powder that were wonderful.  Is it bad that I really really liked them?

30.description: I am a native Chicagoan and love me some White Castles. I don't drink, so have never had them while intoxicated. It's a true love of the tiny burger with the big taste.I used to get them in Cali frozen which were ok -- and I'd add pickles! I was grateful to get them because there really wasn't anything even close to like them. I'd had bar sliders at other restaurants and they always had too much bun, often not soft enough. And as most things in Cali are, way too much money for the privilege of being disappointed.I moved back to my beloved hometown in October. I live in the Gold Coast and there are NO White Castles! OMG! i did not know this. I just assumed that there would be at least ONE nearby.I had occasion to find myself with friends on the south side, so always took advantage of getting some while i was there. I'd get a sack to take home for later and they would either get eaten and then not replenished before I got back, or I'd leave them in my friend's freezer. So basically, I have STILL been eating the frozen version! i hate to admit it, but I was. I love to have them in the freezer for a quick snack. Sometimes I even dress them up like a real burger with lettuce, tomato, mustard and mayo. Don't laugh; they're good!  I always get the cheeseburgers.I've been aiming to get down to this location, the closest to the north side where I live. I hear there's one on North Ave., but I think it's further away. I may check it out in any case.Today I finally decided to make the trek down there. As it was around 20 degrees out -- I knew it wasn't gonna be that easy. I took the Red Line over to Chinatown and walked a few blocks in the wrong direction (thanks, Google Maps) -- then walked the other way 'till I found it. I've heard this neighborhood isn't the greatest. I think because it is cold out, the streets were pretty deserted. But there were some random people walking around, some of which looked a little sketchy. They were kinda checking me out, at which time I pretend to be on my cell phone just in case anyone decides to try anything. This was several blocks away on South Wabash. There were some other folks kinda hangin' out in the street which was a little odd, but I just mind my own business and get where I gotta go. I'd imagine when the weather gets nicer, there will be more street action. I don't plan on being in the vicinity at night unless I happen to be in a car (which is unlikely, given that I gave up the rolling tin can when I moved here).It's a tiny store -- no where to sit. The staff was friendly. I ordered a sack of 10 cheeseburgers, 5 of those marvelous pulled pork numbers they just came out with and got a free sweet potato fries order. They're really good, as well. I waited quite a while, during which time a few other people showed up and because the place is so small, everyone kind of lines up along the wall. I was glad to wait, because that means the burgers are fresh. I shoved 'em in my backpack, grabbing one, hot, steamy little burger to have for lunch before heading off to Target on the #29. I ate it by the large trash can because it was too cold to be eating outside, no where to do it anyway and I was starving, dammit! Then at the bus stop just up the block and around the corner, I scarfed down another one while waiting for the bus. A woman who appeared to be on crack was dancing on the corner, a travel mug at her feet, hollerin' at friends as they walked by (they talked back and sounded like they knew her). God only knows why she was hangin' on the corner in this cold. Doesn't seem probable that she was a hooker, but one never knows. There was some random guy hangin' out with her. In true form, the bus came in around 5 minutes. Great timing!God, I LOVE THIS TOWN!

46.description: It was a yes in Indiana... and it's still a yes now. I LOVE White Castle... I can rub these burgers all over my face and body and shove it all inside of my mouth. They are that good being such simple little things. Warm and soft.. so dreamy. Their fries aren't worth a damn though.... their onion rings are a better choice if you must have a side. Trust me, I'm a connoisseur of deep fried food. Don't even try and pretend you are above eating White Castle. This is good fast food and if you've got a problem with me reviewing a fast food joint then we can take it to the streets. My friend bought me the crave case and even after a quick microwaving, it still tastes good. Mmm... the love affair continues.

1.description: My high school stoner dreams finally came true. I used to dream of driving cross county to get me some White Castle. Yes, you can get the packaged ones in the frozen isle at your local grocery store, but nothing beats a fresh little slider. Granted frozen and fresh don't taste that much different.Stopped in when we were in Chicago and ordered 4 original sliders, 2 cheese sliders, 2 western bbq grilled chicken sliders, 1 small order of fries and onion rings for $13.47. Yes... $13.47! Split between two people and I still couldn't finish it. Western BBQ chicken was the only item I wasn't a fan off. Too dry and the bbq didn't do it any favors. The original sliders were good but the addition of cheese makes it so much better. Juice, compact, and the patties don't taste like cardboard (I'm talking about you Carl's/Burger King), what more can you ask for?Or course White Castle doesn't hold a candle to In n Out or Shake Shack but with prices this cheap, who the hell cares. You can get 4 original sliders for only $2.92. Grilled onion flavor throughout, it's a lot better than most fast food hamburgers.  Finally, it all comes full circle and I understand why Harold and Kumar went from hell and back for these sliders.

55.description: I used to live a few blocks away from this location and I wouldn't feel safe approaching this from State.  However, coming down Michigan or Indiana should be safe enough to satisfy your crave.Make sure you have your wits about you to a certain extent though.

9.description: I love the movie Harold and Kumar go to White Castle. I mean, riding a cheetah??? How awesome is that? After seeing the great lengths these two men traveled and the many hardships they faced, it has to be quality right???Then again they were as high as a kite. My buddy told me "It's sacrilegious to have White Castle before 1am." I could totally see why. You have to be under the influence of something to think the world of this place. Don't get me wrong, the service was very good here despite the place being the size of my living room. The food though...was...bad. I tried a variety of difference sliders and each more disappoint than the other. Bleh, just bleh.

26.description: Upon exiting the plane at Midway, I was stoked to stop by White Castle. Finally! I was in a city where it had existed. Little did I know, it was going to be the worst meal I had ever had! I was starving and still, White Castle was just disgusting. When I opened the door to the restaurant, I found myself in a little hallway that led to a plexi glass window. It wasn't even a dine in restaurant. Thank goodness it wasn't raining. We ended up sitting outside on their tables. I had the regular slider, a cheese slider, and their new mushroom slider. Gross, gross, and gross. I blame Harold and Kumar for my longing for White Castle. Trust me...it's not what you think it is. The meat was flavorless and since the entire slider is steamed, it's soggy once you open the box! Fries? Tasted like frozen fries you can buy at Costco.  Overall, my experience at White Castle was offensive.

25.description: Four of us were staying up the street from this White Castle. We were walking by and we said to ourselves, we gotta try what all the rave is about these burgers. We ordered the sliders and sat down to eat them. We were pretty hungry at this time of day but we weren't really impressed with the quality of the burgers. They were very greasy and the meat tasted as if we were eating spam (that's because the patty's are cooked ontop of a bed of onion). I come from California where we have In-N-Out and this place does not come close. It's worth the experience though, that's for sure.

12.description: What can I possibly contribute to the legend of White Castle that hasn't already been posited so eloquently by John Cho, Kal Penn and Neil Patrick Harris?But after having WC for the first time earlier in the week, I can say that I now see what they mean about gratifying a craving where the unique taste of WC can only satisfy. A standard slider is very easy to eat, travels well, and is kind of elegant in its simplicity, if you think about it. It just contains onions, seasoning, possibly cheese and a thin slice of ground beef. The crinkle fries aren't very impressive, so if you had to watch your carb count, those can easily go in lieu for another slider.Much like the challenges that Harold and Kumar faced in order to get to White Castle, I, and a friend, faced a few challenges to get to this White Castle from our hotel along the Mag Mile. First off, there was rain. That usually is enough to deter most from coming here, but since the closest White Castle to my home state of California is here in Chicago, and this was my only free time to go and get it, I had little choice but to brave the wind and rain if I wanted to finally see what the hype is about.Our bus (I believe it was #29) going southbound was late, and when it finally came around on Rush Street, it just drove past us on the bus stop, presumably to make up for lost time. Naturally, everyone waiting at the stop was pissed. The next bus would come another 15 minutes later, making us run behind schedule. I also should have done a bit more research earlier to find out that this particular White Castle in the Near Southside doesn't have a formal dining room. We only chose it because it was closer to our hotel than the one on the north end by a few miles. Had we known there was a lack of seating, we probably would have trekked the longer distance to have a better dining experience. Though it's open 24 hours, this WC only has outside tables and a walk-up window/drive-thru.  Since we didn't have a car to eat in, we had to eat our sliders under an awning along the side of the restaurant, since, of course, we took public transit to get here and the tables were wet from the rain.But, in eating my first slider outside in the drizzle, one can see the steam more clearly and thus the hot burger probably felt more satisfying going down than it would normally have been. Though the beef isn't much, I really think that it was all in the seasoning. WC probably puts sprinkles of crack in their salt and pepper seasoning because those things can be eaten anywhere from one to three bites easily. The soft slider buns also aren't really much of a hindrance for those looking to scarf down a few of these...they collapse on themselves when you breathe on them, basically.I liked the sliders' packaging, since it makes efficient use of a bag (see my photo posted on this article to see the box the sliders come in). They can "lock up" two boxes end-to-end like two ends of a jigsaw puzzle and stack them in a paper bag for to-go orders. The boxes also serve to continually keep the steamy contents, well, steamy.On the way back to the hotel we discussed why we didn't bother splitting one of the larger crave box combos (containing something like 30 sliders), and instead went for individual combos (I went with the #1 with cheese). I suppose, since it was my first time, I didn't want to be too pot-committed in the off-chance that I wouldn't like it. Lesson learned.

21.description: Whooohooo.....White Castle adventure!!!  :P  Ate here on 6/2/2011. Uhhh, was fist time at White Castle and very disappointed.  Yukkk!  Thin beef-like patties...not sure what meat it is.  Flavor is interesting but won't be back.  No inside seating, just outside.

17.description: Is it, or would it be asking too much to serve the Burgers Hot! I peeve food served warm.

10.description: I really don't enjoy slagging this Midwest institution, but after finally having visited a White Castle franchise for the first time in my life, I have to candidly say that I came away disgusted.I recall seeing one on a school trip to Ohio many years ago and being outvoted by my skittish Pittsburgh classmates. Wendy's won out. After catching a triumphant micro-festival at the amazing Reggie's Rock Club, my mates and I stopped into this takeout-only establishment manned by harried employees who I'm sure are grossly underpaid for amount of nonsense they must tolerate during a typical overnight shift.The zig-zag Ore-Ida-like fries tasted like crispy Nerf sticks. The chocolate covered cheesecake popsicle whatsit was akin to eating fudgy, frozen wheatpaste with a hint of sugar. The haplessly diminutive burger itself was as squishy as a car wash sponge. Overcome by steam and grease, the wretched foodstuff was dispatched in but two mercifully brief bites. Anything in the way of onions, meat product, or as "Weird" Al Yankovic once put it, ketchup and mustard "stains" were nearly invisible. A non-entity designed to quell drunken hunger and stave off hangovers, all it did to this teetotaler was make him somewhat dyspeptic. It was 2 AM, and we had fallen from the grace that is the magnificent and metallic Kuma's...to this...youtube.com/watch?v=oqNy…What a weekend in Chi-Town.P.S. More reviews (positive ones, I promise you, my appreciated and faithful readers) documenting my fun-filled weekend in The City of Wind are forthcoming. If only I'd had more time and cash.

5.description: Typical White Castle, nothing very distinctive about this particular site. They provided service in a timely manner, order was correct and they served the typical options. The place is a little run down but it may come with the way the surrounding neighborhood is setup. Convenient if you are looking for something fast.

3.description: White Castle is definitely a love it or hate it sort of thing. I've been eating their delicious little sliders since childhood, so I'm in the love it camp, but I admit it's an acquired taste. (The burgers are also notorious for giving people stomach aches, so first timers beware.) But if you're in the love it camp like me this isn't a bad location to "satisfy your crave." Service was fast, the fries were hot, and my double cheeseburgers were cooked to perfection. What more could you ask for from a fast food joint? I actually normally hate White Castle fries, but these were actually pretty decent for a change. I'll definitely be back through the drive thru next time the White Castle bug hits. FYI - there's no indoor seating. But why you'd ever want to sit down and eat inside of a fast food restaurant is beyond me.

35.description: I am totally bias because White Castle was made famous by Harold and Kumar and there are none here on the West Coast but ... I LOVED IT. It was the most awesome meal I can remember of this caliber, even more so than McDonalds, Burger King, Carls Jr ... you name it. I would come here every day and be a fatty if I could.I ordered the regular white castle burgers, the bacon, and the peppercorn jack one. I liked the peppercorn jack one the most although the regular is also good. This is not at all like the grocery store ones you can buy at Safeway. There is a difference between fresh and non-fresh and this is it!This place is open all night so it's great for after party noms as Leesha M. mentioned and the drive through is quick. This place is also close to Chinatown where you can partake upon additional noms if 4 white castle burgers does not satisfy the craving.

19.description: I love White Castle almost as much as Krystal burgers.Yummy.

28.description: I'm writing this review based upon my experience five years ago!
