That's gotta be a record breaker on yelp.Let me tell you about my adventure to White Castle; it played out as if it could have been a scene in Harold and Kumar.I was on a 30 state road trip around the country, and that night we were staying at the Hyatt at McCormick; during my wait in the lobby for my friends to arrive, I witness a fine young lady being carried off from a wedding party by two fine young lads as she began to puke all over the nice lobby floor, priceless.As we went on our little walk, I encountered a beautiful little rat that jumped out at me from behind a dumpster; I bid him adieu as he scurried along on his merry way. As we approached our destination, we were approached by a troll, although instead of three riddles he asked us if we had a dollar. Not sure what possessed him to do so, but my friend cracked a smile, and kind of chuckled a bit. Of course it had to do with this land trolls delivery of his all so important question. He burst into a beautifully written prose containing such adjectives as F*, M F'er, foreign M'fer and stupid white M'fer. My group consisted of three Mexicans, but one of us was darker than the rest, upon which the troll decided to label us foreign and white (most white people think I'm white anyway.)Upon arrival to this White Castle, we encountered a young crackhead that was ordering ice water. She explained that she mixed the ice water with corn starch and proceeded to eat it. Not sure what kind of concoction this produces, but I was definitely intrigued.Afterward, a real life pimp with a cane and a white suit walked in the door. We struck up some conversation and he proceeded to tell us about how great and how delicious White Castle was. I was surely convinced after such an adventure that we were about to consume the best food god has blessed the world with. Boy was I wrong, the burgers are flavorless, and instantly gave me heart burn. I'm not sure if you could describe the meat as meat. I'm sure Taco Bell's recent lawsuit should actually be redirected towards White Castle as I was convinced the patty was not of a substance from this planet. In the end, I enjoyed my dinner and a show, but was sadly disappointed in what White Castle had to offer.

45.description: Bring White Castle's To San Francisco!I grew up in the Chicago area and I miss White Castle's.The frozen burgers sold in the grocery store is not the same and is a rip off. White Caste's is the greatest fast food chain ever!I love their burgers!

33.description: Great chicken sandwiches, but the burgers were mushy and lacking any meat flavor, which left me wondering what the percentage of beef they contain!

43.description: I've always wanted to try these burgers, they started in Chicago actually. The building design was designed after the old Chicago Waterworks building. I ordered like 20 cheese burgers, and knocked out like 12. I'm a fatty hoe. It was good but not the greatest burgers in the world. but still good. This location isn't in a nice area, i was there at like 11pm, but I'm mad niggerish. I stay on the black/brown side of town. =)

2.description: THE HOLY GRAIL OF DRUNK FOOD. Yes, it is best eaten drunk and fresh because being half sober, I could tell I wouldn't normally like it. Had the jalapeno cheese slider and a savory slider. My friend said the original slider had too much pickle.

18.description: White castle is not fine dining but I feel that in the years between my last visit and today my memory of some semblance of quality grossly over enhanced the product. I swear that the meat on the bun may be 100% beef but the tiny bit is almost transparent as it is so thin as an experiment in took out the beef patty on one of the sliders and due to the grease on the bun there was no taste difference. Be ready to be sick if you are going to brave this establishment.

41.description: I've only been in here once and never knew it was so small. Order.Wait.Get food.Leave.We usually go through drive thru if we don't want to drive all the way to the Ashland one. It can get entertaining here. Once we were waiting for food and people were walking up to the drive thru. Some guy behind us was getting impatient so he got out of his car and went up to the window. He was trying to ask the ladies what the hold up and was like  "Was that your sexy voice?" Then he goes on about how he got a naked lady waiting at home. This is what you go through for what you "crave."

52.description: if it's too long, go to the bottom of the page to get to the main point. after typing all that up, i felt bad deleting it, so im keeping the essay.our journey to this location sucked a lot of ass. our intention wasn't for it to become a journey, it just happened. we came out of the field museum starving and looking forward to try some white castle since i've only tried the frozen kinds in grocery stores, and plus, i wanted to try it and rub it in my new yorker friend's face that it sucked and how in n out is soo much better. anyway, at the same time we were coming out, there was a baseball game coming out as well. we didn't know where we were going but we knew that we just had to get to the main street to find a cab so we just started following the mob of red and yellow people. after the long, hot, and tiring walk, we finally made it to the street but couldnt find a cab. the cabs either ignored us or had some red or yellow person in it. after trying to walk away from red/yellow people so we can find a cab, we finally found a guy who picked us up, but we were then stuck in traffic because of some accident. hot and tired, we were just so miserable to where we didn't care about white castle anymore.the cab driver dropped us off and infront of us, we see a dinky little itty bitty white castle drive thru in the ghetto part of chicago. at this point, we were just irritated and sat down infront of the place and did the you-know-what to "relax" our minds. ;) after a short break, we were upbeat again and went inside to order. supposedly, you're supposed to order like multiple sliders and a whole mess of other things or something? i dunno, but the four of us shared 10 sliders, two orders of fries, and two drinks. sad, i know, but we were gonna go to bubba gump wit the family later on at the navy pier n didn't want the 'adults' to get mad at us. anyway again, there wasn't a dining area inside, so we sat outside around the corner of the place on the ground where drive thru people can see us as they drive by. i guess it was kind of funny in a way. imagine four asian girls in semi bright clothes just munching on white castles in the ghetto part of town. oh yeh, and a random black guy came up to us and talked to us for a bit and started to walk away, but came back to tell us that he had a hole in his throat. i learned not to ever smoke cigarettes.main point:it was mediocre. kind of dry and kind of boring, but hey, i'm a condiments gal. it was a bit tasty for the first two bites since i was starving and was not sober at the time. i would only come back if i were drunk and had the munchies. but for now, ima stick to in n out. YA HUURD!?ps. most people (that i've encountered) in chicago are rude. made me sad. :(

50.description: So my love affair with White Castle is no secret.  I'm not ashamed of my tiny four bite lover.  I don't visit her during off hours as not to be seen.  I visit her whenever I crave her.  I refuse to hide her boxes at the bottom of the garbage so that I am not found out.  I proudly admit that I have seen her.  Like some, I don't need to be intoxicated to appreciate her beauty.  I know she is beautiful inside and out.  From her light fluffy bun to her steam grilled patty, I see her as a work of art.For the past 29 years I have visited her on a regular basis. Not much has changed since the day I first met her.  She may have been a few pennies cheaper back in the day, but at 47 cents she remains a bargain.  Each time I sink my teeth into her I remember what love is.   It's not just the bun, or the steam grilled patty, or the pair of pickles, or those grilled onions that had me at hello.  It's the way each of her characteristics work together as a team to make her White Castle.  It's true that I like her just the way she is. In my 29 year relationship with her, I have never asked her to cover herself in cheese.  I have never compromised her integrity by asking her to jalapeno it up. I am a traditionalist and prefer her without the makeup.  She is beautiful no matter what they say. Words can't bring her down.  She is beautiful in every single way.  Yes, words can't bring her down. So don't you bring her down today.10 white castles----------------------------$4.70

4.description: Fast service at the window if you order their original burgers. No seating inside so either outside or in the car. In my first visit, the burgers were steaming hot. They were only warm on my next visit which was in the morning. Overall, basic burger that is hyped due to our friends Harold and Kumar. I can say I crossed off my bucket list but would not risk a long bus ride or late evening walk just to get some.

6.description: I've always wanted to try after watching Harold and Kumar Go to White Castle and the opportunity finally came when visiting Chicago for Taste of Chicago. I've tried the frozen sliders before but trying it fresh at their fast food restaurant always caught my curiosity. When I bit into it, I realized the only different between the frozen ones and the fresh ones was that the fresh ones had pickles in them. I still really liked their sliders. Now I find out that they have a location in Las Vegas, NV so no need to trek out to Chicago for these :p

22.description: Harold and Kumar made the long ass trek for a reason, and so did we! No, I'm not talking about going all the way to Chi-town. I'm talking about the journey from the Field Museum to the boonies. We took a cab, walked (to save money because the cab driver gave us whack ass directions to the CTA) and, eventually were able to bus it to eat these little bites of deliciousness. Aside from the yummy little burgers, the onion ring sauce was the huge stand out! It's 1000 island-colored crack! No wonder this place is all up in the boonies! Only outside seating and drive thru.

15.description: Upon exiting the plane at Midway, I was stoked to stop by White Castle. Finally! I was in a city where it had existed. Little did I know, it was going to be the worst meal I had ever had! I was starving and still, White Castle was just disgusting. When I opened the door to the restaurant, I found myself in a little hallway that led to a plexi glass window. It wasn't even a dine in restaurant. Thank goodness it wasn't raining. We ended up sitting outside on their tables. I had the regular slider, a cheese slider, and their new mushroom slider. Gross, gross, and gross. I blame Harold and Kumar for my longing for White Castle. Trust me...it's not what you think it is. The meat was flavorless and since the entire slider is steamed, it's soggy once you open the box! Fries? Tasted like frozen fries you can buy at Costco.  Overall, my experience at White Castle was offensive.

57.description: This is the perfect place for people to dine... that is if you like having wino's at the door and crackheads at your car window hassling your for change.  With that said, I'd still come here for a quick fix if I'm drunk off my ass.  You gotta feed the crave baby!

20.description: I love White Castle almost as much as Krystal burgers.Yummy.

36.description: This was the first time I've had White Castle since I was like 5, so I decided to try a kids meal with two burgers (if you can call them that).The food was disgusting.  Are those burgers actually beef?  Do they even claim they are?  Do they claim they are burgers?  Those are nasty, and I was drunk.  I can't imagine why anyone would eat them.The fries were bland.  What's up with that?  I could make better fries baking frozen ones at home!I got fruit snacks in my kids meal, and that was by far the best part!I tried a couple of onion rings, and those were pretty good.  The mozzella sticks were okay.  If I ever had to eat here again I would probably get the onion rings and maybe try to chicken rings.  I sure as hell will never eat one of those "burgers" again.I did give them 2 stars though, because this place was convenient from the club.  And the drive through service was fine.  (By fine I mean they gave us everything we ordered, which is my standard for drive through places.  That may be a low standard, I don't know, I rarely get fast food, and so I really don't go to drive troughs.)

14.description: A-OK because it's White Castle. A solid three stars when the need arises.Plus one star because it's just 2 long blocks from McCormick Center! An easy walk for conventioneers who crave an authentic Midwestern grease pillow.But, minus one star because there's no indoor seating.

12.description: Terrible experience! Worst salon experience I have ever had!! I'm not sure if the good stars are from regulars or friends of the salon, but I wish I could give 0 stars. I decided to try this salon based off of Yelp reviews. The first sign of DANGER should've been when I rang doorbell and someone just buzzed me in without even asking who I was or anything...should be a little more careful. I checked in with receptionist and sat to side. A nice lady walked in to pick up her daughter and made the comment "still not done? It's been since 11am and now almost 430!" (2nd DANGER sign). I sat there for another 20 mins and a lady walks over and touches my hair and says to another hairdresser that color would be fine. She says she's the owner but I'll be in good hands with the other lady. Ok?!? I sat for another 20 mins while I watched the hairdresser go back to the back to eat something then come get me. I told her I wanted to change my blonde curly coils to warm chocolate brown #4. I showed several colors and she said ok that would be easy. So she placed the color on the roots first and just let me sit while she took ANOTHER customer which was a friend of hers that just walked in. DANGER! She then came back over in looked thru my hair and placed color on ends. I asked if everything was ok and if the color should stay that long. She said it was fine. Well she finished her friend then went to wash my hair. I told her my hair curls up quickly so can't leave me just sitting at bowl. What did she do? Left me with my head in the bowl while she and several other workers sat around smacking on chicken! She then placed me under dryer and when I came out, my hair was nowhere near chocolate brown...well a line of my roots were! I looked like a raccoon with 3-4 colors striped thru my hair!!! Then she had the nerve to take a brush and started brushing my curls into a fluffy mess. I told her at the beginning I wear my hair curly and don't flat iron. So when I said it again, she put water on my hair and some mousse, tried to fluff up my hair and said I could wear it like that! My curls were gone, and she really thought I was going to walk out with a frizzy puffball Afro like Don King. She said "it's cute." What?!? I grabbed a ponytail holder and put my wet striped hair in ponytail holder and left. What a moron! I had to come back home to ATL to have someone fix my brown, gray and GREEN hair! WARNING...DO NOT ENTER THIS SALON!!!

7.description: A good hair care professional is hard to find...Coming from Texas, not have relaxed my hair in 14 weeks, I wanted to going into someone's care that I trusted with my hair. Someone who had the training and common sense with caring with the hair I am growing. I felt I received this at Red Karma after reading reviews on other sites. I asked for Ms. Lisa, who is the owner of two shops of Red Karma in Chicago. I was happy  and impressed that she as owner was willing to take a new client. I received a call about 3 days prior to my appointment to confirm, which I did. I arrived about 15-20 mins late due to work, but Ms. Lisa was friendly and nice about it. I really did like that she did not give me a hard time.The south loop space was great, warm, inviting, and modern. There were products for sale, but no one push them hard, which was nice . I liked that everyone getting their hair done had great looking hair. The lady that was in the chair with Ms. Lisa before me was impressive...she told me my hair would look like hers after Ms. Lisa was though...I got excited. I got a relaxer, trim, wash and iron out. I should have asked for the blow out, but it was still turned out really nice. I loved the way my hair felt and the relaxer brand, tho I never heard of it, was good. Ms. Lisa gave me great feedback about how I had been taking care of my hair, improvements, and recommendations. As a KISS.biz member, I am happy to say that Ms. Lisa really does do healthy hair care. No small combs, my hair was washed in cold water, essential oils used, short relaxer processing time, and most of the tips she gave me I remember seeing on KISS.biz. Its great that I did not have to explain my HHJ to her and that she was supportive of my own hair maintenance. Prices were ok; not bad tho. I only go to the hair shop once every 3 months, so $70 is ok for me. But Ms. Lisa did give me a free first time client trim. I was expecting the price to be in the $80's without the tip. Lastly, kids are welcomed, big screen tv, free snacks and drinks...cool!Overall, I enjoyed my experience here and will be back in Oct to make this my hair professional care home. I want to support black business and I am happy I get to do this with going to Red Karma.

20.description: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this Bronzeville gem.  I have pretty thick curly locks and I get it straightened maybe twice a year.  I'm used to live in Atlanta and for those of you familiar with N'Seya (which I adored), then Red Karma is the next best thing.  Unlike Yehia that burns out your "unprocessed" hair, the folks at Red Karma take their time.  Lisa is my stylist and is also the owner.  She not only did a beautiful job on my tresses but she did it with love but within a reasonable time...maybe 2 hours flat!  If you're looking for a stylist to take CARE of your hair and not just DO your hair, then Red Karma is the place.  The only drawback is that its a pretty small place so I highly recommend making an appointment well in advance, they usually schedule about 2-3 weeks out.  Enjoy!

19.description: I'm not sure who is reviewing this salon or maybe I just had the unfortunate experience of having the most unprofessional experience that I have ever had at a salon.  I booked my appointment for a Saturday for a full weave and take down.  I told the lady on the phone that I needed to be out by 5pm.  She said no problem, I could definitely be done if I came in at 1pm.  I arrive at 1pm and it took the assistant over 2 hours to take my weave down.  I've worn weaves for many years and never has it taken this long.  Then, she was so rough on combing my natural hair out that it was upsetting.  My stylist comes in and doesn't give a consultation or asks how I wear my hair or anything.  For $275, you should see what the client likes.  I said I wear a full hair weave, no hair out.  She told me, she doesn't know how to do that and tried to convince me to leave some hair out.  I said, no and I wanted a net.  Once again she said she doesn't usually use nets so she asked a coworker to help her.  Well, she starts weaving my hair without a net!  Her coworker put a partial net on top and had to do the top closure.  The top closure was great but the rest of my hair is awful!  It's extremely thin and the wefts and braids are the bulkiest that I have ever had!  I'm in the process of making an appointment elsewhere to fix this mess!  Plus, I'm not sure what hair shampoo they used on my extensions but my hair gets very tangled.  NEVER have I had this issue with this brand of hair.  For $600 for hair extensions, I shouldn't! To top this disaster off, the other stylist brought a dog into the salon that promptly peed and took a dump on the salon floor in front of me! This salon needs a Tabitha Take Over and I am so angry that I have to pay someone else to redo this mess that this original stylist did.  This isn't even remotely a first class establishment.  Really? No consultation, a dog relieving itself on the salon floor and poor quality braiding and weaving?

1.description: This is the worst experience I've ever had!!! Do not go to this salon if your stylist is Kalyn Brunt.I waited and hour and seventeen mins and then she stole from me by charging my account AFTER I left because she was way behind. She had an 830 appointment waiting for her and she didn't get in her shop until 1030 which put everyone else behind. (No respect for her client's time)Finally I told her assistant I was leaving and the stylist came up front and said I was "about to be next" after waiting 10 more mins I realized I wasn't "about" to do anything but wait more so I left and halfway down the block I get a notification stating I had been charged.I walked back in the shop and told her young tail that she charged me and her responses "ummm ok" and I said "yeah but you didn't do a service, you were late getting in and late getting to everyone. I sat up there for over an hour and you charged me I need a refund" she said "ok" I said "like now" she says "it will get to you 3-5 business days". I said whatever button you pushed to authorize my card push it now so that I knw you refunded me and she responds "I don't steal" it took everything in me not to say "B!tch you just did!" So angry I'm shaking! Nevertheless, I'll be doing my own hair.I don't recommend Red karma on Michigan Ave , Stylist Kalyn Brunt. Her wrk is good but her work ethic is crap!

2.description: A beautiful salon and a beautiful experience every time I visit my stylist I am pleased

9.description: My sister went to Red Karma Salon, ever since I booked my appointment 3 years ago, I have been going ever since. The place is really nice, relaxing, and welcoming. The ladies there know what there doing and healthy hair comes high on their priorities. The do really nice modern, sophisticated hairstyle and you will leave looking fabulous every time. My hairdresser was Aisha but she recently opened up her own salon on the north side which is way out of my way so hopefully Lisa will be taking new clients, I've seen her work and she does a fabulous job, so I will keep my fingers crossed.They also provide water, coffee, hot choclate and tea which is really nice.Check Red Karma out you won't be disappointed.

6.description: Been to Red Karma and  Brandon hairstylist twice since my first post and he has skills seriously the bangs he cut for me.... I think I can do back up for Kelly Rolland with these bangs...in other-words you can't tell me ish...my hair is bangin (that means looks great!) and the body is poppin (that means its full of body and shine).As long as I am in the city he will be my stylist when I want the straight Love and Hip Hop look... with no hair or eye weave not trying to be that turned up.

18.description: Wonderful salon! Lisa (fabulous owner and hair stylist) is awesome! I've been going to her for at least 5 years on a weekly basis and I couldn't be more pleased with my experience. Best salon in Chicago. If you are looking for a hair stylist who is highly skilled, thorough, professional and kind, look no further. Red Karma is for you!!

10.description: I decided to go natural a year ago and wanted a stylist that specialize in natural hair. So I did a search and Red Karma came up. So I decided to give them a try. At first Aisha was my stylist but then when I went natural Lou became my stylist. She is so awesome. I love her. She is sweet and natural herself and my hair is growing like heck. I have officially been natural for a year and some months and my hair is to my neck/shoulders now from a TWA. She is a God send and I continue to drive all the way to chicago from the northwest suburbs (schaumburg/elk grove village, IL). It's worth the 1-1/2 hour drive. I usually go at least once a month for a deep condition and style.

13.description: I used to split my time between this salon and another salon in the city.  When I decided to grow out my perm, I decided to start going full time to the owner Lisa.  She does a great job with growing out your natural hair and keeping it healthy. The prices are great and the products used are good for natural hair.  Red Karma recently moved to 22nd & Michigan and the new salon has a separate area for the nail technician, clothing boutique and the owner has her own private suite for those that don't want the entire salon staring when you need to have some "special work" done on your hair. Great salon, kind staff and great price.

16.description: I was a sew in virgin when I went to Lisa.  I didn't know what I wanted I just knew what I didn't want to look like.  Lisa assured me it would look wonderful and I sat in her seat and prayed for the best.  Let me tell you!!! My hair looked awesome!! It blended so well that black women that I work with did not know I had a sew in.  My hair is about shoulder length and the weave is a few inches longer.  I didn't expect to fool the sisters! lol  Everyone kept saying they loved my hair and that I should wear it down more often.  Two weeks later I went back to get it washed and blow dried and this time flat ironed.  I don't know how but this time it looked better than me wearing it curly.  I love both looks and will alternate between them both.  Lisa is my go to hairstylist now!  Hands down. If you want a natural looking, no bulges, no track showing, blended sew in you have to go to Lisa.  If you wanna look a fool go somewhere else.

17.description: Lisa and the whole team are fabulous! I can always depend on my hair looking perfect and HEALTHY each and every time. She is also really good at custom styling, cutting and coloring of "Clip In Extensions"!  Be sure to book weeks in advance because she is hard to get in with.

15.description: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this Bronzeville gem.  I have pretty thick curly locks and I get it straightened maybe twice a year.  I'm used to live in Atlanta and for those of you familiar with N'Seya (which I adored), then Red Karma is the next best thing.  Unlike Yehia that burns out your "unprocessed" hair, the folks at Red Karma take their time.  Lisa is my stylist and is also the owner.  She not only did a beautiful job on my tresses but she did it with love but within a reasonable time...maybe 2 hours flat!  If you're looking for a stylist to take CARE of your hair and not just DO your hair, then Red Karma is the place.  The only drawback is that its a pretty small place so I highly recommend making an appointment well in advance, they usually schedule about 2-3 weeks out.  Enjoy!

0.description: This is such a CAHUTE salon!!!! Omg too cute! I found this place on Instagram via the hashtag #chicagostylist and #chicagohairstylist. I setup my appointment with Kalyn via StyleSeat (which I think is the only way to make an appointment with her). The salon. I got to the salon and was WOWED at how cozy, clean and inviting the salon is. Omg. Love the atmosphere. It was very comfortable, and that's big for me in terms of me picking a salon. Then, all of the stylists have their own rooms, so you can chill in their little area without worrying about 50 million people walking around your purse and stuff. Also, I was really happy with the fact that it was secure (you have to get buzzed in). The lobby was super duper cozy and clean. Loved it. They also had a keurig machine for coffee and tea lovers in the lobby. Getting there. It is down the street from the Cermark-McCormick Place green line stop. It probably took me 3-4 minutes max to get to it from the train station. Kalyn. She is too cute, polite, humble, down to earth and professional. She is very personable too (also super big on my list of requirements). My hair came out FLAWLESS. Beyoncé FLAWLESS. Kalyn got hands chile. She got me together honey. Very talented this one. Listen when I tell you. I will ABSOLUTELY be back. I'll attach some pics to this review when I get my brows reshaped (you know how it be). The most important part about my satisfaction with the my experience is the fact that SHE LISTENS. She didn't go rouge in my hair and did exactly what I asked for. I can't stand when stylists do that. So so happy! Cute little story about fate: When I walked in Kalyn mentioned I looked familiar. I didn't recognize her. She asked me a few questions and I then started telling her about a recent experience I had at another salon and that's when it clicked. I actually sat next to Kalyn while under the dryer at another salon (we were dryer mates). I don't recall exchanging any words with her - just friendly smiles. I ended up dissatisfied with that experience and that's when I went looking for another stylist. Enter Kalyn on IG. Small world! Would highly recommend. Whether you're looking to cut your hair or get a sew in, Kalyn's your girl. Go find her on StyleSeat under Kalyn Brunt to see the other stuff she does. Bye.

5.description: I had high expectations because if the reviews on yelp and they were all about Brandon... So I figured I'd go to him. I have a short hair style nothing to short my pixie cut grew out over 3 months an I'm currently growing it out however I just wanted it styled and lined up in the back. It took me 4 hours to leave this shop FOUR HOURS I went in at 5 and didn't leave until 9pm he also CUT the back of my neck... And the style did not last not even ONE day... It was 65.00 and I'mNever going back to that man I'm actually thinking of calling up there and complaining

11.description: I was referred by a friend whose hair ALWAYS looks fabulous.  I was excited about seeing a stylist who had experience with natural (non-chemically treated) African-American hair.Lisa did a fabulous job getting my hair straight.  Unfortunately the cut was a disappointment.  My hair was lopsided!  It was about 2 inches longer on the left side.  It was very 1985-asymmetrical-bob-ish which is not what I asked for. Maybe she was having an off day or something.Again, my friend's hair is always fabulous. I would let Lisa from Red Karma flat iron it straight again, but I wouldn't let her cut it.

8.description: After moving to the city, I was determined to establish that all too important relationship with a trusted stylist (I have short, relaxed hair and a good cut is essential).  After researching, I came across Red Karma as one of the top salons for African Americans (it was featured in Chicago's Best).  Being the procrastinator that I am, I would call last minute to schedule a same-week appt... they were always booked (which is annoying, but a good sign!)  In the meantime, I salon-hopped just to get by.  Given my own busy schedule, it was hard to get in to see *any* stylist so in a desperate fit one night... I (gasp) cut/butchered my own hair. Finally, I made a friend who happened to be a long-time Red Karma client and made an appointment for me *excited!*  The day of my appt, I got a call from the stylist that she wasn't feeling well and would have to cancel--she offered to reschedule for the next day.  Since I was booked the next day, she gave me a referral to Red Karma's (new) second location on 2240 S Michigan.  I was a little skeptical, but they worked to get me in with another stylist for the same time as my original appt.  When I arrived, I found the salon to be nicely decorated (moroccan trendy) and the staff was friendly.  When my newly booked stylist arrived, we realized there had been a mistake in scheduling because she specialized in weaves only. Yikes.  Sure that I was going to have to leave the salon with the same nappy frizz ball on my head, another stylist, Evonda, rearranged her schedule to squeeze me in for a shampoo, cut & style.  She worked wonders... she SOMEHOW salvaged the mess I'd made during my previous scissor-spree!  I left feeling fabulous and was VERY pleased with the price.  They use quality products (KeraCare, Mizani, etc.) and are great with both natural and relaxed hair.  They offer water & tea and the style team is very personable.  Bonus... there's a lash studio next door to the salon :).  Glad I found a new salon home.

3.description: Lisa, the owner, is the absolute truth. And I mean that literally. Her hands will restore your hair and breath life that you thought long left. And as I would consider myself extremely knowledgable of the black salon experience from a client perspective - her professionalism and deep understanding of our hair exceeds the standard. As she's the truth she will give it to you real and won't sell you a dream, yet the difference is in that she will let you know the steps you need to take to achieve your desired goal and she will fully commit to this journey with you.And the talent runs deep at Red Karma as the others like Cynthia are on point and the receptionist is as sweet as pie.The only challenge is everyone loves Red Karma and Lisa so book your appointment in advance!!

14.description: Like so many women, I'm very particular about my hair! I'm even more particular about my time and money. And when I found myself in need of a new hair stylist, Red Karma came up more than once. Breaking up with a long-term stylist is hard to do, but when I finally took the plunge, I decided to give Red Karma a try. What I liked immediately is that the stylists do a variety of hair-long, short, natural, relaxed, weaves...You name it and you'd see someone getting it done! Because I wear my hair short, I don't like to look "boxed or razored" with sharp angles. Even when I show pictures and explain, I've walked out of salons looking nothing like what I described. But not here! My stylist, Aisha, does her thing!! She is a revelation with her shears! My hair is always perfectly styled and never stiffed into a spritz oblivion. Aisha's method is sophisticated yet relaxed and it's never "overdone." And although she aims to please, she won't let you 'send yourself off' by wanting product in your hair you don't need. I'm pretty lucky to have found her and thank Red Karma for promoting healthy and beautiful hair..no matter your personal style!!

4.description: Never ever before in my life have I been able to trust a hair stylist the way I trust Cynthia at Red Karma! I don't go to her nearly as often as I should but she's really the best stylist I've ever had. I think I can go longer without going in because of the great condition she has my hair in. I've been chemical-free (with really thick, curly/wavy/cwavy?, very textured hair) for about 7 years now and Cynthia keeps my hair healthy and growing. My blow outs always looks great when I leave and for many days afterward. She uses the right amount of heat to straighten without damaging, so I don't walk out smelling like burnt hair like with so many other places. Her assistant gives really good shampoos, too. When I wash and go after coming here, my cut always works just as well for my heatless hair as it does when straight. I recommended Cynthia to a coworker who gets a sew-in and now she goes to her exclusively (and this coworker is VERY particular about her hair).The shop itself is cool and has a slightly different set-up with semi private rooms for each stylist. Everyone is friendly and it just has a great vibe. Making appointments and paying is painless (I can add tip to my credit card!) and professionally handled. I tend to be a bit more on the quiet side when getting my hair done and I never feel weird or awkward for keeping to myself, though Cynthia's really easy to chat with. I usually spend just under $100 for my wash/deep condition/trim/blow-out on mid-back length hair including tip, which might sound a bit steep but has been completely worth it for me every time! As much as I'd love to keep her all to myself, I recommend going to Cynthia if you're looking for someone to help you transition, maintain, extend, color, whatever - she's that versatile!

58.description: Just had my first visit here and I have to admit up front that I was/am having separation anxiety from my nail shop in Denver, Tootsie's, which I will always and forever love. That said, my experience today at the Nail Social was pleasant and I think I got a good pedicure. The pros: It's two blocks from my new digs, it's very clean and modern, the people are extremely friendly and nice and I got a very good pedicure at the same price I was paying in Colorado...The only cons today were that I had to wait for about 30 minutes (which they kept apologizing profusely for). I didn't mind because I didn't work today. The second (small) con was that they did not have my favorite OPI color in stock so I had to go with a different color. No big deal- they said they would order it. Basically, the couple who owns it or manages it are SUCH cool, friendly people (not to mention great looking) that it really negates anything else that someone might find lacking. I'll definitely be back and would like to be a regular and bring my friends and perhaps a bottle of wine next time. Really good experience overall. Four stars- maybe five next time!

56.description: This place is great and they do the best no chip mani and no chip pedi I have had in Chicago!Don't forget the wine because it is BYOB.The only issue is that it is hard to get an appointment- especially if you don't have an open schedule and you have a favorite technician.  I have been forced to rotate technician's because of scheduling but I have been extremely pleased with all 3 I have visited to this date!  Don't walk in and try to plan 2 weeks ahead for an online appointment.

29.description: I love this salon. I sometimes branch out and try other ones, but I always come back to Nail Social. Quiet and clean and everyone that works there (even the receptionist!) is so, so nice. Lily is my favorite, but I kind of feel that that you can't go wrong with this place!

42.description: I wish I could give less than one star. But yelp almighty wont allow it! Anyways, so I made an appt for a no chip mani ($40, pretty stndard I thought). I show up 10 minutes before the appointment time and there is one technician available and another doing nails. First impression: cluttered (bags of nail utensils and supplies everywhere), unclean (read paper towels on the flower, containers w nail clippers, files and other tools of trade without any rubbing alcohol or whatever they use to sanitize them!), suffocatingly small place with scraped up walls and old fixtures, even the pedi equipment (chairs n tubs) looked super old!  But never mind I thought...never judge the book by its cover...Anyways, I sat down and she started taking off my old no chip. It wouldnt come off so she tried soaking again and again...and then simply just filed a couple of nails down, which is fine. Then she proceeded to shape my nails and I noticed that she hasnt worked on my cuticles! She didnt even push them back or anything! When she was clipping my nails earlier she cut one of them too deep so I yelped (hehe) and she said sorry and I guess was too afraid to do anything else that couldve caused me discomfort...???  But honestly I have never gone to a nail salon and not gotten my cuticles cut, treated or at least pushed back!! So an hour n 10 mins later I walked away with naked nails, mad cuticles in tact and somewhat softer hands. As she was awkwardly filing my nails into a horrible shape I decided I wasnt going to waste $40 on this. So I said lets just do a regular mani and she happily accepted and said i need to give my nails a break cuz theyre too dry. I said fine. So another 20 minutes time,  some scrub and lotion action later I paid $25 and walked away with not even a clear polish. What a ripoff on time and money, right? I tipped her, yes I did, because she spent 1 hour 10 minutes working on me however useless that time mightve been. And she was nice...but nice dont make ur nails look pretty, right?!? And as far as nail technician skills - zero, zilch, nada. Save your time people, trust this yelpster - ur money is spent better elsewhere - its not like a $25 mani is a bargain!!!!

23.description: I just had an amazing experience in The Nail Social. I read the reviews others posted prior and was looking for a nail salon near my hair salon and ran across this place and I think this is my new home. The salon and very small and intimate. I booked an appointment with Lily a few days prior online. Lily is freaking amazing!!! She's takes her time and you can tell she really enjoys what she does. She gave me the best mani and pedi I've ever had. The complimentary tea was awesome but I kinda wish I took advantage of the BYOB. I will be back in two weeks. It's a bit more expense than the standard mani and pedi but Lily's work is worth it! Can't wait to go back.

47.description: Came here while I was visiting my mom in the South Loop.  Very quiet and clean.  Patrice was awesome, so bubbly and fun.  My manicure lasted long and I loved it!  Thank yoU!

8.description: Unfortunately 5 of my nails have chipped from the No chip manicure that I got only a week ago. Not impressed

31.description: This is a really cute salon with excellent service.  I scheduled a mani-pedi for my mom and I and they were very accommodating.  Oh, and it's BYOB!   I would have felt comfortable having any of their techs working on me, they all seemed very competent and friendly.  I will definitely be back!

34.description: Went here for the first time and it was amazing! I'm a new Chicago resident and was apprehensive about "Nail Shops" in the City after hearing and experiencing poor service at other establishments. I had the Signature Mani/Pedi Combo with Maya. She was so nice and professional. I've already made my next appointment! I also had my brows and lip threaded by Gul...Amazing service as well. She was really patient with my whiny first-timer antics. I usually have my brows waxed, but my aesthetician was unavailable. I never ever ever let anyone else near my eyebrows, but I'm glad I took the chance.

16.description: I've been a client for some time now with The Nail Social. I absolutely love the service that I receive from all of the staff. I've gone to all of the ladies for my nail care and they are all wonderful. I also take care of all my waxing needs at Nail Social. I would highly recommend The Nail Social if you are looking to be pampered and relaxed. I almost forgot to mention that it's BYOB (my favorite part)

13.description: I've been going to the Nail Social for over two years.  I love the personalized service and individual attention that I receive on each visit.  They always have the best polish colors.  This place is the best

11.description: Great nail salon. I love the vibe and everyone is so friendly. Lenore does the best no chip manicure!! Treat yourself and go to Nail Social!

39.description: I love this place. Right across the street from my office, really sweet and helpful staff, and online booking which is pretty great. I've had 2 no-chip manis here that have been great. The techs are awesome and the owner is super nice.

37.description: One of my favorite businesses in the South Loop. While I have had my nails done by every technician and haven't had a bad experience yet, I typically go to Lily. I love that this is just a few blocks from my home and it's so nice to grab a bottle of wine and go get pampered at the end of long day. If you're looking for a salon that isn't your typical place, where they speak the same language and treat you like an old friend, this is it.You don't have to make an appointment, but they get pretty busy and have a lot of repeat business, so making an appointment is recommended. They have an online appointment option so it's pretty easy/

0.description: Lenore is awesome!  I have been going to her for about a year now!  She has gotten me hooked on No Chip Manicures!  I love how easy they are and when you're done, you're done!I always schedule my appointments online.  It makes it so easy!!

38.description: Let me start by saying the positives:  I love the atmosphere of this place.  If you want to go and socialize - its your place.  If you want to go after work and not talk at all and have your nails done - its your place.  Its a great atmosphere.  They do fantastic manicures.. as in, they take care of your hands beautifully.  I have NEVER had a bad pedicure either.  I am the most TICKLISH person EVER. and they do it PERFECTLY.  I LOOOOOOVE my pedicures.  So now you're thinking.... all this praise for a few stars? YEA.  So, the first time i got a no chip it was from here.  My nails chip SO easily, so while its supposed to last 2-3 weeks, when my first was just under 2 weeks I was still pleased.  They take care in their work and make sure the polish job is great before putting it under the light.  But still... less than the 2 week guarantee.  I have had a few no-chips at other salons that last longer, a few dollars more (its SOO expensive!), but last longer.  The last one I got, I didnt even question where to go because i love the location, i love the space and the people... buuuuut.... I got a no-chip on Friday.... Its Wednesday night and one of my nails started peeling back.  I paid $40 for this and 5 days later its peeling?  I am going on my honeymoon soon and really want a no-chip that lasts... Because when it peels it ruins and softens my nails.  I may have to try a new location.  Maybe its my nails fault... but its GUARANTEED for 2 weeks, can last up to 3.  5 days... thats almost $10 a day for my nails?!  Maybe after they put lotion on my hands they need to let it dry more before they put the polish on?  i want to give them another try... but for the money... not quite sure.  PS... great job on the eyebrow threading, but considerably more than Threadz down the street (which does a good job).  I have heard from others that their other waxing services are good.  If you want atmosphere.... come here for a pampering session, come for a nice evening with your girls... but if you need it to last... as i did... dont.  I am willing to give it another try... if they have a special.  5 days! Give me a honeymoon manicure with design detail at a discount and I will re-thing my monthly routine =)

51.description: I agree with many of the reviews here.  I have been looking for a nail salon close to my South Loop condo and I was disappointed with all that I have tried until now.  I booked my appointment online (which I love) with Maria and she did a fantastic job with my VIP Mani/Pedi.  I have been going to Maria for a few months now and I recently switched to a No Chip Mani-love it!  The location is very clean and, as others have mentioned, they thoroughly clean the pedicure stations after each use.  The owners are very nice, as well as the rest of the staff.  Oh, and it is BYOB-YAY!  I highly recommend Nail Social and Maria!

27.description: Great first time at this nail salon.  The staff were very welcoming when I came in the door.  Great job on the combo mani-pedi.  Mireya did a great job.  After a brusque treatment when I asked about walk-ins at one of their neighbor's, it was very refreshing to have such great service.  Definitely recommend it!

32.description: If you are looking for a really good brow threading . Please check out GUI at nail social she's really good. Not everyone is good at eyebrow threading but she is.

54.description: My husband and I went it for a pedicure. We were offered water or tea right away, the staff was extremely friendly and the pedicures were perfect. I can't wait to go back with some wine since I found out it was byob!

48.description: Day two of my mani/pedi and I still feel pretty - and my polish hasn't chipped!!  Yay!  I'm also still thinking of the foot massage and the hand massage - ahhh - sheer bliss!  Will definitely be going back.

44.description: The Nail Social is just that! Very social and a great place to get all your special services done. The minute you walk through the door you are greeted by everyone. It does not matter who you are booked with they all chime in!An upbeat extremely clean environment. I have been a client for awhile now. So happy they are there for all of us in SoLo! We appreciate you. Always there to accommodate even last minute. Check them out you will not want to go anywhere else!Carry on Nail Social!!!!!!!!Christian & ValentinoSouth Loop Residents

24.description: I've been a client for some time now with The Nail Social. I absolutely love the service that I receive from all of the staff. I've gone to all of the ladies for my nail care and they are all wonderful. I also take care of all my waxing needs at Nail Social. I would highly recommend The Nail Social if you are looking to be pampered and relaxed. I almost forgot to mention that it's BYOB (my favorite part)

7.description: I tried this place because I was new to the area. It's a really nice place, people were nice and they took me without an appointment. I got a full set and my eyebrows done. I love my eyebrows!! My nails looked really nice but when I left one broke. And then the next day 2 more broke. By the 2nd day the nail polish was chipping and by the 3rd day I had 5 broken nails and 4 nails were chipped. For $65 I wasn't happy. I went back and the same girl fixed them. This time they didn't break but the nail polish has been chipping. I never experienced this. Usually if I get a normal manicure but not if I have a full set. I'm not happy with my experience at all.

49.description: I tried many of the nail salons in the south loop and I hadn't found the one, until now!  I'm so happy I have a regular nail salon!  I booked the appointment online (super easy).  I booked the 10 a.m. (first appointment on Sunday) because I read reviews about the wait.  No wait, they were ready for me...not just getting in like other places when you are the first appointment.  The owner greeted me and was super nice.  The reason this place is my new go to spot is because of Patrice!  She did an excellent job on my nails and we had great conversation (not awkward silence or uncomfortable/forced conversation).  It was the most enjoyable mani/pedi ever!  I really look forward to seeing her again (don't think I have ever said this of a nail technician before).  She was very knowledgeable about her work and you could tell she took pride in what she does (rightfully so, she is amazing)!  Very happy I came here :)

40.description: Amazing experience! My nail tech was Maya and she did a fabulous job on my mani/pedi. The owner was so nice too :) he was helpful and had a great attitude and to top it off I didn't know they weren't takings Amex for payment so he trusted me to call back later with my other credit card info instead. I will recommend this place and come back as well. Thank you  Nail Social :)

53.description: THE YELP DESCRIPTION IS INCORRECT ON THE LOCATION. THIS SALON IS BETWEEN MICHIGAN & WABASH (not between Federal & Clark).The service here was very good! Polite staff and excellent location! The pedi bowls are very clean and they clean throughly after each use, unlike some places I've been.Ebony did my mani and pedi and too great care of me. I was pleased with my services and I've booked my next service.

30.description: Best pedicure I have ever gotten - period. I'm usually very picky when it comes to my little toes, but the VIP pedicure from Maria made my feet look like I could've foot modeled - if that's a thing. I recommend Nail Social to all my friends, and will continue to do so. Thank you!

46.description: This place is really close to my apartment so when a few friends of mine and I decided we wanted to get some pedicures on a snowy day, we headed here. When we walked in, we were immediately helped and there was no wait. Our two nail technicians were wonderful, sweet, and did a great job, however, my experience was sour because of the manager (?)This larger woman with brown hair seemed extremely annoyed that we were there. We were her only customers! She should be happy that they were making any money on this blizzard of a day. She was really short with us and rolled her eyes when I asked her where to put my jacket. This is no way to treat customers.Yes, my friends and I are in our early twenties and maybe not as "elite" as some of the South Loop clientele, but we still have the right to be treated decently. I don't think I'd go back here, which is shame because I loved our technicians, but the manager was beyond rude.

1.description: Denise is my IT GIRL when it comes to nails.  Best mani/pedi I've ever had.  And when she does a callus buster pedi, my feet are so soft!! Even regular manicures ( I do 2 no-chips, then one or two regulars) last at least 5 days.  I continue to love this place.  People are friendly and I always come away feeling like I've gotten quality services and pampering in a relaxed social atmosphere.

55.description: I'm new to the South Loop and I was excited to find a nail salon so close to my place.  I booked an appointment online (LOVE this!) and went in for my mani/pedi over the weekend.About an hour before my appointment, I received a phone call that my technician was running a little behind.  The woman offered to put me with someone else if I wanted, or I could come in later.   I really appreciated this - I've never had a nail salon give me an update like that.  I had no major plans until the evening, so I agreed to come in later.The couple that owns the salon is super nice and they offered me a beverage when I walked in the door.  I was put in a pedicure chair right away and waited for my mani/pedi to begin.I'm giving this place 4 stars instead of 5, because I ended up waiting in the chair for about 40 minutes before my pedicure began.  This wasn't a big deal to me that day, since I was just relaxing and reading my book, but this could definitely be a problem if I had other errands to run that day.  When my technician came over to start my service, she was apologetic for being so behind.  She was super nice and made sure that my nails looked perfect!  I loved the whole experience.I will definitely be coming back here.  My nails look great and the place is CLEAN.  I actually saw the pedicure bowls being scrubbed down after appointments, while other places merely spray them.  The price is right  - $45 for mani/pedi - and they do a great job.  Yay for a great nail salon in the South Loop!

9.description: I called Saturday morning for a same day appointment- was able to get a gel manicure and spa pedicure appointment a couple of hours later.  Walking in, the staff was very welcoming and relaxed.  It seemed like all the women were great friends who truly enjoyed working there.  I had a fabulous, meticulous, and relaxing spa pedicure.  Denise did an amazing job with my disaster feet.  Also had a gel manicure done by Denise.  I had recently trimmed my nails super short and she did a fabulous job working with what I had!  I would absolutely recommend the Nail Social.  The employees were so friendly and so welcoming- and their services were great!!

26.description: I started coming here as soon as I moved to Chicago. I was thankful to find a tech that didn't rush me in and out, and who would actually hold a conversation with me. I see Lenore. I love that this place is BYOB, and they do a really great job. I always get recommendations on color and the other guests are happy to chime in- everyone here is in a good mood. The appointment takes a long time for a mani/pedi, but it is very worth it. I love the VIP combo with shellac. They have hot towels for your legs and feet and take the time to get your toes in tip-top shape! They My only complaint is that I always have to wait about 20 minutes to actually be seen by my tech....last time it was about 40 minutes with no apology. Makes me wonder if I should just show up to my appointments late!

25.description: I was in the area and they were able to squeeze me in for the basic mani pedi. The shop is very cute and cozy. I was offered beverages upon walking in. The staff were really nice, the shop is well decorated and they have nice perks like offering tea, cookies, etc. Gloria did my mani pedi and she was great. She took her time, made sure my nails were how I wanted. The price was great for the area, and even better for the service you receive. I was there for about two hours, including my dry-time. If you're in a rush, I'd make sure to mention that. However, on a leisurely Saturday, it was perfect for me.  I'll definitely go back.

12.description: Great first time at this nail salon.  The staff were very welcoming when I came in the door.  Great job on the combo mani-pedi.  Mireya did a great job.  After a brusque treatment when I asked about walk-ins at one of their neighbor's, it was very refreshing to have such great service.  Definitely recommend it!

59.description: My favorite part of my experience here was the male pedicurist who gave the best massage ever.The massage chairs are awful - the vibrate kind in their B-grade area. The A-team pedicure stations are less comfortable than church pews - it's a single floated bench.Speaking of benches, an employee was monopolizing one of the two benches in the waiting area, which left me sitting next to a customer calling person after person. The place smells HORRIBLY of chemicals, please get some ventilation!Have no reason to go back here, was really hoping for a 5 star experience.

21.description: Love this place. I have been to many nail salons all over the country and this is my favorite. It starts with the warm environment. Everyone makes you feel at home and when you enter you are immediately offered something to drink. I go to Lenore and she is precise and this is the longest my manicures has lasted. Spending time there is really a wonderful treat to yourself.

17.description: Went here for the first time and it was amazing! I'm a new Chicago resident and was apprehensive about "Nail Shops" in the City after hearing and experiencing poor service at other establishments. I had the Signature Mani/Pedi Combo with Maya. She was so nice and professional. I've already made my next appointment! I also had my brows and lip threaded by Gul...Amazing service as well. She was really patient with my whiny first-timer antics. I usually have my brows waxed, but my aesthetician was unavailable. I never ever ever let anyone else near my eyebrows, but I'm glad I took the chance.

10.description: My toddler son and I were walking past The Nail Social, on our way to pick up some dinner at a nearby restaurant.  Through the windows, we saw the owners and their two children, about my son's age, closing up shop and cleaning.  My son wanted to say hi to the boys, and without us having to ask, the owners saw us and let us come inside the shop for the boys to meet.  The owners were extremely friendly, and treated us very well, even though we weren't really customers--they made a great impression!  This place should get beyond five stars for their hospitality.  I hope to make an appointment with them soon because of their kindness toward my son and I.

5.description: Denise is awesome. Her attention to detail with my mani/pedi was priceless. It's the best mani/pedi that I've had in years. Thanks Denise!

3.description: Great little salon and the staff is super friendly.I recommend it highly if your in Chicago and staying in the South Loop area.A little pricey but more than worth it!

35.description: So this was my second time getting my nails done at The Nail Social.  The first time was about a year ago, and my experience was good although I cannot remember who I had. I had my nails done for a wedding I was in, and I cannot remember how long my manicure and pedicure lasted.  I went back this time because I was already in the neighborhood to get my hair done. I made my appointment with Lenore because a previous yelp review commented on the manicure lasting a long time when Lenore did her nails.So this was my experience this time - Lenore is very friendly and professional, she actually advised me on picking another color because the initial color I chose was transparent (which was not my intent), she fixed my nail when it smudged under the dryer, and true to the previous yelp review, my manicure and pedicure have lasted.  It has been 6 days now since my appointment, and my nails still have not chipped.  I have NEVER had that happen with a manicure, and this is not the no-chip manicure.  So even though I do not live in the south loop neighborhood anymore, I will now start making the drive to the city to get my nails done when Lenore has availability.  That is the reason I normally don't bother getting my nails done unless there is an event - because my manicures never last, and I don't like the no-chip manicures.  That will now change.I think they do take walk ins, but during my appointment, I saw a couple of people come in as walk ins and they were told there may be a bit of a wait until there was availability. So I would recommend making appointments if you can.

19.description: I was in the area and they were able to squeeze me in for the basic mani pedi. The shop is very cute and cozy. I was offered beverages upon walking in. The staff were really nice, the shop is well decorated and they have nice perks like offering tea, cookies, etc. Gloria did my mani pedi and she was great. She took her time, made sure my nails were how I wanted. The price was great for the area, and even better for the service you receive. I was there for about two hours, including my dry-time. If you're in a rush, I'd make sure to mention that. However, on a leisurely Saturday, it was perfect for me.  I'll definitely go back.

28.description: quick, not too expensive and decent work. i would definitely return.

45.description: I absolutly LOVE The Nail Social! It's a very friendly, warm & inviting nail salon.The staff is very professional & courteous. I receive many compliments and always recommend their services. The VIP pedicure is fabulous !

33.description: I really can't think of one complaint. The service is good, timely and professional. The prices are good and the atmosphere is very serene. Also it's a BYOB so I'll definitely be coming back with friends. Lilly does good work!

43.description: I think I've found MY nail salon! I've been to The Nail Social twice for the mani/pedi with Lenore.  She's great!  She provides quick and efficient service.  I love that I can make my appointments online.

2.description: I have been coming to the nail social for a few years now and really like this place because you can make appointments online. Everyone has been great. I had Denise who did a great job on my manicure (no chip) and pedicure.

18.description: Cute neighborhood spot! I came here last minute for a mani around 6:30 and they were able to squeeze me in.  Lenore did an amazing job on my mani,  I'm used to getting no chips but the way she did my polish I feel like it will stay on just as long.  Everyone is super friendly and treated my like a regular even though it was my first visit! I'll be back!

41.description: I love the Nail Social.  They are owned by a husband and wife team and truly care about their clients.  The best pink and white nails I have ever received.  Give it a try, I think you will really love it.

52.description: So I've been tirelessly searching for a nail place, and I've found some gems but NEVER near my home. I read about nail social in best of Chicago and gave them a call. Eek, 40 for a no chip? Well I've had one before, it was streaky and I hoped it would chip because it looked so bad.Enter ebony, she took lots of care and her precision produced a rich, bright, full of depth indigo. I love it and she was easy going and gentle. The salon is cute and has this beautiful picture of a rope bridge in a rainforest or something. I've found a nail tech and a place that (along with being a tad expensive) is tool notch perfection!

50.description: attention!!! attention!!!!!ebony is no longer @ this place i repeat she no longer works @ this place.attention!!!!! attention!!!!!

4.description: I had my reservations about this place after seeing the pictures posted to yelp but I decided to give it a chance because the overall reviews were good even if the pictures weren't.  My pedicure was okay and came out looking nice.  Service was also okay.  I would advise potential patrons not to expect to be seen as a walk-in.  They don't really staff well to accommodate walk-ins.  I got lucky because someone cancelled and I happened to be in the right place at the right time.  At least three other clients were turned away.Overall I have nothing to complain about so I give it three stars.  They did an acceptable toe job but nothing I feel the need to rave about.

6.description: Omg I can't say enough about this place! I absolutely love the nail social! From the location, to the decor, to the outstanding service they are amazing! Lenore is the best!!! Always so nice, very professional and personable. She always makes sure I leave looking and feeling good. My mom and I went in the day before mother's day and got no chip manicures and VIP pedicures. Loved it! My mom had Gloria and loved her. This used to be MY secret little luxury spot, now I have a feeling I'll be seeing her there too. This is not your typical "nail shop." I was looking for a place that wouldn't be full of fumes and people in masks, giving me a run of the mill Mani/pedi. This place is it. It's so charming and relaxing. Everyone is so nice. They KNOW their stuff! Plus it's BYOB and you can't go wrong with that. It's a great place for some girl time and mimosas! Do yourself a favor and go check this place out. Book in advance tho. They understandably stay pretty busy. Go see Lenore!

22.description: Cute neighborhood spot! I came here last minute for a mani around 6:30 and they were able to squeeze me in.  Lenore did an amazing job on my mani,  I'm used to getting no chips but the way she did my polish I feel like it will stay on just as long.  Everyone is super friendly and treated my like a regular even though it was my first visit! I'll be back!

15.description: Amazing VIP pedi by Maya!! Took great care of my feet, was very friendly, and really professional. Four out of five stars just because the massage chairs were only so-so.

57.description: The nail social has a great atmosphere and super friendly people. Very relaxing.I do think that most services are over priced and I've had better and longer lasting mani/pedis at other salons.I actually tried to go this past Sunday afternoon but it was unexpectedly closed. The hours were posted as open on Sundays but there was no signage explaining why they were closed. It's probably just as well!

20.description: I've been going to The Nail Social for about a year now and I love the place. The staff is so welcoming and Gloria is the best. I like keeping my nails shorter and Gloria has no problems with keeping my nails the length I like. These manicures usually last me about two weeks.

36.description: Very accommodating. Online appointments are possible. Walkins welcome. Don't mandate cash tips. Maya is amazing - very professional. Salon is clean, well decorated, well lit. Prices are standard.

14.description: This place is fine.  It's clean, efficient, and has good nail-color options.  It's not cheap but it's also not unreasonably expensive.  I can't speak for the other nail techs but I had Lenore.  She's really nice and very efficient, so you can get in and get out.  It does seem like they are way overbooked because Lenore was really quick with me and I was sandwiched in between two other appointments.  The woman sitting next to me, with a different technician, got a long foot massage, very careful grooming and filing, and, overall a very detail-oriented pedicure, before the nail polish was even put on.  I got a very fast pedicure.  It looks fine.  But nothing special.  My feet still have some dead skin on them.  And, most problematic, was the fact that Lenore filed down my actual nail bed to make the nails smooth.  I know some nail techs do this so that your nails stay weak and require polish, making you come back often.  I really can't say if that was her goal or if she was just trying to save time but that is certainly not what I want out of a pedicure.  I am not sure if I'll come back.  If I do, it probably won't be with Lenore.

58.description: It's the first time I check this place out and It's a solid 3 stars. I had the hot and spicy jumbo shrimp (ok), Hot BBQ chicken wings (excellent), the lasagna (good) and the mozzarella sticks (ok).I didn't get a chance to try the pizza which must be the specialty dishes. I will go back there to try some for sure. The menu has a good selection and the price is decent. It's not too far from the south loop so I will definitely consider ordering a pizza for delivery there instead of Domino's.

56.description: Just ick!I ordered a deep dish pizza and a ceasar salad for delivery. The pizza was just aweful. The box was super greasy and had liquid running all over the bottom, I guess runny pizza sauce. The crust wasn't cooked, and the topics were minimal. The ceaser salad had maybe 4 croutons. The only thing they did right was get it to my place on time. Never again!

29.description: Ok, I never write reviews on restaurants, however after my experience  today I absolutely have to!! So, today I went to Brandi's pizzeria. Initially when I came in, the woman at the front counter had her head down like she was reading, I said hello, hello, hello. Then she looked up, with no smile or anything. Then I ordered a Large Cheese pizza with two toppings.   I proceeded to wait for an entire 1 hour, until I decided to ask what was taking so long and how much longer, then they gave me my pizza. During this long wait time, people were coming in and out with their food.  When I  made it in my car, I looked at pizza, and it was slightly warm, not hot at all, meaning the pizza was sitting around for a while after it was cooked. I wonder if I had not asked them how much longer,  would I have continued to wait.  Also, I was waiting right in front of the the counter the entire time, so they saw me waiting. Its really unfortunate, because the pizza is good, but not great. There are other pizzeria places in the neighborhood, so they are not absolute in restaurant choices for customers. After I left the  restaurant, I decided to call the restaurant and speak with the manager. When I called they put me on hold for so long, I decided to hang up and write a review. What I think is so horrible about this restaurant is no one ever apologized for the bad customer service. I will not be giving them another chance, that will be my last time going to Brandi's pizzeria located on  67 E Cermak Rd  Michigan Ave.  I advise other potential customers, go somewhere else where they appreciate your business. Thanks

42.description: Tried the thin crust pizza and chicken wings...so disappointed with the food. The owners have a wonderful Italian restaurant in Oak Park, so I was extremely surprised at my recent experience.

23.description: Some of the reviews don't seem very deserving of this wonderful place.  So what if you have to wait over 30 minutes for a pizza?　If you want a quick pizza, go to Little Caesars and get a piece of cardboard with cheese and sauce on it.  The pizza at Brandi is as authentic as Chicago deep dish can be, and therefore, it takes time to cook.  If you got rude service, the lady behind the counter is probably up to her wits with dealing with dumb and impatient people who don't know what the hell they want or have a million demands... no different from any other business.  We ordered, and the lady was courteous.My wife and I visited Chicago, and this place happened to be right down the street from our hotel.  We ventured there for lunch after an exhausting five hour train ride and 45 minute walk to our hotel.  I eat pizza probably once a week, and have Chicago-style deep dish frequently around Detroit.  Yet, the pizza we got here was among the best we ever had.  We ordered a small, deep dish with chicken and half tomatoes (for her side) for $15.  We waited and waited... and waited.  It is worth the wait, and we were in no hurry.  We were the only people in there at around noon.  When our pizza arrived, it was massive.  The chicken we ordered was actually huge chicken patties covered in cheese and tons of sauce.  It was too hot to eat at first.  We obviously couldn't finish it and took half of it back to the hotel.  We ate it cold later that night, and it still tasted good.So, if your service was shitty or food messed up, go somewhere else... big deal.  There's a pizza place on every corner in Chicago.  But, when I go back to Chicago, I'll be back here  if we're on the south side..

47.description: To my fellow south-loopers... Give Pizzeria Brandi a try regardless of the erratic reviews. We ordered in tonight and it was surprisingly yummy! We had a thin slice pepperoni pizza and the chicken alfredo (baked with mozarella) and both were delish!The pizza is covered in both sauce and cheese - the former of which is often overlooked - and the crust was crispy. The pasta was really tasty; I ordered it on a whim and am so glad I did. The chicken had a perfect grilled taste and the sauce was creamy and flavorful. Both were piping hot when they arrived!I'm so glad we have a South Loop staple for those lazy work nights (and hungover Sundays).

8.description: It's a good thing I didn't let the reviews of this place stop me from coming here. The staff is always friendly, although they are very busy. I'm sure it's hard to make each customer feel like they are the best and only customer in the world when they visit this place, but if good food is all you care about, then this place will not disappoint!

31.description: I have given this place a chance several times, but today I reached my limit. I always call in my order ahead of time to save time, but it never fails, I wait for at least 10 to 15 minutes, after giving them an hour to prepare my order. What is the point of calling ahead? They mess up my simple orders constantly...chicken wings with out sauce? Are you joking?

34.description: I saw this on Groupon Now and decided to give it a try, despite some of the bad reviews on Yelp. I ordered two thin crust medium pizzas (pepperoni, onion, broccoli on one, spinach and broccoli on the other), and an order of breadsticks. The total with tax was around $35, and with the Groupon it was a total of $20 I paid. I picked up the food in about 40 minutes and it smelled great. Some of the reviews mention that the cheese was too much, but I didn't think so at all. I do love lots of stuff on a pizza, though. I was surprised that they put so many toppings on pizzas, which is a very big plus! The one down side about the pizzas is that they didn't have the toppings I wanted(which were on their website). I had originally wanted rapini and boconcini, but they were out of both:( Other than that, we thought the pizzas tasted great.The breadsticks were a little on the disappointing side, I have to say. They tasted okay enough, but it was an order of 3 "jumbo breadsticks" for $3.95, and what we got where small, standard breadsticks that seemed right from a freezer and baked. I'd skip these next time. Overall I'd definitely get pizza from here again.

16.description: The deep dish pizza is superb here, the best I have ever had! They use fresh, quality ingredients and the sauce is excellent. Five stars for the food, zero for the girl with the tattoos on her arm! Rude, rude, rude. We knew exactly what we wanted to order and she talked down to us like we didn't know how to order a pizza and we should just fall over in gratitude for her taking our order from her fortune 500 company! This is the soup nazis sister! If you are a policeman you get treated differently with politeness. We had to ask for an extra soda and her attitude shifted right back to rude mode. Finally, my husband responded with a comment on her behavior only to be told that she is the granddaughter of the owner and she is supposed to be hard! She's about as hard as her tattoos. Great pizza if you like getting abused for it.

13.description: Delivers to the Convention centerItalian Sub was righteous.Excellent prosciutto and you can add roasted red peppers, combo sandwich looked great too.

11.description: Great food.  Very nice people.  Husband couldn't see receipt and left a tip.  He added the amount incorrectly and the lady came out and asked him if it was the correct amount and was it OK to change the total.  That does not happen often.

39.description: I've ordered the stuffed pizza with green pepper and onions three times and have been very happy with the quality of the tomato sauce and crust. It's as good as Suparosa or Edwardo's and it's close by. I just bought the Groupon deal for my next order. I solve the delivery problem by picking it up.

37.description: I read up on this place before I came. Apparently the owner has other restaurants under his umbrella so I figured they knew what they are doing. It had mixed reviews on this site among others but I went in with an open mind. Haven't now eaten here, I can fully confirm the people saying it's the worst pizza in Chicago are out of their damn minds. Yet, I will agree that there are improvements to be made of which I'll name here. For starters, the woman over the phone failed to tell me a precise time for my pickup order. An hour to an hour and a half is what I expect from a cable company planning a visit to my house, not a pizza place. So I arrived after an hour hoping for the best. Sitting on the counter was a stack of pizza boxes filled with pickup orders. So a word of caution to you future customers - if you waited the full 90 minutes, chances are your pizza may be sitting on the counter for 30+ minutes before you bring it home. A warmer of some sort would help this situation. I paid and was on my way. They have numerous styles offered including thin crust, medium crust, stuffed and deep dish. I was hoping for the Connie's style cheese on top deep dish when placing my order but ended up getting the sauce on top Uno's style pizza. I also ordered a small thin crust to get a good variety of what this place has to offer. The thin crust was decent. It reminded me of the Nancy's chain thin crust pizza from the suburbs but not as good. The deep dish needed help. Sauce was everywhere. I've made that mistake at home when making deep dish pizza - don't over sauce. It becomes a landslide of red lava that moves everywhere but onto your plate when picking up a slice. The crust on the end, however, was tasty and I felt it was the best part of the pie. I'm a crust lover and this place was respectable. With a few changes I'd give this place 4 stars. No, it's not the best pizza in the city but it's better than any national chain and a lot of other mediocre parlors. I'm sure I'll order again at some point.

0.description: I love this little place, I have never had any issues and the food is great! My favorite are the ribs, wings and their pizzas are great! I usually order the food over the phone and then pick it up so I never notice any long waits.
