38.description: When Pizzeria Brandi opened up in the neighborhood, I finally had easy access to great thin and stuffed pizza.  Their seasoned red sauce is divine -- they don't scrimp on their deep list of toppings, and their pizza is truly a joy to eat, reheat and eat again.  Their giardiniera and pepperoni stuffed or their black olive and pepperoni thin crust is like Christmas.  Truly a delicious chicago style pie.  I received a stuffed pie once that had a mistake -- crust wasn't cooked to a flaky and slightly sweet perfection like usual -- and they made it right, as quickly as they could.  Pizzeria Brandi is a pizza gem in the neighborhood.

51.description: Wow, too bad I didn't read the reviews on GrubHub.com first so that I can say I was forewarned. Seriously some of the worst food I have EVER had!! And how do you screw up pizza?  I think there is less oil being pumped into the Gulf than what came in my pizza box.  *ralf*Oh and by the way, cut up fried chicken patties DO NOT equal boneless chicken wings...and don't get me started on what equals Buffalo wings and what equals BBQ wings. Bottom line: DO NOT ORDER FROM THIS RESTAURANT!

27.description: I like the pizza, but just had a terrible service experience. Seven people were sitting around the table when the order was placed and heard the person order a deep dish. Then an hour later, thin crust comes and the person from Brandi who took the order said that deep dish was never requested. Way to call everyone sitting here liars and keep our guests from trying deep dish for the first time. Well done.

32.description: Our Groupon deal to Pizzeria Brandi sat on the bench long enough, so we called it up to the big leagues for a Sunday night dinner and a Redbox. I liked that you could order online but there was no way to account for the Groupon so we had to call. Delivery took about an hour and we got a ton of stuff for the $30 deal: Medium deep dish with veggies, medium thin crust with four cheese and an order of mozzarella sticks. The thin crust was my baby, and HELLO, CHEESE BOMB. And, inexplicably, this was definitely not a good thing. The four cheese was about three cheeses too much. It had congealed into a hard layer that totally overwhelmed both the crust and the non-existent sauce. I used up all the sauce for the mozzi sticks and then heated up some Prego to dip my slices into to provide some of the tomato bite I love. Worst of all, the cheese was fairly flavorless. The deep dish seemed to go over better but hey, I want MY pizza to be yummy, too. Sorry, PB, but I won't be coming back anytime soon.

54.description: I'm kinda with Jason C. on this one. First time here, my brother ordered a large sausage mushroom pizza deal and I got the grilled chicken sandwich and cheese fries.Pizza was ok, but I've had better. The cheese fries had way too much cheese on it. The sandwich was ok, but bland. Had nice bread, the chicken wasn't dry, came with lettuce, tomato and mayo, but just lacking some flavor.Today, went for lunch. We got the italian beef with fries and pop and meatball sub.My guy said Italian beef was ok, but not much flavor, but bread was good. My meatball sub was massive. The meatballs were huge and like Jason C. said, it was hard to eat. It made the bread fall apart. Either I was eating bread or meatball, but hard to eat together. Also, bland.....no taste too it. Good portions and the bread and quality is there, but BLAND!

48.description: After reading a lot of these reviews I was scared......but with such low hopes in mind I actually was pleasantly surprised.  This place wasn't as terrible as everyone makes it out to be.  The food was "ok".  Certainly not amazing but wasn't terrible. I had the boneless chicken wings, fries and cookies. I've certainly had a lot worse then this place.

44.description: Never again. I should have known after calling and being put on hold indefinitely to give up on ordering pizza from this place but instead I decided I wanted something new and called back (to be put back on hold for 3 mins). I order my pizza at 6:40pm (the receipt was time stamped) and it arrived cold and plastic looking at 8:10pm. I called at about 7:30 and was told the driver would be there any second. When I called back at 8:00pm the man that answered said "would you like me to cal the driver to see if he got in an accident". When the driver finally arrived he made me come down to greet him at the door instead of using the buzzer and doing the elevator. He said it was because he didn't know the name but I paid by credit card and it is listed right on the receipt. Once I met him at the door he than requested that I go back up and get the coupon I had mentioned when placing the order. I understand this is customary and I have no issue with this but after waiting over an hour and a half for pizza delivery I couldn't believe I was getting anything but an apology. Long story short (ok not so short) the pizza was cold as you would expect and not worth the wait. Do yourself a favor and order from elsewhere.

24.description: Terrible service. Don't even think about asking questions regarding the items on their menu. The woman behind the counter will shoot you a, "just order damn it! A pizza is a pizza!" look and will act like she's doing you such a big favor by taking your order. Really? Skip this one. There are a ton of better pizza places out there with waaay better service.

7.description: This place managed to regain my business over the last few years when the owner herself delivered my pizza after my last caustic review.  I was a reluctant return customer because of the location convenience and the delivery to my neighborhood.  And while we enjoy the pizza, the customer service is always the infuriating factor.  They can't seem to get it together, and don't seem to care.I wanted to place a delivery order tonight, but the smug chick who is manning the phone apparently has horrific call management skills, answers without letting anyone get a word in edgewise and says "can you hold please. thank you," never again to return to the line.  Three times I was put on hold and three times I was on hold for in excess of four minutes before hanging up.  The last time I called, she actually hung up on me.   Well, her little rude unsophisticated ass just cost them a regular customer.  I hope it's worth whatever reduced hourly rate they must be paying her.

49.description: I love the pizza at Pizzeria Brandi. A large slice of sausage, pepperoni, cheese or spinach with a can of pop is just over $4. Pretty great lunch value. One night, I was feeling adventurous and ordered the boneless chicken wings. I assumed they'd be just any other frozen ball of breaded chicken with the sauce really doing the work. When they brought out my plate, I thought they were kidding. I had a plate of what was quite clearly a breaded chicken breast that had been cut into strips and covered with sauce. At least it tasted okay. The focaccia sandwiches are pretty great.Nice, cozy little place!

40.description: My review is bumped up to 3 stars only because of past experiences which have been good. Lately though... not so much. Recently ordered delivery of two of their specialty pizzas which both came late, cold and soggy. I understand the max two topping rule to insure perfect pizza, but these concoctions (which sounded good) are specifically on their menu so we wanted to try them. I'm sure they would have been good if they came in hot. You almost want to tell them not to have them on the delivery menu unless they could get it there in time. I've had their meatball sandwich which is pretty big and used to be good, but the last two times I ordered it they have come back dry. So, I'm not sure why the lack of attention to detail lately, but I think I've made my last order.

53.description: I was amused when I found this eatery on line today ... they have a Brandi Salad, a Brandi spinach special as well as a a Brandi special pizza & a Brandi Supreme pizza. PLENTY Brandi to go around, boys!! .. wait ... oops... *never mind* Anyway ....There are some things that should only be consumed immediately  (after it is made ... FRESH)I discovered Gnocci roughly a year ago - since then, (elsewhere) I've had it fresh ... I've had it reheated from frozen (GROSS!).  When I saw Gnocci on their menu, I was *so* excited - When ordering,  I was assured it was fresh.  YAY!The delivery fee was reasonable & was quick enough -- The meal was immense.  When you order, the gnocci is served with a salad & a roll.  Those in the office decended like vultures ... everyone wanted to sample the gnocci ... WAIT! that's ... MINE .... ** peering at the NOW empty dish **"What's yours? looks empty to me ...." ... DAMMIT.. GUESS  who's *now* going on speed dial? (and NOT just because we share a name!!)

30.description: We waited an hour for burgers last night. People came and went picking up their orders and finally I asked if they forgot to make our food. "No, its in the oven now". Oh ok. Next thing I know, everyone back there is whispering and looking at me. Not a good sign. Finally we get our burnt burgers and all they could say was that it takes too long to make patties in the middle of making other food so that's why it took so long to make a burnt burger. If the food would have been good, this place would still be terrible on account of the Velvet Lounge that's adjoins this place. BLASTING old chicago house, while the restaurant had their own dance music on. There we were in music hell for an hour waiting for the food we didn't even eat. This place needs to get a clue, fast.

46.description: I'm not sure why there is no love for Brandi.  I am a big fan of their $3.00 slices of pizza.  Just a short walk from the office, I can be in and out in under 5 min to pick up a slice to go.  They put fresh packages of parmesan and crushed red pepper in the bag as well!My office orders from here regularly but I cannot comment of their other foods, as I stick to the slices of cheese.  Yum!

1.description: Oof there is so much wrong here that I don't know where to start.First, the pricing is not what you might expect. I ordered a medium pizza with 2 cokes and saw the price nearly double from the number on the menu, to over $30 - for a pizza and two sodas. Why the leap in price? I asked for deep pan. The menu mentions that there is a surcharge (although doesn't say what it is). When I got the credit card receipt to sign, I was puzzled, so asked about it. "Yeah, that's the tourist price" the guy 'explained' as if that made everything fine. After effectively being called a gullible tourist, I was told the wait is 45 minutes for one pizza! So, I cancelled the order and we got already-made slices instead. "Was it worth it?" the guy sneered as I signed the now cheaper receipt.After that, my friend and I took our slices outside. To top it all off, they were really, REALLY poor. I have had pizza in a lot of cities, so it was disappointing to come to Chicago and taste Brandi's soggy, greasy, cardboard-like pizza. I managed to get one slice down and threw the other one in the trash. My friend did the same.I like Chicago a lot, so I am going to hope that this isn't the typical Chicago pizza experience, because it's fit for no one - not even a "tourist".

55.description: I've had their thin crust pizza and it was fabulous! I've ordered from them twice, both times one their web site; once I had it delivered and the other time I picked it up. Both times it was ready exactly when they said it would be and was piping hot.

9.description: I love the food! I come here at least once a week. The ladies are always fast and polite!

26.description: I ordered the chicken lemon soup and chicken parm sandwich to go. I waited for over 20 for my meal. There were three other people in the restaurant so i was not sure why it took so long to get my food. I asked if there was a spoon in the bag and they said yes. When I got back to my hotel, sure enough the spoon was missing, so I had to slurp it up. The soup was very good and the sandwich was decent, i was just not impressed with the service.

25.description: Avoid! Seriously. Food arrived 1hr 45 min after ordering. I ordered through Grubhub. They had my address wrong, even though it was printed! Pizza was totally wrong, I specified that half the pizza would be just cheese. It wasn't. Pizza and wings were cold. And their customer service was rude and they were completely unhelpful. Unless you like rude service and cold food, AVOID!!!

12.description: Picked up a slice today and highly disappointed. Had to wait 8 mins for slice to be reheated. Customer service was poor, 4 people behind the counter nobody opened their mouth to say "may I help you".I won't return.

59.description: After many different attempts, Brandi is now the go-to for pizza delivery for this Pilsenite. They have a deal for a 14 inch thin crust 1 topping for 9.95, you can't beat that. The crust is just right, crispy, but chewy enough so that it doesn't feel like a cracker. Lots of cheese and there are a wide variety of toppings (fresh garlic, fresh basil, ricotta, bleu cheese, etc.), always arrives in about 45 minutes.

21.description: My boyfriend and I discovered this place when we moved to South Loop last summer and were instant fans!  He always gets the Chicago-style deep dish pizza (pepperoni) and I always order the Meat-Za pizza.  The first few times it was great - the deep dish was as indulgent as it is supposed to be and the meat-za pizza tasted full of flavor.  Also, anytime we interacted with the staff they were always friendly and helpful, so we were happy to make this our local pizzeria. Slowly, however, the quality of the food has deteriorated.  The last three times we have ordered delivery of the same items as above it has just gotten worse and worse, to the point that last night's order will most likely be our last, sadly.  I honestly hate to say it, but the only item that didn't disappoint last night was the canned soda :/ Last night and before, we have also ordered a couple sides and non-Italian dishes and unfortunately they usually tasted funky/old or overly greasy.Still always have a pleasant experience when interacting with the staff, which is why I regretfully am giving it such a low rating.  I honestly liked the place, but it's truly a shame about the decreasing quality of the food.

17.description: I made my way in to Pizzeria Brandi only minutes before they were to close. Despite that fact, the staff was patient and helpful. I ordered a slice of pizza and a fountain drink. The nice guy at the register threw in an extra slice, and the guy preparing the pizza added spinach to both slices for me, since there were only cheese slices left. They were unexceptional, but I always appreciate good customer service.

10.description: HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICESTAFF is extremely rude on the phone. Food is HORRIBLE. do not eat here if you want to be hung up on !! do not eat here if you want an extremely late delivery. I hope the woman at the restaurant reads  this, you know who you are Karma is a BITCH. just like you guys! One star is too good for this merchant

5.description: I come here often when I am working at McCormick convention center. They always have slices ready and hot. They do get really busy at lunch when there is a convention, but I've never waited more than 10-15 min for ordered food (vs slices). The pizza is awesome. They even have spinach slices. Check out the old school pizza oven through the order window. The decor is cool with Italian movie posters and old turn old turn off the century Chicago photos and, what I'd guess are 1950's family pictures.

3.description: Fantastic example of traditional Chicago deep dish pizza! Highly recommend this local home in the wall. Deep dish is worth the 40 minute wait...service was excellent

35.description: Avoid this place  So frustrating that a local business cannot get it together. Was really looking forward to pizza tonight. Hour and a half later still no pizza.

19.description: Good Chicago style pizza in the south side of the City. Small but outdoor seating is available. Good people run it

28.description: Its really a shame.  The woman taking my order was sweet, the pizza was great but the other woman yelled at me for wanting ice not knowing it was empty.  Its pretty apparent that the recipe is here is great.  Now they just need some customer service!  Let's hope that wasn't Brandi!

45.description: Great tasting pizza and delicious Italian ices...  prices reasonable... I will come bak for the raspberry wings...

33.description: We tried Pizzeria Brandi on a groupon and everyone was very happy with it.  The pizza was very tasty with a sweet taste to the sauce that was nice.  Fresh ingredients and it was cooked well done as we had requested.  We split the calabrese sandwich and the napoletana sandwich.  The prosciutto was very salty, but other than that, the sandwiches were good too.  We'll definitely be back for carry out.

43.description: My much delayed return trip, and I can say they fixed the fry issue by going with your run-of-the-mill pre-fab crinkle cut fries.  Nothing special about them, but they are cooked right and now eatable.  I can also report I actually got ketchup this time without even asking.  I have also had a chance to sample a few bites of their 'za that a friend ordered, and it was pretty good.  They get the 1-star upgrade to 3.

2.description: Better off going to a local bar for food, same quality wireless taste. With a Budd, he said the beef was"ok"

18.description: This place is the height of mediocrity.  The food is OK, nothing special or noteworthy, and the settings is really, really casual...just a few chairs in an unadorned restaurant.  The servers are very nice.  This is my 2nd time eating here and the food tasted exactly the same- 1) A well priced personal Chicago Pizza with Jalapeños for $5.99 2) An overly expensive marina linguini with fried onions, mushrooms, and jalapenos for $12.87.  I asked for more toppings and the cashier, Linda, immediately offered to get me some more, then asked how it was.  This joint is difficult to place - not quite fast or cheap enough to be fast food, not quite classy or tasty enough to be high end or notable.  I will not be going back, nor would I dissuade anyone who would like to give it a gander.

41.description: I have definitely had better....I am a pizza lover.  I probably have to have pizza at least once a week... at least.  Seeing how pizzeria brandi was so close to us, I naturally had to try it.  Now... I am a crazy cheese lover.  I will actually melt cheese on a plate and eat it.  Thats right.  But their pizza was SO cheesy that I couldn't handle it.  The cheese was just WAYYYY too thick and the quality wasn't right.  I mean..  I ate it just cuz I needed my pizza fix... but ... Never Again. Sorry pizzeria brandi..  you def didn't make the cut.

52.description: So I saw this place and decided to give it a try. I walked in and ordered a 10 inch deep dish and the pizza did take a little bit longer to cook but it's cuz of how they make it.The place had tables to sit down and eat but I got it "to go". When I got the pizza I took my first bite and it was very flavorful. It was a pepperoni, and yes there was a lot of cheese but that's what makes it a deep dish. The crust wasn't to crunchy (which I like) and the pizza was very filling. You don't need to eat a whole lot to get full. And the prices are very reasonable. Good place to stop by if your hungry and want some pizza for good price.

50.description: Stopped in here after picking up dry cleaning at CD....should have gone to White Castle across the street for a number of reasons. Reason #1: ordered a simple hamburger that comes with fries. I aged 5 years waiting for it. And it was the most disgusting thing I have eaten in a long time. Reason#2: when asked for mustard on said hamburger was assured when hamburger came up that it had mustard already on it and they threw some catsup packets at me. They have NO mustard in the restaurant. They said. Reason #3: asked for a cup of ice. No icemaker in the restaurant. I should have walked out then and not even bothered to order.This place seems rinky dink with some average window dressing and a clean seating area. BTW....the hamburger DID NOT have mustard on it. Only mayo. Who the F puts mayo on a hamburger? It is a serious question. Who does? Oh yea, Pizzeria Brandi. Never again......it was disgusting.

4.description: Arrived here at 1PM.  I Ordered a small Thin Crust Peperoni Pizza and a water.   The restaurant was maybe half full and there were 2 girls working.  I watched many tables get their food before me, and they arrived after I did.  My pizza hit the table at 1:50pm.  50 Minutes!!  although she didnt bring me any plates, napkins or my drink.   She said it was on the way.  I waited 5 minutes then went to the counter to get plates, napkins and my drink.  Finally after several minutes she gave them to me and I sat back down to eat my now cold pizza.  Which BTW was subpar at best.  What an awful experience to taste cardboard.  I would never return and want to warn anyone about this place.  Papa Johns is across the street FYI

6.description: Some of the reviews don't seem very deserving of this wonderful place.  So what if you have to wait over 30 minutes for a pizza?　If you want a quick pizza, go to Little Caesars and get a piece of cardboard with cheese and sauce on it.  The pizza at Brandi is as authentic as Chicago deep dish can be, and therefore, it takes time to cook.  If you got rude service, the lady behind the counter is probably up to her wits with dealing with dumb and impatient people who don't know what the hell they want or have a million demands... no different from any other business.  We ordered, and the lady was courteous.My wife and I visited Chicago, and this place happened to be right down the street from our hotel.  We ventured there for lunch after an exhausting five hour train ride and 45 minute walk to our hotel.  I eat pizza probably once a week, and have Chicago-style deep dish frequently around Detroit.  Yet, the pizza we got here was among the best we ever had.  We ordered a small, deep dish with chicken and half tomatoes (for her side) for $15.  We waited and waited... and waited.  It is worth the wait, and we were in no hurry.  We were the only people in there at around noon.  When our pizza arrived, it was massive.  The chicken we ordered was actually huge chicken patties covered in cheese and tons of sauce.  It was too hot to eat at first.  We obviously couldn't finish it and took half of it back to the hotel.  We ate it cold later that night, and it still tasted good.So, if your service was shitty or food messed up, go somewhere else... big deal.  There's a pizza place on every corner in Chicago.  But, when I go back to Chicago, I'll be back here  if we're on the south side..

22.description: Very impressed. Ordered a pizza and the owner delivered so people wouldn't have to wait. Very cool I think their service and quality are turning around!

15.description: I work for Ford Motor Company, I stay at the Hyatt Regency down the street. I was referred to the pizzeria by a coworker 3 years ago, and I have referred other engineers to the place since I learned about it. I have really enjoyed ordering pizza and dining there over the years. Except for my last visit. There is something fundamentally wrong with this place. The girl behind the counter was genuinely annoyed with our ordering ability and shamed us horrible for not following whatever process she believed we should be following to order a pizza. It was 7:30 at night and there was nobody ordering except us. Clearly not stressed because there were allot of us ordering.  She glared at us and scoffed at our desire to order a large pizza, stating that we only needed a medium. Then I dared to order a drink, a can of Orange Crush that she shamed me over because it wasn't a fountain drink. Geez,  just sell me the can of pop without the drama. When I told her I didn't like her attitude, she stated that her grandmother was the owner and that she had to be tough like that for her. Well congratulations, you are not only tough but you just chased away a good customer. I will not tell others about your restaurant because I would hate for them to have to deal with a person such as you, this counter girl that believes she is royalty and thinks she can treat people like a pissed off Spanish Queen. Well don't worry, I won't annoy you again, nor will I let my colleagues annoy you either. In fact, when I got to the hotel i noticed a man carrying a deep dish pizza in the elevator. He was from out of town and heard of this great pizza place called Giordanos. I usually would have referred him to your place, but instead I congratulated him on a wise choice. Spanish queen, enjoy your reign and solitude. When you wonder where all the business went that your grandmother had gathered during her tenure, you can look in the mirror and know it was you that ruined her business. Me, I am going elsewhere for my pizzas. Great food, zero points for a hostile ordering experience.

57.description: Pizza - they have deep dish, but thin is a better way to go here. The other food is good, not great. I gave it 4 stars due to the deals, great thin crust & effort to make it a sit down 'warm' place vs sterile.Small place, but has table cloth tables & small tv.

20.description: I debated writing this review, simply because I only had their fries. But the reality is, If you can't make an order of fries taste good, then I question the rest of your menu. I was the only person in the place so the only order of which to put their energy, was my order.  The Garlic Parmesan fries - tasted like a mix of old fries that had been sitting in the basket (oily and darker than the rest) and new fries. All the fries tasted like they'd been fried in really old grease, and the fries barely had Parmesan on them. For $3.21 for these fries, I thought they'd be delicious. The fries, along with the bland marinara sauce that accompanied the fries, was mediocre. I won't be back.

36.description: Really mediocre pizza and not much else is really worth it either.I got a thin crust Brandi Supreme but with the way they cook it means the toppings are under cheese and won't really get cooked through. Also there is a lot of cheese and not enough sauce so the pie was pretty dry. The one thing I really like is there chocolate chip cookies which are apparently fresh baked and taste awesome.

14.description: Delicious pizza. Not sure why others hated on this so much. Sauce was really tasty, lots of cheese and meat. Generous portion. Friendly service too.

58.description: I have been to this place thrice. And my fav is Chicken basil fried rice, medium spicy. Curry fried rice was ok, not that great. I also like chicken satay and fried wontons. And yeah, thai ice tea is the best.

56.description: I've eaten at this location on several occasions (over appx 4 years) and for the most part, been great.However, I have noticed the last few times (say 5), been a little disappointed.  I always get the same thing (Chicken Pad Thai) and I've noticed there is very little chicken (has really decreased over time).  I really don't just want the noodles.  That said, I've been disappointed, even though its still good.I was there in July and we asked to have our left overs wrapped up and after waiting 10-15 minutes, they never returned.  When I inquired, they didn't have them (hoping they didnt pack and give to another customer).  They did give us fresh to go, which was in the small container and way less than what we had sent back & asked to be wrapped up to take home. Owell.I will still be back, but just need to manage my expectations a little more. :(

29.description: Fantastic Food! Period. Nice ambience and convenient location with Park Chicago Curbside Parking right in front!

42.description: Great thai place to eat if you're ever in town. My friend took me here and I love their pad thai noodle. To top it off I had their authentic thai ice tea. Will definitely stop by again!

23.description: My husband and I have been eating at Opart Thai since we were college students (about 8 years ago). We still can't stay away. The food is superb. The Tiger Cry has unbelievably juicy and tasty pieces of beef - do yourself a favor and try it.  The Tom Yum soup is superb. The perfect heat and taste. My only problem is, I can't afford this place regularly!

47.description: I ordered from here off of GrubHub and delivery was absurdly quick.  The food was made and delivered to my door within 30 minutes of my putting the order in online - and I lived just blocks away from Grant Park where Lollapalooza was still going on mind you.I had the crab rangoon, the moo ping, and a side of sticky rice.  All of them were on par with to slightly better than what I've had at other Thai restaurants.

8.description: The best Thai place to eat a full,  heartly meal,  this side west of Bangkok. Also,  by far the best place on the south loop.

31.description: Love the food and the staff are very friendly. Evert time I come here I never walk out disappointed. Love the Tiger Cry , and pot stickers

34.description: If I am in the mood for Thai in Chicago, there is no choice but to head to Opart Thai House. The food is consistently delicious and fresh. The Tiger Cry is not to be missed! I also really enjoy the Spicy Fried Tofu. The curries are numerous and all delicious! This is authentic Thai in a relaxed, cool atmosphere.

16.description: The ambiance of Opart Thai is pretty awesome. We really liked the lighting and art pieces they had at the restaurant. Service was great here, with multiple people filling up waters and making sure you're doing ok. We got two dishes, the Khao Soy and the Peanut Sauce Lover. The Khao Soy we decided to get because a lady next to us was eating it and it looked so so good. Sadly, looks can be deceiving. Like your ex AMIRITE?? Or not...Anyways the Khao Soy had all the things that I would typically enjoy; coconut curry, onions, egg noodles, chicken, and lime. Sounds like a winner right? It wasn't. I don't know why I didn't like it, it tasted one note. We got our dish ordered hot on the spicy scale and the spice completely overwhelmed the subtlety of the dish. So that's on me I guess. But my wife loved it soooooo. To each his own I guess.The Peanut Sauce Lover was great though. The beef was nice and tender and the sauce was silky and velvety. The cashews add some texture which was welcome. Definitely have it with rice, otherwise the dish isn't enough to share. Speaking of rice, they only give you a small portion of it here. About half of what is the norm for Asian restaurants. Although the prices were phenomenal so you can't really complain, $19 for two dishes. All in all this is a pretty safe bet if you want some local Thai. But if you're thinking about driving 20+ minutes to eat here, you can probably find a place just as good next to you.

13.description: Whenever I'm in Chicago and need my Thai fix, this is where I go. I used to live 2 blocks from here and lucky was I for this fact since Opart Thai House makes some exceptionally tasty Thai food!Now living in Austin, where Thai food has been quite disappointing, it was so good to order from here while visiting Chicago recently. I was in a duck kind of a mood and on this visit, I ordered their roasted duck with Chinese broccoli and sauce over rice and their red curry with roasted duck, basil, pineapple, tomato, peppers and amazingness. Both were delicious and just what I needed to satisfy my Thai food desires. It should be noted that their menu is very extensive and there are so many options to choose from. I have to say not every item is as exceptional, but there are more good dishes not not so good. Order to your tummy's content and try a variety of things; they make great left overs. I love Thai food, and miss it greatly while in Austin.Atmosphere is clean, decorated nicely and service is great too.

11.description: My sister and I came here for lunch. She was craving Thai food. We read a bunch of the reviews and almost everyone mentioned the Tiger Cry so of course we had to try that. It was good but extremely salty. It came with the sauce and the sauce was very flavorful but also very salty. The meat came on top of a piece of lettuce. My sister and I split the lettuce at the bottom and put the meat on top and rolled it up so it could help balance the saltiness of the meat. The cucumber was very good. It also helped to balance all the flavors.We also ordered the Crab Rangoon. This was very different from Chinese restaurant versions. It was folded differently, almost like a little bag, so all the stuff inside would ooze out when you bite into it. The skin was extremely crispy. The filling was flavorful. We loved it. This was our favorite here.My sister ordered the Gaeng Pet Ped (Red curry with roasted duck, pineapple and tomatoes). This was different. We usually eat duck when it is roasted, with the skin crispy, but this particular dish had the duck drenched in the red curry. It wasn't bad. I ordered fried catfish with green beans and red curry paste. It was very spicy. It didn't hit us in the beginning while we were eating. Both dishes were good. We also ordered Thai Tea, which is always a must when I eat Thai food.

39.description: I generally get my entrees vegetable only.  The tofu is completely unnecessary.  The pork has always proven enjoyable, but their chicken has always been disappointing.  The pieces are too large to really take on the flavor of the dish before cooked.  You ultimately end up with a lot of gamey, tough chunks of chicken that you're not going to eat.

37.description: Place is definitely overrated. The food is ok, but not for the price. Egg roles are terrible.

0.description: The other two Thai places I always went to around the Sloop closed down (Ma & I and Sala Bua), so we had to resort to this.  A lot of people I know have been hyping it up for a while, so we wanted to give it a shot.  Did not let us down one bit, and it's definitely better than the other two places were.We got some soup, pad see ew (sp?), and the infamous Tiger Cry appetizer.  Tiger Cry is legit and a must get!!  Perfectly cooked and flavored cube cut pieces of beef.  Kind of similar to the French Cut Style Beef Tenderloin from Go4Food.

38.description: Been getting delivery from here for the past couple of years and it has always been great. The tiger cry is the best thing I've ever tried here. Delicious meat with an addicting sauce Tom yom goong is delicious. Perfectly sour with lots of mushrooms, yum! The gaeng daeng curry is REALLY good. So delicious, only complaint is the small portion I've tried both pad Thai and pad see yeu and both Ive been indifferent about. Need to step up the noodle game Overall one of my fave Thai places to order from but usually stick to the curry and tiger cry.

51.description: Consistent great Thai food. Extremely affordable. Best spot in the neighborhood! Very clean and friendly service.

27.description: Delivery was fast!  I ordered online and the food was to our door within 30 mins.Pad thai was good. Flavors were there and shrimp was fresh.Masaman curry was also good.  Curry flavor was mild and creamy.  Chicken was tender.  We got it with brown rice which was cooked perfectly.Papaya salad was boring - the papaya itself was a bit tough, seasoning was also not exciting.  I'm typically a huge fan of papaya salads, this one just didn't do much for me.  Pad Kra Praow Pla - the sautéed sole fish was REALLY spicy.  I like heat so it didn't bother me too much but I definitely welcomed the curry breaks in between bites.  I was really disappointed the fish was actually deep fried even though the menu indicated it's sautéed. All in all the food did not disappoint but it did not really wow us either.  The portions are small for the price.  Thai delivery is really a dime a dozen and I'm not convinced this will be our go-to place.

32.description: Went here about a week or two ago with my wife. We ordered a spring roll appetizer and an order of shrimp pad see ew. When we went to pickup and got home, the spring rolls were actually tofu satay. We called the restaurant back and they said they will make another order of spring rolls for us. Since we only live a block away, it was convenient to go pick it up. The pad see ew was good, nothing really set it apart from others we've had, but given how convenient it is for us and how much my wife likes Thai food, we'll be back

54.description: Finally found my go to Thai restaurant to fix my cravings! I haven't had a chance to dine in but my take out experiences have been great. Favorites on the menu - tiger cry and gaeng daeng, both very flavorful dishes!

48.description: This is my go-to Thai restaurant in Chicago. Good quality food all-around. It's hard for me to find a reason to travel farther for Thai food when Opart Thai is 2 blocks from my apartment.

44.description: Disappointed at this Thai establishment! Thai food being one of my top go to food and since I have been craving for some good thai food every since I moved to Chicago - I thought to give this a try since they had such high rating. Totally disappointed :(. So first to mention the good things - they have a free parking lot at the back of the store which is great for some one who sucks at parallel parking. They will substitute tofu as protein for any of their dishes. The soup tom yum broth was really flavorful and tat is where the good things end. They don't have soft tofu and they use this tofu which they semi fry but the texture is really tough and taste like old tofu which has been sitting around for long. The basil fried rice was not spicy nor tasted or smelt of basil. The Pad Ped (Normally my fav Thai Curry) had no gravy/sauce and the veges were still left raw so they had no flavor. The fresh roll does not taste or look like a fresh roll - it is a semi fried veg roll with tofu and sauce poured over it. The tofu satay with peanut sauce and cucumber salad tastes weird - again I think becoz of the tofu they use...Over all still looking for a good Thai Place...any recommendations?

24.description: I used to LOVE this place until I found out that they use MSG! It's widely known that MSG causes a whole slew of health problems including strokes.  It's unfortunate that restaurants rely on MSG instead of using fresh ingredients and good spices to make their food taste good.

7.description: I think that their khol Soi is the best I have ever had. They make an amazing dish according to your spice level. Since it is very close to my house, I take out of order from there almost every week. I would totally recommend this place for a perfect, delicious and easy on the wallet Thai food .

49.description: The best green curry! Addictive my spivey and flavorful! Great place go for dinner close to the convention center. Walkable!

40.description: If you live in the South Loop neighborhood and haven't given this restaurant a chance, get yourself right in there.  They had this interesting fountain artwork on their bar counter, when I asked what it was I was told it was feng shuy and that it had brought their business luck.  Love that!  I had the spicy veggie curry, opted for medium heat, which was right on.  If you are looking for intimate, quiet restaurant, this is not it but comfortable enough environment for group discussions over a good meal.

53.description: Look no further, hands down best Thai food in Chicago!  From the Pad Thai to their Curry dishes, this place is great! The owners are so friendly, it is a family business, and they use the best ingredient for their dishes. And you can tell. When dishes like the Tiger Cry (which you must try) come from their mom's recipe you know it's legit. All in all, this place is a usual in our restaurant rotation. You must now go and try it also. Let me know what you thought!

30.description: I had heard amazing things about this restaurant and so was excited to try it. The delivery came quickly and was hot, but honestly the food was really nothing special. The red curry was not flavorful, and the peanut sauce with chicken was watery and flavorless. Both dishes had such thin and watery sauces. I was pretty disappointed. I'll stick to Sala Bua for my Thai fix from here on out!

46.description: So very disappointing. I live down the street, we used to eat here occasionally. I thought it was meh with a few ok go-to dishes. Now its just gross. Ordered some hard-to ruin dishes tonight, including their 'specialty' the tiger cry. everything was bland, little flavor, no heat, and the tempura was bad on a few levels. Sadly, not going back. Another neighborhood joint takes a dive. Boo.

1.description: I used to live 2 blocks away and would dine in and pick up from here almost weekly. During that time period I loved this place!Just ordered delivery from there tonight though and it was extremely disappointing. The pad see ewe we ordered spicy was not spicy at all. Not even a HINT of spice. The chicken larb we ordered medium and it was way too spicy. Not sure how they messed this up because we ordered online and input all the specifications. The icing on the cake was the side of sticky rice that was rock hard and inedible. It's a shame how much the quality has fallen. The only upside was the quick delivery, but I won't be eating from here again.

55.description: Make sure you call first to verify Opart is open. I wasted 30 minutes deciding on what i would order for my  family. I called at 10:30PM To place a deliver order and was told Opart was closed because "it's slow today". The Opart yelp webpage have hours open until 11PM on Saturday.  I'm so upset and have decided that I will now order late night food from a business that follows their posted hours to avoid this issue in the future. In  result of the Opart owner/manager trying  to save money on labor cost they have lost a long time customer. lol

9.description: Came here with a group of 14 on a Saturday on a whim and was impressed by their service. The staff seated us quickly and accommodated all our crazy requests. We probably had 7 separate checks and not everyone was sitting nicely in 2's and 4's, we were all over the place. The waitress was not only able to divide everything accurately on the checks, but also when they brought the food out. Another thing that Opart did very well was keeping up with water. They had pitchers of water on our tables but we never had to use them because their servers were on point. Our group was also a little drunk and loud so I appreciate Opart for their willingness to accommodate, I did not get to thank them in person.Also food was good.

26.description: Did not like the dumpling appetizer (basically just fried, very thick bread around a ball of questionable pork - don't order these unless you want state-fair style breaded pork) or the noodle dish that I got. There is no other way to sum this place up except that it just isn't good. I won't be ordering from here again.

25.description: Opart Thai never disappoints!Whether you're looking for classic Pad Thai or something more adventurous, you won't be disappointed. We've dined in and we regularly get delivery. I even recently had them cater lunch for 60+ at my office and it was excellent, on-time, and plentiful for the cost of a hot catered lunch.Highly recommended!

12.description: Simple, easy and great food!  They also serve wine.  Kids love this place too.  Best Pad See Ew shrimp ever according to my son!  Tasty Chinese broccoli mixed in noodle dishes.

59.description: So, not the prettiest Thai restaurant in town....and not the friendliest service....but the food was pretty solid. We started with the Tofu Satay, which I thought was great, though I wish the peanut sauce would have had a little more zing to it. The tofu was good quality, and was fried perfectly. For my entree, I ended up getting a dish with beef, and the beef was only so-so....wish I would have stuck with the tofu. But the vegetables in the entree were excellent! A good variety, and very fresh tasting. And the egg noodles were quite good. All in all, if you have vegan friends visiting, and they are staying near McCormick, this is probably your best restaurant option within walking distance.

21.description: Have had good pad Thai here before, but last night's take out order brought with it a case of horrible food poisoning. WASH YOUR HANDS AFTER TOUCHING YOUR ASS!!

17.description: Customer service is amazing that is why I am giving two stars instead of 1. The food was not that good. I tried pad Thai and pad see ew. I am not a picky eater at all and I could not eat either. Best customer service ever though. I hope their dishes improve because it is a welcoming environment.

10.description: Had amazing dinner here and really nice staff as well. The price is not to bad for a entree about 8$ and everything tastes fresh and had a lot of flavor to it!

5.description: 5 stars. Special Kudos for the delicious Spicy Seafood Soup! Really good service and great atmosphere. Will come back again. Thank you!!!

3.description: Totally decent thai but wasn't blown away. The cucumber salad wasn't very fresh tasting, the cucumbers were not very crisp. The spicy seafood soup was pretty good, definitely a very strong flavor of lime and the right amount of spice. It contained shrimp, imitation crab and octopus. The curries weren't quite what I was expecting. Panang is just chicken in sauce with no veggies at all and the chicken had a really weird consistency. Red curry was better with some veggies and a better flavored sauce but neither one was mind blowing. Reasonably priced but not really a strong reason to make a return visit.

35.description: We have delivery from this place. Our order consisted of seafood fried rice, chicken pad Thai, tiger cry, wonton and egg drop soup and shrimp sticks. Overall I thought the food was fresh and well prepared. The tiger cry seemed to be what most enjoyed. However I had the seafood fried rice and it was good yet once I had a bit of soy sauce it was much better. I would get food from them if I'm ever in the mood for takeout.

19.description: Yes, yes, a hundred times yes. I am so dramatic.Finally, a good Thai place in Chicago. It's been an arduous search. I certainly haven't been to them all, but Opart has been the best yet. 6 months ago when I moved here, I began to hunt for the best Thai, and then 3 months later I stopped in my tracks because I was getting so discouraged... Opart has lifted my spirits. Opart is definitely set o'part from the rest. Oh man that was good.Tiger Cry is just as good as everyone else says. Curries were wonderful and packed with veggies and meat. The walls were decorated with Thai-related "stuff", but not in a gaudy or tacky way. I was wearing jeans and a puffer jacket, the couple next to us had on PJ's, two tables away sat three cops, in one corner was a woman in a nice dress, and there were about five first dates happening. My point is, this place is good for everyone.

28.description: great pad thai! overall,  I'll eat again.

45.description: AVOID this place at all costs!!!! They are horrible to deal with! Twice on their website we have ordered delivery, after some time of not receiving our order, we have called them to discover the order came through as pick up. The first time we thought it was our fault, the second time we knew it was not our fault... Call them and someone will treat you like shit telling you that they are right and you are wrong... Ask to speak to a manager and she will not be there for several days. Good food but HORRIBLE service!!!

33.description: After reading all the remarkable reviews I decided to try out this place with my mother one late afternoon  (about a month ago). The service was horrible, no communication for our waitress at all. She handed us or menus and came back a couple of mins later she stood in front of our table and said nothing, I guess we were supposed to use nonverbal communication. We gave her our orders and she left the table, she didn't ask if we wanted drinks or anything. Fast forward, when we were halfway finished with our meals she gave us the check, and I proceeded to ask her if I could  have extra rice to go, she told me that she would go to the back and ask. Long story short, she never came back or said anything about my request. During our visit, we never received a 'welcome' or a 'thank you for coming'. And the food wasn't memorable at all... Maybe I came on the wrong day or at the wrong time.

43.description: The food here is consistently delicious. I particularly love the Thai Custard, yum.The different types of curries and variety in menu is very welcoming. I visit this friendly restaurant regularly, the young waiters are very courteous and friendly.  The restaurant decor is very appealing with plenty of ornaments to keep you busy looking and wondering. Over the years sadly the portions keep getting smaller for which I removed a star.

2.description: Done pick up (I live in west loop and miss the delivery radius by two blocks but the new Chicago Ave location delivers to us!) and dined in. Came in on a Friday around 6:30pm. Packed but got seated fast. They have a full bar and work quick.We split the giant wonton soup between two and then got Penang and green curries with chicken. It was yummy! Planning to pick up tonight but definitely going to try delivery from the new location next time I'm craving it!

18.description: Delivery was fast!  I ordered online and the food was to our door within 30 mins.Pad thai was good. Flavors were there and shrimp was fresh.Masaman curry was also good.  Curry flavor was mild and creamy.  Chicken was tender.  We got it with brown rice which was cooked perfectly.Papaya salad was boring - the papaya itself was a bit tough, seasoning was also not exciting.  I'm typically a huge fan of papaya salads, this one just didn't do much for me.  Pad Kra Praow Pla - the sautéed sole fish was REALLY spicy.  I like heat so it didn't bother me too much but I definitely welcomed the curry breaks in between bites.  I was really disappointed the fish was actually deep fried even though the menu indicated it's sautéed. All in all the food did not disappoint but it did not really wow us either.  The portions are small for the price.  Thai delivery is really a dime a dozen and I'm not convinced this will be our go-to place.

41.description: First Timer .  Ordered Fried Wontons, Chicken Satay, and Basil Chicken for pickup. Everything was really good. I will definitely order from here again

52.description: I've never eaten in, but this is the go-to delivery/carry out for Thai in the South Loop. They always have the food ready quickly, and it's always amazing. The red chicken curry and crab rangoons always satisfy my craving, and the dishes are big enough to split.

50.description: I wish I could give the restaurant five stars. This is was my second time at this location and thought .... The food is delicious. Disclosure- I'm vegetarian and am strictly speaking of their tofu dishes.... Both times I've been here the food has been fast and for the most part really good. However on both occasions my server seems disengaged. I had no water the majority of my stay. My server got half of my order before she was leaving. And in both occasions I had to go up to the counter and ask for sauces because my server never asked if I wanted them and was no where to be found. I understand if the restaurant is busy, I was a server myself. But when I can see you by the Courbet talking to your coworkers and your tables have not been attended, that's a red flag. I don't want my waiter to hound me but things like not running off and making sure your clients have water are basic necessities that every restaurant needs. I don't know maybe next time I'll order delivery and update this. The stars are only because of the food! The food rocked!!

4.description: Mediocre Thai at best. Also the Crab Rangoon was 80% cream cheese. I had the tiger cry which was just meat on lettuce but I put it over rice and it was decent, my bf had the pad Thai and it was very average and the beef was not that great. Don't think I'd eat it again.

6.description: Very authentic Thai food! My new favorite restaurant in Chicago. Some really good specialties include tom yum (soup), nam tok (beef) and pad siew. The ambience is spacious and servers are very nice and considerate.

22.description: 2nd time here, I try to not review on the 1st visit~ Came in a bigger group so I got to try more. Curry fried rice was awesome and their Tom Yum soup was great (nice & spicy). The tiger cry is yummy as well, other reviewers are correct in that being their top dish. I was recommended by a co-worker to try their peanut lover, it was good but not for me. Too sweet I think, and I requested spicy and it wasnt. That made me sad. Overall still good thou. I would go back, but not my go to thou.

15.description: Came here while visiting a friend in Chi-town. I ordered the pad thai, crab Rangoon and a mojito. The service was face. Opart has a nice restaurant atmosphere.My friends ordered the chicken and broccoli and shrimp fried rice and Mai Thai. The Chicagoan in the group said he goes once a week.

57.description: I got 99 reviews, and Opart Thai ain't one?! I must have thought I wrote one ages ago because this is my go-to Thai place in the city. Must try, the Tiger Cry! I'm not sure why this dish is called what it is. But one would guess it's because the beef is charbroiled to perfection, so tender, so delicious, it brings tears to a tiger's eyes, no? I haven't seen this dish at other Thai places so definitely get it while you're here. My other favorite dish is the Pad Kra Praow which I prefer it with ground pork. It's cooked with fresh basil and has a nice kick to it depending on your spice level. I don't know how authentic crab rangoon are to Thai/Asian cuisine, but they're freakin' delicious here.

20.description: Very authentic Thai food! My new favorite restaurant in Chicago. Some really good specialties include tom yum (soup), nam tok (beef) and pad siew. The ambience is spacious and servers are very nice and considerate.

36.description: This is my go-to place for thai delivery. My favorite dishes include pad thai, shrimp fried rice, pad prik king, and fried tofu. I usually add tofu and extra veggies to the pad thai and rice. My meat-eating boyfriend also loves the tiger cry appetizer.

14.description: Taste: 3.5Location: 4Cleanliness: 4Ambience: 4Value: 4Service: 4OVERALL = 3.92* Out of a 5-point scaleSurprisingly this was my first time eating at Opart Thai. I have a lot of friends who have been there multiple times and I've heard a lot of good things about this place.I ordered the Chicken Pad Thai and requested it Extra Hot, but nope it wasn't spicy at all. The taste, despite lacking the spiciness, was good. I also got the Tiger Cry, which was pretty good, but to me the meat was a little bit hard. Their Thai Iced Thai wasn't too shabby at all either. One of my friends had the Khao Soy (Boiled egg noodles with chicken in coconut curry soup topped with crispy egg noodles, onions and lime) which was not too bad. Overall, it was good food. Couldn't say it's great, or the best in Chicago, but it wasn't disappointing certainly.Their location is definitely convenient, located just a bit outside of Chinatown, and in the South Loop area.Their place is well-decorated with a lot of authentic Thai headdresses on their wall. The waitress was pretty good in handling our big party's order as well. We had about 18 people and food arrived pretty quick.Will I come back? Probably. But if I really crave for good Thai Food, I think I have several other go-to places in Chicago.

58.description: All the reviews on this bar are dead on.   - Good food at great prices (yes the tater tots are excellent) on a short & sweet menu - Lots of good beer on tap in addition to their bottles & cans - Free popcorn - Pool tables - Friendly staff - Great neighborhoodDefinitely going back

56.description: Solid local bar, without the thrills and frills of some neighboring establishments.  Bartenders are friendly, all locals hang out here, and it's super laid back.  Every month they have a beer special, which is nice, but at the same time, prices aren't outrageous.

29.description: Cheap beer pool tables no complaints the bartenders are polite. Doesn't ever get over crowded. Not the worst place in the world to grab a beer.

42.description: This place has been around FOREVER.  On the evening that I discovered the superior Weather Mark Tavern, we started off at Wabash Tap because my bf raved about it.So my buddy and I walked in and it was terrible.  Just terrible.  I do not know what the deal with this place is.  New floors, super dark, weird set up, random group of patrons....my friend and I politely drank one round of drinks.  When we left, we both  blurted, "WHAT WAS THAT?!?!"Shortly after, the bf and I were at Jewel and I tried to get him to cross the street with me to see the whole weirdness of the place.  He didn't seem in the mood to have his spirits crushed.  I affectionately call this place The Worst Bar in Chicago.

23.description: :) I like this place. It has a laid back atmosphere, professional bartenders and spaced out seating. You can go to Wabash Tap to watch a game, have a private conversation, play pool, or just sit quietly and relax. The bartenders will not hoover around, flirting, or acting inappropriate they serve you what you ask for and move on. They also sell greasy guilty pleasures if you get hungry, but 100% of their food is unhealthy, so if you are concerned about fat, calories, carbs or whatever you certainly aren't eating at a bar anyway, right? Come to Wabash Tap for some fries, a good beer, or to chat with some friendly people. The only cons of the place is the bathrooms are a bit shabby, but *shrugs* it is a dive bar not a spa, so that's kind of expected.

47.description: i love wabash tap its divey has cheap beer and good bartenders and its a great place to hang out in the south loop if you want cheap and easy its the place to go the service is way better than the Scout down the street who leave you sitting for 20min before u give up on table service and just order from the bar.. also i hear its great to watch games at too

8.description: I came in here for the first time last weekend. While not at all new to the city, I am new to the SL. Beer was cold, crowd was fun, bartenders were friendly, and the atmosphere is exactly what I like. I'll be back.

31.description: Gritty, grimy, maybe a bit dirty, but at least no one will ever accuse Wabash Tap of being pretentious. Not sure if I would categorize it as a "dive," per se, but it's definitely a far cry from the freshly-scrubbed and fratty Scout a block away. Eclectic group of patrons on any given night, and watch for some serious pool players who run the tables. All your basics on tap, but I'd skip the food unless you like your nachos with cheese from a nacho cheese dispenser circa 1982. And tots are just tots - greasy, grubby food, so not sure how a bar can really "excel" at those...

34.description: Used to be my local hangout, was there at least a few times a week. what can i say about this place other then its a local hang out. would i travel out of my way to come here, probably not, but it still holds a special place in my heart. nicely poured drinks for cheap and some good dirty bar food. Solid place to belly up to the rail, pound some shots and watch some sports, if you dont appreciate dives dont go, its a chicago bar, chicago people(minus columbia students) that wander down in random times throughout the day. if you happen to be in the area its definitely worth it to stop in for a drink or 2 and of course the tots and dirty nachos

16.description: Free Popcorn and uhm, optional pool/ping pong tableGreat prices on pitcher/bucketsStop in and get your beer on

13.description: :) I like this place. It has a laid back atmosphere, professional bartenders and spaced out seating. You can go to Wabash Tap to watch a game, have a private conversation, play pool, or just sit quietly and relax. The bartenders will not hoover around, flirting, or acting inappropriate they serve you what you ask for and move on. They also sell greasy guilty pleasures if you get hungry, but 100% of their food is unhealthy, so if you are concerned about fat, calories, carbs or whatever you certainly aren't eating at a bar anyway, right? Come to Wabash Tap for some fries, a good beer, or to chat with some friendly people. The only cons of the place is the bathrooms are a bit shabby, but *shrugs* it is a dive bar not a spa, so that's kind of expected.

11.description: BEER DOWNWe were heading to the Chicago Bears game on a Thursday night game. I checked Yelp to look for bars near the CTA Orange Line Roosevelt stop and this bar was the closest plus it was the cheapest. Score!We walked over to grab a few drinks and this place was packed. We made our way over to the bar and luckily got a spot. We decided to order our first two rounds because of the crowds. I will say that the bartenders were rocking it in here. There was no reason to pre-buy round two because of the quick speed of the staff. They were really attentive. I love it when a staff gets it and works there butts off because once the game starts its probably going to be a ghost town in there. I always believe in keeping the customers happy at all costs. I checked the menu prior to walking in. I noticed there was food available but we did not order anything. They also had pitchers of beer too starting at $12. Now that's a great deal and very old school. I love it. We didn't go pitcher but choose to go bottles for $4 each. Up the street, the fancy Nancy bars charge about 2 bucks more per beer. So if you're looking for a deal then this is the place. We finished up our beers and made our way over to see the Bears. On a side note: This place has a small outdoor patio with about 4 tables. I would say you have to be lucky to snag one of those. It is also really loud in the bar. I blame the ceiling for causing this. After the Bears defeated the New York Giants 27-21 we needed to celebrate one more time and we decided to come back. The bar wasn't as packed as the first time we showed up but in about 15 minutes it would be fully packed once again. Luckily we had our drinks in hand. I smelled popcorn in the air and found the free popcorn machine in the back. Another score! I like this bar. It's just a simple bar without all the frills. So if you're looking for a place to grab a few drinks before or after a Soldier Field event then this is the place. It's close to the CTA train stop and not a far walk to the Bears game. This is totally a winning combination.

39.description: If you're looking for a dive bar (that is in desperate need of updating) to watch the Bears game, while enjoying a pretty ok selection of cheap beer then you've come to the right place. Otherwise you might want to head to The Scout instead.

37.description: We stopped in here before the Bears game for a couple of beers. It was great that they opened at 10am and it was packed within minutes,  and everyone in bears jerseys.

0.description: Coat Hooks: NoAlso: a great dive, two pool tables in the back, good tots.

38.description: I really really REALLY want to like this place.  I love me some good ol' fashioned dive bars.  But Wabash Tap doesn't really deliver.  It's not really a dive bar, and that's sad.The layout of the bar is unfortunate.  It's kinda narrow and long, and for some reason it's always loud in there.  The beer selection isn't bad - and having pitchers for sale is a plus.  But the food is not good, and the free popcorn is usually stale.  Outdoor seating is limited and there's usually a good amount of people out there smoking or begging for money.I'd suggest going to another place if you can.

51.description: It's nothing spectacular, really, but I'm inclined to give it a decent rating. Why? Their burgers are Awesome.Not awesome in a truffled mayo pretzel bun kinda way, but in a way that it tastes something like a gourmet McDonalds cheeseburger. Their fries are thin, crispy, salty amazingness too. I don't even... it's just really good. And really cheap. They have a great beer special on Thursday where all drafts are $3.50, including imports. That said, their beer variety overall is pretty vast considering the general "meh" atmosphere of the place. All in all, it's a must (especially Thursdays) if you live in the hood.

27.description: Met some friends here on Saturday.  It's been a while since I had been there but was quickly reminded why - their service is terrible and the food isn't much better.  The two good things about this place is that most times you can get a table & they have a good music selection on their juke box.  Wish I liked it better since I live in the neighborhood.

32.description: This place is a great dive in south loop. Having moved to Chicago from Tampa about a year ago, I've learned that finding cheap drinks and bar munchies is tough, unless you resign yourself to going to areas of town that might get you killed. This place is in a fine area, and serves up cold beer and reasonably tasty cheep eats. Also, if you're really pinching pennies, you can fill up on PBR (on draft) and free popcorn. For $20 bucks, you could drink and eat your fill, and still have enough cash for tip and cab fare. If you come with a little more in your wallet, they have a surprising offering of craft beers, something that I didn't expect considering the dive atmosphere. All in all, I enjoyed myself very much. Stopped in for beers before work and got exactly what I wanted. I'll be back.

54.description: Went around noon on a Sunday after 11 city diner had too long a wait for us.  It was not too busy but I had some of the best conversations with people since I have moved to Chicago.  Bar tender and patrons were all nice as can be.  Burgers were as good as advertised.   Great bloody marys.  Maybe my new favorite hang out

48.description: My standard South-ish loop stop. Plenty of TVs, plenty of space, nice enough bartenders, decent food selection. Great stop to warm up after a Bears game (it can get a bit crowded when the game lets out). Nothing spectacular, but a serviceable place that has good prices.

44.description: Went back to my old stomping grounds in the south loop before a concert this week. I like this place because it is pretty chill and they have great daily specials and a specialty beer each month.  This month happens to be summer Shandy, not bad not bad.  We went on Monday and had the $3 burger and fries special.  I love their fries!  They are small little guys and perfectly seasoned.  The burger is pretty good...especially for 3 bucks!There are no servers here during the week at least.  So you have to always go up to the bar to order drinks and food.  That's my only complaint for this place.The bartenders are usually pretty friendly and the service is decently quick considering the bartenders do all the work.  I shall keep this as my south loop staple.  Cheers to beer and burgers!

24.description: My kind of place. Totally unpretentious, decent beer list, and the food is good. Yes "regguler" guys come here, but anyone who thinks this place is a dive has clearly never been to one.

7.description: If you are a feminist, avoid Wabash Tap.  If you believe that unwanted catcalling, unwanted touching, and sexual harassment are unacceptable, avoid Wabash Tap.Tonight I co-hosted an after-work meetup for young professionals at Wabash Tap.  The attendees were mostly women in our 20s and early 30s.  The crusty old regulars at Wabash Tap took our presence as an invitation for pervy catcalling, unwelcome caresses, vulgar name-calling upon our unanimous rejection of these vile, scummy lounge lizards.  These creeps hooted at us as we entered and left Wabash Tap, and periodically slinked into our group only to be shooed away again.But I don't blame Wabash Tap for their creepy clientele.  I blame ROB, who was working behind the bar.  I approached him -- twice -- and politely but firmly explained that these toads were making my colleagues and myself uncomfortable, and asked him to intervene.  I don't know if he even bothered to say anything, since Rob was clearly chummy with the scumbags.So, Yelp readers, would you ever want to go to a bar where the staff has no motivation to -- or capacity to -- prevent an environment of unwanted sexual advances?  No, me neither.

49.description: Good tots, PITCHERS of beer, rowdy Bears fans= +3 stars!gross cheeseburger= -1 stara place to sit when The Scout had a 2 hour wait= +1 star

40.description: After years of being at Columbia, I finally went here with a couple friends of mine.  We were hungry, so we wanted cheap eats and drinks.The food is actually pretty good as far as "bar food" goes.  I had the burger, it hit the spot.  Fries aren't too bad either.  Beer selection is decent - better than your average dive.  I wouldn't exactly categorize this a sports bar, it's something between that and a dive.  At least when I was there around 8pm on a Friday.  I wouldn't go out of my way to go here, but if I'm in the neighborhood I will gladly go.

53.description: So I am here with some friends to watch the bears game, and I hang my purse on the side of my chair facing I side towards my friends, one of the staff walked by, GRABBED MY PURSE, then gave it back to me and said I shouldn't put it there but in my lap instead. He could have stopped by, tapped me on the shoulder and said the same thing, but apparently he needed a dramatic display. I'm never coming back after today, that's for sure! That kind if rudeness is unnecessary!

30.description: BEER DOWNWe were heading to the Chicago Bears game on a Thursday night game. I checked Yelp to look for bars near the CTA Orange Line Roosevelt stop and this bar was the closest plus it was the cheapest. Score!We walked over to grab a few drinks and this place was packed. We made our way over to the bar and luckily got a spot. We decided to order our first two rounds because of the crowds. I will say that the bartenders were rocking it in here. There was no reason to pre-buy round two because of the quick speed of the staff. They were really attentive. I love it when a staff gets it and works there butts off because once the game starts its probably going to be a ghost town in there. I always believe in keeping the customers happy at all costs. I checked the menu prior to walking in. I noticed there was food available but we did not order anything. They also had pitchers of beer too starting at $12. Now that's a great deal and very old school. I love it. We didn't go pitcher but choose to go bottles for $4 each. Up the street, the fancy Nancy bars charge about 2 bucks more per beer. So if you're looking for a deal then this is the place. We finished up our beers and made our way over to see the Bears. On a side note: This place has a small outdoor patio with about 4 tables. I would say you have to be lucky to snag one of those. It is also really loud in the bar. I blame the ceiling for causing this. After the Bears defeated the New York Giants 27-21 we needed to celebrate one more time and we decided to come back. The bar wasn't as packed as the first time we showed up but in about 15 minutes it would be fully packed once again. Luckily we had our drinks in hand. I smelled popcorn in the air and found the free popcorn machine in the back. Another score! I like this bar. It's just a simple bar without all the frills. So if you're looking for a place to grab a few drinks before or after a Soldier Field event then this is the place. It's close to the CTA train stop and not a far walk to the Bears game. This is totally a winning combination.

46.description: Holy Tamales!!!!  South loop action for this big brown man! We came in here to lather up on some Cervezas and fill the void in our tummies left by the 8K Shamrock shuffle. Nice no frills simple sports bar! A Sox bar dare I say....suck it Ronnie Wooo woo!For the South loop these Food Prices are Great!!!!!!  Beer specials everyday!Speaking of the food being priced right....its also very good!I had the Cheeseburger.....very tasty @ $6 with fries!My # 1 fan had the CHicken ceaser Burrito(wrap)Ma dawg Broski had the wings which he claims are one of his favorites in da city .His Booski had a burger and CHilli fries....yummmmmmmmmIf I lived in the south loop...this would be my hangout!!Shake and bake seal of approval!Hipster infestation level: ZERO ....Cmon...... Its the South loop!  and this place has Hipster Kryptonite going on!!! meaning Sports on alll the TV's AND 90's music in da  jukex box!!

1.description: One of the few lower key, divey bars that are in the trendy area of South Loop, not that I'm complaining, I like those types of places. For food I got the 2 tacos, one chicken one steak, and then had some whiskey 7 ups and a miller lite. I wasn't paying so I don't know the full story on prices, but I don't think it was that bad. The 2 tacos were only $7 total I believe. And they also have free popcorn and 2 pool tables. A nice change of pace from the more upscale places in the south loop

55.description: This place is pretty straight-forward overall.  Some nice specials now and again with a moderate selection and friendly staff.  Not the kind of place I'd go out of the way to visit but definitely on the list of suggestions when the group is in that area and looking for a place to grab a brew.

9.description: What a useless bar to pregame before heading out to a Bears game!  In the last three years they have decided to go from 2 waitresses,  to 1 waitress, to present day, no service. There were two gentlemen working hard to ID patrons, and crickets working the tables.  After 20 minutes of sitting at a table it became clear that I had to saddle up to the bar and wave cash to get a drink. I am too old for that. I left with my buddy and headed to what will be my new pregame tradition at the new pizza place /bar right next door.  Whomever is in charge needs to hire more staff and stop living in Wabash Tap's glory days of 2009.

26.description: Another dive that has survived improvements and tremendous new wealth into the hood. This place remains dark, dingy, and scummy with the longest path to a bar bathroom I have ever seen. there are two pool tables and aside from that nothing really else to describe this non-descriptive joint.

25.description: Best gay bar in town!!!! Love you jill

12.description: Dive bar in the south loop with pool and darts.  Laid back and offers bar food.  Don't expect to find anything that's not fried though.  Drinks were good, but don't order anything fancy.  Good spot to watch a game or play a game with friends.  Nothing special, but cheap drinks, tvs and games.  A-Ok in my book, but nothing special.

59.description: Best tots around!  Great selection of beers, solid bartenders!  I've been coming to Wabash Tap since they open several years ago and I've been consistently happy!

21.description: Great environment with a great staff.  Came to watch the game and had 3 dollar drafts, cant beat it. Good scene to watch the games if your being a solo tourist.  Everyone is friendly

17.description: Cheap beer? Check. Humongous portion of fries? Double check.  I was afraid that since it was Thursday night, the bar might be filled with football fans, but it wasn't busy at all. However, music was a bit too loud. Atmosphere was very relaxed and laid back. There's even a pool table if you're interested.

10.description: Heads up:I have been sitting here waiting for someone to ask me if I'd like anything since 4:45 pm. It is now 4:58 pm and no one has even said hi or asked me if I want a beer, nothing. So.

5.description: Nothing special here, but a good, honest joint to hang out in once in a while. I was pretty-much weaned on popcorn; so anyplace that has the little cart in which you can grab a free bowl for yourself is alright with me. The bar food is fine, though I will say that the shoestring fries I got last time were phenomenal. The Mexican cook humored my pobre español and was as friendly as could be.

3.description: Came here for a surprise birthday celebration and had a great time here! They had a live band, Joe Hertler and the Rainbow Seekers and they were fantastic!! They offer a lot of beer options on tap and in bottles and service is friendly and efficient. It's a great neighborhood jaunt.

35.description: Despite its rustic appeal, this is a hobo circle-jerk bar filled with low-rent people. I once saw a bartender bowl there.

19.description: Not a lady-friendly establishment, judging from the lewd and invasive behavior of the regulars this evening. One crusty old drunk dude in particular made a point of repeatedly interrupting the conversations taking place at our professional networking event in order to drape his arm over our shoulders and make passes at us, breathing beer-stank into our faces and making everyone suuuuper uncomfortable. The bar staff did nothing to stop him. Do. Not. Want.

28.description: Came here for drinks late in the evening. By this time the bar was filled with drunk construction workers who don't care for their surroundings, booze is everywhere; on tables, seats, and floors. I probably will return since it's a local bar a block from my apt, but if it wasn't i would never return.

45.description: Very decent neighborhood bar. Cheaper than anything else around, and definitely less snooty. However, it's always way too loud. The music selection is great, but the volume is crazy for a non-dancing, super casual place.

33.description: After visiting the Shedd Aquarium, my friend and I grabbed a few drinks and a snack at the Wabash Tap. The server made our cocktails exactly to specification, and our tater tots with three sauces were hot and crispy. We sat by the window to enjoy some sun on a windy day, and my only complaint was the fact that two kids were sitting next to us with their mom. I'm not really a fan of kids in bars, but at least they were quiet. Good service, clean bathroom, and great prices. The outdoor seating is limited but a plus when the weather's nice.

43.description: This place is dive bar, with some decent beers and drink prices.  The building (and interior) is pretty shoddy, and needed to be rehabbed 20 years ago.  I really hope they either A.  remodel or  B. go out of business so someone else could take it over and turn into a nicer place.  The worst thing about this place is you would think that bar staff would be friendlier, and try to get to know their few clientele who actually come in.  Just sayin...

2.description: Just a divey bar with a fun vibe. They have TV's for the sports fans and pool tables for those pool sharks. There's also food, but I've never eaten. Usually a good selection of beers. Love coming here to just chill.

18.description: Love this bar. One of my favorite dive bars in the city! 2 pool tables is a definite plus. Staff is great and knowledgable about beers.

41.description: Nice atmosphere. Started getting crowded around 11:30 PM last night. A mixed set of ages ranging from 20 somethings to 50 somethings.
