I don't know that I would call it so much a sports bar as it only had two or 3 TV's but we could be getting spoiled in today's modern age. It did have an electronic dart board and a pool table. Service was very good and friendly. They had 3 bartenders behind the bar so service was very fast even as it  started getting crowded. They were even nice enough to maintain a six pack of beer behind the bar that a friend had bought at a store. They also charged another friends phone behind the bar. Overall a very good experience for night life.

52.description: I wanted to go to the Scout after seeing it in the Red Eye for 3 weeks straight though after realizing that I would have to stand for the entire Bears game I decided that was not going to happen for me. Wabash Tap was next on the Yelp list of closest boozie establishments. If I only had one sentence to tell you about Wabash Tap I would tell you 'they have a pink lamenite counter top in the bathroom that I am guesssing is from atleast 20yrs ago!'Definitley a no frills neighboorhood bar which is not my thing but the bartender was friendly and seemed to know everyones name so who am I to define what a good bar is.My Stella tasted really flat and after drinking half of it the bartender still offered to get me something else. Since I can not drink a beer with out a snack in hand we got the tots with chilli and cheee on them, not impressed. Everyone elses seems to love the tots so I would say skip adding the chilli and cheese and stick with the already included three dipping sauces.Great place to watch a bears game if your in the area and looking to actually watch the game and not scope out the other patrons the whole time!

50.description: I came here for their supposed Halloween party and, just... ugh.- Average age 35-40 (not that there is anything wrong with age in and of itself, but see next bullet)- Too many creepy older guys dressed as construction workers- Older women trying too hard to look sexy and failing- Their advertised $3 "jello shots" were actually in those small paper cups used for ketchup and barely tasted of anything- Drinks were terribly watered downThe music was actually pretty decent and I would have liked to be able to dance with my friends if it weren't for the ring of creepy older men staring us down like we were steaks. Groooosssss. I got out of there as fast as possible.

4.description: Not a bad place.  It was sparsely populated around 6 p.m. on a Friday evening, which is my kind of bar.  The pool table was available, which pleased the two guys I was with.  Beer was cheap, cocktails were cheap... what more could you ask for in a dive bar?I can see this place getting a bit annoying if it became more packed and there was no seating or no attention from bar staff, but we had neither of those issues (until even about 9 p.m.) so it is worth a visit if you're looking for cheap drinks and a chill crowd.

6.description: Perfect local dive bar. Diverse and cheap booze/food.Good time for buddies and tourists on the way to soldier field.

22.description: Free Popcorn and uhm, optional pool/ping pong tableGreat prices on pitcher/bucketsStop in and get your beer on

15.description: Awesome place for sports events day or night.   Living in the neighborhood for quite some time..... This place totally grew on me it's clear to see that it's  properly managed fr to to bottom. Clean bathrooms greAt bartenders cool managers that are not on top of them because are well trained. Again management plays a huge part in this    And shhhh u can play the music from your phone via touch tunes. Best bar in the south loop period Monday's Sam tues thru fro mary. Jill and Dave evenings   Can't go wrong tight crew great tvs awesome beer selection and for the hood it's reasonably priced gtra live that

57.description: I have been coming here for years now and forgot I didnt write a review, lol. Well the bartenders are great and fun to talk to. It is your local dive bar with good prices on liquor and food. All the food on the menu is good but the steak tacos are awesome! If you are looking for a place to chill with your friends, quiz nights on tuesday or a place topregame before a bears game then this is the place!

20.description: Cheap beer? Check. Humongous portion of fries? Double check.  I was afraid that since it was Thursday night, the bar might be filled with football fans, but it wasn't busy at all. However, music was a bit too loud. Atmosphere was very relaxed and laid back. There's even a pool table if you're interested.

36.description: $3 PBR's and some bad ass tater tots.  Plenty of TV's and friendly staff.

14.description: Keep in mind, this is a dive bar without the dive bar prices, but it's great.Perfect spot to go grab a beverage, eat some popcorn and shoot some pool. I would probably stray from their other food though. Keep it simple here and you'll have a great time.

58.description: I'm always skeptical to try Asian restaurants since I'm Asian myself so I have super high standards for Asian cuisines. This place was good though! The SO and I ordered a ginger ale, mango soda, salmon avocado roll (50% off if you check in on yelp!), garlic ginger chicken with the cornbread side and a shoyu ramen. I LOVED my mango soda. I normally don't drink soda but I wanted a cold drink and our waiter, Dominic, told me that they make the soda fresh so I figured why not? The mango was refreshing and actually tasted like it was made of real mangos instead of syrup which is a plus for me. Salmon avocado roll was standard, generous amounts of avocado which I love! My garlic ginger chicken was good, I just wished there was more garlic flavor. The SO loved it though! The shoyu ramen was tasty. Not the best ramen compared to shops that specialize in only making ramen but still good. Overall, pretty good food, nice ambiance, and good service!

56.description: Vegetarian review:Ambiance deserves 5 stars. As much as I love a hole in the wall, this place puts in a damn good effort in decor. Wish they did that for their food...Food overall is 3 stars. The togarashi chips with edamame hummus was a great looking app, but the flavor was lacking. The chips were fresh fried, but not drained well. Way too much oil to start a meal with. Ordered the butternut squash soup. Lots of good reviews on this, but I've had so much better. The flavor was almost flat (the basil tries hard to save it). If I can make better at home, I don't want to pay 3 times as much at a restaurant to butcher it.  They switched it out for the miso soup....meh. The hot soup felt good, but still pretty flat on flavor. The only winner was the gamma veg roll. I split this with a friend, and so glad I did. The pieces are huge. Normally, I don't care for that, but it had everything vegetarian you could put in a roll: beets, jalapeño (not spicy, wish it was), sweet potato. Outside was tempura with sesame.  If it wasn't for this, the meal would have been a disappointment. Service: 2 stars - no host. Waited about 5-7 minutes before a server recognized that we needed to be seated in a half empty room.  There were not a lot of suggestions or much conversation. The server that helped the table next to is was incredibly friendly. He had in depth explanations of some dishes and an overall engaged attitude. I wish he was our server. So this could have easily been an off night or understaffed moment.I'll go back here for the gamma and maybe try some other veg rolls. If I have the same service experience again, it's getting crossed off the list.

29.description: We started with a sashimi sample which was amazing and fresh. Then ramen noodles! I have the veggie one with some shrimp. It was very good. The service is wonderful and the place really nicely decorated and great atmosphere.

42.description: My fiancé and I can't say enough good things about Asian Outpost! Food = Mouthwateringly Amazing! Service = "You're Family Here" style service! Treat Yo'self and go here again & again & again!

23.description: Great delivery!! The miso soup and dumplings were hot and the sushi was cold and fresh.

47.description: A short review:  Fried Chicken very good worth getting  breast was a little dry.  Ribs nice and tender, good Asian BBQ sauce not the ultra red kind.  The Unagi was nice just okay.  How ever the pork belly bun was excellent, not normally a fan of buns, this was tops, please get it. Service was strange, when they were around it was great, but they would come and go for long periods of time. My friend and I were out for the night so time wasn't an issue, that being said if time was an issue ... Overall I'm going back for sure, I hope I can update with a well written review.

8.description: Ordered from here twice now.  Once for delivery sushi, delivery was fast, fish was fresh, and very delicious!  Ordered take out tonight.  Spicy garlic ramen is awesome!  Pork belly was perfect!  The Shoyu was also very good, but definitely liked the garlic better.

31.description: Potstickers came out nearly cold. The tonkatsu ramen (usually my favorite) was utterly lacking in flavor.

34.description: We randomly choose this restaurant and could not have been more pleasantly surprised. The food was great and the prices were very reasonable. Definately a place I would come back to in Chicago.Also the fried chicken is amazing.

16.description: Food was okay.  It wasn't anything special.  The beef with broccoli was a little salty for my taste.

13.description: I am torn for Asian Outpost. They try, I mean they really do. But after today's visit, we decided we've had our fill and sadly, we may not be returning again. The food and service are both above average but the food (quasi Asian, quasi Sushi) is not stellar! Today was our third visit and now, we've tried everything from their bok choy Salmon, Asian Steak, Sushi rolls, Sashimi platter, Garlic Fried Chicken, Lettuce Wraps etc. pretty eclectic, huh? The sashimi platter is awesome value  since you get 15 pieces of generous cuts for $25, but they aren't the right cuts and hence it's average. Sushi rolls once again average. What did stand out was the garlic fried chicken with a side of corn bread. It appears that Asian Outpost needs to figure out their identity, redo their menu and refresh their space. Sadly, they've been running a Groupon forever now (great value) and in all our visits, the place has barely been busy. I hope better times lie ahead.

11.description: Went to this restaurant for a birthday party, it was really nice. I loved the decoration which was authentic Asian.The reception and presentation was great.The food was delicious and I liked the dessert as well.Highly recommended place to go to.

39.description: all rolls av w black rice... fresh. love the patio! very kind waitress. a gem in the s loop

37.description: I ordered the roasted pork belly sliders as well as the seaweed salad and ruby red cole slaw off of Grubhub. Delivery was very reasonable and I received the food 30-40 mins after placing the order. The pork belly was solid; it was cooked well but wasn't anything exceptional. The salad and cole slaw were also pretty good. Overall, a fine meal.

0.description: I will start with that fact that this is a great place in all the things that matter: Food, Location and Service (Natty was great.)From the minute I stepped in the door, Asian Outpost was a great experience. The hostess was not at the hostess station. Amazingly enough there was no wait, because the gentleman behind the sushi counter came out, greeted us and sat us. The hostess/waitress walked by greeted us and said the waters would be out in a second. In a second, the gentleman that sat us delivered our waters. Best customer service I've seen in a very long time.Everything we had was good: Brussel Sprouts, Pot Stickers, Basil Chicken and Corn muffins. Don't leave there without having the Garlic Ginger Fried Chicken. So very good. Additionally, the waitress will tell you to add certain sauces to certain food, do that. We will definitely be back.

38.description: Great selection of Sushi, Ramen, and Chinese dishes. Service can be better but I'll give them some slack - at least they're all Asians.

51.description: New amazing neighborhood place (new to us). The squash rolls and all the sushi pieces are great. But a special omg to the spicy nutty noodles with shiitake mushrooms - soooo yummy! Service was wonderful as well. Be back soon!

27.description: I really love this place. I get the dragon roll and spicy crab and never have an issue. I also order the ribs, which is amazing. The sweet and spicy bbq sauce is delicious. My first experience was take out and this time I had the opportunity to order take out again, but picked up the food myself. What a wonderful place to dine at. The staff was very nice and fast with getting my order started. The moment you walk in the door there are shelves of herbs that is really welcoming. The decor is the best I have seen at an Asian joint in a long time. I want to light an incense and drink tea all day in here. 4 stars for the crazy loop prices, but the food is good and will see me heading back this way soon.

32.description: So after few comments of friends I decided to try this Asian bistro restaurant. For my impression as soon I got in I was fascinated, decoration inside this rest is so beautiful. I have been in several Asian place in the city but this one was one of the must beautiful Asian decoration that I have seen. Then the service was very fast my server was so attentive, and it was full of energy. I believe his name was woody , he made us feel welcome and no like other Asian place were the servers are so cold and serious. He recommended few things but I decided to try the fry chicken and he was not kidding.... OH MY GOD it was so so delicious. I tried this with white rice, and homemade corn bread. The part of the sides is a little bit limited not a lot of variety but I didn't care it was so good the food that that's the least I care haha. Overall 5 start for this restaurant, great atmosphere, nice background music, AWESOME service and great food.

54.description: We enjoyed ourselves thoroughly and i promise to be back for lunch since i work down the street!

48.description: A lot of people seem to like this place on yelp, and maybe there is something I'm missing.  I've been to this place only once.  The menu was pretty average and pretty small for an Asian place and it was kind of hard to discern a real theme.  We had edamame, I had the vegetarian wok, and my girlfriend had a chicken dish.  In short, all but the edamame was basically inedible.  I'm amazed that more people don't just go down the street to Chinatown to any number of great places there - or to any of the two better sushi places in the south loop.

44.description: Love this place! It's my neighborhood staple. Some especially notable dishes are the pork belly sliders, the gamma rolls and the ramen soup (any of them)! I've been about a dozen times and the food is always fresh and very tasty. Don't forget about the Yelp deal where if you check in, you get 50% off a roll!

24.description: I enjoy this place. Ramen is good though the noodles could be thinner but that's personal preference.

7.description: Was curious about Asian Outpost, I pass it often while visiting other restaurants in the area. I came across it on groupon and thought it was a perfect opportunity to taste the great fried chicken I heard about. The chicken was juicy and the crust was golden brown and delicious, I also tried the beef & broccoli it was a bit salty and I've had better. The cornbread was cold and a smaller portion than anticipated. The decor and atmosphere was a delight a bit quiet, but it was date night so I enjoyed being able to have a conversation. All in all I would definitely visit again, so I can try the sushi.

49.description: I'm impressed by the drink menu and the summer specials. I had to try the Aunt Betty after seeing so many reviews on Yelp. It was super refreshing! I ordered the fried chicken and ribs and both were yummy. The edamame hummus lacked some flavor. Although the server was friendly, the wait time to order and get our food was longer than ideal.

40.description: I LOVE THIS RESTAURANT! 5 Stars!I would classify the cuisine as Asian fusion. With elements of american, and latin, it makes for a great spot to be adventurous with your t-buds while still incorporating familiar flavors - so don't be afraid to bring that picky date of yours. The menu options run the gamut from steak to sushi and everything in between which you can expect to be delicious as well as ascetically plated. You'll be able to appease anyone's tastes with the options and the prices are very reasonable for the portion size too. I highly recommend the fried chicken. Double battered and about as crispy as it can come - unnggg.

53.description: Came here with my family for a birthday. There were 12 of us and they were very accommodating. We tried a variety of things.  Spicy Garlic Ramen was delicious, however the veggie ramen was too salty. Pork belly sliders were very tasty and possibly my favorite item! Chicken curry was disappointing, the portion was small and taste was lacking. No spiciness like other curries. Sushi was very fresh and delicious. Beef and broccoli was a hit among many however needed more beef. Salmon was overcooked but they were very accommodating and quick to remake it. Prices were very reasonable and service was very friendly. Will definitely go back!

30.description: Stopped in around 9:15 on a Sunday night.  While walking up the stairs to ask for a table, my friend pointed out that the hours on the door showed a 9:30 closing time.  The manager on duty (or maybe owner, not sure) saw us and assured us that it was not too late to be seated for dinner.  He graciously set a table for us and we perused the menu.  I ordered the Spicy Garlic Ramen and Spider Roll.  Both delicious; ramen was so flavorful and spider roll tasted so light and fresh.  My friend ordered the Ginger Fried Chicken and cornbread.  She offered me a piece of the chicken (she requested white meat which I typically do not care for as it tends to be too dry)  and I must say it was amazing; not dry at all, perfect texture and taste.  The cornbread with a dipping sauce and a spread (which I think was butter) was the perfect compliment.  I will definitely come back again.

46.description: Food is just ok.  Price is not worth it and the working staff aren't the nicest people you 'll find.Sorry or so long!. Never again!

1.description: 3 or 3.5 stars would be more accurate, but labeling veg options and being willing to accommodate bumps Asian Outpost up.Vegans and vegetarians know that Chinese restaurants can be very challenging. "Authentic" (whatever that means) Chinese restaurants throw chicken broth or fish sauce in everything, even rice. And "vegetable" dishes might still have meat in them. Add a language barrier and you might as well just stir fry your own food at home.However, I ordered a Groupon for Asian Outpost and treated myself on Valentines Day. I previously had messaged Asian Outpost to see if they can leave chicken broth or fish sauce out of dishes, and they said they could. However, they label vegetarian stuff on the menu anyway. I have also ordered delivery since Valentines Day.My favorites so far are the avocado roll sushi, edamame and Dr. Lee cocktail (of course).I liked the wok seared garden vegetable (with just veggies), but it was a little salty, even for me. Don't get me wrong. I am a true American who loves fat, sugar and salt. But I tasted more soy sauce than cilantro or mint. The vegetables were fresh, though. I liked the mixture of textures in the wok seared garden vegetable. The veggie ramen was also full of fresh veggies, which was awesome, but the broth was a little bland. I added some soy sauce, green onions and MSG (ha ha) to my leftovers at home. Service was quick and courteous at the restaurant. Delivery took as long as predicted on Grub Hub. I don't think Asian Outpost is worth the trip if you live far, but if you live near South Loop or find yourself in South Loop looking for vegan-friendly Asian cuisine, this place is solid. Very reasonably priced too.

55.description: As an asian, I get skeptical of asian sounding things like Chinese lanterns, dragon dances and math. However, this place was awesome.Price- very reasonable. We got two rolls, ramen soup, pad Thai and a drink for about $56Quality- fantastic. The spicy garlic ramen and Latin cousin were so flavorfulQuantity- very good. I eat a lot but I am stuffed. You really get your money's worthAtmosphere- love the acoustic covers of Pop music and the wooden rustic fee. Great date placeStaff- we had woody who worked the floor by himself and he was still attentive. Such great service.A great gem of south loop

9.description: I got the chips and hummus. I'm pretty sure those were sunchips. The hummus was whatever. I also ordered the garlic Ramen, it wasn't bad. it was my first time trying ramen, I didn't hate it. It was spicy, so I liked that. Next was the basil thai chicken, and I'm pretty sure that it was something that I got from chipotle. It didn't taste bad, but it wasn't asian, or even closely reminiscent of asian food. Saving the best for last, literally, the potstickers were pretty good. I liked the sauce.

26.description: On a cold rainy day, Asian Outpost is the perfect place to be for a bowl of ramen. I should begin by saying that this was my first ramen experience and what captivated me was both the service and the flavors. The server was great and explained the difference between the multiple broths they offered and recommended to me, the best one. When it was time to dip my spoon in, the server came with a bowl full of ingredients and broth in a tea pot. The server then poured the broth from the tea pot into the bowl which made the noodles and flavors come alive and I was sold! Other features I enjoyed about Asian Outpost was the modern industrial decor mixed with Asian antiques as well as the in-house freshly grown Asian greens blooming in the entryway. Trendy while staying true to traditional Asian cooking, this is a place I will be sure to visit again!

25.description: Delivery was fresh and in time. We ordered three veggie rolls and the spicy peanut noodles. Everything was tasty and exactly what we expected based on the description. We will definitely walk here during the summer but for now keep doing delivery!

12.description: I really love this place. I get the dragon roll and spicy crab and never have an issue. I also order the ribs, which is amazing. The sweet and spicy bbq sauce is delicious. My first experience was take out and this time I had the opportunity to order take out again, but picked up the food myself. What a wonderful place to dine at. The staff was very nice and fast with getting my order started. The moment you walk in the door there are shelves of herbs that is really welcoming. The decor is the best I have seen at an Asian joint in a long time. I want to light an incense and drink tea all day in here. 4 stars for the crazy loop prices, but the food is good and will see me heading back this way soon.

59.description: Fantastic service. They carry Beer Lao. A kaffir lime tree grows in their entryway, although I couldn't taste it in the two dishes I sampled that *might* have featured it. The spicy nutty noodles are excellent (especially with tofu); the veggie ramen was fresh, but the flavors weren't particularly notable. SE Asian cuisine is unique for its balance of sour, bitter, salty, and sweet flavors, especially mediated through fruits & veggies. Chicago, in general, has pretty low-dimensional flavors, but I appreciate that this restaurant is trying to stick its neck out. Too bad the Scout is 10x more crowded. This place would be a hit with just slightly better marketing.

21.description: Was in town for a conference and came upon this place.  The food was good quality, sushi not the best, but price was fair. Menu has a lot of choices and was a little overwhelming. I would consider coming back if I was in the mood for Asian.

17.description: Came here for a large group dinner and thought the prices were very reasonable for Chicago. The sushi tasted fresh - I didn't order any special rolls, just a basic spicy tuna, so I can't talk too much about any of those types of rolls. I also ordered their fried chicken - it was super crispy, nicely seasoned and came with a interesting sweet sauce. I think the chicken pieces were a bit small, but I'd probably still order it. I also liked the slaw side - not mayo dressed, but more like a vinaigrette and was freshly dressed so it had a great crunch. The cocktails were very pretty - as mine came with an flower - but also packed a nice punch. We were expecting the difficulty of breaking up the check as we came in with 11 people, but they graciously separated our checks for us! I totally get why people like this place.

10.description: Love this place! Awesome decor, very clean and great prices. It's a great place to please everyone, sushi, ramen, Thai, fried chicken and they do it all right! Drinks are also delicious. I'll definitely be going back.

5.description: I'm always skeptical to try Asian restaurants since I'm Asian myself so I have super high standards for Asian cuisines. This place was good though! The SO and I ordered a ginger ale, mango soda, salmon avocado roll (50% off if you check in on yelp!), garlic ginger chicken with the cornbread side and a shoyu ramen. I LOVED my mango soda. I normally don't drink soda but I wanted a cold drink and our waiter, Dominic, told me that they make the soda fresh so I figured why not? The mango was refreshing and actually tasted like it was made of real mangos instead of syrup which is a plus for me. Salmon avocado roll was standard, generous amounts of avocado which I love! My garlic ginger chicken was good, I just wished there was more garlic flavor. The SO loved it though! The shoyu ramen was tasty. Not the best ramen compared to shops that specialize in only making ramen but still good. Overall, pretty good food, nice ambiance, and good service!

3.description: Came here for a late dinner. Although this area is pretty quiet for a Friday night, I was glad to stumble upon this spot. The inside decor is very interesting, bright, and homey. It's a blend of rustic meets zen and you get comfy quick. The staff was friendly and came by frequently. The food selection was good with a sushi/thai angle that would please a wide audience. Food portions were fair and filling for two. We tried the wild bonito, hamachi gai, and one of the classic rolls with pad thai on the side. Presentation was lovely, and the pad thai was flavorful without being too greasy. The drinks were pretty but a little watered down. Overall, solid 4 stars, I would come back for the food and atmosphere.

35.description: Came here for a large group dinner and thought the prices were very reasonable for Chicago. The sushi tasted fresh - I didn't order any special rolls, just a basic spicy tuna, so I can't talk too much about any of those types of rolls. I also ordered their fried chicken - it was super crispy, nicely seasoned and came with a interesting sweet sauce. I think the chicken pieces were a bit small, but I'd probably still order it. I also liked the slaw side - not mayo dressed, but more like a vinaigrette and was freshly dressed so it had a great crunch. The cocktails were very pretty - as mine came with an flower - but also packed a nice punch. We were expecting the difficulty of breaking up the check as we came in with 11 people, but they graciously separated our checks for us! I totally get why people like this place.

19.description: This place has the best tasting fried chicken! Definitely coming back for these!! Sushi was very good as well. I tried the spider - yum! I'm going to try more rolls next time. The ambiance is pretty unique and reminds me a bit of restoration hardware. Overall the highlight of the meal was the chicken.We went when the restaurant wasn't so busy so we were serviced promptly. The owner came by towards the end of our meal to see how our dining experience was which is appreciated.

28.description: I'm deeply confused on how this establishment has a 4 out of 5 star rating.  The food quality and service we received was on the level of dreadful.  We ordered the following on this past Wednesday:1 Nama Sake (Salmon) / Sashimi : SML / 2 2 Salmon Avocado : SML / 13 Spicy Tuna : SML / 1 4 Latin Cousin : 1 5 Miso Soup : 2 6 Wild Bonito : 1 Food Quality-The miso soup was only broth and we counted no more than 6 tofu squares in each container.  Every roll was bland and tasteless.  Also, the sushi was warm which that alone is disgusting.  The sushi was most likely warm since it was in the same bag as the miso soup however that should never happen.  The sashimi was simply not fresh.  Ultimately we ate 5 bites and threw all of it away.Service-The service was equally bad as the food.  I live 6 blocks and from order to door delivery was an hour and 15 minutes.  When I spoke to an individual on the phone prior to the food being delivered they stated 35-40 minutes.  When the food wasn't delivered in 45 minutes I called and was told "let me call the delivery company" and then was hung up on.  In conclusion, I called the establishment yesterday to provide a verbal complaint and received the standard short and brief "ok and an apology" statement.  Luckily great company and watching Narcos saved the evening however we definitely won't be ordering from Asian Outpost again.

45.description: Pretty solid place.  I've had about 10 experiences that were all positive.  I agree with other reviews regarding the pork belly sliders, they are great and the ramen is very good.  The buzz on their fried chicken might be a bit over reaching, but it is still quite good.  The staff are consistently warm and the service is fine.  I'd recommend them whether you're on a date or taking the family out.

33.description: I've eaten here once and gotten take out numerous times. The owner/manager? Is always very nice and courteous. The food is great and reasonably priced. My favorites include: pork belly buns, quinoa stir fry, Panko tofu with jalapeños. The decor inside is fun and home-y, and they have some tables set up for outdoor dining during the summer! Overall a great and much needed addition to the Asian scene in the south loop.

43.description: This is a vegan/vegetarian review. Finding spicy, flavorful Asian food that doesn't use oyster sauce, fish sauce, etc. is challenging.  After trying Asian Outpost, I have a new spot to add to my short list of vegan/vegetarian favorites.  The vegetarian ramen was delicious.  I haven't had ramen that good outside of NYC.  The gamma vega roll was full flavor as well.  We got a side of the coleslaw which was wonderfully tangy.  My cocktail was much better than the usual restaurant cocktail.  The chef came to our table to ask how we liked everything, and he talked about his interest in cooking for people with dietary restrictions such as vegetarians and those who need to eat gluten-free.   it's obvious that much thought goes into the flavor profile of each dish.  My only complaint is that like other reviewers, I found that togarshi chips too greasy.  What I'm happiest about is that there are still vegan/vegetarian dishes on the menu left to try.  With a cocktail, appetizer, and entree for each of us, and a shared dessert, my husband and I spent under $70, which includes a generous tip.  There was plenty of food to bring home too, even though we ate until we couldn't eat anymore.   They are in my neighborhood and deliver.  Lucky me!!

2.description: Delicious! I tried the garlic fried chicken and oh my goodness...it's awesome!!!! It's juicy and crispy at the same time. It comes with a side dipping sauce that gives it a completely different and wonderful flavoring. Perfect for a casual night now if friends or family. You'll never regret ordering takeout either. Chicken still good!

18.description: Great atmosphere! Love the service here! The booths are nice and cozy, spacious. The food is very good too, with a variety of options in the Asian culture. Sometimes I feel like sushi, but others I feel like Ramen and other noodle or rice, cooked dishes. Even the kids are satisfied with the fried chicken and cornbread! The drinks look better than they taste, but it could've been that day... A little watery from what I tried. You can't really go wrong with the wine, haha but even theirs is less tasty (too long on the shelf?) I'll try the delicious-looking Lychee martini next time, but I hope I get what I'm expecting... Food is pretty good though, some rolls better than others but overall it's fresh and tasty. Yes, like everyone says the pork belly sliders are good, but also could be better.... The new Flying Tiger Maki roll is pretty amazing though. Along with the Black Stone. My favorite might be the Latin Cousin- awesome.

41.description: This is an awesome place! We enjoyed a great dinner on their outside patio. The food was fresh and delicious and our server was friendly and helpful. I went inside to use the washroom and was impressed by the decoras well. We had a variety of sushi rolls and none of them disappointed. The sweet potato roll and the cream cheese/smoked salmon rolls seemed to be the table's favorite. We also ordered the general tso's chicken wing s and cucumber salad whisk were both very good.  Overall a great experience!

52.description: On a day I just wanted to have a really good meal to make my day right, I came across this delightful spot. The fried chicken is not what you expect from a place called Asian Outpost, but they did that chicken justice. The spicy garlic ramen was great also. The check-in deal is the best, giving you half off any sushi roll. We got the Latin Cousin and it did not disappoint. Woody our server was so pleasant and seemed to be working the whole restaurant by himself. The overall experience was just plain satisfying and I'll definitely be back!

50.description: Was super impressed with our first-time order here. Great customer service, nice atmosphere and the food was exceptional. We will definitely return.

4.description: Asian output is VERY asian fusion. Definitely taking Thai, Japanese, American... and combining them in very interesting ways. Appetizers: I had the pork belly sliders which were wonderful. I think pork belly is fantastic, but this was perfectly crunchy and tender. My friend had the Spicy Nutty noodles which he didn't love. It was a little heavy on the sauce apparently. I had the tonkatsu ramen which was delicious! Wonderful on a colder day...  Service was great!

6.description: Ordered takeout with Asian outpost. Delivery was prompt and delivery guy was friendly. Very little chicken in the chicken lettuce wraps although the flavor was there. Got ramen, the pork belly had no flavor at all, had to be thrown out, and the noodles were so stuck together the only option was cutting them with a knife. Wouldn't order again.

22.description: The space is great.  The food and service were good. They had decent beer options.  We had the lettuce wraps for an appetizer and they were great!  The beef and broccoli was good too.  The vegetable stir fry was ok.

15.description: Great food, excellent service, super friendly wait staff. Best fried chicken I have ever had!

57.description: In short, the best sushi restaurant I have ever been to. The decor is beautiful. Our waiter was really helpful, personable, and professional. The food was delicious. We ordered the pork belly sliders and egg rolls for appetizers. For the entree portion, I got a sweet potato tempura roll, and the black stone roll. Absolutely love Asian Outpost and would highly recommend it.

20.description: We stumbled across this restaurant when we were out walking one night and thought we would give it a try.  We were pleasantly surprised at how awesome the atmosphere was here.  Our server was super friendly and took great care of our table.  Also some of the sushi was made with forbidden rice, which was such a unique way to make the sushi rolls.  I had never had them that way before.  I would say that the prices were very reasonable for what you get.  Great place to have conversations, not a loud environment at all. Will definitely make our way back there in the near future.

36.description: Great atmosphere! Love the service here! The booths are nice and cozy, spacious. The food is very good too, with a variety of options in the Asian culture. Sometimes I feel like sushi, but others I feel like Ramen and other noodle or rice, cooked dishes. Even the kids are satisfied with the fried chicken and cornbread! The drinks look better than they taste, but it could've been that day... A little watery from what I tried. You can't really go wrong with the wine, haha but even theirs is less tasty (too long on the shelf?) I'll try the delicious-looking Lychee martini next time, but I hope I get what I'm expecting... Food is pretty good though, some rolls better than others but overall it's fresh and tasty. Yes, like everyone says the pork belly sliders are good, but also could be better.... The new Flying Tiger Maki roll is pretty amazing though. Along with the Black Stone. My favorite might be the Latin Cousin- awesome.

14.description: Went out with friends. Had several rolls, drinks & the fried chicken for our table. Everything was delicious from the Black Dragon Roll to the King Shrimp to the spicy crab to the garlic fried chicken. Service was also excellent. A little more expensive, but definitely worth it.

58.description: I'm from NJ and when I come to Chicago, I ALWAYS go to giordanos. I've never been so disappointed with my service at a restaurant before. We showed up at 6:10. The girl wrote my name down on a piece of paper and said it was a 20-30 minute wait. Then we waited for 35+ mins and my friend went inside to let her know we are outside waiting and the girl at the desk was totally out of it. My friend wasn't sure if she even understood what he told her. Then I went inside 15 mins later and asked what's going and then another girl was shaking her head at the original girl and put our name on another waiting list. I asked how long the wait was and she said she didn't know. Then we wait for another 15 minutes and then a girl came outside and said oh our manager said its okay to seat people outside.  And we said fine and asked if we could order right away. Then we waited for over 50 minutes. During this time, a party of 15 who was in the restaurant after us finished and left before we even had our food... And the whole row of tables near us also had their food way before us and even finished. Every time the waitress walked out, my friends and I were so disappointed. MIND YOU, THERE WERE THREE OF US and we really didn't order much food at all. We finally got our food 10 minutes short of being there for two hours. They didn't even follow my order, I asked for a specific topping on top! And my other friend asked for light cheese and mushrooms! At that point, we were too tired and hungry to complain so we just ate it . Then we finished, asked for a box and I asked the waitress if she could give us a discount because we were in the restaurant for over 2 hours at that point and my friend missed his train to the suburbs. She said she would talk to the manager and walked away before I even got a chance to mention the rest of my qualms such as messing up my order, making us wait so long in comparison to the other groups. Then she walks out with a check that's $5 off of a bill of $50. REALLY?!? I have never felt so disrespected and disappointed. After all that crap, they take $5 off of the bill and no one bothered to apologize? We ended up giving that $5 and more back in tip. I don't think it's fair that we were treated that way and at this point, I don't think I'll be going back because my experience was a waste of time, money and pizza.

56.description: Awesome. Incredible pies. Delivery service takes a while so plan ahead (we ate it twice and both times was over an hour wait), but it is SO worth it. Most incredible pizza I've ever had. Will do this everytime there's an option.

29.description: Oh goodness gracious, the best pizza I've had in Chicago! We had a stuffed pizza with just cheese and pepperoni and it was the best pizza I've ever had! It was cheesy without being too cheesy and the sauce was amazing! The crust was crispy without being too thin, and all together it made for an amazing slice. We were told it would take around 45 minutes to make, but it ended up being there before we finished our appetizer, the cheesy garlic bread.

42.description: I grew up in the suburbs of Chicago and this has always been my favorite pizza. I love the deep dish sausage and their Cesar salad. I've gone here multiple times with people from work for lunch since it is within walking distance from our office. The lunch special is perfect since you get a small pizza and a side and a drink. The parmesan fries are also really good. If you aren't a fan of the deep dish pizza their thin crust pizza is also really good so there is something for everyone. The staff at this location has always been very nice and fast.If this is your first time having deep dish pizza keep in mind that it takes at least 45 minutes to make it so make sure you're not in a hurry! I think at some locations you can call ahead to place your order. The desserts here are also really good (especially the cannoli).

23.description: The food is overpriced. Which I can not fault THIS location for. What I CAN fault them for is their ineptitude. My last 3 orders from here have ALL been faulty in some way. We normally order a pizza and a family size greek salad. Sounds easy enough. But for some reason, it is never prepared right. The salad has had bacon in it once, it had no tomatoes in it previously too. Ok. I can overlook that. The pizza has been wrong, burnt, or had the wrong toppings on it. Mind you, we are not substituting anything. It is the same pizza as ON THE MENU! I'm done. I'm actually currently waiting in the restaurant waiting for my food that I ordered over an hour ago and had to send back because the pizza was burnt. This is the LAST time SL Giordanos. The LAST time.

47.description: This was great pizza. It is so much food though so my stomach could only handle one slice.  I ordered the Chicago classic and it was great. The stuffed pizza was jam packed with mushrooms, pepperoni and onions/green peppers. I like the sauce on the pizza too. It was loaded with tomatoes and I can really appreciate the powerful tomato top layer on my pizza. I also loved the waiter and I enjoyed the setting. It's perfect for a family. Plenty of big screens all around the restaurant make this a great place to socialize too.

8.description: I have been a few times and it is just always terrible. Let me say Giordano's is not bad, just this specific location. I went with my family yesterday and we got a medium pizza and pasta. We came in at 7:00 P.M. (Even) and sat, Ordered when our drinks came around.. about 8:47 P.M (when you are hungry you keep at the clock) they bring us the pepperoni medium and watery undercooked pasta. It was so depressing. We really tried to eat it because we were so hungry after a day of exploring Chicago, and going on Campus tours .. but, the pizza and especially the pasta was just too terrible.ALSO - The place was half empty

31.description: I'm from LA and this was my first time having a deep dish pizza. Wow!! It by far exceeded my expectations. We decided we want pizza at 11 and unfortunately a lot of the Giordano's close earlier. So we were lucky that this place was open till 12pm. We pre-ordered it on the phone because we were told it takes 30 to 45 mins to make. When we got there the host and waiters were VERY friendly even though it was 11:45pm by then and it was about time that they close for the night.We had ordered a large for two people because we were "starving". We had one slice each. It was sooo  amazing but also very heavy and there was no way we could go for seconds. For cheese and bread lovers (which is everyone) this is the thing for you to have!I'm craving it again just thinking about it ....lucky for us all, they do deliver to anywhere in the States! They halfbake it, package it and deliver it right to your door. All you have to do is bake it and then serve! There is no resisting it....I'll definitely be ordering it.

34.description: Excellent Chicago stuffed pizza! Greek salad was good too but lettuce was a little brown on the edges. Great service at the bar. Keep in mind stuffed pizza takes a little longer, but well worth it!

16.description: Service sucks. We sat down a little after 11am and ordered almost immediately. 3 tables came in at 15 min intervals after that. All of which got their food LONG before we got ours. The server was no where to be found at times. We ordered a salad with grilled chicken. Usually means hot and fresh. But no. It was cold and gooey. Definitely had better service at other giordanos locations. Won't be coming back to this location that's for sure.

13.description: Received another call from Giordano's corporate office. They cared very much about the feedback and correcting the situation. They supplemented my $15 credit with a $25 gift card so that it will cover another order of the correct pizza. In addition to the monetary part of this situation, they genuinely cared about making their customers happy, which was refreshing after my experience with the franchise. I will give this location another try for delivery, but I will place my order over the phone.

11.description: Recently ordered a small takeout pizza and found a strand of hair embedded in the topping.  Called in to let them know and the manager was willing to exchange for another one, and even offered to size up to a medium. However, no apology was given. We had to wait 20 minutes and drive back to exchange the pizza. Upon picking up, I was greeted with an offhanded attitude, as if we tried to cheat them of something. Not friendly, not apologetic, no apology given. To give us all that trouble, the manager acted like we were the one who's wrong...how rude! And by the way, they did not size up the pizza as offer. Not that we needed a larger pizza, but still.... Had a extra thin pizza....it was just okay...

39.description: First time trying Chicago deep dish and we weren't disappointed! Ooeey gooey mouth fulls of cheese that stretched a mile when pulled apart. The absolute only thing that wasn't out of this world fantastic was the wait time and the fact that they wouldn't deliver less than half a mile down the road.

37.description: Can you spell discrimination? To the "manager" Joe...I'm talking to you. Brought my out-of-town family here hoping we'd get a nice, quick taste of Chicago before hitting the town. Should have known better. There was nothing quick or nice about it. Our party of 4 waited 20+ mins to be seated in a half-empty dining room. We watched dumbfounded as several other parties of 4 walked in after us...and got seated before us. At one point even the hostess shrugged in amazement. Joe, who said he was the manager, was directing traffic. So we asked him for an explanation, pointing out the obvious. Then...and I kid you not...out of the blue Joe accuses us of "playing the race card." REALLY?! No one mentioned race...ever. As for my multi-racial family...MINDS BLOWN! Joe's idiotic accusation told more about him than any of us. Perhaps management does discriminate...maybe against seniors (my parents are 65), or adorable little kids (my 2 year old was also there). Who knows? Whatever the reason, Joe couldn't muster up the cognitive ability to explain his "selective" seating tactics. Instead he showed highest level of incompetence and lowest level of service imaginable. Unfathomably bad. PARENTS, SENIORS, KIDS, TOURISTS, SOUTH LOOPERS, NORTH SIDERS...hell EVERYONE...do yourselves a favor...AVOID THIS PLACE. And if you're listening corporate headqtrs...nutcase managers like Joe are destroying your brand. Nobody wants bullshit with their pizza.Never again.

0.description: Really great pizza, but one less star for the poor service quality.The service was a bit slow, where my table didn't get glasses of water until we reached out to our server twice, and he brought it to us 10 min after our second ask. We ordered the House Salad, small The Special, and small Chicken Deluxe. The salad was seriously so good with the zesty Italian dressing which paired super well with the pizza. The Special just differed slightly in taste than the Chicken Deluxe, because it had the green and red peppers. Both were really delicious and we left the restaurant full and satisfied.

38.description: Pizza is good, right? New York style pizza is good. I know that much. So why not try Chicago style pizza?The day had been a long one. It was about to end. The decision was made to give deep dish pizza a try. Giordano's it was.I was almost dead at that point, but the breaded mozzarella revived me somewhat. After 40 minutes of waiting, the pizza, ahem casserole, finally came out. Yeah, does it really need to take them 40 minutes to build a pizza? I couldn't even finish my half. Actually I didn't even finish two pieces. I'll blame that on my almost dying/falling asleep mid meal. Normally I'm sure I could've eaten my share. It was good. I will say that. Actually I'll say it again. It was good. I'm glad I tried it and I could eat some more some other time, but I won't make it a point to get deep dish every time I'm in Chicago. It was even good cold the next day when I was driving through the middle of Wisconsin.

51.description: The sloop giordanos is a very nice location, it's clean. The waiting staff are friendly and helpful. The food was on point! And the overall atmosphere was good. I've dined in, as well as, carried out and both experiences were good! If you're in the South Loop and want quality pizza, definitely check them out!

27.description: It was my first time in Chicago, and everyone suggested me trying Chicago's pizza. We were at the millennium park and that was the closer pizza place. When we first arrived, it was crowded but still the service was pretty good! Although we had to wait around thirty minutes for our table... The wait was worth it! The pizza was very good and the beer selection they have it's also very good! I strongly suggest you to come this place! Definitely, it was the greatest first experience with Chicago pizza! I will be back as soon as I have a chance!

32.description: I just had a terrible experience with this location. A few months ago, my husband and I ordered a pizza. An hour later, we received a call that our order was cancelled because the restaurant had lost power. To compensate, the manager offered us a credit. Tonight, we decided to use our credit, but when we called the restaurant their systems were down and no one was able to verify our credit. After 20 minutes on hold, I was able to speak to the manager (Steven) who told me that he needed a way to verify the credit because, "I'm not going to hand out free pizzas all night." Then, he told me that my credit didn't exist. I'm offended and going to order elsewhere in the future.

54.description: Other than the weird tasting house salad that I orders that had Asiago cheese on it. Everything else including the service and the deep dish pizza was Heaven. I told server I wasn't to happy with salad, he quickly took it off my bill and replaced it with some BBQ wings. Those wings were heaven also. Always a great experience going to any Giordanos location! Consistent!

48.description: Had a really good visit here. The only downside is that you have to wait 40 minutes for the pizza.. Otherwise, good service and really good pizzas!

44.description: We ordered this pizza to go.  Be warned that you'll need at least 45 minutes for them to make it.   It's worth every minute!  We ordered the special which came with sausage, peppers, onions, and mushrooms.  The cheese was so stringy as you pulled each piece and the crust was great.

24.description: Really delicious! We had carry out and it got a little cold and it was still amazing, I would love to go back and dine in and have it hot! We had the special (pepperoni, green peppers, mushrooms and onion). Very very good! I live far away but I'm considering ordering their frozen pizza online!! I just wish they had the special available for frozen order (they only have 1 toppings available now).

7.description: Visiting from California, I had to try the famous Chicago pizza!  I actually tried Gino's pizzeria in Magnificent Mile first and I was not impressed. I was actually really bummed that the pizza was nothing special.... i had been waiting so long to taste the famous chicago pizza! Because Gino's was such a let down, I was reluctant to spend another $40 on a large pizza. I decided to give it another try anyhow and I'm so glad I did!!! Rating the atmosphere, this place was so much cleaner, nicer, quieter, and just overall better restaurant. One of the locals told me that this is where the locals go to eat good deep dish pizza.The pizza was 5 stars! Amaaaazing!   Endless layers of toppings & cheesy goodness. Even though it was pricey, its the experience and great quality you pay for. There is also a long wait for pizza but it's soo worth it.  It's so filling that our family of 5 shared a large and still took home almost half the pizza.I had some fries while I waited. Really good as well. One negative comment is the servers at this location are not the friendliest... management also sucks. You win some... you lose some.

49.description: This was my first experience with Chicago deep dish and it was disappointing. We started our visit here waiting to be seated while a nearly empty restaurant was being served, as the hostess was not present, while the wait staff just glanced at us until we finally asked to be seated. Since it was going to be a 45 minute wait for the pizza, we ordered the wings, which were the best part of the meal. The pizza itself tasted like the crust was made out of corn meal, which didn't compliment the ingredients inside. The sauce however, was good, which was the only redeeming quality about the pizza. I wouldn't recommend.

40.description: Looking for an authentic chicago style pizza. Giordano's your answer.

53.description: Horrible experience! It took 1.5 hours for a sandwich and appetizer to be delivered. I called the restaurant to check on the status and the person I  spoke with was rude. The food was extremely cold when it was delivered and not very good. I would stay way from this location and try another store.

30.description: Totally upset!!! Coming home from a long day work to a burned pizza. What makes it worse is that I called to speak to management. I spoke to Manager Steve and he was no help. I tried to explain that my kids had dinner and they each had server themselves 2 slices each so when they realized it was burned they where already eating it . sorry I can't eat burned food , totally disappointed in the pizza most of all in their management and the way of his indifference. With management and employees that don't care what they server and about their customers will not have my business again. ):  ):

46.description: I keep trying to give Chicago pizza a chance, this deep dish fails. Had a cheese deep dish with my two kids, just no flavor at all. I love NY style pizza, deep dish just doesn't compare. Of course who doesn't love melted cheese, so yeah good, but the crust, tasteless, sauce was ok, I needed more to add some flavor to the whole thing.

1.description: Our server,  Trey was wonderful and attentive, even though I wasn't with the easiest of dinner parties.  He made sure we had enough food and drinks and checked in on us often.  The chicken tender appetizer was delicious, with fresh and moist chicken with a nice batter. The Caesar salad was smothered in dressing and I could barely finish the appetizer size because of that.   The Fettuccini Alfredo was sub-par in my opinion, It was too thin and needed salt.The pizza, which is the main draw is exactly what most deep dish lovers want.  The meat is yummy, the crust is perfectly crisp, and not soggy, the tomato sauce on top is well seasoned.  My only gripe is what most people will love...it is dripping in cheese.  The cheese is great, as far as cheeses go.  I'm just not a cheese person, so I don't eat more than a bite or two of pizza.  This location has been pretty popular since opening, and I can see why.  If you want Chicago deep dish pizza, this is one of the places that does a good job keeping true to the old school way of making a good pie!

55.description: Every time we come to Chicago, we always stop at Giordano's and like other reviews, this time I must admit I was rather disappointed. Although this is the first time that I have eaten at this location, the other three spots (N Rush St , W Van Buren St and a new one in Schaumburg) that I have been to have always been consistent, but this one was not like the others. We always pre-order our food, so we do not have to wait 45-minutes to one-hour for our pizza. This time we ordered about 40 minutes ahead, by the time we arrived, we waited about 30 more minutes, which is unacceptable, seeing that they said they put it in the oven right after we called it in. I ordered sangria, which is a very common drink, although it was good, it was 90% ice and 10% drink. As someone who bartended for seven years, I would never serve this to a customer. I said something, so our server brought a new one, which was much better.The interior and patio on the sidewalk of this place was nice, the people at the front door were friendly as well as other staff members that I encountered. While trying to find this place, we asked a local. After telling her we were going to Giordano's, she said to go to Lou Malnati's Pizzeria instead. After visiting this Giordano's, I will take her advice next time.[Review #317] (Seventieth Seventh Review of 2015)

9.description: I'm from LA and this was my first time having a deep dish pizza. Wow!! It by far exceeded my expectations. We decided we want pizza at 11 and unfortunately a lot of the Giordano's close earlier. So we were lucky that this place was open till 12pm. We pre-ordered it on the phone because we were told it takes 30 to 45 mins to make. When we got there the host and waiters were VERY friendly even though it was 11:45pm by then and it was about time that they close for the night.We had ordered a large for two people because we were "starving". We had one slice each. It was sooo  amazing but also very heavy and there was no way we could go for seconds. For cheese and bread lovers (which is everyone) this is the thing for you to have!I'm craving it again just thinking about it ....lucky for us all, they do deliver to anywhere in the States! They halfbake it, package it and deliver it right to your door. All you have to do is bake it and then serve! There is no resisting it....I'll definitely be ordering it.

26.description: Our favorite pizza place in Chicago.  As we sit here enjoying both a cheese as well as a half pepperoni/half sausage--together with a super ice cold beer, life just can't be any better.  Super nice people work at this south loop Giordano's.  The pizza is simple and complex at the same time.  The flavored are out of sight and can't recommend Giordano's enough.  When visiting Chicago--a must.  Enjoy!

25.description: Being a South Loop resident, we are always excited when new restaurants open in the neighborhood.  We finally decided to give Giordano's a try.  We ordered "The Special" stuffed pizza .... sausage, green peppers, onions, mushrooms.  "The Special" is nothing special.  In fact, it's a big ripoff!  The only thing good about the pizza is that it's cheesy .... lots of cheese.  In fact, when my husband took his first couple of bites he said it had too much cheese ... so much so that it obscured the taste of the other ingredients.  Then we realized that it was not obscuring the other ingredients.  It was obscuring the fact that the other ingredients were practically nonexistent.  We literally had to look at the menu to find out what was supposed to be in the pizza, because we were unsure!  When you get a pizza is it too much to ask that you get a taste of the toppings with every bite?  With this pizza we barely got one piece of each of the toppings in each slice.  I couldn't tell you how good or bad the sausage was because the piece was so tiny that I couldn't really taste it.  The crust wasn't good either.  The bottom portion was way too thin for a stuffed pizza and soggy.  This is Chicago.  Way too many other great pizza places to every go back to this Giordano's.

12.description: The Giordano's House Salad w/fennel delicious!!!! The Special (sausage, peppers, onions & mushrooms) was awesome.  We added black olives. Totally come here!

59.description: Pretty underwhelmed with Giordano's - wishing that Lou's would have let us call ahead. The sauce is tasty and you can tell it's made with care. The deep dish crust was bleh and really didn't have much character. The sausage was bland and very under-seasoned. Would skip next time.

21.description: We walked from the Hilton Chicago to Get his pizza.Thank goodness for the bar! We sat down immediately and got our drinks as we looked at the menu. We ordered the bruschetta and deep dish pizza called The Special. The pizza was good but not our style being from the west coast. The pizza was loaded....and I mean loaded with cheese! I love cheese but this was too much for us. Not our style but still good.

17.description: I'm from NJ and when I come to Chicago, I ALWAYS go to giordanos. I've never been so disappointed with my service at a restaurant before. We showed up at 6:10. The girl wrote my name down on a piece of paper and said it was a 20-30 minute wait. Then we waited for 35+ mins and my friend went inside to let her know we are outside waiting and the girl at the desk was totally out of it. My friend wasn't sure if she even understood what he told her. Then I went inside 15 mins later and asked what's going and then another girl was shaking her head at the original girl and put our name on another waiting list. I asked how long the wait was and she said she didn't know. Then we wait for another 15 minutes and then a girl came outside and said oh our manager said its okay to seat people outside.  And we said fine and asked if we could order right away. Then we waited for over 50 minutes. During this time, a party of 15 who was in the restaurant after us finished and left before we even had our food... And the whole row of tables near us also had their food way before us and even finished. Every time the waitress walked out, my friends and I were so disappointed. MIND YOU, THERE WERE THREE OF US and we really didn't order much food at all. We finally got our food 10 minutes short of being there for two hours. They didn't even follow my order, I asked for a specific topping on top! And my other friend asked for light cheese and mushrooms! At that point, we were too tired and hungry to complain so we just ate it . Then we finished, asked for a box and I asked the waitress if she could give us a discount because we were in the restaurant for over 2 hours at that point and my friend missed his train to the suburbs. She said she would talk to the manager and walked away before I even got a chance to mention the rest of my qualms such as messing up my order, making us wait so long in comparison to the other groups. Then she walks out with a check that's $5 off of a bill of $50. REALLY?!? I have never felt so disrespected and disappointed. After all that crap, they take $5 off of the bill and no one bothered to apologize? We ended up giving that $5 and more back in tip. I don't think it's fair that we were treated that way and at this point, I don't think I'll be going back because my experience was a waste of time, money and pizza.

10.description: I'm told this is the best chicago pizza for people who aren't from chicago. Well, I'm not from chicago. So I thought this was the best deep dish pizza I've ever had. I'm a big fan of NY style pizza. I am in NYC a few times a year. So I wasn't sure how much I'd like deep dish. I loved it. It's like a savory, delicious pie.

5.description: We had a fantastic dinner at Giordanos, everyone who works here is so nice!  We beat the rush and went in early, and had a fantastic pizza and some bruschetta.  Our only disappointment was that the sausage was pretty skimpy in our pizza.  A must in Chicago!

3.description: This was my cheat meal after a long day at work. I got the classic, smalldeep dish (6 slices) and for someone who doesn't eat cheese anymore this was quite good. They managed to cook the pizza so that the bottom has a crispy crust yet you still got that soft deep dish feel in the middle. Worth trying when visiting Chicago. Best deep dish I've had so far.

35.description: If your in the Chicago area you have to try this place or Gino's no excuse. Went with the deep dish pepperoni and sausage pizza as well as some wings for an app since the pizza took 45 min to cook. Pizza was a 5/5 but the dining room was somewhat dirty and the server had no personality.  So for that they get 4/5 otherwise the food was great, definitely a Chicago experience.

19.description: Totally upset!!! Coming home from a long day work to a burned pizza. What makes it worse is that I called to speak to management. I spoke to Manager Steve and he was no help. I tried to explain that my kids had dinner and they each had server themselves 2 slices each so when they realized it was burned they where already eating it . sorry I can't eat burned food , totally disappointed in the pizza most of all in their management and the way of his indifference. With management and employees that don't care what they server and about their customers will not have my business again. ):  ):

28.description: I would give it better service had they acted in a decent manner service was absolutely horrible I waited 15 min before even being acknowledged and brought water menus anything. If it's one thing that's unacceptable  when visiting a restaurant it's horrible service before you've had the chance of tasting what's so great that they all brag about absolutely disappointed in management when there are legit people out there who need work !!!!! give Chicago a better title people it starts small #dobetter #imranting #sorryinadvance

45.description: Excellent pizza. Bbq chicken bacon stuffed pizza was amazing. We had it delivered and it arrived about 20 minutes before expected time which was great!

33.description: Did not deliver a pizza within 45 minutes of promised time (ordered online at 6:15p, told it would arrive at 7:45 at the time of order, called at 8p because still no pizza, and was told it would not arrive until 8:30p). who wants to wait? there are other pizza joints in chicago.

43.description: The Giordano's House Salad w/fennel delicious!!!! The Special (sausage, peppers, onions & mushrooms) was awesome.  We added black olives. Totally come here!

2.description: I had a craving for pizza tonight and normally I get one from Gino's East. If I recall, they really disappointed me last time because they're getting skimpy. If I'm paying $25 for a medium pizza, it better be good. There's always a debate as to which pizza to eat in Chicago. I eat them all. You have to give them all a chance and appreciate the differences.This Giordano's medium spinach and mushroom did not disappoint. I used to think it was too bready, but today, the density of this pizza was perfect. What a welcome sight on a 10 degree night in Chicago. First time at the South Loop location. I'm going back soon.

18.description: This is the most unprofessional Giordanos in the city. They have consistently made mistakes on my orders and the manager Steve is completely incompetent. He needs to take a course in customer service. I really hope they find a new manager to run this place, they are known for good pizza but bad customer service and being disorganized can ruin a good name. I'd rather have Lou Malnati's which is also located in south loop.

41.description: First time in Chicago and had to try the deep dish. From the 2 restaurants I ate at , Giordano's was the best. From toppings to the crust this was real pizza not just all cheese. Plus pasta dishes were better, refined and tasted traditional.

52.description: Hands down among the worst delivered food I've had in Chicago.  While upfront that delivery would take an hour and a half for a small order (e.g. salad, sandwich, calamari, etc.), I did not expect that everything would arrive cold and soggy, as if it had been sitting somewhere for the hour and a half.  We only live four blocks away.  They even screwed up the salad by leaving out things I did not ask to leave out when the order was placed.  Even the salad dressing was problematic because whoever packed it to go didn't stir the vinaigrette before packing it.  I basically got bland oil for salad dressing.  An all around disappointing experience. With other Giordano's that serve our area and other similar places in the neighborhood, there are thankfully many other alternatives. Won't be ordering again from this location, that's for sure.

50.description: Sort of like an IHOP on a Saturday morning, only it was 9pm and people were still lined up out the door. Even though it was beautiful outside and a lot of people were waiting to be seated, they closed the patio. Who knows why. We noticed some people ordered their pizza to go and ate outside anyway. Be prepared to wait an hour for a "just ok" deep dish pizza.  Two stars are for the server who seemed to be doing the best she could in a strange operation.

4.description: Very nice atmosphere! Cynthia is very sweet The pizza is delicious! Worth the walk from the Hilton

6.description: Pizza was the best I've ever had. We had takeout, did not eat in, but upon arrival staff was friendly and helpful. Great atmosphere.

22.description: Visiting from California, I had to try the famous Chicago pizza!  I actually tried Gino's pizzeria in Magnificent Mile first and I was not impressed. I was actually really bummed that the pizza was nothing special.... i had been waiting so long to taste the famous chicago pizza! Because Gino's was such a let down, I was reluctant to spend another $40 on a large pizza. I decided to give it another try anyhow and I'm so glad I did!!! Rating the atmosphere, this place was so much cleaner, nicer, quieter, and just overall better restaurant. One of the locals told me that this is where the locals go to eat good deep dish pizza.The pizza was 5 stars! Amaaaazing!   Endless layers of toppings & cheesy goodness. Even though it was pricey, its the experience and great quality you pay for. There is also a long wait for pizza but it's soo worth it.  It's so filling that our family of 5 shared a large and still took home almost half the pizza.I had some fries while I waited. Really good as well. One negative comment is the servers at this location are not the friendliest... management also sucks. You win some... you lose some.

15.description: Every time we come to Chicago, we always stop at Giordano's and like other reviews, this time I must admit I was rather disappointed. Although this is the first time that I have eaten at this location, the other three spots (N Rush St , W Van Buren St and a new one in Schaumburg) that I have been to have always been consistent, but this one was not like the others. We always pre-order our food, so we do not have to wait 45-minutes to one-hour for our pizza. This time we ordered about 40 minutes ahead, by the time we arrived, we waited about 30 more minutes, which is unacceptable, seeing that they said they put it in the oven right after we called it in. I ordered sangria, which is a very common drink, although it was good, it was 90% ice and 10% drink. As someone who bartended for seven years, I would never serve this to a customer. I said something, so our server brought a new one, which was much better.The interior and patio on the sidewalk of this place was nice, the people at the front door were friendly as well as other staff members that I encountered. While trying to find this place, we asked a local. After telling her we were going to Giordano's, she said to go to Lou Malnati's Pizzeria instead. After visiting this Giordano's, I will take her advice next time.[Review #317] (Seventieth Seventh Review of 2015)

57.description: I have been a few times and it is just always terrible. Let me say Giordano's is not bad, just this specific location. I went with my family yesterday and we got a medium pizza and pasta. We came in at 7:00 P.M. (Even) and sat, Ordered when our drinks came around.. about 8:47 P.M (when you are hungry you keep at the clock) they bring us the pepperoni medium and watery undercooked pasta. It was so depressing. We really tried to eat it because we were so hungry after a day of exploring Chicago, and going on Campus tours .. but, the pizza and especially the pasta was just too terrible.ALSO - The place was half empty

20.description: Favorite pizza in the world.  The buttery crust. The amount of cheese. The slightly sweet sauce... It's all delicious.I can't comment on anything other than the deep dish pizza and the service, despite having eaten here 30 times or so in my 2 years of grad school... I've always ordered the deep dish. The service at this location was great. I called ahead so that it was ready just a few minutes after I got there. My waiter was the bartender (I sat at a high top) and I can't complain about my service.Could be cheaper.

36.description: I frequent this location and it always meets my expectations. Every time I've visited Chicago, I made a point to find a location, and now that I live here, I visit frequently. I've tried several locations and they always seem to be consistent. In my opinion, this is the best deep dish in town. If it's your first time, be prepared because it will take about 45 minutes for your pizza to cook, but it'll be worth every second. They also have some very good appetizers and drink selections to keep you comfortable while you wait. They also offer frozen deep dishes which I keep handy in my freezer for those late night cravings. Also, for you out of towners, they will ship anywhere in the US. Although the fresh is my preference, when I lived elsewhere, I had pizza shipped to my house on a few occasions and it worked out great every time. It is a little pricey to ship, so my advice is to order more for a bigger discount and convince your friends to split it up. They won't be sorry!

14.description: Starting from beginning to the end:Ordered a frozen strawberry lemonade which ended up tasting phenomenal (it is botomless)! The server was great checking up on our party at good times. She had a weird problem remembering our friend ordered a regular coke and not diet, but that wasn't a big deal. We ordered garlic parmesan fries and bruschetta since we were informed our chicago classic pizza was going to take at least 45 mins to make. The fries were delicious and I wish it came with more. The bruschetta was more of a beautiful hybrid of bruschetta and caprese salad. It was deeelicious. Finally, the moment of truth-- our Chicago classic pizza arrived after a 45 minute wait. The inside was amazing. I wasn't the biggest fan of the crust which was a bit of a let down for me, but my friends and I still enjoyed it. There's probably a better place that's a hole in the wall. This place wasn't half bad though!

3.description: Let's just say that I got a cut from here, but had to fix it when I got home.

1.description: If there was a negative star option this place would get it. I'm simply appalled at the shockingly bad hair cut I received matched by the equally bad if not worse business conduct by the bloke who cut my hair.  I was facing away from the mirror while my hair was getting cut.  When my girlfriend saw it after it was cut and the product had wore off she absconded my terrible haircut and pointed out how the back was was completely uneven, the top looked like a mini bowl cut that an alligator had ripped chunks out, and there was a random shaved spot in the front. When I went back to show them the terrible work and try to get my money back the man named Dana who cut my hair immediately started yelling on the defense saying I was full of shit and needed a beating.  All while I was trying to show him how terrible his job was.  He kept cursing and wanting to fight me until his fellow barber told him to calm down and held him back telling him there was a child in front of me. If this is how they do business I'm pretty sure there is another business that is probably not legal that is keeping their door open to the unsuspecting public.  Enter at your own risk!

2.description: This place gets no stars.  The level of service is absolutely ridiculous.   Ive been going to the shop off and on for about a year.  Everybody there would talk about how bad the owner was with her clients....bouncing payroll checks and beyond.  Well I finally got a run in with this miserable old lady...and I use lady lightly.  I parked in there parking lot only because there were no parks on the street and mind you it says parking for d'jons.   The owner wasn't there it was almost 6pm and there shop closes at 630.  So I guess she came right b4 they closed and she parked next to my car and it was so dam tight I couldn't understand why anyone but a fool would squeeze in and risk damaging someone's car yet alone her old BMW truck.  So as  I went to get my car I couldn't get out so I went in and politely ask her to move her car.  She came out and wants to give a lecture about parking.  I'm like maam I got things to do could you please just move your car.  She declined and went back in her shop.   Keep in mind I'm a client that just got my hair cut at your shop.  It's not like her business is overflowing.  She could of easily came in and asked me to move my car or hey....just not park there out of courtesy for your client.  I had to call the POLICE.......They had her move my car.  She told me not to park there again....I'm like ...huh....I'm not coming to this place again in life.  I would not recommend anyone to support this business.  It's sad that a older woman would conduct herself in such a manner.   It's a bad representation for a black barbershop.  There are many black barbershop that are really good so look for another one

5.description: D Jon's is a very cool and relaxing place to get a haircut. Hands down the best shop I've been to in years.

6.description: It hurts to write this review but FAIR is FAIR. Moved to Chicago from Brooklyn and I was looking for a barbershop that could cut African American hair downtown, as I live in the South Loop. I walked by D'Jon a couple times but was skeptical so I traveled down to the south side for haircuts. I finally went to D'Jon and got my haircut from Al. He did a decent job so I decided to go with D'jon over the south side out of pure convenience. I purchased buy 4 cuts and get the fifth one free package through the Shop. Called for an appointment and they said Al no longer worked there and gave me non working number.
