I spoke with the owner, Diane, several times about receiving a refund and she keeps telling me I have to deal with Al. HOW CAN I DO THAT IF YOU DO NOT PROVIDE ANY CONTACT INFO TO REACH HIM ? Also, I paid the shop D'jon not Al. It truly hurts me when I cannot support local and minority business... Back to the Southside - FLAWLESS Barbershop - Steve.

7.description: Nice shop and friendly staff. I was very happy with my haircut.

0.description: The level of loyalty a man has to his barber is very high, so it took a lot for my boyfriend to part with his barber in Hyde Park. The commute wasn't so much the issue as the super long wait times once he got there. Taking a chance on a shop around the corner, he ventured into D Jon's on a Tuesday and had his hair cut by Eric. There was no wait time, which might be a great option for those looking to get in and out during the week. They even offer online booking for busy individuals.He paid about $30 for a hair cut and a straight razor shave and was very happy with the service. He's been going for the past few weeks and has nothing negative to say. I would recommend anyone looking for a good cut to ask for Eric. Barbers are not created equally, so this review is strictly regarding the service Eric provided.I think the exterior could use some work. I'm not much of a fan for the outdated pictures in the window, but then again I'm not getting my hair done here lol. I'm glad to see a barbershop in the South Loop. Hope they continue to grow.

4.description: Don't go here, I think it's a front for anything but cuts

3.description: I went here because I was at a professional conference and was staying in the hotel, didn't have the energy to go forage afield for food. McCormick Place is unfortunately located in a 'food desert' type of neighborhood where any sort of actual restaurant aside from the conference center food court and what's at this hotel are about a 15 minute walk away (and not a nice walk for a young woman alone at night).I sat at the bar and was quickly given a menu and asked if I would like to order by a bartender. I said I just needed a minute to look things over and would just have a water.  It was extremely difficult to catch anyone's attention to place my order after that. There were 4 people at least behind the bar and it was almost like they were purposefully avoiding eye contact (maybe just with people who had ordered water?). I eventually was able to place an order and after that waited a very long time to get my takeout meal. I timed how long it took from when I sat down until when I walked away with the takeout bag: 1 hour (1 hungry hour!). The food was decent, but when I got up to my hotel room, I realized they got my order wrong, too. Adding insult to injury, the 'house salad' that comes with the entree is a little white soup container of spring mix (no other vegetables).

1.description: The best bartender in Chicago is miss.paula her personality is just as good as her wonderful service. Her bloody Mary's with bc stuffed olives are to die for! She was beyond nice she even walked us to where the train was. It's like she was a friend not someone just there to feed me and give me a cocktail. She really wanted to make my 1st trip to chitown the best it could be. I will stay at this hotel again just for the great service at this bar! Oooo and the shrimp cocktail was a 10 :) the pineapple and mango salsa!!!?!!!?! Love love love

2.description: Liked - fast and friendly service at bar- well stocked barSo so- expensive drinks ....this ain't Manhattan. It's a convention hotel. Sheesh.

9.description: I never expect much from hotel bar food no matter how nice the hotel may be. We wanted something easy for before the Bears vs Cowboys game that wouldn't get us stuck in pre game traffic. Since we were staying in the hotel we decided to give it a shot. When we arrived it looked like a lot of other hotel guests/ game goers had the same idea as we did. There was only one open table that had yet to be cleaned from the previous guests. We grabbed it and waited. And waited. And then began to wonder if we were supposed to be ordering at the bar. Just as we were about to head up to the bar to ask a waitress showed up. We weren't sure there were any servers because in the ten minutes we had waited we hadn't seen a single one. It quickly became apparent that she was the only server on duty for the entire restaurant which seemed like poor planing considering the staff was well aware of the football game. We ordered nachos and a Kobe beef burger. The nachos were huge which was nice since they cost $12.00. They were pretty tasty too. The Kobe burger was a tad over cooked but the smoked cheddar cheese was nice. The $15.00 price tag was fairly reasonable for Kobe beef also which was unexpected in a hotel bar. The biggest issues we had were the price of the soft drinks at $4.00 each which were never refilled and the waiting we had to do for the check while the one poor waitress tried to scramble around assisting everyone in the entire place. We would consider dining here again on our next visit to Chicago but I would hope they were more appropriately staffed for the conditions!

10.description: This is the place everyone goes to after the Chicago Housewares Show. You should see this place the first day of the show... packed! After a long day, and everyone waiting for cab lines to go down, we just go there to unwind, catchup with people from the industry, and meat some more. Drinks are always good, servers always friendly... The last day of the show, we went here with coworkers. This time we had the Cheese Sampler, and ordered, from the "Minis" the Chili Dogs (really good), The Buffalo Chicken (a bit spicy, but also good), and the Reuben.  We all eat, drink and celebrate we made it through another show.

4.description: Food was great, ordered the portobello mushroom burger with fries. Service was poor. Seemed like a lot of the orders were mixed up and late. They weren't that busy either.

6.description: Standard hotel bar experience. Stopped in for lunch. Not busy and was waited on immediately. Ordered the nachos. Came out quickly and was a large portion, but not very flavorful and appeared to just have canned ground beef and some salsa dumped on a chips and warmed together. Little cheese to speak of and found the lower chips soggy. Drinks were not refilled and had to ask for check once done. Even with nice portion size, the value still left much to be desired.

12.description: Although the drinks are a bit pricy. The great attentive staff and wonderful variety of drinks makes up for it!.

5.description: We were so tired and starving, we decided to try MX because it was in the hotel.  Considering it is a bar, we had excellent service.  food was pretty good.  I had the burger and my friend had the sirloin.  We were pretty impressed.

13.description: This is a unique review as I am writing about their Sunday BBQ outdoors on the patio.  While walking our dogs we spotted a sign that advertised it as dog friendly.  That is an understatement as they roll out the red carpet for the dogs (literally).  The waiters came to our table with red carpet rugs shaped like  bones & buckets of water. They offer doggie sorbets for $1.50 that are quite large.The menu is based on a BBQ with the chef outside working grills & cooking up Ribs, pulled pork, chicken & other items.  Prices range from $9. to $19. & include two sides and a dessert.  We both ordered Pulled Pork ($13.) that was dee-lish as were the sides. My only complaint would be that they did not bring butter out with my corn on the cob.  However the wait staff (yes staff, there were 3 people making sure we were taken care of) was fantastic.  Yes it was not busy but we got the royal treatment as did the furry kids.

11.description: I am giving this bar three stars only because the barmaid, Paula was the friendliest, sweetest barmaid I have ever met.  I went down there for a late night snack to take back to my room.  Two nights in a row.  The first night I ordered a hamburger.  It was the flattest driest hamburger I have ever seen or eaten. Flat as McDonalds hamburgers are they aren't dry and tasteless.  The second nite, I decided against the hamburger and decided to only get the French fries.  WELL, two people sitting next to me ordered hamburgers and as they passed under my nose and past my vision, they looked like real hamburgers.  They had substance.  They were thick like I would've expected a hamburger to be.  I can't begin to explain what happened to mine. I can only conclude that quality is inconsistent with their hamburgers. Being a junk food junkie  I wish they had hot dogs too.

8.description: They do not have a very good draft beer selection, and they have very little in their menu for food, so I'd you are staying here more than a couple days, you've gone thru everything. The middle aged white female bartender was a huge bitch, too. She should not be a bartender, for sure. But the servers are great and the Diavolo linguine was very good!

0.description: I knocked out on the first night in Chicago waking up at 10pm staying at the Hyatt which the restaurant is in my bf and I decided that we would just eat here since its the most convenient thing to do. The drinks are pricey but at least they list off the prices! Our waitress was AMAZING she was super friendly, helpful and everything you would want from a server. I got the mini sandwiches which are 4bucks a piece you have to try the Reuben sooo good. My bf got the burger which he enjoyed cooked perfectly with a nice side of fries. Definitely something unexpected we thought it would be another hotel joint that would be ok but M/X exceeded my expectations.

7.description: Sat at a table by the bar to simply have a beer with some co workers. 20+ minutes later I still don't have a beer and the bartender won't serve us. Trade show in town and management has not staffed the place properly.

3.description: I enjoy going into Andy's.  Its convenient and they really attend to their customers.  I normally venture in for nail and threading work.  Baby Samir really understands how to make a ladie's eyebrows look great.  My eyebrow's are never too thin nor too thick. Based on what I see from people getting their hair done in the salon, they look great.  I pay attention and I recognize talent when I see it and these fellas really know how to get your hair looking beautiful and flowing.   They are always flexible with fitting you in so if you need a stylist that is thorough knows how to take care of your hair.  Check out Andy's!

1.description: I like Andy, he's nice and a bit entitled.  You know, when your hairdresser thinks he knows better than you and everyone else.  Although, he definitely does no better.  I went to the salon with no makeup and looking ragged.  I left the salon and had so many random strangers complimenting my hair...it was insane.  Love this place, hope I can randomly come to Chicago atleast once a year to get my hair trimmed.

2.description: I could not be happier with Andy's Salon. They have the best shampoo person in the city. He seriously has magic hands. My stylist is Samir and he also has a magic touch with the curling iron. My long, natural hair is curled to a full, glamorous diva do. For $45, getting my hair done at Andy's is truly a bargain when everyone else absurdly charges extra for "long hair". I will not try another salon ever again!

5.description: Yes, Andy is very good but I don't care for the disregard and/or disrespect! That's why I left him after years of service!

6.description: This guy is Very good, if u catch him.

7.description: To say Andy is good at cutting hair is not good enough.  The man is an artist.  I would recommend this place to anyone.

0.description: He has been doing my hair for more than 15 years. He is so good I have followed him all over Chicago! He is humble and definitely has a sense of humor. The shop is quite comfortable and most of all He values my time! I am generally in and out in about an hour! Not to mention he is now open at 6AM 3 days a week! Talk about getting in before work! I recommend this shop for anything you need up to an including a great color job! Have you heard of the cliche' "you get what you pay for" well here you actually do!He knows hair! Whoever Jewell H is.....you need to bring whatever grievance you had to his attention! I am sure he will resolve it. He cant fix what he does not know about.

4.description: OK... so I wanted a new look for a new year... new cut and color.  I was referred to Andy as a real "stylist".    Two months and over $800 later, my hair is just beginning to grow back from where it fell out and broke off as a result of the processing by the "shampoo guys"... complete with chemical burns from the relaxer...  I have a hair color that is nowhere close to what I envisioned, nor what is flattering; also done by the shampoo guys...  and I have a haircut (courtesy of Andy) that makes me look like Julius Caesar on a bad hair day.    I know... you're asking "why did you go back?"... I guess I thought that at some point Andy would acknowledge the problem and try to make it right... never happened!   Maybe this is a good place for a shampoo and blowdry... but I'd skip the real "styling" services.

3.description: I live in the South Loop of Chicago and didn't know where to go to get acrylic nails.  I found Zoe on Yelp and she had stellar reviews!  Upon meeting Zoe, she was very friendly and make me feel very welcome into her salon.  Zoe took her time doing my nails and made sure they were perfect.  After almost two weeks, they still look as good as the day she did them.  Most importantly, Zoe is professional and clean and her online scheduling makes my life so much easier.

1.description: My first time here and I loved it. Great service and awesome pedicure. Love the privacy. It's well worth it to have someone care for your nails like Zoe did.

2.description: I'm a suburbanite new to the South Loop area so I've been learning about the "who's who" in the business world through Yelp. I found Zoe via a nail salon search and was able to get a same day appointment for a pedicure. Her online appointment scheduling worked with ease. The salon is tucked away on State St., so if you are not actively paying attention you may miss it because there is limited signage. The salon has private suites so the pedicure is performed behind closed doors. The suite was very clean and cozy. The spa chair was comfortable and offered a nice massage. I neglected my feet for a couple of months so I got a special treatment for callous removal. Zoe was able to get my feet pretty darn close to baby soft and they are still soft a month after my pedicure. Her nail shaping and polish job was very neat. Again, it's been a month since my last visit and my polish is still "blinging" like I just left the salon. Zoe was very professional and friendly. I believe she said she's been in her business close to 20 years so she has the experience and knows what she's doing. I will definitely make another appointment with her next time I need nail services.

5.description: I love supporting small businesses, especially those owned by women. I hope that Zoe reads this so that other new customers don't have the same experience. She may be fantastic once you experience her services but I never got that opportunity. I made an appointment online and received an email confirmation. I showed up at the appointment on time. She opened the door, said "hi," and stared at me like I was coming to her house to sell her something. There was no greeting, no "nice to meet you, have a seat, I'll be with you in a moment." Nothing. I asked if she was Zoe (honestly I wasn't sure since I was getting the blank stare), she said yes and then quickly disappeared into a room. I was left standing there so I found a seat in the waiting room and waited. And waited. And waited. There was a woman walking around that I assumed was her assistant. After 20 minutes I asked the assistant to ask Zoe how much longer she would be and I was told 15-20 minutes. Had it not been for the email confirmation I would have thought I had come at the wrong time or day. Unfortunately I had a hair appointment so I couldn't wait that long to start my nail appointment. I told the assistant that I had to leave and her response? "You're going to be really sorry. You're missing out on a great manicure." The reality is that there are lots of places to get a good manicure in Chicago. In addition, there are lots of places that treat their customers with respect and value their time. So, no, I'm not "missing out." The real person who's missing out is Zoe. She just lost a cash paying client who gets manis and pedis all the time, and who decided to give a neighborhood small business a chance. She may have amazing skills but I assume that she has all the clients she needs/wants and is not looking to expand. In all fairness, she did send me an email apology later that day and offered to give me a free manicure. That was a nice gesture. But, honestly, I think I would have been more impressed if she had informed me that she was running 30 minutes late when I got there OR when I told her assistant I had to leave, she would have communicated with me while I was standing there that she was sorry for the delay. Unfortunately, I won't be taking her up on her offer to return.

6.description: I love Zoe!!! She has always given me the best pedicures, and really takes the time to make sure the polish is perfect.  Her massages are great too!  I started going to her when she was at Polish, and was so happy to find her again after they closed.  She's my go to girl for nails!

7.description: Zoe is great!  I come to her to get my no chip manicure.  I am addicted to it.  What is best is that the atomosphere is personal and she focuses on giving you her undivided attention. Her new chair gives an awesome massage.  If you are looking for a salon quality, and good clean atmosphere.  Stop right here.  Also the on-line scheduling is wonderful for a busy person like myself.  Go ahead and check out Zoe!!

8.description: Zoe is amazing!  I was so happy to have found her and those amazingly skilled hands (from the days at Polish).  She takes great care with your nails by filing, clipping, massaging and polishing them back to life.  My nails look fantastic.  Can't wait for my next appointment.

9.description: I've been searching for a nail salon that was on the south side.  Although it is south loop, the street parking was easy and I didn't have to fuss with the Drive or 90/94 to get there - so that automatically gets bonus points.  WARNING - Zoe is a perfectionist and isn't going to rush through your treatment and give you poor quality nails.  Although the session was longer than what I'm use to in the loop - my nails and toes have never looked and felt so cared for and beautiful.  I am definitely going to make this my "go to" place and praise her talents to all!

0.description: I don't yelp AT ALL, but when I do it's when things are either GREAT or TERRIBLE. This was my first visit to get my nails done by Zoe and I was greeted graciously by Zoe herself, she took my jacket and then led me to her own private room! There is nothing I love more than being able to really "escape" when I go to get my nails done. (I can't wait to get a mani/pedi but was trapped with time this day... it seems as if it would be such a serene experience, truly relaxing!) One of the things that continues to stick out to me was Zoe's ability to relate and bring conversation to the table. I'm more of the "leave me alone" while I'm getting my nails done type but when you can talk to someone and relate on a majority of topics; I'm game for conversation. Being a part of the service industry as well; I greatly appreciate someone who also works in it, understands it and respects it. Although it was my first time getting my nails done by Zoe, I held off on my review (even though I wanted to post one right after my appointment to see how the no-chip held up). I am a server, and CONSTANTLY washing my hands along with having a bad case of the hang-nails and still no chips! Not even a scuff! Zoe was more than informative on a number of products to use to try and help and I found that very comforting that she knew what worked and what I was using could be switched and show better results.DO NOT let me forget to mention the online-booking... LOVEEEEEEE IT! No phone calls, no talking, just a few quick clicks and boom you have your appointment followed by a confirmation email! In the end, not feeling rushed to get out of the chair due to someone who walked in and the manager not pushing Zoe to hurry up in order to serve a walk-in instead of finishing my nails was GREAT. I appreciate the reservation service provided, and find that Zoe has embraced her "art" and all that surrounds it. OVERALL..... I will continue to go back and represent Zoe for her hard work and devotion to making sure that every nail looks it's best and her customers are happy!

4.description: Zoe is a professional.  Her polish is flawless.  She knows how to take care of all of your manicure and pedicure needs.  I love the private room and the simple pedicure stations.  I don't have to worry about noisy crowds and unreliable services.

29.description: I'll give this Harold's location a lot of credit because it has online ordering AND the chicken and fries there were far better than some of the other locations I've frequented. I can only give  3 stars because the service is awful sometimes. The last time I was there the cashier disappeared for about 20 minutes while customers were entering the store and waiting impatiently to place an order. Either they were short-staffed or she was too busy watching Scandal on her tablet in the bathroom.

42.description: I used to live near this Harold's and I hated it! I couldn't stand it because the service was always slow and crackheads would wander in without fail. Just about everytime I came here I would find myself waiting 20-25 mins on a 4-5 piece mild (thats 4or 5 chicken wings with mild sauce, bread & fries for those that dont know)I came over last night starving after hanging at M Lounge and it was pretty empty at 1:45AM. That was probably due to The Shrine not letting out yet. Ordered a 4 piece mild; sat down and did the damn thing on it. Delicious as always! they also have a credit card machine there which is new for most Harold's Chicken.

23.description: Good chicken. Not the best I've had, but ranks in top 5.

47.description: Two stars for cleanliness, the place is spotless and the folks real nice.  But the chicken is really bland.  The sauce?  I asked for it on the side and it looked and tasted like a side of ketchup (didn't resemble barbeque sauce at all).I'm not sure why they have such a good reputation unless its because of the people who like bland food.  I've also heard about the great reputation of this chain for years, it could be because its clean, basic friend chicken with no seasoning.Not a fan of bland.  Mississippi Ricks down the street beats them hands down for taste of sauce and bird, but that place is filthy.  If only they'd get their act together and pass the Board of Health inspection. Sigh.

8.description: This is some GREAT chicken!! I licked my fingers like I was in a Popeyes remix.. I mean, this chicken was a little greasy but it was well worth it. I was hungry in chicago and waited about 10 minutes to get this order. It was definitely not fast but worth it. The chicken with mild sauce and fries were delicious. If you are near a Harold's, I promise they won't disappoint you.

31.description: Solid Harlod's location.  A bit more expensive than other locations, probably because Shrine is next door.  Pretty consistent quality & portions.

34.description: was driving around trying to decide what i want for dinner and i saw Harold's chicken.. it have a small parking lot in front too so that was cool.. the service was good.. the lady that worked there was really nice.. ordered the 6 pc wings with mild sauce.. it was pretty good but i was hoping the wings would be a little bigger..  it also came with fries and 2 slices of white bread.. the fries was just ok.. i wouldn't eat in there tho.. the staff is behind a bullet proof window and there is a few tables and chairs for you to eat there..

16.description: This is my favorite Harold's. The chicken is fresh and consistently good. Fries are always good and don't forget the mild sauce. They could speed up the wait time and like other reviews do something about the disenfranchised out front.

13.description: Great chicken! I always get a 6 wing fried hard with lemon pepper and mild sauce. :)

11.description: Extremely slow. Waited over 5 minutes for person to come to window for my order. Waited another 30+ minutes for an 8pc dark and some fries. I hope it tastes good as long as I'm having to wait. I get my order and its mixed. I said, I ordered an 8pc dark. She said, "a huh". I told her I had a wings and breasts in my order. She said, "we don't sell all dark".  So I look on the menu and order two four pc dark and pay $.25 more. She couldn't tell me when I placed my original order that they don't sell the 8pc all dark. Btw... I had to wait another 30 minutes for that order. Definitely won't come back or recommend this place to anyone. Gets 1 star because I couldn't place 0.

39.description: I was happy when they built this Harold's close to Chinatown. The other Harolds the parking was harder to get. I'm a seven wang dinner person, and I appreciate the cook getting me in and out quickly. I know the prices have inched up, but what else hasn't? They say the best Harold's is at 87th Street, but I'm happy with this one. When I got out my car, someone was holding the door for the Chinese restaurant next door because I was Chinese. I was going next door for my fried chicken fix.

37.description: Typically, if you're complaining about anything about Harold's, you really don't understand anything about Chicago outside of the north side and downtown.Its a "cultural" experience (for those of you who are reading this on Yelp) - they "specialize" in what is really the root of African American history - making "cheap scraps" taste finger lickin good.  You're paying $2.29 for a dinner special - two piece dark, extra mild, fries, a piece of bread, and occasionally some slaw. This is not "Food Network" style eats. But if you want some damn good chicken, you're in Chicago, and want your money going back through the community, look no further.

0.description: Best wings in Chicago! Service ? Not really . Slow and they don't care about customer they know people will still buy they Chicken wings. Honestly they are so good ! W/Lemon pepper ! Fries aren't good very soggy and always taste raw. But who cares when you get Best Wings in Chicago . 5 STARS not for service nor any other food it's only for the wings!!!

38.description: All Harold's taste the same in my opinion so I'm not rating the food I'm rating the service. I don't know who these people think they are! They cook chicken for minimum wage! They act like they're the damn soup nazi! And they're slow as all crap! I live about 5 minutes away from this place so I call before I leave to give them a good 15 minutes to prepare the food and when I get there I ALWAYS have to wait an additional half hour! And they literally make you beg for sauce that you've paid 85 extra for. And the damn chicken still doesn't have "extra" sauce on it. I'm a vegetarian now so I don't eat this crap and I wouldn't go here but my mom and sister like it so I only go in this place for them. I hate this Harold's!

51.description: I'm craving this so I might make a run for this tonight.The last time I came here, I called ahead to order AND told them that I lived in the South Loop AND I was driving straight over. The wonderful woman on the phone (ANGEL to me) told me that they would drop it right away and it would be ready by the time I get there. It was a 5 minute wait for me so I only had to refuse 2 solicitors inside the seating area. No I am NOT giving you my change and No I don't want to buy that candy bar for your high school basketball team because you look like you are 40 years old, playah.The gizzards I ordered were deliciously, perfectly sauced and fried. It was the food of the gods!

27.description: OMG! This is the spot if you want bomb fried chicken! The price is right, the food is the bomb, & the sauce is on point!We walked in & no one was there about 45 min before they closed. This place got jumping 10 minutes later w/ a line 8 people deep. Even towards closing people were still coming in.Sample either sauce so you know which to get if you haven't tried it before. I suggest to get the sauce on the side. If you get it on the chicken it's just too messy. If you get it on the side ask for extra. There's plenty of these all throughout Chicago so take the time to checkout this hidden gem of goodness!

32.description: Yuuuuuuum!!Kinda far from my neck of the woods but I just happened to be in the neighborhood and thought I try this location. Consistent, hot, and delicious. Wait was about 30-40 minutes but well worth it IMO.

54.description: Still rocking the bulletproof glass, there's not much to differentiate this Harold's from the MoneyGram location on the corner of the strip mall. Still, the chicken is fantastic and the inside is as clean and spacious a place as I've seen at Harold's - there's even a few booths to sit down!

48.description: Yummy! This is definitely a place for the natives to come. We were told to come her and order the 4 wings with mild sauce and salt and pepper on top. What a great suggestion! It was not only delicious, but also a great value - think we paid only $5 for it all. The meal comes with 4 wings, 2 pieces of sliced bread, coleslaw, and fries. Next time I'll ask for the sauce to be separate from my fries but all in all it was so good! It was also surprisingly really filling. The location is pretty cool too, seems to be near a lot of schools so there were a lot of people walking around.

44.description: 4 stars for food, 2 stars for atmosphere.-1 for 15 minute wait after ordering food+1 for great mild sauce+1 for sizable proportions-1 for small seating area+1 for walking distance from McCormick Place-1 for only accepting credit cards through ATM-1 for decorRecommended for take-out only.

24.description: So I work for a medical office and we decided to order from Harold's. We called in our order @ 12:40 and had someone there @ 1:20 to pick it up because, they told us 20 minutes. Well the food wasn't ready till well after 1:40. It was hot when we got it but they should of told us it was gonna be later.

7.description: Rhonda is an incredible cashier! With something as simple as an order for chicken she takes time to ask questions to make sure your order is perfect. She greets you with a smile,  which is not common place in other Harold's Chicken restaurants.

49.description: This is the best Harolds in Chicago other than the one on 87th & Dan Ryan. Food comes fresh and piping hot. Only downside is the wait is so long you  would think they're in the back chasing after the chicken they're about to cook. I also hate how the juice from the cole slaw gets on my fries and chicken. Yuck!

40.description: Quality has gone way down here!! I thought I'd give them a chance again. I ordered over the phone. 9 bucks for a small perch?? With 3 small measly pieces looking like perch nuggets and no fresh fries? Has fish gone up that much?? Also halfway done with eating I realize the fish doesn't look throughly cooked. If I get food poisoning you heard it here first folks. I feel taken advantage of. What happened?? Wont be coming back here again.

53.description: This is my favorite Harold's.   The wings are a healthy size, mild sauce is the bomb and the fries aren't all wrinkly. ...if only they coudl chase away the people you beg you for change for bus fare or food coming and going.

30.description: Restaurant ReviewYummy hot fried chicken. I have been craving this place after trying it at taste of chicago a few years back but have been unable to get to one of these locations until the past week. The restaurant itself is located in a rather interesting neighborhood that I probably would avoid at night i.e. there is 1 inch thick bullet proof glass with a revolving door to get your fried chicken. The prices are higher than popeye or KFC, however the chicken is larger and fried right on the spot. Typically you will have to wait 10-20 minutes before getting your meal. They also have fried fish, liver, giblet, etc. Make sure you bring cash as they have a service fee for credit cards through this weird ATM like machine.... Otherwise great fresh hot fried chickenPro- piping hot fried chicken, super crispy/natural flavorsCon- super long wait, more expensive than popeyes and no spicy variety. Avoid this area at night.Hidden deal-Order online to speed up the process and come in to pickup

46.description: best fried chicken and coleslaw

1.description: Work right near here, best lunch and dinner deal around. $2.99 for a two piece dark meat can't beat it. Get the Hot sauce it isn't even that spicy

9.description: It makes no sense to call in your order. They told me 20 minutes.  It took 40 minutes,  why even call. I'd lije 2 enjoy my lunch and not rush. Ridiculous.  You guys just lost a customer

26.description: The chicken here is absolutely amazing. Like all of the other Harold's they know the secret to keep people returning for all of their fried food!

25.description: I like the three piece, giblet combo.  Recently tried the green bean fries and they're fire.  I wish all Harold's were this good.

12.description: Really wouldn't give them any stars!!! The lady cashing ppl out is rude as hell!  Then the prices ain't the prices when u get to the restaurant! She tells me we aren't on the web get with the times!!! Called in my order & I'm still waiting!!!

21.description: The woman behind the counter seemed nice, but the guy was I feel egging her on. After I had explained foolishly that it was my first time and how excited I was to try Harlolds everything went wrong. A combo meal, the drink is $2.00 more. Then she said "Is that a fillet? " Not knowing I said "Sure"..$2.00 more. By the time we were through my 2 fish and 2 chicken thighs $8.00 combo was over $13.00. To add to the issue the coleslaw portion is about 1 small fork full. They only give you about a half cup of fries. To make they my experience was the worsted they even messed up my order by giving me a leg and thigh instead of 2 thighs as asked for. I gave them one star because the chicken and fish were good.

17.description: OMG! This is the spot if you want bomb fried chicken! The price is right, the food is the bomb, & the sauce is on point!We walked in & no one was there about 45 min before they closed. This place got jumping 10 minutes later w/ a line 8 people deep. Even towards closing people were still coming in.Sample either sauce so you know which to get if you haven't tried it before. I suggest to get the sauce on the side. If you get it on the chicken it's just too messy. If you get it on the side ask for extra. There's plenty of these all throughout Chicago so take the time to checkout this hidden gem of goodness!

10.description: Chicken is consistently good and always fresh.  We moved in the area a few months back and decided to try this location for our occasional Harolds "fix!"  Each time we have had the food it has been hot, and fresh.  I am very pleased with the product they serve at this location.  We needed chicken wings for an event and someone suggested Sharks.  Although Sharks is less expensive the food was mediocre compared to this Harold's.  Glad we did a trial run, because we ended up ordering the wings from this location.  Yes you might encounter some unsavory characters in that parking lot, but I have never had any problems with them and NO I would NOT use the ATM there either.  Too much identity theft and fraud in the world to take that chance.

5.description: I have so many thoughts and feels about this Harold's. I don't know where to start.-It doesn't matter if you call ahead or not. You will wait. Hubs once waited 40 minutes from the time he called in to the time he got our (small) order. Once I waited for 15 minutes, then asked how much longer only to find out they lost my order (and then I waited another 15 minutes).-I'm highly suspect of the "ATM" here. This Harold's is cash-only but then has a pin pad that is an "ATM". The cashier tells you how much to take out (ie: If your order is $12, they will tell you to take out $15, if it's $8, they will have you take out $10). Then the "ATM" dispenses a ticket and you give it to the cashier, then the cashier gives you the change for the difference. This wasn't explained to me, so I took out more cash (I figured if I was paying a fee to my bank, I might as well get more cash so I didn't make another ATM trip) and then the cashier screamed at me for it because she had to give me more cash. This whole thing smells of money laundering to me. EDIT: This ATM is now gone, and they accept credit cards.-This place is kept moderately clean but tends to attract...an interesting clientele. I would not come here after dark and hang around in the parking lot (and this is coming from someone who doesn't live too far away).-This is some of the freaking best chicken in the city. I'm sorry, you can have those fancy hipster chicken places in Logan Square and Wicker Park--this will probably win in a blind taste test. That said, the fries here are soggy and kinda gross.TL;DR: Best chicken ever, but find someone to pick it up for you.

3.description: What isn't amazing about fried chicken? Harold's a l w a y s exceeds my expectations for some fried chicken and to top it off their hot sauce is the cherry on top. I might add that you will be waiting for a bit but it is definitely worth the wait!! I live in Lincoln Square and I always come down here to grab some fried chicken. I mean when can you ever order fried chicken from a bulletproof window??

35.description: This is the hidden gem of Chicago. I flew in from San Francisco last week and could navigate my way from the airport just from the memory of eating Harold's 5 years ago. The memory of the spices wafting in my face as I took bite after juicy bite haunted me for years. No one on the west coast understands Harold's Chicken and if one more person tries to empathize with Popeye's or KFC, I'm gonna kick them in the knees 'cause they just don't get it. Pull up to the parking lot (and try to ignore the White Castle) and you'll find a lot of cars from the northern suburbs. Why? 'cause even Northsiders know where good chicken is. The skin is rubbed with a spicy concoction and has that crunch that is comparable to pressured cooked chicken. The dining room isn't anything special and you're gonna have to fend off the beggars and sneak the occasional wing in the car, but that's why napkins were invented. Be patient, be nice, and be ready with cash and you'll be rewarded with the food of the Gods. Trust me.

19.description: My go to order is: 2-2 piece dark special chicken. 3 wings free.Mild sauce with salt and pepper.The ladies working here are always nice. Only thing is the last few times the wait time have been pretty long even with a call in ahead of time. They do still have occasional panhandlers, but they aren't aggressive.Also, they charge like $.75 or so to get the sauce on the side. Boo! Seems they raised the prices according to their online site! NOOOOO!!!

28.description: I had the wings with hot sauce and it was definitely disappointing. I'd heard a lot about Harold's but the food didn't match the rep. The chicken was fried well but the sauce was average and tasted like it was store bought.

45.description: if you are stopping in here for your first time please dont judge this book by its cover. the food is great and they are slowly improving the decor. i personally love the chicken with mild. it seems like a lot of ppl disagree so it really comes down to personal preference. a lot of my "eater" friends like harolds chicken as do i. i was pleasantly surprised to find out on my last stop that they now deliver. the extent of their delivery zone is limited to the downtown area i believe which may be nice for future lunch orders!!!as an fyi......when you get a chicken meal they serve it with the fries on the bottom, chicken on top of fries doused with sauce, and 2 pieces of white bread on top of the chicken. if you are getting take out or are not going to eat immediately be sure to get the sauce on the side so your fries and bread dont get soggy. i will get harolds at least once a month. there is street parking available right outside and this is a safe area (other harolds further south - cant say the same)

33.description: DUde... Bucket of wings?!  Mild sauce?!  WIN!On my cheating days only.  I'm tryina watch my figure...

43.description: People rave about this chain but, to me, it was no different than any other chicken chain such as Church's or Popeye's. Then again, I probably am not the best person to turn to for chicken shack recommendations since, contrary to popular belief, it is not something I really enjoy ... chicken that is. The fries were really greasy and flavorless and the chicken was bland aside from the flour fried on the outside of the chicken.I will not make it a point to pitch in on my next visit.

2.description: twas bomb

18.description: I ordered 4pc chickens with fries today, they tasted very fresh. Chicken were very crispy and Not greasy at all . The wait time was about 10-15mins without anyone waiting before me . There is a free parking lot outside restaurant. However I didn't feel safe eating inside a restaurant with bullet-proof glass at the counter. Anyways, I will surely come back for take out next time .

41.description: This is our go to spot after clubbing in the south loop. It's right around the corner from the Shrine and we always seem to crave chicken when we're over there. But, Don't even THINK about calling an order in ahead. It still takes FOREVER!!!!   So just get ready to get familiar with the other clubbers because you'll be in there for about 30-45 minutes. This place does not take credit cards either, they only have this ancient contraption of an ATM that no one likes to use. I've laughed numerous when people just gave up trying to take out money and had to borrow from one of their friends because the ATM is too confusing.

52.description: First time at the Chicken Shack! It was everything I expected and more - great chicken and bulletproof glass. Fireworks were being blown off at the corner of State and Cullerton and one of the customers said, "you never know whether it's gun shots or fireworks."

50.description: I LOVE Harold's (#71).  When I used to work in the South Loop, we'd always go to this one.  It was the first Harold's I ever ate at.  They don't have many on the north side (I don't remember ANY when I was a kid).  I've been to the one on Clark (#44) in Rogers Park and it gave me the runs.  This one doesn't!

4.description: I had to take the adventure and go to Harold's. If it is going to be bucket list worthy then take the risk and go into 'hood and brave the panhandlers, the bullet proof window and all of the interesting characters. Well, it wasn't that dramatic. There was someone who wanted 'advice' which meant eventually he was going to ask me for money. I had the 7 piece wings with mild sauce and also the fried green beans. The wait was not that bad - 10 minutes, but it wasn't that crowded. Then it got busy. Liked- crispy wings- mild sauce- green beans had the right amount of breadingDisliked- soggy fries, not cooked long enoughOverall, good chicken but for me, only during daylight hours.

6.description: As others have mentioned, the service is pretty terrible at this location. I was there at about 2:00pm on a Sunday, the place wasn't crowded, and it still took a half an hour to get my food. While there, a couple of women came in who had called in their order 40 minutes earlier and it still wasn't ready. Par for the course for an "old school" Harold's like this one, I guess, but be forewarned. I seem to remember getting faster service back in the day even at 1:00 in the morning with a line out the door. The chicken itself was great, same as it ever was.

22.description: Yep...looking for some good ol' fried chicken come here. Not the best juicy chicken I ever had  but it's delicious and I'll eat here again. Sauce is good, seasoned fries & bbq sauce....what else can you ask for.

15.description: Harold's Fried Chicken.  This is what you do: - You walk inside.  - You neednt look at the menu. You came for fried chicken. That's it.- You order through the bulletproof glass, because yes, THAT's what Harold needs to protect the magical workings of his chicken frying.   - You wait. (Usually around 20min whether you called ahead or not.)  - You people watch while waiting... this is quite interesting considering the time of night.- You wait a little longer. You don't care however because you will be receiving fried chicken so hot and fresh and delicious that your eyes will most likely roll back in your head a few times during consumption. This, followed by a whole body quiver because it's hard to express how good it actually is.  - You receive your bucket of freshly fried chicken pieces through the bulletproof turnstile. No weak spots. - You stand in the parking lot with your friends holding your hot paper bucket of golden chicken as a trophy for all that you've accomplished in the hours preceding 2am.- You burn your mouth while trying to eat the chicken a bit too soon crack open some beers from the trunk of your car. *Warning: Not all Harold's are created equal. I've been told that Harold had a foolish time in his life where he licensed his name to whatever shmuck was willing to give him a few bucks. And therefore, consistent quality at some "Harold's" locations is apparently lacking.  Fortunately, the chicken is so good at this particular store that I'm convinced Harold himself must still work here.

20.description: Harold's Fried Chicken.  This is what you do: - You walk inside.  - You neednt look at the menu. You came for fried chicken. That's it.- You order through the bulletproof glass, because yes, THAT's what Harold needs to protect the magical workings of his chicken frying.   - You wait. (Usually around 20min whether you called ahead or not.)  - You people watch while waiting... this is quite interesting considering the time of night.- You wait a little longer. You don't care however because you will be receiving fried chicken so hot and fresh and delicious that your eyes will most likely roll back in your head a few times during consumption. This, followed by a whole body quiver because it's hard to express how good it actually is.  - You receive your bucket of freshly fried chicken pieces through the bulletproof turnstile. No weak spots. - You stand in the parking lot with your friends holding your hot paper bucket of golden chicken as a trophy for all that you've accomplished in the hours preceding 2am.- You burn your mouth while trying to eat the chicken a bit too soon crack open some beers from the trunk of your car. *Warning: Not all Harold's are created equal. I've been told that Harold had a foolish time in his life where he licensed his name to whatever shmuck was willing to give him a few bucks. And therefore, consistent quality at some "Harold's" locations is apparently lacking.  Fortunately, the chicken is so good at this particular store that I'm convinced Harold himself must still work here.

36.description: My go to order is: 2-2 piece dark special chicken. 3 wings free.Mild sauce with salt and pepper.The ladies working here are always nice. Only thing is the last few times the wait time have been pretty long even with a call in ahead of time. They do still have occasional panhandlers, but they aren't aggressive.Also, they charge like $.75 or so to get the sauce on the side. Boo! Seems they raised the prices according to their online site! NOOOOO!!!

14.description: The chicken here died for a great cause and they so damn delicious. I order a four piece wing with fries and side of gizzards all smothered in extra mild sauce. The slaw is really tasty to.

3.description: I did call the number included in the Facebook response to discuss "off line". Unfortunately it just rang for almost a minute, never going to Voicemail nor answered by a person. At this point I guess all I can do is consider taking a chance and park at the Shops again and see what happens. Risking a tow is very intimidating. Maybe I will print your response and carry it with me just in case.

1.description: How can it be good business to patrol the parking lot for cars that parked to shop, then tow them away as soon as they can!?  Terrible management, I hate this place.  They towed my car within 10 minutes.  Boycotting this shopping center.

0.description: Great new hot spot in the loop for shopping!  I agree with Anthony's post above, cool atmosphere and big name retailers like H&M, ULTA, LOFT.  I tried the coffee at Bridgeport and it was fantastic.  It looks like they have their furniture outside ready to be set up around the fire pit located around their store in the middle of the complex. I am sure when it is warmer out it will be a nice spot.  Looking forward to the rest of the tenants to come.  Yes plaza parking is paid, but you can park in the garage for free, so there is really no issue with the parking since the garage is still free.  I go to the theatre regularly and I think its the best one in the city with VIP seating.  Overall a cool experience (went at night and the lights were amazing).  Check it out!

2.description: COOLEST PARKING LOTTechnology has come a long way and it is showcased here. When you first drive in there is a board that shows you the three parking levels and how many parking spots exist on each level. Now you may think that is not important but when your running late for your way too expensive movie and drinks here, it becomes important really fast. You won't spend your time on level 1 which has only 20 spots left versus level 3 which has 300 spots. The smart technology will help you, so make sure you peak at the board at the front. As you are driving to your spot you will see red lights and green lights above every aisle. These lights direct you to open parking spots. It's like a game of PacMan as you are eating up the pellets. Follow the lights until you see green. The green lights tell you that there are spots down there and of course the red lights tell you there are no spots available. I've decided to share this valuable info because I do not think some of the drivers have figured this out. I keep seeing people searching down the red aisles. Stop doing it and let the parking technology help you. Now don't be confused by the blue light, those are for handicap drivers. This is the smartest parking lot I've ever seen. I'd also love to recommend this parking lot to Candice our community manager in the Burbs because she has so many bad experiences in Chicago parking garages. This might actually make her day plus its currently free. Yes it's free but I do not know how long it will be free for. When they built this place they originally charged for parking and it seemed too expensive. The build it and they will come attitude didn't seem to work. The give people free parking and they will come seems to be working better. I've also noticed that many of the vacant store fronts will be getting new stores soon. Now I must admit this mall seems like a place you would find in Miami. Just walk around and you will see what I am talking about. There's flowers everywhere and music playing as you stroll the paths. There are places to stop and reflect like the fish pond or the chairs surrounding the outdoor fire pits. The fire pit is a good thing on a crisp November day. There's a giant chess board, if your inclined to get a workout in too. Finally there is a play ground for the kids in the middle. All of these activities are in the center of the mall and I haven't even covered the stores yet. Currently the big anchors are the Icon movie theater which is probably the nicest & most expensive theater in Chicago. They offer VIP seating with food & full bar. And for shopping there is a large H&M store. My favorite store, Z Galleria is here. I was sad when it closed down in Lincoln Park but it has resurfaced here. There's a Men's Only Store called Haberdash, which not only sells you clothes but can offer you coffee and a shave. For the ladies there's a Loft, Black / White and other places to shop. In the center there's a Bridgeport Coffee. Those are just a few of the stores but there are more coming. I noticed a soap store, pet food store and sushi place going through construction.The free parking is working its bringing the customers and the retailers into the empty spots. I hope the owners of this mall realize this but I feel there gonna get greedy and bring back the paid parking. Hopefully they read this review and have a change of heart. There is also a great view of the Sears Tower from here. A million dollar view along with a unique shopping and entertaining experience. So if you haven't checked out the mall, then its time to do it. You will be glad that you did.

5.description: Great movie theatre, easy parking,  simple shopping.  Great expansion to the south loop,  along with Whole Foods, Dicks, Pier 1, etc. ..A nice walk if you live in Pilsen as well!

6.description: They will tow you in no time. After years of free parking on the top they decided to start charging for parking and have pay machines that look like they have no power to them. I had no intention of skirting a parking fee and was in a store for 10mins only to come out and find my car missing.  Pretty extreme for a minor parking infraction.

7.description: I live in the South Loop and enjoy making the walk over to the Roosevelt Collection. The movie theatre and free parking are the highlights here. The stores are nice, but their are not enough vendors to make this a true destination.

8.description: Horrible!  I parked my car, left for 5 minutes, and they towed my car!! When I returned, my car was already gone. They must have a tow truck on site somewhere so if you don't pay for parking fast, you will need to take a 20 minute cab ride to the towing center and then pay $280 to get your car back. Apparently they don't give parking tickets like most places do. They tow! And they're fast!! Stay away from this shopping mall!

9.description: As long as it costs $2.25 for 15 minutes of parking, I am NEVER shopping here.  Where do you think you are, River North?  Every other shopping place in the area offers free parking.

10.description: Awesome mini outdoor mall in the South Loop.  Its been open for years now.  The Showplace Icon  has been there since it opened.  Now finally all the stores are opening as well.  H&M, Z Gallerie etc.  It reminds of me of mini Old Orchard Mall.  Its cool and laid back I will shop here alot :D

4.description: This used to be my favorite place to see a movie.  However, due to the new parking fees, it took me 15 minutes to get out of the parking garage after 10 PM last night (a Wed. night). Releasing 250+ people from a movie at the same time late at night has caused an issue with getting out of the parking garage with putting in tickets. There are only two machines to exit and one exit in the parking garage. At Rosemont, they do not charge for parking late at night because of the same issue of the bars and restaurants letting people out at the same time. I understand the parking issue especially during the day and on Sundays with people using it for Bears games and trying to get it for free, but I do not see the point of not letting the parking open late a night after the movies are being let out. I will strongly consider not coming to this theater in the future.

12.description: An acquaintance referred me to Zizi, and it is the best referral I have ever received!   Having been fore-warned about how large of a clientele Zizi has, I took the opportunity to book my first brow and chin waxing appointment in the middle of the day during a weekday.    Universal Aestetics is right next to a cleaners at the corner of 16th and Wabash.  Be warned, there is no sign on the front door announcing "Universal Aestetics".   The waxing suites are spa quality and fairly private.  A few minutes after my appointment, Zizi escorted and verified services I was there to receive.   She waxed my brows and laid out a plan on how we will get them to grow in the right areas.  She showed me the proper way to apply brow powder and she also showed me a trick on how to better highlight my eyes -- WHAT A BONUS!!   She also did a chin wax.   I explained a recurring issue I was having and she then gave me a referral to a renowned dermatologist.   Lastly, she showed me a reflexology trick to do for homework to support brow growth.  In parting, she suggested timing for a next appointment with her, gave me a hug and thanked me for coming.  I paid the receptionist on my way out.   I must say, for the level of service I received, the cost for the services was reasonable.   All in all, I got way more than I expected from this appointment.  Zizi is a warm, considerate person, and I was extremely impressed with her knowledge, know-how and professionalism.  My days of searching for a brow specialist in Chicago are gone; this is where I will be.

3.description: She is great. WHEN she is on time.My first experience occurred late spring when I had my eyebrows done.  She was ONE HOUR behind. That meant, waiting in a very small area with limited seating for an hour. By the way, her salon is NOT near shops etc.. so that you can spend time doing something else while waiting. I had read all of the positive reviews about her talent and the quality of work. And I waited. Waited more. Annnnnd waited some more. She does a great job! However, after wasting an hour waiting, I was less than impressed with the overall service experience.  I decided to give it another try and chalked it up to time of year. My second time was even worse and this time - I did get a call.I got a call 5 minutes before my appointment time to let me know they were running 45 minutes late. It's too bad, they called just as I was parking my car. She gets one star for poor service but good work. It's a trade-off BUT I'd rather NOT waste my time waiting and have a better experience.  At a minimum provide a deep discount for poor calendar management.

1.description: Late again....and I even called before I came.  Shameful!!  Spend your money and your time elsewhere....

2.description: Let me start by saying, Zizi is a lovely woman and does a spectacular job on brow shaping. I am sad to have to find someone new. Last time I had an appointment for a tweeze, which takes all of 5 minutes, I waited 25. I then had to leave, because I had another appointment I did not want to be late for. Fast forward to today. I booked my appointment 5 days ago using the online booking. I showed up this morning and no one is even at the salon. I double checked my confirmation email and called the salon and got no answer. So, if you have absolutely no where to be afterwards and verify over the phone before you come, you will have a stress free experience and beautiful brows. The lack of respect for my time has now trumped the quality of the service and I will find someone new.

9.description: I have been to many estheticians to have my eyebrows waxed and have always returned to Zizi. I have not found anyone who arches my brows so beautifully and colors them so well. Due to so many people seeking appointments, you may have to wait a while but, for me, it's worth it.

10.description: I absolutely adore Zizi. I've been following her for the past 11 years, since her shop on Belmont. I always leave feeling beautiful. Zizi takes her time shaping my eyebrows. Zizi provides awesome facials and is extremely knowledgeable. You can never go wrong with Zizi.

4.description: ZiZi is one of the best in Chicago and she always has a smile. When clients run late that puts her behind but she does her best to make it work.

6.description: I want to write an update of my experience- as you can read on my other revews, I had my eyelid/eyeliner corrected at another salon.  Well, I choose to have the other salon also re-do my eyebrow permenent makeup as well, recently.  After comparing the two salons, I must downgrade ZiZi another star, down to 1 (lowest rating) my brows are SO much better from the other shop, there is no comparison.  Don't waste your money, read my other reviews for the right shop to go to in the near South Side.

0.description: I've been a devotee of Zizi's for 14 years if not more. Living in other cities is the only reason that I stepped out. She is the consummate professional and is deeply educated and passionate about skincare. My eyebrows are my obsession more than my hair. The environment she provides is very zen. Her practices are extremely sanitary. She also provides excellent consultation on skincare.And I'm insanely particular. Her precision and skill coupled with her knowledge is why I will only support Zizi.

5.description: zizi is awesome, the website suck its so hard to navigate to get an appointment and often crashes.

13.description: I've had effed up eyebrows for years, due to an unfortunate freakish mishap when I was four (I was running with my eyes closed after an ice cream truck and ran smack dab into a 10-foot pipe).  I've paid insane prices to get my one stick straight and the other highly arched brows into shape (including the owner of Channings on Oak...YUCK), and Zizi was the only one who could do it.  Zizi is an amazing find.... she is a genius at brow shaping but super affordable considering the quality of her work.The only thing you should be aware of though, is Zizi can really run late.  I've waited for her on average for about an hour.  But truly, there is no one else who can do what she can, and she is honestly super sweet, that I just make sure I either schedule a super early slot in the am (like 6:30a or 7a) or I allocate at least an hour if it's going to be later in the day.

11.description: Don't go to get your eyebrows tattoo!!! I went in and she made me wait 2H for 15min working on my eyebrows. The result is bad, it's a waste of money. First of all it's extremely expensive and then she doesn't do a good job. After 7 days almost everythings disappear. Now I have some holes and some dark spots in my eyebrows. It's totally not uniform and I have to pay someone else to retouch it. I called her to talk with her about it, she never return my calls. I left a message to her assistant, no news! She is not professional and totally disrecpectful. Once she has your money, it's over!I don't recommend this place at all.

8.description: Zizi is my go to person for eyebrows. Since relocating to Dallas I have found no one who compares to ZiZi.  She is thee best in Chicago.

14.description: I discovered Zizi years ago & was a frequent customer at her Welles street salon.  She's tops when it comes to brows & in my opinion, gives highly praised mainstream brow artists such as Anastasia & Damone a run for the money!  I've never been unhappy with her work with brows & she's offered great little tips that I've used for years! (never knew about Emu Oil or drying my face with a paper towel as opposed to towel pre Zizi) She's the best & everyone I've ever recommended to her agrees! Unfortunately, I've relocated to the burbs & unable to see Zizi as I once did but everyone since has been compared to her... my HG of brows!!

7.description: I went to Zizi about 4 months ago for a consultation, it was the very first I gone anywhere to do my eyebrows. After 15 minutes of talking with Zizi and explaining what was going on with my eyebrows and what I can do to maximize their growth, i was convinced. Thisbis the only place I get my brows done, and I love them.

58.description: One of my favorite burger places in Chicago. I love The Gobbler (Turkey Burger). With the cream cheese and cranberry reduction, you don't need to put anything else on it. Another fave is the Buffalo Burger (Chicken). Delicious and again, with the buffalo sauce, it needs no other topping. The order of fries is enough to share and they are crispy and crunchy.

56.description: If you like burgers, you will love this place!  Food is fresh and you can substitute veggie, chicken or turkey burgers instead of beef.  This place will not disappoint!  Try the sweet potato fries-yummy and they come with sweet/spicy sauce.

29.description: Each time I have ordered delivery from them and I do mean each time...something is forgotten or left off the order. I waited a hour for cold food and no drink. And when I called in to tell them I was told flippantly that there is only one driver. You charge $5 fee on top of a tip so it seems you could afford another driver...or better yet an employee sans the smart ass mouth.  Contrary to your smart ass employee saying we are the only burger point ummmm well there is a burger bar not far...time I gave them a try. This place is not worth it.

42.description: Was so excited about the shroom burger and my added bourbon shrooms.  I'm so disappointed and because it was bought for me and my only lunch in a meeting I'm forced to eat this dry, tasteless, sorry for an excuse burger.We got delivery but delivery doesn't account for flavor lacking burgers and tasteless brie and swiss and shrooms.  And I would have expected my burger to be swimming in shrooms.  Instead they all fit nice and flat on the burger.For a place that specializes in burgers it seems like they did everything NOT to do when cooking a burger. So glad I didn't pay for this tasteless dry piece of meat.

23.description: So so service.  We tried to ask to see what burgers were popular and the girl taking our order seemed annoyed.  Food came out pretty fast. Burger was pretty good.  Fries were amazing.

47.description: Let me make this easy for everyone thinking of going to eat here. Don't! Everyone acknowledges the service is terrible. The employees don't care about the customers, and it's easy to see why. When I complained to the owner about the service and food, (only via email because he is almost never there) he took me to task instead of apologizing. This person should not be running any type of business.Now on to the food. If you crave tasteless, dry, overcooked and overpriced burgers, this place is for you. Universally, everyone agrees the fries are terrible. If you enjoy good-tasting food - avoid this place like the plague.I can't figure out how anyone says they like the burgers here. My suggestion to those that do: Please do not review any other restaurants in the future.Unfortunately, Yelp does not allow no stars. I don't see how they stay in business. I wouldn't walk across the street for this place, and I live across the street.i

8.description: Burger Point is a great spot if you like variety! I don't eat beef..so it's good to have the option of a veggie, chicken or turkey burger. Hamburgers can be substituted for these. The options are endless and you can order wings if you're not into burgers. The owners are great which makes it a plus. Everything is organic as well..the burger is kind of pricey...but overall great place to go!

31.description: Stopped here for some quick food after a trade show down the road, was amazed with the quality of the food. Easily one of the best veggie burgers I have had to date and the vegetarian chile was equally as fantastic. One thing I might mention is everything was a little on the spicy side even if it wasn't advertised that way -- for me that's great, but if you're not a fan of hot food I'd keep that in mind, especially in regards to the chile.

34.description: UPDATE: Burger Point's ownership has reached out to me and individuals who were there at the time of the incident. They apologized for our experience and took necessary action in response to this review.I applaud and acknowledge their customer service and find it admirable to see a restaurant go the distance to ensure their customers are treated equally and fairly. You do not see this kind of response and urgency often from a small business ever and so I give them points for this. Thank you Burger Point for the action that you have taken and will visit again.INITIAL REVIEW:I have been here a good number of times and think the burgers are pretty good. However, after today, I will never go again.A group of friends went and we were waiting for our orders. As we were waiting for our food, they called one of my friend's names to pick up his food, but they had difficulty pronouncing it. After a delayed response from my friend, one of the workers mumbled under his breath about "Chinese" as my friend walked away with his food.  Another one of my friends who was still in line and about to order, heard the mumbling and said "actually, he's Korean."  To this, the worker responded, "Korean, Chinese, whatever" and continued to mumble under his breath.  In response to the continued mumbling about "Chinese people...", my friend, thinking she heard the word "chink" asked the guy: "did you just say chink?"  Instead of apologizing or denying his statement, the staff brushed it off and said, "Whatever. Calm down darling. I'm just doing my job."Other employees told this worker to "shut up" and tried to shove him to the back of the kitchen, but they didn't acknowledge or apologize for his behavior.  The guy refused to shut up and continued to shout over his co-workers and argue with my friend that he was just doing his job.  Being even more offended that the business wouldn't apologize or acknowledge what just happened, my friend proceeded to call them out saying, "You do not call your Asian customers chinks!" and marched out. The rest of us were waiting for our food and no one from management came to us to apologize or do anything to alleviate the situation. Although we paid for our food, we all marched out.So I would like to say, congratulations on taking our money and being very racist without any apologies or customer service. You guys lost a loyal customer. Good job!

16.description: Update! I was craving a burger and decided to give this place another chance. I got the Classic with a side of fries. The burger and fries were delicious! Was very happy with the juiciness and flavors, fries were perfect...The reason why I can't give them 5 stars is because it took them over 20 minutes to make my order, which to me is unacceptable for a quick service style burger place for lunch. They weren't even that busy... next time I'll order ahead of time and hope that it's ready by the time I head over. But happy that I have them another shot.Also I wish they had shakes on the menu!

13.description: I was really impressed with the service. The burger was made just how I asked. I have seen some other reviews that complain about the price but I thought my burger was worth every penny. The dining area was a little cold but we devoured our burgers so fast that we didn't have time to be cold. We live around the corner so we will definitley be returning.

11.description: Customer service is just alright lots of laziness in their kitchen food takes forever but tastes pretty good the fries are not nearly as good as I was expecting them to be which kind of is a bummer. All in all I'd say find a better burger place in Bridgeport

39.description: Great customer service very polite great food fast service I have eaten here many times

37.description: This place is such a rip off! The food is way to expensive and the wait is ridiculously long! The guy at the counter is arrogant and has no patience so I felt rushed and couldn't really ask questions!! Also when I got my food it was cold!!

0.description: AMAZING AMAZING AMAZING!Can I please come here everyday?! They have a variety of burgers that it makes my decision so difficult when I come here! You get EXACTLY what you paid for!! The fries are so good especially the vinegar for it! Coming back here with friends to show them how great this place is.

38.description: This vegetarian was very happy with the fare at The Burger Point. The veggie burger is made on site and it amazing.  Surprisingly they also offer a vegetarian chili for their chili fries complete with tofu.I can't speak for the burgers but my friends were more then happy with theirs. If I am ever back in Chicago I will be stopping by again.

51.description: This is the best place I have found that serves farm fresh burgers in Chicago.  Creative burger choices cooked well.  Great fries too! Been here dozens of times and will continue to go!!

27.description: It is really healthyYou have several options to choose including veggie I love itI'll return for sure

32.description: I came here on a Sunday for a burger...obviously. I asked for bacon, which I paid for and they forgot. The burger was juicy and flavorful and huge. Nice place overall and I would return.

54.description: Something's changed here... And it's not for the positive, unfortunately.  We've been coming here since they opened but while I believe the quality is still there and they finally added vinegar on the tables for the fries (yay!), the burgers have lost their juicy quality. They have become super dry with little flavor and prepared with no toasted bun. In addition, their fries are average, almost limp. So now the overpriced Burger Pointe experience is no longer worth the money.

48.description: I like that the meat is local and grass-fed and the options they offer to put on the burger. But it ends there. The people and service are unfriendly and they need to do a better job of building loyal customers. They screwed up my pickup order and instead of trying to make it right when I called they told me the person who made the order wasn't there to verify if I was lying or not.  He said the best he could do was give me a $5 credit for a $10 burger that was inedible (it had bacon and I don't eat pork).  For a loyal customer, you'd think he'd just say sure and offered a free burger the next time I come in. But, as my husband pointed out the people who work there aren't very friendly in general so I shouldn't be too surprised, I suppose.

44.description: So my review is very different as I am a vegetarian. But I had to leave a review on how AMAZING their veggie burger is. It's easily the best one I've ever had and I've had my fair share. The quality is great, the variety of toppings you can get is almost overwhelming! The only reason I am giving it 4/5 stars is because of the fries. I'm kind of a French fry addict, and these are just mediocre. Little too soggy for my liking, but I can get over it because of how delicious the rest is.

24.description: Delicious! Burger made to order, great menu, great variety!!! Amazing! We have one more week at our current  office and are planning a return trip! YOU'VE GOT TO TRY THIS PLACE!

7.description: During my first yelp-elite event last year, I overheard one of the elites' dissatisfaction on her experience at the Burger Point.  The was the reason why it took me this long to stop by and give it a fair chance.  I've been paying attention on the recent yelp reviews; there seems to be some improvements occurring.  I was on the way coming back to the north side.  With that being said, hubby was in South Carolina visiting my in-laws and he wouldn't be able to eat a beef burger anyway (he's a vegetarian...a very studious one).  Being out and about solo meant that I got to eat a burger...on my own...I didn't mind at all.  You can order off the menu.  There are about fifteen (15) kinds of pre-set ones.  Nevertheless, if you're one of those creative burger eaters, you can customize the way you want with the choice of bun, cheese, toppings, and other ingredients. I went for the #5: the all American Classic.  Why?  It has a fried egg and avocado.  Yes, having those things on a burger can really make my day.  Now you know how easy it is to make Rosa J. happy.  Feeding her a well-crafted burger will do the trick! This burger came with the pretzel rolls.  Thank you, because some other chain attempts to defy the science by holding an egg and other ingredients together with the sesame buns!!  Really?  However, the Burger Point folks understand the physics of a runny egg and how nutty this guy can be.  Thus, the use of pretzel rolls was a great call.  I had to sadly deduct one (1) stars for lackluster fries.  This may just be personal preference, but I like the steak-cut fries better than the "old-fries" style.  The flavoring and salinity of the fries were; nevertheless, adequate.  The combo, for $13.24, is pretty steep!  I will have to go there whenever I make a 100 on my test, which I'm no longer a student.  Like other reviewers have mentioned, the cooking-time wasn't delivering in a fast-food speed since everything was made-to-order.  If you want a speedy but "no-love" kind of service, White Castle is right around the corner on State and Cermak.  But who will go to a White Castle?  You tell me.  The CTA 29 (State) bus stop is located nearby.  Get off at Cullerton, walk a very short distance, and you will see the place on the "point" of State and Archer.

49.description: a tasty burger to be sure and nice variety of toppings...however, I felt like the meat was a little overlooked and dry.  Stopped in here after auto show and burgers fries and drinks for two was 33 bucks.  I better see some red in the burger for that amount of money.  Get that right and this place will rock it.

40.description: One of the coolest burger menus ever! Menu Presented in pictures so cool it's almost as if u could taste each one before u buy. But closed at 9am everyday is so early can't tell u how many times I made it to the locked door.

53.description: The burgers are great but.... the delivery is just terrible!!! I ordered using the burger point app (ordersnap). The estimated delivery was about an hour. It took me two calls and burger point over two hours and 15 min. to delivery my burgers!!! Never again!!!!

30.description: Pros - Quality meat and ingredients. Great variety. Cons - Burger seems to only be cooked well done (they don't ask). Your order can take 45 mins with no apology or compensation. Average is 20 mins for a burger. YikesThe floor is slippery (as hell) when (barely) wet. I've seen a few people take a dive. Overall the food is good. Just be prepared to wait.

46.description: awful. DRY. DRY. DRY. I ordered the #2 Blue cheese and Bacon. Bacon was undercooked, not crispy and the blue cheese was a small (half dollar size) portion.Bun was fresh, but it was best part of the order. Took longer than I thought for them to make as well. Staff was cranky. Bad lunch. Not going back

1.description: The burger point is on point!! They have so many varieties that it's impossible not to find something just for you. There are usually only 2-3 people working at a time, even during peak hours but don't be intimidated. They move quickly and food is cooked to perfection.
