All of the burger options (w/ fixings) can be made for the type of patty of your choosing (chicken, turkey, veggie, beef). I highly recommend trying the cranberry reduction and sweet potato fries. Just YUM!

55.description: I used to come here a lot.  See the 49 check-ins?  Yeah, a lot!  And I didn't even check in every time I stepped through the door.  Do the math, ~ 75 visits times $13 per is a lot of frickin' money!But I stopped coming.  Mostly because of two things.  Their burgers, despite being cooked through, still maintained a juiciness about them.  For me, that's all that matters.  This all changed sometime in 2014 which left me rather grumpy.  Second, their fries used to be crunchy and tasty.  Again, something changed and I began receiving soggy, limp fries.  An off night happens but trends started to appear.I don't know if they read online reviews but I'd strongly encourage them to revisit their quality.  Cook the burgers a bit less even if customers don't ask.  I don't want a dry burger.  And ensure the fries are crispy.  Simple concept.  I don't need magic, just food worth craving.  Perhaps I'll visit again in time to see if they've improved upon their mistakes.  I miss this place.  But I miss what used to be.

9.description: Burgers are great, good service, THE WINGS there are my favorite in all of Chicago, better than 50/50 or any spot on Division

26.description: Amazing burgers...so juicy and fresh. We had the mushroom burger and the southern...so good. The fries are fresh cut and good with cheese.

25.description: This is my 4th time eating here. Because it's so close I figured I would give it another try, but the food is yet again terrible. They ALWAYS screw up my order. The fries are disgusting. The burgers are ok, but extremely expensive and def not worth it. Don't waste your money here.

12.description: Was so excited about the shroom burger and my added bourbon shrooms.  I'm so disappointed and because it was bought for me and my only lunch in a meeting I'm forced to eat this dry, tasteless, sorry for an excuse burger.We got delivery but delivery doesn't account for flavor lacking burgers and tasteless brie and swiss and shrooms.  And I would have expected my burger to be swimming in shrooms.  Instead they all fit nice and flat on the burger.For a place that specializes in burgers it seems like they did everything NOT to do when cooking a burger. So glad I didn't pay for this tasteless dry piece of meat.

59.description: I've given this place quite a few chances, and have been left disappointed each time. The prices are obscene. $12.99 for a double cheeseburger? Without fries and a drink? What a joke. And for that price, it better be the best burger I've ever had. Sadly, it's terrible. Dry, bland, and without proper arrangement. Who puts lettuce and tomato below the patty? Burger point! If you're in the mood for an expensive burger, 5 Guys does a much better job.

21.description: So I happened upon this place by accident. My buddy and I were looking for something simple and he didn't like Chinese food (Chinatown is a block away) so we saw burgers and went in. Wow! I'm not some organic health nut, but I do try to eat healthy when I have the option. This place uses all organic products and makes almost everything in-store. It was much healthier than any other burger place and one of the best burgers I've ever eaten. I have been back several times now each time bringing friends with. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a delicious burger and fries.

17.description: Stopped by for lunch ordered the #5 The American Classic. It was tremendous , the bacon was nice and crispy meat cooked just right. The bun was nice and fresh the egg was cooked great too not to wet. The fries were a bit on the cold side. A bit pricey too about 13.50 for the combo. Will def be back.

10.description: The food was absolutely amazing! The only bummer -about a 30 minute wait for the food (during our lunch hour). Everything is made fresh, to order. I think on this particular day, there was some sort of snafu and our "to go" order took extra long. However, the owner was super nice about it and very apologetic.I would totally be willing to go back for dinner when time is not of the essence.I brought back burgers for a few coworkers and we all agreed they were super de-lish! So just keep in mind the time factor when going.

5.description: What started out as a slow experience with the staff member who was taking our order, turned into an ah-mazing one after I took my first bite of one of the best burgers I've ever had! I ordered a cheeseburger with bacon, mushrooms, lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, ketchup, mustard and mayo and I added a side of cheese fries to it. Although our wait time was lengthy and our ordering process was slightly frustrating, things started to take a turn for the better when the new owner made an appearance at our table and apologized for the wait. He even refunded a portion of our money back for the inconvenience (without me asking fToward the end of our meal, he came back to check on us and we engaged in a bit of conversation. During this convo, we discovered he's also from metro-Detroit, so that was an added bonus. He says he bought the restaurant about a month ago and is making some changes to give a better experience to their customers. I wish I wasn't leaving town tomorrow, otherwise, I would definitely be back! I strongly recommend this place and will be back on my next visit to Chicago!

3.description: So I was driving past this place with my mom and we saw it and just thought.."hey let's go ahead and park and try it!" So I got a Savage Burger which is 12oz so it was pretty big it couldn't get even fit in my mouth all the way! But it was delicious it was very filling, I'm still full and so sleepy from it, that's how I know I ate really good meal! Also the fries are delicious and plentiful. My burger was a little pricey it was almost $20 for a combo, but probably because it was bigger, my mom's was 6oz and $13 for a combo. They also have wings which I want to try next time I come, and I plan to! So glad we gave it a shot.

35.description: There was an incident that occurred here the other day. But management has made the necessary actions to rectify it self and has addressed a formal apology on the behalf of that individual.

19.description: I went here with a co-worker to catch up. I noticed they added the Saigon Johnny to their menu. I love that burger, so I ordered for one. The patty is so juicy and that sweet sauce that goes with it is awesome. The Saigon Johnny is a burger's take on the Vietnamese Bahn Mi sandwich. I downed that burger so fast. Then I turned around and noticed their burger of the month. This month's burger is the salmon burger with aioli on it. I'm coming next week to try that.

28.description: Come here for the pretzel rolls and sweet potato fries. Fresh ingredients and great hamburgers.

45.description: Called in for a pickup. Parking was easy. They don't cook the fries till you get there, solid commitment to quality. We ordered two burgers, one 6oz and one 12oz, small fry and large cheese fry. Damage was $28. The 6oz patties are like regular burgers, the 12oz is a double. Dude at the cash register signed me up for FiveStars super quick too, appreciate it. Will be back!

33.description: Peter's initial bad review actually helped this place. We went undercovered yesterday for the first time. We provided Chinese names & ordered from the menu advised the guy that we are lactose intolerance. He actually went extra miles to ask the owner/chef about our needs. We are very pleased with this place. We enjoyed the good food without any incidence. They do catered to Asian customers with dietary restrictions. Thank you Sir!

43.description: I'd give 3.5 stars! Just had the veggie burger it was pretty good! Really big. Offers various toppings. Small str8forward burger joint. My hubby got the classic beef burger he thought it was pretty good as well "except it was too well done!"  I would return!

2.description: I should've taken a picture because the burger was damn pretty. Like picture perfect out of a commercial pretty.My burger was "ashman" and it's just perfect. Nice char, crisp sour chopped up pickles, amazing sauce, some tomatoes and greens. The potato bun was perfect as well. I also got the potato spiral stick. I highly recommend getting 2. Trust me. I really dislike heavy buns and thick patties. Their buns are light and they do multiple patties to prevent that meatloaf texture of a patty. My burger was 2-3oz aka 6oz. I'm not sure why this place doesn't have more hype. Everything is absolutely fresh and made to order. Their kitchen is kind of open and you can see them prepping everything. Including fresh ground turkey for the turkey burgers! Their burgers are better than Au Cheval, Small Cheval, Owen & Engine, Kumas and etc. If you've ever thought of an ideal burger with endless topping ideas and bun pairings... Come here. This place has decent parking too!

18.description: I used to come here a lot.  See the 49 check-ins?  Yeah, a lot!  And I didn't even check in every time I stepped through the door.  Do the math, ~ 75 visits times $13 per is a lot of frickin' money!But I stopped coming.  Mostly because of two things.  Their burgers, despite being cooked through, still maintained a juiciness about them.  For me, that's all that matters.  This all changed sometime in 2014 which left me rather grumpy.  Second, their fries used to be crunchy and tasty.  Again, something changed and I began receiving soggy, limp fries.  An off night happens but trends started to appear.I don't know if they read online reviews but I'd strongly encourage them to revisit their quality.  Cook the burgers a bit less even if customers don't ask.  I don't want a dry burger.  And ensure the fries are crispy.  Simple concept.  I don't need magic, just food worth craving.  Perhaps I'll visit again in time to see if they've improved upon their mistakes.  I miss this place.  But I miss what used to be.

41.description: The food was absolutely amazing! The only bummer -about a 30 minute wait for the food (during our lunch hour). Everything is made fresh, to order. I think on this particular day, there was some sort of snafu and our "to go" order took extra long. However, the owner was super nice about it and very apologetic.I would totally be willing to go back for dinner when time is not of the essence.I brought back burgers for a few coworkers and we all agreed they were super de-lish! So just keep in mind the time factor when going.

52.description: I went here with a co-worker to catch up. I noticed they added the Saigon Johnny to their menu. I love that burger, so I ordered for one. The patty is so juicy and that sweet sauce that goes with it is awesome. The Saigon Johnny is a burger's take on the Vietnamese Bahn Mi sandwich. I downed that burger so fast. Then I turned around and noticed their burger of the month. This month's burger is the salmon burger with aioli on it. I'm coming next week to try that.

50.description: During my first yelp-elite event last year, I overheard one of the elites' dissatisfaction on her experience at the Burger Point.  The was the reason why it took me this long to stop by and give it a fair chance.  I've been paying attention on the recent yelp reviews; there seems to be some improvements occurring.  I was on the way coming back to the north side.  With that being said, hubby was in South Carolina visiting my in-laws and he wouldn't be able to eat a beef burger anyway (he's a vegetarian...a very studious one).  Being out and about solo meant that I got to eat a burger...on my own...I didn't mind at all.  You can order off the menu.  There are about fifteen (15) kinds of pre-set ones.  Nevertheless, if you're one of those creative burger eaters, you can customize the way you want with the choice of bun, cheese, toppings, and other ingredients. I went for the #5: the all American Classic.  Why?  It has a fried egg and avocado.  Yes, having those things on a burger can really make my day.  Now you know how easy it is to make Rosa J. happy.  Feeding her a well-crafted burger will do the trick! This burger came with the pretzel rolls.  Thank you, because some other chain attempts to defy the science by holding an egg and other ingredients together with the sesame buns!!  Really?  However, the Burger Point folks understand the physics of a runny egg and how nutty this guy can be.  Thus, the use of pretzel rolls was a great call.  I had to sadly deduct one (1) stars for lackluster fries.  This may just be personal preference, but I like the steak-cut fries better than the "old-fries" style.  The flavoring and salinity of the fries were; nevertheless, adequate.  The combo, for $13.24, is pretty steep!  I will have to go there whenever I make a 100 on my test, which I'm no longer a student.  Like other reviewers have mentioned, the cooking-time wasn't delivering in a fast-food speed since everything was made-to-order.  If you want a speedy but "no-love" kind of service, White Castle is right around the corner on State and Cermak.  But who will go to a White Castle?  You tell me.  The CTA 29 (State) bus stop is located nearby.  Get off at Cullerton, walk a very short distance, and you will see the place on the "point" of State and Archer.

4.description: Tasty! They have a ton of preset burger options to choose from OR you can build your own. BYO is always a nice option but for me, it's like being at a salad bar... everything might look good but it doesn't necessarily taste good together. I kept it simple and went with option 1 - The Burger Point burger. It had pepper jack cheese, bacon, a roasted chili pepper sauce of sorts a fried (over easy/medium) egg served on a soft pretzel roll. If I made that same burger as a "build your own" it very well could have been $15! --- no idea how much actually, but add-ons were mostly $1 extra each so I'm probably not too far off. I also like the fact that everything is made to order. I don't mind waiting for fresh food. I actually substituted the beef burger for turkey but don't worry I kept the full on pork bacon as-is. ;-)

6.description: Great food, wish that waiting will be shorter

22.description: Freshly made burgers in a variety of interesting styles. Good attention to detail include fixings, a very nice bun, and skinny fries. Staff are pleasant. Clean and simple decor. Convenient location.

15.description: Thee best burger I have had in my life. I wish I had taken a picture to submit. I ordered the the sampler where I selected grass fed beef, original mild buffalo wings (you get 3) and the order came with fries and a drink all for $12.99. The burger was juicy, non greasy and flavorful, toppings were plenty and I did not get the grassy, gamey taste. Everything was fresh and ready in a short amount of time and the wings are delicious. I got to meet the president/co owner Michael Strotter who took our order and explained everything so patiently and clearly as this was my first time there. Do yourself a favor and Try this place out, you won't be disappointed! Check the rear for free parking spots before parking on the street.

57.description: Great place if you're looking for an authentic,delicious burger. The made to order meals have something for every taste. For excellent service, reasonable prices, and a fantastic burger, this is the place.

20.description: I live in the neighborhood and have been eyeing this place for some time. With a plethora of burger joints in the city, you have to pace yourself.  Now to the review. I liked the fact that their marketing indicates the burgers are fresh ground daily. My wife and I both built our own burgers on a brioche bun. I noticed that the patties were the thicker style but I wasn't asked what temperature I wanted. In both cases, the burgers came out well done. The burger blend tasted fine but it had the potential to taste great if it wasn't overcooked.  The brioche bun was falling apart and dry. The fries are cooked in peanut oil and were tasty. All in all, I  think that there are better burgers in the neighborhood.

36.description: Great food. Wonderful action taken upon a bad situation. Respect restored!

14.description: It is really healthyYou have several options to choose including veggie I love itI'll return for sure

1.description: Save yourself the frustration and go to South Loop Market, which is 1 block south. SLM has a better selection, friendlier employees, a deli, alcohol, and they don't make you feel like an asshole for using your credit card.

0.description: Great guys over here, need a warmer environment (Greenleaf is a fine name, but the store does not need to be green and have bright lights - maybe that's for safety reasons) - anyway the staff are super nice and I have seen people pick up cigarattes & lottery here quite a bit. No liquor here, but good spot for the quick pick up of an item or two.

58.description: Like others we had tickets for the "lawn" for Jimmy Buffett.  It is not a lawn - it is a big muddy field of sod.  It seemed like they had facilities and concessions for a fraction of the crowd they sold tickets to.  I have been to Northerly Island before for concerts and I may go back if I had seats in the pavilion but I will never get lawn seats again.  We were hoping for a Ravinia-type experience and it was a horrid experience.  Ended up leaving not to long after we got there because it was so miserable.

56.description: Venue: Northerly Island.  Who thought this was a good idea?  Everything I've read here is true.  I give one star because you must.  The mud was indescribable.  It was like at concert at a farm.  Or Woodstck!  I cannot say for sure that Jimmy Buffett was actually there.  I never did see him.  There were video screens but those couldn't be seen either.  Everyone on the lawn stood for the entire concert then had to walk a mile to their  cars.  Where were these 'free shuttles' from Soldier field?  I never saw one.  Who builds a brand new lawn venue with no incline?  They say there's a 12% grade but I don't believe it.  I have been going to Buffett concerts for nearly 30 years and this was the first time I left before he finished and 10,000 people went with me.  Save you money.  DON'T GO TO THIS VENUE.  I really feel cheated.

29.description: Saw Phish here in July and it was great.  The venue was completely prepared for the 30,000 or so wooks that turned it out that weekend.  Their was plenty of room, the beer was reasonably priced, and the lines for restrooms or concessions were short.  They even gave away free bottled water.  Although you couldn't see the stage very well from the lawn the sound was great and their were HD screens.  I can't wait to see another show here.Another plus is that the venue is in a really cool part of Chicago.  Feel free to show up early and hang around museum campus with a blanket and cooler.

42.description: I've been to this venue a handful of times (most recently for Phish) and while the venue has changed over the years, there are still some fatal flaws. Since this is a "temporary" venue, do not expect any of the features you would find in fixed-structure venues, such as weather protection, real bathrooms, or a functional layout. The Friday night show was cancelled at the mid-point due to severe weather, since the venue is basically a trailer park with a stage and some bleachers, offering no protection. If you are attending a show where the weather might be an issue, I would recommend devising a game plan in advance, especially since the venue does not seem to have one and assumes everyone can just seek shelter in their car. Why not just have everyone evacuate to the Soldier Field covered parking structures?With the bathrooms (those outside of the lawn), I wonder if these trailers were picked up on sale from FEMA, as they could not possibly be any smaller. Although, on the plus side, they have air conditioning.  Here are some helpful hints when attending concerts at this venue:Transportation - I highly recommend checking with the venue on the parking options available for your show. Apparently, parking in certain lots after certain times was included in the ticket price. Bike parking was also available for our show.Concessions - Some good beer/cocktail options can be found; however, it's mostly just miller/bud options.   Food options are pretty limited, with the Robinson's truck being one of the better options. One of the nice features of this venue is that they let you bring in snack food, as well as factory sealed water. GA lawn - Unlike every other outdoor concert venue that has a sloping lawn, the lawn at First Merit is basically flat. If you are located in that portion of the venue, expect to watch the entire show on a monitor. In terms of sound on the lawn, the venue had this remark: "While other artists have opted to use a single delay system, Phish is bringing in multiple delay towers to ensure optimal sound coverage across the entire lawn." So while Phish covered their fans, who knows how it sounds otherwise. Probably less than optimal.All-in-all, if you are not on the lawn and know the limitations of the venue, this venue is a decent option for seeing a show. While it is not Pritzker Pavilion quality, it certainly beats going out to Tinley Park.

23.description: The views of the skyline from here is amazing however, the prices of drinks were out of control! $11 for beer. More for "cocktails." Really?! Although I didn't use the washrooms, I did notice there were PLENTY throughout the venue.

47.description: I was here on july 3, 2013 for the 311 concert. I was expecting a mud pit after reading a ton of reviews on yelp. It started downpouring on my way to the city but to my surprise... the general admission was concrete... no grass... no mud. Which I was very happy about. I am not sure where all of these people complaining about the jimmy buffet show were located. This venue has a great atmosphere and a good sound system. I was fairly close to the stage and could feel the bass! Some cons though,  beer and drinks were outrageous... as stated in other reviews beers were about $12. Another big con that we experienced, my boyfriend and I waited until after the encore to go to the bathroom and security would not let any one use the bathrooms. They were VERY quick to kick people out. Very unfortunate seeing as there's no other bathrooms around for miles. Definitely need help with management. But overall, great atmosphere for an outdoor venue.

8.description: Well, so far so good. I think this space is still finding itself, though. They could really improve the visuals by installing permanent fences first of all.  It seems as though they are still 'temporarily' set up around the food concessions, etc.Entrances are well staffed and it's easy to get in and out with VIP parking. We got relocated in our seats and they have us better seats and were super nice about it.  I will say that the flat seats in the 200-level section aren't evenly spaced, so we had about 2" of extra leg room while the row behind us had enough room for people to sit and walk!Food options are somewhat limited and not super healthy. Robinsons ribs are the place to go (but I'm biased...). Tacos take forever - be warned.  They also didn't seem to know the crowd for the concert I was attending..no cold white wine and huge lines for wine/cocktails (vs beer lines which were shorter).  Lovely setting, though.  The screen on one side was blurry the entire time, but overall, visuals and sound were really good.Lovely space on a nice evening for a concert.  A few tweaks to work out, but overall, a great spot to spend an evening in.

31.description: I was super excited to be celebrating my birthday at the BSB concert at the Charter one pavilion. I had read the horror stories about the buffet concert but i went in there hoping for the best. We had to park in Soldier Field and take a trolley down to pavilion. Luckily we had beautiful weather so this was not an inconvenience whatsoever. Our seats were incredibly amazing, way better than i thought they would be section 103 row J center, we were able to see them and the stage perfectly. Nick and I shared a moment when we looked into each others eyes. The little bit that BSB performed was incredible. That pretty much sums up the good things about the concert. Walking in we noticed the ATM and beer lines were ridiculous. The "bathrooms" were off to the side and were really just port a potty trailers, the stalls were super tiny, thank god they opened outwards otherwise i would have been stuck in the stall. There was only 1 merchandise stand and the credit card machines were down. The concert started way after it was scheduled. The security people were unnecessarily rude and not even paying attention when they needed to. We had to deal with 3 very rude seat hoppers, they kept going around section 103 trying to move up. Sorry but i paid a lot of money for my seats and its not fair for people to move up just because they want to, and at that be rude to the people that actually belonged there. The seats were cheap fold up chairs that were zip tied together, the rows were crazy narrow, and if you sat down you were practically on top of your neighbor. I had to sit with one 1 cheek in the air and the other on the seat. Then when the venue turned on the lights and we were told that it was over. Had the fold up chairs not been zip tied together, I would have started a riot. The venue people turned off the microphones on BSB and did not even let them say a proper goodbye. WTF is there a curfew ordinance on an ISLAND!? They started kicking us out with the guys still onstage. By the end of the night all the grass by the merchandise tent and bathrooms was soggy like it had been raining. I'd rather not know exactly what caused it. I really hope BSB and Live Nation do something to fix this. I paid too much money to not see a full concert. These were the best seats i have ever had at a concert and the ordinances ruined it. The One Direction concert in Tinley Park was better organized than this.

34.description: I am absolutely disgusted with this venue. I was beyond excited to attend the BSB concert (yes, I was that screaming girl) and due to this venue's horrible sound the opening act went on 45 minutes late. Now, while a bunch of people are blaming DJ Pauly D.. I don't know if this was his fault. He goes on when someone tells him to and they were having so many sound issues. Because he went on 45 minutes late that pushed the entire set back. Because of this late start the BSB were cut short of the 3 best songs that most people drove hours to see them perform. It was evident they felt very bad and tried to stay on stage. The security and staff at this venue was beyond rude and and pushing us out of our seats. Not to mention I was already annoyed that a rude employee gave me the third degree when I asked for a cup and ice for my adult beverage.. that was a grand $13. I felt so bad for the boys and the screaming girls that waited their entire lives to see this show. I will NEVER give this venue my money ever again. Oh and the bathroom situation was too disturbing to even write about.

16.description: Well the name has changed again to "First Merit Pavilion"  (Rolls right off the tongue, right?) but whatever they call it, with the stage now turned the other way (facing the lake not the city)- the sound is amazing!And sitting outside on a great Chicago night listening to your favorite music can never be a bad idea, right?A couple of things that still need some working out.  First- the "lawn seats" are totally flat and on the night I went there- recently sodded so they need some time to settle.  I know they don't want to build a berm off of the lake but without it- the back of the lawn (closest to the lake) has decent sound but you can't see much.  The same is true of the 310- 312 bleacher seats over to the one side.  You get out of the direct line of sound and view.I sat in section 202 and the sound and view of the stage were great!  What I did miss was the view of the city . . .for from this vantage point the stage totally blocks one of the greatest skylines in the world!  Too bad as I seem to remember a great view when the stage was the other way!Beer is expensive- $9 for a Bud light- but the lines were pretty non existent.  As for the restrooms- I was impressed to actually see an attendant in the women's room replenishing paper and supplies.  Sure they are "upgraded" porta potties but not as bad as I expected.Parking in the Soldier Field North lot is free if you have a paid seat ticket or you can upgrade and save the walk (it's probably 3/4 of a mile) by buying VIP parking which I think is another $25 or so.All in all a great night of music!

13.description: The venue is located east of the harbor, parking is the North Garage at Soldier Fields.  Traffic into the museum campus is terrible, don't use McFetridge Dr/S Columbus Dr, instead use the 18th Dr exit and up Museum Campus Dr into the garage.  It wasn't too crowded as we entered the venue only took a few minutes to get in.  Food vendors are expensive, $9-12 for just a slice of pizza or BBQ sandwich, bottled water is $4.75 (bring an unopened bottle instead, which is allowed).  There are "nicer" women's restrooms with sinks inside the trailer behind the porta potties, didn't know until someone told me.  Our seats were off to the side in the 300's and since there is no elevation, it was hard to see the stage with everyone in front of you, the rows were narrow and seating tight.  The sound system wasn't good at the beginning.  Leaving the venue was difficult, tight and slow moving as there weren't many exits. Parking was free, two-hour prior to concert time, which was a definite plus.

11.description: What could be viewed as positives, are also potential negatives:OutdoorsPlus: OutdoorsMinus: Flat terrain can mean poor sound, and it does here.On the LakePlus: Beautiful on the lake locationMinus: Dank, especially at night next to sweaty people.Overall  Pros:Great locationSurprisingly decent parkingOverall Cons:Flat main floor seating layout.Smallest folding chairs imaginable, twist tied together. No you can't sit at all.Crammed folding chairs means crammed people, everyone cant face the stage, you have to stand sideways.Overpriced everything.VIP:Pay extra to listen to the party sitting next to you gabbing all night, hope you are drunk enough to not want to listen to the music. It's fun if you want to gab, not if you want to listen.If you're in the first 10 rows or so center, this venue is okay, maybe even good considering the location. Otherwise if you don't mind the pork raising pen style of 'seating", not too bad.

39.description: I was so worried about seeing Phish this last weekend after all the negative Buffet reviews.I have seen Phish under some extinuating circumstances including camping in 105 degree heat.Thank you Northerly Island for addressing the issues.  The venue was terrific and I am super thankful Phish installed their own delay towers and screens.Northerly Island, it would be awesome to see the stage from the lawn and you might have to do something about the sound for future concerts.Phish takes care of their fans. I would not have seen them anywhere else last weekend!

37.description: This place is awful. First the location itself is in the middle of nowhere.  It takes roughly 20-30mn to walk to the venue and there are ZERO taxi's waiting for you after the show.  Second the venue is basically on the lake so be prepared for awful weather. Rain, snow and wind will play a major part of your life if you see a show here.  Third, the layout of the venue is just awful.  There is no reason to have the "field/lawn" seats available.  There is NO WAY you can see the stage past the seats.  Bathrooms are non-exsistant, cell service is non-existant and beer is roughly $11-15.   (not to mention an 11:pm curfew) SKIP

0.description: This review is particularly for the lawn and based on my expectations (which were very low) from reading reviews on here. I was in the lawn for Farm Aid and it was great! I was able to see the performers on stage, although it was quite far away. But there really is not much of a slope; I am 6'5" and able to see over everyone, while my girlfriend who is 5'2" couldn't. But that's kind of to be expected, isn't it? If you're all the way out in the lawn and the performers look tiny, don't you spend most of the time looking at the monitors anyway? And there were several monitors up, one very large at the front of the lawn that worked great. Sound was great.The mud: yes, it was hella muddy. But it rained all day before and there were thousands of people walking around, so again, not sure what people expect. The venue did put down some plywood on high-traffic areas and had other semi-permanent flooring down.One downside for me was that you are so far removed from the main floor that you can't really hear them cheering very much, so if the people around you aren't that into it the atmosphere might be lacking.Bottom line, IMO: don't let fears about the lawn keep you from going to a show there if those are the only tickets in your price range. I had a great time.

38.description: I was fortunate enough to sit in all 3 areas over the course of the 3 day Phish show and can speak to every level of seating. First of all, the reviews from Buffet appeared to have been completely addressed. There were no long lines for beers or bathrooms and the lawn was properly sodded. They also added extra exiting from the lawn to mitigate crowding. The lawn had plenty of bathrooms, beer and food options. Minimal views of the stage but Phish, having their own equipment, gave us excellent sound with high def screens so you can see everything. I would compare the lawn to Ravinia or MIllenium Park. If you want to be amidst all of the action, the lawn is not for you. The pavillion. Not a bad seat in the house. Air conditioned bathrooms w easy access to food. Beer lines were a little long but nothing intolerable. VIP. If you are willing to spend the money, you wlil not be disappointed. All the amenities one would expect w VIP. Bonus views of the lake. Overall. Great views of the city (not as good as the old layout but still a great experience). Exiting was still a little too tight. The rain didnt help as it rushed people out of the venue. General parking was kind of a hike but not terrible. VIP parking was convenient. The staff was, for the most part, very cordial and friendly. Security was relaxed and appropriate.Looking forward to Umphreys and Sound Tribe in 2 weeks! To the lady who gave this venue one star because it was not child friendly, you are bringing a child to a phish concert. What the hell is your problem? I give you one star for parenting. Depending on the show/crowd, this could easily be a child friendly event.

51.description: Sucks.  Put the airport  back.

27.description: I was here on August 2nd for the BSB concert that was shut down due to going over curfew. The show started late but we paid good money for tickets - how is that our fault?! I do not plan to return to this venue. The food was also overpriced. Absolutely ridiculous and disappointing.

32.description: I will NEVER ever come back to this venue again!!!! I attended the BSB concert on 8/2/13. I am huge fan of BSB fan and left the concert so upset. I couldn't believe how unorganized this venue was.  Concert was suppose to start at 7pm (listed on the ticked) and the venue didn't even begin to start letting people in till then.  Then you get in the the venue and they make you wait another 20 minutes to just get to your seat.  Because of this the concert started an hour late!. BSB didn't even get on until 9:45 and were shut down 5 songs before the end of the show! Over half of an hours worth of music that their fans missed out on.  THEY DIDN'T EVEN GET TO SING 4 OF THEIR BIGGEST HITS OR THE NEW SINGLE OFF OF THEIR NEW ALBUM!!! Then as the guys tried to apologize for everything that was going on to their fans the place shut off their microphones, COMPLETELY DISRESPECTFUL!!! Not only did the guys not finish their performance, they weren't allowed to give proper apology's or thank you's to their fans. NEVER EVER SAW his type of disrespect before from a venue.  I am 32 years old and have seen plenty of concerts and NEVER once had to experience something like this.The venue and the Chicago police department shut the show down due to "curfue" ON AN ISLAND WITH NO RESIDENTS!! ARE YOU KIDDING ME!  I have never ever left a concert in the city of Chicago at 11 pm. BSB posted a video saying that they would find a way to make this right to their fans. I for one don't think they should have to. I think this pavilion should give everyone who attended this show a full refund and pay for tickets to another venue to see BSB'S concert in full. BECAUSE THAT'S THE RIGHT THING TO DO!!To whoever reads this, DON'T EVER GO TO THIS PAVILION!!  EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

54.description: Greed turned this place from my favorite venue into utter Crap. With the size before everyone could find bathrooms, get drinks and food and see a great show from anywhere in the place.  Now it's just overcrowed, messy, unorganized (where are the bathrooms anyway?)  And you can't see who's on the stage from anywhere in the lawn. Go to a buffett show and you can't see him?  Or Patrick Kane comeing out with the cup?Sound was just bad (not loud enough) and muffled, you couldn't understand any of the talking in anyway.  And the whole place reeked like fish water.  It Muddy everywhere, and we only had light sprinkles in the morning (show was at 8:00 pm)Seriously, I won't be going back, and 6 months ago this was my favorite place to see a show.  Such a shame..BTW, parking was 40 per car, and drinks were 13 a piece inside.  My face value of my lawn seat was 36.00 but actually 60 after fees and taxes.  What a ripoff. Just ridiculous IMO.

48.description: I was one of the lucky ones, I attended the Jimmy Buffett concert from a 200 level seat.  Pros - the sound was good.  So were the sight lines.  We could see both the stage and the big screens.  We experienced no lines for bathrooms or booze simply by going to the southern tip of the venue.  Cons - alcohol was very, very expensive.  And the walk to/from the venue & parking was very long.  Walking there was festive as all the parrot heads were looking forward to a great show.  Walking out was rough, some folks were very drunk (I don't know how they could afford that! and there were lots of unhappy, muddy lawn survivors. I would recommend this venue if you have a seat and ride a bike.   If I attend another show there, I will ride my bike. I think they should just close the lawn, even without mud, it seems like the venue can't handle that capacity.

44.description: Every time I go here it looks different.  This last time, it was a bunch of folding chairs practically on top of each other.  What a sweaty mess.However, they do have some good shows and the bathrooms and VIP accommodations aren't as horrible as you would think for an outdoor venue.  So it's not a terrible place.I love the view of the city and the lake.  It just makes the concerts better.

24.description: I purchased tickets to Jack Johnson at Northerly Island. I  am not able to attend, so I wanted to give the tickets to my wife and her friends. Northerly Island refused to send me tickets or give me a refund. They said unless you show up with your credit card, no one is able to use the tickets. Beware credit card purchase only. If you can not attend the concert, you will be screwed.

7.description: Loved the music, Bryan Adams that night , hated the venue. Traffic is a pain, seating is all temp chairs. If you are an artist, for Gods sake vet your venues out before you sign them.

49.description: I purchased lawn tickets and figured I could at least see the stage which wasn't the case. There was so much mud in the lawn that it forced people to stand further from the stage. My two friends left me to go get beers and ended coming back with ONE WARM beer 45 minutes later. The bathrooms were too few and way in the back. Leaving the venue took way too long as it was unorganized. I would NOT go back unless they made some changes.

40.description: WARNING:  IF YOU HAVE GENERAL ADMISSION TICKETS ON THE LAWN AT THIS VENUE I WOULD MORE THAN LIKELY NOT RECOMMEND IT...Fortunately this was not the case for me at the recent Phishband 3-night extravaganza BUT my professional concert best friend and I went back there a couple times for professional evaluation and overall we deemed that it was UNSAT.If you have GA Pavilion or reserved bleachers the place is fine.  Good sound, nice scenic views of the city, BUT it's not really a dedicated true amphitheater...  it's very makeshift...  All the concession stands and bathroom very temporary / wheeled in...  The Staff didn't seem that with it either.I would go back, but it's definitely not a top outdoor venue.

53.description: Also at Jimmy Buffett show on 6/29/2013 - awful venue. Echo the complaints about sound and sight lines. Why no lawn chairs or umbrellas allowed on the lawn? Entry search was a joke, we could have smuggled in whatever. Muddy pit of a lawn mess was made worse by local rain, but surely the worst of it was due to watering the newly laid sod. Exiting was actually frightening as I was pushed along from behind - if anyone had fallen they would have been trampled. Too many people being funnelled into too small an exit. Once out no buses were able to come on the normal route up to the planetarium due to exiting crowds, everyone had to walk almost out to the Drive to get onto buses.

30.description: Well the name has changed again to "First Merit Pavilion"  (Rolls right off the tongue, right?) but whatever they call it, with the stage now turned the other way (facing the lake not the city)- the sound is amazing!And sitting outside on a great Chicago night listening to your favorite music can never be a bad idea, right?A couple of things that still need some working out.  First- the "lawn seats" are totally flat and on the night I went there- recently sodded so they need some time to settle.  I know they don't want to build a berm off of the lake but without it- the back of the lawn (closest to the lake) has decent sound but you can't see much.  The same is true of the 310- 312 bleacher seats over to the one side.  You get out of the direct line of sound and view.I sat in section 202 and the sound and view of the stage were great!  What I did miss was the view of the city . . .for from this vantage point the stage totally blocks one of the greatest skylines in the world!  Too bad as I seem to remember a great view when the stage was the other way!Beer is expensive- $9 for a Bud light- but the lines were pretty non existent.  As for the restrooms- I was impressed to actually see an attendant in the women's room replenishing paper and supplies.  Sure they are "upgraded" porta potties but not as bad as I expected.Parking in the Soldier Field North lot is free if you have a paid seat ticket or you can upgrade and save the walk (it's probably 3/4 of a mile) by buying VIP parking which I think is another $25 or so.All in all a great night of music!

46.description: I guess the Buffett show really made an impression on not only the attendees but also management. The outcry of mud led to the decision to pave the lawn area. Unfortunately, I found this decision quite sad. I paid for lawn seats. I came with trash bags to line the ground and lay my blankets on top of. I wore crappy shoes expecting the ground to be wet due to the recent weather. Now, it's just concrete. I'm disappointed. Otherwise, there was only one entry/exit and one merchandise vendor so the wait was quite ridiculous. There were lots of alcohol vendors and seemed to me plenty of security. I left about halfway through 311's show and on the way out saw people passed out in the green near the entry/exit with staff over looking them. Another person was passed out on a picnic table. I get it, people get drunk and stupid at concerts and as the venue owner/operator/manager you should be prepared for that and have perhaps a first aid section where these people can be taken and out of the general view of sober attendees. It was concerning and unsightly to see this happening. I'd still go back. The view was lovely even with the dense fog that night. The walk to and from the venue was awesome. And in the future I won't have to haul blankets that I wont need.

1.description: This is a long overdue of FirstMerit Pavillion.  Went here for the Jimmy Buffett concert in the summer of 2013 and had the worst concert experience ever.  Granted, we were in the lawn rather than the pavillion, but it was a muddy mess with horrible sound.  It was so bad we left early.  In 2014, we saw REO Speedwagon and Chicago and it was much improved - no disgusting lawn as we were in the Pavillion - but the seats were cramped and the bathroom situation not great given such a small venue.The ticket promoter promised all the Buffett concert goers tickets to another concert.  That never happened but it certainly squashed all the bad publicity at the time.The reason for two stars instead of one is that it's so beautiful to see the Chicago skyline - truly a magnificent view while listening to live music.

55.description: At Northerly Island I watched a wookette giving birth during the Jimmy Buffett set. I was just peaking on some 2ci. People were trying to get medical help, but they hadn't arrived. Some other wookette claimed to be a midwife and was coaching the woman through this. Her wook man is standing there shirtless and spun like top, just making these weird sounds while he is crushing his beer can and spraying coors light all over everyone. He looked really anxious about the whole thing, grabbing his face and just making grunts and stuff. The baby's head starts to crown and the medics still haven't arrived. This is where it gets crazy... It was so fucking dusty out there and the baby and all the surrounding fluids were immediately "muddified" by the blowing dirt. I mean, its fucking gross. All of a sudden, this fucking kid (probably 19 or 20) in his oversized neon, flat-brim LRG hat, runs up yelling "welcome to the party bitch!" before he blows a huge plume of smoke right in the baby's face! While the umbilical cord is still attached and shit! The smell was unmistakeable, this baby had just been deemster'd. He must have pulled the hit from a bong, b/c it was monstrous. The surrounding crowd dropped their jaws, and someone tackled the kid as he starts to run away. He didn't make it more than 10ft and the he was probably blasting off about now. The mom is clutching the dirty baby and trying to calm it. Though, strangely, the baby was not crying (tripping balls i guess?). And while the dude is getting screamed at, the dad suddenly pounces into action. He jumps on the dude, and starts smashing said bisco kid's face with the crushed up beer can, of which he seemingly just can't let go. The bisco kid is kicking and trying to roll out of it and the wook-dad grabs the kid's hair w/ one hand. he finally let the can go and shoves his other hand half way inside the guys mouth. He is pulling his mouth open and RIPS HIS CHEEK OPEN! repeat: rips his fucking CHEEK OPEN! there is blood everywhere and the dude lets out this braveheart-like scream as he gets pulled off by the folks around him. Blood all over bisco kid's face, shirt and formerly fresh flat breezy. The cops/medics arrived about that time and took over the situation. Shit was crazy as hell.

9.description: I love the venue in general but the VIP boxes are going downhill quickly for the 2015 season.  Live Nation Premium Seating raised the ticket prices while simultaneously adding more seats to the VIP Club, making the area more crowded. I actually received an email a couple weeks ago from the sales department that tried to spin the addition of seats as a positive. While concession prices in the regular areas of Northerly Island generally remain constant during the course of a season, last summer the food prices in the VIP Club were raised 50% for the popular shows like Dave Matthews and Phish. Expect that same crap for 2015.

26.description: Very disappointed - folding chairs on concrete... Really?  A fabulous lake front creates a perfect opportunity for a spectacular venue, and we had folding chairs on concrete. Even worse - they allow smoking everywhere. I will never again waste my time and money at a show there.

25.description: What a mess of a venue.  The crowds are snaked around Grant Park, which is especially awesome after the concert.  I loved being approached by shady gang members selling nitrous balloons.  I admire their operation though, very well organized.The acoustics were awful, the sound into the open air was very poor.  I'd never go back.

12.description: The views of the skyline from here is amazing however, the prices of drinks were out of control! $11 for beer. More for "cocktails." Really?! Although I didn't use the washrooms, I did notice there were PLENTY throughout the venue.

21.description: Positives: Firstmerit has a small reserved area with great views of the city. It is nice to have a venue in the city (which is close to home for us).  The stage is large and elevated. Negatives: There is very little slope in the reserved area, which results in a poor view from a majority of the seats/places to stand when in general admission. The sound was off at times. Parking that doesn't require a good walk is limited (issue if on crutches as I was). I was told there were shuttles, but I never saw them. It would be nice if they found a way to allow cabs to line up somewhat close to venue. There is NO security/people enforcing some type of order. It was a free for all. People standing in the aisles or any free space. There were people standing five across in a walkway. A girl was allowed to dance with a hula hoop in the main walkway. Fireworks were set off in the lawn. People walked into sections for which they did not have tickets. There was no regulation of smoking and drinking of outside beverages. It was such a mess and no one that worked there seemed to care about anything.

17.description: The pros:-  Beautiful outdoor venue with skyline views (depending on where you are sitting)-  It's on the lake, so always a little cooler, which is great for super hot summer nights-  Shockingly clean bathrooms-  Good sound/accousticsThe cons:-  Same as for virtually any concert venue - tough to get to with large crowds and absurb concession pricesWhen you think about it those cons are pretty much to be expected virtually anywhere, right?  Given that I would rate Northerly Island as one of my favorite places to see a concert.  Just give yourself time to get there.207/365

10.description: WARNING:  IF YOU HAVE GENERAL ADMISSION TICKETS ON THE LAWN AT THIS VENUE I WOULD MORE THAN LIKELY NOT RECOMMEND IT...Fortunately this was not the case for me at the recent Phishband 3-night extravaganza BUT my professional concert best friend and I went back there a couple times for professional evaluation and overall we deemed that it was UNSAT.If you have GA Pavilion or reserved bleachers the place is fine.  Good sound, nice scenic views of the city, BUT it's not really a dedicated true amphitheater...  it's very makeshift...  All the concession stands and bathroom very temporary / wheeled in...  The Staff didn't seem that with it either.I would go back, but it's definitely not a top outdoor venue.

5.description: Love the skyline.  Love the open air.  We parked for free in the Soldier Field North Parking garage and had a trolley/shuttle waiting to drive us over to the concert.  Super convenient!Yes, drinks are ridiculousy priced but that's to be expected.  $11 for tall boy beers but $14 for a tallboy limearita.  Plenty of bathroom options, portapotties and actual bathrooms in one looks like a mobile home.

3.description: I went to the FirstMerit Pavilion in June for Dashboard Confessional and Third Eye Blind. It was a rainy. Like, non-stop downpour for eight hours rainy. It rained right on through the show, which was fairly miserable. On a nice day, I imagine this is a beautiful venue. We walked in to the complex instead of driving/cabbing/etc. Getting in was quick, probably due to the lack of crowd that showed up early on in the evening and/or arriving between the opener and Dashboard. Our seats were easy to navigate to, and nothing felt crowded. Even the line for the bathroom (trailer/port-a-potty hybrids) was fairly non-existent. Our seats were in the 300s in the center. While we were straight back, I couldn't really see the stage because we weren't elevated at all. I watched the screens for 95% of the show - if I hadn't seen both bands several times before, I'd have been annoyed. If I return, I'll opt for the seats a little off to the side so that we are up above the crowd a bit. Sound was okay - the wind seemed to cause it to carry at some points. I didn't have the greatest experience, but I'd like to give the Pavilion another go on a nice night to see it at its best.

35.description: Once again, Northerly Island has failed. I wrote my last review regarding the Buffett concert and I knew I had already purchased BSB tickets. Didn't necessarily want to miss out on the concert so I decided I'd give the venue ONE MORE CHANCE. And it's official, I'm never going back. Overall, the concert was amazing due to the fact that BSB performed so well. But, the concert started 45 minutes after the time listed on the ticket and there were multiple technical issues during the show. Then, 11pm rolls around and BSB says they've been told they can't play anymore because of a "curfew." I'm sorry, isn't this venue on an island where there are no homes around? COME ON. BSB was trying to sing one more song and the officials turned off their mics so they couldn't even have a deserved goodbye to the crowd. UNBELIEVABLE. What venue in the world just shuts down a concert? Talk about an entirely awful experience. The last people you want to piss off at a concert are crazed boy band fans. Let me just say, I hope everyone at that concert that paid decent money calls the box office to complain. We were completely cheated, as was the band.

19.description: Every time I go here it looks different.  This last time, it was a bunch of folding chairs practically on top of each other.  What a sweaty mess.However, they do have some good shows and the bathrooms and VIP accommodations aren't as horrible as you would think for an outdoor venue.  So it's not a terrible place.I love the view of the city and the lake.  It just makes the concerts better.

28.description: One of the worst concert experiences I've ever had. We were there for three nights of Phish in July. I had a bad feeling when we were parking. They closed all close in parking for the event, going so far as to eagerly tow cars. Then they had us parking at McCormick Place literately miles away, but there was a free water taxi that was awesome. However, when severe weather struck we were unable to make it to the car in time to take shelter and got pummeled by driving rain and gale force winds. Why not let concert goers utilize the parking around the aquarium, planetarium and venue better? Then if that wasn't bad enough the parking lot workers were barking orders constantly and threatening to arrest us for nothing, gritting their teeth when asked any questions. Turned out they were all crabby, off duty prison guards, behaving like power tripping douche bags. They know Phish fans like their unique shakedown street tailgate party before the show, but they would have none of that. I don't need this, it's not how I want to be treated when I'm parking for any concert ever, I'm on vacation! I will never return to this venue, not even for a Led Zeppelin reunion, OK, only exception! Not unless they take customer service classes and do a full turn around which ain't gonna happen in Chicago so I'd rather go back to UNC or the soccer field where they tolerated us.

45.description: Improve SOUND!! Improve vending/bathroom options!

33.description: If I could give this place negative stars I would. I went to see the backstreet boys show 8-1-13, and the show started late. There were issues earlier in the day with the fire Marshall signing off on an okay to get the stage open for the show. This delayed the entire evening.        At 11pm the show was shut down for running over its curfew time. The lights were turned on, and The Backstreet boys mics were turned off!! We were told we had to leave the venue??!! That was absolutely ridiculous. A curfew on an island that has no residents??? There were no kids there???!!!!  With all of the crime going on in Chicago you would think they look into that instead of shutting down a backstreet boys show?!      This was my first time going to this venue, and I highly doubt that I will return. The sound system isn't the greatest. One thing I didn't like is that they don't really offer some sort of protection against rain. The first Midwestbank amphitheater is also outdoor, but it is covered. I was there for a show in a thunderstorm, but we were okay. This pavilion is wide open you will get drenched.

43.description: I loved this venue!  We saw Ben Folds Five and Barenaked Ladies, both bands put on terrific shows.  But both were helped by the venue.The location is just beautiful.  With the Chicago skyline as the backdrop, and Lake Michigan on the other side, how can  you go wrong?Parking was included in our ticket price!   We couldn't believe it.  And the tickets were only in the $20 range to begin with.  Granted, we were in a back section, however, we arrived early and someone came around and asked us if we wanted to move up.  We ended up in the 11th row! The sound system was excellent.  Crystal clear and not eardrum-splitting loud, it was just right.  The food and drink prices were outrageous, but that's par for the course with an event venue.  I will definitely watch the lineup of shows for this arena and attend more events here.

2.description: Went to a Counting Crows concert here last night. I had tickets in the 200 section and this was my first time at this venue. I was not impressed at all. The seats (plastic folding chairs) were super uncomfortable and lined up with little room so that when anyone needed to get up, it was difficult. Not enough bathrooms and overpriced concessions. Unless you buy VIP tickets you are out in the elements so keep that in mind. I'll skip this venue in the future.

18.description: I'm a diehard Parrothead. I can make the best out of any situation and I've gone to concerts with far worse weather. However, I've not been to concerts that were far worse venues.   Do NOT go to concerts at this venue anymore.  PERIODSweet Jesus.  The 'new" Northerly is a god awful mess.Tailgating.. sub par at best.  Then I lost my buzz after the 2 mile hike to the venue.  I know everyone has complained about the mud pit that was the lawn, but honestly, it is a lawn and it had been raining immensely the day before so that I pretty much understand.  I've experienced far muddier in Alpine.The rest of the issues, well, I CAN complain about. And I shall... The beer lines.  For real?  you have two tents for beer lines?  For that many people??  I mean, really?  Are you the type of person to invite 10 guests over for dinner and make enough food for two?  The lines for beers were far worse than anything else I've ever experienced. ANYWHERE.  Um, You know how many people go to Lolla every year?  Yet they manage to have you stand in line for oh maybe 10 minutes max.  Nope, not there.  There are no 'lines'. It was a free for all based on the lack of an actual structure.  They were low on employees, you name it.  However, the kicker:  the beer wasn't cold!!!!  $10 for a beer that were served straight from the cartons.  However my favorite was the fact that the employees were straight up asking for tips.  Laughable.No cell service at all.  Getting out of that venue was worse than parking lots of most large venues due to the fact that we had to disperse in two tiny paths.  Glad there wasn't an emergency or anything or we'd all be killed for the lack of exits. I had fun because it was a Buffett concert, I was with my friends, and we love him. I am just thankful I have tickets to Alpine in August..Alpine knows how to accommodate that many people. Alpine will now remain the place to see Jimmy. I will never again return to Northerly.  Nor should anyone else for that matter.

41.description: The Phish concert was excellent.  Perfect venue for this show...

52.description: This place is a lemon, and I want my money back,By now you've heard the Jimmy Buffett stories and mine is no different. Live Nation has screwed this place up, bad. This is city land, paid for by taxpayer funds.The way it is now is a travesty and will be a travesty for a long time to come.I sincerely hope someone sues both the city AND Live Nation.This would have been an ideal place to see a Buffett show, instead it was a perfect s**t show. Someone needs to get fired and someone else needs to refund my tickets.

50.description: I was not at the Buffett concert. I was not trapped in mud pit like so many others on Yelp; however, I was at two shows there in the last week, and a few several years ago.Pros: I love Northerly Island for the views. No other concert venue gives you sailboats behind you and the sunset over the Chicago skyline. Cons: I was peed on by an underage drunk kid. Security dug through women's purses and threw away our water bottles and umbrellas, but didn't even touch the guys, which meant, any number of contraband items made it in. Drinks were outrageous ($13 for Bud Light).Verdict: Great venue, poor management. So many things could be better done here, and have been in years past.One shout out to the security guard who fought his way through the crowd to drag out the peeing man. He was fast and did what he could to resolve a miserable situation.

4.description: I attend the 2015 V103 block party concert at this location in July.  I was very happy with the venue. I was also happy I read the reviews below; they were spot on. For the most part, the drinks here are VERY high. It's up to $15-17 for one large domestic beer. So I made my beer last! There were food vendors and I think a mixed drink vendor. Make sure to bring some funds if you don't drink/eat before. There is seating at this location. This concert was assigned seating. There are folding chairs (that is what it looks like) on the floor. There there are folding blue chairs on the balcony and lastly green stadium chairs on the upper balcony. I am not sure if you have to pay for it, but we saw people with their own folding seats outside the gates....I would not recommend these seats at the fence blocks your view. I guess you may be able to see through the gate, but my seats (blue balcony seats) were $20... Room between the seats are tight, but not too tight where we all couldn't dance :)It is an outdoor location. It may be the best to pack a rain jacket or parka. You CAN'T bring in umbrellas! It was a rainy day and many people had brought theirs...only to hang them on a tree outside the gates and hope no one steals it.The sound was great for an outside location! My last outside concert, the sound crew had a major issue with making the live band's sound, as well as the mikes for the singers were off. Not here! Nothing was off and I'm sure those outside the fence heard everything like those inside the gate. Great job on that!Parking was free at Solder Field for us...not sure if this is the case or other events. I would could to this location again without a second thought!

6.description: Inconvenient location and hard to get to with  the crowds from shows, but once there it's a pretty rad spot!I like taking in the city scape at sunset to the west and the Navy Pier fireworks to the east.  They also have huge cans of adult beverages which make for a fun concert going experience.

22.description: Saw Ray LaMontagne here last night and LOVED it! Yes drinks are expensive but what isn't in Chicago? and yes you have to walk but it's better then sitting in traffic. The view was great and even in the middle section we could see well. Only issue is why does everyone sit down?  Would definitely go back.

15.description: I have to say,  this is an awesome venue.. It's small  and quaint which I tend to like for just about any performance.. anywhere...and that backdrop of the city is amazing especially at night.  We opted to take the bus,  but as far as I could tell,  you could also drive and park in the North parking lot and get the shuttle as listed on their site.  I thought of it at the last minute and we couldn't do it) but you may also check out taking the water taxi over if you are in the city. Just a thought.  The ONLY con for us (like others have said,  the sound from the bands are not what they should/could be and you can tell the difference when the venues' sound system is on kicking out tunes during breaks between bands etc. I don't know why this is not something that they deem not important enough @FMBank Pavilion to fix?!!  It really detracts from the bands' performances.. FIX this already!!!!!!!!   I'd have given this venue 5 stars otherwise!!!

57.description: I'm a diehard Parrothead. I can make the best out of any situation and I've gone to concerts with far worse weather. However, I've not been to concerts that were far worse venues.   Do NOT go to concerts at this venue anymore.  PERIODSweet Jesus.  The 'new" Northerly is a god awful mess.Tailgating.. sub par at best.  Then I lost my buzz after the 2 mile hike to the venue.  I know everyone has complained about the mud pit that was the lawn, but honestly, it is a lawn and it had been raining immensely the day before so that I pretty much understand.  I've experienced far muddier in Alpine.The rest of the issues, well, I CAN complain about. And I shall... The beer lines.  For real?  you have two tents for beer lines?  For that many people??  I mean, really?  Are you the type of person to invite 10 guests over for dinner and make enough food for two?  The lines for beers were far worse than anything else I've ever experienced. ANYWHERE.  Um, You know how many people go to Lolla every year?  Yet they manage to have you stand in line for oh maybe 10 minutes max.  Nope, not there.  There are no 'lines'. It was a free for all based on the lack of an actual structure.  They were low on employees, you name it.  However, the kicker:  the beer wasn't cold!!!!  $10 for a beer that were served straight from the cartons.  However my favorite was the fact that the employees were straight up asking for tips.  Laughable.No cell service at all.  Getting out of that venue was worse than parking lots of most large venues due to the fact that we had to disperse in two tiny paths.  Glad there wasn't an emergency or anything or we'd all be killed for the lack of exits. I had fun because it was a Buffett concert, I was with my friends, and we love him. I am just thankful I have tickets to Alpine in August..Alpine knows how to accommodate that many people. Alpine will now remain the place to see Jimmy. I will never again return to Northerly.  Nor should anyone else for that matter.

20.description: Prior to seeing Dave here (7-5-14) I did plenty of reading up on the venue.  Like many, I saw terrible reviews of this place.  Being the skeptic I was I had a plan going into the show based off of what people had written on this site. While i did not experience the terrible Jimmy Buffet concert that turned the lawn into soup, I have seen OAR here before in the pit (great experience) and now in the lawn with Dave  and  I must say this venue isn't as bad as people had made it out to be.  Sure the 12 foot elevated lawn seats are not the greatest (compared to Alpine Valley's ski hill).  But people, if the gates open at 5:30 and you show up at 6:45 and try to find a good seat for general admission then some of the blame is on you.  I got there at as soon as the gates opened and got myself a nice lawn seat right up by the gates to the reserved seats (going for $200 and up), it was definitely worth the price of the ticket ($50).  My lawn seats also had a giant speaker blaring right at me and had a 30x30 foot video board that made up for it (which I might add, Alpine Valley's sound is weak and the video boards there are out of date compared to this place).   And quit complaining about the beer prices, $11 for a 32 oz beer isn't that bad considering you're in Chicago.  Don't like the beer prices? Then pregame before the show like I did with a flask of sweet American bourbon. The lawn could be more elevated and it was a tad bit crowded leaving the venue but overall I would see another show here in the lawn.  I'd like to see Dave at Alpine next year though just because of the tailgating experience and the fact that the lawn seats are better but go in with a plan. Get there early, pre-game prior to the show, and enjoy the backdrop of America's best skyline and some live music!

36.description: I went to the Phish shows here.  I'll start with the good.  It's a beautiful venue on the museum campus.  If you stand close to the stage you can get great band views.  If you stand towards the back you get great views of the skyline and the bands lights.  The sound was very good on the floor.   Now for the bad.  They evacuated us on 6/19 because a storm was coming in.  I asked multiple people where we were supposed to go for shelter and no one had an answer.   Being far out in the park there was really no place we could take shelter.  We ended up huddled against an outside wall of the Field Museum during the storm.   Luckily the storm was not that bad.  If it really did get 80 mile an hour winds people evacuating would have been hurt.   This venue needs a good evacuation plan where people are given clear instructions on how to evacuate and where to go.  Just telling people to leave isn't good enough!

14.description: Pros: Bryan Adams was in good form, venue had easy access to refreshments and clean restrooms. Event staff members were friendly, if not very informed. Seats were pretty low comfort, but it didn't matter because everyone stood throughout the concert anyway. Great view of the skyline, screens were high-def and sound system was superior.  Navy Pier fireworks visible after concert.Con: Long walk from mass transit (45 min from Roosevelt Station). More of a drag after the concert than before.Overall, great time!

28.description: After MANY unpleasant experiences at the local $12 Stupid Cuts, I decided that the only way to get a decent style haircut is to stop being such a tight wad and plunge for a pricier haircut.  I was on the ledge between the 316 Club in downtown or Halo.  I decided to go to Halo because there were more locations (one close to my apartment) and, being the penny pincher that I am, I had a coupon for first timers (always a plus when trying something new).Overall, I was quite satisfied with my first experience at Halo.  The stylist was attentive and she took the time to make sure all the "loose ends" were clean.  Paraffin wax and scalp shampoo/massage was impeccable.  Definitely gave me reason to visit a second time, and based on that experience alone, would qualify for a five star review.My subsequent visits, unfortunately, have been somewhat subpar.  My same "attentive to detail" stylist seemed rather rushed to give me a proper haircut, possibly because it was getting near to closing time, which I would have appreciated them not taking my appointment than compromising with a haircut I could have received at the aforementioned franchise.Pros -stylist that is more interested in your haircut than dicussing with the other stylists what they plan to do after they clock out-Shampoo/scalp massage/paraffin wax is decent-Nicer & more modern hair cutting tools-Nice interior salon and spacious comfortable chairs-Make appointments with your stylist onlineCons-Value for what you pay is mediocre-I wish the stylist would suggest different options and styling tips-Scalp/hand massage could last a few minutes moreOverall, I am quite satisfied with Halo, but fearing the uncertainty of a questionable experience at a discount haircut chain, I'll continue to try my luck at Halo in hopes that the "powers in charge" at this location monitor the reviews posted here.

1.description: Nice atmosphere, good haircut, free soda, friendly staff, this place is great! Taylor cuts my hair and I always leave happy and my wife thinks my hair looks good.

9.description: Recommendation:Ask for Jen - senior hair stylist, she is absolutely fantastic!The Good:Comfortable place to relax, great decor, attached to Sebastian GreyThe Bad:Not ideal for all guys, can be pricier than most are comfortable with (but well worth it in my opinion)Review:Originally went to Halo - South Loop to have a vest and dress shirt taylored at Sebastian Grey. Had to return for additional fitting - and was really impressed with the service. Great decor and feel to the place.I usually get a cut at a local barber shop that doesn't do anything more than clean my hair up. At Halo, Jen gave recommendations on how to alter my look, and what works/ doesnt work with my hair. I highly recommend asking for her if you stop by.

29.description: I agree with a previous reviewer...I really wanted to like this place and had high expectations considering the price.  The stylist was nice, attentive,  and asked many questions of how I wanted my hair to look.  The cut was good and exactly what I was looking for.As far as the hand massage, wax, and scalp massage...I feel like I didn't get my money's worth.  4-5 minutes later...all three were complete.  I've had better scalp massage and longer scalp massages @ HoneyCuts, LadyJanes, and Fritz's (in Louisville KY...my favorite place to get haircut).Next time I'll try someplace different.

23.description: This place is an awesome addition to the south loop. I have had many stylists here, all of them have done a decent job. But I've found my go to with Jill.  Easy to make reservations online, which is nice. The atmosphere is classy, not like the cookie cutter chains. Only thing is the price is a bit steep. But I guess that's the price you pay to trust people to cut your hair.

5.description: Pretty good package for guys that want a massage, hand treatment and a hair cut.  The technique was ok, but everything else was pretty good.  The price is decent, but for the haircut itself, I would only pay $20.  Oh but I got a free bottle of water...so $21 then.

31.description: 4 stars ONLY because of price.  For a men's haircut (even withthe hand & face 'massage') it should not be more than $20.  I used a coupon ($29) this time, but the normal price is $45.  I signed up for the Rewards Account, so we'll see if I get discounts down the road.  Other than that, great experience, haircut and staff.  They even have a pool table in case you get there a little earlier.  Cheryl - See you next time !

25.description: So yeah, for the price, I would expect more....the scalp massage, hand wax, hand massage, hot towel, and facial toner do take like less than 5 minutes and really are nothing special.  But Alexis is the absolute best stylist and she's what keeps me coming back.  I've never had better haircuts...she works magic each and every time and uses this cool technique I've never seen before.  So even though it costs more than I'm used to paying for haircuts, it's worth it cuz she makes me hot.  LOL.  I do sorta wish they had a "Haircut only" option for those who don't really care for the scalp massage and hand wax stuff, but that would be my only complaint.  Everything else, from the reservationist to the stylists to the atmosphere is perfect.

12.description: First off, if you aren't high income, don't bother about this place. I'm not high income, and I only was able to try it from a Gilt Groupe coupon. That aside, this place is awesome. First impressions are sweet: you walk in and they offer you a drink, I chose a perfect ice-cold Coke, and the spacious waiting room with very comfortable chairs has a POOL TABLE. How awesome is that?So, you sit down and they basically cut your hair. I got Jen (I think), and she does a great job, and did a sort of 'fade' thing to the back of my neck-so you don't get that sharp "I just got a haircut" line that then looks dumb two weeks later. Speaking of two weeks later...they also have free touch-ups within two weeks. So, you can go in after two weeks and get everything re-trimmed so you have that fresh haircut look for a little longer.So your haircut is over. Then the fun starts. They take you back, and double dip your hands in a hot eucalyptus wax. They then put your hands in bags and lean you back for a facial toner/hot towel treatment, and a scalp massage/hair wash. Then, while you're relaxing, they take of the wax and give you a lovely hand massage to boot. These are the little touches that show why you paid $45, and make it more worthwhile-I sat there, hot towel on face, relaxing in a chair getting a hand massage. I would've enjoyed it that much more if I were not a poor college student and knew I could afford to come back sometime soon. If I were successful, I would definitely come here for my every haircut. I would enjoy sitting there, thinking "Yeah, I paid $45 for this. I have a high-income job, and I am sitting here blowing $45 on a haircut, with a hot towel on my successful face, getting my hands massaged, because I'm the man. I made it."Ahhh, someday...Bottom line:  If you can afford it, go here.

21.description: The staff here is courteous and helpful.  I love the fact that from the moment you walk in they offer to give you a drink and take your coat.Their stylists are friendly, but not overbearing.  I heartily recommend the "Man" treatment, if for no other reason than you get a two week check up/clean up appointment.  It's like getting two haircuts for the price of one.

16.description: 4 stars ONLY because of price.  For a men's haircut (even withthe hand & face 'massage') it should not be more than $20.  I used a coupon ($29) this time, but the normal price is $45.  I signed up for the Rewards Account, so we'll see if I get discounts down the road.  Other than that, great experience, haircut and staff.  They even have a pool table in case you get there a little earlier.  Cheryl - See you next time !

17.description: For $49 for a man's haircut you expect to come out looking and feeling like a new man. I did not. My wife did not like the haircut and the scalp massage and parafin waxing of my hands were down and dirty, which is why I was in and out of Halo for my one and only time in under 25 minutes. They are better then the $12 clippers, but not worth $49.

10.description: For my entire life, I've gotten haircuts from Supercuts. I saw no reason to go anywhere else. Finally, this has changed.I broke down and tried out Halo after I had received several of their coupons in the mail, and I realized they were quite close by. Sure, they're a little pricer than what I where I was going before, but once you factor in the scalp massage, hand wax, and a darn good haircut, I think you get your money's worth.
