Cheryl is a great conversationalist, and was able to give me easy-follow instructions on maintaining what she had just done to my hair. The two-week free touch-up ain't half bad, either.

11.description: Surprised this is not a 5-star average!!!This is a good place to get a stylish haircut if you are a man. If you're visiting here with your boyfriend/husband (like me), the staff members are extremely pleasant and make you feel very welcome and not just a silly afterthought. That can be important too!Good job, Halo for Men. I know we shall return!

26.description: Went in on Saturday morning. Very relaxing atmosphere.  Got "the man", which is haircut & style, shampoo and scalp massage, paraffin hand wax, hand massage, hot towel and facial toner. Was $45 for all that plus I can go back within the next 14-days and get a touch up.  Service was great! This was my first trip in, overall pretty satisfied.

27.description: I live in the neighborhood and was glad to see an "all-inclusive" salon for men open up.  The haircut was very good and they service was attentive.  They did run out of parafin wax, but they give you free touch ups for 2 weeks (so they will do it then).  I really like the complimentary touch ups (helps from getting a haircut for 2-3 extra weeks.  The "drink" selection is terrible - other male salons offer a beer, but its not the end of the world.  Overall, good experience and will be back.I love the on-line reservation process, but should be more user-friendly.  Had to keep opening the menu in another window to see what the services were.

0.description: I'm currently on crutches, and from the moment I walked in, the entire staff was very accommodating! I greatly appreciated that. I had an appointment with Marie B. She was super considerate, and we had a very pleasant conversation. I am very impressed with the work that she did! I got "The Man" which consists of shampoo and conditioner, a scalp massage, warm towel treatment, hand wax moisturizing treatment and a haircut. I was in heaven for every moment! What's even better is that within 2 weeks, I can return for a touchup around the ears and neck!I'd gladly return!

20.description: I went in after getting a mailer coupon for the south loop location which is just down the block from my condo.  Lisa was fantastic at the hair cutting, and the conversation kept rolling as well.  I will be back for another cut with her for sure!

19.description: The very first Halo that i had tried was a few years ago in bucktown - and i won't lie, they definitely messed up my hair. After that i was pretty weary of going back and spending 45 bucks to come out looking like someone was let loose with a pair of hair clippers on my head -however, seeing as to how this place just opened up down the block, i decided to give it a go. Halo definitely gets it right with the complimentary pop, pool table, comfy chairs - hand and face massage, shampoo, etc , etc. you get more bang for your buck for the money you spend...this time was also a better hair cutting experience - i think as long as you're specific about how long you want it to be left, what style you're into , etc etc , they do a great job - i'd give them 5 stars if the price was in the 30 dollar range...45 bucks plus tip just gets suuuuper steep.in any case, it was still a shearly delightful experience. ( get it, "shearly"? ha, ha... i know, i'm lame . )

33.description: For $49 for a man's haircut you expect to come out looking and feeling like a new man. I did not. My wife did not like the haircut and the scalp massage and parafin waxing of my hands were down and dirty, which is why I was in and out of Halo for my one and only time in under 25 minutes. They are better then the $12 clippers, but not worth $49.

2.description: Question: What is the difference between a good and a bad haircut? Answer: About 10 days. Alternate answer: Going to a real salon and paying less money than going to Halo (a very expensive version of a strip mall haircut chain). Haircut: I have nothing negative to say about my haircut. I also have nothing positive to say. About 90% of the cut was done with a buzzer, no layering or style was added to my cut. Employees: Everyone working at Halo was nice and I enjoyed the conversation. Physical store: The location is great in the South Loop and everything was "clean". However, the place seemed dingy when you were inside. Scuffed floors. Chipped paint. Slightly damaged chairs and furniture. Overall sentiment: $50 for a haircut pre tip is fine if you are paying a stylist. Halo is far from a nice salon with great haircuts. I will not be going back.

32.description: After having my hair butchered a few times by the local Hair Cuttery, I decided to try the newly opened Halo for Men.  I had been to this type of "Men's Salon" once before but never a Halo.  I was pleasantly surprised by the atmosphere.  It's kind of a mix between a sports bar/pool hall and a bachelor pad.  I had Alex style my hair and she did a great job.  You can tell these people are professionals unlike the Hair Cuttery where you feel like they've been doing this for 2 weeks.  I was also pleasantly surprised by the paraffin hand wax (sexy) and the hot towel on your face while getting shampooed.  Overall I give it 4 stars because it is a little bit more than I like to spend on a haircut but it's better than getting bad haircuts.

18.description: I agree with a previous reviewer...I really wanted to like this place and had high expectations considering the price.  The stylist was nice, attentive,  and asked many questions of how I wanted my hair to look.  The cut was good and exactly what I was looking for.As far as the hand massage, wax, and scalp massage...I feel like I didn't get my money's worth.  4-5 minutes later...all three were complete.  I've had better scalp massage and longer scalp massages @ HoneyCuts, LadyJanes, and Fritz's (in Louisville KY...my favorite place to get haircut).Next time I'll try someplace different.

13.description: $10 off for first time visitors. Two week later touch up included. Ask for Jamie. Is pricey though :(

4.description: Stopped in last week to get a haircut. I was looking for something a bit drastic and new to start my new job. I was met with a very friendly and fun stylist. She listened to me and shared some of her own ideas. I was very pleased with the results. I was a previous customer at the Halo in the Gold Coast. That location closed a few yrs ago, so they gave me the $10 new customer discount. That was an unexpected bonus. This is just a few blocks from my new place. I will definitely be back.

24.description: For my entire life, I've gotten haircuts from Supercuts. I saw no reason to go anywhere else. Finally, this has changed.I broke down and tried out Halo after I had received several of their coupons in the mail, and I realized they were quite close by. Sure, they're a little pricer than what I where I was going before, but once you factor in the scalp massage, hand wax, and a darn good haircut, I think you get your money's worth. Cheryl is a great conversationalist, and was able to give me easy-follow instructions on maintaining what she had just done to my hair. The two-week free touch-up ain't half bad, either.

6.description: I have to say I am very happy with Taylor at the south loop halo. She always makes time for me to walk In and does great work. I think this is the happiest I have been with a hair stylist. This is hard for me to say because I really don't give her much to work with :(

22.description: Avoid...the people who works there are nice, but the hair cut is definitely not up to par. It is probably as good as a hair cuttery or super cut. To give them credit, they did give me a five mins hand massage. If u like all the extra service they perform, you will like it. But if you want a nice hair cut, then go somewhere else.

15.description: Went in on Saturday morning. Very relaxing atmosphere.  Got "the man", which is haircut & style, shampoo and scalp massage, paraffin hand wax, hand massage, hot towel and facial toner. Was $45 for all that plus I can go back within the next 14-days and get a touch up.  Service was great! This was my first trip in, overall pretty satisfied.

7.description: I waited to review until I had a bit of history with the establishment.  I have now been going to this location for a little over a year.  Whether $45.00 is too high for a haircut is a personal decision but it does include the shampoo and conditioning, a scalp and hand massage, and a paraffin hand wax.  It also includes a free touch-up within two weeks which is a nice touch.  I would probably go without the extras if there was a price point that was for the haircut only but it is still a nice touch. The place itself is nice with a pool table, comfortable plush chairs, and multiple flat screen TVs.  I am always greeted by name by the person at the front desk and offered a Coke which is a nice personal touch.  I get a reminder email with my appointment time which is definitely helpful.  I used to be able to make my appointments via the website but they recently removed that feature and now I must call the salon.  Calling is fine but I am a night owl so it was nice to make my appointment after store hours online instead of having to call.I have been seeing Lisa for my haircuts and she has been doing a great job.  I have longer hair that is a bit curly and Lisa has offered up a lot of great ideas and we have found a style that I really like now.  She is talented and patient.  The patient part is important because I hate to feel rushed.  My haircuts always start on time and I never feel like I am being rushed out of the place which is nice.  My wife has been happy with every haircut I have come home with.My only suggestion would be to offer a haircut with a price point that does not include all the extras for those that feel $45 is too high.  I can't compare this place to other Men's salons with similar price points because I was previously going to Supercuts.  Supercuts was fine when I kept my hair short, but since I have been growing my hair out I don't trust it to the discount shops.  I highly recommend Lisa at Halo.

8.description: *Super long review, cliff notes on the bottom*Recently, I've been holding out on getting a haircut because I'm tired of my usual barber and don't want to go to a random barbershop/Supercuts. I haven't cut my hair in such long time that my girlfriend started to think that I looked like a homeless person. Also after realizing that I've been wearing hats/beanies for the past couple weeks that I needed to do something, fast. So, I decided to get off my butt and ask the mighty internet for a place to go.I searched for "Men's Haircut" and the first thing that caught my eye was yelp. I read the reviews of many places and compared prices and services for a couple days. Then I finally decided to give Halo a try. Called, made an appointment, and I was on my way.I arrived a couple minutes early and was greeted by the nice staff and was offered a drink. I sat down in the big comfy leather couch and didn't have to wait long till I was greeted by my stylist, Jen L. I told her about my crappy hairline since I wasn't blessed with Brad Pitt's hair and Jen took care of everything. She made me feel super comfortable and she took her time with my haircut. She made sure I got the haircut I wanted and kept going back to make sure the details were perfect. Jen was also a great conversationalist and I was never once bored while getting my haircut.After the haircut I was taken to the back to get the hand wax treatment. I thought it was really cool since I'm easily amused and I got to have my hands covered in wax. She then took me to wash my hair and placed a hot towel on my face. The head massage was good and the "stimulating" conditioner gave my head this cool/tingly feeling on my scalp. Then came the hand massage. I don't know if it was the mixture of the head massage, conditioner, hot towel, and the hand massage but that was the most relaxed I've been in awhile. At the end, Jen offered me some styling tips and styled my hair. I was blown away by how great Jen was and the services. I will definitely be going back and in fact I've already referred a buddy of mine.I know a lot of people have been complaining/held back by the price but for all the services that the package offers compared to everywhere else, it really can't be beat. Not to mention you get a free touch up within 2 weeks of your haircut.I know my review is super long but if Jen took her time to give me a great haircut, I can at least take my time to write her a great review. Also I got $10 off for being a first time customer, how sweet is that!*Cliff notes:- Great place- Jen is awesome- The services were amazing- Great value if you look at everything you are getting- Go give them a try!

30.description: The very first Halo that i had tried was a few years ago in bucktown - and i won't lie, they definitely messed up my hair. After that i was pretty weary of going back and spending 45 bucks to come out looking like someone was let loose with a pair of hair clippers on my head -however, seeing as to how this place just opened up down the block, i decided to give it a go. Halo definitely gets it right with the complimentary pop, pool table, comfy chairs - hand and face massage, shampoo, etc , etc. you get more bang for your buck for the money you spend...this time was also a better hair cutting experience - i think as long as you're specific about how long you want it to be left, what style you're into , etc etc , they do a great job - i'd give them 5 stars if the price was in the 30 dollar range...45 bucks plus tip just gets suuuuper steep.in any case, it was still a shearly delightful experience. ( get it, "shearly"? ha, ha... i know, i'm lame . )

3.description: My Husband had hair cuts twice in the South loop branch and I was total unimpressed with his hair cut, it looked like military buzz! Totally not something that fit him.

14.description: After MANY unpleasant experiences at the local $12 Stupid Cuts, I decided that the only way to get a decent style haircut is to stop being such a tight wad and plunge for a pricier haircut.  I was on the ledge between the 316 Club in downtown or Halo.  I decided to go to Halo because there were more locations (one close to my apartment) and, being the penny pincher that I am, I had a coupon for first timers (always a plus when trying something new).Overall, I was quite satisfied with my first experience at Halo.  The stylist was attentive and she took the time to make sure all the "loose ends" were clean.  Paraffin wax and scalp shampoo/massage was impeccable.  Definitely gave me reason to visit a second time, and based on that experience alone, would qualify for a five star review.My subsequent visits, unfortunately, have been somewhat subpar.  My same "attentive to detail" stylist seemed rather rushed to give me a proper haircut, possibly because it was getting near to closing time, which I would have appreciated them not taking my appointment than compromising with a haircut I could have received at the aforementioned franchise.Pros -stylist that is more interested in your haircut than dicussing with the other stylists what they plan to do after they clock out-Shampoo/scalp massage/paraffin wax is decent-Nicer & more modern hair cutting tools-Nice interior salon and spacious comfortable chairs-Make appointments with your stylist onlineCons-Value for what you pay is mediocre-I wish the stylist would suggest different options and styling tips-Scalp/hand massage could last a few minutes moreOverall, I am quite satisfied with Halo, but fearing the uncertainty of a questionable experience at a discount haircut chain, I'll continue to try my luck at Halo in hopes that the "powers in charge" at this location monitor the reviews posted here.

3.description: For a cafe located within the Field museum, it's not as costly or bad, as reviews would have you thinking.  A friend and I hit up this cafe whilst exploring the museum the other day.  We came to check out the Vikings and dinosaur exhibits on an off day.  Since we didn't plan on lunch ahead of time, we grabbed a pizza and a couple drinks at the cafe.  The pizza was big enough for two and is offered in one size only.  We got six, decent sized slices out of it.  A hand tossed pie, it was tasty and quelled the calling for a snack.  And all for less than $14 dollars.  Looking over the menu, they have a wide variety of options good for any individual or family.  Soups, sandwiches, grilled items and more and all priced between $5 and $9 dollars.  Drinks and desserts for $2 - $3 dollars.  Plus they make everything fresh and they compost.  Cost-wise, it's comparable to other museum food options and yet, inexpensive if compared to dining at Navy Pier.  Heck, for those stuck on its cost, bring your own bag lunch and dine in any of their remote dining rooms.Do kids like it?  I recall many kids chomping down on food (quietly) while looking around  or watching television.  The cafe is a colorful place and it was maintained well.  What I didn't see was people bitching or complaining about food or cost.  I gotta say, I for one do not eat fast food any longer (when better options are available) nor do I subject nieces or nephews to it.  Cost wise, I'd rather buy them or myself, something better (healthier).  I can't believe a few reviewers are requesting Mcdonald's back here!? There was a time when after school, the drive thru at McDonald's was steadily busy.  Times have changed and people want healthy options for a decent cost.  Need a bit of something fast? There's a hot dog stand outside guys..

1.description: Absolutely hideous selection and barely edible food.  Overpriced, poor quality and not worth clogging your arteries for.  Why families are duped into visiting this den of carcinogens is beyond belief.  I also can't believe people give this dive more than two stars.  Desperation?I gave this basement dive another try and regretted it.  What I ordered was fries and a Chicago beef.  What I got was an elementary school-sized hotdog bun and some chipped beef smothered with melted industrial grade Velveeta.  It almost ranks as the most disgusting thing I've eaten all year.  I am NOT kidding.Save yourselves and go upstairs to the Field Bistro.  The food is almost the same price, and your internal organs will thank you for not being an "Explorer" of grossness.

0.description: Came here since we didn't want to leave the Field Museum to find lunch. Yes, this place is more expensive compared to like fast food places. But that's expected. We ordered 4 grilled chicken sandwiches and 1 burger. Price was around $40 something. The chicken sandwich was actually not bad. The buns were nicely toasted and the chicken was not dry but fairly juicy and tender. Pro tip #1: Bring your own bag of chips or something to reduce lunch costs.Pro tip #2: Beat the lunch crowd, we got in around noon and it wasn't too crowded on a Saturday. But around 12:30 there was a huge line and then you'll also have seating issues.

2.description: The staff is very friendly. However, this doesn't make up for overpriced, disgusting food. $3 for a fries order that would be a small at McD's, chicken sandwich not cooked all the way, and pizza that makes Domino's look good. Bring your own lunch or wait to eat somewhere else.

5.description: This place is ridiculously overpriced and has the worst service  that I've  ever experienced . We ordered one pizza, 1 chicken  sandwich, 1 Italian beef sandwich, and 1 tuna melt for $42, and seriously   $3 for a soda? The dude in charge of cleaning the trays and garbage area literally yelled at me for putting my water bottle in the "recycle". This place needs to give their employees better training on how to behave in front of their customers. The Field museum should consider  getting of this place soon. they are definitely not what museum goers want to deal with.

6.description: This is a well organized dining option for while you're at the museum and not planning to have an elaborate meal. And I ordered the veggie pizza and enjoyed a very cold refreshing Diet Coke the wait staff were attentive and friendly the food arrived within a reasonable amount of time. I wonder if some of the impatience that people often have with this dining option has to do with children and adults being overtly tired by the time they finally take a meal break. And the pizza was perfect no complaints and the crust actually tasted pretty close to hand tossed. Certainly better than frozen pizza from the grocery store or pizza made on an English muffin which we all eat those at home so come on people be real.

7.description: We ordered 5 different items. The Caesar salad and chicken wrap were inedible. In addition, it took between 10-15 mins to get our food. You don't have any other choices at the Field Museum for lunch, so bring a picnic lunch with you if you have that option.Bring back McDonalds!

8.description: 2 hot dogs and a tuna melt took 25 minutes. At that point, who cares what it tastes like. Not that it tasted great. Mediocre and about what you'd expect. I don't expect fine dining but I do expect something actually convenient.

9.description: We had a great Experience.!We came at during the lunch rush and the place was packed. We only waited 3 minutes to place an order and by the time we got our drinks and condiments they delivered the food.We had pizza, Beef, Tuna Salad and Salad.All were fresh and delicious. My friend said it was the best tuna melt she's ever had. The pizza was large for 7 bucks ( I cant believe people complain on pricing) Name any restaurant that's not fast food and the price is much cheaper. I even saw a cook in the back slicing a huge chunk of beef on the slicer which is why I ordered the beef. It seems as if everything is fresh and in house which makes up for any arguments on quality.Overall my wife and friends had a good time.They are coming back to Chicago in two weeks and we look forward to eating the bistro.

10.description: Was very excited for this family café after trying the bistro upstairs, meh, disappointing and overpriced. A cut down version of the Aramark offerings upstairs. Horrid "Loop sausage sandwich" (half a rock hard sausage in a cheap hotdog bun for $8 anyone?) and $3 soda.  Kids ate pizza, small but no complaints other than the wait time. Disinterested staff manning the tills and table didn't look very clean. Avoid.

4.description: Yes, it's expensive.  But certainly not one star.  Ordered 2 tuna melts and 2 hot dog kid's meals.  Tuna melt was $7.50, and didn't come with any side. Yes, grossly overpriced, but it tasted pretty good.  The kids' meals are a bargain.  $6 and it included fries and a Capri Sun.  And the fries were enough that the kids shared with us.  Still expensive though, but since there are numerous vending machines in the museum, and nobody checked my backpack (we brought water, that's why we didn't order drinks),  I'm going to guess that bringing outside   food in is allowed.

1.description: I actually have no idea what this place is called but it's right next to the Planetarium and bus stop on East Solidarity. They sell juices and iced tea plus other beverages. I can imagine if you're lounging on the lake front all day there, it's nice to go get some cold refreshing drinks..

0.description: We stopped in here while at the Planetarium. If you check in on Yelp you get a free cookie.The hubby and I split a awesome tuna sandwich and a Pepsi for $6.80 pretty cheap in this area.  Plenty of space great staff. Easy to get in and find a seat and relax while you eat. They even let you take your drinks out of the area and into the Planetarium.

58.description: We love our South Loop Mariano's! Always clean, well-stocked, great prices, easy parking, and friendly staff. So glad to have this grocery store a few blocks from home!

56.description: I ate at the hot food bar. And tried their gelato. They have the perfect mini size for $1.25. Perfect size, perfect price!

29.description: Very nice addition to the area. Always clean and reliable service.  The smaller parking lot in front can be tough to navigate when it's busy. You're better of in the parking structure.

42.description: Just moved to the area from Virginia and I was looking for a grocery store that was similar to Wegman's, which is high-end, good food with good service.  Well, this place is BETTER than Wegman's.  Went on a Sunday and it was a madhouse.  Won't go on a weekend anymore, but the selection and quality of food is unbelievable. AND they cook your food for you at no charge.  I couldn't believe it.  I bought a cajun catfish and they grilled it for me.  Next time, I'm buying steaks and having them grill it. Wow. The only negative is the place is too small.  It should be about 10% larger.  Also, didn't see anything about delivery and they should really offer that service if they don't. Can't wait to go back.  The selection of deli meats was good and they give you samples.  I couldn't believe how great it tastes.  They also have a popcorn station and it tastes ok, but I won't buy that again.  They should really have Garrett's popcorn sublease their popcorn station because Garrett's has better popcorn. Who in the world would shop at Jewel after shopping at Mariano's???. And the prices are very reasonable. Again, hubby and I can't wait to go back. Very well done, Mr. Mariano.

23.description: Great grocery store. I've been tot his Mariano's and many others, and I can't help but give them 5 stars. Why? Well.1. Freshly squeezed OJ. Delicious and wayyy cheaper than the FSOJ I find in Hyde park. 2. Sandwiches. These are delicious. Well, to be fair, I've only tried the italian muffaletta, but it's delicious. I always get it toasted with a little bit of mayonnaise and it's perfect.3. Grill! Okay, i haven't actually tried it yet, but it LOOKS awesome (they grill anything for you!). Perfect if you don't want to grill actually at home.4. Gelato! Great and cheap.5. Bakery. It's standard but 1 notch better! Their fruit tarts are delicious and I bring one to my girlfriend's house when I visit (and end up eating most of it). 6. Chicken salad. It's delicious. I buy about a pound and make about 3 sandwiches for it for lunch (it only keeps for like 3-4 days). It's great!A nice grocery store that has everything you could want and is priced well. The workers here are also super helpful! This location also has free parking on site!

47.description: Someone asked me what made Mariano's better than a Jewel Osco and I didn't quite convey how awesome this place is:To summarize, it's like comparing Target to Walmart.The aisles are wider, everything looks more tidy, even when it's crowded, it doesn't feel like am entire shit show.Every single time I've asked someone where something was, they knew exactly where to find it.  Not all Mariano's are the same, however.  Some offer free grilling of your purchase at the butcher, steaming of your seafood, and other prepared food options.This location isn't as extravagant about their prepared foods as, say, the West Loop location, but they do grill til pretty late at night (I think 9pm) FREE OF CHARGE.What I particularly like about this location over others is that the parking situation is solid.  Even on a mid Sunday afternoon, the garage isn't near full and the intersections around the store aren't congested.  This is just an example of solid planning.  Just about all the other city locations can easily have you waiting just to get into the parking lot, let alone trying to find a spot.Mariano's has done a good job at keeping the experience consistent across all the locations I've been through.  I like going to the grocery store multiple times a week so the ease of getting in and out of this particular location is a huge plus for me.

8.description: I love Mariano's!  Great food selection, deli, olive bar, hot bar, salad bar, pizza station, gelato station.  I like to treat myself and sit down and have some sushi made for me at their sushi station.  I would of given this location 5 stars but the staff at the sushi station are not friendly like the other Mariano's locations I've been to which was a little disappointing.  Other than that, this is the location I visit the most.  Keep up the great ideas to keep me coming back!

31.description: Mariano's is the best Grocery store chain to Chicagoland. The produce is huge and fresh and I love the prices of the bananas $.39/lb. They sell all kinds of cheeses and wines. You get your high end products and the affordable brands too. I like the Roundy's brand for corn beef hash and spreadable butter they are the best. Who doesn't like Mariano's if you don't feel like cooking your food they can grill your meats and dinner is done.

34.description: Mariano's is my go to for just about any of my grocery needs. They have the best selection and quality for fair prices. Yes you can get cheaper at aldi, or higher quality at Trader Joes, but Mariano's is the best of both worlds and I never have to worry about not finding what I need at the store. Which is a constant issue with Aldi and TJs. Staff is friendly, and they have samples all the time! Can't beat that! Favorite grocery store in the city. Hands down.

16.description: This location is meh at best, the produce is horrible almost every single time I'm there, they actually ran out of lettuce a couple of days ago, like mid day ran out of lettuce..... Their alcohol selection is descent and the cashiers are polite and efficient, the grocery items are  wide in variety but it seems that EVERY SINGLE TIME I'm there it's impossible to find someone working the aisles should you have a question, so it's become my regular alcohol run place because of selection and price, nothing more.

13.description: There is so much promising about this store:  Off the beaten path location makes it a little less hectic than other supermarkets in the area;  the store is new and therefore somewhat cleaner than other grocery stores;  the prices are decent, especially when things are on sale.What I hate however?  There are never shopping baskets at the entrance.  For the last four Saturday mornings in a row, the number of shoppers is manageable, yet zero hand baskets to be found.  Each time, I have had to circle the store, scouting the end of checkout lanes, around the service desk area and any other spots I can think of to find one.  Today, I asked a clerk at the service desk why baskets were no longer being stocked at the entrance and I was looked at like I was speaking a foreign language.Now, I get why they might think this is a good idea:  When only shopping CARTS are available, people load up on more and perhaps it is better for sales.  But for guys like me walking (not driving) through the neighborhood, I want to buzz in, grab 12 items or less and buzz out.  I have gotten to the point that I will simply walk out of the store if I can't see any baskets when I enter.  When it takes longer to FIND a basket than it is to fill it and check out, that reflects an obvious disregard for your shoppers.  Get it together.

11.description: I only come here for the glazed croissant rolls. Apple pie. Cibatta rolls. Lorina lemonade and the salad/ hot bar. No other reason to spend an extra .90 for groceries. A lot of young kids working here and you can tell because that hot bar some days can be messed up. Word of advice. Cooking is a skill that is developed over time. A young child can not cook unless they are Jesus or have been cooking since his/her youth. Please get the kids out of the kitchen. Otherwise store is always clean and employees very nice. They are still boguish for that small front parking lot. I guess that is what you get for shopping in the loop.

39.description: Mariano's is much better replacement for a Jewel Osco and definitely wonderful competition for Whole Goods. The grocery store is awesome and should be a model for other large grocers. The aisles are wider, everything looks more tidy and even when it's crowded. Every single time I've asked staff for assistance to locate a specific item, they knew exactly where to find it and we're always helpful, pleasant and professional.  Not all Mariano's are the same, however, there is a consistent Mariano stamp at each store. How are they subtly different? Some offer free grilling of your purchase at the butcher, steaming of your seafood, and other prepared food options. The sushi bar is awesome!!! The flower shop is always beautiful and offers great prices on various types of arrangements. The juice bar is excellent and the flavors are consistent. The organic food section is extensive.Overall, Mariano's offers excellent and competitive price points.   This location isn't as extravagant about their prepared foods as, say, the West Loop location, but they do grill til pretty late at night (I think 9pm) FREE OF CHARGE.What I particularly like about this location over others is that the parking situation is solid.  Even on a mid Sunday afternoon, the garage isn't near full and the intersections around the store aren't congested.  This is just an example of solid planning.  Just about all the other city locations can easily have you waiting just to get into the parking lot, let alone trying to find a spot.Mariano's has done a good job at keeping the experience consistent across all the locations I've been through.  I like going to the grocery store multiple times a week so the ease of getting in and out of this particular location is a huge plus for me.

37.description: Great market, everything looks and tastes fresh.  The pastry section is amazing and always have warm pies and bread!   It's a little pricey (you could easily spent over 100 dollars in a few things) but worth going.

0.description: I love Mariano's!!! The staff is friendly, the aisles are always clean and the ready-to-go food is always yummy! Lines are never too long either. There are so many lanes to check out that shopping here is super convenient. They grill your meat here for free which is awesome! You can build a salad at the salad bar or grab a warm lunch or sushi. Coming here after work can be a little more crowded but nothing overpowering. I love the organic options they have here! There's a parking lot right outside and a parking garage next door. I've never had to go the garage because people are always coming in and out. Trust me, lines move quickly. When we moved I thought it'd be tough to break away from my beloved Pete's but Mariano's has not disappointed.

38.description: I'm lost for words to adequately describe, but simply put, this Mariano's is the best grocery store shopping experience i've ever had. The ambiance is simply amazing, they have the best of everything and have the friendliest most helpful/informed staff.

51.description: This review is for their amazing doughnuts.  I'm addicted to the powdered Bavarian Bismarck which weighs in at 130 grams (I weighed it at home to estimate calories).  The Boston Cream, Glazed, Jelly, Cronut, and Pershing donuts are also fantastic.  Better yet, they're all good.If you're curious about the calorie count, it's probably around 570 calories per doughnut.  4 powdered Entenmann's Pop Ems weigh 57 grams and have 250 calories.  Therefore, (130/57) * 250 = 570.All of a sudden, I feel bad about eating 2 or 3 of them.  Dunkin Donuts Bavarian Cream donuts come in at 270 calories a piece which explains why they are half the size of Mariano's.  Anyway, this is probably too much info.  Long story short, just eat one if you are worried about your waistline.  However, if we're eating donuts, let's count calories another day.  "I'll start my diet tomorrow."

27.description: The Food service area is terrible and soooooo rude. If you hate your job, quit.I live across the street form here, and every couple of months I pop in to get a quick meal, since I work late it seems convenient but I'm always disappointed.  the food bar is so over priced and not good at all. the soups are ok and the salad bar is too.If you go over to the pizza or hot sandwich stations they will hate you. They hate making that food to order, they hate waiting on you, they will ignore you for 5 minutes hoping that you walk away. When you ask for a sandwich or pizza they will roll their eyes, and be pissed off that you are alive.  I've often seen three or four people behind the counter joking laughing and talking, then when you walk up they either ignore you or scatter like cockroaches when the light gets turned on.We walked over to the bakery at 8 pm to get cupcakes for work tomorrow, we waited at the counter while 2 clerks chit chatted for about 5 minutes, finally one turns and says "do you need help?" yes we'd like cupcakes, (introduce eye roll and "yeah one second") are you closed or something ? "no the bakery is open until 10, (eye roll and hands on hips) which ones you want?"

32.description: This is the only Marianos I have been to that I do not like. The location is awkward, the parking is awful, and the fresh/hot food is not any good compared to the other Marianos. Perhaps the two times I have tried were their "off" nights - but 2 times was enough to convince me that they don't care enough. The store also feels smaller and dirtier.

54.description: This Mariano's is the only one where I have ever run into rude employees, albeit cart gatherers.  Every other employee in every other Mariano's seem to be customer focused, but today I get a rude ungrateful employee who budges me out of her way....and is nasty.

48.description: Sorry Mariano's I USUALLY LOVE YOU; Your Popcorn, Your Taffy Apples, Your Breads, etc......   However this keeps occuring so I thought I should tell people. The Deli service at the Clark location is HORRIBLE.  They never use their number system(WHY HAVE IT?).  There are always sevaral people walking in and out behind the counter and no one looks toward the customers.   The WAIT is Always long and the service is S-L-O-W and unfriendly.  Wait: I did see one guy there yesterday that seemed pleasant and efficient, however I haven't had the pleasure of his service yet.  I will try again and re post.

44.description: Good!

24.description: Not as organized as the other Mariano's and I felt I could not find what I needed. Not as appealing as other Mariano's

7.description: Our go-to grocery. We love the fresh orange juice (you really can't go back to the normal stuff once you've tried it), great cheese selections, decent beer/wine/liquor and whole foods quality produce without the WF prices.

49.description: This is the worst store I have been. They always calculate the wrong price of product. It was very the awful thing. I went there 6 times, but four times the price of product is wrong. They make mistakes, but their attitude is very bad. They don't think their fault, they thought the fault is customer's. They always calculate the wrong price, it looks like the normal behavior. It looks like that this store tries to cheat people's money. I do not want to spend any money on this store again. Because I think their ethics have problem. This store is near to China Town. Some Chinese people do not English very well, so they calculate the wrong price for them. Because some Chinese can not find their mistake, as result their poor English. Nobody know they can get how much money during this behavior. I do not like this store. Their behavior is serious cheating.

40.description: I stayed away as long as I could, because I knew this could become addicting.  It has, but in a good way. The juice bar is at the front door. The Green Detox is wonderful-kale, pineapple, spinach. They have a large produce section, including organics. They also have nice selection of gluten free goods.

53.description: Nice grocery store in a clean and modern space. They have all the basics and more. My kid loves to ride in their kiddie play carts, especially the fire truck. Their fresh squeezed orange juice is delicious and a great deal. I also really like their glazed doughnut.

30.description: Now, I'm a little embarrassed to say it, but I'm in love with my grocery store.When I first a heard the news that a grocery store closer than Jewel was opening near my place, I was excited. Moving from Boston, I was unfamiliar with all the buzz about Mariano's and simply happy I wouldn't have carry heavy items an extra 3 blocks. I didn't expect to appreciate it as much as I have. Mariano's offers quality more or less on par with Whole Foods and Trader Joe's, but presents it with it's own flair and at a price point that is very competitive. Their Vero coffee and gelato are solid. The produce, deli, butcher, and bakery are better than most. Their employees are more professional and courteous than other supermarket chains. Their stores are cleaner, offer more diverse items, and the are just classier (note: grand piano at checkout.) The South Loop location is not as expansive as other stores in the city. I wish that it contained the larger wine and liquor departments of locations in the city. And the overall grocery and prepared food items aren't as varied, as say the West Loop location. Yet, the staff has always been helpful and generally friendly.

46.description: Mariano's is so different from any of the fresh markets I've been to...not only everything is really fresh but they have nice and can i say good looking people working there so courteous and well dress. they have everything we needed from groceries to just a quick salad grub for breakfast, lunch or dinner. i wish we had something like this in Dallas where i moved from just recently. i would totally come back and recommend it.

1.description: How do I say this...I want to stab people when I am here.First: I love Mariano's. Seriously, go there at 9 p.m. on a Saturday, and tell me it's not the most delightful grocery shopping experience you know. Fresh baked pretzel bread, juices, an excellent ice cream selection. It's all you could want and more.But any other time (read: where there are more than 10 people in the store), you're totally screwed. This location needs to figure out how to deal with shopping carts ASAP. Without a cart escalator, the only way people with lots of groceries (which are most people), and thus need a cart can get to the parking garage is by taking an elevator. The same elevators that employees use to bring carts back from the parking garage to the shopping area. It's the definition of clusterf***. You end up jockeying for position around the small elevator bank, praying the jerk behind you doesn't bum-rush the elevator as soon as it opens (and before the people on it can even get off). I have had to play bumper cars with the cart and physically force myself in after waiting for 10 minutes just to get into an elevator.On a different note, with the recent Chicago plastic bag ban, the employees need to learn how to pack a paper grocery bag. I've been given a thirty pound bag that breaks as well as a dozen bags with one item in them each. Maybe a staff meeting with baggers is needed.All this aside, Mariano's is still probably my favorite grocery store just because of the vast selection.

55.description: I live closer to the Mariano's on Archer/Ashland but come to the Clark St. location because of the people who work here -  very friendly and helpful.  I think the store itself if very clean and organized where I can find everything I need and rarely are there long checkout lines.  I have noticed recently that their prices have been going up.  Not only at this store, but all of them.  In fact, when did their house brand, Roundy's get so expensive???  I went on their website to provide my feedback on a particular item and how much the cost has risen over the last year and received an email back addressing an item I didn't even inquire about.   Overall, I continue to shop here, but not for Roundy's Kitchen Cut Green Beans (which by they way are for my dog's diet) at $1.15 per can. (they were at one time $.59 per can).  Those I will get at Aldi or Wal-Mart.

9.description: I love Marianos just not this one. Always a big difference in service between the Marianos in the suburbs and in the city. Usually, in the city the workers seem not interested whatsoever. No one really cares to be proactive. Hopefully, they step it up.

26.description: I honestly am astonished at the rudeness of the staff. I moved from the suburbs two years ago where I used to shop at the Frankfort, IL Marianos regularly, where you always know you're going to receive good customer service. Marianos is a grocery store that's credited for being a little more "high end" with friendly staff and great quality just about everything. I'm pretty easygoing and don't typically get offended by people attitudes, but holy smokes! Like the girl commented below, if you hate your job, quit?I work until 8 pm typically, so I tend to show up at this store around 8:15 or 8:20 pm when I grocery shop, and every-single-time, they are putting away the  bakery items and closing up the deli, the meat and fish section. I understand shutting down the hot bar early, but it's clear as day written on signage that these areas are open until 10. With that said, why am I ignored by deli staff, ignored by bakery staff, and ignored by cashiers? I am talking about blatant disregard for customers. Last night I walked up to the bakery, couldn't reach the croissants because there were carts in front of all the baskets from them trying to close up. Two employees looked right at me struggling and ignored me. I left empty handed. Next, I walked to the deli where I made eye contact with THREE people who were chatting and each one ignored me until I spoke up 5 minutes later. Then, when I checked out, the cashier said not ONE word to me. Nothing. Not hello, not goodbye, NOTHING. I have to stop writing this review because I cant even believe it was real.

25.description: Love this store!  They have a great produce area and meat counter.  The workers are very helpful and give great advice, as well.  They offer to tenderize meat and don't rush you in order to go to the next customer. Will definitely be my "go to" store.

12.description: Decent grocery store with a terrible front end experience tonight. Sat my basket down on the belt and was met with a blank fifteen second stare, followed with "well are you going to take your stuff out for me?" "Oh I didn't know I was supposed to do that" "Yeah, it makes it easier on me" I'm sorry, Sherrelle A., but that is what you get paid to do. I spend my money here out of convenience and that you make MY life easier.

59.description: My fav grocery store. Fits every budget and they have a good selection of organic produce. I absolutely love the fact that they grill my meat/ fish at no extra charge! And its good too with all the different seasonings they offer. Try the super kale smoothie and sip slow as you shop. Friendly, professional staff with fresh plentiful grocery items. Why are you all still shopping at Jewels again?

21.description: There is so much promising about this store:  Off the beaten path location makes it a little less hectic than other supermarkets in the area;  the store is new and therefore somewhat cleaner than other grocery stores;  the prices are decent, especially when things are on sale.What I hate however?  There are never shopping baskets at the entrance.  For the last four Saturday mornings in a row, the number of shoppers is manageable, yet zero hand baskets to be found.  Each time, I have had to circle the store, scouting the end of checkout lanes, around the service desk area and any other spots I can think of to find one.  Today, I asked a clerk at the service desk why baskets were no longer being stocked at the entrance and I was looked at like I was speaking a foreign language.Now, I get why they might think this is a good idea:  When only shopping CARTS are available, people load up on more and perhaps it is better for sales.  But for guys like me walking (not driving) through the neighborhood, I want to buzz in, grab 12 items or less and buzz out.  I have gotten to the point that I will simply walk out of the store if I can't see any baskets when I enter.  When it takes longer to FIND a basket than it is to fill it and check out, that reflects an obvious disregard for your shoppers.  Get it together.

17.description: It would only do them justice to update my last review as they suddenly changed back to the paper bag idea. Hope they continue this. I was able to easily carry ALL the groceries in 3 paper bags.Love the food samples and love Vero!

10.description: I love Mariano's and the addition of the Smoothie bar is everything to me. I was very disappointed when I CALLED before coming to the store to see if the bar was still open and I was told they didn't close until 8:30pm. I got in the store at 8:15pm and the bar was cleaned and the associate that was cleaning it told me she got off at 9pm and the blenders have to soak for 30 minutes so she closed down. I'm highly upset! I called back to the store and was again told the bar was to be open until 8:30pm. Make sure your associates understand the hours fully. Signed,Frustrated customer that wants her smoothie!

5.description: Totally bent over the fact that they completely eliminated their stock of Method eco friendly products - the factory is local and if I use the Ibotta app, that means I have to shop at Jewel to earn the rewards on those products.  The salad bar is still top notch - the antipasti bar still screwed up.  I like the fact that they keep the hot food, sushi, salad bar and pizza station up and running longer than Whole Foods.  The fact that they still charge by the pound not the bunch makes their organic produce more expensive.  They seem to run out of random stuff - large containers of Plain Greek yogurt, for example.  I wish I could be back on team Mariano's but the competitive nature of the markets in this area makes it difficult.

3.description: This is one of my favorite grocers from many perspectives. Parking is great! Also they have a huge wonderful produce section, butcher, buffets and bakery. This is such an ideal grocer. PLUS, they have a very nice wine bar. So, while shopping, I can get a nice glass of wine and relax.  Such a novel concept for us shoppers.  Why not blend relaxation in with shopping.  Checkout is also very nice. This is my favorite Mariano's and all time favorite grocer.

35.description: Awesome "EVERYTHING" Store. Meaning its more than just a grocery store...Its a ice cream/gelato shop, sushi restaurant, a place to grill your food, a juice/smoothie store, a local butcher, a bar, and a workshop center. Yes, you can truly do all of this at Marianos. You go in there to get 1 item, and leave with 5 or more items. I absolutely love the fact that they offer workshops for children and even classes for adults to learn how to make sushi. On nights that i want to eat healthy, but dont feel like cooking, they offer a service where you purchase your meat/seafood, and they will season and grill your food for you (FREE OF CHARGE). I come every morning for a their fresh smoothies/juices that are dairy free and still tasty while being very healthy. The service here is phenomenal, as there is always someone close by to provide a helping hand for any questions. This is the only grocery store i shop at now, as i have given up on jewel osco and petes fresh market.

19.description: I'm a regular Mariano's customer so I've become accustomed to the excellent customer service I've received from various locations throughout the city and suburbs...until today! I approached the gelato counter and was not greeted but received a very cold stare down from one of the young ladies working the counter...I finally broke the ice and said Hi! She didn't say hi she said May I Help You? I asked to sample a flavor...she proceeded to sigh loudly...roll her eyes then hand me a spoon with a sample the size of a single grain of rice...she exhaled another sigh then stared. I told her never mind because you seem to have a problem with your job today...so I won't put you to work! Another worker observed this and intervened. She was polite helpful and friendly...I eventually received a sample with a smile...completed my purchase transaction and left the store. I intend to return to Mariano's and if I encounter this young lady and if I'm met with the same nastiness, I will have no choice but to request a manager and report her.

28.description: Don't get me wrong, I think Mariano's is a great grocery store and I will continue to shop there, however their produce section really lacks something to be desired especially in the herb department. It is a guarantee that there will be at least 2 produce items I need every trip that will be out of stock. The parking situation is pretty wretched with people holding up the entrance trying to get into the parking lot on ground level. Some of the shelved products are often dirty, covered with a weird dusty film which I am assuming is leakage from the exposed pipes above and the eggs are ALWAYS broken. It takes about 5 minutes to find a good pack of eggs. The selection of foods is great and the staff is very friendly though!

45.description: It would only do them justice to update my last review as they suddenly changed back to the paper bag idea. Hope they continue this. I was able to easily carry ALL the groceries in 3 paper bags.Love the food samples and love Vero!

33.description: I was looking for the Birthday cake for my LO's first B'day.I took good decision by approaching Alice from Bakery section.She is amazing.Had lot of patience to hear my  thoughts and she came up with great cake design.I can say it's dream cake and yes it's yummy.I will look for her for my future parties :)

43.description: I love the Street Market feel as I walk into the store. And see the Employees dressed in their Black and White Uniforms, look like they All may have some kind of Culinary food background.

2.description: We have always loved shopping at Mariano's, they have such a great selection and pretty much their prices cannot be beat. We even used them for our wedding flowers. However, yesterday we purchased an item that was not so great. We called and talked to the manager and she said to stop in for a refund. Let me tell you, Jess the manager, is such a wonderful person. She was not only apologetic but she was genuinely kind and actually felt bad for the situation. Needless to say we will still come back, but I feel that Jess needs to be commended for just great customer service and being a genuinely good person. Thank you, you are appreciated.

18.description: I can't imagine a world without Mariano's.I've had the pleasure of being spoiled by the awesome Wegmans back when I was living in New York and this is the closest thing that comes to it in terms of food quality, diversity in offerings, customer service, and store layout/ambience.Mariano's does all the little things right. Clean store. Smiling employees. Pick from an assortment of bottled soda for $4. Samples of food throughout the week. Chicago mix popcorn under $5? Fast checkout lines. I can go on and on...The only negative is the parking garage which is a little too steep. Corners are a sharp 90 degrees requiring a sharp turn and attention to oncoming traffic which you won't see until the last second.I'm glad that Mariano's has good prices on products but doesn't compromise on product selection. Chicago needed a good jolt of competition. Thank God.

41.description: Not only have I witnessed Sourh Loop Marianos selling mislabeled fish but Marianos/Roundys sells the least amount of sustainable fish. Bob Mariano could care less about the environment.

52.description: I regularly buy wine at  Mariano's.  When I bought $20 worth  of wine which had been over heated and tasted sour  and tried to return the for the same kind of wine which was not bad, I was  told that it was not permitted by state law.  Also, that I needed a receipt.  I called Binny's and asked them what their policy was, they said they would have definitely replaced the bad wine and could look up the purchase by my credit card. Most of the food is pretty good, but, my wine business will go to Binny's

50.description: Best grocery I have been to here in Chicago so far! Lots of fresh seafood which is nice because Hyde Park is a food desert in terms of butchery! I spent about $170 on mostly fresh organic produce, artisan cheeses/breads, meats, and some pantry staples. I would say this would last 2 ppl 2 weeks easily! The service was really nice, ppl were helpful and informative. There was a wine tasting going on and a live piano player :)

4.description: The floral department is amazing! Andrea made a custom arrangement for my friends b'day all i can say  "wow". It was a steal and beautiful too!!

6.description: Great grocery store. I've been tot his Mariano's and many others, and I can't help but give them 5 stars. Why? Well.1. Freshly squeezed OJ. Delicious and wayyy cheaper than the FSOJ I find in Hyde park. 2. Sandwiches. These are delicious. Well, to be fair, I've only tried the italian muffaletta, but it's delicious. I always get it toasted with a little bit of mayonnaise and it's perfect.3. Grill! Okay, i haven't actually tried it yet, but it LOOKS awesome (they grill anything for you!). Perfect if you don't want to grill actually at home.4. Gelato! Great and cheap.5. Bakery. It's standard but 1 notch better! Their fruit tarts are delicious and I bring one to my girlfriend's house when I visit (and end up eating most of it). 6. Chicken salad. It's delicious. I buy about a pound and make about 3 sandwiches for it for lunch (it only keeps for like 3-4 days). It's great!A nice grocery store that has everything you could want and is priced well. The workers here are also super helpful! This location also has free parking on site!

22.description: Called various places so I could have a flower arrangement be made but nobody took the time to actually quote me on a price or even bother to call back, until I called the floral department and spoke to Denise. Denise was so helpful and kind from the beginning. I told her I needed 100 roses in 2 days. At first she wasn't sure if they had a vase in stock that would hold that many flowers, but took my information down and called back that exact day.  Quoted me on the price and I went to pay for it the next day. I couldn't believe how nice the arrangement looked once I picked it up. Denise definitely knows what customer service is! Super helpful and super kind! I will definitely be contacting Denise for future floral arrangements.

15.description: Now, I'm a little embarrassed to say it, but I'm in love with my grocery store.When I first a heard the news that a grocery store closer than Jewel was opening near my place, I was excited. Moving from Boston, I was unfamiliar with all the buzz about Mariano's and simply happy I wouldn't have carry heavy items an extra 3 blocks. I didn't expect to appreciate it as much as I have. Mariano's offers quality more or less on par with Whole Foods and Trader Joe's, but presents it with it's own flair and at a price point that is very competitive. Their Vero coffee and gelato are solid. The produce, deli, butcher, and bakery are better than most. Their employees are more professional and courteous than other supermarket chains. Their stores are cleaner, offer more diverse items, and the are just classier (note: grand piano at checkout.) The South Loop location is not as expansive as other stores in the city. I wish that it contained the larger wine and liquor departments of locations in the city. And the overall grocery and prepared food items aren't as varied, as say the West Loop location. Yet, the staff has always been helpful and generally friendly.

57.description: I love shopping here it's clean, brand new, and has so many snack bars/delis/bells and whistles. It has a grand piano for goodness sake.  Love the selection of organic fruits and meat.  The prices are slightly more expensive but I look forward to grocery shopping- a chore I usually hate to do

20.description: I try and try to like this Mariano's but end up hating it every time I go there. The only good point is that it is close to my home. The staff is bored, rude and not helpful. Two young women workers pushed onto the elevator yesterday while we shoppers were trying to get off: great greeting (not). You can NEVER get help at the fish counter. My husband complained a few times and they put in a number system but none of the workers ever use it! A young man waiting there yesterday said he waited 30 minutes already. He had #11; I had #13; the counter said #12. Could not get the attention of any of the 6 workers behind the counter. A third shopper walked up with #16. We finally got the attention of one guy and got our fish. The wine aisle was blocked by a worker stocking. Do you think he moved out of the way or even noticed the customers trying to shop for wine around him? NO! The checkout person was even rude to a co-worker who was checking out ahead of me. Unbelievable!  And these complaints were just from my most recent visit. The customer service here is a joke. I prefer to go the distance to Whole Foods or Trader Joe's or even Jewel in South Loop. Their staff is always attentive and helpful.  Do not expect anything from Mariano's South Loop except products. They do have what I want most visits. Not worth the frustration of dealing with their staff on most days.

36.description: I've only been to this Mariano, but if all of them look like this one, then I like them too. I don't go for the fresh produce or their meats. I mainly go for the following: Gelato ice cream, fresh squeezed orange juice, cheese selection and bakery. They have variety and the food tastes amazing. Also, I truly believe this company treats their employees right because I haven't encountered a grumpy employee yet. They are always cheerful and it makes the experience a lot better.

14.description: I beg Mariano's leadership to better train the kids packing bags on how to pack. Vegetables get crushed. Bread gets smashed. Apple pie inserting sideways. Worst packing ever!!!

58.description: This is one of my favorite places to hang in Chicago. They have a great mix of music and are bringing more big name Rockabilly & Psychobilly bands to their venue. It's always a great time!

56.description: The place itself is a pretty cool venue. Not too big, not too small. The slanted floor gives a good angle to see no matter where you stand, and a couple of cinder block "stair-steps" to one side offer a place to sit down. But man did the show take a long time to get going. Doors at 8. First act didn't even start til 9:30! It was a "variety show" so little segments were sprinkled throughout, but three bands were the main focus. The second band (of the 3) didn't go on til about 11. We didn't even make it til the third (who we'd gone to see), due to one in the party getting a migraine, so that was really fucking annoying. Start the show when the ticket says (or at least close to it!) and get the act together!

29.description: This place ROCKS.  It's a great venue to catch a punk show and an even better place to have a drink (or three) and a great dinner.  The rooftop is totally unique and open all year round.  I'm always amazed at the diversity that you'll see on the rooftop - I really enjoy that.  The beer list is way above average, the food is dynamite and the specials are better than most places will offer.  I would highly recommend this place even if you're not interested in the music that's being performed.  Go to Reggie's for Sunday NFL games and you'll be able to take advantage of their sloppy joe special.  I love this place!

42.description: Let me put it this way: When bands (of a certain popularity level) that I enjoy are touring, Reggie's is where I hope they'll play when they swing by Chicago. The Roosevelt CTA is a bit north, Cermak-Chinatown a bit south. Parking is easily found, more often than not.  Couldn't be an easier venue to get to. Sightlines are usually pretty good, especially if you can snag a spot on that ledge off to the side. Plus, there's a really great balcony, so you've got lots of options on getting a good eyeful. There's a pretty fantastic record store attached to the club if you wind up a bit early, and the attached bar has decent food and a great beer list. Big fan of this place, obviously.

23.description: I love Reggie's Rock Club. It is my favorite music venue in all of Chicago. I wish all the concerts I attended would take place here. It's perfect. They have a nice beer selection and the temperature is always nice and comfortable. Never seems to be too hot or too cold. Nice stage and the staff is always nice too. I also ate at their restaurant the last time I attended a concert, and the food was really good. The bartenders next to the venue were also great, they were waiting the tables too.

47.description: l like this place. It's off the beaten path, and the staff is friendly (try finding kindness at the average concert venue.) In addition, the space is pleasant and comfortable, the sound is good, fans keep everyone cool, and drinks are reasonable. Also easy to park nearby. No complaints here. Will be back.

8.description: A friend and I went here. We wanted to try something new. We came in a rainy Saturday afternoon. They ID upon entering. Since I wasn't here for a performance I can only comment on the food and service. The food was decent nothing amazing. The server was alert and made several suggestions. She seemed friendly. While there a patron and the bar tender got into a little quarrel and a unique young lady  with her clothes falling off and hair all over the place came to use the facilities and drink. It seemed normal noone budged or looked shocked. Nothing too out if the ordinary for the customers or workers. Definitely a lively place. It's best to leave the kids at home and stay strapped.

31.description: I'm definitely a fan of Reggie's.  This place is a music joint that doubles as an inside/outside bar as well.  Great atmosphere at night, but you can also have a nice intimate lunch there as well.  Good liquor and food specialty's will ensure I'll be back!!!

34.description: Sound: well-executed. A good place to come and see shows.Food: I've only ever had the wings, but they were pretty good. Otherwise, it seems to be above-par for bar food, and with plentiful portions.Booze: hellooooo, win! There must have been 50 beers on the menu, many of which were on tap. I grabbed a Dragon's Milk and a friend grabbed a Goose Island Bourbon County Stout and we were in business. There's plenty in the beer department to choose from from around the world, and I can't see anyone being disappointed with the variety. I've also had their gin and tonics and found them to be decent.Service: I find the bartenders and waitstaff sometimes spend more time ignoring me than getting me to buy things from them, but I can't say I mind walking out with a little more cash in my pocket and fewer calories in my belly.

16.description: I love the Rock club. I have seen a few shows here and it is a great place to catch an intimate show. What I mean by that is that the rock club is not massive. It is just enough to be a big show and small enough to get you close enough to the performers to make it memorable. They also have all kinds of performers here. Not just rock. We have seen bands, DJ's and solo artists here. Many of them from very different genres of music. They have a bar in the back and usually someone by the stairs with a tub of beer. I have always had a great time here at a show and it is a very different experience than being at a concert with thousands of people and barely seeing an artist from where you are standing.

13.description: I went last night to meet a friend for drinks and he and his friends were watching the football game.  The server was incredibly rude and condescending.  He also used profanity.  I do not know if this is the norm for this place, but it was extremely off-putting.  The food also looked decidedly unappetizing.    I would not dare try the $1 "beef" taco.  My friend ordered it and who knows where the "beef" actually came from. I would never come here again.

11.description: I've been to a few shows here and really enjoyed myself. We've seen small-time groups as well as major punk bands. I already got my tickets for Leftover Crack! I've always been a kind of awkward person but I feel comfortable here. My brother and I have been coming to Reggie's Record Breakers since before we could get into the bar. What really makes Reggie's for me is the food and the shuttle. One of my favorite memories will always be sitting in the Reggie's roof top eating amazing burgers in late spring with my best friend. They have a shower up there just like the one in Sox Park. We took the free shuttle to and from Riot Fest 2/3 days this past weekend and were lucky enough to get on because a Reggie's employee really took the lead and organized everyone waiting. He was also checking in with the bus driver to see how far he was. While you're on the bus, you can drink. They sell beer and pass out free water. You'll chuckle as you watch people on the street gawk at the bus.Parking at Reggie's is ridiculously easy to find. There are SpotHero spots in the alley in the next block over. There's also a ton of street parking but you gotta feed the meters. The Red Line is also nearby. Honestly, I hadn't visited the south side much before I ever stepped foot in Reggie's and it kind of opened a new world for me as an 18 year old. Thanks for everything, Reggie's.

39.description: Best place to grab late night wings and cheap craft beers on the southside. The crowd is a mix of nearby hip southside transplants and your locals making it a eclectic hodge podge of conversation. The music revenue offers an intimate setting and the bands bring an in-your face sound and fun. This is one of the few well rounded bar to come to the south side of Chicago. All in all a great place to offer all kinds of affordable entertainment.P.S There's a record stop above the bar! Check it out!

37.description: The service here is just terrible. The bartender's were extremely rude to my friends and I and basically turned up their noses and pretended we weren't there. When I asked to speak with the manager, she smiled nastily at me and sent one of her rude male bartenders to speak with me instead. I'm sorry, I understand this is a rock bar/club but customer service is everything. I was highly disappointed. To top it off: at the end of the show they literally kicked everyone out and annoyingly announced over the loudspeaker to 'Keep moving' 'Please leave' 'Get out'....etc. HORRIBLE! :(

0.description: Excellent venue for live music versus sittin home listen to da Raaadio!  Diverse and excellent food menu.  The food, in the restaurant section, is surprisingly well prepared and a delight to the palette when compared to other music venues JUST offering a limited "bar food" menu.  Definitely a cut above the rest!If you like flipping thru vinyl record bins - ya gotta checkout Reggie's record store.  It's a bit of a "flashback" but quite hip, flower power -  like very cool man!  So, put your boots, happy face and party hat on. You get what you pay for and then some, i.e., a good deal and great time! Get together with some good friends and give Reggie's a go!  Very highly recommended as an effective pick me up, anti depressant, shot in the arm and/or just gittin out for a good time after a tough week.

38.description: Worst bartender and bouncer ever! Waited forever to get drinks then they kicked out our entire group cuz someone didn't tip the bartender what she thought she deserved. Probably cuz she was slow and rude! Don't waste your money on the unappreciative, power trippin, jerks like staff at this place!

51.description: Now you won't get A class service BUT on Tuesday they have 25 cent wings and on Sunday all you can eat sloppy joes. They have a decent beer selection too and the food is pretty good. The service is tolerable enough to make you come back for the specials but often not great enough to leave a stellar tip. Go with a group of and it is a fun (cheap) night out with  friends! The rooftop is a great chill spot when its warm.

27.description: Some stray observations from my visit to reggie's:negatives-the decor and vibe of this place looks like it was informed by a really uncool ten year old boy's perception of punk rawk. There are stupid looking skulls painted everywhere, fake graffiti on the walls, the place is called "the rock joint" etc. Everything felt very manufactured- it's like the team who brought you "Planet Hollywood" opened a dingy rock club. -I'm not an audio engineer, but something tells me that BRICK AND CONCRETE doesn't make a room conducive to great sound. It's like the aforementioned ten year old or manager of your local hot topic who designed this place built it with having awful acoustics in mind. Considering that this place is pretty new, inexcusable. -For some reason only god will ever know, there is a railing made from lead pipes jutting from the lip of the stage. They rest right below an average sized man's rib cage, and created an incredibly uncomfortable sensation whenever i was pushed against it.positives-despite the managements best attempts to convince you otherwise, this place is pretty clean and new. Stands out in a city of legitimately grungy clubs.-small and intimate room, very easy to get right in the performers faces. -although the location is a ways away from the main nightlife drags of the city, but its very convenient to get to via the red line,Basically, Only go to reggies rock club if you REALLY want to see the band playing.

32.description: Review for musicians who gig:You've made it. Paid your dues next door, now you're on the main stage. Congrats! It's everything that's good about Reggie's, only a little better. You can load in through the alley that's behind (east) of the club. You can (probably) park you car under the El tracks - but be sure to ask. Park too far south and you're off Reggie's property and you will get towed. That would make load-out a super bummer.You'll still have someone good working the board, with the bonus of another engineer/tech stationed stage left for any showtime tweaks. There's a green room downstairs from stage right... again, ask. I've seen it reserved for the bigger bands. That's not me, but maybe that's you. Drinks are usually offered via tickets, typical 2 per.From the crew working the stage to the door to the security, everyone here seems comfortable and cool, which makes for a good show. Have fun!

54.description: Good food, fair priced beer, cool merch section, decent amount of space. The only issue with this place is the acoustics which i didn't find that impressive.

48.description: Nice venue, but when I went for the Turquoise Jeep show last month, coat check was horrifyingly disorganized. The line was at a standstill for the longest time and I had to leave in order to meet the artists before they left. Their lights weren't functioning so the crew was rummaging through the dark for jackets. People were hopping over and grabbing their own things. The whole time I was there I was afraid that my things were going to get taken or given away! I've only been to Reggie's once, but if I ever go again I am certainly not going to take my chances with coat check.

44.description: What can I say, excellent.First off a hop skip and jump from my place.Live music every night, and great music I may add; anywhere from punk, to solo gigs, to underground hip hop artists.Food is feel good comfort food.Their stuffed mushrooms are awesome and plentiful!Pulled pork is my favorite by far; have gotten it twice within this month alone.Decent drink prices and specials.Awesome roof deck with basket ball hoop and bags.Great place for summer!You will run into me a lot here.

24.description: This is a review of the Rock Club, not the bar next door (which we love).  I have never had something like this happen to me!  We got there early and ate next door (which I highly recommend the food is stellar and the staff over here is top notch) However that is where our positive experience ended.  We got in line for the show at around 8.  The doors were supposed to open then, but did not.   We ended up finally getting in at exactly 9:46.  Missing the first band entirely.  At first I was thinking maybe they were too crowded and that was the problem, but people inside confirmed there was only a  handful of people there for the opening band.  When we asked the security guard who was checking people in for an explanation, he said "should have gotten here earlier".  Basically blaming their slow check in process on us. He also approached me and was very rude after we left the show. We went and complained and got our ticket refund.  To be fair the people who were working inside the venue were really apologetic and sympathetic to our situation, as our sole purpose for attending the concert was to see the opening  band. So all in all I wasted almost two hours of my life standing in line for nothing and then got chewed out and disrespected by a security guard who couldn't effectively do his job to get people in to see a show that they paid for. When I called the next day to tell them what had happened the "manager" who I spoke to on the phone said "you got your refund what else do you want?" Well I want you to give a shit!

7.description: This is a great venue for live music. The room is perfect for a slightly bigger show. The sound is usually superb, and there isn't a bad spot in the room. Ticket and drink prices are typical for a Chicago establishment. I've been to a lot of shows here, over the years, and I must say their security is professional. They take no crap, but they are also nice people who act professionally, not like meat heads! Last few perks are...the music joint next door has good food, there's a record store upstairs,  and there's a rooftop bar... all in the same building.

49.description: My husband and I came here to see the XRT free show with Alabama Shakes a couple weeks back.   It was a super fun way to spend a morning / early afternoon. The best part about day drinking and an afternoon concert was the desperate need for some sunglasses when we exited and squinted at the bright sun a la Varsity Blues. We started the day with bloody marys and breakfast and then moved into the Rock Club for the concert.  I really liked this venue.  It was small enough so that you really were able to see the band and I liked being able to watch the show from the balcony.  There was limited seating and it provided a great view without being snuggled up to hundreds of strangers.  There was a small amount of feedback during the first song but nothing like what other reviewers have said.  My real pet peeve was the $5 can of Bud Light.  Not much beer selection on the Rock Club side and the prices are a bit steep. Wah!Other than that I can't see a reason why I wouldn't come back for another show.  The staff was friendly enough and I like seeing a smaller show. We had a really fun time and even snagged a show poster from the bathroom.  When Alabama Shakes makes it big, we are set!

40.description: Perhaps this review is unfair, since I'm mostly directing my ire at the customers, and a small minority at that, but they are inextricably linked in my mind.
