My friend and I have an annual tradition of going to see Doug Stanhope. Past shows have been at reliable comedy venues on the northside (Lakeshore, Mayne Stage), with crowds that, oh how do I say this............understand comedy. As venues go, this was the comedy equivalent of a Philly sports arena. I'll grant you that Stanhope attracts a diverse fanbase.........those that appreciate his ability to meld biting social critiques and fearless irreverance with a mastery of wit and storytelling ...........and those that saw him on Girls Gone Wild. But seriously, these guys were fuckin' abominations, and they were standing right behind us. Not knowing what to make of the anti-comedy of Junior Stopka (one of Chicago's finest), they quickly gave up on what they couldn't understand, kinda like math, and began hurling taunts of "Mitt Romney" (I guess they did watch the news). In some ways, Junior's comedy is funnier when it elicits a negative reaction, but usually that's a squeamish, confused one as opposed to angry intolerance.  Actually, I don't want to make them sound so special......you can see many of their kind if you go to a bar after a sox game.  It's just that I expect not to have a good time there.

53.description: Been here a handful of times. Amazing.

30.description: Where was this place 20 years ago?!! Bout time the Southside has an awesome venue to catch some great music and have a few beers. Food is great too! And reasonable!Love their shuttles for almost every venue out there!!In the words of Arnold...we'll be back!

46.description: Went on April 13th to see David Allan Coe.  The venue is extremely cool and has the perfect vibe for a concert.  Importantly, the beer selection was very good.  We got the Red Chair seating which placed us right in the front row, practically an arm's reach away from DAC.  We watched the opening acts while standing throughout the room and felt that many vantage points had great views and sound.  Even though we heard people making fun of those sitting in the Red Chairs while we were standing about the room, I am very glad we had them.  They were comfortable, uncrowded, offered a fantastic vantage point and ensured we had a place to come back to after hitting the restroom.  (Adding a waitress for that area would have been sweet!) Having the associated bar/restaurant next door is very nice, as you can easily grab some beers and food, as well as listen to other bands, before and after the show.  My only complaint is the group of loud a**holes who only knew one of DAC's songs and talked obnoxiously the rest of the time.  We get it, you are cooler than everyone else and know one song from one of the best songwriters American has ever offered - now, go back to your Frat house and prepare for your Accounting 101 class in the morning, even though you won't be able to get a job after you graduate.I highly recommend this place for concerts and the cool bar for anytime. Oh, and the Krank Daddies rocked that night, too!

1.description: I had no idea this place existed until I went on their website to study up on what I would be getting myself into before attending the Wishbone Ash show. In an area of the city that was once home to a thriving live music scene, Reggies carries on the tradition, despite having only a few remaining music venue neighbors. From the calendar of shows, to the shuttle buses to concerts and record store upstairs, Reggies is a music lover's dream come true. With a diversity of performers featured almost every night of the week, there is pretty much something for everyone. Although the smallness of the venue is certainly a consideration, and in some cases a drawback, I prefer the intimate setup and the ability to drink in the sights and sounds, not only in terms of the music being played but also the people watching. The sightline from the bar to the stage was decent and it seemed an overall better perch from which to watch the action versus sitting at one of the tables or, worse, a booth in the corner.As far as the ambiance, I would characterize Reggies as rustic roadhouse. Vintage rock posters cover exposed brick walls, with weathered wood and battered old park benches enhancing the old-time patina. Modern touches include flat screen TVs and a selection of craft brews in addition to the selections on tap. I particularly enjoyed the day's drink special-$5 Maker's Mark-which put me in mind of Friday even on Monday evening. All of the patrons I saw were at home in this space, bound by a love of the band and brews. Case in point was the guy seated next to me at the bar, who felt comfortable enough to start munching an apple once the music had gotten underway.As the evening was winding down, I took a look at the rooftop. Certainly, the cursory glance  doesn't warrant a separate review of this space, which has been a feature of Reggies for the past seven years. For a warm autumn night there was a decent-size crowd and this spot looked like more of a neighborhood hangout, with bar seating and a couple of flat screens. As I stood around upstairs, the green EL line rumbled by, mere feet away, bringing me back to the reality of the city. The record store is also worth a look, for anyone looking to relive those halcyon days before iTunes and streaming.

55.description: AMAZING NIGHT! I've never had that much fun for so little dough.

9.description: I'm by no means an audiophile but I can be picky about sound engineering. Four bands played at Reggies last night, and the sound was bad during all four of them. More often than not an instrument was either inaudible, or way louder than other instruments. If you come here to enjoy the vibe or just have some fun this maybe a good place, but if want to hear your favorite band with a decent sound, I'd say look elsewhere.No comments on drink selection or food.

26.description: Probably my favorite place to see live shows. The drinks are not cheap. The rooftop bar and the record store and the music joint bar are great. There is always a great variety of stuff to do and some of my favorite bands only play here in Chicago.

25.description: The sound at Reggie's is great. I've been here twice and the balance between the guitars, bass, and drums seem extremely balanced unless I caught the right shows. It is a small venue and they have seats on the side but its probably hard to see anything if you're just sitting there. The people working there seem a lot more pleasant than the ones at the Metro, House of Blues, etc. The only knock is the neighborhood its in. Not the safest place on earth and you can only park on the street where you have to pay for parking. Gotta love Crook County.

12.description: Hands down best spot in the city! Perfect food,perfect service, and a awesome atmosphere  (down stairs that is, roof top is cool but I enjoy the real feal)

59.description: OH yeah! This place ROCKS! I went to the 4th Anniversary party and had a kick ass time. Hung out with the owner for ahwhile, hi M!, and my gorgeous friend A, and had a great time. The bartenders on the roof are fun, sweet, friendly and dish. And attentive! A little *hic* too attentive, but that is all good.It's pretty far south, but whatever. I'm not going to diss the location. I will definitely be back here for a live music show, hopefully SOON!!

21.description: A friend and I went here. We wanted to try something new. We came in a rainy Saturday afternoon. They ID upon entering. Since I wasn't here for a performance I can only comment on the food and service. The food was decent nothing amazing. The server was alert and made several suggestions. She seemed friendly. While there a patron and the bar tender got into a little quarrel and a unique young lady  with her clothes falling off and hair all over the place came to use the facilities and drink. It seemed normal noone budged or looked shocked. Nothing too out if the ordinary for the customers or workers. Definitely a lively place. It's best to leave the kids at home and stay strapped.

17.description: Anyone working here today?!? We sat on the patio for a few minutes. I went inside to get our own menus. We waited a few more minutes. Still no one around to take our order. Ten minutes later, we left. I usually like Reggie's, but the service has been awful (or in today's case, non-existent) lately. What happened to Michael and the other servers I usually see here?

10.description: 5 stars is all you need to know.Go there now.

5.description: The interiors resemble a dungeon of brick awash in blood, making it the ideal mecca for heavy metal concerts in the Midwest. youtube.com/watch?v=jwnp…It is at Reggie's Rock Club that two friends and I experienced Alehorn of Power VIII, an evening-long summit of the underground's greatest torchbearers of the New Wave of British Heavy Metal: Lady Beast (from my town of Pittsburgh, and it was my first time ever seeing them!), Savage Master, Valkyrie, Chicago's own High Spirits, Bible of the Devil (also from Chicago), and the uncanny headliner, Slough Feg, led by philosophy professor (!) Mike Scalzi. Within this house of flawless, hessian acoustics, vocals soared like eagles, harmonized twin leads clanged like dueling swords, drums pounded like hammers of war, new allegiances were formed with fellow fans from out of state, and ironclad memories were forged...youtube.com/watch?v=c4PN…Unbeatable bar food from the venue's comprehensive bill of fare was also had while the following strains assailed the hall of stone...youtube.com/watch?v=Lv7k…Reggie's corpulent, crispy, severely succulent Buffalo wings stabbed my tongue much like...youtube.com/watch?v=8Aba…Excelsior! Reggie's also does desserts! When I discovered that factoid, I was compelled to order a wedge of lovingly prepared, buttery-crusted, Apple Pie with a molten, cinnamon-tinged filling and a ball of wholesome vanilla bean ice cream, its delectable nature causing me to do the...youtube.com/watch?v=Zgky…And bless the metal heart of Reggie, whoever he is, for serving the underrated RC Cola. My favorite soda pop ain't always easy to find. Until next year...youtube.com/watch?v=XOw1…P.S. The staff was fun and very accommodating.P.P.S. The bathrooms were amply equipped and wickedly cool in their own right. P.P.P.S. In the balcony, independent vendors of CD's and vinyl regularly peddle their wares during gigs. It is there that I snagged the Japanese version of this nugget of legacy-flavored might, making the seller's night...youtube.com/watch?v=mEvR…He said he had it in his inventory for 2 years!

3.description: Not sure how this works but it seems that as venues get smaller for me they also become more comfortable. Mental. Science. Who knows?I've had my share of stadium concerts but I've had more share of intimate venues which are by far the best shows. Now I've only seen two shows at Reggies and it's already a favorite venue. I started out at Metro mainly, HOB for bigger artists, but Reggies has a balance of bringing in underground as well as mainstream artists for only really being able to house a capacity in the lower hundreds I would think. And like I said at my most comfortable. I was mid crowd on the main floor and had no trouble making it out for drinks or bathroom breaks. You could even go outside...HOB has a problem with that.One thing I'd like to know is what's the food policy? Swear as I was on my way to the back bar we see a couple huddled around a to- go container of chicken wings. No harm, no foul...until the guy starts to confront a friend of mine about giving him some dinner space. There was a back and forth of words until his girl wisened up. She realized there was power in numbers or that if the confrontation went any Ionger I was gonna make sure their romantic wing dinner was all over the floor. Don't eat in a venue people. I look forward to more shows here plus the location is bar none. I always find street parking. There is also the Music Joint and Rooftop to keep you entertained.Show out.

35.description: Great place for Sunday football & cheap drinks. The roof top deck with a basketball hoop was a nice surprise too...

19.description: I will never step foot in this place again- even if John Lennon and George Harrison came back from the dead, reunited the Beatles and performed at this unmanaged venue. Terrible service from the bartenders. Lousy attitudes and very slow. Zach the door guy to the bar was the only one worth having a conversation with.

28.description: Was here during a non-show evening.  The bar area is nice and relaxed.  Was able to grab one of their buses to the Sox game.  The food is surprisingly good.  The service is pretty awesome.  The bar on the roof is one of my favorite outdoor spots in the city.  That's pretty much all you need to know.

45.description: Decent place to see a show.  The majority of the acts aren't my thing but there's a ton of shows so chances are something you like will pop up.  The atmosphere is pretty intimate and you can easily get close to the stage if you really want to.   It's easy to have a good time at Reggie's.   I only have one major gripes with Reggie's.  The security has been pretty dickish the two shows I've been too.  Other than that it's not too bad.

33.description: Love the way this place is set up. It's smart. You've got the bar on the first floor. bathrooms are to your left side right when you walk in. I came recently for a PACDIV concert. This place is spacious and the layout is awesome. Upstairs is coat check and seating area. You can see the stage if you're sitting or over the balcony. Two stairways one on each side from the upstair area. The stage isn't too big. This place gives you a really intimate feel. I love how there are two huge fans on the ceilings in case it gets too hot. Drink prices are ridiculously reasonable I think. They were the cheapest here than when I've been to any other bar or concert in Chicago. I'd come here for another show anytime in the future. Oh also the place next to this I guess is Reggie's still and it's just a bar. I went there to use the bathroom because I didn't want to stick around outside in the cold waiting to get into Reggie's Rock Club. The security is super nice.

43.description: Another very cool place to catch great music and even better brews in the South-ish Loop.  Their beer list is awesome, lots of focus on Midwestern breweries and very reasonable pint prices.  I can't speak for their entire menu, but we tried just about everything on the appetizer list and it's all pretty solid bar fare.  The wings were ginormous.They constantly have live music but if you want to go when there isn't any, Saturday afternoon is your time.  Their record store is killer, but not the cheapest.  However, you want that original issue of Exile on Main Street?  They probably have it.  Staff is cool and knowledgeable.  The ladies even commented on how the ladies' room was much cleaner than expected.  The rooftop patio is awesome if only for the basketball hoop.

2.description: Intimate music venue with good sound, good bar, and clean bathrooms. That's all you need! There's also a nice upstairs balcony that has chairs and farm tables for those who want to listen in a more relaxing setting. I would come back again for more music!

18.description: I used to love Reggie's, now they charge for water and have real weird lighting schemes for the stage. Stop blinding the audience. I asked the bartenders nicely and they did give me free cups of water twice because I I was also buying drinks probably. So at least the people who work here are sane. I'll leave it at 3 stars for now. No water fountains or free water should be illegal. Reggie's, you're falling down a crappy crappy slope.

41.description: I went to see an XRT show here on 9/13/2012.  The band, Everest, was pretty good . . .  .I think.  Not sure b/c the sound system was turned up so loud that I had to leave the bar area and hide halfway down the hall near the bathrooms to keep from suffering permanent hearing loss.  Me and another guest tried standing in various places to avoid the deafening volumes to no avail.  There was no place to hide from the excessively loud and lyric-distorting volumes.  Unfortunately, I had to leave after 3 or 4 songs b/c I just couldn't take the deafening volume.  I will not be back unless it's to see an acoustic band.  Bottom line - skip this place unless you have earplugs or don't mind going deaf.

52.description: I went to see "Turquoise Jeep" last night. What a terrible experience! Reggie's Rock Club made my experience miserable. The main act didn't go on until FOUR hours after advertised. The coat check was so poorly organized that I had to wait half an hour to get my coat while I was first in line. Extremely rude hipster scum assholes yelled at me while I was waiting for a cab inside to go outside in the cold winter. The reviewer Taylor below is very correct in everything she says. Also, for the third opening act, white boy "Seel Fresh" is the most horrific, pretentious, TOOL I have ever witnessed "rap". You have no fans- everyone in the audience at one point were all booing, with their backs to the stage, both middle fingers up.  At many points through out his performance, people threw things at the stage. Go get some rap skills, white boy. I will never go to Reggie's ever again. Disgusting hipster scum.

50.description: Great when the weather is warm. I enjoy the space, and the shows span a variety of genres. Guests are usually pretty friendly, but watch out for the occasional drunk bro (frat boy types who are very uncomfortable in their sexuality and will try to punch other random guys to prove they're not "that way").The club has a record store attached, which is pretty awesome, and there's a roof-top beer garden where you can smoke, which I deeply appreciate.Some people say the neighborhood's a bit shady, but I'm a little white girl from Iowa, and I've never had a problem (except with the aforementioned bros - some of those guys have really deep-seated psychological issues).

4.description: The first part of the evening was a big fat 5 at the music venue. My friends and I were attending an event there, and had so much more fun than we had expected. The setup of the venue made this the best karaoke experience I've ever had.  Plus, drinks were pretty cheap. After the venue closed for the night, we headed next door for an after show drinks, where the other part of the night ended with a big fat zero. The bartender was extremely rude, unprofessional, and derogatory towards one of my friends solely based on a song she requested. Just because you don't like the song she picked doesn't mean that you should publicly make fun of her age, gender, or race. If you only want certain music playing in your bar, then don't ask your crowd for song requests! As a result, our entire event group left the venue, and I definitely won't be returning.

6.description: This Place is a great chill spot...Food is Good as well as the drinks. Live band on Tuesday. Great for a simple outing with friends or date.

22.description: Good bands, relaxed environment.. Good sound system only critiques would be have better beer selection and try to have a more open management this venue almost NEVER books local talent unless you are signed to a label...(tisk tisk)

15.description: great beer, music, and staff. one of chicago's gems

57.description: I went to see a show here this past thursday for the first time. Overall, i feel ambivalent towards this venue because it had an equal amount of positive and negative features. The sound system was plain awful for all 4 acts. I've read other reviewers comment on how the sound system is good, so i'm assuming it's a hit or miss here? but seriously, it was so bad and so loud that i could not understand the lyrics to almost all the songs. I could tell that my eardrums had taken a severe beating because when i would go outside, i felt like i was going deaf.  On the plus side, it was a fun venue. Despite it being on the smaller side, there was enough room to dance, the crowd was lively, the staff was nice,  patrons could go outside for a smoke whenever they wanted, the bathrooms weren't crowded, coat-check services.going here was cool for the experience, but i don't know if i'll come here again.

20.description: Ok. So this is a hard review to write because I have such mixed feelings. I will start with what I liked about Reggie's.The atmosphere is awesome. Good vibes, dim lighting, really gives you that rock feel right when you walk in. The door guy with long hair was nice and funny. We went there on a Friday night for some drinks and eats before catching the free shuttle bus to a concert. It was a school bus that was painted all funky, and was super fun. Haven't been on a school bus in ages-- felt like we were on the magic school bus. Becky was the server on the bus, super nice and fun girl, and offered us $5 beers which was convenient too.Ok. The bad. The reason this post is lacking the other 3 stars.Our server (the girl with the long dreads) provided us with the worst service I have ever experienced. When we sat at our table, we had to flag her down and ask her if we had enough time to eat before the shuttle bus leaves. Her response: "I have no idea what time it is so I can't really tell you." Ok, maybe next time just say "The kitchen takes about such and such time to make food so you want to order this much time in advance." Or, you could ask what time it is.We decided to order food-- had to flag her down once again. She came back to our table, never asked if we wanted anything to drink, didn't even offer water...We put our order in and about 15 mins later a food runner brought it to us. Had to ask the food runner for silverware, napkins and water. WE DIDN'T SEE OUR SERVER AGAIN UNTIL WE HAD TO FLAG HER DOWN FOR THE CHECK! Horrible... She didn't even come over to ask if our food came out alright or if there was anything else we needed.I have been a server myself and still tipped her 15% because I know FOH hospitality workers live off tips (usually I would do 20% or more but I really couldn't even possibly justify giving her more than 15%)So, ok, maybe she was having a bad day. Maybe not. She seemed to give the other several tables plenty of attention. Not sure why she didn't give us the same service... I will come back to Reggie's for a concert or a free shuttle ride but I will never go back there just to eat, drink, or hangout.

36.description: Very poor service!

14.description: Reggies is such a fun venue! I am with APHA Student Assembly and we held a social event there during our conference in Chicago a couple days ago. It was SO fun! The event manager Jody is amazing to work with! I recommend Reggies for any event you have in Chicago. All of the staff are cool and very inviting EXCEPT one bartender Bert who is very rude and unprofessional. If you avoid him you are sure to have an excellent time at Reggies! Thank you Reggies!

28.description: Great spot great food.  Best fried pickles I ever had, the wings were pretty good too.

1.description: Nice rooftop patio to enjoy some drinks outside. They do have a nice canned beer selection. I ordered the tater tots, which didn't disappoint and the stuffed mushrooms were pretty tasty, although nothing to rave about. However, the staff is inattentive and unprofessional. It's unappealing to have your server, open-mouth eating while you're trying to place an order.. Other staff were also rude, loud and inappropriate. It's pretty dirty with disgusting bathrooms and I was served a can of beer with so much dirt and dust/hair stuck to the top of the can, that I had to wash it before drinking out of it (because my server was MIA) I probably won't be becoming a regular any time soon...

9.description: Fun place to go for drinks on a sunny day.  Cheap drinks, great service, no frills, but a fun outdoor space.  Pool table and basketball hoop included, and on hot days they have misting water spraying to cool you off.  Sometimes there's even a band playing on the rooftop, which is super fun.  Overall, one of my favorite local bars.

29.description: Really Cool Rooftop! Totally came her on a whim and it had an awesome island feel.  Even the guy who checked ids was friendly.  The service however for food was seriously bad.  When i first walked in I heard some guy yelling at the waitress" NO! I want to see your manager's manager".  I didn't understand until I ordered my food and it took about 45 mins for 8 wings.I would be back to drink, but not to eat.

23.description: I really like the rooftop, creative and urban.  We don't really get a lot of that in the southside but this bucked the trend.  It gets a pretty diverse crowd too.  The food is okay nothing extremely special but decent, it does its job.  They have great drink deals throughout the week.  You can stay up on the rooftop and hang with friends with a little pool or shooting hoops or you can take a trip downstairs and listen to live music.  I've heard metal, rock, jam, and house at some point in time here so you really can't put a specific label on this place, its all good.

5.description: If I could give this place zero stars I would. By far the worst service I have ever experienced. We had to seat ourselves and then was never waited on. We sat and never even received menus. At one point a waitress stopped by to say that she would come back to clean the table off but she was never seen again. We got up and left and 6 hours later they probably never even noticed.

31.description: This is a cool place to go and just chill and on top of that they have some good food.Since they don't have a children's menu we ordered my grand daughter a hot dog.   I can still taste my grand daughter's hot dog in my mouth...Oh this isn't one of those thin finger looking hot dogs but it actually filled up the bun. OMG, they know what a real Hot Dog is, I mean it was thick and it was flavorful and once everyone took a pinch of my Grand baby's Hot Dog she was guarding it with her dear life...lol She is only 3 but she gripped her hot dog with both hands and gave all of us the side eye like no one else better touch my Hot Dog!!!  I can't wait to go back and order my own Hot Dog...lolI have been here about 5 times now and I have not been disappointed yet!!!  The Burgers are clearly cooked fresh and the wings, whew they make you want to order more they are so goooooooood!!!I also liked the the fact that when they made a mistake with the amount of pieces of chicken they gave us that they were apologetic and sent up an extra wing!!  If you want more than the small cup they give you of Ranch Dressing remember that is extra!I would say as a side note if you have a Resturant.com coupon that your drinks will be full price and that was a shock to us, as a courtsey after we spent well over 150.00 dollars for the group you would think they would have given us our two drinks for the special price but they didn't so now I know don't order the drinks unless I want to pay full price.  I don't know how it works with Groupon but I do know on their Half Price Sandwich day you can not use your Groupon so it ended up being cheaper for us to use our Groupon at another time.Our last visit we ate up at the rooftop for the first time it was so nice and with the group of us it made it even more fun especially with their outdoor shower...fun, basketball hoop and just the wait staff and other customers...I would tell anyone if you want a great burger go to Reggie's!!!

25.description: Probably everyone who lives on the Southside, especially the South Loop, has been to Reggies at one point in their life.  Its a place known for its concerts, cheap drink and lunch specials and its outdoor rooftop.  If you go to Reggies with anything over the expectation of getting drunk for cheap, hanging out with friends or playing pool, then you may be disappointed.  Otherwise its perfect for those 3 things.  They usually have some type of wing special on certain days (.50 cent wings) and the wings are pretty good (very good at that price).  And they have drafts and basically any other cheap liquor you want.  I wouldn't go here trying to order some 40 year old Cognac. Bartenders are real cool but when this place gets packed (and it gets packed), they are overworked seriously.  Waiters/waitresses too.  Thats probably the only real negative.  Trying to get a table after 5 in the summer on a workday may be a real problem.  And because its so packed, you may have to track your waitress down to get your orders in.  Wanna go, hang with some neighborhood hipsters and get blasted for cheap, hit Reggies.Wanna drink a 30 yr old Scotch and talk about stocks, go elsewhere.

12.description: This is a cool place to go and just chill and on top of that they have some good food.Since they don't have a children's menu we ordered my grand daughter a hot dog.   I can still taste my grand daughter's hot dog in my mouth...Oh this isn't one of those thin finger looking hot dogs but it actually filled up the bun. OMG, they know what a real Hot Dog is, I mean it was thick and it was flavorful and once everyone took a pinch of my Grand baby's Hot Dog she was guarding it with her dear life...lol She is only 3 but she gripped her hot dog with both hands and gave all of us the side eye like no one else better touch my Hot Dog!!!  I can't wait to go back and order my own Hot Dog...lolI have been here about 5 times now and I have not been disappointed yet!!!  The Burgers are clearly cooked fresh and the wings, whew they make you want to order more they are so goooooooood!!!I also liked the the fact that when they made a mistake with the amount of pieces of chicken they gave us that they were apologetic and sent up an extra wing!!  If you want more than the small cup they give you of Ranch Dressing remember that is extra!I would say as a side note if you have a Resturant.com coupon that your drinks will be full price and that was a shock to us, as a courtsey after we spent well over 150.00 dollars for the group you would think they would have given us our two drinks for the special price but they didn't so now I know don't order the drinks unless I want to pay full price.  I don't know how it works with Groupon but I do know on their Half Price Sandwich day you can not use your Groupon so it ended up being cheaper for us to use our Groupon at another time.Our last visit we ate up at the rooftop for the first time it was so nice and with the group of us it made it even more fun especially with their outdoor shower...fun, basketball hoop and just the wait staff and other customers...I would tell anyone if you want a great burger go to Reggie's!!!

21.description: This place is awesome! PBR tall boys on special, hot wings, NBA Finals, good fire burning in the corner, pop a shot the other corner, people of all races and creeds mixing together, businessman to punk rockers, male and female crowd about 50 50, outdoor pool table 8 small screens and one giant projection screen, overall pretty good place to spend some time. Biggest downside is slow service and scary bath rooms. You can watch the EL go by 50 ft away from you.  Nice place to stumble upon only short walk from my hotel (Hyatt Regency McCormick place).   Great find!

16.description: Really Cool Rooftop! Totally came her on a whim and it had an awesome island feel.  Even the guy who checked ids was friendly.  The service however for food was seriously bad.  When i first walked in I heard some guy yelling at the waitress" NO! I want to see your manager's manager".  I didn't understand until I ordered my food and it took about 45 mins for 8 wings.I would be back to drink, but not to eat.

17.description: Trainwreck-Appropriately named.  I had been hearing nice things about the weekly Wed party there so I was excited to check it out for the first time.  I arrived. Nice atmosphere.  Good music, Lots of my friends there.  I ran into 2 friends at the bar when I went up to order a drink. I ordered 2 for myself and asked my friends to order theirs on me.  The skinny heavily tatooed bartender was serving us.He got my drinks and then set one of the ladies' drinks on the counter,  He told me $21.  I told him fine but he still hadn't got my other friends drink.He told us we were ordering too slow and to pay him his money.I asked "What kind of attitude was that?"He then yelled  "Pay me my Fucking Money"I then told him Fuck You I'm not paying anyone who talks to me like that.He then waived over security.  I tried to explain to the security guard what happened and he said he understood but I still had to go and made up a story about 3 other people complaining about me.  I told him that didn't make sense since the only problem I had was with this bartender and I had only been there 15 minutes.  He then got loud and agitated with me and told me I had to go.  I complied.When I got downstairs I spoke to another security person who seems a bit more reasonable and asked to speak to the manager.Shortly after the manager walks by and he asked him to come over and talk to us.He told us to hold on and came over about 10 minutes later.  I wasn't very encouraged when he walks outside and immediately lights a cigarette before even saying a word to me.  I explained to him what happened and he seemed quite uninterested and even annoyed that I had to take time out to speak to me.To be fair he did apologize and say he would talk to the bartender with whom I had the disagreement but somehow I believe he was patronizing me and couldn't wait to get back inside.  He kept asking me "What do you want me to do about it?"I'm told him it's not for me to tell him his job, but at the same time I didn't feel he handled the situation properly.  Oh and he did say "Well I can't let you back in, you've already been kicked out".  I told him that I wasn't trying to get back in and that I wouldn't be coming back again.Again the manager seemed completely unmoved.I tried to give 0 stars but it wouldn't let me post.

10.description: We swung by Reggie's rooftop last night before we hit the Sox game. We thought, "$1 tacos and half price drafts?! Can't beat it!" Unfortunately, we left the place hungry and a bit disappointed. Here's what happened:When we got to the bar, it was roughly 5:45 PM. The place was already pretty busy, so we posted up at the bar and ordered there. The bartender that helped us mentioned that he was off at 6:00, so it'd be best if we didn't start a tab. That was the first bad sign. If we want to start a tab, please let us. We'll be sure to tip appropriately, but do not discourage us from paying the way that we'd prefer. Annoying.Still, we closed the tab right away so that our bartender could leave at 6:00PM and still earn a tip on our bill. We ordered a few drinks and some food. All good. Our hunger was starting to set in, so we couldn't wait for some of that delicious fare.20 minutes later. No food.30 minutes later. No food.45 minutes later. No food.Finally, that same bartender approached us and mentioned that they did not have a kitchen runner, and the order was never put in. The bartender started calculating the food we ordered and said he'd pay us back for it with cash. You could tell that he was upset, which caused us to sympathize with his situation. We asked for a few free beers, which he happily delivered.Unfortunately, I think the rooftop had a staffing issue last night, and the bartender that was helping us fell victim to that. I'd been dying to try the food at Reggie's since I heard it was pretty good, but did not get the opportunity to last night. Damn.I trust that Reggie's will pull it together and get back on track after a bit of a hiccup last night. We really enjoyed the atmosphere and it was nice that the bartender helping us gave us a few free beers (it would've been nice if he offered rather than us having to ask, though!). We'll give Reggie's another shot, but we expect an improvement upon last night's experience!

11.description: Unless your tastes skew d-bag, you might end up agreeing with me that Reggie's is one of the best bars in Chicago.  I am talking about the whole Reggie's complex, but have chosen to write about the roofdeck because that's where I usually am when I go to Reggie's.  I could go on and on about this place, but I'll just bulletpoint the things I enjoy most:- Like most things South Loop, clientele is very diverse (whites, blacks, indians, asians, hipsters, punk rock looking-dudes, young professionals, older couples who like to feel they're still with it and there to enjoy a rock show, etc.)  If you're someone of color like me, you find that this is more important to you than the next person and it's one of the best things about living in the South Loop.  No place in the neighborhood seems to typify this more than Reggie's--maybe Wabash Tap comes the closest- In the summertime, playing the roofdeck pop-a-shot with the green line going by right behind is really unique and fantastic urban setting.  In the wintertime they put a canopy over half of the roofdeck, and there's a nice smoker's patio and fire/warming hearth for people to stand by when they go out there- The specials are great, particularly on Monday and Tuesday.  Bingo with Burke on Monday is also hilarious, but he can be abrasive and cantankerous sometimes so maybe think twice before bringing the easily offended or a date up there.  Unless she is cool. - I really enjoy the people who work there.  You can tell they're individuals with their own interests outside of work, and while maybe not trained in the formal art of "service" they from my view do a really damn good job and the management seems to give them freedom to use their judgment more than some other places you might see (this is just how it seems to me as an external observer, they might disagree)- The rides and ticket specials to the local sporting teams is a great deal and perfect pre-game option- Street parking is a breeze

26.description: Came here on a Tuesday night meeting a "date" from Plenty of Fish for the first time.Turns out he wanted to come to Reggie's because there's a wing and drink special on Tuesday nights. Suffice it to say, it was a very cheap, very bad date. BUT -- those wings are delicious!The rooftop is a great place to hang out in summer if you can stomach the crowd and nasty restrooms, if you play pool, and if you are aggressive enough to chase down the servers to actually place your order. The drinks were watered down -- but at only $2 on Tuesday nights, who can rightfully complain? The wings are the real winner here, and I think they're only $4 on Tuesdays. Those wings were my only friend to get me through listening to a bad date talk about himself for 2 hours...Reggie's is not my "go to" South Loop spot, but if I ever get a hankering for those wings again, I'd definitely go there again.

27.description: I picked Reggie's rooftop a few weeks as a spot for a Friday happy hour with friends and family that happened to also be my birthday. I've been to Reggie's for shows and food on other occasions but this was my first experience on the roof top. The atmosphere of the roof top is great. It was super crowded when I first got there at 5-ish but the crowd thinned out to more comfortable levels as it got later (and colder). The roof top has plenty of tables, a full bar, and pool table and a pop-a-shot-game. Very relaxed atmosphere. The prices on all the food and drinks were reasonable and definitely met expectations. My dad had a catfish sandwich that tasted absolutely heavenly. Too bad the service is terrible. When I first arrived I went to the bar to grab a drink while I waited for the rest of my party. I overheard a woman sitting at the bar ask the bartender if he knew how to make a certain drink. He snapped "no" at her in response and walked away. When I finally ordered my drink I asked (with credit card in hand) if I could open a tab and he snapped "no" at me, tossed down the check and walked away. No explanation given. If its policy not to start a tab or he was going off shift then no big whoop but he was extremely rude. I chalked it up to one guy being snotty but  as my guests arrived the bad service stories started to pile up.- when one friend who didn't realize we were on the roof sat at the bar downstairs to wait she asked the female bartender what her best drink was, the bartender told her she could "open a bottle of beer really well" and stalked away. - a few people in my party ordered food at the bar...only  to not be told when it was ready. We were sitting at a table right in front of the bar and the server made NO EFFORT to inform them that their food was ready. After what seemed like a longer than reasonable wait they went to the bar to inquire and found their food sitting on the bar, ice cold. - my dad ordered our food from the waitress who made sporadic disinterested appearances from time to time. A few minutes after she delivered our food she came back around and put the bill on the table without a word. She came back around a few minutes later to tell us that she had left the bill on the table, as if she thought we were going to leave without paying it (we were there for at least another 3 hours after this). She also never asked if we wanted anything else (which we did, but had already ordered at the bar because we didn't think she was ever going to come back).- my aunt attempted to order food from the same waitress. My aunt told her what she wanted and then tried to get the attention of someone else in our party who had given up on waiting for the waitress and went to order at the bar. We told the waitress to go ahead and put in the order she had been given. About 30 minutes later we flag her down and inquire about the food only to be VERY snottily told that she didn't put in the order because it wasn't complete. Even is she thought that was the case, why wouldn't she come back around to get the rest of it? - When a friend noticed that someone had set out the little wood burning chimneys at the opposite end of the roof she flagged down the guy who had done it (i think he was security) and asked if we could have one too (it was COLD!!). He acted VERY out upon but eventually did it and made it a point to snap "you good now?" once he was done.  So that completed the circle of EVERY employee we interacted with being unnecessarily rude. Normally this level of bad service would have had me steaming mad but I did my best to let it go at the time because it was my birthday. But I can't ever see myself returning to any part of Reggie's after the shoddy treatment my party received. Its a shame because the rooftop is beautiful and most things about it are great. I understand that Reggie's is a "rock" atmosphere but they should probably invest in some staff training. You can still be a "bad ass" and not treat your paying customers like garbage. I would like to give 2.5 starts but since you can't I'm rounding down.

0.description: Just Awesome.-Outside Raised Deck-Cool Of Showers-Awesome Bartenders-Stiff Drinks-BasketBall Hoop-Plenty Of T.V's-Cigs Available Downstairs-Great Lunch Specials-$$$-Drinks Can Be Pricey Due to The Amazing Chicago Afternoons & Evenings.

20.description: I truly enjoyed the Women in Blues event! Wrapping up a 2-day birthday celebration with my sister & closest of friends. A conversation took place between me, who I presumed is the manager, & a staff member due to an unforeseen incident. And to this particular young lady your discourteous attitude (towards us) brought on your consequence to which I retract my apology. You obviously lost the concept of cause and effect! Reggie's this one incident will prevent subsequent visits!

19.description: This place was awesome, beers were cheap workers have a great attitude, ambiance was nice. I will definitely go back.

2.description: -My first time at this rooftop deck and I'm a fan! This is a perfect place to grab a drink or a bite to eat on a nice Chicago day. The rooftop has a great relaxed atmosphere with outdoor bench-style seating. The rooftop is pretty big and has a lot of space. They have a couple of TVs by the bar. There's also pool and a basketball hoop that you can use at anytime! Just be careful if you're not the best shot, the hoop basically overlooks the side of the building! Parking was pretty easy to find.-Food that I got was pretty good. I got the chorizo burger (1/2 off burgers on Thursdays when you buy a drink). The chorizo patty was flavorful and a great surprise. The burger came with a side of a peppery sauce, which by itself doesn't have much taste but goes well with the flavorful chorizo. Fries were very tasty with the burger. The only let down was that egg I got with the burger was overcooked. There are other daily food specials and I'll definitely try some of those.-Service was good. It wasn't too busy when I went with a group of 5 but the waitress was quick and responsive. The food came out fast and I never found myself thinking, "Where is my food?" A great sign.-All in all, a great atmosphere in the South side of Chicago with tasty food.

32.description: Rooftop basketball, free pool, bags, outdoor shower, food and booze. Amazing.

18.description: Fun place to have a few drinks with friends, shoot a few hoops, & enjoy some delicious chilli-mac!!

13.description: A friend got us a $10 ticket for all you can eat and White Sox baseball ticket. Now that is a good deal.  They have BBQ going the whole time with different meats an side, you eat till 12:30 and they will shuttle everyone to the game. And after the game they will shuttle you back and you can eat again before heading home. Is a great deal for a Sunday activity.

4.description: Junior and the rooftop crew kick arse! The food here is only exceeded by the great service. No better rooftop for miles around. And great specials every fucking day!

24.description: I am almost hesitant to yelp about this..best kept secret in Chicago. Love this place. Shoot hoops, drink beer, shoot pool, and take a shower. Watch the EL go by, watch the games...awesome spot

6.description: Rooftop fun. Friendly waitstaff, pool, bball, middle level is full of vinyls to browse through. Lively, great atmosphere.

22.description: My buddy has been trying to get me to come here for quite awhile, and it took the offer of a cheap concert ticket to make it hapen.  Yes, I am one of those northside dipshits who think that nothing worthwhile happens south of Madison.  Get over it.  You southsiders think the same about us.  But Reggie's made a big dent in that opinion.  So my friend got tix to go see Truckfighters and Marmora (Truckfighters are a little better band but I enjoyed Marmora mormora - ha ha good God that was stupid).  We got there early so we went to the bar to grab some pre-show grub and drinks and are you shittin' me I can get a Surly Furious draft for $3.50 WTF?!?!? That's what it costs per can at Binny's.  So on Mondays every beer on their 25 Drafts list is half-price.  Surly, Delerium, Hoegaarden and on and on.  Excellent draft beer selection.  Half-friggin' price which (again) puts them at damn near store prices.  (The bottles and cans are also strong.)  AND on Mondays they have $4 Maker's.  Within 2 minutes of sitting down, we decided this is going to be an at least once-a-month destination, if not more.  The decor is cool, brick, beams, industrial and not in a "hey let's throw up a brand new place and make it look hipster" kind of way.  Our server, Clara, was a doll.  Always smiling, very pleasant.  The only downside was the food.  The menu looks awesome.  Unfortunately, the execution came up short.  The wings I had heard so much about were very disappointing.  I got the Fire, they were just all pepper, and the oil temp was too low so they didn't get anywhere near crispy and just turned into oil sponges.  My friend's reuben was nothing to write home about.  Short on 'kraut, bread was undergrilled so it was just soft.  Too bad, if the food was half as good as the descriptions, it'd be great. We also got to check out the roof deck.  Great views, good layout, bartender was cool.  Still happy up in Lakeview, but definitely gonna be getting down this way more often.

15.description: I would give Reggie's 0 stars if I could. Great bar and rooftop; horrible customer service. Loved Reggie's and continued to support them despite sporadically abysmal service because it's relatively close to my office. We've held several after-work functions here and I hoped to continue to patronize them because of their proximity. After having drinks spilled on me and my boss by an unapologetic waitress and a serious run-in with a nasty barkeep over an aggressive patron playing pool, I'm done with this establishment. I told the unprofessional bartender (who did not overhear the altercation, but sided with the jerk patron) as much and he agreed that I should never return after calling me a liar. I thought it best to exceed his request and share this incident with my friends, family and Yelp so that they can be forewarned of how Reggie's treats patrons. This venue goes by 3 different names and trust me - they all suck.

7.description: Good drinks. The rooftop is gorgeous on a warm night. They wouldn't let us carry alcohol from the ground floor upstairs and vice versa which proved more annoying than you'd think. The band downstairs was really good too.

8.description: Probably everyone who lives on the Southside, especially the South Loop, has been to Reggies at one point in their life.  Its a place known for its concerts, cheap drink and lunch specials and its outdoor rooftop.  If you go to Reggies with anything over the expectation of getting drunk for cheap, hanging out with friends or playing pool, then you may be disappointed.  Otherwise its perfect for those 3 things.  They usually have some type of wing special on certain days (.50 cent wings) and the wings are pretty good (very good at that price).  And they have drafts and basically any other cheap liquor you want.  I wouldn't go here trying to order some 40 year old Cognac. Bartenders are real cool but when this place gets packed (and it gets packed), they are overworked seriously.  Waiters/waitresses too.  Thats probably the only real negative.  Trying to get a table after 5 in the summer on a workday may be a real problem.  And because its so packed, you may have to track your waitress down to get your orders in.  Wanna go, hang with some neighborhood hipsters and get blasted for cheap, hit Reggies.Wanna drink a 30 yr old Scotch and talk about stocks, go elsewhere.

30.description: Visited Reggie's for the first time for a pool league match.  Loved how the table is located on the rooftop deck where a lot of action happens.  The venue is awesome and it's definitely a casual, fun hang out type of hoppin' place.  I didn't eat, so I couldn't tell you how they add up in that area, but I can say it was extremely busy that night due to wing night.  The wings looked mighty large in size too.  The service was friendly and the selection of beers / specials were good too.

3.description: Love. it.I have no idea how it took me this long to discover this place, but I love it. Crowd was cool, atmosphere on the rooftop is unlike any other place that I've ever been to, but where Reggie's stood out for me is the staff. Friendly without TRYING to be friendly, if that makes sense. I felt like I was drinking at a buddy's house, but a buddy that has a bar and basketball hoop on his roof. Since none of my friends actually have a bar and/or basketball hoop on their roof - and some are lucky just to have a roof to begin with - then Reggie's best get used to this grill of mine.

14.description: Love going there on Tuesday nights with my friends for the wings upstairs is way better then down stairs

1.description: I love going to Ava, she did my first sew-in and I must say I loved it, plus she's very quick, it didn't take as long as I thought and I looked fabulous! I definitely recommend her.

0.description: I've been going to Ava for over a decade and she does flawless work.

3.description: Newly opened. Great beer selection. I love that they offer boars head deli sandwiches to order. We've been there 3 times to pick up lunch. I recommend the roast beef special.

1.description: Great shop! Great People! Plus their Breakfast Sandwiches are delicious!!! Great addition to our community!

2.description: They have everything you need and more. Friendly professional staff. Sure it costs a bit more than Marianos or Jewel but it's easy to get to.

0.description: *You had me at Boar's Head*Soo sometimes you have to ask yourself -- is it worth making a wee bit extra for the things I'm in a bind for and sometimes that answer is yes. South Loop Market has a little of everything -- and this time, they had some fresh garlic for me just in the nick of time!Soo I decided to peruse a bit and just do some comparison. There are some items that are much higher than one would like to pay but some aren't too bad especially considering it is a market. The store is clean, the owner/manger was super sweet AND they have Boar's Head meat. I'll be back for that alone. If you haven't had boar's head, what are you waiting on. From my understanding, a lot of higher end grocery stores carry it and the fact my local market has it, is pure awesomeness!Oh and the hours are fantastic! I'll be back and probably more often then I should be.

4.description: People that work here are very nice. Hours are convenient and they have most everything you could ask for when you need to make that late night run for something you forgot to pick up at the supermarket, or need to make that last minute rum run. Sandwich shop is the bomb-diggity as well!

12.description: Walked in on a weekend afternoon on a lark -- in search of a Boston Creme -- and the place was empty.  "That's fortunate," I thought, after reading the reviews describing the inconsistent service, especially when it got busy.  Alas, the service is just POOR.  Here's why:When I walked up to the register, there was no one there.  So I walked all of seven feet to the left to peer back into the shop (it's tiny) and there was a skinny, bespectacled lady hunched over some boxes who shouted something barely intelligible about "I am working on another customer!" and "Go to the register!"  I didn't see any other customer present, but perhaps it was a phone order.By the time I got to the register, another guy had walked in during that brief exchange and was standing at the register.  Seeing no one present, he called out "hello?"  That set the lady off, who stormed around the corner and shouted (more clearly this time) "Can't you see I am working already?  Why did you do that?  I am working on another customer!"  Then she stormed back and left the poor fellow standing alone at the counter, too stunned to even respond.  I gently told him that I would have done the same thing.And I left.  Never to return.

7.description: Current manager and staff extremely friendly and efficient. This place generally operates like a well-oiled machine. It can get tight in the customer area during peak business hours and the doors open awkwardly in rather than out. Baby strollers a bit difficult to get in / get out. But the energy is positive and there is generally another customer who holds the door so parent and stroller can exit more easily. The manager is good at his job and it shows.

20.description: I never knew this place existed, but we decided to walk back from church.  It's super small and there is no parking.  I wonder where the traffic is, but I bet there's a bus stop close by.We decided to pop in and at least try a donut.  I've haven't had a donut from here since the 90s.  For some reason, the glazed munchkins tasted a bit krispy kreme-ish.  I also tried a Boston Kreme for ole time sake and damn, it brought me back.

19.description: I never knew this place existed, but we decided to walk back from church.  It's super small and there is no parking.  I wonder where the traffic is, but I bet there's a bus stop close by.We decided to pop in and at least try a donut.  I've haven't had a donut from here since the 90s.  For some reason, the glazed munchkins tasted a bit krispy kreme-ish.  I also tried a Boston Kreme for ole time sake and damn, it brought me back.

1.description: Came in to this dunkin a few times . There is an amazingly sweet older lady who works here most days and gets my order correct every time and you can tell she cares about giving excellent customer service.  But i usually get service from these horrible employees . For example- me and one other lady walking in to the empty dunkin and theres 4 employees walking in and out of the back area literally looking at us and ignoring us. Finally the lady in line with me yells out and one of the employee screams to another saying they have customers. Its honestly ridiculous.  Waste of money and time.

2.description: Its time to write about this DD around the corner from home. My kids get a treat once in 4 months and i always buy just  one donut each instead of a box. Nafisa at the counter is a dear and throws in a few free donut holes,kids love it!

9.description: I love this grab-and-go location of Dunkin' Donuts because of the friendly, helpful staff and owner. It's a small shop, but has everything I need to get going in the morning.  There's a positive spirit in the air and it's absolutely the way I like to start my morning. The staff members always remember my order, even if it's been a while since I go in.  The owner always tells me "Don't worry, be happy."   And why not?  Note: the one-star review by Chris W. is clearly for a different branch of Dunkin' Donuts. There is no Baskin Robbins at this store (thus no "baskin side") -- and this branch is so small, no one can really hangout, let alone "bums" (not my language, his....).  This place is not an Intelligentsia Cafe, but it gets the caffeine job done efficiently and well.

6.description: They were so helpful at this location! The best Dunkin Donuts I have ever ordered from. Dillip was especially helpful. I had to order for a large party and Dillip was patient with me on the phone and when we went in to pick up. He went above and beyond to make sure our order was correct and when I brought the food back everything was there and made correctly. Overall, great service.

18.description: This has by far been the best Customer Serviced Dunkin Donuts in Chicago and I've been to sooooo many! The guys behind the counter are always cheerful and kind. One guy seems a little shy buI I wish he would realize that good customer service goes a long way. Smile a little more. He 's a younger kid.  I'm always happy to give my change for tip. It is always clean in there.There is no seating, wish there was. There is no parking! Just recently they put up no parking signs on the side street, often times people still park there but I fear at the rate the city is jumping on car to ticket, I've been avoiding going there and hitting less desirable places with a drive -thru. Management, pay for signs for 15 min. parking with flasher signs. There's an annual fee. You can do this and it would be nice to know your car will not be ticketed or towed while you grab your morning coffee.

10.description: THE best Dunkin Donuts EVER!  The service is top notch.  My order is always correct.  And the quality of their coffee, donuts and breakfast sandwiches are better than any other location of DD I've ever experienced.  Again the service is AMAZING.  The guys that work here actually seem like they're happy to be there.  They remember people's names and their usual orders and they treat everyone with respect and a smile.  I just wish they had a drive-thru!

13.description: Coffee is always fresh. Donuts always tastey. Best part about this DD, the staff. Every staff member there always has a smile on and are friendly and welcoming. Favorite DD in the city.

16.description: not bad.....they don't always"listen" to your order, so you may have to get them to do it again. Still, love the place for its convenience and coffee. No seating, it would be perfect if they put a few chairs and tables outside so you could sit here on nice days...

17.description: Returned to this place because i was in need of coffee badly and couldn't think of any place else--still disappointed: again, my coffee tasted burnt and my husband said his coffee tasted burnt too.

15.description: The really bad part are the God awful coffee and doughnuts.  The coffee is just colored water with no real coffee taste, plus I agree with some of the others that I would prefer to add milk or cream myself because only I know how much I want.  The doughnuts are a total disaster, absolutely no flavor and they tend to just fall apart in your hand.  I never thought I'd meet a doughnut that I wouldn't like but here I never met one that I actually liked.  Astonishing.  You really need to try hard to screw up this badly.The good part are the friendly employees, and I imagine it's difficult to maintain good morale while serving such atrocious food and coffee.  And of course 24-hour a day service is a HUGE plus, especially in the sleepy Chicago where it's tough to find a coffee place that remains open beyond 8 or 9 PM.

0.description: We've all been to Dunkin Donuts and this place delivers what DDs offers at a high level. The employees are also very efficient at taking orders and payment while everyone is in line....The downside is that if more than 2.5 people try to enter this DDs at one time, it feels like you are in a sardine can....minus the lovely odor. Another thing that is cool is that the door opens inwards, so when a new person enters you have to play human Tetris to fit everyone and the door in the restaurant. Can we get someone to reverse the hinges and open the door towards the sidewalk? Sliding door? No door??? The place is open 24 hrs, so there isn't a huge need for a door. This is a good DDs in terms of quality, but you may want to write your order on poster board and press it up to the window, rather than run the human/door gauntlet to get your Oreo filled donut.

5.description: Stopped in for coffee, because I tragically ran out of beans at home. Asked for a large coffee with just one cream, saying I wanted just a little cream. But when I got home, I found the contents to be a very light tan. Why Dunkin' doesn't let you put in your own cream has always been beyond me.

11.description: The guys here are nice and friendly and they make the iced coffee good. They actually turn the iced coffee upside down and shake it for you so the sugar and cream is mixed. Only place I've seen them do that.Downside - they close kinda early.

8.description: 24/7 Dunkin a block from my apartment?  What's not to like.  Even the late night staff is friendly. I just wish try had stronger coffee.  Can't handle them pouring hit coffee over ice for iced coffee.  Gets way too watery!

3.description: This Dunkin is really small on the corner of 16th and Michigan Ave.  I stopped in for coffee and also because I needed to break a $20 for parking so I might as well kill two birds with one stone.  I had to wait in line since there was only one person working and when I finally did order, the lady wasn't very friendly.  I must have misread how much my iced coffee would cost so when I received my change back I had fewer singles than I wanted.  I then asked her if I could get my $5 bill broken into singles and she responded rudely that she already closed the register and it was too late.  I understand that it was too late but the attitude was unwarranted.

14.description: I love Dunkin Donuts & the only thing can go wrong is if service is bad.. I ordered a latte and they forgot about me but when they realized, the manager/owner was very apologetic and even gave me a muffin for the wait. THAT IS CUSTOMER SATISFACTION!

4.description: Your friendly South Loop donut shop!  The owner cheerfully declared "everything low calorie" when I walked in!  They always have a good, pretty selection of donuts available anytime I've been in, and now they have chai lattes and sell K cups!  FYI - it's super tiny so you'll be getting it to go though.

58.description: I ordered a Family Size giardinera only pizza from Flo & Santos last night. Before the pizza I had spent 2 hours fighting the Lollapalooza traffic snafu in the loop. I got the pizza into my apartment and it was a religious experience. No TV, no computer. I just sat in silence eating the pizza. I ONLY broke silence to tell my cats how good it was. It was so good I ate over half of it, and could have probably finished the whole thing. I will either prove or disprove this theory when I order my next Flo & Santos Family Size pie.  Thanks for turning my night around Flo & Santos.

56.description: The food was fast but the chicken wings were not tender and the pizza wasn't that good.The outside restaurants part was nice and the waitress was very polite. It's family friendly restaurant.

29.description: Unfortunately, the somewhat decent food is grossly overshadowed by the fact that service is abysmal.   There are so many better places with higher quality food and good service around - I highly recommend either sticking to take-out here or look elsewhere.

42.description: This was pretty pizza. Came here on a lack luster pizza tour and had the Flo's Polish and Marco's Italian Beef. I was skeptical of both being a very picky eater but decided to suck it up. They we're both amazing! Not sure I could handle them in larger quantities, but they were interesting takes pizza and polish heritage. I'd easily come back here again!

23.description: Stop 1 on a pizza tour. Had never heard of a Polish/Italian fusion restaurant, but I was quite impressed!We were given 3 types of pizzas to try- italian beef with giardinera, a sauerkraut and kielbasa pizza, and their farmer's market pizza (this rotates in flavors) which was roasted brussel sprouts and a white sauce.My favorite was the italian beef one- nice kick from the peppers and the beef had good flavor too! YUM. I know the Polish pizza made many believers on our tour group (2 people said "I hate sauerkraut, but this pizza changed my mind!"), but I'm not a huge kielbasa fan, and this had thick pieces on it, so it wasn't my favorite. The white pizza was different than expected. I guess when I hear the word "white sauce" I think of crappy alfredo from Olive Garden, but this was a nice feta sauce that had great flavor. The roasted brussel sprouts were thick pieces and also pretty good, but I think my pizza brain couldn't wrap its head around the concept of a brussel sprout pizza, so I didn't end up eating the whole piece. The restaurant is long and narrow, and remained crowded the whole time we were there. There's an outdoor patio area which turned into a heated tent area for the winter. We were forced to sit out there since our tour group had 17 people in it, and the owner/manager felt bad, since it was cold. He came out with a Polish vodka and gave us all shots to warm us up! The thought was really kind, vodka was smooth, and the experience was great! I will definitely come back!

47.description: Flo & Santos is everything you should expect in a traditional Chicago-style thin crust pizza. They have really figured out the perfect balance of amount of ingredients and flavors. Crust is crispy and cooked perfectly that the sauce doesn't cause any sogginess. Sauce is a very smooth blend non-sweet with the right amount that the cheese still holds together with crust, making it very easy to eat with little mess. They don't skimp on the cheese either. I find that many pizza places throw all the cheese in the center and you end up with this dry crusty area on the outside; not here. You can tell they put time into crafting their pizza that every slice is as good as the last. I ordered pepperoni and sausage on mine. Pepperoni and sausage were cooked under the cheese, which I prefer, because it adds an extra element to the sauce as it cooks. You cannot go wrong with Flo and Santos. Their pizza should appeal to all tastes palates that can appreciate a quality non-chain pie.

8.description: Consistently amazing pizza.  Huge selection of toppings to create the perfect combination.  Very comfortable dining environment with attentive service.  Vast menu supplemented by daily specials.  Extensive selection of beers and cocktails.  Carryout has always gone off without a hitch.  The order is prepared and ready in a timely fashion with attention to detail.  I love their meatballs and order the pizza extra thin and crispy.  Fanfriggentastic.  You can't go wrong.

31.description: If you are looking for great thin crust pizza in Chicago give this place a try, pizza was super cheesy and a medium was too big for 2 people to finish. My only complaint was the crust could have been crispier and sauce a bit saltier but otherwise it was great. The service was great too, Yosenia was a great waitress!

34.description: Great place to watch a game. Full menu with big booths and large tables. Great pizza and beef sandwiches. Friendly service. Large bar with lots of seating.

16.description: I came in for a pick up with a friend and I was completely turned off because we didn't get acknowledged by the staff for about 5 minutes. They (three of them) were just standing, conversing and didn't even bother to see what we needed as we awkwardly stood there...but I bet you're wondering why I gave the four stars then. The pizza is phenomenal. The best thin crust pizza I've had to this day! I would def recommend a friend to come here any day but the staff needs to clean up their act ASAP!

13.description: thin crust chicago pizzta. they go heavy on the toppings. i guess it helps that we ordered a meat lovers. nice change up from the deep dish that you see everywhere.sleeper spot for pre gaming before a bears game. the entire world was at scout and we went across the street, sat down right away, ate better food, and got drinks a lot faster.

11.description: This review is for takeout only. I placed a takeout order this past Friday at about 7pm and I was told the pizza would be ready in 20-25 min. I walked into the restaurant 20 min later and sure enough, the pizza was boxed and waiting for me. The restaurant was pretty packed and the vibe was great. Pizza is thin crust and a Family size was sufficient for 3 of us even though, the restaurant suggests it serves 3-4. The pizza itself was loaded well with toppings and baked just right with a charred crust but not burnt. When compared to other pizza places around, its priced a little bit higher but then again it is a full sit down restaurant. We'll certainly be back next time for the full service dining experience.

39.description: I've come here on 2 separate pizza tours and loved it both times! The flat "tavern style" thin crust pies are amazing. We had one with Italian beef and hot peppers and another with polish meat and sauerkraut. These were both so good. Being from NY it's weird seeing a round pizza cut into squares but this place made bite size pizza absolutely delicious. I can't wait to come back next time I'm in Chicago. (Hopefully soon!)

37.description: This place is awesome. Their outdoor seating is adorable, and good for groups. Very extensive wine list. We ordered the pierogi sampler, perfect for 2 people. Also, the pizza options look delicious, we created our own and it was AMAZING. Crust is so yummy and super cheesy. Will definitely be going back.

0.description: An awesome blend of Polish and Italian fare, located just a block south of the Roosevelt stop.  Atmosphere is casual pub.  We went there for a late lunch and there was plenty of open seats.  Can assume that it would be packed during game days, especially the Bears.We got the Pierogi Sampler, Cheddar Waffle Fries, and Ravirogi and they were all great!  The Ravirogi sauce is impressive and I would recommend it on anything they make.  They also offer it as a side you can order!Great food, location, and atmosphere.  Will be back for sure!

38.description: Amazing outdoor patio.  Very pretty with little white lights and brick pavers.  Views of EL make you feel super chicago. .  Super family friendly. Awesome pizza..get the Italian beef with giardinara. Was recommended this from a friend and they were right.  Amazing!    Also all their salads are fantastic.  High quality ingredients.   Servers are friendly and fast.  One of my favorite go to places in the south loop.

51.description: This gem has great buffalo wings, but thin crust pizza will be its claim to fame. My favorites are Marco's Italian Beef thin crust which is exactly as sounds and Flo's Polish with Polska kielbasa, sauerkraut & Apple smoked bacon. Has good atmosphere for watching Bears game or just to have a drink. Service is fast and attentive.

27.description: - TIP:  The polish beer (Zywiec) is a great deal at just $6 for a massive 22oz glass.- CON:  Not too many items that aren't gut-bombs...but this is a polish pizza place...so what would you expect?- BOTTOM LINE:  I was here when visiting Chicago for business and went to their bar to catch the CHC/PIT Wild Card game.  Great atmosphere and decent food for a sports bar.

32.description: Delish! We are visiting from Florida and the Marcos Italian pizza was awesome. A good kick of spice but the flavored were awesome. The pierogi sampler appetizer was also delicious as was the kielbasa sandwich. Really enjoyed dinner here.

54.description: Stopped in here because Zapapitos did not open and what a pleasant surprise!Had the steak burger. Best pretzel bun I've ever eaten. Waffle fries, perfection!Long island ice tea kicked my ass.Excellent food and very good service!

48.description: Although we have lived in the South Loop for 6 years, we just recently started visiting Flo & Santos. In the last couple months we have been here at 4 times. Food is good, and fairly priced. We have tried a couple pizzas including one of the specialties. Beer menu seems to change regularly, with different options on each visit. (Always fun to try new choices) I don't recall which sandwich it was a friend ordered but it was very good... and so large they had the other half for lunch the next day!

44.description: My families favorite place for pizza. We take the long drive from the far north side to go here. We first saw this place on check please and instantly said we have to try it. We have been here more than 10 times by now and never have a complaint. We recently began exploring other options on the menu and everything is great. MUST try their pork wings! Pizzas are awesome along with their daily specials. Salads are good. We just love this place.

24.description: Great service and great selection of food and atmosphere at the restaurant. Fresh and food has flavor. Dine in only. Delivery might want to stick to somewhere else.

7.description: This place was alright. Their pizza was not as good as I expected. And before they give the drinks menu, they should first check the IDs. They need to follow the rules if they don't want to take the responsibility later on if something happens.

49.description: This place is great.  As other reviewers commented, legit and delicious. In my experience, the food is prepared thoughtfully and is super tasty, especially the pizzas. The staff could be a little more involved, but whatever, it's a casual place, my group is preoccupied talking amongst ourselves and the restaurant is always busy so I don't care too much as long as the food comes out on time. If you're trying to decide between The Scout and Flo & Santos, go with Flo.

40.description: This is our go-to Friday night spot. Pork wings, pizza, buffalo chicken sandwich, and waffle fries are all A+. Great beer selection and a fun place to watch a game.

53.description: I was in Chicago on business and was on a rental bicycle looking for pizza and lo and behold Flo and Santos was the closest and it did not disappoint.  Great food and a good beer selection.  What more could you want?

30.description: Pizza was good. They serve thin crust which is an alternative from the Chicago Deep Dish which is so prevalent. I didn't like that you couldn't substitute ingredients on the pizzas which slightly limited what I wanted. Otherwise, the sevice was good and the place is worth a visit so you can give your own review.

46.description: Flo's is my favorite restaurant.  I love the thin pepperoni and sausage pizza. Flo's has great wine and beer.  The restaurant is clean and the ambience is awesome!!  Flo's has good and fast service.   I recommend this place. You should try it out!!

1.description: Still loving Flo's.  I think this is some of the best pizza in the city.  I order mine on the well done side.  The outer edges has just enough char.  so good.The sausage is great.  The wings are spot on.  Tons of beers and vodkas.Bears game days can get very hectic.  Watch the schedule.

55.description: Been living in the south loop for quite some time now and at a loss for words. Friends of mine from New York which I am from they live in the upper East side of Manhattan Soho area came in to see my neighborhood that I've been bragging about for quite some time now and put it this way on the laughingstock of the group thank you for Santos may I continue  they were a bit apprehensive going in because you do not have curb appeal but I convinced them that it was a cool place and bathrooms are clean and again wrong move put it this way you did not even have to put the air conditioning on because the staff was so cold you can feel the freeze from the sidewalk the staff is not friendly and did not acknowledge them right away after having to beg for a drink and getting the bill and come to find out paying $11 for a Jamison is in acceptable  these people are bankers they go to Vegas they been around the world Japan etc. etc. you do the math unreal if you want to get ripped off go there just bring your wallet and your credit cards and the manager is so rude and the bathrooms are disgusting  I feel like calling to heath department on this one it is not right has open kitchen it looks clean but how clean is the kitchen if the bathrooms are disgusting I had to beg for toilet paper  . Enclosing my friends from New York are so laughing as Chicago they came in for the air or so and will never come back again because of this restaurant it takes one idiot to ruin the whole vacation and the way the manager spoke to them about the price and he said "deal with it". loss for words I doubt they'll be back to Chicago to visit me thank you rude ignorant and all the above I would never recommend this place is embarrassment to the south loop period One more question for you who the hell do you think you are ? seriously you're not New York you're not Vegas years in the Southloop Chicago OK sorry lost major customers no hard feelings XO XO    One more thing here's dessert for you thanks for ruining my birthday appreciate it

9.description: So, I've been ordering and eating from F&S for a little over 2 years. I would say their pizza (thin crust) is quite good, albeit pricey.  Solid/good ingredients and a nice crust & sauce. Haven't ever had mushy pizza. Other stuff is "okay" (have had pierogies and a couple of their sandwiches).Their POLICY is that you can't remove anything from any of their specialty pizzas.
