I wanted to order pizzas today, one of which was the Veggie - without olives (without, not asking for a substitution).  They refused - citing policy.  She even said that it would "cost me a lot more to do a build-your-own without olives", so I should just take the olives.That "policy" will keep me away permanently - so I'm done with F&S. I really don't have time for restaurants that have unreasonable policies. I'm REALLY curious what purpose this serves. They even would have got a few free olives from me, but instead they lost a customer for life.

26.description: Consistently amazing pizza.  Huge selection of toppings to create the perfect combination.  Very comfortable dining environment with attentive service.  Vast menu supplemented by daily specials.  Extensive selection of beers and cocktails.  Carryout has always gone off without a hitch.  The order is prepared and ready in a timely fashion with attention to detail.  I love their meatballs and order the pizza extra thin and crispy.  Fanfriggentastic.  You can't go wrong.

25.description: Great food and beer selections- horrible wait staff. All the employers were rolling eyes at each other and the customers, they took forever to put in bar orders; everyone seemed to work against each other and the customers got the worst of it. I saw many annoyed tables- many who went up to the waitress station to ask for help because no waiter came to their table.

12.description: Nice variety of beers on tap and unique menu items, if I were in the area, I could see this being my favorite local bar. They seemed to have a nice sense of community with a lot of regulars paying a visit when I stopped by for a beer and some snacks. Spacious restaurant area, nice bar tenders, what's not to love!

59.description: I'd be willing to go back and try some other stuff. The pizza was average, the toppings were good. we got the margherita pizza with sun dried tomatoes on top. It was good, but could have had more sauce.  The crust was a bit overcooked, but pretty solid.  My husband got the polish pizza. He liked ours a lot better.  The best part was the cheese fries.  The waffle fries were cooked perfectly and the cheese was good.  We'd  go back and try some of their other pizzas for sure.  The biggest problem is that it was a pretty expensive pizza.

21.description: I've eaten at Flo & Santos a lot of times and I've always had a great experience. My favorite thing to order is the pizza with Italian beef and giardinieria peppers and an order of waffle fries. I think this is "Marco's Italian Beef" pizza on the specialty menu but I like mine withouth onions so I customize it. This pizza is usually around $18 for a 12" so not super cheap but still reasonable and definitely worth it. Not sure if it can really feed 2 people, depends on how hungry you are and how much your partner eats too. Enjoy!

17.description: Pizza was good. They serve thin crust which is an alternative from the Chicago Deep Dish which is so prevalent. I didn't like that you couldn't substitute ingredients on the pizzas which slightly limited what I wanted. Otherwise, the sevice was good and the place is worth a visit so you can give your own review.

10.description: I came here recently as my lady has always told me this place was awesome. My experience here was just ok. I was told they had all these awesome vodka cocktails that she raved about, but once we looked at the menu she didn't see the drinks that she liked and then we figured they changed them seasonally...I can respect that. I ended up drinking a spiked root beer type of drink which was ok. I decided not to drink anything else after, but they do have a good beer list. I was also told the pizza here is awesome so we were gonna go with that. We were starving so we decided to start with the calamari which was good. We ordered a 14"pizza with sausage, sun dried tomatoes and caramelized onion...was pretty decent. Our server didn't really seem engaged with going over anything with us and she would disappear for long periods of time. We just assumed that she must have been working all of the tables in the joint. The place itself is bigger that what I thought it would be and is very sporty with TVs all over the joint to catch the games. I would come back to try some of their famous vodka drinks.

5.description: Great beer, very chill/casual environment. Good pizza and perogis too - we ordered the italian beef pizza which is not a usual kind I would order, but it was fantastic.

3.description: Went here today for lunch with a friend.  When we arrived at 11:30 it was empty..except for one other table.  When we left it was about half full.  The location lends itself well for the working lunch and later in the evening to the people in the neighborhood.  Place is nice, reminds me of a standard pizza joint in NYC.  Nice and simple menu with a wide variety of sandwiches and pizza options.  The prices are a bit high, but the quality was good and the portions aren't bad.  I got the lunch special pizza (personal pan size) and the chicken noodle soup.  The soup had lots of chunky fresh chicken and vegetable.  My friend got the italian beef and said it was great as well. The only negative I have is the waitress was more interested in chit chatting, than in taking our orders and checking on how we were doing.  Otherwise the service was great.  Food hot and plentiful.

35.description: Hard to find a cook Polish spot in the city, but this places checks all the boxes. The pizza is amazing, the pierogies are decent (but as an app at a Sports bar - they are good), the onion rings are on POINT (PLEASE ORDER). Great selection of polish beer and sammies.

19.description: Delish! We are visiting from Florida and the Marcos Italian pizza was awesome. A good kick of spice but the flavored were awesome. The pierogi sampler appetizer was also delicious as was the kielbasa sandwich. Really enjoyed dinner here.

28.description: Great pizza with Polish Sausage and the Pierogi appetizer was just as great!

45.description: Ordered pizza last night for delivery. Took about an hour but I wasn't really in a rush. Pizza (pepperoni and mushrooms) had quite a bit of garlic so if you don't really like garlic, you may not like the pizza. I actually thought it was pretty good, not great. I'm not a reviewer who gives a place 1 star just because everything wasn't perfect however, when I opened the pizza box, the first two sliced ends were stacked on top of each other because the delivery woman obviously didn't carry the pizza flat (posted a picture of it as well). That's just INEXCUSABLE.  How do you expect a customer to have a good 1st time experience when your pizza was delivered in such a non-caring, nonchalant manner? If I do order here again, it definitely won't be via delivery so chances are, I'll be less likely to take the walk from Printer's Row when I have other choices like Lou Malnatis where I can pick up a pizza and make sure the pizza doesn't slide over in the pizza box.  The pizza was pretty good, but the delivery experience was bad. I just feel bad I had to include the tip in GrubHub for that. Pizza-wise I would have given it 3 or 4 stars, but you can't overlook the entire package.

33.description: This review is for takeout only. I placed a takeout order this past Friday at about 7pm and I was told the pizza would be ready in 20-25 min. I walked into the restaurant 20 min later and sure enough, the pizza was boxed and waiting for me. The restaurant was pretty packed and the vibe was great. Pizza is thin crust and a Family size was sufficient for 3 of us even though, the restaurant suggests it serves 3-4. The pizza itself was loaded well with toppings and baked just right with a charred crust but not burnt. When compared to other pizza places around, its priced a little bit higher but then again it is a full sit down restaurant. We'll certainly be back next time for the full service dining experience.

43.description: I came in for a pick up with a friend and I was completely turned off because we didn't get acknowledged by the staff for about 5 minutes. They (three of them) were just standing, conversing and didn't even bother to see what we needed as we awkwardly stood there...but I bet you're wondering why I gave the four stars then. The pizza is phenomenal. The best thin crust pizza I've had to this day! I would def recommend a friend to come here any day but the staff needs to clean up their act ASAP!

2.description: My 5-star rating is for the pizza. I'm a thin-crust lover and FLO is my second favorite pizza spot in Chicago (after the south-side's Vito & Nicks)! When I am in the neighborhood it is a must-visit. I go there 1) for the pizza & pierogis 2) the Patio for pre/post Bears game festivities.

18.description: Cool little place in the south loop. Great pork wings and beer selection. Fun atmosphere and big space that's good for groups and kids.  Definitely try the pork wings - so good and the best thing here. Braised pork shank, on the bone, then deep fried about slathered in either buffalo, bbq, or teriyaki sauce.  Then have the s'mores desert pizza. So good that makes you think that you're at the fire roasting some marshmallows. Pizza....well...just ok. Inventive combinations but not the best here. We tried the pepperoni pizza, margarita, and Italian beef. Def order don't the margarita...like eating frozen pizza I've gotta say. Best is pepperoni but would not come back for it. 100 other places are better. Italian beef was good but nothing special. Service...also just ok. Not bad but our server seemed to be in a bad mood the whole night. Again, not rude but not pleasant either. Would come back for a beer and wings...at the bar.

41.description: No deep dish pizza? I thought this was Chicago. While the thin stuff was good, it didn't blow me away. Also, our service wasn't great. We sat unnoticed at a table for 15 min before finally flagging down. Then more prolonged waiting. My brother had to order a beer multiple times before it was finally brought out to him.

52.description: Pizza and Pierogis.  Why has it taken a Polish Chicagoan like me so long to get here?  Well, I did try to order a pre-order a pizza to be ready for me when I got there due to a short lunch break when I was employed up the street.  The server was seemingly confused at the concept and just kept putting me on hold.  So, I gave up and I brooded for awhile.  Then the need to try Polish pizza was too much and I talked a few friends into going with me.THANK GOODNESS I got over myself.  Cheap beer and some mighty fine tasting pizza.  Kielbasa, sauerkraut and bacon pizza.  Cheese and sauce too.  Cooked, the flavors mellow and meld and you will find yourself reaching for 'one last slice' even as your belly is going to burst.  Planning a group outing there next month.  Such a nice corner of Chicago.  Street parking, ample restaurants, fun atmosphere.

50.description: This place is really, really legit. My girlfriends and I showed up a little drunk after a Bears game.... got rejected from across the street and they welcomed us in. And then, we were creeping on a table's take out pizza slice that the manager (Phil) was going to box, and he came back out later with an extra "mistake" pizza for us. It's stuff like this that separates a phenomenal customer experience from a visit to some restaurant. The food is good, the people are awesome, super impressed. We'll be back.

4.description: Stop 1 on a pizza tour. Had never heard of a Polish/Italian fusion restaurant, but I was quite impressed!We were given 3 types of pizzas to try- italian beef with giardinera, a sauerkraut and kielbasa pizza, and their farmer's market pizza (this rotates in flavors) which was roasted brussel sprouts and a white sauce.My favorite was the italian beef one- nice kick from the peppers and the beef had good flavor too! YUM. I know the Polish pizza made many believers on our tour group (2 people said "I hate sauerkraut, but this pizza changed my mind!"), but I'm not a huge kielbasa fan, and this had thick pieces on it, so it wasn't my favorite. The white pizza was different than expected. I guess when I hear the word "white sauce" I think of crappy alfredo from Olive Garden, but this was a nice feta sauce that had great flavor. The roasted brussel sprouts were thick pieces and also pretty good, but I think my pizza brain couldn't wrap its head around the concept of a brussel sprout pizza, so I didn't end up eating the whole piece. The restaurant is long and narrow, and remained crowded the whole time we were there. There's an outdoor patio area which turned into a heated tent area for the winter. We were forced to sit out there since our tour group had 17 people in it, and the owner/manager felt bad, since it was cold. He came out with a Polish vodka and gave us all shots to warm us up! The thought was really kind, vodka was smooth, and the experience was great! I will definitely come back!

6.description: Damn good stuff.  Close to the orange line so an easy ride for us southsiders.  Good for decent prices.  Loved the fling pork wings and calimari was spot on.  Polish sauseege was tastee but thought the italian beef was dry and a bit on the pimpy side.

22.description: A food anchor for the neighborhood. Every pizza is delicious, and the beer selection is tops. Service is always quick, and those pizzas really do show up on time.Not a cheap date, but great dates rarely are.Pro-tip: get the pierogis, at least once.

15.description: A food anchor for the neighborhood. Every pizza is delicious, and the beer selection is tops. Service is always quick, and those pizzas really do show up on time.Not a cheap date, but great dates rarely are.Pro-tip: get the pierogis, at least once.

57.description: Been a regular for approximately 6 years. Consistently good food and beer.  Try the Pork Wings, Grace's Favorite Pizza, and Marco's Italian Beef Pizza.  The Polska Keilbasa is obscene.  Only complaint: Never once -- seriously, not once! -- has their beer menu been up to date. 7/30/15 Kurt

20.description: Went here based on reviews but have to say I wasn't impressed. I really wanted the waffle fries with blue cheese and those aren't available, don't bother with the cheddar ones. Our pierogi platter was decent but nothing special and our Pizza was burned around the edges. Great atmosphere and drinks on the good side.

36.description: The Polish pizza is SO GOOD. This was our first stop in Chicago after I insisted on it remembering how harmonious that pizza was with the kielbasa and sauerkraut. I usually get sour cream on the side for the pizza which makes it even better. The bloody mary I had too was fantastic. The polish vodka was very smooth and the bloody mary mix had the perfect amount of spice. I had one of the polish lagers as well, and although it was more along the lines of a pilsner it was still delish.They have great outdoor seating and dogs are welcome!

14.description: The Polish pizza is SO GOOD. This was our first stop in Chicago after I insisted on it remembering how harmonious that pizza was with the kielbasa and sauerkraut. I usually get sour cream on the side for the pizza which makes it even better. The bloody mary I had too was fantastic. The polish vodka was very smooth and the bloody mary mix had the perfect amount of spice. I had one of the polish lagers as well, and although it was more along the lines of a pilsner it was still delish.They have great outdoor seating and dogs are welcome!

28.description: I decided to propose, and a friend recommended this joint for the flowers.I walked in and I'm like, "hey.  I have no idea what I'm doing.  Help me out."  This goes on, and my stupidity excels, and the gentleman helping me never loses his patience, and he talked me out of several very bad ideas, which led to a very simple, beautiful red and white rose bouquet with a Christmas touch.  The man was very informative, gave me a good deal, and made me look way less dumb and nervous than I really am.Good experience, good joint, great arrangements, great service, good prices.  Definitely returning.

1.description: I heard so many great things about Henry Hampton Floral so on a whim I decided to stop in for flowers for a friend's birthday. I had an idea of what I wanted and chatted with David. My request was a black box with a dozen roses needed the next day. David, custom made my box, and placed 12 long stemmed roses with Eucalyptus in the box. I was BEYOND impressed by the class and elegance he created in so little time. Moving forward keeping it masculine. I can honestly say friends (men and women) were raving about my flowers for days! Thank you David for your creativity, excellent work ethic, and putting my vision to reality. You are amazing!!!!!!!!!

9.description: Still fantastic across the board. Small town feel with Chicago level Service.  Great eye for design and always willing to go the extra mile to make sure I'm happy. Thanks David.

29.description: Just got 2 houseplants (fake ones) for a great deal during their 50% off sale.  Service was helpful and honest, and also not too into your face, which I love since I like being able to take my time and look around.  Overall a great experience and a great place to buy some decorations for our new south loop apartment.

23.description: Henry Hampton did our wedding flowers in early September. We were students on a budget, and this florist worked with us and did not disappoint. My bouquet looked wild and fresh and lasted for days once I plopped it in a vase at home. My maid of honor's bouquet was so gorgeous that I almost stole it when I first saw it. The color and texture were so lush! Most remarkably of all, when I told David that for the centerpieces I had bottles and wanted to order bulk flowers to fill them, he said, "It will be cheaper and more fun to just go to the farmer's market." He even recommended a favorite grower that sells there. I so appreciate that he gave us the best advice instead making a somewhat larger sale. What a pro! We will definitely use Henry Hampton again.

5.description: Always friendly and helpful on the phone. Delivery as promised. Just give them some ideas on colors or flower types and the bouquets come out fantastic.

31.description: I love this place, it has that urban feel  you don't get from most flower shops.  They have a large assortment of flowers and I can have an arrangement customized on the spot.  Their flowers are fresh and last a long time.  Prices are reasonable too!

25.description: All The People that work there are so pleasent. Thank you so much for making such beautiful arrangments for the graduate. You are the best!!!!!

12.description: Skip the grocery stores and go to a real florist!I have been a frequent customer of Henry Hampton Florist for a few years now. Every time I come in David is friendly and accommodating. He has made beautiful arrangements for several charity events I have been involved in and every week can be counted on to make a wonderful bouquet for my wife. Whatever the size of the order, David can be counted on for wonderful suggestions and a fantastic finished product. If you want great product and service, I highly recommend Henry Hampton Florist.

21.description: Horrible service...  After my grandma passed away, a good friend tried to send me flowers from this florist.  The guy who called to inform me of the delivery, David, was very unpleasant to speak with.  Very rude and inconsiderate.  After the flowers did not come within the designated delivery time frame (and after waiting at home for that long), I called to ask about them.  He claimed they were already delivered, and implied that I must have been lying.  After finally convincing him there were no flowers delivered, he did not even apologize and just asked when I wanted them re-delivered.  Even while knowing the flowers were for my late grandmother, he did not even do so.  Perhaps this florist is good, and David is the problem.  In that case, try to avoid working with David at all costs.

16.description: ***PLEASE NOTE**** They have moved locations and are now at 1335 S. State Street.I've been going here for years.  This place is amazing and the owner one of the kindest people in the world.  Just picked up flowers here for mothers day and was wowed again.  I wish I could give this place 6 stars :)

17.description: I placed an order for a simple flower arrangement to be delivered to my wife at her work place on our anniversary. They did a fantastic job of putting together a beautiful arrangement and my wife enjoyed them.

10.description: I was looking for a local florist to send flowers to a friend. After reading the posts on Henry Hampton Floral, I decided to give them a try. I called my order in after looking at the website (Telaflora based). I referenced an arrangement that I saw on the website, but gave them free reign to do something similar in cost.  My friend sent me a picture and it is spectacular!!!! It was an assortment of colored roses with baby's breath and some kind of tiny pink flower and it looked so beautiful.  It was in a clear vase with a beautiful sheer bow around the neck of the vase. My friend felt special and honored. I would definitely order from them again! Also, he gave a two hour window for the delivery on this day and got it to her within the hour! I'm sure that depends on how busy the day is, but it sure was a nice and prompt delivery from when the thought hit me to do this to when my friend got it! I also thought the price was in a good!

11.description: I walked into Henry Hampton Floral exactly one week before my wedding, in mid July, looking for a wildflower bouquet and worried I had not given myself enough time... I must have looked stressed because the first thing the owner said, without prompting from me, was "Are you getting married today or tomorrow?". When I told him it wasn't until the following Saturday he told me I had all the time in the world!  He was extremely friendly and amazing to work with. I didn't know what I wanted, but I knew I wanted wildflowers, after looking very briefly at only one photo on my phone he made me the PERFECT bouquet, that was exactly what I envisioned.  I had also ordered hops online to make boutonnieres but David made the groom's boutonniere with a couple of pieces of hops that I gave him and and the same wildflowers from my bouquet, and it was also perfect! While we only purchased my bouquet and boutonnieres from Henry Hampton Floral, their prices were reasonable and the outcome was perfect and beautiful!

26.description: I love Henry Hampton Florist!!  They created arrangements for both my wedding and my daughter's Christening, and I could not have been more pleased!!! The individual I worked with definitely had a bit of sass to him, but he was funny and good to work with.  He even suggested that I could buy my own vases to save money! What florist does that!?!? For my wedding, I provided a few pictures of potential bouquets I would be interested in, and when the bouquets arrived at our hotel -- they were better than I expected!!! Gorgeous! For my daughter's Christening, all I told him was "Springy and girly" and he set up some time for me to see a sample of what he was thinking.  When I went in for the sample, I wanted to mix some of the colors around and he was totally helpful in getting more, as he called it "ummppfffh" in the centerpieces! It was great! They turned out beautifully!! Highly recommend!

27.description: This florist had an issue with my order and, in my opinion, was very unpleasant to deal with trying to get it resolved. I do not recommend this florist. I've never had problems like this from FTD or 1800Flowers.

0.description: I'm very lucky to have a thoughtful boyfriend who sends me flowers. With little guidance other than a color scheme (i.e. purple and white when I graduated from NU, pinks and greens in the springtime, red and green for the holidays, etc.), Henry Hampton has created and delivered over a dozen bouquets to me, and every single one has been beautiful. The florists are extremely talented and they only use the freshest of flowers. I change the water once in the morning and once at night and it isn't unusual for my bouquets to last 10 days. The one time my bf didn't use them there was a noticeable difference. The quality wasn't the same and the arrangement was sparse.  So I'd highly recommend Henry Hampton if you're looking for beautiful, quality flowers.

20.description: I look so forward to our weekly Henry Hampton floral arrangement delivery at work! They truly are works of art and in 4 years I have never seen the same arrangement twice! Love love love!

19.description: Horrible service...  After my grandma passed away, a good friend tried to send me flowers from this florist.  The guy who called to inform me of the delivery, David, was very unpleasant to speak with.  Very rude and inconsiderate.  After the flowers did not come within the designated delivery time frame (and after waiting at home for that long), I called to ask about them.  He claimed they were already delivered, and implied that I must have been lying.  After finally convincing him there were no flowers delivered, he did not even apologize and just asked when I wanted them re-delivered.  Even while knowing the flowers were for my late grandmother, he did not even do so.  Perhaps this florist is good, and David is the problem.  In that case, try to avoid working with David at all costs.

2.description: Awesome job as usual. I trust no one but Henry with my floral decorations. Every funeral, every special occasion, every birthday party, etc. Prices are great as well!

18.description: I decided to propose, and a friend recommended this joint for the flowers.I walked in and I'm like, "hey.  I have no idea what I'm doing.  Help me out."  This goes on, and my stupidity excels, and the gentleman helping me never loses his patience, and he talked me out of several very bad ideas, which led to a very simple, beautiful red and white rose bouquet with a Christmas touch.  The man was very informative, gave me a good deal, and made me look way less dumb and nervous than I really am.Good experience, good joint, great arrangements, great service, good prices.  Definitely returning.

13.description: Love this place. I'll be back soon for more flowers. My arrangements are just beautiful.

4.description: I went to Henry Hampton Floral on a referral for my wedding flowers.  Thank God I did!! I had a very particular vision when it came to my bouquet as well as my centerpieces and was terrified that I would not find someone who could pull it off.  My bouquet was something I saw out of a bridal magazine - long, cascading, and elegant.  My centerpieces were manzanita branches with bright flowers and hanging votives that were tied in together.  Again, not the norm - and not easy to pull off!  I was left absolutely breathless when I saw the finished product. Not only did they pull it off - it was even BETTER than what I saw in magazines. I received endless compliments the day of the wedding and my bouquet was featured on Style Me Pretty. I could go on forever about how wonderful they are - but you get the picture. My wedding would not have been as gorgeous as it was were it not for the talented people who work here (David)!  I am officially a lifelong customer.  Below is a link so you could see the work yourself.stylemepretty.com/2015/0…

24.description: My boyfriend and I have been getting flowers from Henry Hampton Florist for three years and have always been impressed by the quality of the flowers and the customer service that we have received.  David, the owner, can whip up an amazing arrangement to meet our vague and varied requests.  He never fails to deliver flowers that have our friends oooooh and aaaaah. He is very conscious of cost and can work with any budget. Trust him and he will not let you down.

6.description: No matter the occasion, David is always able to provide me with a fresh and beautiful arrangement. From my high school prom, many family funerals, or even just an "I'm thinking of you" arrangements to my mom and sister, I am never disappointed.  Even without providing much insight to what I want, I am treated with patience, and kindness despite my being indecisive. All he needs is a color scheme and he gets right to it! My family's go to for all things floral. Never a disappointment.

22.description: ***PLEASE NOTE**** They have moved locations and are now at 1335 S. State Street.I've been going here for years.  This place is amazing and the owner one of the kindest people in the world.  Just picked up flowers here for mothers day and was wowed again.  I wish I could give this place 6 stars :)

15.description: I was in Chicago on business (staying in the South Loop at the Hyatt McCormick Place) and needed a floral arrangement as a gift.  Found Henry Hampton Florist via Yelp and made the trip.Touchdown.  David could not have been more helpful!  He figured out exactly what I needed, pulled it all together, and made a beautiful arrangement that cost less than I thought it would.  This is a terrific shop, and in its new location, he could use the word getting out.Please give Henry Hampton Florist a try.  I'm so glad I did.

7.description: I have been there twice so far.  Always helpful even with my discombobulated requests.  Although a little on the expensive side, the flowers are always gorgeous and last a very long time.  Definitely put a smile on my girlfriend's face.

8.description: I thought I would give them a chance again this year for valentine's day.  Apparently I should have gone elsewhere.Last year, they screwed up my order and didn't even know who I was when I came to pick up my flowers.  After waiting for almost 45 minutes, they finally found my order.  However, they had no record of me having already paid and would not let me leave without giving them a credit card number.  And of course they did exactly what I knew they would and charged me twice.  I spent the next 3 weeks getting them to take the double charge off.Now today the roses I picked up were wrapped in plastic and I couldn't see the detail until I got home.  I almost didn't even give them to my wife because they were so bad.  Every single rose either had dead spots and was wilting or was torn.  Prices are already sky high during valentine's day, but when I spend that much money on roses, they had better be perfect.  Their flowers are far from that.I'll definitely be shopping for a new florist next year during this time.

30.description: A classic boutique flower shop: Fresh flowers, beautiful arrangements, fair prices, good service, owner with a unique and charming personality.  I have bought a lot of flowers over the last 25 years.  This is one of the best shops that I've had the pleasure to deal with...

3.description: I used Henry Hampton Floral for my June 2015 wedding and the team there was incredible! The centerpieces were stunning, my bouquet and bridesmaids bouquets were better than I could have even imagined and the customer service was outstanding.  I first discovered Henry Hampton when I stopped in one day to pick up a bouquet for a friend's bridal shower and casually asked about their services and prices. I mentioned my budget (which according to other florists was "very low") and a rough idea of what I was looking for and instead of hearing "unfortunately, our minimum price range is...." or "For that amount your only going to get..." I was told they could most certainly work with me. After an in-person meeting with David to go over what I wanted, we then scheduled a time to look at three samples--yes! They put together 1. exactly what I asked for 2. what they thought would look best 3. something in the middle. I can't tell you what a wonderful perk this is! Not surprising, what they put together is what I selected and I left feeling 100% confident as to what I could expect on my wedding day. And when I had last minute changes, because I did, Denise was wonderful and would send me an updated outline reflecting all changes. Speaking of the wedding day, everything was delivered on time and both my cocktail and reception venues looked exceptional. I will upload photos once I receive them from my photographer. I absolutely recommend Henry Hampton Floral--they were a joy to work with!

14.description: We used Henry Hampton for our wedding flowers. We were so surprised at how reasonable their floral costs were and we loved working with them to narrow down what flowers would be in our bouquets and boutonnieres. They were very quick to answer any questions we had and were flexible when we had changes or add-ons. We picked our flowers up ahead of time so we could use them for photos and they were all labeled perfectly. The flowers turned out more beautiful than we imagined and they were the perfect addition to our wedding!

58.description: Hands down, my favorite sports bar in Chicago.I don't think I've ever had a bad experience here. The service is always great and the atmosphere is pretty consistent. It's usually a fun, young, vibrant crowd. It's especially wonderful in the summer because of the outdoor seating. Don't even get me started on the nachos!!!

56.description: The Scout burger is fantastic, and the giant bacon/jalepeno/grilled cheese was great.   One of the best sports bars in Chicago.

29.description: One of the very few places to go out in the South Loop. The food is good. The foot long grilled cheese is a really cool thing to have on your menu. The staff can be hit or miss. Sometimes we get someone friendly, sometimes it's a hot girl who was clearly hired for that reason b/c she's spaced out and not very attentive.

42.description: Walked over on a sunday, to grab lunch and a few drinks! This place is A OK! Pretty solid, good drinks, good food, good service. But nothing overly amazing. I ordered the bean burger, which was once again just good. My favorite part of my meal was not the burger, but the Sweet potato fries, they were great! My boyfriend had the grilled cheese, which was huge! But again it was just good! I might be back, but this place doesn't make me say "omg i have to come back and bring all my friends" haha

23.description: The food is absolutely amazing here and the beer selection is great!  We have just moved to Chicago a couple of months ago and have already been here 3 times.  We have tried a few different things on their menu including the foot long grilled cheese which was fantastic!  I will say that the atmosphere tends to be louder so having conversations can be a struggle on their busy nights.   However if you want to watch any of the Chicago sporting events, they have so many TV's, that pretty much anywhere you sit you will have a good view.  Hands down one of our favorites in the South Loop.

47.description: The food is great, and my wife and I have been regulars for years, but they recently added a new "air freshening" system that smells like cheap perfume.  We've tried eating here three time since the addition of the system (Spring 2015), but we've had to leave each time due to the crazy smell.  Once this "new system" is gone, we'll be returning.

8.description: This place is so amazing, very chilled and laid back, I come in from time to time to write and have a drink, I've been here twice, and I absolutely love it. Not to mention the BACON GRILLED CHEESE, my new favorite. Thanks for being warm and friendly to new customers.

31.description: Loud, like really loud inside. So it was a beautiful day in Chicago and we sat outside. Grilled cheese with bacon and jalapeños was great. Everyone enjoyed their dinner. More stars if not so loud, maybe I'm getting old. 30 is the new 65? Would go back.

34.description: Scout is a good place to eat at times. But if there is something major happening nearby (Bears game finishing up, Hawks in playoff,  some parade) they are crazy busy. And they get crazy sloppy with service. After two bad experience when they were busy I've only been back during slow periods and the food is great. The Margarita pizza is thin and delicious with actual mozzarella balls and leaves of fresh basil. The Mac and cheese is good, but if you add chicken it is amazing. My favorite is the foot long grilled cheese sandwich with tomato dip. It's can be a entree or easily an appetizer. I love cider and they have a small but good selection. I wish they had a couple more selection of ciders but now I'm just being picky. Good stuff when the timing is right.

16.description: This place is great! Always a go to place when we have friends in town. They have awesome food, service and space! I've never had anything here that I didn't like.

13.description: Their Guinness beer is great!!! A lot of places do not know how to correctly pour a Guinness beer. It's a must have and there booths are comfortable and the waitress was very nice. I also ate a signature burger and fries needless to say I am very satisfied with the experience at this location. A few friends and I recently met up there for a few drinks!!

11.description: This place is a reliable bet in my neighborhood, and it's usually where I tell friends to meet me who want to have a casual dinner and/or drink.  The footlong grilled cheese is amazing, but if you're not in the mood for the associated calories, their salads are also good.  Decent selection of beer, and I also really like their Sangria.  I didn't give five stars, because I've had issues with service before (nothing huge, though).  Overall, it's a solid neighborhood bar with some good food to go along with your drinks!

39.description: When we first scouted for places to live in the South Loop, the previous tenant in our soon-to-be unit advocated how quiet and neighborly the building was...excepting for one night when the Blackhawks won the Cup and descended upon a little bar named Scout in droves. Two years later, right before moving out of said apartment, lo and behold, the Hawks won again, and we saw Lord Stanley hoisted in all its glory at 13th and Wabash.Even without that cool occurrence, I don't understand the Scout-bashing on Yelp. At worst, everything is better than average. Seating is usually plentiful. The patio, during patio weather, is small but sufficient. The TV's are tuned to a myriad of sports, sure to capture your favorite. The menu can best be described as elevated bar food. The waitresses are quick and not uneasy on the eyes. The draft menu isn't craft beer optimal, but it's got enough staples to avoid sudsing Bud Lights. In fact, I had my first Green Line here and it's still a go-to.Maybe the whole 30 paces to my neighborhood bar thing is clouding my judgment, but I struggle to see what's not to like about Scout. But once I order that Green Line and pick a food item of choice, I'm pretty settled and happy about my life choices. Highlights on the menu include the insane pile of chicken nachos, the wings (my wife's go-to), and the grilled cheeses (I vote for the Wolff).I miss the walking distance option already.

37.description: We were in Chicago on business and wanted to get some food and watch the game. The food was great. Lots of choices when it comes to beer. I had the Prime Rib sandwich others had the grilled cheese. I really enjoyed both but liked my sandwich a little better. The service was also great. Good time.

0.description: Traveling to Chicago I wanted an exceptional grilled cheese. After a quick Google search, The Scout popped up atop many lists for best grilled cheese in the city. After a fun little trip on the red line, we arrived a few blocks away.Once inside, we were greeted by foreign fellow with a delightful accent. He made sure to know that they were hosting a party at 7pm (3 hours later) and we were welcome to be there but it may get loud. We were given the option of a plush, roomy booth and soon our waitress arrived. We ordered our drinks and food, ready for the great grilled cheese. My best friend and I ordered the regular grilled cheese and the third in our party a Flatbread (and fries). I ordered a tequila sunrise and our waitress asked what kind of tequila I wanted which was nice that she didn't assume I wanted the expensive stuff.The service was great, she came 3 or 4 times to check on us. The reason it's not 5 star is because although tasty, the grilled cheese wasn't exquisite. I dont find myself feeling like I must go back to pay $12 for a grilled cheese. The tomato dipping sauce was a fun treat and a neat take on tomato soup. Apart from being a footlong, there wasn't anything particularly great.TLDR: great service, decent atmosphere, but grilled cheese was something I could easily make at home.

38.description: My friends and I came here for a celebratory after hours hangout. The staff was great, the food was great. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.

51.description: I have been going to Scout for years and truly loved this place until last night. I accidentally left my phone on the table with my signed check. I returned 5 minutes later to retrieve my phone, and the table had just been cleaned. I talked with the manger and explained what happened. I also explained the the find my phone app said that my phone was still there. The manager went to "ask around", but I was then told that no one had seen my phone. I then asked to look at the security camera footage, and I was told that the cameras "conveniently" do not cover the booth I was siting at. I also spoke with the table directly across from mine, and I was informed that no one had been at my table except the waitress and cleaning guy. Then I looked at the find my phone app again, and my phone had been turned off. I explained all of this and asked for the manager to talk with her staff again, but she told me that she could not shake down her staff and that I was not allowed to interrogate them. I was basically told that there was nothing she could do, but I could try to come back tomorrow. I came back this morning, and she admitted that they have had this problem before with staff members stealing things. She also told me that she told her staff... "I know that one you took it, and someone better find her phone."... Unfortunately, I am still without a phone and this is very disheartening. As a loyal customer, I am very disappointed. I have filed a police report and plan to file a complaint with the BBB. I also will take some sort of legal action. As a business, you have to be responsible for the actions of your employees. As the manager, Heather, admitted, this is not the first time that this has happened, I hope that Scout will take more responsibility for its employees in the future, instead of telling its customer... "I'm sorry... there is nothing that I can do."

27.description: I've been here twice now. Once before a Bears game and it was ass to elbows. Great lively time with great service at the front bar.Second time was last night before seeing Kaskade on Navy Pier. The restaurant I had made a reservation at couldn't accommodate us.... we were hungry, we were in a time crunch and there were 10 of us, watch out!The Scout accomodated us no problem. They said they needed the table by 6 pm for another reservation but that was fine because we needed to be on our way by then.Service was very prompt. Drinks came out FAST as did the food. Awesome experience. We all shared grilled cheeses and got various salads and appetizers to snack on as well, best grilled cheese ever as the pictures show. Super grateful that we were able to share a delicious dinner together before our show despite the mishap at the previous restaurant. Great atmosphere as well.They do require one check for large parties, FYI

32.description: Their Guinness beer is great!!! A lot of places do not know how to correctly pour a Guinness beer. It's a must have and there booths are comfortable and the waitress was very nice. I also ate a signature burger and fries needless to say I am very satisfied with the experience at this location. A few friends and I recently met up there for a few drinks!!

54.description: A group of us went here at the last minute. Excellent service and superb burgers. We enjoyed the sangria and Peach Palmer.

48.description: Super rude bouncers with very nasty attitude who don't know how to talk to customers in the proper way.

44.description: This is the kind of place I wish I had in my neighborhood - an upscale sports bar with a solid beer list and decent pub grub. Atmosphere - 5, Service - 5, Food - 4, Drinks - 4.The first thing you'll notice is the place is pretty big with a few different areas of seating so you can get a dinner vibe, sports bar vibe or "hide away in a corner" vibe which I liked. We were quickly greeted by a friendly server who gave us the lay of the land and didn't leave us stranded which I appreciate. Nothing like sitting down, not being ready to order and then your server disappears for 15 minutes... One thing you'll notice is there are lots (and lots) of TV's so I would imagine this is a good place to watch a game (well, duh - thanks Einstein) but as the Bears were just starting training camp, I'll have to wait to see what it's like on gameday. We ordered a margherita flatbread pizza and some guac and chips. Both excellent choices. Guac was fresh (and plentiful) and the pizza was nice and thin with fresh tomatoes and basil. Quite tasty.  Food came out quite quickly too which is a plus.Server was always around and the water glasses never went empty. plates were cleared quickly so overall A+ on the service. As we were leaving around 8pm I could see the place was turning over a bit with the crowd moving from dinner / drinks to bachelorette parties and bros with backwards baseball caps so if that's your scene, you'll like this place the later it gets.Overall a solid choice if you're in the South Loop looking for somewhere fun with lots of TV's and good food and drink.

24.description: Ended up at The Scout because my first destination was closed. The atmosphere was a bit loud for it not being very busy inside. They have a great beer menu with highlights on local and seasonal drinks. I tried Off-Color's Troublesome Gose Sour - SO good. I'm just getting into sour beers, and this one wasn't too sour. For dinner, I had my mind set on fish tacos and was very disappointed. The fish itself was grilled and tasty. The tacos were garnished with a carrot and pickled cabbage(?) mix - I picked it all off, it had no taste or crunch. However, the tacos were served with a side of red chili green beans that were delicious! Also, my boyfriend ordered miso grilled salmon on a bed of farro from the specials menu, and his meal was so so so much better than mine in taste, composition, and presentation. I'd like to try this place again, but I'll stick with ordering from the special/seasonal menu next time.

7.description: When we first scouted for places to live in the South Loop, the previous tenant in our soon-to-be unit advocated how quiet and neighborly the building was...excepting for one night when the Blackhawks won the Cup and descended upon a little bar named Scout in droves. Two years later, right before moving out of said apartment, lo and behold, the Hawks won again, and we saw Lord Stanley hoisted in all its glory at 13th and Wabash.Even without that cool occurrence, I don't understand the Scout-bashing on Yelp. At worst, everything is better than average. Seating is usually plentiful. The patio, during patio weather, is small but sufficient. The TV's are tuned to a myriad of sports, sure to capture your favorite. The menu can best be described as elevated bar food. The waitresses are quick and not uneasy on the eyes. The draft menu isn't craft beer optimal, but it's got enough staples to avoid sudsing Bud Lights. In fact, I had my first Green Line here and it's still a go-to.Maybe the whole 30 paces to my neighborhood bar thing is clouding my judgment, but I struggle to see what's not to like about Scout. But once I order that Green Line and pick a food item of choice, I'm pretty settled and happy about my life choices. Highlights on the menu include the insane pile of chicken nachos, the wings (my wife's go-to), and the grilled cheeses (I vote for the Wolff).I miss the walking distance option already.

49.description: Good service. Plenty of room. Nice outdoor area. Minutes from Roosevelt el stop for all my Southside brethren. Great beer selection and lots of menu options.  Great end to our divvy tour of lakefront.

40.description: This is the second time my boyfriend and I have been here. The food is awesome and the environment is so great. But our waitress is seriously the best! Colleen was so friendly and advised us on everything great to eat. I will absolutely be back and I will ask for her. She made our dining experience awesome without being pushy! We love it here

53.description: I had a panko-crusted chicken sandwich, topped with a fried green tomato, drizzled in a jalapeño bacon sauce, and nestled in an onion bun.  Um...YUM!!!  For the side, I chose their Brussel sprout salad.  They chop Brussel sprouts similar to a cole slaw texture, then add a little sautéed bacon, and toss in a champagne vinaigrette.  I don't care for coleslaw, but this was refreshingly light with a cool and crisp crunch.  The ambience is true to Chicago's south loop style, casual, friendly, and easy on the pocket.Oh!  Do try their house sangria - DIVINE!

30.description: Great neighborhood bar with above average food and service  TVs galore, so plenty of space to watch a game and the game you want is always on somewhere.  Definitely a crowded place, no matter the day, but bears game days i try to stay away because it gets too crowded.  Definitely one of my favorite local sports bars, and the service is always great.

46.description: I live in the neighborhood and have been a patron for years, however, after how I was treated on Thursday night I won't be going back anytime soon. Four friends and I were enjoying our first beer when two of my friends started singing a song. The bouncer came over and told them to stop and that we were "too loud" and "disturbing the tables around us".  We looked around us and all the tables were empty......um?  Then the bouncer kept saying "Are we cool, man? Are we cool?"  We quieted down and continued enjoying our beers. When we went to order a second round, the hostess came over to tell us that the bouncer had cut us off!  Ummm....what?!  Over singing?  Seriously?  We tried talking to the bouncer and he told us to leave and then gave us the middle finger as we were leaving.  I asked him his name and he finally told me "Walter". Yeah, right. I have never been treated so rudely before.  I've also witnessed on MANY occasions much rider behavior and never seen anyone kicked out for it. Scout - your people are your brand. Is this how you want to be represented????

1.description: I've only ever been here on Bears game days so of course it's very very packed. That doesn't bother me at all, I love the atmosphere. The food is absolutely delicious. I've had the wild berry bliss stuffed french toast, the breakfast burrito, the triple cheese grilled cheese, pulled chicken nachos, the big scout burger, and more. Never a complaint about the food! My biggest issue is with the service. It never fails that we always get a rude waitress who acts like we are inconveniencing her just by existing. I'm always there with a group of 4-6 people. We're never the people that have picky orders and a million special requests. Always a very easy going, friendly group with simple orders but you would think we're asking these waitresses to give us their limbs. Unfortunately, I think we've probably reached out limit with the poor service here.

55.description: It was a nice day out so an old friend and I decided to catch up here. It was a pleasant experience. We sat outside and threw back a couple beers. The footlong grilled cheese was yummy. I'd come back just for that alone. It looks like they have a good amount of TVs inside to watch whatever game is on.

9.description: I had a panko-crusted chicken sandwich, topped with a fried green tomato, drizzled in a jalapeño bacon sauce, and nestled in an onion bun.  Um...YUM!!!  For the side, I chose their Brussel sprout salad.  They chop Brussel sprouts similar to a cole slaw texture, then add a little sautéed bacon, and toss in a champagne vinaigrette.  I don't care for coleslaw, but this was refreshingly light with a cool and crisp crunch.  The ambience is true to Chicago's south loop style, casual, friendly, and easy on the pocket.Oh!  Do try their house sangria - DIVINE!

26.description: Great great location!  The food and service were wonderful!  Our server, Chelsea, was excellent and very attentive!  Great place and I will definitely come back.

25.description: Horrible staff...over priced...arrogant management...save your money and go somewhere else.Nuf said-

12.description: Horrible staff...over priced...arrogant management...save your money and go somewhere else.Nuf said-

59.description: NBA playoffs and no audio on the Bulls game? WTF? Asked to talk to the owner who was standing right in front of me and he walks out.

21.description: This place is a reliable bet in my neighborhood, and it's usually where I tell friends to meet me who want to have a casual dinner and/or drink.  The footlong grilled cheese is amazing, but if you're not in the mood for the associated calories, their salads are also good.  Decent selection of beer, and I also really like their Sangria.  I didn't give five stars, because I've had issues with service before (nothing huge, though).  Overall, it's a solid neighborhood bar with some good food to go along with your drinks!

17.description: Ended up at The Scout because my first destination was closed. The atmosphere was a bit loud for it not being very busy inside. They have a great beer menu with highlights on local and seasonal drinks. I tried Off-Color's Troublesome Gose Sour - SO good. I'm just getting into sour beers, and this one wasn't too sour. For dinner, I had my mind set on fish tacos and was very disappointed. The fish itself was grilled and tasty. The tacos were garnished with a carrot and pickled cabbage(?) mix - I picked it all off, it had no taste or crunch. However, the tacos were served with a side of red chili green beans that were delicious! Also, my boyfriend ordered miso grilled salmon on a bed of farro from the specials menu, and his meal was so so so much better than mine in taste, composition, and presentation. I'd like to try this place again, but I'll stick with ordering from the special/seasonal menu next time.

10.description: Affordable ($16 below dinner menu) comfort food with excellent portion.  It's a sports bar that is loud even though slightly empty.  Great hours!FISH & CHIPS ($15) -- the best well seasoned fish in town.  3 chunks.  Perfectly crispy French fries.  Serves 2.BOTTOMLESS COFFEE ($3) -- Intelligentsia brand in light/medium roast.LOCAL BEERS -- available here.  Woo hoo!  About 1/4 of the beer page.VENUE -- good spacing between tables.  Plenty of seating.  Quick cleanup.SERVICE -- Quick seating.  Meg was pleasant and appropriately attentive to needs.  You pack your own brown bag (hence, 1-star less).

5.description: A good friend lives in Chicago and has a lot of friends that have been here so he wanted to try it - cool atmosphere for hanging out w friends and watching a game! We sat outside yet I could still see the game on one of the many TVs inside (CAVS final game was on I couldn't help it!) We both got the Copy Cat burger - it was good! Burger and Egg was cooked perfectly. I would get it again, but I also would say nothing stood out - but it was a good burger. Hopefully that makes sense! I did love the Brussel sprout side - very different and I would recommend it! A healthier different option! The drink menu was also very good - lots of options!

3.description: Decided to be a tourist in my own city for a day and ended up at this joint.  The location is pretty big and spacious.  Luckily we got here early enough that we didn't hear the loudness that everyone is complaining about. The waitress and bus boys are beyond attentive, I very much appreciate this.  I ordered the signature burger and to my surprise, it was so good as was the copy cat burger.  The burgers were hot, cheddar cheese was melted on to the patty and the meat was so juicy. I saw the grilled cheese and was tempted to get it but there is no way I could eat a grilled cheese that big. I will be back to try this famous grilled cheese.

35.description: Went to watch a football game on a Saturday night. The place was half empty and had flies buzzing around. Ordered apps and cocktails, which were mediocre. We spent money, had no issues, weren't drunk/rowdy, and were appropriately dressed. In the first quarter, the bar-back randomly turned off our game of interest. He then refused to change it back (!) despite repeated friendly requests, and lied several times about the status of the game: "it's over", "your team already won", "it's off the air". This was easily verified by internet to be untrue, and was extremely bizarre. We immediately went across the street to Flo & Santos, and they had no problem putting on the game for us. We watched the rest of the game without drama, ordered a bunch of better food and drinks, were not subjected to weird random attitude or flies, and tipped abundantly as usual. Will not be back. Your loss, The Scout. You need to do some thinking about yourself. It is not the bar-back's job to decide which customers are suitable for your half-empty, mediocre, fly-ridden bar on a Saturday night. Maybe we should have worn backwards hats and yelled "woo" a lot about the college game - those guys appeared to be quite welcome.

19.description: Excellent place to watch a game.  Good food and the service is top notch.  Shout out to Amanda our waitress.

28.description: Fish tacos and Nachos are great. Nice spot to watch a game or go with a group.

45.description: Very disappointed... Came in here, very excited to try a menu item. Asked to have one menu item adjusted due to dietary restrictions ( I have been put in the hospital by restaurants disregarding food preparation instructions before). I was informed that there was no way that this food item could be modified as it was premade. It was a grilled cheese. You can't tell me that the kitchen didn't have more bread, cheese, and short rib ( as there are short ribs in other menu items)... I'm very disappointed... I may have tried to find something else, but, their hesitation to modify sincerely made me a bit nervous. My life is worth more to me than subpar service and a grilled cheese.

33.description: I've never eaten here, but there's no better place to watch Bears or Blackhawks games in the South Loop. Always packed, cheap beer, fun fans. Definitely recommended, especially for home Bears games.

43.description: The food here is great. I love the foot long grilled cheese and the tomato bisque to dip it in - it's a great place to go to satisfy my surprisingly frequent grilled cheese craving. My boyfriend got the mac and cheese and it was one of the better ones I've tried. The thing that knocks the stars down for me is the atmosphere. It's extremely loud and kind of bro-ey. One time when we tried coming in this past winter, all the tvs were set to football and we asked if they could turn on the bulls game on one tv, and they said no, it's not possible. Other than that, I've always gotten decent service here.

2.description: Bought tickets for New Years Eve, great deal that is actually affordable for Chicago. We deserved a table and service was great. We had a waitress that wasn't too over worked and had plenty of time to grab drinks whenever we needed them. That night they had coat check, super convenient for Chicago's cold. The bathrooms were pretty big and able to accommodate for the crowds. Drinks were properly made.The one huge turn off was one staff member. Much like other reviews about the people who work there, this one staff member ruined my experience. As the bar was closing we were closing out our tab. Meanwhile this Caucasian, 6 foot-something man with curly, short hair in his mid 30s was cursing and yelling at paying customers insisting they leave "right f&@$*#$ now". No one was resisting the fact that the bar was closed. People were gathering coats and on their way out. This staff member was upsetting customers and and even other staff who clearly felt uncomfortable. This went on about 30 mins. Really ruined our night. Made me feel like a cattle.

18.description: Scout is a good place to eat at times. But if there is something major happening nearby (Bears game finishing up, Hawks in playoff,  some parade) they are crazy busy. And they get crazy sloppy with service. After two bad experience when they were busy I've only been back during slow periods and the food is great. The Margarita pizza is thin and delicious with actual mozzarella balls and leaves of fresh basil. The Mac and cheese is good, but if you add chicken it is amazing. My favorite is the foot long grilled cheese sandwich with tomato dip. It's can be a entree or easily an appetizer. I love cider and they have a small but good selection. I wish they had a couple more selection of ciders but now I'm just being picky. Good stuff when the timing is right.

41.description: A good place for brunch. Delicious food and great service. I planned to order the Signature Bread Pudding, but the Stuffed French Toast made me stuffed... Will come back for the pudding next time.

52.description: Great late night menu! Grilled cheese was awesome! And bar staff was friendly. No complaints.

50.description: A great place to eat. They have a huge beer menu and huge portions of food.  And the food tastes great!

4.description: We came here for some drinks to catch up with a friend. It wasn't very busy when we went so we could sit anywhere we wanted but the bar was busy. Our server was lovely and fun. Our drinks got mixed up but she made no hesitation to take it back and have new drinks sent to us without charge. I can not comment on the food menu but the drink menu had a great variety of beers, wines and spirits for reasonable prices.There are plenty of tv's for you to watch a few different games that are being played. The vibe was chill and perfect for us to have a few laughs an catch up.

6.description: I've been here twice now. Once before a Bears game and it was ass to elbows. Great lively time with great service at the front bar.Second time was last night before seeing Kaskade on Navy Pier. The restaurant I had made a reservation at couldn't accommodate us.... we were hungry, we were in a time crunch and there were 10 of us, watch out!The Scout accomodated us no problem. They said they needed the table by 6 pm for another reservation but that was fine because we needed to be on our way by then.Service was very prompt. Drinks came out FAST as did the food. Awesome experience. We all shared grilled cheeses and got various salads and appetizers to snack on as well, best grilled cheese ever as the pictures show. Super grateful that we were able to share a delicious dinner together before our show despite the mishap at the previous restaurant. Great atmosphere as well.They do require one check for large parties, FYI

22.description: The bar staff is super friendly to everyone. This place is the best atmosphere for a Bears game on Sunday. The menu is very good for a Sports Bar. Top choice in South Loop Bars.

15.description: The food is a bit pricey for "bar food" but it's always so good! The jalapeño and bacon grilled cheese with tater tots never disappoints.

57.description: A good friend lives in Chicago and has a lot of friends that have been here so he wanted to try it - cool atmosphere for hanging out w friends and watching a game! We sat outside yet I could still see the game on one of the many TVs inside (CAVS final game was on I couldn't help it!) We both got the Copy Cat burger - it was good! Burger and Egg was cooked perfectly. I would get it again, but I also would say nothing stood out - but it was a good burger. Hopefully that makes sense! I did love the Brussel sprout side - very different and I would recommend it! A healthier different option! The drink menu was also very good - lots of options!

20.description: Friendly, good service. I went to watch a football game, place was packed! I sat in the front bar and had some good cider beer. The food didn't look too amazing so I stuck to liquid lunch! Good sports bar vibe

36.description: Scout out somewhere else for family food. This place is only looking for 20something drinkers with dull taste buds.

14.description: Great neighborhood bar with above average food and service  TVs galore, so plenty of space to watch a game and the game you want is always on somewhere.  Definitely a crowded place, no matter the day, but bears game days i try to stay away because it gets too crowded.  Definitely one of my favorite local sports bars, and the service is always great.

12.description: Surprisingly good for a restaurant in a gas station in Chicago. I have so far been there twice and have had nothing but good food from them. The cheese fries are really good there and I will be back there soon for an order of those. I haven't tried their burgers yet, but my boyfriend has and he loves them. He has already been back a few times without me. The only reason I give this place a 4 star review is the wait time. It is horribly long. It took our food 20 minutes to be ready. I mean, I understand that there are only two people working, but to make a hot dog and fries and a burger shouldn't take that long for a hot dog place. I mean, even five guys across the street can make a super quality burger in 1/4 of the time. Other than all of that, great job - will be back.

7.description: Pleasantly surprised.  Went before going to a movie at the Showplace ICON theatre nearby.  Blue cheese burger was big, juicy and tasty, turkey burger was ground turkey, a little dry but nice grilled flavor. Asked for fries to be extra crispy and got what we asked for. Ambience is a little sterile being in a gas station convenience store but it was clean. Service was good.

3.description: Small place attached to the am/pm gas station on Roosevelt, I almost couldn't find it actually. It's a good place to get some quality food before heading out on the road, or better than usual gas station food that is. I got the fried chicken sandwich, which was solid,  with fries and a drink, all for $9 which wasnt bad. I wouldn't be opposed to stopping there again

1.description: This was the first time I've ever saw a fully functional restaurant inside of a gas station convenience store. You would think the quality of the food would be subpar. However, I was pleasantly surprised by the amount of taste in the food. The restaurant itself reminds me of an old school diner where you can see the cooks making the food and the style of seating. The tables, floors and counters were all clean and neatly put together. The only downside to this place is the bathroom situation. They share restrooms with the convenience store and the woman's room was out of order when I came. I ordered the signature blue cheese burger and it was heavenly! Made and cooked to order, it melted in my mouth with flavor. The fries were also made to order and were nice and crisp. I also got a strawberry milk shake which tasted great (although it wasn't made with real strawberries). My fiancée order some grilled chicken sliders and they were excellent. I will def be coming back here again!

2.description: A quick place to grab some descent snacks/lunch. It is better than your typical gas station food. There is some waiting time, which I didn't mind.

9.description: Urban Counter doesn't have a storefront on Wabash or Roosevelt because... it's in a gas station?!I typically stop at the gas station on my way out of Chicago during the Holidays, before jumping onto Southbound LSD.  After about a year, I decided to try some of the food at the Urban Counter.  Here's what I ordered:-Blue Cheeseburger w/ no lettuce (comes w/ blue cheese crumbles and bacon jam?)-Fries-Fountain Iced TeaI'll admit, I had very low expectations for the food here.  My concerns began to grow stronger after waiting about 15 minutes for the food to come out, but when it did - I was pleasantly surprised.The burger patty was legit.  The quality of the beef was impressive and the bacon jam was jam-dropping.  I'm not a huge fan of bacon, but this jam was very unique.UC fries were very fresh and crisp - perfectly prepared.This may sound crazy, but I would consider driving here JUST for gas AND another burger - check it out.(See Joseph B.'s review for details on parking)

10.description: Unique concept....I was able to get hot food and gas at the same time.  Turkey burger and sweet potato fries were awesome

13.description: Lets face it. This is a hard concept to grasp. Quality food from a gas station?Luckily I got over it quick because I really enjoyed it. I have stopped for coffee, hash brown and a breakfast burrito about 10 times. I often get breakfast burritos every where i go and this is by far the best one I have ever had. It's very consistently executed, great ratio of ingredients and just he right amount if spice from the jalapeños.  Some might find it a little spicy so be sure to ask. Extra tip: if you call in an order right when you leave you house, they will just be finishing up when you arrive.

16.description: I ordered from Urban Counter yesterday through Delivery.com and was not impressed. We live 4 blocks away, yet the order took over an hour and the food was cold when it arrived. Husband had the blue cheese burger and it was ok, although it was cold. I had the turkey club; the bacon was flabby and fatty and the sandwich was soggy. The fries were ok (cold) The $2.99 order of onion rings had FOUR onion rings in it. Four. Are you fricking kidding me? The only benefit was that the price was cheap, but what a waste for cold and unappetizing food. I wouldn't order here again.

17.description: One of the best burgers I've had in a while and its inside a gas station!  We ordered the bacon burger, turkey burger and sweet potatoe fries, all of which was cooked to order.  It was delicious and only cost ~$15-16ish, which is nothing compared to other food purchases I've made since living in Chicago.  Would definitely recommend this to everyone and will be back often!

15.description: I had a build your own burger and it was okay. The only memorable thing about it was that it had mayo which I asked not to be put on it. Good luck to them especially since Five Burgers is right across the way.

0.description: Good food for cheap! Been here a couple times while showing homes in the south loop.  They are inconsistent with their cooks.  I think I've had 3 different versions of the bacon burger lol.  Definitely recommend this burger with sweet potato fries and a beverage all for under 10 bucks.  Expect to wait 10 minutes for the burger.  Free parking is a bonus.

5.description: They have open fire grilled burgers here. Don't get anything else but their burgers. It might take a while (15 min) but it's worth getting one.

11.description: The only thing this place has working against it is that it's in a gas station. But still, you should do yourself a favor and check it out. The food is quality, and well prepared by chefs who really seem to care and take pride in their work. No, it's not the kind of place you go on a date, but if you need some breakfast or lunch downtown, its great choice, plus theirs almost always free parking.

8.description: Here on a Tues afternoon in June. Best gas station food you will ever have. Got a turkey club(prepared incorrectly), rings, and a choc. malt. Food took about 10 min and curiously the malt took about 15. Sandwich was delicious with fresh avocado & veggies, hickory smoked Canadian bacon, and thin sliced turkey. Bread was lightly toasted on the grill. It was supposed to NOT have cheese on it but it was mild and fine. The manager gave me a coupon for my troubles. Ring order was large(8-10 rings) and crispy. Malt was good! This place is in the BP gas station but the food is quite good! I certainly will be back:)

4.description: Grilled chicken sandwich is tasty, same price & better at Panera and Cafe cito thoughThe burgers & rest are priced nice. Worth a try.

14.description: Such a convenient location and a great idea - who would ever thought of decent food from a gas station. They also have great shakes and some bite-sized sliders for a quick snack to go.*I'm surprised that they also have a delivery option through Yelp Delivery and Grubhub, interesting.

6.description: I've only had the BBQ burger, but it's very good and reasonably priced.

3.description: There aren't many seats inside, so you're kind of stuck sharing a chair with your friend if you're lucky. The customer service is alright. The lady behind the counter seemed to know the nurses coming in late at night, but she just stared at us while my friends and I were awkwardly sitting there eating and chatting.

1.description: I witnessed a rude incident yesterday where a worker was rude to a customer. Customer ordered a pint or quart of ice cream, paid, and the worker put the ice cream on the counter and walked away. Customer waited a few minutes in silence probably thinking the worker was coming back to bag the purchase. When she didn't customer asked for a bag and the worker opened a paper bag and put it next to the purchase not in the bag. Customer asked for a plastic bag and the worker put the bag on top of the ice cream. Customer asked the worker to bag the item and the worker admittedly refused. Customer asked other workers to bag the purchase and they ignored customer. Customer again asked for purchase to be bagged or refund her money. A gentleman walked in and the worker told the man to refund the purchase. I taped everything and talked to the customer and told her I was going to report the incident and so should she. This morning I called and talked to Thelma who was very nice and told me to call back in the morning and ask for Simo, the manager,  and I will. Only Mexican/Hispanics work at this location and it is a bad representation of us! I live in the neighborhood but will not buy from this store again until I talk to the manager! #rudeandridiculous

2.description: This location is clean and the staff are quick in the morning at Dunkin Donuts.  A few times I have gone here at night to get some ice cream. They only have 1 or 2 people working so the wait can be very long if you get behind a family trying to taste everything. The location is convenient, but a bit seedy with people asking for money outside.

9.description: Although my Jewish grandmother may disown me, I have learned that, in a pinch, a Dunkin Doughnuts bagel isn't half bad.  Every once in a while when I am craving a bagel before work, I may just stop at here to get my whole wheat with reduced fat cream cheese.  For a fast food restaurant in a, sometimes, less than desirable location ,(depends on the time of day) the staff continues to impress me with their degree of customer service and efficiency.

10.description: Staff is prompt and friendly. The real drawback are the panhandlers outside. Everytime I go in, there are at LEAST 2-3. Be careful.

4.description: Is a medium French Vanilla iced coffee with cream and sugar that difficult to make?!This location is a  "hit or miss".Nothing else around for a quick bite unless you prefer expensive, and strong, Starbucks.I actually stopped going to this place after so many disgusting iced drinks.This week made me write the review though. A girl named Marilyn made theeeee best iced coffee after my hiatus. I looked at my receipt and since asked her to make my coffee. I went this week and asked her could she make it again; I didn't have singles after my change so I told her to keep the $5 dollar bill as a tip. The cashier was happily surprised but then had to ask the manager, who seems like a jerk to work for, could she take it. The manager shook her head with an attitude and told Marilyn that she herself would make my coffee.The manager actually told another employee to make it ...and it sucked.Wait.... they can't take tips?!!! I've worked in food service and even the Jersey Mike's nearby and we were able to take tips.Today, the manager herself made my coffee ....and it sucked.LOLOh well, I still don't think this is enough for me to just hop over to Starbucks. If you can get over the small area that can get crowded quick and, occasionally, the dark water they claim is coffee, it's alright.

6.description: I come here all the time, it's one of my favorite dunkin donuts/baskin robins location in the the city. Employees are really friendly and it's not to noisy either.

11.description: This location is pretty small, but the service was prompt and friendly. The owner even gave us a bunch of free munchkins (it was late at night).

5.description: 2 things make this place amazing.1.  It's open 24 hours.  Other than the grocery store, not much else around here is.  So that's awesome.2.  Their ice cream flavor of the month for April 2011 is Firehouse 31 which is the best thing I've ever had.  It is vanilla with cinnamon candies (very spicy) and cinnamon swirls (also very spicy) - kind of tastes like hot tamales candy as ice cream with a little bit of vanilla mixed in.  And I'm in love.  The guy behind the counter didn't really believe me when I told him I wanted it and that yes I was sure I wanted it without tasting it.  But I was right, I loved it.Sometimes it smells a little funny inside, so no 5th star.  That said, the outside smells FANTASTIC, sending delicious donutty scents wafting throughout the neighborhood.

7.description: I usually go to the Dunkin Donuts on Wabash and Harrison because it's convenient, but I was in the area so my friend and I went to this location. I was pleasantly surprised that the service was good. The employees were pleasant and friendly, and the wait was not long. Dunkin Donuts is always cheap grub too, which is great for me since I'm a student.

8.description: Okay so this location has a couple of bad reviews, I can understand why, but...my opinion is going to be a little different because I know what makes this location good, I will start with the drawbacks though.Its tiny. No indoor seating tiny. Long ass lines that go out the door. BUT...You know why the lines are long? This is one of the few locations that actually make the donuts! That's right people not every DD makes their donuts in shop. So if you come here you'll know that you'll get a super fresh dammed tasty donut! Also the staff bust their ass here to get everyone out as quickly as possible...just don't go on a Sunday when the Bears are having a home game. Also its open 24 hours, Which is nice if you get a donut craving at like say 3 am.

0.description: So glad this place is in my neighborhood! I can't believe it took me this long to visit! I try really hard not to have coffee on weekends but this weekend I was craving coffee! Trying to cut down my coffee costs, I opted for Dunkin instead of Starbucks. For a small caramel iced coffee and a sausage wrap, it only cost me $3.20! Awesome deal!Service here was phenomenal.  The staff was very fast and friendly.  The lady double checked with me the type of caramel I wanted (apparently they have sweet and unsweetened caramel?).
