I was happy she wanted to make sure my drink was perfect. And it was!They have about four to five 2-seater tables and they are joint with Baskin Robins. Lots of fancy ice cream cakes. It looks delicious!A super bonus is that this place is opened 24 hours! Another wonderful reason to living in the South Loop!

3.description: If you are near Adler Planetarium you must go to this taco stand, this place brings Adler and other museum employees such joy every year. Highly recommend the del campo taco, mexican nachos, and cheese fries! They also are always trying new menu items and we are happy to be their taste testers because everything is so good!

1.description: Awesome and authentic tacos! Love the pickled veggies!

2.description: Hidden little gem on northerly island, Best steak taco in the city.

5.description: Stopped by here after biking the Lakefront Trail. This is located by the beach (12 Street beach) that is on the left of the Planetarium. They have a pretty good selection of food and snacks for a reasonable price. Elote (corn on a cob or cup) is $3. My friends who came with ordered tacos and tortas. They said it was good. Might stop by again next time when my tummy asks for it :)

6.description: Glad this place is here.That way if I forget to bring a grill I can still get some good carne asada tacos.Theyre authentic as well.Really enjoyed the taco de chicharron.Plenty of choices of refreshments and ice cream as well.Prices are MAYBE slightly higher than your neighborhood joints.But not bad considering their location.Of course busting out the grill is always cheaper but WHAT A PAIN IN THE BUTT THAT IS.Im cool just ordering my food here and let someone else clean up the mess.Thank you.

0.description: Yumola! These folks come into our office to offer lunch and I live for those days. Great tacos and tasty guacamole.  Makes coming to work not so bad.   Check them out.  Real Mexican food and delicious!!

4.description: Yea these people are so rude, who really cares about the food. Visited them at the air and water show this past weekend and they tried to charge my friend three dollars to use a debit card when they never had it posted anywhere or told her when they took her card. Then they want to get mad and disrespectful when she refused to pay it. Also they tried to charge us extra after serving my friend and I the driest elote I have ever had. Telling us we should have mixed it up, first dont tell me how to eat an elote. Dont charge four dollars for an elote if you just plan on giving a dry cup of corn, that is really worth a dollar. These people aren't worried about how they treat people. Completely dissatisfied as a customer,  must be why they only have a taco stand and not a restaurant.  Wouldnt send a rat to eat the leftovers from this spot.

58.description: The one star was because I actually liked part of my food and I really wanted to like this place as it seemed like a nice place to start hanging out during football season.  Maybe it was just a fluke but I had the absolute worst experience!  The waitress basically rushed me to order as soon as we sat down. I didn't even have the opportunity to read through the menu and when she saw me reading she just stood there staring at me like a deer in headlights. Then when our food finally came she rarely came back to check on us. The food was ok. The guacamole was good and my sweet potato fries were delicious. The veggie burger not a winner.The absolute worst part of the night was when the waitress spilled her entire tray of drinks down my back. Instead of checking on me she was more worried about how her arm was wet. My entire body was soaked from head to toe down to the inside of my shoe! When she finally returned she was so busy trying to clean up the spill she still didn't check on me. I received more attention from the patrons in the bar than anyone on the entire bar staff. What a disappointment!  When the waitress finally asked if I was ok she was joking around asking did water fall on me or beer because she noticed only half of the water spilled. SMH And on top of that I never saw a manager come out. She also didn't even offer to at least comp our tab or at least a drink since I was wearing two drinks on my body and no one seemed to care that my night was basically ruined. I couldn't go anywhere with a wet backside and smelling like beer! Also what about my cleaners bil???Definitely did not like this place!

56.description: Not bad...bartender was a somewhat inattentive.  Food came up fast.  Burger was pretty good and I loved the take tots.   The draft beer was good as well.  Atmosphere was cool.  Just walking distance from my house...

29.description: This place proved to a be a life saver .We were hot , tired and hungry when we hit this place for a late lunch.We ordered creatively.I had a Turkey Club , my first in years.I really enjoyed it.My fellow companion in torturous urban exploration had a fish sandwich(perch ,I think).It was good.It was hot that day.My feet hurt and we'd been up since 4 in the morning.My spouse generally doesn't enjoy beer but this day it went down easily.Had several local micro brew- craft brews ( or whatever they are now) made in Chicago including the now local Lagunitas.Prices were reasonable and service pleasant.After we stumbled back uptown on a bus.

42.description: A chill, sit-down vibe. Nothing stands too much for me. It is very big and it has TVs, so it's nice to go during sport games. I don't think it's as well known because it never gets overly crowded. The food is pretty good and I would say the service is average. It takes awhile to et noticed. Their mixed drinks are pretty awesome though. Try one of those if you're in the mood.

23.description: Nothing like I expected. Just wanted a nice tuna salad sandwich, but it was fishy and dry. The burger was okay, but probably more for a lunch thing... Ordered delivery for a quick dinner but I ended up still hungry :(The best thing was the fries and tator tots. Crispy and delicious.

47.description: So if you are a female, this is a great place to go after a Bears game because apparently it's guys night. That might be the best part of this bar. We ordered a mixed drink, a glass of wine, and a hummus plate. The hummus was so spicy we had to ask for water. We asked the first bartender what ingredients were in the hummus? She responded, "um, I don't know." We asked the second bartender and she staged a few. We asked what was making it so spicy? She replied nothing should be in there making it "that spicy." So we have her a taste, to her demise, she gave us a round of drinks and apologized for the mistake. And on top of it, we are in Chicago - NOT Green Bay! What is the deal with the plastic cups for mixed drinks and wine? This isn't a frat party and I'm not 18 anymore. A little bit more class for the Windy City!!!! ... Written by my hubby. He hated it. OBVIOUSLY.

8.description: I like this place but am always so disappointed by its service. I've only ever visited on a football Sunday, too, so you'd think they'd have their A Team ready to go!The food comes out quickly but drink refills are s-l-o-w to follow, if not completely forgotten about all together. I'd love the opportunity to politely remind my server but rarely see him/her after the food has been dropped off...It just always seems like somebody called in sick and nobody else could come in and help pick up the pace. There should be more people on the floor taking care of customers.

31.description: I am originally from green bay and grew up eating the original krolls, so when my boyfriend moved only a few blocks from this one we had to try it. We went for brunch and I had the captain crunch french toast breakfast sandwich which was AMAZING. My boyfriend got the supreme breakfast pizza which was good but not incredible. I gave it three stars because our service seemed a little slow (it wasnt very busy) and the bloody Mary I ordered was super spicy when I asked for it to be mild. Otherwise the food was good and I will be going back to try some of their lunch/dinner options

34.description: I am surprised that Kroll' has anything less than 4 stars. We live around the corner and have been here a lot of times. They have a lot of food and beverage specials during the week including 20% off your bill on Tuesday for local residents. The space is large with lot of TVs and  screens, and although they do get packed on game nights the wait isn't too long due to the number of tables and seats at the bar and the inside dining area. Food is bar food done right. I usually get the Tuna Steak sandwich which is a piece of tuna steak, and not chopped tuna like other places. For $13, it's one of the better tuna sandwiches out there. I also like that I can get tater tots, sweet potato fries or regular fries with my burger. The sweet potato fries is a no brainer. Service is attentive and I have never had a bad experience in all my visits.

16.description: This place proved to a be a life saver .We were hot , tired and hungry when we hit this place for a late lunch.We ordered creatively.I had a Turkey Club , my first in years.I really enjoyed it.My fellow companion in torturous urban exploration had a fish sandwich(perch ,I think).It was good.It was hot that day.My feet hurt and we'd been up since 4 in the morning.My spouse generally doesn't enjoy beer but this day it went down easily.Had several local micro brew- craft brews ( or whatever they are now) made in Chicago including the now local Lagunitas.Prices were reasonable and service pleasant.After we stumbled back uptown on a bus.

13.description: Nothing like I expected. Just wanted a nice tuna salad sandwich, but it was fishy and dry. The burger was okay, but probably more for a lunch thing... Ordered delivery for a quick dinner but I ended up still hungry :(The best thing was the fries and tator tots. Crispy and delicious.

11.description: Let me start off by saying if there a option to give this place no stars I would. This was my first time eating here and the restaurant was nice and clean but the  Service sucked! The lady was  snotty she finally just had someone els serve us and he was ok I guess. he only came back once to give us the check only one refill and the food was bad. I actually think I got some type of food poisoning from there. so basically I paid 34 dollars to have bad Service overpriced food and food poisoning. literately McDonald's has better food them them!! You couldn't pay me to eat there again!!!!

39.description: I'm surprised I've never reviewed this as I live a few blocks away and frequent.  More often than  not, the service is below average but once in a while you get a great server.  The food is average or better for typical pub fare.  Their wraps and burgers are some good go-tos.  The apps can be hit or miss but their tots and fries are solid.  There are plenty of TVs and thus a good spot to catch a game.  Good trusty place.

37.description: Foods decent - typical bar food. Quality is not consistent though. Menu changes after a certain time to "late night". Service is atrociously slow every single time we go. Also, never go on trivia night unless you want to here a guy shout into a microphone with really lame jokes. With that said, the guacomole, steak salad, and burgers are pretty good.They recently started delivering and it took an hour to get 2 salads (I only live 1 block away... Before you judge me for being lazy, I was sick and it was below freezing out). The manager personally called me to apologize and give me a credit on my purchase to make up for the slow service. I was amazed, it was the best service I ever received there!

0.description: You know you're not a huge sports fan when you literally go to a sports bar on Super Bowl Sunday, but eat, drink, and leave before the actual game event starts. I mean, who does that?? This girl.I participated in a pre-Super Bowl broadcast at Kroll's and stuck around after of course to grab something to eat and drink. I mean, I may not be a big fan of football, but I am a big fan of food. I had brought my mom along for this city adventure so she accompanied me for the meal.Kroll's had Goose Island on special for $3 so we indulged in a few of those. After browsing the menu we decided to each start with a bowl of their chicken dumpling soup since it's one of their specialties (and it was a pretty chilly day). Our waitress asked if we wanted to upgrade from a cup to a bowl for only 50 cents... Well sure! The bowl was actually the perfect amount. It looked like a lot more than it was, because the bowl was really shallow. They definitely make a mean chicken dumpling soup though. Boy was it good!The soup ended up being pretty filling, so my mom and I decided to split the three cheese grilled cheese ($8.50) with added pork belly (and extra $2.50). This creamy blend of sharp American, mozzarella, and gouda cheese melted perfectly onto a crusty rustic bread. Yum! As our side we went with the tater tots. Of course our waitress asked if we wanted to upgrade to loaded tots and at this point, hell... why not! The tots were good, but I wasn't totally loving the melted cheese on them. The bacon pieces were a nice touch though. Service was great and our waitress was really nice. The only bummer was that she forgot my ranch. We sat at a high top table towards the back of the bar, but they also have some pretty comfy looking booths and plenty of TVs. Seems like a decent spot to watch a game. Ya know, if you're into that sort of thing.

38.description: To all those road warriors who think they have seen it all I strongly urge checking out Kroll's if you are in Chicago.  They have an epic dish called the loaded tot and it is loaded with goodness: bacon, sour cream, cheese and all the deliciousness of a tater tot.  It is remarkable and worth visiting just for the that dish.Overall, everything was good.  Quesadilla, Rueben, Nachos ( I ate here 3 nights in a row).  All A+ in this writers book.  Only a few blocks from the convention center and worth it.  Service is good and the crowd is mellow.  Prices are also very reasonable.I highly recommend this joint if you are in Chicago.

51.description: So we went to vote for the first time as Illinois residents and decided to stop in and grab a bite at Krolls. We sat ourselves after checking in at the hostess stand and being given menu's.  The bartender looked at us 4 or 5 times and never acknowledged us. We sat for another 10 mins and decided that was enough time for someone to have said SOMETHING! Returned the menu's to the hostess who seemed surprised that we hadn't been acknowledged yet, although she didn't seem to care enough to ask us to stay. Sub par looking establishment with extremely disinterested staff. Won't be back and what a shame. They don't care so why should we.

27.description: Here on a Sunday night.  Great Cobb salad.  Many choices of beers on tap and the bartender offered to bring me several samplers to help me choose.   This is a bar where all the locals come in for dinner.  By 7pm it was a packed house with families and kids.  Tonight they played a trivia game that was really entertaining.  I have no idea why this place doesn't get 5 stars from everyone!

32.description: Came to Kroll's about a month ago for my birthday and I have to tell you - the staff alone will have me coming back. Apparently they weren't really open yet but they were so gracious and just went with the flow; the group I was with didn't check hours before-hand but am so grateful that they accommodated us. Had burgers all around and they were so good, done just right. Seating is so comfortable, we had a table with captains chairs and after those burgers and a couple of beers we didn't want to leave our seats! Eventually we did and as I write this I know I will be heading over there for lunch today! Lunch time crowd as it trickled in was a mix of business people sitting at the bar, young couple with kids, and some pick up orders. Nice atmosphere. Would love to come back at dinner time some day.

54.description: Went here for trivia night. It was tough but fun good food and good drinks. Impressed with the beer menu and the way it's laid out by type of beer better then I've seen at Other bars. Cheese curds were yummy, food was typical bar food though.

48.description: Good neighborhood bar but not-so great sports bar.   One of the best things about Krolls is the couch seating that surround the jumbo screen TV.  And they do have outside seating for the summer time although it's very small.  But once you get past that, it's pretty much just average.  It's a good spot to grab a burger with some friends after work but if you are looking for a true sports bar, you may be disappointed.  Even on Bears game days, the place is generally a bunch of people socializing with one another and very few watching the game on TV.  Service can be a little slow at times as it's only one bar that serves the whole place.  So expect to wait a little bit if it's packed.

44.description: I love this place!!!... It is so nice to have a neighborhood bar right below my building... The prime rib sandwich is one of the best I have ever had!!! Bartenders are friendly and knowledgable about their menu and drinks. Suburb prices in the city. Love going to a place where they remember who I am. If you're looking for a no frills, reasonably priced placed to watch sporting events... This is the place for you!!!

24.description: If you want a bar that has great food, drinks, service, and sports venue in the south side of chicago this is it. My friend lives close to this place and this was are go tospot for watching sports games and a wide variety of drinks. Its a large spot with big tv's and a projector.

7.description: Solid sports bar in south loop, we had 3 apps-the sidewinder fries, cheese curds, and mac and cheese, all were good, and a respectable beer list, including three floyds, they also make a 312/Green Line mixture from Goose Island that was actually pretty good, they mixed very well together, and best of all they have rolling office chairs at the Tables by the TV that are super comfy, it did get pretty packed during the wisconsin game (it is a wisconsin bar) so just be aware of that, or just be sure to get there super early those days

49.description: Let me begin by telling you about their LOADED TATER TOTS!OMG! to die for!best tater tots I've ever tasted in my life!!!Their pizza, to burgers, to wings ---- Incredible!I've been their multiple times and the waiter and hosts are all awesome!Very friendly and relaxed atmosphere!

40.description: This is our neighborhood bar, and we love it. Awesome beer list, food is fine and the service is always good. Trivia Night is fun and Kay is great! If in you're in the South Loop and want a cool bar (replete with great chairs!) to hang at, Krolls is the place to go.

53.description: They have really good BBQ wings.but they are expensive.and don't come with fries.at least they should come with fries.

30.description: The service was slow, and the beer selections weren't that good. The food is what you'd expect from a bar. I definitely wouldn't categorize this as a gastropub.

46.description: This place has see better days. It was dead on a Sunday during the Bears game. Chili was good and portion was huge! Cheese curds were the perfect accompaniment to a few cold local beers. My co-workers enjoyed their wings. Another patron told us to go to a craft beer bar a few blocks away to watch the second half of the game. It was good advice.

1.description: Kroll's used to be our go-to spot, as we live nearby and could always get affordable, creative, and surprisingly good food along with a great beer selection. Unfortunately after new management took over and all the regular staff either left or were dismissed, things have gone downhill. While beer prices are still good and seating is ample, service has gotten ssslllllooooooowwwww. They've done away with most of the creative menu options (and all the vegetarian ones!! Seriously, wtf?) and everything tastes like it came out of a freezer. Hoping they realize that the scores of regulars that have been coming for years are as important as the game day crowds they're trying to woo, and bring back better, fresher food and faster, more personal service. Right now, this could be any other mediocre sports bar in Chicago, which is a shame.

55.description: Bad attitude! No wonder it's dead now. Bar tender can't take a joke and pms'ed out of nowhere bc she had a bad day. Get over yourself. U ain't all that. I use to actually enjoy this place. Not worth your money to deal with bs on your off day. Drama drama drama. Bad attitude all around.

9.description: Went here last night to just get some drinks with friends. I had the Chicago Mule which was really yummy, but after two, I felt nothing. The amount of vodka in it was negligible. Everyone else generally enjoyed their drinks as well.Our main complaint was service. We were immediately taken care of by our server, but once our first round of drinks came out, he never came over again. Whenever we wanted refills, we had to purposefully flag him down. At one point, we couldn't even find him for about 20 minutes. He was nowhere to be found.I'd come back because I generally enjoyed the three hours I spent there, but they need to step up service on a Friday night (when there aren't even that many customers there) if they want me to tip 20%.

26.description: Good service. Drinks were good. Nice atmosphere. Lots of TVs. Good sports bar. That said, we live right around the corner so it's close to us. But let's face it, if you're gonna be bar hopping or going out, the south loop isn't the best place to do that.

25.description: Really nice servers.  The food is regular bar food.  The only reason I write a poor review is because they messed up my order twice.  I repeated what I had ordered and it was wrong the second time.  Other than that, its a cool atmosphere and a nice place for lunch or dinner.

12.description: Kroll's is a great place when you just want some great greasy food and a casual atmosphere. I recommend the loaded grilled cheese or the wahoo sandwich.

59.description: Great place!!!  I went on a Sunday before the Bears/Packers game and the place was packed.  Even though it was hard to even find a place to stand, the waitresses were working their butts off, making sure that everyone's beverages were filled.  We stayed for about 2 hours and had a pretty good time.  Being the lone Packer fan in my group (there were 8 of us), everyone in the bar was really friendly.  I would definitely recommend this place.  Cheers!

21.description: I enjoy going to Krolls because it's a great neighborhood bar. However, the service has been horrible Friday evenings. Twice on a Friday, it took about 15 minutes for the bartender to acknowledge that we were seated at the bar. A water request with my meal took an additional request which totaled another 15 minutes of me waiting. I like Krolls but the service needs a major overhaul.

17.description: We have been going to Kroll's for years. Owning not only season tickets to the Bears but a condo on south Michigan ave. That is our weekend place. The staff in the past was always great. But, in the last few weeks/months something has changed! The new management has been ignorant! I claim this as them being unaware and just plain not smart. They where so disrespectful to my party and others around us. Our orders where messed up and when we tried to tell them that this isn't what we orders. We where treated as if we did something wrong!!!! Poor nservice all around  the new manage "Ceaser Douglas" was so disrespectful. This is not the Kroll's I know!!! What happened to the staple staff???

10.description: Came here to watch a Badgers game. Atmosphere was good with lots of Wisconsin fans around, not as rowdy as a lot of other badger bars but still fun. They have a lot of huge screens to watch sports and they do take reservations which is convenient. Ordered cheese curds & tater tots as appetizers. The cheese curds would disappoint any true sconnie but the tots were really good. Entree was the pulled pork sandwich which was tasty, average bar food.Prices were really competitive for beer

5.description: The food here is like something you would find in a cafeteria of school or hospital.  It is very mediocre American.  Not for the adventurous palate, that's for sure.  Good service but not food.

3.description: If I could give ZERO stars I would Offered on grub hub I was excited about the huge menu. First time I have seen it on there. Ordered a grilled chicken on ciabatta. I understand delivery isn't as good as dine in...But geezzzz send it out in a container so it don't turn into a disgusting mess. The chicken was pink. Almost the entire breast so I pulled it apart and ate the parts that were thin. The sandwich was a soggy mess and just a total disappointment. The pork belly mark and cheese tasted like burnt pigOmg it was not even edible. I didn't even call and complain because I will never be ordering ever again.  32$ for delivery. Small chicken sandwich with disgusting under cooked fries and some burnt pig Mac and cheese. Now I have to order somewhere else and spent another 30$.

35.description: Came here to watch a Badgers game. Atmosphere was good with lots of Wisconsin fans around, not as rowdy as a lot of other badger bars but still fun. They have a lot of huge screens to watch sports and they do take reservations which is convenient. Ordered cheese curds & tater tots as appetizers. The cheese curds would disappoint any true sconnie but the tots were really good. Entree was the pulled pork sandwich which was tasty, average bar food.Prices were really competitive for beer

19.description: Good neighborhood bar but not-so great sports bar.   One of the best things about Krolls is the couch seating that surround the jumbo screen TV.  And they do have outside seating for the summer time although it's very small.  But once you get past that, it's pretty much just average.  It's a good spot to grab a burger with some friends after work but if you are looking for a true sports bar, you may be disappointed.  Even on Bears game days, the place is generally a bunch of people socializing with one another and very few watching the game on TV.  Service can be a little slow at times as it's only one bar that serves the whole place.  So expect to wait a little bit if it's packed.

28.description: Pass on this place. The service was slow and sloppy and the food was just ok. The inside of the burger was good, the bun, stale. The ice cream dessert was served before the meal. My flight arrived messy looking and with no explanation as to what was what and the server seemed either clueless or put out by being asked and in any event, didn't even answer my question. The place seems inadequately staffed with no one to acknowledge  you when you arrive and long waits to order, then to get your food, then to get your check and no one to check in to see if everything is going well or if you need anything at any point. At least the flight was a good value at $12, the flights generally are, with a lot of very good beer, wine and spirit options selected which is why I'm giving 2 stars instead of 1. There are a million better places to spend your time and money.

45.description: Use to be a lot better. Great for home bears games and that's about it. Just an average boring bar with a greasy burger.

33.description: Waitress was great - very nice.  Chicken nuggets were really good!  Cheese nachos were also awesome.  I'm not sure I would go back to be honest.

43.description: I like this place but am always so disappointed by its service. I've only ever visited on a football Sunday, too, so you'd think they'd have their A Team ready to go!The food comes out quickly but drink refills are s-l-o-w to follow, if not completely forgotten about all together. I'd love the opportunity to politely remind my server but rarely see him/her after the food has been dropped off...It just always seems like somebody called in sick and nobody else could come in and help pick up the pace. There should be more people on the floor taking care of customers.

2.description: This is based purely on the food.  The waitress was great and the drinks were great.  But the food was nothing more then something I could find inside soldier field.  Not many options on the menu and everything tastes like it was just pulled out of a freezer and plopped on the grill or warmed up.  The place is very nice and comfy in the inside, but they need some help in the kitchen.  This place would be a gold mine if they had some creativity back there.  Walking distance to soldier field and nice buckets of mimosas.  Other then that if your looking for food, go somewhere else.

18.description: Great local place with a very laid back feel. The foods good too. I'd give them 5 stars, but have come across some very rude and judgmental bartenders. One time I came and sat at the bar and the bartender ignored us and I mean that in the most literal sense. After avoiding us for as long as possible, I kindly tried to get her attention and got an eye roll and huff before she turned and walked away. We could have brushed it off as her being busy, but the bar was not at all busy. Maybe she didn't like my girlfriends hat? ..Amongst a few other unpleasant encounters. Now the servers? Superb! All are very friendly and outgoing. I'd recommend grabbing a cozy table over sitting at the bar any day.

41.description: For food, it would be tough to find a worse place. But the drinks, tvs, and location to soldier field is nice. Bottom line tho is that there's a reason this is the least crowded place in the sloop.

52.description: My most memorable experience here was coming here for Valentines Day after we found out Firehouse wasn't open yet....I know big difference right? Lol. Anyways this is a good place to come to watch the game and have decent bar food. I love the tater tots here and the service is always consistently good. Nothing special to note, but a decent place to come game day.

50.description: Seems like a decent place. It was quite busy after the All Blacks match at Soldier Field, but my friends came early and scored some booths in the back. Got my Guinness in a plastic cup. One should never drink Guinness out of a plastic cup. Nice server even though she was clearly slammed with orders. The guys were ordering two drinks at once because she didn't come back to us that often. Gotta be smarter than the crowd.

4.description: I am surprised that Kroll' has anything less than 4 stars. We live around the corner and have been here a lot of times. They have a lot of food and beverage specials during the week including 20% off your bill on Tuesday for local residents. The space is large with lot of TVs and  screens, and although they do get packed on game nights the wait isn't too long due to the number of tables and seats at the bar and the inside dining area. Food is bar food done right. I usually get the Tuna Steak sandwich which is a piece of tuna steak, and not chopped tuna like other places. For $13, it's one of the better tuna sandwiches out there. I also like that I can get tater tots, sweet potato fries or regular fries with my burger. The sweet potato fries is a no brainer. Service is attentive and I have never had a bad experience in all my visits.

6.description: After a night of being harassed by another patron, my party was tossed out of this racist establishment. Our treatment was so poor, another guest wrote a note on a napkin apologizing for the treatment my party received and sent it to my table via a waitress. I will never go to this place again.

22.description: We live around the corner and have been here a number of times. We have always had a good experience - great beer selection and bar food! The restaurant is large with lots of tables and bar seating. Though it does get packed on game nights, but the wait isn't too bad. I usually get a burger with crispy tater tots or their dog with chile. My husband loves the Tuna steak sandwich with sweet potato fries. The service is friendly and attentive and we love coming here.

15.description: Mediocre food at best. Been here a couple of times to support the local business,  but just not that great.

57.description: I've really tried to like coming to this place, especially since it's so convenient. I guess if you're a beer drinker (which I'm not) it's ideal. The place itself is huge and quite nice, yes service is slow but the staff is very nice (not overly friendly, just the right amount of warmth, professionalism, and pleasantry), the location is perfect! The reason for the two stars is the food, I end up walking 6 blocks to another bar because the menu has healthy options. Most of what is on the menu here (at Kroll) is greasy, deep fried, heavy, etc. Even the salads are subpar, the vinaigrette dressing is super oily (seems to be olive oil with a few herb and tons of vinegar thrown together) and very tart. Upside, for a non-beer drinker that is, is that the desserts are delicious (have only had them twice, but we really enjoyed them). So guess dinner elsewhere and then to this bar for dessert it is. Really feel the menu needs some revamping, it may have been fine when there wasn't much competition in the neighborhood, or many residents but things are changing and if they revamp the menu a bit the place will probably be full more often than not (as it seems quite empty for it's size every time I walk by...unless there's a good game on and beer drinkers are "in the house!")

20.description: My first date with my GF was here, and I'm so glad this place is still going strong.  We recently had dinner here with her son, and enjoyed every moment.  I tried their turkey leg dinner, and I declare it was the best leg I've had in Chicago.  I've tried some at the Ren Faire, and the Taste, but this leg was as good as it gets.  Make sure you stop in for lunch or dinner, this isn't a place to be missed.

36.description: This place is nothing to write home about. There are plenty of other great places in the south loop to try out, Kroll's unfortunately, is not one of them.

14.description: I'd give 3 1/2 stars if I could but it is for the beer prices, tater tots and service...Had some good specials on local Chicago beers; I usually like to try something new and from the area. The tater tots were REALLY good, just the right crispness to the exterior and soft and creamy inside (although they should have been salted before being served). Derek was behind the bar and did a great job balancing everyone at the bar and their needs; the food runners were also very attentive to the customers needs.Now the down side; I had the Buffalo Chicken Sandwich, there was nothing special at all about it. I could have taken a Tyson Chix patty and made the same thing (actually, I think this is what they did). It's bar food so maybe I set the "bar" too high.It's a nice atmosphere and if you're looking for drinks and don't have high food expectations, it's a good local place.

1.description: Watched" Varna Colors of White" by Natya Dance Academy founder Hema Rajgopalan and team. Beautiful perfrormance by all with excellent dance expressions...a wonderful reception to conclude with drinks and horderves.Such an awesome experience for my 300th review!!

0.description: ANTHONY IDOLI never had any formal training. I use to sing when I was a kid. I even appeared in a few musicals in my life.  Can you believe that? That's just crazy! I also like to grab the mike at Karaoke and belt out a few tunes. When I look back I wish I had been properly trained. But it's time to pass my dreams on to my little one!Every day of my life is like living in a musical. When my little one was a baby I sang all the time. Well it rubbed off and now our life is a musical. We love to just to do some humorous improve family singing...which always seems to include the word poop! It's funny for the kids but my old improv coach would be mad because he said stay away from potty humor and poop belongs in the potty. We decided to take some of that creativity and give it some formal training. This is our place. The front desk and staff are really friendly. I wish the rooms weren't sound proof because as a parent sitting in the hallway I would love to hear the kids singing. The facility here is really nice. I also love all of the free musical shows they have posted. I guess I know what I'm doing for the rest of the summer. The other day my little one started singing a song and I jumped in and sang the next line. My wife looked at me and said, "I've never heard that song! How do you know it?" I looked at here and said its from the musical, "You're a Good Man Charlie Brown!" And I sang it on stage. I haven't heard that song in 26 years and as my little one sang it I remembered all the lyrics.  It was so surreal. This is the current song my little on is learning. She was so excited to hear the story about me being in the musical. I might have to dig up that old VHS tape and show my little one her Dad on stage. So the journey begins! A little person with a big voice steps up to the microphone. Will they be your next American Idol...sorry I was auditioning for Ryan Secrest's job. I couldn't resist. So only time will tell. You either have it or you don't have it. But the only way to find out is with some professional training. Sherwood is moving us in the right direction but I need America to vote. Sorry! I really want that hosting gig. I need to go to a hosting school. Do they have classes here for that? If yes, then sign me up. So if you are looking to expand your child's culture through music then this is the place. As they say...Doe a Deer a Female Deer! Name that musical for $50? Oh no now I wanna host a game show! Will this ever end?

58.description: My friend suggested this spot after we departed the Yelp holiday soiree. I had heard of it before, but had never made any effort to try it out. Seeing as I was already floating with a decent amount of drinks, one more seemed like a great plan. From the street, it doesn't look like much. Actually, you may even wonder if they might have left off "S &" before the M when you first walk up. In my mind, "Am I remembering this correctly to be what I read about?" I had some brief reservations as I recalled the fact ou can never really know a person - 'a person' being my friend who suggested the place - until I got right up on the door and could see how nice it was inside. Relieved and impressed, I entered this contemporary posh venue. It's dripping with a classy atmosphere that isn't too full of itself. I really liked the interior decor. My friend had also suggested the Yummy Bear martini here, which I just had to try. The drink... was more like Tasteless Bear. There was really no flavor to it outside of the three skewered gummi bears garnish. Have you ever gotten a gift that was in a big box, only to open it to see it's something like a pair of slippers? That's how I felt. Jaded.My same friend assured me the drink had been excellent her last visit and it was even the same bartender. She got the same thing I did and agreed this time around they weren't up to par. All 4 of us in the party felt all our drinks lacked any merit. The $6 margarita I had in Chinatown the week prior was better than this lackluster $11 cocktail.Jaded, I was, but not ready to totally count M Lounge out. It really is a nice spot and I was happy with the music. I'm willing to give them another go to see if their drinks can bring it like their atmosphere and interior does.

56.description: place is an all right place for a drink.i don't personally find anything special about it, except that there are very few other bars nearby so if you need a drink after eating at the firehouse this might be a good choicethe two bartenders serving were extremely friendly and welcoming and laid back.

29.description: Great atmosphere, drinks and service.

42.description: I've been going to M Lounge for a looooooong time, but I've only been on a Fri/Sat nite. They do have live music during the week, which I heard is awesome! M Lounge is small, but cozy. It has low lighting and candles for an elegant and sexy ambiance. There's comfortable couches and chairs as well as seats along the bar. It's a great place to have drinks with your GF/BF/friends/colleagues. Whether it's crowded or not, the staff and patrons are always friendly. No meat market or creepers here! It's mainly a nice professional Black crowd of both singles and couples ages 30-60, but any race/age would definitely feel comfortable and have a good time. The dress code of the patrons is typically business/smart casual or trendy. For the gents, jeans with a nice jacket/sweater/collared shirt is fine. For the ladies, jeans with a cute top and heels is perfect. Those wearing 3 piece head gear (doo rag, head band & baseball hat), white t's, sagging pants or hoochie mama dresses with hooker heels should keep it moving past 1520 Wabash. M Lounge is also a great place to celebrate your special ocassion. I actually celebrated my birthday there twice. Drink prices are comparable to other more upscale drinking establishments. This is not a "bar" or a "club". This is a lounge. If you are looking for a $2 PBR, jello shots or a $5 glass of box wine, M Lounge is not your place. I usually get Macallan 12 or 18. They have a good selection of wine, spirits & cordials and a limited selection of beer. For the non-drinkers, you can order non-alcoholic and coffee drinks. Unfortunately they do not serve food, but they do have a catering menu for planned parties/events.Reggie, the owner, is friendly and ensures his patrons are taken care of, which is great! Charlton, Trillion and Crystal (hope I spelled their names correctly) are all awesome!!!Overall, M Lounge is a GREAT place to socialize and have drinks.  It's more upscale than your typical bar, but it is unpretentious and friendly.Support small businesses. Support Black businesses. Go to M Lounge!

23.description: I've been going to M lounge for years, and it is now a South Loop staple. It's a very intimate space, but has cosy seating, dim lights, and a little background music, making it a great spot for a date.   The layout and seating also makes it a great spot for groups.  They don't serve food, but they do allow people to order delivery from area restaurants. The service here is always exceptional, even when they're super busy, and the drinks are always well made. This is one of my favorite go to bars!

47.description: I've been to M Lounge semi frequently over the years and I've always enjoyed the ambiance and service. The drinks are hit or miss in my opinion but generally they are okay. My favorite drinks are the  fruit fusion cocktail and the x-rated fusion drink.The best thing about M Lounge has got to be the live music. I've seen some of the best bands there. The last time I visited there was an R&B band called Delivery Point playing. They were amazing and I really enjoyed their set. It was almost a crime that there was no cover charge to see them.IMO, the best nights to go are Tuesday and Wednesdays. It's not very crowded so you can actually get a seat and hear each other!

8.description: I've been going to M lounge for years, and it is now a South Loop staple. It's a very intimate space, but has cosy seating, dim lights, and a little background music, making it a great spot for a date.   The layout and seating also makes it a great spot for groups.  They don't serve food, but they do allow people to order delivery from area restaurants. The service here is always exceptional, even when they're super busy, and the drinks are always well made. This is one of my favorite go to bars!

31.description: I came here last night for the 2014 Chicago Jazz Tour (which was a first for me: both to the tour and to this place) where Sarah Marie Young was singing and I had a great time!! Albeit the size of the lounge was quite small (& the place was packed, which is a good sign to me!) I was able to get a seat on one of their leather bound cushioned "cubes" chairs, ordered a French Kiss martini (raspberry liqueur, vodka, orange liqueur with a splash of champagne, Mmm so good!) and enjoyed the soulful & soothing vocal stylings of Ms. Sarah Marie Young! Her voice is amazing (it reminds me of the late great Amy Winehouse - if you didn't know that she [AW] sung jazz songs then check her out, it will pleasantly surprise you!) she put a jazzy spin to some of R&B favorite hits like El Debarge's "I Like", Micheal Jackson's "The Way You Make Me Feel", and Etta James' "At Last"; the passionate way she sings and the electric way the band played (the guy on the keyboards was on fire!!) along with the cocktails, decor, and lively crowd made it a wonderful experience in which I'll return with my friends!!

34.description: My parents really like this place.  They drive in from the suburbs every other week to listen to live music.  I went along recently and had a great time. It's so hard to find authentic live music in this city.  And it's also hard to find a bar where people aren't constantly trying to impress one another.  Super chill.  Great drinks.  Cool crowd. Awesome place to spend an evening with friends. Or by yourself!

16.description: ML is hip and cool without trying to be, which is beautiful. One of the only places to listen to some real jazz with a subdued crowd that doesn't overwhelm the music. This review is only based on my one trip there, but there will be more. Friendly staff, too.

13.description: My wife and I along with a few friends and their spouses enjoy getting together once a month for a nice midweek drink in a warm comfortable setting with great service and music.  The M Lounge is the place.  Our group was there last night for the second time and we have already planned our next visit.  The staff is professional, friendly and quick.  Drinks are very good and reasonably priced.  The atmosphere is wonderful for small groups to stay close while enjoying the lounge and occasional impromptu conversations with other guests.  Last night the Delivery Point band did just that with their smooth R&B mix that had everyone engaged and singing along when not applauding the talented musicians.  They don't serve food but will let you order (they keep menus from the local places).

11.description: My second time in Chicago in 8 years and I get to this spot for a surprise birthday party for a friend.  Everything was great, from the ambiance to the great and extensive martini menu, the friendly and accommodating staff as well as management.  The music was on point as well.

39.description: I've been to the M Lounge s few times over the past three years and it never disappoints!  I love the adult crowd, mostly 30 and over, and laid back atmosphere.  Was here last night with a friend and while it was not crowded, there were just enough patrons to move around comfortably, and enjoy conversation.  It's a long small bar, with seating throughout.  A good spot for after dinner drinks and music...definitely a cozy date night spot.

37.description: This cozy little nook is truly a find! Yes, the room is small, but that allows for a lot of mingling and getting to know your bar or booth mates. A laid back atmosphere topped of with great drinks. Two Southern Hurricanes were my limit!! I completely enjoyed myself and I can't wait to go back!

0.description: Very nice lounge atmosphere nice music good staff and EXCELLENT martinis ( to die for).... definately i recommend this place i had the almond joy and my fiance had the esspresso one. Both of them were just AWESOME!

38.description: Cool area, lounge seating. The bartender gave us great pours :)

51.description: I went here on a Saturday night recently with some girlfriends. The staff was extremely nice, although part of that may have been because my friend frequents the bar and is a regular there. When we arrived, we were shown to a nice loungy area at the front of the lounge to enjoy our drinks. The martini I had was amazing! I think I had the raspberry lemon drop martini. Hands down one of the best martinis I have had in Chicago. My friends all had really good martinis too. One friends martini came with a gummy bear in it...yum.I loved the ambiance of this place. It felt laid back and chill, and felt like you were hanging with business and professional people. The night my friends and I were there, there was a DJ playing music. I also believe it was the DJ's birthday, and so they passed out free cupcakes. There also was a liquor company there passing out shots and promoting their liquor.Needless to say, my girlfriends and I had a nice chill, laid back time here at M lounge. I will definitely be going back for more fabulous martinis and to experience one of their jazz music nights that I believe they have.

27.description: Pre-gamed here on a date night. Good drinks, I just wish it was a bit more spacious. We'll go back.

32.description: Saturday evening was my first time at this place. My friend and I went out with the intention of going to another spot, paid the cover, but could not deal with the crowd or the atmosphere and left after only being able to wrestle our way to the bar for one drink. I whipped out my phone and saw that this place was down the street and we decided to give it a try. We were so glad we did! M Lounge is elegant and chic.  The staff was amazing and attentive. And the owner makes sure that every customer is taken care of. The prices were perfect and less than you would expect from an upscale lounge. I tried about 4 different martinis and every one was amazing! I plan on making it back there on a regular and can't wait to hear the live music.

54.description: I had a great time there on a date. Lighting is perfect. Vibe is perfect.

48.description: I really like it here. I've been a few times and enjoyed it greatly. nice quaint spot, just my speed. I've only ever been on a saturday night. I don't like the music they play, but I usually meet nice people here. the bartenders are so nice and attentive (the 2 ladies always compliment my makeup, lol)definite "A+" for service. I can agree with another Yelper...there are a few creepers  here, but they buy drinks and don't hover over you (usually), so it's cool ;)It's small, but I'm always able to find a seat to enjoy my time..I keep meaning to go on a night with the live jazz...that will be coming soon.

44.description: It can get crowded if you there. It's a nice spot if you want to just have nice drink & chat. I went there last Saturday my homegirls & I we had cocktails. On Tuesday they have nice live  Jazz  section.

24.description: M lounge is a very small, intimate place where a lot of older people and professionals hangout for parties and events. They often have live music with Neosoul and jazz artist. The seating is limited and this place can be very crowed. I have always had a nice time here.

7.description: Call me a prude but I am too offended to return. We stopped in for an after dinner cocktail after a much needed date night without the baby. My husband went to the restroom when I looked through the drink menu. It was quite empty which was fine with me. The bartender seemed nice enough when he brought us water. When my husband returned, he said in the men's restroom, there was a photo of a woman lying on a bed with butt in the air and her vagina front and center. At first I chuckled and 2 seconds later, I realized it was not funny and this was not a place I wanted to patronize. We went to Acadia for great cocktails instead. I just kept thinking. That is the kind of crap that can make a date for a single girl that much worse. I didn't stick around long enough to confirm whether or not there were photos of large dicks in the women's bathroom but I would imagine that answer is no.

49.description: Niiiice spot in the Chi.Love. It. The guys at the place are a bit on the odd & uncomfortable side, lurkers galore...The atmosphere of this place I loved. Dark & classy with good tunes & movies on the big screen TV's.I enjoyed my visit with a great guy friend who couldn't have picked a better spot.I will definitely be back to visit Chicago and back to this gem of a place.

40.description: M Lounge is a small venue situated at the far end of the South Loop. It was a Saturday night and full house. Our party of 11 arrived without a reservation and had to cram into two small tables by the door. It didn't work so well and eventually the servers gave us a reserved area by the windows because that party was late. The area had four small tables combined together and a couch-like seat stretched across the window ledge as well as other small ottomans and plush chairs. The menu offered a good selection of alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks. Prices were not bizarre. Most of us ordered at least one drink and we also had a round of jagerbombs. M Lounge isn't the typical lounge for chit chat. It was a bit loud and we could barely carry on a conversation without shouting across the room. We lingered for an hour and a half before we decided to switch places. P.S. The group who originally reserved the area never showed up. That was a huge plus for us!

53.description: This has got to be one of my favorite places; kinda like my Cheers. Great place to mingle and listen to great music. The martinis are to DIE for! My fav is the French Kiss. Reggie the manager is always a pleasure and always very polite. Great place to bring out of towners who want more of a laid back setting.

30.description: I simply love this place. Excellent ambience and great customer service. It's a nice place to unwind and listen to some great live jazz. If you enjoy cocktails and priceless company definitely stop by.

46.description: this bar is skinny, but it is pretty (just like me). there's not much to add. i had some specialty drink in a champagne glass which was good. the place was crowded but we had seats and eventually found a table. we went on a saturday and there was no cover. hells yeah! hope thats the same. plan on going back

1.description: M Lounge is one of those rare places where you won't feel forced to shut up and listen to music (due to venue layout, an exorbitant cover charge, etc). That said, the vibes and talent here will definitely make you want to groove along by your own volition. The drinks can be a little hit or miss (depending on your tastes, I suppose), but the quality of the musicians makes everything worthwhile. It definitely fills up, so go early if you're going with a sizeable group. Aside from the bar stools, there are ottomans and lounge chairs placed around small tables. Not ideal seating if you're trying to cozy up with a date, but like I said, the music will make up for it.

55.description: I ventured back to M Lounge after several years and was very pleased!  It's a good spot for professionals of color to hang out.  The French Kiss martini was tasty and the bartenders are super nice!  It's a very comfortable lounge and a good weekend hang.

9.description: I came in on a Friday night with friends after having a drink around the corner. We weren't expected but were able to snag one of the back booth for a quick private party. This bar is extremely slender and there are not many seats and it gets crowded really fast. If you have more than 6 people with you, you might want to try up north somewhere where you can breathe for a little bit. Also I ordered a whiskey and they gave it to me in a martini glass which I have never seen before. Most of the drink spilled on my clothes. But they played Barber Shop which is pretty funny so there's that. And the doorman was very nice and accommodating. overall not terrible but the bar is not my favorite.

26.description: I'd give the spot a 3.7. I've been here once, and was DEFINTLEY digging it. If you're into jazz, live music, and an overall soulful vibe, this might be your little spot. Yes, it's small, but beautifully quaint. Drinks were nice and strong. The band was jamming. I've yet to go on a packed night but plan to in the very near future! Check it out!

25.description: I had my birthday party here on the 18th of Dec. and we all had a ball. My server and the manager were great! The drinks were delicious and the music was fabulous! We will definitely be back!

12.description: In visiting the South Loop area of Chicago, we rarely venture out past Reggie's Music Joint on State Street. However, this past Sunday afternoon, we stopped in for the JoAnn Fastoff Book Signing of Two Years of Heaven at M Lounge.M Lounge is one of those uber-cool bars that makes you feel like maybe you should have reconsidered your outfit before venturing out. The vibe here is relaxed-trendy. Look around, this isn't a sports bar. This is the true definition of a lounge; drink and enjoy the company of who is joining you. M Lounge is really small which only adds to the good vibes. It sort of has a private lounge/club feel to it. M Lounge was more of an upscale watering hole for locals than an upscale swanky cocktail lounge.The real stars of this place are the Martinis. Each one is handcrafted and delicious. Weather you in the mood for something sweet and tart, they have got you covered. Check out some we recommend below:M ClassicA large pour of your favorite vodka or gin served with a hint of Vermouth and queen-sized olivesAlmond Joy MartiniCoconut vodka blended with Frangelico, white Cream de CacaoHershey's chocolate & creamLemon Drop MartiniCitrus vodka, lemon juice & sugar mixed with a touch of sour, served in a sugar-rimmed glassAny one you pick you will be sure to enjoy.Have a favorite type of Martini? Comment below and let us know!!!!Cheers,Jordan & Marks

59.description: This is for the ultra sexy crowd! I love the vibe on wed and thurs LIVE MUSIC! Friday and Saturdays are the best!

21.description: ML is hip and cool without trying to be, which is beautiful. One of the only places to listen to some real jazz with a subdued crowd that doesn't overwhelm the music. This review is only based on my one trip there, but there will be more. Friendly staff, too.

17.description: M Lounge is a small venue situated at the far end of the South Loop. It was a Saturday night and full house. Our party of 11 arrived without a reservation and had to cram into two small tables by the door. It didn't work so well and eventually the servers gave us a reserved area by the windows because that party was late. The area had four small tables combined together and a couch-like seat stretched across the window ledge as well as other small ottomans and plush chairs. The menu offered a good selection of alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks. Prices were not bizarre. Most of us ordered at least one drink and we also had a round of jagerbombs. M Lounge isn't the typical lounge for chit chat. It was a bit loud and we could barely carry on a conversation without shouting across the room. We lingered for an hour and a half before we decided to switch places. P.S. The group who originally reserved the area never showed up. That was a huge plus for us!

10.description: The world needs more kickback places like this to have a drink.  The music is good, falls in to the 80/90s Hip-Hop and R&B.  The music is loud but not too loud that it prohibits conversation.  It's an awesome place that you can kick back and relx and have a drink.  I will say the only downside is that all of the cocktails on the menu seem sweet.  I would like to see a bit more liqour focused manhattan style drinks on the menu.  The bartender was super friendly and I could see myself chilling out here for a while.

5.description: I'm guessing that the "M" stands for the initial of owner Reggie's last name, but for me this is the "Magnificent Lounge." It's one of the best bars in the city, and it's only a few blocks away from me.Reggie is the root of the experience here. He's been "in the house" almost every time I've been here, and he truly cares about making sure his guests have a good time, and he's thoughtful about how he can improve their experience in the future. In fact, he once followed a friend and me out the door to ask us about our experience, what we liked and what could use improvement. Wow! I love when owners of restaurants & bars greet the tables, but this went well beyond that. Trilion is equally hospitable behind the bar, suggesting and crafting high-quality cocktails. While M Lounge doesn't serve food (they would do well to at least sell some munchies such as fancy nuts, like The Whistler), they welcome you to order in.I've been here when it's busy, and the energy is overwhelmingly positive and energetic. But I prefer to come early in the evening, before dinner, or on a weeknight, especially a Tuesday or Wednesday when they have live music. It's free! And the music is goo--ood. For such a small place, I'm surprised at the quality. The talent must really like Reggie and the room. Most recently, I saw Tracye Eileen, and her sultry voice made me fall in love with her at first sound. She rocked, romanced and soothed the room with her R&B and jazz, both up-tempo and ballads. A great voice accompanied by a muy tight band.I also like that the clientele is diverse, like is the South Loop (at least by Chicago standards). While M Lounge is most-frequented by African Americans, those of us with lower levels of melanin are warmly welcomed and equally taken care of.Truly, this place could also be called "Magnificent L."

3.description: I LOVE this place! I had a great birthday gathering of 8 people with no problem! Drink prices are reasonable for the area (my fave is the Nut Case Martini!) The atmosphere is PERFECT!! Street parking isn't bad and is free :)

35.description: I went here recently after hearing about it for a few years. It was a holiday (the 4th) so the place was quiet and cozy. Music and drinks were good, the crowd was small and  mature so I enjoyed that. I will definitely be returning soon. I'd like to hear the live music.Parking took forever to find but its a really nice place so it's worth it.

19.description: One word LOVE...I wrote my last review 5 years ago and totally love M Lounge.  The staff is still amazing and the place just feels like home.

28.description: 3.5 StarsI've been to M Lounge on many occasions. Most recently I went last night for a friend of a friends Jazz event. M Lounge is on the smaller side, but the atmosphere has always been great. Usually this isn't a place I just stop into. I've moreso come for bday parties and events. On a prior experience I came for a bday party and they were nice enough to give us the more secluded area by the front of the window. Only downfall is food isn't served here, but your more than welcome to place an order from another establishment and have it delivered. Really intimate place and usually a good time.

45.description: Visited M Lounge on a Friday night around 10PM. It is not a very large place but cozy and there were just enough people in there where seating was available. The service was very good so were the drinks. My favorite part about the evening was the music. I love house music and the DJ made my ears very happy. I would definitely stop back through next time I am in Chicago.

33.description: I stopped by this Mid town spot , i found this place to be incredibly small, far to small for two VIP rooms or spaces. The staff is always polite and the Drinking are poured to perfection, but photos that are shown must have been taken by the owner.

43.description: Great music, reasonable drinks and friendly bartenders. Live music 3 days a week in an intimate setting. I could frequent here...

2.description: This is a great lounge. We came here on a Thursday evening and to my surprise, there was a live band!  When do you ever get to go for a drink with a live band!?  The music was perfect. Their drink menu has an extensive list of martinis. I had the French Kiss and it was ok, but surprisingly the lemon drop one was better! I would definitely come back here.

18.description: Great place for drinks and music sets. They have the best local jazz artist that perform there. Very cozy atmosphere.

41.description: My fiance and I were walking down the street and I saw this bar. When we walked in, we were very pleasantly surprised. I loved the music, the people were friendly, and the vibe was nice. Great find! You should go.

52.description: Little place but the atmosphere is wonderful and I love the live music.Drinks are just okay but you'll enjoy yourself either way.

50.description: long, narrow bar.  decent drinks. nice staff.  good local place to go for a drink or to catch up with friends.  too small for dancing but nice chill vibe.

4.description: The M lounge located in such a way that you would need to look twice to actually see the location. The vibes, the relaxation is amazing !!! Not too crowded on this lovely Saturday night(weather wise) but not empty..I also understand that everyone does not enjoy a overly-crowded place. The music selection is GODLY... The drink selection definitely lives up to the Hype!! I'm an average size guy and the bartender deserves credit for the drinks he served us.. My lady seconds my opinion of this place we were actually very surprised with how comfortable and intimate the ambiance is.I have chosen to give this place four stars, if you are in a chill mood looking to just relax and have a couple drinks this is an excellent choice. it covers all basis except food, if they had a snack menu with a few appetizers I would have given it five stars.Needless to say.. The M Lounge will receive my business again.

6.description: 3.5 StarsI've been to M Lounge on many occasions. Most recently I went last night for a friend of a friends Jazz event. M Lounge is on the smaller side, but the atmosphere has always been great. Usually this isn't a place I just stop into. I've moreso come for bday parties and events. On a prior experience I came for a bday party and they were nice enough to give us the more secluded area by the front of the window. Only downfall is food isn't served here, but your more than welcome to place an order from another establishment and have it delivered. Really intimate place and usually a good time.

22.description: I went three friends for a night of exploration. This place was small and romantic. The music is very jazzy and the drinks are things you would associate with that era. Everyone was dressed nice, classier than your average lounge. I had a very good time.

15.description: I went three friends for a night of exploration. This place was small and romantic. The music is very jazzy and the drinks are things you would associate with that era. Everyone was dressed nice, classier than your average lounge. I had a very good time.

57.description: I was here for drinks with a friend a couple of weeks ago on a Thursday evening. It was pretty dead when we first got there but eventually people trickled in. The setup is really cute and cozy. The place is small and a good spot to have drinks after a date or with friends. I had the chocolate martini and it was really good. Two nights a week the lounge has jazz so I will try to come back on those nights for maybe more of a crowd but overall its a nice place.

20.description: In visiting the South Loop area of Chicago, we rarely venture out past Reggie's Music Joint on State Street. However, this past Sunday afternoon, we stopped in for the JoAnn Fastoff Book Signing of Two Years of Heaven at M Lounge.M Lounge is one of those uber-cool bars that makes you feel like maybe you should have reconsidered your outfit before venturing out. The vibe here is relaxed-trendy. Look around, this isn't a sports bar. This is the true definition of a lounge; drink and enjoy the company of who is joining you. M Lounge is really small which only adds to the good vibes. It sort of has a private lounge/club feel to it. M Lounge was more of an upscale watering hole for locals than an upscale swanky cocktail lounge.The real stars of this place are the Martinis. Each one is handcrafted and delicious. Weather you in the mood for something sweet and tart, they have got you covered. Check out some we recommend below:M ClassicA large pour of your favorite vodka or gin served with a hint of Vermouth and queen-sized olivesAlmond Joy MartiniCoconut vodka blended with Frangelico, white Cream de CacaoHershey's chocolate & creamLemon Drop MartiniCitrus vodka, lemon juice & sugar mixed with a touch of sour, served in a sugar-rimmed glassAny one you pick you will be sure to enjoy.Have a favorite type of Martini? Comment below and let us know!!!!Cheers,Jordan & Marks

36.description: M Lounge looks small and nondescript from the outside so I'd walked by it a bunch of times before a friend suggested we go in for a drink. It's beautiful inside with comfortable seating arranged so that you can relax, hang out with friends and catch some good music. It's great to find a place that supports so much local talent. Sitting down for a nice drink and some good live music makes for a great night out. The drink menu is extensive with options for a variety of tastes. I think it's worth highlighting that they also have a pretty good selection of non-alcoholic beverages to choose from that are no less tasty and fancy than their standard cocktails. It can get pretty loud, even during the week but its more the buzz of groups of people having a nice time out than anything else. The only bad experience I have had here was one night when I was in with friends and we were aggressively harassed by a guy who said he was a regular customer. We mentioned this to the bartender who said he was going to cut him off but the guy kept coming over to our table and bothering us.

14.description: I LOVE M Lounge.  I give it 4 stars because I just hate that I have to get there early in the evening to get a seat & parking!  I tried going last weekend & had to walk out due to lack of seating.  But I knew that because I got there late.  As long as you are mentally prepared prior to going in with an understanding that it's a small establishment, you'll be fine.   My favorite cocktail is the yummy bear martini.You can also bring in food, which is convenient if you're going during happy hour.Great atmosphere and good music.

0.description: Nothing like the soothing sounds of a jamba juice blender during your massage.I had the same experience another reviewer had 7 years ago (perhaps customer service hasn't changed in all these years).  The doors were locked and the employee arrived about 30 minutes after the start of my massage.  Finally got in there, freaking blender blaring the whole time, a curtain is used as a door (which another employee opened during the massage- got all wide-eyed and promptly shut them and left).Will not be back.

29.description: I was here on a saturday night for a birthday party, there was no cover charge and we there was plenty of seating. they had a dj that was on point. it reminded me of the united nations many nationalities and every one was having a good time and there was a variety of music that everyone enjoyed. i was drinking my go to club drink long islands and i tapped out after two which says a lot. I was a nice place, i would go there again.

42.description: Velvet Lounge is a cozy, nondescript music venue and bar where kool kats lounge over french onion potato chips and beer, and listen to some great jazz.  All in all, it's really about who's on stage, which in this case was Jeff Chan (Trio Plus One), and he was amazing!The place is small enough where the music reverberates to the marrow of your bones and takes you on a smooth saxophone ride.  Get there early to grab a seat, it's pretty small.  And like most serious jazz places, get ready to shut up when the music starts!

23.description: I rsvp'd for it on eventbrite party last Friday night. TIP: The bouncer won't ask if you are there for a party or rsvp'd for an event. He'll just quote you the price to get in unless you SPEAK UP! I'm not shy, so I did, and he pleasantly granted us our free entry. Otherwise it was $10. Reasonable. But free-99 is always better.It was around 11:15/30 so it wasn't too busy. There wasn't a coat check which sucks in Chicago winter. [That's another cash cow opportunity owner! We'd pay for a coat check. We would!] Anyway, the venue isn't very big so within an hour it was packed like sardines in there! The DJ was on point and the vibe was chill. We had such a great time and literally danced the entire night. Drinks were reasonably priced too and it never took too long to get served. I'd check it out again. It's a nice local, chill spot to add to the list if you aren't trying to go too far, pay too much or deal with any drama. I'm with it!

47.description: We went to a AACM sponsored "big band" jazz show featuring approx 20 band members. They played an overwhelmingly progressive piece that last over an hour long. Followed was an extended happy birthday song to Mr. Fred Anderson himself, a jazzical conga line around the room and all.The "New" Velvet Lounge officially seats 99, but the house felt a lot more crowded that particular night. There is also no smoking and a cash-only bar. The new locale is squeezed right between a gyro/hotdog joint and Chef Luciano's chicken joint just east of Wabash.$5 cocktails, $7 premium liquor, $15 cover. Being present for ice cream and cake for the owner's birthday: Priceless.

8.description: Soul Sessions Live hosts live entertainment every Wednesday from 7:00 to 10:00 pm, doors open at 6:00 pm.  Music genres include Jazz, Soul, Latin, and R&B.  What a great afterwork set.  Plenty of eateries, street parking, minutes away from LSD (Lake Shore Drive), I94, and Blue or Red Line elevated trains.Drink Specials...

31.description: The service was wonderful! Jose and the rest of the staff took great care of us. Definitely a place for a private party or a place to chill!

34.description: been here one time, cooooool place!!!!

16.description: I was so excited to check this place out. Didn't know there was a $10 cover. Aside from that when it came to ordering a drink, it was horrible. Directly at the bar, I actually asked the young lady (bartender)with curly hair if we can get a drink when she finished the one she was working on she said ok. What felt like 10 minutes passing she took walk up orders, had side conversation, did everything but took our order. Got to the point that I asked the couple next to us if they can order for us and they did. At that point we were asked what did we want. Did I tip, I most certainly did not. The DJ was off. Songs going in and out. A couple points there was no music. Among other issues.Overall I don't plan to come back anytime soon. Not sure how to feel about this place.

13.description: I actually liked this place even though its small. I've been twice on a friday. There was a 10$ cover. The venue is upscale and the DJ was awesome. However, the drink service and bar waitresses are rude. They walk around you, ignore you, and have terrible attitudes. The drinks are average 10$ and I had to wait thirty minutes or throw my hands in the air just to get service. What I did notice however if you weren't a guy with a hand full of money or asking for bottle service then yes you are waiting forever for a drink.

11.description: This place was ok. I recommend arriving early because it's so small inside with very few seating.

39.description: I spent a Wednesday night here listening to The Fred Anderson Trio (featuring Corey Wilkes) and was blown away.  Cover was 15.00, and the three hours of music that followed was well worth it.  The place is small and comfortable (not quite nice and not quite a dive).  The combination of bright paint mixed with an old bar, paintings, and red chandelier light fixtures is perfect.There are shows here five days a week, and if you are a jazz or live music enthusiast a visit to the Velvet Lounge is a MUST.Other Notes:I usually take public transportation, but I would recommend driving if at all possible because it is not the best area to be walking around in at night.  Didn't look like there were many/any cabs out front after the show. There is plenty of street parking out front. The house allows you to bring food in, and many people took advantage of that and brought take out to eat before the show began.Cash only bar

37.description: Intimate setting. Great Music.  Nice people.  Strong drinks.  Couldn't get better than The Velvet Lounge.

0.description: Typical small, lounge.  I'm mainly a fan because they show Mayweather fights & games. Lol.  I stayed after a fight for the music.  I wouldn't recommend it late night.  Get there early due to limited seating & nearby parking & free entry.  No cocktail menu (or I don't remember one) so be prepared.  Decent drinks & prices.  You can bring in food.  I've ordered from the Harold's Chicken across the street once. There's also another chicken place and pizza place next door.  Comedy night is cool.

38.description: I've heard of the Velvet Lounge for a long time, but never had a chance to visit. Finally, a photographer's meetup came up and I jumped at the chance and I am so glad I did.  We went to see and photograph AACM musicians perform on Sunday night. It was an great performance and the venue is equally impressive.You can definitely go for dinner in south loop and Chinatown then some great music here on the weekend and I will definitely do so for Mr Anderson's Birthday Fest.

27.description: I was impressed with the mystique of the unadorned entrance and the hallway draped with velvet. The lounge's ambience

32.description: So, I would prefer to give this place no stars, but I'm not sure if that's ok. Pretty sure they are under new management/ownership. I'm actually sitting here right now. We got here at 7pm, ordered around 7:45, and everyone just got there food and drink about 35 minutes ago...it's 9:10 people. we gave the waitress a pen and she still got our orders wrong. We got free shots due to the poor evening out we had, so that was nice. But we were also given a discount and it wasn't present on the bill. Needless to say, we will not be back.

48.description: I miss this place already- I am glad I could go while it was still all run down and full of cobwebs. The music was always good - none of that sleepy smooth jazz like up at the green mill- more like insane Coltrane with a heavy dose of funk. I hope the new location can go ahead and get the lived in look the place on Indiana had.

44.description: This is a great place and I can't believe yesterday was my first visit! It's a little sterile with simple tables and chairs in a non-descript strip mall just east of Chinatown, but everyone is super nice and the music is great! The prices are a little steep for the neighborhood, but you can definitely understand once you hear the woefully underpaid musicians and notice the small space/lack of crowds. I hope with the increasing population in the South Loop and Pilsen, this club will start attracting new crowds. Go now, before they get here!

24.description: Fake drinks...I ordered Ciroc...The bottle was Ciroc...But the taste was more like STOLI :-(

7.description: Had a good time on a Saturday night! Timely bottle service, chill and fun crowd, no wait and no hassle! Pretty intimate space with seating around the exterior.  The DJ was good and played a variety of music old school hip hop, new hip hop, reggae, etc. All feel good stuff.
